column4: Was a lot of fun. Ate in the 360 Restaurant and while it was pretty expensive, the food was AMAZING! View was even spectacular enough to pull my teenagers eyes away from her phone!

Great views sure, but what a cash grab. 38$ to take an elevator to the top. Then another 15$ to go a bit higher. 30$ photo opportunity. Be prepared to spend cash to see the city from a very cool view.It's just one of those things, if you're in Toronto you've got to go to the top but expect...

1400 feet from ground , from the elevators till the top floor its an experience!!.You have to be there to believe it. It takes a min to get to the top floor and it has the most breathtaking views. The whole downtown can be see from here . And the open you can walk or blown away by the...
Just like last year, back to Toronto and this is a must to do attraction. Night views are amazing. To be repeated soon

The CN tower is a symbol of Toronto and a must see. You don't appreciate the size of the building until your standing in its mammoth shadow. The views are amazing.-tip buy tickets online, save a bundle.- go towards the late afternoon for nicer pictures-must see both during the day and at night

The CN Tower is probably the most well known spot in Toronto, and it lives up to the hype. Going to the top, there are amazing views at any time of day. You can even have the opportunity to stand outside of the CN Tower behind some netting, although you'll get the best pictures from the indoor observation deck. If...

The CN tower hosts a magnifcent view of Toronto's entirity. On a clear day, you can see for a hundred kilometers of the surrounding horizon. The skypod takes you in just over 1 minute, up to the top. There is a lovely revolving restaurant with a great menu. I would recommend the CN tower to any tourist or local looking...

We clubbed our visit with the 360 Restaurant otherwise you will end up paying 40$ per person just to go up the elevator. Reservation at the restaurant gets you to the top and the only thing you spend on is food. The night view is to die for and it is definitely at least a one time activity visiting/staying in...
Great views of the city and lake, could just about make out the buildings in Niagara.Also Went on a day when the sky pod level was free - normally $12 extra.

This is a must do in Toronto, learning all about the built and history.The lift goes so quick and you have views out of the windows in the lift. The glass floor may take you a few minutes to walk on, but you must do it, we were told to lie on the glass floor and take a selfie. Go...
Visited Toronto numerous time, the weather was great and there was no wind. Just so happened that the 1464ft Skypod was open. Well worth the extra entry fee to get up this high. Great experience.

Elevator up to the top can be quite nauseating for some, anxiety producing for others, and while the view is nice, it's just another tall building. Friendly staff, longer lines than I would've liked, not much to entertain young children. The show (extra cost) was well done.

We had free access to the viewing level as part of our Restaurant booking at the 360. Having been on the Tower before it is one of those things that one should do when in Toronto. That being said though it is not a cheap excursion to do. The glass floor is pretty cool and the views are stunning on...

I was really glad I had made a reservation to eat at the rotating restaurant in the top of the tower. With lunch, you didn't have to pay to go to the observation deck, and you didn't have to wait in long lines. We waited less than ten minutes to be taken in the elevator up and seated at our...

Try to take in the view to overlap daytime, sunset and evening views - couldn't be better to see all the 'different' views of the area. Expensive to ride to the top but combine with a meal and save some $$

Went just to say I've been to the CN Tower once in my life. Would definitely never pay $70 for 2 people just to walk around. The glass floor had so many people on it and we didn't feel like waiting around.Definitely not worth it in the long run.

We visited CN as part of our city pass, and what a great way to spend an hour or so. The kids loved the glass floor (even though it terrified me!) Do recommend doing this on a clear day. The day before went the lookout area was covered in cloud. We also decided to pay for the skypod level. And...
If you like your disappointment then make sure you take the time to go up the CN tower. It will not let you down.
Great day out with the family. Ears pop when going up the lift. Best to go just before sunset, views are amazing!!

We managed to snag the perfect weather for our CN Tower visit, clear blue skies and about 13 degrees C!This meant uninterrupted views of the magnificent city below.It's $35 entry for an adult plus taxes, which made it about $39. Totally worth it for the views of the lake, city and also the airport for the aviation enthusiasts...

Given the height, a clear day is best to maximized your view. Even on an okay day, there is lots to see during rush hour -- plenty of trains, planes and automobiles to take in.Glass floor is a chance to test your courage.

I recommend going on a week day in the off-season if you want to avoid the crowds. We went yesterday with a 10% off coupon on our phone. They told us we had to have it printed out to apply it, which was annoying because we are travelling and do not have a printer! So after finding a Staples we...

As the last reviewer stated, it is a "must-do" but still you don't get a whole lot except a view, which you can only look at for so long before you get bored. It's not like you can spend all day here, so you're paying 35 dollars for maybe less than an hour, depending. Expensive activity with low excitement compared...
Not much to say. Paid a pile to see Toronto from a lower vantage point than our flight. Our bad! I can't believe we shelled out like that for an elevator ride. Lol.
You can't go to Toronto without doing the CN Tower but at $35/person you don't really get a lot of value other than seeing the city at a height

It should be noted, they you have to pay to go to the top of the CN Tower, The Experience for me was terrifying at first as the lift to the top is made from glass, and the floor is also glass, this played havoc with my vertigo, adding to the point that there were kids jumping on the glass...

We visited the CN Tower during our trip to Toronto in August of 2016. We purchased the City Pass, which provided us with admission to this as well as a few other attractions. We were amazed by the views of the city. It was really neat to look down over the baseball stadium. We also paid a ridiculous amount of...
Great view, elevators are not for the faint of heart! The 360 restaurant is a great value and wonderful food. Make reservation.

This place can be crazy in the summer but in the winter is quieter and more accessible. Also, crisp winter days mean excellent views from the top. We spent a lot of time at this attraction and loved it. Do not buy the extra ticket to go higher--you get a great experience from the basic tickets up.

As part of the Citypass the CN tower is a must do if in the downtown Toronto area.We went shortly after 9am and completely avoided a line up.We were the only ones on the elevator on the way up.Once at the top the views are spectacular.There isnt a lot to do but look at the scenery so we spent about...
Was alright. You basically just go up an elevator and then look at the sky line. Staff were awesome though. Very friendly and encouraging to my yellow livered children who almost chickened out.

Took kids for March Break. They loved the thrill of being so high. The glass floor was a little scary but the kids both tried it. We ate lunch in the main restaurant with a great view. Price of food was reasonable for a captive audience

If the cost is an issue, look into the Toronto CityPasses. They were perfect for us.Entry was simple and smooth, it was engineering month and there were tables with activities for younger kids (my 5 & 7 year old kiddos loved it). Displays, information, and then the ride up. 58 seconds to go up. Amazing views, the glass floor...

We took our 10 year old son to the top of Toronto for the first time. We were the first visitors of the day and picked a beautiful morning to view such a great city! Didn't partake in the additional activities that you could pay extra for. The staff seemed friendly, customer focused and very informative. Anyone that comes to...
The tickets are pricey and the line for the elevators was a bit long, but the CN Tower is a real engineering marvel and shouldn't be missed. I really enjoyed the panoramic views of the city.
The snow storm affected our viability but the grandsons enjoyed just being there. The glass floor freaked them out but also intreiged them...lol

Spent the day sightseeing in the city. Took the subway to Union Station then walked just a few blocks. Bought a city pass in advance so we were able to bypass the LONG line of visitors waiting to purchase tickets. Visibility was disappointing as a Nor'easter was approaching the city, but what can you do...mother nature! :) Loved the elevator...

Like you wouldnt miss Eiffel Tower in Paris, you should miss the CN Tower if visiting Toronto. There is large area around the base to sit and take pictures. I went up to the restaurant and got to see the view deck as part of it but the price to just go up and see the view deck is a...

The glass elevator is not glass all around which was a disappointment. The glass floor deck is wonderful experience. Feels a bit scary. Part of observation desk was under construction. So not a 360 views. Plus was too windy. May be better viewing in summer. Check weather for clouds before planning. We had a clear day and a visit to...

I went to check it out mainly because everyone talks about the view. It was nice but the cost to ride to the top really wasn't worth it. It's a one time thing for sure and probably better for little kids. I gave it an average rating because it wasn't bad and wasn't amazing either. I was up there for...
Quick visit to CN tower. We have been to Sears Tower so this was comparable. Expensive ($35 per person) for what you get. Staff in elevator and at glass floor area were very nice.
It.s the CN tower... where all tourists want to go. It's a fair bit of money for a very short experience.

Such an awesome experience! It is a tad pricey, but it is a MUST while in Toronto. You can pre purchase tickets online & even buy front of the line access beforehand or at the entrance. There are basically 2 types of observation tickets: just for the multistory main decks at ~1150 feet (346m) or a more expensive one that...

One can obviously not miss out on visiting this large man-made structure. The panoramic views of Toronto, the Ontario lake and islands from the 348 meter high observation deck are truly spectacular. The interesting, and for some scary, view through Glass Floor, 342 meter above ground level, adds a nice touch and photographic opportunity. The only critisizm is the long...

Going to the CN tower has not been on my bucket list ever, but one night walking by, we decided to bite the bullet and check it out. I must say that I was surprised. I really enjoyed the view. The glass bottom is very cool. I would go again.

Visited for our 3rd anniversary and had dinner at the 360 Restaurant. The food was impeccable, and the views were amazing at night. Toured the rest of the tower in the evening and then returned the day after to experience it all again during the day, including the SkyPod. When visiting you need to go to the top and visit...
Awesome view, no doubt. Rivals elevator to the restaurant. Great service, as well the food was exceptional!Only complaint, loud. I would not recommend for an intimate romantic date.

Recently took relatives from Scotland. Due to high winds the elevator ride was longer than normal, maybe a minute or two longer... As a resident of Toronto, or nearby, I am so proud at how many compliments are afforded to our city for its cleanliness.

On the weekend, ordering ahead is a must. Staff and security personnel were friendly. There is lots to do around the tower which is a five minute walk to Queens Quay and the waterfront. Great idea for a Saturday or Sunday.

If you manage to plan your trip up the CN Tower try and do it on a clear day. The view is breathtaking spectacular and worth the pricey admission fee. Make sure you go to the upper level as well and if you're daring enough try to Skywalk. A great once in a lifetime opportunity.

This place is OK. I have been here so many times and its upsetting to see the level of service drop to almost nothing. I was with friends from the USA and they said it nothing special but a money grab and it hurt me. But they are right if you pay $35 you really want to be wowed but...
We've been many times and it just never gets old - so much fun and if you pick a nice day the view is just phenomenal. Not to be missed.

Amazing view from the top. You get to see all of Toronto and the Toronto islands and Lake Ontario. There is a glass floor where you can see all the way down when standing on it or next to it. If you're lucky, you might be able to catch a ball game at the Roger's centre from the top. The...

The view was great. We also stopped in the restaurant, and split a pizza, which was decent. Unfortunately, there is some construction happening on one side of the observation deck, so you couldn't get a full 360 view

This place has fantastic views of the city. You can see all around and on a clear day you can also see Niagara falls at the end of lake Ontario. It has one feature not for the faint of heart, that is the glass floor at the top of the tower. If you are brave enough you can see what...
Riding in the elevator on the way to the top is a great (and kind of scary) way to see the city. You can't beat the views you get from the top of the tower.

We thought the 360 view was amazing. It was very expensive just to ride up the elevator. Not something we would do more than once. It is worth it for tourist to get a great view. The restaurant is also expensive. We had a glass of wine and a sandwich- we did enjoy the view while having a drink and...

The trip to the CN Tower is well worth the 2+ hour wait it took to get up (we visited during the first week of July) and another 1+ hours to get down. The best place to see everything is from the revolving restaurant. We had a decent meal as well as a great view of the entire city,

High speed elevator whisks you up 1300 feet to the top. Great 360 degree views of Toronto. You can watch planes taking off and landing at the airport below, ferries heading over to the Islands, and much more. Get vertigo standing on the glass floor, looking straight down

If you want to get a unobstructed 360 degree view of the beautiful downtown and far suburbs of Toronto, this is the place to be, on any sunny day! We had gone their as a family, on the last leg of our visit to the various attractions of the city through Toronto City Pass. If you ask about the place...

You have to visit the CN Tower if you come to Toronto and it's well worth a trip BUT be warned it's very expensive to go right to the top as you have the basic charge and then an additional fee to go right to the top. The restaurant is also extortionate so don't plan on eating or drinking there!
Might not be great in some places but if you can manage to get up there while the sun is up and leave when it's going down then there are few better views of the city
Went with family in Winter. Too long a line and costly to see from something that you can view from most other taller buildings!
This is a place u go once just to see it for yourself but not worth a second visit. If it were cheaper to see it than I would say go again.

The CN Tower is an iconic visitor spot for Toronto visitors. Centrally located in downtown it draws millions of vosits per year. Though pricey for some to journey up the elevator to the look out and not for those with vertigo. Splendid views and and a restaurant await your arrival. Like all tower restaurants the prices are high and the...

Best view in Toronto. Situated just a short distance from Lake Ontario and right next door to Ripley's Aquarium. I do recommend. reservations for the CN Tower 360 Restaurant. . The restaurant opens for lunch at noon and if you want to get a good seat right beside the windows, then arrive on time or even a little bit earlier....
Be sure to walk on the glass floor while express trains running several feet under your feet! If you dare, experience the sky walk on the ledge of CN Tower...
Just make sure its a clear day - but then the 360 resteraunt is amazing in any weather! Go for the view - stay for the food!

So worth the trip up, on a clear day the views are amazing. Our 6 year old had a blast, she was the only one of the three of us who had the stomach to stand on the crystal clear floor, but the views from the floor was just as breathtaking.

Waiting at the bottom for the elevator ride up was nerve racking. Kids were initially nervous going up but as we got higher and higher they got very excited.Once at the top there was a lot to read about the cn tower and history as well as a glass floor which the kids loved. Going outside and looking down...

Love the needlelike structure on our Toronto skyline.. It certainly distinguishes our city., Going uo the elevator feels like travelling in a yellow bug up the side of a large beast. The viewing decks are fun to explore, especially the glass floor deck. visiting later in the afternoon on a clear day affords the individual a wonderful view of city...

A must do when in Toronto. What can go wrong when you are having a 360 from the amazing city of Toronto? My suggestion is to go by the end of the day to admire the sunset and see the city changing colors and the city lights starting to light up. You can end the attraction with drinks at the...
you can see the panoramic view of Toronto. ? think it is better after all the lights up to see the light show of the skyscraper. you should visit when the sun goes down to see both face of the city.
We always take our international guests here and have also taken our kids. It is a must see for Toronto. Take lots of $$$ as everything is pricey but definitely worth at least one trip in a life time

It is worth a visit. Come by the end of the end of the day, watch the sunset and then wait for the city lights. It is very nice. Also you have a glass window and you can see the the street. At night the colors change up there. There is a restaurant that blocks the view of the island,...

you should try the hanging off the roof by cable option. many levels, each requiring more payment - but apart from a panoramic view, and average food, there isn't really much else, apart from a lot of waiting to get up or down.

I have been there just before te subset so I could enjoy the view before it was dark. But the best view in my opinion was in the night. The city lights are amazing from up there. Really recommend to reach the top.

The Edgewalk was not as bad as you might think and the staff was excellent. I've grown up looking at the Tower my whole life, and have eaten at the restaurant and taken in the view many times. There is nothing like it and I view it as a must-do in Toronto, albeit a bit pricey - it is worth...

We've been to a number of towers around the world. This was my least favourite.The guide going up in the elevator recited his script with about as much enthusiasm as a pre-pubescent male cleaning his room. I actually had visions of the teacher from Ferris Bueller taking the attendance. That's the level of enthusiasm we're talking!When we got...

Definitely a must-do in Toronto. The coolest thing is the glass floor-I few of my friends were even too scared to step on it. It also got super windy on the lookout, which made things pretty fun going out there! For an extra $12 you can go up to the Skypod and get some even better views.

This has got to be one of the best restaurants iv been to so far, the level of service is exceptional, the food was delicious and I had the steak!if your not a fan of heights then this place will really make you have a relaxed feel with the music.The restaurant does give a 360 spin so that...
Wow what a view! Worth the wait to get to the top, the 360 degree view if spectacular in every direction.

We visit the CN Tower and it was absolutely amazing. A bit nervous because I am afraid of heights but when you get up there it doesn't even matter. The view was amazing. The restaurant was good. The service and staff working were very helpful and nice. I could of stayed up there all day if I could.

Oh wow! After being advised to buy a city pass I was glad CN Tower was one of the attractions. The city pass also tells you what they consider to be good times to visit, for this 10 am I think it was. Well as it's quiet this time of year I knew there wouldn't be many people but to...

Spend a great couple of hours here on a super clear day. Minus 9 outside but bright blue skies and windy.Elevator went slower due to winds - this made the sights even better. The viewing gallery enclosed with big windows is great. So so high up. Visibility was great.The viewing terrace was closed due to the winds but...

The elevator ride is the best part. They really need to revamp this tourist attraction, as they charge high entrance fees with nothing new offered in years. The outside observation area was closed due to winds. Boring.

The views from The CN Tower were amazing! We had a city pass and we used that to go up during the day and then we payed to go up again at night as it was a stunning view. Totally worth while and the roof to the Rogers Centre was open while the Blue Jays were playing at home so...
At this beautiful place is necessary to go, I didn't tried to dinner but you can try. You can see a beautiful view from Toronto.
You can walk on the outside, inside and stand on glass looking right to street level. Price a bit harsh, consider it was a bit messy and we could not walk around 360 inside because of upgrades

I know everyone does it!! But it's worth a look, especially the "upper pod" and yes, it is pricey! But worth it I'd say, if u already paid $30 to get there what's another $13?! And less kids up the top as well, shame the restaurant does not open till 11 am yet tower open at 9? (I had wanted...

Great view and a really fast ride up, for those not great with heights and fact you can see where you are going and the glass floor to look down can be disconcerting. Stick with it the view is tremendous
I live just outside of Toronto but the CN Tower will always remain as the highlight of the city. There are too many places I've been to here but this is always good. Lots to do.

The best tower ,the ride up is amazing as well .The glass floor is a must .The view of the city and the lake is a site to be seen .Just loved the attraction . Price is reasonable(its a tourist attraction so its going to be costly??).The sky walk is not for faint at heart its for thrill seekers .If...

I was part of a group of 16 that went to the CN tower for a meal, I thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience the food was delicious, the service was good, the views are amazing the turning restaurant is well worth a visit

We were lucky to have a clear blue sky day on our visit last Saturday. The views are amazing and we spent a good 2 hours here. Make sure you buy a ticket to the top (skypod) it's worth the couple extra dollars. They are renovating a section of the main observation level but you can still walk through the...

Unfortunately upper level was closed when we went due to strong wind. The general ticket is 35 and the upper level access is 47. You can take pictures on the glass 350 meters above ground. Overall not bad.
A must do if you are visiting the city, also a great revolving restaurant for dinner to see the city lights, great food and great wine list,best to book reservations.
If you visit Toronto then a visit to the CN Tower is a must. Great views of the city and Lake Ontario in all directions. The glass floor is a must!

Welp, its one of the must things to do in Toronto. And of course its one of the best aerial views you're going to get of the whole city, but in my opinion the view of the tower looks better than from the tower. Tickets seemed a bit over priced just to take an elevator to the top, especially since...

I am not terribly partial to heights, but I managed to survive the elevator rides up and down. The views on the open-air walkway are inhibited by the safety grills and the inside observing areas are divided up into care/bar spaces. We had a reasonably priced (for an attraction) lunch and got some good pictures. My wife enjoyed getting some...
Sheer size of the concrete building going straight up is amazing, wish I was there to witness part of the construction

I worked at Tour Of The Universe so really UNDER the tower in the very early 90's. ThereforeI have been up it many times both as a child and an adult. More recently I took my own family for family day.1. I know it's super "touristy"2. It was family dayThe line was insane but we accepted this....

If you're looking for a great view and some touristy fun, the CN tower is a option you can do for a short while on a weekend. I went up on a Sunday afternoon and it was pretty much empty. There was very little line up and a lot of the windows had no one. The elevator ride is a...

Went with my husband. He really enjoyed it, but I'm scared of heights...One good thing is that as long as I don't look directly down I'm OK, so I did get to enjoy the sunset over the city from a great angle.

We were lucky that the weather was so clear because it was a beautiful day that allowed us to see far and wide. It's definitely worth the trip up. There's a great glass bottom viewing panel too although not advised for those with a fear of heights!
A 'must do' attraction when visiting Toronto. I go every summer. The views are out of this world and amazing food .. There are many attractions near by that you can enjoy as well

Although we visited in February we were fortunate enough to get a good clear day to go up the tower and get some great views of the city and the lake.There were no queues to stand in, just straight up in the elevators to the viewing platform. Like some other reviews said there is some construction work underway so...

Friend and I went around 9pm on a clear night, amazing to see all the lights. Would recommend anyone wanting to go, to definitely go at night! It was empty when we went, so we got to enjoy the full experience!

You can have an amazing view of the city and the bay, the only downside is that the glass from the main floor is very dirty and people stay there for a very long time and do not let other people check the view, that should be regulated and avoid people leaving their phones recording the view for 20 minutes...

It's quite the maze/mission to even find the main entrance. It's a whopping $40.00 to enter the CN Tower and if you want to reach the highest point it's an extra $12.00.Great views of the city but I think the price should be half of $40.00. When you get up there, there's not much going on. You've the views...

This is one of the must see attractions of Toronto. The price is definitely quite expensive (especially because we where there when they had some construction work going on and not everything was open). But the view is just amazing and everyone in Toronto should have visit this at least once.

Went with a 6 year old. Enjoyed going up and the view is amazing. Not a lot to keep a younger child's attention. The cost of the picture package at the end is really high, but I'm a sucker for family pictures! All in all enjoyed the visit but no need to go back.
It is Beautiful to see with lights at Night. You can enjoy a lot around the tower for street walk. I did not climb up actually but it was amazing to see from Outsight at Night. !!!

When visitors come it is a given that I will take them to the CN Tower and Niagara Falls. Of course on a clear day you can see Niagara Falls from the top of the Tower.Sometimes now I don’t go up, I just sit at the bottom and wait for my guests to have their adventure.At night the...
Just visit restaurant at the top. Nice view in the evening!And try to stay at the glass floor and look 350 meters down :)
You can see Toronto in a different way. It's pretty good go there in a sunny day. You can go alone, with friends, family or couple

CN Tower, a Canadian Icon, rises above more than 550 meters into the sky. At this height, the Tower provides spectacular panoramic views of Lake Ontario, downtown Toronto as well as the old Toronto. Adding these views can be enhanced with excellent foods served in 360 revolving restaurant. The glass floor, the Skypod, a higher observation deck are excellent for...
A must do if visiting Toronto. Glass floor is really cool. Great views of the city from the top deck.

The CN tower is totally touristy, and over priced, but still a "must see." The view of Toronto is amazing, and the glass floor is fun. We were lucky that there wasn't a huge line, because it might have been less worth it, had there been a wait to go up.
Awesome,,took my granddaughters there,,they loved everything about the Tower,we went to the reliving restaurant which my granddaughters though was really cool,,food was great.
We had a wonderful trip to the top. It is very well done and staff were very good. We had dessert and coffee in the restaurant it was pretty good. Would recommend doing this to anyone.

Brought friend from Europe. He was very impressed. We had a beautiful sunny day. Great views of city and across the lake! Currently under minor renovations, but still access to the views. Paid extra to go to the top; even more spectacular!

Going up to the top of the CN Tower is a bit scary but, well worth it. The views of our beautiful city from a 360 angle are amazing. A must see for first time tourists. Stop and have a delicious meal at the top, enjoy. It is reasonable priced

CN Tower in Toronto is a 553 m-high concrete tower which you can see the whole Toronto from there. It is located in downtown Toronto, Ontario, Canada., the third tallest tower in the world. its a symbol of Canada too.The "CN" name originally referred to Canadian National, the railway company that built the tower.In 1995, the CN Tower...

This is included on the Toronto CityPass booklet, which I recommend to get on line here on TripAdvisor, anyway, it is supposed to be a great experience though the weather did not help, it was a foggy night and we just saw some of the city on our way up on the elevator. The view from the top was not...

Visited in the morning which was great as not many people and no lines. The views at the top are amazing, make sure you pick a clear day!. The staff were great and took photos of us (as many as we wanted).The elevator up and down has a glass bottom, but if you are scared of heights they will...
Wow! Something worth seeing especially with the kids. They couldn't get enough. Pay the 12 $ go up the skypod
- Go on a nice, sunny day is important to have a good sunset view of the city- Approx stay, 1hr- Experience 7/10- $$- Good for first time in Toronto

As a one time thing for a tourist in Toronto, I think this is just about worth the money. Even though it is expensive, there is quite a bit of information about the tower to look at, and the views from the observation deck and lookout are very good. The glass floor also adds another thing to do.
It is just one of those places in Toronto you just need to go. Personally, nothing special but a neat view and if it would have been a 100% clear day I bet you could see forever.
Its funny how many locals have never been to the cn tower. Well its a must at least once in your lifetime. Its truly a modern wonder to build such a structure. Its an experience for everyone.
Love the view , had a great time watching people get scared shitless of walking on the glass floor ???

My daughter, 13 years old, and I went to the CN tower the first afternoon we were in Toronto. It's a nice chance to put the geography of the city into perspective. We used the Citypass, and also the Citypass coupon to go the highest point on the tower- that was $6.00 more person with the coupon. It's worth it...

Terrible experience. $107 for two adults and 1 child.58 second elevator ride with operators who just cram you and don't care if you have the worst experience ever.Glass floor was neat.My recommendation. Stay at a tall hotel. Get to a elevator. Ask 20 or more people in the lobby to join you in the elevator. Press the...

I've been in Toronto for 9 years now, and I always took the CN Tower for granted presuming it was just another tourist trap. Boy was I wrong....well yes, it's a very touristy thing to do, but it offers some beautiful views of Toronto. I always recommend people to go in the late afternoon, so you can see the sunset...
The observation deck is a great place to go to for the views and skylines of Toronto. There is also a glass floor area which is cool to look down through. Highly recommended.

We visited in February so it wasnt very busy. The sight is absolutely gorgeous. They have a glass floor that people can stand on to take pictures of how far up you are. Although it sounds easy it was rather difficult to do. Good luck
There is not much thing up there, and price is expensive, but if your are first time visit Toronto, you should go.

Amazing views of the city and lake - close to Skydome and many attractions. 360 Restaurant is high end but a nice place to enjoy a glass of wine from their extensive cellar.......World's Highest Wine Cellar !
One of the tallest towers in the world. The glass floor gives you different perspective. Loved the views from up top.

Absolutely love the CN tower!The glass floor is terrifying and the rotating dining room was a trip... but it did make me feel a little dizzy.Wicked experience... can't wait for this summer to do the Edge Walk!

Waited for the clouds to clear for a couple of days, then went across town at 10:30 on a Saturday expecting huge queues. There were none and we went straight up. Staff are all well trained and friendly. The views are stunning and it is well worth the extra €12 to go up to the Skypod. Only downside to the...

Great view but with limitations because of the Horizon Restaurant takes up half the 360 view. Also sort of ridiculous you have to pay an extra $12 to go up higher. Went right at sunset, city at night was very awesome.
Its big. Use it as a way to navigate the city while your here. The see through floor and elevator ride up are pretty fun. Unique experience.

It was wonderful. When your from the east coast it is always nice to look at what my family have caught for years. Have to say my favorite are always the jellyfish. I did get to see the blue lobster that was caught by a friend near where my husband fishes.

Most times, the CN Tower is the place to be if you want an amazing view of Toronto. However, if it's a foggy day, you are better to wait, do something else for an hour or two and go back. I was recently with a group from Germany who wanted to go and it was foggy. We may as well...
It's a must see attraction if your down town Toronto. Amazing view once your up there. Great restaurent with great view over the city. Nice to see at night time.
So beautiful you could send all day up thereStaff are amazing and so helpful great value for money my lil one loved it we would recommend to anyone

We ate lunch in the revolving restaurant, the food was decent and the views were stunning. The general viewing deck, is a bit tired, but going out into the open air area was a great experience. I loved the glass floor, but the husband was less enthusiastic.
Obviously very touristy but views were stunning, you can see for miles. We also stopped for a cocktail and took away the CN Tower cocktail glass for memories!

Had a wonderful meal. Many items to choose from if you are having the 3 course meal. Portions are small but absolutely delicious and perfect for having multiple courses.The view is spectacular and I love that the restaurant spins so you have a different view all of the time!!Very romantic for a date. Highly recommended. It was about...

If you're not afraid of heights you should try leaning over the edge with a harness, looked fun but not for me! The view over the city and the water , especially at dusk is wonderful. A must do if you're in Toronto
Of course you have to go up the CN Tower when in Toronto. No question. Just do it.Take the elevator and get the view. You won't regret it'

I would say if you have a few days, get a City Pass. We parked across the street in a parking lot for $15. Nice area to walk. Ripley's is next door. We got there around 8:30. I would recommend going at sunset and view the city in light and darkness. Beautiful views. Not too bad of a wait. Prepare...

Every tourist that comes to Toronto wants to see the CN Tower then go to Niagara Falls. It has a breathtaking view of the city and also has a glass floor at the top if you are brave enough to stand on it!

The CN tower is famous in canada for being the tallest, most beautifully engineered building around. We had a great joy on our trip to the top and took away the biggest impression from the glass floor. Although this is a fun sight to see in the grand city of toronto, if you have a fear of heights it may...
Right next door to the aquarium, our first stop, and not nearly as crowded. Fast ride to the top, where the view is exhilarating.
It is pricy to view the lake or the city. It is still a marvel of our time. Had to do it once, since it is in my country. But ounce is enough.

We were nervous about our trip as it was a cloudy day for going up the CN Tower. But after getting to the top, even with some low laying fog you could see all of the Toronto area! I would highly recommend going before the mad rush at 11am as it feels like you've got the whole place to yourself!...

I live and work in NYC. I've been to the Burj Khalifa in Dubai and the Eiffel Tower in Paris. Basically, I've been around some of the world's finest architecture. I finally made it to the CN Tower and I have to say this could be the best structure in the world. The Burj has jaw dropping size. It has...
A few said it's boring, I disagree strongly. The view from the top of the Toronto skyline makes you stay up there and admire the beauty of this city.

You have to do this, the views are amazing! On a clear day you can see for miles and also see the beautiful neighbourhoods mixed with the skyscrapers.Step on to the glass floor if you dare! You can have a professional photo on it to!Lift goes up around 15mph, not too bad at all. Glass fronted lifts for...

It's cool but pricey. $170 for 2 adults and 3 kids and it's all over in half an hour. Slight rip off. Plus they try and get you again with the photos. $60 for a set or $30 for one. Ouch. Nice views though...
We heard that the new chef and menu were excellent so we booked for my wife's birthday lunch. Everything was superb and the views are stunning.

Yes, its just a building, but its iconic, how can you come to toronto and never go up the cn tower? You have to!Great view, scary glass floor, and if you are a billionaire you can even buy a coffee at the restaurant. Otherwise eat a hotdog for $10 on the street corner below.
book a table in the 360 restaurant, beat the queues, excellent meals, and free access to the viewing deck..

No trip to Toronto is complete without the CN tower, mindbogglingly gorgeous views. I'd recommend this to anyone.We ate in the restaurant (Horizons) which is very good value. It's worth paying the extra $12 to go to the higher level where the views are spectacular.

Great views of the city and lots of fun on the glass floor. Staff were all very friendly and relaxed. I wish we had known that we could have booked a meal and saved on the entrance fee, thereby making it more of an experience. Saying that, I didn't think that the entrance fee was particularly expensive compared to similar...

The CN Tower is the tallest standing structure in Toronto. Although it can be expensive to visit, but I think it is well worth it. Once you get to the observation area, there you can view 360 degrees of the city. It is truly breath taking.

When I visited the tower, I did the whole nine yards except for the restaurant. The tower had striking views of Toronto and Niagara Metro Area, CA and Rochester, NY, which could be seen surrounding the lake. The best time to go is sunset so views during day and night can be viewed in such a short amount of time....

Go early to avoid the queues, and if possible, choose a clear day. The scenes from the top are amazing. I didn't go to the Skypod for an additional $12 as the reviews say that it just isn't worth it. I'm sure this won't be my last trip up either!

The day I went was really nice. Not to cold so spent a fair about of the time I was there outside looking around. The glass floor was a little disappointing because I was under the impression that it was the entire floor not just sections of the floor. But all in all I would totally go again and make...
CN TOWER was the tallest tower in the world. To be amazing you take the top and last stop. To see Toronto very well.

Great place to go up and see a great view of Toronto. We got some fantastic pictures from the tower. I had to take my glasses off though to walk on the glass floor as I don't do heights very well. It was quite expensive to go up the tower and you had to pay even more to go the...
its so crazy to go up there. I was there when the lake was half frozen and it is a really cool view. Tallest man made structure ive seen so far.
Amazing view to watch 360 the city. if you are so extream you can go on EdgeWalk ... OMG it's so fantastic!!!!
Great friendly staff and an exciting experience, a must do if you are in Toronto. We had a beautiful weekend weather wise so the view was amazing!
Good day at the tower. Weather was good so could see a lot. Prices are getting a little high but overall a good day.

Thoroughly enjoyed this 'must do' sight of Toronto.The lift climb in 58 secs makes your ears pop !The walk on the glass floor mesmerising.The info from staff was great and the whole experience was simply fantastic.
Go for it you won't regret it!There's no place like it and it's a once in a lifetime experience you won't forget.

The wait to get into the elevator was long (on the long weekend). Been able to see outside in the elevator going up and down was fun. The views of the city and the lake were great. Then again, the wait for elevator to come down was long as well.By stay in the hotel near by, watching the lights...

Visiting my Canadian Nephew who lives in Oshawa about 20 miles from Toronto, it was suggested that we visit the CN Tower, this structure was originally erected to hold all the telephone and broadcast equipment for Canadian Broadcasting.It was erected using a continuous pour method of concreting, and is 1122 feet high to the observation deck which is the...

If you are in Toronto you have to go and eat in the restaurant in the tower! Great views out over the lake, airport and the baseball centre via the glass floor! The lift is enclosed so if you don't like heights, which I don't, it is fine. Outdoor walk is madness!!! Brilliant, a must!!

We spent a couple of hours reading up on the construction of the tower and the changes made since we ere last in Toronto on our honeymoon. The exhibits are well set out and detailed for the lay person. The lift to the mid station is really fast and the glass floor is just incredible to walk on, lie on...

I've been there at least half a dozen of times. The experience depends on the weather and fog or rain can really take most the fun away. But on a clear and sunny day, you don't know where to look first, the blazing view south, across the lake, towards Rochester, or hundreds of shades of red of a serene sunset,...
Heard so much so we went with our visiting family.the view is nice but that is it.nothing special and nothing to do but walk and look
Awesome glass floor experienceLoved the views from the 350 restaurantMust visit place in Toronto ????

Didn't have time to do this during the day unfortunately so decided best way to do it at night was eat in the 360 restaurant while we were at it. You can get two courses for c. $65 dollars and it included free entry (worth $35) so well worth it. The food is delicious and you are sitting in a...

The CN Tower is the best way to see Toronto aerially! There is a glass floor that you can stand on. that shows you the bottom of the CN tower! That is pretty wild especially if you are scared of heights!Tip: 1.Get the dinner package for the restaurant (360) there. They gave s you food + the ride up...

This was a spur of the moment decision with extra time. Very cool, one of a kind but the fall backs are first the price and second it of course was very touristy. The sights from the tower are incredible and one of a kind.

This is a very busy attraction! I visited with my family during an off peak season and still find the queues deplorable. I think the problem is the lack of lifts getting up to the viewing pod at the top and once up there, it can get very crowded. Its a must visit only for the great views of Toronto...

58second ride in an elevator takes you to a viewing area with a restaurant. Walk round the circuit to see miles of views across the lake or land. Skyscrapers look tiny from up here. Glass floor area is freaky!

I am local and when I came to room Toronto first, I went with young kids and our family and loves it. Since then I have Ben here several times. Every time someone to visit us out of country or town first thing we do is take them to CN tower and we enjoy as well. The only thing I...

A very nice few hours spent in the Bistro Restaurant. The other is the $120 fix menu. You know what, Great Bistro Food. Burger or Sandwich...very nice. Add a few beers, Ontario cider or some decent wines. Boom, you got yourself a great night. Same view, more lively and easy access to all the tower attractions.
Had a blast! Had always wanted to go up the tower and finally got too! The views are just amazing! A great time had by all

Beautiful views of Toronto and Lake Ontario. The only drawback is the price (expensive for the amount of time you are actually there). Bypass the crowds and get a City Pass which you can use for the CN Tower.

Went with the kids and their grandma. Half the tower was under construction - not able to see everything - no discount - only 2 elevators working so they packed them crazy tight and couldn't see or move - kids thought glass floor was fun - but wanted to know what else you could do - great view but not...
I went to the CN Tower with friends and the food and the views were amazing . the. service was very quick and the food was delicious
Excellent Experience with family trip at CN Tower. We can explore the whole city of Toronto from the tower
If can't come in Toronto and don't visit CN tower. Is the symbol of the city. You definitely have to go all the way up
The view from the top is spectacular. Buy your tickets online so you don't have to lineup.Toronto looks so different from the top.
Honestly I'm conflicted about the CN Tower. The views are incredible and the glass floor is freaky and fun, but OMG it's expensive!!!!! Highly recommended if money isn't an issue.
Trip well chosen , even if you are afraid of heights,this won't be an issue the design is made to keep everyone safe.The dinning is great ,the view is great .It's wonderful do visit .

Spend a good 20 minutes roaming around after our supper at 360 restaurant. It was great. Although the glass floor was really scary, we managed to take a picture while sitting on it.Really liked that we went during the evening. It was less busy and more peaceful. It comes free when you go for the 360 dinner.
It is a perfect place to view the entire Toronto especially in the evening with children, friends and families.
Great place to visit during any time of the year! Glass floor is liiiiiit and so is the restaurant!!
Beautiful scenary a must see for anyone visiting TO. The restaurant was great and the food fantastic.

Visit CN Tower on a sunny day and enjoy gorgeous view of lake and downtown Toronto. Walk on a glass floor hundreds of meters above ground, or if you are really brave, walk outside CN Tower attached only by safety rope.

best time is to catch sunset and to view the city at night time as well. dinner is good but on the expensive side. however, considering the view, it is well worth it. it is a must to visit specially if you have visitors to Toronto

You definetely should go to CN Tower, Toronto’s tallest attraction, besides the stunning view you can have dinner on the 360º restaurant, taking a walk outside around the circumference of the roof, walk on the glass floor .....

The first amazing experience is how fast goes the elevator! Then, the window floor - in the begining I was very scared to walk on it and suddenly I started to jump! Finally, the revolving restaurant that we can have a 360o view of the city. Easy access by subway.
Took the wife downtown for a special dinner. It took forever to get up and the food was very expensive.
If you dine at the restaurant, you get to eat and go to glass floor for freeIt is worth the extra 20 bucks, specially for lunch
Even though we came under a snow storm the views are absolutely stunning. Loved standing on the glass floor an incredible experience

Was expensive to go up and see the view. After you paid they told us there was construction going on which meant some of our views were cut off. Would have been nice if maybe theyd discounted the ticket a bit. $80 way too expensive for what it is for 2 people.

Everyone in North America that built a building says his is bigger than the others. The place is very high, you reach the top with no more than 24 sec, the high is about 114 floors making it as the highest construction of the word, but is not an office building, is a tower. The view from there is breathless...
Worth a visit and go to the top if not the first then one of the original CN Towers of the world.Seems like alot of cities around the world has one nowadays....

This is a great place to visit. The views are spectacular and it is an overall exciting place. The food in the revolving restaurant is exceptional and I suggest a visit on a clear day to really appreciate the view.Go up to the glass floor and look at the street below. This sort of experience is hard to come...
Ok but kinda dirty, Not much attraction. expected more but it only took 10 min to experience the whole thing.

Taking a ride up the CN Tower is a life time experience, there are so many breath taking things to do and see there. The edge walk is one and then sitting on the glass floor and looking down are just out of this world.I will highly recommend a day trip to the CN Tower.
On a clear day, the views are excellent. You can see as far as Niagara falls (faint shadows though) from Toronto. A must see attraction. Good facilities at the base.

Go around sunset. The restaurant gets very busy and service slow but food is ok. Go to the skypod, its worth the extra few $$. Can get very busy with long cues at the security checkpoint. The outdoor deck is pretty windy, but amazing to see the city and lake from there.

Really cool to do when in Toronto.. Do not think the extra cost for 360 view is worth it. You can see almost as much on level just below and views are still amazing. Gotta catch out the glass floor when at tower. Unfortunately kids under 15 can't do skywalk so daughter was disappointed. But had fun and loved the...
Seeing the roof open while the Jay's are playing is sweet. The glass bottom is also nice. I would not suggest eating up there.
Stunning views of Toronto and further. We had a nice lunch and a beer at the restaurant at 350 m, which was awesome. In January no queues, almost no tourists so really great time for a visit.

My wife and I took our Nieces and Nephew to the CN Tower. They've never been and they had a great time. The glass bottom floor was the highlight but the kids also loved going up and down the elevator with the glass floor cutouts. It is probably the most iconic spots in Toronto.
An amazing experience & drinks. The staff was wonderful & very helpful. I would deff. recommend this stop, especially for people traveling from small towns! (Monroe, Michigan)
Love the CN TowerGreat time with the family .A well spent Friday afternoon and a few memorable pictures to go along with it.
The CN Tower is an icon. One can see it as they start to come into Toronto and it just keeps getting bigger. It makes a perfect backdrop for the cityscape.

I've always wanted to visit the CN tower, and now that I'm finally here I was able to enjoy everything, though I came on a snowy day there was limited visibility but I was still happy that I got to at least see rogers center down below and my fiancé and I took a picture on the glass floor and...
It is nice to see the city from the top and get different perspectives. Just be prepared to deal with the crowds and the high prices if you need to buy anything while visiting.

This is one of the tallest structures in the world. The views are amazing you can see all the GTA.This is like any other tourist attraction the prices is a little high but no so much.This tower has a glass floor that would make you scare. you can see from the top to the sidewalk its terrifying.When...
It was an amazing tower. 100% recommended, but do not buy the ticket for the very top portion of the tower.
Went up for dinner in the CN tower. The rotating restaurant really was something to remember. It felt strange to see planes flying beneath me - something I'll never forget!

This a must to go when you are in Toronto. You will find an amazing, breathtaking view of the city! The elevator up and down is super cool if you're into heights! Although, $40 is very expensive, I will probably only get to go once so it was worth the money!

This is one of the tallest towers in the world..though there are many more taller towers in the other parts of the world this tower offers breathtaking views of down town toronto. I would not recommend this tower if you have been to Empire State in New York or Sears Tower in Chicago. It is on an expensive side.

This place has survived only due to tourist traffic, I think. The view is gorgeous, but the food is barely palatable. At the prices they have, they can at least do better than serve tasteless, bland, sorry looking food. Not much of a choice for vegetarians, and children are stuck only easting pasta because that's all they apparently like?Save...
They love this place and still remembering the view of Toronto from Top. They also love the Restaurant food with local authentic test.
Such a great place to visit it's cool seeing Toronto from so high above I would defiantly refines to all.

It is a good attraction and everything is well organised and presented. However, there's not that much floor space with small glass floor bit. On a busy day you may be there a very long time waiting for a turn.

We took the kids to the CN Tower for the first time. It is such a touristy thing to do, but it is a lot of fun, nonetheless. The kids love jumping on the glass floor. They are much more fearless than most of the adults!
Expensive for what it is...simply viewing platform and a small glass floor. Quite disappointing really but I suspect a must when visiting lovely Toronto.
The tower is amazing!!!!The view from here is fantastic!!Well worth the price of admission and conveintly located right next to the aquarium.
Main attraction in Toronto. It is in down town Toronto. Early morning is good otherwise need to line up for couple of hours.
I did not go up at the tower but the place were its located is beautiful. very tall building and its a happening place in toronto
What am awesome way to represent our City to overseas guest. Everyone of us had great time. The glass floor was cool and one of a kind.

Went to the CN tower summer 2016 and it was my Second time going. Like the first time it was so fun! Great for anyone. There is also a restaurant in the building and the food was average but still good. Definitely recommend!

For anyone visiting Canada, ensure you make a stop in Toronto and visit the CN tower. The is not much to do there because upon entering you are guided to the elevators where an attendant assist you up to the main observation deck. You are free to move around the deck and walk down the stairwell to the second deck...

Horizons restaurant took part in winterlicious and it was cheaper to have a three course meal rather than do the tower alone ie $35 for the tower or $23 for,the meal with and extra $10 to do the towerMeal and service were great, tower views and glass floor added to,the experienceA great half day to end our holdiay
Always good when visiting a new place to go to the top to get an overview. Still a thrill after many visits to ride up the glass elevator and enjoy the view. Do pick a clear day
In town for business for first time in downtown district. Went to 360 restaurant for dinner on the CN tower. Nice view of the city from 115 stories high.I would recommend and visit again.
West went at night and the views were breathtaking. The glass floor is fun and skypod is worth the extra to get up so high!

The ride up in the elevator is great, the view great, and the revolving restaurant, wonderful. There are other activities like being outside on a railing, the plexiglass floor, and a few other odds and sods which make your stomach and heart .....squirm!
Visited with the City Pass. View was amazing. Parking was close by and we were able to visit the aquarium at the same time.

The CN Tower is a great spot, perched on the edge of the lake with a revolving restaurant, a glass floor for thrill seekers, and unparalleled views. But it's not cheap. Check for coupons and specials to try and get the price down if you can.

Typically I wouldn't want to go to a tourist trap like this. However we had lunch there and the food was actually good. The views from the top were incredible. Surprisingly I think your trip to Toronto wouldn't be complete without going to the top of the tower.

Felt they had been lazy and could do a few things to make this a much better experience for visitors eg why were there no maps to point out the sights you could see - would have been such an easy thing to do. Great views though and given that a bit of a compulsory sight.
The view from here is fantastic...your quite literally in the clouds. It was awesome!!! Well worth the price of admission and conveintly located right next to the Aquarium. I did them in one day!!

There is nothing to do at the CNN Tower, as much as I love it from afar, there is nothing but a glass floor to freak out about four $70 +tax.Waste of time and its a little embarrassing. They're is a lot of security (which we should have) massive lines but then nothing. Shame

We took the kids up to the CN Tower in January. This is the 2nd time we’ve taken the kids up, and the first within the last few years. And while the views of the city are breathtaking from that height, I must say that none of us were overly impressed this time around. While the conditions were excellent –...

We took visiting family from England to the CN Tower for the afternoon. Our plan was to go to the CN Tower and then follow up with a late lunch somewhere nearby. We realized when we got there that we could go up to the revolving restaurant at the top and have lunch and the trip up to the top...
Really beautiful views of the whole city, and definitely take a stroll on the glass floor of the observation deck!

You don't go up it everyday. Its Toronto's most recognizable landmark, its awesome. If you haven't checked it out, do it, its worth your time and your money.Pro Tip: Go during a baseball game in the summer time when its bright out, something about it that just enhances the experience.

A visit to the CN Tower is a must do for any visitor to Toronto. The view is magnificent. I did not buy any food there so I cannot give any impression from this visit. We did eat at the restaurant many years ago andat that tie it was average. Hopefully better now.

I climb the CN tower stairs every year as part of a fundraising event, and I really enjoy the challenge as well as the rewarding view and cool breeze at the top. They have both indoor and outdoor viewing areas as well as a glass floor, which I have to warn is not for anyone who are afraid of heights!...
Expensive but worth it. We went here for a celebration dinner. The wine list is extensive. The service was outstanding. The food was delicious but it comes with a price tag.
Absolutely incredible views of Toronto! I was a little surprised by the price but would have paid more after experiencing it! Worth every penny! Go during sunset! You won't regret it!

As part of the city pass the CN Tower is a Toronto Cultural icon.I can never stand in the glass floor, it freaks me out. The views are breath taking especially on a clear day.Going for lunch up the is wonderful too.
We visited with our 3 month old and it was very straightforward.baby was free and you can take your pushchair/pram.

I had a wonderful time with family and friends in the CN Tower. My only advice is do not eat at the 360 restaurant at the top of the tower. Go somehere else for dinner. It would be so wonderful if this was a high-end restaurant as the view is incredible. Unfortunately the food is super terrible and super overpriced.

We had dinner in the Revolving Restaurant at the CN Tower which included access to the observatory level. The fixed price menu was fairly expensive but well worth it for the experience and the quality of the food. Would highly recommend.
very impressive...we enjoyed this attraction. It would be excellent on a clear evening. The night we went, it was cloudy and snowy... still worth it.
I enjoyed the view with my family. The rotating restaurant was a hit! Great food! Fine dining! Great for families or couples. Bring a camera, the view is breathtaking!

If you go for a meal in the revolving restaurant, you not only get an amazing meal, but last time I checked, the lift costs are minimal and you bypass the main queues. You still have access to the other floors once you are up there. Obviously choose a day with good visibility for best affect.
I loved the view, its French cuisine therefore do not expect big portions. One must try at least once in a lifetime.

I've been up the CN Tower too many times to count. If you go during peak times the queues to get onto the elevators can be an issue.The view from the top is worth the pricing in my opinion and friends always appreciate the excursion. Recommended!
A must see in Toronto. The panoramic view is amazing. The glass floor scared the heck out of me. Go to the top level, it's worth it.

I brought some overseas friends to the 360 Restaurant for dinner overlooking Toronto and it was great, they were impressed! Food was good Servuce good view spectacular and after dinner you get an opportunity to go to the observation deck. With a dinner reservation you do not pay to go up the tower it's included in your meal and you...

We have "done the Tower" many times with people from out of town, however this attraction never gets tired. Everyone is always amazed by the views, even more so if there is a fantastic sunset. For us, with all the construction going on, the views are always changing. The glass floor is a "must see" even if people are scared...

Elevator ride up and glass floor are highlights.I don't have the nerve to do it but Skywalk is supposedly only for real thrill seekers.Don't go if you have a fear of heights or if you are claustrophobic.

We arrived close to 4pm. We had to wait 10 minutes to buy our City Pass. Once that was done, you have access to a section where you can read a little bit of history about the construction of the CN Tower. After this section, there is group of 3-4 people from the staff that request to take a picture...

I visited when I was in middle school and although it was beautiful to see everything it was a bit too high for me! Especially walking on the glass floor. It was a neat experience but I prefer lower heights. If you have a fear of heights I do not recommend it to you.
Don't forget to buy Toronto tour ticket! There is a lot to watch- I did made about 500 photos. We had a good time up there ;)

We took our 6 year old daughter because she wanted to go up the tower. It wasn't busy and we enjoyed the glass floor...but after that there is just a feeling of 'is there more to this experience'. Not sure how they could make the experience better - maybe more interactive exhibits, history of toronto exhibits - better use of...

My kids and I liked the free play area just off the cafe it was wonderful. My kids played there for 2 hours. And it was right beside the aquarium we just walked over and there it was. The gift shop was good too. We did not go all the way up the tower. Kids 4 are under are free...

don't visit on a Saturday summer day !!! the wait can be for 4 or 5 hours !!!Specially check if there is any football game in the rogers stadium, it can be so crowdedthe visit by itself is greatthe view is amazingand don't forget to see the glass passagealso if u have time u can...

Too much for visitors from the North to take in really. They were more excited by sugary drinks and frozen treats at the refreshment stand than the view, which makes Toronto look more like wide open space than it deserves to.The glass floor thrills. Climbing on (forbidden )screened in fences holds even more appeal.Beware of establishing rendezvous points...
Always a great experience. We ate at the top overlooking Toronto. Food was good and the view is amazing.
I've been up the CN Tower many times in my life, not something I'd want to do too frequently but every once in awhile it's amazing to just see the view of Toronto.
LONG WAIT times and when you think you are almost in there is another room awaiting you. The view is spectacular and if you didn't have to wait would be worthwhile.

worth a visit if this is your first time in Toronto. It is much better to combine it with a dinner reservation at the 360 restaurant because in this case you are also covered for your visit to the observation point and don't have to stand in line for the elevators. Make sure you visit when the weather is good...

Very long time ago I studied in Toronto Ontario, one of the most relevant places to visit in that city, it is CN tower, one word to define this building: Amazing!, an icon and part of canadian culture, you can dinner at top of the tower, Enjoy the beatiful sightseeing.
If you ever travel to Toronto you cant leave without visiting the cn tower, amazing views and outstanding experience.
Nice experience with superb skyline and view of the cityProfessional organization clean and safeOn the top nice bar and restaurant

The glass floor in the elevator is pretty cool but once up in the tower there wasn't too much info or help with what you were looking at. Made Toronto look very grey though up there! The glass floor inside the tower doesn't overlook anything too exciting but it is a strange feeling! Worth going if you have some time...

Definitely worth a go. There's not a lot of glitz or glamour (like Empire State Building for example) but a pretty impressive feat in its day and something all Canadians can be proud of. As Don Cherry once said: "Hey. Pass the salt."

Whether you're a tourist or a local you really do need to visit the CN Tower otherwise it's like going to Paris and neglecting the Eiffel Tower. The view is obviously amazing and there's no rush to see what you want since you can spend as much or as little time as you want once you're up there. It is...

Well it has advantages and disadvantages from the entrance to the top 10 minutes no waiting lines the view was foggy, but no lines!!! , there is an area with the glass floor ,amazing the photo guy took all the pics that we wanted and in the end we went to the bar which was good we had nachos and...

column3: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
column4: Every tourist should make a trip to the CN tower. The view is amazing. Standing on the glass tiles and looking down at the street is a remarkable experience

We went up the tower and did the Edge-Walk. Highly recommend the edge-walk. It was a bit of a crazy idea, but so cool! Not often you get to hang over a city from that high up (or any height for that matter). It was very safe and I never felt uneasy at all. The safety equipment is the best....

I am a touch of afraid of heights and I still enjoyed the view from the top. Make sure you plan out about 3 hours or so for this event. It takes a long time to get through the line but it is so worth it.
You cant go to TO without go to CN Tower. It's the best view in town. Toronto has a very nice skyline. Great place to visit.
Great iconic structure that encompasses Toronto as a world class metropolis - If you've never been, go and if you have a few bucks, enjoy the 360 restaurant for the lamb is the best I've ever had!

We went to check out the tower 1st thing in the morning. I thought the ticket price was expensive. There is security you have to go through first. Then we were taken up in the elevator to the top of the tower. There is a small glass floor area but it isn't very clear. The restaurant on that floor takes...
A cool thing to do in Toronto. Great 360 degree view. A bit pricey but when you stand on glass with 400+ meters below you, it's worth it.

It is pretty busy and long lines! We had a city pass and were fortunate, but I would not do the waits needed to go up. The views were cool.My husband and friend did the extreme walk and really enjoyed that! OnlyIssue was weather was bad the first tomeWe went and so we had to reschedule, no...
Great place to see Toronto from upstairs. Even when it's cold it's something that everyone needs to do.

One of the highest towers in the world and one of the symbols of Canada!A must see... from there you can see the hole city of Toronto!I recommend to go by the end of the day so you can enjoy both day and night views.The price is a little expensive. In my opinion. I went all the...
You cannot go downtown without a visit to the CN tower. The views are second to none and there is so much to see and do. Little bit pricey. Not a cheap attraction.

This was our second visit to the CN Tower but our first Night-time visit. The views of the lights of the city were beautiful. We lucked out with the the weather, you would never have known it was the middle of January out on the Outdoor Sky Terrace.

Though my timing is bad , its all cloud out there ,but i have only this weekend to visit , so done the ride. my experience will be more exciting if i visited day with sunshine.. still great place to visit , walk able distance from ripley's aquarium
The view from the top of the CN Tower is an absolute stunner. Must do when in Toronto. Toronto City pass works out economical, it clubs 5 attractions at a discounted price.
The CN is a great place to see Toronto. But that is about it. It is expensive, and so is the restaurant. I would recommend to visit it only once.

Visited the tower in the evening with a friend. Around 6pm is good time to go there wasn't a long line at the entrance or in the elevator so the process was pretty quick. I had a citypass which expedited the process as well. I'm sure the daytime view is great but the nighttime skyline view is amazing. Beware of...

Spent the weekend in Toronto and have done the Cn tower many times but figured what's once more. It was a beautiful sunny day so we figured we could see lots but by the time we reached the top it was snowing and couldn't see anything! Felt like we were in a cloud. The glass floor still creeps me out...

Never get tired of icons. Can’t say you visited Toronto without having dropped by the tower. Elevator had a view to the outside. It made for a short thrill when zipping up and down.Visited on a cloudy day. Visibility was still pretty good. Outside observation deck was blustery as heck. Indoor views had panoramic, wrap-around glass. Nice!Would be...

We booked this restaurant to celebrate a special birthday. It was expensive. The food was alright. The view of the city made it well worth it for us. We and our great sets loved seeing the city lit up.
Went here twice, once in the daytime and once at night as we had s dinner reservation. Highly recommended!
Worth it to go up so high to see Toronto's Panoramic view, in what was once the worlds tallest free standing structure. A Toronto landmark for sure.

This is a Toronto must see, standing at the bottom looking up was my favourite part, it seems so high and its shape with clouds moving above made it feel almost hypnotic!We had a 5hr stopover at Toronto Pearson Airport from London to Miami. Even with security etc a trip to the CN Tower, Lunch and short walk around...

A must-see location in Ontario, with nice 360 degree view around. If you planned to get to the 'Look-out' level, bring extra jacket because it could be very windy. If you're here, you can go to Ripley's aquarium next to the tower and brewery across the road and call it a day.

Yes it's a tourist attraction and yes it's very touristy but it's also very cool. I live in Toronto about six months out of the year when people come and visit I will always bring them to the CN Tower . I'm afraid of heights I'm not a huge fan of elevators and I've seen and done this activity a...

A must see if you've ever been to Toronto. Around $20 for admission. Glass floor area is just a small room and you look down and see the ground below from the tower. Nice views of the city of Toronto. Gift shops too to pick up souvenirs. Fun for everyone.

It's old, it's not Burj Khalifa but it was great. Indoor and outdoor viewing. Outdoor 360 degree which was super cold but fun. Inside you need to eat in restaurants to get full view. Definitely worth a visit and I enjoyed it with it being my first time in Toronto.

We enjoyed it very much but it's a place to go there once, unless you want to go to the restaurant.The views are really beautiful on a good day. There's a nice restaurant on top with great food. There's a glass floor to go on if you courageous enough. Beautiful tower to visit.
If you are coming to Toronto this attraction will make your trip 100000X better. The view is amazing. I will come back every time I'm in Toronto!

The 360 restaurant at the top of the CN tower has the best view of all Toronto, especially at night. Whether it's your first visit to the city or after many visits , you will always see something different as you revolve around.

My fault that I went on the day that it was raining, but that was my only free day. 58 sec elevator ride going up, saw the city-- that was probably the best part of my visit. Would recommend to get the City Pass which is $65, that includes 5 other places. Worth it if it wasnt zero visibility

If you're visiting Toronto this is a MUST on your "to-do" list. Amazing views of the city starting from the elevator ride up. I would recommend lunch or dinner at the restaurant if you have time and the money. The glass bottom floor was scary and fascinating at the same time.
Great experience for everyone to enjoy, makes for great photo taking opportunities as well! Would highly recommend visiting this attraction.

If it is your first time in Toronto, then you probably need to stop by the CN tower and experience its wonder. Being one of the tallest buildings in the world and overlooking one of the largest North American cities, you can just imagine how wonderful the view is from the observation deck. Being a 360 deck and since it...
The CN Tower is definitely a place a tourist must see when in Toronto. It gives you a beautiful view of the city, even the city airport. Really nice.

Very breath-taking view of the City of Toronto firstly from the viewing gallery. The Glass-floor then gives a unique experience of what's under. The Restaurant serves an elegant Lunch. The staff, being Canadians, are very informative and personable. Its a veritable exceptional sight.
it is very good experience specially at night time but day light have its own glow .but don.t go on rainy days view is not very clear. and revoving towerrestruantisverygoodlle.overcxe lla

The CN tower is on many tourists lists when they visit Toronto. As a Torontonian I tended to stay away from it! However, I was treated to dinner at the top for my birthday and was thrilled with the whole experience. The view was spectacular, and the meal was exceptional. A very pleasant surprise. Make sure to go on a...

Worth seeing, and worth paying extra to get to the upper deck, but definitely buy your tickets online ahead of time. The lines are long to get in and to get on the elevator. Don't make it worse by waiting in line to buy tickets on the day.
No matter how many times we visit, we always enjoy the CN Tower. On a clear day, the view is magnificent. The restaurant is excellent and the various other attractions are informative.
Great views of Toronto be prepared to wait we waited around a hour and half but was pretty cool. It was extremely windy and cold at the top but expected at that time of year.
What a view ? it's totally amazing. The elevator ride is not for the faint hearted but definitely a must when visiting Toronto
The tower itself is very impressive and when on top gives you a nice view of the city. The wait and costs are (probaby depending on the time of year) a trade off if it is worth it.
Its a nice view of the city Im not a fan of heights but sometimes you just have to do it. I am glad I did. There is a restaurant at the top and lots of other activities to do. Bring your wallet.

I had to do the tower on one of my first real tours of the city. The elevator was cool as you can see out and below and you go really fast. Up in 58 seconds.I was a little disappointed with views you get from inside. It only covers about 1/2 of the city as the 360 restaurant occupies...

I brought my boyfriend here when he came up from the United States so that he could see the city lights. It was a gorgeous sight and not something even the locals are able to see very often. It was quite busy in there but it was really interesting to be able to read the information on the walls while...

We purchased the city pass for toronto. It was worth it. The kids loved the glass floor. The view from all sides was amazing. I highly recommend this attraction. Buy your tickets in advance to avoid waiting in long lines!

Go on a clear day and you will see for miles across Toronto and beautiful Lake Ontario with its island. Well worth a visit. Has indoor and outdoor viewing areas and a glass floor for those who don't mind heights!
My 2nd time to the tower. And view is still amazing. We didn't go to the skytower, but that's on the to do list. Always love walking on the glass and look down.
If you have a lot of free time you can spend some here nothing very interesting comparing to similar observation decks in other cities (like Sydney) the realy interesting thing here is the edge walk
