We had dinner at the top for my wife's birthday. The meal was amazing as was the view. The rotation of the restaurant takes an hour so you will have a chance to see everything. I would recommend making reservations for just prior to dusk so that you can see the city in the daylight, and also at night. The...

Sensing a thrill of being in the height. Standing or lying down on the glass floor of the tower and looking down is a wonderful experience. Indeed, it is a beautiful place for sightseeing Toronto 360 degree from above.
We really enjoyed the views and pushed ourselves to lay on the glass floors. The restaurant was very delicious too but not cheap.

We took a two grade three classes to the CN Tower, a couple of months ago. The children had the most amazing time learning about the entire structure. There was even a children's play area which was used after lunch. They had a blast and so did the parent volunteers and the teachers. We all felt like tourists and the...

Was excited to see the glass floor but it's only about 2ft long so you don't really see much. Rest of the views were nice but we went after dark and you only really saw the reflection of the lightbulbs on the window so no real photo ops. Nice if it's your first time in the city.
Everyone should at least go once. It is not the cheapest thing to do but it is worth going up the tower and seeing the city from a birds eye view.

This was part of the city pass and the best part is we didn't have to wait in line to get the tickets. The elevator goes up really fast and we had excellent views of the city. The glass floor was just a little scary to see how far up you are.
If you are visiting Toronto this is one of the best places to see the coty from. Choose a sunny day for your visit. The scenary is amazing!
Incredible view of Toronto. I think it's the most important place there besides all the amazing ones

Pretty much like all the high building attractions. Good views of the city which is larger than you think and it's one of those things to cross off your bucket list. I preferred the Eiffel Tower even though it's a lot smaller.
Sadly we could not go up the tower as we did not have time as we were due to fly home but we did watch the variety of lighting effects and were impressed by the rainbow effect.

You have great view on Toronto.That's it.Got begged to go up by kids, they were so excited to up so high... And got disappointed by nothing but a view. Yes, you have a glass floor. Yes, it's scary for some. But for what's in there the "attraction" is just highly overpriced.If you are coming from abroad, it...

I thought that I'd get tired of visiting the CN Tower every time a family member or friend comes to Toronto and wants to go up in the Tower and see the view, but I've been there over two dozen times and it never gets old. It's amazing going up in the open glass elevator and then walking on the...
Cost is prohibitive to some for sure, but for a visit to Toronto it is a must see. Great views and history to read about. Also be sure to visit Casa Loma.

I am scared of heights but couldn't miss a visit to the CN tower and so glad I went up. The view is spectacular and you see for miles. For those not scared, walk on the glass floor or take it to the next level and do an edge walk. We spent several hours in the tower including grabbing a...
Food came out quickly, a little under seasoned, but fresh. Very classy restaurant. A little annoyed that they didn't have valet.
Good place to have a high perspective of town. Transparent floor. Everything is closed so photograps are not the best.

Lots & lots of waiting for elevators. I think the wait to get down is longer than the wait to go up.The experience itself is pretty cool. My favorite part was looking down into the Rogers Centre while the Blue Jays were playing a game. (Don't do that if you have a weak stomach tho)
I'm afraid of hights, and still I went up !!! Very glad I did this, and will never forget this experience.
I would recommend thisGreat view of the city can get very busy so be patient also I would recommend you go to the glass floor amazing view!
This is undoubtedly one of the top attractions in North America, definitely Toronto. I keep going here once in awhile to see what's new. Always a good surprise and I always have an amazing time.
This is a tick box and must to do when you are in Toronto. CN tower was world tallest tower once but still worth for city views.

They hide the length of the queues from you so it isn't until you have paid your money that you see the queue winding round. We completely missed the sunset we went for and it was horrible queuing with my husband who has health issues and finds it uncomfortable to stand for long periods of time. Had we known the...

I'v been in the CN Tower a few times now. As far as going up High buildings goes, this is my favorite. The learning side of things is, the gift shop is excellent and they also have 2 restaurants. The views are just amazing (try and go just before sunset).The 360 restaurant is a very high quality restaurant and...
The view is spectacular. Plan on taking the elevator up on a nice sunny day or on a clear night. The view of the city lights is beautiful.

We've been to tall towers all over the world. The 360 degree revolving restaurant in the CN tower is truly special because the food is so outstanding too. (I had the prime rib.) You get to see the entire city as the whole restaurant slowly turns while you enjoy and excellent meal. (Admission to the other observations decks is included.)

It is, of course, the best view of the city. We went in on a Thursday in January, so there were no waiting lines to buy the tickets, or elevators. It is expensive, but it's totally worth it. The glass floor is very impressive, outside walk offers a great view all around the tower.If you're going to visit the...
Excellent views from the tower. Not very packed when we went. Good gift shop and very friendly and helpful staff would recommend.
Outrageous ticket prices, ok for a one time visit during your entire lifetime. Go on a clear day else a waste of money

It is a landmark and once you have done it once, no real need to go back. Elevator is fun, unless of course you are afraid of heights. The glass floor is a hit. The restaurant is very expensive for what it is.
The view is great of course and there is some information on the history of the building. But aside from that its more an expensive novelty than anything.

Luckily we could get up without to much of a wait. Price was up there for what it is. I guess everyone needs to go up the CN tower when they visit Toronto. Views were great. Visiting the upper deck wasn't really worth the extra money. On a windy day the tower does physically move quite a bit so be...
Took me a while to step on the glass floor after I convinced my brain it was safe. I would totally recommend that you visit this venue. Did not have the nerves to do the edge walk yet!
I love the CN Tower but it's pretty expensive now. However it's still my go to place to take visitors to the city.
From the plane I already saw how huge it is! It's amazing! The glass floor is pretty nice and scary (for me). The view is perfect and great for pictures! Loved it!

Kids had always seen and heard about the CN Tower and really wanted to go but always too long a line on previous trips as we didn't plan ahead. This trip we booked ahead and showed up at 9am on a weekday. No line at all...perfect. Obviously it's nice and clean and professional and organized. We visited the main level...
This was fun. I don't think we would have went if we didn't have the city pass. I really liked the airport right on the water. We went in the morning and there was not a line.
Is a must to do and help you get over any height pheobia ! I advise to buy the city pass as it works out cheaper.
It's truly a great monument, and the view is great. But there is a long wait to get up the elevator. Be prepared for 30 min-2 hours.

Ok, it's not the tallest in world anymore, but still well worth a trip up.The views are amazing, couple of decent restaurants, one fine dining in the revolving deck and the other good quality burgers etc. It's worth paying the few dollars more to get to the nacelle level where you can feel the building swaying.
What a perfect experience. The glass bottom floor is so scary but makes for some great pictures! Not a long wait time.
We really enjoyed looking out over Toronto. We waited and chose a clear day to get the best view! Such a beautiful city! We also paid to go up to the sky pod which was worth the nominal fee.
You can really feel the tower swinging when up there (it swings several feet easily).Stand on the glass bottom :)
Me and my son went up in the tower. we thought the price was a little high. The guide in the lift told the point of interest in a good way. the scenery is great. The Restaurant was completely full.

If you go to Toronto, you have to visit the CN Tower. The views from the top of the surrounding area are amazing. It might be worth getting a city pass if visiting, as I forgot about the additional tax added to the overall price.We visited during the day, so can't comment on night views, but imagine they are...
Had a great time. The only drawback was the lines. Great view from the revolving restaurant! The food was pretty good for a tourist attraction.
Amazing view overlooking Toronto.. the glass floor.?sorry im not able for it?? i did stand on the side only.it was a good craic!
We had a dinner in CN tower and everything was perfect. Great view and beautiful view over the whole city.
A must see to get a better perspective of the Toronto skyline! Eye candy , without the sugar, height will not stir you. Bring a jacket it's pretty breezy and a few degrees lower up there.

A good way to see the city but we payed pull price and were after told we could not go outside. There were different options people were offered but we were not offered anything so we're unsure of what all you could do at the top.
Worth a visit, especially with the citypass. Not the best place to take someone phobic of heights - husband was not a fan!

Decided to visit the tower with my daughter. I used air miles card and got a 15% discount. Going through security will slow you down so leave plenty of time for that. The outside observation deck was closed due to high winds but we still had a great time. Check online for discount codes that are current or on their...

This should be the first thing you do once you get to Toronto. This is a can't miss and you get quite an interesting view of the city. It was not super crowded when I was there, I suppose it was because it was in the morning.This is a "can't miss"
Good experience with young kids. The staff is very nice and helpful. Went on Jan 1st and it was not crowded at all, no need for us to pre-purchase tickets in advance.

If visiting the Toronto area, take time out to go up the CN Tower. Not only is it exciting to ride the elevator you will have spectacular views of the city. Worth taking time out to enjoy this opportunity!

I have been up the CN Tower many times both during the day and night. Each time it has been spectacular. Better than Sears Tower, Empire State Building, John Hancock for sure. Elevator ride up is amazing. Observation deck and outdoor viewing area is incredible. If you have time and can afford it, the restaurant is very nice...

The queue for the tickets was not too long but we queued one and half hours for the lifts but it wasn't worth the wait really as we felt we'd seen it all after around 20 minutes. People with children found it difficult to keep them entertained - bring water! The views were good and the glass floor was entertaining....
The views were not that spectacular for the price you pay. Best part was the glass bottom floor that looks down on the aquarium.

It was always on my list of things to go and do. My boyfriend surprised me with tickets to go up the CN Tower. This was an amazing achievement to do. It was very windy and cold on top of the tower. We got some funny videos of each of us walking around outside the tower. I'd definitely like to...

I took my girls here for a improtu vacation and was delighted to get a reservation last minute. If you are taking children get last available reservation for lunch. It is cheaper, and you get the best of both worlds for the view. We were able to see everything in complete daylight to the sun setting, and night city line...

Very nice view, worth seeing once in your life, slightly pricy but it is the CN tower after all, other things you can do up there as well if your planning more than walking a circle. There is no rush which is nice

No trip to Toronto is complete without a visit to the CN Tower. We have found at peak periods it is more pleasant to visit early in the morning or late in the day. Waits to get to the "top" can get quite long. Having Dinner at the tower is well worth it. While the cost is a little more...
A must see while in Toronto so beautiful at night... one of Canada's highlights enjoy the view...you won't be disappointed
Whenever we have visitors from out of town we take them here. Price is a bit steep but it's hard to beat that view and the gift shop is great. Nice restaurant too.

The view all round is amazing as you can see the different parts of the city and plan out your trip. The glass floor gives you chance to really get an idea of how far you are up along with a quite unnerving first step.

We dropped in, completely on a whim, no planning, happened to be downtown. It was a beautiful clear day, with a great breeze. It was fantastic, on the outside screened deck, was very enjo\yable, great pictures.The ride up is very good, and the wait line was very short, we were up in no time.Was a bit more expensive...
Climbed the stairs in a fundraiser for WWF Canada.. always a great place to visit . The view is spectacular .

I went during the summer when my mom and aunt had friends visiting from the Czech republic. We only did the tour around and the glass floor section. Everyone had a good time, and the view was great as there was not a cloud in the sky. However, it is very expensive and everything inside (food, photo taking and editing,...

If you've been up one tall building you've been up them all. Just as with the Space Needle in Seattle, there is nothing special about the CN tower. You get some decent views, sure, but is that worth the extortionate fee of going? Not whatsoever. I only went as it was part of the CityPass and as expected I wasn't...

I did the edgewalk which was amazing, if you actively like heights it's the one for you! The tower itself was very boring though and no where near as entertaining as say the empire state building or willis tower.

Worth a trip but we recommend having dinner there first as it includes the tower tour as well, and you have faster exit through the restaurant rather than with the tours only elevator " tip, if you go back to the restaurant through the snack bar via the spiral staircase to take the elevator back down"
We went up there on a cloudy morning, after an hour or so it cleared up nicely. Giving a beautifull view of the surroundings. A must for all visiting toronto.

It's a great view from the top, but $35 is a lot of money to just walk around and look out over the city. If I had it to do over, I'd put the money toward dinner in the 360 Restaurant and get the same view plus a meal for a little more.

Thank goodness we go free tickets! The price to go up the tower was ridiculous!The view is impressive and of course, it was freezing, but some great photo ops so cant complain too much ;-)Do it once, but try and get a free ticket or a discount - it's not worth what they charge!

We did the SkyWalk and it was the most amazing and thrilling experience we have ever had. The 360 degree view was out of this world and at no point did we feel unsafe while hanging 1,168 feet high. The crew was super friendly and helpful.

column3: Nova Scotia's Bay of Fundy and Annapolis Valley, Canada
column4: The lines were long but moved fairly quickly. The ticket prices were expensive for what you actually get and if you want to go up in the highest tower there's an additional fee. It's the kind of thing that you do only once to say that you did it. And if you do go, make sure it's a nice day...
A must do while in Toronto. Note, for those family members who are height adverse, there is enough to keep them busy while waiting for the brave.
A little pricey worth one trip up glass floor was great ride up was fun had lunch in restaurant it turned the view was fantastic
Of course the city and water views are wonderful, but we especially enjoyed the acrylic platform where you feel like you are walking on air. Surprisingly scary and fun!
Visited at 11am on a clear day. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Views amazing and the food was excellent in the restaurant. Would recommend.
No trip is complete to Toronto without going to the CN Tower. It's not the best looking building and the views are just ok. But it's fun to jump on the glass ceiling.

Thoroughly enjoyed visiting here, after doing the Burj Khalifa in Dubai. Similar immaculate views way across into Toronto and further into Canada. The glass floor looking down into Ripley's Aquarium was fun too!

Not a fan of heights, so this was a mixed experience for me! I went later in the day, in mid December, which meant there were fewer tourists, and no queues. But the sunset was spectacular, and the staff were very helpful in pointing out sites of interest, when asked. (A shame there wasn't more written information available on the...

Busy to go up....good view but is only half of the observatory is observable because you need to pay extra to be seated in the cafe to see more. Had already booked to go 360 restaurant another day so have not seen much really. Glass floor is a tiny section only.Only 2 of 4 lifts were operative so a...

There was a security check before buying the tickets. We went on 31 Dec and there was no queue. It was raining and the view at the tower was limited to only the downtown area, so do avoid on days with bad weather. The view of the downtown area was average as there was no particular landmark that was spectacular....

I enjoyed the experience of visiting the CN Tower. I am extremely afraid of heights but I am very adventurous. I conquered the glass floor ?! It's a bit pricey but well worth it for the memory. Today was a pretty sunny day, which would have been great, except for the fact it made it very difficult to get great...

We visited today and had a really good time. The highlights were the glass floor in the lifts going up which made my stomach feel a little funny but also made you truly appreciate the height and again when you get to the top there is an area with a glass floor that you can see right down to the...

What can I say...if your in Toronto a must visit...but time to visit is when the sun is up and about to set.. you're able to see the area during the day...and the city at night..wow can I say. It's a must see.
A great family outing. The view from the top was amazing. We were a bit disappointed by the glass walk which was only in a small area. Also despite it being a sunny day, pictures were not too clear.

"When in Rome, do as the Romans do." So, when in Toronto, do not miss a visit to the iconic CN Tower.Check weather advisories before planning a trip (i.e. if it is foggy, plan for another day) and check the schedule of other activities in the Tower (i.e. I was there on a Tuesday and they do not have...

Queues to get to the lifts to go up the tower but expected at such a huge landmark. Going up at night is a great experience and the glass floor was great fun. Great time going up in the lift on the outside too!

A friend recommended to eat at the 360 restaurant. Definetly worth it.You need to reserve a table and have the choice of either a 2-course or 3-course menu (fixed price), or you order a la carte.The food is amazing, the waiters friendly and the view is stunning!It's way better than just going up for sightseeing and going...
It's an expensive and timely ordeal to get to the top. In my opinion it is not worth it. Willis tower in Chicago has far better set up and view.

The CN Tower is a sight to see from its incredible height and building of the venue to the attractions inside. Breaking bread in The 360 Restaurant is a pleasurable experience but rather expensive, the activities are not for the height shy as you get the opportunity to look through the glass floor or do the walk around the outside...

Go to the glass floor, it was really the best part of the tower. I went extra high onto the tripod and you could technically watch a Blue Jays game from that vantage point. Bring coupons if you are to go and be prepared to wait, as there will be a fairly long line to get on the elevators. It...

Attraction itself is always a joy to visit. The queue is tailored such that you have to take a photo on the way in. At the end of our visit we then had to wait at the rather busy desk with no serving system in place and when it finally got to our turn there was no photo to mark...
A fabulous rotating experience. The staff was attentive and my glass was always full. The view was amazing over the lake and as dusk turned into nightfall and the city lights came on. Beautiful!
CN Tower has a magnificent sightseen of Toronto's City, 360 degrees around the tower to take pictures!!!

We went to the 360 restaurant and it was an incredible experience. We had the chicken and the pork loin both were exquisite. Dinner includes you the trip to the observation room and the glass floor which was pretty scary but great at the same time. Overall a great experience with the most amazing views in Toronto. You should make...

We beat the snow showers by going early although it was interesting to see a shower reaching down from the sky to the lake. it is interesting to see how many new buildings there are since my last visit 6 years ago.

Too expensive.. but considering its the landmark of Toronto (and may be of Canada), it will be cashed!! :-)The glass floor is interesting..and pretty scary.. Its wonderful to see scared adults while children jump on the glass floor..If you like adventure try the walk on the top outside the tower - hanging on a rope..

The glass floor is where is at! The prices are a little steep, but if you're going to be there anyway, I'd totally splurge if I were you. You do have to wait for an elevator both ways and you will be packed tightly into that elevator. Seriously, if you have issues with claustrophobia, that elevator ride will be hell.

It's more impressive to look at than to go in to.We went at night so it was really hard to get a good picture. Maybe if you go during the day it is more impressive.I would keep your cash for something else.
Great 360º View of Toronto that must be visited. The glass floor showing the ceiling of the aquarium is an attraction for the child
It is a great view that is undeniable however it isn't exactly inexpensive. perhaps its a bit of a tourist trap.

CN Tower is obviously a fun attraction to see when visiting Toronto. The views are lovely and they do offer a VERY unique option of being hooked up in something resembling a sky diving suit and being attached to a rail outside the top of the tower and walking the exterior of the tower. NOT Afro the faint of heart....
Nice place to visit even though the lines are very long , but interesting none the less. A good place for the family.

This was our 1st view from this iconic tower & we weren't disappointed by it. The speed of the lift taking you to the top was incredible, but not overpowering, & the view over the city itself was excellent as it was a very clear day. The snack-bar was sensibly priced & I had a snack & drink while looking...

If you are visiting Toronto, this is obviously a must-see. Every time we have out-of-town visitors, they want to go up the tower and I am happy to oblige. On our most recent visit, we were on a family "staycation". My younger son hadn't been up to the top yet, and asks all the time, so he was so excited...
Amazing viewI went with my cousins they loved it so much and so did I. If your scared of heights it doesn't matter

Like Seattle or NY Statue of Liberty, one of those stops you need to do as a tourist. A bit expensive if do general admission plus the high deck for another $12. For two people it came to $100. Yes, you see sights and all, but entire trip over in 30 - 40 min.

I live near Toronto, but had never gone up the CN Tower in my life. We went up the tower for free as part of our reservation at 360 - otherwise, I think it's about 35$ per person to go to the observation deck and glass floor. The view is cool, and if I were travelling some distance I'd probably...

This is a very important landmark in Toronto, Canada. It is also one of the Seven Wonders of the Modern World, and the tallest building in North America. This place is a fun place for adults and children, and for tourists in Toronto, this is probably the number one thing on their list. Think of it this way, it is...

CN Tower is one of thing to do in Toronto. The tower is beautyful building. I didn't need to wait in line because it was not so many tourist at this cold day. It was great and view is so amazing. It was nice to drink cup of coffe at the restaurant in top of the tower. For others I...

Always worth going to see the CN tower is a Toronto icon. I was living in Toronto when it was being built. Nice place to eat, great views of all over, plus some fun things to do, walk outside around the tower etc
Thrilling ride to the observatory! Great view of the city and beyond. It is a must visit while in downtown Toronto.

How people go and do the walk outside the top of the tower, I'll never know, but the view is incredible. The glass floor had be terrified, but we were lucky to be up top on a clear day and it was a great trip to Toronto.

Very excellent time here.I am extremely scared of heights Hahaha so yeah that was the worst of my experience. To be honest though the elevator was super fast and not all of the elevator was exposed.When we made it to the top the whole floor spun, but nothing extreme. The view was stunning. This was definitely a memory...

Great place to have a lovely dinner with my mom, to celebrate her 70th birthday. Food was good, service very accommodating (menu in different languages), you get to have tour picture taken for the "souvenir picture" (we haven't taken it, felt a little out of place to offer this kind of product there". The great thing too is you get...
This is a must do for Toronto. The restaurant is great as well. The edge walk i have not tried but looks great.

The restaurant is nice but like many restaurants high above in an iconic landmark, you are there for the view not necessarily the cuisine. The walk along the edge outside is definitely very cool and fun if you have extra funds but also not my top recommendation for spending if on a budget. Feel the same about going up to...
Taking the elevator up to the observation level is worth the ride. The glass floor up there is scary but exciting. Defi

Okay so it is a MUST do if visiting Toronto which I'm sure you would know already.I would say try and get their early as I ended up waiting about 2 hours in like to get to the top.Once you are up there it is totally worth it! 360 degree views of the city. Beautiful. Stand on the...
I visited the Canada's mosted amazing landmark. It is must visit place on the visit to Toronto. the view is mesmerizing. I will highly recommend this place.

column3: Grand Turk, null, Turks and Caicos Islands
column4: Beautiful view! Worth the amount. Staffs are wonderful! Getting there can be difficult if you're walking so I would suggest to catch the subway nearest to it and go from there.

We got the City Pass, so this was one of our stops. The tower is very cool looking from the outside and it's fun to hear a little more about it. The elevator ride was quick and fun and the views from the top were worth the short wait. There's even a bar at the top where you can have...

CN Tower is apparently the tallest needle in North America. It offers a great view of Toronto skyline and the glass bottom view is really cool.It's definitely an overpriced experience however I think it's one of the most interesting attractions in Toronto.

We visited the CN Tower viewing levels after dinner at 360. It contained great facts about the Tower and other tall monuments, had great views from the glass floor, and even offers a dramatic adventure of hanging outside on the ledges over the city. This is not for the faint of heart! Be prepared to be amazed at the spectacular...

The view was absolutely stunning. We ate at the rotating restaurant & the food/ view was phenomenal. It's a must do. The very top view (cost extra) isn't really worth it. We went while the sun set & it was perfect. Must go here if you're in the 6.
Good timing no crowd just touch and go for us been here before. View alone is worth it watching planes lands on the airport, clear enough to see across lake Ontario

The view at the CN Tower is awesome and the glass floors are very cool to take pictures on! At the highest level you can feel the tower sway if its a windy day. A must visit in Toronto. (Visited in 2015)

My family and I visited the revolving restaurant at the top of CN tower xmas eve 2016 whilst visiting Toronto. The food was exquisite,the steaks are enormous, the attention from staff was second to none. The wine is blooming expensive, I'd wait till you got home. We had a booth which was fab , slightly raised above the window tables,...

Back after more than twenty years.... view still great (even better as Toronto is undergoing a housing boom) but a bit disappointed that, besides the view, options at the Tower remains much of the same as of the 90s: glass floors, the on-top restaurant and express elevators.A renovation and improvement of entertainment options (suggestion: an IMAX theater about Canada...
$107 for a half an hour experience, could of hung it out by spending MORE money in the restaurant or cafe but no!!!.

Well, for me was incredible, me boyfriend and I were taking an awesome look from the first part of the tower, were the glass floor is. But then we were to the second part (which is $12 plus), and he proposed to me! Haha giving you guys and idea.From there you will have the entire city!By nite it's...
It is the place to visit in Toronto. You have a great view of the city and also has a restaurant. A must see landmark

Iconic tower in the center of Toronto affords great views of the city. The glass floor causes some small amount of vertigo ;-) The optional "edge walk" seems like an adrenaline booster but you have to be able to afford the $195 cdn per person to do it. Small restaurant in the public area. Nicer restaurant with "probably" higher prices....

All of the travel sites boasted that this was a must see location. I was disappointed in how little it offered. It didn't live up to the hype. We had gotten city passes which were a wonderful value but didn't expedite the long lines at the CN tower.
Kids loved...great views...be advised it's high if you are scared of heights...but must do while in Toronto
We visited at night and it was beautiful!!!! The restaurant is also very good to spend the evening with your partner. Absolutely loved the evening

No longer holding the most impressive world records, it is a rather expensive trip to the top. As locals, we did have fun identifying buildings and neighbourhoods from the awesome vantage point. Also, go in the summer, the visibility is an important element.

Amazing 360°view of the financial city, entertainment area, harbour area.....great historic and engineering details details of the tower provided on the walls at the top.....standing on the glass floor is a breathtaking anf heart pounding experience....since we went in the winters, the edge was not possible as it was too windy and extremely cold.....
a great view of Toronto and the Island, pretty good food at the cafe...not the greatest for pricing but definitely a worth while visit

The CN Tower is my favorite Toronto attraction. The dome is packed with information about the building and staff at every corner to answer questions. The clear elevator was such an interesting experience and gives you the opportunity to look out over the city. The dome had views of the city and views of the lake. There was a glass...

Living in Toronto, I visit the CN Tower every couple of years. They continually make updates the attractions, have very friendly staff, and make it a must see for people visiting the city.It can be quite busy on weekends and during the summer, so it's best to try and visit in early mornings if possible.

I remember as a kid my Dad would drive from up north to take me here. Now I take my wife to the restaurant and do all the things I use to do as a kid. Still after 30 years this is still one of my favorite things to do while visiting Toronto. Friendly staff. Amazing food. Look out. Glass...
Lovely but my advice is that visit this place only in summer. I came here in December and it was too cold and breezy. So the edge walk was not opened.
We had the 3 course dinner just after sunset. The food was amazing. The staff were very helpful and cheery.

This is the number one must on everyone's visit to Toronto. Paris without the Eiffel Tower. The ultimate way to experience it, is lunch at the top in the revolving restaurant. It gives you access to the express elevator to the top - no waiting in lines. A delightful lunch in which time you will complete one revolution around the...
One towering landmark of Toronto. One surely can't miss this one amazing structure. Nice place to visit with family.
CN Tower is a wonderful place to visit once and a while. It provides you with a stunning view of Toronto and its surroundings.

A must see on any trip to Toronto. Everyone should experience this at least once. The glass floor is amazing!!They have a beautiful gift shop with a variety of CN Tower and Toronto souvenirs. Get the souvenir photo! It's a great keepsake from your day.

Since the late 1970's the CN Tower has been "the view" of the city. It is like a fly by without an aircraft.I have been up the tower several times, showing it to friends and family who visit Toronto. It never gets dull. The view is beyond compare and it is really cool to see weather systems headed towards...
Great tower and spectacular views but waiting time of over an hour to get up tower takes some of the gloss away.
Good foods.and good servise nise location in down town toronto parking is expensive.very nise sinery from the top of the CN tOWER.

Just thinking that will be going to the top of the highest building in Toronto will raise your Adrenaline and increase your heart beats. It is really fantastic to be up there viewing the lake, the airport and the City. If you are dare enough, try doing the breath holding activities. Do not forget to take your camera to shoot...
A great way to see the City of Toronto. Centrally located in downtown Toronto close to the Rogers Centre ( Blue Jays Baseball play here)

I visited the CN Tower along with my spouse on a City Pass Ticket. The pass has a single entry ticket that entitles you to ride up the elevator which rises up to the top via the stem of the tower. It has a glass shell so you can see the surroundings as you are elevated to the highest point....

We were advised to combine trip up the tower with the restaurant at sunset and it was really worth it. Once we found out where to go we were whisked up the tower with a great view of the city on the way up and given our table overlooking the lake. The service was good without feeling that we were...

This is an oldie but a goodie. Everyone has to walk on the glass floor of the CN tower and look down if you dare. The food is surprisingly good at the restaurant and would be a unique place for a special night out. Go on a clear day!
I took my dad to CN Tower when he was here in the summer. He loved it! The view of the city is spectacular. A must see!

The elevator is extremely fast. The moment you get to the viewing platforms. At the bottom of the ramp I recommend a walk through the glass floor. Walk more than 400 meters under the ground glass is "creepy".
I went during a bitter cold snap before Lake Ontario froze over and you could see very cool thermals rising out of the lake like tornados of steam hundred of feet high.

Food was very good, as was the wine, service too. We've eaten at many good restaurants in Toronto but if you want a good meal out, matching most others in town, the CN Tower offers a feature that no other can match - what a view as you go slowly around. It is worth the money alone.

Everything looks mini when your almost a kilometer in the sky! The food was decent and as we went into it thinking it was going to be pricy we were not dismayed when the prices were more reasonable than expected!
It's a nice place to visit. But you have to choose a good time so you can see the hole city from above. A little bit pricy.
It has a beautiful view overlooking the city. Only suggestion is to go just before it gets dark as you can see the both daylight view and evening view when the city lights up.
Great parking close by. Excellent view of the whole city. Just enough adrenaline rush for my 11 yr old
I went to the CN tower just after a heavy snowfall, and the views were amazing! Looked like icing on a cake!Definitely a must do when visiting Toronto.

The price for admission is quite steep and, if you've been before, might not entirely be worth a repeat admission, but I say that as someone who has real issues with heights. The views, though, are incredible.

Well worth the price of admission to get spectacular views of Toronto! It's amazing to see the people who pay big bucks to hang off the edge of the tower in harnesses. You could not pay me to do that! There's a nice restaurant on top. We did not eat there, and a gift shop on the way out which...

I went in a Sunday afternoon to see both day and night. I did not even have to wait. Great view and not too many people up there. Not good for taking pictures because there is either glass or other barriers in the way. Also the glass floor is very small.

if it Toronto, need to check this off your list, that's it. at the end of the day, (yet) another tall building, long lines, expensive tickets, crazy priced pictures...but what you gonna do! its a good experience getting to the top, the glass floors are very cool!get tickets online please!

The CN tower still offers the best view of the city of Toronto from all vantage points.A must for tourists and locals alike. The glass window elevator makes for a tummy tickling ride. The views are spectacular of the city and the lake.

This is the kind of place you go to once, maybe twice, likely with out-of-towners. But it's so worth the wait, the admission, and your time. The views are amazing! On a clear day, you might see the mist from Niagara Falls if you're lucky. The entire city is laid out below and beyond, almost like a miniature toy. I...
Pretty expensive to visit. Get a city pass and go to the aquarium much better value. Nothing else to say
Enjoyed the experience with my family, you get some great views of Toronto on a clear day. Well worth the visit but is slightly expensive.
The CN Tower is amazing, whether it be for local residents or worldly travellers The CN Tower is simply a one of a kind experience!

Be careful you choose a day, if possible, where the sky seems clear. We only had a weekend to choose from and went on a mostly cloudy day which was a shame for the view from the top but still really neat, especially as the elevators let you look outside as you go up so you could see the cloud...

Wonderful views across the city. We were lucky to go up on a clear, sunny day in December and were rewarded with fantastic views over the city seeing for miles and miles around. We headed up to the sky pod also and had the whole level to ourselves which was great. It is quite pricey to go up, but worth...

A popular attraction for tourist, local's . Either approach it as a physical workout and or gentle approach to see Toronto downtown core from one of the highest structure and advance points. Well worth the experience.Even more worth while, & exciting make it a charity event! Simply climb the stairs and feel those muscle score as you excel. Good...
Great for the spectacular views and the dining experience at the 360 restaurant is a unique dining experience. It's good to knock off your bucket list, but definitely not worth a repeat visit.

First time visiting. We were there in the afternoon, the views were great, it was something to see. I zoomed in on the Toronto Blue Jays game thru my camera. The skyline probably would've looked better at night. Recommend getting "Toronto CityPASS" gives you a discount on multiple attractions. Use it next door at Ripleys Aquarium, that is worth going...

Down town attraction. When in Toronto, please do not miss to visit such a beautiful place. You can see major parts of Toronto from the TOP of it. Smooth sailing elevator, takes you on TOP in just less than a minute.

We spent a few hours up here having lunch and taking in the view. The food here is amazing and well worth the price you pay.If you are on a budget don't go up for food but definitely go up to the observation deck, the view is breath taking.

The line up to get tickets, the wait to get on the elevators, the crowds of people taking selfies may be good for some but not for everyone. This is a great tourist attraction and something worth seeing. Be prepared for long waits though. You get to see some beautiful skyline from up at the top. Wasn't for me though.
The CN Tower is a must see attraction when visiting Toronto, you can see why it is the most iconic building in Ontario, the views and overall experience are amazing.

Instead of paying approx. $35 each to go up the tower, my husband and I paid $54 each for a 2 course meal at the 360 degree restaurant at the top of the tower, taking time to soak in the views as it slowly rotates. We splashed out a little more on drinks, but the food was amazing and with...

Our daughter booked into the 360 degree restaurant at the top of the Tower. It was a sunny evening and the views are fantastic as it revolves so you get the 360 view. The food and service are excellent well worth the fast lift and getting over the fear of heights
We went to the CN tower during our first trip to Toronto. I was not impressed. There is only a small section of the floor that is glass. It is a nice view but not worth the money!
A must visit if you visit Toronto. Gives you amazing views and 360 degrees of skyline. Ideally located next to Ripleys aquarium which is also worth a visit . Possible to do both in one day.

The Canadian National Tower (CN Tower) is a huge tower built in the coast of Toronto) next to the Roger's Center Stadium and near the Center of Toronto. Going there is a great experience, you can entirely see Toronto from the top, if you want, you can even eat in the restaurant located in the Tower, or if you prefer...

My friend and I visited Toronto as our first trip to Canada, so we made sure to hit all the tourist spots. The CN Tower is NOT to be missed. They have a glass floor where brave people can walk out and look down at the ground and different levels, depending on how high you want to go up. Both...

Very tall tower with excellent views of the entire city, even all the way to Niagara Falls on a clear day. Good restaurants in the building, and well worth a visit to enjoy the view without having to take a helicopter. There is an available outdoor walk around the edge for the adventurous.

Very nice place to see Toronto 360 view from the height of ~350 meters. Nice views via windows, place also to walk outside to feel the breeze and about 10 see-thorough tiles to stand on and look down. Very nice all in all. There is an option to purchase additional ride for a ~450 meters high view. Personally I do...
visited this at night pouring rain very high winds went outside at the top what a night time view fantastic experience with the glass floor glad we visited it.
Great opportunity to see Toronto from up high. I do believe that the value without a city pass is not there however.

I have been up to the top of lots of towers in the world. They are generally mostly the same where ever you go.This is good, on a clear day you get a great view of the city and the airport plus the lakes. We could even see the mist from Niagara Falls in the distance the day I...

Ate on the lunch set menu as this looked to be better value than the evening version. Although the food was lovely, we really just visited for the view which was great!! It's far better to take in the views whilst eating than from the crowded viewing deck, just make sure to book a table next to the window.
Breath taking view of the city and Ontario lake. Must visit if you are visiting the downtown Toronto. Highly recommended.

Panorama flying in or out in airplane are alot better because it is significantly higher; although much more brief. I am not one of those who value a better view from a higher vantage point because I enjoy the details of a visit to places more than seeing it from a distance. There is a restaurant up on top but...
I've spent time in all the levels and this is a great building. The food is good, prix fixe makes it a steal. Views are great from the deck. Can't beat the view.

Features:360 Restaurant: A good place to eat and watch the scenery. This restaurant spins (not too slow, not too fast) and has good food. A little expensive though.Edge Walk: Scary and cool.Glass Floor: Can see the floor below, very scary.Observation Points: Good scenery, can see Toronto very clearly.
I really wanted to go up in the CN tower. Fortunately for us I chose a time where there were no lines, and the cost was reduced. I was happy to see the city skyline and locals in the distance.

I visited the CN Tower with a few friends while staying in Toronto. We decided to take a tour and were glad that we did.Our host provided us with lots of information about the history of the tower. We had the option to do some bungee jumping thing, but we passed on that.A great landmark to visit!

Although an impressive feat of engineering and an important part of the city, don't pay just for the view. If you've been up a tower before, don't spend CAD$40 to do this for the view. Perhaps winter is the wrong time to go, but thought this was very overpriced for what it was, wouldn't recommend it.
You get to see nice views of the city, so that's a plus. I was expecting the glass floor to be more exciting though.
From the Toronto Islands up to just beside it, this tower is amazing - very iconic indeed.We did not get inside anymore due to the expnse but we were still awed by its outside appearance....

It's funny how I have lived in Seattle for over 20 years and only been to Space Needle twice, and not because I wanted to, but because I had some guests in town. But once you go to a different city, you can't help yourself to visit the main symbol that represents that city. CN Tower not only takes you...

I heard horror stories about waiting hours to get in. I arrived first thing in the morning and there was no wait or line up so I got to go straight up!The elevator is cool! Goes up super quick and partially made of glass so you can see yourself moving faster away from the ground!!When you get to...
This was great for views of Toronto. Had a glass floor for viewing straight down to the street below. Expensive entry price, probably would not go again.

We went to the Tower dressed up with my 15 yrs old niece to celebrate her and our anniversary. View was amazing. Food great. Loved the charcuterie appetizer and the mushroom chowder. But the ambiance didn't have the same classy feeling as in the past. The wait staff seemed in a hurry to move people through. The a la carte...

If you don't mind the traffic in downtown Toronto, then this place is for you. I love the glass floor though I was scared to step on it at first. The restaurant at the top served great food. Good place to visit and enjoy the view.

Enjoyed a spectacular view of our city while enjoying a great meal complimented with very attentive service. We were pleasantly surprised with the high quality of the food served and it's flavour and presentation. Being a clear day we could see quite far and we enjoyed the scenery watching activity at both the Island and Pearson airports. No one rushed...
If weather permits, you will be able to see as far as New York city. Very impressive! The only concern is traffic and parking in downtown Toronto.

Amazing views in every direction. Go up on a clear sunny day with your camera. The windows are kept washed for good viewing. You can see Pearson airport, Pickering nuclear station, sometimes the plume of water from Niagara Falls, etc. If you eat there, the ride up is free and you can visit the observations decks after the meal.

If you haven't gone up the CN Tower yet you definitely need to go! The price for admission is a bit pricey but it really is worth it. Once you are up there the views of Toronto are beautiful and it's a really cool experience. Make sure to go over to the glass floor too.

Had tickets to the top and the pod, we managed a private lift going up on a Sunday morning. Very friendly and helpful staff. Great facilities and great views! Definitely a must visit on the Toronto list!

This is one of the most popular attractions in all of Toronto and rightfully so. We had this as our first stop on a day-long city tour and LOVED it! What an amazing way to start the day! If you can, go early or very late to avoid lines. The views are stunning and informative as to the layout of...

The CN Tower does what you expect it to do. You go up, get awesome views of the City and surrounds, take some pics and head on down again.The process of moving people through the Tower is smooth and the staff are friendly.The glass floor in the lift is a little scary for some! And being able to...
What a view! Food was good -expensive - but worth it for the view! Make sure you are in the correct queue, if you book for the restaurant you can skip the main queue!

Amazing view of Toronto and surrounding areas. We went to the CN Tower after dark and were able to see the city lights. It would have been nice to see the city during daylight hours as well. There is a restaurant at the top of the tower that offers fine dining with a breathtaking view.

Be sure to buy your tickets on line to save lining up. Of course the views are amazing but there's a great bar/restaurant at the top so be sure to spend some time. Also a fantastic kids play area on the lower floor near the huge gift shop.

There is a reason why Drake put this only his latest album: it is iconic and breathtaking. If you are in Toronto it would be a sin not to go here; this is a tourist trap that surprisngly does not disappoint
A must see when you are in Toronto...it is the landmark in every picture of Toronto. The glass floor is the highlight as well as checking out the 360 degree views of Toronto.
Try to visit the CN tower on a sunny day without the clouds cause you will be able to see the whole Toronto and the view is really great. You might also be able to see the other side of lake Ontario.
We had a a long layover on our way to India and planned to visit the tower. Instead we had a lovely lunch with impressive views at the CN Tower.
Nice view on top.A lot of history a tourist will learn.We never had a chance to go at 360 restaurant as you need to booked before you go there and we didnt know. Bext time we definitely do it.

I was visiting my oldest brother and my other brother and I went up to the SkyPod. There was only 3 of us and I think you can only fit 4 people. We didn't stay very long since the floor and sides are glass and I have a fear of heights. Additionally the SkyPod was swaying, so both of us...

440 Meters above the sky in one of two observation decks, you get an awesome 360 degree view of the entire city skyline and Ontario Lake. On a clear day you can see all the way to the US to Buffalo State.There's a restaurant called the 360 which rotates 360 once and hour. The food is quite good considering...

Was an amazing experience. The view is breath taking all the way to the top. The staff extremely nice. A bit pricey and crowed but worthwhile. Parked across the street for $12! Do recommend and most definitely will go back.

The CN Tower in Toronto, ON, Canada is a must do!!!! People come from all over the world to visit here.Do the WHOLE tour. It's worth it - plus you are already spending enough on a base fare ticket anyway.Go on a clear day. Or in the early evenings so that you get the view in the daylight...

Be sure you pick a nice Clear Day for your visit You Can See For Miles you can see across to New York State. The restaurant at the very top is expensive but top rate. If you go to the restaurant you do not have to pay for the trip up.
When visiting Toronto, this is one of the "must sees". Lovely views of the city and the lake. Make sure to stand on the glass floor for pictures and have a drink at the restaurant.

Had a friend in town from the US, she wanted to check out the CN Tower, I had been a few times when I was young, loved the invisible floor and we had a great time having some drinks and appys....all round, great time....again !!!
I've loved my time at the CN Tower. It something that I will definitely recommend to anyone that go in Toronto.
Loved the view. Food was OK, but not wow. Waiter George is an awesome guy with a smoothing voice (not sure how this helps others, but true).
Great view. Was not expecting the glass elevator (almost the best part) does seem kinda pricey though for just a view. Id skip the sky pod next time. Got better photos from the main deck.
The overall experience was good, the purpose is usually to show visitors from out of town and they were quite overwhelmed.

My husband and I went to visit the CN tower this month. We didn't get the tickets that take you up to the skypod however. My husband loves amazing views so he very much enjoyed this. I also enjoyed it but there wasn't much else to do, so I wasn't overly thrilled by it, to me it's your typical tourist...

This was my second visit at the CN Tower. I like the view from above. I love the glass floor and all the Tower provides. The price for ticket is also very acceptable. What a great place to visit. Nice view from several feet high.

A little expensive, I definitely wouldn't take the whole family, but date night with wife or friends. The meal was good not the best I've ever had but service was excellent and timing was good one full revolution from arrival to dessert. And tour of the tower after. Great night out in Toronto.

We went there in November and didn't have to queue at all, apparently in summer there is a waiting time of 3 hours.You have an excellent view on the city and on the lake, if there are no clouds (something we had to endure for 30 minutes).Take a drink at the cafe and enjoy the view, the even...

The CN tower is a great attraction, whether its your first visit or tenth. I've taken many groups of students there, and all have been impressed. The glass floor is always a hit, as is daring to walk around the open deck.
a gotta see while you visit toronto ,,,been there several times ,,,love to visit there,,,one of a kind place ,,friendly people ,,,
It's a must do thing, good views, a very fast elevator, glass bricks to walk on, good historical information and just fun all around.
The view is free if you have lunch in the restaurant.the staff were very friendly and efficient.the food is good with very good presentation.of course, the view is excellent.would definitely go back.
We visited during a recent 6 day stay and just had to go up and experience the Tower. Not disappointed although we could not do the outside walk due to high winds on the day.
Some of the best food I have ever eaten. The drinks are very pricey, so its not good for someone on a budget... but the food and view were well worth it for me.
We enjoyed our visit to the CN Tower and it provided fantastic views of the city! We had lunch in the restaurant and it was a brillIant setting.

Although i had been to this attraction few years back, I took my young family here while visiting Toronto. My kids loved the ride on the super fast elevator to the viewing gallery. we really enjoyed the view of all sides of Toronto. Kids enjoyed looking through the telescopes. Well worth the visit, and a must see in Toronto.
A spectacular view of downtown Toronto. Especially impressed with the glass windows that you can walk on with the view below.
We went to watch the sunset and it did not disappoint. We took photos of the sunset and had drinks at the top. Then we photographed the night sky and the lights of Toronto.
It was a great outing on visit to CNN tower and downtown wow it was fantastic experience after visiting Canada three times before.
This is the second tallest tower in the world. It is well worth going up to the top and seeing this. I also would recommend a restaurant that is up there

It is a nice place to go in Toronto. The view is great. As you go up on the elevator you can see the city and it's so cool. I also enjoyed the glass floor.In my opinion it is a little expensive, specially if you have to pay for kids 5 and 7 years old....

It may seem just touristy and it is but the CN tower offers the most stunning views of the city and a chance to see a unique piece of building and architectural design. There is time to stop and stare at the top. The lifts are crowded and there are significant delays getting in. The security search can be tedious...
the 2nd highest tower in the world - this is something should stop you thinking about visiting it), absolutely amazing views in good weather!

The CN tower is definitely number one on my list as being the best part of my trip to Toronto.The views are stunning!! We opted to eat up there. 2 courses for $65pp is pretty good value considering its like $40 without dinner. I had no expectations that the food would be much good but didn't mind as its...

We had a lunch reservation at the 360 Restaurant . I really didn't expect the food to be as good as it was. Everything was well cooked and tasty. We had main course and desserts. The staff lack enthusiasm and professionalism, if your going to work at a tourist attraction then wake up before you get to work. Not impressed at all,
The CN tower is the third tallets tower in the world. This is a must see in Toronto, it has a great view of Toronto at night and it also has a restaurant, strongly recommended.

It speaks for itself. This is such an important Landmark for Toronto, Ontario and Canada. It is A great facility to come and visit. Do you need to spend the money to travel up to the top? At least once in a lifetime.

Enjoyed dinner at the revolving restaurant as a package including lift price with the meal. The dinner was well prepared and the views were enjoyable. One of those things you have to do. Go to the top of the tower and experience the great view of Toronto.A bit old now but the large pane of glass that gives you a frightening view of the ground was popular back in the day.

Great place to get a view of the city and have a meal whilst doing it.have a meal at the 360 restaurant which includes access to the viewing level.

Wonderful place for you know and appreciate the view.... The price is not the best, but it is fair for the place. There is a very good restaurant . The CN tower is wonderful because you can see all the city and Niagara Falls of far.

The views were great and the elevator ride is an attraction itself. Great views. However, the price seemed a little too high as well.

When in Toronto and if you have a chance I would recommend the 360 restaurant. Unparalleled views of the Toronto skyline. With a great menu for fine dining or special occasions. Worth the $$ along with the outstanding service from the time you arrive till the time you leave. A must see!
Very nice view from this tower. It has a rotating restaurant, a smaller restaurant and a cafe. A glass floor to view straight down. A must visit
Wonderful experience in the CN tower. Had a small dinner on top of the world in the restaurant. Nice area and full of fun sights.

I surprised my 2 teenagers and made reservations at 360 The CN Tower Restaurant. The staff is at every corner so they easily guide you through elevators. Great service and succulent courses at 360. After supper we went on the glass floor and then the deck outside. At night it is beautifully lit. Great memories for my family!
Food is great and the choices are good too. We always go with the prix fix and it never let us down. Plus if you reserve a table at the restaurant your tour is free.

I guess you have to go up the CN Tower if you are visiting Toronto. We enjoyed our visit. We got to the top just in time to see the sunset. One downside is a lot of the views are spoiled due to metal mesh. Not the best tower we've been up but the glass floor is great.

If you're in Toronto you should probably check this out. The view on a clear day is absolutely amazing. While the lines can sometimes be long, the view from the top can make you forget the inconveniences of getting there.

Nothing really else to do at the top than an awesome view. There are still space for improvement and activities and interaction on top. Need some updating. We visited the CN tower in July 2016. It was a nice view of the city. We got the Toronto city pass and used the included ticket for the CN tower. This place gives a great view of the city, and the customer service here is excellent. Be prepare to once to be on a long line many people traveling to Toronto want to come here. It's worth the long wait because of the Amazing view of the city at night.

This is still a good visit. We did it 20 years and were amazed how much the city has grown in that time. The security is pathetic either do it properly or don't bother. The queues on a Monday were very slow. The views are well worth it

If you visit Toronto spend a few hours at the CN Tower. While dinner is required, it is very good. Other than dinner, the observation tower is great. It's always been a dream of mine to visit the tower and I can't believe I finally made it here nevertheless with someone very important to me makes it all that much better. it's an amazing architecture.

The view from above is the same as the view from airplanes, or any other tall building. There was no real "wow" factor for me, but at least I can say I have been there. There's no reason not to include it in your plans.

This is a must do for a first visit to Toronto. Even on relatively cloudy days the view is spectacular, plus the weather changes rapidly. Terrified of heights but just knew this was something I had to do. Visited in November around 7pm and there were no queues. Was lovely to see such amazing views of the city at night time. Enjoyed the view and dinner @ CN Tower...I would recommend this tour to everyone who visits toronto.

This was our first time to Toronto and I am so glad someone told me to check out the lunch specials at the top. We went off-season - the line was nonexistent, got right in. My 11 yr. old will always remember this. We decided to take friends up the CN Tower in the late afternoon for a gorgeous view of the Toronto skyline and then seeing a sunset and lights starting to come on. The ?N Tower offered very nice views of the city (with the typical gimmicks with these types of attractions). I think it was worth spending the extra money to go to the higher observation deck. As a first-time traveller to Toronto, the CN tower was a must see and the view is amazing. There were no queues at 4.30pm on a November Wednesday and like all tourist places, it's hard to leave without going through the gift shop, but the view makes it all worthwhile.

The CN tower is in the middle of Toronto, close to the lake and right next to the Rogers Center so you have a spectacular view of the city. I visited here around 8pm on the evening I arrived in Toronto. The views at night are spectacular! The lift up is cool, and the glass floor is an awesome feature. Simply amazing. A great way to see Toronto. A must see attraction when staying in the city. And it has easy access from the Union Station via the sky walk and is close to several other great things to see.

Dinner at the CN Tower can be an incredible experience! Reservations are a must. There is a good selection on the menu. The food and service is great. We often overlook what's right in front of us. The CN Tower is a marvel. Sure, it's a big tourist attraction, drawing thousands every day. We tend to ignore this magnificent structure. This was a part of our city pass that we took. we loved every minute up there its a beautiful view , amazingggg i am usually scared of heights but this experience was perfect. Is the highest tower of North America, in a sunny day you can see the Niagara falls. You must try the glass floor is beautiful. Wifi in the entire area
We were very impressed by the views from the CN Tower and spent some time there taking photos and enjoying the 360 degree views from this Toronto landmark.

I was first up the CN Tower in 1990 and despite being back in Ontario many times, this was my first opportunity to re-visit the attraction. Its definitely worth visiting if you are in Toronto. Best view on Toronto from the sky, go to the glass floor if you dare. Very nice experience but quite pricey.

This is an amazing place to visit and is a must visit if you are visit Toronto. The sky walk is an ultimate experience. Perfect place for corporate events too. Visiting it at night is different experience all together and must be visited at night too.

I've lived in Ontario my whole life and have never been to the top. It was a beautiful day and you could see forever. We went to the top and then did the skypod, which is even higher and are glad we did. Make sure you go on a nice day so you can see the city and Toronto island....
Great to see Toronto from the tower. It is definitely a great place to visit while in TO, especially on a beautiful day.
The tallest building in the world is a must see when you visit Toronto. It also have one of the beautiful restaurant and sight seeing available.
Be prepared for a good wait especially during peek times. Awesome views of Toronto and the glass floor is a must do.

It's the perfect place to go on a cold clear winters day. The different levels and pictures on the glass floor is highly recommended. The bullet elevator is fast and effective.The service is great and the view of the city is amazing.
Enjoy the sights. Have lunch up top because it includes a pass to the observation deck and you can bypass the lineup this way.
We purchased our tickets online in advance, Getting to the top was very quick and without hassle, The views were spectacular.
Nice tower , access and getting around great, no hassles or hold ups , spectacular views of Toronto defiantly worth a look - reasonably priced also
The CN Tower is a must see for anyone visiting Toronto - the lifts are clean and efficient and the viewing gallery is great - particularly the glass floor section.

I took my dad to the CN Tower for his first time ever and was met with a truly mediocre experience. The view is always great but we waited in line for over an hour before we were finally able to crest skyline and experience Drake's life from the top.
Had a great time well priced enjoyed the freedom, loved the glass floor and then we went up another level above the restaurant watching the sky walkers from above great place to visit

Great views of the city and lake. Be prepared to go through security like an airport before joining the queue. Restaurant looked good but unfortunately we didn't have time to eat there. If you are visiting Toronto we highly recommend going here. The glass floor and especially the outside adventure are amazing. You'll have a blast. You can spend some money here but was worth it we thought.

You have beautiful from up there. However, make sure you go just before it gets dark, so you can both see Toronto at day and night, to get more value for money, since tickets are expensive!

An amazing adventure, we booked and cancelled our trip here 4 times before we finally made it, and we're so glad we did eventually get there. Little expensive but guess the view was worth it 360 degrees of beauty on a clear brisk day. Lovely walk from the motel.

We went during sunset and it was absolutely beautiful. I would recommend going before sunset and staying up there until it's dark. It's cool to see the differences. Only disappointment was the outside viewing deck was closed due to weather, but there isn't anything we can do about that!
We budgeted for having our last meal in the city here the night before we left. It's well worth the price of the meal. Staff is great, food is excellent! They're great with food allergies too!

We have visited Toronto numerous times but we always like to go up the CN Tower to watch the sun set. This year was no different. Really good way to see the city of Toronto. There is also a partial glass floor on one level and a revolving restaurant as well.

Too expensive and not really fun for the kids. The glass floor is fun for about 15 minutes and looking out is fun for about 15 minutes but then we are done. Go to the Aquarium which is right next to the tower. The Aquarium is cheaper and is more fun for the family. Take pictures of the CN tower...
Make sure you reserve tickets in advance. Then a long line to get in but it goes quickly. A great view from CN tower on Toronto
This is the third highest tower in the world and the sensation of being there is unbelieveble. We were there to watch the sunset and it was very beaultiful.

Not only is the structure amazing but all the information contained inside that you have the opportunity to learn about is awe-inspiring. This was my first trip to Toronto, and went with a friend who lives nearby. The views are amazing and the trip to the pod (cost extra) is worth it. Take your time and enjoy!

Yes I know that it's probably the most famous building in Ontario, however, for the amount of money they charge it doesn't really seem like something thatHAS to be done... the glass floor is tiny and in squares so it's not like one huge pane of glass, which takes some of the fear away. I am a Torontonian and I will say that this is a must see attraction.The restaurant is quite pricey but if you are in it for the experience then go for it.The views from up top are great and there is nothing like jumping onto a glass floor that is hundreds of metres above the ground below!
Been living in Toronto for more than 25 years and you can never get tired of visiting the tower specially once your on the top f the tower looking down the city and Lake Ontraio its amazing.

Wonderful view of the city! A nice place to Visit with family! And if you want, you can book a dinner in the restaurant!

Bit difficult to find initially but worth it for the views alone. Food not as good as expected but acceptable. You go here for the view though, great views from the table in the revolving restaurant but amazing views from the viewing deck.
I had a long week of meetings in Toronto brought my daughter with me 22yrs, We strolled and came to the tower, its high gives the best views. The even elevator ride was a new experience!
Beware of the crazy lineups on weekends. Selfie crazy people are everywhere. Keep young children under your close watch. It'S surely a fun place to see in Toronto.

Amazing view of Toronto. However, it's a shame that the upper deck has the small grills as it prevents you from taking proper unobstructed pictures.

The trip up to the top of the CN Tower is a destination not to be missed while visiting Toronto, is highly affordable via the City Pass, but, is not for the feint-of-heart! Breathtaking: aptly describes the sensation of looking down through glass panels from a million miles up!! If you have the stones, there is an option to "walk...

We were lucky to be here on a beautiful sunny day so we could see for miles. Lots of interesting information on the way to the lifts and up on the deck. Great photo opportunity, helpful staff and worth a visit.
When you are up there, sit down and relax for a while in the restaurant. If it is a sunny day (and you want the best view) prepare to get hot:-). Restaurant not to expensive, good burgers.

You just can't beat the view when you're above the city. This is worth going up at least once in your life. So cool to stand on the glass panels and look down. It can get very crowded, very quickly. Best to go right when it opens I think.

I have been there twice. Once because we had a birthday at the revolving (revolting?) restaurant, and once again recently when we took some students there. It's nice to go that high up, feel the altitude in the glass elevator, and look down through the glass piece of the floor, if you dare! Not bad.
Visited after having dinner at 360 restaurant. Was a great view. Daughters loved jumping on the glass floor.

The CN Tower is an iconic part of Toronto's skyline. Taking the tour is well worth the entrance fee although plan to go on a clear day so you can see across the lake to the USA and all of Toronto! If your budget and time permit the 360 restaurant has amazing food!

the day visited visibility wasnt good so our experience was average..also if you compare to some other architectural marvels now it takes a back seat..worth it if you try the walk on the edge experience which we didnt but other who did vouvh for...nice for photo ops

the views are just simply outstanding from the CN Tower, simply stunning, there is nothing remotely comparative to the CN Tower. If you visit Toronto you must visit the CN Tower and enjoy a fabulous dinner in the 360 restaurant. Amazingly moving whilst enjoying fine dining. Highly recommend smoked Atlantic salmon starter. Great views of Toronto. Skypod extra cost of a view of Toronto from higher up. Get access to all when purchasing edge walk ticket.
We thoroughly enjoyed this attraction and we thought it great value. Early November was a great time to visit. We had great weather and no queues.
Was fun specially we have to face our fear to walk on the glass floor. Very busy place! Dobt forget to dine in at 360 restaurant !

It is nice, nothing really special, the walking-glass is nice but the architecture of the tower doesn't let you see very good. And the glasses I think needs to be changed. Even the cameras cannot get the pictures nice. Maybe the illumination, I am not a photographer. It is very secure, even the outside part. At the top it's beautiful,...

For beautiful 360 degree views of the city, this is the place to go! Toronto is a lovely city and this was a great way to see it. There are several fun things to do while looking around and it was not crowded at all.
No queue to enter. Excellent views of city from top. Glass floor looked down 1100 feet, took some deep breathes to go on it, very scared, but did it
We went for an early dinner and enjoyed both the food and the view. The elevator trip up the tower is a little daunting.

Went there early on a Saturday morning and there was virtually no queue. The views were fantastic and the staff very friendly. As an individual attraction it is expensive at $35+tax but as part of the city pass it will seem more reasonable. Either way it's a "must do" in Toronto.

Visited on an absolutely clear sky day, wonderful 360 degree views, fun on the glass flooring, and tied it into a very good restaurant meal, revolving once every 72 minutes. Would obviously not be as good on a smoggy or fogy/cloudy day.
Well this is definitely a "must visit" place if you visit in Toronto. The view is amazing, you can also eat and drink at the "top of the world".

We did the 360 lunch. The food was good and the view was amazing. It's fun to watch the planes take off and land.A bit over priced but with a nice meal it's OK. I wouldn't want to pay to go up without the meal as I think my money could be better spent.

Certainly on the 'must do' list but be prepared to spend C$40 each to visit the first level and an additional C$12 to go up to the top level. Once you are there though it is a great experience on a clear day, especially the glass floor!
I love my Toronto so much to do and see ? l enjoy trying different restaurants and coffee shops. The CN Tower was fabulous you have to experience it for yourself!
I went to see it with a friend. Thoroughly enjoyed the tower and all it had to offer. Did not eat at the restaurant but I heard others say how good the food was.
Enjoyed the view and the visit. Liked that you were left to wonder at your own pace. Friendly staff some items and prices are a tourist trap price

The CN Tower was really neat. A glass elevator takes you to the top where you get some great views of the city and the islands. One level down is an outside viewing area, the views are not as good there because of the fence all around but it's still cool. There is also a glass floor that you can...

The views of Toronto and Lake Ontario are amazing from the CN Tower but it is expensive for what it is. I wouldn't necessarily recommend it if you were on a budget and definitely wouldn't recommend the sky pod as you have to pay extra and it doesn't add anything to the experience.

I've been at CN tower three times already with different family members. On a sunny day, the view is amazing! It is such a great experience and I highly recommend it.Try to get as early as you can as it's always busy. At times you can wait in line for 2 hours (happened to me in the past). Ask...

This attraction is the quintessential tourist must-do. Keep in mind however that it is also the biggest tourist trap. Really expensive, lots of photo opportunities, VERY cool to see the entire city in one of the world's tallest buildings, even the history of its creation is a great anecdote, however, nothing ever changes about this attraction, if you've seen it...

When you walk up to the CN tower, is it stunning from the outside. You go up to the tower by a very fast lift, and the staff are great! You must go to the 360 degrees restaurant - it rotates!Well worth the money, also in the evenings it is lit up - beautiful!
After an amazing meal at the 360...see the city lights endlessly sparkle. FANTASTIC views. Ample room to roam around. Vendors present selling refreshments and souvenirs.

What an amazing experience. 100+ stories up and the views are breathtaking. The glass floor is not for the weak hearted. The prices should be more affordable for the average person / family. It is expensive, it is breathtaking, no matter what time of year. I've done it many time over the years as every visitor to Toronto needs to visit the CN Tower. Just do it! You have to!

So how impressive can just another tall structure be? I mean, I am from Chicago where skyscrapers were born. The CN Tower is really really cool and definitely worth a stop while in Toronto.
