Has a glass elevator, glass floor, open sides. It's awesome. Great views across the city on the clear day we were there.
We visited this location on a bright warm and sunny day. The whole experience was wonderful. The lift is super fast and the view out over Toronto was spectacular. Well worth a visit!

I was most intrigued by the stories of people pogo-ing up the stairs of this engineering marvel. The glass floor and spectacular views of Toronto and the lake make this a must for any Canadian Holiday.

The view is nice, but when Payed online I did not recieve the tickets however the money was gone from my account. Simply stunning. Not enough amazing words to say about the views. Dare to go on the walk around the outside but the glass floor is really freaky! Try if you dare.
Amazing view must go and visit. No ques great staff and great day out.We visited the restaurant so didn't pay for entry

1. Enjoy the rapid elevator and try to take a place near the door or side glasses.2. take your time to visit all around Toronto from above. October was great because you'll see lots of colors, but check the weather, to enjoy it should be clear.3. I didn't try the edge walking but it should be interesting!

Go up to CN tower the view was spectacular day and night. You can dine in at 360 Restaurant. The restuarant it revolve every minutes while your dining, and you can view every angle of the bottom. A must see attraction, but do not visit it on a foggy day.It was very nice from the ticket office personnell to warn us, that we might not see anything on 18th September, when the forecast was not too optimistic. But we still headed for it, since we only had 7 hours to spend in the city. And as...

We paid extra for the skypod, but after going up the Stratosphere in Vegas I was slightly disappointed there wasn't any outside option to take in the view. That being said the views were still great. Nice time to go as there weren't any queues!
We had lunch in the 360 restaurant. It was delicious and relaxing and had great views of the area. We had access to the observation deck and the glass floor also.

enjoyed the visit, liked the wee walk about you could do outside, but it was well meshed so couldn't get a clear photo ...the glass floor was pretty good, my sister couldn't walk on it! We could have purchased photos of us with the view below but decide to do that ourselves..all in all it was worth the visit!

We were lucky to visit the tower on the only clear day we had while visiting Toronto.The wait, an hour, went fairly quickly. first time i visited to CN Tower in so many years even though i live in toronto.i really want to go back again next yeaar

Stunning views, we had super weather and could see for miles. Went here after work with a friend to catch up and have a drink on top of the world. it was quite fun having wings a beer good company and the best view in the city.
Great views. Good service inside. Definitely a must while in Toronto. Check out the observation deck and glass full.

This was my second time up the CN tower, and while the normal platform is nice, there are way too many people, the popular glass-floor area is quite small, and if outside isn't available (often due to wind), there isn't much to see! I was hesitant to go due to the high price but truly am glad that we treated ourselves to an experience. We celebrated both of our children's upcoming birthdays and the restaurant made it truly special. This is the best way to appreciate what an amazing city Toronto is!! We arrived first thing Monday morning so quickly found ourselves at the top via the lift which takes you up on the outside of the building the start of the views!We spent around an hour and a half at the top amazed by the wonderful weather...

It was a very beautiful place to visit, I recommend it to every one to see it. It's has a beautiful view and lovely restaurant, nice took out to see the whole Toronto plus the outside rope hanging who brave enough to use it.

We decided to go for dinner as we had found at other observation towers like the one in Seattle you pay a little more tweeter drink but if you just went to the observation deck you would pay two thirds of that with nothing to gain. We really enjoyed to visit CN Tower. It was a sunny day and everything clear. The view is amazing and the glass floor frightening, but worth a try.

Well worth the money. Even though it was very crowded the wait also was worth it. You are moving in lines from buying your tickets to waiting for the elevator but it is a major attraction so expect it to be busy.

We purchased our tickets upon arrival and had an hour wait.It was worth the wait. We paid extra to go into the pod - the view was totally amazing. We had drinks and hors d'oeuvres in the Horizon Restaurant while waiting for sunset which was spectacular.

Last time I was in Toronto the helicopter was lifting the antenna onto the top that was 1975 so finally got to the top although rather expensive we went right to the top. The entrance price is expensive for what one gets. Some good views over the city but that's about it. The Sky Tower in Auckland, New Zealand is a lot more impressive.

You have to go to the restaurant 360. You don't have to pay a lot more when just going to viewing deck, We arrive at 4 pm and saw the city in daylight and at 6 pm we saw it in city lights. The food was very good, and you just sit and you will make many turns over the...

After going thru security the elevator ride is a very neat experience regardless of how many times you have done it. The view is truly spectacular and it is fun just watching people walk across the "glass" floor. It is a very interesting feeling looking straight down. We had dinner at the revolving restaurant which is not cheap but makes...

We enjoyed a great evening weather-wise, but having set our plans for this to be a special dining experience proved a disaster.Perhaps it started with the waiter we had to endure. We visited the CN tower on our first visit to Toronto because it's what you do right? Nice touristy activity. Great views. Great area to do several stops along with resturants and coffee shops.
......we did a city hiphop bus tour.... we love the views but Toronto was very expensive, but nice.....I loved it !.........

Its a fast and easy ascent to the restaurant level where you can get some excellent views of the city and its environment. There might be a queue for the elevator to the next level but it's worth the wait. Overall an interesting visit and close to other downtown attractions.
If you want to view Toronto from on high then this is the place to go. On a good day you should be able to see the tallest tower in New York. Has restaurant and nightclub. Great place to visit.
I was born and raised in Toronto, but I make it a point to go up the tower every few years. It's awesome!

Have a spare evening we and our two friends decided to do the visit to the tower. We just did the first level observation platform and the open air platform. Go at dusk. You will get an amazing view of distance and then when the sun goes down you will see the city light up!
Try to time your visit for about an hour or so before sunset on a clear day. Then, just hang around until right after sunset. The gift shop is pretty cool too with reasonable prices.
Reasonably priced, plain but good food at the café restaurant at the top of the tower. Fantastic views of Toronto

Favorite part was the elevator...ok, maybe the glass floor! Didn't care so much for the "security" or the wait to get into the elevator, but they were soon forgotten on the way up. Terrific way to see the city!
The views form the CN tower are spectacular, it is even a little scary. The price is too high but it is worthy.

It's one of those landmarks that draws you in just to determine what exactly it is all about. You can't miss it when in Toronto. It is a lengthy process to get in with the lines but they do move: expect about a 45 minute wait time to get to the top. It is however organized. A lot of people...

One of the must do in Toronto,on a clear day the view from the restaurant is simply fantastic, going up to the Sky pod is a farther exciting experience, standing/ setting on the glass platform is not for the faint hearted!!Lunch is basic but enjoyable

The CN Tower is hands down, without question, the one thing you have to do while in Toronto. Followed very closely, I'll add, to visiting and eating at the world famous St. Lawrence Food Market. great clear views from the top of the tower......the partial glass floor is a bit of an attraction in itself...makes you realise how high you are...there is a restaurant which you can book to eat in at night for great night views....entry was approx cn75$ after tax per couple which is about norm.......well worth a visit and not far from...
Top of list of things to do - what a view on a clear day. A full 360 degree view of Toronto. Didn't take long to climb up.

Quick and easy to get up to the top. The glass overlook experience is great and there is lots of space for multiple people. It a an experience that you have to do if you are staying in Toronto , it's expensive with great views over Toronto , the glass floor is not a full floor it's just part of the floor with glas tiles on it.

The Tower is expensive to visit I thought, but it has to be done if in Toronto! The staff are helpful and it's well organised. The view from the top is amazing and the tower itself is well maintained with information everywhere and a huge gift shop. Enjoyed the time there although it was pricey.
This is a must do when in Toronto. The views from the viewing deck are great and the glass floor is terrifying but also thrilling. Very worth the time and money to go up as high as you can.
We went for dinner and had a good time. Very friendly service. Food wasn't top quality but still tasty enough.
A must see. Spend a few good hours in the tower. A bit dirty here and there. Glad to have been there.
It wasn't great. The lineups were long and there wasn't much to do once you were up there. It's the thing to do as a Toronto visitor I guess, but I wouldn't go again.

As part of the Ultimate Toronto Tour, we visited the CN Tower. Much like Seattle's Space Needle, the views are amazing. On this particular day, however, it was VERY crowded as school children and some adults climbed the stairs for charity. The elevator ride to the top was fun. Glad to have seen this landmark.

Fantastic experience and great views of Toronto and Lake Ontario...but it's expensive. Nearly fell over when the guy told me the price for a family of four. But we enjoyed it and would suggest it's a must do for a Toronto visit...just don't plan an expensive dinner that night!

Visited the CN Tower as part of the Toronto City Pass experience. I was visiting Toronto in June from the US and this was the first thing that we did. No trip to Toronto is complete without doing the CN Tower. It was crowded but we kinda expected that. We had a great lunch then went to the Glass floor level. We noticed the floor was dirty and tired. The whole place needs to be painted. Staff needs training on customer service. If we didn't go for lunch first we would have been very disappointed.

The CN Tower experience can be expensive for some, but it is a once in a lifetime opportunity. The view from atop is spectacular. If you go in the evening as the sun goes down, it is so special and amazing to see the city below, all lit up in the night sky. They have a glass floor that you...
If you are in Toronto then taking your other half up the CN tower is a must do.Great views and the restaurant was good as well.

Went here for the first time and it was well worth it. I love that they take a pic for purchase once you enter to go to the Tower. The view is breath taking. I paid to go to the extra floor and it was worth every dime! I would also recommend standing on the glass floor (I am afraid...

The CN Tower is a Toronto landmark that attracts tourists daily. You take an elevator up to the observation deck for views of the city. That's about it. Went up the CN tower in the evening prior to having a meal in the restaurant. Well worth the money, amazing views and lovely food!!

There's so much to see and do. We had a rainy, cloudy, foggy day and it was tough to see the city but if we were patient the clouds opened up on occasion and we got a few good photos. Though I think they should charge less when the day is like that it was still worth it. Lots to...

I am not positive, but I think the last time I was there when I went to the Ripleys Aquarium I checked it out, and I thought I remembered that it was $15 a person to go up. As one, if not THE most known attraction in Toronto the CN tower is a must to be visited. We visited the floor at approx. 550m heights and it offers great value withe the 360 view as well as the floor glas.
The CN Tower is a must but it's expensive so chose a sunny day to appreciate the incredible views. Take a camera!
The view was spectacular. The ride up the elevator was exhilirating. Try and avoid visits when there may be too many school kids.

The CN tower is a "Must Do" for Toronto trips. Great views and likely the most recognizable icon of Toronto. This is my wife and i's second visit to the tower, it offers views that never get boring and neither does seeing the CN Tower standing proudly in the city. Amazing bucket list item! Checked this one off witH my friend - what an awesome rush! I highly recommend this for the thrill seeker!
Although it was fun to go up the tower and see the city, it is quite costly for what you actually get. Recommended to see Toronto from above, however, would not do it again.

Alright, we woke up at 1am becausw the drive was gonna be 8 hours long, you can thank me for telling you everything. I was in my kindergarten spring break, well that was fine. Loved our trip to the CN Tower - an absolute must and very enjoyable. If the weather's clear - go! Tour bus only stopped briefly for a comfort break on the way to Toronto Airport. Looks magnificent, wished I had time to go up to the observation deck. Across the road from the restored train yard containing a brewery and locomotives.

Well worth the money! The view from the tower was wonderful but our favorite part was the 360 restaurant on top. We tried duck and lamb I believe. It was the best damn meal we've ever had in a restaurant and I wish we could go back!
A must while in Toronto!!!. The city is spectacular, but until you see it from here you really do not grasp its beauty and size. We went for lunch, so we could see all its natural beauty.

Not sure I would pay for just admission to the CN Tower, but as a part of the CityPass, it's a really good deal.Great overall view of Toronto and cool glass floor.

What a view - you can see to the end of the earth it seems. We had lunch at the cafe at the top. It was a bit pricey for what we got but how many times are you going to have that experience! Worth every penny. We really enjoyed it !

CN Tower offers stunning views of Toronto. If you are visiting Toronto, you must check it out. Buy tickets in advance to avoid lineups and go on a sunny day for the best views - especially during sunrise or sunset. Hungry? There's great restaurants up there as well!

Very slick operation & smooth elevator (thankfully!) ride to the viewing gallery. If going for a meal, maybe do the glass floor viewing first!! Fantastic views from up there and obviously best on a fine day, which we had. The outdoor viewing gallery is well secured so no one can fall off!Sunset was fabulous from the revolving restaurant. I went to the CN Tower at near 06:00 p.m. in October and it took about 45 minutes for me to have a sight of the beautiful changes during sunset. The lift taking up the the top is very speedy. Walking on the glass floor is an interesting and exciting experience.

Such an amazing time at the tower. Staff are the greatest with exceptional customer service. I would say it is definitely worth your money. Special rates apply to seniors as well, this really is a wonderful feature for all the older folks heading up to the tower.
Must visit spot in Toronto. Beautiful view from the deck. Nice upscale 360 (revolving) restaurant. The glass floor is quite interesting.
Fantastic view of Toronto. Also had a glass floor which was daunting ! Good time of year to go . No crowds at all.

Awesome view of a part of the city lol.....windy and almost saw the falls from there but it was a bit cloudy......but it was worth the money

Despite the long queues and dirty windows all good. Fantastic view and polite staff. Lifts are with glass doors, so you can actually expierience the view while going up- just make sure you're the last going into the lift and stay at the door ;)

I think my title says it all, it's not impressive on its own but you get a good view of Toronto from the top. However, I wouldn't pay 35CAD for that view. Luckily, we bought Toronto cityPasses (72CAD) which included tickets for CN tower and 4 other attractions.

Can't visit Toronto without having a meal 110 stories up in the CN Tower. First of all this is not cheap as almost $400 for two courses and a couple of drinks for 4 people. But it's not about the cost. This is a one off experience for most people and the highlight of my trip to Canada.I chose...

Our Toronto Citypass was a bargain and definitely worth the purchase. The CN tower offered spectacular views of the city in both daylight and dark if you visit around sunset. Quick and easy to enter with the citypass, however, some queues for the way down due to lift problems.

The CN Tower is an impressive architectural achievement. Provides a spectacular 360 degree view of the Toronto and beyond. There is a resturaunt that also provides this view while you are dining. Great views, both on general deck and on the sky pod level. Walk over the glass floor and look down - your stomach may not thank you though ... Highly recommend but it is a bit pricey and not sure you should have to pay extra to go that bit higher.

The CN tower is Toronto to the traveller so has to be done.Queuing system could be slicker but once through the trip up is good. Great views obviously but the landscape is American urban and flat. Not sure it's value for money tbh

Wow, what a view. I would definitely recommend going here. Try and go either first thing in the morning or after 7pm as it is less busy to do. Even if you do have to queue though, it really is worth it. It has several different levels and a glass floor and an extensive gift shop. Definitely worth seeing.

A bit pricey but it is something to do whilst in Toronto. I enjoyed the CN Tower. It was a great view of the city from the top of the tower. I am not particularly fond of the glass floor but it was fun to watch the others. I would suggest taking a tour in order to skip the lines.
We enjoyed the visit, but a bit on the pricey side and 1 visit is enough. The queues were not too long & the elevator ride to the top was good.

CN tower is a building, but if you want to see Toronto very well, you would better to make a dinner at the 360 restaurant it's on top of CN tower. In the meantime you will have a free visit for building.Show pictures for your decision. View and salmon

Extraordinary view of Toronto!! Unfortunately, it appears you pay for the view and not the quality of food. While it wasn't inedible, it just wasn't very good. I ordered off the courses menu so perhaps the a la carte selections are better? The wine and the service was good. Wish they had better food :/

We did this kind of on a whim, but were super glad we did. My son is not a fan of heights, but were glad we paid extra to go the extra distance up. It was a cloudy/misty day, but we still greatly enjoyed the experience. Great view of Rogers Centre, lake and downtown. Great fun!

So so so very worth the visit! We bought a city pass but realised that If you book lunch in the 360 restaurant you do not have to queue or pay for the tower visit! We visited this attraction on the second day of our visit when the clouds had cleared. We arrived relatively early when we expected fewer people. Our experience at the CN Tower was absolutely fabulous. We visited in mid October, at approximately midday and during this time the crowds were fine. I love going up towers so the CN Tower was a must when in Toronto. It was a clear day, so there were great views in all directions. It's not cheap but you get a great physical overview of the city and its layout.
Discount in price for students. The view is amazing, even with rain. There a small restaurant, but not recommendable.
Liked it a lot! amazing views, glass floor is great! If scared of height do not try! Really liked the souvenirs in there :) not cheap but nice!
Be sure to have a meal at the revolving restaurant - the vistas are spectacular & the food very good - excellent service from the staff.
Weather awful but had to use tickets before leaving. Staff helpful and informative - not their fault weather spoiled things for us
Awesome experience. Undoubtedly the highest that I've been. Must see if you are in Toronto. The glass floor is nice but bit old.

It's an incredible place. It's possible to get a 360 view of Toronto. You also can enjoy an awesome sunset.

Best way to get there is by Go Train as parking is expensive. Fee to get in is expensive. The view is fabulous during the day and even better at night. I tried walking on the glass panels where you can see below to the ground. It is scary. There is a friendly moose you can take your pic with.

We went with the kids after dinner in Toronto. The four of us paid well over $100. It was interesting but I wouldn't say it was worth the price. It may seem obvious but you will not get a better view of the city, airport and harbour.Go early to miss the crowds, and make sure you test your nerve by walking on the glass floor.

Although the price seemed expensive since the beginning, we didn't hesitate to go to the CN Tower, as it is a must of Toronto. The CN tower is as people say a necessary attraction to be seen while in Toronto. The Skypod is a 12$ plus, but is totally worth it, the view there is amazing. Be aware of the big lines, specially when going down (waited about 40 minutes and it is not the crowded season).

You come to Toronto you have to visit the CN Tower. It's one of those Toronto things you 'have to do it, but be prepared for lines, wind on the glass floor level and a hefty entrance fee. Actually I did not plan to go there because of high price of this attraction. We have purchased the Toronto pass and in such way it was less painfull. An icon of Canada and the Toronto Skyline. The observation deck offers panoramic views of the city and the glass bottom floor is quite an experience. A must see if you're in Toronto.
Went for a meal at 5.30 and saw the city in daylight and as the sun went down and it was fantastic. The meal was great as was the service, this is a must do experience.
The price is about $30 each and is worth it. We had lunch at a little café on the top and it was affordable and very nice to sit and look out the window. Fun day

You can't visit Toronto without visiting the tower! what a good way to see over Toronto. though you will have to bear with long queue and security otherwise a nice viewing place.

Amazing View from the top skypod and outside observation deck. Better at night as you can see all the lights below

It doesn't lose its charm. We brought family visiting from the UK. She loved it. Great introduction to the city. The food was interesting. I had the four ducks appetizer. Great ?? it was a little expensive to get in . But really enjoyed it and it was worth it in the end :)

It's a must see tourist attraction for all. The view from the top is incredible. And the glass floor is amazing, and scares me, but still pretty awesome.

The best view of the city incredible view..good food and great people..Canada great country and toronto great city..

We got the last reservation for dinner so after dinner we had the chance to go to the viewing decks with just 2 other couples. Food choices can be limited and the restaurant can get crowded. This is something you should experience once.

Its a nice tower set up with multiple views where u can see all of Toronto. Its nice if you've never been to a tower before but I have to admit I like NYC's One World Observatory much better. In the centre of the town next to the aquarium. The hop on bus stops outside the baseball ground. Modern skyline and very informative.

We booked a lunch here and wow, great views, food and service. Very well organised and we loved the fact we weren't rushed especially as it was Thanksgiving weekend. It did cost a lot of money but if you can afford to do this instead of just visiting the observation decks it's well worth it.

Living in Toronto we sometimes bypass our own visiting landmarks. Took some family and friends ghat came to visiting from EuropeLovelyThe view does it every timeWorth the wait in lineA mustPls take a couple of hours and ho visit this beautiful structure a true Landmark fpr us TorontaniansEnjoy
The CN Tower was another exciting and great see in Toronto that we will for sure be returning to for another vacation

Go early to avoid the crowds and enjoy the fab view. It's not for the feint hearted but it's not as scary as you think.

Great attraction easily connected to the hop on hop off bus or trolley and next door to the aquarium. Can get very busy, but well worth a visit to stand over the glass flooring and go outside to soak up the great view

We ate in the restaurant. Staff helpful and friendly. Meal was lovely. Great place to see in the summer. Amazing views of the city, especially in the winter. However, to go up is way to expensive.

a must in toronto queuing can be a bit of a bind but its worth it for the views and the glass floor is an experiencestaff and very friendly and get you up as quick as possible the longest wait was buying tickets to get inif you want to be brave and do the sky walk its £100...

that was definitely an experience to remember , it was a bit crowded indeed but overall it was breathtaking and very awsome^^ due to bad luck the weather conditions weren't that great but we still managed to see the whole city <3
First rate meal in a beautiful setting high above the City of Toronto. Service was efficient and the quality of the food delicious. Good value for money overall.
Fast elevator!! Once the fog lifted we could see for miles! Pleasant and helpful staff, really enjoyed the trip up the tower & gift shop

If you are in Toronto for the first time, this is the place to visit. Dont bother going up the CN Tower in Toronto unless you have a clear day its very expensive and we should have cancelled our reservation when we saw the mist was down but we were living in hope the mist would lift
Thought the price was reasonable, seems like a shame to not do it if you are in the city. Good views of the city.

We visited Toronto as a part of an organised tour of New England and Canada.As the second tallest building in the world, the CN Tower dominates the waterfront area. This was a great experience - even though it is plenty of people waiting - there is a lot of stuff - videos. etc. that makes it wright and unforgettable

We booked a meal on the revolving restaurant which meant that we didn't have to queue to get it. We started dining before sunset so had the benefit of the view in the light, during sunset and at night. I would highly recommend it, it was fantastic - but do book in advance!
from bottom to up you ll be full of excited even in elevator, wonderfull view to for city of Toronto, you can see everything.Also ontorio lake and island. And some adventureis waiting for you.

My wife and I shared a great meal in the wonderful surroundings of the CN Tower. Food was very good and staff more than attentive. Views over the city are just fantastic. Expensive meal but worth it.

In all touristica attractions in Toronto in can have a sense of going to a show and CN tower was not an exception. You can see the place full of historical information, and many things to make your visit a good experience.Visit around 8:00 to experience the daylight and the night view.

Try standing on the glass floor - it is adventure for itself. After that weird experience, buy yourself a coffee and enjoy the view of the lake.

I'm not a fan of heights, but had to visit while in Toronto. It's just an observation tower that was crowded. There was a long line to go up and back down the tower. I didn't enjoy it and wouldn't do it again. However, my kids loved it.
Great views and great food in the revolving restaurant make sure to walk on glass floor. For the adventurous there is the outside skywalk as well

Went to the tower during the week on a clear day. Not too busy, the line moved quickly. Great experience, the glass elsvarors were cool. You can take as much time as you want.

Breathtaking view of the city. We decided to go to the upper level this time around. Miles and Miles of City sight seeing can be done. Picture taking is a must they turn out beautifully even through the glass.

Excellent views and friendly staff here. This forms part of the wonderful Toronto skyline. The glass floor was also exciting.

We visited the CN tower in the fall so the lines weren't as busy as the summer, but we still waited for 30 minutes to get in the elevator. Views were fantastic. No too much to do with young kids, but worth the expense and time.

A must see attraction in Toronto! We did the tower at night for the first time in August and really thought it was better than our daytime visits. Such a pretty city all glittery at night!
must do if in Toronto..at times it can be a long wait in the queues but dont let that put you off! the photo opportunities are fanastic.

One of those thins we had to do whilst in town. This was in my opinion very expensive but did offer great views of the city. That's about it really-done it now never to do again. Would I recommend??? Not much else to do in town so if you can spare some cash, yes.
Second to none when it comes to the view. Increadibly smooth and fast elevator to the top two levels.

Lunch at 360 Restaurant is highly recommended if you are visitors. You get express elevator to the top, overservation tower and glass walk is included, better than just a paid administration to see the two and you have to write 1/2 hour or more in line for the elevator.

A trip to Toronto would be incomplete without a visit to the CN Tower. The views from the observation deck are gorgeous. A must do. The staff are super friendly. It is worth it to get a Toronto Pass as a visit to the CN Tower is included.

Dinner in the Rotating Restaurant is an experience. Went with a friend who had never been to Toronto so the view was quite a thing to behold. She even sat on glass floor for a picture. Great way to spend an hour.

The view is breathtaking and it's beautiful. I went here with high hopes and we're full field. They take photos of you, and you can see the amazing skyline. It's an experience for kids and adults as well.

My 80 year old Dad had never been to the CN Tower so we made reservations and had Thanksgiving lunch there. We were very surprised (pleasantly) that they had added a turkey dinner that day. Our server, Shane, was great and the food wonderful.

Top of our list for the visit to Toronto and not disappointed. Perhaps a little expensive, but enjoyed the night visit and views so much, went for a second visit during daytime. The CN Tower is expensive and a total tourist trap but its worth going to the top to see the city and surrounding areas. I did not have a lot of time up there but totally enjoyed the views.

Did the CN tower with a 9 and 12 year old and they LOVED it. Went up to the sky pod level. Not for those that fear heights, as I believe we were 147 floors up! We did this on our first day in Toronto and it is a great way to 'see' the entire city

Visited at sun set. Food ok but pricey. Very good service if not a little transactional, but v helpful - it was our first night. Had lovely fresh oysters. Incredible views. Would only go again with people who hadn't been before.

Being a must see attraction of toronto,the cn tower provides a scenic view of toronto. Besides you have the glass floor to stand on(it's free) and "on the edge" activity at a cost if you are an adventure seeker.

The CN Tower never fails to entertain. On a clear day it is worth every penny of the admission cost. Beautiful views of the lake, Toronto Islands, the downtown airport and downtown Toronto. Make sure you visit the Skydeck.
Lovely views from the top of the tower where you can see the entire Niagara Falls with bird eye view

If you are in Toronto, and the weather is clear, do this tour. I will never forget it. Awesome !! If you book a me in the restaurant, you get free entry and are fast tracked to beat the lines of people waiting.

Worth it for the views, if nothing else, just for the Canadian Bacon references. Fun to do, and great views of the lake and city, and the U.S. side as well.

You can't go to Toronto without going up the CN Tower. The views are best around the sunset and its really cool to see Toronto Island from up above.

Absolutely worth a visit! 347 meters up, 114 floors and for the brave even more ( there is a second elevator) There are glass floors if you want to get dizzy..We visited off season so it wasn't crowded.

Every one should visit ,,amazing views stay as long as you want , resturant avail be for lunch or evening meal extra price or you can just have a quick bit or just a drink

The view from the top was nice, but it was crowded and a bit difficult to appreciate the whole thing. We bought a City Pass ahead of time (5 attractions in the city for one rate, saved us a lot of money) so it was definitely worth the trip, but I'm not sure if we would've done it for the...

Nice 360 degree view of Toronto and the surrounding areas. Can see for miles. Long line to get up (30 minute wait) and plus another long wait to get up to the highest pod level (another 30 minutes). Then a 20 minute wait to be able to get down so plan your visit accordingly.

Loved it!! Loved it!!! Pause for a while looking at the view from the restaurant over a hot coffee or iced tea. Worth the expense. Amazing views of Toronto.

This tower provides sweeping views of Toronto, the lake, etc. Must visit. Do not miss the glass floor, it will renew your fear of heights.You can look into the Rogers stadium right next to the CN tower. If a game is on, it provides an interesting perspective.Try the sky walk on the CN tower.
Brought some good friends from England. Definitely go for the sunset view! Bring your camera the view is amazing!

Spent $70 Canadian for me and my son to go up the CN Tower. Was a small walk around the building and after 15min we were done. Beautiful view & very cool to see but really expensive for what is up there. Do it once but no need to see it again.

A great view of the harbour and city. Standing on the glass platform and looking down is very cool. It is a good thing to do.

Very nice to take the highest level tickets for the best views. I loved it! This is a must-see-must-do activity in Toronto.
Toronto is pretty grim but this is a peak experience, good food, great views, nice service, although the whole thing does work out pricey, the kids really loved it. Booking in advance is important.

We really enjoyed the CN Tower. We spent more time there than I had thought we would. There was an amazing 360 degree view. Very fun.
It is a cool experience, once it's done it's done tho you don't need to go back, glass for is different and trips a lot of people out. High speed elevators and pretty fun too.

column3: Ruwais, Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates
column4: Nice place to visit. Gives great view of the city & enjoyable winds. Glass floor was something a real fun for all ages.

This was a very cool experience. My friends and I went to both levels of the tower. The views are amazing. As one of the tallest building in the Western Hemisphere I highly recommend this to visitors. Grab a local who know the area and can point out points of interest, or take your phone and use apps to allow...

Torontonians usually visit the CN Tower only, when they have visitors from somewhere else. That's my unscientific experience anyway. I had several visits from overseas and visit to the Tower in on TOP of the list. If you have the luxury of time, pick a clear day, you are going for the view. Anything else, you can experience elsewhere with...

Ok, starting with the bad thing, the price.. paid like 39 Dollars which is pretty much in my eyes.. but you do have an amazing view over the city, the city airport and the waterfront. If you don't mind the price I can recommend the CN Tower!

Expensive, but the view is excellent -- just don't bother going unless the visibility is good! It costs extra to go up to the highest viewing level, and all amenities on the main viewing deck are premium priced. That said, the view on clear days is superlative.

Beautiful city, and no better view of it than at the top of the CN tower, it has a fantastic revolving restaurant which has delicious food with great staff for optimum service, If traveling in Toronto it's a must in the bucket list

We brought out of town guests to the CN Tower for lunch at 360 and to experience the glass floor and the great view. We went on a Friday, thinking there wouldn't be too many people. It was very disappointing in that there were so many people that it was difficult to really experience anything. Lunch was ok, but there...
going up the tower is good for an hour so the price doesn't match time. but kids had a good time so will enjoy every few years

A friend who had lived in Toronto for her job advised us to start here to get a feel for the area. We went on a Tuesday at 10:00 and there was easy parking and no lines. We thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Once done we walked to the Saint Lawrence Market. It was unbelievable. And the walk there gave us...

A fantastic 360 degree view of Downtown Toronto and the outskirts of the surrounding areas! The glass floor was fun to look straight down below and stand over but you may be disappointed because you only get to see the roof of Ripley's Aquarium. This area is very popular for picture taking and does get very crowded on a busy...

We visited on a Sunday so is was crowded for sure trying to get up to the hotel. You have to make a reservation to eat at 360. There is also an restaurant called Horizons. The food was ok could of used a little more seasoning but the views & restaurant was very nice.
Book early for meal and watch sun set. You never grow tired of the view. Our waiter was great and very professional and attentive without being intrusive.

We had a meal in the 360 restaurant but cover that separate. The Tower for me is a must, as in any city we visit we like to get the birds eye view. The views are fantastic all round, on different levels, for the very adventurous you can do the skywalk, I am not that adventurous but it's available to...

The problem with going up on a visit to the CN tower is when you're up there you can't see the CN tower! In my opinion, the beauty of Toronto is the skyline so it was much better to view it from afar than climbing the tower and looking at the city from above. We went during the day also...
Wonderful!!It was my first time in Toronto. Couldn't have missed seeing this beauty.I would love to try the edge walk. Didnt have the heart this time :P

The must - do attraction in Toronto. We only had one day and we're pleased we did this. There is a brilliant 360 degree view of the city and a glass floor. Great idea to really make the most of it and have lunch. Expensive but fab food at restaurant at the top but for a cheaper alternative have lunch...

Well we went to the CN Tower with intension of going up to the look out. Well when we got there it was $50.00 just to go halfway. To me it wasn't worth it. So we visited the gift shop. We looked for a Souvenirs with something regarding CN Tower , couldn't find anything. Not even a key chain. How...

Overall it is what it is. You get beautiful view of Toronto, nothing can go wrong with that, except for one. The crowd.I was there in June, the crowd was massive.I really think you should go for the 360 Restaurant experience instead, it's much more "private" and worth every penny. You get to dine in a rotating restaurant,...
The view from the tower is incredible. The waterfront is beautiful. Fun to look through the glass floor, but it is small and somewhat crowded. Restaurant inside the tower if very good.
Visited this last weekend and it was great, such lovely views and lots to see. Would like to go back and see it at night time to see different views. Very enjoyable

This is a must do if your a visitor to Toronto. A superb structure, and the information on the construction is informative with some great pictures too.I visited on 31 August 2016 in early afternoon. The crowds were light so no long queues. On reflection, I thought the cost was a little on the steep side.The main viewing...

Was a great way to spend an afternoon when my brother came down to visit but it isn't a full day event as it gets boring quick.You should get the sky pod ticket which is 16$ extra but enhances the experience alot

The CN Tower (Canadian National Tower) is a 1,815 feet high concrete communications and observation tower in downtown Toronto, Ontario, Canada. Built on the former Canadian national Railway Lands, it was completed in 1976, becoming the world's tallest free-standing structure and world's tallest tower at that time, till Burj Khalifa in Dubai was built in 2010. For those looking for...

We visited a Toronto for three nights on our September tour. On the second day we walked the city highlights. The CN TOWER being one of the main attractions. We paid the extra to go up to the SkyPod and what a view. The glass floor was a bit frightening but gave us dome good photos.

So myself and my partner booked toronto city passes! Learn from out mistakes after security don't queue up at the ticket booths! Go into the main hall and to the test you can collect your passes here.Everything went smoothly from security to getting our passes.You have your photo taken and then up the super fast lift you go!....

As a patron of the city, the CN Tower is definitely a must see. Like Niagara Falls or the Empire State Building, the CN Tower is only memorable its first time around. I visited the CN Tower with a City Pass with my sister and the line was ridiculously long. I waited about 2 hours and spent at least 15...

This is a great way for visitors to see downtown Toronto. The building itself is beautiful, and the views are awesome. Overall, I would definitely recommend visiting the CN Tower to anyone looking for a unique experience in Toronto. I would not recommend this for a person who is scared of heights, though!

First tip - get there early.Second tip - Have realistic expectations! You get to view a city from a great height and have the chance to purchase an over-priced souvenir before you exit the building. Nothing more.I arrived shortly after opening time and got myself a Citypass. The seller in the ticket office was very helpful and informative...

Definitely need a clear day to do this attraction. We arrived one day and the staff were kind enough to tell us there was zero visibility from the top this particular day. We came back a different day and it was spectacular. You get an optional group photo then there is an elevator that takes you to the top. There's...
My boyfriend and I did the Edge Walk and can not recommend it enough. It's a memorable experience and well worth the money paid. We will remember it forever and loved the experience.

This is obviously one of the main attractions in Toronto, and it really is a must-see. Spectacular views across the city from every angle, a great place for a bite to eat with a view, and plenty for thrillseekers, who can walk on the glass floors or even do the edgewalk, outside on the top of the main pod!I...

It's what you'd think: incredible views. Was lucky enough to visit on a clear day, so I could see Rochester, NY from the SkyPod viewing area.The queue to get up the tower was long (better part of an hour) on a holiday weekend.The EdgeWalk looks insane, but for thrill seekers would be amazing.*TIP* Bought our tickets online...

I traveller to Tranna with my girlfriend - who is terrified of heights. So, like a loving partner, I took her to the CN Tower.It's a very unique way to see the city. We got lucky and had a beautiful blue sky with out a cloud. It isn't cheap but if you're a tourist you almost feel obligated to...

If you live in Toronto and have been up on the CN Tower before I am not sure going again is really an amazing experience, however it's definately a must do at least once in a lifetime. I would recommend going up in the afternoon and spending some time in the lounge or going for dinner at 360 so you...

Its a tower like most countries have but what differentiates CN is whats below.... the view is so breathtaking the city of Toronto is so beautiful and from above it looks the best,,.,i had been in winters and trust me it was fun standing out side and the chilled breeze passing thru the body was an experience, you can see...

We got the senior price with 15% discount on top but it's still a bit pricey. The Horizon restaurant was closed for a private function so that was a bit restrictive. You can see a long way obviously from that height but the view isn't that interesting!

Spectacular views on a lovely sunny morning. Got there at opening time and already a queue but well worth wait. Went to sky pod first which was amazing views and then back to viewing area. Again, amazing views. Only downside was we got tickets online and when we went in we went to the girl who was checking tickets and...

The iconic CN tower was a "must see" tourist attraction preached by all tourist guide books. We followed the tradition and paid a visit there while in Toronto. Took a long time waiting for the elevator due to the poor queue management and traffic control planning, or lack of it.Weather was not sympathetic during our visit and most of...

I really loved the experience as the building is one of its kind. It was a great feeling to be on the tallest building of the world. The views are amazing. The only big drawback(like any other touristic site) the waiting time to reach the top can be anything from 30mins or more.

Spectacular views of the city. Book online if possible to skip the line. I went right after it opened and it was only a few people up there with me so I had unobstructed views to snap all the photos I could've wanted. It started getting busy once I was already done and ready to move out. Wouldn't miss this...

It you have visited other towers as high as this one, as I have, you will not be impressed. But if you are a tourist, visiting Toronto for the first time, it is one of the top atractions, so you should go and see for yourself

If you are in Toronto you have to go to the CN tower. Great value for money and great for the family. From stepping into the lift and looking down as you are going up through the glass floor in the lift, to the glass floor at the top of the observation point.The history of the CN tower was...

Queues ... you have to be prepared to wait in line if you want to get into the CN Tower, it being one of the biggest tourist attractions in Canada.Visiting the Skypod however (more like waiting an additional 4 hours to get to the skypod) ... not worth it. Only go if you see there's not much in terms...
I was very disappointed that I was not told that I would not be able to see in the observation deck.

This was fun to see and the glass floor was a great attraction. No matter how many signs you have or how many people are standing on it, it is still hard to trust a glass floor! We had lunch in the restaurant, and found the prices to be surprisingly reasonable, and the view was great. Sit on the side...

This is just a must see when visiting Toronto. The views are stunning. the crowds weren't too bad when we went but I believe they can be horrendous. However worth the extra 6 dollars to go to the sky pod and see a bit more with less people. The glass floor is kind of freaky to walk on, but kids...

It's not bad but I cannot compare it to Empire State in NY. as the view up there at night is nothing special. In my opinion, too much money to spend in that place especially if you go with your family like me. I do not think I will go there again if I visit Toronto in the future

This is a MUST DO if you visit Toronto!!!!Fantastic views! You have to go to the Skypod!!!You HAVE to stand on the glass floor, 1000ft above the ground!!!! Terrifying!!!! The 360 restaurant is fabulous, revolving while you eat! You see the whole of Toronto in one hour!!!!!Staff in the Horizon restaurant, one lady in particular, was very,...

The CNT is the tallest standing building in Canada it was a wonderful opportunity be there, the glass floor was one of my preference and for my kids too in this attraction, and the restaurant was good.
On a beautiful day the view was amazing.take the Toronto pass to really get a deal. Next time will pay more to walk outside ang higher up.

This was one of our signature Toronto experiences. Way out of character, I booked dinner for my wife, my brother in law, and myself at 360, the restaurant at the top of the CN Tower. It was over $200, but it was a great experience, and the views during dinner were great. Afterwards we headed down to the viewing deck...

It is what you would expect, its a very nice view, though the extra "fee" to get to the actual top is a bit excessive, we still did it and got just what we expected. Definitely worth checking out, Toronto looks very nice and you are right on top of the Rogers Center so you might get to check out...

The CN Tower offer great views of the city especially on a good day, the glass floor adds and extra element of experience, however the signage for disabled access is a little lacking. We had to ask several staff members how to access each area with a wheelchair and although they were helpful and knowledgable extra signage for independence would...

Definitely get a city pass -- that helps shorten the wait a bit. The wait for the elevator up took about 30 minutes. The wait for the elevator down was about 40 minutes. It's a very pretty view, but really just not worth the money or the time.

There is an excellent view from the top of the tower (obviously) and the ticketing and queuing system is very well organised.On our visit, the 360 degree restaurant was closed for a private party so it wasn't possible to see the view all the way round without going outside. Something they should perhaps mention at the bottom.The glass...

We went up an a clear day, we booked lunch in the restaurant. It was expensive but well worth it for being able to sit for the 72 minutes it takes for the restaurant to revolve. Don't go up for the food, it's ok but not great and not worth the money, but the view is worth it.

The view is astonishing, obviously on a clear day. The food looks great but you don't go for the food. The reason I say 'looks great' is because it's simply okay. But spending two hours with the best view of the city in real comfort makes the food secondary.The view is breathtaking. I actually was a bit 'meh' when...

This should be a fun activity, but maybe I was expecting too much. The view is good, maybe I was expecting the glass floor to big this large section. Instead it was this small area that got crowded fast.

Being our first time visit to Toronto we felt the CN Tower to be up there as an attraction to visit. It is the height of engineering excellence but I still think this was an over priced experience compared with other city attractions.
This must be the number one attraction in central Toronto. Best to book in advance to avoid what can be very long queues. Stunning views from the top and the glass floor is great for the daring!
Always an incredible view. I like to go have dinner there but better pick times that are not too busy.

we visited the cn tower with a friend of mine who lives in toronto,we got there before sunset and stayed for a least 2 and half hours when it turned into nighttime,we had a amazing meal with drinks and thought it was great and worth the money,a full cycle of the tower was i believe around 45 mins...

It's not bad if you haven't been to any other 360 tower before. Although I have to admit that the food was very good, the view up there at night is nothing special. In my opinion, too much money for the experience you get. You could skip it unless you don't have anything else to do in Toronto.

This is definitely worth a visit because the views from the top are fantastic. The lifts are very quick and when we were there we did not have to queue for long. There is a good restaurant at the top.
Really high, really exciting to go up and have this amazing view over the land !Several levels you can visit, and also walk on glass and have over 500m beneath your feet....
This is a must see when in Toronto. The view from the top is stunning. Make sure you go early to avoid long queues.

The CN tower is a beautiful work of modern engineering and has quite a lot of history surrounding it. The observation deck does a good job of explaining facts and figures, similar to a museum. The elevator ride is fun if you can be near the doors to see outside, but they put so many people in at once that...
If you are in Toronto down town and the weather is sunny, CN Tower is one of the best choices to spend time!

It was a very clear day so we had excellent views of Toronto and Lake Ontario. Not much of a wait to get in given the time of day. Saw a couple people lose their lunch when on the observation deck, so I have to say if you even suspect you are scared of heights, don't push it.
The lineups are a bit long to get to the elevator, but it's worth it! We are impressed with the sky pod, along with the glass floor. I'm very happy we went up the tower.

We visited the tower as part of a dining experience. After eating at the CN 360 restaurant, we visited the observation deck's and the glass floor area. Wow. Not for acrophobics.The elevator ride up was an experience, as well. Fast and smooth. The view of greater Toronto was quite striking.

We went during the week on a beautiful sunny day. No waiting in any lines. We could stop and look out the windows for as long as we wanted. We paid the extra charge and went up to the skypod and watched the people doing the skywalk...

So we done the whole lotWent for the meal, the food and drink are not cheap but we found to be very goodThe observation deck and glass floor are free if you have a mealThe outside deck was closed due to weather conditions when we were there.We went to customer services and they gave us a...

it was average because i didn't like the obeservation deck and the wind blowing on me and i didn't like the glass floors too. but overall it was a average place and i did like the gift shop because it was huge too.

If you're terrified like I was of walkin the tallest building in Toronto, DO IT... that's the point ... I'm going to remember the 29 minute tour for da rest of my life... will take a while to forget the rap/song or the personality by the Guide Katie as well...

Easy to find, not that expensive for the experience you get. Paid $43 for adult admission to the lookout and glass floor. Really gives you a different perspective of Toronto and Lake Ontario. Realize how robust the city really is.

the views were amazing at day and night and I paid the extra 12 dollars to go further up to the skypod and was glad I did you get some amazing uninterrupted panoramic views of Toronto and Lake Ontario and all the surrounding towns, at the main lookout level the views are still amazing and with the option of being...

Overall, underwhelmed. $30 each plus tax was quite steep for very little. Could have gone up, looked around & come down in under 10 minutes. The Vancouver Lookout was better with more infoThis was just "relieve the tourists of cash as quickly as poss"! Good views but....

One of the main reasons for my trip was to go up the CN Tower and I have to say it more than lived up to expectation. The views are spectacular and there is enough information about the attraction given as you make your way to the lifts. The only downside was that it was too windy and the outside...
Beautiful views of city and lake! We went in the morning and didn't have to stand in line! You can also do a tour of the Rogers Center next door. Also rail museum across the street to the south.

I visited in sept last week. Unfortunately we were the chosen one, when I made the payment, the computer gave up and had to wait for more than 25 minutes to get a ticket, They don't have a way to refund and go for a new ticket. This is the only unpleasant moment for us because of which we missed...

Went up the Tower on Labour Day Sunday evening, along with thousands of others; it was a glorious day weather wise and there was a 90 minute queue to the elevators (which we were warned about before buying our tickets). Once up there, the views were very good, although the viewing windows could do with a good clean (easily remedied)...
With so many amazing high rise towers in Toronto there hardly seems any point going up. I guess which just wanted to do as we were after all tourists.
Be prepared to stand and wait. I thought by going in the "off season" the lines would not be long. I was very wrong.
This provides a wonderful view of this beautiful city. The security is a little inconvenient but welcome in light of the times. Highly recommend visitors utilize this attraction.

The Tower is fantastic and the views from the top are amazing. It's extremely busy, of course, and when my wife went to the ladies toilets she said they were absolutely DISUSTING. She complianed to a member of staff but the response hardly suggested that anything would be done about the situation. It's not cheap to visit the Tower and...

Took a trip to cn tower yesterday and all I can say fantastic . spectacular views and we were lucky enough to c the toronto blue jays stadium roof open.this is well worth a visit at 37 dollops, if you want to do the sky walk it's an extra 170 dollops. Walking on the glass floor was eary but fun.i...

We opted to do dinner at the top of the tower, which is something we would never typically do, but the reviews for the restaurant raved about the service and the prices were not bad at all. I cannot tell you how wonderful the server was! He was so attentive, welcoming, and wonderful!!! The food was beautiful presentation but definitely...
it really is an experiance that one must see. it gives you a great view of toronto and you really do feel like youre on top of the world.
What a great way to see the entire city of Toronto from high above. Glass floor was a bit intimidating

It great a bit scary when u go up in the lift once at the top the views are great.It's a bit expensive but worth itI personally have been to the top of the tower wouldn't do it again but it's worth going for the first time

The CN Tower is a really cool place to visit and gives you a fantastic view of Toronto. We did the 360 restaurant (highly recommend) as well as the regular observation deck and both were very fun! The glass bottom part of the observation deck is silly, but fun and definitely something to do. I highly recommend coming here if...

We visited on a windy day unfortunately and therefore the public were not allowed outside onto the viewing platform. However it was a good experience. Not the cheapest place to visit for what you get but the views you get from the top are magnificent. Taken up in high speed elevators, you get to learn the history of the tower....

Have been up towers in several cities cos it seems to be the touristy thing to do. Had to queue up for the tickets . The ride up in the elevator was accompanied by a girl ( staff) who rattled off some info in an almost bored fashion, not doing anything to enhance the experience. I wouldn't really recommend this...

Wasn't going to do it but decided at last minute to go for it! I am so glad we did! We were able to get reservations at the last minute and didn't have to wait. Scott, our waiter, was great and the rest of staff was good too (Amine was so helpful). Expensive for sure but it is an experience...

The style of this attraction is spectacular! The elevator goes up very quick from top and bottom and the best part is, on the whole way up you can look out the window of the elevator and view Toronto. The best part though is once you get to the top and get to stand on the glass bottom floor! Very...

My husband and I visited the CN Tower on a Tuesday morning & there was no wait time or overcrowding. The viewing deck offers some fantastic views of the city from inside & outside. I do think it's pretty expensive as we only spent about 30 minutes on the viewing deck but I guess it's one of those tourist things...

CN Tower was on the list of things to see and we went this morning. We had a lovely clear sunny day when we went up so had a beautiful view our into Toronto. The view of the harbour and Toronto Island was spectacular. The buildings itself looked clean, tidy and well maintained. The staff were polite too.The glass...
$40 Canadian to wait in a queue go up and down in a lift. Daylight robbery.Great views but you miss a piece where the coffee shop is located.

This was my first time at Toronto and the visit to this iconic tower was a must , according to our Canadian colleagues.The view is simply spectacular !!! we went at the end of the afternoon and the view was clear end the lights of the city from the tower were impressive.The food ( a meat and a...

Good. Just the line ups are outrageous. We bought an extra ticket to go to the sky pod. Don't do this if you are on a time line. It took an hour just to get up to the lookout tower and another hour to get to the sky pod. By the time we got up we had to race back...

Have been here for a couple of times already but still very eager to visit it again. We bought the tickets online to get discount and also save the time for queuing. The views were as beautiful as we first visited 30 yrs ago.

The last time I visited the CN Tower was July 2007, and not much has changed, it's still the iconic scenic tower it has always been. Amazing sights! If you are in Toronto, or even Ontario, put this on your to-do list!
We went to restaurant it's 65$ and u get two things. Doesn't matter what you get have to pick from menu.

Line moved quickly and our trip to the top was fun and informative!Enjoy the view going up and marvel at the number of flights you cover in a short time!Best part was seeing the baseball game in progress through the floor!!

What must have been a good experience turned out to be almost a nightmare. Buying the tickets, they advised there will be 30 minutes waiting time, and we agreed because that does not seemed extreme. We waited standing in line for almost 2 hours. There was some sort of explanation related to elevators been affected by the winds. Once we...
Went to visit the CN tower in mid September and enjoyed it as it was not that crowded. No line going up waited less than 5 mins heading down.
Still awfully impressive. I especially like the glass floor which makes you fight your instincts against your rational brain.

We wanted to see the beautiful view, but wow, $36 a person is way too expensive. Very crowded at top. It would be something you would do once. It was great to see the amount of security you had to go thru in order to go up the tower. Appreciated that.

You must have reservations for the 360 Restaurant. We scheduled a late lunch the same morning but was unable to get in for dinner. The food was excellent as was the service but VERY pricey. It was a great experience to sit and see the sites as we dined. After your meal you can walk the observation desk without charge....

Scenery made up for the service. part of a large group so menu limited. Service rather hurried. You need to get up and walk about to appreciate where you are. restaurant moves round so don't have to walk about. Nothing tells you what you are looking at..disappointed.

We thought this would be an anticlimax but it was fantastic. It is worth the wait and the money to travel up so high on a sunny day. We could see a live baseball game below in the Rogers Stadium. We could see right across the lake to Niagara.
If you buy the ticket which includes the aquarium etc. price is better value but we only wanted to do the tower. Shame they don't clean the glass more regularly too

I visited the CN Tower with 2 friends while in Toronto for a girl's weekend. I would definitely put it in the "must do" category for Toronto. It's cool to see it from the ground right under and the view from the top is amazing. When you are standing on the ground looking up at the tower it appears to...

Few words could to describe the fellings about this vision. So amazing, Awesome could try. I loved Toronto and its places. So, in your "travel list", Toronto should be one these places and CN... Just enjoy it the indescribable view! <3

Tremendous views of Toronto and beyond. The glass floor experience is quite daring for the faint hearted. Very good information on the construction and historical facts about the tower. Great photograph opportunities.
Nice place to see Toronto from above. A bit on the expensive side. but on a clear day its great. We went to the higher observation deck . Kids really enjoyed it
A must do if your staying in Toronto....can see for miles..has a glass floor in parts ! Queue was minimal when we went only waited about 15 mins

If you book the restaurant you can skip the queues and don't pay the admission fee. Otherwise go early to avoid the crowds, at this time the restaurant is closed and you have access to the restaurant views as well as the public viewing, the glass floor is great fun.

You can't miss the CN tower. Personally, I found the tickets a bit expensive. you can buy tickets for the big donut, which is about half way, or if you pay extra you can go all the way. Since I don't like to do things half, we went all the way up. The view is awesome!
Must see landmark we great views! Have a glass for that let you look straight down and gives you a somewhat awkward feeling. Not for the fainted hearts among us. Easy access, hardly waiting lines

I found the visit a little disappointing, the view was great to see Toronto Island and main areas. After the view, there wasn't nothing else to see.I wouldn't bother to go again but would recommend if you have never visited Toronto.

I've been into the tower a number of times over the years-- it's still a huge attraction. The views are astounding out over Lake Ontario and what you can view of the city is just captivating. The restaurant is expensive but it's worth it for the experience, I'd urge you to make a reservation well in advance because it is...
Reasonably priced to go and see the most amazing 360 degree view of an amazing city. Well worth a visit and a must see if your in the city
This is an absolute beauty. AmaZING!!Breathtaking views from the top. Sky walk is great. Restaurant on the top is good too.Recommended.
It was rainy on our day but still amazing view and a must see! We stayed at the super 8 downtown and we could see the Cn tower from our room which was amazing.
This was part of our tour on 10-1-16. No controlling the weather which made the view from the top limited. If you are here on a clear day go for it when you can!!

It's for sure a must see. The view is amazing, and it is an experience. As someone who is terrified of heights , it is still worth it! Definitely go outside, the wind whipping around is part of the fun.
So, while there is a couple of restaurants up in the tower it is the view people come for.I went there during nighttime and the view of Toronto-by-night was very nice.

The view really cannot be beat and if you are alright with heights it is amazing. The glass floor is definitely something to experience and if you haven't gone before it is definitely worth a trip up. It is going to cost you though, with tickets costing roughly $40, skypod another $12 and if you want the skywalk option it...

The view from the CN Tower is spectacular. That's the simple truth. It costs a lot to see it, but so does The Shard, The Empire State and many other such towers. The mix of city, airport and lake makes for just an amazing view. The glass floor was brilliant, and very entertaining for my 1 and 3 year old!...

Ate at the top of the tower at 360. The restaurant rotates while you eat which made me slightly dizzy but the food and the atmosphere were both great. And the wine list was beyond amazing.... If you like good wine.
Long wait for a few minutes view , that said fantastic view , but not cheap and if you want to go right to the top it's another $12 , can work out expensive for family

We hesitated on going up or just passing it by. We are glad we went up the tower. It is pricey but after all it is the one and only CN Tower. We went on a cloudy day and the greeters at the entrance advised us that it may be best to wait for a better day due to visibility...
This was worth the visit. On the evening we were there the view was spectacular and we all enjoyed the meal.

On a very clear day you can see the whole of Toronto. Free wifi also means real time updates on your social media ;-pDon't forget to search for discount coupons online if you're not buying the Citypass.

So, CN tower is obviously just a tourist attraction. But for all the peoples who are saying that is the worst thing in the world.. stop being hateful just because you spend time on a queue !It also impressive to walk on the glass floor because you can't stop thinking " what if the glass break.. " hahaI...

it is always a pleasure to eat in a restaurant where you can take all of your family, meat eaters and vegetarians and there are no worries because the choices on the menu would please any palate. The price is reasonable and the view amazing.

We visited the CN Tower in the evening. I believe the line up wait was shorter, which was good, but the view was not as good. However the lights were beautiful.
Quite a busy area to go to especially in the tourist seasons but definitely worth going up to. The glass floor is great.

Not prepared for the stunning views from this tower. The glass lift is high speed and you see the ground shooting away. Glass floor area for the brave, a restaurant which is priced separately and a further viewing floor even higher. A great souvenir shop, good prices and variety of stock.
