If you are a tourist in Toronto it's worth visiting this imposing tower. It is among the tallest in the world and a tourist attraction. You could either have a meal at the restaurant on the top or just take the elevator to the top. If you can time it to get to the top a little before sunset you...

We've been up many City needles before, but this is a magnificent feat of engineering. Designed with copper cabling through its center, to divert electricity down into the ground, we were shocked to learn that the CN Tower is struck by lightning an average of 75 times each year! There are opportunities to walk the circumference on the outside as...
We had some friends visiting us from Ireland, so the first place I told them they have to see is CN TOWER.they were very impressed so did I, every time I visit.
booked this as a special meal out. The food and service was excellent and so were the views. Staff efficient and helpful.

I would advise anyone who has purchased the toronto pass to go straight through to the main building, we stood in the (thankfully) short queue to exchange our pass ticket for a real ticket only to be told to go to the visitors kiosk inside (this was not mentioned in the booklet or anywhere at the Tower) i would have...

I've been atop the Needle in Seattle, the Empire State Blg and the Effiel Tower ....the CN Tower was comparable nothing extraordinary. ...except for a glass floor that was great...if you're not afraid to stand on and look wayyyy down! Worth the trip.... (Effiel was great!)

Arrived at the tower purposely early, 5pm to allow plenty of time to get up for 7pm and the sunset.It took 40 minutes to get a ticket and myself, wife and baby son We'r told its a 45-60 minute wait to get to the top. That was acceptable, we'd still have time to see Toronto semi lit up and...
Excellently view, but expensive and toooo long waiting time (2,5 hour/at 7PM), the same waiting time to go down

We opted to book ahead for a meal at the top of this tower, once the tallest in the world until the Burj Khalifa in Dubai and were not disappointed. We were shown to the front of the long queue outside, ushered up to the internal entrance and whisked up with the minimum of fuss to the restaurant. Here we...

Food quality was overall good but then we had to wait over 2hrs to get to the ground by elevator even though we paid almost 900 dollars for our meal .Others that had been guests at the restaurant were given priority in another lift

Great Structure.. but going to top is kind of expensive now.. around $40 bucks and almost everywhere glass and fence.. so if you want to take stunning pictures from top it's very difficult to take as reflection from inside light ruins pictures...especially at night.
Love the place. The views are very nice. The food and services are exellent. Will come back again soon.

Recommended by our concierge to go for dinner which fast tracks you to the rotating restaurant at the top and obviously includes the viewing deck if you wish. Having enjoyed a tasty dinner whilst watching the wonderful skyline of Toronto pass slowly we didn't need to go to the viewing deck. Absolute must when in Toronto!

Be brave and do it!! Awesome views over Toronto and Lake Ontario. Nice cafe for lunch but it does close early. Free ride to the top if you are eating in the 360 restaurant. Usual photo shoot stands. Glass panel floor and glass lifts. Queuing for lifts wS quite lengthy. Allow 2 hours to visit.
Great views of the city and surrounds. Included in the ticket is standing on the glass bottom tiles where you can see the street below (not for me). Lots of places to eat and grab a drink as well.
Sure the views are amazing. But it's a lot to pay for 30 minutes of entertainment. Also, be prepared for high winds on the outside walkway.

Only one side of the elevators is running which means 1.5 hrs of wait to go up and 1.5 hrs of wait to go down. The reason for the long wait is due to the elevators not being able to move as fast per usual and there's too much at risk with safety to operate all elevators when the building...

Wow!! This is not to be missed. My fear of heights were well out the window, the glass floor I conquered eventually!! Great views of the city, busy but worth every minute of the few queues we had to entail

we had a meal at the restaurant in the tower. we went at about 6 in the evening so got a view of the city during the early evening and then the night view. the views are stunning and really good that the restaurant revolves..i had the 2 course meal but didnt think much of the starters..for the main...

It is expensive to get up to the observation area ($35 per) so you have to ask yourself if experiencing this iconic Canadian landmark is on your 'bucket list' ? I simply can not imagine paying the roughly $200 for those that want to do the Edge Walk. Seems like a waste of money to me.

Fabulous experience as long as you are not afraid of heights. Staff very knowledgeable and safety conscious. have to make a reservation as it is very popular. You walk outside on a platform and can hang out of you wish. If it is on your bucket list, go for it!

We went to the observation deck. It was a nice view. Going out to the open air deck was when you realized how high you are. The air hits you and you have to stop and get your bearings. At least that's how I felt. The tower does have a glass floor section on this deck. Also the elevators have...

As now the third highest building in the world, the views from the CN Tower are spectaular over the lake and the city. The glass walk is a little unsettling, but fun, and the food reasonably priced when you get to the top. Highly recommend this attraction!

It is one of the things you feel you must do when in Toronto. It was a tall tower, great view, but that is it... The trip up in the elevator was a squash but very quick.Great view but that's about it.

First visit to a building so high for me, lift takes approx 59 seconds to reach the viewing area, we opted for the Sky Pod at the very top, outstanding views all around you, a must visit if in Toronto

I have been to the CN Tower a handful of times over the past 30 years and it hasn't changed much in that time. It is certainly very tall and has great views of Toronto and Lake Ontario. It is pricey to go and can be very busy during high season but everyone should go at least once. The glass...

Yes, it is expensive but it is a must do in Toronto. Great views. Get your tickets on line or do as we did and get there about 30 minutes before it opens. An hour later when we left there was a very long line. An hour is plenty of time once you get in.
The most iconic building in Toronto...a must visit. Great views of the city and Lake Ontario. The glass bottom floor was a trip. Go early and avoid the endless lines created by tour groups.

Worth a visit, but be sure your credit card is well in the black if you are having dinner. Food is very tasty though and the views all around are magnificent. We were lucky enough to be having dinner when a 'Blue Jays' game was taking place below us. I've never had such a unique view of any sporting event!

We were expecting huge queues but it actually only took us a few minutes to get tickets and there were no queues at all for the lifts.The main first level (that is included in all tickets) was actually a disappointment. It's very dark and half of the windows are in the cafe. The views are great obviously. The glass...

Absolute must do when in Toronto, the views are incredible! You can literally see all of the different areas of the city crystal clear from here. The entry was a little steep, but worth doing for sure. The glass floor was a nice touch as well!

Not sure of cost of ride up as I was there on a package deal. Had a great salmon dinner in the restaurant. Similar to space needle in Seattle, as the restaurant turns slowly so you can enjoy a lovely 360 degree view. Staff friendly and attentive, good service.
It is a landmark of Toronto and a must visit place. If you have not visited CN Tower, you have not visited anything.

Had to wait about 1/2 hour to get into the lift after paying $35 each for the lift ride to the top. Way too expensive for the experience. Whole time spent there was about 30 minutes. The glass floor was fun, & the views are wonderful, but $105 for 3 of us to ride a lift?? Really??

I live in the GTA. I have come to the CN Tower twice so far, and both times were mediocre. The price of admission was not worth it at all. The highly-buzzed glass elevator is just small glass panels that just takes up 1/10 of the floor. The view is nice, but definitely not worth the price of admission.
We had a wonderful view from the CN Tower. You could see all of Toronto and for many miles around. It is pricey, and was busy, but the view of Toronto and Lake Ontario was worth it.
The CN Tower is ok the food is good but way to much money to really just sit and eat!!! Been there a few times and it doesn't change but the view is awesome
We ate in the 360dedgree restaurant which includes entrance to the tower. Quicker elevator too ?...fantastic views and the glass floor amazing!
One of the highlights of our stay. Brilliant views over Dinner. there from 1745 till 2015 by which time it was dark., Staff service excellent and delicious food, beautifully served.

We were lucky enough to visit the tower in the day and at night. Excellent food at the 360 Restaurant with good service. We were there for a special birthday celebration which the restaurant acknowledged.

Loved the views from the top...went up all the way to the top, to the SkyPod. Views don't get any better from the SkyPod but the island airport seemed much more closer and clearer from top. Loved the sight of the planes landing and taking off from the tiny airport and runway. The glass floor was a big hit too.

We were amazingly lucky with the day we chose to go up the CN Tower. Because it was the Labor Day weekend we were treated to an air display by the Canadian Airforce and we had a bird's eye view. We stayed and watched nearly all of the fabulous acrobatics and general display.
The tower dominates Toronto skyline. It looks awesome. You can easily approach it from Union Station. There are amazing views of all Toronto from its observation deck

We went at night and had a wonderful meal and everything, but the view just isn't as great at night. Sure it's spectacular and you can see a lot, but in the dark views are definitely tampered with.
This was a must if you visit Toronto, especially the glass floor at the top which not everyone is brave enough to walk on. The views are fabulous.
Great attraction, lots of fun for thrill seekers and families. I'm afraid of heights but was still able to enjoy the view...from a few feet back!
I was mesmerized with the view from the top pf CN tower.The glass floor is just awesome. We took so many pictures from the top

An absolute must visit, for visitors to Toronto. We also went up to the top viewing platform, where you can see the "thrill seekers", walking on the outside.

Yet another tall view point to have a spectacular view of Toronto and greater area for the top. Revolving restaurant make it much relaxing to chill out from top!

Our teenage sons went to the top and had a blast! Wish I was not afraid of heights because the pictures they took were amazing. For the price it is worth a trip. Downtown Toronto is also amazing.

CN Tower is a must see for all visitors! ISuggest to get there very early in the morning and to buy tickets in advance to skip the long lines!

pleasantly surprised. open airy. nice variety of menu. noisy friendly and amazing view on a cool summer evening

the visit was a much anticipated one for me and my son and lived up to our expectations .The view and the setting in the revolving restaurant cannot be faulted however the food is only average at best !

By going to CN Tower you will be mesmerize how simple it is but beautiful and meaningful.It was near and surrounded also by different parks and stadium. You will feel how a gigantic tower become a heart of the city.

Absolutely loved the CN Tower. Great views. We went up just before sunset so we got to see the city in daylight, watch the fabulous sunset and then see the city with all the lights on. We went early afternoon had city pass so no queuing...which was great. Views were amazing got to see stadium from above and even managed to see a plane take off and land from Billy Bishop airport. All round good attraction.

The CN tower dominates the Toronto skyline, It is definitely worth a vist. The views of the downtown area and the lake are amazing. It can get incredibly busy thou, so head up there early.
We arrived at the opening, and went right up to the top without a wait. The staff on the elevators could have been a tad more dynamic.

Unfortunately the weather was not optimal for enjoying the view-heavy rain. We had booked lunch which was excellent. Because we had a restaurant booking we had no queuing for lifts and had complimentary access to the viewing platforms.
Excellent visit. Not to mention the glass floor.The 360 Restaurant is a definite must but you need reservations! Fabulous!

So glad that we got the Toronto City Pass for this event. Otherwise, we would have stand in a long line for this event. Amazing view of Toronto... a MUST if you are a tourist!We went during the day, so I suppose that going at night too (especially for photographers) would have been a must tooIt was not cheap, but as I said, a MUST!

Arrived there early one morning. No line. The view is gorgeous. Looks like you could also " strap up " and repel a very short distance from the outside. Restaurant looked nice but reservations required.

Very fast lift up tower to see wonderful views all around Toronto. There is a glass viewing area and an outside area. The inevitable gift shop has to be walked through to exit the attraction

My girlfriend and I visited thile cn tower. The food was OKAY not overly dazzling. The view was great how ever. The staff barley spoke english so that was kind of annoying. But overal it was a great time.

A Canadian landmark you should see at least once. Best times are early morning before sleeping travellers wake and line up. Expensive but something to do while in Toronto.

The CN Tower its a lot of fun, and it lets you see how large Toronto actually is. It's a wonderful aerial view, and the history provided on how the tower was built is fascinating.

The CN Tower was one of the first on my list to see in Toronto, and it was indeed worth a visit. I'm really not sure it's worth the full price (around $30), but with the City Pass it did seem worth giving it a go and I'm glad I did. The views were incredible from the top; it was...

Maybe I've been to too many towers and Big Wheels but this was decidedly underwhelming. Particularly the 'glass floor' which is a bit of an insert in a floor full of people doing selfies. Very commercial and hard to escape the gift shop on exit
Breath taking views and great picture opportunity. Is a must when visiting Toronto. The glass floor is a very weird experience but quite unique as well.
Worth a visit on a clear day. Expensive. Two levels of visit ie observation desk with glass floor below and Skypod which is an additional cost to the general admission ticket.

The view from the observation deck is wonderful. While the temperature was in the 90s, there was a nice breeze up top that was delightful. The line at the bottom was a little long but we could stay up top as long as we wanted.
We went in September at dusk. There was virtually no queue and great views as the sun sets. We almost booked the restaurant but it didn't have great reviews, shame.
A visit up the tower will give you a complete panorama of the entire city. This should be a tick box when visiting Toronto

I bought my ticket (for both levels) early (15 min. wait) and came back with 1.5 hours to reach the top before I needed to leave for the train. 35 minutes in line to get to the first level. 10 minutes at that level and then another 35 minutes in line to get to the sky pod. Finally had to...
This was a real good thing to do while in Totonto. We went around sunset and there were no crowds and no wai ting in line. Beautiful view of the city and of a magnificent sunset !
Loved the CN Tower. Went while it was raining which was not as fun. It was very cloudy and rainy during our visit.
Wasted 2 hrs and $35. All of that time was in a lineup. Security, ticket purchase, elevator then the elevator down. If you must waste a couple hours probably prepay online.

Not impressed by the view. We stayed at the 54th floor of a nearby building that had a better view of the harbour than the CN Tower, so this place didn't impressed me when I visited in 1984 and didn't change my mind now.

Even though I have been at the top of Burj Khalifa last year, this tower didn't disappoint me to be frank! I enjoyed the all around view, there are enough facilities: washrooms (as Canadians call the toilets) a bar and a restaurant, and various vending machines. I cannot tell you about the quality of the bar and restaurant as I...

it's one of the best attraction in Toronto, maybe you have to be a little bit patient with the queue. I really enjoy the window on the floor, and the shop at the end is wonderful. perfect if you have a rainy day

Went there late evening to try catch some sunset. Have to go through the security checks before buying tickets so do take into account extra time. Was told that i wouldn't get to see downtown Toronto and still same price but I went up anyway. Could have better signages as to how to get to the lifts to go up...
We did not go in, the structure is amazing just to view. One morning while we were sitting on a bench outside, we saw people hanging off the building. Have fun

We booked dinner and was really impressed by the quality of food, the service and the wine/beer list. We had a really enjoyable meal and then spent time enjoying the views. Recommended.We had dinner just before the sun set and so had the benefit of both early evening and night time views.

This is a must to see in Toronto,we came here with a group tour,so we didn't have to pay it was included.Amazing views and you can go to the observation platform and look down its all glass and have your picture taken.Plenty of cafes and souvenir shops here.Great place to visit

my 3rd time here. 1st as a 10 yr old, 2nd as young adult (19) and now with my own kids at 46. Its changed quite a bit over 40 years. the wait is 3 hours long now, but the view is great and the area is so nice now with aquarium, brewery and skydome. nice family outing. gotta do...

As previous reviewers said, it is a shame you can't get 360 degrees views - the one level you can walk around is enclosed with mesh so you can't take photos. The otherhalf of the other one is taken up with a restaurant. So if u go at the wrong time your camera is looking into the sun. They...

A lot more expensive than the last time I was there, still enjoyed it. VERY expensive for the keepsake photos that they take and try to sell to you.Views were great. Remember to grab your coupons before you get there. Try to save yourself a few $$
We have been up the tower before, but the view never gets old. Just can never seem to get to get into the 360 Restaurant. Enjoyed it anyway.
Amazing views of the city! I highly recommend eating in the cafe. During non peak hours you'll get a window seat and can really enjoy the views while having a wonderful meal!
Amazing views. The glass floor is an added bonus although it can get very crowded. An absolute must when in Toronto.
A must see landmark in the centre of downtown Toronto which on a nice day has the most spectacular view. With many additional places to visit nearby this is a must see place
Well worth a visit. Lifts get you to the top very fast. Although busy, the queue moved quickly and it didn't seem to be crowded. You must walk on the glass floor.
Buy online tickets which will help you skip the first line. 90% of the visit will be spent standing in a line. Not worth the visit when it ia busy.
Very high great views ????Come to Toronto enjoy life withThe melting pot of CanadaThe museum the culture night life
My husband and I went around 1930h & it is a beautiful view. I wish we had gone during the day. We took basic entry and spent about 45 minutes up on deck. It is a marvel of engineering!
If you visit Toronto, This is a must to see. The views from top of CN tower is awesome. If you need to wait to get to top, i advice you to wait as once you get to top it will be worth waiting.

I recently moved to Ontario and my best friend and I decided to check out Toronto on his visit. Of course, we did the CN tower. I don't regret it and I liked that I did it mostly just to say that I did. I wouldn't bother going again.The good:If you love the city, it is a good...

Definitely worthwhile. We went in the evening about 7pm, when queues had died down slightly and were not just as mental. We booked tickets earlier in the day, went for some food and came back at 7pm. Once inside we did have to queue for about 45 minutes - 1 hour to get the lift up, there is plenty to...

We booked the 360 restaurant for dinner as we heard it was the best way to experience the CN Tower. We were expecting the views from the revolving restaurant to be amazing and we were not disappointed. On the other hand, we were not expecting too much from the food, given that it’s a major tourist attraction. However, in this...

As the title says, "CN Tower is an awesome piece of engineering" that everyone should see. The views from the top are spectacular as you can see all over the city, lake and watch the planes arrive and takeoff from City airport. The initial ride up in the elevator is fun and leads to the observation decks. The upper deck...

This was worth the wait to get up to the top. Amazing views and im still not sure about the glass floor! We stayed for cocktails and a snack, really reasonable. Beautiful looking out over the city. Good gift store

The CN Tower is a not to miss attraction in Toronto. The views are amazing & the history behind it is really cool. All the staff are great & it doesn't take a long time to go through the attraction, which is always a plus.We got the ticket as part of a City Pass, which I recommend getting if...
We had reservations for an early dinner at the 360 restaurant, and it did not disappoint. We went mainly for the view, but the food was delicious! Definitely the way to see the top of the city!

This was worth the money! Unless you're afraid of heights this was well worth the money. It's amazing views and just a great atmosphere. We were in a time crunch or else we would have done the sky pods as well!

The CN Tower is pretty cool. I remember as a kid my parents taking us down to watch a big Russian helicopter named Olga, deliver the very top of the antennae in place. I've been a couple of times before but never to do the Edge Walk - so it was about time!I went with a friend who was...

The view of Toronto and Toronto Island was excellent. We did have a beautiful sunny day. The $2.00 charge to use the binoculars is an absolute waste of money, As pensioners we were charged $67.80 to walk around the observation deck twice. Although the view was excellent it wasn't worth the cost.
What can I say, a must see of course. No regrets at all. Awesome views. The one drawback is the excessive cost of the sky walk. A lot of money for a half hour or so.
You have to do this if you visit Toronto - the views are amazing and the glass floor is a great extra

nice attraction , you could see so far as america, short waiting time, had to make a complaint to customer service because at the register they did not give me aaa discount because im from europe. The glas floor is creepy but amazing, also a glass floor in the elevator on the way down

CN tower is well worth doing if you are in town. It's not cheap at $35 but it's worth it for the spectacular views of Toronto. If you want to go to the highest floors it's an extra $12.the bar/ restaurant is surprisingly reasonable so you can enjoy a drink while you enjoy the views. If you are in toronto...

Some amazing views from the top. Also managed to look down onto a baseball game taking place which was great.Did not book in advance, don't think it's necessary, queue was reasonably quick.A must do if in Toronto.

The CN tower is a must if you are in the city. If you are planning on visiting here which most are I would recommend coming early in the day as it can get busy. I also recommend buying the city pass if you will visit most attractions as this can save quite a bit of money. The tower is...

Again, I was working abroad. This time in Canada. First time in there. Toronto is a modern, very clean and full of life city. We took a boat ride in the dawn and it was amazing. The tower is fantastic at night. I recommend!!!
Was a little hazy when we visited but the view across Toronto would be magic on a clear day. Nice restaurant.

Cost 39 dollars inc the tax which I thought expensive for what we got for this. However the views are great and part of the experience of seeing Toronto so not to be missed. I am slightly nervous on heights but can say that I was not bothered at all and plenty of places to head to if any fears...

column3: São Carlos do Pinhal, São Paulo, Brazil
column4: The experience to see the whole city from the tower is incredible. You can have such a wonderful view and plus have lunch at the most spectacular restaurant.
Fantastic views from the Skydeck and hardly queued for long.A must is the Glass floor but can get crowed.

We booked a meal because you can go up the Tower for free if you do this. On our arrival at 4.30 we were ushered passed at the queues (an excellent feeling!) to the lift. The food was on the expensive side but absolutely delicious. Spectacular views of Toronto, particularly as we witnessed it during daylight, twilight and nighttime.

Great meal and views. We arrived at the perfect time, about 1hour before dusk which meant we had both day and night viewing. Great to look down into the Rogers baseball park all lit up with a night game in progress. A must do if you are in Toronto.
Between the beautiful city views, dinner, activities and shopping, this could be a full day activity!

We found this experience to be average and over priced. Not sure if it was because we've already seen the view from the rockerfeller centre in NYC but we were really unwhelmed by the view here. There are much better things to spend your money on in Toronto.
The tower was great. If you go early before 11am it's not that crowded and you can get as many photos without the big crowd.

We had a great visit at the tower today. We chose a day when very few clouds were around and the view was awesome as a result.Don't bother with the sky pod; you pay extra for not very much and no different a view.If you feel brave pay $195 to strap in to some work clothes and be...

You know you are not going to go to Tornoto and not go to the CN Tower. I would highly recommend getting the city pass if you are going to do ANY of the touristy things in TO. With the pass we skipped the unbelievable long ticket line up but still had to wait almost 2 hours for the elevator...
The views and lunch in this City icon was unbelievable. When in Toronto this is a must see and do if nothing else......

For bit more than 50 CADs you can get into the highest point of the CN tower and you will not regret this investment. The views are stunning, you can see whole Toronto city and also Ontario lake. No 1 POI in Toronto.

Last time here was as a child, almost 40 years ago...awesome thrill to have such a spectacular view of Toronto and the Lake Ontario shores. Neat to see the old landmarks from this perspective and to view all the sprawl. It was a beautiful clear day with a gorgeous view of the completely flat horizon (sorry globalists, no curvature...) on...

A must see in Toronto and a lively restaurant with nice staff too. Definitely the highest date I have had so far!!!Upper level was worth extra as it scared the sh1t out of my wife!! LolLift staff were miserable but so would I be doing that job!!

As said by a previous rater, it is what you would expect. Excellent views of the city and Lake Ontario. I thought the glass floor was a bit small, as I thought it was going to be all the way around instead of about 15 feet of it. It was a pricey attraction for what was entailed in the visit....

Greatest disappointment ever!! I'm a lover of high towers and I have to say I was expecting much more from CN Tower.It is the most expensive tower I have ever been (and I've been to many) and the one to offer the basic, with quite bad views.The outside deck is surrounded by a metal fence with such small...

i wouldnt say that this was an amazing experience but they make the best of it. the views are unforgettable and the glass floored part is fun.Expensive for what you get, but if you ve travelled thousands of miles to be in Toronto, what's 50 bucks on top?

This is one of the 'must do' sites in Toronto, but if you leave your visit till the afternoon you are bound to have to wait in very long queues, especially during summer vacation time. We went at 9.00 in the morning and had not trouble getting to the top very quickly. Depending on the weather, the views are magnificent.
What an amazing view at over 1100ft, you can see for miles. The glass floor is a must to stand on for the brave.

We went reasonably early so the queues were not too bad (also got the City Pass, so could queue jump at other attractions in the pass). We also got 50% off going right to the top with the City Pass, so went for it. The views from there weren't worth it - similar to the views from the normal viewing...

It's a impressive building not commonly seen in Europe. I'm afraid of heights he certainly not taken chance to go up and enjoy the views of the Torontos panorama. CN tower looks also awesome at night. Walk-in distance to city marina.
Well worth the visit. I was there shortly after it opened and there was no wait to get in, especially since I purchased the City Pass and got to go past the ticket line.
Dinner and then the viewing areas made for a great visit to Toronto for our 25th anniversary. Be sure to go

I went at dusk, so I could see the city by daylight & then at night. As an added bonus the Jays were playing baseball, providing an excellent view of the stadium.I thought it worth paying the extra & going to the highest part too.

My mother and hubby visited the CN tour last Friday as we were staying nextdoor at the Renaissance hotel. It was a higher cost for the basic tour and it's what you would expect: high views, lots of tourist, and overall a bit boring. The sky window in the floor was so mobbed with people that you could barely even...

Visited with family.. The view from the top is absolutely breath taking. when I stood on the see through glass it was exhilarating but i did go weak in the knees.We spent a couple hours there also sampling the restaurant. I would recommend they add more varieties for vegetarians. I would definitely suggest this to future travelers. Toronto is an...

This was our 4th visit over the years but this attraction never dissapoints.!The thrill of the ride up the tower, the observation deck and the glass floor. Then that second ride up to the top.Everyone should do this visit at least once in a lifetime.Here is a tip, Consider buying the Toronto City Pass (available at the...
It is pretty cool but like everything else in Canada - Pricey - and the restaurant at the top starts at about $50 pet person.

Loved going here. Went on a date. It was such a cool experience being able to look at the city. We went at night. Although I heard if you go during the day you can see ripleys aquarium which is basically open at the top to see the fish

CN Tower is located in heart of the Toronto city. To beat the long lines, go for the city pass. Go for the edge walk (not for faint hearted). The edge walk is at height of 336 mm (116 storeys high) walk around the edge of the CN Tower. Safety measures are high and you have a guide.The...

Incredibly crowded and busy all the time! We went right after a thunderstorm and the ticket seller warned us that we wouldn't be able to see far but we went anyhow. The sky pod view was out of this world! Biggest complaint is probably the long lines and the prices were a bit high for what you get.

My hubby and I went up the CN Tower using our City Passes...so we beat the queues (though not security). The info in the lobby area before you take the elevator up we found to be really interesting. The views really are fabulous. We wandered round for a while taking photos before going up to the Sky Pod (you get...

This was a great experience, but I would advise if you're on a time limit, tell them when you buy your tickets. We asked about the wait and they told us 30 minutes. An hour and a half later, we still weren't close to going up and we had a flight to catch!! They did let us go to the...

Fantastic especially early evening and whatch everything light up over the city, the restaurant was fabulous and scrumptious menu food cooked perfect, the restaurant moved in a circle so you could see all Toronto whist eating, the glass floor was good if you dare to stand on it. Well worth a visit.

We took a metro from our hotel to go to here.They said it was the tallest tower in the world i think.Cant remember much abt d facts.But once u r on top u can see the whole city..i guess it has the same experience as in gold coast n narita obervation deck.I think they can improve the place better maybe...
We had dinner at the CN Towers the ambiance was nice view was fantastic the food was ok very expensive and the restaurant is way over rated but we had pleasant experience dining at the CN Towers.
go early, and it is alright. Not worth it to go the extra little bit to the top. It gives you not so good photo ops because of the small space, and support blocking view
Great view of the lake and the city. Easy to plan your day when you can see exactly where you are going next. Don't miss the chocolate covered croissants at the snack bar.

If it weren't for the discounted tickets through City Pass, we would not go. Basic regular tickets cost $35 for an adult. That's too steep for my blood. The view was nice from up though. We had lunch at Horizons. The servers were very unenthusiastic for staff at a tourist attraction. Barely a smile out of them and it took...

We bought the Toronto city pass, beat the long lines, got in to see the views and it was really nice. Coming from Chicago where we have the Sears tower with the sky deck, this wasnt as impressive but it was still nice to see Toronto from the high vantage point. The glass elevator was a nice touch as well...

Yes, I been here couple of times but hadn't any change to had a great view due to clouding weather. Last weekends was my lucky day had a fun and love the view from the top. Of course those really want to have an experience with glass floor should visit this place. Great time and money worthy. Highly recommend those...
The wait times can be avoided by going directly to the restaurant for lunch..pay the extra $$have lunch and enjoy the same views...don't tell too many people

The CN Tower is located in one of the most touristic squares of Toronto. Being the most famous monument and attraction of the city, it defines its skyline. Its beauty easily increases when the night comes, when lights in several colours illuminate the tower.From inside, one most highlight the fast elevators and the magnificient views from the city. Notwithstanding,...

Wandered through after dinner instead of heading straight down. Found the views nice (although obscured by clouds on our particular day). The glass floor is a bit of a rush, though you know it is safe. The lines for elevators down were long so we walked back up to the restaurant and got on that one - no line at...

I'm scared of heights but this really is a must do in Toronto! The glass floor is moderately scary but still put the baby on there, lol.Very family friendly although there isnt a nursing area there is baby changing and a kids soft play area.The views are amazing, and we didnt have to queue very long to go...

Great experience, we went today September 14th, the sky was clear, we took the sub way, there was no line, we paid CAD 35 per ticket plus tax (!!), we took the elevator up to the glass room, then we went down where you stand on a glassy floor, it is not scary as it looks.We paid for the...
This attraction may seem a little cheesy but you can not beat that perfect 360 degree view of the city! There will be long lines, but they move fast.

The wait to get up to the top of the tower is quite considerable if you can book your ticket using the internet either by your phone or from your hotel will be an advantage. as we had a 45minute wait to buy our tickets. Then a further 2hs to wait in the line (as they call them) before getting...
I've been there a couple of times now. It's a nice view from the top, but a bit pricey for what you're getting.
had a great night here, its well worth going up for a meal, not just the observation deck, sit there and watch the city of toronto go by as you eat some great food

Having challenged my students to do something to face a specific fear (dance, swim, public speaking etc) I found myself doing the same - my fear of heights. A friend kindly 'surprised' me with a dinner at 360º at the top of tower and no matter how hard I prayed for clouds to cancel the trip, it was a clear...

Part of the City Pass system in Toronto. It offers a tremendous view. The glass floor is a highlight of the trip. Offers, for an extra price, the trip to the very top where you are held in place with cables as you walk around the structure. The restaurants are fine dining with a marvelous view. Be prepared for a...

Long, long wait but excellent view. We didn't get to the top until dark which was very nice to see Toronto at night but I would highly recommend trying to schedule your time to straddle day and night for the best of both. The restaurant (360) was incredible!!
Get the full pass that allows access to the highest viewing area, suberb views of the city and the magnificent Lake!

The view from the Skypod at the very top is worth the extra few dollars. The experience up there is similar to any tall tower in a major city but it is well worth it. The glass floor is good fun and if you go early in the morning you should not have a long wait to get up and...

We visited the CN Tower on our first visit to Toronto. It is a well run tourist attraction. They do a good job of getting people to the viewing deck. You can view from the inside or go to the outside deck. You can walk all the way around and see all of Toronto. The glass floor is also a...

Had supper at the restaurant, 360, food was surprisingly good quality as was the service. Pricey, but worth a trip once! Amazing view both early evening and later as the sun set and lights came on in the city. Don't miss it!

I have been multiple times. It is a fantastic view.The wait times however can be very long so I would recommend staying clear on a long weekend or peak hours. You can end up waiting for over an hour.It is also very expensive I found. $35 for adults and $25 for children. So for a family of four...
Although I can say I have now been at the top of the third tallest building in the world, the wait for this was too long and the price too high. Once is enough for this one.

My children and I decided to go and visit the CN Tower, some clouds floated around but not much until we arrived and it started to lightly drizzle. I didn't want to go up what can you see up there while raining. Well this was an eye opener and experience for us not only did we expereince which is only...

I have always felt this sounded a rather expensive outing but we had a great time,two grans,our daughter and 6 year old grandson.We went on a Sunday morning...a very short queue to buy tickets and then straight up in the elevator to the observation deck.We drank a leisurely delicious quite expensive coffee whilst surveying the view of the lake...

Looooong lines. Get a city pass or add 40 minutes to your visit just to take tickets. Then another 40min to get to the elevator. Taking a mandatory picture seems to be a 'right of passage" in Canada , there's no way of opting out of it.. Keep your party and young kids close on the two top floors ....

We got lucky and there was an air show the same day. It would have been impressive even if there wasn't. Our hotel aloud us to leave our car until 2 pm on checkout day with no additional charge so we choose checkout day for CN Tower. We arrived around 11am and purchased the pod option. We took a lot...
At over 1,100 feet, don't be afraid of heights. View is spectacular! Glass floor is a must visit. For the really daring, do the outdoor harness hanging off the side. Must do in Toronto.
Get a reservation to the revolving restaurant instead of buying the tower tickets and you get the tower experience for free and no standing in long lines.

A wonderful meal, with brilliant staff and breathtaking views.The menu was excellent, but the experience was exciting, amazing and one to be remembered.I'd highly recommend to anyone visiting Toronto. Well worth it.
I have been to Toronto many times , but didn't really check it out this city from tourist point of view . Today we visit CN Tower , amazing experience ! What a view ! You have to check it out .

Great place to view the beautiful city of Toronto, at night and day. Have to walk or lay down on the glass floor and enjoy the view of a baseball if played when the dome is open. The elevator and staff operating them were great and minimized the wait time to go up and down the tower.

This place was packed on the labour day long weekend. 20 min lineup to get up the elevator, 20 minute lineup to get to the observation deck, 20 minute wait to get down the elevator from the observation deck, and another 20 minute wait to get down to ground level. And, try doing that with little kids... it's nuts!The...
The CN tower is very overpriced for what you get.. We paid well over a hundred dollars for two people to stand in line for three hours.. Very disappointed

The lineup to get on to the elevators was way too long, and to add insult to injury there was an almost equally long line to get back down again. The line to get back down was poorly managed and marked, several people were annoyed by people cutting into line. One of the elevator banks was not operating so this...

A visit to the CN Tower is thrilling; I would highly recommend that you go for the full package; if you're going to visit make it worth your while. Definitely an experience of a lifetime....walking on the see through floor was a bit scary - okay, it was very scary but fun at the same time. The CN Tower has...
What an amazing experience. Very expensive, but none the less, so glad that we did it. Also went to the second level which had fewer tourists.
In the summer, I spent about 1 hour just waiting in the queue. But the view is astonishing. You can see almost the entire city from there.

When you enter the lift (with its partial glass floor) it takes only a short ride up to the viewing pod. The pod also has a partial glass floor to stand on when you can see to the bottom - if you dare. The views from the outside across the city are fantastic.

Got there around 5 after going to the aquarium next door. We got the city pass so we were able to skip the lines for buying tickets and got right in the going up line. Wait was 1 hour and 45 minutes to go up but the line was moving very fast. Amazing views from hitting the elevator to all...
This is a must do if you are in Toronto - the CN Tower has absolutely stunning views and will provide you with a good understanding of where everything is in the city.
Great experience once we got to the top, but it costed about $35 each, and the wait was around 4 hours to board the elevator up. 4 hour wait for maybe 1 hour up there.

WOW!.We took the challenge to do the Edge Walk.What a fantastic experience.The staff from the Edge Walk Team are absolutely brilliant! Katie our guide on the walk was very professional and made you feel very at ease.Its not the kind of activity that we would normally do but so glad we did.As part of the Edge Walk Package you...

Visiting from the UK and this is one of our things to do in Toronto. There are no long queues and the elevator ride up gives a feel of the height of the tower. Great views of the city especially on a clear day.The glass walk is a must do if you are brave enough.
An excellent way to spend the evening, I recommend heading up just before sunset to maximise your viewing.

In Weekend we visited tower.It was crowded and we were a long time in queue for going up for start and also going down at the end of visit.The Tower had Three Levels from bottom to tops:1-The Glass Level At the height 342m ,2- The LookOut Level At the height of 346m , 3-The SkyPod Level At the level 447m.Before...
Well it wouldn't be a trip to Toronto without a trip up the CN!! To save some dollar just go to the lower level and avoid the skypod as it's essentially the same view.

We used the hop on hop off bus to get to the CN tower we bought tickets on line before visiting which is well worth doing saves queuing we also visited in the morning when there was not much queue when we went passed after lunch the queue was twice the size.The views are amazing all the staff are...
Great view of Toronto great value also the 360 view restaurant also is great value restaurant this place is most go if visit Toronto.

We visited on a fairly clear and very hot weekday in September. It wasn't that busy, we had booked our tickets online. We were able to gain entry and travel up without any large queues. We booked tickets to go to the space pod level.Fantastic views- glass floor good, saw folk doing the edge walk below. Had lunch in...
Went for dinner , and view ok place a one time visit is good. A tourist attraction. it was a business event
its a long way up and worth the price to say you did it. Elevators on the way up give you a lift, pun intended. Dod buy food its not the best.
Second time going up the CN tower (first time was about 15 or so years ago if not longer). The views were really cool.

If you are reading this then you have already made the decision to visit this attraction. Don't miss it, the views are phenomenal. The ride up is breathtaking if not stomach churning. A must do if you are in Toronto

Visited here at the end of August. We queued about 30 mins for tickets... Then queued another 10mins for lift to viewing floor. We paid extra to go to the 'pod' we then queued 40mins for the lift. So all in all we queued an hour and half for 15 min attraction. To be honest after queuing so long we'd...
We visited early in the day and queues were short so benefitted from a chilled and enjoyable time taking in the stunning views across the lake. Not cheap but worth the experience.

It's high, one of the highest once, and has a splendid view over Toronto. You can also look down through a glass floor, but what's the fun of that. Nice to have seen it. Next time will be late in the evening.

One of the seven modern wonders of the world for a reason. The CN Tower is a spectacle to behold. This thing is ENORMOUS, and they light it up at night in a beautiful display of colors and patterns. The Mrs and I just came back from Toronto and our hotel was literally walking distance from the CN Tower. We...
We went to the CN tower and had a meal here in the 360 restaurant. Beautiful views over Toronto during sun set, and the food was absolutely delicious. Would definitely recommend!
had to wait over 2 hours but was worth it as git to the viewing platform at nightfall and spent over an hour enjoying the views

after taking well over an hour in the queue before getting to the top, we found it overcrowded with people at all the dirty windows and also more people sitting around the floor.As we felt very unsafe (we knew if a fire broke out, hundreds of people would die due to being unable to escape) we decided to go...

We visited first thing (9am) and so avoided any crowds. My husband doesn't like heights and so spent his time in the glass sided elevator sweating along with several others. There was also the opportunity to stand on the glass floor in the tower which he was able to do by the time we left. Excellent therapy!The views of...

We were not exactly looking forward to this lunch with much gleeful anticipation - thinking of the difficulty of reaching the restaurant - however we were very pleasantly surprised with the smooth way reaching our destination was achieved. The lunch was excellent - the reception staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful - starting us off on the right...

Only drawback was the hour long queue but worth the wait. When you get into the elevator you have to deliberately stay to the front to get the amazing views from the glass elevator a fast minute journey to the top also bit cold on the observation deck there is also a glass floor to look down through not for...

We paid a revisit to the CN Tower after a number of years and was disappointed to find no new attractions - only the gift shop seemed better stocked.There is nothing new to see or experience for repeat visitors.

You can never tire of the views from the CN Tower. Is definitely worth a visit when you are in the city. I finally worked up the nerve to stand on the glass floor. Now that is a definite experience. I don't think I can ever do the walk on the outside, hanging from safety straps but if you're up...

The cost to go up to the main observation deck for two people was about $75 CAD. We waited about 10 minutes for the elevator and then up we went. CN Tower has spectacular views of the city, and there is an area where you can go to the outside observation area. They also have a glass floor viewing area...
We went up on a lovely clear sunny day and had the most fantastic views all around.This is not recommended if you can't take heights, particularly over the glass floors!
It's an engineering wonder of the world, what's NOT cool about that! Check it out it'd hard to miss!

Great views and on clear days you can see forever.Glass floor does excite everyone.No markers to tell you what you can see from the observatory. Not a problem for locals but no help for tourists.The bar was a good place to have a drink and scan the horizon. Enjoyed watching the planes landing.
Beautiful View! The 360 restaurant had great food and great servers. Make reservations there and avoid the lines. I will go again!

Amazing views and the glass floor was really really cool to walk across. I appreciated the reviews from other users that if you are going during a touristy time to get there early, shortly after opening as the early afternoon lines looked much longer while we were leaving.

We had dinner at the CN Tower's "360" Restaurant on Labor Day weekend and highly recommend it. Our waiter was knowledgeable, the food was very good and the view was amazing. (I'd love to have the recipe for the tomato-corn gazpacho!) The dinner price includes admission to the observation deck without the often- long wait. We especially loved seeing planes...

Yes, it is a great view from the top. It was very clear and warm, so you could see everything, but other than that it is fairly boring. There are many other exiting things to do in this city. I recommend going once.

Took my son to CN tower as it was his first trip to Toronto. I had been to the tower years ago. Bought our tickets online before we arrived in Toronto. Got there early as suggested by some reviewers on the Internet on a Saturday morning. Basically breezed through as there wasn't much queuing to do since we could go...

Amazing view from platform located at 3/4 of the tower. A bit pricey but worth it if done in the evening. Around 35/40 CAD but more expensive if you want to reach the Skypod (almost on the top) and do the walk outside on the edge of the tower.A must do (not if you suffer of heart attack).

Had a great lunch at 360 restaurant in the Canadian News Tower. The view is amazing on the 151st floor. The restaurant is revolving and we turned a full revolution during lunch. This allowed us an unparalleled view of all of Toronto. Fantastic

You can easily walk here via a sky bridge from Union station in about 10 minutes, depending on your speed. There are a few different ticket options depending on how high you want to go. We just went to the main floor at about 120 floors up. The elevator takes 58 seconds. Views were beautiful. We took a few pics...

The views from the tower are undeniably spectacular. We visited on a clear afternoon and the height of the tower is quite amazing. However - as an attraction which sees so many visitors, they really could be making a lot more of it, and organising it far more efficiently.We had pre-booked tickets and were told on arrival that our...

Excellent meal, surprised by the quality and service, we thought we would be rushed through but no, we kept to the set menu, and the meal was great, with great service from waiter (Bill) Bill was exceptional explained menu and food and was spot on. Pleasant surroundings and not rushed although fully booked. The whole family really enjoyed the experience...

Where else can you eat while the restaurant rotates 360 degrees but the CN Tower. Yes its expensive but your on holiday get over it pay the money and experience it. the food is better than good if not huge portions, the staff are friendly. Its not a quiet dining experience but there is no sense of rushing you and...
This was a great experience. Fantastic views from the top of the tower. It really is a must do when in Toronto.

Nice views, small gift shop, nice food probably not worth the price but obviously paying for the view that came with it. On thing that would be good is if like the Berlin tower they put some info in the restaurant of what you are looking at at the time of rotation. The worst bit about the whole experience which...
It's was ok glass floor was smaller then expected view was nice but couldn't go all the way around on one section. But it was fine part of Toronto so needs to be seen I guess.
I never realized you could see Rochester, NY, from Toronto. The glass floor where you could look down and the view of Rogers Field almost directly below are neat.
Everyone needs to visit and go up in the CN Tower once in their lives. If you go to Toronto, this is a must see attraction!

I took my niece and nephew that were visiting to the CN tower. Great view of the city. Tried using the vending machines as the kids were thirsty and the machine failed to dispense the drinks not once but twice. The staff seemed disinterested when I approached them about the issue, gave me a number to call and walked away....

The views of Toronto and Ontario Lake are stunning!There is a restaurant at the top (nothing special, unfortunately. Don't recommend it as there are better places to eat) and some other facilities.The famous glass floor is rather a small area and very crowded with small children so forget about an unique photos.It's definitely worth to buy tickets...

Had a super meal .. Early Dinner and watched the sun set. A so got a blimp's eye view of a baseball match at the Rogers Centre next door. We were lucky with the weather as the previous evening we would have seen nothing but cloud and rain. Food was good, flavoursome and reasonably sized portions. A tad expensive, but...

We went up the tower on a lovely clear day with high expectations! Only stayed about 30 minutes. It was packed, squashy, no signage indicating what the buildings are or the history of them. I expected a guide like at Vancouver but nothing. The views were great but I had no idea what any thing is or what I was...
I visited CN Tower, there are too many things to do!!! Toronto city it's Beautiful.... Make sure brings your credit card an the camera!!!...

Big downside was the lengthy queues.but I did go on a Saturday and it was also a holiday weekend+ the weather was so clear. Once you get up, what a view, difficult to describe, but I'm sure glad I did.and you also have to queue to come down again!!!!!' Also saw a group out on the edge. Not for me...

I remember playing pretend 'CN Tower' in the late 1970s. Although you get a good view of the city, the safety mesh on the outdoor observation area makes it hard to actually see anything. The glassed-in area is better, but it is hard to get a good 360 degree view due to the restaurant/bar in the way. I still enjoy...
Scary, hahaha; GREAT view of the Toronto area. If you are into heights, there's a complimentary tour you can take outside of the freaking tower... Take pictures!

The CN tower is a beautiful structure in the Toronto skyline and certainly features in any visit to the city. However, given the high price of admission and the dated feel of the experience, I would recommend giving this one a miss. Compared to other tall structures I've visited - the empire state building and the rock in New York...
Took company here and of course they were impressed. Had a clear day and could see for miles.Thank goodness for CityPass as everything in Toronto is $$$$

The tallest structure in North America, the CN Tower has a view that is second to none. On a clear day, you can see the US. The glass floor and the observation deck were great, but not for acrophobia.

Used our Toronto pass to get in here to avoid the queue and was soon on the way up to the top in just one minute. The place is busy but large enough to allow everyone a view down onto Toronto . We paid another $13 ( half the price quoted as we used our pass ) to go to...

My boyfriend and I enjoyed the CN tower as a part of the Toronto City Pass. We are both a bit scared of heights, but we still very much enjoyed going up in the tower, the 5th tallest structure in the world. It has a glass floor you can stand on and stare down from the dizzying height of the...

Seen this in films and heard about as being a great attraction. Been to a fair few towers in various cities and this is pretty good. Shame all the views are behind glass or mesh. Lots of reflections especially when taking pics. Not sure if the extra $12 is worth it for going up to the highest point. Glass floor...

The CN Tower is a modern wonder. The views are spectacular but I felt like I was being herded in and out and missed a lot of the history and background of the Tower. It would have been helpful to have had a guided tour.

We booked online before we left and got a really good group booking deal. The views are amazing and the glass floor was brilliant. We also did the sky pod at the top and it was amazing to see just how much the tower was moving when you could not even feel it A fantastic feat of architecture and well...
We were unimpressed with the tower,it was quite in need of attention,untidy,Windows not clean making photography almost impossible. Staff appeared disinterested. I would not waste my time again.
The views from the top are amazing. A 360 degree perspective of the city. We liked the glass floor..scary

Would highly recommend going here. It is not cheap to eat in the restaurant but it is the experience of a lifetime! Especially if you go in daylight to catch the view over the lake before the sun goes down and then to see the night view as well with all the lights - it is just gorgeous. Go to...

My GF and I went to this and it's hard to recommend this up against say Empire State in NY/Walkie Talkie building in London or other high buildings I have been to around the world.We only bought general admission tickets for the lower tier and the problem with Toronto is only the lake side is worth looking at. (in...

The views are stunning from up here especially of the coast and the island/harbour side. We went up on a sunny day and you can see for miles!The glass floor is a bit overrated but fun and the higher floor (Sky pod) that you pay $12 extra to go up isn't really worth the money. If I were you...

In comparison to other similar towers like the space needle, this is rather underwhelming for a lot of money. I ate in the 360 restaurant so had complimentary use of the viewing deck. My boyfriend and I both concluded it was way too expensive and we would be a bit annoyed if we had spend $35 each to go up...
Great service. Great place to visit. Great view of the city. It's truly an architecture feast and wonder.

A friend and I visited this site in the afternoon on Labor Day. There was a short line at the ticket booth but it moved quickly. Even the wait for the elevator to the Observation Deck was not long. During the ride to the top, the elevator operator provides the visitors with factual information regarding the structure including details on...

This is my second time going to the CN tower the both times I went with my boyfriend. I recommend going with your special someone or your family, especially if you have never been before. I also recommend to book an appointment at the 360 restaurant, the view is worth it, so amazing! That way after you finish your meal...

I have been to the tower several times since it was built in 1973 and it never ceases to amaze me. It's presence is a defining characteristic of the Toronto skyline and spending time up almost 1,500 ft or 450 metres in the air is a blast at any age.I have not done the "Edge Walk" but my niece...

Visit on a sunny day for the best view of Toronto and the lake ever. A good spot for the family, especially the younger ones who will love the outdoor viewing area, all 360 views. Stand on the glass floor and test your vertigo. Plan to spend about two hours up and down.

If and when you are visiting or living around Toronto, you simply do not want to skip the CN tower. The highest visitor level offers an unparalleled view of the great city of Toronto! Try to go on a reasonably clear day, and you can sometimes look as far away as Niagara.
I am not a big fun of this things I did it because of my wife, but I am not a big fun of going there pay fee and see a building.

We arrived at the CN tower at 9.30am on a Sunday..well worth getting there at this time as we didn't have to wait very long in the queue. Cafe at the top wasn't too expensive and we were able to sit and enjoy the views. Fantastic experience.

I scheduled a dinner meeting at the tower for work. Many people came from out of town and had not been to the tower. Accommodated our large group with no problems. Service was excellent. Food great. No Complaints. Everyone got to walk around outside before dinner. Great night

Fab views over Toronto city. There is a glass floor too which is something different. Easy to take photos/ selfies. Definitely worth a visit if you are in Toronto and a chance to get some amazing photographs!

Firstly it must be said we were here on a clear blue day so the views were never ending. Told that on overcast days it is a whole different story. We were with an organised tour so got in and up quickly. By the time we came down again the line was really long. Worth doing.

Breath taking view from the top. But you can't miss walking on the glass floor. Never realized it would take so much courage to walk in that see through glass floor.Had taken the economic city pass and it helped me jump the ticket ques everywhereMust see the place

Took my daughter and her friend for daughter's birthday. We didn't go to the sky deck as it was foggy and the girl selling the tickets said there would be no point as we wouldn't see anything (I appreciated her honesty and it saved me some $). The glass floor is very cool, some people jump up and down on...

I took my husband for his first time he loved the views there not much to do if you are on a budget there and there's not much to due unless you are going to do the city walk or the edge walk I think it's called ! We did the CN tower and the aquarium all within 3 or...

Waits are really really long to get in. Buy tickets online before you go. The best way to bypass the line is to make reservations at 360 degree restaurant. After your meal you can go down to the other floors. However, the best view in the tower is from the restaurant. The windows are clean (no fingerprints or mesh in...
Once you get to the top . The view is good but facilities while you wait for an hour ,could be improved....even a few seats instead of folk sitting on the floor
A must see if visiting Toronto. If you can, make reservations in the restaurant at the top but best if it's a clear night. Well worth the cost.

This attraction is a must for all tourists new to Toronto -- the view of the city is wonderful and its great both daytime and nighttime. You can purchase your tickets online in advance for faster entry - If the visibility is bad, they will gladly change your tickets for another day. Great for families with young children or teens...
It's definitely worth the visit. Great view of the entire city and the lake. Would definitely take the time to buy your tickets on your mobile device. Cuts down on the wait time to get in.
Always a treat to go up the Elevator and See the City from a unique vantage point.. Never a dissappointment

So glad we went up the CN Tower. I loved the glass floor and the day we were there, an airshow was being performed and it was wonderful to watch! If you have been in the Seattle Needle and the Niagara Falls Skylon they are all very similar.... a great view of the city and surrounding area!

We had limited time in Toronto as we were en transit back to South Africa. We thought that a trip up the CN Tower would afford us an opportunity to see the city from a bird's eye perspective. Booking for dinner was not an option as we arrived in the city too late, so we tried a lunch booking, sadly...

We ate in the 360 restaurant which has the most phenomenal views, absolutely outstanding.The menu was OK, extremely pricey for what it was. We selected the paired wines which did not pair well (or at least in my view).The most disappointing of all was the service. A very uninterested waiter who had no desire to please or ensure...
well if you want to look Toronto from the top than this is the place. loved the CN tower tour each time and glass floor experience is the best part of it.

If you're a tourist, stuff like this is just what you do! Its expensive and arduous but totally worth the sight and the memory of being at the tallest tower. We didn't stand long in line. Staff was ok. We enjoyed.

Go at night, I think you get the best views of the city that way, plus, it's less crowded. So many amazing views and you can go outside as well! Enjoyed the transparent floor to look down! Book online, or get the Toronto City Pass, well worth buying. There is also a restaurant here as well if you are looking...

column3: New York, New York, United States
column4: There are so many wonderful sights to see in this warm-spirited city of Toronto, Canada's largest and capital city in the province of Ontario, that, for me, the CN (Canadian National) Tower stood out, both figuratively and literally, in the Downtown metro area and is a 'must-see'.At 1,465 ft/447 m, an express elevator known simply as the SkyPod, lifted...

If you want to go up the CN Tower, which is well worth it for out-of-towners, the restaurant provides good value. Even if menu is a bit more $$$, it includes the $33 tower-only fare and enables you to skip the elevator line up. You can even wonder around the observation decks afterwards, then return the the restaurant to use...
the scenery was breathtaking, with the opportunity to see the island across the water and a steady stream of small planes landing nearby the view of both the city and the waters were so beautiful

We actually went here particularly to do the edge walk. It is pricey, but it was definately worth it.The staff who run the Edgewalk were fantastic , they made everyone feel at ease, IT was a great experience, anyone considering it , I would deffinately recomend it

We really enjoyed our trip up the CN Tower. The views are excellent and the glass floor is fun. Lots of interesting facts and figures. The queue system seems very out dated and we had to queue to exchange tickets that we bought on line which was unnecessary and painfully slow.
A must do in Toronto for the stunning views across the city and over the lake. Good to do early in your visit as it gives you a sense of the city.Walk on the glass floor - a little daunting!

A Very Busy Attraction. I'm unsure if there are times that are better to visit. We went Mid-week, and the queues we're very long. We opted for the "advanced" (It might have been called a Platinum Entry?) entry option, which helped us to get in immediately, and not have to be inconvenienced in any way by standing in queues that...

As still the third tallest structure in the world this is a must if in toronto, book on line and you save both on the queue and the admission price. The view is amazing, looking down on planes coming in to land at the airportIf you have the stomach for it the glass floor is a pretty cool things...

We visited this tourist attraction while enjoying the holiday in Toronto. The wait in line was about an hour, but the tower provides you with a tremendous view of the city. You have the option of walking around the edge of the tower, with a harness, for an even better view of the city. This attraction also has a glass...
You can't come to Toronto and not see, let alone go up!! the CN Tower.The tower symbolizes Toronto.On a clear day you can see for hundreds of kms all around.Views you'll never forget.
Went up the CN Tower. Wow what an experience. Have to say wife and I were both dubious about it due to a fear of heights, but we are both so pleased we did it. Would recommend to anyone visiting.

We visited in the Summer and this attraction tends to be crowded. It's best to visit CN Tower if you have reservation with 360 Restaurant. You will get free elevation and the visit to all observation deck after dinner as long as you buy their dining packages. If you add the price of the regular dinner and the price of...
The tower is a great place to see views of Toronto as well as people watch. There was an hour-long wait to get in the elevators to the top, but once up there it's a great view.

Amazing view, but not much substance after the nostalgia wears off. Find the attraction overpriced and not much interaction on the default "observation deck". We did not check out the skypod for 50$ each nor the edgewalk for 200$. There could be more to do with regular admission. Worth the price, once.

It's wonderful that the CN tower, the Blue Jay's stadium and the Ripley's aquarium are next door to each other and paid parking is available. The tower is the least impressive specially for the cost. It was $35 per adult and kids were $26(?). --our wait was only 15 minutes to go up in an elevator with a peek view...

I had read so many mixed reviews about having lunch at the top of the tower, that I went with rather low expectations. I am pleased to say that we all (2 adults and three kids aged 9,8 & 6) thoroughly enjoyed lunch and the trip to the top. The food was a little pricey for what it was, but...

Visited the CN Tower in the early evening to be able to see Toronto by day and by night and we did not regret it!We were told the wait for the lift might be an hour but in the end it was about 15 minutes.This is a must visit if you are in Toronto!

It's one of those things that you want to cross of of your list and never do it again. The view from the top was good, glass floor was an interesting experience but other than that there is not much to do. The cost is high for the experience in my opinion but that's usually the case for most of...

Its a tourist must-do, period. Great view 360 degrees especially at sunset. Like being in a low airplane. We live here but go to the restaurant once a year or so, to treat out of town guests. It is not a tourist-trap restaurant, actually very acceptable mid to high end. The view from your dinner table is stunning. Treat yourself...

Awesome view from 113th floor had dinner at the restaurant there looking at that view did glass walk too since I never went to any Horst building before so this experience was really cool...though it was lil expensive. Around $35 per person
Catch up on some history while seeing some great views of the city. Really great experience and you can watch a video of how it all started which is really cool.

Simply a blast! Buy your ticket at the base. Ride .the elevator to the first viewing platform The views of the city and Lake Ontario are incredible! We went in the late afternoon so had the wonderful experience of seeing the view in full daylight, watching the sunset and then seeing the lights come on in the city and the...

Have been to the top about 7 times now over many years. Still a staggering experience, from the lift, the views on a clear day, which we had. The glass bottom floor is intriguing and worries some. Shame that the simulator and the film re the history have gone but I guess that is progress. Always a must if visiting...

This was a blast. The city pass helped us in the ticket line up. Security was not to bad but a necessary measure these days.The elevator ride up and down was great and informative. The view was impressive and lot of opportunity for photos.A must on the bucket list.

After visiting Toronto for 25 yrs , was always to scared to go up the tower . Two years Ago I finally did it and this year built up the nerve to do the edge walk . The views ( once your up there ) are amazing I love this this city . The guy Justin who did the edge...
We drove an hour and a half to get there. When we finally arrive, there was a half hour wait for tickets and over 90 minutes to go up. We just grabbed something to eat and left.

Well worth the trip and queues not too long. Good panoramic views all round & across the lake to the islands. Also the chance if you're brave enough to stand on a glass floor with a clear view to the ground.

It is pretty cool to read all the facts about the tower and its construction on the way to the top, but the whole experience is way too pricey!And we found it very disorganized to take the elevators, seemed like much more staff is needed.The glass floor was much smaller than I thought and at least by lunchtime...

Went on the tour that took us all the way to the top. It was over $100 for 2 which seems a bit much -- the tax also added to the bill. In any event, the view was fantastic and the service was good. The windows were clean so you could see out and take pictures. The area where you...

It was great seeing the city of Toronto from the highest point in the city. We went half an hour before opening and only got up the tower an hour and a half later. The lines were crazy but the experience was worth it.

Going through Toronto with my son to see his older brother play in the N..J.C.A.A. national hockey championships we had a chance to see this National treasure.The timing of our trip was perfect as there were very few other visitors .We went through the security gates and then headed to the observation point.The weather was great and the view over...

Haven't been to the tower since 1980 and it is still impressive. My parents were a little apprehensive about going up but they really enjoyed it. It was a nice clear day so we were able to see a long ways. Supper at the restaurant was fantastic & our waiter Bill was the best. Great sense of humour & ready...

Great tower but a bit pricey especially for a family. it only took ten minutes of queueing to get to the top but before that there are interesting information and pictures of it being built. There are two floors one inside and the other outside. Here you can see into the Rogers stadium and hear the crowd. There is also...

The CN Tower itself was amazing - the view was spectacular and the SkyPod and the glass floor were so cool! However waited nearly 2 hours in line. By myself. They need to consider having interactive things along the lineup to keep people entertained - a few readables and a movie about the transit system didn't really keep anyone's attention....
Looks great from the out side but not paying $35.00 per person to go up there. 10 maybe but to expensive for me.
I went up to take in the views and to take photos as photography is my hobby this all I have to say as all I did was to take photos
As one can imagine it was an unbeatable experience, but lines too long, no chairs to sit, dirty bathrooms. It's the CN tower though, one has to go. Also went to the sky deck which was unnecessary

Buy a ticket at the hotel in advance to avoid any needless queues. The elevator zips you up to the viewing area, although there is an extra charge of you want to go up further. At one time the worlds tallest tower, it now falls behind many others, but is still somewhat an iconic symbol of Toronto and worth a...
Very long wait (hour and a half) to get to the top, but you can't find a more beautiful view of the city. I'm glad I waited.

CN Tower is historic landmark right by the Rogers Center and the aquarium in its vicinity. It has such awesome view of Toronto, one must visit to experience it.In the night with lights it's as romantic as a dream.
Expensive touristattraction!!! The tower has great views over the city but ticket price is very expensive!

Totally worth Every penny!! Loved it. Top notch experience. Felt so secure. Awesome!!After doing the edgewalk the rest of the observation areas seemed no big deal.Buy tickets online to avoid long lines

You just have to go to the observation point of this tower. Granted, the lines going up and back might be longer than the time you spent up there but it is well worth it. Perhaps the city's main landmark, an elevator takes you in seconds to great photos ops, a glass floor level, and if you are into adrenaline,...

We went to the CN tower at 9 in the morning on a weekday, so avoided all the lines. Best bet is to buy the Toronto City Pass which gives you a discount on the basic ticket price, 50% off the higher levels of the tower as well as relieves you from the pain of standing in queues at other...

Wow, just wow!! If visiting Canada then the CN Tower is a must! The glass fronted elevator gives you an idea of how high the tower is and the speed it takes to get to the the top. Once at the top, the views are on another level. I don't like heights but I wasn't letting this pass. The glass...
Awesome views of Toronto city and especially the airport nearby.I have cut 1 star only because the tickets were very very very expensive.....

Located right next to Ripley's Aquarium of Canada. Elevator takes you up to the observation deck. Enjoy the city and lake sights. Park in Green Municipal Parking and do both attractions on same day then enjoy downtown Toronto afterwards.

Was unsure whether 35 dollars each would be worth it. As it turns out it is a fairly unique experience. Plenty of background to the construction through multimedia displays while you are waiting. Amazing views from inside and outside the tower plus the glass floor when you get to the top. If visiting as adults, consider booking the restaurant...lunch menus...
After all these years, the CN tower is still interesting to see and visit. Stuff for kids and the 360 view can't be beat
