Go at 10 in the morning to avoid rush. Comfortable viewing. Staff is helpful. Don't miss the skypod.

line up where long but once u got in elevator and started up the fun started .. amazing views great cell service lol .. glass floor is neat .. but really need to go to top in skypod thats really neat. cant wait to try sky walk when kids are older
Sunsets are beautiful especially on a clear evening to enjoy! The menu is pricey....but on floor below the 360 restaurant burgers dogs kid friendly... affordable an Asus floor makes great pics!
Absolutely amazing experience! Staff were helpful giving us information and facts with a smile! Views were phenomenal! Has the wow factor!

Even though we are both afraid of heights, the CN Tower seemed like a 'must do' attraction in Toronto. We booked our tickets in the afternoon via phone (really simple and quick) and arrived around 7pm at the tower. We could walk right in and didn't even wait 5 minutes for the elevator (we visited end of august).Once up...

A most beautiful site in Toranto, an eye catching tower visited by hundreds and thousands of people from all over the world.A must see iconic site,You will love it.Dont leave Toranto without visiting CN tower.

My grandson and I thoroughly enjoyed our visit to the tower. Our curiosity about the tower was peaked as we watched a Blue Jays night game with the tower hovering over us. So the next morning we walked over and did the tower and the pod. Total height was 147 stories. Elevators were fast and had partial glass floors! Larger...
A great view from the skypod. Pay the extra to get up to the highest point called the skypod. Full 360 degree unobstructed view and at night was incredible.

A true architectural and engineering marvel. The magnitude of this structure is only truly felt when you are directly below it looking up. The view on a good day is awesome but sucks on a bad day. Not even worth going up if it is overcast. A site to see.
Good one time family visit. Crowd management is better than Sears tower.Will not visit again for ticket and parking fees near by.

$35 Canadian plus an extra $12 for the Sky-whatever they want to call it, but the view is certainly breathtaking and standing on the glass floor 1300 feet in the air is a feeling that is hard to explain! We had a drink in the bar and as one could imagine, its very pricey. A 6 oz. glass of wine...
I loved visiting the CN Tower. You can see the entire city. Impressive glass floor and views. Highly recommend to anyone going to Toronto.

The line was depressingly long but we managed to get to the top after just over 30min. Took a few photos, walked around a couple times and we went to the glass floor. It was so crowded we could hardly get onto the floor.It is still worth going up just for the view though.

We had the City Pass so went to the tower about 10:00 am Saturday morning and walked right in with no wait. The glass floor is very cool but hard to get onto with all the people laying on it for photos (really gross since everyone walks there). We did not pay to go up further but enjoyed the level...

To be honest, if you go to Toronto the CN tower is a must do attraction! It has great views of Downtown Toronto as well as the Island.. my advice is... try to go early, the longer you wait the more crowded it get; also, get the Citypass if you plan to visit other attractions like the Zoo, Aquarium, Museum...etc
Best time to visit is after sundown. No lines. Plus you get a very nice view of the city lights. Quick up and down the tower.
Good half day experience. Well organised must do it once if downtown visitor. Staff sociable on the lifts deal with the masses quite efficiently superb experience on the glass floor !
Loved the restaurant and food.Travelled up in the amazing lift which was frightening! Amazing views.

Visited as part of a school trip and it was amazing, the views from the top were astounding, such a clear day so could see for miles and miles around. We had a meal at the top of the tower but it was very average food. Not too sure about the price as it was included in the price of...

Excellent and worth it if you like visiting towers as we seem to. I am afraid of heights so previous visits to the Shard and towers in Dubai, Malaysia and Auckland have been personally terrifying. However this one was fine. I felt completely safe and actually quite enjoyed it.

For someone with walking difficulties this is ALOT of working just to get to lifts. The lifts up the a Tower give a spectacular speedy view of Toronto's city and lake position. The revolving restaurant is very good. Seafood and steaks dominate. The prawns, huge and fresh, were the best. Service comes with a smile and the view is ever...

Being the tallest tower in North America, it definitely has a great view of Toronto city. It is recommended for everyone, and is one of the must see in Toronto.The glass walk is not so amazing, guess being the first of its kind makes sense.

The view is great, but the whole place is very crowded! People everywhere from all over the world fighting for their picture. If you have the money, eat at the 360 restaurant for a more premium and civilized experience.
CN Tower, has to be done while in Toronto.... Expensive for what it is.Views from the top are amazing.We didn't bother with the souvenir photo, you have to exit through the shop ?

The CN Tower was a wonderful experience! The views of the city and Lake Ontario were spectacular! We at lunch at the top of the tower and the food was delicious. With the cost to ride to the top, I would definitely recommend catching lunch, as the food is great and your lunch price includes admission to the tower (making...

It was summer and the city was full of tourists so the CN Tower was really busy... The queue to get tickets seemed quite long but it was nothing compared to the queue from the ticket office to the lifts. I cannot tell how much I valued the premium tickets that I bought; expensive - definitely - but if you...

Look - lots of cities have these towers (Brighton in the UK being the latest) but what do you get - a view of building, water and suburbia. Why queue , spend money on a 58sec elevator trip when Toronto is such a lovely city on foot. The glass floor terrified the bejesus out of me (I don't care if...

Easy to reach by train from the St James Hotel where we stayed. Tallest building in the world. Crowded at the very top, but world-class views of forever. And a treat to walk on the see-through glass floor and look down through the glass panes on the elevator floor and glass doors as you ascend/descend.

I have come to the CN Tower twice in the past year and I love it every time. My first experience as an adult, I came with my boyfriend and my child. We all had a blast as it is an amazing experience for all ages! The glass floor is incredible on its own, kids are sceptical at first but...

I got an extra free ride to the observation deck since I had done the Edgewalk. Having done similar tower experiences in Calgary and Seattle the setup was familiar to me and even though we were a good distance higher up the presentation was about the same. The glass floor section was incredibly crowded though with people laying across it...

I was spending a couple of days in Toronto and had this as the first thing to do on a Thursday morning. We arrived early (as with most attractions, the earlier you get there, the quieter it is) and was able to skip the ticket queue. However, we did have to queue to redeem our tickets (pre-booking online gets a...
Had been to the tower a couple of times. Usually with visitors from abroad to show some Canadian history and amazing downtown views from the top. Must visit at least once if you're in Toronto.

Despite the long lines and gobs of people, the sights from the CN tower never disappoint. Given the cost of admission, I would highly recommend the Toronto City Pass. Having eaten at the rotating restaurant in the past, It is worth it to get the reduced admission but the City Pass is much more affordable.

We got to Toronto Saturday afternoon and walked around to see the attractions.. one of which was the CN Tower. The line was long on Saturday afternoon (3 hours) and were advised by the staff to return early the next morning. Sunday morning, we arrived 30 minutes before it opened, got in line, and were in the Tower by 9:30....
Awesome view over all of Toronto! Entry is a tad expensive and there are fences all around the outside area so taking good pictures is a bit tricky.

I'm going to share one of Toronto's best kept secrets with you. Lunch at the CN Tower. My visitors to Toronto all want to take a trip up the CN Tower. The view is magnificent after all. But you can avoid what 99% of tourists do, which is to stand in line, sometimes for over an hour and a half,...

This tour was way over-priced in my opinion. The view is spectacular and the glass walkway was good, but thats about it. Not much else on offer - and that cost $80 for two! If you wanted to ascend to the 2nd, higher platform - that costs a further $12. A commemorative photo was also priced at $25!! We had...

The tower is very nice and was a great place to see the Toronto City skyline. We purchased a city pass and had the option to visit 6 sites. It's also very convenient to other sites such as Rodgers Center, Ripley's and others. Worth a visit while in Toronto.
How could you not come to visit here if you are in Toronto? Embrace your inner love of heights and ascend! Take your special loved one for a meal while circling the city. Wonderous!

This is a sight that you can't miss. Although higher than Empire State Building,it is not more impressive. What is unique is the glass floor where you can step and "feel" the height in a safe way.90 min waiting time is the standard.
Expensive tickets, long queues, and when you get there, the view is very disappointing ( nets in front of you ). I wouldn't do it again
The view is amazing during sunset! I purchased the citypass so it was a quick in and out of the tower. They also have a little shop inside which is cute.

I was at the CN Tower primarily because I was eating lunch there with my sister and mother, but we really did enjoy re-visiting the floors below the 360 restaurant after our meal. It had been over twenty years since I had last visited the tower. I had forgotten what a thrilling place it is to visit.
If you were in Toronto, go to the CN Tower! You will experience an incredible view, near to the sky and maybe you feel close of God. I tok excellent photos over there.
Fabulous views and surprisingly good food. A great place to take visitors from out of town. Service is excellent.

I recommend going to the CN Tower at least once. And if you can afford it and book the reservation go to the 360 Restaurant. The food is honestly nothing that spectacular but the view is. It also means you can then go to the observation deck and the glass floor which never fails to freak me out.Haven't done...

We had a lunch reservation at 2 p.m. so did not stand in the long lines and paid no entrance fee. The food was delicious and presentation beautiful but expensive. Good wines available also. The revolving restaurant gave views of the entire city in a little over an hour - good spot for photographers.

After a scenic ride to the top you are rewarded with the most amazing views. The city and lake views are so different and each equally rewarding. Many learning options while here. I live just over an hour away and have been here many times. Each time is a different experience.

Though the view is spectacular, the ticket to the elevator is expensive. I would not have gone if I had had to pay the ticket for myself, but luckily it was covered for me. The aquarium next-door is more bang for your buck

The view's are awesome but realistically for the amount of time you spend there, I find the prices really high! I recommend purchasing a city pass to enjoy this attraction so you get more for your money.

CN tower is a "has been" attraction, but now it has become simply over-priced and not worth the wait.The views of Lake Ontario and Center Island are good from the south side windows.However, the rest of the views look out over the western and northern parts of the GTA - basically jungles of concrete.Once you are done...

We were lucky because we visited at a quiet time -5.30 on a gloriously sunny Monday. It isn't cheap- roughly 40 dollars each but the views were spectacular. We visited at the end of our stay and it was good to be able to see the places we had visited from a different perspective. The glass floor was a good...

This is certainly a must do for first time visitors to Toronto. Great views but you have to do the Sky Pod to get the best views. Line ups can be long. Buy your tickets on line to save a bit and check out other discounts.The EdgeWalk is thrilling for those adventurous enough to do it.If someone in...

We did the CN Tower in the late evening...fabulous experience...go up to the SKY Pod for that little added extra, and if you're lucky enough, as we were, there may be a Blue Jays game on below in the Rogers Centre while you're up in the sky, and you get to hear the crowd sign and cheer and you get...
Of course there are the great views of Toronto and the surrounding areas, but the glass floor is very cool as well.
You can't miss this one !If you want a really good look at Toronto, you must go up !Best attraction for sure !Better in summer time but not that bad in Winter ! I tried both, and extremely recommend!

We went up the CN tower about 10 am on a weekday and it was quick and easy to get up the tower. Spent the extra money to go up to the sky deck and it was well worth it. Fantastic views of the city. Glass floor was a little nerve wracking to step out on but the kids loved...

I thought that I would be scared as I went up there but I was totally calm. The elevator ride up and down is 55 seconds. I went around 3 on a Monday afternoon and there were no lines. Once you get up there and you take pictures and walk about , look at everything below. You kinda get bored...

Simply don't bother if you use a wheelchair my fiancée and I visited Toronto, OK we visited Toronto for the HRC,but I thought what else can we do while we're there? I wish we hadn't! Ok I visited their customer relations department and got a full refund but I will never get the two hours on vacation I wasted back!...
Well worth the extra $ to include a meal at the 360• restaurant. Great view of downtown Toronto as you dine. The restaurant rotates so you get a full view in 72 min.
I love it. the best thing are EDGE WALK ( I wish I can try but was scared will try next time) , GLASS FLOOR( its so so scary to walk on glass floor ) . the view is amazing from top

By now there are more and higher buildings that offer a view from the top.The edge walk is nice but expensive.The glass floor is a nice extra.Would not have done it if I knew it was just a view from the top of Toronto

Get there early and buy your tickets online, would be my first recommendation. Especially if you want to go up to the pod. If you are thinking of going also the the aquarium and the zoo, better buy the City Pass.

Not as awesome as i was hoping for. It was still very good and i had to try it as who knows when we will be back that way. Long line to get in builds the suspense a bit too much. Really breezy so that was awesome as it was a little warm out. The glass floor is worth checking...

We went there on a Thursday evening around 8 PM. This was a great time to go because there was no line. It cost $53 to get to the top. This is a bit pricey but since we were there we decided to do it.

Easy to get to, there are plenty of ways to save including coupons online, tickets from a BlueJays game, even student ID so definitely check for savings before you go. Be prepared to wait in line at night or weekends. And don't forget to check out all the levels. Finally, if you go at sunset then wander around - it's...
We visited the cn tower during a holiday to Toronto. It is so worth going up, its so high, and the views over the city and around are amazing, we even caught a blue jays game from above!

The CN tower is still one of my favorite attractions in downtown Toronto. I've been there many times over many years from a kid all the way up to a grown woman. But it's a great place to take family and friends especially visitors from out of town. There's always something new and different going on in the area. In...

Be smart kids: get there when it opens! We went on an August Monday first thing in the morning - no lineups whatsoever. It's up to you whether you think the price of admission is worth a trip half a kilometre into the sky - we bought City Passes for our family of four and thought that the value was...
It's worth to go up to the highest posible point, yet quite expensive.You must be there, it's imposible to explain!!!!

If you want to see how vast Toronto is, go to the top of the CN Tower! It's worth the experience and the money. I recommend going on a relatively nice day without much cloud cover so you can really appreciate the city from this view. Also, the glass floor isn't very big, so I wouldn't get my hopes up...
The CN Tower has great Scenery and it is a very great tourism area. It has amazing shops and restaurants that can be a tad expensive but overall I recommend visiting it.
Definitely buy the pass beforehand, online, that way when you arrive you can by-pass the normally very long pass-purchase line.

One of Toronto's finest attractions! History, Insight and Adventure Abounds. From the entertainment at the base level, to the ride up, on to the glass floor and finally 360 degrees of breathtaking landscape this place never ceases to offer less than you would expect.

I took advantage of the CityPass and decided to go to the CN Tower. We arrived at 630 and was headed up the Tower by 645, this after taking a picture and waiting about a minute or less for the elevator. Service was good. Michael the Elevator Operator was friendly and ensured our safety and that we had a positive...

This was going to be the highlight of our trip to Toronto, only to turn out just "Meh". This was very pricey. $200 CAD for 2 adults and 2 teens (14 and 17). We don't mind spending the money, (heck, we just finished visiting and laying out a lot of $ at the very touristy Niagara Falls) but this was...

We visited early evening in a Sunday using our City Pass - no queues. The structure is wonderful and the engineering is very impressive. The elevator to the top is fast at 15mph and the views are very good. What a shame we had a choice of slightly dirty glass or a wire mesh. It would have been much better...
Yes, highest point in Toronto; but long lines and high priced tickets, just not worth it. View it from the outside -- and visit a tall building, like a hotel, and see the skyline for free.
Queue was short on a Tuesday morning and easy to access the top of the tower. Remarkable view, thou it was not the cleanest sky and a bit foggy outside. Tickets are not so cheap.

One of the seven wonders of modern world. Nice place to see, view is awesome (check weather before you visit). On clear you can see Niagara fall as well. If the weather is not clear do not go for skypod. Would also recommend to buy a city tour pass you can save a lot on all tourist attractions.

It was a Wednesday evening, perfect time to escape the crowds !!A must see for those coming to TO for the first time!!!Incredible view:)))The boys 7 and 8 really enjoyed the 58 second trip up!!And the kids loved the glass floor:)

Well, it is a tower. You go up and you get the view - just as simple!CN Tower is the highest building in Toronto and it gives you spectactular views over the city. Do take the extra option to go up to the pod - views are almost identical but you get away from the crowds and the glass...
The girls enjoyed the view. Be prepared for the cooler air and breeze once you step outside at the top of the tower. The views are great. Some people were afraid to stand on the glass floor.
My local friends recommended this venue. Greta view of the city. We stopped in the cafe for drinks and a light meal. Great service.
You can't beat the view. The elevator ride up is incredible. once up there, check out the glass floors. I personally can't stand on it, but my kids love it.

It's a must visit for any visitor to Toronto.Location number one taking my family coming from back home, it's a real attraction.Very good idea to get the CitiPass so you get 5 attraction with nice discount, but you need to finish it withon 9 days.

A great place to hang around and the views are amazing.If your lucky you'll see one or maybe even two spidermen lurking!Take a walk across the bridge up close to the vast domed stadium next door and notice the great sculptures on it.

A great view and a nice walk around the observation deck. If you want to see Toronto, then this is the place and the view of the Islands are awesome. If your lucky then you can see some planes taking off from the Island Airport.The only thing I do not like is that if you want to go up...
I went at night at about 10pm and the que wasn't that bad. I can imagine at earlier times it may get busy. Obviously it's the best view of the city so something you have to do while in Toronto.

Went here again with my son 17 and husband. Both my husband and I have been herd prior. We all had a great time and would recommend it for all ages as long as you like heights. Prices are good but then we had the Toronto City Pass which we strongly recommend.They also give you the chance for a...

We visited with our 10 and 12 year old children as part of the Toronto City Pass. The city pass helps you get in for cheaper but does not help you get past the line.We went at 3:00pm on a Wednesday in August and the line was super long. We asked the person working the counter if there was...

Coming to Toronto without going up the CN Tower would have been like never visiting the city at all.I came on a Friday morning, and quickly realized that the lines have a time pattern. I had been told that the waiting lines were crazy, but they are from 11am and on. I came to the tower entrance at around...

Actually had dinner here while taking in the sights. (If you eat in the 360 Restaurant) the elevators are free).2 levels are included with your $35 ticket. The first is an outside walk around balcony. Just inside the balcony is a small section of glass floor on which you can walk and look down 1,000 ft.The next level...
We enjoyed the whole experience. Very crowded and hot but it was summer. We had a wonderful clear day. We could see very far. Good organization.

I Was really excited to see CN tower while I was on holidays from Ireland. Was very disappointed tickets are quite expensive and all you get is an elevator trip to the top where there's a look out! Don't get me wrong the views were amazing but I think it's just a hype over nothing!
I could have spent longer up the tower. It was brilliant and well worth the money. It was an easy queuing system and was well organized.
Ridiculously overpriced. Are you kidding me? $52 per ticket to go to the highest point is highway robbery. Others agreed. I went 20 years ago when it was once affordable. That may have to do for me.
Awesome structure and a must see. Ticket to the top was a little expensive but once up top the view was brilliant. Must see attraction when visiting Toronto
Amazing views and loved being at the top of the tower, it has a glass floor so you can walk and look down through at the same time.

Wonderful experience. We just went up to the first observation level which was still high up with a great view. You can spend an extra $12 to go all the way to the top or $199 to do the ledge walk. Tip go early in the day to avoid the lines.

For most people CN Tower is the first thing to come to mind when thinking of Toronto. It's the most populare experience. It's the most crowded experience. It's sort of the most predictable experience, yet it's such a massiv fantastic experience. Toronto is a beautiful city, and this is definitely the place to see it from! The view from the...
Very beautiful!Very expensive! I went early and didn't have to wait much at all. I did go up the highest point. The view was amazing.

Visiting Toronto you must go to the C N Tower one of Canada's wonders of the world with a spectacular look out with a 360 degree look out !! if you can buy tickets on line will save you quite a bit of time ! elevator ride is a long wait but well worth it !! not cheap but not...

Can spend more time queuing to get in than time spent in there! Very high. We did the Edgewalk (had prebooked so avoided all the queues) and it was fantastic. Thanks to Keegan and especially Katie who helped me fulfill the experience (I was very scared but did it).

We were on a short visit and bought tickets on line, certainly saved time queuing up. Pay the extra and go up the skypod. The views are amazing on a clear day and its a lot quieter than on the main viewing platform. The roof was open at the Rogers Centre for the baseball, the players looked liked ants.

Go early to avoid lineups. I've been so many times as a kid but feel it's overpriced for what it is. We took our kids up for the experience. The first time we tried to go up the wait was 2hrs long so we went the following day right when it opened with no wait time. Was great.

Want to go up the CN Tower? Buy tickets (or CityPass) in advance and be there before it opens at 9 a.m. Otherwise, you might have to wait for three hours just to get in the elevator. Now, maybe if you're from somewhere with no tall buildings, it'll be worthwhile. But except for the historic value (and glass floor) the...

We visited at sunset, the views were superb but the Tower was very busy and there were too many people at the top to get great photos. The glass floor was smaller than expected and again very busy. There was a baseball game in the stadium below so it was worth visiting on a match day for a good view...

We were told that we would be in line for 2 hours before being at the top. We got to the top in 1 hour and 20 minutes. That's a long time to wait, yet it was 40 minutes less than the ticket cashier told us.I enjoyed looking down on the Blue Jays Baseball Stadium (The Rogers Center )...

The CN tower is a great lace to go to see Toronto from the top, the restaurant is a wonderful opportunity to have a nicer diner for 65$ including the cost of going to the top to the CN , with out diner 40$, so my advice just go there for diner !
Outstanding city, incredible view...the CN tower is a must in a city where everything seems possible...Inside,outside,this tower is huge,colourfull and breathtaking

On a clear day, such as this was, the views were spectacular. However, for me, the overall experience was diminished by the need for constant queueing and on a hot Saturday like today this was not pleasant or comfortable. We bought our tickets online in advance and I'd recommend others to do so as this at least cut one queue...
Great lookout over the city. Glass floor area was crowded. Be prepared to wait in line, waited o ok her an hour. Web site does say that they recommend reservations. Do it if you can.

Worth the visit ,we when early 10.30 we didn't have to wait to long in a queue.Fantastic views, the glass floor is something else. Down by the shop and restaurant,there is free play area for the kids while you eat.
Price is high! No real family discounts if you do not have the City pass. Waited for two hours - I guess not much can be done about that though.
I don't particularly like heights but staff where great and told me where to stand in lift. Last time up here was 26 years ago and still amazing views!
We went summer weekday evening. The wait was reasonable and interesting things to see while waiting. Great views in all directions. We used CityPass.

The view was great would have loved to have had time to do the skywalk. They dont advertise where and when it is available to do and can take 90 mins to do. Each person I asked said something different. Still amazing views to be had of all of Toronto from it.

What a view! It took use over an hour to get to the elevator but wants we were up there the view was great. Glass floor is super cool. The it took use another 20mkns to get down. Wish the line ups weren't so long? but had fun.

Amazing views of Toronto and plenty of room at the top. I was a little anxious about this (don't enjoy being on the "edges" of heights) but at no time felt nervous while at top...or even during elevator ride up

I booked a meal in the 360 restaurant (separate review) and the good thing about doing it this way, is that don't have to pay to go up the tower. Okay meal for 2 will set you back $200 but it is still good value for money.Seeing the views pre and post sunset is well worth it

CN Tower is the thing to do in Toronto. The price is quite high but the view is certainly worth it. We didn't pay extra to get up to the Skypod because the weather was a bit foggy but otherwise that is probably worth doing. If you are in Toronto and the weather allows, CN Tower is a must.

As you might expect, the view from the top of the tower is spectacular, but the price is eye-watering. We booked online to avoid the long queues, and for two seniors and one adult, the cost was $107.35. What you get is a 360 degree view - the best bit of which is probably Toronto Island - and a place...

This is one of Toronto's best tourist attractions and is highly recommended for those that have never been here before. I recommend you buy the "City pass" which gives you 5 of Toronto's best tourist attractions at a 40% discount.

Although scared of heights, I braved the 1 minute elevator ride (it has glass panels in the floor) to the restaurant. The views were breathtaking and the food was superb. We would highly recommend a visit here.

This is a must do if you are in Toronto for the first time. Looks iconic from the outside and you have amazing views of the city, the lake, and the glass floor is cool. Yes its a bit pricey and you have to queue, but get there early, buy your tickets online, and dont go on the weekend unless...

it is worth a visit, but yes very expensive, and one hell of a long wait to reach the top, but all in all its worth a visit, going all the way to Canada and not seeing the CN towers is just not worth it.

Nothing can beat the views and the revolving restaurant. There didn't seem to be a bad seat in the house. The staff was attentive, and the meal was very nice. Avoid a lot of lines by asking staff / security where to go if you are there for dinner reservations.
Go up to the observation deck at sunset. The view will not disappoint! You'll see twinkling lights that are gorgeous and memorable.

My wife and I hadn't been up the CN tower since we were children and we thought it was time to take our your teenage son up. The line for tickets and then to wait for the elevator was much, much longer than expected, but the line moved steadily. It was very crowded on the viewing platforms and getting a...

They views of Toronto and lake Ontario are great and for us worth the 75 minute wait. We purchased tickets through City Pass and at least avoided queue to buy tickets. It might have been worth it to book ahead. Definitely a must see.
This is a must when in Toronto, early morning and late in the day are best to avoid the queues.Staff are very friendly.Views are amazing mind the camera

The lines are extremely long and takes hours. Nothing to do or watch while waiting. We went in the evening but it was still very crowded. One person had her cell phone battery drained by the time she got to the tower and she was unable to take the pictures. I took her pics but lost her phone number and...

When in Toronto do as the tourists do? Sure why not! It is a long wait and not a cheap thing to do but worth it! Great view of the city and lake and the glass floor is very cool. Save a ton of money and get a city pass if you are going to the zoo and aquarium too.
This has best views of Toronto, coolest place in all of Canada. i cannot stress enough how much fun the elevator ride to the top is and the photos we took are so amazing.

We arrived at the CN tower on a Monday mid-afternoon. We waited in line for nearly 2 hours to go up. This is not fun when you have three young children. There are things to read as you wait through the line but the kids weren't into it.By the time we finally got to the elevator and went up,...

Hadn`t been to the CN Tower in about 30 years, so when we had a chance for a family get-away to Toronto it was a no brainer to visit here. We were only in town for about a day so we ended up paying full pop for tickets, vs the citypass option which I would recommend as a less expensive...

The CN Tower is a must see but be prepared to splash the cash and to wait! $112 to enter for two adults and two kids was okay and $25 for a small framed photo was a good memento. However, visiting on a Sunday was a poor choice as the wait, in relatively hot and humid conditions, was very long....

We purchased tickets online, which advertised a discount, but they appeared to be the same price as those buying in person. The view was great from the observation deck - we didn't pay the extra to go up to the space pod. The glass floor was kind of cool, but very crowded, even early in the day. It was our...

I've never been on the CN Tower ever until this year and it was alright.. We waited a long time just to go up the CN Tower and we were probably there for 30 minutes. It was nice to actually go on the sky look or whatever they call it. It was a nice view at night and it was...

Avoid the queue and book online beforehand, We just walked in no queuing for more than a couple of minutes. Make sure to go on a sunny day for the amazing views. Well worth the price, fantastic experience, walking on the glass floor was fun! Great time for all the family. Then go to the aquarium just at the bottom...

The CN TOWER offers wenderful views of Toronto and the lake front. It is little pricey, but worth it. We ate in the lower level rather than the skyroom and had more of a picnic experience. We rode to the top after having ridden the open touring buses so we spent time finding buildings we had passed at street level....
Glass on the elevators were a little scary and fun. Beautiful views and when you get around to one of the sides it was so windy we almost fell over, it was so fun.

You need to visit the CN Tower when you are in Toronto. It was the world's tallest free-standing structure for a long time until recently. It sways a bit when it's windy out. The glass floor is scary but fun too.

Doesn't get boring (although many people would disagree). I used to go here frequently as a kid, as my dad worked for CN and we had free entrance. It's still fun to go as a paying adult.The glass floor walk is nerve-wracking (for me) although little kids were lying fearlessly on it with noses pressed to the floor.Go...

We got to the tower in good time and went through security, when we got to the ticket office we got told that we could buy a ticket but there would be a 3 hour wait to go up in the elevator. We didnt bother, if there is a 3 hour wait to go up then there is a 3...

My dad and I did this at his urging. It was on his bucket list. We bought our tickets in advance. DO THAT! Or the wait is sooo long. Took us 90 minutes top to bottom, including the glass floor and the Sky Deck level...wayyyy up. Worth it just to say you did it.
Well worth a visit, fantastic view! We had the City pass which allowed us to skip the ticket queue but we were queuing for an hour and a half to get up the elevator. Lovely bar to have a drink!
The whole experience was amazing from the weak knees over the glass floor to the view so amazing to have this in our beautiful city in Toronto.

I don't like to queue... so I bought a relatively expensive fast lane ticket.The queues where very long... but with my ticket I get to skip them all.The elevator is nice with a vie we to the city as you go up,and also a view to the elevator shaft at the bottom. The view is excellent in both...

Worth the wait but you have to have patience. It would be difficult for smaller kids. The lines are endless and boring. There has got to be a quicker way to get people through to the top for the great views.
This was an amazing place to see. We bought a few CityPasses so the line was very short for us. Would def recommend

I tried to make reservation 4 days in advance for 9 people for dinner around 7-8 pm but there was nothing available so I had to take the 9.30 pm seating.(should book at least 2 weeks before if you want to eat at a descent time) When we got there, we were rushed to go up the elevator, the elevator...

We had this as part of our Toronto Pass. Can't visit Toronto without at least visiting this site once. Go early! We got there when it opened with zero line on Monday morning. When we came out an hour later, the line was on an hour long wait. Glass bottom elevators were awesome for the ride up! Also a must...

The CN tower can be seen for miles. One of rhe tallest towers I've seen. There is security at the entrance. We had quite a wait throughout our visit with long queues in all areas. The lifts are on the outside of the tower so you can see out over the city as you travel at 19 ft per second!...

We visited to see the view, and were not disappointed. We found the process well organized, the lines moved fairly quickly and the staff was friendly. We spent about 30 minutes on the inside and outside observation areas and walked on the glass floor. There is a dining area as well. Other than the view there is not much else...
A must visit while in TorontoHighly recommend just keep in mind that sometimes lines can be long to get into depending on day and time but worth it

This is something everyone needs to tick off their "To Do" list while in Toronto.Is it expensive and overpriced - yes absolutley but as are most top tourist attractions these days. You wont get better views of the city anywhere else. We went in the evening before sunset so we were able to see the city in light and...

Visited there on our honeymoon and the food, service and staff were all fantastic. The day we visited was a littler overcast and cloudy (it was March 13), but we could still see as far as the eye could see. The Caesar Salad was lovely. The world's highest wine cellar was a cool thing to look at too.(Top tip,...

We visited the CN Tour on August 16th after buying our tickets online right before entering the tower. We had almost a 3-hour wait for the elevator up the tower and a 30-minute wait to go down. It was impossible to judge the length of the queue because it snakes back and forth behind big pillars. There was no information...
Line ups a mile long. If you like to line up for over an hour, this is your place, not mine.Never got to the top as I don't like to line up with over 200 people in front of me and wait for elevator.

Typical tourist attraction in that you queue for a long while and you get the family green screen photo opportunity whilst waiting but views from the top are great. It is a lovely way to see the beautiful Great Lake. In my opinion a must do whilst in the city especially as the tower dominates the skyline and is an...

The view of Toronto is astonishing from up in the CN Tower. You can go up to the very top if you'd like and breath in the air and feel the wind. You can also get many good photos from there.The elevator ride is quick and you can see out the huge window as you go up or down....

The scenery was beautiful we could even see the baseball game going on. The elevator ride up was super packed with no room to move. The main level indoors was also packed. Once you go into the outer area it was breezy and not as tightly packed. The 360 degree views of the water and city were great. I have...
The tower became the center piece of so many of our pictures we decided we must go up in the tower. It was awesome and very worth the time and money.

Long lines but move fast .free Wi-Fi to enjoy while waiting. Very good security great place the best views. Friendly ght was are second time here. I must say it needs to be experienced in the day as well as the night. The night is by far the best time it's truly amazing

The views are spectacular over the lake and across the city. It is a 'must do' site for tourists in Toronto and this is evident in terms of the prices charged and the massive queues for each stage of the climb. This means that it takes a considerable amount of time to visit it. But if you've never done it...
No complaints, perfect service, perfect food, perfect view, lovely white wine (local Pinot Grigio), a pleasure to go to.

So....you want to go to the CN Tower. So this is the protocol:1. Stand in a queue to buy a ticket (you can sidestep this by going with a tour group....this is actually a good idea...the queues are seriously long).2. Stand in a queue for security checks3. Stand in a queue for the queue to the lifts...

If you have never been to Toronto and not seen the CN Tower, get ready to fork out some serious money (cost $100 for an adult and child!!). It takes you less than 5 min. to go up and another few minutes to walk around the tower to see panoramic views of downtown Toronto and the skyline....

I took my son here for part of a day trip and we enjoyed ourselves. The prices are fairly high, but if you are able to purchase a CityPass, it's not so bad. The elevator ride with the glass windows is awesome and much quicker than you might think. They do a good job of sharing the history of the...
We received a recommendation that the best way how to spend time in CN Tower to book a lunch in the restaurant. We were there around lunch time and it was very nice. The meal was with a great view.

The ride up the elevator you will have butterflies in your belly, and the glass floor is thick and not too big so it wasnt scary for me or my husband however some other people were freaking out over it lol. regardless its impressive and a great experience. make sure you go to the 360 restaurant for a fancy meal,...
A must to do in Toronto, the view is awsome, also the glass walk is good, I recommend to buy the city pass to avoid lines, me and my friends wait for more than 2 hours to go to the top.

I booked our tickets for this whilst still in the UK, printed them at home and took them with us. It gave us more flexibility on when to go as you do not have to specify a particular day. Already having tickets also cuts down on queuing. Although we had a massive queue to get from the main observation deck...

It's best to go on a day where the weather is nice, especially during sunset. You get a pretty nice view of the city, even at night. The 360 restaurant is pretty expensive and I don't think it's worth it, unless it's a big anniversary of some kind.

We were given a tip by The concierge of our hotel when we told him we planned the visit.As you will be eating anyway later, and you have to pay for entry to the tower, combine a meal in the 360 restaurant with the visit as your entry then will be free!So this is what we did and...

I was in Toronto a few years ago on business however I did have some time off. I'm petrified of heights so going up in the lift was frightening haha. This is a must if you're ever in Toronto. Its tremendous
Great views of the city. If you are into excitement and not afraid of heights, try the edge walk. It is too scary for me.

The view is spectacular. We arrived in Toronto after travelling for over ten hours from London (England). We then queued another half hour to get tickets and another two hours to eventually get to the elevator to take us up the tower. Was it worth it? YES, YES and more YES. I could try and describe the feeling of getting...

The ride to the top is exciting if your not afraid of heights. Once you reach the top of the tower take some time to see The beautiful views from all directions. Then as an added enjoyment have lunch or dinner in the revolving restaurant. The food is first class although a bit expensive but a treat for that special...

WQe had a week vacation in Canada with my family, and we decided to spare the time to go up to the CN Tower, one day. The line was not so terribly long, like at the Niagara Falls, and the first half was relatively effective. The view is great, and certainly worth the value! The photos and films you see...
Fantastic time up the tower with family.Great facilities and well stocked gift shop.Queue for security was very long but nice to see them being so thorough.

We went to the top of the CN tower on July 1st, 2016... Stunning views, but I think it it way overpriced... it was $ 110 CDN for two of us to see Toronto from the highest point... Oh, and BTW... the elevator operator was so over worked and tired, she had not idea which tower she was at, which...
I had only few h in Toronto, and CN Tower was open till late so I could do this. It's must doo in Toronto :) even in the night it's worth to visit. Mostly I enjoyed the lift :)

I have been up the tower many times now. I had family visiting from another country so we took them to the restaurant at the CN tower. It is the ONLY way you should visit the tower.We didn't have to stand in line or wait for an elevator because we were eating. The line for the tickets was at...

We were so lucky as the day was perfect. Although the line was very long and it took us about an hour and a half to be up there, it was worth it.Being here almost two weeks, walking the streets and visiting areas in the center and around, i did not visualize the lake and islands as part of...

If you can pre book ticket I did this saved a long time queues were over an hour at some times of the day early morning or late afternoon not too bad. Glass lifts great and only take 60 seconds to the top. If you can stomach it stand on the glass floor!!

The wait to get tickets was not long because we were in a group. However, the wait to get on the elevator was very long because one elevator was not working. The wait was well worth it but this is not for people afraid of heights.

I suppose that this is something that you should do when in Toronto, but if you have been up a tall building before and looked down at smaller concrete buildings, don't expect to be thrilled when you finally get to the top of the CN Tower; it doesn't really offer anything new. If you like queuing, having your picture taken...
The food is good - not amazing, but it is the best Cn tower experience you can get. No lines, and you get to see the view and the glass floor w/o tickets. The service is irreproachable, lovely.

Toronto is a great City , CN Tower is iconic andthe glass floor is great , not sure people appreciated my daughter jumping up and down on it . Scary but not as scary as the coasters at Canada's Wonderland . AAAGGGHHH !
fantastic views over the city and surrounding area from the revolving restaurant. menu very extensive just a little pricey but well worth a visit for the spectacular views
Visited here today.Big queues. Once in the lift you get to the top. Views ok. Glass roof poor.All the build up and you feel let down when looking around.In my view not worth the money.
went with our 3 kids 7-11. They were bored after 5 mins. Cost over 110 CAN, 1.5 hours wait. There are better places for kids than this in Toronto.

Just make sure it is a clear day!A bit pricy but the food is great, the view is amazing!The service is ok but they do expect a tip. They also tend to talk down to you a little but then they are government employees.Just go and enjoy the food and the view
Great view from the top.I was expecting the queue to be long but not so.Good queue management system.
Loved the cn tower large queue to buy tickets so best to buy on the internet in advance fantastic views
Book your ticket by internet to avoid the queue. The view is nice but not spectacular. So if you do not have time - choose something different.

We waited in line to buy tickets 3 times. Saturday morning, Sunday afternoon and Sunday night. The shortest line was 45 minutes on Sunday night which we joined. In fairness it was less than that - probably only 30 minutes so they set expectations at the worst.They did try to push a very expensive skip the line VIP pass....

This is the first stop we did during our Toronto visit. Appreciate Toronto from high above. As added attraction, experience much more higher spot for an extra fee. Restaurant is onsite for a good view.There is a cafeteria & gift shop at ground level. Arrive early as line up could be long. If you are visiting a few attraction, buy...

The wait to go up was INSANE. Full of pushy and rude people. We shuffled along for almost 2 hours to go up the tower. Once we got up there the view was wonderful. We had a clear and beautiful day to see. The crowds were still crazy, but worth the odd shove received to say we'd been there. On...

It's classic - the beautiful, magnificent, really really tall CN tower highlights the Toronto skyline. The tower serves as a landmark and is a classic icon of the city. We went up to the observation level and spent quite a bit of time admiring the city of Toronto from above. We were not particularly interested in paying more for the...
a great trip for everyone who likes to view from high abve the greater toronto area and on a very clear day all the way to the other side of lake ontario to rochester NY

I found this building to be a little too tall. I walked up the stairs because I didn't realize there were elevators. No bar at the top. But great views! Passed out on the glass floor. Got asked to leave.
Absolutely a fabulous day.... Nothing like the view!!!My father helped build the CN Tower in the 1970s

Considering this is one of the tallest structures in the world, you must visit and stand on the glass floor just to say you did. Beautiful views. The waiting line was about an hour when we went. But a definite tourist must -see.

Must to do in the city.The glass elevator ride up is a special one and not to fast so you dont need to worry about your ears popping ! The Glass walk is intreasting but reach early otherwise you wont get a spot to take your photos .The view of the city airport with flights taking off is another added...

Beautiful view, great location downtown, went for dinner and it was delicious! I had the squash ravioli and friends had the steak. Everyone enjoyed. Well worth the visit, you will not be disappointed. Exciting, scary walking on the glass floor at the top if you dare....Gorgeous city, a must see!

The CN tower is a must see in Toronto, the view is stunning, yes....But like most must see attractions elsewhere, it is overpriced and has very long lines! A once in lifetime thing, my teens wanted to go, so I went... if I were alone, or with other adults, I wouldn't have gone..

How can one take a trip to Toronto and not go to see the CN Tower? You can't! The CN Tower was once the tallest building in the world (I admit, I did not know this before my visit). While the views are breathtaking, the screen mesh on the exterior does block some of the view for obvious reasons. Inside...

Ok, yes, it's one of the top tourist draws. The queues were not as bad as anticipated, well worth paying the extra to go for the higher observation platform.

The view from up here was breathtaking. The 2 hour wait to get up there was ridiculously long and boring. Had we not paid up front, we would have left.I have been up there now, would have to think very hard before a repeat visit.
I went here with a few family members I really like it . If you live in the city you have to do this at least once because this is what Toronto is all about really liked it

Views from the tower were flawless. Young baby with push chair were accommodated and staff were great.We also sat down for lunch at the view point and had a bamboo basket really enjoyed it again staff were great.

Visiting on a weekend includes line ups, so if you can, wait until towards the end of the evening to head up. The views are a bit limited but it's still really pretty to see the city light up at night. And the line up was only about 30 minutes all in, while it was 2 hours long in the...
This attraction is a bit expensice but if it's a clear day, the view is amazing! I love the super-fast elevator ride too (thus the review title - LOL!)

CN Tower offers the best views of Toronto. The observatory is divided into two levels. The upper level has two restaurants and the lower level is open air and let you walk around and see the beautiful city of Toronto. In my opinion the price for the entrance is to high considering you are at an observatory.
Everytime I go to the CN Tower, I'm always mesmerize by the structure. The view from above is an awesome experience. Great Place to take friends and family from overseas.

We used a City Pass and visited CN Tower on our Toronto visit. The lines moved quickly and we didn't feel too crowded at any point, even though it was a day with a large number of visitors. It was as expected. We got to see incredible city views from a couple different levels. We did not take the time...
Toronto can be smoggy or hazy in the summer so the view might not be very good. It will usually be better early in the morning.

Very cool views but busy in the summer. About a 90 minute wait for entry. Deceiving wait times as the line up snakes around inside so much...get around a corner and find the line up is twice what you thought it was. Expensive but fun, we ate dinner and watched an awesome rainstorm come in over the lake. This is...

Although there were queues it was worth a visit to the CN tower. The views were spectacular, even the view through the glass floor to the bottom. We thought it quite expensive at 38$ but that was a group price and we did not get the best rate. If we had bought the tickets individually it would have been 34$
Beautiful views of Toronto and other activities including the Edge walk on the outside of the CN Tower. The elevators have glass cut out bottoms and the view level has a glass bottom section.

Visiting from Wales UK our family toured the CN Tower. Prices are high but you can expect that. Long queues initially (Monday 12 noon) but copeable. The vistas are exceptional, plenty of photographic opportunities. You can also have photos done for $25 each or all offered to you for $60.Excellent day out something my children won't forget in a...

We went at an "off time" and they told us that it would take about an hour to get to the top. It took well over two. The views were nice. The lower level was much more fun than the level that you get off on. The line to get back down was horrible. Took another hour and a half....

We were told by the aquarium to do this first thing in the morning otherwise expect a long wait. We did so the next morning and waited only in line about 10 minutes until it opened. Huge benefit was that when at the top the restaurant was empty and you could easily walk around the whole area without lots of...

I did the tower the elevators are bad blah blah blah blah and I took the extra $12 trip to the pod I think that's what they call it. I am not disappointed but it's an expensive trip and you get tired of it in about 30 minutes. How many times do you have to go wow I'm really far...

This place is well worth the visit at least once. Very high but you can see that its also very old. Their is a new attraction that includes walking outside on top called edge walk witch I think is just plain crazy but for some will be a very exciting experience. The first time we tried to get to CN Tower to watch the sunset we were told that it will be an 1,5 hour line before one can get to the top, so we thank for the information and decided to go the next morning. If you go by 9AM it is almost perfect, very few people, perhaps less romantic...

Make lunch or dinner reservations at the restaurant and the scenic tower trip is included. The food at the restaurant is quite good. The restaurant revolves 360 degrees. However, the changing colors of the tower makes it a bit difficult to see all of Toronto's wonderful neighborhoods.

I have visited the Tower on several occasions. The 360 degree view still amazes me. On a clear day, you can see as far as Niagara Falls. Dare to stand on the Glass floor and look down on the City. The Queue to enter was very long, but worth it in the end.

Booked table in restaurant for a fabulous meal - food was superb, staff all very attentive and added to that we had the fantastic panoramic view of Toronto at dusk and at night. Fantastic experience and would thoroughly recommend.
Admission to the tower was free with restaurant booking although the food was very expensive . Well worth a visit as the views are spectacular. You can see for miles and the food was really good
Great views of Toronto area and Bay.Very long queue to get in and then long queue to go up elevator......but well worth the wait as the views are amazing
Great views! Worth visiting while in Toronto! 360 degree view allows you to see whole city and lake. Purchase mobile tickets before hand to reduce wait time.

A must-see when visiting Toronto but I'd highly recommend planning your trip to avoid queues. I do have a few comments though ... We planned to go up that evening and visited the website to buy tickets ... the website said you *have* to leave 24 hours before your visit when buying online. This wasn't true! And would have saved...
The view is wonderful at night. The whole city if Toronto is huge, even though we come from NYC, but feel this city is much bigger than NYC!

This was better than expected, a fantastic experience and the view from the top was breathtaking. We booked out tickets from the UK via the internet and we didn't have to wait in line queuing for tickets, just walked straight through to the guest reception and then onto the lift for the fastest accent ever.

Bought the city pass which saved us quite a bit of money. A must buy if planning a family trip to save on tourist attractions. We got to skip the line up to buy tickets but our wait time to go up was 1 hr and 15 minutes which was shorter than the 2 hours they quoted us before going...

We were fortunate to visit the CN Tower on a clear day when it was not busy. The views of the city, Lake Ontario and beyond were amazing. $35 per adult cheaper for children will get you great views of Toronto from their downtown skyscrapers to the small islands nearby. You can pay extra to go up higher or there is a restaurant fancy n pricey if you want the full experience. Only a 30 minute wait which was better than expected. They also have a glass floor...
Excellent (but pricey) views of Toronto. There's a glass floor section that you can look down to the ground, but it's often covered in children. It can be a bit of a wait to get a down elevator.
This is a really nice place to visit while in Toronto. Sometime can be very busy but overall it is great.

My 16 year old son & I stood in line for ever to go up the CN tower. The film they played about a tram was a complete waste of time. Why not give information about the CN tower ? That would have been more interesting & more valid ?The view from up top was awesome though, would I...

The experience at the top of the tower was amazing, but getting up there was an endurance test. Two and a half hours in a queue with little to do except stand and gradually wilt. Take snacks and drinks for kids and avoid the most popular times if possible.I think it's time they looked at timed tickets for entrance....

During our June 2016. Visit to Toronto. We were overwhelmed ! With the Architecture and " buzz" the city created. The C N tower however, was much prettier to view from the distance, as compared, to actually entering the elevators to ride to the top. It was beautifully set in a very high-tech city. Long lines.. To be expected in the summer when Toronto is busy with tourists. The view is fabulous and there is a nice restaurant that you can stop for a beverage and snack if you like.

The best way to enjoy the view is to visit the Resturant , with a partner / the one you love :)If you don't like queues. The Resturant gives you access and the best views . Sit down enjoy your meal rotation of the tower takes 72 mns so take your time no limit we enjoyed the meal and...
There is a nice view from the top over the city and down through the glass floor. But that is about it.. They should renovate the place, add a bar, better restaurant that you want to stay up longer.

It is what it is: a very tall building! Well organised to cope with the crowds and gives a great view on clear days. There are high adrenaline options to walk on the edge, but it's not a cheap deal. As part of the City Pass it's good.

One of three main draws for me in Toronto was the CN Tower.It's mere presence looming over the city high into the Canadian skies it would almost be a crime not to venture to the observatory deck.Staff are very friendly and make you feel at ease, so even if you're scared of heights it's worth braving it for...

The tower is a great experience. Some queuing but worth it for the views and the elevator ride. Down to the foot of the tower and for a drink and a burger in the nearby Turn Table brew house was an added bonus.

The CN Tower is an amazing tourist attraction. I liked the glass floor, and I also like the outside area that is fenced in. There is an attraction called the Edge Walk where you walk outside the building all harnessed and such. The views of the city were incredible. Amazing!!!!
After paying you have to queue for 90 minutes, no number system, just stand around in the heat, wouldn't recommend

Best tip: go first thing in the morning! The day before there was a 2-3 hour wait but we went at 9am and there was absolutely no wait, not to mention we had a ton of space on the glass floor and to see out the windows. It really is a sight to see!
Have been to the top a few times. I'm afraid of heights but the view from the top was definitely worth it.

Beautiful views of the city from about 1,200 feet up. It gives you a good feel for how the city is laid out. You can see small planes landing at the airport on one of the islands to City Hall and beyond. If you eat at 360 The Restaurant, your admission to the CN Tower is included plus you miss...

My grandson was in for a visit from out west. We had tickets to the Jays game and he really wanted to do the C N Tower as well. Problem was we were running out of time, and they said it would be a 2 hour wait to get up and then further waits once we were up and for...

Enjoyed traveling to the top of the CN tower. It was about an hour wait after clearing security (buy tickets online to avoid ticket line)Staff was very friendly in the elevator and it's a quick ride up when you finally get there. You can purchase an additional ticket to go one level higher which I recommend. You can see...

Very glad we had the sky pass. The sky pod was cool about 300 meters up, and nice view. It was hard to find glass floor and sky pod. Had to take another elevator for skypod. Quick elevator ride up to top. Very organized and efficient. Got some good pictures of the Toronto skyline. Really enjoyed it after dark. Lots...
Does what it says on the tin. You've gotta do it to say you've done it. Fabulous views of Toronto. Well organised and not a lot of queuing. Advise you to get tickets before you visit.

This was our first visit to Toronto and the CN Tower. $35/pp and a 90 minute wait to board the elevator to the observation deck on a Monday afternoon. Pass on the cheesy photo op in front of the green screen like we did. I can only imagine what the charge for that is! Yes, the views were great, the...

Booking ahead makes sense to avoid the lines - although we hadn't and it was not bad to be honest. It does all it says on the tin and you get all you expect delivered in an efficient way. You have to do it when in town and they do it well!
Great way to see the whole of Toronto. Gets busy so try and get there either early or late evening and if you can get there on Blue Jays game night you can see into the stadium if the roof is open.
Once again , the CN Tower never fails to AMAZE us and our visitors to Toronto :) This is a must see for any visitors to our City !

My son from the moment he learned we were visiting family in Toronto set his sights on visiting the CN Tower. The CN Tower was a cool spot to visit. However, I don't ever see myself returning as it is not something I'll ever have to see again. I wish it were less of the tourist attraction it has turned into. Toronto: Loved the fast pace, varied & authentic restaurants, convenient hotels, and friendly, helpful people! Our favorite hotels were the Hiltons downtown and Little Italy, especially Trattoria Taverniti. It was super easy to walk most places. Highly recommend taking in a Blue Jays game, an Argonauts game (Canadian Football League), and purchasing the City Pass. With the City Pass, not...

I found it expensive for what you get. Long wait to get to elevator, Look around then down you go. It is a breathtaking view and on a clear day you can get some really good photographs. The glass floor is entertaining, watching people gingerly step on it then develop a huge grin. A must see once, even at the...
Visited the Cn tower but primarily this time for my husband to do the edge walk, he had a fantastic time , great value for money, staff brilliant and an experience well worth doing.
What can I say it's the CN Tower. Love the View, love the city and love the atmosphere. Always worth a trip up the tower.
What a view ,try the glass floor so cool can with stand 48,000 pounds ! Miss the info from the elevator guides like the old day .

Wow what a view! Simply breathtaking.Yes the meal is expensive but hey - you only live once and get this...If you book a table (you can do online), then you skip any queues and head right to the restaurant.It would have cost you to go to the observation deck anyway.You get access after the meal to...

My husband and I went to the CN Tower on a Thursday around noon time with our 16 month old in a stroller. 24 hours prior we had discussed not going. Amazing views were had from the glass panelled rooms inside but to get a glass free view (and pictures!) you struggle with a wire mesh on the observation deck. Surly something more appropriate could be found to keep it safe without ruining the view. Other tv towers I've visited were great experiences but unfortunately this wasn't!Don't waste your money...

Don't expect too much, yes is a good view and the revolving restaurant offer nice views too, but expect as little as possible and you will not be disappointed. I also got to stay in a long line to get up, not sure if this happens often.

We tried twice to visit the Tower but in July it was very busy. The lift ride up is exciting with a view of the city below. When at the top there is plenty of viewing area with a small cafe and two restaurants.

We arrived at around 8.30 pm and queued for around 50 minutes, I think if we had arrived half an hour later the queue would have been very short.The glass lift was interesting as was the glass floor.I enjoyed the view but if I went again I would go during the day.

We stood in one queue for about 25 minutes to get tickets, to then be told that there was a further 75 minute queue to get up the tower -they had kept that pretty quiet. When it was time to come back down, the whole level appeared to turn into a queue and no-one really seemed to know what to...

I actually didn't just go up, I dug a bit deeper in my wallet and went for lunch at the 360 degrees restaurant. Yes, it's not cheap, but the food was great and the view just stunning! We visited August 2015. Throughly a thrilling experience. We took great photos from the top of the the CN Tower. Our kids 9 and 13 had a wonderful time.

I live just outside of Toronto, so I've seen the CN Tower numerous times and had always wanted to go. I have to say that it didn't live up to my expectations. The elevator ride up was really cool and all of the staff were super helpful and friendly.The view from the top was spectacular - but what wasn't...

We visited from Northern Ireland along with our Canadian family. We bought the Toronto visitors pass as this worked out good value if visiting attractions over a few days. The views from the tower are amazing especially the glass floor and the location is very central especially if like us you were attending a bluejays game. Downside was the 2...

Get there early in the day to enjoy a less crowded experience. My 17 year old loved the glass floor and the glass elevator floor. It's impressive. There are 2 restaurants but we did not eat there. Nice gift shop. Bathrooms on the observation deck level. The only thing I would have liked is more info on the various points...
Second time here and this time of year it was jammed. I reccomend off season. Friendly staff and night time is better then day time to see the skyline

If your visiting Toronto it's worth going to the CN tower - it's not the type of thing that you have to do multiple times, but it's worth doing at least once. There was a (very) long line, but it moves fairly quickly. The view from the top is nice and the glass floor is also intriguing - the only...

We went to the Cn Tower and it was peak season. It took us 2 hours to get through security and through the lines to the elevator that takes you to the top. It took us five minutes to do the actual tour. It was great seeing the view and enjoyed the cool breeze but it was a long wait...

We have lived in this city for years and regularly bring family and friends as they visit to this time tested tourist attraction. It never disappoints. We can always find a way to enjoy our trip up the elevator and the views of our city are just amazing. It is also a really great place to go in the winter...

This is one of Toronto's most famous must-see attractions and it is worth the inescapable lines and waiting times. The best alternative is to buy tickets online 24 hours in advance and you skip the longest lines.

This is a must if you are in Toronto. Yes, it's scary, but the views from the top are so worth it. We had to rush through our experience due to a flight times, but it was super cool to look down and appreciate the beautiful city we had walked for 4 days. The Rogers Center looked so small forum...
I paid the extra money for the premiere experience. Well worth it, as we were put ahead of the long line ups at every level.
having looked at the tower everyday throughout the city we made our way up on the 3rd day, great views, helpful staff and the rotating reataurant was a nice experiance also

On a trip to Canada in August we started in Calgary and visited their tower, although not as high, the Calgary tower was hugely more interesting. Armed with ear phones and player , every view from the top was explained with the history behind it , very informative and interesting.....Arriving at the top, well not quite as they wanted more...

The CN tower is Iconic, but in my opinion more of an iconic statement from the outside than the inside.The Disney Land style queuing is brain numbing in the heat and the queues to get back down are also long (don't forget that if you're planning a quick exit).The Views from the top are indeed spectacular and on...

Located in the heart of other great attractions in Toronto, CN Tower is a must if you visit the city.Once you're on the top, you can get incredible 360º views of the city, of course, but it is particularly great whatching Toronto City Airport from above, as you are over the airplanes.If you plan to visit Ripley's Aquarium,...

Visiting tall towers in the cities we travelled to has recently became one of the "to do" things.I was in Toronto in May and couldn't resist to visit this tower as an addition to my list of visited towers. Just wish I was with my daughter and wife.Anyway, this place is definitely worth to check out if you...

The lines are very long (on crowded summer days anyways) but the observation tower and the "Sky Pad" are great fun at great heights! If you have the nerve, the best way to do the Tower is to pay for the Edge Walk. Over four times the price ($220 instead of $53) but very short lines and WAY more exciting.
It's one of the wonders of the world. Watched it get built when I was younger. Still enjoy visiting all these years later.

the rise to the tower was very quick..extra security check very good..parking nearby...lines were not too long...the view was amazing...the glass floor section was interesting...had to go slow..next time will try the skypot..ripleys aquarium just around the corner

3 hours waiting to get in! I don't think it worths! No resting areas at all, the hostess at the entrance wasn't clear about the waiting time. We were waiting to get in from 15.30" to 19.00'. I don't think it's worth it.

Definitely a MUST DO!!!! Especially at night!!!! The 21st Floor of our hotel wasn't high enough to capture the beauty of Toronto in the day & at night. CN Tower allowed us a perfect glimpse of this amazing place. The elevator ride up & down is very scenic & not scary at all. I always thought I had a fear...
Great views of the entire city, see-through glass that allows you to lie down on it and take some really interesting pictures was the highlight.

Certainly a nice view but not Worth the 2 1/4 hours waiting (+ 20 min to buy the tickets). To be fair, the staff told us before. We took a rest in the bar area which is a bit quieter than the rest of the Platform; personnel

The CN tower gives Toronto the most beautiful Skyline in the world. In the heart of the tourist area in downtown Toronto, the tower has much to offer. Take the elevator to the top and experience the glass floor or Edgewalk if you are brave enough. Dinner in the 360 degree restaurant is spectacular.
I love the CN tower, beautiful! I took my family there from the states and they enjoyed it. make sure you go when the weather is nice, otherwise it is just not the same.

We went to the CN Tower in the early afternoon and after going through security we were directed to an extremely long lineup to get to the box office. After waiting quite a while in line, we got to the box office only to be told that there was a wait time of approximately 1.25 to 1.50 hours to get...

An obvious tourist trap but still thrilling. $30 admission. Use parking under convention centre $12. Choose a clear day! Prepare for long screening queues. Restaurants and picnic areas. Spend an hour.For another ($100?) do the Edgewalk ...if you've got guts or a death wish! ?Best photo: put iPhone on the sidewalk for selfie with tower behind you; timer...

We bought tickets at the CN Tower - it was super busy, from the time we got in line to buy tickets, go thru security and finally get to the tower elevators was 1.5 hours. Recommendations: 1- buy tickets online ahead of time to skip the ticket line. 2- if your group is all adults, instead of CN Tower tickets...

You cannot come to Toronto and now go up the CN tower. Whilst the queues were long they moved quickly and we got up the tower I would say in less than half an hour. It is a bit expensive but you can get a discount if you used the train from the airport (25% I think). You get a...

This is a must do since it's the CN Tower after all. Be prepared to wait in line for a. tickets and b. elevators. Sunday noon queue for elevator was 45 mins, which is a moving line including the obligatory green screen photo (feel free to say 'no thanks').The view is of course, fabulous but at $35 for an...
Must do if in Toronto but a little disappointing after waiting in line for over an hour. Another tower.

I'm glad that we did decide to go up the tower but there was so much queuing which did spoil the experience to some extent. We booked the citipass tickets as we plan to visit other places too but I would advise others to spend that bit extra to speed through the queue if you can afford it. We went...

Oh my word, the queues. Queue 1 - security check - 20 minutes. Queue 2 - buy ticket - 40 minutes. Queue 3 - waiting to board lifts - 75 minutes. Unless you are really desperate to go immediately, but a ticket in advance (online) or buy a ticket in person and come back and visit during a quieter period...
Visited whilst on honeymoon here. Amazing views of the city. We went late afternoon and had to wait for quite a while. Be prepared to queue but well worth it.

The wait in line was excruciating - horribly managed, no seats, no water, no easy access to bathrooms, and no entertainment. Then to top it off, they closed the outdoor 360 level while we were waiting in line, but didn't give any sort of refund or return ticket. The underwhelming view is definitely not worth the exorbitant entrance fee.

- Reading reviews online before we went we went into it expecting long lines so that wasn't really an issue. We arrived at 1pm....it was 1.5 hours until we reached the top. We spent another hour at the top and it took about 20 mins to get an elevator back down.- PRE-BUY YOUR TICKETS USING THE MOBILE SITE! It...

I'd like to start by saying that I am a happy, optimistic traveler, and love all my experiences. I really did enjoy the CN tower. Here's my two-cents:Yes, you're in Toronto, you naturally need to go up the CN Tower. This was not my first time going up, but first time as an adult. Had my two boys (6...

The CN Tower is one of the must dos for visitors in Toronto. It's amazing that it was the tallest building in the world for so many years. the views of the city are fantastic. the glass floor is one of the top attractions there and very unnerving. they have edge walk and photos behind a blue scene but we...

It was monday evening (no saturday, friday or sunday), at the purchase of he tickets they told us we needed 45 mins to go up. We were in the queue for 2hrs to go up to the skypod. I don't think it's good to tease visitors. And remember, during he looooong queue there is nothing to do, nothing to interact...

We had to stand in line for about 75 minutes to get to the 114th floor. It was really crowded.Once we got to the Glass Floor it was worth it. It an once in a life time experience.To take a photograph through the professional photo people cost around $25 a photo.
Nice views, almost a "must do," but the lines are long and the price is a little high. Not as good of an experience as, for example, the Sears Tower in Chicago.

The lines were insane. The price for the basic ticket was close to $40. The restaurant has a price fixed menu for around $56, they have 360 views and you get to visit the observation deck too. I think that would be worth it because I waited a half hour just to get the ticket.But be prepared for the...

Looked forward to this visit but spoilt by the length of the queues.Having been up numerous buildings in other cities we felt that timed tickets would have been better.Allow a few hours and take drinks!

The CN Tower is perfect for all ages! The view is beautiful! The glass floor is small and crowded and doesn't provide the greatest view (compared to The Willis Tower in Chicago), but it was still fun. My advice would be to go before 11am and you should not have to wait. We visited on a Sunday at 10am and...
