The elevator trip is impressive. The view is amazing. It's definitely worth the time and money to go up there. Allocate enough time as the waiting time to go up can be pretty long (I waited 1 hour around 19h) and you'll have to wait again to go down (around 15 min. at 21h).
We had a group of 36 all siting together at the top of the tower where the restaurant is situated, the food was of a very good standard, service was amazing, not cheap but what an experience

If your okay with the long wait in line ups and want to see a great view of the city then have at er'. We found we were in several different line ups from tickets, security, photos, the actual line up and then for the elevators. Got up to the top and there were lots of people, walked around but...

We booked dinner in the CN Towers restaurant (360). This meant we got to skip the lift queues and go up in a restaurant lift which was great. We had a short wait (about 7 minutes) for our table as they offered us a window table (which I'd strongly recommend). The restuarant revolves slowly, so you get a great view...
Worth the drive downtown, over priced in my opinion, would recommend to visitors to Toronto.At the least find a spot to park get out and stand and to bottom and look up.

Our decision to lunch at the 360 Restaurant really paid off. We bypassed the main queue to the tower lifts and the entry fee. After lunch, we continued on to the main observation deck, glass floor and verandah to enjoy the vista of Toronto.

Can't go to Toronto without doing the tower. However, it is expensive and a very long painful wait. If you do the restaurant, also not cheap (min $65/person), there is no wait at all, you get a great view as the restaurant seating area rotates a couple revolution every 72 minutes and you get free passes to both the observation...

I grew up in Toronto and have been up the CN tower many,many,many times but I find the older I get the less I want to do it and yet I'm still drawn to go up and see the city I love the most. Such a great time pointing things out to our kids who did not grow up in...
Had todo it because we where there pricey $ 25 per person expect to wait in long queues up to 2 hours only good thing you can look over in the the baseball park otherwise I would not bother
Tourist trap. Very expensive and nothing special. There are better things to visit in the nice city of Toronto. Would not recommend.
Go after 7 pm, great views of the ballgame and downtime night lights, way less wait times. Also good to have a CityPass.

Toronto Citypass only gets you past the ticket window but gives no advantage to avoid the line. Elevators loading is slow and disorganized going up and getting down. Just be prepared to wait.The views on a sunny, clear day are great. More information on what you can see from the tower would be beneficial. The glass floor is a...

We booked our tickets online through CN tower website and printed them before we went. I thought this would be quicker but we still had to queue to get another set of tickets. However, this queue wasn't long as we were there 30 minutes before they opened. Fantastic views from the top.

The CN Tower is a 1,815.4 ft observation tower in downtown Toronto, Ontario, Canada.Built on the former Railway Lands, it was completed in 1976, becoming the world's tallest free-standing structure and world's tallest tower at the time. It held both records for 34 years until the completion of Burj Khalifa and Canton Tower in 2010. It still remains the tallest...

In going to the CN Tower you get what you would expect (i.e. the amazing 360 views of Toronto) but there are a few other nice touches such as the glass floor that you can stand on on the main viewing platform and the fact that on the main viewing deck you get big panes of glass for unobstructed photos....

The views from the top are stupendous. I read that many people had to wait for a long time in the queu. We arrived when the tower was oppening to the public and we mad no que or had to wait or the elevators.

It was very interesting and the view is absolutely amazing. Try to visit early since it gets very busy with 2 hours waiting lines if you go in the afternoon. They have a good organization and if you want to have food, they have 2 restaurants at the top of the tower.
The view is amazing. The security people are annoying and patronizing. The restaurant up on top of the tower is overpriced and their food is mediocre! Better go somewhere else.
It was a great way to see the City, the lake and life in Toronto, I think the best way is to book lunch that way you can enjoy a good meal (or dinner!) and see Toronto at it's finest.

Brought relatives from England and everyone enjoyed themselves. The 1.5 HR long wait to get to the tower was very difficult for the younger ones as well as the seniors and the entrance cost is on the steep side I feel.
Always fun , with dinner at the top !! The views of Toronto are beautiful, being able to have virtually a 360 panoramic of the city is fantastic !!

We had a great time with the family. Wait time was less then expected. Great views of Toronto. Friendly staff and lots of space to walk around. Did feel crowded until the elevator rides. But they were fast.

Costs a small fortune then you finally get to the top to have all the views crowded but fantadtic when you could see.No where to sit (they obviously don't want you to).Small consession ran out of expensive food.Restaurant had a small expensive menu. No service so we left. We only ended up wanting to eat there because it took so...

This landmark is definitely worth the visit. We heard that the wait could be 2-3 hours so we decided to have lunch at the restaurant on the top floor. It is fine dining and pricey, but the food was great. Not much more expensive than the admission price (waived when dining) and in 72 minutes the restaurant rotates for a...

Best time to visit is close to sunset so you can experience both the lights and day view. There was a blue jays game the evening we went which made the SkyDome even more appealing. Wouldn't visit often but worth experiencing at least once.

This is THE site in Toronto and that's evident by the lines to get in. Still, it was a short wait in line to go up into the tower and experience the beautiful views of Lake Ontario and the city. Just a wonderful experience! We also got a chance to have a drink at the bar - full service and...

If you haven't been up the tower, you should. The views are stunning and well worth the price to go up. Its funny watching people go onto the glass floor, some wont even attempt it. We usualy go into the restaurant for a drink at the highest bar in canada. Highly recomend

We really enjoyed the views, but the experience was rather spoilt by lots of kids running around. We went at about 8.30pm after having dinner in the revolving restaurant (which was lovely, see separate review) expecting it to be reasonably quiet. The place was packed and we waited for quite a while to try and get a good photo on...

Some say there are certain times that are less of a wait, perhaps first thing in the am, but when we came by at 4:30pm there was an estimated 2 HR wait. We returned at 6pm and it was said to be about an hour, so we hoped in line.CityPass does nothing here to get you past any lines....

This is an awesome experience. I haven't been up the burj in middle East and don't care. This is amazing and dominates the great city of Toronto. Once you have been to the sky pod, every time you look up from the streets you simply marvel. Hats off to those who do the edge walk too, not only for the...

We chose to go at night time about 1 hour before closing. No line-ups and crowds to deal with, so we entered and took the elevator straight up. The view is ok from the look-out, but disappointing from the external platform because the lights and the protective cage greatly obstruct the experience of a clear view. For a better night...

Ticket quote expensive, for two people including taxes, almost 80 Canadian $. View is super nice. Elevator trip lasts view seconds. Then on the main in deck you can stare at Toronto and have some drinks at the bar. Aldo available restaurant service. A must when in town

The view from the CN Tower is amazing. We waited in line for over an hour. The attendant told us that the wait was three hours earlier in the day. Call ahead to find the best time to visit to avoid waiting in a long line all day.
A must do if you visit Toronto!!! Amazing view, 2 hour wait for the elevator, but worth the wait! Glass floor is very cool!
Well worth the money and the wait. Even with all the tourists, we made it to the top of the tower in less than one hour. There are several different view options, so take your time and enjoy.

We spent the $79 for two to see the 360 degree view and were not a bit disappointed. The skies cleared and we had a great view of the Toronto area. I would recommend a nighttime view to get the "sparkle" of the city skyline.
If you have a condo or hotel w/a ktchenette you will want to come here. Vast 2 story market with every food you can imagine from crepes to meats. Other food related products for sale as well.
A must do in toronto. It is the view of the city and is on every picture postcard etc. A landmark and a must see

As with any major attraction it was very busy but well organised to keep it flowing as quickly as possible.We paid a bit extra to go up to the sky pod, which was good but not necessarily worth the extra money.Be assured that the glass floor isn't every where so you can avoid it if you want.It's...

If you book the set menu the prices are very reasonable here, the food was fantastic.. I was very surprised. Obviously the views are spectacular showing you a 360 degree view of toronto.. you also get free entrance to 2 floors when dining in the restaurant.

It's always fun to check out the city from up high, but it's like any other large tower that overlooks the city. Long lines getting up there unless you have reservations at 360 degrees restaurant. If you make reservations at the restaurant, your entrance ticket (approx $30 pp) are waived (so figure your pricey entree cost -$30 for the real...

Decided to make a reservation for an early dinner so we could see the city in the daylight and at dusk. Definitely a good move. You by pass the huge queues to go up to the observation tower. Dinner was reasonably priced, for pretty good food. The tower takes about an hour to revolve completely

We were excited to go up in the CN Tower and see the view of Toronto. We did not buy our tickets in advance and that was a mistake!! Buy them ahead of time, it would have saved us 30 minutes waiting in THAT line. After we bought the tickets, then we had to wait another hour to hour and...

If you're going to visit the CN Tower buy your tickets online. We made a mistake of buying the tickets when we got there and the line was long. It took us 20 minutes just to purchase the tickets and about 45 minutes to get to the deck. When we finally got to there the view of the Toronto skyline...

Highly overpriced at $150 for a family of 5. 2 hour wait to get to the elevators to travel up to the top. Once there it's so packed and hot you can barely move. Nothing really optional for food other than a small snack area and over priced restaurant. The kids at this age did not appreciate the structure and...

Visited with family on a Saturday morning around 10am. we purchased the City Pass so we were able to skip the very long ticket line and proceed to the inside line. the wait once inside was about 30 min or so before boarding the elevator. Great views of Toronto and lake Ontario. If you puchased tickets for Sky Pod, I...

If you are willing to pay the price and wait for a while (took almost two hours for us to get in the elevator) the view is great. The downside is that besides the glass floor the kids can not really appreciate the view since there is nothing for them to step on and admire the scenery. It is mainly...
Very lovely place to visit, stood on that glass floor and looked down now that was indeed a sight to behold. Can't wait to come and visit it again in the future

3 hour line up to get into this tower, even with PRE-Purchased Tickets. What a waste of Time and Money. I lost almost 200 dollars. I just gave the tickets to a women with her kids, The kids are I were not standing in that....and me with a sore hip and knee...I didn't want to go up it that bad,...

Give yourself about 3 hours to visit the CN Tower!We spent 2 1/2 hours in line in total to buy tickets, get up the tower & also in the line to come down. Be prepared for crowds!The views on a clear day are spectacular! Open until 10.30pm so consider a sunset / night view.Scared of heights? Me...

Nice for an get together with friends! The restaurant has good food and service! Nice to skip the line to get inside the CN when you have dinner reservations. Terrified to step on glass floor but a fun thing and nice outing for Torontonian to visit once!
Get there right when it opens at 9 am to avoid the normal 2 hour line. Get the Toronto City Pass to make it more affordable. It's worth going up for the views of Toronto!

What an experience! A group of friends and I decided to have dinner at the CN Tower. The views from the tower are breathtaking! Toronto is a beautiful city.Definitely a must see when you visit Toronto!

We visited the fine dining restaurant so didn't have to queue to get Into tower. It gave us free access to the viewing levels afterwards.The food was nice though not as good as some of other fine dining places we have visited in dubai. The restaurant rotates slowly so over the course of an hour you get the full...
Great views. Rather crowded as one expected in august. Took us 90 minutes waiting to get up. The higher platform costs a bit more but the queue for that made us not bother.Worth doing
We wait for about 2 hours to get up .... But it is totally worth it, the view is amazing especially the glass walk...should try it

column3: Emirate of Dubai, United Arab Emirates
column4: We felt it was not worth the price and the long wait at the que. Better book the ticket online. The view from the top is average.

The wait to get to top of CN Tower was one hour 50 minutes even though we had the fast pass from the tour bus that took us round downtown.The view on top is great as you get a fantastic view of downtown Toronto from way up.

I was there this summer with my girlfriend and wanting to give her a good view of Toronto. Well, that didn't happen. We arrived at 4:30pm only to find that we couldn't go up the tower until 6pm, which was doable until we learned that we'd have to wait in line or lose our space/time. Needless to say we were...
In spite of the hordes of people, the staff was friendly and the food was average. You are really there for the view in the revolving restaurant at 1800 ft. Up. We enjoyed it.
Was a nice clear day and you could see right across the lake to Hamilton. Great views all around the city. Didn't do the skywalk but have that planned for the next trip.
Its an excellent experience!! One should also visit the Skypod as well. They need to make it more ways to reach on top as waiting time is too long.

The visit to the tower took us over two hours to wait in line. I recommend going after 7pm because as we were leaving the line was very small. OR have reservations at the restaurant will make your wait short.

Price is roughly $35 Canadian. Line (and we were there on a Wednesday evening in August) took 90 minutes. Indoors and cool, but on line. The views are great, but not spectacular. Spent 30 minutes on the various levels, but definitely not worth the 90 minutes. Had they let us climb the stairs, maybe. The stairs are only open twice...

Definitely a nice view over Toronto, but to be honest I think it's a lot of waiting in line for at quick look... Eat at the restaurant or do the outside rail walk to make the most out of it. If you are not doing these things, it's not a Toronto must try - if you ask me...
A very exciting adventure with amazing views. Worth the time invested to see it all. Staff was courteous and helpful. We booked our tickets online. I would recommend it. Made wait time much quicker.

We were the last set of people to ascend the tower on a weekday evening. The late night views were great, and he glass ceiling was still breathtaking. There was about a 45 minute queue (we joined the queue at about 9:15pm) to get into the lifts, but once on the tower, we were left to our own devices with...
We went on a weekday night and avoided traffic and lines. Waited maybe 30 min and had beautiful evening views.

Loved the view of Toronto from up the CN Tower. The view is the best on clear summer nights. To avoid lineups, make a reservation for the 360 restaurant up the tower, which gives you access to the glass floor levels as well. Enjoy a meal with a beautiful view. It's romantic up there.

After a very long queue in the heat we decided that we would buy on line. Wish we had done sooner however the queue beyond was still huge! We decided to have a lunch in the cheaper eatery which was lovely. Had a mooch around but probably queued longer than we spent up there!

We had a wonderful tour of the CN tower made a million times nicer and easier by having a dinner reservation at the 360. The views as it revolved were wonderful, the service phenomenal. You skip each and every queue but can then go to the viewing platforms as well (though the view from the restaurant is better I thought)....
This is definitely a place with a view. We had dinner here - a nice dinner but a title pricey. What a view though on our day we could see Buffalo USA.

If you have never been to Toronto.... You most go up the CN tower. You will have the choice of going to various levels.Also you may choose to do the sky walk. You and a group of friends, or others will be hooked up with a harness and can walk outside on the roof of the rotating restaurant. It...

This is the best view you will get of Toronto. There is a clear transparent section in the elevator and up at Observation deck that you can see all the way down. This can be scary so don't look down if you are scared of heights! Nice restaurant at the top where you can relax and enjoy the view. Since...

The restaurant atop the TD tower is spectacular. The food was not inexpensive but genuinely delicious. Steaks were cooked to perfection. The restaurant rotates every 70 minutes so we got 2 complete tours of Toronto from 1000+ feet above the city.
Must for Toronto, use Citypass. Try to avoid crowds and bad weather. Regular ticket is not for the higher in the tower for adrenaline junkies price is really expensive.
The CN Tower is a very high platform and if the day is clear, you can see Toronto very well. The downside is that it is expensive.

Had the opportunity to visit the CN tower with friends from out of town. This is a must see when visiting Toronto. 360 views of the city are outstanding. There is a revolving restaurant on top but we did not use. One area has a glass floor to look down. Highly recommended this site b

A great place to visit it will give you such an exhilarating view of the lake and the city, and a perfect opportunity to get photos too, also walking the glass floor does make your palms sweat a little although as safe as the structure may seem to be

So ive been to many towers over the world, and i have to say this one was pretty impressive. A view of Toronto and on clear days, neighbouring cities. A clear view Toronto Island (which again is defo worth a visit) as well as the roger stadium. What i would recommend, is going to eat at the 360 restaurant. The...
A must while in Toronto, great views from the top around the entire city. The glass floor is great looking down at the bottom of the tower. Great gift shop for souvenirs.

Even with pre-booked tickets (do this online), we queued for two and a quarter hours for 10 or 15 minutes of viewing time. This included going right up to the top in the Skypod and the views are fabulous but really, you are completely trapped in a snaking, exhausting, frustrating queue punctuated with sales opportunities for photos and bored, tired...

What a view at the highest point of the CN Tower coupled with great food at this 360 degree restaurant. Best to take it all in when the weather is clear as you get fantastic views all around you from every angle. A walk on the glass platform was fun too!

So many lines!! There is a line for security. Then a line for tickets. Then a never ending line for the elevator, and just when you think you are next to go up, there is actually one more line for the elevator. So now that 2 hours have passed since you first lined up, your kids are cranky, hungry and...

We've been to the CN tower many time and every time we come it is because we have company, in this case it's friends from Northern Ontario and we planned a day trip to Toronto. Not that there is anything wrong with that but I found myself wondering today as we visited this amazing site why it was always when...

First off, the views from the tower are awesome. Great for pictures. The glass floor is a must and on that same level are entrances to more viewing but it's outside which is a different feel then the floor above which has windows. We did not do the sky pod.So let's talk about the lines… As many reviewers have...

I am still in line after couple of hours. The lines in summer are very long and you snake, snake, snake forever.I've visited the tower in Dubai and they specify a time that the ticket is valid. The CN tower is gouging their customers and making the experience a disaster.Come when tourist season is over.

After queuing half an hour we were taken by the elevators up and what a great view! A bit expensive in my opinion but, hey, it' s one of a kind!The glass floor was kind of terrifying, I couldn't step on it but other people seemed to enjoy it a lot. Guess what? great picture for Facebook, right ?...

The CN tower is really cool. It is one of the tallest buildings in the world and makes Toronto Toronto. The lines get massive but once you get inside, you get to go into an elevator with small glass panels and watch as you ascend to the top. You then can go outside the building and see the entire city....

One of the things included with the CityPass. A must do in Toronto. Offers a glass viewing (looking down) area AND glass enclosed viewing area AND a screened in viewing area!! Lines are typically long but with the citypass you can walk right in and bypass waiting in line to buy tickets.

The view is beautiful, not only seeing the tops of the buildings, but seeing the beautiful lake. It was a great sight. There is also a glass area where you can see through. Everything was ridiculously crowded, though. There was no way to ever even move much because it was so crowded. Views were hard to see. There was waiting...
The tower offers the best views at night, but prepare to wait in line after line to go up, and come down.
Good place to visit worth the wait, note you can cut the ticket line by shopping online, the advice to show up before 11 am was working.
Paid extra for premier pass but it was worth it , informed staff that I was claustrophobic and they let fewer people in the elevator
Nice view from the tower, glass floor is awesome. Had wonderful time with family but dinner was not good at the restaurant

We went to the tower twice in one weekend, one to see the city during the day and the other at night. During the day trip the staff informed us the line for the elevators to the top had a three hour wait!!! We already had our CityPass but we opted to buy the premier pass as well which gets...

First of all - arrive by 10:30am or you will wait up to 2-2.5 hrs to enter the elevators to go up!Once you're there it is a great view. Not sure it's worth the regular price though. We had the City Pass so it was worth the discounted price.The glass floor is pretty freaky and for a hefty...

Being from Toronto, this was my second time visiting the CN tower, and the first being when I was a lot younger. My boyfriend and I visited on a Sunday afternoon early evening, and the lines were extremely long, although we had purchased tickets online. The queue was 90 minutes long, which I thought was ridiculous since there was probably...
Lovely views of Toronto. Glass floor was cute idea! Should serve breakfast at the restaurant. Overpriced elevator ride!!!!

We took the Toronto city pass, it provides you the chance to visit 5 different attractions for 78$ CAD, the best is that with the card you can avoid queues! We went to the tower at 9:30 pm on Monday and there were just a few people. The glass floor is something that every adult should try!!!

My husband and I were in town for business for him, so our time was limited. We made a dinner reservation for the 360 Restaurant which gives you access to the Glass floor and observation floor. So glad we did! The lines were super long and people were everywhere! The restaurant revolves offering picture perfect views of Toronto on a...
Great view over Toronto and a glas bottom to have a scary look down.Recommend to go early in the morning when the lines are short.
The view on to was nice! We all enjoyed it including our two young kids.. We had a citypass so it was worth the price. We are glad we went its a must see!!
Long lines. Observation floor partially taken over by restaurant. The glass floor was a good experience. Many doors to the outside perimeter were closed.

yes the views are impressive, but the tickets are pricey and the wait is mind-numbing. You have no idea after you have waited for 30 minutes to get tickets that the fun is just beginning. you have 90 more minutes just to get to the elevator!!! we ate in the restaurant because we would have felt stupid paying that much...

I kept reading the negative reviews of the CN Tower, but still decided to take the chance even on a Saturday in August. We arrived around 845am, 15 mins before opening and a line of 80+ people had already formed. Maybe 5-10 mins before opening, they allowed people in. Here is the key: BUY A TICKET or CITYPASS ahead of...
we hit this tower after doing the space needle ,in seattle, if for sure rivals that and what spectacular views of beautiful Toronto city
Expensive and busy touristic place. Waiting line to going up at least 2 hours in the evening. I recommend to go in the morning. Expected more of it for $40. Altough, the view is offcourse not bad!
Great place to visit .well worth it so mush to see and great views of the cityGo early as ques are big .

The waiting lines are way too long, and you cannot see how long until you are already in line for like 30 minutes because it is divided among different sections. The view of Toronto is great, but if you do it, do it for the glass walkway and experience walking on glass and seeing the city below your feet at...

We went to the CN Tower a first time mid afternoon, very crowded, we went through security control (15 mins) and then for the tickets (20 mins) where the employee told us that waiting time for elevators was at least one hour and half!! Why they cannot put a screen before security control to advise of waiting time??? The ticket...

Really enjoyed our visit at the tower, beautiful view today with clear skies. The visit to the skypod really impressed the kids. The only negative was the very long waiting line to go up to the observation deck (about 45 mins) and another 45 mins wait to go to the skypod. The view from the top was worth the wait...
Great views and really informative if you take the time to read all of the displays. Glass floor was a lot smaller than I thought and was very crowded considering that overall it wasn't a busy day.

THE queue was very very long and full of people with children and buggies. If you did not have a buggy or a child you were weapon less against the relentless assault on your ankles or ears. By the time we got to the top in just under 2 hours of standing on a hard floor I was wilting to...

This is a nice tower where you can see the overview of Toronto downtown. There is also a glass floor where you can stand. Experience in the tower is just ok, nice to visit but nothing really spacial unless you try the edge walk.

I wanted to do this as I loved my experience on the Willis Tower in Chicago. This wasn't as tall, but it felt a little bit more intimate as we were able to get some space alone to view the city in relative piece. The views were amazing and made me realize how much green space was intermixed with the...

this place is a bit of a tourist trap, but 1st time visitors to Toronto should go. Its a bit pricey for a ride up to the observation level and the views are amazing. It can be crowded. Photography at night can be challenging due to window reflections

This is the thing to do if you are visiting Toronto. I did not purchase advance tickets and got there an hour before it opened. I was probably the 100th person to get in and by the time I left the line was terrible!The views were great but it was a bit pricey! Even with the price, I recommend...

We bought tickets online beforehand, make sure you do as otherwise there can be long queues. Once you get through security if you have tickets already then you just have to make it through the queue for the elevators to the observation level. The views are wonderful. We had tickets for the Skypod as well but the queue was a...
This tower is crowded all the time so best idea to visit it is to book a table in 360 Restaurant, eat there and then have a tour around the tower with marvelous city view. Good place for couples.

Yes it I only a tall building but the views are exceptional especially from the sky pod. The glass floor was exceptional and it is an amazing surreal experience stepping out on to it. If you can get here early then there are no queues to get in and therefore less people circulating around the viewing areas.

A tower width a good view of Toronto. Don't visit this during evening if you want to take pictures. Reflections in dirty glasses don't give you the picture you want.Long queues to get access to the attraction. By a Citypass and you will jump through most of the queue.

There's about a 45-minute wait to get to the top at 8pm on a Thursday night. The view of the city was beautiful.The AC didn't work quite well in the indoor portion of the observatory. Fortunately, you got plenty of fresh air outdoor.

CN tower is worth a visit, but it's so crowdy that one should start early to get in and some space inside the tower to have the 360 degrees view over the city. Impressive the glass floor which makes you feel you are walking over the edge.The ride in the elevator takes 52 seconds climbing something like 500 meter.We...

Impossible to come to Toronto and not to do it.Ok we waited 1 hour and 1/2 (we were there around 4 p.m.), ok the city pass didn't allow us to avoid the line, ok it was overcrowded with kids jumping everywhere (bored by the attent) (but i like kids, trust me ?), but arrived at the top it was...
Ate dinner here the other night and it was very nice. Service was excellent, food fantastic and atmosphere breath-taking.
Great view of Toronto from the top. If your lucky enough the Rogers Centre roof will be open when your at the top. I wasn't lucky enought
Great place to be and must visit for Toronto visitors. Do not forget to try 360 resturant. Easy way to access without waiting.

impressive for sure, but not really worth the price, nor the wait. We were told there was a 1hr 15 min wait to get to the top, given we would have been stuck in traffic anyways, we opted to wai it out. As it turns out, it took 2hrs 20 min to make it to the top.The place was...

I just had guests here from the Middle East and the one thing they wanted was to go up the tower. They were not disappointed! What a great view - the staff were very helpful. And though the gift shop is right at the drop off point for the elevators- you can avoid it. It is expensive though!

I read from previous reviews that the queues were horrendous and it almost put me off going. However, I bought my ticket before hand which means you skip one line, (just go to customer services inside to transfer the online voucher for a ticket). I was also there for 9am. I walked straight in, no queues. Worth getting up early....

It was a good experience on the day we managed to go up.We didn't realise how long the wait times were - no one informed us until we reached the ticket desk by which time we had queued for 45 minsthe - to then be told it would be 1.5 hrs before we got to viewing area and then...

The view from the top is pretty good, but it is pricey. Make sure you go early (before 11) and book you same day tickets online to avoid the long waits for tickets. If you do spend the bucks, go ahead and buy the skypod as well.

We purchased the City Pass and this was one of the included attractions. It is very popular with tourists and locals. You certainly have a great view but it is so crowded that it almost takes away some of the fun. It is one of those things that you can do once to say you did it and probably never...
It was worth spending over an hour queuing to go up the tower to see the amazing 360 degree views of Toronto. Standing on the glass floor looking downwards is not for the faint hearted!
The lines up where 2+ hours long. The glass floor was so crouded. Then took 1 hours trip down. Not rexommended for family with kids.

Been to the top of the CN Tower on my birthday, and 360 Restaurant with a cute lady friend and it was just awesome! The restaurant rotated slowly with a good view of the city that was just so amazing and lovely. And with a free walk on the glass floor and free travel up the tower with a meal.

Came here with my husband and my 2 children 7 and 4. My children loved going up in the lift especially as it got to the top in seconds. They loved the glass floor and they didn't mind sitting down in the middle of it. It didn't frighten them. They were both amazed at how high we were.

Have a meal in the restaurant to fully enjoy the view from your table. The menu was not over priced as the food was good, and admission to the tower was included, with the added benefit of no waiting for the lift. Just make sure you book in advance so you get a time you want. Don't forget to go...

We walked to,the CN tower from the hotel and arrived 30 mins before opening. This was a great piece of advice from a previous review. The queue started to build by opening time at 0900. By being the first in there were not the crowds jostling for positions especially on the glass floor. We were able to take time on...

We were staying with friends local to Toronto. The city itself is beautiful. It is clean and the restaurants are to my experience reasonably priced with good quality food.We decided to visit the CN Tower. Whilst it is a great attraction we waited almost 3 hours in the line to get to the top but it cost $35 (Canadian)...
Good way to get acquainted with Toronto.The view is beautiful even without going to the last floor.Quite expensive though.

column3: West Warwick, Rhode Island, United States
column4: I would give this a 3.5 if possible. It is above average in that it is a unique experience, but it isn't super exciting. That being said, it was still a pretty cool experience and I am glad that I went. It was the first thing that we did while in Toronto, and it was cool to get a bird's...

I get the premise of this, but I think the Burj Khalifa in Dubai does it taller and better. We were able to bypass the lines due to doing the Edge Walk, but I'm not sue how long the wait normally is. I do like that you're able to go outside, but the views are somewhat obstructed by the grating....

I'm not sure if I would wait in a 2 hour line for this attraction. It was fun to see Toronto from this high but the glass floor was disappointing. It was only a partial glass floor and very crowded with tourists laying on the floor taking selfies. We had dinner reservations at 360 restaurant and were able to bypass...

This type of attraction is good but I am generally not a huge fan of this type of attraction which is why the 3 stars. A quick elevator ride up (and down). You can spend as much time as you want looking at the city from the tower.... There's a walking area as well which is nice.
Excellent views but I wouldn't bother paying to go to the higher floor! You are up so high on the first stop that you don't really benefit from the extra flights and cost

If you want to see all Toronto (which is a beautiful) - you have to go there. Problem is always long queue and it is not cheap. If you buy tickets by internet - you don´t have to wait. Be carrefull, ticket is valid after 24hours and you have to have a credit card and ID. Everything is well organised,...

We went up early in morning and so didn't have to queue too long for the lifts. We went up to the second level, where the views were great (if very scary.) There is a glass floor if you are brave enough to stand on it - I wasn't. The restaurant / bar looked nice but wasn't open then we...

Booked online and tried at 9pm.... Told a two hour wait.So, returned at 0830 today.I know they had a flood outside, but .... no control of people queuing. So my partner and I, along with two young girls found ourselves being bumped back in the queue. Even after I told one couple there was a queue, people still...

We bought our tickets right before we got to the tower so we could avoid one line. After security, the line inside kept moving but was long. It took us about an hour to get to the elevators. There were interesting facts along the way and an informative movie to keep us entertained. I would pay attention to the Blue...

You are VERY high up, which never gets boring for me, and it's exciting to see planes way down below, heading for Billy Bishop airport, but there simply isn't all that much of interest viewable from the tower. Well run experience nonetheless and worth doing once. I arrived soon after opening time on a Sunday morning (with limited time) and...

column3: Emirate of Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates
column4: Clear sky and wonderful scenery of Toronto downtown.After getting up at Burj Khalifa, I prefer CN Tower just because one can see city without worrying about haze ( It is hard to see over few km distance due to haze from Burj Khalifa "At the Top").Kids loved the glass floor and Sky pod and overall well worth the...

We visited the tower for the second time but this time it was not acceptable. From purchasing the tickets (after standing in line for security and ticket) it took us 3 hours to get up the tower. At no time there was an information or update how long it would take (after purchasing we were told about 90 minutes give...
I really enjoyed the trip. i believe CN tower is one among the 7 wonders in terms of modern world. i would try edge walk during my trip. glass floor was the most exciting part.

Was really fun activity. We went the extra 33 feet Worth it! You can see all the way around because there is no restaurant on that level. Went outside and also checked out the glass floor.Have options for the truly adventure seekers Lots of photos ops.

Was in Toronto for the first time for Carabana Festival and decided to get the Toronto City Pass. I got one line cheaper through Viator a partner of Tripadvisor. It gives you passes to Toronto Zoo, Aquarium, Museum, Casa Loma and CN Tower. We had a great time learning about the tower the viewing area and glass bottom floor. No...

My husband and I went with our 1yo and 3yo. The lines were pretty long for us and we got there around 10AM - we noticed that the lines were all MUCH longer as we were walking out.My kids didn't handle the long lines and crowds all that well. There is a line for tickets, then a loooooong line...

Walking on the glass floor of the CN Tower is vertigo-inducing indeed. The wait to go up however is a little gut-wrenching at about 1 1/2 hours and the food at Horizon's restaurant good but skimpy. If you are willing to pay $65-$100 per plate, you can go to 360 the fine dining restaurant and also skip the wait. A...
This is great way to see Toronto. The view is great. The information on the building of the tower is very informative.
After waiting in line over 2 hours the view from the top was a let down, maybe if we'd been able to just go straight up it would have been worth the cost on a busy day skip it

I agree, the view from the top is stunning. But don't go in high season (August/holidays). We had to wait in line for 2 and a half hours!! The horror starts when you are inside and have to zigzag along through the area. You would expect waiting time to be announced before you get in, So you can decide on...

What is a visit to Toronto without a stop at the CN Tower? Completed in 1976 is is a true engineering wonder. Be prepared to stand in line for the elevators (90 mins to 2 hours) and be sure to get your tickets online or take advantage of the Toronto City Pass or you will have to wait in line...

Purchase City Pass so you don't have to wait on any lines to actually purchase the tickets. Line was about 45 mins long once you get in. Definitely worth it. Nothing else like it. Once you get to the top, enjoy a beer at the restaurant !
What a location to get a idea of the size of Toronto. Restaurant excellent with good service. Would fully recommend booking a table.

Everything seems to be well organized. The reason I didn't give this 5 stars is because of the bar on the observation deck. There's a bad odour in that room. I think it's coming from the rug. Perhaps one too many beers has been spilled on it? In any event, it's time to do something with it.
brought the kids to Toronto for their first time. CN tower is a must see. they were really impressed. we were able to bypass the lineup with the citypass

Visited the CN Tower yesterday as you really couldn't visit Toronto without exploring it.They get thousands of visitors a day so have a lot of experience of managing the lines of people waiting to go up. When you arrive you line up outside to go through security. Once past that you can either join the line to purchase tickets...

The view is brilliant especially on sunny days. However the queues are awful at least an hour long. My recommendation is to book lunch at the 360 restaurant in advance (as we did) and you just skip all the queues first through security and second to buy tickets and third to queue for the lifts. From presenting our tickets at...
The view was spectacular, meal was very good. Elevator ride was funFinding tower was easy but getting into it was not. The signs for entrance are unclear, long line to get through security.

This is a must see , if you are visiting Toronto.It works out better to buy a city pass which will give you access to top 5 Toronto attractions.Try and visit early in the day in order to beat the queue.

I've been living in Toronto even before the CN Tower was built, and I finally decided to go for a visit.The site is accessible by public transit, however the line-ups can be excessive depending on the time of year.We made dinner reservations at the 360 Restaurant, so we were allowed to board the elevator shortly after we arrived,...
When I visited it. It is a nice place to. From the trip of the elevator to walking on the glass floor area, that to say a fact I couldn't do it. To dining while the view rotate as you dine.

This is a phenomenal view of the city. We had a discount coupon from our hotel, so we walked the easy distance from Union Station/Air Canada Center to the tower. Be prepared! It's a long wait, even on a Thursday evening. At the top, there are lots of photo opportunities, restrooms, and several restaurants. We just had drinks and enjoyed...

I really enjoyed seeing Toronto from the CNN Tower. The line to get to the elevator that took me to the top was very long, I am glad I wore comfortable shoes. Once I stepped off the elevator and saw the amazing view, it was worth the wait. I was told by a resident of Toronto that if I had...

Busiest attraction in Toronto. The Aquarium is also right there. Reserve the restaurant on line. And you can spend an hour or more in the revolving restaurant. About $60 Canadian "prix fixe" meal which will include the view downstairs everyone else is paying for (you will not need since the restaurant has a better view). Food is expensive. Appears tasty....

A must when visiting Toronto. So beautiful during the day and very cool at night. Lots of fun facts and information while exploring the Tower. I would love to go back. I recommend this to all of my friends who visit Toronto!

We arrived early in the morning from Niagra Falls, the queue was so long and we didn't get out until the end of the day!!!To avoid the queue, book to eat at 360 degrees restaurant, you can then go straight up. It was approx $60 for meal.If you didn't plan ahead, ticket up alone was $35. We couldn't...

The CN tower had a good view of any thing for miles.Go towards the end of the day because then is a much quicker line. Avoid going on a windy day because the elevator goes slower and so does the line.

Longest queue ever, poor queuing system, complete chaos at the entrance, no entertainment while waiting, been in the queue for 2 hours so far and still only just half way. Not even been up the tower while writing this, but whatever it's like doesn't really matter anymore.

We bought had the prix fixe lunch in the 360 restaurant, the price of which included the elevator to the top and to the glass floor. The food was delicious, though pricey. For a family of four adults including a bottle of wine, and two glasses of beer, and gratuity, our bill came to just under 300 USD. The views...

What a view! It helps that it was a bright sunny day. We also got tickets to to Skypod - the bit that freaked me out (I'm afraid of heights and am not ashamed to admit it ?) was it showed you how much it was swaying up at the tip. Didn't think concrete was supposed to flex. Well worth...
I can't tell you how many times we've been up this beautiful structure and how many different family members I've brought. A true tourist experience even for those who live in Toronto
Great view on Toronto and the Ontario lakeBut long queue.Very "basic"restaurant food at the restaurant
In my own opinion it wasn't worth the 3 hour wait to only spend 30 minutes at the top and another 30 minutes in line waiting to come back down.

We ate at the CN Tower for my husband's birthday and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. It was expensive but worth the price for the views alone. We thought the view from the 360 restaurant were as good as those from the upper floor, so it's not worth paying another $12 to go up higher.
This is definitely worth doing. The views are simply amazing. I have been to similar towers across the world and this was probably the most impressive. Arrive before approx 10.30 to avoid queuing.

We have been to Toronto many times, but this was our first trip up the CN Tower! We booked a lunch reservation, which I highly recommend, you avoid the huge lines to get into the tower and once you finish your lunch, you head right up to the top of the tower. The fee to go to the glass floor...

The iconic tower is a piece of Architecture and marvelous of structural engineering.Used to be the highest tower of the world..The views from observation gallery are superb and you find best view of Toronto city. At that level you can admire the city with respect to landscape and planning of the city. The elevators are comfortable with nice speed. The...

The line to enter the CN Tower was ridiculous. We had city passes which we expected to get us front of the line access they only spa up the process to actually get through the security line and not in fact the elevator line itself. The glass floor was the coolest part though ti is actually disorienting

First time up with the family. Teens loved going at night as the tower was lit up and changing colours from the base to the top. The city sky at night with many, many lights really helps emphasize the size and bustle of urban Toronto.As well, we were able to pick off many of Toronto's sights at night just...
Incredible views, make sure to go during the day. Make sure to stand on the glass floor! The queue to go up the tower is quite long though so go at non peak times

The view is of course amazing, a great way to see the city from above.We booked lunch at the restaurant, was a very pleasant experience, great service and food. Takes an hour to do a full rotation so you get to see it all while eating.Would highly recommend this to do.Prices were as expected, lots to choose...
With the ever increasing size of the Toronto skyline there are little bits of the city where the tower cannot see but not too many. The skywalk on glass was much bigger than I expected.

We went on a beautiful summer Saturday, and arrived shortly after the Blue Jays game (next door) let out. Bad decision. ;-) They were kind enough at the ticket booth to tell us before we paid for tickets that there was a one-hour wait for the elevators to the top. We discussed it and decided to go for it. I...
It was a nice atmosphere...very romantic with the ambiance of the lights and just overlooking the city.

When visiting Toronto, add this to your list. CN tower has several activities you can participate in including a great restaurant for either lunch or dinner with excellent choices. If visiting the restaurant ensure you ask for a table with a full window view.

We visited on a Sunday afternoon, lines were not that long, about a 35-40 minutes before we made it to the top. Amazing views of the city from upper observation deck, also made sure to walk/sit on top of the glass floor and take some pictures. The first time I had been there about a few years' back, I was...

Your City Pass does not allow you to bypass security so you need to stand in that line first. Inside we were told it would be about 2 hour wait up. Note it will be close to the SAME wait down. The elevators hold about 15 people each. One minute ride up. Do the math.After waiting 20 min we decided...
Amazing views and on a very busy day staff were professional and friendly at all times. The gift shop had a wide range of items to choose from.

This is the second time I've been up the CN Tower and still I loved it!The glass floor was a hit with our 12/15 year olds'Got there around 10am which was a nice and quiet time to visit with no queues at all. We were done within the hour!Views were lovely!

If you are going to do one thing in Toronto, do this. The elevator ride up is amazing. Step onto the glass floor and look way down. If you make a reservation for lunch or dinner, which is well worth it, you don't have to pay for the ride up. You can go to the observation level before or after...

We had a reservation at the restaurant so went straight up to the observation deck with no queues! We walked the whole way round and enjoyed the panoramic views. I thought the section of glass floor would have been bigger and it was very crowded with people trying to get pictures. After a lovely dinner we decided to pay a...

This tower was great! My 2 kids loved it,me as well. We arrived early at 9.20 and bought tickets online so we had no queue and it went really fast. The tour is impressive and different from other tower I saw in NY or Paris. Recommend it.

This famous visit changed with the addition of security at the gate. The security officers are mean and does not respect people belongings.I am not willing to visit again to be disrespected and to see unhappy faces.
not a big fan of going up towers, so i really didn't go up. just took pictures which was enough for me.

I suggest u to buy city pass before visiting (to avoid standing in lines) and also not visit there in the weekends cos I did this and there was reallllly crowded. I went there at noon and it was hot. But I think its better to visit at night because of avoiding heat and the beautiful colors of tower! Meals...

We enjoyed this for the view that I am sure you won't find anywhere else in Toronto, and if you are not bothered by heights go to the upper observation deck, my son and I went but my wife is not as adventurous and if the view is not enough take a picture or two from the GLASS FLOOR

We visited the CN tower on general admission tickets using a city pass. Queue for tickets was 20 mins but was efficient (it was holiday Monday). Queue for lift more like an hour but kids loved it and view was amazing

Great photo opportunities available here. The views from the skypod, the high speed elevator, and the observation deck at night are great. Also inside are replicas of moose and bears that can be posed next to or even photographed alone. Excellent signage pointing to where you need to go as this establishment is very large. Friendly and helpful employees provided...
If you visit Toronto you must see this, the views are tremendous. It would be like going to New York without seeing the Statue of Liberty. Toronto is a beautiful city and the food is amazing.

Negatives:expensive for what it is and a long wait (over an hour) to get up there BUT really neat to see the city from way up there. We got to see the blue jays game from above the day we went which was cool! The glass floor is awesome and surreal and going outside to feel the wind is incredible...so...

The CN Tower was a great place get a good view of Toronto. The glass floor was interesting for those with strong hearts as you look down from the viewing area. They also have a restaurant , and for those adrenaline junkies you can hang off the side of the tower. My favourite was the view of the stadium where...

We visited the tower on a Monday evening. We ordered our tickets online which helped us skip the ticket line. But once we got in the tower there was still a one and a half hour wait. It went quickly and they had things to read and watch along the way. The view from the main floor and the sky...

The CN Tower is a must-do attraction in Toronto. We first visited on a Saturday afternoon. The line for tickets was an hour. Once we learned that there was a second line for the elevators that was 2 hours AFTER we got tickets, we walked away.We went back on Monday morning at 10 AM. There was no line at...

If you are in Toronto - CN Tower restaurant is a must to visit. Stay one hour and you will see all of Toronto as the restaurant use one hour to rotate 360 degrees. Not the cheapest place to dine but worth the money. PS - if you do not like heights - this is not for you. Remember to...

Visiting from England the main attraction to see on a trip to Toronto must be the CN Tower. Prior we noticed the queues very long and uncomfortable on a very hot day. As it was my husband's birthday decided to go the next day early. This was a good move as the queue outside for the tickets was minimal, but...

We wanted to go up the tower in the evening for sunset but were told that there is a 45 min wait for the elevators. We were told that if we come back at 9am the next day there shouldn't be a queue. However, we only got there for 9.45 but it wasn't too bad as we had already purchased...

Canada's "Wonder of the World" CN (Canadian National) Tower has long been a source of pride for Canadians in and around Toronto. Favorite tourist attraction.At 553 meter (1,815 feet) in height, the CN Tower was technically the world's tallest building (if you include communications towers and not just habitable space) from its completion in 1976 until 2009.The tower...
My husband did the edge walk and absolutely loved it. I'm not that adventurous so only went inside the tower but the views were amazing and we really loved the whole experience.

There is not much I can say that other travelers haven't said yet, but basically this place is great! The views from the Tower are amazing and totally worth your time and money. Make sure to walk on top of the glass floor :p. It's funny to watch people get scared when walking on it. It's totally safe, so don't...
This is a MUST do for visitors to Toronto. Great view of the city and perspective for how spread out Toronto is.

Make sure you go early if you want to get out of here in a reasonable time. Went around 10 am on a Tuesday afternoon and still waited 20 minutes to buy a ticket and another 30 minutes inside the structure before getting up to the elevator that takes you to the observation area. The view on a clear day...

We lined up at 9 because we heard about the wait that occurs. Glad we did. We were able to get right in. There is brief history of the building on the walls at the top. You ride a elevator to the top and look around. You can see pretty far. But other than that it's a tower haha. Glass...

Bought a ticket in advance and still queued for 2 hours.Great views and a nice experience but I wouldn't recommend unless you were guaranteed only a short wait.Had to queue 30 mins to come down and the systems in place at the viewing platform were abysmal.

Arrive earlier in the day and the lines are better for great views of Toronto from on high. The SkyPod is a great addition on that should be considered. I felt more comfortable with the vertical view from the SkyPod than the glass floor.
food was great lamb sausages and salmon the views from the top was great, excellent service. It's was a surprise dinner for my 60th

This tour was awesome. The staff was friendly and alert I felt safe at all times. Take the walk in the edge tour which takes you around the outer rim. It's about 35 for the tour and you will not be disappointed

From bottom the lift races you up on CN TOWER observations dock at 22 mph speed within 22 seconds.Most beautiful sight of Canada .part of the floor fitted with toughened glass where you can see underneath looking down aqarium .not for light hearted .

To reduce waiting time:- buy the CityPass (if you are also seeing the Science Centre, Aquarium, Casa Loma, Zoo etc) so you can skip the ticket buying lineup. It is available at Costco at a discount.- if you don't have the CityPass, buy tix online (you can do this at the site itself via the wifi hotspot!)-...

My husband wanted to go up the CN tower after a Blue Jays game. He went through security & just before purchasing his $25 ticket the agent told him there was a 90 minute wait, so he decided not to go up. Be sure to ask how long the wait is first.

The CN tower view and elevator ride were great. The photo ops on the observation deck and glass floor were excellent. There was a Blue Jays baseball game going on when we in the observation deck and I took photos of the stadium from the deck and glass floor. The only negative is that we had to stand in line...

Since 1976 opening this concrete and communication and observation tower, became the world's tallest free standing structure and world's tallest tower of the time. The tower was constructed on a large railway switching yard. Multiple skyscrapers were constructed in downtown Toronto compromising the quality of broadcast signals making necessary higher antennas.CN Tower contains a restaurant, gift shop and several...
Was a bit of a line up, but we made it up and enjoyed the view. Even with my fear of heights, I enjoyed the trip up?

We had a great experience. Our dinner was booked for 7.30 and we arrived at 7.10, went through the security checks, then were whisked to the check in desk followed by the lift up. It was all very efficient and friendly.

As an icon of Toronto, we had to pay it a visit. Overall, nothing spectacular. The view from the top was nice, but the other attractions like the glass bottom floor and the elevator ride up was quite unimpressive. The only thrilling activity would be the walk outside the tower, but that is an additional cost.If you feel the...
We have been visiting the CN Tower since I was a kid and its always a must see.. Ill never get tired of it!
It is a obligatory place to go when you are in Toronto.The view is terrific.I thought the ticket for Sky very expensive .

The CN Tower is a very tall structure. The ride up to the viewing area is in a glass elevator, so be prepared. The view from the observation area is fantastic. Full disclosure, I am afraid of heights, but I enjoy photography. I am very glad I joined my husband and went to the top.

CN Tower is certainly a symbol of Toronto, but the visitation is quite simple and a bit overpriced in my opinion. From up the tower you can make a 360 view through a thick window and that is about it. The tower looks quite cool from the outside at night, which for me is nicer than actually going inside of...

We went at 7pm and the wait was still almost 2 hours to get up. You have to go through metal detectors just to get to the ticket window. Price is $35 CAD for an adult save a few $$ if book online but still kinda pricey, but obviously this does not stop people with the 2 hour wait

The CN tower is just something you need to do at least once when visiting Toronto! It provides a 360 view of the city which is breath taking! You also need to test your confidence on the glass floor! The elevator ride is a thrill on its own! I would like to try the revolving restaurant next time. I didn't...

We were here in the early evening, and the queue was quite extensive. However, and this is a top tip, if you book dinner at the 360 restaurant at the top, you get, not only to skip the queues, but also, entry to all the viewing platforms is included with your reservation.So, we went straight up to the restaurant....

Not for those afraid of heights, the CN tower dominates the skyline of Toronto and not surprisingly has probably the best views in Toronto. Access is by a very fast elevator and the viewing area was large and provided views in every direction. Surprisingly few people visiting so nice not to have the crowds experienced at some other towers/platforms I...

Glass floor certainly attracts kids but at the outdoor sky terrace it is difficult to shoot good photos because of thick safety net. Best views are provided by 360 restaurant where you can get super revolving view of Toronto.
Went up the CN Tower while visiting Toronto. Beautiful views of the city and surrounding areas. A must visit if you are in the Toronto area.

I enjoyed my visit to CN tower. It's open late so I visited in my first day of seeing Toronto since I had some time after checking into my hotel and wanted to start sight seeing. The negatives were that it was a 2 hour wait to get to the top, it's crowded, and there were many cranky, crying children....
Have to check this out if in TO. The tower is very cool. Best to go before 11am on weekdays as the lineups to get on can be over an hour wait.
So often I've witnessed it's elegance from below, awe inspiring were it's views from above! A must see, must do Toronto attraction.

As part of this summer's travels, Toronto was the first stop- naturally, on my to-do list was the CN Tower.The Tower itself dominates the skyline and makes it quite distinctive when viewing the skyline from further away.On arrival, the tower is very exciting given its large size, great height and, of course, its reputation.As I had limited...

We went to the tower on a semi overcast day and although the view was still spectacular it was limited. It is quite pricey to go into the tower so if you are Ben going to two places that are on the city pass purchase it. You will save money

I guess we caught this at the right time. Waited in line about thirty minutes to ride up the elevator to the observation deck. Great view of the city and the islands. We had lunch in the Horizons Restaurant which has great views, but doesn't revolve like the 360 Restaurant. Food was kind of expensive but the service was good...
The view of Toronto from the tower is great,nice both for kids and adults.The walking on the transparent floor was scary experience...

My first trip here in 2009 we only went up to the main level. We discovered on this trip you could go higher to the sky pod. that was super cool and well worth the extra cost.Best advise, go to Costco.ca and get a Citypass to save money on the TO attractions.

This was absolutely the highlight of my stay in Toronto! Yes it is pricy at over 100 for my family however it was a lot of fun! The service was nice here and the views from the Tower were excellent! We loved the glass bottom floor and the fact that you could walk outside! If you are going to Toronto...

Yes, it's a tourist attraction, but you knew that going in. I'm perhaps a bit biased since "go to the top of all the really high buildings you can find" is on my Bucket List. The views are, as to be expected, spectacular.And the wind is more than brisk, no matter how calm it is in the ground. The...
It was worth it to see, although I expected the glass floor to be a bigger spot. The time I visited it was quite crowded around glass floor. The view from the tower is amazing though
Great view! A touristy thing to do. Extremely long lines, but a great view. Go after 7 Pm for short lines and to watch the sunset, then watch the city come alive

This is very close to Blue Jays field and the aquarium. So you could make a day out of all three attractions. However, I found this attraction to be average. We waited about 25 mins. to reach the top. I would not wanted to have waited much longer than that. We went on a Sunday morning around 11a.m. The day...

The CN tower offers a great birds eye view of the city of Toronto. Be prepared to wait in line if you have not purchased a front of line pass or if you don't have reservations at the 360 restaurant. I'm glad that we went up but it was Packed... Try to find a time that is off-peak to go....

There were two of us and paying $70 plus tax for two BASIC tickets is just outrageous.. we did it although I was grinding my teeth..this is at least $10 per person more than any other view towers/observatories in North America...Plus to get to the higher platform there is another substantial charge ( and we gave up on that otherwise...

We waited approximately 2 hours just to see the observatory deck of this building. Nothing spectacular with the tower. The 360 view was beeathtaking. You can see Toronto in a glimpse but nothing different from the towers I visited in the past. Don't waste to go to the top and pay more. Not worth the penny. Just have a picture...
The view is Really Nice, very close to downtown, close to roger centre, I will recommend it.........................................................................
This place is a toal rip off. $125ish for family of 4 and really not worth it. Total tourist trap. Yikes.

Unless you can afford the $200 for the EdgeWalk, this was a waste of 3 hrs of our trip. $35 p/person to wait in an hour line only to struggle for a view at the top. The glass floor is a joke and is literally only a few floor panels of "glass" surrounded by tourists. There is no audio tour...

This is like any other building with a view. It was very pricey for the experience. Although I am glad we went, I had "heartburn" afterwards for how long we waited and how much we paid for what we ended up seeing and doing.
Well worth the money for great views. Booking a table in the evening offered good sunset, very atmospheric,
There is a great view from the observatory and the glass floor is fun to look through. We got our tickets from our hotel concierge and saved a few bucks and the wait in line.

We were a little confused when we looked on line the night before. It stated you had to book 24 hrs in advance. So we said oh well we will just stand in line tomorrow. When we arrived in the line the next day though we found we could buy on line the Day of. So while we waited in...

It was our first trip to Canada and we decided to visit CN tower. Its kind of expensive and expect a long wait no matter what day or time you go. Once you are at the top enjoy the great view of Toronto. But if you have seen Burj Khalifa(Dubai) don't waste your time here, as its no where closer.
We visited the tower through a restaurant booking but the views are so good, the glass floor was nice to look through but like I said rather expensive.
Great views, queue was long though, even on Sunday!Once your at the top, its all about the view. Would recommend having a cockatiel in the bar to take in the atmosphere.

Still beautiful after all these years. Dinner at 360 is a must see on a clear summer evening. The city around you in lights and water and greenery is spectacular. It brings a whole new appreciation to this beautiful city of Toronto.

We arrived before 10am. Long line to clear security, then long line for elevator. We were in line for 30 min. Once at the top we looked at the view, very cool to see. Don't waste you time withe the upper floor, we purchased the upper floor, but the line was so long we skipped it. It was on my...

An excellent way to get a perspective on Toronto. Make sure it's a clear day when you go up to make the most of it.To avoid long queues book your tickets on your smart device for use that day.Alternatively, book a table in the restaurant and eat and get the view and avoid the admission fee. The cost...
The welcome, service, food and the view, everything was breathtaking. The staff was a extremme kindness.

As we queued the heavens opened?. At the top we got a good view of the inside of a cloud ??. Then the clouds passed ??. Amazing to see the city revealed as the rain passed. This is a must do in Toronto but be prepared for the queues for much of the day.

One place that everybody should visit at least once ...incredible view and feeling . If you like special and unique places , put this one on your list ! Go up to the sky pod level and feel the movement of the tower! This is the second time fr me here but never get rid of it .
An expensive elevator ride, but the view makes you forget all about it. We waited for quite some time in line, definitely go with the thought of there being a wait.

What can i say, we decided to book the 360 restuarant which includes free admission to the observation deck & glass floor lookout. Whilst the meal was a little overpriced, it was a once in a lifetime experience! The views are amazing!
Absolutely stunning - a must visit and definitely worth doing the Edge Walk - amazing views over the whole of Toronto

This is a must if you are visiting Toronto for the first time. You can see all of the city from the top of the CN Tower. I would say the activity is only a necessity once and is on the more costly side.

Firstly, don't queue to buy a ticket! I got it on my phone and saved the bar code as a picture - that got me in.However, I bought the ticket in the morning - clear blue skies and warm in July - but by evening there was a torrential thunder storm, so not the best viewing weather. However, there...
A must visit attraction in TO. We've waited 90minutes to go up but the wait was made more interesting with all the fun facts to read and discover about the tower.
Great attraction to add to your day of excursions... To eat at the 360 restaurant you will need to make a reservation and the picture is a little expensive 25 to 50 dollars.

The view was beautiful and it was a good experience once we got through the 2 hr line to go up. I've waited in long lines, we live in Orlando Fl., but the way this waiting was organized made it feel like we waited 5 hrs. I'm thinking a quicker way up is dining at the 360 restaurant. Maybe that...

I'm afraid of heights but had to go up anyways. There is a glass floor you can stand on (not me lol).Even with my fear of heights I felt safe being in such a huge tower!Must see 360 degree view if the city!
Just going up the elevator to the top with amazing views of Toronto is spectacular. The restaurant at the top has wonderful food and views.

I was with three friends for my friend's 50th birthday. What a great way to celebrate. We were going to just to the tower and not lunch but the concierge at the Omni King Edward Hotel recommended we do lunch. Access to the Tower is $33. Lunch is about $55.00. Lunch was delicious and, of course, the view from the...
This is the best! A towering baseball experience. One of a kind. 'We are family!" And the exchange rate is favorable!

While everyone says this is a must, the only way to do this is to eat in the restaurant or have a drink so you can go up and down in their elevator. The line moved pretty quickly to get to the elevator to head up, but the line to come down was totally disorganized. The view was cool, especially...
Totally worth the view. and is a great architectural monument. makes the skyline of Toronto a special mark

First of all tooooo expensive! Which makes you not to go back up again even if you wanted too. After all, it's just a circle and a patch of glass floor. The dining though is nice and not overly priced.
The views from the top are breath taking. If you suffer from vertigo then stand at the back of the lift away from the glass doors.

Dinner was excellent about 650 above the City after going to the top of the CN Tower. What a great view not just of Toronto but across Lake Ontario. On a clear evening we were able to see the Skon in Niagara Falls. Dinner was super and service was excellent. A little pricey but worth the cost

This is the best experience ever, to see the whole extension of the city. Great overview!The best time is before sun set!You can even combine with dining at the 360 restaurant, which rounds up the nice experience. I have been there several times, at least 6 times the last 6 yearsStill, the views are stunning!
Easy to purchase tickets on the day,2 hour queue to go on to the lift.Amazing views from the tower,Snacks available at the top also restaurant there.
Great place to visit if you travel to Toronto, greay view, you can obtain great pictures of the city.Windy but really funny. Is as great in the day such as night.
We were fortunate to have a great viewing day as far as visibility. Lots of people but defer from a good visit.

Waited 1 1/2 hours to get an elevator up and then had to wait over an hour to get an elevator down. Instead of designating one elevator for restaurant patrons, they give them first right to all elevators so that nobody else can get on them.

Took a trip up CN tower and yes your ears do pop as the elevator speeds up to the top, lovely trip to do with friends for a dinner setting and photo's. Not too expensive and good food. Cannot fault the staff or restaurant at all,

Toronto isn't a city of huge attractions, so the CN tower is probably on the short list of "must-do's". While definitely a tourist attraction, I enjoyed my visit to the CN tower. The line wasn't too long when we arrived mid-day.It was nice that the staff charged discounted admission for our deaf friends in our group.The larger gift...

$35 and fantastic views. However don't recommend going on a Saturday. we stopped by during the day and they said it would be over a 2 hour wait, they said come back in evening. We came back at 7 and they said still over 2 hour wait, come back at 10 PM. We came back at 10 and STILL over...
Go early or late. We got there around 2pm and waited over two hours in line. The view is spectacular. Interesting display on the tower construction while moving in line.
We timed visit for 9am in the morning .... No queues , walked straight in . Paid extra for visit to very top , great views and the glass floor is a great laugh

Pretty long wait just to get tix then told the wait for the elevator was going to be very long too. So we only got to do part of what we hoped. Ok but may be not worth all the time we had to spend just waiting around in lines. But like other towers we've been to, there are of...

I've been to the CN Tower a few times. It's not something that I would go to often but every few years it's nice to go up for the views. Laying face down on the glass floor is a must. The CN Tower is accessible for all and very kid friendly. For the best views, it's important to go on...

It's really awesome & fantastic!If you are at first in Toronto, this is the best way to look around the whole city!Don't be scared!You may feel comfortable with safety gear and all crew are nice & kind!
We had a nice view of the tower from our hotel room. Since we've already done observation things in other cities we passed on this one. But we did enjoy taking pics of it :)
We could see forever on our clear day,as well as the Blue Jays game going on next door.Get a reservation if possible.

We went on a beautiful but hot July Saturday afternoon.We waited 45 minutes in line just to buy tickets. We then were told that there would be a 1.5 hour or so line waiting to go on the elevator up to the viewing floor.The attendant suggested that we come back at 9 AM on Sunday morning (We bought...

We did not even went on top but during our whole trip, I we were constantly reminded of the greatness of this monument. It just defines the city. We are from Montreal and sadly, one of our biggest landmark, the Olympic Stadium, is so far from downtown that we almost never seen it. I just love what it can add...

Amazing views of the city! We went a little before sundown and saw both a daytime view and the beautiful city lights! Ticket booth line was long, so we bought tickets on our phone and skipped the line.

Waited 30 minutes to get thru security then found out it would be a 2 1/2 hour wait to get up. So we just didn't have the time. Wish we would have done this first thing or could have gone back later. So beware of time management. Also Blue Jays had a game so maybe that was what caused extra...

The CN Tower was extremely busy the day we went to visit. There are security precautions which is important during these times.We were told it was the busiest day in the last five years. Needless to say, the lines were extremely long and we lost track of time. We had purchased the City Pass and were determined to go to...

been here once before but first time with the kids. Glass floor is fun and always a spot to stand. Been to the Willis Tower and the glass lookout is too crowded and rushed. Cn Tower also has an outside observation deck.

Brilliant once in a lifetime experience that will blow you away. The speedy ascent to the first section was really smooth, glass floor in elevator fantastic. Go to the skypod for the breathtaking views of the beautiful city. I bought the city pass which gives a great value experience on the major attractions. Toronto people are lovely and helpful.

I Am afraid of heights so i had been putting this off. If you have city pas getting in is a breeze. The lines are long but they move reasonably well. The experience going up is not scary by the time you start thinking about it you are at the top. The restaurant is reasonable and it's right by the...
best attraction for toronto and wonderful view from skypod observation and try edge walk very funny !

The CN Tower was the cherry on top of our Toronto Sunday. Best advice was to make advance lunch reservations in the rotating 360 restaurant. We skipped all the long lines, went directly to the top, had a delicious lunch and a spectacular 360 degree view of the greater Toronto area below. Then we skipped all the lines again and...

My wife and I visited the CN Tower with our City Passes this week, and while I'd say that it is definitely an architectural masterpiece and something that is probably almost "required" of you if you visit Toronto, it was not as unique feeling as other attractions in the city.
