The wait in line (even with the pass) was several...

Don't bother. It's just another attraction spoiled by greedy operators throwing as many people on as they can fit. Take a picture from the base of the tower, it looks great and there is no queue! Go inside and write off a few hours of your life to get in a lift, see a reasonable view through grubby windows and...

So yes we had an incredible experience dining in the revolving restaurant of the CN tower and we were very impressed. Our waiters and servers were very professional though also had personality.We had 3 course meal with cocktails, champagne, red wine and desert wines.I have officially given up eating red meat after this meal as I know I...

You can get these online or at the customer service desk at each attraction.Got mine online before hand. Skipped the ticket line, and got the actual ticket booklet at CN tower service desk. The line was already building for tickets, and we skipped it.Recommends getting there around open time to avoid security check wait time.After the tower...

360 degree Restaurant is well worth the visit. The restaurant resolves, so perfect 360 degree of the City. Do it near sunset. The food and service isn't bad either. You can then visit the observation decks for free. Don't remember the glass (see-thru) floor.The location is perfect, near the Rogers Centre and the Aquarium.

I recently visited the CN Tower while on a business trip. We went all the way to the top and had dinner at the 360* restaurant. This is a fantastic attraction who anyone who isn't afraid of heights. If you're visiting/eating at the restaurant you don't need tickets to go up to the top. The tower gives you awesome 360*...

We waited over 2 hours in line to get up to the CN tower • it was beyond frustrating • but we waited and enjoyed the experience from the top • sad to have to wait in line to get back down • we were exhausted after just from all the standing and waiting • was it worth it ........
Super fun experience!! We got there early at 9 to avoid lines! We walked around the entire inside and outside !! Beautiful views all around

I've lived in Southern Ontario my whole life and been up the tower 3 or 4 times - last time being summer 2015.The facility is clean and is kept up nicely for all the traffic it gets. The elevator is an attraction in itself as the floor and outside panel are glass - giving you some nice views while...

Don't be fooled by a long line, it does not take that long to get update there.When getting inside the elevator try to stay close to a window, the view is amazing.Up there enjoy the view, the sunset is wonderful, in the summer don't forget to enjoy the open space with a lot of wind hehe.Finally, the...
Excellent views of the city, goes all the way around.Glass floor is a little bit disappointing, would have expected it to be biggerShame the grill covers the view a lot
From the Observation deck, you see the whole of Toronto. If you are uneasy about heights, don't look down. You can almost feel " on top of the world", from up there. Wow.
Very pricy, good for a one time visit. Staff are friendly and courteous. You can get more bang for your buck at other nearby attractions like Ripley's Aquarium and the Royal Ontario Museum.

If you have never been to the CN tower, then you've missed out on everything. The CN tower is one of the best experience you will ever have. They have rides, photo booths, games, and shops. We came here for birthday diner celebration at the 360, restaurant at the CN Tower and visit to the tower top was included. I was in town visiting friends in St. thomas and they wanted to bring me to Toronto to sight see and this was the first thing on the list. We went about noon on a Thursday and the line was long just to get tickets, then another hour to get in the first elevator. The ticket center told us it...
It is a marvel of engineering the ride up the view and the restaurant is good. The views are great during the day or the evening . The gift shop is expensive you can get other souvenirs elsewhere.

Views are nice but the food was bad for the prices. Make a reservation to eat, arrive 2 hrs early, avoid the lines and then cancel your reservation after you've seen the sites. It's a great way to avoid the lines. We ate at the 360 and the food was not work $500 for four people. The place is old...

The CN tower is next to the aquarium so you can combine the two activities. Get there early to avoid the queues. The tower is pretty high and the views are amazing. Try grab a bite to eat there and take along your good camera for some really awesome photos. The glass floor is a small section - good enough...

We have been to the CN tower many of times and we love it! Although the lines to pay and for the lift up to the glass bottom floor can be very long , it's well worth it when you see the view! Stunning ! Nice and clean next time we visited we are going to go to the restaurant...
In my opinion is way too expensive for just a ride with an elevator and see the view from the high point, you can do this from any tall building in Toronto, if you have access.
Great place to visit we had a great experience with our grandchildren. Would go back again with the whole family
CN tower unique to Canada Ontario 1,136 ft./346m LookOut in a mere 58 seconds in one of six high-speed glass-fronted elevators and take in the stunning views of Toronto.
It's a fun, touristy spot that has a welcoming charm. The view is spectacular, staff are friendly, and it also has a well stocked gift shop as you exit.

A visit to the CN Tower on our Canadian trip was a must despite my fear of heights.Access to the tower was easy and when we visited there was a very small and fast moving queue. The staff were friendly and helpful.A fast elevator ride to the top and the views across the city were amazing - you...

It didn't settle my stomach to pay the price for the long-promised trip to the famous Tower, or to ride the elevator to the top. It was only after much pleading from a spatially challenged nine year old and fearless six year old that I ventured near the edge. There are people who will rate this as a fabulous experience....

We visited the tower in the evening and had dinner in the revolving restaurant. The food was great quality and most of the staff were very helpful and nice (just one grumpy one!). The main attraction has to be the view.....it was amazing. We were there for the sunset and it was stunning. Definitely a must for anyone visiting Toronto

so my son really wanted to see the CN tower so we took him, other kids weren't planning on going up but when they saw it they wanted to go up. we took train from airport UP, which gave us 20 percent off ticket , didn't pay to go to very top I know it would just be another line....
Great family outing. Fantastic views of Toronto and beyond. Think about visiting at night to avoid ques
Wonderful! Food was delicious. Pricey but well worth the experience dining in the rotating tower. Tower was within walking distance from our hotel.
Don't just seek your thrill going up the glass elevator, book a table to eat and enjoy the revolving restaurant! Perfect for family or dates.

We really enjoyed ourselves!We took family that were visiting from out of town. It was a REALLY hot day, and we thought we could escape the heat...but it was hot inside too.Prep your self for lots of standing in line for elevators.The view is spectacular, and totally worth it! If you can pass up the touristy trap...
telecom tower giving a view of an extremely boring city - elevator ride is expensive and just not worth it. As I say, don't bother!

Had friends visiting from Ireland and we took them up the CN Tower. It was a beautiful day and you could see for miles. The glass bottomed floor is always a hit. Although it is expensive it is worth it.
I went during the night time , everything lights up!The visiility is not that good. I had a great time though with my date but for the money spent; I would definitly do days!

We came on a Monday in July around 3:30pm and it was very busy. It took us 1.5hrs to wait before getting on the elevator to go up. I would give this a 3.5 if I could. Not a 3 as listed.If this was the first view I'd seen I would give it a 4, but as I have...

Queue time was over an hour long. Glass walk way is poor and there are no staff to move the children on who roll around on it stopping anyone else from enjoying the view. On the way down queue etiquette doesn't exist and people are just so rude. Frankly a waste of 35 Canadian dollars

Climb the CN tower with your young teen kids. Better in the autumn time when you can see the colorful trees on the ground. It was fun. The observation deck was fabulous. Every one loved it. The restaurant on the top is not that bad. Don't forget to get to the theater to see the documentary movie about how this...

Once you are up is cool but you need to get there first and you are not informed at any point (before or even after buying the ticket, and they are not cheap) that you may be queuing for a looooong time. We queued for 90 minutes. Then, if you have been silly enough to pay even more to go...

A must for anyone visiting Toronto. Do your homework and decide before you purchase tickets whether there are other sites you want to visit that are on the CityPass as well. It will save you money. There are various levels that you can view from the top, as well as walking the edge which you need good nerves for. The...

On our trip to Toronto, we decided to splash out and eat at the 360 restaurant at the top of the CN Tower. What a perfect way to have lunch or dinner overlooking the amazing city of Toronto and Lake Ontario.Although the menu is on the expensive side, the views do compensate. Service is excellent and we did enjoy...

Visiting Toronto was a spur of the moment decision during my trip to Canada but I am so glad I did. On the drive to Toronto, the CN tower is visible in the skyline and the closer you get, the more beautiful it becomes. It can be seen from anywhere along the highway. We arrived into Toronto as the sun...
Seriously a magnificent piece of modern engineering!Great views, freaky glass floor.Crowded.Get there right when it opens to avoid the crush of people.

The CN Tower is old, but never gets old! It truly is a marvel and a wonderful thing for people of all ages to experience. Worth the wait, and the price....though twice a year you can climb the stairs for free by fundraising for a charity. If you're afraid of heights, you might not enjoy it as much as someone...

This was the second Toronto City Pass Attraction we chose to visit today along with the Ripley's Aquarium. Had we not had our City Pass which allowed us to bypass the ticket line, it would have been an extreme disappointment. Typically the CN Tower has always been the place that you visit only when touring around out-of-town relatives or friends....
A must see when visiting Toronto. Lots of other things to see and do when in this part of the city and some great restaurants all around

Visited the CN tower this month. Entry fee to go up the tower was 28 plus 13% tax, like the tower, it's a bit steep. That fee is just for elevator ride.- that price did not include entry to the sky pod or the spinning restaurant.At 1.30 pm on a Thursday, the queue to buy tickets was 20 mins...
Exceeded expectations was a great view over a great city. The weather was exceptional for this experience
We arrived in time for the sunset, which was beautiful from the Tower. Our wait to go up was fairly short. It was a little longer to get down, but they seem to do a good job moving people.

I went up in the tower during a business trip. The lines took approx 40 minutes and started 100 m outside the security check. When arriving at mid station I took a walk outside and it was very windy. A lot of people and if you were inside the glass windows was "foggy". It was cool to see a 360...
It is great to see in a bird's eye view of the Greater Toronto Area, walking on the glass floor and edge walk for the adventurous.

I started going up the tower in 1982 and have visited it many times since. Since the city never stops growing the view is always interesting and if you get the right day with a clear blue sky you can see for miles! No need to buy the ticket all the way to the top and for sure the walk...

Couldn't go to Toronto without visiting this architectural masterpiece. The staff were very informative and full of information not only about the tower but about what you can see from the top. Brilliant tourist attraction, well worth visit on a cold morning.
Been there a lot of times ....for your first time it's a beautiful experience...but rather too expensive to bring kids

My sister and I had lunch at the 360 Restaurant at the CN Tower. I don't know if I should say "the food complimented the view" or "the view complimented the food". Either way it was great and definitely worth the money spent. If I am ever back in Toronto I will visit again for luch.

What a great place for a special occasion. Great photo opportunities and the ambience is wonderful. Very romantic. A little bit expensive for the type of food but worth it for the experience. I must say though there is much better food in the city for the price you pay here.

We were sat at a table by the window. Views are spectacular, especially while you're slowly revolving and catching a bird's eye view of Toronto. The only negative is that the food is mediocre at best and quite pricey. No complaints on the service, it was very friendly and accommodating. Glad we had lunch there, but wouldn't return.

Everything about the Tower was great, but its pricey. We did it on a City Pass which included other attractions and made it less costly. We went to the upper observation deck too and that was neat. Glass floor on lower deck is free (included with admission) and that is fun to stand or lie on.

Travelled with sister in law with crutches and autistic boy got very nice treatment, discount for autistic boy with id card proving his disability, also got to go to the front of the line, best time to go is around 8pm as it closes at 10.30pm, lines are very short, and lights are dazzling..fun
Great to say seen it , adventured it , loved it . Food was great , the views was amazing . A must adventure if you travel to Toronto Well worth the experience .
The view was fabulous. The observation deck was not over crowded. The staff was all very nice. But... it was a 1 hour 40 minute wait and I loath lines!
It's a must see and a will see given its height. I think it looked most stunning against a dusky sky. Truly one of the most impressive parts of the Toronto skyline.
A fast trip up the elevator to great views in every direction. Walk, lie, dance on the glass floor 342m up. Some great history panels too.

It goes without saying the views are well worth a visit to the CN tower. It's rightfully one of the top attractions. Unfortunately, there were problems with some of the elevators during our visit, leading to long queues everywhere. In retrospect, going up all the way to the skypod might have been worth the extra money, but not the wait.
A beautiful view over the lakes, amazing when you first walk out the door of the elevator, down side was buy tickets on line first, as we had a 3 hour wait.
A very interesting place to visit since it's one of the world highest buildings, and actually held the record of "highest build" for 34 years.

Make sure you have your tickets purchased before coming to the tower to avoid long lines. The view is incredible, on a clear day, you can see the whole city, plus. Did not go to the next level (13 stories higher), we felt that 30 to 45 minutes is enough and any higher was not worth it. Great tourist stop,...
A true landmark with much history! You have to visit it and stand on the glass floor! Has restaurants inside that are quite good!
This is a "must see" feature when visiting Toronto. Must try the lean over the edge. I did, but it was the edge of the sidewalk at the base of the tower.Enjoy
My husband and I came to Toronto for a mini vacation.We got the City Pass and the CN Tower was included. Was well worth the money.

Having walked along the lake front, we decided to head to the CN Tower to do the tourist bit. NB: if you are thinking of eating at the revolving restaurant, book ahead and avoid paying the Tower entrance fee. A unique view of Toronto and the lake so it's popular with tourists. We were there early May so not crowded...

The ticket cost is high. I think that we went on a rather busy Sunday, there was a Blue Jays game that afternoon so lots of people were there visiting the tower before the game started. We did not purchase tickets for the highest point but rather for the middle. The view is nice but the windows that you look...

Used to be tallest, now just tall. All about catering to tourists - junk shops and money for elevators. Sure the view is good On a nice day but you are better off just walking around the base and saving cash.

Go early in the day, which may help avoid the queues. But they can be long- you'd expect it, in a place like this. There are videos to watch in the queue, which helps. But the views, when you get up there, are second to none, especially over the lake, where byou can watch planes land and take off far...
Amazing view. Skypod wait takes forever due to only 1 small cramped elevator that holds about 10-12 ppl. The place is understaffed so expect to wait in line if you buy the extra skypod access.

Well worth a visit! If you are wanting to see stunning views over the city of Toronto then look no further. 360 degree views. We also went to the revolving restaurant at the top. The food was amazing.

If you have done another tall building then this is exactly the same just different view. There is a glass floor to look down if you can find space as it is free for all! Also expect to queue for about an hour.

The view of the city is very beautiful! It gets windy and chilly on top so be prepared. I walked on the glass floor which made me quite nervous at first but conquered it.If you are visiting during summertime, be prepared for long lines. Don't forget your souvenirs on the first floor before leaving the CN Tower. Lastly, get your...

In my opinion this is the one 'must do' thing in Toronto, because everything else listed can be found in many other cities too. I went on Saturday afternoon - turns out this was a bad idea, as the tower was insanely crowded. The queue is well managed, it moves, there are info boards, photo ops, videos along the way...
We didn't go up but the area was nice to walk around.Too many people in our group to do this (and a few were afraid of heights ...)
A must see while in Toronto. Can be busy and noisy, but it's something everyone wants to do. Next trip - dinner in the revolving restaurant!
Very crowded ,but worth the view , after waiting outside for about 10 mins, had a long line inside about an hour before taking the elevator ( very fast) to look out deck ...

Thanks to the citypass we didn't have the long wait times to get in! It was quite windy the day we went up, I don't recommend wearing a dress on skirt unless its ankle length. We went up at lunch time but there didn't seem to be a place to eat if you had brought your lunch, so we just...

We booked a table for dinner on our last night in Toronto. The views are stunning, well worth the visit as you get amazing views of the whole Toronto area and beyond. However a note of warning the food is ridiculously over priced for what it is- kids menu $40 for nuggets and chips and a scoop of ice cream...

The CN tower shows a breathtaking view of the city. Glass floor is made at the top observatory deck for people to stand on and feel they are standing on nothing, very good experience. Gift shop and refreshments are also offered there. It is a must do for Toronto visitors.

Its the CN Tower. Sure it's expensive, and the line is exhausting but no visit to Toronto is complete without it. The glass floor still scared my kids and the views from the outside deck are spectacular.

We live in Toronto and still love coming here every few years. I think it's worth the extra $12 to go up to the sky pod, but overhead others that thought it wasn't worth it.Be patient, wear your comfy shoes and try to visit on a weekday if you can.

We were hoping to squeeze this in before a flight which is IMPOSSIBLE. Wait time was 90 minutes in a Saturday at 1pm in July.1. Traffic into Toronto downtown was horrible (we think due to a BlueJay game)2. 90 minute wait was not possible due to our limited time.You must purchase tickets online at least 24 hours...

Long wait to get In but the views of Toronto were well worth the wait. The staff at the base had the time of the wait right down to the minute. Part of the city pass which is a must for Toronto. You get to enjoy the top at your own leisure. It was amazing to see how big Toronto...
The sheer hight of the tower makes the rest of the buildings in Toronto look like LEGO buildings. But expect quing during the summer time

Always a great place to visit. I would get the city pass even if you don't go to all the places it offers it still pays for itself if you just go to two places. We went to CN Tower and Ripley's Aquarium.

Ok so if you have never been to Toronto this is a must do. It is a once in a lifetime experience. However, that being said I don't think I would do it again. It is definitely a tourist trap. I purchased a city pass which helped with the lines ( buying one allows you to bypass most lines) I...
Definitely go with the City Pass as it saved us an hour standing in line! Special coupon on half off the highest top ramp in spindle! Worth the 30 minute wait to get there!views majestic!

We had a short amount of time to visit the CN Tower. Unfortunately, it was during a Blue Jays home game. That made finding parking difficult. It also meant an extremely long line for the tower after the game. Blue Jays ticket holders receive a 15% discount on tower tickets on game day. It seemed like a good chunk of...

The question you have to ask is it worth the wait "in line" ? If it is then take the trip if not don't bother - the views from the top are amazing.For me the it was so busy the wait was too much and nearly walked away - 100's of people and crowded lifts.If that's your thing...

We had a really good time. The view was awesome. We had the chance to see the last rays of sunshine and the night view a little bit later. We were also lucky enough because there were almost no waiting line. It can get really hot at the top if it's crowded. I would recommend avoiding time of huge crowd...

From below you can see the odd red dot which turns out to be people paying to be frightened out of their lives by hanging off the side of the tower. I just took the least frightening option of standing on the glass floor but that can still give you the colly wobbles. There are superb views of the city...
Plan ahead and buy tickets or CityPass online, this helps avoid some of the queues. The restaurant on the main viewing area was pretty good value for money, and food and service were good.

The views from here were amazing. Our day was clear, thankfully, as it could get bad when rainy or misty. Stepping onto the glass floor feels so weird. The souvenir shop was well-stocked (but no polo shirts), but the coffee shop did not open until after we left. Why is it not open the same hours as the Tower itself?

The views were great. The glass walk was cool, and very nerve wracking. The line to the elevators up the tower moved steadily. The line to the elevators down the tower did not. There are better things to do with your time than sit in 2 hours worth of lines.
1) it's hard to mistake where you are2) this iconic symbol elevates your image3) just looks coolEnjoy !!
You need more then one hour to have a view through bars between a lot of People. The Restaurant was ok and not to expensive.

This is obviously a big tourist attraction and rightfully so. I've always been a fan of going to the highest point of every city to have a top down view of the area.It's about 1160ft up with views in all directions...even down. Yes they have a glass floor bottom in a small area which people love. Don't worry it's...

It was an excellent experience from that height.One can see Air, Surface, water, Tunnel transports very easily.Experience at Glass roof top is fanatic.The lift takes /bring down very fast.It is fun with young children

Last weekend my boyfriend and I went to the 360 Restaurant inside CN Tower to celebrate our anniversary.The view was great: the rotating floor of the restaurant offers you a 360-degree view (hence the name) of the city and the lake.The atmosphere was good: there are a lot of different groups of people, some there for a casual...

We went up the CN tower one morning. Really great site. We paid the extra 10 dollars to go up to the Skypod which is above the normal viewing area. Superb sites to see from up there. Well worth a visit
I found it waste of time and money to go up the Tower. Its better to go to Toronto Islands for the beautiful view of Toronto Skyline.

We enjoyed our visit of the CN Tower once we started the elevator trip up. The wait was over two hours. The reason given was the windy day. The elevators were slowed down for safety so keep that in mind if you visit this site. The view at the top is outstanding. Once out on the observation deck you can...

viewed as far away as 50 km and built 40 years ago, allows visitors to two different levels as per tickets . glass floor view deck with a 360 degree revolving restaurant at level 115 floor and the top most skypod about 145 storied high reached through glass elevators in about 60 seconds offers breathtaking view of city around. top...
It was with school activities it amazing place you can't see like that in all your life if you have Fear of high places don't go there
But it´s much more comfortable to come for a lunch, then wait hours in the line. The food was very good at the restaurant. Of course, the view from the tower is great!!

Did dinner for 4, cost $400c, pretty good overpriced food, but includes elevator ("elevation" in Canada-speak). Great view while eating, then you get to walk on the glass floor, freaky, and go outside to the windy terrace, blinking color lights, great fun for us and teenagers, could be used in a finale of an Alfred Hitchcock movie!

We had an unexpected day-long layover in Toronto and had to choose one major attraction to visit.Despite the long lines we were both glad we chose the CN Tower. We arrived about noon with only a 10 minute or so wait to purchase tickets--when we left at about 3:30 the line for tickets seemed a hour long. Once ticketed...
A bit pricey, but good for families. The glass floor is terrifyingly amazing. the views stunning. I did not opt for the sky-walk, but if you're a daredevil I'm sure it will thrill!

The glass floor is a bit scary, in a fun way. The view from the restaurant is very relaxing and nice. The lookout area, open air, was very exciting where the wind was strong. Lots of fun.There were interesting displays showing facts about other towers around the world.

Glad we went just so that we can say we experienced it. But it was pricey for what it was. I guess I really wasn't that enamoured or impressed with the views. The lines to go up and TO GO DOWN (yes, you have to line up and wait to get out of there!!!) really ruined the whole experience. We...
This trip is worth the long wait. It was 45 minutes when we there. It would have been longer had we not purchased the tickets ahead of time. Excellent view of Toronto

We went after dinner when the wait was only 45 minutes vs sometimes up to 2 hours during the day. The line moved fairly fast and didn't seem like a45 minute wait. While seeing the lights of the city it would have been nice to see the view during the day to see further and the water. The glass bottom...

I had been super excited to visit the famed CN tower since I arrived in Toronto. in all honesty ,it was quite a let down. There is nothing spectacular about the building or the surroundings except the view at the top which was very anticlimactic . Im glad I did it but I will not be returning or recommending this...
It was a great experience but very expensive. Glad I went once for the experience but not something we will be doing again.

Visited primarily to eat at the 360 Restaurant but the viewing platform was amazing and the glass floor was a mind-blowing experience. Lifts are fast and have the added benefit of glass doors and floors!

I went her on a school-trip, I thought it was incredible, the views were outstanding I went all the way to the top part of the tower and it was amazing, I would not recommend if you are afraid of heights or you don't like glass flooring, as there are some areas that do have that, the service is great...

When you arrive at the tower, you have to go through security and then only to the line to buy tickets. Buy your tickets online!! You don't have to pick a specific day, they are good for 3 months and they save you time in the line. But, you do have to wait in a much, much, much shorter line...
This was my second time at cn tower. This time I had lunch there and it worth because when you go to the restaurant you skip the hole line to go up!
I went to Toronto for a few days. The CN Tower is a must! Amazing views of the city! The pictures that I got were stellar. Beautiful! Worth your time to view the sights!

My friend and I decided to take the challenge of looking down from far! Our limits were tested to how far we could see and how afraid we would be. Everything was set with minutes ahead of us before our citypass was scanned we couldn't guess what awaited us. From the amazing graphics of CN Tower swirling in its photocells...

Visited recently. 35 dollar entry fee which I thought was a little too high. Try to get one of the freely available vouchers which offer a discount. If you don't want to stand in line (quite a long wait), purchase your tickets online in advance. The views are fantastic, and the glass floor is great for those trying to overcome...

You have to visit here when your in Toronto the views of the city and the surrounding suburbs are amazing. If your even braver you should do the edge walk, which I did which is liberating and gives you even more of a grander view of the city.
We went there at 9.30 and there was a few people in the queue. When we left it was already super busy.And around noon the queue was insane. Go early. Worth a visit

This is a must see attraction however it can be a bit disappointing if you get a cloudy or rainy day. There was a 2 1/2 hour wait the first time we went so be sure to go early in the morning to avoid the crowds.

The ride up the tower is a bit exhilarating. Great view of the city of Toronto. Observation deck has a glass floor which is pretty nerve wracking as you can see the city hundreds of feet below you. Restaurant is pricey. We were 4 adults 2 children - $625. Food and service was good but for that price I can...

This is the iconic CN Tower! If you're visiting Toronto, how can you miss it? The ticket price was at an expensive $35.00 but it was truly worth visiting!When we went, there was a 50 minute wait to go to the top. As well, there was a 15 minute wait to get back down. However, while in line, there...
We purchased the Toronto City Pass and this was a ticket in it. We enjoyed the view of Toronto. The line was extremely long, but worth the wait.

A great experience once you get up there. We waited in line to the elevators for almost an hour but the views once we got up there were breathtaking! You have to have a clear day which we did to be able to see and enjoy it all.

Great visit to the CN tower. I would recommend paying the extra for the VIP pass. We passed 1.5 hours of line up and viewed the full tower within 45 minutes. The VIP pass is wonderful if you are on a time crunch. If not, beware the line ups are very long!
If your in Toronto, just do it. It's an icon. When you get to the top, it's fun to walk over the glass floor. I didn't have any wait at all the day I was there.

We had been to the CN Tower previously but this time we decided to have lunch in the 360 degree restaurant and what an experience it was. There are 2 levels of menu that we chose from either 2 or 3 course and included in the price is access to the viewing tower and the glass floor below. The restaurant...

The restaurant is located about 500 meters in the air and rotates so you get a 360 degree view of Toronto. On a clear day you can see all the way to Hamilton, so the setting is one of a kind and worth the visit. It would be a top destination if only the food weren't so mundane and overpriced.

Maybe ten years ago I would have called this an essential experience. Now, with the airport-style security, long queues, and fees nearly double what they were ten years ago, I would say if you flew in to Toronto, skip this one; you've already seen what you will see again. We had relatives visit from Australia and they balked at the...

Head to CN tower early as possible to skip the queues. It will be crowded with very long queues within few hours. Since I went early, had enough time at the skypod and the others views with free people around.

OK so the view is what you go here for, the lunch - quality and quantity - is by the way. Our server was ok but a bit random as he disappeared for ages at a time. It is expensive even with the fixed price menu and if you're looking for a fine dining experience then you will be unimpressed....

This is a must see attraction when visiting Niagra Falls /Toronto area. There is many attractions around this including Blue Jays stadium, the Aquarium, and lake OntarioThis is such an icon in the city and the tallest structure in North America-go early because the lines get pretty long.

Avoid attraction unless willing to do sky walk. Ridiculously expensive for basic tour. Visited lounge to get a beverage...fries, two juices and two adult beverages for $60. Take your money elsewhere!!

This is a must visit for anyone visiting Toronto. I went on a Saturday and had to wait a couple hours in line for the elevator, but it was well worth the wait. Excellent views from the tower. Also ate at the Horizons restaurant while on the Observation Deck. I paid the additional fee to go up from the observation...

We started to join the queue when the guide told us if we downloaded the passes on our phone we would say 1/2 hour queuing time at the payment stalls. There is free wifi to do this.we then had to queue to gain entrance. the queue is for 6 lifts which take up to the first landing part. In...
A high end tourist spot for sure. Pick a clear day to visit and you'll feel like you're on top of the world. If you're more inclined to passive views the restaurant offers amazing views.
Great Experience. A must see for all Family members. Great view of the City. Quite expense. The SkyPod really takes you up there.
Once the tallest tower in the world you are guaranteed to get great views. Total experience takes about an hour, which makes it a bit pricey.

CN tower just isn't worth the effort if you're been to either the Empire State Building in New York or the Willis Tower (FKA Sears Tower) in Chicago. Long waits, small capacity elevators, and the dirtiest windows we've ever encountered in an observation deck. Climate control kinda weak for a summer day.

Guys , if you are strolling around downtown Totonto you won't miss CN tower!! It's one of The most astonishing sightseen you can get from any tower in The world because of its 470 meters. Its a classic canadian icon so if you're not canadian by all means go for it and pay 35$ plus tax or more and encourage our tourism economy, fellow canadians dont waste your money its such a huge rip off and waste of time. If you are going to go its open till 21:00 so do yourself a favour go...

This is a great place to visit but is rather expensive and was not too short of $80 for admission but the waiting line was well over an hour so be prepared for a very long wait but once at the top the views are spectacular. The initial stage is fine but go up another level is around $20 but...

We went to CN tower, first for a dinner at the restaurant at the top and then onto the viewing dock. The views from the top are amazing and the attendants in the elevator are great. They give out a lot of information which is very helpful.
Beautiful and scenic view of Toronto and lake OntarioBest to go on a clear dayIt's a bit pricey just for an elevator ride up to the observation areaStill, a great experience.
I was surprised at the cost. Check beforehand that you are happy to pay. I just arrived on site & paid.
Just FYI, the CN tower is not the tallest tower anymore, many have surpassed it, but with the price of admission you would think it touches the moon. Save your money, tall buildings was cool in 1976.
I would recommend going 7:30 pm. That way you can experience the city view during the day and at night.
I was an amazing experienced in the CN Tower. most impressive place in the world. Will definitely bring my family again to see the amazing view right from topic of the tower.

Had a memorable time at the observatory deck of CN tower. Weather was good and view stretched on for miles. Admission a bit on the expensive side though and bringing many friends or family may cost quite a bit.

I am scared of heights and I get vertigo when looking down from high up! The glass observatory level and even the outside viewing platform were all very doable for a scaredy cat like me. However, going up the lift kind of freaked me out as its 3/4 made of glass. In the lift I had to look at the...
Well when you're in TO you must go up the CN tower they say so we did. It was a bit pricey but we had some amazing views.The glass floor is quite a trip.

In July I went with my family to visit and have lunch at the top of the CN Tower. The view is OK, but the lunch and te prices are totally out of any good reasonable for what they offer.The food was "so-so", the service has nothing special, but the price is FIVE STAR!!If you want to see...

We are from England and had a wonderful time in Toronto. Going up The CN tower was a must, and in our enthusiasm we decided to go right up to the top (which for the 4 of us cost substantially more than just going to the main platform). We queued for about 40 minutes to get up to the main...

We ate dinner at the 360, the rotating restaurant in the CN Tower. The food wasn't perfect and was quite overpriced for what it was, but it was totally worth it to be able to sit and relax, enjoying a drink while overlooking Toronto. Can't beat that view! Definitely worth doing it - and it's much more relaxing than fighting...

The city pass is a must to skip the lines, there is no way however to skip the airport style security check you have to go through. The ride up in the elevator is nice and quick with a spectacular view. The view from the top is just a treat. Not many times that you can see a plane take...
I want to recognize the outstanding service I received from Dhara at guest services on Sat. July 16, 2016. She helped out my husband and I and it is very much appreciated.

This was very busy but the queues move fast dont worry. We did the standard tower experience and still had amazing views from the windows and the glass floor, great experience and the staff are very nice- definitley a must do for a Toronto visit!

Everyone visits the CN Tower. It approx $35 to get to the viewing deck. So why not book a table in the restaurant for a fixe price and eat quite a good meal whilst rotating. Oh and you avoid all the queues at the bottom. Well worth it and highly recommended.
The view is great but the prices are crazy!!!! Watch out for the wine list as usual that's where they get you. Otherwise it was nice. Also try to time it for sunset

Had another great visit on a very busy day at the Tower. I have been to the Tower over a dozen times, but always come out wowed! We took family from out of town, they loved the sights too, especially the glass floor. Buy the City Pass if you are planning on doing more than one Toronto event and save....
Just something you have to do when being in Toronto. Definitely go outside to have the real experience. Enjoyed this very much.

Great views of the city. For a busy place it isn't well signposted for which lift is for the glass floor. We were fortunate enough to be here on the 40th Birthday of the CN Tower. The trip to the top was fast and very exciting, the view was magnificent and on a clear day you can to Niagara and it was a clear day. We purchased the pod ticket tour and that included a trip to the highest point of...

We went on a busy summer day, a tip is buy your tickets ahead of time or mobile tickets and you will get to skip the long line to buy tickets. Ate at Horizon Restaurant - great food with a great view.
Awesome place to visit ,especially walking or standing on the glass floorBeautiful views in the eveningsHighly recommended
Great place to visit, but VERY busy!! We visited later in the afternoon and the CN Tower was packed! You must check out the glass floor, it's crazy!!!!

What to say - great view.Some tips: it is good deal with city pass. Money (if you plan even just 3 out of 5 attractions) and time saver (you skip a line in most of them). Although in CN tower I recomend to buy additionally ticket for skypod -the highest level (not included in city pass).Good time to...

A two hour wait was quoted even after having the City Pass Voucher ahead of time. In the end, it turned out to be an hour. The views were very nice. Spent about a half hour up there. My teen boys loved it. The glass floor was nice.
Best bit is the elevator ride up with a glass floor, and it's a great view of the city when you up there. Both day and night is good!

Aside from the view the restaurant was mediocre to say the most. The food was over-priced and the service was poor. The tower has a great view over the lake and the city. I worth a couple of visits. Visit it Day and night in sunshine and in cloudy weather as well. It has a restaurant on the top that is turning around while you sit in the restaurant. I think it takes an hour to a full turn. Awesome. I...

We stopped at the tower during the night time to experience the lighted Toronto skyline. It costed $35 person to ride the packed elevator up to the observation deck. Honestly, it should be more of a $10-15 affair.

Yes it's touristy but going up the CN Tower is a must. And as you are going to do it. Book yourselves into the revolving restaurant. This allows you to bypass all queues, have a great 2 course meal and have amazing views of the city! All for about $20 more than a standard ticket. So worth it!You get...
The CN tower provides great views of Toronto! Check the peak times to get in at the best times, so worth the visit.

It was crowded and touristy but pretty cool none the less. Just something to do to say you did it. I dont think i would get the toronto pass if i did it again though, the other attractions (zoo, aquarium, casa lamo, royal ontario museum) were just a good waste of time if you have nothing better to do. Take more than 30 minutes to the top of the tower. An amazing views of the city. The glass floor was cool but too crowded.
I didn't go in the tower but was able to view it from close. It's very nice and well kept. Had visited it about 30 years ago and wow looks amazing.
different level attractions on the long wait and also inside. staff tryd to be funny, but its a kind of sarcastic humour, I think they were a bit tired.. or n a bad mood.

We booked the Edge Walk around CN Tower which was probably one of the highlights of our trip. Amazing view of the whole city from that height on a clear day and the picture opportunities were awesome. When you got your confidence being able to lean back off the walkway was one of the best experiences and looking down on...
Be sure to stop here during your visit to Toronto. If possible, make reservations to eat at the 360 restaurant, as you do not have to wait in the long lines to get to the observation deck.

CN tower and I got off to a wrong start, and things didn't get better after that. We encountered very long lines inside, which seemed to go on and on. I understand that there are a lot of people who want to do this attraction, but the least the attraction administrators can do is to post average wait times to...

We went at 5 PM with a 15 min wait (although the staff predicted a 45 min wait). Good time to go, not so crowded. On the way down there are two lines for the elevators. Check them both, one can be long while the other is short.

We arrived as the tower opened at 9am to avoid the queues we had seen the previous afternoon. Pleased we did as we were up the top inside 10 mins. Great views as you would expect, and quite a bit of room to move around. Put it on the "to do" list.

Be prepared for lines if you go to the CN Tower any time other than when it opens at 9:00 am. The staff were all friendly and full of information. It was a wonderful way to take in the city and get landmarks.

the most iconic attraction in Toronto and definitively a must!The view was amazing, since I was attending a conference did not have to pay and being at the horizons restaurant twice. Awesome experience such fantastic views of the city not to go on a windy day one will not be allowed access to the outdoor ring of tower which you will understand when you are up there. I didnt dine in the restaurant on top floor as the menu was to over the top for my taste buds .

OK, there is a view! We had dinner here twice. Not for the perfect food, which is good by the way. But this 360 moving restaurant is amazing. Go there when it turns dark and see all the lights go on. A memorie never to forget!

We enjoyed our visit to the CN Tower which allowed us to have a birds eye view of Toronto skyline. My toddler enjoyed the glass floor as well. So glad we checked out this attraction/landmark which made our trip to the city even more memorable.

What an amazing view and the family had a blast. Teens were even more eager after they realized the CN Tower was on Drake's new release. I'm undecided whether or not the experience was worth the wait in line (~1 hour). You don't really see the extent of the line until you're kind of committed. A must see for Toronto and Canada, bit pricey but we got it thru the Toronto Pass.Long queues so be aware of time.The best place is the glass floor area and the external corridors, exposed to fresh wind (which is good for summer).I wouldn't recommend at all the SkyPod, that's the additional floor 100 meters higher.
