What's a visit to Toronto without a visit to the CN Tower? You kind of have to do it. It's expensive, but we're on vacation. I was NOT prepared for the 75 minute wait for the elevators, though. It's a great view. We had considered doing the lunch/observation combo, but decided against it since the menu didn't seem all that...
On a clear day you can enjoy spectacular views of our beautiful city. The location of the ticket office was a bit confusing though.
You must see this. Very nice. Fast elevators and you can see you rise up in the sky. Explore the glass floor. Diner is expensive but nice. Every tourist must try this. You will not be disaapointed.

This is the one must do site in Toronto but it is worth paying extra to come for dinner. You get a great view as the sun goes down and the service and food are excellent. You also get access to the observation deck and the glass floor viewing area before or after your meal. Book online and you skip...

Amazing view, of course. And the glass floor that allows you to look straight down is knee-quaking. We didn't do the additional flight up, so it took just about 10 minutes of looking around before we were ready to head back down. Given the price, to me it's a skippable attraction. Regardless, be sure to have your tickets purchased ahead...

Incredible view. Breathtaking especially the glass floor that is crazy how high up you are. Recommend for a few extra bucks to go an extra 33 floors up to the Skypod. No wonder this place attracts millions. Expect to wait in line but staff move people pretty efficiently and the view is well worth the wait.

I was fortunate to be invited up the top for a private function.The view is good however if it is a humid Hazy day it wouldn't be.The queues were extremely long when we went and only 2 lifts were operating.The viewing windows were very dirty.I was lucky my trip was free as I doubt I would...
This was amazing, could see miles of Toronto. Glass floor was not what I expected though. I would go again in a heartbeat.
I highly recommend getting a City Pass for this and other attractions in the area. The view was awesome, and it wasn't too crowded in April.

This is something you have to do while in Toronto. The general admission is sufficient where you can do the glass floor but the extra that you have to pay for the sky pod is a waste of time. Don't bother. We also ate at the rotating 360 restaurant. Beautiful views but no need to do it again.

Had dinner in tower on our last night in city. It was a little hectic and confusing figuring which line to be in to get to the restaurant. However, once we resolved that issue, we enjoyed a great meal with terrific service and then visited the observation deck at sunset for more wonderful views.

Firstly, we bought our tickets at the information centre at Yonge and Dundas to get a discount on the entry fee. It was a general entry but you could pay an extra $12 at the Tower if you wanted to do the Skypod.The square outside is a bit of a concrete jungle but that didn't put us off. You...

Great views from the cn tower. But clearly in need of.some.modernization..The tower looks very 90ties, a typical us attraction but should be renovated. Broken revolving doors, old fashioned gift shop ...So a bit expensive but again...great great views from one of the talest buildings on the planetB

Going at sunset lets you see the city in some daylight and then as the lights come up, so you get the best of both views. We opted for the extra ride up to the skypod that sits atop the concrete, which is at extra cost. There's also a glass floor on one level that lets you see how high...
The restaurant turns as slow as the earth turns around the moon. Very nice vieuws. Beautiful surroundings and the food and wines are fine.

The view from up here is phenomenal! Elevator is fun and fast and the wait was fairly short. Very well organized with the crowds and because the day was a little hazy we chose not to pay the additional fee to go the next level up. If it's clear one should go! You can stand on the glass floor which...

We visited here on a rest day as we felt it was a must do thing in Toronto. I'm so pleased we did. From the sub 60 seconds in the elevator whizzing up the glass lift shaft, to the glass floor looking down on the ant like people below it was a totally amazing time. We also visited Horizons cafe...

I have been to the CN Tower a few times in the past. I always enjoy the views. I suppose I was lucky that the line to get in was not overly long. Granted the summer holidays for schools had not started and it was early in the day. The one obvious thing that changed since the last time I...

Definitely worth going for the meal. Allowed time to sit and view the city. Will come back for an evening meal soon just to see the evening lights. Observation decks extremely crowded. Didn't get any time to spend there as you were fighting the mass of people . So going for the lunch was definitely the best choice.

great experience especially the glass floor. There are 2 observation levels. The first stop is the large one with restaurant and glass floor features. The second costs extra and goes up again in another lift to a smaller area. I wouldn't pay the extra for the second level at busy times. The queuing for it takes forever and its the...

My wife and I last visited this amazing building 22 years ago. This time we were joined by our Toronto cousins and our 3 teenage sons. The experience was just as wonderful, if not more so. An elevator that takes you up to the top in about a minute helps you realise how high up you are. The views from...
But go first thing in the morning at 9am, or you will be waiting a long time. The facility is nice and the glass floors are cool.

It took us 3 hrs to get to the top of CN tower very long wait kids were very tired. We found it very disorganized and would have helped to have adults supervising operation. The operation is run by teenagers and Maritimes felt very disorganized. You can tell that they were not used to large crowds and this made me...

The CN Tower is a must visit if you are visiting Toronto. The view of the city is quite spectacular, as well as the street view from the glass floor. However, be prepared to wait at least 60-90 minutes in the afternoon (summer) and cost of admission is high.
It is quite expensive but there are amazing views up there and the glass floor was a great extra touch.

The cn tower is great!!! Make sure to call before you go! Microsoft was in town when we wanted to go and they had booked the tower so many angry people! Also making other attractions busier, they do have a restaurant wich is nice. Make sure to bring a light sweater even I summer as it is rather windy!
Great place to see the skyline, on average you pay 35 dollars to go up! Lot of tourists, so it will take you about 30 min to get up. But I would not go there twice.

Best left to absolute tourists of Toronto who are coming from a far-away land to visit the city. From a value standpoint, this is just an average attraction considering the price point and the experience. Considering the fact that Toronto is a world-class city there are far better attractions in the city that present better value options.

We went to the top of the CN tower after a Blue Jays game, so we got to see the beautiful city of Toronto at night! There wasn't a large crowd, the wait at the elevators wasn't to long. When you get to the top it is so cool to look out and see the city all lighted up! There...

I was amazed by the views of Toronto. Grand, sweeping views of the city-scape and water! Just beautiful and a great way to get a feel for how big Toronto is. It's windy up there and you get to stand on a glass floor and look all the way down!
Great view of Toronto. Great for travelers. Great to take your visiting friends and family to see. Doesn't take a long time. Bring a camera make some memories!
Pay the extra few dollars to go up to the upper viewing area, where you can look down at people hanging off the side of the larger disk. Great city and lake views from all around the viewing areas.
A must visit if you travel to Toronto obviously this offers amazing views of the city great for taking photos, I also really enjoyed walking over the glass floor not for the faint hearted!

Ok first I must say that the day was overcast so we knew ahead of time that our view was going to be limited. Yes, the view was great but that was it. On other tower or observation deck attractions there are maps pointing out what you are looking at. Nothing here at the CN tower. Lots of info on...

I thought the CN tower was a must when I visited Toronto. It was an amazing view from the tower and the glassed floor was pretty amazing. But for the price, it wasn't exactly satisfying. The glassed floor was not as big as imagined and the view you could see through the glassed floor was not as pretty. We did...

The waiting a bit too long but the view totally pays for it.We went to the first floor/stop where you could see the city through the sky floor. I could not step on it but my kids did and were amazed but the sensation.I was disappointed with the windows. There was not a single clean spot to take...

Pricey tickets, but still worth doing. We didn't elect to go to the highest level and glad we didn't. The views were amazing and the glass floor was fun to do. Buy tickets online so you save a few dollars.

we bought our tickets one day in advance at our hotel and went early in the morning on a monday. There was no line and it was really fantastic as all other days you see a very long line that discourages you from wanting to visit it.But on monday morning (around 10.00) it was empty and we had a...

Seven of us dined here last week. Dinner was excellent and desserts were lovely. We were not rushed and were able to watch the sun set. We ordered a two course meal, so we did not have to pay the $36 fee for the tower elevator. Good value.
Wow, on a clear day it seems you can see forever, and apparently if you pay the extra $12CAD and gonupanother 32 flights you can see Niagara Falls. The waiting line moves quickly.

We have been up several times now and we never tire of it. We love the time of day when the sun is just beginning to set. That way we get the sun to see things by, then we watch the sunset (so beautiful from up there) then after the sun goes down we get to see all the glorious...

You will need to navigate the tourist crowds and high prices, but you need to go up the tower at least once in your life. Plan to get there early before 10 am. The lineups can get very long with 2.5 hour wait times in afternoon. Kids enjoyed the glass floor.

Line to get to security line, Line to get through security, line to get to the line to wait, then line while waiting, line for the elevator, line to go back down elevator, line in gift shop, etc. You get the point right. The view was awesome, the cafe was good, but the lines......not good.

Family of four, 10 & 8. Kids first time. 10 yr old wouldn't stand on the glass panels but would stand on the enforcements that held the glass together. Beautiful clear day, just after a hard rain! A must when in TO. We purchased a City Pass, great value

If you've not done this, you need to go once as it is a Toronto mainstay attraction. They are good at crowd management, but there are better times to go. A worker told us to come back around 7PM, and that was perfect. Instead of waiting 90 minutes at 3PM, we walked got in at 6:45PM in about 10 minutes!!...

As we walked into this tower,which by the way is the tallest free standing structure in the Western Hemisphere .We were sited right away.The menu included many choice dishes.After we were served we could eat as the restaurant rotated.By the time we returned to the starting point,we just had finished our meal. The food at this towering eatery was excellent.When...
Just like any towers in any cities, there's nothing special to go into the tower and take pictures. Viewing CN tower from Toronto island would be recommended.
When you are visiting Toronto, taking the elevator and going up the CN Tower is simply a MUST do. Even if you are afraid of heights, this is a magnificent tower and a great experience.

I picked up a group of tickets via the CityPass, which included tickets for the CN Tower. As a resident of Toronto I, like most residents I presume, haven't been up in the Tower since we were kids and went on a school trip. But when you have kids or out of town visitors you do a lot of things...

A visit to the CN Tower is a must if you are visiting Toronto the views are spectacular. The queues are quite long around midday so I would recommend going later in the day plus you would have the benefit of seeing it at sunset. We had the city pass which is fantastic but paid extra to go to the...
The 360 degree view is fabulous. Walking out onto the glass floor is a piece of cake until you look down and your stomach drops!!

Go early to avoid the queues. Great 360 degree view of Toronto. Viewing in and out. There's also a glass floor if you dare to walk/stand on it. If you're really daring you can even take a supervised walk outside!

This is something that you really have to do when visiting Toronto. It's pricey and the line ups can be long but you cannot beat the amazing 360 views of Toronto.If you eat at the 360 restaurant (which is pricey) but it also includes the cost of your trip to the top (as long as you purchase their "prix...

I recently spent my birthday walking the Edge at the CN Tower and it was fabulous - would do it again in an heartbeat. The CN Tower is wonderful to visit from top to bottom although I would suggest going really early and not on a weekend - too busy with line ups. Whether you are visiting Toronto or live...

We had an amazing time at the CN Tower for Canada Day! Get there early, it gets crazy busy. Amazing views, heck out the glass floor, and the Sky Pod is awesome, but the line up is loooong if you're later on in the day.
This is built for tourists but take the time to experience the area, the view and if time, dining - it's well considered and worth the view.
Such a Canadian landmarkWell worth the moneyView is out of this worldCan be crazy busy in summerRecommend a fall visit
Great views form up top but the glass floor is amazing and what a weard feeling you get whwn you look down

The glass floor will no doubt be the highlight of the day for all in the family! The kids will love it and spend most of the time there, so be prepared LoL! :) The view from the tower is simply amazing, just be sure to go when the sky is clear as you don't want to be caught with...

Undoubtedly the main attraction in the city. Speedy elevators took us up to the spacious viewing area. The views are nice, but not particularly spectacular. It was good to sit and have a coffee while enjoying the view.

Here is a hint - have lunch in the 360 restaurant. The lunch costs only $20 more than the ride in the elevator and you get to skip the line, sit comfortably and experience the revolving restaurant.Then - you can tour the rest of the tower at your leisure.
I'm afraid of heights but this was worth the trip, we did this tour using our Citypass the line was long but it moved quickly and the views from the top were great..

Fantastic scenery from the viewing points. Standard entrance only takes you to mid platform so pay the extra and go to the top level.Go early, we were there for opening, and pre-buy your tickets as it does get very busyPicture is looking down on the 22 floor apartment block we stayed in, so gives some perspective

The good----awesome view. The bad? Lines could have been better defined to come back down and no idea how you got to sky pod but who cares. I loved it and the glass floor. If they could put a people mover like at aquarium more people could experience the glass floor some people just hog the whole thing but again...
Definitely a place to visit. You will have a nice 360 perspective of Toronto. Pay an extra $12 to go all the way up to the pod to get a glimpse of the view. Definitely not for the fain-hearted.
I recommend to go at 360 restaurant, have a nice meal, and enjoy the CN tower! Once you go for the restaurant you don't pay the fee to go up there. One of my favourite Salmon dish!

2 hours of waiting in line with previously purchased tickets!! Was not impressed. It was expensive. Wished we used the time for walking around that wonderful city! You definitely need to purchase the additional Sky Pod tickets. It had seemed like a clear day but up to the top, the visibility was poor. Not there fault. It was very crowded...

If you visit Toronto you absolutely must visit the CN Tower. The 360degree view of Toronto is spectacular, with the added opportunity to stand on the glass platform and look down 1122ft to street level - toe curling but worth doing.We bought tickets in advance online. These were valid for 3 months from the date of purchase and could...

This place is worth the trip at least once. The views are great. I recommend going later in the day. The lines are shorter. The wait for admission was 30-45 minutes then the wait for the elevator was an hour and half to go up. There is also a wait to get elevators back down. There is an extra charge...

I hate heights but this is something that had to be done. It was a bit complicated to find the way in but ok when we got there. You have to have your photograph taken when you get in which cost us about $30, but not compulsory. We did buy ours as it was a good picture. The view is...
The services at the tower are getting better. The wait times were short, staff polite and courteous. The security screening added to the confidence of carefree enjoyment.Sheldon

We paid the extra to go up to the very top, one of the highest viewing platforms in the world. Great view of all of Toronto but completely enclosed on both viewing levels. Not much guidance on what exactly you were looking at, as you get on similar attraction elsewhere. Glass floor is very freaky and not for anyone scared...

The CN Tower is one of Toronto's famous tourist attractions. The view of the city is spectacular. However like all sightseeing tourist excursions it's extremely overpriced for what you get. I would suggest getting the City Pass because the CN Tower is included. Also you won't have to stand in the ticketing line, which can get very long. I'm afraid...
My husband and I loved the experience of the CN tower. Awe inspiring view of Toronto. Memorable beautiful, felt like we were on top of the world!
Once of the best towers I've ever been up. The views are fantastic, it really is a must see. We stopped off for a beer 1000 feet above Toronto, which really is an experience!

We ate dinner in the CN Tower Revolving restaurant. The food wasn't the best we've ever had but the atmosphere and amazing views can't be beat! Our favorites were the tomato salad and smoked salmon as appetizers; prime rib as the main course; and the chocolate sampler for dessert. After dinner, we headed up to the lookout decks and glass...

This a great opportunity to get a wonderful view of the skyline. I have been in the Sears Tower and the Empire State Building, this is no different. If you enjoyed something similar then definitely experience the ride up the tower.

For all of the hype the CN Tower gives you views but with masses of unruly people. Crowd control is almost non existent. The personnel need additional help and training to help alleviate this problem. Only go if you have nothing else to see or do in Toronto.

Really fast going all the way up to the top. Although scary, once you are up there, the view is phenomenal!!! I think if you look really really hard, you can see the tip of Niagara Falls!!! A bit pricey to climb up but otherwise you should do it at least once in your lifetime.
A must see. Great for families, friends, solo. You don't have to go all the way to the top in order to enjoy the view.

I'm afraid of heights so I was shaking for the first bit up there! But my bf and I stayed for a few hours so we could catch the sunset! We ate at the restaurant on the general admission floor which was actually pretty good and not too pricey. It was a great atmosphere and the workers made sure everyone's...

Though the line wasn't too bad when we visited in the am (1/2 hour or so) I wish I had't waited at all. Once you go up to the main observation level there is another line for those going to the top. The volume of people in the second line was so great that it was almost impossible to walk...

Ik was here for an business diner. The food is good but the view over the city Toronto is amazing! It's expensive too eat but the view makes it worth!! The room is making a spin what takes one hour to go round. During the day you can go outside to do the edgewalk.

You can't go to Toronto and not go to the CN tower. We purchased tickets online and it saved a bit of time, however there was about a 25 minute wait to get on the elevator. The observation deck view is a bit obstructed by the wiring, but the glass floor is pretty neat. We also upgraded to do the...

Great view of the city, island, and lake. Worth a visit, expecially with kids. Avoid long lines at the ticket booth by buying tickets online or buying a City Pass. Go early of late to avoid the rush of visitors going up or down the elevators.

The family and I went to the CN Tower. The history around it is very interesting. The line moves quickly. Watching the glass floor elevators on the way up which is very cool. I think it is a must see if you go to Toronto.

I definitely recommend buying tickets in advance, it saves you some money and saves you from waiting in one more line.NEVER go after a Blue Jays game, we made that mistake and waited 1.5 hours to get into the elevator.It's a great experience, add on the SkyPod that takes you 30 stories higher I believe, more thrilling that...
We went up here on Canada Day. We purchased the City Pass (awesome deal by the way!!). Waited about 30 minutes in line. Glass floor was cool!

We visited the CN tower as part of the Toronto city pass. I would recommend purchasing the city pass so you don't have to stand in the long ticket line. Standing on the glass floor at about 1200 feet in the air was the best part of this tower. We didn't get to go to the outside portion of the...

A tourist must-visit destination and, though not cheap, gives you a fresh view of Toronto and Lake Ontario. During the 58 second elevator ride up you can stand on the normal metal floor or on one of the small glass floor panels giving you a unique view of your ascent. Or wait until you get to the observation deck with...
Family enjoyed the trip to the top and viewing the city from above. We bought a Toronto City Pass, and this was one of the included places.

Great Views all over! You have to go here if you visit Toronto! Worth the wait in line. It is so incredible. I had never been to Toronto before, so I got to really see the entire city and beyond for the tower! Beautiful area!

Really nice place. A bit overpriced for my liking but we purchased the city pass so combined with a visit to the Ripleys aquarium next door it was ok. Very crowded and while the crowd and lines were well controlled on the ground floor it was the opposite on the tower. Super chaotic no structure to the line just people...

Long lines move quickly and before you know it you're on an elevator to the top of the CN Tower. Two different observation decks to view the skyline. Even a glass floor to view down and feel your knees buckle! Was a fun experience.

Front of the line and straight to the elevator if you have a dinner reservation in the 360. The view through the outdoor deck was obliterated by thick wire mesh and 75% of that was too windy to stay very long. The glass floor area was OK, but nothing spectacular. Dinner was great with a fantastic view. Turns 360 degrees...
We bought the extra ticket to the skypod. It was ok. So much space between the glass and the individual that it is hard to take good pictures with it. But it was overall an average experience.

Although I've been there on a Sunday, there where no long queues and the viewing platform was not crowded. Ww couldn't go outside because of the wind, but the views have been spectacular non the less.
We only had one day to spend in Toronto, our first time to this city. I am glad we included the CN Tower in our day.

Hotels can book tickets one day in advance..Must have identification and card used to book to show at desk the day of entry!!!Can book on line tooGo early as it can get very busy even if you have ticketsMust buy ticket that will cost extra 12$ to go to the Pod right up the last observation...

The long lines are well worth it for the view, absolutely stunning. Got a nice Toronto Brewski at the top with the fam, caught a Jays game after and seeing the warm up from the top of CN Tower was surreal. Highly suggest enduring the lines atleast once in your travels.

If you beat the lines... it's a wonderful experience indeed.The views are breathtaking.If you aren't fainthearted, go for the Edge Walk.Our kids did... and couldn't stop talking about it for a couple of hours after that.Must buy the maple cookies from the souvenirs store at the Base.... after you're done

If you love to see the world from above, you have to climb CN Tower. Learn about the construction history and details. Look downward through the glass bottom or hang over the edge. And miss to watch air traffic at Island airport from the 360.

Great views from atop, and the glass floor was a hit with the kids. There's lots of info about the tower, how it was built. We went all the way up to the pod, which was fun and worth the additional $12. We also took some time to have a drink at the bar.It's rather expensive, but something you...

We had dinner in the 360 restaurant and then did a tour of the tower. It is an amazingly busy place which probably accounts for the slightly grimy feel of the place (lots of finger prints, rubbish here and there, worse-for-wear displays, etc.) Still, it is definitely worth the time it takes to get through the line up to go...

Yes, you get a good view of the city. It's an expensive view of the city, but good none the less..I would definitely not pay the extra to go up the 6 feet to the sky deck viewing area.Really? More dosh to see the same view?Well, each to their own.We were in and out in 30...

It didn't seem very busy but the queues for the lifts were crazy. 1 hour for the observation platform then 45 minutes to the pod. Wish we hadn't bothered with the extras. Rather be outside visiting something else. Would struggle to recommend visiting.

We stopped off for a quick visit with the family on a Sunday morning in May. Easy parking in the garage close by with good signage and directions. The line to buy tickets and go up the Tower was already over an hour by the time we arrived, so we skipped it. I would suggest getting tickets in advance and...

While the views are obviously spectacular, I would not recommend paying the extra for the Skypod. The over 1 hour wait to get in the elevator to go to the top was hardly worth the effort or extra cost. Several people left the queue. There is only one elevator which holds approx. 8 adults at a time.The view from...
Lovely view, well worth going. Didn't have dinner there but restaurant looked lovely. Staff friendly, may be worth getting city pass as works out cheaper

I would recommend buying tickets in advance for CN Tower just to cut the wait time down (we didn't do this and should have done!).I really enjoyed our trip up the CN Tower and we paid extra to do the sky pod stop as well. I'm afraid of heights and whilst you wouldn't get me on the glass floor...
We enjoyed the view and ate lunch at the restaurant in the tower. At the top in fifty eight seconds. We used a city pass to enter and did not have to line up
Fabulous lunch at the 360 restaurant and a visit to each and every level open to visitors. We even got to see some young people doing the Edge Walk. Not for me but kudos to them.
Book lunch at the 360 Restaurant and you get free access to the observation deck. It is worth every cent!
We ended up doing the elevator to the first viewing deck (make sure you go outside too) but then part of our group did the pod as well! Both were neat and worth checking out!

OMG! What an experience. 346 meters up in the sky. The elevator ride going up is all worth the scary feeling when you get to the top and see the view. Breath taking! Looking down everything is small as ants! Endless view over Toronto. A must when visiting this amazing town.
We all loved the view from the topThe sheer size of the towerThe brilliant glass floor! The whole experience was just thrilling!

Usual high tower experience but when on holiday you have to do it was a bit expensive though.Liked the glass floor in the lift didn't like the cafe seating blocking the acess to some of the windows especially as they were on the city view side and we have payed for the view.

I visit the tower every time I'm in Toronto, and it's always wonderful. Use available discounts, and consider eating at 360 (which gets you the observation level for no additional charge). There's no time of day or year that this isn't a great experience. Don't miss it.

We took a holiday in Toronto and had an evening at the CN Tower and had a table in the revolving restaurant, it was fantastic, to see aircraft flying in to land below you was just amazing and the views were mind blowing. A friendly atmosphere with good food and service, well worth a visit.

Nice but short. They have a restaurant on top but a bit expensive and needs reservation but worth the shot. make sure to check the menu and prices and reserve to be worth going to the top of the CN tower

This is an iconic landmark in Toronto and is in the core downtown area of Toronto. Everyone who visits Toronto must climb this tower (in an elevator) to get breathtaking views of the Greater Toronto Area. On a very good day, you can even see the Niagara falls from here.Highlight of the tower visit will definitely be the glass...
The views are great, the staff is very informed. A must visit site when in Toronto. Not something you have to do over and over again, but a great experience.

We went up the CN Tower which was good in itself but the best experience of all was having dinner in the restaurant which turned 360 degrees whilst we looked over the whole of Toronto. It was amazing and the food was pretty good too. We didn't find this too expensive as if you are booked In for dinner you...
I really expected more of this tower. Its really cool to see toront from the hight, but if you dont pay more, you cant go to the highest level......
A beautiful experience to do. Fantastic city view. Worth seeing! The trip all the way with the glass elevator is amazing. Scary to look down through the glass floor but worth it.

I pre-booked a City Pass for this attraction so I skipped the never-ending queue for tickets. Also, the City Pass is cheaper (5 tickets for 5 attractions at about £50). There's not much to see apart from the view of Toronto (mainly skyscrapers) but you do see Lake Ontario.
Great views from the top and offers good spots to take pictures. We took city pass to avoid long queues, and it was worth it.

I highly recommend doing the edge walk! It is a super cool way to view Toronto. You are put in a harness, then walk around the outside of the CN tower. At each side you do a pose (lean forward over the edge, lean back, ect.). It is a little expensive, however included with the ticket for the edge walk...

This is a lot like other tower tours but it is a must see if you visit Toronto. We got the city pass which gave us 50% of the $12 to get to the small tower. This glass floor in the elevators we fun and scary but the class flow in the tower was more so. we went after 9...
We went at night which is probably the best time to go because you get to see the city all lit up! Awesome experience especially if you have the Toronto city pass.

Provides a great view of Toronto and gives you plenty of facts about the tower itself. The glass floor is really interesting as is the outside walkway which gives you a real indication of the height you are at. We ate at the restaurant first and then spent sometime walking round. Overall a really fun activity and gives good memories...
Great views from both levels - should have taken a change of underwear after riding up in the glass elevator

Very long queues to buy tickets, and then to get the elevator up. It was very crowded on the observation deck, and there wasn't any information about what you were looking at. Then had to queue to go back down again.

Fantastic views, we went when the tower opened and didn't have to wait long. The staff was friendly and helpful. I thought the souvenirs were to expensive. The elevator ride is very smooth and it is great that it is low speed so you won't get sick going up. I highly recommend you visit the CNN Tower.

I took my cousins visiting form NYC. it was such an amazing experience. TIP, you need to get there a bit early to go through security. We ended up telling a staff member we had reservations and he put us at the front of the line.
Observation floor of the tower is awesome, especially the glass floor area looking 1,500 feet straight down!!!
If you are gonna pay to go up, you might as well pay for the 360 revolving restaurant. You get to see everything while enjoying dinner. Rather than just going up to see the view.

Very interesting. We have spend in line the same time as we were in tower over. This of course is one of the "must be" place for visit in Toronto, but you must be prepared to spend to a lot of time in line.
It was just awesome. The food was absolutely worth the cost ($$$$). The staff, both in the restaurant and elevators were very considerate, helpful, and friendly.
It's an experience if you never done that kind of fun before, though be aware that it's pretty pricey for a family.

Had dinner at the top - that was great! It was a bit difficult to find entrance to this big building so give yourself a lot of time Before your dinner reservation.Nice pics taken there as a souvenir too!

After dining in the restaurant, we found the "glass floor" and walked across it, with weak knees I might add. The best way to do this is to make a reservation at the revolving restaurant, and then your prix fixe dinner price includes the ability to explore the tower. The scenery was gorgeous!

You go for the views. They are excellent and it was a nice trip with the kids. The extra for the skypod was worth it to go higher, less crowded, etc. The glad floors in elevators and on one of the decks were cool and a bit freaky.

The weather was clear so the view was spectacular. The service was first class. Because it is a tourist destination, I was pleasantly surprised that the food was so delicious. It is costly, but worth every penny for a special night out. Definitely make reservations.

It was $135 for a family of 4. It was a long wait to get on the elevator and they crowded us in so much that half of us couldn't see the view on the ride up. We were able to see the blue jays warming up for their game. The roger Center is right below the tower. The glass...
I visited the CN tower back in the early 2000s with my family. We ate at the revolving restaurant at the top and the food was delicious and well presented. The view from the tower is tremendous.

Took my two 8 year olds to the CN tower. It was a 40 minute wait to get through security; a 30 minute wait to get tickets. We were told there was a 75 minute wait to get on the elevator. We waited over 2 hours to get to the elevator. Once at the top there were so many people...

I am a bit nervous when it comes to heights but I thoroughly enjoyed this attraction. We did not get the Toronto pass package deal for tickets because we were only seeing two of the attractions listed. It was cheaper just to pay for those two things. The views were great and the elevator ride up was not bad at...

It was a beautiful day to enjoy the views from the Top of the CN Tower before a Blue Jays game at the Rogers Centre. A fabulous meal from 360 Restaurant was enjoyed by my husband and I, along with our niece and nephew, visiting from out of town!

If you want to do something exciting while visiting Toronto, I recommend CN Tower test your nerves, you can go to the glass floor, sky pod, and the most scary for me the edgeWalk Overview. You will not regret because the view is just spectacular.
I had my holiday party here. It was great. The food was ok, but the view was spectacular. I recommend going to see the sunset over the city.

I took my boyfriend here for his birthday. We had an amazing time the food was delicious and the portions were a good size. Plus the view of the city while we ate added an interesting and romantic touch to the evening. After dinner we went to the observation deck and walked on the glass floor for some tourist time...

Walked over to the tower after dinner on a Tuesday evening and was able to get tickets and go up without any reservations. It is an awesome sight to behold and the view from the top is amazing. There were several school groups there at the time so it was quite busy, but still enough room to completely walk around...

What can you say about CN tower ? You have to do it at least once when in Toronto. The latest addition is the Edge Walk for the thrill seekers. It's a little pricey and the line can get a little crazy during the summer weekends but it's worth the wait.

Views are not bad from the top but it took a great effort and patience to go due to the long lines and crazy number of tourists. 2 hours line to go up, 30min line to go down, spent 5 minutes on top. Similar to disneyland's experience.
You can't visit Toronto and not go to the CN Tower, I had been before, but my fiance had not. Its a cool spot to check out.

It was the best experience ever. This was our first time seeing Toronto city from this hight. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Despite a long line up, it took us less than half an hour to get up there. It worth every penny! Fully recommend.

The view is great, but I find this is a one time thing. I find that I wouldn't go back to Toronto to go to the CN tower. It does make for an amazing landmark if you get lost in the city, as well as the glass floor is a terrifying but great detail.

This is a really fun site to go to. The views are terrific and there is a fairly large section of floor made of glass. Nothing like standing a thousand feet up in the air with nothing between you and the ground but a couple inches of glass. Lots of fun and a must for a trip to Toronto.

Coming to the CN Tower is one of those things you do when visiting Toronto for the first time. While copying the Space Needle in Seattle in almost mostly every way, even to the location of their gift shop, this is still a great place to get a beautiful view of the pretty city of Toronto.We ate in the...
This provides great views of Toronto, yet it is a hassle and long process to get in. It seems to be always crowded.
We did the fixed menu option that included your entry cost.Well worth the money and the views were amazing. Recommend going during sunset.
If you want the best experience, skip the long line and get a reservation at 360. The food is delicious and you get a better view in the revolving restaurant than you do from the observation deck.

To be fair...the view is very nice. But, we just went on Saturday July 2nd 2016 (CA AND US Independence Day weekend!!!) and we waited in line 1.5 Hours to get up there. Then we waited 1.25 Hours to get to the Sky Pod! Then we waited 45 Minutes to get down!!! Yes THREE and a HALF HOURS in line!!!...

Went with my 12 year old son had a great time! We tried to go on a Saturday night as a Blue Jay's game was underway at Roger's Park next door, but there was a 2 hour wait! An attendant told us there is "never" a wait first thing in the morning (9:00am Sunday). So, Sunday morning we purchased same...

Surely deserves a classy no glassy cn towers.it is a one time must see attraction,a landmark literally seen from everywhere in Toronto. Toronto downtown best viewed from here and do take selfies lying down on floor.

You simply cannot visit Toronto without going up on the CN Tower. The views are breathtaking and the glass floor is really cool. I highly recommend purchasing your tickets online to go straight in and bypass ticket lines. I also recommend adding sky pod upgrade and doing it first since the line gets long. I was too chicken to do...
Well worth a visit, the staff are very friendly, we stopped for a drink in the bar. Stunning views over Toronto and for the brave it's worth stepping on the glass floor. A must do if in Toronto

yes there are lines and tickets are not cheap, but this is such a unique experience and the views are amazing. Tip: be tickets online and have them ready as screen shots on your mobile and you can skip one of the 2 lines that other must go through. Based on my visit during the busy weekend after Canada Day...

Excellent 360 degree views of Toronto, Toronto Islands, the Harbourfront and Rogers Centre. We happened to be in the tower while a Toronto Blue Jays were playing, so that was an added bonus. Make sure to take a picture standing on the glass floor.

During a holiday to Toronto we decided to have a meal in the CN Tower. It was a brilliant idea! Although a little pricey (which you expect anyway because of the amazing view and the fact it is a tourist attraction), it was faultless. The food was lovely and the view was spectacular! I had mentioned that it was my...

Maybe because I'm jaded, or maybe because I've lived in Toronto for a few years and have since been to many metropolises with tall skyscrapers. But I just know that I wouldn't enjoy this attraction if it weren't for the company of my little nephew and nieces. They loved the views, the glass floor (actually the least exciting part because...

Took a school group there and it was awesome. We ordered tickets ahead of time and it was fast to get everyone up to the top. We did have some issues making a reservation, but that was due to many groups booking at the same time.

So impressed with the staff at the CN tower! We were visiting with our three boys aged six, nine and thirteen. Our thirteen year old son has autism and travels with a service dog. A staff member saw us standing in line and stated we could go straight to guest services. She also contacted guest services to advise them we...

I was really surprised how nice the view was from the top of the CN tower!! The staff said it would be about an hour wait in line to go up but after we got our tickets and got to the top of the tower the line seem to go rather quickly. They have tv's in one room to hold...

I went to the CN tower for a business training session and the people there were great, the session was amazing, the room and set up was lovelyWe went to lunch after the session up at the restaurant and no matter how old you get- the views can't be beat! Food was great...loved the day!
Amazing views the glass floors are fun elevator speed is wild! This was great for me and my friends may years ago!
great views, staff knowledgeable. a great addition to any plans while down town Toronto. available outsite viewing. don't be afraid of heights :). Rogers Centre next door
I love that place it has the best view of toronto and a really good programation, also has a restaurant where you can have a good time (if you have more money)

No better view in Canada. Look out over the city or the lake and see for miles. Truly breath taking. Next time I will be more daring and do the walk outside. Looking forward to the wind and the thrill of the height.

The Aquarium is close by so afterwards we went up to the tower. Again lots of school groups so be prepared to spend some time waiting for elevators. Unfortunately, the guides at the tower spoke with heavy asian accents and were difficult to understand Also the information desk were not able to provide information on possible restaurants in the area....

Expensive but if your in Toronto you have just got to do it. It is a must see. There is a café on the ground floor which is suitable for snacks but that's about all. Fine dining is up in the revolving restaurant but be prepared to pay steep prices, No pun intended. From the glass ledge we could see...

Overall, gave it 3 stars because of massive crowds, inefficient lines, but decent view. We were a little disappointed with some of the views as the glass had finger print marks and some cloudy windows, the glass bottom floors were so crowded with people laying all over the floor and the views at that level though outside, were obstructed by...

This is one of THE things to do in Toronto. We were lucky and didn't have to queue to get the lift to the top. The view was fabulous, we went up around 8pm so we could enjoy it in the daylight and the dark.The only gripe I did have was the skypod, we were told that it was...

I loved the elevator ride to the observation deck - it takes 58 seconds and is a smooth ride. Once there, you get a great view of Toronto. Down one floor is the glass floor where you can look down to the ground below some 346 metres below - a good photo opportunity with your own camera or the 'in...

Go to this restaurant! It's BEAUTIFUL. Make reservations and dress up too. It's expensive...like really is. We paid 95$ each. If you want drinks more. However it's special and a once in a life time adventure so you should go. You can also visit the glass floor and observation deck free if you go to the revolving restaurant. The food...

Every city has one attraction that seems to define the city. The CN Tower seems to be that attraction in Toronto. You get a great view of the city. The Tower handled the crowd well, but I was disappointed that the windows were dirty. I wanted to take pictures, but the dirty Windows spoiled the pictures. The second attraction was...

What can I say, great view of the city, fun experience. Was all that I expected it to be. Had tried to make reservations on line for this attraction prior to visit to the city, but were unable to do so. However, was able to easily obtain tickets on site.
Loved touring this architectural beauty. My husband and I did everything in the tower except the skywalk as I am too scared lolHighly recommend making this ur #1 stop if ur in Toronto.
View was amazing!!! A bit crowded but it was worth the wait loved the restaurant view of the city in 360. Glass floor was amazing.
Went to the CN Tower and have to say it was well worth the queuing! The view is amazing and well worth the photo opportunity. Some really good restaurants nearby for evening meal too!

My husband & teenage kids did the edge walk on the CN tower. They said it was an amazing experience. My mom & I went up the tower and could watch my family on the edge walk. The glass floor was a little scary but definitely neat to walk on. We lucked out as there were no lines when we...
I love the CN tower because it makes me feel like "This is Toronto!". It's worth going up the tower to see the views of the entire city.

You can't visit Toronto and not do this. The lines moved quickly and the waiting time was minimal. It was fairly expensive (but then Canada is). Once inside its clean and well signposted. You are shuffled through the photo screen. This seems non optional but you don't have to buy it. Then you make your way up, and it really...
My 2nd visit to the CN Tower and 360 restaurant, fantastic views within walking distance of the hotel. Food was ok but small portions but would still recommend it and the views are amazing.

Stood in line for 15 minutes to go through security. Then stood in line for 15 minutes more to pay $35 dollars (for an additional $12.95). We entered the building to stand in another line. After another 15 minute wait, we were put in front of a green screen ("Everybody gets their picture taken. You don't have to buy it")....

Very busy and long lines during the weekend. Weekdays appear to be much better. Expect it to take 3 to 4 hours on the weekend. The view is what you'd expect but it is not a cheap date for a family of 4. Once in a lifetime sort of thing

The glass lift that brings you up is the first highlight on your CN Tower experience. The glass bottom on 346 meters height the second one. The ticket price is heavy but it's worth it. Particularly recommandable is to watch the sunset from above. It's absolutely breathtaking and romantic.

I lived a few minutes away from the CN tower for 2 years. I never thought of going up there until the day we decided to have our family gathering at the restaurant, and gosh it was so special! The view, the food and everything

Good place to visit in Toronto. Tickets cost around CAD 25, and you have the best views over the city. There is the option to do the walk outside (with harnesses and guide),but couldn't muster the courage to do this. Maybe another time.

I was glad to go to the viewing area with our group of six but boy it is not cheap. We went on the day of its 40th anniversary so it was neat. But the visibility wasn't great.Try to go on a clear day and definitely get the City Pass to save some money if you plan on three...

This was the highlight of my recent tour of Canada. We took the glass elevator up to the top and enjoyed lunch while we revolved around Toronto. This had to be one of the most spectacular views ever! Toronto is a beautiful city, and being that high up, you get the view of the city building and the gorgeous harbor....

It is probably better not to leave Toronto unless you have taken the opportunity to visit this tower, which dominates all downtown Toronto. We visited on a Wednesday mid afternoon in June, so before the schools were out. The waiting time was minimal and the staff very skilled in managing what queues there were. Having visited towers in other cities we wanted to do this tour to get a view of the city and were not disappointed. We visited just before lunch and went straight to the skypod. The queuing was slow moving due to the small size of the skypod but I would definitely recommend going at lunch time etc as when we...
after tour in Toronto Island then i decided to visit CN Tower at last because i was running out of time.i would definitely recommend you to visit this place.

A place you have to visit when in Toronto. It was very expensive for what it is. But one to tick off the tourist list. Usual photo opportunities. Elevators fast and frequent. Lucky not to be too busy when we were there so not much of a queue. Good views although on the first level the is lots of wire...

94.92 CAD for 2 to go to the highest level, and the view and experience was worth every cent. We could not go outside because it was too windy but even from inside I thought that this was a great experience and looking down on Billy Bishop Airport was just amazing.
40 years old this September and a fantastic place, well organised security and minimal queuing, views are terrific and has a revolving restaurant and a sky walk for those brave enough, great place!

It is the second tallest building of the world. You can have a fantastic View of Torinto. The best time to go is at sun set. The is a 360 degree rot story restaurant in the tower. It is necessary reservation.

I have been to the CN Tower several times and it's fun for the first time. But there is no reason to revisit it. The view from the top is certainly beautiful and you can book a reservation to dine at the restaurant.
Had a lovely day at the CN Tower, staff were very friendly, and it is a great place to visit and the great views you get at the viewing levels.
Spectacular view! Really worth while to do this activity while in the Toronto area.We where lucky enough to see the day time view and the night.

After dropping my bags in my room at Le Germain Maple leaf Garden Hotel I walked a few blocks to the CN Tower, the tallest tower in the western hemisphere at 1,136 feet. Visited by 1.5 million people annually. I did walk around the observation deck but the glass floor looking straight down was too much for me. Great views...
Lunch in the revolving restaurant is an unmissable experience. Food was excellent and reasonably,priced and with views to die for,

My daughter and I visited at 7pm. The lines were not long so we quickly boarded an elevator to the top. The views are incredible and we saw a Blue Jays game from a different perspective! We stopped for desert at Horizons - delicious. The glass bottom elevator was a little disappointing (too crowded to see anything shoes) but we...
Great view of the city at night! Would have loved to arrive earlier than 930 so we could have had a meal too. Restaurant was already closed by then.
Best place in Toronto in my opinion- love bringing my family here from up north. For lunch or dinner it is great.

The tower offered a nice view of the city, but you have to pay extra to go up to different levels of the tower. The outside elevator is nice and you can see out as you ascend to the top. The glass view floor is nice but doesn't compare to the Willis Tower in Chicago.

After a long wait (mid-Week), the ride up was nice as we were the last ones on, thus got the best view. The view was OK given most cities are similar.Choose not to do the restaurant with prices (even with US exchange quite good) and as locals said better food at better prices can be had on the lakefront...

We went on a Monday before noon and were able to avoid any long lines. Lines were much longer when we left. Go on a clear day when you can see FOREVER. We don't usually like spending $30+ for something like this but I think you just have to go when in Toronto.

The view is breathtaking, just remember your coins so you can use the giant binoculars to see even farther. The glass floor is only in one space so if you are afraid of heights don't let that deter you. We had time to kill so we had a drink in the cafe, they were delicious and were served in CN...
CN Tower celebrates 40 yrs. as we celebrate 40 yrs of marriage. The exhilarating changes to Toronto since 1976 are astounding! Lots more people, but the herd moves along nicely.

A quick and easy ride to the top of the tower with minimal queues and slick process of getting you safely up and down. Not sure the extra cost to the higher observation deck would have been worth it (I didn't buy it) would the view have been better? I doubt it
Not only it's the iconic tower of Toronto but it's also a great place to see the GTA.View from the CN Tower is really great and one can't miss it.The glass floor is really nice too...
It was a great experience to go atop the tower - iv visited alot of these high buildings and what the cn lacks is an "update" a clean and. Spruce it looks rathet disheveled
Great experience and ankle to "Walk the ridge" highest outside walking platform, awesome views, and great revolving restaurant (need to book)

A special treat with a super atmosphere for the patrons of this restaurant/landmark. A moving experience for sure! If you don't get on with heights then take the inner tables as the outer ones will trigger your fear for sure. Staff are really good,friendly and attentive. For drinks,wine is a bit expensive but a noir irony California at $73 is...

We didn't queue long for tickets and the lift takes you quickly up to the first level. Fantastic views of the city, Toronto Island and the city airport, plus you can look directly down into the Rogers Centre, home of the Blue-jays. For a little more you can go up another level, but to be honest the view is not...

You have to go up the CN Tower if you're in Toronto. Views of the city are excellent. We ate in the revolving restaurant. The meal was fairly average but no real complaints. Service was friendly and efficient. Would recommend.

You will have the best perspective of the city.The views are beautiful and entretaining.They have glass flors that make the experience more fun.You can have lunch up there while enjoying being on top of the city.Cool activity.

This is a fantastic experience overall, and worth the price of approx $150 for a 90 minute adventure. You spend about 30 mins or so outside, with the rest of the time spent on orientation to the experience, safety protocols and preparation, including a breathalizer! While outdoors, you talk a 'stroll' on the edge of the CN tower, while leaning...

This is a tower, with a great view out over Toronto.There are 2 viewing areas: indoor and outdoor. The indoor area faces the city, and to see the other lake-side requires one to either dine at the cafe, or view it from the open viewing deck.Unfortunately, the open deck is covered with mesh for safety reasons. Don't expect...

I had been to Toronto many times, but never went to the CN Tower until I went back on a family vacation. It gave an amazing view of the city. It's about a minute right up. There's a viewing area with a glass floor that was pretty neat. The lines were a little long coming down, but it wasn't too...

Visited today as part of our trip to Toronto. Had booked the edge walk 30 days prior. The most amazing experience. 1168 feet above ground connected to a harness. We got to lean over the edge and walk around the whole tower.

Our visits to the CN Tower on the 21st June 2016 to have dinner was a big disappointment. The food quality was way below the price they charged. The service was mediocre. The one saving grace was the spectacular view. We paid CAD $90/ head.Do your math before deciding to dine there.
A must when in Toronto.it gives you a great view of the city.the queue going up is very efficient well manned..the staffs are very helpful too.always there ready to help
I really can't believe l enjoyed an experience involving heights, but l enjoyed every single minute of it. The views are spectacular. Pricy but worth it.

Its not cheap and the food is not the best you can find in Toronto - but none of that matters for the experience of the revolving restaurant (a little weird at first....) and that view.......... We were fortunate enough to eat at the 360 restaurant which also allowed us access to the lookout deck - the views were breathtaking.. this is truly a world landmark!
Fantastic views over the city and right over the lakes, apparently you can see Niagra on a good day. Glass floor isn't for those with a fear of heights....

We almost didn't do this and tried to talk ourself out of it...too expensive, too high up!! I am so glad we DID it!!The elevator ride is quick and the view is incredible on a clear day!! Do not pass this up!!
The dinner experience was great. The weather was nice that evening so the view was amazing. It was worth the trip.

A return visit for us after 8 or 9 years. The foyer part of the attraction is neater and less cluttered than previously and the ticketing was straight forward and efficient. We went fairly early in the morning,so the queues were short and the staff at the lifts got us up to the viewing area as soon as they could....

I have been up towers in Auckland, Las Vegas and Sydney and now I can add Toronto to that list!We went up the CN tower as part of the Toronto Pass so didn't have to line up. It's a bit of a maze to get in and out to the elevators but the journey up the top is quite...
A bit expensive to go up the tower... but views are exceptional. Located in the center of the town of Toronto.
Great fast lift up to the 360 restaurant. Fantastic views as we move round while seated. Efficient and very pleasant staff. Great food. A fantastic experience ... What's not to like about it ?

This is definitely one not to miss in Toronto. We went up the tower for lunch and dined in the revolving 360 restaurant which takes 72 minutes to revolve fully so during lunch you get to see the whole of Toronto. It is extremely good value, the meal was delicious with desserts to die for. You are then able to...

I used to ride to the top monthly as a kid, when it was only a couple dollars my dad would take me all the time. Now that I have to make my own money.... Obviously times have changed, crowds have swelled and so has the cost. Despite, the dusk view is amazing and a must see at least once....

This is the major attraction in Toronto, other than driving 50 miles over to The Canadian side of Niagara Falls. From 1976-2920, the tower was the tallest free-standing structure in the world. Per varying sources, it remains the 2nd to 6th tallest tower in the world. Regardless of its rank, it is well work a trip to the observation level,...
Beautiful views of the city from this height. We had the Toronto CityPASS which got us to the main floors (and to the Skypod for half price). Worth the visit, had a nice time.
Have visited the CN Tower on many occasions and are always amazed at the views from the top. Ti stand or lay on the glass floor is a must . The journey in the outside elevators is awesome
Amazing but it's overpriced for what it is. The view was nice tho… now I know why Drake love Toronto :)If probably go back anyway because I just love Toronto and the CN tower

We booked in advance to dine in the CN Tower on a Saturday night and I'm glad we did, think we picked the night with the best sunset!! Arrival and trip to the restaurant all very well organised, restaurant full the whole time we were there but the staff have got things down to a fine art and the service...

Is cheaper to buy the City Pass instead the single ticket of the CN Tower. You can go to 5 attractions with $83, each attraction is around $30.Very high view, the high is 147m, awesome shots.

My little son asked to go to the CN Tower last weekend. It was the 40th Anniversary. It took over 30 minutes in line and cost $96 for one adult, two children. It should just try. Great view-Great Experience. A good experience you will not forget and you get a fantastic view overthe continent. :-)
It was a good experience all round, including the elevator up to the tower. The food was delicious and we left feeling very full
This is a very expensive experience! But the experience you will walk away with is memorable. Being your camera!
I've been here multiple times and can say this is a must-see place. However I wouldn't go there second time around if you spend some time here.

We were up the CN Tower for the 3rd time. Different years but equally enjoyable. They have the glass floor that you can see down to the ground. It's pretty cool. They have a new thing that you can walk outside on a tethered line it's an extra fee. I do t k ow much about it cause that's not...
Waw!! Great view from upthere. The glass elevator and glass floor is amazing. Your knees will shake when standing on the glass floor.Good to visit with the aquarium .

The CN Tower is a must see when in Toronto. The view is spectacular. The ride up the elevator to the top is about 15 seconds. We went early in the day to avoid the crowds, But I hear the view is fabulous in the evening. The glass provides a great view of this fabulous structure and the surrounding city....

You have to see this though I found myself closing my eyes on the elevator trip Down. Strangely the trip up didn't affect me! Would advise checking the weather and getting there early. We didn't have to wait at all.Very well organised, smiley staff and an unusually good gift shop.

We went up to the restaurant and spent some time walking around the tower, all the way up. The glass floor is definitely impressive specially when you see the kids jump on it with a +350 meters empty hole underneath. On a beautiful day, you see the US. Great view, great organization, great experience!

We ate in the 360 Restaurant which slowly rotates. (The toilets stay still so remember your table number if you go!) The beef was the best and most generous portion I have eaten and the whole experience was great. After dinner we visited the other decks and were glad we had visited the restaurant where the views unimpeded and very...

We had booked our tickets for both observation levels via internet in advance because we were afraid of a long queue in the afternoon of Victoria Day. So we did not have to wait too long and already at the lower (=large) observation deck the view was amazing. The weather was excellent what made the impression even better. It was...

In short, it's dining but not of the fine variety. Food seems hit and miss on quality and the tables weren't luxuriously laid out but the servers were friendly and helpful and funny. Worth the experience but maybe not worth the price.Ah, the famous CN tower. We reserved dinner and felt like VIPs passing the many tourists queuing for...

Despite going to Toronto for work often, I had never visited the CN Tower. So, a friend and I decided to go on a Saturday. We decided to do the Prix Fixe lunch, which includes access to the observation levels, and then bought a skypod pass.The personnel gave us different answers about what we were supposed to do -...

We went on the extended tour up into the pod and loved it all!! Worth the extra time and money! Very clear day, amazing view. Been in Wills Tower , Empire State and several others. Quickest up and in by far. Not many employees up in the tower to direct you, but overall a lot of fun!!!

We had dinner here so really didn't have to buy tickets. While eating, we had the opportunity to see the full 360 degree view given the restaurant rotates about once every 80 minutes or so. If you do go up, make sure to go to the observation level (below the restaurant) and stand on the "glass floor" so you can...

I'd rank this with the empire state building or space needle - something that you should check out while in town, but with reasonable expectations. The view is great, but lines can be bad and the viewing areas busy. To avoid these, buy your tickets online and visit earlier in the day.

I went right smack dab in the afternoon on a Saturday and expected the crowds, but other than that it was a great experience. I really enjoyed the outdoor viewing where you could walk all the way around and enjoy the sights without too many people. Tightly packed elevator ride to the top and a bit of a wait if...
Just do it. On a clear day, and bringa camera or cell phone. Wondrous 360 visit. There is a glass floor, but it is optional. All ages will be breathless. Eat somewhere else tho.

We went by 6 pm, it is almost summer so there was no wait time to get in, it was not crowded so we were able to take very good pictures. There are a couple of restaurants, one a more fine dinning, reservations required and buffet. The other one is more casual, with small plates and delicious appetizers, suitable for...

Saturday morning we lined up for tickets,took approx 20 min to get to the ticket booth and purchase tickets, $35 to get to the main viewing floor and an extra $12 to travel to the pod another 13 stories higher + tax = $53 each...Not Cheap.We then lined up for 15 to 20 minutes to get into the lift...

Amazing tower, we enjoyed this experience. We had pictures there too. After the tour; we had dinner at the 360 restaurant and it is another unique experience. everything is Super amazing. I do highly recommend it. Don't forget to buy some souvenirs from the gifts shop in the tower
Definitely a must see Toronto icon, for more than 30 years the tallest free standing structure in the world. Great tours great history, a little pricey but worth it!
