We queued for quite a while but once we were up there it was worth it! We had lunch in one of the restaurants and the food was pretty good

My first time here, was amazed to see the skyline, learn about the reasons why it exists and the construction techniques that where used. As most thinks go, overpriced, but a once in a lifetime for sure thing.
Had supper at the CN Tower the revolving restaurant it was a beautiful day and the scenery was Beautiful. After supper we went to the glass for it was a Great experience

For really amazing views across Toronto and Lake Ontario this is worth the entry fee. The cafe/eatery (no need to book this one) is good and the staff are very friendly and efficient. If it is very windy the outside viewing gallery is very brisk. Also, go and stand on the glass floor. It'll make you really dizzy.
Incredible view all over the surrounding! The stadium ! The town airport! The skyscrapers! Worth queuing !!'
Went up CN tower on a bright, sunny day and the views are fantastic. It is a must if you visit Toronto.
I thought it was an average observation attraction similiar to other cities. The only kind of cool thing was the small glass floor where people sat on or laid down on to take selfies.
It is a pretty building and located right at the center of the town. There are nice gardens nearby and a lot to do around it, however it is just a tower.

I would really recommend getting a Toronto City Pass prior to visiting anything in Toronto.The CN Tower had a great view over whole city. I really enjoyed the glass elevator and parts of the glass floor where you could look down.A must see in Toronto!!!

The quintessential symbol of Toronto, the CN Tower offers a magnificent view of the city and a great counter-phobic experience for those leery of heights! The open-air observatory was a refreshing experience on a warm June day, and the chance to walk on a glass floor so high above the ground is not to be missed. No worries--signs will advise...

We visit in a clear sky morning and we saw al city sorrounds. (Including a part of a baseball game)Part of the balcoons were close but the view was wonderful.Great place to take city pictures, specially in the glass floor area.Needed couple of hours
Excelent view from Toronto,it is a must since it is the icon of the city. I would recommend to visit during summer since it is all clear an windy

I wish to relate to you what a fantastic dining experience that my finance and I had at your wonderful restaurant. From the moment we arrived we were greeted with a friendliness, and an efficiency, which gave an ambiance of peace and security. In no time, we were ushered to our table, and seated, where we were gifted to witness...
Was fun being up there but thats it, a 1 time experience is enough. For those who wants to visit its next to the Aquarium so eassily to combine.

Cn Tower is located in a very good location to have a great view of Toronto but the Edgewalk experience is a must.I got the tickets as a surprise for my family, specially for my children and they enjoyed so much that wanted to do it again.You feel the adrenaline pump in hard as soon as you get...

If you plan to visit the CN Tower at the observation level you may be disappointed...quite a lot of the view can be blocked by cordoned off private function areas.However the view from the revolving Restaurant is fantastic especially if you visit at a time that takes in sunset.The food in the Restaurant is good but it is expensive.For the...

Although I am terrified of heights I was persuaded to go up the CN tower. It was a quick ride to the top (had my eyes closed all the way) and it was so worth it. The views over Lake Ontario & Toronto were spectacular. I chickened out of going up the top level but was told that I missed...

After recently returning from Disney World, and then bringing guests to the CN Tower, it is my belief that you really don't get all that much for the money. I understand that it's a tourist attraction, but $8 for a bottle of water? Smudge marks all over the windows from people jamming their greasy heads against the glass? And then...

The CN tower is a beautiful landmark in Toronto.Depending on the time of the year, lines can be very big to get to the top, but it is still worth the visit.Kids loved the glass floor, but I wouldn't come close to it ;)

Toronto is a beautiful city and the CN Tower is the perfect way to see it. I have done it several times mid to late afternoon and loved it every time. The wait can be long on the weekends. One time I waited three hours, but your ticket is good for the day so you can try coming back later...

Salut:I've visited Toronto many times and in two occasions I was on top of the CN tower. It's something you have to do, at least once in your life time. The view is amazing from up there. Toronto is such a beautiful city. And the tower is like the crown of this unique place.If you pass by Toronto....
Excellent view from height equivalent to approximately 114 floors. One can see the tall buildings, air strip, railway siding, lake front etc. glass floor walk is an additional attraction.

I highly recommend to book a dinner at CN tower, because you can enjoy the view and eat for almost the same price of the ticket (except if you're using the city pass), but you need to do this 2/3 months in advance.

Nice way to see the vast area of Toronto. Be ready with your camera before you get on to the elevator up. It is a quick ride up and the glass in the floor makes for a neat video if you are ready for it.

The thing about the CN Tower is that it gives one a good idea of what its like to be working or living in some of the tallest high rise buildings in the world. It does sway a bit in the wind. Nice to visit but I wouldnt want to work there.
If you've never been it's a must do. But consider eating at the restaurant since you then don't pay only to go to top. And you also get to use the private elevators skipping the long lines.

This was a worthwhile way to spend an hour or so on a business trip. I was lucky to time my visit to CN just before sunset so I got to see the last shimmers of daylight off Lake Ontario as well the Toronto skyline illuminated. My visit was on a weeknight early in January so it wasn't too crowded....

Great way to see Toronto ..views spectacular ... $35 for standard admission but if you want to go up to the next spacepod its an extra $12...had lunch at the restaurant Hudsons ..excellent food ...overall good visit ..loved tje glass floor .but not as good as the Skydeck in Chicago

We hit it on a perfectly clear day - great views. I really enjoyed the views from the Pod - it's a little extra to pay, but I think it's a better experience.It is really touristy and it was a little irritating that they rope you into a line to have your picture taken before getting on the elevators....
Met up with worldwide family for a fabulous Meal in the revolving restaurant. Great way to spend time together and enjoy the clear views. Then we went down to the glass floor and viewing platforms.
This a nice view, but it is very expensive and honestly is just another tall building. Don't go unless it is a clear day.
This iconic landmark in the heart of Canada's most recognizable city has an unparalleled view of the surrounding downtown and Lake Ontario. This is a must-see for locals and tourists alike.

This Tower literally towers over the city, unlike in New York were even the skyscape looks crowded this is a lonely tower. The best feature is the glass floor you can stand on it and see the baseball stadium, Ripleys Aquarium from it.

I'm not afraid of heights but the elevator ride up freaked me out just a bit. My advice? Don't look down. Very touristy but totally worth it. The weather wasn't so great the day of our visit. So the tower walk was cancelled. Glass floor was a big hit w the teenagers!

Highest point in Toronto to catch the view. Pay the extra to go up to the Pod for an even higher view. Not for those with a fear of heights! Two restaurants in case you're hungry after the elevator ride.
My husband and I went to the top. It was easy to enter and all the staff was friendly and knowledgeable. Would Highly recommend it. Views can not be beat!

We were extremely impressed with the CN Tower. We have been on the Skytree in Tokyo and thought this wouldn't be as impressive, but it truly was a great experience. The views of Toronto were beautiful. We ate lunch in the regular restaurant up top, the food was great and the prices very good. (they also have a very, very...

Our travelling group visited the 360 restaurant. The lift swept up very quickly while we were able to look through the glass floor if you were not too worried about heights. Fabulous views with great visibility. The service and food all good. A well worth experience

Came here around 730 and waited until it got dark to see the night view as well. On the floor that you get off the elevator it's a 360 view of the city so you can take some nice photos. Then on the floor below it's open air with a fine mesh around so you can feel the breeze and...

had an amazing time at the CN tower, the views were just fantastic. Loved the glass floor and we had photos taken on it as it was quite difficult to get good ones with our own camera. I am afraid of heights but this was just amazing. From the glass elevator to the glass floor, wow. We also watched on...

We had city passes, which covered the visit, my understanding is that it's quite expensive to get in..It was a pretty quite day and we didn't have more than a 10 min wait to get up. The views are spectacular... the glass floor area was very popular, I hate heights, so didn't look but the rest if my family...

This was great for the teenagers and adults. The view was breathtaking and we got lots of pictures. I was disappointed staff didn't know who the architect was, the history or any of the unique stories of the CN tower. They didn't know if it was still part of the railroad. Ned the architect is a fascinating story , people...

We've been to the Willis Tower in Chicago, so I can't help but compare the two. We used the City Pass, and saved money. The regular price is too expensive. We went on a Wednesday afternoon and the wait wasn't too long. It seemed to go quickly. The ride up was quick and they have a tiny glass floor to...
Very organized lines. Not too long to wait. Lovely views from top. Loved the glass floor. Overpriced photos. Souvineer shop at the end of the tour.

I have shocking vertigo and love to challenge my feeble self by going up ridiculously tall structures! We were fortunate in so far as there was no queue to get to the elevators and we went straight up - woosh! It was good and quick with not much time to worry that I was standing on one of the glass...

We got there, and since we had booked our tickets online, we asked a very friendly young lady (whom was standing outside), where we should go. We were advised that we did not need to stand in the MASSIVE line up :) so we went up, got our tickets and got to jump the line up (hour wait for the...

Totally worth going to see and do.Worth the money but would advise getting the city pass as you get to skip the main queue and go straight into the tower.Gift shop is as a gift shop would be.Would recommend this attractions
Well worth a visit, scary, but i wouldn't have come home without visiting this wonderful place, the view from the top is breathtaking.
The views of the city were impressive however inside it was far too busy and people were sat on the glass floor which stopped other people from viewing it properly! It is also quite pricey.

It took a few minutes to get through the lines at security at the entrance to the tower both make the reservation and on our way to eat, but this is to be expected in this day and age.Thee are two options for the set menu: 2 courses or 3 courses, but you do not have to make that...

Went to the Tower while in Toronto. Would recommend buying City Pass to save money on Admission and there is a 1/2 off coupon in the book for the extra 33 floor Skybot ride above the Rest. and Observation Deck which takes you 147 stories up. Went early in the day to avoid crowds. Nice views on a beautiful day....

Main Toronto landmark promises a lot and delivers even more.The view from the top is amazing, the (first in the world) glass floor lets you test your faith in engineering.A must see!Try to get into the elevator with a glass window in the floor.

While this is a notable attraction, it does not meet the standards of the Eiffel Tower or Empire State Building... The tickets were pretty pricey and the line was a very long wait, however that's expected. The glass floor didn't really show much and when we went the lighting made it hard to even take a picture. If you want...

I was there right at opening on a day in June and literally was on the first elevator up with 6 other people. I immediately went straight up to the SkyPod. For the first 15 minutes, I was the ONLY person in the SkyPod area which was really cool to be by myself to experience the view on my own....

Love this place, walk around to enjoy the views, try the skywalk if you dare and dont forget your camera, we were lucky to choose a day where there was match in the stadium - too high to see anything but if you bring your binoculars might be worth a try - just saying

Went for dinner with some friends. Obviously the view is outstanding. The food is very good & the service also very good. For people not living in Canada, beware of the price on the menu, for a steak it may say C$40, add on another 15% gov tax plus add another 15% tipping. Makes it a bloody expensive steak.
We went up this week, was quick to get in we hardly queued at all. Bought the city pass, that helps skip the queues. Glass floor freaked me out. View was cool

Expensive, £40 for about 15 minutes for 2. this really is all about the view, full stop. Found the timing of the visit at 6pm avoided most crowds, skipped the photo booth and into the lifts.Initial views do have the wow factor, if you can find half a metre of space to look outside , away from the selfie...

It was a special family day for mother. It was the first time for me to eat this high up in a rotating restaurant. The view was out of thisworld and it was hard to eat with the view of Toronto. The meal was exceptional and our waiter had served at the tower for many years. It was all...

We went to the restaurant, which had great views of course but without the crowds. because we had a reservation, we didn't wait in any lines and got front row seats. Access to the other floors were complimentary (again with no lines, unless for an elevator to go down).

Was lucky with the weather,beautiful cloudless day so had a great view over Lake Ontario and the city. With the added bonus of the roof open on the Rogers centre,home of the blue jays. Good value,well worth a visit!

Get the fast track ticket in order to avoid the queue, otherwise it may be a long wait. Depending on the weather and time of the day it can be more than an hour, Anyway once up, you can start enjoying the views of Toronto. It is not only beautiful to watch sky-scrapers on one side and peaceful Toronto Island...

I didnt really know what to expect from the CN Tower but had heard of it. So... off I went. Wow! What spectacular views! A must-do in Toronto! Took me a while to get over the walking over the glass floor but I made it. And I even got to go up to the 447m tall viewing point. CN Tower...
Pros. I enjoyed the view.Cons. The 360 restaurant was overpriced. The pictures was also too expensive.

Busy place and need to queue about 10 min to go up the tower $35 plus tax. Elevator takes 58seconds and the view is excellent though it was a bit foggy in the distance. The glass floor was of interest and some people were a bit hesitant in stepping on to it and looking to the street below.

There was nothing much to do on CN tower other than experiencing the glass floor on the top. It was long waiting(2 Hrs) to get into the lift which was because of crowd and due to heavy crowd not much on the top as you need to keep on waiting for your turn to walk on glass floor or to...
If your visiting Toronto then this should be on the cards. There is a revolving restaurant which offers fine dining experience on the top of the tower but prior reservation is must.
Looking down into the Blue Jay stadium! So very high above the entire skyline. We paid the extra $$$ to go to the very top. So fun. If you do go up the CN tower, you must see the glass floor.
The CN was a very awesome experience and I'm very happy to have been able to visit. We paid the extra for the sky pod which I would do again.
Nowhere else will you get such a remarkable view - we were lucky to have a cloudless evening. Try the glass floor too to complete the experience.....

We only went to the first platform, and that was enough. Had a lunch at the restaurant, staff not overly friendly, and was pricey for really not great food. They had the outdoor platform closed, so it was 35.00 a person to ride a elevator and look out a window. Not really worth it.

Visited the CN Tower while in Toronto. What spectacular views you get from the top. We didn't have to queue. Just got our ticket and went straight up. Paid extra to do the Skypod. Well worth it. Get better views and photos from there. We were up there when the Blue Jays were playing. Amazing looking down on the field.
Another part of our anniversary escape, as a Canadian I can finally say I've been up the tower!!!!! Spectacular!
If you are going to do this I would suggest paying the bit extra and doing the Sky Pod which is much higher and has unrestricted views. The lower level is covered in safety mesh.Quite expensive

Went to the top of the CN Tower and what an experience, you wizz up the tower in a glass fronted lift so fast you can't feel it apart from ear popping, once at top the views are amazing. The restaurant turns very slowly you won't feel it but you can sit and enjoy a meal and within that hour...

I am not into heights but this is one of those once in a life time adventures. During the Blue Jays game we notice little red dots moving around the perimeter of the Tower and found out that those were people who were harnessed and walking around on the outside. REALLY! That is not for the faint of heart! Even...

Awesome ! Get a City Pass on the day i went it was packed and people queing to get tickets having to pick up my citypass at guest services i bypassed all of that so its worth spending $34 which gets you into four attractions in the City
Nice view, not TOO expensive & a Toronto "better go there" tourist sites to visit. Expect what you get in other big city communications towers but with a view of Toronto.

Yes, It is one of the few things that Toronto has to offer but frankly it is just a high skyscraper with a view of the entire city.Its priced at $30 odd and the line is insane. It took us 1 hour to get to the elevators that take you up to the viewing point.I have been to...

You go up, have a view, you go higher, you see more, you come down. Well, that's basically all there is to it. As I was there on a Sunday, lines may have been longer, but maybe not. Expect waiting time to go up, more waiting time if you want to visit the SkyPod, waiting time coming down one level,...

We did the inner and out decks. Great views but some signage of what direction you're looking at would be helpful. The extra sky pod doesn't offer extra views really and the claustrophobic should not do it.

It's actually was quite more interesting when I have expected. I liked the elevator ride all the way to the top. Since the doors of elevator see through try to get the last one into elevator so you will get a great view once you are elevated to the top. I didn't any reservation in the restaurant, but there is...
Absolutely amazing experience. Totally recommend this to anyone considering a daredevil add-on to your Toronto adventures.

Glad we paid the extra $20.00 to have lunch in the revolving tower as I know I would have been disappointed if I only just got to see the views from the public areas. Having a fantastic lunch at your leisure while enjoying the 365 degree views that take 72 mins. to rotate was a definate must.

First time in the area so the group I was with decided to check out the tower. The view was gorgeous, and it was definitely worth it for a first time experience. Thing is that I cant see myself paying to go another time in the near future.

Admission cost was approximately $80 CAD for two adults. I felt this was overpriced for the experience of the attraction.Also, before you enter the queue for the elevators to ascend, there is a place for the photography staff to take your picture with the only objective of selling you a photo when your visit is over. I politely told...
Great view of Toronto from an amazing high rise perch. 360 degree Ariel view of the lake and all the surroundings. Did not try revolving restaurant but it looked interesting

As we were staying in Cambridge for our holiday, me, my partner and my cousin decided to book reservations for the restaurant and the observation deck. The revolving restaurant was great and the views were stunning! Food was bit pricey but it was well prepared and tasteful. Customer service was excellent too! We made our way up to the observation...

Our family visited Toronto for a business convention. We knew we'd regret not taking in the aerial view of Toronto and Lake Erie that the CN Tower offers. This is one of the tallest towers in the world. The vast expanse of Lake Erie was magnificent, as was peering down into the Rogers Centre, home of the Toronto Blue Jays....

We've lived in Toronto for 15+ years, and finally came with the kids. Good experience and lots to see. We only went to the observation deck which was included in our lunch package. We realized there is a much cheaper alternative if you don't mind not having the revolving restaurant experience. Great way to see all of Toronto. It was...
This is a good way to see the city of Toronto (bird's eye view). It's also a good way to get over your fear of heights. :-)

We traveled all around Toronto & the CN Tower served as a landmark to maintain our bearings. We did not go up the tower, as our days were filled with many activities.I attached a number of photos - see the close-up photos showing people hanging off the edge!!

I've been wanting to check out the CN tower my whole life, but every time I was in Toronto, the line up was wayyy too long so we skipped the tower. This time, we decided to go early in the morning to beat the crowd.So we got there and there were only a dozen people ahead of us but...
Great way to see other things you want to see! Buy tickets in advance to save time in ticket lines. Fairly quick elevator lines. The glass floor at the top is a definite picture stop!

I can't believe this tower has stand there for decades! Still very fun to visit and enjoy. Pay the extra for the upper deck, it is worth it. Anyway, how often are you gonna go up there anyway ;) !Go early if you can to avoid the crowd.
big tower,glass floor....scary. sky view restaurant, mahoosive cake. pictures in the lobby whats not to like?
This is one of the few definite sights of down-town Toronto but it is expensive, and these days there are plenty of other high buildings in the world.

We went first thing in the morning, this meant it was not busy. At this time in the morning there is no point in buying tickets online in advance as the queues to collect these tickets were longer than the queue to buy tickets!
We purchased the City Pass. It was a great way to see the CN tower. Very exciting and a beautiful view of the city and water.

This is a must do when in Toronto. The views from the top are amazing, you know you're high up when you're looking down on the birds flying around! The glass floor is rather disconcerting at first but pretty spectacular once you get used to the idea.

We didn't go up this but it was so cool. We saw people tethered to the top looking over having the time of their lives. The view must be spectacular. Very thrilling. Have heard it was pricey but well worth nit. This tower is really neat and at night it lights up in different colors.
Beautiful view of Toronto and has a glass floor to look down from on the elevator level. The open view is nice too.

Great views. Recommend going 815-830pm to get sunset views during June. $ 45+/ per person for probably a few shots overpriced. The skypod ( higher level views) is a rip off for another $ 13.5- reason I say is there isn't clear glass views, they are broken into small frames, I'd save the money. Even the main level viewing us...

Not a fan of heights, but the views were worth it! Felt safe and secure the whole time. They do crowd the elevators alittle bit to keep the lines moving, but other than that it was a wonderful experience! Recommend not going during a school day when field trips are going on - it makes it super crowded and kids...

What beautiful views from the top of the CN Tower.If i remember correctly it took 1min & 30 secs to reach the top & had to pop my ears.Lay on the glass floor for photo,s & got the most amazing views over Toronto

Great Views of the city, the glass floor is great as well! The only downer is the outside part has heavy grills so cannot take decent outdoor photos.The skypod experience is OK, not convinced it's worth the extra 12 bucks.
Well worth the cost, best view in t.o. Apps and drinks priced not bad. Would do it again.glass floor at the top was a surprise.

The views of Toronto city and Ontario Lake are amazing from the CN Tower; it is awesome. The glass floor is pretty cool where you feel like floating in the air but not for those scared of heights.It is wonderful to see the aeroplanes landing and taking off from the city airport.The restaurant and gift shop are expensive...

Although the entrance fee is expensive the breathtaking views from the top make it all worth it. Even the lift ride up is exhilarating , with a glass floor it is unnerving looking down. The glass floor on the top is not for the faint hearted as even I was a little reluctant! This attractive is not to be missed...
This is one place that I would recommend to anyone who isn't too afraid of heights (I was terrified). Overall, beautiful scenery of Toronto. A must-visit to anyone visiting Toronto.
The view from the top is quite spectacular, but the admissions fee is also quite high, but for those who want to get to see all of Toronto all at once will not regret it.

The three couples in our group decided to check out the CN Tower mostly because it seemed like a required Toronto icon we had to check out...and because it was a short walk from our hotel. But it turned out that this was one of the most interesting stops in our three days in Toronto. We loved being able to...

Although it was a bit foggy on our visit, it was still a wonderful place to visit, even just to say I've been on one of the tallest structures in the world!!! There are wonderful views of the city. It was well worth the time and money to visit this marvel.

When we arrived in Toronto, one of the first things we saw was the CN Tower. Everywhere we went in the City we saw it towering over everything, and couldn't wait to go check it out. We decided to eat at the 360 restaurant (which I will review seperately), admission to the tower is included if you order an entree...
My son is 17 and has autism, and was thrilled to go on the Edgewalk, the staff were helpful and fun, and he loved it!

The views are great and the line/wait to the top was short. Well not the top but the main viewing area. We had a city pass and did not know that were was another level above where we were! I was a bit upset that we missed the other level. There should be a way to add that once you...
Really enjoyed riding the elevator up, what amazing views. This is a must do while in Toronto. They also have a ride that hangs you off the side of the tower.

The tower itself, glass floor and views especially, are amazing and worth seeing.The problem is with the restaurants and gift shop, which are extremely expensive and very touristy. If you're a foodie, head to a nicer place nearby, if you just want to eat with a view then totally go ahead. Personally, I thought it was a shame to...
The view from the top of the tower is FANTASTIC you will take a lot of pictures from there. The glass floor is the best one.
Scared of heights? why don't you try the glass floor. It's awesome! the view that you have on Toronto and on the Ontario Lake is just great. I suggest that you go at sunset or at night.

We dined at the 360 restaurant that included complementary access to the viewing deck and glass floor. Very expensive but a delicious meal with attentive staff. We chose a 3 course meal and we made a complete circle view of Toronto during our meal. Afterwards the viewing deck was a bit disappointing as it was so windy which made dinner...
if your travelling to Toronto be sure to do the CN tower edge walk its a fantastic experience and a big achievement on the I Did that list

This was my third visit on the CN Tower but every time it I visit the views of the city are amazing. The glass floor is pretty cool where you feel like your floating in the air. This is a must visit for anyone visiting Toronto.

Reasonably pricy ($35+tax for adult, kids under 4 free) but a must see when in Toronto. The glass floor elevator made for a thrilling ride to the top which was very quick. The glass floor at the top was as expected (also exciting) and we walked around outside where it was caged in and windy. We got there before the...

The last time I was at the CN Tower was some 27 years ago, obviously not a lot has changed in this time but it was still a good experience.Security is tight as is to be expected in this day and age and after going through the airport type security you can go ahead and purchase your ticket. Tickets...
A must do when in Toronto. Gives a great idea of the vastness of the area and how green Canada, Toronto in particular, is.

Views were spectacular. Unfortunately, the broken elevator and negative discourse between fellow employees really put us off.I also think the ticketing process when using City Passes could be explained better. We waited in lines we never had to wait in.Again... The view was spectacular but I don't think I'd go back.
Beautiful view from the top floor.Hardly any queue during week days. Awesome experience loved the glass floor to look down to the bottom very thrilling.
Yeah it's a nice view from up there but $40 per person is pretty expensive I think. It's a tower. You go up, you look around, you leave.
Visited on a lovely sunny day and enjoyed every minute of it. The glass floor is very impressive. The sky pod is well worth doing as well.A really good experience

As popular as a tourist trap should be. The best thing it can offer is the revolving restaurant. The view is spectacular, food is over priced. Service is so-so, they treat you better if you order a big meal than a fix dinner, I tried both and notice the difference.

Was at the tower with my wife and children (10 and 12) and was an unbelievable experience for all of us. The views they give you and access to "the edge" is really, really good. Very happy to have gone.

This was a very fun activity and we took the extra capsule experience. The extra $12 (Canadian) per person was worth it. You go quite a bit higher up the tower and get away from some of the crowding.There is a see-through floor on one level which is very disconcerting even if you aren't afraid of heights! So fun...
This was my 2nd visit to the Tower,this time at night,what a view.Great time with the family,,all enjoyed it .A must see on your visit to Tor.

A little expensive, but the view stretches for miles! The elevator gets quite crowded. The windows were surprisingly pretty clean, so pictures turn out quite well. A must when visiting Toronto, just to simply say that you've done it!
Any visitor to Toronto must go to the CN Tower and Niagara Falls. The CN tower has absolutely amazing views in clear days you can see the USA and the whole city / GTA area.... Fabulous
we went for lunch- excellent and only a few dollars more than just paying for the view. Be sure to stand on the glass floor!
Though expensive for a high rise view it's still very much worth it. The views are incredible and walking on the glass floors bring a good adrenaline rush. Attempt to do it on a sunny day

While obviously touristy, i think this is a must for anyone visiting Toronto. It is an amazing view of the area, and allows you to get your bearings for the city and where you are. They have a glass floor to lay on and take photos. They had have a place to have a drink or food as well if...

My daughter strongly urged me to take the tour when she found out I was going to be in Toronto for a conference. The history of the tower is an interesting one. I couldn't make myself walk on the glass floor, but I did enjoy walking all the way around the main viewing area where the wind was quite strong,...

1st went up in 1989 and went back on Sat for a 2nd visit! Was defo as good if not better than the 1st time! Fantastic views and glass floor is awesome if your brave enough to stand on it? Blue Jays were playing in Skydome below and they looked like ants! Weather was brilliant and you can see for...
Really enjoyed! You get to see everything high up! Make sure you go to the top! We ate at the restraint it was ok burger was dry. We were happy we went.

Visit as it opens to avoid the queues. Leave time for security checks, bag searches etc too. On a good weather day, fantastic views and photo opportunities, good laugh standing on glass floor. They'll try to sting you for their photo of you

The Edge Walk is just an unbelievable thrill, to be outside at that height (and hanging over the edge) is amazing and the city views breathtaking.The staff were very friendly and helpful and made us feel very comfortable, the equipment is first rate.We also ate in the 360 restaurant which provided great views, excellent food and wine and...

We went last week and took 5 kids between us. It was very expensive to visit considering there is not much to do once you are up there besides look at the view and go on the glass floor if you are brave. My kids loved it (except the 4 year old. She was scared).Amazing views on a clear...

It has been well over a year since last visiting the CN Tower. I think it is a great place to take family from out of town to experience Toronto at night, you see all the lights and Porter Airport and you enjoy this attraction. We were at the opening years ago and enjoyed the view then, and still enjoy....

The experience was amazing but I definitely suggest you going online and purchasing the Toronto City Pass. Paying a little extra and you get to do multiple things. But the CN Tower was amazing! A little pricey if you're just buying tickets but well worth it in my opinion. The glass floor and the glass floor elevators was terrifying for...
A trip to Toronto, especially a first time, isn't complete without a trip up the tower. The view is great. It is a little pricey, but I would say it's worth it, just to get a perspective of the city.

Typical viewing attraction, but what makes this one more unique is the glass blocks where you can look down to the ground. Expensive to visit but on par with other similar atrractions in other cities. I recommend doiing the City Pass, this is included.
The Glass floor is very unnerving but worth the visit for the views. For the complete experience would recommend the full package to get the extra height.

While it is an incredible view, there was a clean window to be found where I could take a decent picture. The best view to the lake is restricted to the restaurant. I would suggest just eating in the restaurant, get the free ride up, your meal is expensive but it all balances out if you eat somewhere else near...

The view is breathtaking and everyone should experience it at least once. I took my family there once a year during the CNE airshow for extra fun. The restaurant rotates 360 degrees in just over an hour so the view keeps changing. The food varies in quality, usually quite good, but be prepared for a shock when you get the...
The wait was a little long, and it was bit costly, but it was worth it to see the whole city. Fantastic view!
Great views over looking city and baseball fieldIf you dare walk on the glass floorFamily had a blast

If you are afraid of heights, than this definitely is not the site-seeing place for you. The elevator going up has glass paneled doors so you are aware of the distance going up or going down. I was so frightened when l got up there, because it was soooooo high, that l pretty much stuck myself to the wall, outside...
Although it is a major tourist attraction it is still a unique way to see the city of Toronto. The glass floor is really cool as well!

if you are just visiting TO for a little bit CN tower is definitely a must! one possible tip - book a meal at the rotating restaurant on top, and you get access to all the levels for the sightseeing. it is about a bit more expensive price-wise, but you get a nice meal and get to go to all...

First and foremost - be prepared to go through security, xray machine,and metal detectors upon arrival. Once you get through the pleasantry, you will be ushered through a series of stops including to a host stand downstairs where you will get your "pass" to go up the elevator. Once up the elevator, you arrive at a fantastic view of the...
A must see while in Toronto but I think it's overrated and costly. Glad that I went but definitely would've survived without it.

I was there last year with my wife. I booked for dinner at 7:30 Friday night. We got complementary tickets due to diner package . We reached at 5:30 just because we want to see sunset . We had great time at the tower. Enough space for lots of people . We walk whole tower and got to see whole...

We would recommend the 360 restaurant first and the views and visit are included. However, if you just want to go up you should definitely do it. It is iconic Toronto and gives you great views and a lot of fun to do. The teens and preteen really liked it. Take the family up

Wasn't sure whether to go up the tower, long queue and around £20 each, but decided to give it a go. Worthe every penny the views are absolutely stunning, and the glass floor view straight down is amazing. Walking around the exposed walkway, the wind when you come round the corner was so strong, a great experience.

We visited early on Saturday 28th May and were really pleased to see there wasn't a queue in site. Straight up to the top and we could get a good look straight away.The views are unbeatable, but we slightly felt there wasn't much to do. Perhaps some sort of boards on all of the decks would have been useful...

I first visited the CN Tower and 1985. I find that the love of the commercialism still about the same. We arrived on a Sunday, before 10 o'clock and the wait was very minimal. I found the staff to be extremely welcoming. Aside from the lame tourist treasures available during a shopping spree, tourist souvenir shop, The only place to...

A fun thing to mark off your bucket list! The tower did have great views of the city, but that was about it. Worth doing while in Toronto, but not a completely unique experience as many cities has something similar.
Just do it, that's all there is to say. Thrill of a lifetime made easy by the supportive and professional staff. By far one of Toronto's must do thrills
excellent views very busy but very clean everywhere, good gift shop,did not dine but food looked good

This is a must see if you have never seen it before but I do recommend going all the way up and dancing and jumping on the glass floor that looks down a least 1000 feet. The elevator ride feels like a roller coaster it takes up 1200 feet or so in less than a minute (remember to jump up...

My 2nd time up the CN Tower. Great views (obviously) and the glass floor is a must-do. It's also fun walking in the wind on the outside deck. Bored staff member in elevator was telling us how "repetitive" it is when asked about working there. It cost $35 each for regular admission with an extra fee to go higher up...

Obviously amazing views. We had dinner in the 360 rotating dining room. The movement is only noticeable by the fact the washroom is always somewhere else. Really quite neat to see planes flying below you while you eat a great meal.

I visited the CN Tower with my Ma in Law in May while on a 2 day visit to Toronto. Whilst it is a little expensive for tickets we enjoyed the chance to see Toronto from a height...The high speed elevator whizzed us up to the lookout deck in about a minute.....pretty quick considering how tall the tower is....!!...

If you haven't visited the CN Tower you owe it to yourself to go. It is an awe inspiring architectural wonder. The views are spectacular. The building itself is amazing. We found the staff very pleasant and ready to answer any questions. I would definitely go back again.

I went to the CN Tower as part of a larger group of friends who were visiting Toronto. It was a week-day, in the evening. It takes a while until you start enjoying the visit (there was a long line) but once you are in the elevator, the fun is on!I would recommend going around the time it is...
Maybe the weather didn't allow us to see far out because it was foggy but this is a great place to visit. You can go outside to feel the strong winds or have a nice dinner inside.

We enjoyed this attraction and restaurant. The views from the revolving room were amazing. It did get a little warm as we twirled by the sun, but it only lasted about 25 minutes. The outside elevators are not for the faint of heart, with all the glass. The food was OK, not spectacular but good. With a relaxing dinner and...

This is a world class attraction. Well run with friendly helpful staff. If you have a meal booked then give yourself additional time as added security measures meant longer admission queues and waiting times.

This is truly a one of a kind location. The glass floors up top and the skywalk are very unique. I have been there multiple times with friends and family and would go again. This, in my opinion, is the number one spot to visit in Toronto. Once you’re up top, you have an expansive view of the city and...

The views of the city were amazing from the Sky Pod! We were so lucky coz it was a clear day! Though the Sky pod was not as spacious it wasn't packed with visitors so we could enjoy the full views. We loved the experience! XXThere were no toilet facilities up in the Sky Pod so I had to...

Its a pretty amazing view from up there so if it's your first visit to Toronto it's a great way to orientate yourself and get a great perspective of the city. You probably want to time your visit to when the queues aren't too long. We also ate at the revolving restaurant which was stunning.

The glass floor is a must see. Try to walk out on the floor and look down. Wow, that alone is enough to get your heart pumping. Great views of the city and a great way to start a visit to Toronto. Going on an off day, early in the day seems best. No waits in lines. Can't imagine having...
having wanted to visit for 30 years i finally got the chance this weekend, although pricey they trip is worth it. I do have a fear of heights, but the view made up for any nervousness. must see

This is an iconic symbol of Toronto. I first went up it as a young boy. It still amazes me. There is no way however that you would get me to do the crazy thing they do at the top where people get hooked up in harnesses and lean out over the edge! Some people love it though! To each...

I visited the Tower with my parents and sister (all adults), it was a good experience in general, but not as great as I expected to be. I made reservations to the restaurant which also said it included the ticket to the tower, I have to say that the view from the restaurant is amazing but not so amazing from...

A complimentary visit to the tower is included if you have two courses from the menu at 360 - the restaurant at the top of the tower.I later discovered, kind of obvious I suppose, that the food is made on ground level and sent to the restaurant.The food and service were ok, perhaps a little better than average....

This is another one of those attractions you must do at least once in your life! This was my second time here and it's certainly improved from 5 years ago on the interior. We got to watch a group doing the sky walk. Very neat!
CN tower is awesome! The view that we have from the top is amazing. From Lake Ontario to the Financial district, the view is breathetaking.
Great way to see Toronto! Amazing views of the city! Paid extra for the top viewing platform... Great views but can get busy!Overall awesome visit
A must see if you are going to Toronto. Spectacular views of the City. Try the restaurant for fast, courteous service and excellent meals.
Have been on many towers, but love this the most. Terrific glass floor and the sightsare amazing. Its a must to see, when you go to Toronto

Loved it. What a fun trip to the most beautiful scenic view. The trip on the elevator was so thrilling... Walking on the glass floor so many feet over the city was scary and beautiful. Felt safe at all times. There are other high thrill experiences offered, like getting harnessed and dangling from the sides... Too much for my heart....

I love big cities and their high lookout observation decks, and the CN Tower is an excellent one. A few queues to get through security, but then quickly in the elevator and off to the top. Fantastic views and good facilities at the top await.
great tourist spot ... kind of expensive for what you're getting though. Food is good, but over priced and small portions.
I loved the cn tower it is an absolute must. I am petrified of heights so panicked in the elevator but once we got up the views were outstanding! Deffinately a must see!

We were in Toronto for only a short stay and the CN Tower was on our short list of things to see. The lady in the ticket booth warned us the wait would be "over an hour" but we had come so far to see it we thought we could deal with an hour wait... Well, technically, she didn't lie...

We did enjoy our visit to CN tower and we were really surprised that there were no queues to enter (compared to other similar places).The view is magnificent and I would suggest to go right before sunset when city starts to light up.

It's a must. You must do it when you visit Toronto as its iconic. It's one of those things you tick off the list.HOWEVER...It's not great value for money. Having been up the burj Khalifa, the Shard, the Empire State Building and the Freedom tower; this is the least value for money.The interior could do with an...

I visited as a part of a big group (about 100 people). We also had a dinner in the revolving restaurant. Here is my experience:View: The view is obstructed with net on the main view deck. I however like the glass floor where you can stand and see the bottom of the CN tower. You can pay additional $20...

As soon as you come out of union square ,we took the train to Toronto from NiagaraYou wonder which way to turn ,but not for long as you look upwards you get your first glimpse of the tower and you walk towards itIt was an amazing sight to be in Toronto and see the tower loom ahead of...

We were able to enter the tower as part of the admission for dining at the 360 Restaurant which is in the Tower. After dinner, staff directed us to the viewing area.They have this glass floor and it's quite cool and scary looking. You realize you're standing on a floor made of glass and you can see the Blue...
Amazing views from the viewing platform, helpful and friendly staff, reasonable price. We have visited the Shard this year and this is much less pretentious.

I wasn't expecting much, and the experience was almost less than my expectations. The view of toronto is very nice and the glass walk on top is cool but i don't really see the added value of this attraction.

Not the least expensive thing to do in Toronto, but well worth the money. I went with a friend who lives there and according to her the lines weren't as long as usual. It was fun to go to the uppermost level and look out 360? at the city. The regular admission will take you up 114 stories, but you'll...
This is a must see in Toronto. Great city view and the souvenirs are great too. You definitely will want to buy the CityPass.

Did the sky walk. No wind and was really warm outside at the top. Great experience if you don't mind the 1300 feet drop :-) Came in and had a lovely late lunch in the revolving restaurant. Back up to the highest viewing platform in the tower. More photos and then down the elevator to ground level. Great experience.

We visited the CN tower and we went up to the sky pod. The views were stunning. It was a windy day and you could feel movement. My husband and I are both scared of heights so our time in the sky pod was short. There is no time limit put on your visit. We purchase toronto city pass which...
The CN Tower definitely provides great 360 views of Toronto.My friend and I had lunch at the restaurant and it was very tasty and the staff were all very pleasant!
Waited for 30 minutes to get tickets but once you get up there, the view is incredible. The gift shop is a bit overpriced but thats the only bad comment I have for this experience

Maybe cause we just got back from Paris, but the view was ok, not spectacular. $100 not worth it other than to say you did it. Went to the very top which wasn't much better than the regular level. Glass floor interesting but not overly so. Nice clear night but the lights inside the viewing area, whilew admittedly very cool...

Had an excellent time travelling as a family with 2 teenage boys. Had a great time on the glass floor - standing, sitting, taking pics. The lower observation deck was very crowded so it is worth the extra money to go to the top. We spent a lot of time up here and were able to take our time to...

Our grown-up children treated us to a meal in the 360 restaurant for our 60th birthdays. It was a wonderful occasion: good food and wine and incredible views, which kept changing. Charge for ascent is included if you buy at least 2 courses on fixed price menu. Assume that is the minimum spend as there was also a la carte...
My husband loved this experience, I'm afraid of heights but did it anyway. We went all the way to the top. It's something I would absolutely do again, fear and all.

Long queues, expensive ticket and when you get up there the windows are smudged and its impossible to get a clear photo of Toronto. The glass floor is a complete rip-off - 3 small squares of semi-opaque glass and a view of nothing below. Avoid this tourist trap

We arrived at about 9.15. We waited a few minutes to buy tickets and then straight up. It was worth paying the extra to go all the way to the top especially on a clear sunny day. Free wifi at the top so you can post your live selfies! Glass floor is good fun, I eventually managed to stand on...

Just another observation tower honestly, so just enjoy the view and scenery. Ate at their 360 restaurant (will do a separate review). You can also walk out of the tower and tour the circumference (understand if weather permits), unlike some other towers.
What can I say? It's one of the engineering wonders of the world! The view is stunning, the elevator ride thrilling, and the glass floor gives you the sensation of being on top of the world!
Well worth the price of admission. We had an amazingly clear day and could see all the way to the US. Pay the extra $15 and go up in the pod or whatever they call it. Well worth the price.
I can't add anything of value, but I will say that this is a must see Toronto attraction. Go to the CN Tower Wikipedia page before taking a visit.

Dined in the 360 restaurant at the top of the CN tower, celebrating our 30th Wedding Anniversary. Is was absolutely amazing, the food was fantastic ......a bit expensive but well worth it especially for the stunning views which kept changing as the restaurant revolved.
This is a great place to take in Toronto as whole. Be prepared to spend some time going through security but the amazing views are worth it.

I arrived at 9 in the Morning looking forward to visit the Tower and also do the outside walk attraction . The price for all wad 195 cad dollar wich i was willing to pay. However the First outside Tour was at 11h00 . So i thought i visit the tower First the. Do the outside attraction. I was told...
We had a great time going up the tower. The glass floor at the top is breathtaking. Great view of the city! We also visited the Rogers Center since it is right next door. Very convenient!

Viewing from the Glass floor at around 340 meters was a first time and unique experience for us took lots of selfies based on the trip advisor went early as Rush was minimal

I actually went with a family member so not solo. We never went up to the Skypod for an extra $12 dollars, just to one level below it which was $35 + tax, total entry was $39.Good views, the interior observation area the good enough views and glass floor gave a good sense of height. In the exterior area...

We have been coming to Toronto for years, but this was our first trip up the CN tower.The 360 degree views are great, the process of buying tickets and getting up to the first observation deck went quickly.HOWEVER, we had purchased (for an additional $12 CAD per person) Skypod access..It was another line - fine, but there...

We spent an evening dining in the restaurant and it was a fantastic experience. We were lucky to be there on a clear evening and the views were really breathtaking.Watching the sun go down and the lights of Toronto come up was something we will remember for a very long time. The food in the Restaurant was very good...

There's no best way to admire the grandeur of Toronto than from the top of its most iconic landmark. The CN Tower is impressive from its base to the top. And being in the Skypod, which offers the most impressive panoramic views of this amazing city, is an awe experience. Visiting the CN Tower is a MUST of Toronto.As...
Had a lovely seafood meal on a glorious sunny eve here. Food was plentiful and good choices. The views are amazing. Well worth the visit
You can really see some amazing things and for quiet a distance from this tower. The glass floor is also a very cool experience.

The view up top is great, although it takes a little time to get used to the moving restaurant (it spins very slowly). The food is good (pricey though) and the service very good. It's definitely a special occasion restaurant , but well worth the unique experience .
I went with a big group of people, great experience to see the view over Toronto and dine at the 360 restaurant.

Like previous reviews if you are in Toronto, this is a must see and definitely a must do. Take the extra trip up and actually really go all the way to the top. It is pretty good and I actually could see Niagara on the lake and such and I have awful eyesight. Make sure you go on a day...

Lovely. A stunning view of a beautiful city. The lines looked intimidating, but were managed efficiently and smoothly by wonderful staff members. The elevator ride is to die for and our guide, Lucy, was incredibly charming and informative both times. The glass floor is freaky but worth it! We certainly hope to make a return trip.
Excellent view of the city. Went up on a clear, sunny day and could see for miles. Would definitely recommend this when in Toronto.

If u haven't been, then going to the top of the tower is a must for a visit to Toronto. I hate heights and was scared bejesus but glad I mustered up the nerve. It's quite a thrill. We made reservations to the CN tower for lunch and were greeted by friendly staff when we arrived.Our belongings were searched when we arrived and then we were ushered, by friendly staff, to the proper place for dining.We were seated at a window in the revolving tower and our waiter immediately began to take care of us.He...

CN Tower is a major attraction in Toronto, so its best to visit early in the day if possible. We went on Sunday morning (opens at 10am) and there were already quite a few people queueing when we got there. At the Tower, you will get the opportunity for you and your party to be photo shopped into a photo...
Going to Toronto without a stop to the Tower is unimaginable! Thanks for the memories, our kids loved it!

We visited and feel that the price is very high compared with what you get, there is no clean view since due to security the windows are protected, so it is better to get discount tickets on your hotel concierge, the visit is OK since it is the highest according to the statistics, but there are other visits to do...
Amazing view from the top!It is very expensive to get there so don't rush and take the time to see everything to make the visit worth it.
Panoramic views of one of the greatest cities in the world. The glass floor and Skywalk are unique features.
Unbelievable views,staff is very welcoming everything was fantastic.Number one spot to visit in Toronto
Wonderful restaurant and view! Must see if visiting Toronto. The glass floor and revolving restaurant were definitely the highlights.

Photo ops were difficult due to the screening and I think the $35 ticket was a little pricey for the experience. Elevators were fast and the staff was nice. The glass floor is definitely a cool experience.

I don't have a good head for heights so I really wasn't sure about going up the tower, but so glad I did. Even managed to walk over the glass floor although it was hard to look down. Amazing views from the top.

This structure is not new but stands well against other newer and taller structure. It looks quite handsome at all angles with many towering blocks newly erected by its side in recent years.The security check before entering was a hassle but staff was quite friendly. Despite the huge crowd on that day, toilet was very clean. This showed how...

I bought the tickets online using my phone. There was no need to pick a time, just the day. We decided to go up on Victoria's day at sunset so that we could watch the fireworks from the bay. We thought it would be packed because of this. however we were pleasantly surprised to see that it wasn't.We didn't...

Like most other people have stated - when in Toronto it would be silly not to go up the CN Tower. We visited on a Monday when the sun was out and the skies were clear. This was end of May, so it was not very busy. We booked e-tickets on a mobile online, and from entering the building to...

We took a day trip to Toronto from Niagara Falls Canada and the first thing we went to was the CN tower. We got there about 11 am and there was a small line to get the tickets to ride up. I was a bit taken back because it cost 200 for a family of 6.The elevator to the top...

A visit up the CN tower is a must do when in Toronto especially on a clear day.Seniors tickets are $25 and well worth it for the fantastic 360 degree views of Toronto.Go early as always busy and long queue's at the entrance.

This was my first time here at CN Tower although I have been in Toronto several time. I found CN Tower to be amazing and enjoyed my time here. Read all the trivia in the Tower and I was taken away. The tower looked very strong and loved taking the elevator way up. Didn't eat at the restaurant as I...

Didn't go up the tower partly due to limited time but had a good look up close. The base has an enormous footprint which with the tower being 1800 feet high is hardly surprising so you can get a good idea of its construction. You can see the window panels of the lift shafts between the massive "legs". Apparently for...

This is a must do when visiting Toronto. Avoid large crowds by going at dinner time. We went up to the sky pod and the views and realization that you're so high up were amazing. I pulled myself to the rail and looked straight down at the people "on the edge" no thanks !!! We watched. Beautiful sunset then headed...

An amazing experience, soaring up at speed to a fantastic panoramic view of Toronto. There are even better, completely unobstructed views from the revolving restaurant which offers fine dining at reasonable prices and the highest wine cellar in the world.
Its always fun to see the city from high up. It gives you a perspective of the size and density of areas below. Kids will love it.
We got there early Saturday morning around 9 and there was no Que which was great. Got up early before the crowds the view as spectacular. Had great weather
Long lines, but that is to be expected. Great 360 view of Toronto! The glass floor is amazing! Wondeful location for restaurants and bars when finished
See all of Toronto from the highest point possible. If you eat at their restaurant , ticket price included as it is pricey.

Took my wife here - we went all the way to the Skypod and witnessed bright sun, snow and rain in June!! The security check is reassuring, the elevator rides are fun, glass floor is amazing and induces vertigo to those afraid of heights! Must go outside and enjoy the fresh air!

I love going up to these towers and seeing the city so I'm a bit biased in that regard. However, I definitely think it's a worthwhile tourist destination. We went when the sun was still setting, which was beautiful to see so high up. The elevator is windowed so you see yourself going up and down, which is a bit...

I had already been a few times in the past, but I took my boyfriend for his first trip up the tower. There is plenty of history to read up on when you go up (the elevator let's you see outside as it goes up), and there is a glass floor to stand on. This was so much fun. You...
The view is incredible, the staff very kind and helpful, everything worked the best way possible. I just thing the gift store could be better, with more items like souvenirs

My boyfriend and I just got back from a trip to Toronto. We went to the CN tower and really enjoyed ourselves. But I was surprised to see that so little people took one of the many opportunities to get a 15-20% discount. I got mine with Air Miles, but you can get a discount with CAA and also by...
Amazing 360 degree views of the city. It is a must see, but seems pricey at $40 USD/$31.60 CAD. Helpful hint: buy tickets online before you go and avoid game days.

This is a lovely attraction. Great view from the top. Just not a lot of anything else to do but admire the view. There are a few extra options, but they're not included in the price. My kids and I did enjoy going, just not something we will be doing regularly.

Go for the full experience and have a meal at the 360 restaurant instead! (Ask for Babu as your waiter!) But with a reservation at the restaurant you get a free ride to the top (usually $35) as long as you get a fixed meal of $55 (so you do the math). Amazing view! And it rotates!

It was my first time visiting Toronto and I was told the CN Tower was a must. They weren't wrong.We had excellent food at the 360 Restaurant, which rotates around the sitting at an unnoticeable pace so you enjoy a 360 view of the city while you eat a wonderful dinner. It's worth to do :-) Nice view, you can see the whole city and a great view of Ontario lake and the islands

This is a very exciting place to visit.This is not a cheap attraction to visit but well worth the money for the spectacular view.We went early in the morning and had a clear view across the city.The glass floor attraction was good.

We headed up the tower at 7pm on a beautifully clear evening & were able to see all around. Going up in the elevator, you get some sense of what is ahead of you, as there are small glass panels in the floor of the 'lift' to look down from where you were minutes earlier. I celebrated my 50th birthday with a walk on the edge with my two kids. Super safe but outside my comfort zone. Tour guides were great. I loved the pictures we brought home.

It was a fun time. Little bit pricey - over $80 USD for a trip up including the pod. It's your every other city sky deck. Amazing views. The glass floor is not for the faint of heart. Certainly a good spot to visit as a tourist.

I went all the way up to the Observation Deck, which is about 100 metres higher and 10 bucks more than the normal deck.It was definitely worth it. Just what you expect....a high view of the world. Quick elevator ride up and down, landing you squarely in front of the gift....easy to hit the aquariumImmediately after of you have the CityPass.
My cousin and I were together and we are both afraid of heights. This was an empowering journey, especially standing on the glass floor!

Interesting views, mostly of buildings but you can also get a good view of the airport and are able to see landings and takeoffs. Compared to high viewing facilities in places like NY, the CN Tower is starting to appear rather dated - both in terms of maintenance / decor and facilities. I visited on an evening. The glass on the main floor and the skypod are dirty and obscure the view in places. The metal grill is not great for taking photos.

Pretty expensive and long lines that you can not see from the entrance of the building. Every time we got through one line and would move into another room/area, there was another line. Probably the best attraction in Toronto with outstanding views. It is very bust and the queues are horrendous but worth the trouble.
Amazing experience! Strongly recommend having a glass of wine at the bar whilst enjoying the view! Also, strongly recommend going to the SkyPod!
We spent 2hrs at the CN tower taking pics. It was clear enough that we could just make out the skyline of Niagra Falls. The staff were friendly and courteous and answered the many questions asked.
I think $40 is a little excessive to visit this tower with underneath having cheap items made in China.
Kinda cool, quick up, Quick down. Nice view, no line ups. Restaurant was closed for private function

Amazing views from the top with a restaurant, bar and different viewing options including the glass floors from the top and in the lifts. We watched a beautiful sunset from the top. However, in saying that, I think the entry fee is a little overpriced compared to other viewing towers around the world.

This was the top attraction for us to visit during a recent visit to Toronto. It is the 3rd tallest building in the world, must see it .. right! The glass floor was totally cool and a real hit with my teenage daughters. The views were wonderful! Lots of cool information to read as well. We did not pay the...

We went up till the observation deck. View is great but a bit of disappointment because of the fact that there is no way to go for edge walk once you have reached the deck. You have to go all the way down, queue up again and come back up again to do the edge walk. They must give this...

Had a great day here.However I bought photos of us on the glass floor for $30. Asked about getting digital copies and he gave me a link to a website. When I logged in at home they wanted an extra $30 for each photo! At 4 photos that means a total cost of $150. This exploitative behaviour left a...
I have fear of heights and challenged myself to go up to the highest point . of course I crapped my pants but I liked it
Try and go early in the day-should be less congested. We went before noon (during the week) and had no wait times going up or down.
Fantastic and thrilling experience up the tower. View of the city and the ocean from the tower is truly indescribable. Must visit.

I'll start by saying I've been to the top of the CN Tower on multiple occasions, and it's never disappointed. The views are nice and you don't have to wait in a long line but the food prices are high for what you get.

Although a little pricey, the cost can be reduced through booking the package of the 5 major tourist sites that includes the CN tower or if applicable, asking for the senior rate. Lots of room to take selfies, and friendly other tourists that can take your pic in exchange taking a picture with their family. Wish they had directional identifiers...
Excellent experience, the lifts are great, don't look down. The views are excellent. The glass floor is not for the faint hearted

My husband and I each always wanted to dine in the 360 restaurant since we were kids who regularly visited Toronto.
