I'm on a bit of a tall buildings craze right now. Burj Dubai, One World Trade Center and now the CN Tower all within a couple months of each other. It was fun and impressive visiting this tower that was the worlds tallest for quite a few years. Entrance price is reasonable. Views are pretty good too. From the outside...

You can't come to Toronto without going up the CN tower. The views you see from the top are great and being able to look over Toronto at it's finest. You can pay extra to go up a bit further which is a bit pricey but still enjoyed it.

Although you can see the tower from miles tanding above the high rises I still struggled to find the place......But when I did. I found the entry not too bad to go right to the top and what you can see is incredible.

I was not blown away with mvisit to the CN tower. We were planning an anniversay dinner at the tower till we saw the prices. We also did not go to the top or the edgewalk, again too expensive. I could not imagine taking a family there and having to pay for everyone. Sorry Toront , would not recommend this...

Again this was one of the top things to do in Toronto and it wasn't too bad. I purchased the CityPass booklet which includes entry to CN Tower.I stayed nearby so it was an easy stroll there. I recommend going around prior to sunset. It does get busy around this time because I'm sure almost everyone wants to get...

We went here after going to Ripley's aquarium (they are located next to each other). Had to wait in lines for almost an hour before we could go up. Once there the views are awesome. You could here the roar of the crowd from Rogers Centre while the Blue Jays were playing. Standing on the glass floor looking down is...

We booked our dinner reservation during sunset, which was absolutely stunning. The view over Lake Ontario couldn't be more beautiful. The food at the CN tower was just ok. Definitely go and experience the scenery but don't expect to be blown away by the menu.

My girlfriend and I have both been to Toronto previously but neither of us had been to the CN Tower. Since it was included in our City Pass we chose to go since we had a couple hours before going to a show. We both thought it was unremarkable to see and definitely not worth the regular price of admission....

Bought the coupon book, and checked out CN tower.CN Tower - the line up was seriously very long, when you buy the coupon book you get to skip a part of the lineup!The elevator ride up is nice, but very cramped!All in all - Not much to brag about :(
You go up in the elevator and you come down. There's not much to do. The view of the city is good, if there's clear weather. At the top there's only expensive restaurants and a small cafe.

The CN Tower provides stunning 360 degree views of Toronto and Lake Ontario and for that reason alone is well worth the visit.The internal glass observation deck, at a height of about 340 m, was a much smaller area than expected and only provides a view directly down to street level. It does however provide a challenge to anybody who...

This is a one time visit for us, we wouldn't go back. You don't have an option. You either get a 2 or 3 course meal. They have prices next to everything and if you pick two options, it comes out less than the price of a two course meal. You don't have an option to get everything separate which...

I'm a fan of Toronto and the CN tower is a "must" if you're in town for a couple of days or more. The views from the top are simply spectacular and the glass floor panel offers a rare opportunity to walk 500m up with nothing but a plate glass panel between you and the ground below.
We did the observation deck and the skyhub. The views were incredible, but it's extremely overpriced for what you get.Skip the Skyhub. The views aren't much different, it's cramped, and it's hot.
A must when in Toronto. Great view of the city sklyline and very impressive engineering for the building itself.
Stayed at hotel nearby. Walked by many times. Chose to pass on the ride up. Didn't think it was worth the money since it was an overcast day

Wasn't too impressed, lady on the desk was rude and took us 40 minutes to get our tickets because she didn't not listen fully or give good clear instructions.Glass platform was the best, not really worth going to the top as mesh fully obscures any opportunity to take view in or take photos
Was a good view of toronto, however pretty expensive compared to other city towers. There are other attractions at the Base worth a look
Is best icon in Toronto most be visted if out town or you leaving in city. The view from top the tower is magnificent. Jus everything little bit pricey.
Awesome experience. Definitely one of a kind. The glass floor on the pod was the best. Literally takes your breath away. Am so in love with the CN tower.
Excellent views over the city and islands. Restaurant reasonably priced and service good, especially the beef nachos :)

I had dinner with a friend from out of town there and the food was expensive but much improved from before. It was acceptable food and the big draw of course is the view.Good for a tourist but too expensive to go there on a regular basis

The outside was closed due to too much wind, which is too bad. Great view but I find quite expensive just to take an elevator to a cramped room. Waiting was about 45 minutes, which isn't so bad on a Saturday I guess.Intresting documentary on the building of the tower while waiting. Good souvenir shop.Wish I knew about the...

Enough has been said of what was once the worlds tallest building,suffice to say it has been able to survive the last 56 years by being relevant and changing with ( ahead of ) the times. The glass floor looking down at the human ants below, the views over the Blue Jays baseball stadium and the awe inspiring sky walk...

As someone who has visited a number of high buildings including the bottle opener in Shanghai and the Petrona towers in MalaysiaThis was disappointing , not the tower it self , but once they had took your money (inc extra to go further up)There was no direction from anyone as to where you could go , if you...
The iconic sight in the Toronto skyline. Well worth a visit for excellent views of the city and a view of the stomach churning drop through the glass floor!.

If you are looking for a view, I would totally recommend the CN tower, you can see all the city from here. Although there are very long lines to get in, you can buy the Toronto Citypass and skip them all...
If your one.for heights this.is a.fantastic thrill, Sat on.the glass.floor.and.Got.blown.away at the.top, ideally you would want to go off peak season when.it's.less.busy as it's.Very crowded.

Last year went to the top if you're afraid of heights you might not like the outside elevator ride to the top. Spectacular view once you're at the top. Very nice revolving restaurant. Well worth the visit

Excellent visit. Had the meal at 360 CN restaurant. Was very good - perhaps could have been better but would recommend going to the restaurant as it made the whole visit a great experience with quiet ambience and skips the queues.
Went there for a meal at sunset. Great views of Toronto as the sun went down. Food was excellent and price included visiting the observation desk and trip in the glass floored elevator
Worth going. Great site. Not spectacular but pretty cool. Check it out. I actually love he presence of this building in the city more than the visit.

I would have liked to have gone up the tower however I really felt it was too expensive. $35 just to go to the observation deck. I also asked if I could just go to the restaurant for a drink and snack but you still had to buy a ticket. No thanks....but I'm sure the view was great!
My partner and myself had so much fun. its very high- and adrenaline rush! but we concoured it and had such a great time.

I was a bit nervous to do this, but it so worth it! If you are first timers in Toronto and don't go up the CN Tower, you will regret it--hold on to a loved one if it helps, but DO IT. We had a beautiful, clear day and could see for miles.
Not worth the price, get the City Pass! Windy at the very top but the views are beautiful . Kinda hot too! No AC.

Even if you are local you will appreciate the view, we don't always do things that are close to us everyome else raves over.It is pricey but worth doing once, not sure it needs to be repeated.It may not be the tallest tower in the world anymore but it's ours and it's cool.

I've been meaning to visit here for 20 years. Seriously. I finally made it! My husband doesn't like heights so he waited for me. It was expensive (both tickets were about $55!) but worth the money. The elevator ride was exciting but the guide had such a thick accent that I didn't understand a word she said. Once I reached...

Totally worth visiting, especially on a clear spring day.We bought the City Pass, which gives you access to 5 different places in Toronto for about $80 per person. It's good for 9 days and you save tons of money.
Yes, its pricey but the views are amazing. I went on a Tuesday around 6pm and there were no line ups. If you come to Toronto you must go up the tower.
If you are in the area do this...! It is the standard tourist thing to do but embrace it. You will either be scared of it or love it.

I'd say this was a decent attraction, if you've been to any tower it's probably similar. Thankfully we visited in late May before the summer hit. Our wait was under 30 minutes. It was mentioned that the line could run an hour to an hour and a half during the busy summer months.

This was well worth our time in Toronto, and the City pass made the price of this go much lower than without the pass. Also, the pass allowed us to by-pass at least a 30-minute wait on a Sunday morning. In fact, thanks to that pass, we probably did this activity in less than 30 minutes. We didn't pay extra...

Visited as part of the package that comes with dining in the restaurant. Views are fantastic across the city, and it is an interesting experience to walk on the glass floor. Try to visit around sunset so you get to catch the city lights too. Staff were friendly and helpful in the well-stocked gift shop. Even though we visited when...
Always a thrill. Beautiful view of the city. Make sure to go to the glass floor and look down if you can. We found it hard to get a good picture with our cameras.

It was my second time at the CN tower, first with the wife for a romantic dinner late in the evening, the food was great, service was great and the view at night was amazing.This time, went with my father, bought tickets online so after the security check, you're suppose to go directly to the group desk (as mentionned...

Queuing on the day we went was really good and we went through at a reasonable pace. Price was on par with most types of attractions around the world. Looked like Canadians get a discount ( driving licence and passports being shown).Staff really friendly and toilets very, very clean. Views outstanding and the glass floor unbelievable.
Stunning views of the city. The elevator ride up and down is stunning as well! Love the glass floor lookout.

It's nice and best place to see the view 360 . But it's took 45 min to go to up because very long line to buy ticket and at lift . But it's worth to go up . Nice weather when we go up . There is glass you can see under but it's looks a scary. We stay there...

Great lifts; smooth acceleration. Obviously wonderful views. I couldn't bring myself to stand on the glass floor.I wish we'd gone up there for breakfast.

We were walking around and decided to go to the CN tower. You can buy tickets on your phone and skip the line. The view is very nice. It is one of those things locals probably never do, but really is good for tourists
Nice place to visit and must be on every travellers' itinerary, if for nothing else to stand on the glass bottom.

If you're in Toronto and close by this is one thing you have to do.The price seems pretty high for basically a ride up an elevator but the views are spectacular and there is a restaurant with great views for dining so you can spend a little more time and get a little more for your money.

The first thing I would mention is that the queues can be long, would strongly suggest booking online beforehand. The view from the top really is spectacular, the glass floor is terrifying, and the restaurant at the top is surprisingly good. Today we ventured out to the CN tower. My husband doesn't like heights but he was brave took the life up it takes 60 secs and he just looked straight ahead and not down. There is a viewing platform up the top which has wire all around. If you walk down a floor there is a heavy duty glass which...
Amazing view. We went during sunset. We bought the cityPass so we were able to by pass the line, however the line looked extremely long without a cityPASS. Would do it again forsure.

If you're new to Canada the CN Tower is a must-visit destination. nice place to see whole of toronto from one place or i will say bird eye view nice place to go have a resturant gift shop glass pod to stand on i personally like it fun to visit
Nice tower very highGood for groupNice view nice cityIf you want action try this towerVery nice not forget this time really

While taking a break from work had the opportunity to finally check this out. Glad I did!!The views and history of this iconic Canadian triumph is second to none! Would come again with my family to experience this!Best thing to do is purchase your tickets online to avoid the lineups to make it even a better experience!The...

I purchased a package which included the Edge Walk, observation deck with the glass floor, and the Sky Pod observation deck. All I can say is it was amazing and worth every penny. Take a walk over the glass floor and look down if you dare, the views from the pod are breathtaking.Buy your ticket on line and beat the ticket queue.

Took an hour after getting the tickets. Once up it has great views of Toronto and the lakes. We went up late afternoon and got a water and coffee and sat enjoying the vista before going down a floor to the glass floor level. I am used to heights but it is quite scary! If you go outside to the...

The whole experience was brilliant.The views were amazing and the food and staff were first class.Mohammed was our waiter and he was lovely really attentive,I would say to anyone if you are thinking of going up the tower then go for the meal.

I have to admit I didn't go up, I just viewed it when walking outside, and from the view from my AirBNB 66th-floor condo. However, without the illumination at night, it's just appears to be a tall cement landmark.

The first time I was up there was 1985. I thought it was too costly then. But last November it was shocking! The cost tripled. What did I see? Fogs! It was not worth my trip. My advice is to go up there when the skies are clear. Don't bring any beverages or snacks you are not allowed to take...

it was little bit pricey but it totally worth it.well next time i will definitely do the edge walk.you can see niagara falls from there that was so cool.yeah but there's huge lineup for elevators that was the only thing we had to deal with.
Visited here during the GFOA conference. Great experience and I am terrified of heights. The Horizons restaurant was surprisingly reasonable for lunch...also try to see the sunset!

When my friend asked me what I wanted to do in Toronto, I immediately thought of going up the tower. Recommend grabbing food outsideThen a coffee or beer in the tower with time to change nappies of our 6m twin boys and feeding themSpent 2hours in there but chilled

CN Tower is the place that you MAST visit! Experience is breathtaking! Beautiful scenery, amazing views, elated impressions.

Thoroughly enjoyed our visit. Well organized and efficiently run. Views were spectacular. Great Restaurant.Good place for a visit.Best to book tickets online before you visit so you can walk straight through to elevators.

Spectacular view, can walk out into an area that is netted and open to the lake breeze. Also can walk over a glass floor that allows you to look below.

Squeezed in some time to go and see this tall tower.Must see in Toronto, if one is closer to the airport, UP Express is the best mode to reach this place.It was crowded.One must keep minimum of 4-5 hrs. to see this attraction.

I first visited the CN Tower when I was 15, I went again this year at age 30. I went on the Monday of the May long weekend and it wasn't super busy. Fairly quick to get in and not too crazy busy at the top. Nice views of the whole city and over the water. The glass floor is...

There are several options when taking this tour - the main tour takes you up to the first level, where there is a restaurant and glass floor and amazing views all the way around (360 degrees). Just do it! We got a package for the 360 Restaurant and the SkyPod. It's really worth it. The food it's great, the views of Toronto are simply breathtaking, it takes about an hour and fifteen to do the whole round so it gives plenty of time to enjoy the view and finish your food.Will come back to enjoy...

Although quite pricey ($35 for observation deck and +$12 for skypod). It provides a great view of Toronto and surrounding areas. Booked tickets online before hand so we didn't have to queue. I think going early is better to avoid the crowds because you have to go through security. Great views from the top.
A must-see in Toronto, the view is absolutely stunning. The only downside is how expensive it is, always look for possible discounts before visiting.

Glass floor elevator whisks you up to the top of Toronto. Excellent views and definitely worth the price on a clear day. One of the tallest structures in the world. If you're feeling in a death defying mood, try the Edge Walk on the exterior roof.

We stopped by on Saturday, but the lines were outside the door and it looked like a long wait. We called on Sunday and they said it would be an hour wait. The dinner package at the restaurant is def worth it! Stunning views, good food and great service, made it a truly memorable experience!Looking at the pricing, it makes more sense to always go with the dinner package

Took my young kids here on a fall day to view downtown Toronto from the top of the tower. We really enjoyed the glass bottom elevators and glass floors at the top of the tower to lay down and get our pictures taken like we are on top of the aquarium roof. A decent restaurant to sit down and have...
probably the best view of the skyline and the islands but the windows are dirty and reflect the light so pictures do not come out so well
Skypod, is less crowded and view is even better. It´s great experience in Toronto. You will like it.
Excellent attraction in Toronto. Te restaurant 360 wast good. The elevator are incredible you can see all.

CN Tower was always top of my list when visiting Toronto. I arrived early morning so as to avoid any wait lines which worked out perfectly being able to walk straight through. Security was quick and efficient while the cashier on the ticket desk was pleasant, helpful and quick. Arriving early meant also avoiding any wait times for elevators or...

The CN Tower is what you would expect, an elevator ride with some beautiful views of the city. The glass floor was really cool and a little bit scary. My only complaint was it was CROWDED. Especially on the glass floor, it was hard to get good photos with so many ppl around.We made a reservation at the restaurant...

I went with a group of co-workers one night after work. We bought tickets to the main observation deck plus the Skypod. The elevator ride up to the main observation deck is neat because it's glass elevator doors. The main observation deck is fairly large and has a lot of historical information on the Tower including building of the tower,...

I went to CN Tower a few times when I was living in Toronto. The view it's amazing, I recommend to go in the end of the afternoon and beginning of the night, this way you will be able to see the wonderful sunset and also the lights of Toronto at night.

Great dinner at the 360 restaurant Full views great food Then did the walk around tour afterwards If you've never been to the city it's definitely something to see Replace to take a customer to dinner find out what time the sun is setting and try and book so that you're there during that sunset
Well worth the no 1 rating on Trip Advisor. Lots of space so you could spend a long as you liked peering out.
Visiting this tower is wonderful. From the top a visitor can have a very nice view of all Toronto, especially of the Ontario Lake, with is like a sea, so big it is.
I went up solo because my companion doesn't do heights. Great view. Stood on the glass floor but didn't go all the way to the top.

You don't have to go to the top and pay! You can simply just see and enjoy it from the ground. Unless you want to experience a formal dinner in 360 restaurant. It's gorgeous when you're on the top and looking over this huge, beautiful and very multicultural city!

This attraction is about what you would expect. There are good views of the City from the main viewing areas which include both an inside and outside area for viewing. The glass floor appeared to be a big hit with many of the tourists. There is a second charge to go up to another level but we had paid enough....

I'm not the type to throw out !00 bucks for an attraction, but in order to do something 'totally Toronto" my wife and I went up the Tower. It's scary but a great view of the city. One of the top attractions in Toronto and is a must on your to-do list if its your first ever visit to the city. We went when day time turn to night. We got to see the many shades of Toronto. It was not to busy at that time. maybe people are out for dinner? No wait time

I was really excited to go on the famous glass walkway of the CN tower, only to get to the top and realise that only a small part of the tower has the glass walkway.Half of the inside view of the tower is taken up by the restaurant, and while the outside views are fabulous, the mesh wire made...

I haven't been to the top in over 25 years however not much has changed except the hour long wait for the elevators and the inflated price for a family of 7. If it's your first time by all means do it. My family enjoyed their first time view of Toronto but it did cost me $282 for the basic...

As a family, we went to the CN Tower to eat at the 360 degree restaurant. It was my son's birthday, and I could not think of a better place to celebrate. I hate heights, but being in the restaurant was not scary. The fact that you rotate is a great bonus. Toronto at night is beautiful.

We visited the CN Tower on a Sunday afternoon, which is probably why it was so crowded, and went up for lunch. The food was very good and actually reasonably priced. The view goes without mentioning and I imagine it only gets better around sunset.

First off, I did the Edge Walk, which was really amazing, but that aside, a review of the tower itself is probably worth writing in its on right.The tower itself is impressive. But the customer experience isn't the greatest. Signage inside is poor on the ground level - it's not clear where you need to go for various attractions....
Okay not sure the value is great but kinda must see if your in Toronto to experience at least once. Get the City pass at Costco to save more.
Its a great first time experience. If you are even travelling to Toronto, the CN tower needs to be on your list of places to go.

We went to the CN TOWER AM as a part of the citypass. It was a great experience, we came in the last daylight hour of the dsy sobee got to see the city in light and dark. We loved it, no line at all...Toronto is a beautiful city!

Situated at 351 m over the ground the restaurant has a magnificent view over Toronto. The restaurant revolves around the tower in, what they sad, 72 minutes (5 degress per minute). However after ordering our meal it took a whole revolution before we got our food. Beneath the restaurant is an observation level and beneath it you can stand on...
Just do it!! Seriously, you will not be disappointed!! Offers a great view of TO. Don't worry if you're nervous with heights, it is all manageable!!

I've been to the top of a few other structures in my travels and this one wasn't too much different. The staff was mostly friendly and knowledgeable although one read from notes. Maps indicating points of interest from the view at the top would have been helpful.

Friends who live in Toronto took us for lunch to this wonderful placeIn addition to the fantastic view as the restaurant rotates the food was surprisingly goodThe meal plus view is fairly expensive but it is a special treat
You can see it from everywhere in Toronto.The high speed elevator makes you feel dizzy when you reach the top but very nice view watching Toronto from that height.

For a budget traveler, especially one not earning in Canadian dollars, the price of the lift up is just super expensive. We finally didn't go up and used the money to see the Ripley's aquarium and was not disappointed. Probably with a longer visit in Toronto it would be good to use the 5-attractions discount pack, including both the Aquarium...

We were lucky enough to visit on the nicest day of the year so far, according to the staff, and due to a bit of jet lag up early enough to be one of the first to visit the Tower at 9 am. We were the only ones up in the Skypod at that time and made the most of...
Beautiful views! I like how there is an outdoor section to view from. Great gift shops and service. Overall fun experience.

The view is amazing! You can actually see the other side of the Ontario lake. The crew is well trained and the infra-structure is very well maintained. I think is not worth it to buy the upper access. You can get a great view with the normal pass.
Went here to eat one evening, food was very good and surprisingly cheap, views at night are enchanting.

Was a neat experience if you haven't been before. This is definitely a primary tourist attraction. Went around 7 pm on a Sunday and did not have to wait with a previously purchased city pass (save $$ when doing at least 3 of 5 places). I did not feel the photo ops gave a true view, as the glass area...
The tower is a must visit if you are in Toronto. It is organized and they also have a restaurant. It has a part where the floor is transparent it was great.
Has the best views of the city. Seems a bit pricey to me as you are not really up there for very long ( my choice)

Best to purchase tickets before traveling as queues can be long. Views from here, especially on a clear day, are amazing - you can (if you're lucky) even glimpse the mist of Niagara Falls!! Great restaurant - you can even just sit and have a drink and enjoy the views as the restaurant slowly revolves 360 degrees. For the more...
This is a great tourist attraction. I often bring colleagues that travel from overseas to see the CN Tower. I recommend going to the top at least once, just to check out the view.
This place still takes my breath away !! The view is amazing all across this beautiful city ? so proud of our city and encourage anyone who has not been here to come visit
We didn't actually go up in the tower. This is the most recognized landmark in Toronto. We took pictures of it from all over the city.

A must see in Toronto with excellent views over the city. We came here in the morning and thoroughly enjoyed the sights from the observer and glass bottom levels. The views were beautiful thanks to the fantastic sunshine and definitely worth the money. Don't miss it when in Toronto!

Never realized just how big Toronto actually is until you get to the top. 360 degree view, sometimes in the snack bar area. One level has a glass floor, but is closed on windy days. Souvenir shop after you come back down. Lines can be long, early mornings best for quick access.

We visited here while on a recent trip to Toronto. The views from the tower are really amazing. This is a must visit place if you come to Toronto. If you are planning on visiting other places in Toronto you can get the city pass which saves you a good bit of money.
Took my grandson up as a treat. Great views and elevator ride. By the time I paid for a photo and had a pop I spent $100 :) ...

Be warned there is a lot of construction going on at the Tower. There is a security search going into it. Two of us decided not to go up but used the washroom and then wandered the area around the Tower. Two stood in the line for tickets and elevator for the grand view of Toronto and beyond.
Super fast lift to a view that you can see 100's of kilometres of Canada. The bars at the top offered good food and refreshments.An absolute must to visit

what an experience and one not to be missed if in Toronto. The view from just even the lowest level is breathtaking but needs a clear bright day to see it all. Would have given this 5/5 if the entrance pricing was more reasonable, for a family with kids it could be an expensive experience and not sure if worth the money.The que for ticket was fast, the lift ride was super fast, the view is amazing, had a chance to see the sunset also beautiful site.

Initially we joined the wrong queue, it was for the pickup tickets, and after a 10 minute wait we were told we had to go outside to the front of the attraction. Our fault as we came in the side entrance!!!Getting a discount as you're over 65 gives me a warm feeling wherever I go, and the one and...

After a fifteen minute wait we boarded the glass fronted, glass floored elevator that takes you up 1815 feet up in the air to reach the Sky Pod. CN Tower used to be the tallest tower in the world, now it's just the tallest in the Western Hemisphere. Pricey to go up just for a visit ($40+ before tax), and though I comtemplated doing the sky walk, the price put me off ($188 before tax). You do get a good view of the city but not a lot...

The CN Tower is a must-see attraction in Toronto. The 360 view is one of a kind and there are some really impressive facts around the structure (the total hight is about half a kilometer!). The glass floor on one of the top floors is quite a trill. The $47 ticket price was a bit higher than expected.

I had visited the CN tower a few times before, always in the summer. The crowds were crazy, waits to go up and down the elevators were long and so many people in the way when you wanted a pic.This year, we went on a Monday in March (not March Break). What a difference! No line-ups, no crowds. ....
I am really happy to have been able to get to the tower. I walked there on my own. The city is great.

Poor wheelchair ( for stroller) access at top.Had to wait for a while to find someone to bring us down one level to get down to the ground floor.Also it didn't seem to be possible to access the 360 restaurant from the viewing area.One would have to go down and back up again
Fantastic view of Toronto on a sunny day. You can discover different parts of a huge city. Don't miss glass floor to see people walking downstairs. Be careful if you get dizzy easily.
Toronto you are amazing. You never forget this one. I took the elevator thank you very much! Mesmerizing.

We had dinner reservations at 360 Restaurant, and admission to the lower viewing deck/glass floor was included with dinner. This was a beautiful way to see Toronto. I went to the CN tower using my city pass and it was worth it! Not sure I'd go just paying the fee. You could see everything and the elevator ride up even had glass floors! The staff were great, and super friendly. Ask them anything and they'll likely know the answer.

One of the big tourist sites in Toronto so expected it to be packed out but was actually not too crowded.Views were spectacular! I would recommend only going up on a nice clear day and choosing the extra ticket which takes you to the higher level is a must!
Very cool experience. Was too windy to go outside so wasn't really worth the money but was still pretty cool to see. Great view of the city

For a tourist destination we were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food. The service was excellent. Definitely worth the price especially since it included the price of admission to the top. Enjoy!

We didn't go inside but we went to a Blue Jays game and it was really amazing to be able to check out the CN tower while watching the game. First visit to CN Tower. What a great attraction. There was a bit of a queue to get in but is was worth the inconvenience. The weather was clear and the views from the top were fantastic. Wait for a fairly clear day and this is the place to visit. We went early in the morning and almost first people there at 9 am. Easy access, no queues and straight up to the top. Wonderful views as you would expect. The glass floor place was scary! Made my legs turn to jelly - your brain just yells...

This is a must go attraction in Toronto. It has two levels and hence two types of tickets. It is good to buy the tickets for the highest level. The glass floor experience is scary in the beginning but it is amazing. The view from the top is amazing.

I booked the meal for my partner's 60th birthday meal and decided to go for the sunset so that we could see both sides of lightness... interesting and meal itself was delicious though pricey but we opted for set menu which was bit cheaper. we felt it was worthwhile as no pressure from the waiters. then we went down to...

Before going to Toronto everyone said go up the tower. To be honest, I wasn't very excited due to the fact we were going to the Empire State building and I had already visited the Shard in London. However, this was my favorite thing in Toronto!The glass elevator made us feel like we were Charlie flying through the sky....

This is definitely a great stop for site seeing. Toronto is such a cool city and at the CN Tower you get a chance to see it all in one swoop! Only downside is that it's older and it doesn't take many people to make peeking through the glass feel cramped. I went at night about 8ish on a Saturday...

We signed up for the Edge Walk but that ticket also includes the LookOut, SkyPod and glass floor. The CN tower is a majestic piece of art. You can see it from every corner of the city. The night themes look magical. I have seen it from outside but have not visited their revolving restaurant this time with their fantastic view sincewe were short of time. But definitely now in my bucket list for next year.

I was afraid of the glass floor but I did it anyway..great experience. strange feeling in the elevators going up to the 100 and something level..so worth it. try out the restuarants. need a reseravtion for the 360 restuarant

We took the family to the CN tower for lunch to celebrate my father-in-laws 90th birthday last summer. As everyone we thought this is a must! As everything is surrounded by glass, not as spectacular as it could be, but still very nice views. Going up with the elevator was very cool!
Great elevator ride up and observation lookouts. We went at night and the view was amazing esp with all of the lights like Kanye West.

The tower is one of the iconic landmarks of the city built in the 70s so is a must for sightseeing. There is a brief security check before you can access the main building. A must do place to visit. Amazing views. Perfect for getting your bearings around the city and great photo opportunities. The history of the construction is pretty amazing as well. I did the walk around the outside edge for a birthday present. Not cheap but well worth it if you're not scared of heights.

The view from the top of the tower is spectacular, breathtaking and beautiful. However, for the full effect, I would recommend that you eat at the 360 restaurant.The restaurant rotates once every 72 minutes, so comfortably seated diners can experience the full panoply in all its glory. We visited this as a family. Two of us decided they would do the Edge Walk The cost for the two was approximately $400. This may seem a lot but it was for an hour and a half. Took the chance to go up this wonderful tower. Great for a view, don't expect anything else. Not worth the price if you live here. If visiting, honestly you would not be missing out. Spend the money on cheap seats at an open Jay's game, you get to see the CN tower and feel more of the atmosphere of the city.

The CN Tower is the largest free-standing structure in NA. I love visiting towers. CN tower is a must-see. At downtown Toronto, with a great restaurant, you can save the tickets buy getting a city visit ticket and even buying a pack with dinner. The glass floor is spectacular and a daring attraction for adults. As for kids, they do not seem scared at all.

This is well worth a visit, although in the summer months there are long line ups. Good idea to buy tickets in advance so you don't have to line up for them. The views are great from the top only if its a good clear day. Don't bother going up on a cloudy or rainy day. The revolving restaurant serves...

I live a minute away form one of the highest free standing structures in the world and I am amazed every day when I glance at the engineering of the magnificent super structure. We go to the CN Tower to eat at the 360 Restaurant. If you dine there then the tickets up are included in your dining cost. My cousin lives at the base of the tower. My 14 year old son wanted to go to the top so we did the tourist thing...it was fun and what great views. A little on the expensive side but still worth it for sure.

We dined at the 360 restaurant, worth a trip if you haven't had the experience of dining in a revolving restaurant. Been years since we visited this attraction really enjoyed it!City hasReally grown and you can see itVery well done a must see for visitors to Toronto

It is a really nice to visit, You can see the city from the top, but I advert you: do not take too much expectations because it is kind of expensive and you should pick a beautiful day to visit it. My wife and I celebrated our anniversary with a meal in the restaurant at the top of the CN Tower. Extensive menu, good food jwith excellent views of the city and we were even served a celebration cake.Not overly expensive either.

Living in Toronto, I've gone to the CN Tower multiple times over the years. It's always a fascinating experience to go. I think my favourite part is the glass floors, they scare the living daylights out of me but they're still pretty cool. If you're a first time goer you will have a fantastic time. We planned our trip to the CN Tower based on recommendations found on trip sites and timed in perfectly. Definitely pick a clear day and go early. We had the elevator ride up to ourselves and only one other group on our way down. No waiting at all. Felt like we had the place to ourselves at times.
I wad just around the area and didn t have much time, so I didn t go inside . But seeing something enourmus makes you feel amazed...;)
Great panoramic view of city -However can get expensive if couples or families, big group.View is nice but there are not that many thing to do once you are up but to "observe".
When to the observation deck an the 360 restaurant. Great view of the city from my seat in the restaurant and the food was good, which you would expect, but nothing extraordinary.

If you live or visit Toronto this is something you have to do at least once in your life! It is pretty much always full but if you go early in the morning when it just opens it is a bit less packed. Definitely go on a clear day or evening but the view and experience is unique!

I had the afternoon to myself so I decided to go up the CN Tower. It was a gorgeous day, so the view was amazing. I tried the Skypod too,which I believe is worth the extra, though the whole thing is a bit overpriced.Buy your tickets online to skip the cashiers.
The CN Tower is VERY high. The views are amazing. I loved the glass bottom floor. We were up there for hours and it seemed like only 15 minutes. A must see as long as you're not afraid of heights.
The views are spectacular and the glass floor is not for the squeamish. That said, it's not cheap. Who knew an elevator ride could cost so much?
The biggest tower around. The view das Amazing and you could see the view for Miles and Miles. Loved the story of the building and that in the summer people can walk outside with a roap attached
Great views of Toronto and Lake Ontario.Should no longer be prominently claiming "highest" tower as Tokyo and Shanghai now have taller

Fun tourist attraction with beautiful views of Toronto and the surrounding area. I love that you can look down into the baseball field. Comprehensive gift shop is fun to browse through back down on the ground.

The elevator ride up to the observation area was a trip. It was scary at first but so much fun. The same with the glass floors! Scary but so much fun and a great experience! The view is obviously beautiful considering you can see all of Toronto and more!
Not sure it was worth the $$. It was a beautiful view for people who never have the opportunity to be up that high above a city, but not sure it was worth the cost of the ticket.
A bit pricey but great views. The pictures they take of visitors are very nice but too expensive. They rather throw them away than make you a better deal. But the tower was a great experience.

This was such an amazing experience. The views of the city and surrounding areas can't be beat. I went on a weekday afternoon in the spring and there was little to no waiting for tickets and entry. I really enjoyed it, but I was with a longtime Toronto resident who could point out all kinds of interesting structures in all directions and knew the stories behind them.
fantastic 360 degree view of Toronto and Lake Ontario, for the brave thrill seekers try the Edge walk
Lovely meal, but not much of a selection, amazing views. was a bit disorientating at first. After dinner you could go down and take in the views first hand

lovely views of Toronto and Lake Ontario.An hour is enough for this visit.The glass floor is great and seemingly 68% of visitors wont walk on it.Downside is its not worth $35 each and thats before tax

I had heard people about the food, however they must be more jaded than I as I enjoyed the experience including the meal with family of ages 5-81 as we revolved around the tower. The wait staff was pleasant enough, relatively inobstrusive, and fairly well-trained.
View is great - the food is pricey and taste was just above average. I don't recommend taking kids - $40 for chicken fingers..YIKES!
The view is excellent, especially on a clear day. We didn't eat in the restaurant. I heard it is very pricy and average. It is worth the price.

can be really busy in the tourist seasons, but quite an adventure. Elevator ride goes up the outside, not for faint of heart. See through floor section on the observation deck will make anyone's stomach twitch. I don't have the b****s for the outside walk. Absolutely fabulous views. Recommend buying tickets online before you go to avoid queues get there early - again to avoid large queues, also many tourists so earlier the better. Staff extremely helpful and knowledgable. Probably not for those who are afraid of heights. shop is average, could certainly do with a better range. Prices of gifts also quite expensive
It was part of the stop of the Toronto hop on/hop off service. A nice tower to take a picture!! It has a rotating restaurant with a great view I suppose.

If you want to have a nice view over the city, this the place to be! Do not miss the glass floor, it is amazing.Going to the 2nd floor is not really worth it to my opinion. It does not change much in terms of the view.

The CN Tower was fantastic. It is so high and allows for wonderful views of the area. It was a gorgeous day when we were there and it was well worth it. It was an easy walk from he hotel and if I return to Toronto, would certainly do it again.

Very expensive, but great views. Be prepared for a little waiting but don't skip this experience! There are fun photo opportunities along the way as you make your way to the elevators. The staff speaks French and English as well as a few other languages. You won't be disappointed.

We loved dining at the top of the CN tower. The food was delicious, better than we were expecting it to be. We toned our visit with the sunset so we could watch the sun go down and see the city light up. It takes about an hour for the restaurant to rotate and we were thrilled by the views...

Bought a CityPass, which is a must to avoid the queues! We went through security, straight down a side entrance and to a queue for the elevator. We had a discounted tourist card to get into the tower, however if we had not I don't believe that the view is worth the $35.00 price tag. Well worth the visit, great views. Towers above the rest of Toronto. Glass floor was amazing and extremely weird to walk and stand on, but great for photos.
It was neat going all the way up to the skypod. It was rocking a bit up there but we got over that quickly.

As a native Torontonian, this was my first visit to the CN Tower! The entrance fee was about $35 plus tax. The elevator ride was very quick (about 45 seconds). We went on day time, maybe it is the reason why I am not that enjoy the scene. The scene is good but the ticket is too expensive to this kind of scene.
It is a must see once you're in Toronto! The view up there is really nice and you can take many good pictures. I strongly recommend the visit.

Went when the weather wasn't that great so visibility was low and the outer deck was closed. This wasn't all that bad, low visibility made for great photography as the clouds would blanket the city of Toronto and you felt like you were on Cloud 9.

Go to the 490 meters high tower, seat in the 360 spinning restaurant and enjoy the amazing view of the islands across the Toronto mainloand,the airstrip, the city skyscrappers,the stadium view from above.Excellent

No surprises in what you get you're at the top although surprisingly nice bar was a bonus. Not sure extra $12 to go to the skypod or whatever it's called was worth it. But the glass floor is great. I'll take my kids when I go back.

When you visit Toronto you must try the restaurant ,360 at the top of the tower.It is expensive but the food is delicious the rotating restaurant has spectacular views.You get the two level viewing and ,glass floor with your meal.

Totally worth it! The view is awesome, it's a must place to go, and if you have time have dinner at the top restaurant which is yummi

I was fearful because of the height, but no problems. Beautiful building, stable. Every employee was pleasant and of course the views are phenomenal. Drinks were expensive but really unique and tasty so they were justifiable.

For the best view of Toronto, Lake Ontario and the Inner Harbour & Islands, the CN Tower is a must. You can also walk around the top of the tower both indoors and suspended by a tether. Walk on the glass floor. Eat in a good revolving restaurant. A must see for visitors to Toronto.

If you are visiting Canada, and specifically if you're visiting Toronto, this must be one of the first places you visit. My family visited the CN Tower and also had dinner at the 360 restaurant. The tower has fabulous views of Toronto and Lake Ontario. It is truly beautiful!
THe CN Tower gives a 360º view of the city and a great chunk of Lake Ontario, including the southern, NY state shore

We went to the CN Tower for lunch one day and the views were outstanding. The staff are really friendly and helpful should you have any questions about the food or drink. The CN tower is an engineering marvel! And is the pride and joy of Canada. The view is great! And i really enjoyed the sights.Some parts of the tower were underwhelming.. Had to visit the CN Tower as it's almost compulsory if you are visiting Toronto but it is an expensive let down. Worth combining with a meal in 360 restaurant which was delicious and gave access to viewing platform. Best views from window in slowly revolving restaurant. Viewing platform has quite a dense safety mesh so not so good for photos. Great literal overview of Toronto & surrounding area, able to appreciate the vastness of Lake Ontario.

A must have seen location in Toronto with also the opportunity to have a nice lunch or dinner at a height of 360 meters.The additional ticket for a 100 meter higher view does not bring a lot of better views but being that high is special!

Impressive engineering feat that is a must see destination for many tourists. This is an incredible view of the city. I went with my husband, and we had lunch at the 360 restaurant. The food was delicious, and with the revolving view the experience was amazing! If you purchase a prix fixe menu (lunch or dinner) as we did, you will have access to the LookOut and Glass Floor.

A must place to visit in Toronto. In downtown, one gets a superb view of the city and surroundings.Many of tourist attractions are nearby, so one can plan a whole enjoyable evening here.Rakesh K. Shah

Seeing the look of my teen with me was ALMOST worth the crazy amount you pay.This takes 58 seconds to go up elevator which is likely the coolest 58 seconds.For two of us it cost just under $80.The glass floor though cool is very small. Outside isn't what it's chalked up to be as very "gated" in...
Always visit here when I'm in Toronto. This time my daughter did the Edge Walk and it was quite the thrill.I'd recommend it to anyone visiting.

If you are visiting Canada, and specifically if you're visiting Toronto, this must must be on your places to visit list. At a breath taking height of 342 m the view that you get to see is something no amount of money can buy. Best time to visit is in the spring when its not too hot not too cold.

If you're visiting Toronto, you have to check out the CN tower. Obviously the best views of the city. 360 degree views and even a glass floor which was very cool. There was an outdoor area that was caged off and very windy.I recommend.

The vistas are spectacular, if you're sensitive to heights, beware you will become queasy! A bit pricey at $35.00 per ticket, the views are awesome, a great to spend about an hour to gain a very unique perspective on the great city of Toronto!

It was so lovely to sit and eat a meal while you revolve very slowly around Toronto. Unmissable. Clear view for miles. Great 360 view of Toronto at 1,100 feet above ground level.Yes they have a kids menu at lower restaurant which they do not seem to advertise. The food for this type of attraction was a wee bit better than average.

We visited in the bright sunshine and it was amazing, well worth the little extra to go up to the top ! We arrived quite early in the morning and were very pleased we did as the place soon gets busy and the queues looked quite long as we left. A must do if you're in Toronto.
A strict no for those who are afraid of heights. The lift is pretty fast. Awesome view of city. Good time to visit is summer.

Brought the family to the CN TOWER as it isn't a trip to Toronto without seeing the amazing skyline. It was neat to be able to use the views as a map as we planned out our next adventure. Tickets were a little pricy and I feel the greenscreen photo they take of you when you get there should be...
Pretty cool to see a top view of toronto. I think we overpaid for what it was. Missed the nighttime view which probably would have been better.
A memorable sunset, multi colored sky, rainbow included. Skip the glass floor section. Hanging over the edge will satisfy any adrenalin needs. Well worth the time.
First time for my Husband and myself, a great experience we had a drink and a bite to eat at the bar. Worth every penny, an experience i won't soon foget
A must see while in Toronto. Amazing view and great experience. Try to pick a sunny day for an even greater experience.

I've been there 3 times and I'm always ready to go back, it's great to be so high, employees are efficient and everything is well organized, loved the walking glass and am ready to go again for another tour

Went with friend to the top. Need to buy tickets for the lift. Fantastic view of Niagara lake. Weekends have long queues. Glass bottom floor on top gives a wonderful experience of the height!

Nothing really unique with the CN Tower that I saw. The usual panoramic views and option to walk around the edge of the tower at the top ($). If you enjoy that, then this is for you, otherwise, nothing to make it really stand out.
Incredable view. Friendly staff and great experience. The food is good, not fantastic but the overhall experience was very positive.

The tower is definitely worth a visit and worth the money.The views from the top are magnificent and you can see the whole city. Going on the top of one of the highest buildings in the heart of down town Toronto offers an unmatched views of the city, lake, Rogers centre and AirCanada centre. I consider it the top tourist attraction in the city.

My husband and I had been here before but we took my 17yo son on this visit. We all had fun and enjoyed the views. We stopped in the small bar/restaurant to have a drink. It was dirty and not worth the cost. Overall, the Tower was a nice way to kill some time.

My husband and I have been here many times. We've experienced the Edge Walk, and the 360 restaurant. Both of which are amazing and i would absolutely recommend to anyone! We pre-booked this restaurant online at home as part of our stay in Toronto. The quality of the food and the service was impeccable and would recommend this restaurant for celebrating a really special occasion.

I can see why many millions come to CN Tower. The views are spectacular! I DID stand on the glass floor, but did NOT stay for long....... Very spacious place. Never felt cramped, but then again, I came during the low season. I can just imagine the amount of people who will come in the summer time. Well worth it....

The CN Tower is the place to be if your one for heights. It is a great time for people of all ages. The view is marvelous and thrilling. I definitely recommend this as a place to check out! Although, lets not forget about the food! WONDERFUL! Although, I would recommend they have more options.

The CN-Tower is probably one of the things that you have to go to when you visit Toronto. You have a nice view over the whole city and can take lots of good pictures But just for the pictures and the view it is a little overpriced since you cant stay up there for a long time.

I guess when this was new, it was a big deal. Thirty years ago, we visited and were impressed. Now, however, with so many tall buildings, the CN Tower is sadly just one more. You only go so far with your first ticket and then have to pay extra to go up in that circular elevator, seems like a rip-off...

It is worth a visit on a clear day. One sees the city of some 4 million which is widely spread out to the west, north and east far beyond the horizon. Lake Ontario is south of it with the Island Airport nearby where planes leave and arrive beneath the viewer. On a clear day one can see the mist...
Ok, the view is pretty nice but not exactly good value. If you have the time you would be better off getting the 4 attraction pass and seeing more of Toronto.

Had an absolutely great time with a group of people for dinner at the CN Tower. The food was excellent with superb service. Couldn't ask for a more beautiful night with a full moon and the city lights. The moonlight was reflecting off of Lake Ontario which made if even more spectacular. A very memorable night.

It's an uncomfortable feeling having only 5 inches of glass between your feet and the earth - but if you can get past the fearfulness, it's quite a sight straight down 1800'!!!The story of the building of the Tower is on panels around the inner observatory. The outer ring is screened but windy. On a clear day you can...

I don't know the cost because we went for dinner at the 360 restaurant first and that gets you into the viewing level as part of the deal. Views were great. Standing on the glass floor.....yikes - but you have to do it. It's so cooooollllll.

I do not live far from Toronto and have always wanted to go inside the CN Tower. It seems to be the building that everyone recognizes. Some clear days you can see it across the lake from Hamilton. I had dinner in the fancy restaurant with my boyfriend. The food was excellent quality. The service was excellent. The tower and...

I have absolutely no head for heights... My feet feel like lead and my spine tingles intensely.... but still I do the tourist thing.The CN Tower is a great way to see Toronto!. I know this sounds stupid, even as I type it, but it is higher than you imagine from street level. You really do get a sense...

We went at night to CN tower. The city looked fabulous from that high, equal led the Empire State view.The restaurant looked prices but you can have a drink and a meal in the bar, fab views, but prices but with the view worth it.

After having gone up the Empire State Building in NYC and the John Hancock Tower in Chicago, I found the CN tower to be a little overrated. Keep in mind that we did not go up to the SkyPod, and in a way I almost wish we had because on the main floor there is a lot of mesh wiring...

How do you visit the Toronto without a trip to the CN Tower. We had a beautiful day with clear skies and low winds - thank goodness! The view is spectacular. The lines are a bit long, but we went on their mobile app standing right there in line got our tickets and stepped out of line!The tower is...

We went here with my son's high school orchestra and really enjoyed it. There is a glass bottom that you can take pictures looking straight down from. Great views of the city. I absolutely recommend this if you're visiting the city.
We were impressed by the quality of the food ,the service was very good and the view exceptional ! a bit expensive.
Went up the CN for a meal with friends. The whole experience was great , food , staff , views.Well worth doing
It's a high tower where you can see the city. The main attraction is walking on a glass floor (very exciting!).

If you are afraid of heights....maybe try another attraction. This was a cool attraction with lots to see. We paid extra for the pod but didn't find value in that. It should be part of the regular admission price. The glass floor was scary but cool.
I enjoyed it a lot it was a very wonderful experience it took several steps to get up there it was worth it

One of the best visiting place in Ontario.. Visited second time.. I felt taller being there.. Whole city can be seen.. It is of 553m above sea level. Visual treat of city life, flying planes, travelling boats, trains n buses, cars etc.. Glass floor was amazing..

Few queues as weather was slightly overcast. Informative displays, good views, helpful staff. A must see when in Toronto and is worth paying the extra to go up for additional views (a further 32 storeys)

the great thing about the CN tower is that its next door to the Aquarium and Rogers stadium so you can do all 3 at once. There is currently some construction going on at the main entrance but still has lift access so no real issues, just spoils some pictures. Also look great from a distance.

This is the top place to eat in Toronto. Pun intended.As a teenager I brought important dates here for a sunset dinner. Now I bring my young son.I always enjoy the food and have a good time.When you reserve dinner the elevator trip is included in the dinner bill.

Awesome adventure. Great view on the way up and down. Awesome views from the observation decks. Didn't really care for the glass floor viewing area, at least not to stand on it. I recommend it. Also recommend getting the Toronto City Pass, to significantly cut down on waiting in line.

The CN Tower is incredible. The view of the city is breathtaking, specially the glass floor. As other tourist attractions, the place has a gift shop where you can find good souvenirs for you and your family.

It's a sunny and warm day. The sky is clear and blue so we can enjoy a wonderful of the tower. Everywhere you go, you still may see the tower and we couldn't resist the temptation of taking photos every time we saw it. It's just magnificent.

Went to the CN tower when visiting friends. We had dinner in the reloving restaurant and timed it so we would be there for sun set. It took a while to get used toThe movement of the resturamt but after a few minutes you didn't notice it. The views were amazing and we got to see the best of...

Travelled here years ago with my mum, aunt and 2 young cousins. I still have clear memories from back then but it is certainly a landmark worth visiting especially early evening when the city starts to light up.

We went for dinner, which included admission to the observatory and glass floor. Dinner was so-so, not to mention pricy, but we really went to enjoy a clear evening view which made up for the mediocre meal. Probably better to have lunch there or just go on regular admission during sunset so you get a day/evening view. The glass floor...
If you are in Toronto, worth the visit for sure. Really nice view to downtown and to Toronto Island.Pay attention to the options available, higher the level, higher the price.
Great views and worth the cost for the experience. We also dined in the 360 restaurant at the top of the structure. Enjoyable experience.
You can see all toronto city from this tower and can experience the glass door on this tower.. Its feel good to have this experience.. Standing on the glass and see tha the city is below you

If you don't have time for anything else in Toronto, be sure to go up the tower. In clear weather you can see as far as your eyes will allow. It gives you a great appreciation for just job far the city stretches.
Excellent place ,glass roof experience... View Toronto city......Billy Bishop airport ...but ticket little expensive...

This was the third time I had been up to eat at the tower -- just great fun to spend an evening with friends while slowly taking in the city. As to our food, which was fish we were quite happy with our choices. The wait staff were attentive. It s just a very comfortable way to spend an evening....
If you want to see the city this is the place to do it, spectacular view, day we went it was extremely windy but well worth the view. Staff were fact oriented and friendly

Interesting place to check out with lovely city views and there are murals to explain its construction and history.April seems a good time to visit Toronto....not too many visitors and weather was cool but sunny
Great view - we did it at night after having dinner at the revolving restaurant. You can't come to Toronto and not go to the top of the CN Tower, it's iconic.

Certainly well worth a visit. 58 seconds and you are 114 floors up with the most panoramic view of the city, the water and the small airport on the island. Lovely staff ready to help you with your questions and a nice restaurant to have a light lunch in.

I went there for the first time with a good friend. It was a beautiful night and an amazing view. Super fun way to spend the evening. While it was a little bit expensive, if you've never been here before I think it would definitely be worth it!

Awesome structure with views typical of other similar towers. We went early just before all the class trips & tours got there so no wait getting in. Nice, safe location with a pretty good gift shop though they were out of the best t-shirts in the best colors. Glad we went but the real beauty of this structure is the...
The plane descended out of the clouds, and there it was, I have been up it many years ago, but it was great to see it again, brought back so many wonderful memories of a nice holiday in Toronto.

I feel CN Tower is a place that you have to check out if you go to Toronto. The problem I had with it was that it was packed and took forever, it was also very expensive. I forgot exactly how much but to ride an elevator to a tower it was excessive. There is a cool view from the...
Fun and visual, great for photos and OK for dining with a view. $35 per person is too much - should not be more than 15

I personally think seeing it from a bit of a distance shows it in its glory (for picture purposes) there are several great places to do this where your not right beside it.-the beaches , other tall buildings, parks in Missisauga the over look into the Toronto harbour.This is free to take pictures from a distance, to go...
We bought the linch package and it was heaven to sit with that tremendous view of Toronto and be served great food with great company. Our waiter Abu was the best!

One of those experiences you really can't miss whilst in Toronto. Queuing for tickets on a busy national holiday was a bit of a trial, likewise the wait for the lifts 'up and down'. Well worth the admission fees, breathtaking views from the top pod and a well priced restaurant with a stunning vista. Not something I would do again,...
It's been a while since I last visited but one can't miss visiting this place coming to Toronto. This is the best way to see Toronto. Long to visit again.
Clear view of Toronto which is mesmerizing and if you plan to do edge walk then just go for it, adventurous !!
One of the best restaurants we have dined in with the added extra of a fabulous view. Tables, linen and cutlery top notch and food exquisite. It was all unhurried service and worth the cost.

I lucked out and arrived into Toronto fairly early on a really pretty day, so I used my ticket for the Tower. The views are awesome, and the glass walk is fun! I was kind of surprised that it closes before dark! Being accustomed to the three NYC towers that are open late (Empire State Building, One World Trade, and...

Good view of the city, but make sure you go on a clear day. The tower is expensive for what it is. Something to cross of the bucket list. I think the Skylon Tower in Niagara is better value for money.
Or watching the bottom line ? everytime we go we see a whole bunch of new buildings. The upside, none of them are that tall. Glass floor is interesting.

I grew up, and live across the lake from this great city. I've visited Toronto at least annually for almost 40 years...and I FINALLY went up in the tower with my son. It was fun. It was not a clear enough day to see Rochester, NY across the lake, but the views were amazing. Definitely a must if you are...
We went to the top, including the sky pod, when the weather wasn't great (wet/rain) but the view was still great, the lift up takes no time at all, and the glass floor was worth seeing/doing too.

You have to go up the tower at least once, so don't skip it. Not cheap at $32 ($23 for seniors or children) but, wow! For a even better experience eat at the 360 rotating restaurant. That will cost you $65 but that includes the ride up. There is also a restaurant on the visitor level but you have to...

We booked a table for 6pm to celebrate our sons 21st and the lift ride and access to the viewing centre etc were included as part of the package.Our table was by the window as requested and the staff were most friendly and helpful throughout. The food was also delicious!Whilst we ate our meal we revolved twice and...

I can never get enough of the CN Tower, but it is pointless to spend the money if it is foggy outside. Thankfully, the weather was stunningly clear and bright outside when I went. The glass floor is unsettling, but the view of the city is breathtaking. I could look outside for hours.Best money spent if you are into...

I visited Toronto for the first time and wanted to see the Hockey Hall of Fame. I did just that and toured the area as well. I went Toronto on the Trolley tour and enjoyed every stop. I did not think that the CN Tower would be fun but was surprised by the experience and the view.The elevator ride...

The tower is a good attraction with fun entertainment and a nice view of the city, but if you have to take a big line and pay over 20 dollars for it, it's just not worth it. We went up for free and had a really nice lunch at the restaurant, which has an awesome and better view. Great food...

Definitely go in here, and stand on the glass floor if you are brave! Couldn't get a better place to see the city. I will go again at night, if they have that available. (check on that) Take the whole family, it's amazing.

In short, you get what you pay for. The views are fantastic. The price in my opinion is a little too high, but on the other hand the attraction could end up being too crowded (or too hard to get tickets for) if it was lower.
Go to the top! Find the glass floor and look down, once you get over the initial fear it's a great view.A bit windy on the outside but really worth the visit.
Had a wonderful view of the city. Paid a little extra this time for the second elevator ride to the top observation deck and had an even better view.
Fab views over the city and the lake. The meal is expensive but well worth the visit for a special occasionThe steaks were halal and that was a real bonus.
This is a must do on a clear evening as the sun is setting. The lights of Toronto at night are just beautiful, and you can see for miles.

CN tower is your typical tourist attraction with the added bonus of a great restaurant. If you enjoy seeing a fabulous view, it will be worth the expense. If you aren't into high places or fabulous views (on a clear day its amazing!), you may want to skip it because it is costly.

A most see if visiting Toronto for the first time as if offers great views of the city and an exiting experience, best if weather is clear for better pictures. Going to the second observation area is at extra cost, a little expensive, should be less or even free on my view. Nice to sit on the 360 degree restaurant...

I know that everyone will tell you if you are in Toronto you must visit the CN tower but honestly it is nothing special. It's so expensive especially if there is a few of you going. We took my cousin who was visiting we paid $160.00 just to go up,look around walk across the glass floor and leave. It was...

Sometimes you just have to do these things. Great views (though not for the faint-hearted!) and there's even a glass floor if you're feeling really brave. Expensive admission for what it is, and there are plenty of attempts to sell you photographs and overpriced tourist tat so the cost could soon mount up for families. Fun but not unmissable.
Had a excellent meal but didn't book! Luckily we took a last minute cancellation so recommend booking.Would have been a 5 star but service let it down

Make sure to take advantage of lower area, which is safely screened, but not entirely enclosed. Has a more "real" feel with the wind, etc. Glass walk is also nice feature. Go towards sunset for amazing view.

We were lucky when we visited the tower there were no queues and it was a sunny day with great visibility. The views from the top and the perspective through the glass floor were stunning. The gift shop at the foot of the tower has many quirky and unusual souvenirs.
Unique architecture structure of the world. One of the best place to visit. Me and my family had a great time. Located in the best location in the city. Excellent experience to visit this place.

When you are in the observation deck you can see well past the outskirts of Toronto and the view is incredible. If you have never been I would recommend you eat at the restaurant as then you get a free trip up, if not you have to pay $35 for each adult - instead you can use that towards your...

I spent a few hours up the top, gazing at the beautiful city and lake; to ensure I got my moneys worth. At the end of the day, a city looks like a city and if you've been up a skyscapper before you dont need to do it again. Something to do once or twice in a lifetime for sure...

The CN Tower is a prime tourist attraction and landmark in Toronto. I had been up to the restaurant as a guest a number of years ago, but had not taken time to actually take in the whole experience (the restaurant rotates, which is an experience, especially at night).So on this occasion I went the whole tourist and bought...
It was a wonderful day and I have to say I liked walking around on the glass floor outside. It's not for people who are afraid of heights!

We had a young guest from Germany for five months and this was among the final tick-the-box items for him. Dull, gray wintery day, and yet the anticipation, the procedures, the novelty of finally doing something he'd been looking forward to - well, it just nailed it.It doesn't matter what kind of day it is, and this visit in...

Ate here with my brother, when had lunch and drinks before we left Toronto and was a great way to end our trip. The food was of amazing quality and a good selection, the price wasn't cheap but when compared to the price to go to the viewing platform alone it isn't bad. The view while you eat is unparalleled,...
Everyone has to go at least once but be prepared for crazy-long line ups.Restaurant messed up our order and was wicked-expensive.
Worth every penny, best to go on a clear day so you can see the falls. The glass floor is awesome. Pay the extra to go all the way to the top, it's worth it
Definitely worth visiting when in Toronto. Especially if you're there for the very first time. A little pricey but the view is just breathtaking.

great to go to. I would go for lunch. wonderful resteraunt and that way you do not have to pay to go close to the top. You also get to look at our city from east to north to south. A great way to have lunch

The CN Tower Experience is a must for anyone visiting Toronto. We arrived in the late afternoon and there were no crowds at all. The Observation Level offers outstanding views, whether you are viewing from the inside or from the outside. But the one view that is unique to any other view on any other observation tower is the view...
its one of those things you have to do - whether you are a visitor or local. Take in the view of toronto.

Went on a morning trip, it was a nice ride up to the tower, once on top the view was breath taken even tho it was of season they were pretty busy, for some reason the revolving restaurant was closed. The weather was perfect, clear but cold
It takes a while from start to finish but this is an attraction that is worth the cash. Choose a sunny day for the greatest vista.

My son and I flew to Toronto for the David Gilmour Pink Floyd Concert. His first time to Toronto. Wanted him to enjoy the views from the CN Tower. He is also a photographer. While it was raining part of the time and partly cloudy, it was an interesting site visit to see all of Toronto from above.

Really enjoyed this restaurant the view across Toronto was amazing and as you were high up the view was uninterupted across the whole of the city. The service was excellent and the food was too, this was one of the highlights of our trip, well worth it.

This is a must see for anyone in Toronto. I have been many times and it never fails to amuse me. Great gift shop and views. The glass floor is in my mind the pinnacle of the CN tower. Don't miss the new aquarium next to it also!

The glass elevator ride up might be their favorite part of the trip. The views are picture worthy and the glass floor was a hit.Tip: Buy the city pass ahead of time so no standing in line and includes the aquarium, zoo and a few others.

Good place to get a view of the city, we didn't do the space pod, but the view from the main observation desk was quite good. Not much to do up there apart from the view. There's a glass floor but its not above anything too exciting.

I've a love/hate relationship with the CN Tower. It's over-priced, but not over-rated. Recommendation... eat in the restaurant at the top. The elevator is included with your meal, making the meal quite affordable and you get a relaxing 60-minute revolution. I recommend it, because it is what it is but be prepared to spend more money than you intend to...

Towers tend to be a bit of a hit-and-miss experience, and Toronto's CN Tower tends to be more of a miss, but for reasons that people don't recognize. The tower is often one of the things that is visited first when someone is looking to visit Toronto, but they fail to understand what makes Toronto special, and that is the...

CN Tower is a “must see” for all visitors to Toronto. Listed as one of the seven modern wonders of the world, the tower provides views as far away as New York on a clear day. Walk into the CN Tower’s Horizons restaurant and pick your table/view while you enjoy a casual lunch. Well worth a visit, and don’t forget...
It is perfect for viewing Toronto from a different angle, make sure it is not cloudy for better pictures, great restaurant, and gift stores.
For sure it is not that cheap to get up but on a sunny day you will have an awesome view. Currently the price is about 55 CAD incl. Skypod.

different view of TORONTO .. it does really give you pic of Toronto how big it is how amazing .. very fast elevator and guide always someone next to you ! when you go down they have shopping centre especially for toronto and canadian daily life style
Obviously, you can't travel to Toronto without visiting the CN Tower. Tickets are priced reasonably and provide amazing views over Toronto. The highlight has to be the glass floor though!

You can miss it, though I think it is expensive! We booked dinner at 360oC and got our complimentary access to the Glass Bottom level. The views are amazing, but you need to check the weather in advance. We were lucky! After we got additional tickets for the SkyPod, which I would also recommend. From there we saw the crazy...
$35 gets you high enough, add $15 and you go to the top! Add some more and you can live dangerously - Tied to the outside!

This iconic landmark is a must on a clear day. The 360 views of Toronto and Lake Ontario are AWESOME.The legendary glass floor gives a great view of the ground and boy do you realise how high you are up.Fortunately the edge walk wasn't on the day we turned up as it was still to cold. If you...
We did this following the edge walk and the view is just superb. You really have to see it to believe it.It can get a bit crowded at peak times but it's worth the wait

The view from the tower is fantastic. Before the day I visit the tower, there was 10 mm snow. I saw a white covered Toronto and it was quite special in spring season. I recommend visitor should arrive before 11am. It is a bit crowd afterward.

$35 gets you to the observation deck of the CN Tower. You can walk around inside and outside. There is a casual restaurant there too. Love the glass floor. It was nerve racking at first but fun to experience. There is also a live video feed of people doing the edge walk. If your brave enough the edge walk looks...

Haven't been up the CN Tower in years I can safely say that the view never gets old.Elevator ride to the top only takes a minute.It's over 1100 feet high and the views are fantastic. The outdoor observation deck is enclosed in wire mesh/screening and makes it hard to get good pictures from there.The indoor observation deck...
Our visit to the CN Tower was surprisingly quick and easy. The ticket line and entrance line both moved very fast and we were at the top of the tower before we knew it. Great views on a clear day!
