I went to CN tower with my husband and mom. We had an amazing dinner and we had a great time while we were there. The view from the CN tower was so thrilling and exciting.

Hate to admit it but this makes the Empire State Building child's play, except they have the recorded tour. The Edge Walk is really windy and colder than below so bring a jacket even if you think you don't need it. You may at the top. Don't miss the glass floor. Takes some getting use to in order to stand...

You cant visit a city that hosts an iconic tower and not visit the top. We went twice on our trip because we had the Citypass and we also ate at the 360. It's much better to visit in the daylight as there wasn't as much to see at night. The glass floor is also much scarier during the day......
The glass floors are overrated as they cover a very small area with very little to see below. The rest of the views are fantastic, however.

I have been up the CN Tower a few times. It is high. I don't really like heights but I have kids. It is windy on the outside walk and cold so bring a jacket even in the summer.The inside is crowded and not much to see other than the view.Kids seem to love it. They like to...

Do not want to miss this awesome attraction in Toronto. The price of admission seems high but it is worth it. You can see so much from on high. Did not engage either of the restaurants but they were busy b

It think everybody that does not do skydiving or piloting an air plane should go at least once. The views are beautiful on the right day - open sky. On rainy days or overcast it is not worthy because the look up is above the clouds.Plan no more than an hour because there is not much to do up...
You need to experience it to love it! the view from the top is awesome, if you're in Toronto make sure to include this trip in you're itinerary!

I went to the cn tower with my friend while visiting him in Toronto. It's like a building site on the outside when you arrive. So when you go inside you buy your ticket 35 dollars plus tax. Then if you want to go higher is an additional 12 dollars PER FLOOR which personally I think is s rip off....
I enjoyed visiting the CN Tower and learning more about this iconic and historic structure. I recommend it for the entire family

Cheesy jokes aside, we visited the CN Tower because it's just one of those things you have to do while in Toronto. The main entrance was closed due to construction, but that didn't significantly affect our visit. The views are breathtaking. Understandably, there are barriers on the outdoor observation deck, however we felt they were too obtrusive and essentially ruined...

Wow, not only were the views extraordinary the build up was too. details of how the tower was build is shown all over the tower, really interesting and some great photos of back in the day.the restaurant was also fab....
I enjoy going to the cn tower over and over again its fun to go up in the glass elevator and look at a birds eye view of beautiful toronto
Had a awesome experience going up the CN tower. It was on my bucket list to do. And will go back again. Very cool to see Toronto from high above the skyscrapers!
The view from the top of the CN tower is awesome! The CN tower is also good for all ages, couples, families and friends!
I attended a large group dinner and the restaurant handled the group well, but it seems like a food factory. The views were worth the visit, but I probably wouldn't go there for a dinner on my own.
Honestly there are many other ways you can spend $35 especially if you have kids and get a lot more than a very quick ride to the top to see the city in an "aunt shell"!?! Not worth it...

The CN Tower in Toronto is worth the price provided you have a clear day. You can see for miles and miles. You can also do the SkyWalk if you have the nerve. It is pricey but worth the view if you have never been up there before. The kids loved being able to walk on the clear glass window...

I was lucky to have visited during the sunset. I was able to see a beautiful sunset along with the brilliant city lights coming on. Most beautiful views from the tallest structure in North America (Yes Its taller than One WTC which is a building and the CN tower is not...)

We visted and had dinner in the restuarant for New Years. The food was lovely and the view sensational. Unlike Sydney nothing really happens at New Years here a few little fireworks but you could not see them ver well. I would recommend it for the viewbut certainly not for New Years celebrations.
I guess you are paying for the view because I've had much better tasting food for half the cost.Too over priced for the quality and size

Of course if you are in Toronto for the first time the CN tower is a must-see, and the view is definitely nothing short of spectacular, but in the summer the lines are quite long and the tickets overpriced. However, it is definitely worth it to see the view once.
Towering over the city of Toronto is an amazing experience. From the views of the lake to the sprawling city, you will enjoy and appreciate this Canadian cities appearance. Please enjoy.

I have been to the CN Tower on many occasions over many years. I make it a point to take all of my friends there, if they are first-time visitors to Toronto. I find that it is nice to go up some time before dusk, and to stay until it becomes dark, so people can see the city during both...

Been here many times as a resident. The last time I did the Edgewalk and it is worth every penny. A once in a lifetime experience. I aways bring vistors to the CN tower for the view, sometime a nice dinner, and to experience all the surrounding area attractions.Old, but tried and true!
Have an excellent diner at 360 meters and see it all while the sun is setting.The Alberta rib is fantastic and the wines are excellent too!

One of the tallest buildings in the world provides an excellent view of Toronto and the surrounding areas including Lake Ontario. The restaurant in the tower is revolving and while a bit expensive, is a good experience. Kids enjoy the opportunity to be so high and there is also an open observation deck.
Took 3 grandchildren. We were more nervous than they were. Skip the rotating restaurant. That's more for a romantic night out for two.
Not a cloud in the sky so an amazing view. The tour at the top is worth some time. It still took me time to walk across the glass floor.

Visited here on a Sunday expecting it tobe busy but it wasn't. The CN Tower offers amazing views over Toronto and the glass floor is an experience on its own. Slightly pricey as they add the HST on top of the advertised price but overall a good tourist attraction and well worth a visit

This was just what we expected, a quick elevator to some great views of the city. We stayed here for quite a long time, watching planes go into the airport.It's not the cheapest attraction, but so worth it for the views!Just a shame that they're currently doing lots of work on the entrance so you go in through...

column3: National Capital Territory of Delhi, India
column4: The restaurant is located almost at the 118th floor at the CN tower. The place has a bar just below the restaurant where guests can wait for their table, the main restaurant is located just above and has a unique revolving floor. The edge seating is discomforting as you feel the revolution of the floor the max. The food is...
Loved the experience! Courteous staff. The views are fantastic. Once we got over our fears we really enjoyed ourselves.
Thoroughly enjoyed our visit to the CN Tower. We went at night so we could see the lights of the city, was so worth it!! Loved the glass floor and being able to walk outside.

$35 for a trip up the tower, another $12 to go even higher. The tower offers a great view of the city, it is definitely worth it if you are in to landmark towers etc. If you are on a budget it can be skipped. The restaurant closes early so no late night eating.
You must go see if you can manage get past your fear of heights. The 58 second elevator ride and glass floor observation deck were too intimidating for me..
I've been to many towers across the country and didn't feel the need to pay another $30 to go up another one. Enjoyed learning some history of the CN Tower.

Do you want to see all of the Greater Toronto Area, but on a time crunch? Visit the CN Tower and you'll be able to see all of the GTA in one shot! Not to mention Drake shot one of his music videos in the elevator here!

Visting Toronto and NOT going up the CN Tower may seem plain wrong, but I wouldn't put this on the top of my list of attractions. The view is fine, the glass floor at the top a thrill, and my kids loved getting blown about on the observation deck. But it cost three of us well over Canadian $100 to...
Very nice but expansive.. I dont think that the price for what u getting...any way it was great place to make nice photos and see toronto from the top.
What a rip! I couldnt believe how expensive it was, all to look at tall buildings... You couldn't even go outside because it was so windy. The whole thing lasted 10 minutes. Woopdy doo!

Iconic place to visit in Toronto, but very costly for a trip up a tall tower! Apart from the view, only thing I thought was special was the section with the glass floor that made it look scary. But is it worth the money? Don't think so.
I have climbed this tower twice and it was a challenge both times. Highly recommend this for people in great physical condition. Not for those who prefer the elevator.

The ride in the lift was exhilarating! Your ears pop on the way up and the view at the top is spectacular. I had sweaty palms walking over the glass floor which makes your heart jump a little, but all in all it was a great experience.Even had time to have a cup of tea and lunch in the...
An amazing structure that offers some incredible views not only of Toronto but on a clear day as far as Niagara.Glass floor is not for the faint hearted but incredible to see.

I've been to Toronto too many times to count but this was my first trip to the top of the CN tower. It was a great view on such a clear day! Would recommend to fo once. Our daughter loved the glass floor. Not much else up there and it was $95 for the family to visit, but something you...

Having got to the top of the tower, one wants to linger a while, and the temptation to eat comes easilyI inquired about a table and the bar man pointed generally in the direction of tables, with the minimum of effort on his part, and lounged on the barThe waitress came who was made of more energetic stuff,...
The scenery from the tower is nice however nothing different from what you see from other towers. It's pricey so I would recommend to buy a city pass so you can enjoy other attractions.

Some great views over Toronto, including the airport which was cool to watch. The glass floor and glass elevators were really great too. Didn't have the time or the nerve to do the walk around the outside, maybe next time!

We had been staying at Niagara Falls & had a beautiful falls view room and have been lucky in our time to go up many a tall building for views. The CN Tower was almost the same cost as the Shard in London but not nearly as amazing. The glass floor looked down on the aquarium so that was a...

My second trip to the CN Tower - Toronto's signature skyline building! Friendly and helpful staff ... fantastic views over this incredible city! I went on a Friday in April and there were no queues/lines. I understand waiting times can be up to two hours at busy periods. But don't miss it!

Lucky for us we went on a clear day and it wasn't too busy so not much queueing thankfully. The views from the top are fantastic and you can see the whole city. Well worth a visit up in the glass elevator as long as you are not scared of heights it's quite spectacular.
It's a must do here in Toronto.. You will love the views of the city and also you will enjoy the glass floor that you can stand on it .... not suitable for people with a fear of heights _ obviously-

This is something I'd do again! The wait wasn't too long. The lift up was a little scary because u can see outside. Once you're up there you can really enjoy the view! It is beautiful do go to the Skypod.
Haven't been up here for over a decade. I got the chance recently and it brings back memories. Can't believe how much Toronto has grown. View from the top is GREAT!

Definitely a place to visit when you're in Toronto. The view is spectacular and amazing if you can get up there to see a beautiful sunset. Dinner at the 360 is a great place to see the city in an hour as the restaurant rotates. There's really not much to do for young kids other than the glass floor. Personally...

The views of the city are good but we didn't think much of the glass floor. If you do visit this and are planning to also do the science museum and zoo plus a couple of others the citypass would work out better.

The CN Tower is a spectacular piece of architecture. The guides are good and helpful however like everything these days the chance to make more bucks from tourists is the name of the game. Before you go up the tower, have a picture. When on the glass floor - have a picture. Not sure that you get your money worth...

Going to CN tower is a must when in Toronto. The queue was fairly long however when with others the time seems to go quite quickly, children may find this test grade though!The view was fantastic , as was the glass floor - this took me some psyching up to do as I don't like heights. Crazy what it...

I like visiting high structures in general and the CN Tower was definitely an amazing tour, especially in a sunny day. You can get to the second stage for some 12 CAD$ more and get 100m higher, up to almost 500m! That's equivalent to a 150-storey building! Amazing. The glass floor in the lower section is fun. For those willing...

The view is terrific, the glass floor does require some mental challenge and the walk around the outside was bitterly cold. A little too much safety netting meant the best view was a floor above. It was a tad windy when I visited so the lifts were running slower. Quite pricey at $35 plus tax – (why is tax always...
I wasn't completely blown away but this is worth visiting if you're in Toronto. We went during the day but I'm sure the view would be beautiful at sunset or at night.
Fabulous meal...as expected. Service was a little slower but it was a busy night. I had more a little more patience than my husband.

What can one say about the CN tower that hasn't been said before? Visit in daytime and at night. You will get different impressions of the city.During the day, you will be struck by how much greenery exists in Toronto. At night, Toronto is beautiful, with the city laid out in grids, illuminated beautifully. It will make you appreciate...
incredible views from the 6, beyond what you have ever seen or expect to see. I would recommend dinner at the tower was incredible!

I know there are many popular landmarks to explore across the world that are highly rated for their remarkable landscapes to considerate visiting, but I’m here to tell you that the spectacular birds-eye view offered above the CN Tower holds the trophy for the tallest structure in Canada rising 1,800 feet above sea level. With various look-out levels to explore,...
The CN Tower is a cool attraction. I suggest going with a citypass. The Skypod View was better than all the other views. The glassflow was cool, I expected more.

The CN Tower was well worth the visit. Although it's no longer the worlds tallest structure, it's still a fantastic way to spend a couple of hours. In addition to the great view from the top of course.Be careful of walking too close to it when the weather has been cold. On the day we went there was ice...
Excellent tower which also enables you to go outside it also has a glass floor which is cool? Don't be fooled by thinking the buildings around it are taller it an optical allution.
Absolutely amazing! Fantastic, breath taking view from sunset to city lights. Good food at the restaurant. Just an amazing experience. Go if you can! :-D

I was there twice and the experience is amazing, it is a good place for have some dinner, the Skypod is very particular, the view is amazing in winter season, my family and me really enjoyed for afternoon and night hours being there.
The tower is a must when in Toronto, views simply beautiful. Lift is an experience as is the glass floor, it's scary to say the least!! Got to get photos on the floor though!!

We lucked out with a beautiful day so had clear views. A terrific way to see the city and gain perspective. We just did the basic ride up and were very pleased with that. There are 2 floors to explore, including the glass floor and inside and outside terraces. If you are a AAA member you get 10% off.

Summary: A must see attraction while visiting Toronto, Restaurant 360 if within your budget provides high value with a decent dinner and included admission to the observation deck. Great for kids and adults alike. Make sure you go on a clear day for maximum experience. Admission is a bit high priced but well worth it for the spectacular views and...
You can not visit Toronto and not go to the CN tower. Well worth every cent! You get a remarkable view of the city. A must see by everyone.
When you go to a big city you tend to plan for at least one really nice expensive meal, this is it. Starting at about $100 per person if having anything more than an entre, it was well worth it.

I'm a Torontonian and have visited the CN tower several times. It's definitely worthwhile to visit for visitors to Toronto esp if you haven't seen this before. The overall service is quite efficient and the elevator really does go at a good pace - be prepared to experience popping ears. There is a restaurant (the 365) up top which actually...

Toronto as part of a stop off on the say to Vancouver, and the CV Tower was a must!We went in the evening and the views were absolutely amazing from both the main pod and the sky pod had spectacular 360 degree views of the city and beyond.If anyone has a DSLR, make sure you take it (along...

We were lucky to visit in early April so got straight in as I imagine it gets very busy in the height of summer. The views at the top were amazing and it was lovely to have a coffee in the cafe looking out across lake Ontario. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Definitely worth a visit.

This isn't a particularly long visit but the views are well worth seeing. We had the CityPass so took advantage of the 50% discount on the Skypod tickets, this is definitely worth doing. The views are amazing and standing on the glass floor is a very strange experience. It can obviously be a little boring for younger kids though the...

So for someone who is petrified of heights I managed to go up the CN tower I must admit the lift ride is over in about 20 seconds or less but I had tears in my eyes. But I'm so glad I went what a view !!! We went in the evening so saw all the lights and it was...

Jaw dropping standing on the glass floor. I you want to conquer your fear of heights then standing on the glass floor will do it! The food at the restaurant was less to be desired for considering the price. However, the view makes it up for.To get the best experience, make sure you reserve dinner time which will allow...

This is one of the largest towers in existence. It was a bit pricy to go up to the top, but worth it. Amazing views of the city and water. Also, there is a plexiglass floor that you can stand on and look down. Such a cool experience.

The CN tower is one of those sightseeing visit which has to be made. The entire experience from travelling up in the elevator at 15 miles per hour ( made me feel a little uneasy) to the magnificent views at the top and of course standing on the glass floor which is a must part of the entire experience.Just...
My favorite part was standing on the glass floor while near the top of the CN Tower. Definately a great experience.

The hight of the tower is shortly covered by the fast moving lifts. The upper view gives the chance to look at the city in all directions & to have a new feeling of how Toronto looks like. The glass panel at the bottom gives you a real sense how high above trhe ground you are.

Must see visit while in Toronto! Looking for some amazing views? Then the CN tower is a must. You can see for miles from the tower. There is also the glass floor that shows you the street level from the tower. You can also go up farther by boarding a separate elevator on the LookOut Level to travel through the...
Great to see the view of the city, from the islands and to see everything from above. a bit pricey but must experience at least once. If you eat dinner at the resteraunt your lift ticket is free.
One of first places to visit if your visiting Toronto! did i mention that you can have dinner all the way up there too? Great experience!
One of the best views ive seen. You can even see the niagara from a distance. Great view even during the day. The glass floor is very scary and not for the faint hearted. Must visit!!!!!

From the major fast elevators that take you to the top to the glass floor to the revolving restaurant there is something for everyone. If you are an extremist...which I am not you can do the Edge Walk. Not for the faint of heart but I hear exhilarating. I have been here for corporate functions, family functions and just as...

This was not our first trip to Toronto, but it was our first time in the tower. We combined our visit with dining in the 360 Restaurant at the CN Tower. The weather was clear and the views were gorgeous. Must allow time for security screening and also to wait in line, but it was well worth it!

Haven't been up in ages but we had a friend in town so went for dinner. Clear night so we opted to go a bit before sunset. Not cheap, dinner was about $100 pp without alcohol but as tickets up the tower are about $30 each i guess it's a $60 dinner. The food was actually quite good, pleasant surprise...
Woah that is something. I'm still months later shaking from standing on the glass floor looking down into the stadium! it is a must see if you are in the Toronto area and well worth it.

A well run tourist trap, but still worth doing. After you get up to the main viewing platform, it costs extra to go to the very top (I think they call it the Skypod). Felt obligated to go to the top, but I would skip buying those 4 tickets if I had to do it over. The main floor and...

What is there to say other than it is magnificent and unparalleled in the world. What a treasure. One comment though:for people who have purchased tickets ahead of time to not have to queue up it would make sense for there to be a separate security line for them otherwise it defeats the whole purpose of pre-purchasing ticjets and can...

Looking through a guide to Toronto, I saw I could get tickets on line at discount and avoid the ticket line. I bought two, only to discover that I had tickets for a the Skylon Tower verlooking Niagara!Happily it was a short line at the CN Tower. The Blue Jay game hadn't let out yet. Cheapest adult ticket is...

Lineups were short, people were pleasant, and the experience is a must. I don't think it impressed me as much as it could have, but the CN tower is pretty awesome. As with most things like this, price is a factor, and parking in the area is terrible, but the tower didn't disappoint.

We visited on a particularly quiet day, but the entrance is well set up, and includes a security check. Staff were knowledgeable and worked efficiently to make sure you weren't waiting around for too long. The views were great from the top, particularly of Toronto Island. The glass floor is a nice touch, and there are staff waiting to take...
This was the tallest building in the world for decades. Even though it's not anymore it's still a beautiful structure & there's actually a lot to do there
Less than 2 minutes to climb 114 stories. Not for the faint of heart! Not cheap but worth it especially with kids.
Fabulous views, just got to do it. Don't attempt it however if you are scared of heights or have vertigo !!!!!!!

Went to the CN Tower since I have never visited it although living in an hour away for 35+ years. Not much going on there. Expect to pay $100 per couple. The views are cool and the glass floor is a favourite among visitors. There is a gift shop and a booth to buy a photo, both of which are...

Experienced the CN Tower from both observation decks. The higher one is smaller and costs a bit more, and probably isn't worth it. The price is fairly steep, but it is the tallest structure in the western hemisphere, so it is hard to pass that up.

The CN Tower was exactly what I expected it to be. The elevator up to the top was kind of freaky because you can see out the whole time. Views of the city were nice but the whole thing only took about a half hour.

It's the 2nd time of my life I go to Toronto and the 2nd time I go to the CN Tower.The view is always impressive.The 1st time we went to the CN Tower it was in August, so there was a little smog. I suggest you go during colder seasonal period like automn and spring.If you can...
If the weather is okay, this is a good attraction. Nice views over Toronto and the lake. Expect some waiting for the elevators.

360° Restaurant was well worth it! Portion size was perfect. Menu had a good selection especially for those who are picky. We all enjoyed the meal along with the views. We went with three children, aged 3, 6 and 8 and two other adults.

i have been here a few times now and love it we had the best meal ever here the view was amazing 360, if you go go when its sunset so you see the view in both day and night also take the glass floor walk its so good.

We got in just after 7 pm, no queue, clear sky, sunny day, just in time for sunset, all the way to the top. Yes the view is great, you can see across the lake. But it's also disappointing in a way, Toronto doesn't look great seen from above. Not that much to see really. We'd do it again 'cause...

Visited on Easter Sunday with my wife and two sons. We arrived shortly after opening and had a very short wait before heading up. View from the elevator was impressive, but nothing compared view from the lookout level. We were treated to amazing blue sky views in all directions. It was fun to be able to do a full circle...
Great views from the tower, as expected. Very minimal crowds, maybe because of the cold weather. We used CityPass and purchased it here. Friendly staff!
Not worth the money at all.The viewing deck isn't that impressive neither is the glass floor.In all honesty, the building looked more impressive from the outside.

Our second visit and worth it. Great views and even got my wife to step on the glass floor. Ate in the cafe this time..food was good and not too expensive by the standard of such places. Had an excellent poutine/ curry mix. Brilliant!

The CN Tower is one of the defining sights in Toronto at 550 metres high. The glass sided lift speeds you up to the LookOut at high speed. Our kids loved it and the glass floor where they could look down from a dizzying 346 metres high. With only the strengthened glass between you and the ground it takes guts...

Some queueing chaos due to building work was quickly worked through. Exciting lift to the top and great views across Toronto. The glass floor was less exciting than the sales pitch suggested - it was indoors, I had imagined something closer to the edge. Still worth the trip.
You get an awesome view from the top of tower+even more if go to the very top which there is a cheeky extra fee ! Ate in the restaurant which was fab+the 360 degree views were amazing !

Don't get me wrong the view was beautiful while I was the during night time.But for the 40+$ that I paid this is not enough.Being there around the evening the place was almost abandoned. I wouldn't pay more than 15$ for this attraction.

If you get the city pass and enjoy heights then stop by here. We got the pass and after attending the aquarium stopped by. Not being a fan of heights puts this stop as a "not really necessary" part of a family agenda.

The restaurant is able to offer delicious dish...I tried a starter and a salmon dish very delicate but the most unforgettable dish ....I had been the cioccolate cake...omg!!!! And during your lunch what amazing skiline...Toronto in all his beautiful essence...try it!!! And the crew is very professional and friendly also if your English is spoken by an Italian...???
Since it's only April and still cold and snow on the ground, the CN Tower was not too crowded, short lines going up. It's a must to go up, and if you are not afraid of heights, a must see.
I was freezing me up there, but the glass floor just mae my day. it was like walk on the hair. bestplace to go for abit of adrenaline

It's fine. Nice view of city. If you haven't been to a big city tall building with scenic lookout, you should probably go. I have been, so it was fine for a few minutes. I didn't like the fact that you had to pay extra to get up to the higher level once you were in.

I bought the Toronto city card which included a visit to the CN tower. What can I say? Of course, to be able to see the city of Toronto from that height is somewhat of an experience but in truth the view is not that impressive. Toronto is not London or Paris or Rome so what you'll see is a...

We didn't have a great view because of the snowy/rainy/foggy weather but it was still fun. The glass floor was scary with only being able to see fog beneath. The employees were all very nice and helpful.
It was my second visit to the CN tower. The views are amazing! I got the city pass to skip the lines. Great attraction, love the glass floors!
Had mixed feelings prior to visiting after some of the reviews on here but can't praise highly enough - was expensive but food excellent and ambiance great so when factored together brilliant evening

You can't come to Toronto without going up the CN tower! I have to admit the glass floor did make me feel a little sick and I couldn't walk more than 6" out on to it but there are plenty more views to be enjoyed for those who are prone to vertigo! There are both inside and outside viewing areas...

That's definitely a must for people that visit Toronto, I strongly recommend to visit it in the afternoon, then you get a chance to see the sunset and if you extend your visit you might have a wonderful view of the Torontonian landscape at night

I have lived in the GTA my whole life but had never been up to the CN Tower. I decided to take a tour and it was nothing special. The price was around $50 per person and we decided to do dinner as well. I thought the dinner was great and definitely the highlight of the evening. The one thing...

Every time that I visit Toronto, I come to the CN tower.It's a beautiful area that is ever improving.The glass floor is still fun to jump on and take picture straight down from.You can't beat the view from outside.

I felt this Tower was expensive for just an elevator ride and when you got up there the food was of a two star restaurant with prices of a five-star restaurant save your money and skip this one there's much more to do in Toronto

Either pay $35 or get lunch/dinner reservations will give you access to the observation deck. Awesome views. The lunch/dinner will run you about $65-85 per person but it is very good, and you get access to the decks and awesome service.

This is one of those touristy things that you just have to do in Toronto, but it's definitely best to do in warmer weather so you can enjoy the outdoor deck. Regardless of the weather, the view is really nice. The price is steep, but again, it's just one of those things you have to do.

Thought it would be another travel trap, but also a great to see the entire city. the folks downstairs selling the tickets and giving information could have scared us away with their lack of interest and knowledge- but we went up anyways- paying the expensive price. Views were awesome. We ended up eating at the casual restaurant on the observation...

On a clear day you can see forever it seems. We had a great view of Lake Ontario and the city. The high speed, glass front elevator gets you to the top in under 60 seconds. There is a glass floor area one story below where the elevators deposit you at the top. There is also the option of going...
Amazing experience. It was really cold out there, but the view is breathtaking. It is not cheap at all, but it worth.
skyscrapers are small when you are up top there....nice is a must...a restaurant up there...can have lunch...have a drink...the view is spectacular..
It's a usual tower but with glassed lift. We missed explanation of the view and it was crowded. Nothing special.
Incredible views and fun ride to the top. get the city pass and enjoy this and many other exhibits for an affordable price.

Standing on the glass floor the glass floor was a weird feeling. The elevator ride up was a thrill. The staff is wonderful. The views are incredible. I believe we were able to see all the way to New York. This is definitely worth experiencing if you're in Toronto. Especially if you buy observation tickets to the skypod and the...

This was one incredible experience going up the CN Tower. Since I saw the tower as a kid I wanted to see it. It was thrilling to go all the way up. This must be one of the top 10 best things I have done.

The views from the CN Tower are awesome. The price is a little steep but worth it for the views you get of the city. They have a glass floor on the top so you can look straight down from above. Very awesome experience

As a Brit I don't often get chance to stand atop one of the tallest structures in the world, the views were sublime and truly something to behold. Perhaps urban travellers may take this experience for granted but I enjoyed seeing one of my favourite cities from this unique perspective, a must do!

So we paid the admission to go up to the first level (the restaurant level) only. This level includes the glass floor feature. We went while the restaurant wasn't serving food (only drinks) mid morning, we were able to get full 360 degree views because we could walk through the restaurant part (apparently you can't do this when they're serving...
Stunning views across the city and the lake. Cool is the glass floor to stand on and look down. The elevators have an impressive speed!

I first went up the CN tower 33 years ago when it was the tallest and I was a lot younger and more impressionable. I was every bit as impressed this time. The whole experience is fantastic. The only tip I would give anyone is that if you are considering eating in the 360 restaurant, then do it and don't...
Great food and view. Go just before dusk to enjoy the city of Toronto transforming during and after sunset.

A group of us went to the restaurant at the CN Tower for an evening meal. It was a fantastic experience. The night sky was beautiful, the meal was very delicious and the portion size was large. I enjoy my Martini and the ambiance. Great night!
An Icon for Toronto, and a must do on any trip. You get amazing views not just of Toronto, but beyond.

The CN Tower was a short walk from our hotel and is well worth a visit it has 2 restaurants the 360 @ (1150ft)and Horizons @(1136 ft). High speed lifts take you to these levels on the outside of the tower . You have to pay extra if you wish to do the Edge walk on top of the 360...

We went there twice. First time was absolutely stunning! The Glass Bottom is much fun, and not for people scared of hights.Our second visit was for watching the sunset. SO romantic and amazing to see Toronto at night, too.I loved the idea of the edge walk, but it was too cold when we visited, so it was not...
Great place to see the city, not too expensive and great way to see the harbour. Beautiful restuarant with lovely food, definitely worth booking if your going up for a look.

Went up the CN tower on a crystal clear day. What a view of Toronto and Lake Ontario. You have to do the glass floor. Even though I know that the floor wood not break it is just a creepy feeling looking down.

I love views and I must admit I was a bit disappointed by my visit to the CN tower. Paying almost 40Cad per person is too much, when half the view is blocked by the "horizontal bar" and the guests there. The glass floor is fun and there is a bit of information/fun facts about the tower and we also...

Have been several times. This is a must do, if you have never been. Kids will definitely enjoy, at most ages. Lines can be very long in the summer, so buying tickets ahead will save time. Security for this attractions is similar to airport security, so be prepared for an intensive security process. Food is very expensive at the top,...
Great food, great view, great service. What else can you ask for? I secretly wanted to lick the plate.

Went to 360 for dinner. View was spectacular! Rotating throughout dinner was different but slow enough that it wasn't unpleasant. The restaurant was pricey but completely worth it. The food was delicious!

What a great view, we see something amazing every time. My 10yr old liked the history lesson and our 2 & 5 yr olds liked watching the island airport. Great spot to kill time while waiting for a Blue Jays game. I have eaten at the rotating restaurant before at night and it is quite the experience!

I've been to this landmark several times and it continues to fascinate me each and every time. The addition of the glass floor some time ago is very cool although I will say that walking on gives me some amount of anxiety but I suppose that's just me....lol. Always a breathtaking panoramic view, equally impressive at night!

Ride the elevator to the top and walk on the glass floor if you dare! Was a little off putting looking down from the glass floor at that height....definitely avoid that section if you are scared of heights! Could not do the edge walk when I was there due to weather. You get a great 360 degree view of Toronto...

The family loved the CN Tower, however I'm not one for heights. We used the Citypass which was excellent value for money and would definitely recommend. We visited at 10am in the morning and we had the place to ourselves for breathe taking views.

Dragged my daughter up on a nice sunny afternoon for a great view! The 58 second elevator was cool and the glass floor was pretty unnerving. We walked outside and around in the observation deck. Worth the money in a City Pass, not sure on its own. The City Pass is the way to see the major attractions. Saved a...
Great, quick tour for a sunny day. Plenty of fun to walk out on the glass! Buy tickets online in advance so you don't have to wait in the line.

My family spent hours in the tower on both levels and had lunch in the horizons cafe overlooking the city. It is not inexpensive but definitely worth the visit. My kids loved looking through the glass floor, I did not:)

This is not for the faint of heart~it is as high as being in a plane and the restaurant spins 360 (hence the name) as you dine, There were several times that I found myself feeling slightly anxious but since it was my idea to dine there I was able to pull it together and stop freaking myself out. one...
Even if it's the "Attraction" in Toronto this is a must seenThe view from the top of the tower is great

We booked dinner for two in the 360 restaurant and it certainly did not disappoint. We were a little apprehensive after reading some of the reviews on here but had no need to be as it was an amazing experience. Of course there is always going to be a better restaurant but no where else has those views! The large...
A must if you are close stand at the base. Go for a ride. It's a true Canadian icon. So awesome to touch the base. The view of the lake is unreal. What a structure. Love being in the whole area.

We felt safe with the security check they did at the base of the tower. Staff was friendly and helpful. They had my son concentrate on reading the words on the wall to get him to walk on the glass floor. I think some of the murals could be updated because they still have it as the tallest tower in...

Tallest tower to see the best aerial view of Downtown Toronto. I like most is dining in its restaurant while watching the view and the price is good. If you are not scared of heights, try the edge walk. It can be a short or half day visit depending on what you want to do. Beside it is Ripley's Aquarium...

It you are visiting Toronto that a must go place, we went there on a rainy day so view was not great but it was still worth it. I recommend to go there on a clear day to enjoy the most. The lifts are super fast and their glass walk on the top floor is the killer. You get snacks...
Loved it but wish skywalk would be open on nice days. We went and the weather was 65 and it was still closed
This place has amazing views. Even though our days was rainy and foggy we were still able to see Toronto. Staff is very nice and polite. We had great time.

You kind of have to visit when in Toronto, the tower dominates the city and is hugely impressive. You can see for miles from the top but there really isn't anything spectacular to look at. Looking down at the Rogers centre through the glass floor is kind of cool. It's a shame they used half of the viewing area on...

CN Tower is one of the most beautiful landmark in Toronto. We go there every 2 years with the City pass. My daughter likes to be on the glass. Love the restaurants. food is great. If you are brave and have no problem with heights try walking on the edge. The view of the city is spectacular in the night....
Really enjoyed this, brilliant views of Toronto and a great experience. Get the city tour tickets so you can visit some of the other attractions too as it's much better value.

Although I live in Toronto, I love going to the CN tower over and over again. The glass floor is an awesome place for a proposal and the revolving restaurant at the top is a great culmination to the evening.

We decided to take the kids up the CN Tower during March Break. We were a little concerned about how busy it would be, but we were in and up in pretty good time. It is a bit pricey, but it is also quite amazing. The view from the glass doors of the elevator was spectacular! You rise right above...
A view like no other of the cityscape of the city of Toronto, a stunning lake view of Lake Ontario and the Toronto Islands.

The CN tower is a attraction on your list to do if you visit Toronto. The queues were minimal this time of year and we didn't have to queue for the lift. The views up the top are stunning and the lift which takes you up over a hundred floors in less than a minute is awesome. Once you've walked...

Not much to say that the view is great and this place is an iconic place to go in Toronto. You must do, it at least once. If you are a tourist, like I have mentioned before on other attractions, get the City Pass, you save money and avoid long lines for tickets.

An amazing experience. Fantastic views across Toronto and Lake Ontario.Lift takes 58 seconds. I have a few issues with my ears so worthwhile taking some cotton wool with you if you do too plus be careful re the thinner air. However great experience and one definitely worth doing.

I went up through the restaurant, which you have to commit to spending $65 - since the cost to go up anyway is $35, consider it as you get a great meal for $30! I also went at night, and I love city views. It was a nice relaxing way to enjoy Toronto while the restaurant spins around and you...

My husband and I got the toronto city pass and this was the first thing we did and loved the views of the city and the lake. In the back of the city pass is a coupon for 50% off the additional higher viewing area.

Stopped here for lunch and it was such a good idea and a great way to eat whilst sightseeing. Gives you an amazing, 360 view across the whole City. Food prices are very reasonable too. 2 Courses cost CAD55 and the food was delicious. I would suggest you give the CN Tower a try! Make sure you make a reservation...
We visited here on a recent trip and was amazed at the view from the top! You can really appreciate the size of Toronto! The see through glass floors were also interesting!
Great food and service and the view is spectacular!! Would love to make this a place for yearly dining!

A classic visit. Enjoy the view of Toronto and its Lake from above. You need about 1 hour to go around. There is a restaurant at the top if you wish to grab a bite or a drink while you look at the scenery. The see-through floor wasn't great, we could barely see through it.

I wasn't expecting much to be honest when visiting the CN Tower, its an old tower with a glass floor that looks directly down at the ground. Not much to see other than the lake and some buildings. The lines were long and I was greeted with a forced "welcome to the CN Tower" every single time I saw an...

360 restaurant is a great place for couples. The restaurant is very romantic place to have dinner with, with your special someone. The view, the environment and the food were fantastic. I couldn't complain I had fun going there. It's also great for family time also. My 8 years daughter loves the place and she keep saying I want to...

We were fortunate enough to go shortly after a rainstorm so there were few people here, but the views were available. I was a bit creeped out when I stood on the glass floor and peered down, but I bet the kids would love it. You can't go to Toronto and skip this attraction!

It's pretty. And you can see it from the ground. The cost to go to the top is astronomical for what you get ($35 for adults plus an additional $12 to go all the way to the top). What you get is an amazing view of the city and a chance to walk over some glass that will make even...
I Love This!! What can be a better place than this??? This Skyscraper can be seen from Mississauga too! Will plan for another visit soon! That rotating restaurant is one of its own kind! ??
I've been to the CN Tower many times. The view is stunning. But ever since they got better lighting on the CN Tower's exterior, it's even cooler now. Not it's fun to go at night now too.

We arrive early in the morning 9ham to avoid the crowd. Good thing we where only 15 persons. So we had time with kids to enjoy the view & the glass floor.If you want to buy a family pass, take good note only available on line. If you walk in they charge you individually. I save about 40$ doing...

Although its an amazing view, on a clear day.... I consider $35.00 for an elevator ride a bit much. But, it did make my wife and kid happy. Security line was long, moved slow. I hate staying in line for things I like to do, so this did not make me happy. Yet another line waiting to buy tickets, and...
We went late afternoon to see the sunset and to have our dinner and it was a perfect experience. Beautiful views, perfect dinner!!!
Fun way to see Toronto and learn about the area. You can linger for as long as you would like. The glass floor part is fun, but you can avoid it easily if it's not your thing.

Everything was perfect from the entrance to the gift shop. The security guards on the entrance where very polite and even asked us about out trip. The employees where very pleasant to talk to. The main reason of the visit was the restaurant, beautiful place. Good food quality, great service, amazing view. Our waiter, Scott, was exceptional, answered all of...

The CN Tower is a worthwhile visit. It can be busy, particularly on clear days when the view is best - but my suggestion is to brave the crowds for an enhanced view. A tip: consider splurging on lunch at the revolving 360 Restaurant. You can relax and enjoy some pretty decent food while your view of the city and...

Its always an experience to get up to the viewing deck and the glass floor. Try to go on a clear day. you can actually see the mist coming off Niagara falls from the top. And if you date yo do the edge walk, go for it. Once in a life time experience.

The famous Toronto landmark, CN Tower, is definitely worth the visit. The view at the top was stunning, I suggest visiting on a clear day. The view at night is great as well. However, the ticket was quite pricey for this attraction, and despite having many posters and information about its history, we did not spend a lot of time...

Stopped here to sight see and dine in the restaurant. If you are daring, step on the glass in the observation tower. If you are really daring, go up to the pod. The restaurant revolves as you dine. Very worth a visit.

A must, could see all toronto and lake ontario. Interesting facts about the attraction in the wall near the exit elevator, restaurants are ok. So cool that this tower was initially for communication purposes. Next to Ripley's aquarium and Blue Jays stadium!

Amazing structure and excellent views around the city. We went right before sunset and stayed as the lights came up in the city. We also went up to the sky pod which I would recommend. It's a little more intimate up there.
We went on a somewhat rainy night. No wait at all. Got right up to the top of the tower no problem. Great view! Definitely recommend the City Pass as this one can be a bit pricey on its own.
Worth seeing this place. We killed some time here before going to a baseball game. Expensive though for the amount of time spent there
This is a great tourist attraction. I really enjoyed it and recommend it. The view ai totally worth it. And the workers are very nice.

Wow what a view!! It took a little while to get through to the elevator but once we were going up it was amazing. 58 seconds and you are at the top looking through the glass floor the whole way. The see through floor was awesome although a little scary for the squeamish. Definitely worth the money don't miss out...
Huge line up, very efficiently processed with short waits. Great space although busy. Not as much info given by elevator staff on stats my boys would have appreciated.

It is the main attraction, nice. Try to go in a sunny day and no need to spend extra money to go to the second part of the tower, the first one gives you practically the same experience. The tower is right next to the Aquarium so try to schedule both visits on the same day.
Been there today on a lovely sunny day. Took photos, walked around, didn't go up to the tower this time as did many times before.

Not my type of tour; I knew it wouldn't be exciting, but decided to please my husband.I got the city pass because I wanted to go to the zoo and Casa Loma, and my lovely hubby want to tour CN tower. That being said, I didn't feel bad "paying" $32 for this tour (i actually don't consider I paid...
you will love this and you really have to walk on the glass floor its so cool. was scared at first but what a rush
spectacular! great views and great shopping for keep sakes and presents to take back home! purchase the pictures of your trip from the gift shop. they are worth every penny
Visiting the CN Tower is worth it to be able to see the whole city, experience being very in the sky. This building is pretty amazing architecturally. It is pricey but fun for thrill seekers.
CN Tower is a great way to see the entire city, actually to see the GTA and well beyond. we were there as the sun was setting and it was great for taking pictures and offered a fantastic view.
This was a fun activity. The ride up & down was exhilarating. The glass floor was a little freaky, but fun.

Great experience - top notch food and great service - server left us plenty of time to enjoy our lunch. Our kids ages 7 and 10 were made to feel very comfortable and enjoyed their lunches. Food prices seem high but are more than reasonable when you compare against cost of going to observation deck alone which frankly is a...
Pick a clear day and see across the lake. Book at the 360 restaurant to skip the elevator charge and lineup.

Visiting the CN Tower is a fun way to spend a day as a tourist, and even a local who hasn't been there in some time. The trip up the elevator is always thrilling, and the view on a clear day is spectacular. Standing on the plexiglass with the ground far below you is chilling!Recommended.
The food was great the staff were very friendly.....if you have a couple of spare bucks or a special occasion it's a place to go!!
A visit to this place makes you fall in love with Toronto! It's an extraordinary structure and a testament to the aspirations of the people of Canada!

All viewing towers feel the same to me but I thought due to the height this would be a bit more special but alas - just like every other tower I have been in. Good if you like views of building rooftops.

If you go to Toronto, you have to go up the Tower. It was off and on cloudy so we did not have the view that I would expect on a clear day. We spend some more money and went up to the top observation deck. While impressive, this part was spoiled by a huge group of kids kicking and...

Used a City pass to get in which helps bypass lineups. It was busy but not overwhelmingly. Views are astounding of the surrounding city/lake/area. Best viewed in good weather. Lineups to go up and down, went quickly.

We splashed out and had an early dinner at the top of the tower. Although fairly expensive you get free entry to the tower (which is not cheap) and if you go before dusk you get to see both daylight and night views. The teenagers really enjoyed it but not quite as much as the Blue Jays baseball game!
The wait to get up to the tower was longer than the time I spent there. Idk it wasn't worth my time but I live in the city. I did it once just to say that I've been there

Great views of Toronto from on high. There are two restaurants up the tower, 'Horizons' on the viewing deck level and the rotating '360' above it. To eat at the Horizon restaurant is reasonable with quality fare and you get a reduced price ride from the ground. Choose a clear day for the best views.

Did you know there's a play space for children in the CN Tower. A lot of fun , you have too keep a eye on your child a lot of different age groups We went upon the elevator a little hard on the stomach but what a view, it's beautiful to see this city from so high. The glass floor...
I visited the VN Tower with lots of friends. We enjoyed it very much since it's one the tallest towers in the world, if not the tallest.It is one of the biggest landmarks of Toronto
Its an amazing experience! The view from the top its not like any other. Take the time to enjoy a few hours.

We love the CN tower. We celebrated my husbands 50th there and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The glass floor was as far as I'd risk but my son and hubby did the skywalk and had a blast.I saw all ages enjoying this destination and it seems there is something for everyone.We ended the evening with dinner in the revolving...
Great view of Toronto. Like how major venues are so close together so that you can walk to the Air Canada Centre, The dome, it's compact and beautiful.

I visit many tower observatories around the world, but always enjoy coming back to the CN tower. Great views of the city and on a clear day you can see to Niagara Falls. Fun for the family, but I have been on my own, and with work colleagues when on business in Toronto. There are two levels, and it costs...
No visitor to Toronto should miss going up the CN Tower.Even if you don't spend the extra money for the Space Walk.

I took my 10 year old grandson here at spring break. There was quite a long line up for tickets, so we were glad that we had purchased our tickets in advance through the Toronto City Pass. My grandson thoroughly enjoyed everything, from the ride up in the elevator; to viewing the the city from the outdoor area, looking for...

It was amzaing experience. Loved the ride to the top. Spots to take photos.DEvn when it's busy and you feel that you wont be able to take any nice and clear shots.... just get creative and you will do fine.

One of the best ways to enjoy the CN Tower is for lunch or dinner which includes admission to the tower and preferential access to lifts which can become quite a delay on popular days. Besides the view from the rotating restaurant catching a sunset over a slow dinner is great as is the wine cellar.

the top top pod is super hot and confining not worth the 12$ bump for your party of 5, thank goodness we went up right away on the day before march break, the woman told us it can be 1-2 hour wait just to go up.

You looking for a spectacular view and to have great dinner? You got it. My family and friend's of the family (4 people) visited 360 recently. I have a reservation online. I always take friends from out of town up for a look at Toronto an it still amazes me to this day, a national treasures. Don't miss this Toronto Landmark

We had 2hours before going to the hockey game so we walked to the base of the tower. The line was short and the price acceptable given your going somewhere like no where else on the planet. The kids loved walking on the glass floor. We enjoyed the 360 views. The harbour was partially ice covered but the lake was...

The price of general admission for 2 people is about $80 Canadian. This gets you a view of 114 stories around the Toronto skyline.Is it worth 80 bucks to take a few pictures of Toronto's skyline and lakefront?
one of the must see things for first timers in Toronto, Great view of the city and lake, the tickets are a bit pricey but i still it was a worthwhile stop and see.

The empire state building impressed me but not til the point of this tower, and not cause it s 60-70 meters higher than the empire building, but for the view up there, on the east part the city, the high skyscrapers which look like dwarfs comparing to the cn tower, and on the other side the harlbour and the tiny...

If you have been to the Space Needle, you will find the experience at the CN Tower very similar. Purchase a ticket, ride up the elevator, look around the observation deck, and maybe eat at the restaurant while you're up there. When done, ride back down and get barraged in the gift shop. Not worth it.Too expensive for what it offers....which is not much.There is a caffe on the top ,so you have only half an hemisphere to take pictures from.

Was worth the trip on the subway downtown to look around and check this landmark out. Long lines and security checkpoints to tour the tower. Very near the Ripley Aquarium and other attractions downtown. Would NOT drive here, no where to park. Take public transportation or cab if possible to avoid this.

Being so far over Toronto is quite an awesome experience. I definetely recommend to buy the extra pass to go to the 450m high viewpoint. I think it was 10CAD more and it is worth it. I can not imagine they build this crazy building so long ago. Price may be a bit high but overall I think it is...

No tripster to Toronto can leave without the CN Tower experience. Deciding on whether to walk the edge into space, to eat at the restaurant etc...like all world class venues must be planned in advance re. tickets and the weather!The view is spectacular.

Ride to the top will offer you unprecedented views of Toronto. Outside elevators with glass floor is a bonus!Definitively not for people who are afraid of heights.You can also for about $100 Canadian dollars enjoy really scary moments when they strap you to the railing outside and you can lean and watch 100 stories down with just a...
Worth a trip up for the views but we did consider it quite pricey compared to the other sights and trips in Toronto. Glass floors are fun.

Great overall city view. We went in October. Took advantage of the "city pass". They have an option to hang over the edge ($100). Probably would have taken this visit to 5 stars but the price for the hang wasn't in my budget.

I went to the CN tower and was impressed. Everyone that worked there were very friendly especially the lift man who made going up 118 floors a fun experience even for someone who is scared of heights. So much that I even looks down through the glass floor on the way down. The only down side is how expensive the...
i have been here many times,and it never gets old. its such a great place to take family from out of town, the food is great also in the 360~

$34 general admission to the general viewing levels. yeah, the views are nice on a clear day. Not sure its worth the price of admission. I've been here before several times with out of town guests. it was cloudy the last day we went and the cloud level was right at the viewing level. bummer.

A bit pricey but I think worth the experience. No where else in Toronto could you see these views. Lines moved quickly but I could see it backed up during peak days or times. The whole place was neat tidy and well kept. Gift shop was full of need little gifts keep sakes and memories. Torontos must see at least...
Great view - but honestly I found it to be overpriced just to ride the elevator to the observation deck. For myself and my 7 year old it was close to $60.Staff was very friendly and helpful.
Wanted to treat my daughter to a surprise supper location. 360 Restaurant, what a fantastic evening the food was great, the sky was clear, and the view was breathtaking, And the service was on par!
Was a great visit staff was awesome, the line up to get in went very fast! Had mistakinly bought tickets for the wrong day but the manager had that fixed fast and let us in!

As much as I'm not a fan of elevators especially fast ones you can see through the experience at the top of the tower makes it worth it. The views across this unique and beautiful city are amazing and it is something that I feel connects people to the city

Whenever in Toronto I often go to the CN Tower for dinner, drinks and a view. Especially beautiful at night. Trust me and take a friend(s) and a loved one(s). It's a nice evening and the foods always been good. I'm due to go again soon.

In all the cities we visit that have a tower we visit. This like all towers has a great view of the city and surroundings areas. It is a good feeling seeing the area from above! A nice gift shop at the end of the tour. Staff helpful. Worth a visit.

Best way to really enjoy the view is to stay for lunch or dinner at the 360 restaurant. Prices are $20 over admission but includes the meal. Pick one appetizer and one main dish. Drinks are extra. Reservations are suggested. You also bypass the long wait and go straight up to the dining area. Indoor view was lovely on a...
It is a landmark of TO, make sure you visit it on a beautiful sunny day. Amazing how far you eye can see. Glass floor is for sure an attraction for both adults and kids.

I really do think this is worth the money. It is enough to go up to the first viewing level, that itself gives you a brilliant view of the city and neighboring areas. Try to go at sunset, that would be the perfect time to visit! We went at night so there wasn't a queue, but at the same time...
Simply an amazing view! On my visit, however, the 360 restaurant was closed for a private event, as well as half of one of the observation floors.

This is fun to see, and everyone has to visit at least once every few years. All the staff are super friendly and courteous.My only complaint with this place is the prices have gone up significantly since the last time I've been here 8 years ago.For just me and my son, $70 just for admission . Which seems...

I really enjoyed our trip to the CN Tower, & would definitely recommend taking the time to visit this attraction. We really wanted to visit during the day but the weather was rainy and foggy so we waited until it cleared up. Glad we went during the evening, the city lights were wonderful and it wasn't too busy that we had to wait in any lines. The glass floor was scary but a must do. We did go all the...
I visited with my family last week.It's the crown of the city and a must see attractions for all ages. Don't forget to rake picture on glass floor. ..

The wait time was zero which was excellent. It was straight up :) I also got the skypod which is another 100m I believe or 30 floors up. In the skypod you're 447m above the ground. Honestly I was hesitating to give any review on this but thought this might help for some people. I was here Dec 23rd 2015. The food was awesome, to my surprise not pricey, not the way I thought it would be, quite affordable. The only thing that comes close to this view is a few times that I've flown over T.O. You are literarily in the cloud.Fun place to be with the family even.
It is quite high, views are nice. But it's expensive for what you get. Visit the tower in Vancouver for a lot less while the views are about the same.

Went there once, loved the elevator view and the glass floor but I thought everything in there was a bit too expensive and branded, I live in Toronto so maybe that's why but I felt that a lot of stuff was probably intended for tourists.

Well, i found this experience a bit disappointing! Of course the elevator ride and views are amazing but considering the price of admission their really wasn't much to do.... We were pretty much bored after a half hr..... They could do a lot more to keep the kids interested and entertained. obviously a must do for tourists visiting our city...

I celebrated my 50's anniversary in this restaurant. I also took my daughter there several years later when she came with a visit to Toronto. This Toronto attraction doesn't require advertisement. What can be more special. Toronto without CN Tower doesn't exist.

we came here during school break so they had some free kids activities during this visit which my son enjoyed ( plane making, lava science demo project) and then the visit to the tower itself was quite fun, we didn't see very far that day as it was cloudy but non the less we enjoyed the experience of taking the...

Climbing to the observation deck in a high speed elevator with glass panes and running commentary, gives a unique experience. On reaching the observation deck - a revolving restaurantyou will have a breath-taking view of Toronto, the railway lines, view from top of Ripleys Aquarium, Rogers Centre, Railway museum. There is a curios shop also. All come with a price....

Even though our March Break visit to the city was covered in fog, as we only had one day left we still decided to venture up the CN Tower. It's not cheap for a family of 5!! But we took the risk anyway as we do not know when we might return. Even with limited visibility, the kids were still...
Fantastic views of a great city, both by day and night (a must) .. very professionally run with excellent attention to detail.. Canadians are such lovely friendly people..

A must see for any visitor to Toronto. this is an iconic structure which offers an experience at every level; from entering the structure to the ride in the elevator and the views from the top, as well as the fantastic restaurant experience. if you do nothing else in Toronto then do come here!

Been to Toronto a hundred times, and I had never been in the tower. Was not as busy as some of the other attractions on March break. Happy we went. Make sure it is at least mostly clear if not sunny for the best affect. The glass floor is fun
It is a good place for friends coming from another area. It is very popular place to see the city from top in the shine days.
Visited the restaurant for son's birthday few years ago, went before dusk so we got the nice daytime view of the city, and then the beautiful night light.
The glass floor is fun and it does give you a great view of the city. We had restricted views over the lake as it was foggy but the overall view of the city was worth it.

I have dined here countless time's with my kid's, siblings, friend's, date's and we are always more than pleased and can't wait to afford to do it again. Food is always great and the view is out of this world!!!!... ALWAYS A WOW FACTOR!!!!CHEERS!!!!

I was lucky enough to service telecommunications equipment at the top of the tower for years so got a free ride every week. It's a view that you can never be tired of. On a clear day you can see till the curve of the horizon. I have not eaten in the revolving restaurant for a number of years and...
We had an amazing meal of beet salad, pumpkin bisque and smoked salmon, arctic char and rabbit and the cheese plate, wine and desserts were excellent! The view of course,,,,,well.

Its a kind of place I can visit almost everyday.. :) It gives a thrilling experience, be it the glass floor or the top dome that shows a mesmerizing view of the city, especially in the Evening times...A must go place in Toronto..

Took some young girls (2 and 3 months) to the CN tower. Found it very expensive for what you get. The view is pretty impressive, but the outdoor viewing area was closed. Don't miss the tower. On a clear day you can see so much. The elevator ride was awesome and the exhibits cool. Food in the restaurant also Great.

An excellent place to take your out of town visitors for a full 360 view of Toronto and neighbouring United States across Lake Ontario. Rather expensive if you're only doing a couple attractions, it would be great as part of the City Pass. Be prepared for X-ray machines and the search through your purse. Eventually you have do to the CN tower. Whether you're visiting or you live here... It's very cool. I recommend making reservations at the 360 restaurant for a later dinner. The menu is worth the price - free ride to the top and you get to spend time on the observation deck after dinner.

My family visited canada, and the trip cannot be completed withpt visiting CN Tower. We visited night time. The view was astonishing. The glass floor is the best part with the visit to skypod. My nephew who is 3 years old enjoyed the most at the glass floor. I will definitly recommend the visit.
On a clear day you can appreciate how big Toronto is.as a tourist it is a must but also as a special treat for localsIt is expensive but worth for once

Im biased because i recently got engaged at the cntower. but its fun for the whole family. great observation deck. able to view from outside. and the infamous glass floor is an attraction. great food as well

When coming to the CN Tower be sure not to have a lot of stuff with you, there is a security check that is just like at the airport, except we were not told what they were looking for?The elevator is quick and getting pictures can be difficult especially when its full. Pretty cool views of Toronto. If you have the time take the ride up. The pictures are worth the price of admission
this place is Symbol of Toronto next to Roger center .. well good for tourists and not good who are scared of heights lol

The elevator ride was really good, even thought it doesn't last that long. It can be quite freaky for people which are afraid of heights, although it's a thrill. I took my wife and daughter here and it cost $95 dollars!! When we went through security the X-ray froze my iPhone so I couldn't take any pictures. The view is amazing but not worth the cost of admission in my opinion.

Easy to get to. Right next to the Blues stadium which was fun. The view was amazing. My son bought a great Tilly cap in the gift store. Was incredible to view both inside and out. Was not daring to do the outside climb but watched on the TV.

Bought a city pass at ticket booth. Good savings if you plan to spend a couple of days exploring the city. Spent a couple of hours walking around the restaurant elevation and went up to the higher level( an extra 12 dollars well spent). The CN Tower is still one of the tallest buildings in the world. When in Toronto, it is a must see. A visit to the panaromic view platform is breath taking on a clear day. It's big. Yup. Climbed the stairs, nearly killed me. This is the compass for the city as you can orientate yourself to it and find your way. Entering is expensive. The merchandise is expensive and the restaurant is dying for customers.

I have been at the CN tower a few times! I enjoy it every time. It's a bit overpriced. The vie is great if you go on a cloudy free day! The restaurants cater to all types of food lovers! All in all a good time!

often show my out of town friends this outstanding building with pride. they would walk across the plexiglass floor totally impressed. we usually complete this tour with lunch or dinner at its 360 restaurant.

Being the tallest building in Canada certainly warrants a visit. You can see buildings all the way on the other side of Lake Ontario on a good day. Definitely very pricey though so be ready to empty over CAD $50 per adult (including taxes) if you want to go on the highest viewing platform

Great views 360 degrees of the city of Toronto / the GTA and Lake Ontario but outside of the views its limited appeal and $35 dollars of so per person for about half hour as that's what I felt it takes to see and view the tower is a bit pricey, also the cafe / restaurant poor food lack of...

Going up the CN Tower is one of the things to do when in Toronto. The view is great (obviously), but everything also starts showing its age. A special experience in Toronto. Make sure you make time to visit the Tower on your visit to Toronto....a thrilling must do!
Panoramic to the core, great life, great food, #cheers to the the beer and appetizers, well done shawn boi

This a must visit place; the structure itself is an icon and the view is great in a clear sky. Must walk on the glass floor and have lunch/dinner if you're not on a budget. Climbing the stairs is another amazing experience!!!
The concept of the 360 Restaurant rotating to see the whole city is very cool and unique! The food was good but very expensive.
