Observation area was easy to walk around. Kids liked that they could be inside and outside on the observation deck.

We visited the CN tower while we were in Toronto visiting family , the elevator to the top was very fast and once you got out of it there was a section of floor which was glass and when you stood on it like you are on air very scary for me as I am afraid of heights.A very...

We went in the day and the weather was a little hazy so it was quiet. Got some nice pictures in the end. We used our city pass to get in. Then we went back at night (free entry with 360 meal) and got some excellent shots for an extra cost we went a bit higher as well. Totally worthwhile....

Been there a few times as a local, the elevator is pretty nice, you get to see out the glass as you rise to the higher levels. At the top, would say the glass floor is neat to try out, the view is pretty nice since you can see Lake Ontario to the south. They also have the stair-climbing challenge,...
used to be the tallest but still a great toronto attraction, little expensive for a family but a great experience you can walk all over from there so park for the day..

When you go to Toronto there are a few places that you must go to and this is one of them. I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised when I went to the CN Tower. The view is spectacular (no surprise there) but it was the people that worked there that makes the difference. Helpful? Yes! Friendly? Yes!...
CN Tower is true ICON of Toronto. Place worth visiting if you are in Toronto downtown. The city view from the top is breathtaking. I like it.

Visiting the CN Tower is one of those "must do" when in Toronto. I know some would argue stay away from anyone's must do lists as they are overcrowded, overpriced, and under whelming but for me, to understand a place there are certain things you must do.For the price (over $40) it can run a family almost $200. If...

If you like heights and a top view of being on top of the world, go for it. the elevator ride is exciting enough, once you get to the top wow, what a view. stepping on a glass floor, you are able to look straight down with a viewer. All will enjoy this outing.

I saw tower only the outside. Because the entrance pay was higher by me. They want $ 35 for a certain height . If you want to go higher, you have to give more than 12 dollars. It made more sense to see under water. I went there.

Take the time to take in all the views, the glass floors and if you are brave enough hang outside on cables. Also take a few minutes to watch the video on the construction of the tower. An engineering marvel.

What an amazing view! We were in Toronto to visit friends and family, so we decided to go to the Tower and have dinner in the 360 restaurant with some friends. Most people already know that is revolves and completes a 360 degree revolution every 72 minutes or so. We had appy's and prime rib for dinner plus we all...
Went to the revolving restaurant here and had an amazing meal with simply stunning views! The tower is a lot of fun and at night we could not believe how beautiful the surrounding area looked.
Everyone should make it to the CN Tower once in a lifetime. Toronto is a CLEAN New York City! The CN TOWER is a great place to bring your family/kids. The price is fair and the view is AWESOME.
Go during the evening so you can see Toronto during the day and at night. Bring snacks so you don't have to pay for their expensive food and drink in the tower.

TIP: You can actually visit the CN Tower for free if you eat at the 360 restaurant at the top. I think you can actually get a cesar salad for cheaper than a ticket but reservation should be made as they are usually booked up.The elevator ride up was very cool and my ears popped at the top. The...

I never know what to expect when you get a meal at a tourist attraction...an expensive one at that. .. was it the best I every had? No. Was it good for the value? No. Was it better than expected and filling? Yes. (We did learn that an appetizer in canada, truely is just that. No american sized portions here.)...

The view is unreal on a clear day. The revolving restaurant is a treat, but can become expensive. Reservations are important to have. Elevator ride up and down is cool. The glass floor too. There are attractions at the base of the tower as well as a walk around the outside. This is one thing I haven't done yet. Expect...

The CN Tower is obviously a main tourist attraction here, we contemplated going at all but are very glad we did. It is a MUST to pay extra to go to the highest point (SkyPod), the views are much better and it is much less crowded than the main observation level. We went right before sunset and it was a...

I wish i had been to the CN tower when it was the tallest building in the world, but never had the chance.Its still a busy place even though its not the tallest building in the world. Has a wonder full glass floor that the kids really enjoyed. My daughter wanted to take pictures on it while lying down,...
Well worth the cost to get to the top.....Amazing view......inner enclosed or outside deck have a great view, even in fog or rain.Brave the instinct and walk on the glass floor.
Something that must be seen, it is the third tallest tower in the world, a signature icon of Toronto's skyline, and a symbol of Canada.
It<s a nice experience to go up, but the price is a bit expensive. You can present your airmiles card to get a rebate which is good. Nice package if you get the city pass.

I played tourist and to see if I could get a great photo. Unfortunately we could not walk outside and the glass is not that clear, but you can walk over glass and look down, but no photos with the exception of one of the water. They had typical cheesy photos that you could pose for and they would place...

Had a beautiful sunny day and could see a long way in every direction. Had lunch and relaxed and then the glass floor, yikes, great but kinda freaky at the same time. Definitely a must see if you go to Toronto, just make sure it's a clear day or you'll miss a lot.

We ate at the 360 restaurant at the very top of CN tower, and our server was very nice and gave us extra dessert as it was our first time in Canada and Toronto. The food was ok, the price could be a little more reasonable but essentially you are paying for the rotating view. We were able to see...

This is not a cheap excursion, and I wouldn't even call it a "must do." The lookout level offers neat views of the harbor and city, and the glass floor is pretty cool. Just a tip...don't pay the extra $12/person to go up to the SkyPod. They have so much wire mesh around the sides that you can't even really...

We went up the CN Tower for lunch at the 360 restaurant. It was a nice clear day and the views were amazing. The revolving restaurant was nice but the food and service was just ok. Worth a visit for the views and if you eat it the restaurant you get access to the viewing area so for the price...

We had to connect to fly home so we decided to stay a couple nights in Toronto, of course we had to check out the CN tower. It's pretty cool and the 360 restaraunt was the best part in my opinion. There's a spot on the floor where you can look down and see the city which was amazing. It...

The CN Tower has a great view and is expensive like other reviewers have stated.I'm going to break things down from start to finish of our visit.Getting there:Its easy to get to CN Tower, even if you get lost. Most times you can look up and see it from many downtown location.Getting In:- if you...

A nice experience to get a beautiful view of Toronto and the lake. Glass floor can be quite scary if you have a fear of heights. The restaurant, though expensive, provides a beautiful view while rotating with delicious food.
A tall tower. Yes. That's really all one can say about it. Expensive to visit, more expensive to eat at (360). The view is amazing, but that IS all this place has going for in. One-trick pony.

I have visited CN Tower in the beginning of year 2016 and it was really a nice experience. The entrance fee itself was on the higher side /40 CAD+/ but it was worth it - we actually paid for the extra few more metres to see the city better.Toronto is huge and we were even able to see landing...

The CN Tower is a little expensive, it cost about $100 for three adults. Go early to avoid long lines and bring a jacket to walk outside, the wind was intense. Walking on the glass floor was a little scary, but offers a great opportunity to take a picture with the street below. We parked our car in an open...

As part of Toronto CityPASS package, had the chance to visit the CN Tower last summer with my family. My daughters liked it ( 6 and 9 years old), my wife not so much as she doesn't feel comfortable with heights. Stunning city view ! I'd recommend it on a clear sunny day, better if it's cold outside then you...

I wouldn't say it was a memorable experience because frankly it wasn't. You pay a handsome fee to get a lift up to a viewing deck to get a clear view of Toronto. My recommendation is that if you have the time (and willing to shell out the cash) then by all means go and see it, it would be...
Whether you are a Toronto resident or visitor you must venture up the CN Tower to fully appreciate and experience the world's best city Toronto.

Sure, one of the tallest towers. The glass floor is kind of cool and unique, and the restaurant is a romantic (expensive) experience! I think at this point I have been so many times, but I still take all my Toronto-visitors and they love it :)
Going up to the CN Tower was a nice experience. The view over there is pretty beautiful. We had the opportunity to have lunch there looking to the Toronto Islands.

I don't think I will every get tired of looking at this amazing structure. It to little nudging to get me on the glass floor but once I got over my fear is really enjoyed the view it's an experience that one should experience at lease once.

We took friends from Finland to the "Top of Toronto" restaurant and had an amazing time. Meal was lunch and was a fantastic experience. The Finns were amazed at the elevation and the food quality. Server was very attentive and knowledgeable. Many Torontonians have never been to this venue and should. All tourists should visit for a fantastic meal and...

Had dinner and the prix fixed menus was delicious. Billy helped with the wine suggestion and offered opinions on dinner selection. It was a clear night and the view was amazing. Nice atmosphere and spent some time admiring the wine cellar. Did not feel rushed and made time to visit the observation deck. We will bring guests here for sure.
Toronto is a wonderful town!!!! Go to this great city and visit everything, but start at the CN Tower. Not long lines when we were there. Very well organized and tons of fun with family and friends.
Paid the extra to go up to the very top. Very high, but the views were spectacular. You can even see into the Rogers centre
The revolving restaurant is nice offering a full panoramic view of the city. The glass floor on the observation deck is a great test to see just how you handle heights.
Visited here on New Year's day! It was really good to see the city view from the top. I would love to visit here again in day time too.

This is a great option if you have kids traveling with you. Depending on when you go there is a wait and a ticket cost. The views are amazing, but of course if you don't like heights this isn't for you, since even parts of the floor are glass.

I have to admit that once we were up on top of the tower, it was a fantastic view and I enjoyed being there. However, the cost for a group of 6 was outrageous and it took up half the day waiting. Although I would say it was worth half the price, that would probably make the wait twice as...
Must visit for friends or relatives that are visiting Toronto for the first time. Its always a joy myself and it always impresses the first timers...
I found the tower to be a little overrated and overpriced. If I had one tip it would be to go for a meal in the restaurant to get the views for free!
It's verry great the inside is AWSOME it's so tall I almost sneezed cause of the sun they have great service there I felt like the lucky one who's special

The CN Tower wasn't originally on my list to visit in Toronto, but I'm really glad I did.It was a clear sunny day which convinced me, and although I thought it was fairly pricey it's still cheaper than the London shard to visit.As you'd expect it's all about the spectacular views of Toronto once you reach the top...

Make sure you visit the tower if you are in Toronto. 1 time is enough. You'll experienced seeing from a very high tower, and standing on a glass then see through it. Thats all.They have a rotating restaurant, I didnt get the chance to visit it.
View was fantastic. Took videos of the elevator ride going up and down. Only con is, too crowded esp by the glass floor. But thats understandable since its a tourist spot
It might seem expensive and silly. But get the photo take of you flying over the CN tower. A year later it is still our most cherished photo from recent times. Other people love it too.

Wether you are driving toward downtown Toronto,hanging underneath the tower or going up and explore it, it is spectacular every time I see it. Once you are on top, you will see Toronto from a whole different view. It is amazing, and nice place to chill for couple hours.
We made reservations at the restaurant for lunch. Ride up the tower as well as admission to the observation deck was included. No wait. Meal was excellent and views amazing!

Whether you're a tourist or a Torontonian, the CN Tower is an attraction you definitely need to visit, at least once. Although tickets are a little pricey and it gets very busy during peek teams such as the weekends, the CN Tower offers the best views or Toronto. My wife and I like to go right before sunset so we...

We went here Saturday afternoon the place is pretty neat because you can see the whole Toronto down town. Also thy have a restaurant in there I herd if you eat there than you can view the tower area for free which would be a good idea to do.
Good way to spend a Sunday. Took the kids to get out of the house. Also the edge walk rocks for thrill seakers
I was just a kid when I first went to the CN tower as a grade 8 school trip. Brings back a lot of good memories when I go back

My fiancé and I were visiting Toronto last December as a mini vacation before Christmas, one of the stops we made was the CN Tower. It was very quiet (there was only one other couple in the tower) as it was during the off season, and it was rainy so we didn't have a crystal clear view of the city...

The 360 diner isn't as good as you'd think. When we first got up couples were waiting to talk to a manager about their meal, and after I ate I can see why! The 360 Skylon tower in Niagara had way better food for sure.
Great exhibits, and superb views are worth every penny at this well run canadian Icon. Head down earlier in the day to benefit form smaller lines!

Main icon of Torontowell organized experience, awesome viewsrestaurant and merchandising availableeasy to reach location, you can visit it in the same day you do the aquarium, blue jay's stadium, harbor and walk around downtown
Essential Toronto highlight, breathtaking views way way up and appreciation for the magnitude of the beautiful Southern Ontario region. We could even see Niagara Falls!
The view from CN Tower is awesome. Visit around afternoon, so that you can see both the day/ night view. The Glass floor gives you the creep. But it is a exciting experience -
It was lovely experience while visiting this landmark. Beautifully organised trip of the tower with Toronto view from top

I first visited the CN tower in 1979 when all it looked down on was railway sidings and little else. We made the trip again on a beautiful cold and sunny clear winter's day. We were not disappointed. Great film and exhibits before you go up the tower talking about the build and the history. Not sure the top deck...

Well, nothing much changed since my first visit 20 years ago! LolThe skyscrapers around multiplied for sure and the view is great on a clear day.I am just writting this review to include a tip... Don't pay just for visiting the CN tower, it isn't worth it!Combine it with either lunch or dinner at the 360• revolving...
Great place to go especially on a clear day.The added feature of the Skywalk is great (didn't do it). Glass floor adds to the experience. Great overall experience even though I am afraid of heights.
While the food was somewhat mediocre,the experience of the revolving restaurant was wonderful. It gives a great view Toronto.
Really good trip - well worth it. We also ate in the revolving restaurant, and this gave us the full 360 experience

For the view, yes, especially at night. The lift attendants kept demonstrating how strong and resilient the glass tiles were by standing on them until I pointed out that the glass might be strong but the holding frames and screws weren't guaranteed. Fear! Lol. But true...

Great to visit. Should go at least once. Very neat to look around the city from that perspective. Able to look down and see a baseball game depending on the time of year.Book ahead online and get 10% off!

The views are amazing.Make sure you pay the extra and go all the way up.When you go outside the wind and chill factor are phenomenal.Coming from Australia it was cold we have never before experienced.A great place to view the airport and the lake.
The highest tower I've been in!! The glass floor is sooo scary at first prepare for cool pictures :) dont look down the elevator has a glass window to see as you rise and fall enjoy ?
We took the kids up found out one is not a fan of heights. It was pretty cool but we could not stay long kid wanted down.

Views are great but i feel the staff could use some pep. The ride up the elevator would have been better if the attendant had more energy. I could barely here him. We ended up eating an early dinner at horizons which was just overpriced pub food but we expected that. We stayed to watch the setting sun. And it...

It's a great attraction and within walking distance of ?most? hotels. The glass floor elevator is amazing but the real gem is the glass floor up in the tower. Take a minute and watch other peoples reactions, it's amazing!If I'm compare it to Petronas Towers in Kuala lumpur, it is a greater feeling with CN tower cause of the...

So me and my wife have been to NYC did Empire and Top of the Rock which were awesome...This however takes the lead with a MASSIVE wow for views and how high you get. I mean it really is above all in the city!!!!Make sure you do this one thing if you can only do one thing! Also...

The CN Tower is a fantastic thing when looking at it on the Toronto skyline but it's the one thing you can't see from the top of it. It's very expensive to get to the top and usually very crowded with the need to stand in line at a lot of points. If you have your heart set on going...

A must see, but not worth the price. On a clear day the view is amazing and the glass floor was also awesome, but other than that, for the price not worth it. If you go to Toronto, you should see it just once because it is the view from everywhere. It lights up during the evening, which is kind...
Better than it was in 1977, but a must do if in Toronto. Pay the extra and go as high as you can.Don't check your coat though, as you will need it if you step outside at the top.
The elevator ride is awesome, the views incredible, it's a one of a kind visit that's one of the most unique experiences in Toronto
This is an attraction for everybody, good price and a really excellent view, if you wat to eat something good make sure to make a reservation in the restaurant at the top of the tower!

It's expensive to go up...The elevator ride up is fun. Once your up there. There's really nothing to do....but that's okay cuz the view is AMAZING. The glass floor is difficult to see through and impossible to get a photo worth looking at.The real fun is you can go outside and walk around the tower in a caged...

The CN Tower is the tallest structure in downtown Toronto. It gives you a shop for trinkets, fine food restaurant, a bar, an inside and and outside viewing and a glass walled elevator. The cost for access to the viewing level is $32 for 13 to 64 years of age and $23 for 65+ and 4 to 12 years of...

One of the icons of the Toronto skyline CN tower stands tall at the edge of lake ontario. We went to CN tower on a nice clear day and from the upper deck you could see as far as your eyes could in any direction. But the highlight for me was the thrill of standing on the "world's first glass...

There's not much to say except if you curious to visit this incredible piece of architecture, you will be glad you did!The glass floor is a very nice "photo attraction", the elevator ride lasts 50ish seconds, it's a great view.Regular adult price ain't cheap but then again, you don't go there every other week.Was glad i did...
Had a super time at the CN Tower! Super trip to the top and then dinner with the kids in the revolving restaurant!Can't wait to return!Sincerely,Jeff
It was fun, but it's not a unique experience. It's just the typical high tower, great view cliché. I still recommend taking the kids but don't expect to be blown away.
Very unique building set in this fantastic City. We starred at this for hours and hours it is an amazing feature.
If you are a tourist, you must go, if you are not, then, you can wait, since it's always there! Extremely high! Provides the best views of the city. 360!! Restaurants options and upgrades.
The view from the top is nice, and the "glass floor" is impressive. But the price is prohibitive an really expensive in comparison to the view itself.

My family and I went to CN Tower on my Birthday which is February 1 and its pricey to up the observation deck but well worth it ...... I really like the view of Toronto Canada and yes I try the Glass Floor my first reaction I was scared ....yes I was scared but I overcome my fear of heights...

Booked the trip through our hotel concierge and got it a little bit cheaper than paying on the door. The trip to the top is fantastic in itself, with views over the city as you're going up. Amazing views from the top as you can imagine. Even the view looking down on the glass floor! The restaurant at the top...

What can you say really? You take an elevator to the upper level, get off and have a heart attack when you look out and see just how high up you are. Had lunch at the restaurant and was nothing special for the price you are paying.
Very interesting, a shame to come to Toronto and not do it. Highly recommend you take them up on the photo op on the glass floor.

It is always a great pleasure to visit this awesome landmark of our great City. I never get tired of it and every time is just as fun as the first time. Glass floor, awesome views of Toronto, elevator ride, super nice restaurant and much, much more is available around a clock for visitors from all around the World. Great...

Imagine standing on the floor of what was at one time the largest structure in the world ... with a glass floor ...Okay, don't just imagine it ... go do it! Our visit to the CN Tower was breathtaking ... the views, the elevator up, the glass floor, the "sky tower" that takes you up even higher ...My...
fantastic sunny view of a chill October day! the glass floor is adrenaline - sitting upon it eating ice cream...running outside around it was memorable!

Any visit to Toronto wouldn't be the same without a trip to the top of the CN Tower. Make sure you pick a clear day. Elevator ride is great, going outside on a windy day is a little crazy. Views are outstanding.

I went up the CN Tower as it is the thing to do when in Toronto, and I was not disappointed. The view from the top is outstanding and you can see for far around and there are numerous photo opportunities, including over a glass floor. Perhaps a tad pricey but something that has to be done.

Even in January the CN Tower doesn't fail to excite! Had a special dinner in the revolving restaurant atop the tower for my Granddaughter's 21st Birthday. Food was awesome. service was great! Had an unforgettable time!

Great view of the city!Insider tip: to avoid the atrocious lines, make a reservation for lunch or dinner at the 360 restaurant. They have fixed price menus with high end dining (~$50), and you get to skip all lines and have free access to the elevator and observatory. This beats waiting and hour or two, only to pay $30...

It was nice to see the glass bottom at the CN Tower, however it was a busy day and too many people. It looked like our batch that went up had more people then usual. I've been there twice already but not after they built the glass bottom. It's still a one time experience to visit the Tower. The good...

I'm my 50 years and after too many trips to count I finally made it up the CN Tower and it was definitely worth the wait.The line up was short and I could not get over how friendly and helpful EVERY employee was.The views were breath taking and anybody who frequents TO will be taken down memory lane...

A visit to the CN tower is definitely a must for anyone visiting Toronto for the first time. The guides are young and enthusiastic and share some very interesting facts and statistics about the tower. Opportunities to purchase souvenirs are also present at the large gift/souvenir shop on your way to the exit.

This place is embarrassing.Theme park prices to climb and elevator and look out a very tall window.I'll give them some credit and compliment them for adding a new attraction every 25 years.After you blow your brains out at the base of the tower ... Get ready because the elevator ride will keep your attention longer then when...

Booking lunch or dinner at 360 gives you admittance into everything a normal ticket would give you but you pay for lunch or dinner in an amazing restaurant instead of just sightseeing. We have had lunch and dinner with full admittance to the entire CN tower as well. Food isn't that amazing but it's pretty good. Revolving restaurant is unique...
It's worth it. Specially at sunset. Propose to someone, make a beautiful memory with family, children. Amazing place.
Fun place, I have been a couple times with family from out of town. Prices for entry are fairly steep. For what you get. Cut the price to increase appeal.

The CN tower has a fantastic 360 view of Toronto and GTA. The rather small glass floor area offers a novelty for those who are not afraid of heights. However, the $40+ dollars entry means it is definitely a one off. One or two walks around the tower and you'll find yourself stuck for things to do. The restaurant has...
CN Tower is a beauty of Toronto great food lot of tourist like the view on city I enjoy every minute.

CN Tower sits in Toronto and is its uniqueness has been overshadowed by Condo buildings around it. For those who haven't stepped out of Toronto or Canada it offers unique picturesque environment. But those who have been to Petronas Towers in (KL, Malaysia) or Oriental Pearl Tower in (Pudong, Shanghai, China), CN Tower might not be able to provide any...
The staff was great and the food was amazing. Usually with this type of tourist environment you don't get great food but it was a good experience

The CN tower is one of the symbols which will be placed on Toronto emblem. Being one of the tallest buildings in the world you will be fascinated to see it from outside and inside. You could have amazing views all around Toronto from skypod or revolving restaurant. The glass floor, a bit overrated, could offer you some thrilling images....

While the views from the CN Tower are great on a clear day, night time viewing should also not be missed. These views are often more reliable since the city lights will still be amazing so long as cloud cover is not below the observation decks. It can also be very romantic and usually less crowded. All in all, I...

I've visited many tourist attractions around the world and I think that the CN Tower bight be the worst value of any attraction that I have visited. I was there recently with my little nephew who is from out of town (I live in Toronto) so I thought he would get a kick out of it. But at almost $100...

Cant leave YYZ without seeing CN TowerIt can be pricey if you are in a family or large group- costs add up.There is a glass floor which will spook you and a restaurant which is over priced- but you pay for the experience.At night time there are lights that light up- different colours for different days which...

For a long time I avoided visiting the CN Tower. It is too high, I thought and going up in a glass fronted elevator was not to my liking.. But finally, when I went up, what an experience that was.! You are high above Toronto, actually about 1800 feet above, seeing clear as far as the eye could see, in...

column3: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
column4: Dinner at the top is pretty fun, but pretty expensive. The view is interesting, but not breathtaking
Great views. Would recommend visiting during the day. Night time can limit your view over the lake. Would visit again. Free admission with dinner reservation at 360 Restaurant.

This should be high on your list of places to visit but only on a clear day. The views are spectacular. There is also a glass floor which is popular. And the outside walk is expensive but great for those adventurous people. Tickets can be bought online. The cost is high. But, if you decide to book lunch or dinner...

You will have a wonderful view of the city and the Toronto islands. Security is very thorough, but the lines move quickly. The elevator ride was much more pleasant than I had expected. The glass floor is amazing.Best to buy the tickets in advance, so you don't have to wait in the line.

Not only was the view out of this world, the food was mouthwatering delicious. The wine paired with my Osso Bucco was a perfect match. The staff was very polished and attentive. We will be back for a daytime visit in June.

A typical tourist attraction but absolutely worth it for the view of the city. Would've loved to have gone to the restaurant but as expected is booked up quite far in advance! A good thing to do if like us it was your first time in the city.

The CN tower is a really nice place to check out, but only once. I wouldn't go more times. The price is very high, 41$ per adult. You get a great view of the city but that's it. The glass floor is average. Very small. And the outdoor area is surrounded by a thick fence, where you can hardly see...
no facilities and staff is rude.good view of course but not worth the money.just a one time visit at sunset would be prefect.make sure you check the visibility in the news.
I go visit it every time I'm in Toronto. Can't get naught of seeing it. Their is always musicians around it to entertain you during your visit.

The glass section of the floor is fun to give a slight vertigo (if you are predisposed to get vertigo in the first place).The view is....okay.Over all, not really worth it unless you are with kids as they will be the only ones impressed by the glass floor.
Take the family and bring some money (you will need it), and head up to the observation deck. While it is pricey for an elevator ride, it has some amazing views and the glass floor is amazing.

So many reasons to go to the CN Tower. Amazing sights, fun movies, fabulous glass bottom floors. The elevator ride is as enjoyable as the sights once you get to the top. Great stores for souvenirs. ???
Good view, nice place to check an above the city view.Nothing special. Same as any other big city with a tower view.In general Toronto is a fun city to spent some time .

Great views of Toronto. But the most amazing thing was looking straight down through the glass floor at roof of the skydome. We got up the nerve to walk on the glass floor and looked straight down. A must do!

column3: Park Ridge, New Jersey, United States
column4: Great experience - bit over priced costs 35 per adult and 25 for kids. It's a must do so I guess it's fine. Your there for 2 hrs max
Pretty pricey for what you get. The view is great but the price tag not worth it unless you go for dinner in the 360 up too where you get free access to the viewing decks.
Glass floor was exciting. We could see Niagara Falls in clear sky. We loved the high speed glass elevator shooting up . Next time have to try edge walk.

Heightened security since my last visit probably 16 years ago.Still a magnificent attraction here in TorontoIf you do no other typical tourist gig here, do this one.Weather is a huge influence so save your money if visibility is poor.Afraid of heights? Get over it.

We opted to eat at the restaurant and go to the experience afterwards, which is included along with your meal price. We went to the CN tower on New Years eve and it was such a lovely and memorable thing to do. The food was amazing, the views are fantastic and I love the way the restaurant revolves so that...
Had a brilliant visit to the CN tower, very informative. Such a great view from the top and in particular the glass floor was an amazing experience

I did the edgewalk and it was so much fun! It was beautiful and they take pictures while you're up there. It is on the pricey side but is definitely worth it. Before you go up they do lots of safety checks.
Amazing view from up there. The glass floor is so scary and fun at the same time..if you go to CN tower definitely you have to try it.The view from up there is in Amazing.

All the time, during the visit, we (me and my wife) were asking eack other: OK; So what?Not really something interesting in 2016!If you have time, just go. Why not?But if your time is limited and you want to choose, you'll have definitely better choices.

We went on a gorgeous and very clear but extremely cold day and the view was amazing. It's $35 (Canadian) to ride up. Another $12 to do the pod if you want to go higher. It's a must see but prob will get old quick because of the tourists... Unless you do what we did and have drinks at the...

Do buy your ticket for meal and entry to go up. Ever had a meal when you need to use the loo then when you return your table has moved. Yes it is a revolving restaurant with fan static views around Toronto. The food and service was very good

I saw surprised about the prize of the ticket, but moreover about the difficulty to take a foto ( FULL of people). Certainly was a unique experience but they have to reduce the price and after 10 minutes you only want to go out ( after half an hour of row)
Definitely worth it, even if you've been to other towers or buildings. Great views and photo opportunities.

I really liked to how great the view of Toronto was. But one thing that I dislike about this place is the glass floor. For some reason the glass floor makes me nervous. I also liked to how fast the elevator shoots up when going up and down to the main floor of the place.

of course this is a must - of course the views are great and of course the exit is through the gift shop and they do the souvenir photo thing. However, despite all the obvious aspects to it it is still a unique experience. The glass floor is not always full of kids and it is fun watching people who...

i went to the CN tower with my family. Although it was cool being in one of the tallest buildings in the world, it was a long lineup to get in and not much to do inside. There were a couple cool things but nothing to good.

There are two views available the "Tower Experience" and the "SkyPod" which is an additional 33 stories. The views are spectacular and worth going up to the Skypod more to say you have done it more than anything else. It costs an extra $12.00 which in effect you paying for a 20secs lift ride, for views a little bit higher....

Yes, there are taller and more glitzy towers around the world, but none compares to the CN Tower. For over 30 years it was the worlds tallest...and it still impresses. Try the 360 restaurant...the food is great and you get to go up as part of the price of your dinner. Do go to the top...the views are even better.

If you would like to see the city from a different angle this is your place. It's got a glass floor and a nice restaurant. also be sure to visit the Aquarium at the foot of the tower. you can save a few bucks by the city pass. if you arrive by train at the union station, it's connected via...

If you go to Toronto, you can't miss visiting the CN tower. Not if you're too afraid of heights though. The elevator is very fast, really amazing. I loved the view, and standing on the glass floor.Don't waste your time with the photos they offer. Too expensive and not such a big deal.
This is well worth a visit when you're in Toronto. The view is spectacular, the see through floor is knee shakingly enjoyable.

I live in Toronto and every time somebody comes to visit from out of town this is one of the things they must see.It really is an amazing structure, one of the tallest free-standing in the world.The elevator ride to the top is easily my favourite part!Once you are up there, you can spend hours just sight-seeing,...

Living in Toronto for many years we saw the CN Tower being built. We like to go back every couple of years for the amazing views an to see what new buildings have popped up, Always worth a trip. Now if we could only get the American pilots to quit calling it the CNN Tower!!!
Crowded, but very well organized. You can have wonderful views of Toronto, recognizing places you visited previously.
I went here by myself and while the day was overcast the views were still really good. I regret not buying the ticket for the very top. The glass floor was really cool too.

I went to the CN tower 3 times and it was a great experience. The view is amazing! The thing is that you shouldn't go when it's raining because you won't be able to see the view haha that happened to me once

Not a cheap lift-it's $40 per adult, base fare, to go up. But the views from the top are incredible. I headed up right before sunset on a clear night and then enjoyed dinner at the lower restaurant afterward. Beautiful evening.
Wow the height of this Building was high in the sky. Had a good tour. Enjoy my pictures. Like the history that was provided in some areas of the tower.

What a great skyline tower, well organised and easy to get to. Yes it costs a bit to go up but it is well worth it, great views and great displays showing the history of the tower, even a short movie about it, which is free

Line-up is long, but well worth the wait! The glass floor is scary at first, but you get used to it. I would not recommend to someone who has a fear of heights. Otherwise, great experience, and you should try the restaurant while you are up there!

Toronto itself isn't big for sightseeing and whilst the observation deck is so high there isn't too much to view. If you're sightseeing in Ontario, I'd rather pay for more attractions in Niagara, there's a memorable experience
Getting cisitors on and off lifts was well organised and staff very courteous. View was amazing, glass floor a bir scary. Not brave enough to do the edge walk. Thought it a bit expensive though.
It is a must try to enjoy a dining at the rotating restaurant. You get to see the surrounding of Toronto with Bird's Eye View while dining.

This is a unique landmark in Toronto. My daughter used to call it "My Tower". Everytime we used to drive pass the Tower when she was you, it was "my CN Tower".She is now 21 years old and she still loves the tower. I think it is a good place tovisit and have dinner. It is way...

We were going as a large group up the tower. It was quite windy so it took about 3 minutes to go up rather than the typical 58 seconds. The glass floor is a lot of fun. The outdoor area was not open due to the wind. Overall a great experience.
It's always nice to say you have been up the CN tower. We took our two kids and they liked it not much to do once you get up there for the cost. Neat to see but one time trip.

I had the pleasure of dining with my sister and the talented violinist virtuoso Yuhe Li from China the day after her debut concert in Toronto. The restaurant on top of the CN tower is perfect for such intimate special occasions. The food was great, the view, breathtaking and the service was excellent. It was a memorable evening for all...
Best place to look at downtown Toronto, the Roger Centre, Toronto Centre Island, the lake front high rises and the Chinatown.
Beautiful view, worth going, you can see all toronto!!I went in winter time and not as busy as summer.
Great site to see, on a clear day you see Niagara Falls, affordable. Located downtown Toronto with lots of other attractions

My husband, my two children ages 7 months and 4 years, visited the CN tower on NYE 2016. It was a great trip-not busy at all, no line ups, walked right in. Great view at night from the top! No matter how often I go to the CN Tower, I am overwhelmed by its structure, its beauty, its tourists from all over the world, and its spectacular views. I've been up a few high observation decks, the Sky Tower in New Zealand, the Stratosphere in Las Vegas, Empire State, etc. While this has amazing views of Toronto, some of the ideas within are being done better in other attractions. The glass floor is great, but the one in Auckland's Sky Tower is definately a step up. Overall, a...

The elevator ride is worth the price of admission. The food was well prepared and the service was good. This is a good spot to take business visitors who have not been to Toronto. Views are fantastic on a clear day and mystically in the clouds when overcast.

Amazing views of the entire city and the lake. Best time to take pictures is between open and noon. Around 1pm the sun moves into a position that is behind Toronto island airport and is hard to shoot into. Glass floor is a great experience!
Not a place I would immediately consider for lobster but my cousins from England wanted to go. It was great!! Would definitely go back.

This venue is great to celebrate a special birthday or anniversary. I have been there over a dozen times and each time was memorable. The food is fantastic: fresh and savory. We opted to eat lunch at the top here, and the kids thoroughly enjoyed the experience, both the food and the observatory. The lunch itself was on the pricey side, but the views from the top are breathtaking

This needle is waaaay higher than the needle in Seattle. They also have a glass floor lookout that is super creepy even though logically you know it is safe. My wife and I along with other family members enjoyed our time while visiting the CN Tower. I suggest you spend the extra money and eat in the revolving restaurant and the view you get of Toronto is fabulous. I lived in southern Ontario when I was young and I remember taking trips to downtown TO to do different things. Heights don't bother me and I loved the glass floor. The restaurant is expensive though.

Wife & I went up in the CN tower, very good views and the experience overall was great. There is a glass floor area that is quite unique. The building is the iconic figure of Toronto, recommend to go see it.
Too expensive for what it is ... Not worth the money more then one time in your life. I've come few times with dif family & friends . Not great

I was a bit afraid to go up as I am nervous about heights. I'm so glad I did. The view is awesome. I did eat at the restaurant. I thought it was good. If you visit Toronto you really should make a trip up the tower. The elevator is very fast so hold on.

The view was great but the price with a family was way to high and its the same story for the "restaurant" overpriced and there are so much better places for food that are not in the CN tower also the photo we're again overpriced and were i was it was very overpopulated in the weekends over all tho it...
This place used to have the highest observation level for many years, before the worldwide high rise boom.
It's a must see as the views are amazing on a clear day. We discovered the Toronto Island from up there which was worth the price of admission. It's busy, pricey but still pretty amazing.
It is worth a trip to the CN tower as it offers amazing views of the city.I suggest going as it starts to get dark because I loved the lights of the city

The queue was pretty long, but we didn't have to wait more than 30mins or so to buy our tickets. We decided to go all the way to the top. I expected the glass floor to be bigger though. Having said that, you do get some lovely views of the city and we managed to take some nice photos.

As part of the city pass this attraction would be worth it, but alone, it's a lot of money for a family of 5. While I am glad we did it once, we won't be returning unless as part of a City pass. The general admission for kids is quite pricey as they loose interest pretty quickly. Due to a...

This place is unreal. There is a Restaurant on top. You can see really far including Niagara Falls from a distance. We were sky high on a over cloudy day. The visibility was still good. But please go in the a.m this is the best time. Or get there early to see the sunset.
Expensive admission but beautiful views from daylight to sunset. The glass floor is a great feature.
What a fantastic place to visit, the views are awsome, would have loved to have had a meal in the restaurant but sadly not enough time, very reasonable too
An astonishing 360 view of a city that seems to only grow with skyscrapers every year. A must see if visiting Toronto.
That was my first time with my family. My wife and kids loved it. So do i.night view is so amazing as well as late afternoon.

Verne & my daughter visited and their talked about the Beautiful views of Toronto and surrounding. It was a clear day, could see the US. They were especially excited to stand on the glass floor. February is definitely a great time of the year to visit this must-see in the city of Toronto. There was absolutely no wait time. The view from up there is just amazing and breath taking! A great way to see Toronto! I recommend eating at one of their restaurants - the 360 has an amazing menu and of course rotates so that you are able to see an entire 360 of the city (just be sure to make your meal last an hour!).

Its just an awesome view from Tommy Thompson Park to Vancouver, I give you the advise to visit the Park and go all the way up till the peninsula of the park. Amazing view of the city in a clean sky day. Has a reasonable price. A must-go experience in Toronto! The staff is friendly.
I love going to the CN Tower. Such a cool experience and I learn something new each time I go and love being family members who are from out of town!
Eat a wonderful meal up on the 115th floor at a restaurant that has great food and service and fabulous view. The restaurant rotates slowly, stunning view at night.

Great event for the family to see a awesome view of Toronto. Go up on a clear day. Try to go up when first opens to avoid long wait times.
Excellent just for the lift alone - glass floor is great nice restaurant , as well - nice steaks washed down by decent wine!

Standing on one of the tallest tower in the world, a marvelous view of beautiful city and big Ontario lake and green islands. A must visit in Toronto.

This is a great place to visit and see a 360 view of TorontoCheck out the glass floor which is quite scary
Great views from both inside and the outside deck. Challenge your phobia with a walk on the glass floor.Hit the restaurant for the highest drink around

If you're in Toronto on a clear day, you simply must visit the CN tower. Visited around 4pm, which was an excellent time as views were had both in daylight and then in darkness with views of city lights. Cost approx £25 for the main tower, glass floor and additional pod views. Reasonably priced for the length of time you would spend up there but still worth it for the fantastic views.

This is Toronto’s biggest landmark, one of the tallest towers in the world and an icon that signifies Toronto. Whether you are a tourist or not, you should definitely check this out. You get a panoramic view of our beautiful city and our lake Ontario. It is an awesome experience.

getting expensive to go up...but if your looking for an amazing view.. you have found the right place..
nice tower, with lots of attractions and the puls is the restaurant at the tip! too scared of doing the edge walk but very sensational idea!
The CN Tower is a must see if you are not from the Toronto area. It's a once in a lifetime "must do" when coming to Toronto. There are fantastic views from the top.

On a stopover for a few days en-route to Havana. We had exhausted the coffee shops and were at a loose end thinking hmmmmmm what now? It was a clear day and the view excellent. quite pricy, but if youre in toronto, its a must-do. Went to 360 restaurant in December for mid week lunch. Good service and nice food. The menu is somewhat limited for vegetarians though. Bonus for dining in this restaurant is that you also get to go to the glass floor area and the outside portion of the CN tower as part of your dining experience.
Visiting the CN tower is a must do when in Toronto. The restaurant, located on the top floor, has super views of the city!

I've been up the CN Tower numerous times as I live just outside of Toronto and always end up having to go when family visits from outside Canada. I visit the CN TOWER in 2013..during a school trip, it is an amazing place from which we could have a nice view of downtown Toronto..I was scared to walk on the glass floor.took a lot of pics...a place to remember and never forget...
If you come to Toronto you must visit this historic landmark!! It's views are amazing and worth every penny you pay to visit!

I've been there 3 times in different years of my life. It's always an amazing experience to see the whole city from top. This time we were lucky enough to see a baseball game at dusk, so timing was perfect. .We will never forget the experience.

Great place to get some amazing photos of Toronto. There are different levels. There is a level with restaurants, which I had some tasty nachos and a lovely drink. Great to see the view of the city but overpriced for sure!The food in the restaurant wasn't good at all and it's very dated but the views are great especially if you're new to the city or just visiting!

If you are in Toronto you must see this place. It is not the best place but you must see it . don't forget the aquarium next to the tower.

you must visit the CN Tower, I would skip the pod at the top. The main views are awesome and you can go outside. The dinner although on the pricey side does include the price of viewing and entry so if you're up for an excellent meal with a view, I'd do that instead of just the tower alone.

It's an impressive structure (if that's your thing) and for my interest in all things that have led engineering, it's worth a trip.Pricing was fairly steep for what you get. A wonderful experience. A great location to visit for tourists! Beautiful view from above with wonderful restaurant and good. Nice people - good customer service.
I really did enjoy the views from the top and it was pretty awesome to be up so high but I do think it's overpriced and the wait times are outrageous during busy times.

Our visit to the tower on January 20th was excellent. We arrived around 4 and spent some time enjoying the day time view. We then checked out the glass floor--very cool. Scary at first but so worth it!! I visited the CN tower recently and the views from the elevator all the way to the top are just breathtaking!

A must do whilst in Toronto on a short business trip, the view at night is stunning, a glass floor in the viewing tower is very tempting for some not for others.A cannot miss if you visit Toronto and have a head for heights

Visiting Toronto it's almost impossible not to pay a visit to this beautiful sightseeing. You can enjoy the view of the beautiful city and the Great Lake Ontario. The views are breathtaking. Its wonderful to orientate yourself in the city and surroundings. Tip: go on a clear day and try to go before sunset so that you can experience that moment as well. The glass floor is quite photo worthy too.

Excellent view of the city and Ontario Lake, up there you feel like you are on top of the world. If you go to Toronto it's an experience you can not miss.

Entrance fee was about $25 (Canadian). The views were very cool and the elevator ride was also cool. Considering its one of the few attractions to see in Toronto I would say it's worth going up and taking in the view.

If you are afraid of heights this place is not for you. But if you are thrill seeker, this is a must. The glass floors and views are amazing. Go early - this place has long lines and tends to be very crowded.
Got to the Tower when it opened on Dec 26,2015. Felt like we had the place to ourselves.. Private Elevator ride for the 8 people in our party.

Went up with the family, having not done so for over 20 years but it is something you have to do if in Toronto and you have never been before. Some great views ( go on a clear day of course) and some other attractions to keep you entertained while there.
Great view to the city. City airport and all arround. There two levels, low and skypod. Skypod is realy great. I like that.

Expensive, resto has weird vibe.. not very welcoming. One of the 7 wonders of the world? ? In Mexico City El tournée Latino is 10$ to go up and Toronto is like 40$.. then you can pay and extra 12$ to go right to the top. The glass floor is cool.
It was amazing day.I have enjoyed a lot. nice shot and the best atmosphere.my husband has loved the views when we look at the sea.

It was impressive to see the CN tower in person, after having seeing and hearing about it so many times. When we went there it was rainy and extremely foggy so you couldn't see the top. Id say that if your near the cN tower go see it, but once is honestly enough.

Ok so the view itself was fantastic. But it's very pricy for what it is. And now they want you to pay for to go up a little higher. Glad I can say that I did I it. But probably wouldn't pay the price to do it again. The glass floor was pretty cool.
