it's worth it to climb the tower. the view from that 400 mt high point of view let you see the great area of toronto, the suburbs included. and also the lake. it's however expensive
We ate at the restaurant. Really good food. Great view. Plus we got free admission to the observation deck.
If you are going to go see the CN tower, definitely go at night. The lights are awesome and the view of Toronto is amazing. The elevator ride up was exciting and fast, loved it !

Awesome gift shop, and absolutely AMAZING view of Toronto and Lake Ontario from the top. The elevator to the top is quick, and there is a restaurant up there, too. Everyone who visits Toronto must visit the CN Tower.

It is expensive to get up there, but the views are really nice. You have to pick a clear day, though.The glass floor is very cool, but also covers a very small area.Extra attractions are available, but cost a lot of money.The gift shop is better than average.
Amazing view but far too expensive...maybe the landing platform could do with a freshen up as well?! Make it friendlier...Tim Hortons cafe over tres bien restaurants!

I'd recommend going to the restaurant, because you get free admission to the observation deck if you eat at the 360 restaurant. You can arrive an hour early or so to your restaurant reservation and then enjoy the observation deck! Otherwise it's a bit pricy for me to pay just for the views.

One of my fathers wishes was to have dinner at the CN tower so we decided on his last birthday to fulfil his wish.Having eaten at a number of restaurants in Toronto and other parts of the world - eating at a tourist attraction, to be honest we were not expecting a great meal but more hyping up the...
Very nice view of the city. Saw the view at night and the amazing skyscrapers. Definitely worth the visit and recommend it to anyone visiting the city.
Awesome way to spend a few hours and Se Toronto. The glass floor is mind blowing. Great view of the base ball ground from up there. Worth it!!!!
It's a truly a Canadian landmark. It represents Canada big time. Love that it has a restaurant on the top. It's a good spot for tourists who wants to see the beauty of the city! Well done!
It's a real pleasure to see the sunset with a glass of wine in the restaurant there.Not important to go to the upper level.
You gotta do it one time. Cheap and uncreative entertainment. Do not eat here. Dirty wash rooms. Crowds. Queues. Needs renovation.
I´ve visited the CN Tower twice and it is very impressive and tall! Haven´t get in though, but the park that sorrounds this place is very nice and cozy and you can chill out there.

the CN tower is awesome ..but it's so much better when you get to go up for free..if you reserve at the 360 for dinner your flight up is for free...and dinner is great up there .you get to relax have a drink good food as the restaurant tours the city..great for a romantic night out...ps don't order the steak...

I have been going to the CN Tower from the time I was a kid. I grew up in downtown Toronto and my friends and I used to sneak on to the CN Tower elevator by going in where everyone would exit (can't do that now). However, now as responsible grown up I take my family there every year for...

The tallest tower in Toronto, Canada. To have a good deal make a reservation for a condumable buffet lunch or dinner at Bar 360 - the only revolving restaurant. With this buffet lunch or dinner you'll get a free pass on CN Tower.

the 3rd tallest tower in the world. It is one of the focal points of the Toronto Skyline. From The LED lights that change with holidays or special events to the glass elevators, it is a wonderful way to view Toronto. It is a bit expensive but definitely worth experiencing at least once.

Okay but no obvious improvement since last visit three years ago. A little tired and overpriced-paid $140 for basic entry for 1 adult and 3 teens and I felt like I was on the tourist production line. View good but value for money debatable.
We had a clear day and could see for ages. Had a drink and dessert in the bar - the prices were expected - I would have expected them to be prohibitively more expensive.

A must see for everyone in Toronto.It is not good to see on a cloudy day.Step on the glass floor, for a thrill or walk outside when the weather is nice for a super thrill.We also had lunch in the restaurant and it is a great place to have lunch.
Interesting place to go to at least once. The glass floor is very fun. I could not even stand there. (I am scared of hight.)
This is a must do while you are in Toronto. A couple of pointers - pick a clear day and also go early so you skip any lines. Definitely stand on the on the glass floor - very weird sensation.
Been there so many times but still... I would go again! :-))it is always a new experience.Planing to go there on a rainy day..
It's not a site to travel to Toronto to see exclusively, but once you're in Toronto, you have to see it. It's a really tall old building. With a glass floor.

We went to the restaurant at the top of the CN Tower and it was a great meal. We had originally stood in line to pay to go to the top for the view but considering the cost we took advantage of the time standing in line to see if we could get a dinner reservation. Lo and behold! we...

First of all I am terrified of heights but I had a great time I am glad I was able to enjoy the day out in Toronto and experience this attraction I would highly recommend checking out the cn towerThe staff were friendly.

We went to the top of the CN tower, what an amazing view. a must see in Toronto. We didn't eat at the restaurant at the top but it looked reasonable . The tower is lit up at night , absolutely stunning, a great gift shop too.
The restaurant combined with the lift ticket makes for a great deal. It's a wonderful view and the food is great as well! Try to go on a clear day if possible because it's really all about the view.
Cool place to go. Meal was really good service good. View was out of this world. Great value meal when you think.it 30 dollars to get up the tower without food.
Went on New Year's Day and was busy around sunset but quieted down by around 6 allowing us to easily grab a window table at horizonsThe glass floor is awesome!

A must-visit in Toronto. It offers a fantastic view of the city. There is the glass experience: part of the floor is made of glass and it was quite challenging for me to step there while a bunch of kids would just fearlessly jump on the glass floor. It also took me a while to have the guts to take...

I went there around 4:30 pm, which was the perfect time for the sunset, and I stayed for the night light also. The view was magnificent, that's why it brought me back for the second time to the tower !!

We went early one day in November and there was no queue.The views were great.The glass floor is incredibly scary - even for two grown adults! It's a great feature!We paid to go up to the sky deck, this was really quiet (we were the only people up here) and it was great. We enjoyed watching the...

To go to the top is really fast, they are very organized and the elevators are fast. On the top you can see entire Toronto area(I think) and a lot of lake Ontario(some people says that you can see until the Niagara Falls in a sunny and clear day). Has the glass floor that I didn't got very excited but...

The views are fabulous but the glass floor is the real draw. The view down isn't anything wonderful but it's all about daring to step on it! I would really recommend eating in the 360 restaurant then going down a floor to the viewing deck as the ticket is included when you eat in the restaurant, and you skip the...
Visited in the late afternoon on a beautiful blue sky day and stayed up top until the sun set. Fantastic views.

The CN tower will be able to show you great views of downtown Toronto. Perfect for casual dates; hang out by the windows during sunset. However, for the most part, the greatest view could only be shown on one side of CN tower - the first window you see when you first enter. Personally, the rest is mediocre since I...
Excellent view of the city especially at night. Check the weather before you go because it the view may be limited. Great for kids, teens and couples. Definitely worth checking out.

This is vaguely interesting but outrageously overpriced. Kids enjoyed the ride up in the glass elevator and the glass floor up the top. Views are obviously good but TBH Toronto is not exactly known for it's spectacular scenery. Probably didn't help that we were there in the dead of winter.
Touring the area I am from with a friend made sure to stop in. Not at all what I recalled form 15 years ago. Over priced, long lines, very few Aww moments.

We decided to take our kids (7 & 10) for their first trip up the CN Tower.It was a bit of a grey and cloudy winter day, but we decided to give it a go anyways. We enjoyed the elevator ride up, looking out the windows on our way to the top, and down through the glass floor panels...

This does not compare to observation decks around places like New York City. For the area, it is a great place to visit. Gets you higher than most people will be outside of an airplane. The additional height for an extra $12 might be worth it if the skypod (or whatever it's called) is not fogged in.

Although it was a bit cloudy I decided to still go up the tower. Views were restricted due to the cloud but no crowds The glass floor walk is awesome even with the initial trepidation, after the first walk you begin to wonder why you worried at all.

I would definitely recommend getting the city pass for around $64 + tax (about £35ish) (at the time I went). We got ours from the museum but you can get it from any of the attractions included in the ticket eg casa loma, Royal Ontario museum, science centre, CN tower and the zoo. We visited all of them and they...
Spending is worth and very good experience.360 is better and have several option for food. Be early and don't wait for the Q

My husband and I went there on Canada day. It was an absolutely wonderful experience.The view was amazing.Worth every penny. Service was exceptional. The staff were attentive and knowledgeable. The view of the city at night was breathtaking and the food was what one would expect from such an establishment, delicious and flavourful. We would certainly come back.

If you're on a budget or you've been up other towers in other cities, then I wouldn't worry about missing this too much, but if you have the time and money then it's a pleasant half day out with amazing views. Don't forget you ID though.
Good information, great facilities and an amazing view. I was hear in winter when the lake was frozen which made it even better for the view.
Had lunch here, views,food,service were fantastic, highly recommend this as a treat wouldn't have missed it!

Pretty disappointed- expensive for a family (no family price though was a kids price) - but displays were seriously out of date. References to the Guinness book of records (tallest building) and a chart of other buildings comparing the cn to the Petronas towers (no shard or burj Kalifa).
Better when the weather is good, and then you can see even Niagara falls.Good view, but not the place to spend a lot of time...
Nice way to view the city. Once past the ever present security checkpoint the ride to the top gives you views out over the city. Great way to orient yourself.
Cheaper with city pass, then pay the extra for the Skypod visit on the 147th floor. A tourist expectation in Toronto for a reason.
You can't come to TO and not go up but make sure you go all the way for the best visit. Hell, for the best visit do the edge walk
the glass floor makes you feel like you're going to die but its so fun. The views of the city are amazing, My favorite time is sunset for sure.
I took some visiting family members to visit CN Tower. They were very impressed by the view. Kid was also excited by the glass floor. This is a must visit attraction for visitors.

Just an amazing view. On a clear day you can see for miles and then the night view is just as breath taking. Well worth a visit. It has toilets, restaurants and the staff are very approachable and friendly. We had a great time. Our party had the age range from 70 - 1 years and we all loved it....
Avoid going on high season or on winter. It gets very cold because is very high. Go to the first floor to see the glass floor.
This is a tourist attraction, straight up. Go up there, look around, take pictures! Great fun if you like this sort of thing.
It's impressive! Truly magnificent. Really breathtaking view. We want to go there again, during evening.
Good place to visit. Great view from the top of the tower.Good access on its periphery and good attractions in the vicinity.

Visited the CN tower with my mom +60 and my sister (in our 30's)We found that the deal of food in the restaurant plus entrance was better value ...entry alone is $35..Entry +2 course is $ 55Considering some crappy nachos is around $15 having 2 course meal for $20 is not bad.Other benefit of the...

Gosh I can't explain how amazing this destinations was! I was lucky enough to not have the lines too long or have the place crowded because school vacations had already ended. You go up in the elevator which was convenient. Now I recommend to try to go last into the elevators so you can enjoy the view up through the...
i took foreign visitors to see Toronto from the top. They were very impressed with the tour and the tower in general. Cost is rather high, but worth it.
its a must to visit if you are in toronto . you see it every where you go .. its not great to take oics from up there because of the glass windows up , or the metal fences windows down

We had a great time at the CN tower. Though this was a second visit, my kids enjoyed it a lot since they were very young on the last one. The view is amazing, lots of dining out opportunities, variety of photo booths, well maintained and reasonably priced gift shop. Best part standing on the glass floor...scary but lots of...
Beautiful place to visit it is the most high tower in the world from where you can watch almost all toronto plus the Lake Ontario
Wonderful view of the city. Even though everyone says it's somewhere to go once, I have been several times to take visiting relatives and I never get bored.
- Awesome view and cool ride with the elevator (it is pretty fast)- kind of expensive to go up, but you can get deals with the restaurants up there
Good story but just as any other tower e?perience ... Definitely worth a visit if you are in Toronto...

Note that only the front of the elevator and part of one side has windows -- try to be near a window on the way up/down, either by being first or last on the elevator. The ride to the very top costs extra, and was only barely worth it. Not sure I would bother to go to the very top...

there is nothing I like better doing in Toronto than to take photos of the CN Tower. I have been doing so, from so many different perspectives that I cannot wait until I get to take another. I have taken photos from the north, from the south, from the east and from the west - at nighttime in between a...

Having last visited the CN Tower about 20 years ago, I was glad to see it's not just fun for 10-year-olds! We went around sunset on a cold winter evening, so it wasn't busy at all. The view over the lake and the city is really lovely and the glass floor is really great fun! I don't conceive of myself...

views a great, excellent for fantastic photos surprising beautiful glass panel floor not recommended for light head viewers also recommend to step to the viewing platform, it is just an amazing attraction to visit when you are in Toronto, we loved it.

On a clear day, it is a gorgeous view but it isn't cheap. Consider having lunch as the cost of going up the tower is included in the price of the meal. The City Pass makes it even more affordable if you plan on seeing a bunch of different sites (zoo, science centre, museum) all over a period of about...

we spent a wonderful week in Toronto and went to the CN tower on couple of occasions....we enjoyed a superb twilight meal at the revolving restaurant, very good food and service though a touch pricey but hey, the views are hard to beat.Additionally, for thrill seekers there is an edge walk...the highest in the world where you are led...
Go early or weekdays and try to be there in a bright day.Good place to see the city and enjoy a nice meal.Perfect for sunsets and Romantic Dinners.
Yes, the view is quite something, but I don't know if the huge line and the crowd place were worth it...

Towers seem to be a must visit in every city, but this one is centrally located and offers excellent views during sunset for instance in any case towards the bay and the citycenter. It is too pricy in my opinion and a surcharge applies if you want to reach the upper top!
Great views neat glass panel floor to view through not for the faint hearted though lol and you are also able to access a viewing platform on the outside of the tower also a great view but cold wind
Maybe one day I will climb those stairs - something I've been saying for many years. But really, once is enough to go to the CN Tower. It is a real wonder and rather extraordinary but so expensive.

We visited it as you do. There view was good from the tower. Photo opportunities are not great from the tower. We also visited the 360 restaurant later on and on hind sight we should have only done the restutant.

The facility itself is very informative and has a lot of side activities to do.But above all the ride up at night was soooo much fun.Climbing at such a rate of speed was something to not be missed.The views are breathtaking, definitely take a jacket though, it's a little cold.
The CN Tower ist a amazing place to see all over Toronto. Make sure you go around a time that you can enjoy the view day AND night!The money is worth it and it is a must thing to do in Toronto
Paid out for the edgewalk and it was INCREDIBLE!! Totally worth the money. If you like an adrenaline rush, book this up now!!
It was an amazing view of Toronto from way up high! The glass floor was a bit scary for me but I did it! It a must do in Toronto!
One of my favourite attractions in Toronto...you have to arrive to the top and check the view! stunning...it used to be the tallest structure in the world
Very busy, but didn't affect our experience. Great views, definitely recommend paying extra to go to the skypod, views are Amaazing
As far as I am concerned, this is Toronto's best attraction. It's a predictable one (go up high, look over city), but enjoyable overall. The staff was helpful and friendly.

Booked weeks in advance for 360 restaurant, service and food excellent. Sadly the day was very misty so limited views, not CN Tower fault of course. Would have been nice gesture to offer a free or reduced rate return when view was better, sadly not offered.

It all started when I bought my Citypass, and the CN Tower was included. Then I realized that you can go there for free if I ordered food. I decided to do so after having been a visitor of my own for ten days and wanted to celebrate. And what did I then experience? A window popped up asking: Do...
Our entire family enjoyed it and would do it again.We used a CityPass, and enjoyed standing on the glass floor!

An excellent place to spend the afternoon if you are new to the city or a long-time resident. Torontonians should play tourist in their own city more often!On a clear day you can see Rochester NY and Niagara Falls as well as the Golden Horseshoe.Food and drinks are overpriced as expected.The extra fee for the skypod is...

I visited the CN tower with my husband for a trip after Thanksgiving. It's a bit expensive but worth the beautiful views of Toronto and the surrounding area. The staff was very nice when getting tickets and making our way to the top. There is a restaurant at the top if you're interested in enjoying the view for a little...
Amazing place to view entire Toronto City. Main attraction is glass floor and most of us will get scared to even try that. Worth a visit and must if you are travelling to Toronto
Good experience. Landmark of Toronto. Defenatily recommend anyone going to the c.n. Tower. True Toronto. "The 6"?
This has great views of the entire city. If you are scared of heights, it's still a great adventure. Don't let the "glass bottom" scare you off completely.

The CN tower is truly a must do attraction if you are in Toronto,just beware of all the additional chargers and make sure you budget for all the extras. With your average tickets you only get access to the glass floor and the walk out, the sky pod costs extra, so does the skywalk/edge and anything else you want to...

Having visited the Rockefeller center in New York City and the Burj Khalifain Dubai the CN Tower is the lest interesting in regards to views - however still worth a visit given there isn't much else to do in Toronto.
Love the ambiance and romantic view of the Toronto city... Recommended to go after sunset. Good food, good service and you are allowed to go to the glass floor and the observation deck

I had not been here since I was a kid and my niece wanted to go. It is extremely pricy for what it is. The "Glass Floor" is big enough for about 20 people to stand on it. For an extra fee you can go higher up...and if you want to spend even more, you can do the sky walk....

If you have been to many landmarks around the world, you might agree with me that the food often disappoints; so I went up to the 360 restaurant on top of the C.N. Tower with reservations - and yes, I made reservations. The food was brilliant, service was friendly and the room spun so as desert came we were back...

Really enjoyed visiting the CN Tower with spectacular views all over Toronto. Would recommend booking with a restaurant reservation as this includes the lift to the observation deck and the food is really good. Not only that, the restaurant revolves so you see all of Toronto go by whilst enjoying the meal.Also recommend visiting late afternoon so the views...

The CN tower is one the most important thing to see in Toronto. But once. In fact you have to pay almost 50 Canadian to to to the highest point and extra money to do the sky walk .With that being said think cautiously on how you spend your money and time there. Forhe extra cost to go to the...
The CN Tower has a great 2 level viewing platform that encircles the tower. Towering above the city, you can look down on everything. We visited on a clear day and could see for miles.

Not as exciting as I thought it would be. Staff were very knowledgable and had all the information you could possibly want. Found it expensive for a family of 4. It was an experience for the kids and now we can say we've done it but we won't do it again.
amazing views, great food good parking. Wish it was closer to me but overall good value for money. The glass floor is so cool on a clear day
I enjoyed the see through glass floor. Definitely not for those who are scared of heights. Make sure to visit the outdoor terrace.
This is a must if you visit Toronto, the views are incredible and the staff take photos of you that you can buy on the way out.

As a torontonianIt is a great place to see, i try to the everyyear, the view is wonderful,You have to check the weather for visibility report because you'll see as far as 60 km away when the air is clear, do not forget to bring your own binocular and photograf with the device to zoom inDo not...

On a clear December night, my husband and I went up the CN tower for dinner. I hadn't been there in almost 30 years. We ate at the 360 restaurant and watched the view of Toronto and all the lights. The food was surprisingly good. I was told it was only so-so. For starters the smoked salmon was awesome, and...

After a long line to buy expensive tickets , we ascended in one minute to the viewing area. Toronto glowed at sundown and the glass floors were thrilling . The cold winter winds blasted us on the outdoor walkway. This was a very expensive outing but it thrilled our kids .

This one will be short.. We had seen the videos on YouTube and were super excited to visit with the family.. That was until we learned that the elevator ride up the tower for a family of four was $140. Really? For a view? No way. We passed and instead took pictures upward of the CN tower.. Despite the cost...

We went to the CN tower in the daytime and the nighttime. Both times were great. We also did the sky pod.The line can be a bit long but it moves pretty quickly.If you buy your tickets on your mobile phone you will jump the line
Had a lot of fun I would go again. The class bottom floor was scary buy cool at the same time. Definitely check it out

We visited the Tower for dinner on December 15, 2015. The cost to ride the elevator was roughly 40.00 per person if you dine at the restaurant the ride is free. So we opted for the 2 course price fixed menu, the ambiance was nice it was cloudy on the evening we went so we couldn't see extremely far, the...

I've visited the CN 3 times in 2015, once just to go for the views and twice to the revolving restaurant. The views are gorgeous, especially at sunset. If you book in the restaurant, you can beat the queues and go up to the viewing deck for free. The time I went up and just got a couple drinks in...
Can't find a better spot than this for viewing the big city. Good for an hour or so. We took about four guests to see the city.

I though it wasn't really worth the money. it's just a view you can get from any tall building in Toronto. The restaurant is way overrated and over priced. the 3D cinema plays very short movies. the glass floor is very small area with foggy glass.if you get impressed easily and you haven't seen much, you'd like it.if...

column3: Cherry Hill, New Jersey, United States
column4: A great place to see Toronto from the sky ... from the Glass Paneled 360 degree view to the outdoor walkways then add the cool Glass Floors ... it is an awesome experience ... We will definitely go back this summer to try the "Edge Walk" (it's a little too cold for me to do it in December)

The tower has panoramic views of downtown Toronto and lake Ontario. The ride up to the top is in a lift that has a glass side panel which enables you to see the ground as you go up. At the top, there is a section of glass flooring that you can walk on. When walking on this section you can...

Visiting the CN Tower in Toronto is one of those things you kinda have to do but the good news is that it's actually pretty great. The glass floor looking way way down is very cool and if you want a real thrill you can do the new Edge Walk which is awesome. Skip the whole thing and head to...

My daughter & I recently visited the CN Tower in Toronto Canada. I am not a huge fan of heights but wanted my daughter to experience as many things as possible while we were on holiday.The first observation level is at 114 floors. The lift on the way up has a couple of glass panels on the floor allowing...

Toronto's iconic building - a must if it's your first time, but that's about it. The views during August were great especially with clear weather but it gets a little stuffy and heated inside without AC.The outside railing obstructs some of your photos and there is no much room to move at the top.I haven't tried any food...
when going to Toronto .. you must visit CN Tower (take full tour) .. beautiful view for the city ...

Looking to see Toronto from the high here is the place , nice view of the whole city and high sky raise buildings, nice cafeteria with lovely cocktails and nice moving restaurant (A bit expensive) but food is ok and service is friendly.

You can see everything in Toronto and for 100km around from the top of this amazing structure. Pay the extra amount to go to the upper observation deck. You won't be disappointed. A tip - skip the cloudy and foggy days.
Saw this from far. It was nice, the neighbourhood was relaxing and clean. Very charming harbour nearby where we took picture and had some snacks.
Crazy, surprisingly bad. Staff do not listen or help. Embarrassed for Canada. We can do better with a major attraction.
Great time!Staff is friendly, Edge walk is great.Chris Hall the Manager was very profesional and lead a very well trained team.

The first time I visited Toronto planned to get a City pass and relax. One of the main things to do in Toronto is CN tower. Very fast truck on elevator and we on the top where amazing pics can be done. But sometimes very windy.

Loved the glass floor area, even though it was only a small portion of the floor. They will take your photo on the glass floor for a charge, which is worth it as they clear the area for the photo. The glass area was very crowded I don't think we would have had much of a chance to view it...
Definitely worth the visit for someone who as never been. Impressive views, breathtaking when you go outside. The gift shop was actually our highlight, as they had a bunch of really nice things.

Went on a clear day, the views are fantastic. Really enjoyed the glass floor.Paid extra and went to the top however I don't think the extra money was worth the extra few levels.Would recommend doing this.
Mmmm.... Algo que tienes que hacer pero nada fuera de este mundo/ something you have to do but it's nothing out of this world

We pre-purchased tickets through our hotel which made them cheaper and they were valid for 9 days (in case weather was bad and you can't go on the day you want). We had to wait a couple of days to try get good weather before we decided to go up, though still a bit cloudy.Security before you go up,...
Went for a meal to the 360 restaurant and got a free ticket to the outside of the tower and the glass floor. well worth the visit

When in Toronto! Beautiful view of the city, too bad we didn't go on a clear day.The glass floor was exciting and definitely a magnet for selfies. It is a bit expensive considering you're only going up an elevator, looking around for fifteen minutes, reading the stuff and that's it. But it's a modern day world wonder and third...

Thank god we got the CityPass for this place. It's definitely OVERPRICED for the lame experience. Buy, buy, buy if you wanna have this or that. I understand it's a tourist attraction and its business but seriously? $60 per person (with CityPass) to just go up the elevator and walk in a circle. There's a restaurant for food but forget...
No doubt that is a place to go in Toronto. The best view in the city! Don´t go if you are afraid of highs!
Took my 4 year old up the tower. Unique experience. Had to hold her up to view most things. Would be nice for more platform viewing for the little ones. She loved the glass floor and the restaurant.

To be honest, it's really NOT worth the price of admission. I believe it's around $40 now which just doesn't cut it for an extended elevator ride and the chance to look around the top to the city. Best to just enjoy from a distance.
The tower offers great views of all of Toronto. There's lots do within the tower and I would recommend the Sky Walk.
Yes, it is expensive. However, in my opinion, it is one of those things that you should do at least once for the experience. The views are incredible and it makes for some great pics and memories.

I think this tower is the most notable symbol of Toronto and used to be the tallest building in the world. The views are amazing. I enjoyed the elevator and the glass floor. There is also Restaurant. What I did not do was the walk outside with a safeguard strap.
Great views, long lines, overpriced food in the food court. Lots of souvenirs to buy. Go anyway, or you will regret missing it.

Granted it was a k in May 2006, but all my holidays now are to be one like a proper tourist and see things that you won't see in another city and in Toronto that is the CN Tower, might be considered expensive and boring, but it's now off the bucket list and I can say hAnd on heart WE...

Not worth the money, very expensive – we paid extra to go the sky pod and got great views as you could go all the way round, this was the only saving grace. We were lucky enough to go on a clear day as we could see the mist from Niagara Falls, in the distance and the lake was beautiful....

Staff is always friendly. We went during the week so there were no kids or waiting in any lines to go up the tower, pay or anything. Nice quiet scenic day. CN Tower is definitely a staple attraction to visit when in Toronto.

The tower does offer nice views, but so do many buildings in the downtown area. It cost $146 for my family of four to visit the observation deck, which seemed expensive. My kids were bored after about 30 minutes. I made them sit through the movie about the tower's construction in order to get something more out of the cost...
Very expensive and extremly over crowded but would probably never go again now that we've gone once cool view through

Great views and glass floor experience amazing. But the attraction is looking like it was last refurbished in the 70s. My daughter was in a wheelchair and it was a bit confusing to get to the glass floor as the elevator markings were not clear. Otherwise a good experinece

Went with friend and enjoyed it to the fullest. The city view and the crew are amazing! I bought the CiTy Pass which included visits to Toronto's top 5 tourists attractions. It was one sunny afternoon I went there, the elevator experience was rather joyful and the inside photo session was great too.

Well, you can't miss it, especially the skypod from where you can actually see a 360º view from the city. But I really thought that the glass floor was larger... Just be carefull to go in a sunny day, clouds spoil the tour.
Beautiful views of the city and lake Ontario. There is a glass floor that is definitely an experience!

If one is in Toronto, do visit the CN tower. It's the second largest building in the world. From the observation deck you can see the Niagara peninsula, the parks and many more. The views are stunning and take some time on the glass bottom for a dazzling experience. It's worth all the effort to get there!

Spent an hour at the CN tower and loved the view over Toronto, especially watching planes fly in and land down below you! We paid the extra to go to the top tier and we were glad we did, although the glass floor was scary! The restaurant served nice coffee too!
We didn't even go up to the top, and it was exciting to see the tower. We were able to go inside at the bottom and see the movie about the building of the structure.

There are great views on a clear day from atop the CN Tower. If you are hungry and looking for a fancy meal a table at 360 restaurant comes with a free ride to the top, and after eating you can head down to the observation deck.

Visited this place again for the nth time, always makes me wonder how this structure endured extreme temperature over the years. The tensile strength only proved the brilliance of those who designed it as well as their technical expertise.

Amazing view of Toronto and parts of America. We ate at the restaurant and enjoyed the glass floor looking waaaay down. I'm afraid of heights so I only stood on it for a minute or so and I was done. Ha.The whole experience was amazing though, looking out and being outside, that high up.

Views are gorgeous of the city, however admission is expensive. The restaurant at the top also I don't find worth the price. The glass floor is the best part as well as the elevator ride to and from the top. Worth seeing but I think the outside is nicer than the inside especially at night when it lights up.
It's awesome. But to use it to it's fullest, You'll have to eat at the restaurant and do the edge walk.

The CN Tower is a landmark in Toronto. Everyone that is coming from out of city that isn't totally afraid of heights should take a trip up the CN Tower! There are two bulbs, the first larger bulb is where the majority of the tourism takes place. This includes a glass floor that you can stand on and look down...

Recently took my grandchildren to the C.N. Tower. The view from the observation level was fantastic. Having lunch while you are looking down on Toronto was great. I would highly recommend this attraction.
For all those who claim to have no fear of heights, go stand on the glass floor.You will definately know!

This is the second time i have been here with a large group of students from the UK. Everything is well organised, the views are stunning and there is enough information to keep the students engaged. There could be a better rate of discount for a large student group despite the ages, as i felt that having a group of...

Travelling up the CN Tower is not for the faint of heart or those who don't enjoy heights but if you can get past that, it is an experience you will always remember. Incredible restaurant, spectacular view, an adrenalin rush to say the least. The clear glass floor area can be engaging and unique. Definitely bring a camera and gravol...
A great place to visit if you are in Toronto..Awesome 360° view from the top..The main attraction of the tower is the glass floor...its scary but fun to walk on it.

The CN Tower is an overrated destination when visiting Toronto. I have gone with quite a few friends when they visit Toronto, and it has been beyond boring. The rides are outdated, the elevator is not that exciting, the view is frequently blocked by fog. The glass floor, the only interesting part of your visit, is not worth the price...
Wonderful place to check it out, dine, and watch at the skylight and nice view of downtown Toronto. It's a great place for couples and families to hang out.
the trip up is thrilling . Once at the top, you will find the view spectacular. Maybe you will wnt to have the ultimate thrill, an Edge walk..

The ride up to the CN Tower is really cool, watching as more and more of the city comes into view and feeling your stomach drop a little at first when the elevator starts going up is an adrenaline rush. The glass floor they say can hold 16 elephants and even though no human being could possibly weigh as much...
This is a fun thing to do with visitors to Toronto. Can't beat that glass floor at the top and the cities views!

We took our N.S. visitors to this landmark tourist destination for the 'experience', but not expecting such good food. We had a wonderful time, and the food was far, far better than we had anticipated. We were picky too, as we had just come back from spending winter in France, and were expecting the usual 'tourist destination' fare. Boy, were...
Amazing view on a clear day. On a cloudy day it is not uncommon to not be able to see the ground from the observation level.

The CN Tower afford that "different" experience to take guests to when you entertain in Toronto.... And for visitors it is a must see.Your experience starts with a fast ride in an elevator on the OUTSIDE of the tower. Make sure your camera is at hand!You can then dine in the 360º Revolving Restaurant from where you can...
You will definitely will see how beautiful our city is from every side, I went late winter and the reflection of the city light and the height is memorable.

I have no word for my trip and it is very good experence about my trip and nothing to compare about it and specialy trip .com offer about vacation and airline fare , is cheppest then any other webside offer.

Visited in September 2015. Recommend to visit on a clear day in order to enjoy the view over the city. Many different levels to visit and many different attractions within the tower. Enjoyed the glass floor experience. The elevator ride was an experience in itself. New this year is the edge walk. Will def try that on my next visit.

Until the last time I had been to the CN Tower was approximately 1980. Business associates and friends from France, Germany and Mexico recently visited Toronto. I went to the CN Tower twice, once with my friend from France and the second time with my friends from Germany and Mexico. On each occasion as impressed as I was with the...

The CN tower is an experience to say the least. My only set back is the hit on the wallet. It is a very expensive Toronto outing. I did enjoy every minute of it but will not be able to do it again any time soon.

If you are in this city its certainly worth a visit. Choose a clear day and you will have wonderful views of Lake Ontario and the landscape around Toronto. The restaurant is pretty good. If you are courageous enough you can do the edge walk outside the Tower. There is also the glass floor to walk on and get a...

I'm a local, but love the CN Tower. It really is a cool experience! Looking down onto the glass floors is probably the weirdest experience in the world, but it's strangely amusing. In a lot of ways it hasn't changed, so if you've seen it once you probably don't need to see it again.

I used to love this place the last eight years or so. My last visit there for dinner was a bit disappointing. Service wasn't great. Food only average, considering the prices. It used to be much better menu, much better service and better food. I'd still go back for the overall experience, but if it continues to go downhill, I'd...
Terrific outing for the whole family. Wonderful view of the city and the lake. Impressive structure and a proud Canadian monument.

If you like to see Toronto up high, this is it - both day and night views are beautiful, and breath taking.Some don't think it is worth the $40...but as a visitor, you probably won't want to miss it...
ok visit - stuff to do and see - great place for tourists but very over priced - like i said before it is over priced

Yes I am :-) but I couldn't leave Toronto with having been in the CN Tower and walked on the glass floor - eventually!!WOW its incredible, the speed the lift traveled up the side of the building was brilliant and scary at the same time.I didn't want to leave and I cant wait to go back.

Amazing 'trip' into the sky!I had a very great time, the day was wonderful so the view was special.I was very very afraid before to arrive to the Edge Walk.More or less we passed almost 30 minutes, the price is not so cheap (about 150€) but for one time in the life it would be ok, especially...
Great for everyone, but a business person with a couple of hours layover should stop here and look down at the city.
We have been a few times but this time was with 3 grandchildren who were in awe of the sights as we rotated.Don't miss the opportunity to experience a nice meal, wine and spectacular views of Toronto
It was a great experience to see Toronto downtown from 447 mt high ! To drink a beer in such a hilarious view is priceless !!

The CN Tower is a must see while in Toronto. Be sure to take the time and go to the top of the tower - it is well worth it! You see panoramic views of the city that you can't get anywhere else. It's fantastic during the day, but also beautiful at night.

Its really not that exciting if you are from around here but its a pretty neat one time thing to do! And if you have a friend from out of town or another place all together then why not! But I would suggest something more involving for the price.The floors are neat but really the exciting part of it...

Toronto to me was not as interesting as Montreal was...Thus CN Tower saved the day offering you panaromic views of the city. The fun starts when you go up the lift (express) and there is also a portion of the area with glass floors to which can be a 'Dare-yourself to jump on it' or just walk through it. There...
No lines. Get the city pass! My wife and I enjoyed it very much. The glass floor was quite dirty, I wish they had a way to keep it clean.
I stay at the hotel right in the heart of the city next to the CN Tower. I used this for a landmark getting back to my hotel.
I went to the CN Tower for the fourth time as I had family visiting. They were really happy to visit.

You can't go back home without visiting the CN TOWER!! I recomend 100%, its a bit expensive but you are going to visit one of the most taller places around the word. Never visit with fogg! The best choice is visit at 3-4pm and wait inside up to the sunset. Amazing...

CN Tower started the whole glass floor thing for the towers you see in other countries today. It's a nice way to start a trip although the view of the city isn't as memorable or iconic as other places like NYC, probably. It's a bit pricey so best bang for the buck would be to check if the 360 or...

Got there just after opening and benefitted from having both levels to ourselves; would suggest this. Relatively expensive so if you were to take a family it would add up but worth it for the views - absolutely amazing. It was worth paying extra to get to the nacelle.
This is one of the best atractions in Toronto in Canada. From there you can have a espetacular view from the city.

We had reservations at the restaurant atop the CN Tower -- definitely the way to go. Skip lines, eat a nice meal, and see the top in style! The glass floor is no joke -- if you are not into heights, just observe.
The elevator tour with glass bottom is very special. Not suitable for people who dislike hight.Don't miss the 360 Restaurant which turns 360 degrees.

What a thrill it was to take the elevator up 1,815 ft. To the tower deck. We enjoyed the view and then sipped a beverage in the restaurant before descending. Standing on the glass floor took a bit of courage, but the photos were worth it!

Obviously being so high up in the sky you are bound to get a great view of the city. That's exactly what you get when you go up in the CN Tower! There is the glass floor which is quite scary actually, but gives you a good idea of how high you really are. I love the fact that you...

Our annual Christmas party was held in the tower. Great view, of course...the layout for this type of function works well. Those that want to sit and eat have the tables with a view. Last day in Toronto lunch up the tower. Not disappointed service food and wine all very good. Very relaxed afternoon.

Views from the top is great. Though this is a bit old liked the views better in Toronto than from Willis towers in Chicago or burj khalifa in Dubai. Edge walking was too good and the instructors were great..
It is a great way to see Toronto, it give you a new perspective of the city and of the way we look at things.

One of the 'must do' attractions in Toronto. Friends with us spent ages identifying buildings and other attractions from the upper observation gallery at around 1400 feet. In my opinion, this is a bit of an overpriced attraction that the budget-traveller can probably forego..Pros: you get beautiful views for miles around. you get to say you've been to the top of the tallest building in the western hemisphere. the elevator ride feels a bit magical when you're going up for the first time, and the glass...

The view is amazing, it's possible to see the whole city from there. Nice stuff as well, and is easier to find yourself inside. However, I think the price is too high for only go up.Tips: take as much pictures you can, from inside and outside the tower.the best hour to go is at before the sunset, the...

Yeah it's ok. The glass floor id fun, but basically it's like any other tall building in any other city. Expensive I thought around $30 an adult or something like that. One of those things you do only once in your lifetime - thankfully :)

The CN Tower is a must visit. We visited the CN Tour while in Toronto in August. The day we had available to go was rainy and foggy so we didn't get a great view of the city but it was worth a quick stop anyway.

Lunch at CN Tower restaurant on Labour Day weekend -- the food and service was excellent . The views as your turn amazing. Wonderful experience. Recommend the lunch. Views from observation deck are terrible because of heavy mesh wire fencing.

With me, "heights-fobic", it was terryfyiing yet intriging to walk over the glass floor.Not every city can offer such attraction.Alltie renewing, getting interesting things and good to show to newcomers and the guests.Prices a bit high though. So you pay a bunch of money to take the elevator up real high, then you walk in circles for 20 minutes and come back down. It's really expensive and is only interesting for a couple of minutes.

Great tourist spot! Thought about having lunch up at the top, but it was price fixxe at $55. Took lots of pictures, though, and really enjoyed it. The glass floor panels where you can see the ground is pretty interesting. Loved watching the planes take off from the airport nearby.

Back when I was a kid the CN tower was kind of a big deal. Nowadays there are office towers on either side that seem to be about the same size. If you're a tourist go check it out. It's an iconic Toronto thing to do.
It is a landmark. It is one of the most famous places in Canada. So, you must visit it. There is a restaurant at the top, and you can have great views of Toronto and the lake.
Great view, elevator ride wonderful.Don't miss the glass floor, or pick a nice day and venture outside to the observation deck.

Its worth visiting if you like tall buildings and if you want to complete this on your list while visiting Toronto. I found this a great way to get up above it all and see the one of the great lakes and also one of the great cities in Canada. Quite reasonably prices and worth the time!

Yes it is the 3rd most tallest building in the world. Make sure to have your camera ready on the elevator ride up, it's a very unique ride up. The glass floor is very small and not much of a view, still interesting. If you step outside there is a huge net to obstruct your view of the beautiful city....

A must for all visitors!!!There is lots to see and do either with family or your significant other. From the basement to the top of the tower and even outside the tower.Don't miss out walking on the glass floor sure to delight and scare you!

Its a monument which you can watch standing anywhere in downtown. No need to go above the tower and watch the city as the fee is expensive and as you go up it has protective grill which hampers the view.
If in Toronto you so need to go up the CN Tower. It is not frightening at all and I'm so scared of heights....the views are tremendous..with the view of Toronto that stay with you forever.

It is one of those things you do in a new city. Go up the highest tower and gaze at the city below. The CN tower is no exception, except that the price you pay for going up DOES NOT justify the cost.We went up at 7PM (with twilight on the horizon) to see night fall over the city....

Decided to have lunch in the revolving restaurant as the incremental cost is not huge compared to the cost of just going to the viewing platform. I really came to CN Tower with high (no pun intended) expectations. However, I left disappointed. Unless you're really into going up elevators and viewing the city from a tall building, a visit up the CN Tower will not be worth the price. It's pretty cool, but should cost about $10-15 instead of $35. Also be prepared to waste a lot of time waiting in line.
Worth the visit. A bit expensive but if you're visiting Toronto it's a must. The view is spectacular on a clear day.

I went in July and it was super crowded due to the holidays. There were so many people it was hard to get near the windows due all the selfie taking tourists. I think it's nice but I've been to a lot of skyscrapers where you can get better views. We got free passes with our hotel but it's about...

I don't suppose you can go to Toronto and not visit the CN Tower. An engineering marvel! The view from the top is a jaw dropper. If I was going again I would plan on having a coffee at the restaurant. I might even try the higher sky pod if I'm in a brave mood. We scaled the Rockefeller Centre...

From the moment we were greeted by security we were welcomed by a friendly staff who genuinely seemed happy to have us there. CN Tower is the tallest building in Toronto Canada. It is the world's 6th tallest free-standing structure.and 4th tallest tower being the tallest in the western hemisphere.It has two restaurants from where you can take amazing photos of the city and it can be seen from far away it is the landmark of Toronto and a very nice tower

Excellent tourist landmark with tasty food snacks and some entertainment. The major attraction though is the view. Specially if you like taking pics. There is a breath taking view of the city downtown.

It was a great experience to go to the observation deck of CN Tower, Toronto in a very speed elevator. Badly managed for queues, no real organisation. Rip off prices for a view of concrete. Go visit the city and the lakes stay out of tourist trap places like this.

So looked forward to our extra day in Toronto especially to visit the CN tower and aquarium maybe that caused the utter disappointment in the visit. I just went up the CN Tower a few days ago and had a great time. The view from the observation deck was amazing and you could see basically the entire city from there. And the glass floor was really fun (and a bit scary to stand on too). I would highly recommend checking out the CN Tower.

It costs $39 to go up the CN Tower and extra if you want to go to the higher pod. The views from the top are fantastic but once you've looked at that for 10 minutes then stood on the glass floor there isn't really much else to do. I even checked with the woman who was working the elevator...

Our company holiday party was held at the CN Tower, and I cannot say enough good things about it. Despite a long lineup to get through airport type security, everything was first class. Second time visiting the CN Tower, the view is simply breathtaking, a must when in Toronto! The queue was surprisingly not too long!

Beautiful views on every side! I don't like cities but the Cn tower was the first stage of my falling in love with Toronto! I found it ordinary, it's nothing great. If you like views from height it's the place for you. Line is a killer. It's like every other tower ? in any big city.

It is nice to see the city from above for couple of minutes but it is not worth the price you pay for the ticket. I would not miss anything if I wouldn't have gone. There are better things in Toronto to spend your money on.
A sure to go place, can't go wrong with it....the view will amaze and aww you....a must go attraction in Toronto

We visited on an unseasonably warm afternoon in November, when the sun was shining and the sky was clear. Visibility was wonderful from the top. The experience starts with great views from the lift which even has glass panels on the floor. The glass walkway is also a unique experience. Visited in winter so no queues

I loved it. My recommendation is to go up before the sunset so you can enjoy the view with daylight and by the night. And if you-re a sunset lover like me, it´s the perfect place. I wasn't wowed or in love would this venue. It is probably much better in day than it was at night. we couldn't or didn't anything but a few close up buildings. outside was closed so we stayed within bother observatories. The glass floor is nothing special and stepping out you feel nothing.

A fun trip up the tower....TIP - if you are planning on having dinner in the area then you should make reservations at the 360 restaurant at the top of the tower. I'm in town on business, not sure when I'll be back again, so I thought this is a must-do while in Toronto. The view is excellent. It's a bit pricey, but a rare experience. If you are on a budget, skip it, but if you can afford it, check it out.

Although there is a entry fee, but people always say "if you come to Toronto, you must visit CN Tower". I went to this tower with my friend, it is worth a trip, you can see the view is so beautiful! Suggestion - go around sunset time, you can see the both day and night view.

I went to this place because my hotel was right next to this when I visited Toronto. I was scared to ride up at first, but it was fun at the top. I didn't do the edge walk but it looked fun. I loved the glass floor at the top. I hope you love it too if you go there.

I came here at night. It costs $40+ to go up to the restaurant level, but at least you get food out of paying the big price. The view from revolving dinner room is fantastic and there is a separate area in a nearby room with glass floor and outdoor deck. Worth the money, but best deal is dinner package.

We wanted to have drinks but honestly didn't want to pay $35.00 each to go up the elevator, so we opted out, since those would've been expensive drinks LOL.I'm sure the view is spectacular. Maybe next time

I hadn't been to the CN tower in many years, we decided to go at night as I'd already been there during the day. It was a beautiful view as the sky was clear, also no line-ups at this time. We had a City Pass so we didn't need to stand in line to buy tickets.
Visited the CN Tower on November 25 in the evening.A bit expensive but what a great view!Nice glass floor..loved that.

Unmissable experience in this fabulous city. Gives you a lovely view of Toronto. Go to the 360 restaurant whilst you're up there! You get free entrance to the observation deck and glass floor with a reservation.

I only saw the views from the normal tower area after doing the CN Tower Edge Walk - so it was pretty poor in comparisson. The windows are quite scratched and dirty so ruins the views, would recommend the Edge Walk so much though! Amazing experience!

Excellent way to see the city, I recommend paying the extra fee for the higher deck. The glass floor deck is great to test your nerves and for pictures, if you are in Toronto you have to visit this iconic place.
Engaging elevator operator. This looks over Roger's Centre, the lake, and the entire city. Gives you a great perspective of the city.

We went up the CN tower on a Sunday Morning before it got busy, which I'd recommend. The view was stunning and if you've never gone up a tower before, it's worth the time. If you've visited the Space Needle or Willis (Sears) tower it's a similar experience.

Just don't eat there! The Horizon restaurant is terrible but the tower is great and the people are friendly. We paid extra and went all the way to the top (a second elevator once you get up top) and it was fantastic. The kids loved it.

I went with my girlfriend who is new to TO, I've been before but it never fails to amaze me. The day we went, however, was very busy and I did not feel that it sufficiently showed how amazing it was due to the large volume of people.

Excellent attraction that allows you to take in the immensity of the city, towering over the buildings that tower over you when at ground level was weird. Great view of the city for guests who come to visit. We always have lunch and spend the afternoon slowly spinning around!
Best experience! Went in summer last year. Was hot but we were lucky to keep our SunZone sunscreen along and didn't get the sunburn. Visit this place whenever you can. Totally worth it!

My 2nd time going up the elevator was just as interesting as the first if not more so! We purchased the Pass to take us to the next, higher, level and it was worth it! What not to like about a bird's eye view of a city. We ate a pleasant lunch in the revolving 360 Restaurant and were fortunate to sit by a window. This gave us plenty of time to se the sights. We also went to the viewing level. It was August so there were a lot of people visiting. By eating...

Went in a Saturday afternoon for a birthday lunch with a party of 5. Had amazing customer service from the moment we entered the building. If come to Toronto you have to visit CN tower. One of Toronto landmark and amazing views at the top of the tower.

What an experience !! It was amazing. Have been up in towers in Sydney & Melbourne but this was unbelievable. The staff were all very friendly & helpful.My only problem was there was no consession for people with disabilities - I have MS & use a walking stick, so the cueing was very difficult.

Beautiful at night....amazing structure....would recommend it to anyone who visits Canada for the first time

Went with mom, awesome attraction of Toronto city. Mom loved it. sitting on the glass view in tower and ambiance. Perfect for travelers and even for a reset for Torontonians!!!!

High above the Toronto skyline, on a clear day, to enjoy the spectacular view of the Toronto city skyline. Place is very good. You can watch very nice sight in Toronto.Little bit expensive but doesn't matter.We don't taste restaurant.Glass floor is very scary.
