When it was time to leave, we waited about 30 minutes for the elevator. There was a large group of students that was leaving, and there is only one elevator for...

High atop the Toronto skyline lies an observation deck that allows visitors, on a clear day, to enjoy the awesome view of the Toronto city skyline and miles beyond that too. Swiftly rise above the city's skyscrapers on the glass enclosed elevator offering breathtaking views of the city. It almost feels like you are on your way to something spectacular....
Great views from the basic level. Not worth paying to go up to sky pod. Staff helpful as everywhere else in Toronto.
I would suggest to visit once CN tower if you are in Toronto. Do wait till sunset for awesome lights.
Well worth the scary trip up ! The view is like no other . Something that's defiantly timeless ! I could have walked around the top all day
The best view of Toronto! Very unique experience. Just a pity the skywalk is so expensive as I would have loved to do that!

We got very lucky with the weather in Toronto for a November day so decided to take a trip up the Tower. Its a fun experience which really allows you to get a look at this amazing city. We started at the first level which think is around 118 floors where you can walk around the outside of the Tower....
We had a great family experience here. I loved the glass floor. I didn't pay so not sure of the cost but it's a must visit when in Toronto.

well you cant see a view like this anywhere else in Toronto.I personally like to go to the place with the highest viewpoint in whatever city I go to at least once. I was not brave enough to do the skywalk or even walk on the glass floor
It cost $106 for two of us to go up the tower (including the Skypod). Which I think is pretty overpriced however the views are amazing.
Great views!!! Went during the week and there was no lines :) staff were really nice and told alot of info when you were in the lifts on the way up.
Not being from Toronto, the CN tower is something that I had to check out. Some fun stuff to do but not overly engaging. Try to not be afraid of heights with this one.

good security at the bottom, before buying tickets. Fast lift up to the first level. Near 360 degree views from the enclosed area, 360 views from the outside area. Area of Glass floor on the way to the lift. We didn't pay the extra $12 to go up to the bubble but we could see to the edge or Tononro...

This is my highlight of a great visit to Toronto, the view is truly amazing from the revolving restaurant, the restaurant is top quality so much more than I expected when we booked, I couldn't believe the quality of the food for a visitor attraction, if I visit Toronto again I will be going back

Amazing views! We went on a monday, so it is was nice and quiet with no lines. My legs got wobbly just using the elevator, which has a glass window on the floor. Probably not the best attraction for people who dislike heights, but still a must-see if you visit Toronto.

It was much higher than we thought it was going to be! It reminded me of the Sears Tower in Chicago, but we loved the outside area where you can feel the wind whipping through your hair. Also, the "glass" floor was a ton of fun!
Toronto is a great city cn tower good glass floor quite frightening . Bought tickets at hotel which was $5 cheaper than at cn tower also got to front of line

The cost is going to be prohibitive for many especially those with a family. That said we enjoyed the experience. Ww paud the extra to go to the hoghest level. Really, probably not necessary as the extra height is really not discernable from the lower one. We ate lunch at the cheaper restaurant and the food was pretty good.

This really is the place to go for the out of this world dining experience, the food is pretty good too! the full effect of moving slowly whilst dining doesn't really get you immediately until you realise your view from the window has changed! this is a treat for families, couples and romantics. Perfect place to propose or to celebrate...

What was once the tallest free-standing structure is still damn high. Don't want to do the Sky Walk? Walking on the glass floor is still insane.Hate the elevators? Try taking the stairs during one of two fund raising events held each year... You'll appreciate the elevators.
it has not changed too much since I was a kid but still fun too see. I will return in a few year I am sure.
The CN Tower was a great experience. Go at night to get the full effect of how far you can see. My only disappointment was that the bar restaurant stopped serving food at 6pm.
Amazing place to take friends visiting Toronto. They loved it. View from East to West, north to South of greater Toronto. Seeing Toronto Centre Island & Porter airport.

My boyfriend and I went first thing on a Saturday morning to avoid the lines. The ticket price is worth what you get. We also paid extra to go up higher to the skypod which was also very cool. We were lucky as it was a very clear day. Would also have been amazing at night with all of the...
Expensive for what it is - however, if you come to Toronto and not travel to the top you have missed out.Essential visiting.
Expensive, but well worth it, we brought family of all ages here, quite spectactular...combined it with a bus and water tour that day, really fun!
This is the Most Beautiful View, of Our Beautiful City in TORONTO. WE ARE soooo Proud of Our Free Standing Tower. Yp uh Must come Visit ft, IRS A Beautiful TResturant and View Amazing.

It was Great Sunny Friday - September 04 2015 - Evening , Me and My Friend's Friend ( She was from Japan ) visited to CN - Canadian National Tower or Canada's National Tower - Tower. She was amazing about CN Tower. She said "WOW" and " I love It ".She took so many - Sunset and Night of Toronto...

We enjoyed our visit but it lasted less than 45 minutes and it cost close to $148 for myself and my two tween kids to get to the skypod. The views were interesting but I can't help feeling fleeced to show my kids the tower. We must be paying for all the extremely bored security at the tower. Should be...

The wait time to get into the elevators took us 2 hours!Then, once we got up to the glass floor, there were too many people pushing around and unruly kids jumping on the glass floor. It was too crowded to get some time to explore the glass floor level. The views were obstructed by the sheer amount of visitors,...
Toronto Ontario what a beautiful city !!!!!!!!!!!!! the sun was shinning and it was November when to visit my son and his family in Milton Ontario
The menus and wines in the revolving restaurant, 360, are reasonably priced and the view is amazing. The seafood is fresh and tasty.
We went us twice and needless to say the views are simply amazing - try to pluck up courage to sit on the glass floor makes a amazing photo good restaurant which serves decent food
Good views all around specially when the weather is clear. Nothing much exciting other than the glass floor.

A very good visit with spectacular views. The Café is a good place to relax and see it all .... the clouds actually came in below us at the end of our visit!!! And walk on the Glass floor if you dare!! Scary!!

Nice view of the city, but really not worth the $40.00 entry ticket. Numerous spelling mistakes on the wall presentations. Glass floor is all scratched up, hard to see through it, and the bottom view is of a building. It also had screws missing from the frame, so no one in our party wanted to step on it. The elevator...

If you like to be on the top of a city, the CN Tower is a must. One of the world's tallest independent standing buildings, it is a beautiful slim structure. The glass floor on the Lookout level, though not the highest point you can visit, is exciting, you feel you are in space (some people do not dare to...

We were in town for a couple blue jays games last year and decided we had to head up to the top of the CN tower. Everyone should do it once but it really is overpriced. Once you get up there it's awesome to look around and the glass floor is fun to look at as long as you aren't...
CN Tower was always a good attraction in Canada, It was the symbol of toronto. The only thing, it's too expensive including the 360 restaurant

We (2 of us) went up to the skypod, a little over $106.00. Yes the views are spectacular, but not one hundred bucks worth. Seen it once, definitely not worthy of a repeat trip. There are far better attractions in Toronto to spend your dollars on.

CN Tower is a nice place to checkout when in Toronto. Once the tallest structure in the world, one can have an excellent view of Metropolitan Toronto and looking towards Lake Ontario, you can see Niagara Falls as well as the shoreline of Buffalo NY. There is a revolving restaurant at the top where you can enjoy a nice lunch...

Great place to visit. Was a little scared at first but once you are up there it really isn't bad. We went on a windy night so we couldn't go out on the outdoor observation deck. The only downfall in my opinion is the extra 12 dollars they charge to go up to the highest level. Not so worth it....

The view from the top is fantastic - although there's veery little information up there, you could look at the view/take pictures for as long as you like. I personally didn't stay up the tower for too long, but if you fancy staying up there for hours that'd be no problem. You must walk over the glass floor - and...

I was up in the Tower not long after they built it. The view going up the elevator is incredible. Everything just gets smaller so quickly. The elevator is like riding on air, you hardly know your moving. I never ate at the restaurants but used the time for photography. We have this great gem right in our back yard,...

We went downtown Toronto on a beautiful Monday morning in November and enjoyed the CN Tower with no lineups, pushy people or crowds. It was absolutely the best time to go, as we chose not to go this summer when it was very busy. The view was awesome and we did a few laps of each floor taking in the...

I have been up the tower countless times..it magic wore off long ago for me. But it is a place to go and say you have been. The glass floor is pretty neat and may be very exciting for the nervous person. Get your wallet out it is not cheap.

Been there at the end of October 2015. I think it's a little bit too pricey for what it has to offer, but again it's a place where you have to go at least one time in your life to see if you have the opportunity.
Been Here on 3 separate visits over the years......always amazing. It has good views form the restaurant, glass floor, and pretty much everywhere.

I always wanted to go up to the highest possible viewpoint of this tower ever since I was a small kid and read about it in a book. I think the name of the observation deck had something to do it, it was called the "Space Deck" back then.I had a long layover in Toronto so I took the...

The view is cool, but if you've ever been on an airplane or in a tall building,its esstentially the same idea. Paid $30-$100 to ride an elevator, if you want to feel like you've been had, this is a good way.Lots of souvenir's at the store if you'd like to commemorate your trip.
Toronto was a beautiful city highlighted by the CN Tower in the skyline. The people were friendly and we were able to find a little European style market that had great food.

This is a very expensive elevator trip with a view. We went early to avoid crowds and went straight up. It really is a great view, but other similar towers that i have been up, have excellent info at viewing points to tell you the buildings and landmarks you are looking at. There was nothing like that, once we had...
Best views of the city are here, location is at the very heart of enternainment district and accesibility is pretty good. when in the elevator you get a full view of the city as well
Please ensure you visit CN anytime you are in Canada. The breath taking views from all angles were lovely and the glass floor was thrilling

We only visited the CN Tower as the lines were shorter than normal, but if it was high season and you were anticipating over an hour wait, I would not say it's worth it.I could see the Tower climb would be an excellent experience, but to wait an hour or more to see the view is overrated.

This was a very interesting place. The view from the outside was super. We went in the afternoon and then stood outside on the deck for the view. It was really something. Lots to see for anyone-young or old.

You absolutely have to go inside the tower. Totally wicked elevator ride ( not for the faint of heart). This is how you truly see the amazing views Toronto has to offer.The restaurant view is fantastic in the evening.
The views are wonderful of the city and the lake. Definitely worth the trip up at least once in your life. Stunning
loved the glass floor and the history and OMG the restaurant!! Best food every! not one bite wasted and huge huge portions and incredible view....great experience.

When you visit something like the CN Tower you know if will be touristy and expensive, but you also know you can't see anything else quite like it. We were only in Toronto for one night and we knew we wanted to see this. We went at night and it was gorgeous! We saw the Toronto Blue Jays playing in...

The CN Tower is pretty awesome. It is one of the seven Wonders of the Modern World and has really earned the title. At 553.33 it was the world's tallest tower for 34 years and it is still the world's tallest freestanding tower in the western hemisphere. From the lookout, you can see 160km on a clear day - as...

Quite a while to wait but the experience is worth it. It is a must see for any trip to Toronto. Take your time with the views and the nerve-wracking glass floor. Can reserve a table at the restaurant online, or for a real experience do the edge walk...if you have money to burn.
CN Tower is a must to visit in Toronto if you are not afraid of heights. Beautiful views of Toronto.Dining in the circular restaurant was fantastic. Great menu choices and excellent service.
Went there to celebrate my older daughter's birthday. We had a surprise dinner planned for her at 360 Restaurant. She was ecstatic! Still remembers it as the most special spectacular birthday.

The CN Tower is the number one need to do by every visitor I've ever had to my place in Toronto. If you come to Toronto, you have to go to the CN Tower and check that off your list of things to do or you will forever be asked about it, even if you didn't. It is unbelievably amazing...

Arrived rather frazzled after a grilling for some unknown reason at Toronto Pearson...anyway once I arrived at the Tower it was literally up all the way. The weather was not the best, but could still appreciate the scope for viewing far and wide. The food and wine was amazing..just what I needed on my first night in Toronto. Travelled in...

It took two attempts to see go up the tower. The tents out front look like a special occasion is happening so we didn't try. As it turns out, the tents are security. Fairly fast lines to get up in the mid afternoon on a Friday. Super view - can't say anything but positive about that! It is expensive for...
It was in the spring, so there wasn't any interesting thing to do. They even do not open the door to the outside area for better view. Better come on summer to get experience on CN tower Edge Walk
Excellent trip and kids loved sprawling on the glass floor and the elevator ride up ... Also use the free ride ticket which is on the ground floor ... Food not great up there so don't plan to eat

We had a fantastic meal . The Staff were excellent and nothing was to much trouble. It costs 35C$ to go up to the veiwing platform but only 55C$ to have a 2 course lunch sat watching the veiws as it goes 360° in 72 mins. Recommend this
You must go up elevator - walk or eat at the restaurant - and DO THE EDGEWALK - way cool - spectacular view of the city - highly memorable life experience!

Though the line ups are long and the lift tickets expensive, no trip to Toronto would be complete without visiting the CN Tower. Why not save yourself some cash and enjoy s meal while there? If you reserve a table at the 360 restaurant, you can get a beautiful evening prix fix meal for $55 and your lift ticket is...

Terrific view of the city and a long way north, south, east and west on a clear day. Fun to stand in the glass floor section and look a long way down. Works for kids and adults. Bring tourists here often.
..speedy elevator takes you up in moment..the glass walk is really scary but you have to do it..the edge walk..OMG...speach less..MUST DO.
If you want to see all of the GTA (greater Toronto area) than this is a great activitie. Make sure to avoid if is very cloudy.
Hi above the city in one of the tallest buildings in the world. Fantastic to look at from the ground and even better from the Observation area.
I have been twice, once during the day and once during sunset. Both times was worth it. Take your time and enjoy the view :)

Not for the faint of heart....those "afraid of height" or prone to vertigo, but the CN Tower is a "must see" for 1st time visitors to Toronto !The (rather pricey) ride up the exterior elevator sets the stage for the truly impressive sights from the top.If you've time (and a wallet just needing to be emptied), the 360...
I live here but I still enjoy coming up and seeing the city from high. A must do for any visitor to Toronto
We went because you have to! Very expensive to get up there and quite boring actually. The view was lovely and we went during sunset, so saw day and night views but hardly worth the money
This is a must do item if you're visiting Toronto. Go out on the glass floor and be amazed!! The view is out of this world!! But if you're afraid of heights, you may be terrified!

The CN tower is a must visit if you are visiting Toronto or having someone over. We dined at the restaurant there when we visited, which is highly recommendable. The price of a 2 course meal is around $50 and $70 for the 3 course one. It's definitely higher than the average meal of a restaurant in Toronto, but the...

Go on a clear day and if you need lunch...then the view is free...you don't have to pay to go up. Kids love the clear floor panels that allow them to see all the way down and daredevils can hang right off the outside deck, rigged up in outfits like sailors leaning off deck. If CBC's Rick Mercer can do...

If you want to see the CN Tower I recommend that you book lunch. You won't have to pay to go up the tower so long as you have lunch! Then you can enjoy the 360 degree views - they're amazing! The food was excellent too!

Yes it does give panoramic views of Toronto and it was a beautiful day so they were good views, but I wasn't blown away by the experience. We visited on the same day as a Blue Jays match and the place was heaving. All I'm saying is if it's your thing to go up tall buildings then you will enjoy...

Went up the CN Tower while doing some sightseeing around Toronto. The tower is easily accessible from the UP Union Station, which was the main draw. While the tower has great views, the price is a little steep ($35 or so) just to go up the elevator. Once upstairs, you can walk around the deck, take photos, and see a...

The CN tower was pretty cool and had great views, the price is probably a little high for what you get.I didn't do the skypod just the normal viewing level. The staff were friendly and it was nice to see Toronto from up there.

I give it a 4 because the glass observation area just doesn't compare to the old Sears tower in Chicago. It isn't very clear and photos don't really show the drop. But what's unique about CN is the outdoor deck. Our kids had a blast walking around the circle and finding the wind tunnel.

The CN Tower has an incredible view over Toronto. With the revolving restaurant it is a very nice place to be. Good food wine selection. Not cheap, but it is worth it! Quite busy also. Reservations needed. Especially for the outside ring (by far the best places) in the restaurant.
Really wasn't planned to visit there but was worth every penny... Loved it... Recommended for people who love to watch the view from heights :)

We booked a late lunch at the CN Tower. We chose the fixed price menu which was excellent value, as this included entry to the viewing level and glass floor. The food was very good and the views were amazing.

Great view of the city. We went about half an hour before sunset and it was beautiful. My husband got some great photos. We were there on Monday, August 31 and it was not too crowded. There were no long lines or waiting for a place at the windows. We watched the sun go down then went to the open...

What a great way to see the city of Toronto. The Tower has great view all around. I went on a Sunday morning and the lines were not existent.The elevator up has windows to see out which is cool. There is also a windowed floor area where you can look down and take pictures.It's a bit pricey for...
We had dinner in the revolving restaurant which allowed us a free trip to the highest floor, the views were stunning as it was a beautiful day!

The CN tower offers great views for Toronto and the lake Ontario. You can also see Niagra and the other side of the lake if the weather is nice. There's interesting information about how the tower was build. However the entrance is a bit pricey (35$ for a regular entry) but you can't skip CN tower if you're in Toronto.

The CN tower is a must-do in Toronto but it left us feeling a bit underwhelmed. The tower is stunning to look at from the outside but the 114th floor did nothing to impress us. I guess we could have done the edge walk on level 147, but one of the kids was not yet 13 so that was out....

On the CN Tower, you have several levels: glass floor, observatory, 360 Restaurant and Sky Pod. The cheapest option, which is included in Toronto CityPASS, just gets you to the glass floor and observatory levels, but none of these offer a 360 degrees view. The restaurant, albeit expensive, will actually give you the opportunity to enjoy the whole view around...
Really if you're in Toronto the best attraction that I recommend is the CN Tower because is really an amazing experience and you will enjoy it cause the pleasure of being so high is incredible...

Basically what you see is the whole view of Toronto when you go up to the tower, you can pay an additional sum of around $12 to go up even further but its just not worth it. The attractions below the tower is minimal but okay and as always the souvenir shop is huge. Its worth it for the view...

It's one of those things that you "have to do" in Toronto but in my opinion whoever manages the attraction are coasting along and extremely lazy. Completely relying on the fact that people will just pay the extortionate price for a nice view of Toronto and Lake Ontario.I think I may have been spoiled by first visiting Willis Tower...

Hey guys. I have been here to see the famous CN tower. The story why this tower have been build is quit nice, -to show to the world where Canada is in power of- but the entrance price to get in is quit schocking. The general admission is just for the platform, not for the top-floor where other tickets are...
The view is spectacular, but it is very expensive... La vista es fascinante pero es caro para lo que me concierne...

Visited the CN tower on a Sunday around 1pm and it wasn't very busy. I highly recommend going to the 360 restaurant and getting the complimentary trip up to the glass floor and the other level since it's only 20 more dollars but the view and ambiance is a lot better.

We came to the CN tower a few times to show our friends and family from out of town. This is a must-do in Toronto but it is quite expensive just to go up an elevator and come back down. The views are amazing. You can even see parts of the state of NY on a clear day.
Nice view of Toronto downtown when you get to the top. Edge walk is super amazing here. It was fully booked when I was there, looking forward to do edge walk soon.

For the price, I was expecting a lot, and it didn't disappoint.It is like many tall buildings in cities - so do bear that in mind before going up - in the way that there is an indoor and outdoor walk way, posters about the construction, a cool lift with part glass floor, souvenirs, cafe at the top, etc....

The view from the CN tower is just wonderful. The restaurant food is delicious althought it's a bit expensive and the portions are very small. But then once again, even when you order the food, you're still actually paying for the view. If you want to take the stairs....you literally have to be in a very good physical condition, not...

This is really worth the visit. However I've never felt so sick in my life. Glass lift up. Glass floors in the floor of the lift. Glass floors in the floor of the tower. It's a must to visit. I've just re found my stomach lol

Bought the citypass and was very straightforward to use. Didnt have to queue and was shown straight to the lifts. Quite busy up on top but not too busy, great views all round and didnt feel rushed. We loved the gift shop (10% off with city pass) and stopped at the cafe on the ground floor. I wasnt going to...

Great views of Toronto and the surrounding areas and not busy at all. It was excellent value and we particularly enjoyed the glass floor and being able to watch the brave souls doing the "On the Edge" walk around the edge of the lower observation platform

This is a must see whe visiting Toronoto. Also one of the only thigs to do and see in Toronto.We went up all the way to the Skypod, The glass floor is also a pretty good feature. Bit overpriced though.
We grew up in Ontario, but moved away just wanted to see the changed that has happen over 10 years,so much as has changed was great visit nod had lots of fun
Spectacular panoramic views! What more do you expect? We had a cocktail at the restaurant before we left, which was special. Recommend.

This attraction seemed a bit unreasonably prices ... just about every city has some high structured building after all ... this price is somewhat offset if you go to the restaurant (although the food there is very pricey, just grab a drink ??). The restaurant allows you to see ALL of Toronto as you slowly spin. It was highly enjoyable...

Visited CN Tower in the evening and we had our dinner at 360. The ride up & down was an awesome experience. Be the last few to get into the lift/elevator and you will enjoy an exhilarating experience!

A bit pricey for what it is but the views are amazing!There is a secure net and you can walk around the tower with no glass, so you can actually feel the wind that hits the tower every day. Even in a no windy day. They have the first glass floor and it's is really interesting and fun if...

One of the things on my bucket list and I am so glad I did it. The views are superb but as there was a high wind blowing we were not allowed outside. I do recommend paying the extra and going on up to the nacelle above the observation platform.
It was awesome.You get a feel of world beneath you.This experience being the first time and I am sure I would love to go there once again as well.

A must see for any visit to Toronto. Expecting long lines we found ourselves shuttledto a separate line as we hoped to dine for a late lunch. We didn't have reservations but they were able to find us a table. We were ushered to a separate area and our pictures were taken before being lead to a private elevator...
Wow. A wonderful time going up the very fast lift with fantastic views of Toronto. A must for anyone visiting Toronto.

Fantastic views from the top of the CN Tower over Toronto, wasn't clear enough to see the Niagara Mist, but apparently can be seen on a very clear day. We went mid-afternoon and stayed until after sunset, very different viewing experience, both beautiful in their own ways.We ate in the restaurant on the main floor and the food was...

I had some time to kill before a Blue Jays game at the Skydome - so I decided to check out the CN Tower. I was expecting to be greeted with a large line up for tickets, but I was pleasantly surprised to find it was relatively quiet. Before I knew it, I was being whisked up to the viewing...
1. About 553m in height. It is a must go if you visit Toronto.2. Cost is about 36 CAD.3. Glass floor is a star attraction.4. Try Edge Walk.
Im not scared of heights, but I didn't end up going up. im from the prairies & got super dizzy from walking around downtown all day. super nice area though.
An iconic building so a must do. Stand on the glass floor if you dare. We found no queues and had no waits.

We went up the tower on a really clear day and the view from the top was amazing...not just of Toronto but Lake Ontario and Billy Bishop Airport too. the glass floor was really cool and kind of scary. However, we didn't like fact that you had to pay extra for everything(going in the skypod etc.) or the fact that...
I thgouth I would be wowed byt he views. But a 90 minute wait time to see a view just sucks the joy right out of it. Not worth the money, I could have lived without seeing it.

We took some friends visiting from England to the CN Tower. We had not been there for 25 years...Pleasant surprise! Going all the way to the top is a must! What a spectacular view! The price was not too bad and our guests were blown away!

As it was my first trip to Toronto it only seemed right that we did the CN Tower. The views from the top were great, overlooking the islands and seeing the vast size of the city from above. It was fun standing on the glass floor and looking down (with sweaty palms). It was pretty expensive for what you get...
Good food, lovely scenery, good service, and economical brunch. Great a reservation includes your ride up the tower. No line up.

Book ahead and enjoy lunch or dinner. the 3 course lunch is a good deal. Book early lunch to get a window seat. # course lunch comes with free elevation so it's definitely worth it. Had the Berkshire pork, it was gourmet! I am a big eater and it was almost too much for me! Almost! Clams disappointing, Service very...
This place is the usual lookout over a city but I really enjoyed it. Always helpful to get a sense of the layout of a new town when visiting. It's a peaceful attraction to visit.

My friend and I waited in line for two hours to get to the top. Worth it though. Walking the streets of Toronto you do not get the feel for just how huge the city is. On top of the CN Tower gives the city justice on size.Suggestion though, if lines are routinely that long there needs to be...
Was nice to have gone, but defiantly dont need to go back. Not much to do unless you want to pay extra.

Want to see Toronto downtown with a hawkeye. Then go up here and see the slowly rotating viewdeck. Didn't try the skyward afraid of heights and besides it was a windy and chilly Indian summer I got caught with.

I am sure that this attraction would have had some of the most spectacular views Toronto (and many other cities) would have to offer. However, the only day I had available to tour the city was a terrible weather scene the entire day. Rain, wind, and low clouds made it so I couldn't even see but halfway up the tower....

You can see the whole city and harbour from the CN Tower. It is very clean and very safe and quite interesting. Great for out of owners and for people who live in Toronto and want to see the whole city. Day or night..........The View is Breathtaking!!!
The tower has an amazing view of the city and its a place you have to visit if you go to Toronto. Its a little bit expensive buy its worthy.

The first time to the tower was with a charity climb up the stairs! Fun. And the view from top would have been even nicer if the day was clearer. The clouds marred it a bit! Did not have the time to try the restaurant. But surely shall make it someday!
Good food and a great view at the revolving restaurant. If you book a table at the restaurant you get to skip the line to go up and can look around after the meal.

I know that it has to be done and there is no doubt that the view is superb, the glass floors part is very spooky and that it is an impressive building, but somehow it just didn't have much WOW factor for me. Not sure why but it just didn't. Also it is very confusing trying to figure out where...
Spectacular views! Horrific lift journey unless you like heights, which I don't! Fab glass floor if you like hat sort of thing.360 restaurant excellent value for the great food and views
Great view of downtown toronto... stunning view of the lake Ontario...The glass floor was very interesting.Buy your ticket online to skip a long que.
It's a great view of Toronto, but it's a tourist attraction and crowded. Can be long waits for elevator to the top, and just as long to get back down.
Having been up the CN tower during the day I personally find at night is a lot more beautiful. For me one the best things about the city is it's fantastic display of lights.

I have been to the CN Tower several times and it is always a place to comeback. The Tower is an architectonic and cultural symbol of the city. Walking on the glass floor on the top floor is not for those with fear of heights. It is always worthwhile to visit the 360 restaurant. Great food and the views are...

Very much enjoy this trip, paid the extra $12 to go up 33 more stories. Informative wall information and spectacular views of the city. Well worth doing. My only downside were the staff, particularly the girl who did the extra 33 story elevator. She look bored and uninterested and only spoke to tell us enjoy or straight on! For me...

The cn tower is such a great attraction in canada because it is so high. I liked the glass floor alot but something you need to know is that it is very expensive. You should bring a camera to take wonderfull pictures of the amazing view! P.S. Never go when it is windy so you can go on the balcony!
Glass floors are awesome. The tower looks over the baseball stadium. An incredible view of the city from all the way around the outside. Great Restaurant

Great views from the sky pod at the CN tower and views over Toronto. We went on a clear day, so views were great. We stood on the glass floor looking down which we both amazing and scary at the same time. We weren't brave enough to do the sky walk but looked amazing for those brave enough to do...

I've been up the CN Tower as a kid, so I took my daughter up when she was about the age I was. Needless to say, it was spectacular for both of us. There were a ton of renovations made at the base since I was a kid, so there were lots of shops and treats for us to visit....

Amazing views, great food and reasonably priced. Recommend this to anyone as there is no entry fee for the tower when you go to the restaurant so deduct this from your meal price and it really is worth the experience.

I have lived in Toronto a couple years and never seen a view like this. Gave me a totally new perspective on the city and how the different neighborhoods fit together. It was awesome watching the planes take off and land at the island airport. Dinner at the 360 restaurant was delicious and service was quick and attentive. Only complaint...
It is a pricy thing to do, but we'll worth the money! The views are spectacular and you can see for miles and miles. This is a must see if in Toronto. Take the kids, they will love it! A gem!!

In hindsight we should have bought the all inclusive lunch and tower visit tickets as it is quite costly to just pay for the view, better value to do the all inclusive package. However the view was fabulous on the clear sunny day we were there.The queues weren't too bad at late morning when we arrived. There is a glass...

This was great. If you are just in Toronto for a day like we were, you simply have to do this. We were there in half term - a holiday not many people take in Canada - and we didn't have to queue up at all. Straight to the ticket desk, straight from there to the elevator via a very...

We enjoyed our visit to the CN Tower, and spent a lot ot time here having a good look round and had a meal in the restaurant. The viiews are great, and we were brave enough to stand on the Glass Floor! Surely you couldn't come to Toronto without visiting here?

Nothing compares with the view from the CN Tower. The glass floor is pretty neat, although quite small. We walked around on the external observation deck, but it got too cold and windy to stay out there for long. We were fortunate ate to have already had dinner at the restaurant and enjoyed a beautiful sunset view.

So it does give great views of the city, but the extra price for going up to the very top level is just not worth it. I dont regret going to it just think they oversell the glass floor and wasnt happy with the extra asked for going a bit higher up
The views are amazing from up the tower, my only bug bear is the top viewing pod isn't really that great. Limited view and small.

We had gone for business to Toronto. Took some time out to visit CN tower. It's an awesome place. Definitely worth visiting. There was a long queue for the tickets. So we decided to instead go for lunch at the 360 degrees restaurant. That way, one can avoid the long queue and directly head to the restaurant. The fee is...
One of the tallest telecommunication tower in the world in Downtown Toronto. Need to purchase additional ticket to go right on top.
The view of the city is impressive, we visited it at night. Great structure, the guides where awesome. Don't miss it. Now the traffic in Toronto is the worst.
price is a bit expensive but truly the best place in downtown Toronto,you could see the sky line and the best part is the glass floor, a few centimeters of glass between your feet and a 142 floors!!!

The lift takes you up to the observation deck which gives excellent 360 views of the city and lake. The outside deck was too windy to spend more than a few minutes outside on the evening we visited although there were some hardy souls outside. Standing on the glass floor is a good experience although scary.
Like many similar structures it is a little expensive but worth it for the views you get from the top. A bit of a must do when in Toronto.

CN Tower is surely Worth a visit if you love to see the world from high. It's the first tower to have had a glass floor (here only a small piece but still challenging to walk on) then copied by many cities. It has also been the tallest building in the world for quite some time. But if you miss...
The view was great once you get to the top but if the food at the restaurant there was really terrible and not worth the $$$ paid.
This is an ameazing place, you have a great view of the city of Toronto from here. There are good places to go and eat around.

It is the most iconic building in town and probably the most visited. When inside and on top you get a wow feeling. However the price requested is absolutely not acceptable for families with young children.

A brilliant Toronto iconic building with incredible views. Fun experiences are available, for however brave you are feeling! We visited the SkyPod to get as high as possible - definitely worth the extra money. The glass floor was lots of fun, even though we are both afraid of heights!

I guess if u come to toronto, u must come to the CN tower anyway. With this mindset, they have jacked up the priced to $35, thats insane, it was a lot cheaper few years back. But if u come with a tour, its really not bad, its nice up there, its really high. If not for the price, i...

It is an amazing tower to look up at and the views are fantastic.It is quite pricy to take a family up - $45 plus tax for an adult including the Sky pod. However it is one of those things you ought to do in Toronto.Going through security is slick as is getting the lift up - it...

This was my first time back in Toronto since 1969 and the tower did not exist then. Thus, once we stepped off the Go train at Union Station, it was the first place that my wife and I went to view the city.There is a small café and a restaurant available on the main viewing level.We stood on...

Just come back from our 4 day visit to Toronto to celebrate my 50th birthday. This should have been one of the highlights of our trip, my birthday meal. The starter of shrimp cockrail was amazing , waited with wager anticipation for my main of gnocchi, mussels and lobster tails. We were sharing my birthday meal with my sister and...

Went to the CN tower at night using my city pass. We had already been up during the day when we had lunch in the 360 restaurant.The views were good and the mass of light lit up the night sky. It is disappointing that the outside viewing area is covered in betting and inside because the glass panels are...

The views. The views. The views. The thrill of being terrified of heights and sitting on that damn glass floor or walking around the tower outside. It's an amazing feeling. I love to watch the planes taking off and lading on the Toronto Island Airport. The vista towards the west is utterly breathtaking - not to mention I can see...

I've been visiting this place since I was a kid, now that my kids are all grown up, I can't wait to go back with my future grandkids. The structure had evolved over the past four decades but still looks great!A must see for tourists

I was at a conference and one of our evenings out was a gathering at the restaurant at the top of the CN Tower. The food was amazing. So often a tourist attraction offers tourist level food but not the time I was there. Fantastic!!! The portion was so large I could not eat the entire meal.Had a great...

Had one day to spend alone in Toronto and it took me a while to decide if it was worth $32 to go up, I ended up going and I'm happy I did. Was a good experience and I don't regret doing it. The weather wasn't good so the visibility was a bit limited but I still had a good...

Me and my boyfriend visited the CN tower and dined in the revolving pod before going on to the viewing platforms which is also included. We both got the set menu so we had the same amount of courses and knew what we would be spending. The food was delicious and it is fine dining service so a really special...

A must see daytime and at night. The tower overlooks the entire city of Toronto. The tower lights up at night. The colors of the tower can vary. Blue for the Blue Jays, pink for breast cancer awareness,etc. There is a rotating restaurant. And a souvenir shop.

Glass floor is great. The view is as you would find from any tall tower.....unless the game is on in the rogers Centre below, with its roof retracted. Then its an experience to write home about....50k ppl cheering Blue Jays
We had a great time the sites from the top of the tower were fantastic. The rotating restraunt was good food nice . The glass floor amazed our visitors the children were lying on it lol

At over 1500 feet high, you get a tremendous view of the flat surrounding countryside and the City of Toronto. Glass floor areas add to the senses of height. There are the usual security measures in place and it can get very busy so with this, its close proximity to a baseball stadium, queues for tickets and lifts, it may...

Fantastic view of the city below....loved the glass floor. The lift is also part glass but as there were so many people in the lift I couldn't see out of it... A bit gutted! Went for lunch at the Horizons restaurant at the CN tower, save your money guys & have lunch else where it's not very good, sorry. But...

The CN Tower is a must when visiting Toronto. Apart from they tower itself, the scale of the view is breathtaking. The trip up to the pod is also fun to do once. I confess I don't understand the people who want to rope up and walk around outside. This is a place to go to see the vastness of...

The queues are not too bad. If you don't like the wait, go visit Steamwissel Brewery. When you get out, the queues are probably shorter. It is worth the wait.The view is amazing. The glass floor is really cool. The edge walk is scary but a great adrenaline rush. The view at night is magic.The restaurant is decent,...
Great views of city and gives a bearing on where you are. A bit dated and glass needs cleaning. City is great and has a good vibe to it .

Seems every city has one of these! Standard tall tower offering great city views. Has the glass floor which let you see straight down.Highlight would be the airport in the middle of the water. View was really good, not just over the city...but also over the lakes.They have a outdoor area, which was very windy and was fun...

If you have tourists or family from out of town, this is where you should start. On a nice day it is awesome view and gives everyone a great overview of the city. The glass floor is a must. It's $40 a person but well worth it. I have never heard a bod word from anyone about the place.

The ride up the lift is very smooth and the views on a clear day which we had were superb. The glass floor can be off putting for some but you have to do it. Its a strange feeling at first. Be prepared for the wind when you step outside onto the walkway.
Fantastic view of Toronto. The panoramic areal view of Toronto up to part of Niagara is something that I wont forget.

We were impressed with the structure itself and of course the amazing views!! $35/adult adm and $12 extra to travel another 33 stories higher for a total of 147 stories! elevators are smooth and travel at a rate of 11km,( much smoother than the Sears Tower in Chicago). There are small glass windows in the floor of the elevator and...

The queues to take the elevator to the top were well worth the wait. After 58 seconds and 348 metres, awaiting you in the revolving restaurant are spectacular views of Toronto by night. Food and beverage service also very good.
Just bad food. It is a cafeteria food with the price of high end restaurant. The service on the hand is good.

Visited the CN Tower yesterday. It had amazing views over the city. The glass floor was something else you just have to see it. It expensive to visit the tower so be prepared if you have a big group. I would recommend a visit. I really enjoyed the experience.

Everyone has to have a trip to CN tower. It is beautiful, colourful and if you are adventurous go to see through glass or go crazy and bungy- jump off or just walk... If you have enough to time and money than I would suggest try the restaurant even if it's just for fun. It's neat.

Best view (on a clear day). The restaurant turns around the tower and one turn is about one hour so go one hour before sunset and you will have, on a two hour dinner, a sunny view and the nightlight view

Went to the CN Tower twice during our recent trip to Toronto. I would recommend going on a weekday and early in the morning if you want to avoid standing in lines to buy tickets and enter the tower. The glass floor is terrifying but fantastic. They charge extra for accessing the sky pod at the top of the tower....
Fantastic view, great food and very goof service. A must when visiting Toronto. Good value is also a consideration when you find out that the ride to the top is free with a dinner reservation.
I've been coming here since I was a child and the cn tower is the best place to go to definetely a place to see and enjoy

Was so excited to go but once arriving its not as great as other building look outs that ive been too. The cage around the outside blocks the views so cant take good pics. One cool thing was taking photos from the glass floor a bit scary but fun. Was good to tick it off my bucket list. Maybe next...
When visiting Toronto you have to go up the tower. Price was a little high but worth it in the end..
Great place to see Toronto. The glass floor has a great view down onto the baseball field at Rogers centre if you have the nerve to stand on it! Frightened me to death though!

I went with my mom, her friend from out of town and my son. It was a great time! It has been a while since I've gone to the top and it was worth the view! There was a wait for tickets when we arrived but the process from there was quick and efficient. We were all impressed!

I always feel it is a good idea to get up high to see where i am in a new city! This place exists explicitly for that reason and with three levels it commands exciting views of the city all around. Don't miss it!
The CN tower is a must see for any one local or visiting from out of town. It is easy to get to next to the train station. A bit pricy.

it's a MUST for tourist to Toronto! CN Tower isn't the highest building in the world, BUT it has its own meaning to Toronto; especially it's just a tower for transmitting purpose back days, compare with to all the others in the world!

The CN Tower is a Toronto landmark and you can see it from almost everywhere in Toronto. The Observation Deck is breath taking and the restaurant is very good, it rotates around the tower in about an hour giving a view of Toronto from all around. The rides are fun and the history interesting. I recommend it for visitors and...

love the cn tower however if you do not like heights its not so good I loved seeing the city but felt scared being so high up loved the view but was a little leary of height it is a must do but be prepared for the sheer height of it

Any true Canadian or visitor to Toronto has to include a visit to the CN Tower at some point. The views are incredible and it's a fun site to see the range of reactions. The view and the winds from the lookout are incredible! We went at night which I would almost recommend highly.

Visited here whilst touring Toronto. We didn't pre-book the tickets but just showed up and were quite pleased that we were able to get in. The queue wasn't too long and just took us about 15 minutes to buy our tickets - Can$67.80 [£35] for one adult and one senior. Very reasonable price compared to other towers.The queue for...

My family was visiting us from Australia so CN Tower had to be on the agenda and it did not disappoint. The process to pick up tickets and go through security was smooth. The elevator to the viewing area has viewing out the side and below, a great taste of things to come. Once in the viewing area the scene...

The views of the CN Tower 360 rotating restaurant are amazing! It is a nice atmosphere and clean. The food is over priced for the quality. You are mainly paying for the views, not taste.Most of the staff was very friendly, helpful, and professional. Unfortunately our waitress was rude. I asked her specifically what came in the pasta dish...

Super high - lovely views at night! Glass floor (not for the faint-hearted). Would recommend you dine in the restaurant, which gives free access to the viewing levels (effectively a $35 discount on the meal).

What a view! I was quite apprehensive about going up this tower and soon learned it was well worth it. If you are wary of heights don't be put off - you can stay in the enclosed sections which made me feel safe. The views are breathtaking, staff are lovely. Highly recommend it

All around 360 view, 2 different spaces to walk in, one inside with glass windows to get good pictures, and outside to feel the breeze way up there, glass floor if your brave enough to walk on it and look down you can see Ripleys aquarium, and the Rogers center.... Sky dome can be seen from it, we went when...

The views from the top of the CN Tower are impressive and on a clear day you can see for miles but in terms of what you can see there isn't much to look at! Not worth paying the extra to go to the very top

Great way to spend time looking down on Toronto. Lovely views and lots of information about the tower, with a gift shop and restaurant, which offers very nice food. Easy to get to ( You can't exactly miss it! ) would recommend it to anyone

toronto is nice, friendly, clean and polite. there is alot to do, but in terms of world class call your friends sort of attractions, this is one of the only in the city. literally a world wonder. you have to eat at the restaurant on the top of the tower, which is designed to spin around once an hour. hence,...

If you start your visit to Toronto by going up the tower, you will have a phenomenal idea of the layout of the whole city and region. On a clear day you can see Niagara Falls. Buy the ticket that gets you onto the main observation deck, but also to the higher, smaller observation deck. Lineups can be wicked in...
Well it's a viewing tower and on our visit the weather was clear and it was a good view. Short lines as we didn't go peak season. It's a must do I guess

It would be rude not to visit CN Tower! We purchased City Pass which meant we didn't need to queue, although it was off season already so it was a matter of minites before we were going up the lift.The views are pretty spectacular and it was a good clear day so we see alot.Clearly some nervous bods...

Enjoyed the views of Toronto from the observation deck on a bright and sunny day.I have been to similar towers or viewing decks of skyscrapers but what I found unique at the CN Tower was the glass floor on which you could walk and see all the way down to the ground.

I have visited the CN tower quite often in he past 2 years. I have had lots of visitors coming and this is a MUST when you come to Toronto. It is so breathtaking to see it stand so high above any other building in the city, and the different color led lights make it so much more entertaining.You...

You pay a large admission price to go part way up the tower to overlook Toronto, take pictures, get snack in cafe on that level. If you want to dine in the revolving resturant at the top of the tower,the price of admission is even moreeeee. I was expecting a bit more for the price. The price to park your...
I loved this attraction.. I went just at sundown and the views were stunning from the top. Suggest you arrange your visit so that you will be there at sundown
It's not something special to waste $32 on. It's quite a low tower compared to what u have else in the world.
This is a great way to finish your tour of greater Toronto. Way up on the observation deck you can see pretty much everywhere within 50 miles. ..or more on clear days.

Came here once myself when I was studying in Toronto during the daytime.This time, I came with my family during night and it was a fun experience for all of us. Less people during night time so those who don't like crowds, go during the weeknights. Beautiful views and my young son enjoyed it when going outside and the...
Nothing beats our CN tower. Taller than the Eiffel Tower and the views majestic.The food at the restaurant also pretty good and great service.

This is the biggest draw in town and for good reason. This is Toronto's iconic sight and it offers a wonderful view of the city.Unfortunately, it isn't cheap. $53 to see both the look-out and the Sky pod. The extra $12 to see the sky pod is worth it to get the best view. The edge walk seemed very...

Although very crowded and with an incredibly long and tedious security screening, there was very little waiting if you were going to the 360 Restaurant. We had a great lunch and walk around but did not go up to hang off the edge outside.

We had been looking forward to the CN tower as anywhere we go int he world we also go the the larger buildings like Eifel tower, Rockafeller, Empire state etc etc. I have to say this is the worst one we have been to.The views from above are great but is let down in a few areas, not that...

I was so pleased we went up the CN Tower, as we had a wonderful clear day to view Toronto and we were not disappointed. I did not walk out on the glass floor, as I am scared of heights, but my daughter did. I would not go up here if there was cloud coverage or smog/haze, as you would...

Go early and buy tickets online. We were one of the firsts to go up. Watch weather reports and try to go on a clear day. Views are unbeatable. We even thought that we could see the water spaying up from Niagara Falls about 80 km away in a straight line?? The glass floor is funny too, to see how...

It has great views, but so had the hotel I stayed in maybe a few storeys less. The main gripe is the price of it what is nothing more than an observation post. If there is an upside the glass floor was good just to see the fear some people had to stand on it.

The hype of the glass floor is quite disappointing. One you get up there there's hardly any space on it as the crowds flock to it. The views though beautiful you can go to a bar and get decent views. The price of 35$ does not justify the views or experience. I would not recommend this or go again.
The history of the tower is really interesting, and on a clear day the views are outstanding. A touristy must-do.
The view is great, the place is iconic and every year there is more to see. It is in a perfect location downtown, visible from everywhere. Touristy, but fun.

This is a great place to go! The view is breathtaking and the staff really takes care of you. I went with a huge group and we were treated like royalty. The atmosphere is relaxed and elegant but also family friendly. Great place to go.

CN towers is one of the best places Toronto has to showcase,from the observatory deck one has the best possible view of Toronto city and the view of Lake Ontario is an amazing one,would definitely go there once again

WOW, what an experience! We went at night so being able to see through the elevator was a little less impressive than I imagine it must be during the day, but wow, the view of the city lights at night! The glass floor experience was really cool, as was the higher level with its angled glass windows. We were unable...

I read some of the TA reviews before I visited Toronto, and I had mixed feelings abou visiting the CN tower. I generally enjoy seeing a city from the tallest building and I am very glad I went up. The views are amazing and it does give you a feel for Toronto.

obviously..any time of the year is perfect...as long as it's a clear day....The views in all directions are beyond belief...even looking south in the summer affords one the mist coming off of Niagara Falls...and being above the TorontoIsland Airport is great for everyone , including kids (of all ages) to watch the planes' take off and landing!

If you come to toronto or you lived here, you'll have to come to CN Tower at least once. It's just your typical tourist spot for toronto. It IS tall and once you're at the top, and you can look down through the glass ground, your stomach may drop a little.. that's where the fun is! It's quite nice view...

When my husband and I travel, we do so on a strict budget, and so it was with some reluctance that we paid the admission to travel to the top of the CN tower. Having said that, it was worth it! We spent a lot of time enjoying the view from two levels, and then we found the glass floor...oh...
if you live in TO and havent visited it's a must. atleast once in your lifetime. tickets might be expensive but once you're up there and view the skyline and Toronto below it'll be worth it
Nice view of Toronto and the lake front area. Only recommend going on a clear day. If you have been to the top of any other high-rise or Monument, nothing unusual or spectacular about this one.

You can see it from almost every where in Toronto, the tallest free standing structure in the world.After paying 23$ £11 in UK money you troop up to the lifts on the 3rd floor. You are then whisked up 110 floors to the viewing platform, about 3/4 of the way up. The famous glass floor is here and it is...

We don t know what the admission price is because we went for supper and access is free if you do that. The food at the restaurant was great but very pricy. We were there long enough for the turning restaurant to go all the way around one and a half time. After supper we went up to the platform...

I made reservations to do the Edge Walk so I can only say based on what I saw that the lines can be long and the observation floor was very busy, so says my wife- who didn't do the Edge Walk. This was Mid August so... tourist season. This tower is huge and provides. The best view in the city....

We failed to plan well and found ourselves waiting in three very long lines... one for security, one to buy tickets and another for the elevator. If you choose to eat in the Sky Terrace restaurant, make a reservation and you can skip all the lines except the one for security. We tried that, but my kids wouldn't eat anything...
Nice views of Toronto, but I thought it was pricey. I object to paying extra for the telescopes, I think they should be included.
The CN tower is not worth the price charged to go up it. It isn't very high and there isn't much to look at either. A very boring attraction.

The visit is purely entertainment, and an extremely poor one too. No culture, history, knowledge or landmarks. Not worth a fraction of the outrageously pricy entrance fee. It's an embarrassment to compare to Prudential Tower in Boston or Empire State in NYC. Just concentrate thru your plane window while landing over Toronto and save the $50 (admission + skypod).
AMAZING VIEWS! You're in Toronto, so go. It's the tallest free-standing structure in the Western Hemisphere.

It was a sunny day and so we ventured up the tower. The views were great but information is now nearly all on screens around the building, often behind where you're standing and it would take half a day to work out what you're looking at. Simple line drawings with names along the windows would be helpful... sometimes technology isn't...

The tower is the tallest building in Toronto. The view from the top is pretty good. However the restaurant blocks the 360 view. It is an expensive outing and the security screening is like going to the airport.

A fast elevator to the top gives an array of great views. Be sure to pay that little extra to go to the very top.Good cafe at the base is much better value than the restaurant at the viewing platform.
Very good service, a little pricey but it's the atmosphere you're paying for as well. Great place and a must go for tourists!!!

The building looks amazing from the outside.The lifts move so fast and you get great views on the way up.We walked around a bit taking pictures of the views, which were lovely. It wasn't too busy which was nice.I do wish there had been signs up showing what the view was, or even what direction you were...
Great way to see any city with amazing views. Activities at the top not for the faint-hearted!Well worth going to the top for views alone.
worth a trip up but it is what it is, a large antenna. glass bottomed floor is unnearving. I would say queues in the high season are unreal but it flows well.

We were very lucky to visit the tower on a beautifully clear morning in October - still gorgeous views of the city and surroundings but barely any other tourists! Hardly had to queue at all and got a good look round with plenty photo ops. We got our tickets at the hotel rather than at the tower which made them...
The place to visit in Toronto. We were lucky and the day was beautiful. You could see as far as more than 100 Km. Take the option to go on the top pod or you will miss the best part of the tower

We went to this destination not expecting it to cost us $107 to go to the top. Seems pretty expensive to ride an elevator up.The views are amazing from the tower, the see through floor at first is scary but very scenic to look through the floor. We decided to eat at Horizons restaurant so we could spend a...
A nice place to visit when in Toronto. When ur up in the tower they have a glass floor that is fun and scary when standing on it.
In stead of just going up the elevator and come back down, have dinner at the tower! If you get the fixed price menu's it's not super expensive and the food was actually really good!

The CN Tower is well worth a visit if you're in Toronto, luckily the day we chose to go was a beautiful clear morning so we were rewarded with amazing views. We arrived just before 10 in the morning and it was already quite busy at the top (and it was a weekday) especially where the glass floor is as...

A must for a trip to Toronto, as used to be the tallest free-standing building in the world. Certainly worth going to the main area, but not sure about the Pod. Views are spectacular. The glass floor is not for the faint-hearted! If you eat at the restaurant the trip up to the top is included, and the food/view was...

We had booked a meal at 360 restaurant which gave us the opportunity to see right around toronto as the sun set and then go up to other levels to take photos and see the sights. The meal was well worth the money and so were the sights!.

The view is of course the big draw here. Had dinner in 360. Everything was lovely but though well cooked the food wasn't quite up to par for what you'd expect. Great views and superb food just around the block at Canoe would be my recommendation!
It's not as amazing as Burj khalifa (Dubai)if u have done that before. But if this is the first experience, worth a visit as it gives u a nice view of the city and the surroundings.

Not too busy so little queuing involved either to purchase tickets or for the lift. Fabulous 360 degree views across Toronto and out into lake Ontario. Glass floor was crowded with people lying down taking selfies so not a great experience. There is a revolving restaurant and outside walk which we didn't do however I'd recommend it for the views...

At the end of the afternoon we wanted to visit the tower. Going up cost you about Can$ 30; but a 2 course dinner costs Can$ 55, including access to observation deck.The food is great, service nice. But the view is amazing, in about an hour the restaurant revolves.
nice place to be ,to see and be seen many people there sightseeing take the elevator and enjoy the view its very nice

Took the family to see the cn Tower and it was pretty spectacular. Started with glass windows at the bottom of the elevator floor which puts your heart in your throat if you don't like heights and once your up top you can walk around the tower outside or go even further up to the viewing cage in the needle....

Downtown Toronto has a ton of things to do. We choose to scale the heights of this C N tower. It was a clear day. View was amazing. There is also a glass floor that you can walk on. It felt weird but not scarey.
If you have the money to spend, enjoy the rotating restaurant. Just book early to get a windows seat and enjoy the view.
Fantastic views - but the tower sways at the very top, which freaked my dear wife! The staff are very friendly and reassuring!

Very expensive to go up to the first level of the tower. You get there, take in the view, look down through the glass floor and you're done. All in all, about 5-6 minutes at $38.00 so that each minute costs $6. For an additional $12 (plus tax), you can go up to the higher tower. Your call.

We pre-booked dinner at the CN 360 restaurant and so our general admission was included in the price of the set menu. We were directed through to specific elevation points for the 360. The sun went down whilst we had dinner,watching the stunning city and lake views. After dinner we went to the outside deck to see the lights (and...
Enjoyed viewing toronto from the tallest building in the world! Purchase tickets ahead of time or on your phone. This will save you from long lines and quick access
If you want to see this great city start at the top. The views are great and it is worth every minute. Once you come down this is the entertainment district so there is a lot to do and eat.

We were surprised that we had to go through two security stations before entering the tower.Two people in our group we terrified of heights, getting to the revolving restaurant was fun for the two of us who enjoyed heights.

Don't like heights but went up because my partner wanted to do it. Amazing views on a nice clear day. Quite expensive. Elevator made ears pop because of speed. Didn't stand on glass floor, but went outside.
I would say that it is of course always nice to get up in a tower and you get a very nice view of Toronto. The outside deck was closed when we were there so that took the rating down.

This was something I could not not do! I am so glad I have done it but never again as I am terrified of heights.Once we reached our level I felt safe enough to walk around and take pictures. However, I did not personally walk on the glass floor, that was one step too far!Pick a bright sunny...

After over an hour of queuing, a fantastic view of Toronto, like many of this type of attractions you do queue at busy times, but a fantastic experience and a must if visiting Toronto. Drinks were pricey in the bar however food was not particularly high priced though I cannot attest to quality
Way too pricey.I've been to better places at those heights.Prices could be trimmed down a bit for what the place has to offer.

I didn't really know what to expect, so I was very positively surprised.Despite the (very) long line it was well worth it. The view of Toronto and beyond is pretty amazing. I would definitely recommend spending the extra $12 to have access to the Skypod higher up the tower. The view from there is even better and you are...

You get what you expect. There are beautiful views of the city. I'd recommend you pay extra to go up to the skypod - the views were even better. There are really no surprises - you got up and see the city from different angles.
Looking down Toronto from the CN tower was cool. The glass floor was exciting. The high speed elevator was a thrill.
Amazing views of Toronto can't complain. The lift is really fast and gets you up in no time.I can't say anything bad about the CN tower this is a definite for Toronto

This is well worth a visit; although we had been before, this time we headed up to the SkyPod to check out the view and it was awesome. What made it even better was the Blue Jays were playing at home so we had a great view into the Rogers Centre!

If you are in Toronto you have to catch the elevator to the top, even if you come straight back down again like my better half did! The views are spectacular and well worth the trip up. The glass floor was a bit nauseating though, didn't enjoy the experience but I did it. You can go outside and catch the...

Imagine going to Paris and not going up to the Eiffel Tower. That´s right.To go to the CN Tower you need to plan on a clear day so you can enjoy the view at its best. My favourite plan is to have dinner there and to go a bit earlier. Calculate that you get the sunset so you enjoy...
Fantastic way to see Toronto from above, glass floor great fun if you are feeling brave or go for the ultimate on the edge skywalk. Worth getting there in the morning before it gets too busy
Great sunny day and you can see all the way to Niagara Falls also try 360 restaurant great day at the tower

Very central in the city and very easy to find. Would of loved to do the sky walk but it was winter when i was there. Great views of the city and surrounding area from up top. Well worth the price to go up.

Well, I have been in few towers in my life and this definitely isn`t the best of them. And i kind of understood that before buying tickets, BUT there is really not much to experience in Toronto except CN Tower and Toronto Island Park. So I don`t know if it was worth the money, but I don`t regret it either....
The CN tower is very tall and provides you with the best view of the city. On a clear day you can see very far.

We went here after finding the Aquarium closed one evening. The glass floor and the views of the city are awesome. Pay attention to the weather as they will close the outdoor observatory if weather conditions are poor. Overall, this is a once and done place. I remember going to CN tower as a kid, and revisiting it more than 10 years is definitely a new experience. The wait seems to be longer, and we did not wait for the Skypod (>1 hour of wait). The glass floor is definitely a cool experience.Suggest best time to visit: sunset/night.

Really amazing view. Very costly so you might have to save up. Worth doing once in a few years. Takes about 2 hrs, depending on how long line ups are. We went up the tower, into the skypod (you must go all the way up if you are going to do this!). Went to theater in basement. Saw a movie...
Must visit -very good place to visit. Good people,taking care of customer. Pls visit when in city. One of its kind.
Although I have a fear of heights, I did go up the CNTower and as glad I did as the view is amazing - and I didn't feel ill once.
There are so many lines! But, the view was worth is. The casual restaurant had the BEST vegetarian burger.
Been here several times, to take family visiting the country or just to hang around with a friend. Never stops to amaze me and when its serene, it precious.
wow wow this was the most fun I had in a long time I live in the city but never went there before I am so glad I went
CN tower one of the best attraction of Toronto, it stands so high that it can been seen from the most part of the city
Huge tall construction in the center of the city with the restaurant on the top. The view is amazing, the food is very good, but the place is not chip.

Great attraction for all ages, must do for those visiting this wonderful capital !! I like that you can eat in the restaurant up there and also they have a small shop where you can just buy a drink/snack if needed.

Going up the CN Tower gave expansive views of the Toronto city. Perfect sunny day greeted us though, Skypod was a let down with cramped space and the glasses obstructing views.
It is not just a high tower, it is a stunning tower which enables you to have an overview of Toronto. The glass floor is an awesome experience.

Incredible views over Lake Ontario and east west and North, too!! The glass floor is also different, it's kind of weird walking on glass and seeing down to the ground. The restaurant has a great selection of entrees and service is great. The 360 view of Toronto is unmatched in the city. Even the ride up and down the highspeed...

Go during the week. It's very busy on weekends. To optimize your budget, book appetizers or a meal at the resturant (that way you forgo the fee up the tower). Check out all floors and definately go outside. Make sure you go on a day that is clear. Avoid rainy or foggy days (not worth it)
Best wonders in CanadaFull view of toronto view of harbourfront gate and center island the 360 degree restaurant is unbelievable
I got engaged here. Love the food and experience. An icon for the city of Toronto.Now also has the skywalk

Can;t believe I am gonna right that, but although this tower starts aging a bit, we enjoyed the experience much more that the Burj Khalifa in Dubai. The views were great, the staff was friendly and the glass floor really gave you vertigo. Dont miss it if you go to Toronto but obviously avoid wee-ends and afternoon. A week day...

This was a birthday trip to myself!!! I visited the CN Tower at around 8ish and the view was spectacular. I was able to view the last day firework show of the Pan American Games. The views from the CN tower are really good and on a clear day one can see way into the distance. It's been a while since my last visit to the CN Tower. Best time is 45-minutes to an hour before sunset so you have a full rotation in daylight, then a full rotation with the...
Look up, way up and you can't miss Toronto's iconic tower. A fun thing to do with the whole family. A fantastic view from the top. You can also enjoy lunch or dinner in the 360 restaurant that moves!
The CN Tower is well worth a visit. The 360 degree views of the city are awesome. In addition, there is a revolving bar and restaurant which are excellent as well although a little expensive.
Great views of Toronto from here. We went to the restaurant for a meal,which was very good, but not cheap.

My husband is scared of heights but decided to overcome his fear and have dinner in the 360 turning restaurant and he was very glad he did. His steak was really great as was my salmon. The views were amazing went up in the light but it got dark while we were up there, brilliant. The lift is like a...

Toronto is well known for the CN Tower - it's an integral part of the skyline - so I decided to act like a tourist and visit it with some relatives. The lines to get into the elevator were definitely long - but they moved at a decent clip, so even though it was a fairly long wait, you were...

The Good-- CN Tower, good spot for all tourist, tallest tower you can see nice view City Of Toronto. on the top theirs revolving restaurant. Staff are all helpful an friendly.Same Street, you can see Convection Centre and Rogers Centre where Blue Jays play and some other concert. At back of Rogers Centre 30 minutes walked you can see...

My boyfriend brought me here when I first moved to Ontario. It's quite a worthwhile experience seeing the city from so high up and there's some great history there too. It's a little pricy but as is everything downtown Toronto. Its beautiful at night as well. If you go to the aquarium and the tower you get a discount on...
Used to be the tallest tower in the world. Still nothing to shake a stick at. Make sure the weather is good if you want the view that fog can really easily disturb.

We really enjoyed it here, and we would recommend going there an hour and a half before the sun goes down to give yourself time to get up to the top, and then see it and get both day and night photos.

Worth a visit here! Glass floor area in lift too! You have a real photo taken whilst on the glass floor 400+ meters up! Scary at first but got used to it. We paid extra to go up 33 floors to the next viewing point. Well worth it. Next time we'll do the sky walk!! It wasn't busy for us...
The cn tower in Toronto is one place not to be missed you can go right to the skypod cost about $53 to go up.or if you like to walk the edge

wow is all i can say, great feat of engineeringview the toronto from the top and see miles.Very busy in the holidays.Would recommend the you go 1 hour before sunset so you view in the daylight and stay after sunset to see toronto in full lights. It's a must to go up into the tower, but for the cost of it and what you actually get, I feel it's a waste of money. I am glad I did it but wouldn't do it ever again

The tower is one of those icons you just have to experience, despite the ridiculous cost. $35 plus tax pp is a little steep just to ride an elevator, in my opinion. This is a belated review. We've visited the iconic CN tower many times and we always have lunch at the 360 restaurant.
