You can't visit Toronto without a trip to this icon!The glass floor will play tricks with your mind, and the experience and views are unbelievable.We saw the sunset, and watched the city come to life!We visited as part of a meal we had at the 360 restaurant meaning it was free.
Great view - too expensive these days to go up to the top, especially with children in tow but the view is second-to-none.
The elevators go crazy fast. The view is amazing. Be sure to go on the glass floor! It does get crowded sometimes. It can also get very windy.
You have a great view of the city, but when we went it was very windy, you have to go there at least once.
When my family went to the CN Tower, we were amazed. We saw through the glass in the floor and even stood on it. If you reserve tickets, it won't be that long of a wait.

A must do on your visit to Toronto.Well organised and effecient.View from the top makes it a must do.
Beautiful views of the ever expanding city, the lake, really stunning! had lunch at the 360 restaurant and while pricey for lunch, quality expectations were met and then some!

Went to the viewing point and the views were wonderful. A little bit pricy but worth the visit. We looked at the 360 degree restaurant and took photos. It was a pity we did not have time to have a meal as the restaurant revolves round giving great views. Because it was very windy we could not go out on...

A good view of Toronto and despite the cold weather, the indoor area provided a comfortable and excellent view. Expensive for 4 adults but worth doing once. The view down onto the stadium with a baseball game in progress was the highlight.

The place is located in the middle of toronto, therefore you must visit it!. The gift shoft was very poor in terms of good items. At the top, you can get some nice pictures of Toronto Island and the city. In addition, there is a glass floor to check what is happening down in the streets.
great night view siting at a table of the 360 restaurant, wine is good, steak also good,but the sea food I ordered not as fresh as I expected

this is one of the gems that toronto has and the view from a top is amazing so if you are planning on visiting toronto then you have to come to this place.they have a revolving restaurant at the top but keep in mind the food is okay and well over priced but the view from a top is...

The CN tower is an icon within Toronto and Canada and rightly so. The views from the top of the tower are spectacular and it is a marvel of construction. We had a great time up the tower. We made reservations at the restaurant as entry to the tower was free if you ate at the restaurant so it works out very reasonable to do both. Food was amazing in the rotating restaurant. Views were out of this world!

Maybe not as famous internationally as the Eiffel Tower in Paris or the Kremlin in Moscow, to Canadians the CN Tower is synonymous with Toronto. It was nice to be able to experience and to be able to say I've been there, but I will not return if I visit Toronto again. I truly believe it is over priced for what it is, as there's so many other interesting and fun things to do within the Toronto area instead. Also, be prepared for a lot...

A visit to Toronto is just not the same without looking at it from above in the CN Tower.Sometimes there are lengthy waiting lines to ascend and descend the tower, so try to go during off times to save a bit of a headache.The standard package allows access to view the city from within large glass windows. The views were breathtaking, a great way to see the city from a birds eye view. The lines were long but was to be expected and they moved pretty quickly.

No better way to get a bird's eye view of the city. Don't miss the chance to look down through the glass floor from the equivalent of 180 stories up!

We never had to wait to get in to the CN tower and the views are incredible, the lift scared me as its outside and has a glass bottom but the door man was great chatting to me to keep me from turning green.

While the view is great the price you pay isn't in line with what you get out of it. I was there just before sunset and the view of the city was amazing but I didn't feel like I was having a VIP experience which for the price of admission is what you expect.
A must do if you visit Toronto! We were very impressed by the view and glass floor. If you go with the car,note that is very hard to find parking.

Arrived in Toronto, and saw the CN Tower - which I had to go up. It costs a bit, but it is actually worth it. The ride up in the lift/elevator was slightly scary. Once up to the main part of the tower, there are good views of Toronto, much like one sees when flying over a city. There is...
Well worth a visit. I have a fear of lifts but so pleased I conquered my fear, takes less than a minute to reach the top. Amazing veiws of Toronto.

I went once in May a few years ago and returned again October 2015 and both times were busy! It's a major attraction so be prepared to be in several lines and just feel like you're being herded from one line to the next. Once you're up there, you're free to hang out as long as you want but keep...
View is great. Don't use your car as parking is impossible to find.A once in a lifetime experience as we found it very expensive
We were lucky and had a clear sky when we had a early evening meal and watching the sunset was brilliant found the staff very pleasant and helpful and well organised

Having ventured skywards in the lift , which leaves your internal organs at ground level , it is a delight to see the panorama of Toronto stretched out far below.It was a fine sunny day when we visited but on a cloudy day the visbilty would be far less.I would consider it a must if you want to...

I don't think I need to say too much because this is by far the most beautiful thing I've ever done;to go up the tower and look over the city. The view is spectacular! Nothing could compare. I'll do this everyday if i could.

How often do you have an opportunity to look over a big city like Toronto and see for miles and miles. If you're in Toronto take the time to go up there. You won't regret it. Plus, the next time you see it in a movie you'll be able to say you were there.
Still one of the most beautiful things to see in Toronto. Very unique and always has something special going on.

I was not impressed with this attraction. It was not worth $35 to go up to the first level. If you are going to do this.. you should spend the extra money. There were too many people at once, the view wasnt all that exciting during the day.. I am sure during the night is better. There is a cool...

Great palce to visit. Went up to the higher level and it was stunnig. Mu husband and I laid down on the glass floor, which freaked him out a little. I jumped up adn down to show it was safe first, haha.

My son works in Toronto and invited us to the 'must-visit' CN Tower a Toronto landmark. His advice 'let's go to the restaurant for a meal' - the price of admission paid off. The views at the rotating restaurant on top of the CN Tower is superb and the food is great as well albeit a bit pricey.

My husband and I are in Toronto celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary and decided on the 360 restaurant as the perfect setting for our celebration meal.We booked in advanced and were asked to arrive early to go through security and up the tower to the restaurant. Awesome views! This was an amazing experience to view out over the Toronto area. Now line to wait in either, just to go up the tower!

I always tell my visitors to go to the 360 restaurant at the CN tower for lunch - it costs $21.50 to $32 to just go up and look out. But if you make a reservation for a 2 course pre fix lunch it is free and lunch is about $55 each. So you have to eat somewhere downtown you...
we had dinner up there, what a beauty. Recommend both the dinner and the view. The service was great, the food was good and above all the views were brilliant. Must do when in Toronto.

This was a fantastic experience. We pre-booked dinner, this was just out of this world. The views, the revolving tower made for an amazing evening. There are little or no queues for dinner as you pick your own time using their app. The staff were lovely. It is expensive but it works out a lot better having dinner with the...
Amazing. Views are simply breath taking. Loved the views. The highest I have ever been and LOVED it!! A must when in Toronto.

We went up at 6pm in august and hardly had to queue at all. It was a great attraction/experience. We used city passes and paid extra to go up to the skypod. My 13 year old son really enjoyed it too, definatly a must do!
A must see from the top! Great all around views and nice cocktail lounge on the top as well. Hosts very informative and nice elevator ride.

It wouldn't be right to visit Toronto without going to see the CN Tower, a fast elevator takes you to the top and then you have the most amazing view of the city. Also not to be missed is standing on the glass floor looking straight down to the ground.

You have to go thru security before you board the elevators to the top (including this weird blowy thing, which can apparently detect bombs or something), which is understandable. The CN Tower is a must see place in Toronto. There are optional fares, for the basic tour, the nacelle, and the outside space walk.The bottom floor of the main observation deck has a glass floor area, which is really nice to experience.Overall, an excellent tour.

I am afraid of height. Everyone laughed at me but WOW the view were amazing. The elevator ride up explains through video in the walls how the tower was built. What a day visited the tower weather was perfect to see Toronto loved the ride up ,plenty of staff to help you with your photos to get the perfect shot ,stood on the glass floor to look down what an experience to see the logo of the aquarium down below not to be missed.
Long lineup of people but they manage very well. Like it. Worth it.Too bad it was very windy that they had to keep people inside for safety that day.

Flew in late from Heathrow, mad traffic etc arrived just in time for 1900 booking made through Open Table. Free lift access though strickt and unusual security, mind the air blasts!! Fantastic views from 360 restaurant. 4 course meal was C$102 which includes C $40 entrance fee. The meal was excellent with both having rib eye steak. Canadian medium is a little rarer than UK but still very good.DON'T MISS THIS EXPERIENCE.
If you're going to go up the CN Tower, you might as well go as high as you can! It costs a bit extra, but worth it to go up to the SkyPod. The chamber is small, but the view is incredible!

Lineups weren't too bad when we visited in Sept. Views of course are great when the weather is clear. Worth checking out for sure. Best value if you're going to a few other attractions in Toronto is to get the City Pass.

My wife and I went on the observation deck at night after dinner at the 360 Restaurant. The view is awesome and obviously can not be matched. Dinner at the 360 allows access to one deck. Check the website on your preferences. For us, this was perfect after a fine dinner.
An expensive venture but its always good to be at the top of the city. $35-40 (roughly as I can't remember exactly) is a bit on the steep side considering its just a view of the city.

I agree with those who say the CN Tower is a must; but definitely make sure you're there first thing when they open to avoid crowds. A fantastic piece of architecture but definitely not for those with a fear of heights, there are even opportunities to walk around the top edge if you're adventurous or mad enough. I didn't pay to go in (not my thing) but there are plenty of vending carts and seating around so a nice spot to spend some time relaxing.

If you go to Toronto you must do the Edge Walk! 1400+ feet above the city for a 30 min 360 view of the city hanging off the edge of the top of the tower. On the level of sky diving or cliff diving without the diving off part, LOL!!

The CN Tower was the first thing that I did in Toronto, and I was glad to do so. Obviously, the view of the city was great. CN Tower lives up to its "hype" it's an incredible building with some amazing views. My only issue is that the "glass floor" area was much smaller than I expected, slightly disappointed in that aspect. But overall it's a must see in Toronto.

Well worth the visit and if you do decide to go up the tower it is worth the extra to go up to the Sky Pod as the view is less interrupted than the main viewing platform lower down - not one for those who are not particularly keen on heights !!
We were astonished by the view, the beauty of the region and everything. The organisation to get on the Tower is professional and highly secure.

It's a great activity for old and young. Lots of things to do, beautiful city view, interactive displays. Been more than once and always have a good time.

The views up there are great, you can see all over Toronto and beyond. Had dinner in the rotating restaurant its was great. Wow to be up there is like to be free, dont miss the opportunity to climb and enjoy the beautiful view!!

Very tall tower looming over the Toronto waterfront, the Rogers Centre and the aquarium. Elevator to the observation deck. Impressive view of the city and beyond. It is really worth to go up to the CN Tower, a very beautiful view of the city, but the line can be very long... and you get exhausted!!

I'm sure the view would be great- however there are other areas in toronto with a view (namely bars) that would be much cheaper. Ugly monstrosity - expensive - waste of time on a cloudy day but people still paid to go up even though they could see nothing!

As a tourist, this is one of the things you have to do.As we came in the end of September 2015, there was not too big a line. On a day trip to Toronto with limited time we took a trip up the CN Tower to get a feel for the city.Well worth the effort.

What a fantastic way to spend a few hours doing the edge walk! Even though rained still allowed up to do the walk. The guys there were so professional. Felt totally safe! The safety checks were totally necessary but totally required. Brilliant Brilliant. Thanks guys for such a great experience!
Very interesting to see Toronto from up there. Glass floor is a different feeling but good for taking photos through

Loved this place, however, it is better if you check the weather prior to visiting because you don't want to miss the beauty because of the clouds, which is exactly what happened to us. It was covered and you couldn't see much but we still enjoyed our visit :) Excellent service, love it all!

Went for the 1st time this year even though I've lived close to Toronto my whole life. Definitely a cool experience. Nice to see views of the water and city, line was a little long but didn't take long at all. If you show your air miles card you get 15% off general admission!
Very interesting place to go especially if you are looking to see Toronto in a 360 degree view . The glass floor was something else , brilliant view of the waterfront .

Fabulous views. We had an evening meal in the Restaurant. The meal was just ok. Nothing more to say about it. They put on extra 15 to 20% gratuity. We did not think it was worth that much, so we paid 10%. Waiter very unhappy about that, snatched our money and threw us reciept and walked off.No we would...

My husband, my bff and I took the CN tower tour - not to the upper levels - but just to the viewing area and the enclosed outdoor area. We stepped out on the glass floor and took pictures - what a crazy thrill to do that! The view of Toronto from the enclosed outdoor area was fantastic. We were...
The view was amazing. Wonderful view of the island and the whole city. I went to the Skypod, got a much better view from up there.

The CN tower has one of the most beautiful views I've ever seen and it's a nice place to take new comers and just anyone looking to spend a new Saturday afternoon!It is a bit pricey for what you get but its one of those places you don't visit often so the price is reasonable (in business perspective )...

We went on a Tuesday, late morning. No lines. No waiting. We had a beautiful clear day so we could see for 100 miles. This was the worlds tallest self support in building till 2009.There is a minute plus glass elevator ride up to the deck. There were glass windows in the floor of the elevator that added an...

I've gone up the CN Tower a few times & I always have a great time at the top - the view is awesome! It's usually always pretty busy, but the lines go fairly quickly & if you go on the right day, you don't have to wait too long! Not somewhere I will frequently visit, but will definitely take...
Try walking up the stairs. Then take the elevator, then do the skywalk and the glass floor. Then enjoy a nice meal at 360.

Good value for money and the best views of Toronto possible. Process of clearing the enrtance was well organised and tower staff very helpful. Not too busy the day we arrived on the bus tour so we were able to get to vantage spots easily to record the vista. The glass floor was a bit of a challenge to me...

Well, make sure it is a sunny, clear day. If it's really clear, you can see the mist of Niagara Falls. Great views of the city. Kids and young at heart will love the glass floor. If you only go once, try very late afternoon, and stay until the lights come on. Best deal is the yummy dinner at the...
Very pretty at night. From the ground nearby buildings look just as tall (they are not). Allow some time.

Big fun if you like heights. The observation deck is 183 floors up, or 1183 feet. The security is good and the views of the GTA? Wowzer! There is a glass bottom floor for those wanting to push the envelope of height-induced sweaty palms, dry throats and knocking knees.

Oh wow what can I say this is a must if your in Toronto and worth the extra cost to brave the skypod. Once up there the views are just breathtaking. Ladies tie your hair back when going on the outside observation deck. Staff very friendly get there early to avoid the queue.

So I have height freight, and still had a good time here. Why? Because they made several things for people with height freight and for people who don't have height freight. For an example: There is an room with an glass floor (don't enter it if you have extreme height freight). And there is an room which is more accesible...
Its something you have to do in Toronto I guess but at nearly $40 I thought it was expensive for what you get.I guess maybe I have been up too many towers and am a little over them :-)

This is definitely a tourist trap but not without value in going. I found the price and the lines to buy tickets high and long. Add to that the fact that they want extra money to go to the highest point of the building was a bit off putting. On the plus side the views were indeed great and there...
An excellent choice, great views from the top with gift shop too. Very quick lift to the top and you walk around the outside too. Also there is a super restaurant with tasty delicacies.
Kids loved the glass floor and the outside observation deck. A great place to visit, but definitely not cheap. We got to see the Blue Jays play from up above--pretty neat!

Went up with kids (8, 8 and 11) and they were especially thrilled by the elevator ride and the walk over the glass floor. Some other highlights: watching planes take off from the small airport and watching the Blue Jays game from above. Very cool! It is pricey, though. I recommend looking for coupons online. We got 15% off and...

This is my second visit to the CN Tower and it is a great experience. Looking out over the city on a clear sunny day (which is mostly what they are in Toronto) is a great experience. This time I was with colleagues who come from Toronto and they were able to point out things and there was a Jays...

On the day we visited the outside platform was closed due to high winds, and the skywalk was unavailable. The lift was also operating at half it's normal speed. The views were good and the glass floor was unsettling, but overall I think this attraction is overpriced

Huge lines all day, up to 1 1/2 hours. We waited until 8 pm and got up just as sun was setting. That was good but then there is that dead time viewing the city below before the effects of all the lights take effect. It would have been special had the Dome had the roof open since their was...
Spent a fantastic evening in the 360 restaurant - great food and service, and some of the most spectacular views imaginable - a must visit if in Toronto.
Worth going up if you have not been up the Eiffel Tower or Sears Tower. Buy tickets on line 24 hours prior. cheaper..
Amazing aerial view of the city! Definitely worth coming up here for the view. The price is worth it!
Nice view of Torornto however the glasses we're dirty and when you go outside the wire mesh do not let you really appreciate the view personally I think is overrated and expensive

Go here if you are in Toronto, it is a must. Its fun to see Toronto from another point of view. There is a charge, and when you get up, you can pay a bit more to get even higher up, i will recommend it.

Nothing spectacular but informative reading for history about this monument .Good aerial view.I think more guides are needed to educate the visitors .One has a guide in the elevator ,who seems to try but job is only to transport to the top ,with a few details.

Went on Saturday night while the blue jays were playing. Walked in purchase ticket stepped on elevator and 58 seconds later we were there 5 minutes tops. The view was great after dark must be as good or better in daylight. Looking straight down at the open roof watching the blue jays playing was great.

The most famous canadian landmark after the niagra falls and rightly so. The views from the top are absolutely brilliant and the place is completely worth the visit. Some people might think it's a bit over priced but personally I don't think so.Queues can be very long in the summer months so be prepared to stand for a while....
The glass floor is very unique. On a clear day you can see the USA. The 360 degree view will let you see the entire city.
A bit pricey at $40 for the basic ticket but the scenery was spectacular. The glass floor was pretty cool as well.
Well worth a visit. A little expensive but it is a must do if you visit Toronto, The glass floor is amazing. The view of the city is stunning.

This is worth every penny, and pay the extra to into the sky pod. The view are just out of this world, your can see for miles. The staff are very pleasant and have great information about the CN tower. This really is a must if your in Toronto

It's an amazing experience to see the city of Toronto from the top. The elevator is very fast. The views up the tower is amazing. It was not very crowded when we were there so u have the chance to go around.

You have to go up to the top of this tower and enjoy the great view of the city. there are glass floors to look down, good enclosed viewing area, and you can also hang over the side with special equipment for additional $195CA dollars....no we did not do this.

One of Toronto landmarks that require some money for tickets, some time for staying in lines and some courage to lie down on glass floor. Almost forget - some memories to fill.I would recommend to eat before you go. Food on the ground is better then on a top.

Great views of Toronto. Book online the day before and beat the crowds, get up early & see the Tower before the bus loads arrive. Get the ticket to sky pod, as view is amazing. You have the option to walk on a semi open deck, very cold but amazing views. Free wifi too so great if you wanna to...
Great View.....try to do the Skywalk...the Souvenir shops are a rip-off though...The glass floor was amazing-gives u the chills when u stand there :)

We visited on 8th Sept and breezed straight in. The security team told us that it had been a nightmare up until the end of the previous week but that, with the kids back to school, attendance had dropped dramatically. It's overpriced, but it is a good view, so I do recommend it. However, I think I would have been...

One of the most iconic Canadian landmark !!Very crowded in the Summer.Spectacular views !!The glass floor is a picture perfect spot.The outside balcony was very very windy..the speed to reach the top or bottom was fast..faster than our building at work (5 floors to be exact:)Cool spot to visit

The elevator speeds you up at 20 kilometers an hour. It needs to as it is 553 metres high. Once up there is a variety of viewing decks, indoor and outside with spectacular views. A passable restaurant and souvenirs round out the experience, but it is the view you come for, worth doing once on a good day to see...
My wife and I had a wonderful dinner at the revolving 360 Restaurant on top. An amazing view of the city Toronto and Lake Ontario. The meal was pricey but it was worth it.

You gotta checked this out and see the top if you are in Toronto. Stunning 360 degree view of the city. And try to step into the glass floor when you can, there was a lot of people trying the same as well. Admission to get in was a bit expensive but it was all worth it.
Pre purchased tickets and still had a 65 minute wait on a mid week isit. That was not impressive and horrifying given the option of not having prepurchased.
We visited the CN Tower with our younr child (2). We really enjoyed it.Excellent views of Toronto. Glass floor was really impressive.Highly recommended.

I wouldn't be the bravest when it comes to heights but knew I had to go up the cn tower and I'm so happy I did! You go through plenty of security before being allowed queue for the lifts up. When you are queuing for the lifts, if your a little nervous like I was, try and get in the...
What a view and quite a story of its origins. It was a windy day so we didn't go t the highest level but the mail stop is super.
Why not? Great view and all support for tourists...you know, lines, buy ticket and really nice to walk around the place.

My son and I visited CN tower in August. I had been there before but it was his first time. It started to rain while we were there so the view wasn't as good as it would have been on a sunny day. Also we couldn't go outside due to wind. In those cases I think they should reduce the...

This is an exciting elevator ride up to the top of this very tall structure. I believe it is up about 1200 feet. You go up in an elevator with a glass floor to look down. Once you get up you walk around inside the glass enclosed observation deck and can see everything about Toronto. Lots and lots of tall...

We arrived at noon on a busy Saturday afternoon and inquired about "walk-ins" for lunch. Once we had the terms explained to us, we were able to bypass any line-ups for the elevator. The deal is that each guest must purchase either a 2- or 3- course fixed price meal. This includes the minimal-wait elevator and access to the observation...

You can enjoy a nice view from the top of the tower. Taking picture, looking around... this is about it! You can pay an extra to get higher but actually it's not really worth it, you see the same thing! Take the regular package and you'll be fine.There an option to walk outside the tower that seems very nice...

We had fun! The views were great! We were there after dark and it was still great! Standing on the glass floor looking and the ground was scary and fun! It is so iconic Toronto that you have to do it!Tip: Bring change for the money token thing. You need 2, $1 Coins and a nickel to put through...
Stunning view. Go on a clear day. It's also fun to go outside and have your breath taken away on a windy day. I've been about 10 times and still don't mind when visitors want to go.

So yes...it's a fast elevator ride and an observation deck, but you just have to do it! The views are stunning. I even watched part of a Blue Jays game from up there! We spent the extra to go to the highest observation level. It's definitely much higher, but if you are on a budget, you won't miss anything by...

Nothing like checking out the Blue Jays setting up for another win high up top the CN Tower. Kids loved it and the glass floor is a special treat. The elevator ride was smooth and the glass doors gave you a view of the entire city.
I didn't realize how many trees are planted in Toronto. We had a really fun time, with friends and family. The children esp I ally liked it but the adults were impressed as well.
expensive, but worth it to go up to the observation deck to see the views. Great views of the city and Lake Ontario.

This is an awesome tower visit from the elevators to the inside and outside viewing decks. There is even a glass floor where you can walk over the 1,000 drop. For $12 more you can ascend to the very next higher level. Fantastic views on a clear day.

We visited the CN tower in the evening and had amazing views of the city and beyond. Whilst there it was a lovely sunny evening, until a snow storm appeared and it was amazing t be up at the top of the tower whilst it was going on, we couldn't see a thing!!But that only last 5 minutes and...
Experienced the spectacular view at sunset whilst dining in the restaurant at the CN Tower. Highly recommend going up at this time of the day. Food and service was good.

even on a busy day your trip amongst the clouds ney gods of olympus (aka the 6, aka tdot, aka tzizzle)with run as smooth as silk.gliding at a speed of 22km/h or 15mph in charlies glass elevator you will be treated with views only our feathered friends enjoyed...until now.

We went for a meal in the 360 Restaurant which was expensive enough (£100 for two courses, glass of wine and 2 soft drinks) This included access to the main observation deck. Views were fantastic as expected. We ate at 7.30 so got views of the sunset. We also got a pretty spectacular view of a Blue Jays game in...
If you go to Toronto you must see and go on top of the CN tower. The view is just amazing! One of side you can see the island and the beach and the other skyline which is great.

Would be a strange decision to not elevate the CN Tower whilst on a trip to Toronto. Stunning views of the city and surrounding areas, I could have stood there for hours watching planes land and the city go about its business. We went early evening (~6pm) and there was no queue at all which was fantastic. Expensive to get...
Perfect organisation, nice look (it was sky without clouds), mandatory to see in Toronto, one of the highest towers in the world
We were hosted to an evening view at the tower , on a clear afternoon, and then into the 360 restaurant, quite an experience , and worth doing to get a great view of the city
If you not there you not in Toronto. You can see Toronto from the sky . Amazing attraction for family

We have so many visitors either family or through our B&B so we always recommend that if you are going up the CN Tower the best way is to book a meal at the 360 restaurant. The view is amazing with the restaurant revolving once every 70 minutes or so. The stipulation for the free elevator ride up is to...

A must for all ages! Exciting lift to the top 'glass elevator' that will take your breath away.The restaurant 'slowly rotating' as you enjoy luxurious plate full of excellent, chef prepared meal!PAMPER yourself, spend a few hours to absorb the beauty of this Toronto attraction!

Excellent bonding with Alonzo 2nd generation twas a lot fun priceless moments to cherish.A walk to the whole of downtown area from the harborfront to the chinatown...a city tour by bus and a subway walk to the rest of the parks situated all around the CN tower captivating ones attention to the splendor of the city.

Very enjoyable. Make dining reservations. $65 with dinner $35 without. The dinner was very good and effectively only cost $30. With the favorable exchange rate a real bargain. The restaurant revolves 360 degrees every 72 minutes so you can see the whole city and more.

If you do nothing else in Toronto you've got to go up the CN Tower!We went to the Sky Deck, which is 33 floors higher than the main viewing platform, and it's high, very high. It is an additional CDN$12 per person, but it's a must do.The views from either platform are amazing, but the weather was clear...

Amazing! Such a tantalizing part of this experience in Toronto! I especially loved the 'see-through floor' that WOW's you when you step on it!! Not as easy as you would think! I could NOT do it! I am a brave soul! I did not like the feeling!! You must at least attempt it, from my perspective...happy downward views!!

The CN Tower is one of, if not the main iconic landmarks in Toronto, the price to go up the CN Tower is $35 excluding tax, this was a standard entrance fee, with a lift up to the Lookout platform.Considering I had just done the Rogers Centre Tour across from the main entrance of the CN Tower for $16...

Whether visiting Toronto or a resident of "Hog Town", The CN Tower is a MUST. We took our grandchildren (ages 4 & 6) up the heart skipping elevator ride for this magical trip. The restaurant offers decent fare and what an experience for the little ones (and we grown ups!) in the "revolving restaurant" that offers 360 views of the...

A beautiful experience starting right from the journey up the super-fast lift to the first level viewing platform and a fantastic view of the beautiful city of Toronto. Dinning at the revolving restaurant is quite an experience by itself. One has to make reservations in advance though. One can carry back personalized photo shots of the tower by paying $25....
Loved the glass floor and the outdoor viewing platform. Easy to reach via subway and simple to understand transport system
Dont look down! Only joking ... walk on the glass floor in the cn tower its amazing. One of the best places to see all of Toronto
You must visit the CN tower. It cost about 35 dollars for regular admission. The view is spectacular. You actually get to see how large Toronto really is.

One of the main reasons for a visit to Toronto,and it didn't let me down,visited early one sunny morning and was able to gain entry through security checks without much of a problem we had paid for tickets at a discount rate from the hotel so this gave us fairly quick access.what can i say yes the view...
If the lines are short and the sky is clear, it's worth the tour. I went after the Blue Jays game started and did not wait in line. The view isincredible.

Simply breathing views, paid around $55 CAD, this gave access to the first level viewing platform and to the Skypod a full 445 meters above the ground.I am not a fan of heights but the views soon took my mind from the vertigo.If your in Toronto you need to go here!

This is truly awesome experience, one of the highlights of of our holiday and really good value given recent exchange rates. The tickets are priced for two levels, the ultimate height can be reached for about an extra £5 or $10 Canadian both levels are breathtaking and you are already above the height of thr UK Shard at the first...
The view from the glass floor is wonderful. As you go higher the more beautiful world is at your disposal. From the tickets to exit you are in the world of Height only.

We had lunch at the revolving 360 restaurant, then walked the glass floor area. I also paid the extra 13.55 to go up another 33 floors to the sky pod area. Views are great, unfortunately the day we were there was a bit foggy. If you dine at the 360 restaurant and get their prix fixe lunch for $55 each,...
Worth to reach to the top to see the full view. suggest you to check the weather before you go.if not you will not get the best view.so expensive but to see once in lifetime

We visted the tower before attending a Blue Jays game at the Rogers Centre. We ended up buying a Toronto City Pass while we were there which included the CN Tower, Zoo, Casa Loma, Royal Ontario Museum, and Science Center. The passes are a great value! You ride the elevator up to the top and are able to explore the...

Great view of Toronto city from the top. I wish we'd done the glass floor before we went on the sky walk as we weren't as amazed after hanging off the side of the building haha.A must do when visiting Toronto.
Unfortunately it was very cloudy on our trip but it was still an amazing experience. Iteresting to find out how it was all built and the comparisons with all the other tall buildings in the world.

Meal booked from hotel, not cheap admission to the tower is included in the meal which saved about $35 each and avoided the need to queue, the view was great but make sure you go on a bright day, walking on the glass floor was a strange experience!!

One of the most hyped attractions of Toronto and have to admit, it was completely worth it! An amazing view of the city, especially the baseball stadium. Brilliant really.The edge walk is a must do for ones with a taste for adventure! And there's always the glass floor for ones not so brave! All in all, definitely a must...

Highlight of any visit to Toronto. Excellent staff. Provided a wheelchair for my wife to use as she was on crutches. Timed our ascent for sun down to watch the sunset and then see the lights come on around greater Toronto. Walking on the glass floor was very cool.
You cannot go to toronto and not visit the Iconic CN tower but make sure you go on a clear day or you will be very dissappointed - Cloud cover can dissapoint

This is a great way to see the city and offers plenty of great views. Not too expensive and worth a visit. A bit heavy on the sales pitches, but a good way to lose an hour (be warned if you have visited New York or Boston, once you've been up one Tower or Skyscraper, they are all pretty similar)
its worth it to go up there! The view is amazing! And the glass floor is lots of fun! A bit expensive, but its cool.
The iconic Toronto sight! great vistas of the city and lake, fun activities and acrophobia. Fun for the whole family albeit a little pricey.

The CN Tower is one of the main attractions of Toronto and it really is really cool! I went with my family and they all enjoyed it! Especially the 360 Cafe. We were a friend of someone who worked there so we got to see a little 'behind the scenes' as well. There is much to do there and amazing...

The views are incredible i highly recommend the extra 12$ and head up to the top its worth it makes you feel like your on top of the world kids will get a kick out of it for sure its a cool ride up the elevator with the glass squares in the middle of the floor.
40 dollars per person including taxes ...just to go up on a lift and see Toronto from a height ....what a waste of money.....Eiffel Tower only costs half that.....
Well glad I went and saw it and traveled up. 40 dollars a bit pricey, should be less. It's a great view and standing on the glass floor and looking down was a bit weird.

My two sons and I visited the tower while my wife and daughter went to a girly concert. We had good time. I found things very touristy, as to be expected and as I remembered. I had visited years ago with my parents. We enjoyed it but didn't spend a lot of time up there. Now that we did it,...

35 dollars get you standard access 365 mesh view (no good for photos) or about half a view glass as restaurants take up the rest of the space. The skypod is 12 dollars more higer up and may well be worth it. The tower was well run. Amazing views at sunset and over the blue jay stadium. Well worth a...

Great 360 degree view, exciting elevator ride. The staff is welcoming and knowledgeable. The first time you visit the CN Tower, it is worth paying the extra cost for the SkyPod ticket in order to go up to the next level. Make sure you go on a clear day in order to get the best value for your money. This...
A visit to the CN Tower is a must do,the outside glass lift gets you to the top very quick,the views over Downtown Toronto are spectacular,walking on the glass floor is something else

Second time I visit the CN Tower and is stills and amazing experience. The cost of the ticket is a bit expensive but it worth it. I couldnt do the edgewalk because of the lack of time but it seems a cool experience. It cost about 110CAD. The view of Toronto once you are in the highest level is incredible.

Taller than Kuala Lumpur's Petronas Towers and Chicago's Sears Tower (but not taller than Dubai's newest superskyscraper), Toronto's CN Tower is certainly a sight to behold! While not technically considered a building, the CN Tower functions as a broadcast tower while also offering observation decks and a restaurant waaaaaaay above the skyscrapers of the Financial District. If you're not afraid...

A totally great experience, great views of Toronto & Toronto islands. The food was excellent as was the service, worth every dollar. Instead of going to the observation it is worth going for the meal. had a very enjoyable time.

I was in Toronto for work but I was able to get a way for a couple of hours to check this out. I went on a Sunday, and since it was a rainy day, there wasn't a long line to get in, but the wait to leave the tower area was almost 45 minutes. Overall it was a great...

Not entirely sure what I was expecting but was somewhat dissapointed.waitng times to enter were about 40 minutes and the queues within the building even longer .once we got to see the views from up top,it seemed somewhat a mediocre experience .we came ,we queued ,we saw ,not much else unfortunately

Seen the tower too many times. Visiting friends and relatives all want to go up but it's always the same and a let down at the end of the visit. The tower is too costly. While the view is good the often long line ups and cost add up to a mediocre experience. If you want to see a tourist...

You must see the CN Tower ! This 170 story wonder is amazing ! We choose to go up for dinner . It was light out when we went up soWe could see everything ! I loved the outside deck ( very safe !!!) with the wind blowing and the sights . Inside there is a large glass floor...

The view at the top was ok (expected it to be higher actually). It is very expensive for the experience. I would not really recommend it b/c if you are travelling with a family it can easily cost you 100's of dollars.

The top of the tower view is the most amazing thing you will see, the edge of walk needs to be booked in advance, I didn't get to try it cause of that reason so I can't say how it was. The glass floor is mesmerising. I won't say its a must but its fun

It was ok I really don't know what I was expected. They have a semi glass floor you can look down and see the ground outside. That was very scary and I think that the weather had an effect on the visit. It was raining and cold.

Do yourself a favor and get one of the price fix meals at the 360 restaurant. Then take your time on the two observation decks afterwards, included with the meal! Super fun. Wonderful way to take in the view!
It's a great view of the city, but why is it so expensive. The restaurant is nothing special beyond the rotting gimmick. For a landmark spot, we should have landmark food

We went around dusk and got to see it both at night and in the daylight. It's a very nice view. It's a must see at least once. Be prepared for crowds. As far as I can tell, it's always busy. I will say, looking through the glass floor made me dizzy though.
a must see if you go to toronto the edge walk is unreal and its a very reasonable priced attraction highly recommend this

I have previously visited the tower however as my Wife hadn't, we decided to visit the 360 restaurant and I can tell you that the experience was far better than the experience you get with just visiting the observation deck and definately worth the extra in price.If you factor in the cost of getting up the tower anyway +...

this was a 'must visit' place in my bucket list. I really enjoyed the view from the skypod. Couldnt take a picture in the way I want from the glass floor as it was pretty crowded. Service was polite & friendly. Maybe it looks better in the night...

If you are planning a trip to Toronto the CN Tower is a must see. Not only is it the tallest freestanding structure it offers some amazing views of the city. If you are planning to visit more that one attraction during your visit to Toronto we would suggest purchasing the City Pass as it offers entry at a discounted...
Amazing views over the city. On clear days some say that it is even possible to see the New York state. A must visit in Toronto!

For anyone new to visiting Toronto this is a must!Sure its not the most exhilarating experience (unless you do the walk on the outside of the tower) and there are a number of reviews referring to cost but it is an essential part of Toronto and will give you the most spectacular photos!We saw the tower both at...

We visited on a really clear day and got fantastic views of the city. We had lunch in the revolving restaurant which was also excellent value as it included your entry price. The meal was excellent quality and the service was good. We both had the salmon main course which was lovely, and very filling. I also had a champagne...

The CN Tower is impressive...the views are out of this world...but...and it is a small but...its a tower...its an all singing all dancing tower...but its a tower, and if theres a few of you...its a little pricey for a tower....but I suppose its worth the gig, after all, it is one of the main attractions in Toronto. Had brunch up...
It's ok I didn't think it was worth the money and the glass floor is very small, I would save your money to be honest

First experience having brown gravy on fries. Interesting. Wonderful place to see the sights of Toronto. If you're not afraid of heights, definitely walk on glass floor. Awesome! Did this on two separate trips. One with family and once with girlfriends. Both trips had a great time. The wind was incredible as you walked around the observation deck.
Cost too much to just go up and view. Did not think it was worth it, Cost started at $49. I was disappointed because I had wanted to see it.

The CN tower is a modern world architecture wonder.Looks beautiful too as it stands tall. Started as a Transmission center, later used for tourist attraction. Located in downtown toronto, closer to harbour front, it is very well located.But when you read details about its hollow inside and the amount of work, science and thought gone into it, gets...
I visited Toronto in September and decided to check out the CN Tower. The view from the top was fantastic. It was well worth the hour wait. Next time my friends and I are going to do the edge walk!!

The queue for this is badly managed, and there are not enough pay booths. The attraction needs refurbishing inside as it seems dated and worn. The view however, is magnificent and the structure is amazing; you'd marvel at how anybody could build this. Had lunch at the top, which was expensive but worth it as you get time to really...

column3: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
column4: The CN Tower is a must-visit. Seriously. The views are spectacular and the glass floor is an incredibly simple thrill. I'm not really afraid of heights, but it was surprisingly scary to step out onto that thing. I can't imagine doing the "Skywalk"!It's not cheap, but if you go to the restaurant (probably not great for small children), the...

We went for visit to this tower. First we went around the tower to enjoy lovely ground surroundings and than went up to enjoy the views of Toronto city and lake from various levels. It is really thrilling to be in this tower. Must include in plan to explore Toronto City.

We booked a table at the 360 Restaurant for dinner. We decided to go at 6.30pm to catch some daylight as well as the night time views. The food, service and view were all outstanding. The restaurant is not cheap but when you allow for the fact that you have not paid to go up the tower it makes the...

I have fear of heights, but I put myself together, close my eyes in the elevator (other people were laughing at me LOL) but the view was worth it! Outstanding view of the city! Another must see in Toronto! :)
I was very dissapointed. There's a metal fence so you can't see anything. If you decide to go, choose a sunny day because the view is better and as I heard you can also see all the way to USA.

Reportedly the highest man made structure in the world. A must see in Toronto. Look for the big wind turbine on the lake when your looking out from the observation deck. When finished try the Baton Rouge restaurant near by for some Cajun flavor. Also while in Canada pick up some Canadian currency. The new Canadian bank notes are among...

While I am not fond of heights I did enjoy this place a lot. There was always a good view and not just of toronto and the lake.One of the best places. It has a bit of everything. Gift shop as well as restaurant

We visited on a Wednesday evening and there was no waiting time. It is an unmissable view of the city. We paid to go up to the sky pod but felt we didn't gain anything, we didn't see anything different.
The tower is more impressive than the view from the top or the lengthy queues to ascend and descend. Save your money and take a ferry over to the islands for a more impressive view back to the city.

We had a meal in the 360 degree restaurant , booking recommended and the meal was not too dear. We had the "fixed price" evening dinner with wine and beer and this was reasonable by posh cafe standards. Including tips and taxes our visit for 2 adults totaled 200 can dollars approx. I would 100% recommend eating at the restaurant at the top of the CN Tower. It's around $20 more (The meal to buy is the $55 one- App and entree- I got a salad and a steak!) and the difference in crowds is HUGE.We got to the tower 45 minutes late to our reservation for lunch (bad traffic!) No...

I was interested in the human effort, engineering, and technology that was applied to construct it in 1975..seems like yesterday when I was reading about it. Also, providedgreat views of the region on a clear September day.
Make sure you go when it is a clear day so you can enjoy the view and take great pictures of Toronto.

Great place for romance..make sure you get a window seat...although the inside round works well too...Pricey as heck but you are paying for quality.....If you are going to visit, it's well worth the experience of the restaurant top....I have met one of the chef's and he's a fantastic fellow and great cook!

We visited in September 2015. We enjoyed the views at the top of the Tower. If you've visited similar attractions in other cities you'll know what to expect, however it's still worth visiting to get a unique view of Toronto.

We visited CN Tower on July 06/2015 with our visitor from India. Photos and videos we took are breathtaking memories for us and for our visitor from India! One of the awesome experiences of our lifetime. Our visit was exciting and enjoyable. The souvenir shops at the bottom of the tower were great. It's a must see tourist attraction for...

The CN Tower was on my list to visit before the trip to Toronto due to reviews on TripAdvisor. Downtown is very large but we were lucky enough to be within 30 minutes of walking to the tower. Once there it took less than a minute (58 seconds) to get to the Lookout observation deck. We decided to go ahead...
A tad expensive (buy the Toronto City Pass which makes it better value for money), but well worth it. The views are breath taking....
We visited the tower and upgraded from just the tower to eat in the restaurant aswell, for an extra $20. Fantastic food, amazing views, awesome, awesome, awesome!
A nice but pricey experience. Just a tip, to experience day and night, go just before sunset then experience it at night with all the lights.

The tower is a must see on your trip to Toronto. It is amazing clean not over crowded at all. I particularly like the piece of glass floor and great place to sit if you want to overcome our fear of heights. Love, love CN Towers ?

My husband and I visited the CN Tower using the Toronto City Pass (a good deal as long as you are going to do at least 3 of the 5 listed attractions) and had a great time. We lucked out with a very short line on a relatively clear day.The elevator ride is fast and you are dropped right...

The trip up the CN Tower was memorable!If you purchase a meal in the stunning revolving restaurant the ride up to CN Tower is free :-)The views from the Restaurant of Toronto are awesome, especially the see through floor windows that you can see through to the Floor, yep, not for everyone, but those that are not scared,...

We went to the area and took different angles of pictures. Then we proceed to Boston Pizza to take our snacks, then start walking around the area, Nathan Philips Square. I have a great time with all the shopping malls and different magnificent sights of buildings along the Toronto Downtown area.

One of the things you hear about Toronto is the CN Tower and it didn't disappoint. The views are extraordinary, the glass floor is a surreal experience and I enjoyed the visit. If you can stomach it try the Edge Walk too!
I was a bit scared, going up that high... but it was absolutely worth it!Early in the morning, nice weather, perfect view and not too many people... we loved it ?

Visited the tower for my birthday. We booked a table at 360° restaurant, which enabled us to jump the elevator queues! Elevator is quick, and with a glass wall and partial glass floor, gives a great view. The top of the tower viewing area are large, and the views over the city are impressive.We went early evening, and as...

Loved the view from CN tower, you get to see a wonderful panoramic view of Toronto and the Lake Ontario. If you feel like splurging you can visit the rotating restaurant on top for breathtaking night view of the city.

The Canada National Tower, rising to over 1'800 feet above ground, offers not only impressive views of the entire agglomeration both from the Lookout and the even higher Skypod, but also the thrill of a lifetime for the fearless and adventurous, namely the Edgewalk, hanging outside at almost 1'200 feet without railings.

I have been on a lot of towers. The difference in this one was the flooring glass and the restaurantS. Yes, they are 2 restaurants one that is all the way on top and you need a reservation and the other one that is quite reasonable in prices and the food was magnificent

Great views of Toronoto from the cn tower, queuing up took forever but once we got to the top wow wow wowPeople were pleasant enough which made the Experince better.Would love to do this again once winter sets in

Get there early as there are little queues. By midday it can be a one half + wait. Worth the money in my opinion S views are very good. You can also pay extra to go even higher where you can just make out the edge walkers.

Nice views of all the city, go there only if the day is clear and sunny so you will be able to see the city.It's expensive to go all the way up (12 extra dollars) no matter if you have the Toronto City pass.Pictures are 35 more dollars, too much! They print them and if you don't buy...
an amazing tour and experience of one of the worlds highest free standing structures , the glass floor is amazing and the views incredible, go up to the top level , highly recommended

Customer service was terrible. Early in the morning visibility was not good, so they warned us before buying the tickets, which is appreciated. Then I asked if they knew if the visibility was expected to be better in the day. The answer was "I am not a meteorologist, come back when it is sunny."If you decide to go, make...

Spent the weekend in Toronto, if you go, CN Tower is a must. It was $35 for 1 adult ticket to the observation deck. We opted instead to go have dinner at the 360 restaurant, which was very good, but pricey, about $200. With dinner, you get "free" admission to the observation deck. We went on a long weekend, so the line ups were very long. It's pricey just to go up. The views from on top are unbeatable. You can literally see for miles. Something good to do once.

Our anniversary fell on Labor Day this year and a lot of the nicer restaurants in Toronto were either closed or booked for private events. The CN Tower made our night extra special. I made reservations about 2 months before our trip (early July). From the moment we walked up to the gorgeous tower from our hotel - only about...
When in Toronto you must visit the CN Tower. It is better to go early because there is a lot of people later in the day. The view from the top is stunning.

We went early to avoid the queues and talk the whole package.Good decision.The films in the basement were very interesting showing how the tower was built and another about the Tooronto tram system.The coffee in the cafe was very good.Views from the observation level on a bright sunny day were awesome especially looking down on the...
Not expensive to go up the tower, nice to go up in the glass elevator I took lots of photos looking down at buildingsome .....glass floor you could walk 9r lay on looking down

This was on my to do list of Toronto get there early its less crowded got here on the tour bus stop 14 or 16 it was a nice clear day and the view was great allow time to go through the security check just like airport check so takes a few minutes if you want to go to a...

Spectacular view and an unbelievable cuisine! Usually attractions like this have either great food OR great entertainment. CN Tower has both. Great view AND great cuisine. A bit on the pricey side, but well worth it. Don't miss this one!

The CN is a symbol of Toronto, its most recognizable structure worldwide. People across the world identify Toronto with this Tower. Stepping over the glass in the observatory is always fun as well as taking the time to watch the city. Nice restaurant on top.

Upon reading a few reviews on here we opted to reserve a table at the 360 restaurant for our trip to the tower. This was a fantastic choice and well worth doing. The views, food and service are excellent and if you purchase 2 courses then you obtain entry to the same observation areas as with a normal ticket. When...
A glorious view of the city, one of the must see attractions of Toronto, the price of $50 for the full skypod experience is a bit too much.
If you are in Toronto i would recommend it. Don't expect anything special view is exceptional and restaurant prices are almost as high as the tower, but every time i went i head a good time.

We were in Niagra Falls Ontario & decided to take a day trip to Toronto, & it was one of the best decisions of our trip. We spend an awful lot of money to be VIP visitors and skip the ques. If not, we would have to wait for more than 45 minutes. It was a nice experience, if you are willing to stand on line. Really, I don't think it's worthwhile paying so high a price.

An interesting sight to behold at the top. The elevator goes very fast (at least for an elevator) which psyched me out. The food was great at the 360 restaurant, but, we were rushed through, to accommodate the next sitting, I'd say. No time to really relax & enjoy the experience!! I've been to many observation towers and this one was average. The glass floor was not good at all for photo opportunities. The View was OK from the lowest Deck but then you had to pay To go to the highest point after you Already paid To enter. I would suggest doing the edge walk for an exciting trip.

We took the trip up during the night. Probably less frightening then during the day. We were able to enjoy all the lights illuminating the Toronto night from above. We payed extra to go further up. In my opinion it was worth the extra fee. Just be ready to wait because the line was long. We went with friends and...

The views were AMAZING!! Definitely come to this, because you can see the entire city and take lots of awesome pictures!! Visited the CN Tower and had lunch at the 360 restaurant before going up. It is nice to see the city from up there, fun to stand on the glass floor, but doesn't require ny more than 30-40 minutes to visit unless you plan to read all of the information.

Go early and consider booking a lunch for a little extra cost. With the lunch booking you can by pass the long line to get upstairs but note - you have to enjoy lunch first before you can walk around.

We decided to visit the CN tower in the evening. We booked our tickets on line and used our mobiles to should tickets. This helped with the queues although you still had to wait for the lifts. It was a lovely evening although very windy up at the top. The kids enjoyed the glass floor and had photos taken.

Visited the CN Tower 360 restaurant to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary (book before you go to avoid disappointment) Fabulous views good but expensive food. Best visited at twilight to gain the full advantage of daylight and night-time views of Toronto. Incredible views, but not of the faint hearted. Very pricey but would still recommend going. Beautiful views and standing on the glass floor was quite exhilarating. I probably wouldn't be able to do the EdgeWalk but if you've got the money and the nerves, for heaven's sake go!

Visited at night during an electrical storm so we could not go out on the deck but "the show" was great nevertheless. However, still an amazing experience and highly recommend it...if you are not afraid of heights. Would love to visit during the day for a change in perspective. Great and very well organized!

If you go to Toronto, especially for the first time, the CN tower is a must. It held the record of the tallest structure in the world for almost 30 years and it is an iconic feature of the Toronto skyline. The observation decks offer great views of the skyscrapers downtown, Lake Ontario and the small island airport. I would...
Much more cost effective to visit for dinner as viewing is then included in the cost. The glass floor is worth a look and is included with normal viewing.
Amazing high tower, look through the glass floor and test your vertigo. You can also go one more level up and sense the wind on the highest building of Toronto

Our visit to the CN tower was great. Fourth visit (There are reasons). Tremendous views. Visit early evening to avoid the queues. If you want several of the CN Tower, Royal Ontario Museum, Casa Loma, Science Park or the Zoo, get a City Pass at the first one you visit, and save money and queuing.
You have to visit. The views are amazing and whilst the cost to eat in the revolving restaurant are a bit pricey, just do it.

It was our first visit to Toronto and this was very much at the top of our wish list. We booked a meal at the 360 restaurant. The views are fantastic and changing continually as it revolves. The view from the top of the tower is absolutely stunning. There was a game going on when i visited and i could see the entire stadium with its full lights and glory. A wonderful view from the top, the glass floor is really cool if you don't mind heights. Well worth a visit if your in Toronto.
Breathtaking experience and a must do when one is visiting Toronto. The view is great and the glass floor is to be experienced. Although not cheap, attraction is highly recommended.

we went to the very top viewing area, well worth the trip as you can see further, see clearly as the restaurant level even though outside the safety grills stop you getting a good view. Ive done the CN Tower a number of times now, but every time love it more and more, great $ to go to the up! its a must in Toronto

Our family had lunch at the revolving restaurant and the experience was very good. The food was excellent, the service was courteous and prompt, the view was incredible! Living in Toronto we take things like the CN Tower for granted. Well, I visited it with friends during the summer but this time went at dusk. Incredible morning and lunch at the top of the tower. The construction and story behind the CN tower is fascinating and the views are out of this world. We went during Easter and there was still some ice in the bay/ harbour area which made the view even nicer. The distance you can see from those dizzying heights is something...
I love CN tower great best ever seen February 2014 my first time on it.I want back again. I love it.

Great views from the restaurant. You should book a table an hour before dawn so you then get to see the whole city in day light and at night. The food is good and they don't hurry you to leave your table,

I hadn't visited the CN Tower since 1989 and was a little disappointed. For the cost of admission, it seems run down. With 9000 visitors per day, it must be hard to keep up with repairs and cleanliness. The observation deck has really not much to see compared to the 360 Restaurant provides a much better experience.
The views are worth the wait. 360 degrees of Toronto. The sky pod adds extra height and is a nice addition to the general admission.The glass floor is rather over-rated.
Well organize, safe, with additional attractions (like to skywalk which we didn´t do!). It is not cheap but the view is a must. Just consider that, even in a clear day it can look cloudy up there...

What an amazing experience, the restaurant is amazing! The journey up the ntower breathtaking to say the least and a bit scary but worth it. Outstanding views whilst you revolve 360 degrees (really really slow so you dont know you are revolving!) The food is out of this world and not too pricey. Real fun element to a holiday.

The food in the revolving restaurant was very good. Cheaper than i expected too. We went there on Sept.2 to celebrate my birthday. The meal was superb, very tasty and cooked to perfection. The service was excellent. I would like to see more on the dessert menu. The view and the who;e ambience was wonderful...

Enjoyed our visit to the CN Tower. The elevator ride up with the window is pretty incredible. Great view of beautiful Toronto and Lake Ontario. The glass floor was pretty impressive. Purchased the CityPass, which allowed us to visit multiple attractions at a great discount. Would highly recommend this!

Went up the tower after doing the edge walk. We were lucky to have great weather so the viability was great. I'm glad I got to go up the tower as part of my edge walk ticket but I don't think I would have been blown away as a stand alone tower ticket. The glass floor is a good experience...
It was very outstandingAnd I have been a very lucky girl to be able to get to go in the CN tower!!!!!
I've been to the CN Tower a few times. The glass floor at the top is cool, and the elevator ride up is awesome if you're not afraid of elevators like my sister. :p

I didn't want to miss this attraction because I love aerial views. I waited until the line outside wasn't too long to get in, but the line to get down still took quite a bit longer than expected. It's an amazing view but it's like any other tall tower view for the 40 dollar price tag it wasn't worth it. You can just go up for food, and get a meal for cheaper than 80 dollars you would pay for two. And the views free then. So maybe try that!

Got City Pass (covers Cn Tower, Casa loma, Toronto Zoo, Ontario Science Museum and ROM. This is a must see when you visit Toronto!Go through your hotel to get your tickets for the CN-Tower!High speed elevators are the state of the art!The staff is very helpful and they are friendly too!

We had a very nice lunch at the top of the CN Tower.One has a great view from the restaurant and the price and the quality of the food is also excellent.Afterwards we also walked in the glass floor and enjoyed to look down to the ground while standing on almost nothing.Great thing to do in Toronto.

At over 1100 feet above ground, what an amazing view of Toronto. The glass elevator makes the trip in 58 seconds at 15 mph. The glass floor on the lower deck lets you look straight down the tower. We had a 30 minute wait before taking the lift up to the visitor platform. You have a 360 view on the neighborhood which is nice. The "Tower Experience" is much like the trip to the top of the Freedom Tower in New York City. I have visited Toronto 10 to 15 times over the past 20 years but had never taken this tour before. I am glad that I did this time.My friend and I bought tickets while taking the double decker sightseeing bus....
I am not very impressed...it defintely wasnt worth the money they charged... u basically just go up the lift spend 20 mins max and come back...

It offers a wonderful view of the city and surrounding areas at quite the high up view. There is a meal package that included a restaurant lunch or dinner (not between 2pm and 4:30pm). Food was great, the view is wonderful.Service was excellent, delicate and cheerful.Atmosphere and music just well tuned. Wow!
One of the most famous monuments in canada that must be visited if in Toronto,the views are unbelievable
A must see if you visit Toronto. If your brave enough, try the Sky Walk and experience something that will give you a story to tell for the rest of your life. Hope your not scared of heights :)
Excellent view of the city. Food is pricey but considering that it costs $35 to just see the view, it's worth it to pay a little more for a fine dining on top of the CN tower.

This was #1 on my list for an afternoon in Toronto. The view from the top was good, particularly from the lower level where we could go outside rather than look through window glass. There is a stunning view from CN Tower , you can get on the top in glass lift . Worth going to the top .
This place is a must visit if you are in Toronto, it's definitely well worth the time and money. Fantastic views of the city and Great Lakes from the top.
It is a great sight. Make sure you pay the extra $12 to go all the way up. Much less crowded and a great view.

This is my review from my visit one year ago, we took our granddaughter up the tower for lunch and she loved it. It's a must place to visit. It's in a very nice area, lots of things to see, along with restaurants to eat in, the glass floor, the lookout, walking on the ledge. This is just beautiful

I LOVED our visit to the CN tower. Spectacular view from the top, and the glass floor is amazing!! Totally worth doing the "tourist" thing :) Visit - July 2011

Its iconic so you might as well check it out. First, go online for the CN website and check any specials for pricing. I got the CityPass through Costco for $57 instead of the $35 CN Tower Ticket. It was an amazing view and my favorite part was the elevator ride. The Glass Floor is exciting but it was very scratched up. You get to see two short movies just before exiting and the TTC streetcar film was way better than I thought...

Dominates the Toronto skyline and surely no trip to the city would be complete without viewing the landscape from one the world's tallest buildings. Just a really one of a kind experience. Go on a nice day and you can see so much. Definitely worth the entry fee.
Cafe is really nice and not to pricey really enjoyed our visit , you can see for miles and watching planes take of from the air strip was cool

We visited the famous CN Tower in April / May 2014 when we were on our visit to USA and Canada. There was lot of rush. We went up through a very speedy lift and enjoyed the Toronto all around from CN Tower. It was our old desire to visit CN Tower and go up during our trip to Canada,...
Really nice place a must go and visit if you are visiting Toronto, a place too see the city the island and during the night is just a amazing

Well worth the money!! Even on a cloudy day the views from the top are spectacular. Go early to avoid the bus tours. Top tip is to eat at the restaurant as the set menu is just a few dollars more than the tour ticket and you get a vip lift to avoid the queues!

it is a breathtaking structure with aview to match, its a we bit expensive for what it is, but, it would be a shame not to enjy a trip up the tower, the views are magnificent, the staff are friendly and well informed

It's a tower. the highest one.With lovely view around Toronto and even beneath your footsteps (yes, there is part of the floor in see-through glass).And it is always fun to look on the world from such high point of view.

This was not my first visit to the CN Tower, but was in Toronto so why not. There are amazing views but there isn't much more and it seemed dated to me. If you want to feel a real sense of Canadian pride you have to check out the CN Tower. Hubby and I got to go in July. We paid the extra 12 to go up in the sky pod which takes you up an additional 33 stories TOTALLY WORTH IT! Do yourself a favour though and go before eleven or...

Great view of Toronto, from every angle including down. The glass floor gives some people the creeps but it is fun once you get used to it. Walking on the tether around the tower is expensive, over 100 dollars, but if you are a thrill seeker, this could be a once in a lifetime event.

We were lucky, it was a clear day and the airshow was on. Don't be put off by the crowd as soon as you get out of the elevator- just walk a bit further along and it thins out. Make sure you stand on the glass floor and go down a floor to the outdoor area

This is 3th time I visited CN Tower and allways is excited.Amazing to know how it was build and beutiful view of Toronto city from it.I recomend everybody, Torontonians and Visitors to go and visit this place. It is Toronto's symbol.

The CN Tower is always an interesting way to scope out the city and maybe catch part of a sold out jays game lol. the glass floor is great but i think the gated balcony is by far the better experience. and it is better to go up during the daylight so that you can see the majority of the...
Go have dinner,at the 360 restaurant.the food is good.the view is amazing.plus when you go up to eat,the trip is free.

I visited the CN tower in July 2015 and I had a great time. Lots of fun . You get a great view of the city and there is a souvenir shop to buy goods. What I like the most was the glass floor very impressioning. A must visit if you go to Toronto.
The food is overpriced but if you're coming to Toronto, it's a must see. Stand on the glass floor and it's kinda freaky, or do the edge walk it's kind of spectacular

Go here on a clear day for good visibility. Nice revolving restaurant at the top or if you dare, walk around the top on the outside of the tower (in a harness of course). Although this isn't as scary as the first visit (our second time here), it still gives you a thrill to look down through the glass floor, or even better at the glass floor of the elevator as you go up. Hope for a clear Toronto day for a great view of the city.
After seeing for a third time lost it's wow factor, ages to get up, very loud Chinese,long delay and queue for lift down,a must if it,s your first time to Toronto.
lots to do love it there when the Ex is on watching the air show snow birds what a view over the lake and Toronto can see all the way to my house

No trip to Toronto would be complete without a visit to the CN tower. The views are amazing. Even the elevator ride is fun with glass floors. Don't miss the glass floor area of the tower, it's not for the faint hearted! Highly recommend this attraction and it's pretty good value for money too.
By far the best place to view Toronto in all its glory day or night. Food is pretty good and overall a must do when in Toronto
it is a bit pricey, but you have to take out of town guest and brave lil kids to go see it. the see through elevator and floor will make your stomach go crazy...in a good way

I went there with my boyfriend last June for my birthday, it was the most amazing experience. While you're getting higher and higher in the elevator you feel the incredible place.
