A nice sky-high landmark. I enjoyed going up to the top of the tower and looking down. The weather wasn't great, since it was March, so there was mostly just greyness and ground to see, but it was still a cool experience.

The view from the moment you step in the elevator is breathtaking. The glass floor, the observation area. Watch out as there might be some wind on the lower level that is so strong it might be difficult to walk.

From the ride in the glass elevator taking you up to the one of the WORLDS highest structures, the view is amazing. As you rise you begin to see the city unfold in front of you. From the Rogers Center next door to the amazing waterfront your breath will be taken away! As you enter the floor you will be...

Located downtown Toronto, near the lake Ontario. Is near hotels, restaurants and public transportation.Elevators will take you almost to the top and on a clear day you can see Buffalo USA. There is a nice restaurant too. For the brave you can get a harness and walk on the edge of the tower.If you are fit you can...
We all loved the view from high atop the CN Tower! Definitely a worthwhile stop in Toronto! To save time waiting in line, book your tickets from your phone or buy them in advance.

Must to see place once you are visiting Toronto. When the weather is good and skies are clear you can see and observe amazing view of the waterfront, Downtown Toronto and more. Haven't tried the EdgeWalk but my friends did and loved it very much. Consider to make a dinner reservation at the 360 Restaurant - you'll be offered fresh...

Soar high above the city in an elevator travelling 30 feet per second and then stand on a glass floor and observe the planes flying below you. Truly one of the modern wonders of the world and iconic landmark of Canada's largest city.
Lots of interesting facts and the glass floor is crazy!! Maybe wait until the lines die down... or plan to do something else like the restaurant or edge walk while you're there.

If it's your first or only time in Toronto, you must go to the CN Tower. Don't bother with the restaurant, just go up and enjoy the view. If you want to pay the extra $15 to get to the top, that's up to you. The elevator ride is fun, the glass floor is underwhelming. It's really not that scary...

nice views. Super long wait though, not sure if there is a way to avoid the long lines, 75 minute wait for us, but try to avoid it. It is not air conditioned. Try and bring in your own water. Nothing to do while you wait in line so be prepared.

Great place to bring visitors, they always love it, Great views of Toronto and Lake Ontario. Eat at the 36 turning restaurant. Other attractions within short walking distance - Rogers Centre, Ripley's Aquarium, Steam Whistle Museum.
Excellent view, from the top. did not try walk over the edge since was too scared of heights. But worth trying seemed fun from people who did. Not too much waiting but advisable to book in advance.
A must-see on a visit to Toronto although it is pricey and crowded during the summer. My favourite is the glass floor and the green screen souvenir photo is pretty great, although overpriced.
My wife and I went to the first level early in the morning before the crowds hit. Best time to go. The view is spectacular. It was a bit hazy but still breathtaking.

If you come to Toronto this is a must do! You can see for miles! The glass floor is daring but really fun! The lift was fast and safe and was the bit I was worried about but it was over and done with in a minute and was absolutely fine :) the photos were brilliant fun too! It cost...
Not such a great view today due to the weather but when in Toronto you must visit this place. A lot of security in place made for a safe visit.

A must-see attraction for any visitor to Toronto, we took in this landmark on our own. Although it was very crowded at the time of our visit with tourists from all over the world, the visit was orderly and relaxing. The staff at the Tower were very helpful in providing information about sites seen from the observation deck. We spent...

Was a bit pricy but a must see experience. Take advantage of any coupons or discounts available. The ride up is fast and breathtaking, the views are amazing and to go outside and walk around feeling the wind blowing was an experience all in itself. We were at the top after sunset with all the city lights going on forever....

We visited CN tower on a busy saturday so the queues were long but it was a lovely day so we were not put off by the wait. Once in the tower it is straightforward to be whizzed up in the lift to the first of the viewing platforms. We also opted to go up to the next section too...

Excellent service, great food and a wonderful view of Toronto. I would highly recommend to anyone. Reservations are recommended, if not required. The evening lights of the city are beautiful. The atmosphere is very pleasant.

This is a good site to visit around downtown Toronto. It's around all the main attractions downtown so it is definitely something to visit. Very historic being that they claim it to be the "first glass floor experience". It's good for all ages, pay the extra $15 to head all the way to the top. If you're a thrill seeker...
Finding parking is next to impossible, especially on weekends. Be ready to park far and take the subway or drive around till you get a parking lot free

buy ticket in advance , buy city pass if going to more than 1 attraction. wait time to buy ticket 1 hour . first you wait in line for security check . then purchase tickets . then another line to stand in machine to have air blown on you . then another hour wait to elevator to the top. then...

There were two levels of security which I appreciated. The ride up the elevator was quick and the height didn’t bother me (but I couldn’t handle looking through the glass in the bottom of the elevator!) We went as a large group (over 30). While they were getting the last table ready, we went to the observation deck. This level...
Great trip up the tower & views were good . Wait times only 10 mins or so for the lifts . A must if you visit Toronto . We went early evening when it was less busier .

Going up to the CN Tower was another great experience. The view of the whole city of Toronto was fantastic. The view below the Glass floor was quite scary at first, but got the nerve to have my picture taken on the Glass floor. Some daring people went to the Edge Walk. Everybody passed through the tight security checks before...

We had expected the great view. After all, a revolving restaurant (one revolution takes 70 minutes) at 351 meter results in a great view overlooking Toronto.We also ate the 3 course "prix fixe" menu ($79), and it was really good! We expected good food, but not that good!If you can spare the money, try it!Hint: Eat in...

It was indeed as advertised. You really feel on top of the world here. The place was a little crowded maybe due to the weekend. Staff were friendly and patient. A visit to Toronto is not complete without visiting CN Tower.

This is quite an experience, and to be honest, if you are a new visitor to Toronto, you are almost duty bound to visit the CN Tower. If it is busy, and you feel a little wealthy, then get yourself the premium pass to go up to the Skypod which is the highest viewing point, and pass by the endless...

It's got to be done, hasn't it... No trip to Toronto would be complete without a visit to the CN tower! Try to pick a clear day for the best views. For the best experience, book a table at the revolving 360 restaurant - the food is great, the price includes admission and you get to skip the queues!

Well this not much I can really say about the tower we got general admission and paid extra for the sky-pod which takes you higher for a better view because they say on a good day you can see New York and the Niagara Falls but we couldn't see anything but Toronto,the view of Toronto was great but that's all...

You have to go up the tower at least once in your life. Try to pick a nice clear day and you certainly will not be disappointed with the view of the city and the distance that you can see.Try the glass floor if you dare. Kind of expensive if you have more than one or two people ---try...

We had lunch here as part of the last day of our Road Scholar cruise of the Great Lakes. We were in the 360 restaurant, at the top and which rotates every 72 minutes for great views while dining. We could see our ship docked in the distance waiting for the return voyage. After lunch we went one floor down...
The icon of Toronto, this tower has 553 meters with one restaurantecalled 360, it has a incredible view of all city, a obligatory visit.

After work last week our party took taxis downtown and got let off at the bottom of the Tower. The Blue Jays were playing that night at the Rogers Stadium next door so it was rather busy. Nevertheless we quickly made our way through the tight security and were soon stepping into the glass sided lifts on the side of...

We visited the CN Tower in Sept. 2015.We weren’t sure where to park and stumbled upon an underground municipal parking lot in front of a Jack Astor Restaurant on University Ave. and Front St.. $3.00 / 1/2hr.. We only had to go up to the corner, a short walk in front of the Toronto Convention Centre, and into the...

We booked ahead for the lunch in the revolving restaurant, when we arrived we were taken straight to a separate lift and to the restaurant where our table was waiting. The views were absolutely amazing from the panoramic windows and as the restaurant moves slowly round you can relax and enjoy seeing out across the whole city.The portions for...
We visited the tower went right up to the top we stood on the glass floor that was scary but interesting the lift going up is quite fast and scary to but its well worth a visit
Nice for tourists . Must see the glass floor as without that there is no use unless u r scared of heights :) get the tickets on line to avoid a line up

CN is an amazing engineering feat being the largest free standing tower in North America. There are 3 viewing levels and the lowest level has a glass bottom floor so one can look straight down onto the roof of the Ripley's Aquarium and sidewalk below and watch those brave enough to do the outside walk suspended by cables as the...

Did this since I was on my first trip to Toronto. Pretty neat place with beautiful views but the ticket price makes it almost not worth it... Skypod was a nice add on too, it's too bad you can't just do that alone. Lol

Amazing views across Toronto and the Harbour and an excellent Dinner in the revolving Restaurant. We weren't brave enough for the Edge but did attempt the glass floor some of us with some trepidation.We'd definitely recommend a visit.

Went to the top, had a look around. A mandatory site to see when in Toronto. Loved the guys walking around the outside, crazy! But you can do it once, and soak it in, but probably not worth a second visit - better to spend the cash on a baseball game, hockey game, or perhaps the walking distillery tour!

After over 2 hours of waiting in hot, crowded, loud conditions we missed daylight views and only saw less than spectacular evening view. Restaurant was bearable, but like going to Dennys, although wait staff nice. 20+ minutes wait for elevator down into gift shop to sell more stuff. Over all, staff was unhelpful on actual wait times and general info...
Good experience and excellent views, great glass floor in the lift. Next to other attractions, baseball, aquarium, Steam Whistle Brewery. Has a restaurant. Well recommended
Toronto is a verry nice city, better than NY I think. The people are verry friendly and are willing to help

The famous C N Tower is located in the heart of Toronto and is a must visit. Visitors are given a ride up in a glass elevator,that goes up on the side of the Tower to give a thrilling ride.One sees all objects on the ground grow small in seconds ! The Tower is 1122 feet high with a glass...

We did not plan ahead....during peak tourist season..we waited nearly 90 minutes for access to the tower. Purchase tickets on line if possible. It is a better deal to book lunch reservations in the 360 restaurant and experience that view with the view of the glass floor. If you pay admission to the observation deck it's only $10 less than...
Great view from up there. I did the hanging activity and I would recommend this to people that are afraid of the heights.
This gives a great view of the city. It can be done in less than an hour and is right next to an amazing aquarium. Security is thorough.
This was an awesome experience. I had also done the skylon tower in Niagara and loved. This was a beautiful view of the city all around! Definitely worth it!

Fantastic views (and photos) of Toronto and beyond. The first stage actually wasn't that impressive but if you go to the upper level, the view are fantastic. We could look down onto the baseball stadium below (Blue Jays were playing Yankees). The queues can be frustrating, even if you buy tickets in advance as we did, but still queued for...

Excellent Views from this iconic building in Toronto. The elevator ride is fantastically stunning, along with their glass floor. However it is also quite expensive and often the lines for tickets are long. Plan half a day for this if you go during a busy time. (Also don't bother eating up there, its expensive and not worth the price, there's...

Fantastic view as you would expect. We paid the extra to go to the very top which was worth it. Arrived around 11am on a Tuesday - no queue for tickets or the lifts. Only disappointment is that there are no skyline pointers to tell you what to look at.

We went to the tower at around 9:30 pm and got the most spectacular views of the city at night with no lines or crowds. The tower looks so awesome all light up at night. It was dizzying walking over the glass bottom floor and the wind outside the observation deck had us blowing away but it was all fun.

CN Tower, needless to say, is one of the best attractions in Toronto. With its easy access from the city centre, it's listed one of the must-visit-spot while you are in Toronto. What matters in your visit would be the weather. If you have plenty of time in the city, it would be good idea to check the weather forecast...

Visited the CN tower for the second time (last visit was 35 years ago). There is a large gift shop at the base, some educational videos and info while you wait for the elevator to go to the top (I waited 30 mins.).From the observation deck the view was phenomenal! I'm not sure I would pay the extra (or...

I went right after I did the edge walk. observation of the city was great. Other than that it was pretty boring. I left after 5-10 minutes and stood on the glass floor 1 level below, took a photo and left. So many people were standing on it all at once even after pictures and so forth. I couldn't get...

Visiting the CN tower is a must! There are great views from all sides and on a clear day, one can see the United Staes across the lake. The glass floor is a fun experience. Thrill seekers can even walk around the outside ('the Edge Walk'), harnessed in.

This iconic tower is one ot the first things I look for when travelling to Toronto. It is kind of a trademark for Toronto in a way. This tower stands out predominately in the skyline, but I wouldn't recommend going up it more than once. I went as a child and then went back last year and it was kind...

After having seen Empire State in NY and the Seattle Space Needle we were a bit skeptical about doing yet another city tower with a 1.5 hour wait to get in and overpriced tickets. But truly you never tire of classic tourist destinations like this one. Stunning views of the city and lake Ontario and on a clear day you...

The line was too long to wait. There are signs recommending to go online and purchase your tickets a head of time. I'd go with that suggestion. There's an option to hand off the outside of the top of the tower and scale your way around. Not sure why someone would want to do that, but there was a line...

We went to both the movies prior to the ride up the elevator. The first was a thinly disguised ad for the trolley system and should be passed on. The other was about the construction of the CN Tower and was quite informative, a should-see.The ride up the elevator was rapid and we explored the observation level; unfortunately it...
perfect, beautiful, expensive, very good place to relax with the view of the city and the lake, perfect for couples

We took our kids here in the evening for an experience they wont soon forget. The security to get in was tight but understandable. We enjoyed the ride up and the glass floor but Id say the highlight for my daredevils was the observation deck. They loved running around with the wind whipping their hair about lol. It was a...
When we saw how much it was to just go up the elevator we decided it was a total waste of money...35canadian per person

Amazing views from the top of the tower. Well worth the extra charge to go to the very top. Standing on the glass floor looking down was a strange feeling. Great way to spend an hour or two. A must visit when in Toronto.

Be aware that tickets are at a premium price! The views were great, but unless dining in one of the restaurants or doing the Sky Lounge, you didn't really get to experience the 360 degree views. The glass walk was a good experience, if somewhat scary.
Excellent accommodations for the handicapped! Awesome views from 360 degree view. Place is clean and they handle large groups effectively! Staff is really friendly and helpful!

I have been going up the CN Tower every few years since it opened and it sure has changed over the years. The visitor centre has grown quite large and the elevators are much nicer than the old days. We took our kids for the first time in August and they had a great Tim. They loved the glass floor...
Had dinner there first off it took over an hour and the place was not busy at all. The portion was enough for a small child any way over priced. Nice view that's all!!!!

The curiosity and excitement while on the ascending elevator plus when you get to the main viewing deck which is made of glass makes you feel vertigo. Amazing view of downtown Toronto and beyond. A telescope is recommended. I just think 35.00 is a bit expensive for just CN tower.
Visited during the Paralympic Games. Was very busy, but the view from the top was worth it. All the workers were very friendly and kept the queues moving well.

A 58 second ride to the viewing area which can be both inside and outside. There is also a partial glass floor on which you can walk, if you are so daring. If you are really brave, you can walk outside on the edge as your secured by a harness. A 360 degree restaurant is available. There are also 2...

A historical and integral tourist landmark...a MUST-See attraction.Tickets are better to be purchased online or through a CityPass which gives multiple attraction visits for a great price.Can get a bit hectic during peak times (weekends) so be prepared...and take anti-nausea pills if needed ;-)
Great tourist attraction, magnificent views but long wait in queue, I guess that is to be expected. Highly recommended

I am terrified of heights and yes this was not a treat per se but the whole experience is well worth it. I summoned the courage and went up with my son and I am glad I did because the views are amazing. You can see clear to the niagra peninsula and as far as the eye can see. The...
Beautiful views but $35 is a little steep for 20 min. or so of picture taking among the throngs of tourists.

The view was truly brilliant! Unfortunately it took ages to finally get a space to take a photo. The elevator was very crowded as well. I was very lucky to go up exactly at sunset and we stayed until it got dark
You can't visit Toronto and not go up the CN Tower. The views are spectacular and there is no other way to see the city. The glass floor makes it even more interesting.
fitting dinner ambiance for a celebration. We experienced a beautiful sunset over the buidlings, airport and Ontario Lake.

We pre-booked tickets but were warned to still expect queues. We were either very lucky or the team at the Tower are well practiced at getting visitors through the doors. One of them let us know before we went up that there would be reduced visibility because of mist and checked that we still wanted to go. The views were...
Enjoyed the trip up the tower and had great views over the city and the islands. We paid the extra to visit the Skypod which was worth it.

Pretty much have to visit CN tower if you are in Toronto and have visited it before. Cool going up & down the elevator and the glass floor (although much smaller area than I imagined) is likely to cause some butterflies in the stomach. Rotating restaurant/bar is nice but very pricey so we just checked it out w/o eating/drinking. Can...

I maybe overreacting but I'm a person that loves city lights so much. We chose to come at night and indeed it was breathtaking. I could go here all night to see the beauty of Toronto. We went to the Glassfloor and skypod was only $10 more for technically another building higher than the normal look out. It was very...
A real tribute to the engineers who constructed this landmark.Who can argue with such a dramatic view, a see thru glass floor and the well organized staff.

Ground staff outside the CN Tower were great, although signs were unclear and only one small one. When you get to the ticket box they just tried to up-sell you tickets that are even more costly. Frustrating that you have to wait in a long line to get your photo taken. Elevator lift line moved so slowly, and the man...

My friend and I were visiting Niagria Falls and decided to go to Toronto for the day. The last sight we wanted to see was the CN Tower. Since we drove to Toronto we needed to be on the road, back to The Falls, by 3:00 to avoid traffic. We paid $25 each for the ticket , which I thought...

Having been to numerous towers and observations decks around the world, this is one of my favorites. The views are great, the customer experience was very good and I thought that the price tag was very reasonable (N.B. I booked in advance on the official website - not sure if that makes a difference). I think we happened upon a...

Admittedly, we did visit at the busiest time of the year, but we had to stand in a queue for at least 1 1/2 hours before finally reaching the lift that takes you up. Then we had about another 1/2 hour queue down. That was the negative, but other than that it was worth doing, albeit quite expensive. The views...
This was a wonderful experience for the kids. If your kids are young, however, you may want to pay for 2 hour on street parking instead of the garage to save a few dollars.
One of the musts when visiting Toronto. Pretty fun experience watching the glass bottom window while going up to 118 floor.

We really enjoyed our time here seeing it in light and then turning to darkness. It wasn't too busy so could look at the view all the way around without problems. Took lots of pictures. The glass floor was funny and enjoyed watching everyone on it.
The price may be a bit steep but the views from the top are well worth it. I was there on a sunny clear day and what more can I say - magnificent !

A bit overpriced for what it is. The observation deck is crowded and the outside area has cage like screens that are difficult to take pictures through. The "glass bottom" floor is a piece of Plexiglas that is nearly opaque from age and design, and is so small, it's pretty deceiving by description!

We were lucky to visit the CN tour in a relative no crowded time, advise pick your time, no lines, spent wonderful time to see all GTA from the top of the city, do not miss the movie that's show the history of the building. if you have small kids in stroller be wise when you pick your visit time...

Toronto is widely considered by many as one of North America's mega cities, and with nearly 17% of Canada's population in its greater area it is easy to see why. Views over its massive expanse from the CN Tower are simply breath taking but to truly experience the beauty and just how far out the metro area spreads one needs...

I chose a great time to go to the CN Tower - morning about 8:45am on a Sunday hahaha There was however a massive blue coloured line outside, fans waiting to enter Rogers Stadium for the Blue Jays game, so I got through that and entered the Tower security.Now, once inside it's a little confusing, but I found my...

The city of Toronto did it right with 1 of the 7 wonders of the world in the 'CN Tower"! Beautiful sights above the majestic city of Toronto, Canada, this is a must see attraction! And also for only $200 per person extra, you can hang off the edge of the CN Tower in a full harness & climbing gear...

Going to the top of CN Tower is one of the things one must do in Toronto. The lines or queues are substantial and the price is outrageously high, and I hate tourist traps. But I have to say that I loved it. The views of the city and its environment are terrific, and the glass floor part was an...
The food in 360 was very good. Although we were more occupied with the lovely view of Toronto. This is one of the best spot to take in Toronto night view , try to book a window table.
View from the top is amazing!! Tried to do the glass floor didn't have luck as I'm afraid of heights but if you have a chance to go up do it!

We booked a meal for a family of four whilst up the tower. The price was on the expensive side and some of the meals on the menu seemed a little fancy. If you have any doubts - don't. It was a fabulous meal and enjoyed by all the family. The views were marvelous. We weren't rushed at all with...

A lot of stuff to do. Elevator ride is great and view is incredible. On a clear day you can see Buffalo. The glass floor, looking down, is very cool and an odd feeling because you are really up there! Fun for the whole family.

Fabulous view but very busy, expect queues in the summer and holiday season. Little advice, eat in the 360 restaurant and you get free admission to the tower, well worth the extra, eat your meal over 74 minutes and you get a full view from every aspect of the tower, a real wow!

It had been many years since going up the CN tower, and I remember as a kid it used to be very exciting and educational. There would be a short movie you could watch that explained how the whole thing was built and other fun facts along the way. It seems that they've done away with a lot of that...
A must. For the more adventurous try the Edge Walk, hanging off the edge of the top viewing station! Pay to go to the top, the views are better and it's enclosed

You have to go up the CN tower if you are in Toronto. It is like, going to New York and no going up one of the buildings there. Yes it is very expensive for what it is, but being something like the tallest building in the Western Hemisphere, what do you expect?There was no queue at all at...
Went there for my girlfriends birthday August 27th. The food was amazing and servers were amazing. Overall great experience
You must visit the CN Tower , fast elevator to the top slower coming down because of the windy conditions, very windy on the observation deck , nice store on the way out .good views over the city.

It was fun to see the city and lake from on high, but I can't recommend it when it cost well over $100 for a family of four. The lines were long for the elevators, and the movie explaining the history and construction was on small screen televisions and was hard to hear. We did like the glass floor area,...

Paid $35 was just ok.The elevator up wasn't scary but was very smooth and sleek and very fast.It wasn't overwhelming this is why I rate it poor as it was quite overpriced for the amount of time I spent there.
fast and easy to get up there, staff are helpful and keep you moving along, ate at the 360 restaurant, very good!

We pre-booked our tickets as we were doing the edgewalk challenge. We arrived early morning with no queues. (Noticed a big queue when we left in the afternoon ) the views were fantastic and the edgewalk experience we paid extra for was amazing. If you're too scared to do the edgewalk experience you can watch others doing it via the...

The CN tower is a must do for anyone visiting Toronto, offering great views of Toronto and Lake Ontario. I would definitely recommend paying extra to go to the sky pod as the 360 views form here are spectacular and much clearer to see than on the viewing platform below. The experience is incredible from the off with the glass...

It was not that exciting. The view from the tower was not that different from the view from my hotel room (43 floor). The elevator was fast. If you haven't had any high tower experience, it may be a good chance to have.

The views from the observation deck are stunning. There is a glass floor section that you can stand on and look straight down. If you don't like heights you might want to give this bit a miss. There is plenty of other views to take in. There is also a caged in outdoor section which gives you the breeze as...

This is a must - see if you are in the Toronto area. Easy to get to and the best view hands down. On one of the floors there is a glass floor where you can look down. We learned that the ENTIRE floor is made of glass and covered by the carpeting so you don't get freaked out.Great...
Pay the extra $12 and go to the sky box. Spectacular views! Next visit will be at night. We skipped the touristy photo, no need for that.

Sharing a tip of a location where you have a nice view of the CN tower and place to take photos.If you are in Toronto at Sunset go to University of Toronto on Wellesley and Kings College Circle. Stay on the north side of the King College circle and you will have a direct line to the CN tower....

I visited the skypod and observation pod as part of the included ticket from the EdgeWalk and it was nice seeing the Jays playing below in a packed-out stadium and seeing all the boats over the beaches out at the island park was awesome.But the real CN tower experience is the EdgeWalk which is beautiful, especially at night. However...
OK, but views nothing special. Not really worth the money, or the wait. One of those things you feel you have to do, then wonder why.

As part of our visit to Toronto city we thought it would be a good idea to get a birds eye view of the city from the building that best defines the city's skyline - the CN tower. Phew! Not the best decision. Long queues everywhere, first to buy the ticket, then to get into the tower and then finally...
The skyscraper of TorontoExcellent viewsLong linesBeautiful views of Toronto islands ans Billy Bishop airport

This iconic building is one of he greatest structures of its time. The tower itself is still a sight you can not miss die to the sheer size! Its great to use when visiting Toronto as a pin point for when you are gathering you bearings.Inside the tower is also defiantly worth a visit. The glass floor really needs...

I really liked it, you can see all the city from there and have a 360 degree angles of all the city, you can also go the restaurant they have and eat with the amazing view. They also have a glass floor which is kind of scary for some people hehe

Went for lunch with my wife and 3 kids (9,7&4). The food was above average but not quite excellent. You get a great, rotating view without the crowds and the observation tickets are included so when you are done you can experience the regular tour as well. I would definitely recommend this route, you skip all the lines and get...

If ever in Toronto take this tower in, what views of the city, pay a little bit more and take in the Skypod which takes you 33 stories higher than main tower. Even standing inside you want to hold handrails looking down. Very worth it!

There was a long line to get to the top. Once there, the view is amazing. The glass floor was nice, just wish someone was there to keep the traffic jam of people trying to get on it a little more in control. It was hard to get a good picture on it.

The CN Tower is definitely a must when visiting Toronto. I highly recommend paying extra and visiting the SkyPod as well. We were glad we did since it was so windy it was almost impossible to enjoy the views at the LookOut Level. We went about an hour before the sun started to set, that way we could enjoy the...

I visited the CN tower with family, and we purchased tickets at the door. Surprisingly, we did not have to wait too long, and were in and out in less than an hour. The children enjoyed the glass floor, and the large windows were perfect for taking photos.

Pre-booked this trip before our three day trip to Toronto. No problems with lines and we went straight up to the main observation deck and then to the higher level.Higher level was interesting with the ability to walk on the glass floor but we all found the experience a bit underwhelming. this was probably because we had a trip...
This spot provides a great Toronto view, but it is not cheap to go upstairs. If you are going to have a meal there you will save the fare.

I wouldn't say one must visit the CN tower before leaving Toronto, but if you have free time and want to see they city, then traveling to the tower would be a good activity. My family and I were mostly drawn by the fact that it is one of the tallest buildings in the world. The views were good, but...

Beautiful view from the tower, I really liked the view of the water, boats and the island airport and lying on the glass floor. Seeing the top of the buildings and roofs (the shapes from the tower was interesting)

The reason for visiting the CN tower is that it is an obligatory thing on the check list when visiting Toronto.It is an impressive structure and is worth exploring from around. Going to the top of the CN tower is definitely cool and a good experience (with great views), the cost is a bit steep.... 35 CAD per person...
The views are amazing and the glass floor is an experience . Maybe a nicer view at night but either would be

This is definitely a must see attraction. We did the regular trip and also the sky pod. It's amazing to see the whole city below. Definitely worth the money to go up there. The only downside is the windows are not clean at all so spoils the pictures as you can't get great pictures when the windows are dirty.

There were tons of people visiting the tower so the queues were rather long (half an hour wait). It was worth it though. We went all the way to the top and absolutely enjoyed the view. The glass floor is a must, especially when conquering your fear of vertigo.

If you have already been to tallest buildings this might be yet another saga. Experience it once as this is the tallest building in the world for a long time. However only place to have edge walk, if you are adventurous enough just don't think twice to get the adrenaline rush. kool!

Great panoramic view and easy enclosed ride. You can also rappel off the side if you care to!! Best idea is to arrive early nlt 0800 as crowds non-existent then. Otherwise it could be a long wait. Also check out the Toronto City Pass sold at numerous booths for a good deal.

My family and I absolutely loved the experience! This is a "must-see" spot in Toronto: the views, the revolving restaurant, the "glass floor" and everything else! I visit Toronto on a regular basis to see family and friends, and every time I am there I would go to the Tower. I am looking forward to my next visit.
If you are new to the area it is good to see. The view is amazing. I have been up once and am not going back.

My Husband and I wanted to visit the CN tower during a short stay in Toronto. Having visited New York in the same trip, we weren't sure if the views would be as impressive as we had seen previously. On that note we decided to visit at night in order to see the city lit up.Having read lots of...

There are just some things you have to do and a visit to the CN Tower when in Toronto is one of them. I recommend you go early and consider purchasing a City Pass which gives you prepaid entry to 5 attractions and allows you to by pass the lines if needed.

A sight to see and definitely a must do when in Toronto! Two security checks and some longer lines for elevators so ensure you leave a little additional time. Entrance is not only less expensive if you buy in advance, on line it will also help you avoid lines upon arrival. Pay the extra money to go to the highest...

Great place to visit with great views around Toronto, there's a glass floor with the views of down under you if you dare to stand on it, plenty did.Reasonably priced I would say half the price of Empire State with views just as spectacular.

I'm super afraid of heights so it took me quite a while to find courage inside of me to visit this attraction. But I did, somehow, and it was very worth it. The staff is great too, specially Maurizio, who kindly offer to go up the elevator with me so I wouldn't be too afraid, that was very nice. Once...

I am not a fan of heights, but needed to see this and sit on the famous glass! I was not disappointed. Very scary sitting on the glass if you are scared of heights but the views were amazing. A great world famous building.

If in Toronto for a visit, it's quite natural to visit one of the citiy's main attractions. We went on a Sunday evening and surprisingly only waited for 15 minutes to purchase tickets. The view of the city is obviously spectacular and worthwhile. It's not very stroller friendly however. It definitely caters to tourists, which is attested but the ridiculously...

We booked dinner in the CN Tower 3months before our trip to Canada for our anniversary. We went up the 350m to the 360 restaurant and were seated right at the window. My husband had already been in contact with them to request this because it was for a special occasion and it was certainly special. The view was stunning,...

The CN Tower always has its beauty and uniqueness, a must see for all visitors. The tiny glass floor is a favourite and getting a photo on there is next to impossible without people walking into it, past you or banging into you as they try to strike some odd pose which they find amusing. If you go to the restaurant you can have lunch or dinner (even though is very expensive) and enjoy the views during one or two hours; but if you dont go to the restaurant you cant really see the views bc you wont be in the same level as the one where the restaurant is.
No trip to Toronto would be complete without a seeing the city from the highest point in town. Make sure you go to the upper level to get the best views.

A really, really must see and do in Toronto - the unmissable (and completely distinguishable!) CN Tower!The CN tower gives you amazing views of Toronto's skyline and city centre, with a glass floor for the brave ones too!!The skypod is also worth the money to go up and have a look at, 100m extra up! There was a 360 degree view at the top and you could see the top Ripley's aquarium when looking through the glass floor. Its best if you go on a sunny day so you could see as far as the Pearson Airport!

The CN Tower was an amazing sight to see. From the ground, the building makes you feel so small. It even dwarfs the massive Rogers Center, home of the Toronto Blue Jays, right next door. From vantage points all across the city, you can't miss what is the true definition of a landmark. If you are ever lost in Toronto,...

I first went up the CN Tower in 1977, the year after it opened. The CN Tower is something a person should visit every few years. The view is breathtaking. Looking through the glass floor is very special.Here is a suggestion: Have lunch at the 360 restaurant as this will save the admission to the CN Tower. I wish I would have known this before standing in line!If you can, buy tickets...
I thought it was expensive for a family of 4. It's one of those things you feel you have to do but I wouldn't do it a second time.
We had Dinner at the Tower. Dinner was good. The views are beautiful. We went at night. Book online as it is much easier. Make sure you go downstairs and stand on the glass tiles!

We stayed less than 5 minutes on the line to buy tickets but we came earlier than most people so that wasn't a problem for sure.View from CN tower is amazing but around 11pm the sky deck gets too crowded getting really hard to move there. Another reason to tell you, if you're going to Toronto you must be...
You cant come to Toronto and not go to the CN tower. I took the edgewalk and it was very cool. Highly recommended

Don't bother even going to Toronto. It's a mediocre me-too architectural pastiche. What it calls "multiculturalism" means everybody speaks English. The CN Tower itself is a giant stick of concrete devoid of any style or function besides being a broadcast tower. You get a view over the lake (into nothingness) or back over the ugly city to more nothingness. Cold...

My husband and I were told that one of the things to see in Toronto was the CN Tower. The views ARE amazing. We went after dark - highly recommended. But, be prepared for lines, and more lines. I found the CN tower very nice. The elevators were very fast and showed a brilliant view of outside. The CN tower is a great tourist attraction as it is the biggest tower in Canada. I went to the very top floor on the sky floor and saw the whole city almost. On a clear day you can see Niagera falls and Rochester, NY.

Amazing views overlooking downtown toronto to go along with dinner. Food is a little over priced but is reasonable because it includes you ride up to the top of the 360 restaurant. Would recommend reserving a table next to the windows because that's the area that actually rotates as you eat.

Visited with a 10 year old and a 12 year old on a beautiful sunny Saturday. Line up was over an hour to get on the elevator. When we finally got to the observation deck the boys were amazed by the view. My suggestion would be to visit on a weekday if possible to avoid the long lines.

I've lived in the GTA for 37 years and have always wanted to go up the CN tower....I purchased the Toronto City pass, and made it a week of Toronto day trips for our vacation. This attraction is worth a visit for first-time Toronto tourists, especially if you've never been up in a tall observation tower before. Having family visiting from overseas, CN Tower was on top of their TO attractions list. The line to buy tickets was long but was moving at a good pace and it took as around 15 minutes to get to the tickets booth. But then we were told that line to the elevator is about another 40-45 minutes long. We decided...

Sometimes it is good to be a tourist where you live.In that spirit, I recommend doing dinner up the tower.The food is decent and not too overpriced for the quality. What you're really paying for is the view. And what a view it is.If you want to go to he tower, go for a meal. You get...

The CN Tower is of course one you must see when visiting Toronto.After security check and the bomb check (a machine blowing wind like being in a vacuumcleaner) you enter the building.TicketsThere are so many different tickets available that it is kinda confusing which one to buy. This is one my favourite places that high lights Toronto, as a kid watching this structure being built was a very special moment. Put Toronto on the map, we had the highest structure in the world. This experience was amazing. Its a must see in Toronto. The views were really great. Really recommend a visit.

Some people say that the dinner at the CN Tower is overpriced for what you get, but you must remember that if you buy a main entree or fixed meal, the ride up to the restaurant is free. Amazing view!We had a fair weather evening at the observation deck and could see form miles. Nice view of Toronto!

Last went to Toronto in 2008, it was April with fog and low cloud so a visit to that CN Tower was not an option. Really nice view up there on a clear day. We really enjoyed having dinner at the 360 degree restaurant; not because of the food, but the view. If you are going up there, you may as well pay a little more to relax in the restaurant and enjoy the view.

Figured this was a must do when visiting Toronto so we did and enjoyed the time spent here very well. We have visited at the CN Tower in Toronto many times when we have guests visiting us in Toronto. Would recommend everyone takes a high-speed elevator up the CN Tower to see those amazing views over Toronto. Well worth paying the extra $12 to go up to the Skypod to get an even higher up view. CN Tower stay to Toronto as Eiffel Tower to Paris: would you skip this if in town? On a sunny and clear sky day the view from up there is just breathtaking and since you are already here the 12.50 CAD they charge for the higher POD are well spent although you need to take a second elevator. Great place to take pictures, but the tickets are very overpriced. CN Tower is a 1 time visit attraction. Its great for visiting with family. I would love to do the CN Tower sky walk one day :)
I really enjoyed this attraction, it was a quick elevator ride up and the view was spectacular. We could see the full 360 view of Toronto and a little bit of the Centre Island.

Literally visited the CN Tower today and Wow! What a view. This tower was pretty freaking cool. It took some time to find parking around the location but once we did we had a great time.

I am from Chicago and have been up in the Sears Tower which is also incredible. As Toronto seems to me to be a smaller version of Chicago I really enjoyed the views. Although we couldn't see Niagra falls this day, we were told on a clear day you can actually seem them from the Tower. It was busy the...
A another must see. We enjoyed lunch in the revolving restaurant with spectacular views as we ate. The glass floor level was awesome!!

After spending about a half hour in the ticket lines and entrance lines, took the high speed elevator to the top, walked around getting many spectacular views fo the city below us. Well worth the wait in line and the high ticket price though.
Ate dinner at the 360 restaurant - worth every penny! Expensive, but you don't have to pay for a ticket to explore the CN Tower. A great experience!

One of the must do attractions in Toronto. The CN Tower Toronto is visible for miles around and even more impressive close up. If you are scared of heights you might want to reconsider. I hadn't been up in more than 20 years. The access is good. the views are spectacular on a clear day. There appears to be more information available regarding it's history.

It holds the Guinness book of record as per the plaque displayed. It is an experience to view the city from that height. since, my wife is scared of heights we did not go to the sky pad. Great view at night in the summer. I recommend going all the way to the top and look down over the Blue Jay stadium to see just how small people can look from that height. The glass floor is also pretty cool and worth the trip up. Take advantage of the city pass!
Very cool but kind of expensive, got in and up very quickly but it took a very very long time to get back down when we were done.

You line up for long time depends on what time do you go there? $35 for adult plus tax $4.55, almost $40, it's the most expensive admission fee I'd ever paid!! You can stay as long as you like but not much to stay long for. Sure, you can see whole view of the city but really nothing special? It's...
I find this attraction a little over priced. If you have an air miles card, use it as it will give you a small discount. I was pleased with the service and you can't beat the view.

There are 2 levels for viewing, the lower one is for base cost and the upper costs an additional fee. This is a very popular tourist venue and at night gives you a panoramic view of the lights of the city. Looked at the views from the CN a Tower. They were spectacular. The only problem were the queues to pay. Enjoyed my visit.

Fantastic views as far as Niagara! Great attraction for the whole family. Takes a couple of hours start to finish. Queues were short and served quickly.

Before visiting Toronto, we knew about the CN tower and have seen so many pictures of it. It was great to be able to visit the tower in person. The tickets aren't cheap, but the whole family enjoyed the experience. Might caution if you are extremely scared of heights.

Went up the tower on a beautiful sunny day - superb views and even saw a Blue Jays baseball game from above! This is my second visit since the early 90s, and it brought me some nice memories. The view is breathtaking especially of the lake and the city diminishes with all its skyline. A pre-purchased ticket was the best way to avoid the long wait.

The obligatory tourist visit!! its a must and does not disappoint. The glass floor is the highlight of a visit here. and of course, the view. Take enough time to enjoy these. For the brave of heart the outside walk is really exhilarating - worth the wait and the cost. DO IT!

Toronto in the jewel in Ontario's crown-ahem- the CN Tower is of course a world class tourist destination. It is like most things in downtown Toronto very expensive but justifiably worth it if you want a spectacular view of Toronto and the G.T.A. I would recommend buying your tickets in advance. I think the CN tower is a must for visitors to toronto. Allow time to go through security etc, as this can take a while. I skipped most of the queues as was heading for the 360 restaurant. Great views and loved looking through the glass doors. However, due to strong winds, was queuing over an hour just to take...
The iconic landmark is a must visit while in Toronto. It doesn't come cheap but you'll be rewarded with a 360 degree view from 342 meters or 342 meters straight down through the glass floor.

Book dinner in the tower, the price of the lift is included and you won't have to queue.Great views with no rush and you will be able to see Toronto without kids taking selfies getting in your way. The 2 or 3 course meal was excellent.
Did the CN Tower, glass floor photos and all...a unique experience full of panoramic views! This is one of best things to do, and all around the tower there are sights to see and visit.
A classic ! Impressive views of Town! Better to buy tickets before, so the waiting we'll be a lot less.
Fantastic view, great experience. A must do if you are visiting Toronto ,the only problem is the queing Make sure you buy the Skypod as an extra as the view is even better up there.
Such a spectacular view overlooking the Great Lake and the great city of Toronto! I don't know if I'd say the Skypod is worth the extra cost (nothing extra to do, you just go up ~100 feet higher).

Everything here was first class. We were anticipating an unpresidented view at dinner hour and we were not disappointed.Our waiter Billy was very good and friendly. It was my third time to the CN Tower, but first time by night, it was amazing! We were able to "see" the game at Rogers Center from up there and the light of the city, beautiful!!
Very entertaining visit. It was fun and educational. Kids loved it outside at the top. Drinks a small bit expensive but overall very good few hours spent here.

Visited it with the kids and we had a blast. Wow, an amazing 360 degrees view of the city, the glass floor was impressive, breathtaking and wild. We all had a blast. Long waiting lines on the weekend but definetly worth doing.
1st time to Toronto, and 1st time to the CN tower. Always heard about it, and finally got to see and enjoy it. Worth the visit! Would go again!
Cool experience, glass floor was wild (but scary). Tends to be VERY crowded though, almost an hour to get in on a Sunday!

We went to the top and had an almost 360 degree view of the city. It was amazing. We had a clear day and that was extremely important if you want to see the entire panorama. The floor below has a section with a glass floor that you get to see directly below you. You also have the opportunity to...
Although this attraction comes with a long wait in line it is worth it once you gets to the top. There is many things to see along the way to the top and it will be worth the wait.

If you do this, I suggest you buy the additional pod ticket for $12. If you don't (which I didn't), you only get a 180 degree view of the city as the restaurant takes up half and there's no entry unless you're eating in it.
Went on a Saturday afternoon and the wait was not bad. All the kids from age 6 to 17 enjoyed. The view is breathtaking! The cafe was not great and very overpriced...I would skip that.

Ate at 360, GREAT experience, MUST DO. Food just OK, not bad, not great, you're paying for the experience. Cost $35 adult and $25 for kids just to go up, this is free, with dinner. Do it for the experience.
Obviously the perfect view on the city and the lake, and the US and Niagara side on nice days! The tower itself is not an architecture wonder but it's part of the city skyline.

Want an experience ? The CN tower is the place, a must when you visit Toronto.. A little tip, Book in for lunch or dinner the price includes entry to the tower. We had dinner in the 180 Restaurant and found it a great experience! The views were spectacular with excellent service and a very high standard of food. The bill for the evening was not over the top and certainly worth the visit.
This tower was an awesome view from the top , excellent value well worth the time and funds to get in .

We arrived at the tower at 9am on a Friday in August & sailed right up to the top... barely a soul in sight, elevator all to ourselves! We also had the glass floor all to ourselves and wandered around freely looking at the sights way down below! We bought our tickets online (they were a bit cheaper) and didn't...

I'm a history guy and I enjoyed the learning lesson provide throughout the tour. Please keep in mind the $35 does not include a tour guide but I must also day it's not included.My wife and I visited it together and it burned about 1 1/2hr and a half of our day. The $35 is a base tour which...

I did the Edge Walk. It is a fantastic experience and well worth the price. The sky pod was great although the queue for the lift took quite a long time. It took time for me to stand of the glass floor, but you must give it a try. Its amazing. The CN Tower is a place not to miss

Our family of five almost skipped this attraction due to the ridiculously high ticket prices. Figuring we were't likely going to be back in Toronto any time soon, we decided to go. The views on an outdoor platform are stunning but the wire to stop people jumping is quite thick and close together When trying to photograph the view all you get is green criss cross. A must see for anyone visiting Toronto. The views are spectacular. A little bummed that I could not do the skywalk.... maybe next visit!

It was a wonderful visit. Besides the Edge Walk (who was totally amazing), the views from the Tower are unimaginable. Breathtaking ! Brilliant views, a very popular and crowded attraction here . There are high security checks , plentY of staff to guide you to the lift, in the lift, out of the lift etc. take a video of the lift journey (58 seconds to get to 346m) and lie down on the glass floor .

The view is good. There are so many tourists.The introduction is not very clear. The restaurant is good with nice view.???????????????????????????
If you're in TO, you (of course) have to get to the top of this tower. The views are pretty incredible. It was a little pricey, but a neat experience overall.

Seems to be the same experience I had when I was younger. Too many people, long waits to get up, and then a decent view of the city. It's something that our kids wanted to experience, and they all said they'd never want to go again. Very expensive if you don't have the Toronto CityPass.
The CN Tower epitomizes Canada - outgoing, forthcoming, exciting and exhilarating.Definitely worth a visit for everyone who goes to Toronto

I'm in Toronto a couple times a year and I try to visit the CN Tower at least once a year. It has so much information at the observatory. You will want to see this once, just so you have it covered as a must-see attraction in Toronto. The view of the city is indeed amazing. The cost however is insanely over the top.
Having a drink or a dinner in the evening on top of this tower is magical you can have a 360° view of the town, worth going there with your beloved ?

The view from up there is simply amazing. When the sky is blue you can see all the city and the sourroundings at 360°. An the glass floor is a thrill experience. I've been there at least 5/6 times, when I used to lived in this wonderful town.

a bit expensive but the view is definetly worth it. have been there in the 90´s, still the same. had fun.

If you are going to Toronto then no point to miss out CN Tower. Elevator will take you to the Restaurant in less then a Minute from where you can see Spectacular View of the City, Hold Enough Courage go for the Edge Walk... Its like once in a life Experience.

I was worried that this visit was overpriced - it certainly isn't cheap - but was definitely worth it. The lines were not bad at all, even though we were there after noon on an August weekday. my kid is still talking about the cn tower. can't beat the view. he loved the glass walk. go in morning, not very crowded.
Never forget my experience going up the tower and then the spectacular views from the top. When I went up 25,years ago it was the tallest building.

Get the citypass if you're going so you can get a bit of a discount. It was not very impressive to me honestly.
If visiting Toronto, on a SUNNY DAY do not miss this attraction! Even for an acrophobic like me standing on the GLASS FLOOR high above ........... was exciting!

Great visit nice view of all the city at night is amazing great restaurant, nice gift shop you can take amazing pictures of the city

Great wine list - very accessible - and our somm was highly knowledgeable (Michael I think?). All 3 entrées we tried were very good, two of them were vegetarian and not lacking anything for it. Dessert was great. Of course the location is sufficient draw, but the food stands up to the reputation and the wine even more so.
this CN tower is a landmark and a must do while in Toronto because of the views and the restaurant on site is great with amazing views as well.

If you are in Toronto, the CN tower cannot be left unrecognized. So on my visit I decided to pay it a visit. Some may feel the entrance fee is expensive but if money is not an issue- I suggest that you take advantage of it. I even went as far as taking a picture on the glass floor- I...

beautiful view worth the wait and money that you spend to go up into the observatory. restaurant has some great views and the food is great although getting a seat view is really hard so make reservations.
If you are visiting Toronto I would highly recommend a trip to the very top. I eat dinner with my family of 8 and the food and views were fantastic.
CN tower and the area around it with rogers centre is one of the main attractions in DT , day or night .

This is a must do if you are in the Toronto area. Ample Parking in the city so you don't have to walk far. Buy tickets online to save a few $$. It is amazing to see the City and beyond from that high up. Would highly recommend.

A must if you are in Toronto as it gives you a great view of the city and surroundings. However, it is expensive and the queues can be over an hour in the summer. The observation deck is high enough to afford excellent views, but you can pay another $12 and go to the observation pod. There is a glass...

Great views of the city if you go on a nice day. Recommend going earlier in the morning as 11am-5pm is the busiest time of day for crowds. We arrived around 930am and noticed that the line had gotten LONG for the attraction by the time we were done in the gift shop.The observation deck on the main level...
The observation deck of Cn tower has a phenomenal view of Toronto and Lake Ontario. The elevator is fantastic that has a wide window on the way up.

A little expensive compared to the other attractions within Toronto, and be ready for at least 30 min of queuing to get to the lift to take you up the CN tower, but views are spectacular once you are up there and glass floor gives good photo opportunities

CN Tower lives up to its name the surrounding area at the foot of the tower was clean and tidy the waterfall was great. The glass lift gave stunning views across the city and went up very quickly much to my relief as I hate heights. Got to top and the views are to die for wish we had booked...

Amazing view of the city, but very pricey. We were visiting with our teenage son and infant son. Long long lines, not great for younger children, however, it was air conditioned and very hot out. We paid the extra $12 to travel to the upper level and was very inaccessible with a stroller, wish I would have known, I would...

This is way overpriced, and they don't offer any of the typical discounts, but it's nonetheless worth it on a clear day. The elevator ride provides great views, and your ears WILL pop. Wonderful indoor and outdoor observation decks. Great views of the lake and waterfront. We were told that on especially clear days you can see the mist from...
Is expensive for what you can do at the top. Is a small place with a round 360 degrees to look at the city, long lines to enter to go to elevators, I visit on a friday and was crowded.

Driving in to Toronto you can't help but see the Tower. It's the 6th tallest free standing structure. Which was completed in 1976.Rest of the fascinating info can be found on Wiki.Que to get in was quick as we applied on line beforehand. Family of 5 with the Sky Pod tower is about $250 but as I'm not...
Great experience if you're visitng the city or even for a local. Do the skywalk if you can...I can't lol

On a clear day you cant see NF! The 360 view of the city is quite spectacular, especially over the lake. I don't know that paying the extra to go a little further up to look down was worth it, other than to say you've done it. Line ups were short on a week-day. So getting a front view for...

This is a must do activity, weather permitting! Located adjacent to the aquarium and Rogers Center (baseball stadium), the CN Tower provides awesome 360 degree views of Toronto and surrounding area. Tip #1: Go early in the day to avoid long lines. Tip #2: on the observation level, there is a restaurant that has the north & east facing views....

First - buy your ticket to the Skypod in advance and beat the queues! The ride up to the observation platform in the glass fronted lift is amazing. The views from there and from the skypod are spectacular.

Really enjoyed our trip up the tower - ended up doing it twice. Once with business colleagues and once with my wife. Both times, very little waiting time. Decided to go right up to the pod which is the highest point you can visit.Awesome view. You do really feel above it all when you're up the tower. Glass floor...

We were there during the first weekend of July and it was packed with people. There were super long lines and even with purchasing the tickets online, we still waited at least two hours in line to get to the top. Because of this, they encourage us to buy the tickets while waiting in line using their free wifi. After...

Absolutely awe Inspiring views. Slightly overpriced, and the washrooms at the top of the tower are not great, considering the attractions popularity and status. The glass floor is overrated. The SkyPod is worth visiting although again, its overpriced (an additional $8). Parking is very handy - underground and only a 4 minute walk.

It was my first time in Toronto and I had to see the CN Tower. I'm so glad I did. The price was a little high and the line was a little long but it was so well worth it. The elevator ride up was fast and had a great view of Toronto through the glass. When we arrived at...

If you've been on a tower before, this is really no different. In saying this, it's always good to get to the top of things and have a sticky beak at the city. The price is an average price for a tower admission, and the sky pod is an extra charge.
Too expensive compared to other world towers (nearly 40 dollars per person for a basic package)Too long waiting for both going up and down ...I spent more than 2 hours in a line :-(

you get an overall view of Toronto. But there are no signs telling you what you see (in Chicago Sears Tower it was like that). I would say do it because it is the thing to do as a tourist but it is not different to any other towers in the world.

We arrived around noon long wait in line then an additional wait in the queue for another hour and a half to get an elevator up. Suggest going early or late in the day. Was extremely hot that day and herded into a tight lineup didn't help. I would think twice about the value to go up - $35 is...

Visited the CN Tower with a group. We got there early (approx. 8:45 AM) which was a great time to get there since it wasn't crowded. The ride up to the observation tower was quick. The views of Toronot from the observation tower were fantastic (the weather was nice when we were there)!
One of Toronto's main tourist destinations and not likely to be like anything else you have every been to.

Unfortunately it was very rainy when we went to the CN Tower, so the view was not very far. However, a very interesting and amazing experience. The glass floor is extreme. Dare you? I did, and it felt really strange, to see down over 500m. When visiting Toronto, this is one must do!
Expect a long line up to at least 2 hours, then only to experience the whole tower for 15 mins. It's a nice view though of the entire city

You might think that going to this tower will be as any other high tower as in any other country, great looking of the city and that is it. Well, let me tell you that it is not! First, it has a big section of glass floor , where you can walk and lay down to take a picture, it...
I am glad we went.I wouldn't go again. Once you have seen it you have seen it.It is a spectacular view and an impressive structure.Over priced considering the amount of people in it at one time.

Very very high :) As you can expect the view is gorgeous ! I recommend it to everyone who visit Toronto or surroundings. Skypod is worth extra $ and extra waiting time but they could install additional elevators ;)

We had a short queue but would suggest you either go early or late afternoon to avoid crowds .it is quite pricey to get in plus they try to get you to add on two extras skywalk and crown top but no need too .We had a great ride up and views are amazing across whole of city and...

When you go to Toronto first time CN Tower is a "must be" visited. But not for next time for me... Once is enough for several years ))Impressive height, amazing view of the city and lake. Nothing else special. I expected a little bit more.We were there with 3 children and paid 200 loonies for going up and...

After coming from New York and going to "Top of the rock" and "Empire State Building" the CN tower was disappointing. The outside is covered in wire for safety purposes, but they could have done it a better way to have un-obstructed views like in New York. It was also more expensive than New York which was shocking because the...

A very unique and must try for everyone. The best part is standing outside at the deck and watching the city at night. We even ate at the revolving restaurant and the food was delicious although pricey but we were able to visit the deck for free since we bought meals at the restaurant. The glass view is breathtaking once...

In the CN Tower you can see forever seems like. Went up in the elevator and made it to the top and just realized what beauty lies at the top. You can saw all across the lake that looks like a ocean. If you have not been you need to.

We took our son for lunch at the 360 restaurant atop the CN Tower for his 7th birthday. It was indeed memorable for him! We walked over to the observation deck afterwards and enjoyed more of Toronto. I recommend having lunch/dinner at the restaurant to skip the long lines of people just going on observation deck. Much worth the price!
Great views, and information on the tower. Enjoyed the glass floor and our visit to the Sky Pod (additional charge)

You can't go to Toronto without going up the excellent CN tower! Best to go after you have been there a few days and then you will recognise places you've seen on the ground. Not too much waiting time, excellent helpful staff! An essential part of this wonderful, vibrant city!

A must see place if visiting Toronto. Minimal queuing means that you quickly board a lift/elevator to the top. They travel fast and I believe it takes around a minute to climb to the observation deck. The views are great!

CN Tower stands over half a kilometer high. A symbol of Canada. One of the World's tallest buildings, it serves as communications and observation tower. It costs $35. admission. The tower has a very good restaurant.

The CN Tower is a must see if you go to Toronto. The views are awesome. It is worth the extra to go up to the sky pod to go upto the higher viewing area. Try and go later in the day so you can have a daylight and a night time view. We ended up eating at Horizons Restaurant....

It was a little pricy, but it was worth it. If you are visiting Toronto, the CN Tower is a must! The view is spectacular! You can see far out over the lake, and it also provides an amazing view of the city's gorgeous skyline. It wasn't very crowded because they regulate how many people can go up at a...

Yes it is expensive but you are only alive once . You need to do this to experience one of the wonders of the modern world. Just beware of the tourists .There is a glass floor you can find under the bundle of tourists laying on it
Go early because it get crazy crowed, beautiful views. I did the lunch for $55 on a perfect day. $35 just for the ride up, so do the lunch at 11AM

My husband and I visited the CN tower during our trip to Toronto. The lines were long, but the flow was steady and we were up in the tower in about 20-30 minutes. The views were spectacular! Although there were a lot of people we were able to pick a spot and see the entire city!

We visited on a cloudy day around sunset, but the views were restricted due to the weather. There wasn't much information at the top compared with other large buildings, the Empire State for example. However, the money $42Can per adult was worth it for the night view. The tower lights up in different colours and is particularly impressive from outside.
The evening view is amazing. Go there when the sun is about to set. Worth the trip up and going outside. Didn't make it to the very top or to walk the outside but next time most definitely will.

This is a must for Toronto visitors and is worth the ticket price, but cost us $35 each and then $12 each to visit 'The Pod'.Amazing views of the whole city. We ate at Horizons restaurant, rather than the rotating one at the very top. Good service and reasonable prices, though not a varied menu- there was something we...
CN Tower is one of the tallest towers in the world! "CN" stands for "Canadian National" - the railway company, which built it. A MUST-SEE site to visit in Toronto!

If you are visiting Toronto, it is worthwhile to go to the top of the CN Tower. However, I have been at better observatories. It would be nice if there were unobstructed outdoor views for better photos.We bought our tix online the day before, which saved us from at least one line.
I do not like heights and we came for a corporate dinner. Good food - I sat on the inside! Good views.I recommend the effort.

Definitely buy the Costco city pass !!! Makes this and other attractions more affordable !The CN tower was not crowded at 11 on Friday which was nice as I had read about long lines and such. It was a rainy day but we still had good visibility. We did not eat at 360. You could see a great distance...

Everyone needs to visit the CN Tower at least once!. You can go to the large observation deck or pay a little extra and also go to the higher skypod observation deck which is a thrill. I visited both and felt it was worth the money; mind you I like heights. The larger deck has two levels with outdoor 365degree...

Great view. The glass floor was pretty cool, but some of it was scratched up pretty bad and there were lots of kids laying on the floor. Watching the folks lean off the tower was pretty neat too. Worth the visit.

A really well run tourist attraction.Easy to book tickets on line in the UK. Top tip, get there early and beat the lines, don't forget some i.d. And the card you booked with.The trip up in the lift is quick and exciting, the view form the top impressive and the glass floors not for those afraid of heights....
Awesome visit with a view of GTA 360 degrees with our lunch which followed. Book online for reservation to avoid the line up.

If you've seen one high view of a city, you've seen them all. Pretty pricey for a look around. The Skywalk is also pricey. Of course, you get let out in the gift shop. Also, cheesy picture takers in the beginning, just say no and they let you walk past. They do warn you of restricted visibility before you buy...
We went up to see the city through the CN Tower. It was a beautiful way to capture the scenic views.

It's a great view, but a long wait. We were there this August and waited over an hour in line for a 30 minute experience. The glass floors are small and not nearly as good as the ones at the Willis Tower (Sears Tower).
Consider having lunch or diner.....the price is a bit more and you can enjoy seeing the city with the revolving restaurant. Lunch was great!

The CN Tower is visible for many Km around Toronto and conversely from the Tower Observation Deck one can see an amazing distance. If one is keen, you can stand on the glsss floor and look straight down to ground level. For the really keen it is possible to do the extrrnal tethered walk. The tower is a must see...
Its hard to tell as new towers keep popping up all over the world. It certainly has a great view of Toronto, but its only worth visiting just once

Experience was ok...but nothing much to do when your up..just the exciting part was the glass floor then after that everything just ok

Get there early so that you don't have long lines and busy crowds. It is definitely a must do once, but if you have been up in a tall building before, it will feel like you've already done this before. The glass floor is pretty cool, although a bit of vertigo could set it. All in all I would say...
An amazing view, and free to see when you go to the 360 restaurant. Very worth while! The restaurant and view made for one of the best evenings we have ever had together.
A great experience that can seldom if ever be repeated. Don't second guess, just do it. Go to Attractions Ontario's Web site for a discount coupon.

Yes, I've been a dozen times, but when you have out of owners, it's always on their "must do" list. The 2 men did the edge walk while the 2 girls watched from the TV screens. Exciting for all of us. Worth a visit, but the glass floor was about 10sq feet so we had to wait awhile before we could squeeze in. Definitely worth the trip, but glass floor not a must.

CN Tower was one the few places we managed to visit. It was a must do since we were right there .It was an awesome view ! My 3 teens enjoyed that part but that was only about 10-15 min of our visit.The time we spent a ton of time standing in line to get on elevators going...

Great view, especially as it went from day to night. Do yourself a favor and dine at the restaurant. You won't have to pay for going up in the tower (as long as you purchase something in the restaurant) and the quality and prices of the food are well worth it.
Excellent adventure overlooking Toronto. A must see. Love the clear glass floors at the top. Worth the admin fee.

We purchased our tickets in advance on the Hop On Hop Off Bus to get a 5% discount. It was not until we arrived at the CN Tower that we learned about the combo deal.....free trip up if you dine at the 360 Restaurant. Once on the Look Out level, where the restaurant is located, we looked at the menu...

Great place to have dinner.. Make sure you arrive one hour before sunset so you can see the City of Toronto in all its beauty. The food is good (I honestly can't say it's spectacular), and the service is generally great. It won't disappoint. I return time and time again simply to enjoy the sunset.

Booked a table for two for 8.45pm in the revolving restaurant at the top of the CN Tower. Probably a tourist trap I thought. However the whole evening was magical and a total surprise. The views are truly fantastic and you are able to view the whole city at least twice during your meal - the city at night looks...

A trip up the CN Tower is a to-do list requirement. There are two prices, pay extra if you want to go to the highest observation level called SkyPod. The view is dizzying, walking on a glass floor may be difficult for some. The restaurant was OK, but sitting down and enjoying the view made it worth it. There is...
Amazing city view and Toronto symbol.A short elevator time and u will be on the top of the city and overlook it.The price is a bit high and long line on vacations.
Once again, it's a few years since we were in Toronto but we loved everything about it.If you're visiting Toronto you just have to do this attraction it's a must!Planning to go back in 2016.

the best way to see it is to eat at the 360 restaurant in the tower - that way you get free access to the building and all of its decks, AND bypass a line to the tower that can be really huge. food was absolutely great, we didn't expect it as we thought the restaurant sells its location and...

So this may not be a great review because I didn't actually go up into the tower. On a recent visit we wanted to but the line to tickets and get in was at 3 hours. It's a super cool structure and it may be worth it but while on a short vacation we didn't want to spend all that...

We turned around the moment we saw the prices at the ticket booth. 35$ per person is too much just to go up an observation deck and that's not even the highest one! For that, you have to pay extra for the "skypod" (I think that is how it is called). Understanding this is an important landmark and canadian icon,...

The CN tower is a great attraction for Toronto. The elevator ride alone is worth the admission price. When you get to the top you can see some pretty impressive views if the day is clear. But if you really want to view the city... do the Edge Walk. This is where you get into a jump suite and helmut...
Not for the faint hearted, but this is one of the few places on earth that you can look down on the roofs of skyscapers. Take the lift and be amazed.

We booked lunch at the tower restaurant and for a 3 course ala carte meal it costs $75 with soft drinks.
