A great experience , wot a view , would recommend a trip to the CN Tower on any visit to Toronto , and also the Blue Jays

One of the places I would recommend going while you are in Toronto, Views from the top are awesome.The extra 12 bucks for the skypod are not worth it, if you are short on budget skip it !!The restaurant on the top is on expensive side, you do get burgers and sandwiches outside of that restaurant.Go Enjoy...
Nice view of the city, one of the greatest tourist attraction. I would suggest to purchase city pass to get the discount.
Been to the top of the Sears Tower, John Hancock and Empire State Building - this was nice because the city is beautiful - but the building itself is a little anticlimactic.

Admittedly, the CN Tower is a tourist trap, but it's a nessessary tourist trap. You can see the tower from just about anywhere in the city, so why not try to see the city from the tower. The weird thing for us was that the cashier said it would be a 90min wait to the elevators, but it really only...

I would highly recommend eating dinner at the tower. We arrived at dusk, so we were able to make one rotation in daylight and one at night. The view is drop dead gorgeous!The prix fixe at dinner is only slightly more than the regular admission. The restaurant is classy, and food is surprisingly good!

Visiting Toronto and not going to the top of the CN Tower, would be an opportunity lost. This iconic building provides the most spectacular views across the city and lake Ontario. Completed about 40 years ago, it is as modern as tomorrow and is not likely to be surpassed by any other attraction in Toronto. While is not a cheap...

Went to this evening out, extremely disapointed with the meal ,two entrees of salad! The steak, was so tough could not chew it, dessert well, skip that, and the waiter whinged when we asked for more milk, very sad, the view was good,

CN tower was the tallest building in the world in the 70's. It is still breathtaking and amazing. You have to pay $35 per person to go up the viewing floor. The view from top is amazing and very pleasing. It is worth the money and long wait.

We didn't think about the long lines of people when planning our trip to the tower. While the lines did move fairly quickly, they were very long and snaked in and out and around of so many obstacles. Views were pretty good. We were given tickets otherwise I would have been upset spending $70 for the two of us to...
The kids loved it and it was an overall good experience.Once the tallest building in the world for almost a decade!
If you're ever near Toronto, you need to go up in the CN Tower. Unique perspective from this height to enjoy the Toronto area. The glass floor is fun, especially for the younger folks.

The CN Tower is quite close to the Ripley Aquarium so we went up for the view and a casual lunch, not the more expensive dining area. The service was very good in the cafe and the view itself at that level was well worth the visit.
Great view of Toronto if you go on a sunny day. It's worth the extra fee to experience the SkyPod. There was also a movie included on the history of Toronto streetcars, which was excellent.

A great view from very high up. The glass floor is very cool. They also have a tour that goes outside the tower to get a truly birds eye view (I did not take that tour). It is definitely worth the time and money. It can get crowded so go early and if you want the outside experience call early...
Not worth you time or moneyIt's a tourist trap as far as I see it. Not worth it at all Look at it from a far

It's an alright view from the top, but once you've seen a view of the city you've seen most of them (barring amazing landscapes or structures). When travelling to Toronto, this is definitely a must see - and for those adrenaline junkies, check out the Edge Walk. I'm afraid of heights so I passed, but my husband did it and loved it. As a spectator, it was great that you can watch everyone outside on multiple TV screens from the observation deck. There's no better way...

Visiting The Tower is a must do. If you are new to Toronto, just visiting or even been in the city a lifetime but never got around to checking it out - it is WORTH a look.Not only is the view spectacular, the restaurant I thought would be overpriced with underwhelming food was DELISH! I live in Toronto and see the CN Tower everyday, but haven't been up it in years. Has some family in town for a short visit, so we took them to the rotating restaurant and it was amazing. Given the rotation of part of the restaurant if gives you a 360 degree view of Toronto. Food was a little expensive...
Went during a long weekend in peak season, long line up waits for tickets,elevators up and down. Expensive for what it is, but worth a look.
It is definitely worth the elevator ride to the top and to eat at the restaurant is fabulous. It can be romantic and adventurous.
While visiting the CN Tower, we also patronized the 360 Restaurant. I would suggest you do the same. Both experiences we great!

So excited to finally get this opportunity. The scariest part of the adventure was the elevator which rapidly zoomed up to the top. I was terrified to look down. Once we reached the top, everything seemed normal (to me). There was a huge crowd of people so we waited our turn to stand on the 'looking down' glass. Outside, the...

So glad we went as the views from the tower are absolutely amazing. As someone who is terribly afraid of heights I was not particularly interested in going here, especially on the windy day we went. I was really surprised at how safe I felt while there. We didn't have to wait long to get up or down and the...

Went to the CN Tower during a break while in Toronto on business. It's a little expensive, but certainly an experience that is difficult to replicate anywhere else. The glass floor is really the highlight, but the observation level and the outdoor section are worthwhile as well. I would skip the restaurant.
We were looking forward to visiting the Tower and really enjoyed it. There were a few queues and it was very busy, but everyone moved along nicely. Well worth a visit if you are in the area.
Great view of the city from the top. Paid the extra to go to the very top which was definitely worth it. Staff are very friendly and well organised. It's a must go if you visit Toronto.

I don't think paying extra to go all the way up is worth it BUT going up the tower definitely is. It is as semi cloudy when went so we couldn't see Toronto island which was a bummer but the views of Toronto put things in perspective. I had no idea how big Toronto was until going up the tower....

The CN Tower restaurant is the best value in Toronto. When you make reservations at the restaurant you pay $55 to go up the CN Tower and be treated as royalty at the restaurant. It costs $35 to go up the Tower for the view. We paid $55 and you get to skip the lineups, your own elevator and a...
Efficient device, the views were incredible, lovely staff, scary glass floor and the only elevator only took 58 seconds!!!

If you like heights this is the place. Have not done the walk and will not. LolWorth the time.Have not tried the restaurant; heard it was overpriced.The Laser tag was a good experience with my kids also.
Wait for hours on the tower for the sunset, from 6-9pm, but the weather is not perfect. However, still got lots of amazing photos. The restaurant is reservation based, reserve advance before visit.
I know it is not cheep, but the views!! Best way to do it is with a meal, which gets you access to all levels

The view from the top is amazing, but it is very expensive. We would not have done this if it was not included in the Toronto City Pass. We were quoted a 75 min wait, but we were on the elevator within 25 min. If you eat in the restaurant, the ride is free. I think the best time would...

Wonderful observation deck, but also a beautiful monument which can be seen throughout Toronto (and even by air). In the day it overlooks gardens, the Toronto Railway Museum, and the Rogers stadium. By night it transforms into a nonstop light show with different colored beams of light going up and down it's length and coordinating with the ever-changing colors of...

I have wanted to go up the CN Tower for many years but my wife is afraid of heights and would never go up with me. We went to visit our son and daughter in law and mentioned that I would like to go so Ziria said she would go with me while my son stayed with my wife. It...

And any occasion will do just fine...just remember to make your restaurant reservation well ahead of time. This will keep you out of the long lines and get you to the top in fine fashion.Personally, without including the restaurant, the tower becomes a 3-star attraction...very "touristy" and a view encumbered by safety fencing.But in the restaurant, the view...

We visited the CN Tower with our 3 children (15, 12, and 10) on a Thursday afternoon during a vacation to Toronto timed during the Pan-Am games. It is a great view of the city for sure but definitely not worth the $175 we paid for the 1 minute elevator ride up and the 15 minutes looking out the windows...
was a great experience but lines were too long. we paid for the full experience but didn't get past the main lookoff because the lines were over an hour long to advance higher

LED Lighting gives the CN Tower enormous opportunities to celebrate different events (e.g., PAN AM Games). Enhanced tourist photo opportunities and traditional draws (e.g., Glass Floor) make for a fun visit.
What a beautiful view, over an incredible sky line. On a clear day you can see right to Buffalo. You have to do it, I would also pay for the SkyPod it has the best views!

We've been up the Empire State and the Burj Khalifa and now the CN Tower. The view from up there is pretty spectacular on a clear day so it's worth a look.The only problem with these spectacularly tall buildings is that once you're up and have walked round at the top then that's it. I mean, if you're in Toronto for a visit, you just have to do this tower. Sure the trip up is a little expensive, but it's fun and the view of the city from this altitude is amazing. Whilst this is one of those things you have to do when in Toronto, it was quite pricey just to ride to the top. The better view of the city is from Toronto Island...

I loved my visit at the CN tower.The wait was about an hour but I guess thats normal for the very touristic attractions.We payed extra to go to the higher level as well as the normal level. The higher level is really worth it because there is less people so you get to enjoy the view way more...
A must see if you visit Toronto and take the trip to the top to see the spectacular view of the city.

The last time I was here was 16 years ago when my son was in diapers and we made a pact to return before I was in them? we live an hour away always in Toronto just doing other things.It helps to go early or late during tourist season and of course plan on a clear day. I suggest...
Seen it once you've seen it a dozen times. It was busy, crowded and really - nothing to do once you got to the top. Not worth the money after seeing it once.

Views were spectacular , but when you see one tower you have seen them all. Very similar to the Skylon in Niagara, although this one had the glass floor. We went up to the skypod which for the extra price was not worth the ride.
This is a unique attraction that should not be missed. This being said - be prepared to live with dirty windows if you visit at the end of the day like we did. Sunset is a bonus, though. Awesome.

At 1,815 feet tall, the tower held the record for the world's tallest freestanding structure from 1975-2007. Even though it's since been passed in the record book, it's still impressive to experience. If you're planning to do it, buy your tickets online in advance. It's cheaper and you'll save yourself from having to wait in the ticket line. I've also...

I went and checked out the tower on my second day in Toronto. I thought it would be a great way to see the city but was really disappointed. After doing towers all over the world this was the poorest of all of them. The view is only on one side from the viewing point. Then you go downstairs and...
First time I'd been up the CN Tower in years and brought a few first timers along, the glass floor is really cool.People are complaining about the wait...well, get up early and beat the queues!
This attraction is constantly busy but very well run. Our family got us a city pass which avoided the lines. Magnificent views of Toronto and beyond. Worth a visit

The CN Tower is Toronto's highlight attraction. The best view you can get from the CN Tower is when the blue jays dome is open and there is a game on.It's nice to see Toronto in all directions as you walk around the Tower.If you are a first time visitor to Toronto I'd recommend it. You can take...

Absolutely amazing experience, worth every penny, the views are just stunning and also having this being our first visit to Canada, this is definitely something we planned to do as it was recommended by friends, you have to do it!! the glass floor is quite scary to walk on but honestly, when you are up there, it's just incredible, Yes...

We were in town for 48 hours, and while the view from the top is interesting, it doesn't compare to views offered by similar attractions in other major cities. It isn't cheap either.Add the fact that you have to line up to buy tickets, line up again to go up, and line up to go down... you will spend...

All the reviews we read about the CN tower mentioned the long waits. But we arrived on a Sunday morning just as they were opening and there were no lines at all. We spent the extra $12 to go to the highest level, the SkyPod, it was definitely worth it. The views are spectacular, although I wish there had been...

I've been up the CN tower twice before, and I could go up again tomorrow. This time I brought my family (wife and kids 10, 11 and 14) and they all loved the experience and the beautiful views. We ate supper at the Horizons restaurant and found it delicious and only a little more expensive that going to an earthbound...

Great place to visit but the queue's can be horrendous. Book a table for dinner around 7pm to 8pm in the summer and you can fast track entrance and enter the Tower for free. The views are fantastic and at this time you get the sunset. Dinner is good value and the food is excellent.

Visited the Tower today. The view from the top is great and scenic. The C N Tower may not be as high as the Burj Khalifa in Dubai but the view here is certainly better because Toronto is a well developed city of many skyscrapers and a vast expanse of Lake Ontario. from the Burj Khalifa one can see the...

Great views, of course, but pricey to get up, and it took an hour or so of queuing and various security checks to even get to the top. Make sure you allow time. Had to queue for ages for the lift back down too. But great views from the top, and the glass floor section is pretty cool.

The lengthy wait to get to the view really ruined it for me. We hit CN at a bad time and the wait was an hour and a half. Our spirits weren't helped any by the total lack of queuing management. After a while, you want to throttle the next person some clueless employee lets jump the line. After an...
Great views. Lines were a bit long because it was right after the Blue Jays game but it moved pretty well.

It was great. The extra cost for lunch up at the tower was worth every penny! 1) you don't have to wait in any lines (and those lines get long!), 2) food was great!, 3) best view (the view downstairs is great too if you like unwashed, handprinted windows), 4) can see the entire 360 view in 72 minutes, and...

A tourist place in its finest.Must see for visitors or those of us living here.You do need to carry alot of cash and a lot of patienceThis is of course part of the experience and it must be done fully . Is not a disappointment.

We arrived at the CN tower outside of 'crowded hours' but were disappointed to know there was an hour and half waiting to get to the elevator to go up. With children and a bad hip, we opted for the 'premiere' package that costs a heaping 89$ per person regrdless of age and no discounts available for this ticket. This...
Amazing views from this Canadian landmark. The lineups were long, but moved along steady......worth the price. Early mornings or evenings may be better to avoid the mid-day crowds.
Worthy of a visit, unless you don't like heights. For me, it was worth the visit; however, I was pretty unsettled throughout my visit because I don''t like heights.

This is not to be missed! Awesome views of the city, especially on a sunny day. It can become crowded so to avoid the queues, definitely buy tickets beforehand. We had lunch in the revolving restaurant which was also lovely so could jump queues.

We booked online to go to the C.N tower to go to the 360° restaurant, it was fab, the views and service was great. When booking i had requested a window seat as it was our honeymoon, they asked if we would mind giving them 10minutes so they could give us a window seat, which was appreciated. People say the...
fantastic views, especially going right to the top, worth every penny, just make sure you have a clear day to enjoy the experience, shame you have to pay extra for the top view but still worth it.

Some really fantastic views from up here. Had a restaurant on the top which was fully booked for a function. The lift only takes a few seconds to reach the top as the a very fast. You can see the top of the aquarium and also the baseball game.

CN Tower has amazing views from all three decks. The main deck has a good restaurant with amazing views. The lower level (one flight down, where the down elevators leave from) has a small glass floor section. The highest level, SkyPod, is fed by a single small elevator and has the best views. Lines at CN Tower can get long...

Toronto is a nice cosmopolitan city. You can feel the Asian influence in its energy and cuisine. The CN Tower is next to the Rogers Centre. It has a walk on the edge which we didn't do and great views of the city

We went there around mid day. We had to queue for about 15 minutes to get a ticket. On arrival at the booth the attendant advised that there was a 90 minute queue. We declined. The queue time should be displayed at the entrance which would mean people who do not want to waste 90 minutes would not have to...

Just couldn't agree to do skywalk on the outdoors of tower otherwise it's a great 2-3 hours taking in sky high views. We had lunch at top and it was good.. a little pricy to be expected. The glass floor walk indoors certainly gives you a good (stomach turn) idea of how high up you are. Worth a trip.
1168ft stood on the edge of a very scary 5ft wide grated metal platform. Then you're encouraged to just lean out! Wow what a view

The view is great and a 'must see' for Toronto provided you put the price... Incredible views, so good to be honest that here is nothing I could say to bring this place down.It is too crowded for sure, it is too expensive yes, there is no audio guide like there is in say.. Calgary Tower... but the views really do wash away all those negative thungs.Try to go when there is a...

REALLY NEEDS UPDATING LIKE... CMON.the carpets ...are so old. with all that money please please use it to update the place.Also if youre going just get the CITYPASS instead so atleast you can go to the other places, just CN tower for 30 something isnt worth it.
It was nice trip. But nothing special.Go early to avoid the big queues especially at lunchtime onwards
Great view--worth the wait. Make sure to sit near the window.Food is ordinary, but that is not why you go.

We knew this was a Toronto "must do" so we took the best option and reserved at the 360 Restaurant. (That review- food, service etc. is separate). As far as waiting in the regular/non-dining line, the restaurant was DEFINITELY the better option. That line was VERY long and was moving extremely slowly. THEN the line to get down is ALSO...
I am not to good with heights, but I couldn't go all the way to Canada without a trip up the CN Tower. The views are just spectacular.

My teenager went with me and we both had a blast. No need to worry about your safety. They use very sturdy harnesses and you are checked at least 10 times by 4 or 5 different people. A little scary at first, but after a few minutes you will feel comfortable. Can't take hays, ear rings, or anything that might...

I thin the management should be precuted for the high prices and the way they are ting to squeeze money out of you. i had a very well prepared and lovely dinner with a fabulous view. Staff were very friendly even taking photos of us. It was definitely worth the visit.

CN Tower is one of the main attraction downtown Toronto for tourists (and residents). Went with colleagues up to the restaurant / roof to overlook Toronto and the surrondings. Loved walking on the glass window showing the bottom of the tower.A must do with family and kids even if the price is a bid expensive.

Friendly staff, short lines, great view. Look, this is a tourist trap stop that everyone does. Its a really tall building with a great view. If the lines are short and it is not crowded it is worth your time. If I would have waited more than 30 minutes to do it and then fought crowds for window space, I...

It does not matter how many times I've seen it and how much I enjoyed these visits. So, technology has advanced over the years: buy your tickets on-line. It is safe and easy, and enables...
We did not go inside or up in the tower, but this beautiful landmark is visible all over Toronto and is wonderful to see and photograph from just about anywhere.

It does worth a visit for the spectacular view on Toronto.But the ques are terrible, about 1-1.5 hours, therefore an online booking should be doneThe cost is about 35 CAD per person for the first dock and a few more to climb a bit higher.The access is done through external elevators with parts of glass floor and...

If this is your first time to Toronto, recommend trying to go up the CN Tower early in your trip as it provides a great overview of the city's layout and major areas.Lines can be long during certain times of the day - enjoy the atmosphere nonetheless.
Security is overwhelmed, but it's a good thing. No accidents there. I went there for the sunset and enjoyed the beautiful view!

I enjoyed everything; the food was divine, service was unbeatable and really, how do you top a moving skyline seat? I would recommend this to any tourists - it costs $30 to go up, so add a meal on for $40 extra!! Ridiculously good.
The views and glass floor make the queues worthwhile. Save a bit of time by buying tickets on line. It is amazing to look down into the baseball ground and 100 miles or more across Ontario.

Definitely worth the visit and this is from someone who's been to the Burj Khalifa.The skypod was a very nice addition for a even higher view. The best part about the CN tower was eating a meal with views of the city. You could spend more time looking out at the city and it was a fantastic experience - something like never before. After the meal in the 360 restaurant you can go up to the viewing tower with the glass floor, thus skipping the normal...

I don't like heights so the CN tower wasn't great for me. They...

Wait was long, but worth it. Very expensive. Make sure the weather is clear when you go. Buy your tickets online and go right in. The line outside is to get tickets. There are snacks and a restaurant on top.
Toronto is a beautiful city and you will agree with me as soon as you are at the top of the CN Tower. It is a must do if you are going to Toronto!

We recently visited Toronto and included in our itinerary was a visit to the CN tower. The Toronto skyline is particularly spectacular so we had great expectations of the tower itself. The views were amazing but we were somewhat disappointed that at least 50% of the public area in the pod was taken up by the restaurant. We had thought...

The place is located and the heart of Toronto blow it there is no please believe it or not centre the place is very tall you have to go and left and take you on the top of the tower the floor was built with glass and as you stand on the glass you feel betfair.com looking at the bottom...
I loved it, the view of the entire city is breathtaking, it is totally worth visiting! Pay a little bit more and go to the skypod.

One of my favourite place is the CN Tower. It is amazingly attractive and visible from any part of Downtown Toronto!! And I have hundreds of pictures taken directly or as reflections from the surrounding buildings.! The ticket queue was fairly quick but the wait to get in the lift was longer. I hate to have to write such a poor review about a beloved Toronto attraction. On my the last day of my visit to Toronto, I had to choose to go either to Ripley's Aquarium or the CN Tower. I chose wrong. It was a looooong line for an elevator trip to observation deck. Once there, it was underwhelming. Honestly,...
A good view - but a long wait in the queue. The whole experience could do with a bit of a refresh. But it's got to be done when in Toronto.
Fantastic views and that glass floor Brilliant go early to avoid the crowds.make sure you go to the sky pod
It is a real uniqe experienct to be at a hight that tower. Good service, nice atraction. You might find it crowded at dayligh, try it at night.
The CN tower is a must do in Toronto but it is essential to pay the extra few dollars to go to the sky pod as the views there are better although the wait for the elevator can be frustrating.
Great view, especially at night. It was only irritating that it was sooo focused on making money with the tourists. But definitely worth going.

We went to the CN Tower in the evening. Unfortunately the Blue Jays game was on at the same time so the traffic was a mess, but we found parking ($20) ouch. the line to the elevator was not long and soon we made it to the top. The views are very nice and the kids really enjoyed the glass...

We did the Edge Walk and had so much fun with it. We did the 8pm walk and there was a beautiful sunset and the Blue Jays were playing so we got to look down into the stadium....very cool. Best views of the city.Would do it again and recommend it to others.

This is the place to get your bearings of Toronto. We went on a clear day so views were great, although we should have gone right to the topmost part of the tower. The glass bottom view was really good and a little scary.

Me I hate heights. So when I looked at this from ground level I thought NO WAY am I going up there, it did not help seeing the lift ascending through glass windows.But my brother-in-law had booked for us to have lunch there also, so no escape.The lift ride was good although against the side I could see...
Amazing view of Toronto. Could see the preparations for the blue jays game at the Rogers centre, pretty awesome. Glass floor was cool and scary. Lot of waiting in line though!

Now im afraid of hieghts BUT strangely enough the CN Tower cured that in what swoop.I am SO pleased that I did it. the lift gets you to the top in super fast speed, and somehow ehen you step out you dont realise that you on top of the tallest free standing building in the world, you feel more...

Fab few hours spent here. Would definitely recommend going up to the pod as the views were spectacular.Plan to spend a few hours there.Food was quiet pricy but we didn't eat there.Amazing views. Maybe go just before sunset so you can see it during the day and night.

This is a good attraction to try if you have never been in the CN Tower before. I was up in it as a child and teenager, and took my 15 year old daughter in it recently. For first time visitors, it is a memorable experience. I will say it was overpriced for what you get. An interesting part of...

Well worth the big lines because the views are spectacular. You can go to different levels depending if you pay extra to go to the pod level. You can even dine in, but I would recommend bring your own refreshments. Buy your tickets online to avoid the long lines to buy tickets because the lines during peak times are extremely...

I recently visited Toronto for the first time and made sure to add the CN Tower to my itinerary. Like the Space Needle, the Sears Tower, and the Empire State Building, the CN Tower is a North American icon. While the structure itself is very impressive, I ultimately felt that the CN Tower Experience was overpriced and a bit of...

Wasn't sure the price was worth it but we went up anyway. Fantastic view of Lake Ontario and the city. That is all. Still not sure if it was worth the money but if the weather is clear and you want the best vantage point then go.

My husband and I went with our 3 sons ages 15, 13, and 8. We arrived around noon and pretty much walked in. We had to wait in line briefly for the elevator but wasn't too long.It was a beautiful sunny day and we could see for a long way off. It's very impressive.We paid the extra $12...

If you really want to enjoy a great view from above, book a table at the 360 restaurant. When ordering a 3-course-menu the elevator ride is complimentary. The view from the visitors platform is rather disappointing. You can't see clearly through the net or the dirty windows, no chance to take great pictures.
A beautiful view of Toronto, Lake Ontario and Toronto Island. The Tower offers other attractions, but unfortunately way too expensive, such as the Edge Walk.

Its a must do in Toronto, how an you visit and not do the CN Tower.We thought it was expensive, pre purchase your tickets and go early to avoid the queues.Elevator ride was thrilling as it has a partial glass bottom and a glass side, even those with a fear for heights will be fine.The viewing platform...
Avoid the line at the ticket booth and buy the tickets on your smartphone. Be prepared for long lines on the weekends (1 hour). Was still totally worth it!

Pre booking is essential to avoid the queuesDinner is excellent with attentive serviceWe watched the most astonishing thunderstorm sweep over TorontoAfterwards go down to walk on the glass floor (if you dare..)Well worth a visit!

It was very nice i liked the elevator ride up and beautiful view from the top. But I was expecting a lot more than just a look out point. There was absolutely nothing esle to do quite disappointing I was so happy to actually see the cn tower and to actually be there ,that when we got back downstairs I...

Enjoyed my visit to the CN Tower, amazing views across Toronto guaranteed. Only complaints were the long waiting time (over an hour to get to the lift) and that they crammed the lift so full that everyone was uncomfortably tightly packed in. Staff at the top were friendly and pointed out main landmarks across the city. A must for anyone...
We arrived quite early which meant it was easy to,park for the whole day. Did the glass floor level plus the higher level too.

Visited on a Sunday evening during the Pan Am Games, so the venue was jammed and there was a very long line at 6PM. I opted to walk around and see some of the waterfront and managed to get in very quickly a couple of hours later when there was no line to get in. The price went up significantly...
It is always fun to go there, it was my 5 time but it is getting more and more expensive. When you have guest from europe, it is a must:)

CN Tower provides a great bird's eye view of the city, but it is incredibly expensive. I've been to Chicago, New York, Seattle, Las Vegas and other areas where their is a tower with a viewing area for significantly less than the CN Tower is charging.
I have gone up before and it's worth it but I simply admired this beauty from outside. You can walk around if you don't want to spend money going up or waiting in lines. The view is magnificent

If in Toronto a visit to the CN Tower is a must. Great views over the city. Usually busy so you can expect to queue - several times ie for ticket, security and getting onto lifts - but still worth it.
It is a really cool view and the restaurant is pretty neat but depending on when you go the long lines aren't worth it

No visit to Toronto is complete without a visit to the CN Tower. I don't think I need to say much about the need to visit the attraction itself; I'm sure others have had plenty to say on that. I will give a couple of pointers to make your visit a little easier. First, buy your tickets online or go...

Wait to get to tower was over 2 hours, either go early or after 6 pm. We stayed up at the tower for only 40 minutes but waited too long in huge Line up. The cost of the attraction is easily over 100 dollars for 3 people not including food and cost to travel. People were exhausted and leaving line...
Great view of the city. The glass floor was fun. The extra ride up to the very top was not too different than the main level.

It was a cool view and we liked the glass floor. We did not pay the extra to go to the skypod. We did find a 15% off coupon in an Ontario travel magazine in our hotel lobby, which for a family of four saved us $21 dollars (you have to purchase the tickets 2 at a time and need...

You think because you can see it from everywhere in the city it would be pretty cool, and yes the view is great. However, for the amount of money you pay it really isnt the best. Just go across to the Island to get an amazing view or go up one of the tall buildings and honestly you get the...

This is something I would do again for sure. You are really high up above the ground looking down andseeing everything down below you. Then theres the glass panes to look down from, and its really scary but an amazing experience. Next you can go up even HIGHER! That was cool as well.Just beware of line ups

Simply amazing views of Toronto and and lake ontario. Didn't do the restaurant but know people that have and they say its pretty good. Plenty to do and it keeps the kids entertained, especially the glass floor. It's a must do attraction for those coming to Toronto. You just have to appreciate it for what it is and enjoy.
Great experience. I would recommend going around 8 pm (because the sun goes does in Toronto around pm). Got to see the sun go down.
We had a great tour guide and dinner was pretty good. I was inpressed by the view once we reached the top. Dinner was a bit pricey but definitely worth it.

The staff is very knowledgeable and efficient. The process runs smoothly, from buying tickets to getting to the viewing deck, even with long lines. Lots of cool exhibits along the way. Views are spectacular.

Everybody visiting toronto, should visit this place atleast its a must, if you have some money to spend. Food is expensive but worth a try. Revolving restaurant with scenic view of toronto from height. Make sure you book the seats in advance.

After reading other reviews about how you might feel rushed to move from one observation area to another, I decided to travel to the CN Tower via TTC (underground subway) around 9 pm at night. Like I suspected, there were few lines and hardly any visitors which made strolling around by myself quite nice. Unfortunately, by the time I got...

you go up in a lift and look at the views. The glass floor is nothing special anymore as a lot of attractions have them. it is good for the views but the cost does not reflect the attraction. Poor value for money.

Great place to bring the family and get a birds eye view of Toronto and the GTA.Kids loved the glass floor while us parents were worried about the glass breaking.Well worth the money to travel up and the extra to visit the sky pod.Wpuld do it again

This was the fourth trip up the CN Tower. First for 20 years. Still worth doing and iconic. Views are great and the the glass floor is always good. Go early to avoid the queues especially at lunchtime onwards.At 10pm the tower puts on a light show quite impressive.
It was good to see all the city from above, financial district, lakefront and the other places.. Also the crowd is handled nicely

Just love spoiling ourselves in our very own city!! This is the dinner that you should bring your out of town guest to as it has fantastic seating no matter where you are, and an incredible wine list that is sure to impress!! Dinner is always perfect and we would dine here more often if we lived closer. Just love...

Underground parking is just across the street and very convenient. The views are unbelievable. The engineering information is fun to read. The glass floor was a unique experience that provides for some fun photos. Union Station train station is nearby and provides subway access to the rest of Toronto.

We enjoyed the beautiful views from the observation deck. The Blue Jays were playing and it was surreal to hear the cheers and see the players on the field so far below. Probably not worth visiting if the visibility is poor.

The best part of going to the CN tower was doing the edgwalk. It was simply amazing. The view from outside is mindblowing. I would however say that the view from inside is not great because of the way it was built. There is no clear view because the poles get in the way. Overall it's probably a great sight...

The CN Tower boats incredible view of the city on a nice clear day. If you are up for adventure, try to do the walk around the perimeter of the tower. I'm deathly afraid of heights and went with a friend. I dared myself and surprisingly after doing it, I overcame my fear of heights! The restaurant 360 serves top...

This was an outstanding experience and very well done. The fastest way to get to the top without waiting in line is to make reservations at the 360 restaurant which is a rotating restaurant. $55.00 per person for lunch is a little pricey but you pay a little extra to skip the lines.
Well worth doing. We were able to eat in one of the restaurants at the top for dinner without even having reservations. Amazing view of the Toronto area. Will visit again next time I'm in Toronto.

The CN tower is a must-see if touring in Toronto. It dominates the skyline, whenever you are in the downtown core. The views on the elevator and on the glass platform are fantastic ... but its certainly not cheap. The area around the CN Tower has lots going on as well ... especially when the Blue Jays are playing.

This was fine. It's a really expensive elevator ride that has a good view if you are one of the lucky ones not to be packed (like a sardine) into the back. You get up there, you walk around, great views of the city, nice breeze, lots of people just like you trying to get a great photo. The glass...

When you go up the restaurant you get an excellent meal and can spend as much time as you like in the observation area. Honestly it is so much more relaxing, comfortable. Once you make it clear that you want to go to the restaurant you will get upstairs so much quicker. True the restaurant meal is more expensive than...
expensive and long line ups today. Nice views the kids enjoyed the glass floors and elevator ride. Should have better pricing for families.

Good experience. I did not walk outside the tower on the top, but seems to be a nice experience. When buying your ticket consider buying a package including the acquarium, good value. Surprised you have to pay to get to the restaurant.

It is a must see if you like to go to unique places. Some may say it is just another place to see from way up high. Of course it costs, but so does every other tall building with and observation deck. I am glad we did it.

The only way to see the CN tower is to pay a little extra and have lunch or dinner at the 360 restaurant. Your admission is free with a full dinner, there is no waiting in line for the elevator and you still have access to observation level and glass floor. The wait staff is exceptional, food is great and...
If you want a view of Toronto from about 100+ stories up, this is the place for you. Food was good, not fabulous. Prices quite high. A bit of an effort to find. Close to the Aquarium. Lots of crowds.

We very rarely go here bc it's so expensive to get to the top. The restaurant is not bad. Once you get up there, you look at the gorgeous view for about an hour and then you leave. Nothing special once you get up there really...just the view of Toronto.
Amazing, well worth the price and having the opportunity to "hang" over the edge was fantastic but not for the faint of heart. Great visit for a family or by yourself.

Great view of a big city. It'll be busy, so expect many line-ups. Buy tickets online for a discount and the opportunity to skip one of the lines. Online tickets have to be purchased 24hrs before they can be used, but you can use them anytime. Go up to the skypod. Cost more, another 2 lines for elevators up then...
If there is a single attraction to visit in Toronto, it would be a CN tower. Enjoy the view and glass floor walk. Get up to the skypod level - totally worth it!

you have to go to the CN Tower when you come to downtown Toronto, its worth the wait for getting in the complex make sure you bring a camera and that the camera or phone is fully charged, the views are amazing, you will on a clear day see Rochester to the south and Barrie to the north, but do...
If you are ever in my city you need to visit the CN Tower! Super funny looking piece of concrete but the views from the top are definitely worth it. go on the seethru glass floor - if you dare! ;)

It was wonderful celebrating my birthday at the top of the city, with my family. The view was spectacular, and the dinner was great. I highly recommend going to the rotating restaurant because you get a full view of the city, while sitting down comfortably, enjoying a good meal.

The interesting fact of the CN tower is not the opportunity to view Toronto from the top, it is to see it from "within". Aside from learning the history behind the construction of the tower and that there is a functioning antenna on the top, the cool thing is the ability to sit or lay down on the glass floor...

First of all, I would recommend getting the Citypass as admission to the tower is expensive, but it is one of the attractions included in the pass, which we found to be great value for money considering all of the attractions it includes.We thoroughly enjoyed our trip to the CN Tower, I would highly recommend a visit. We paid...
The restaurant was fantastic, the view on the glass platform was awesome looking into the football field below
I have been to many tall buildings, but this CN Tower was the best. Their revolving restaurant is lovely, especially for a special occasion. Magnificent views and amazing engineering.

Enjoyed our trip up the CN Tower. It was a fairly clear day, so views were very good. It was a great first thing to do in Toronto and we all enjoyed it. The staff were all very friendly and informative. We went early and the queues were not too bad, but as we were leaving they were horrendous, so...

The tower itself was impressive from the outside but we weren't prepared to pay the ridiculous price to go to the viewing platform. Once you've seen the view from a tower they all become the same - saved our money for better things!

Fourth time up the CN Tower, and it never disappoints. Obviously, go up there when the weather is nice. Love seeing the whole span of the metro Toronto area. Didn't do the add ons of the skypod or the walk. Not worth it to me for the money. Go after 7 and avoid the crowds and see the sunset.

This is an ICON in Toronto and well worth taking a visit, this is the 3rd time I have been up the CN Tower, and the views are fantastic, there is a lot to see, and an area where you can buy some souvenir's, you can stand on a glass floor and see right down to the ground,,a bit scary...also...

This is pricey but a must do. Standing on the glass floor is unbelievable. We purchased a city pass which saves you money if you're planning on visiting some of the other attractions in Toronto (the zoo, the ROM, the castle and the Ontario Science Center). Even if you only go to three of the attractions, it's still cheaper to...

Was bummed that they don't do the "edge walk" on w/ends...i would have loved to have done that. The tower is amazing, the glass floor is amazing and the ride going up above the observation deck is amazing. WE really enjoyed that. I only wish that if one wants to...they can choose to do the stairs...i LOVE stairs....hahahah...the more the...
A terrific view but very expensive. Unless you are doing the skywalk or have a significant amount of disposable income, this is not worth it.

If you are in Toronto it is must do to visit the tower. The view is breathtaking and even on a very busy day the waiting time for the first level was not much more than 15 min.However it would be worth for waiting much longer as you are rewarded with the great experience.We did not have enough...

It's fun to see the view of the greater Toronto area. Very touristy site, with lots of upgrades avaiable for extra money. Not sure if it's worth the money - very commercialized.

We arrived early to beat the queues. It was during PanAm games so they had opened early. It was a cloudy day but views were surprisingly good. The tower itself is the great reference in the city. The skyline of Toronto wouldn't be that great if it weren't for the Tower. you can actually walk the perimeter of the tower on the outside, not just a the GL but also at the high point....

I am scared of heights, so I was a little scared when the elevator starts up and you can see out the door the whole way up; but once at the top, you just can't beat the views of the city. The glass floor was really cool as well (though I was petrified). I didn't do the skypod. I went...

CN Tower offers a fun (and pretty quick) ride to the top of the tower. It can be pretty darn busy, with everyone trying to get photos with the best views. This tower is a 'touristy' as you can get for Toronto, but it is an amazing attraction and one that I am glad my children were able to see. This was by far the tallest structure they have been in and seeing their faces as the looked out over the city made me smile. Check the other reviews for best...
This place is truly spectacular. The view of the area is breath taking. Make sure to see the clear floor to look down 300 meters to the ground!

Wherever you are in downtown Toronto and many other parts too, the CN tower is an ever present site dominating the skyline. So you really find it very hard not to make a visit. However it was interesting and not too expensive and the views as expected are amazing.
For you basic entrance fees- One outdoor 360 and one indoor 180 views. I felt a bit misled with the indoor level access. 1/2 of upper indoor level was resturants. Excellent views as promised.

A brilliant way to spend the morning - so much better than I expected. Loved the glass floor area and the outside walkway around the tower. Lots of interesting facts and figures displayed in interesting ways. Would recommend.
The tower is a good starting point to an exploration of this lovely city. Great views and the usual scary thrills of being up so high and next to a big glass window.
Pretty cool views of the city. Definitely a must do on your trip to Toronto. Good value for money aswell.
Not for the weak knees brigade. If heihts worry you gat to the back of the glaas fronted lift and stare at the neck of the person in nfront. My wife did.

It is a while since I visited (the choice of dates does not give the option) but I want to share this. The view from the tower is superb. At night especially, it is possible to see Yonge St snaking for miles into the distance. Enjoy a meal in the revolving restaurant and see Toronto spread out before you
This is a great attraction if you want to see a great view of the toronto city. Lake Ontario from this height seems so much bigger.

My family and I was in Canada visiting some friends .They took us to the CN Tower and I must say place have a breath taking view we have been to the one in New York and I must say that I think I love this one more.

I've seen some communication towers like those in Tehran and Berlin. Among them I think that of Tehran is the tallest and most beautiful. Should say that attractions of CN Tower are very expensive, i.e. 250 C$ for edge walk!
we called in to celebrate my 70th birthday and what a night it was lovely food good service and great views the place is not cheap by any means but for a one off i would recommend (i didnt pat )
The must see in Toronto, The tallest building in North America the 147 observation pod is unbelievable aand the glass floor has grown men trembling
Views are spectacular on a good day. Worth doing once just for the experience but definitely not for those suffering from vertigo (even the lift up has glass doors)
It really is an engineering wonder. Don't miss the movie about building it. Amazing views! Not really expensive and well worth the view. Sometimes doing the touristy stuff is best!

we visited the tower & the views amazing. We also did the tower walk which was very professionally done and although expensive was very good. Had a meal I the revolving tower restaurant which was a little expensive for what you got but the setting was what you were paying for
The view is amazing to the view of the whole city and surrounding area. It is lit up with colorful lights at night. The CN tower is a favorite by all who visit Toronto.
I am not keen on heights but I could not miss the opportunity to see the sights from the top of the tower, I did not regret it!

Why pay full pop just to go up for the view ? Go for dinner and all is included. The menu is very good and the service is fantastic. Don't leave anything on the window ledge Because you will be sure to lose it as the restaurant revolves to give you a full view of the city. Everyone should put...
It's expensive but the views are amazing. Try going early in the morning as we were able to avoid lines.
For anyone coming to Toronto....this is something you will want to experience. It's truly amazing. Worth every penny.

My 2 grandchildren, 8 & 5, went with Grandpa & Grandma to the CN Tower. To get there from their house required walking to the subway, taking it to Union station, then walking about 6 blocks thru the skyway to the CN Tower. Since we were getting there shortly before noon, there were lines: to go thru the security, next...

The CN tower is quite pricey but for 20 dollars extra you can have a delicious 2 course meal and avoid all queues by having lunch in the 360 restaurant. 55 dollars for the 2 course Prix fixe menu instead of the 35 dollar standard fee. Food was delicious and with excellent service.

Great view - even the elevator ride was exciting. We went to the 360 restaurant to make it an event and were not disappointed. Highly recommended and the rotating restaurant was much better than recommended. Highly recommended.
I am from US and have been on Empire State Building. The view from CN tower is alright. I would not do it again. Its very crowded and the view is not worth the wait & money.

We went with friends. the food, service and view was a worth while experience.I found it pricey but it is a once in a while place to visit.There was 6 of us and everyone enjoyed the meal, we went in the late afternoon and got to see the sun set which added to the view of Toronto.Would...
What an amazing feat of engineering. Great views and great story about the build. We are so happy that we went. I highly recommend the City Pass and use it to see the tower.

When you buy a city pass for $60.00 you get admission for the CN Tower, Toronto zoo, Casa Loma, Ontario science center, and the royal Ontario museum..visiting the tower was a.nice experience ...living in a big city myself I was not that impressed..the surrounding area was fun, Rogers Centre home of the blue jays next door, set whistle localities across...
It is a bit expensive, but definitely worth it! I would definitely recommend doing this on your first day, because you get to see the whole view of Canada!

Well worth the visit, especially for couples.Take your significant for a meal there and the tower visit becomes free, otherwise there is charge to go up the tower. The food was amazing and the view is spectacular. Try the tiger shrimps pasta,
Breathtaking view - you can see Niagra Fall off in the distance - it's kind of strange to see helicopters and small planes at a lower altitude than you are.

Its bit expensive but the view was spectacular. Kids enjoyed the height. Though i have been to burj khalifa in dubai but this one was rather better. Enjoyed photography at glass floor n cool breeze as well.

As you are about to enter Toronto the CN Tower gives you first indication that you have arrived. The 147 floor tower was the tallest for a long time. It is a communication tower but also houses a observation deck and restaurants. No visit to Toronto is complete without a visit to CN Tower.

Absolutely incredible view of the city and the waterfront, one that can't be beat by any other view in Toronto. I managed to get there earlier in the morning and beat the rush; by the time I was leaving things were starting to pick up and there was a line to get in. It was nice that the overall experience...
great value, great views. right in the center of Toronto. The glass floor is a lot of fun as well as the outside patio.

Inwould not spend the money again. At 150 dollars for 2 adults and 1 child including the tickets for the sky pod honestly it is not worth it. Good observation point, no doubt. But lines to get the tickets, lines to get into the lifts, lines to get a glimpse of the views, lines to get to the upper level...

I would recommend going up half an hour before sunset to get the daylight & nightime views. The lifts are impressive.Going up was fairly well organised - you have to run the gauntlet of the obligatory photo shoot. Or you can duck through like us if you are quick.There is an extra lift to take you to the...
An absolutely amazing experience which we really enjoyed. We spent 5 hours which included 1.5 hour lunch. We also did the viewing platform.

Since I doubt I will ever come back to Toronto, I'm glad I spent like three hours in the CN Tower (counting the queue time). It was quite expensive but I just couldn't walk past it. It is a major world attraction (one of the seven engineering wonders of the world) so it's worth 50$.

An Adventure at Every Level! The Tower Experience offers general admission up yo the LookOut Level at 1,136 ft), including EdgeWalk. I have been there a few times and is always in awe at the view especially if a clear day. The food is good but pricey, I would have preferred more choices. This is a once in a lifetime experience.

Great place to visit & very easy access to all places. Lifts on the outside of the Tower & nice speedy ride up & down. Great views of Toronto Islands, the small airport, Rogers Stadium & lots more. Great experience to walk outside if you dare!

If you are in Toronto , The CN Tower is a must do, day or night. Actually do both because it is a different experience each time and very enjoyable. I have been up the CN tower many times from a child to adult . it's always a great experience for me . Learn the history, the story, then enjoy...

We did this using a Toronto City Pass. Else it would have been very expensive. Fun for kids who may have never been to a very high building before, and the glass floor is kinda cool.But if you've ever been to a tall building in the civilized world this century then it's not so special. Ok, this is my fourth time visiting the Tower as it is a place to go with my overseas family member when they visit. Honeymooners last year, their 50+ parents this year. The view is great but price-quality relation of the food is nowhere to be found. Quite some time waiting for going up. It goes smoothly but not worth the money spent to go up. Also difficult to take pictures as you are behind glass or openings are to small to pass your lens.
We went back four times in 2 days and couldn't get a wait time of less than 1.5 hours, despite going at different times of the day. That's way too long to wait for an elevator so we passed.

If you enjoy city views and to get a feel for the city, this is a good place to check out. The lines moved pretty fast. There is a glass floor you can stand on. You have to pay another 12$ to go to the very top on the outdoor bug elevator (we didn't). Expensive, but a must do, especially...
it was overrated to me i wish i would have picked the aquarium instead. It was just you go up take a few pix and go back down lol waste of money

The CN Tour had an excellent menu, very tasty food and an absolutely fabulous view. The food was a tad pricy but we all had an excellent time plus we were able to take the very quick outside elevator up to the viewing decks and the Plexiglas floor - that my family loved...

Great visit, great view could spent long time just looking at the views . Could out that if you have lunch or dinner at there restaurant then they will not charge you to go up. So check rate on lunch or dinner.

Not my first visit so I knew what to expect. Still a clean and very well presented building. Buying tickets was straight forward and the journey up was smooth. Took the stairs down from the 360 restaurant as there was complementary access to the observation deck. Hard to add more then what has been said before. View is spectacular and the whole story around the construction and challenges they faced was very interesting. Try to go when it is sunny and get there early to avoid crowd. Also the City Pass is a good deal if you want to save some money.
Simply a must see. The View is amazing. It is a little pricey and can be annoyingly crowded, but it's well worth it.

I was really excited to visit this with my mom, brother and friend. 3 of us had been here before (years ago), and one never before. We wanted to be up the sky pod either side of sunset but found no information on wait times. We guessed entering the tower at 8 we could make it up to the sky...

I went at the sunset so I could see the city with the lights, really awesome! The elevator was fast and the history of the creation of the tower is interesting. The elevator operators can give good information. No rows after 9 pm, at least that day
this was cool, but i think it was a bit pricey. you pay and go up the elevator and look about and that's it. nice if you have the extra money, but not fantastic
This is worth the money to go and see the sights of Toronto. The sky walk is amazing and great for pictures. The outside views are amazing. We had a great time as a family.

The views of the city from the top of the Tower are quite beautiful and the glass floor area was neat. Other than that, it was quite pricey for the extent of the experience ($40). Good for a one-time experience for a single adult.

i last went up the CN tower in 1977 as a child with my best friend, shortly after my mum took me to live back in england i returned as an adult with my youngest 15 year old son, It was still amazing such a fantastic engineering feat, the glass floor was an added feature for me and made it...
Great place for a great view of the city. Get there early - we arrived at 9 a.m. On a week day and walked right in. A must do when visiting Toronto.

Since I grew up in Toronto the "CN Tower" was always a great place to go on a clear day and have a great look over the City.The views are spectacular if you don't mind heights. I understand now that they have added a ride/amusement to the Tower, you walk on the outside of the tower and drop all...
It's a place that you have to go, now that it's the icon of Toronto down town. The best view it's achieved in the afternoon when the light sets in the horizon. The tickets are quite expensive.

Tip: Check the visibility before you go there. You won't be able to view anythingthing on a foggy day. You will pay a lot and get disappointed. Amazing views! A little pricey, but worth it. All four of us - wife and kids had a blast! Glass floor is fun!

I have a fear of heights and decided to conquer it on the CN Tower. Its a bit pricey, but there are not alot of places that offer this sky high experience. I went to the top with my two (2) great-nephews for dinner. It was more than I expected. The views as it revolves around on different time, and seeing the change of color on the horizon was incredible! The foods were out-of-this-world. Although it was a bit pricey, but it was worthy. I will go again.
You can't be a tourist to Toronto and not go up the CN Tower . Views were impressive and we were able to appreciate the view in a relaxed manner
The views from the tower at night are not disappointing. It is a great way to see the Toronto skyline all illuminated.

A great view of the city and all of its surroundings. Definitely go on a clear day. The food was excellent, the revolving view of Toronto is really spectacular. Not cheap but would definitely visit again if in the area.
This is one place where never forget to visit if you stay in Toronto don't forget to visit. I went to last two months ago.

I booked an evening meal rather than pay for just a view,it works out much better and the food was fantastic a three course meal for two including all access was about £101.00 well worth it even though it was quite cloudy to start but this soon cleared up,and the views in the rotating restaurant were fab.

Nice landmark with great views (especially in summer) but the high price point makes it unacceptable. Long queues and tight spacing real reduce the quality of the experience. Being hounded through by staff is also quite questionable.

We decided that it was likely to be better value to have a meal in the revolving restaurant and access the observation deck and glass floor as part of the cost of the meal. Despite the price, it's something every tourist to Canada should do at least once. The views of the city and lake are incredible.
If you like heights, go for it. We wanted to have a meal, but the restaurants were way to expensive,

I overcame a morbid fear of heights that was at its peak in the mid-1970s when I first saw this huge tower soon after it was built and there was no way I was going to get in that glass-enclosed elevator. You have to go up here and see Toronto from 300 meter high, it's certainly a view you don't ever forget. We booked also lunch in restaurant so did not have to wait in the line, it was looooooooong. The CN Tower is the iconic site for Toronto. Towering high above any other building, its presence cannot be ignored. Well, the view from the top is also fantastic. Went up with my family of four on a beautiful day. We enjoyed it ok, but considering the cost the view from the ferry to Toronto island was better and much cheaper.

This is my third visit over the last 33 years. I only seem to go when we have out-of-town visitors. I always seem to enjoy it; the panoramic view of the city, especially downtown, and Lake Ontario never gets old. Only pay the prices in the restaurant if you want the view; the food alone is definitely not worth it!

We went up to have lunch at 360 restaurant and its so worthed, really enjoyable and great food, i had shrimp cocktail and cheese tortellini and was delicious and we skip the line if u make reservations u go straight up and prices are reasonable.

I went on top of the CN Tower a few days after being in New York and being on top of the Empire State Building, which makes this review somewhat bias, as the views did not compare at all. It is a great activity, great views, amazing glass floor and elevator experience, but it is VERY EXPENSIVE!!!!
Seeing Downtown from 300 m high is definitely one of the best things that can be done in Toronto. The skyline is so beautiful. Also there is a glass floor that you can see the below.

The CN Tower is super nice, well managed by friendly people, and a neat experience. Toronto is beautiful, and the observation deck is glorious on a clear day. But, the fact of the matter is that the CN Tower is WAY overpriced. WAY. Just absolute nonsense to spend more than $50 for my wife and me to ride up for...
Nice views of the city of Toronto, right next to Rogers Center Ballpark. It is a must do when you are visiting Toronto.

Long lines in hot environment the day i last went. I found it to be dusty and needing and update. Maybe they have done that since i was there. The panaromic view is amazing on a clear day. Skywalking is yet another thing on a to do list...not. I had terrible service dining there years ago and won't go back....

If you must see the CN tower, avoid the lines and have a more relaxed viewing experience by booking a lunch reservation at the 360 restaurant. You have panoramic 180 degree view of the Toronto skyline and they have a restaurant and a gift shop there too. The elevator brings you to the sky deck in less than 30 seconds and there is a portion of it that has a glass floor at the top, make sure you check that out b/c it is amazing.

I have been to towers before and seen many city views but this one in Toronto ranks way up high. The city looks beautiful from the top, especially the sides from where you see the Island and observatory etc. There are two areas to enjoy at the observation deck itself, one indoors and one outdoors. My partner and I did the Edge walk at the CN Tower. What a fantastic experience. Slightly scary but absolutely fantastic. We also went up to the observation deck and stood on the glass floor. The revolving restaurant is very nice, a little expensive but nice if its a special occasion.
Great place to visit . don't go up if you are afraid of heights. don't go at peak time space is limited .
long lines but worth the view...went there several times. Lines are moving fast.A bit overpriced ....
Worth checking out...we were lucky a clear day in June...but talking with a friend who to relatives up tower and no visiblity...something I didn't think about...

This was one of the highlights during my time spent in Toronto. My ears seemed to pop a couple times going up the elevator.It was a clear day when I went and the view of Toronto from way up was just excellent. I guess the cost was well worth it. we went quite early using our citypass tickets and managed to miss all the queues. choose a sunny day and the views are amazing
Been here twice - both for meals! The first time I managed to take pictures over lunch of the Toronto skyline, but on the second visit it was too cloudy. Food on both occasions was fantastic!
This is a must do for a tourist to Toronto. The views in every direction are incredible. We were so lucky as we got a clear day with high visibility. Well worth the lining up and waiting.

Visited as part of Toronto sightseeing. If you have seen any other top rise building or tower that shows the overall city view then you can skip this. If not then it's a must. I suggest to go in the evening, so you can enjoy the view during the day and night. After you visit go to the restaurant. You will love the great food and the scenic restaurant

Yes it is a great view, however if you have done something similar in New York City, Seattle, Paris, etc. it is not as thrilling. No trip to Toronto is complete without a visit to the CN Tower. The observation deck is at some insane height like 135 stories or the like. Yes, it opened almost 40 years ago, and you'd think that by now it would have become tired and boring. Well worth the effort just for the panaramic views of the city, lakefront, and Lake Ontario. If you want to avoid the entrance fee, reserve a table at the revolving restaurant which then gives you access to the observation platform at no cost.
The best part of CN Tower is that it is having three versions means three different floors from where you can watch the Toronto Skyline

We purposely went toward dusk so we could see both day and night views. The views are nice but the price paid AND more importantly the lift wait times make it a pain. We waited 25 minutes in que to get back down. Save your money for a blue jays or maple leaf game.
The whole family enjoyed the experience. It is a bit pricy though. Go up to the upper viewing platform to look down on the 'edge walkers'. Unless you are crazy enough to be one yourself.

i lived in Canada for 3 years,and it was only when I knew I had to return back to the UK did I start doing the sights....so theCN tower was a good place to start. It's all its cracked up to be and more. Such stunning views from the top, couldn't stop taking photos! Even walking over the glass floor...

The views from the tower are spectacular! Great views of the city if you're not afraid of heights! Crowded a couple of hours before a baseball game. We went a half hour before the game and had no trouble. Made it to the game by the first inning.
I have so much afraid of height, but it was amazing! The view are incredible and it's so cold there! The glass floor makes me so scary but it's very cool!

Somehow, I managed to live in Toronto for more than 5 (cumulative) years before going up the CN Tower. Likely down to my dislike of heights ;-) I needn't have worried - it is surprisingly undramatic. After looking around for directions, entrances, information and encountering numerous errors while trying to book online, we eventually gave up jumping through hoops for this already too expensive tourist trip.

It is a landmark that cannot be overlooked, especially if you are visiting Toronto. It might take a bit of time to get to the elevator but once you start your climb, you can bask in the amazing views. This was a very cool experience and Im glad we did it. However it was overpriced for what it actually has to offer. You should do it at least once because it is mind blowing to know that you are that high up. The glass floor gives a slight rush also!
Yes, it's a tourist trap - but it's a great view and a fun time. If you don't watch out, however, you can end up spending more money than you intended.
Enjoyed the EdgeWalk fantastic experience. Great service from start to finish with great support given by all the team. A must to do

I think the CN tower is definitely a cool attraction. There is something for everyone. If you're a daredevil you can walk with a harness on the outside of the building scary. The invisible floor was cool. Its a nice tourist attraction.

The views from all over CN Tower are amazing, but the best views come from the Glass Floor. It is definitely a challenge for many before the set their feet on the glass, but once you do so the views are amazing.
The view is spectacular once you get to the very top! My family and I were able to get some very good pictures. All in all, we had a nice experience.

I have been to the CN Tower every trip to TO over the years. On good days, the views of the GTA are great...and great views of aircraft traffic into and out of the Downtown Airport. Amazing views. Definitely worth it. Look for coupons if this is the only place you're going to, otherwise opt for Citypass. Glass floor is fun and scary. We didn't do the pod or edge walk. The main viewing area was fine for us.

The ride up to the top, the glass floor, the masses of people... all add to the fun of a visit to this tower. I've been up it twice and enjoyed it both times enormously. The revolving restaurant is well worth making a booking for as well.
Enjoyed superb views over toronto, worth paying the extra to go to the sky pod. Queuing happened at many points but it was well organised and you never waited long.

it was amazing to view Toronto from such a height. We were there during the week and there were short lines. Standing on the glas floor was quite an experience.

Recently visited the CN Tower for lunch - unfortunately it was a cloudy day. But, still had a great time - despite the obstructed views. Enjoyed the rainbow trout (looked and tasted more like salmon, tender and delicious). The short ribs fell off the bones and the pecan cranberry tart with raspberry white chocolate ice-cream was splendid. If you have...

Too many people, too long a wait and make sure to purchase your tickets ahead of time. If i were to recommend anything I would say go at sunset and eat in the restaurant so that you can sit and enjoy it! Too many people with strollers and unruly children. Who could blame the kids! I strongly suggest this to anybody going to Toronto. CN Tower is part of Toronto's history. Your trip will not be completed without visiting it. Dont miss your chance, go!

An engineering masterpiece! Don't forget to watch movie of CN tower history. It has general admission and skypod tickets. If you are planning to go on top, need skypod passes. Otherwise OK with general admission - it includes glass floor, general view and a movie about history. Entry is bit pricy. We chose weekday to avoid big lines.

I liked the CN tower although the tower is not as pretty as the needle tower in Seattle.The good thing about it is that, you are able to see the lake and the islands located in the middle of the lake.

Perfect to taking visitors when they want to see Toronto. Amazing view of all the city, and I still get scared walking on the glass floor. buy the toronto visit package to get a better rate, and see the ROM and AGO as well.

How can one visit Toronto without taking a picture with the CN Tower? I always love visiting observation decks, and the CN Tower is among my favorites. The tower is a very popular stop for tourists in Toronto. The cost to go up the tower was a little steep, no pun intended. It feels like it. The views are amazing, 360. Only downsides are the lofty price and the wait time if you are there during high tourist season. But it is a must.

Came here originally in 1981 when we first got engaged so was worth a revisit, views were great and spent quite a while taking pictures of surrounding area which was great as very sunny day. The sign of Toronto, the CN tower is right in the middle, you can bee hanging around tdowntown and see it from everywhere, there are many cool places where you can eat having a beautiful view to it, it is just next to the Ripleys aquarium and you have to pay to get in the elevator and take pictures of...

I generally don't like big cities or purely "tourist" attractions therein, but I did enjoy the experience of taking the elevator (glass floor and walls) up 1,122 feet in the CN Tower to the lower observation deck with portion of glass floor. Stuck in Toronto due to cancelled flight. Went downtown to look around. Only about 25in from airport. Tower was cool. Watch a baseball game from 140 floors up. A little $$$ but won't ever get to do it again.

I truly enjoyed the CN Tower, especially the glass floor. It took my friend repeatedly asking me to sit on the glass floor to have my picture taken as I am terrified of heights but she eventually convinced me to do so; it was thrilling and the view was fabulous.

We want to the tower late evening. There was no line and the view at night was beautiful. The open deck was windy tho, so be prepared for some chill coming off of the lake. Over all a great experience.

Having been in some of the world's tallest buildings, the view from the high points of the CN Tower looks pretty much like every other city in the world. As a Toronto native I've taken friends from out of town to the tower and they always love it! In the warmer months it's fun to go to the outside area and take pictures! They also have a great souvenir shop!

I have been living near Toronto for over 14 years, and each time I see the tower from miles away it is just as exciting. loved the see through glass floor. Elevators and line moves quick. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Cool breeze on the outside deck felt great on a hot day.

The CN Tower is located in downtown. The queue is short and you are not waiting for long. I remember going into the yellow lift which then goes up. While going up you get the view of the outside. After a full day bus tour to Niagara Falls, we asked to be dropped at this Canadian icon to dine at the restaurant above the city. We went on a Sunday early afternoon, The line ups were about 30 minutes. The staff were polite and helpful. The glass floor was a big hit with my 13 year old. Once the tallest free standing structure in the world, the CN tower is the iconic landmark that signals downtown to all Torontonians. Amazing views on a clear sunny day.Visited around 5pm so smaller queues,book online for a discount or book the 360 restaurant and entrance is free.For full 360 view you need to visit the Skypod (extra CAD12) a further 33 floors up.The restaurant takes up half of the observation deck.A must visit when in Toronto.

The views to be seen of Toronto from the top of this tower was amazing. It's the tallest building in North America so the views on a clear day are amazing. You can see from all the sides. There is a spot with glass flooring so you can look downward...pretty cool.

Wonderful place with amazing view over the whole citt. Shops also great there. Good location and nicest spot in toronto.

It was great to get a birds eye view of Toronto. It's spectacular. Puts phila to shame! To get to the highest point of the tower you have to pay an add'l $12 on to $32. Or onto$25 if your a senior. I thought that was crazy but once in a life time I guess

The CN is one of those "must do" places if you're visiting Toronto, but it just wasn't that great. The base is packed with cheesy souvenirs and enough tourists to populate Luxembourg. Do not miss to do one thing in this landmark of Toronto: Once up in the tower, take a selfie picture with your friends laying down the glass floor, head to head: it's stunning!

CN Tower is an experience. We went there for lunch, at the 360 Restaurant and was treated to not only gastronomic delights but also to the stunning view of Toronto as the Restaurant revolves. Afterwards, we went to the Lookout and the Glass Floor. It was a little bit scary but amazing.

It was an amazing stop on our way through Canada, even for a short time. Always wow me this place,from inside-out,my favor place to be !Gorgeous views,amazing restaurant !Lots of adrenalin feelings ,especially on the glass floor .

Our bus tour of Niagara Falls stopped for a short while at the CN tower in Toronto. I believe this is the 3rd largest standing structure in the world. Across the street was the Toronto Blue Jay Stadium and an Grassy area the had old locomotives and a brewery.

As a staple venue for any visitor to Toronto, the CN Tower is a great place to visit. I took visiting family members on several occasions and it never fails to impress everyone. You either like high rise towers, or you don't. If you do, don't miss Toronto's for stunning views and the chance to stand courageously on the glass floor contemplating the ground. 550 meters below. When built in 1976, it was the world's tallest freestanding tower. It has slipped down the list since but remains a stunning triumph of vertical engineering.

This iconic tourist attraction is a must in some ways, but only if you are willing to stand in lines. Nonetheless, the view is fantastic, despite the modest overcast that day. Did not do the “sky-walk” but having jumped off the tower in Aukland, this seemed pointless.

Despite its age, the CN Tower is still a great attraction. Fantastic views in all directions.
