You go up. You go down. Big Fat Deal. There is a glass floor which is not scary. Nice view of Island Airport and Lake Ontario. Other than that... Meh. Save your money. The CN Tower is nicer to look at from outside.

Yes, the CN TOWER is simply spectacular. The only suggestions I have are to only go on a clear day. It's definitely much better a view.Also.. COST... this is where I have an issue. It's quite costly to go up and if you really have a few extra bucks, go the distance and go to the exploration deck.

We did the CN Tower because it is "the Toronto thing to do" but overall were disappointed. it is expensive, the restaurants are average and there were no free guided tours once up there. I am Torontonian!!!CN (Canadian National) Tower is one of the attractions in Toronto that no one wants to ignore. Amazing view of Toronto ..elevators take you to the top in no time...scary but interesting...view from the glass floor is wonderful...revolving restaurant has nice food and great service.Enjoyed the atmosphere and ambience at top of the world

Definitely a must see for a tourist in Toronto. The view is amazing. The glass floor is fun to walk on. We skipped the extra money and didn't go up to the capsule.Make sure you watch the movies in the ground floor cinemas. They are short, included in the ticket and are interesting.
this is not just a tower- it is truly a magnificent piece of architecture. From the bast to the top there are things to see! A must for any visitor to this landmark of the Toronto skyline.

This was part of our city pass. The wait was not too long, and the tour guide made sure that the youngsters were at the window of the elevator as we rose to the top. The glass floor was a little scary for some, but the youngsters enjoyed jumping and lying on the glass floor.

What can you say about a structure, so tall that your in awe of the view, seen from all angles in the observation lounge. I will be back, there is no doubt!

Preferably during sunset. Toronto really is beautiful, especially on its way from afternoon through thigh light to evening.It a bit expensive. But have dinner in the 360 pr at least drinks at the bar while enjoying the view. It's worth it once. Then enjoy the rest of the city.

The CN tower is.. well a large tower,,, that you pay some good money to go up, It does have amazing views, the glass floor is a lot of fun, easy to spend up to an hour.. then move on to the next site... ps.. steam whistle brewery is across the street, :)

So I'm decidedly biased being a native New Yorker. Must say it was a fun part of our trip. I think in 20 years if Toronto continues the growth that it's had the view will be spectacular. spent the morning here and enjoyed looking at the tower itself and the amazing views of the city from all around the tower, loved the edge walk, this is an attraction that cant be missed when in toronto.
get there early to get your tickets..depending on the time of year the lines can be very long. Other then that all levels are worth the wait to see. quick ride up and very smooth. just a great view!

I went ot the bar upstairs and the view is oustanding, it is a great place to sit down and talk with friends and family .
Amazing view of green city of Toronto. Dont miss the 3D cinema and glass floor! Not recommended for people who suffer from vertigo!

Almost 30 years old and yet this is still a must do for tourists. There is no better view of Toronto than this (I'm not saying this because of the Argo cheerleaders were there at the same time. Honest!). As with most things touristy in Southern Ontario, get used to paying approximately $50.

The CN tower is THE landmark in Toronto, and from above you can see EVERYTHING all around. If you have clear day, jump on the chance to go. We paid extra to go to the very tip-top observation deck, and I have to say that there was probably no real reason to do that, if you're on a budget.

The C N tower is a must see in Toronto. Exciting trip up in the elevator. non stop views in all directions from the top. I loved walking on the glass ceiling. I live in Toronto so would only ever visit the CN Tower if friends come to town. $35 each for a ride up an elevator is ridiculous. The view is nice but it could be more fun up top or include something else for that price. Kids under 4 are free which is nice.Glass floor was scary!

It's truely amazing to have our CN Tower to be one of the seven wonders of the world! We always bring our out of town family/business clients to CN Tower. we paid over $100 for 2 adults and one 4 year old. It was not worth it. The view is amazing. However, it gets old quick and there is really nothing else to do up there. Buy your tickets on a discount website to save yourself some money.
It's worth your while to have lunch or dinner at the top as the meal price includes the elevator ride. Check out the website before you reserve a table.
Very fast elevator to get to the top. On a clear day one can see the layout of Toronto and surrounding areas.Kirit.

I've always loved the CN Tower, it's a fun stop while touring around Toronto. What came I say about the CN but it is simply amazing the views are fantastic day or night. The glass floor is such a Rush plus there the edge walk if you have the guts which so far I have not.. It a must do if you are ever in Toronto..

A major feat of engineering which certainly impressed me as a chartered engineer. Well worth the time and effort to visit, even if you are not staying in the city. What an amazing tower this is and worth every cent. Once you get to the dizzy heights of what seems a long long way up (which it is) you get a magnificent 360 degree view of Toronto. The glass floor is also something you should do as you mind is telling you hey this is just wrong as you look...
I love CN Tower. The views are amazing over the entire city of Toronto. Standing near the edge is a little nervous for most people and a little winding, but a must see adventure..

A trip to Toronto is not complete without a visit to the CN Tower. Once a record breaking building for its height, it is still worth the visit to the top for the wonderful views. The glass lift and glass floors make for a breathtaking view. Definitely the place to take visitors in Toronto no matter the season.

The sheer height is amazing. Once on top there is a toughened glass see through floor.it makes one a little dizzy.the brave ones can go along the outer wall of the tower on a slow revolving trip . It's a must visit in Toronto.
amazing tour at cn tower ,the sky port was so nice glass floor is amazing view from there to down the road wow it so cool .

Good experiences, nice and attractive view, awesome and so helpful staff working there. I really recommend it to the tourist

The CN Tower is a great place to visit if you want a fantastic view of the City. It is a little expensive but sometimes you can find coupons to help with the expense.
It's one of those attractions that you just have to do when you're in a new city. If you're from Toronto however, I'm sure you've already brought up family or friends.It it what it is.
A must for anyone coming to Toronto their first time. The view is great on a clear day. I had been before but we took family visiting from overseas.
A buddy and went up the tower. I'm a bit afraid of heights but still man up and did it. Spectacular view on clear skies. Worth the price.

I had a girlfriend visiting from England, and we did the whole of downtown. We went to the CN Tower on a gorgeous sunny day. The views are spectacular! !The admission price was reasonable. If your going to visit Toronto it is a must see.

one of toronto's finest tourist spots. Great views of the entire city. People are very helpful. You can ask the elevator operator any question about canada. I asked how many sheep they have. LOL the operator had a great sense of humour.
enjoyable to visit but it is no Eiffel Tower! The history is short but that will change with time. it gets harder with age to walk up all those steps. Clean.

We purchased a Toronto CityPass, which included a trip up the CN Tower. It was better than I thought it would be. You can go outside and look down over the city, and they have a glass floor you can stand on and look down over 1400 ft. Overall it was pretty cool, and the tower is incredibly tall, you...

A very over hyped place, have visited it couple of times and it can get boring after a while. Definitely surrounding areas are good i.e. dining in Baton Rouge just there and Ripley's being next to CN Tower.
Nice view of Toronto from the top!! The ticket does not cost that much, and you also can combine the visit with a nice lunch/dinner at 360* Restaurant.
Poor view thru dirty windows - not even 180. Very expensive to stand in line to get in or out. 35CAD per p. Nothing to see. (comparing Seattle or Vancouver towers)
My 13 yr old daughter really enjoyed the glass elevator and the glass viewing floor. Me, not so much but was glad I went up for the view of the city.

The CN tower is a must if you're visiting Toronto. The glass lift is a great way to get to the viewing deck. Loved the glass floor and the views are lovely. Never used the resturant but looked nice. Not a great deal to do once at the top and looked at the view from all sides but could spend...

The CN tower is one of the worlds great sites and the views are fantastic. The surrounding area has many attractions, hotels and really great places to eat. You can now get fitted for a walk on the outside top viewing deck if you are brave enough, well worth the visit to a fantastic city.

The CN Tower is a great first place to take our visitors to Toronto for the views and luncheon as all of the major attractions unfold as you revolve and resolve to visit the Toronto Islands for instance.

We were with our 4 and 6 year olds. It was a hassle.Location- Don't bother driving in. PIck a good hotel location and walk to the CN Tower. We stayed on The Sheraton Centre which was a great location. About a 20 minute walk from there. We advise you to buy your tickets online 24 hours in advance to...
a must visit when in Toronto, such a great view of all of the city.The price is a little outrageous for a family, but its unforgettable

I went to watch friends do the edge walk and most of the staff members where cold & rude. Also just to watch them do the edge walk I had to pay $40. They need to have videos in the edge walk lounge area that is before the elevators so people arent forced to pay the $40 entrance fee just...
Had clear weather that day so the views were fantastic. Walking on that glass floor is quite an experience.

If you have done the signature lounge in Chicago (for free I might add as oppose to $35) its hard to do this and think its impressive. They did have a cool clear floor section which I was not brave enough to do...

I visited the CN Tower first in 1991 and was fascinated by it then already (I was only 12 then...). But I was surprised to see that I really...

Bit pricey but lot more added from last time was here so spent quote a good few hours here. Views are amazing and this has to be done if visiting Toronto. Wee extras for Canada day, flag, tattoo and lapel pin.

For a tower that was built some forty plus years back - this still amazes - it was my first time going up here with my wife and 2 year old son. We had a great time, and despite the massive crowds, we moved through reasonably fast. The elevator up was very cool, with views straight down, and the observation...

I waited around two hours to go up the tower and didn't stayed for 15 minutes... I mean the view is great, but isn't worth the hassle, specially if you have small children (I was alone, but witnessed a lot of desperate kids along the way)

I purchased a ticket at the venue, which is a little confusing - the ticket office is actually outside and around a corner from the Tower entrance. I didn't get the SkyPod because I only had an hour; if you're going to go and have the time, it's probably worth the extra money. The elevator ride was fun and fast!...

The long walk down Yonge Street was well worth the effort to visit the CN Tower. Initially the cloud cover was low and it was not possible to see the top of the tower. we had an amazing meal in the CN tower the food and service was of very high standard . The meal was worth every penny if I ever go back to Canada the CN tower will be 1 of my 1st places that I will visit.
This one of the places you should go in Toronto, but the prices are really high. General admission only give you access to the observatory and glass floor. I expected more. The staff is really nice.

I went here 3 years ago and it was amazing. There's even a revolving restaurant on the top. It's expensive but worth it. It's very safe, it has security. Also there's a glass floor that you can walk on.

CN tower is definitely worth a visit if you are in Toronto. I came here with my daughter and used out City Passes for this attraction. We stood on line for 2 long hours and when we finally made it to the top it took all but 10 minutes to enjoy it and heading right back down to the lobby.The Skypod is an extra charge of $12 which is not included...

what a horrible experience and not worth the money. Long lines, waiting for ever to get to elevators only to find more crowds. The only thing about the view is that you see Toronto from very high, nothing else. After every elevator there is a shop selling all kinds of itchy stuff that is expensive and useless. I appreciate the...

We visited the CN tower and it was quiet so that helped, although as you can take as much time as you like there is no rush, views were excellent of the city - if in Toronto you should defintiley visit the CN tower.
Go here for the views NOT the meal. The service was good and the views fantastic but the meal was very average.
You have to see this, the view from there is amazing! I spent the whole day and evening there, and was awestruck to watch the sun set over the lovely city of Toronto, which I miss so much.

Had a lovely meal in the revolving restaurant, wasn't too expensive. Chose to go during the day to appreciate the views, it revolves slowing but strange when you return from the toilet you have to look for your seat!
The CN Tower is a must see. The views are great and we ate in the 360 restaurant and we had a good meal while enjoying the views. Loved it!

We have been up a few towers in different cities and was a little disappointed in this one. Great Experience!!Wonderful views of Toronto and surrounding area a little overpriced for the add on to go up further in sky podBut it's a must do of course!

We had purchased the CityPass which included a ride up to the CN Tower. We had done it a few years ago, but a couple of our kids were too young to really remember it. It is definitely fun to go up and see the beautiful views, feel the breeze up there and stand on the glass floor. Is it...
Great views but be prepared its expensive to go up over 50 dollars each person. Do the extra and go to observation deck its small but good. One time will do at that price!

This was my second visit to the CN Tower, previous time was 20 years ago, when I ate in the 360 degree restaurant. I was too chicken to look through the glass floor the last time, so given the opportunity to visit again I decided to try again. I managed, albeit briefly! Me and partner decided to eat at the restaurant in the tower. For lunch you must spend 55$ a person or so, and then after eating your admission is covered. The cost w/o lunch was 35$. So I saw this as about a 20$ lunch. View was very nice from the restaurant, but it would have been better to have...

I will start by saying as good as I think the views are from the CN Tower, I do think it is a little pricey at almost $35 per person. Unfortunately the day I went the weather was slightly overcast, but the views are great as with any view tower in a big city. I think the views are particularly...

CN Tower is a must-do on a visit to Toronto, especially on a day when the weather is good, allowing for visibility for miles. It may be pricy and the lines may be long, but it is worth the visit. Views through the glass bottom floors and skypod at 450 meters height (equivalent of 145 storied building) are unique and...

One probably needs to do this when in Toronto, but it was crowded and expensive. The glass floor facility is quite small, but does offer an additional aspect. Suggest only go up if visibility is good ..........

We visited on 23 June 2015 on a very beautiful sunny day. The views over Toronto were spectacular especially looking out over the 14 islands. The skyline views of the tall buildings, some with wonderful reflections of other buildings on their glass fecades. This is an absolute must if you visit Toronto.We bought our CN tickets whilst on a...

We arrived a few minutes late for our 5:45 360 Restaurant reservation after finding a parking space in a multilevel garage two blocks away, but were ushered on up and in after necessary security checks. We had a great time at the CN Tower. You have to go through two security checks to get in there, and walk quite a way, but once you do it's worth it. The views from inside and out are fabulous and they allow selfie sticks so you can get some great shots! You can even look through a glass...

Although it not a cheap experience, ($104 for both of us with the sky walk) it truly is a great experience, and one we are glad to have done. Long queues are worth the end views. The staff were all genuinely friendly and helpful.

I have been up in many super tall buildings, but the cn tower is a little different.. If you are brave enough, which I was not, you can go on the roof with a harness, hand dangle over the side, 1200 feet up! It's called the edge walk..I strongly suggest getting a city pass, or calling for reservations, as...

Tickets were a bit pricey for what you get, but worth a visit. They were very busy when we went and waited over an hour in the line. Glass floor was great and it was funny how some people walked on the frame rather than the glass!!

Not a fan of heights but I enjoyed the CN tower so much I forgot about being stressed. We had a gorgeous day and the panoramic view of the lake and city was fabulous. Kids loved the glass floor and we enjoyed playing in the intense wind on the open level. The history of the tower was interesting. Didn't try...

Visited here last week and what a fantastic visitor attraction. Reasonable prices and so much to do inside. The views over the bay and surrounding areas was incredible. A trip higher up to the space pod is recommened.

We visited recently for the 3rd time...the last was quite a few years ago. We chose to have lunch at the 360 Restaurant to include the price of the CN Tower in our lunch cost. Unique but expensive view of the city. We got their early to avoid the long lines we've heard of. We were in and out within 30 minutes. Cool view but not sure it was worth the $40/person.

It's a bit expensive but so worth it. I would recommend going early to avoid crowds. Views are beautiful and it's so awesome that you can have a dinner there as well. Definitely a must see attraction.
I've been to Seattle and it was $10-15 to go up on the Space Needle. CN tower was $35-40 just to go up. All I have to say is what a racket! Save your money for better things.

My husband went to the 360 for our anniversary and it was just lovely. There was a bit of overcast in the evening, so we couldn't see the city very clearly. :( However the food was amazing as usual. A great restaurant for both foodies and tourists!
I had only a short time to see Toronto, so I chose the CN Tower. It is an amazing view. The day was clear, so, it was possible to see very far away.

Breathtaking views of whole city. If you do not like heights this is not for you. Initial ride to the top was slightly frightening and I'm not too bad with heights! Glass bottom floor also an experience.We paid extra to go higher and feel this was worth the money, allowed you to see more and feel some fresh air...

The ride up the elevator was great. There are windows on the floor so you can seeeverything below you. It was a cloudy day out but you could still see a good amount.The 360 restaurant was amazing. I was visiting with colleagues and we all decided it was a must do for Toronto.The day we went was foggy and cloudy. I recommend doing something else instead if the weather winds up that way. Great information about the construction of the CN tower before going up really gives a sense of how incredible the tower is. The staff were great and friendly when getting the lift up. The views really are stunning. Great city-scapes as well as fantastic views of Lake Ontario, The glass floor is also great and really hammers home how high...

Took a trip up the CN Tower and despite visiting before this was just as good. The weather was clear which allowed fabulous views over the lake and to the island and of course stunning views of the city of Toronto

Amazing views, like any other tower, I always try to be at the top before sun set to enjoy day light and night time views. Expect long ques so be prepared. If you want to dine in the restaurant, that's another deal so plan your visit ahead of time.
Always great fun lot to do and it is great to see who can stand on the glass floor the longest. If you have a course night dinner at 360 is just incredible.

a tad expensive but....what a view ! not only is this one of Toronto's trademark buildings it is nice to be around when it was topped off back in the 70's it has always been a place that I take out of town guests to, to give them a thrill and a view from the glass floor.so very cool

While visiting Toronto you can not leave without visiting the CN Tower, amazing view of the city from one of the biggest towers in the world if not the biggest it used to be at least... I've visited this place numerous times - as a tourist, competing at events, and dining at the restaurant. It gives you a view of the city skyline and the numerous skyscrapers being built around it. If you're in Toronto, might as well visit this iconic landmark.

I waited 45 minutes to get a ticket to go up the elevator. They told me that the wait was one and a half hour. I did not do it. I just walked around. It seems easier if you have reservations for the restaurant on top.

Been here a few times and each time it is awesome to ride the elevator up to the top. I am not afraid of heights. Bit expensive but when being tour guide to friends from other countries it is worth seeing their expressions.
Enjoyable with incredible views. Weekdays in the summer are better than weekends of course.....less crowds.

awesome way to get a great look from a birds eye view of the city. You'll be shocked by the amount of foliage Toronto actually has. consider dining at the 360 to avoid line-ups and have a good meal at a reasonable price. price includes ride up and access to look-outs.

My wife and I went with our two Grandsons, 14 & 12. It was a nice drive and we could see Lake Ontario on our right occasionally. Toronto was a clean city and the tower was an easy access from QUE expressway. Well worth the visit if you have an extra 100 dollars. The view was excellent.

If you're moderately afraid of heights, no worries -everything is caged in and safe! It's not inexpensive at about US$30 to get to the top, but if you dine at th3 360 Restaurant, they will comp your lift ticket.

It feels top of the world once you go the sky top. It is on 147th floor and the whole world is under you. Wow !The glass bottom lift and walking on the glass bottom floor is a great experience.you can also have some beer in the top floor restaurants.

The CN Tower is the pride of Toronto and of Canada. Historically, it has held the title of world's tallest tower, and even though it no longer can make that claim, it is well worth your time to visit and explore. Be sure t pay the extra money to go up to the Skypod for an even better view of...

You see this sight from everywhere and can't see how you would not go to the Tower. It probably takes about 60-90 minutes depending on how busy it is. Make sure to also go below and watch the video on how it was made and the streetcars. Although the streetcars wasn't as good. Many different views to see outside and...
great viewing o all the way up to the top have lunch or dinner in one of the restaurants take your time

Good experience and views. Minimal queues to get in but quite busy when we were looking around which made it more difficult to look around easily. Didn't do the upper viewing platform (sky pod) or edge walk which looked terrifying. Worth a trip up.
Great structure. Glass floor, outside viewing, sky pod are all amazing. Was expensive 35 each plus added 12 for sky pod.

Being the tallest building in Canada, if you're in Toronto, visiting this tower is a must. From the top, you get such an amazing view of the city! As other reviewers have noted, the CN Tower is a little pricey but it is worth it for the views at the top. You start with a quick elevator ride to the lookout level. Try and position yourself by the elevator door as there are windows next too it and you can watch the outside as you go up which...
A suggestion: go in the end of the day, so you can see the town day-and-night. I couldn't look down the glass floor, but i've seated there with my eyes closed.
My daughter wanted to do the "Edge Walk" at the CN Tower. She did and I watched. The view of the city is breath taking.

If you only visit one place in Toronto this must be it, my wife and I not only visited the tower but had dinner in the restaurant.The view of the city is wonderful from the observation deck is great, the view from the restaurant is even better as you slowly revolve around the tower while you eat.The food...

Unique experience! Our guest loved the view, it was a beautiful sunny day, we could spot Niagara way down at the horizon.The glass floor is scary for some, but its a perfect way to show, what you have below your feet when you so up high.This is the second tallest building on the world...Must visit for the breathtaking...
It's a must do. Sadly a bit cloudy when I went up but it is organised well. Suffered no Queues ( although can be very busy in summer ). Extremely fast lifts to top. Very professionally organised.

I spent last week in Toronto because of work and had the chance to visit CN Tower. I went up to the Skypod - which is the highest possible level you can go. With 5 other people we went up to the top did the "Edge Walk". It was the best thing I have ever experienced in my life. They give you instructions and staff are with you the whole way, They take your picture and a video they give you at the end. The view was spectacular. A must see and do...

Loved it for the 2nd time around just in time for my kid's birthday. We went unplanned after eating lunch with relatives. The weather was really nice so the view from the top was amazing! The glass flooring from the tower and the elevators were very challenging! Overall the view was spectacular! Oh! By the way their security check was...

It was just the two of us at theCN Tower- pretty good for Paul being claustrophobic going up that elevator. And for me who is afraid of heights. We were escorted in and seated on the window side. It certainly looks impressive but gee it was hard to find from the ground. Not really worth the money. Yes, you are in a very tall building. But there's not much of a view. Just an average-looking city and flat lake and flat land. The view from much shorter buildings, such as the Rockefeller Center in New York, or the Vancouver Lookout above Harbour Centre, is much more interesting. If you go, I would...

Although I am afraid of heights, I took the glass elevator ride up to this tall tower and had the view of the whole city of Toronto.It deserves a place in the list of things to do in everyone's lives.If you have time and money, have lunch up there and, although is a little scary standing on the...
The tower is neat to see and neat to go up, but it is pricey at $35. There was no wait when we got there around 3PM on a Sunday and the whole thing was very efficient.
An attraction not to be missed in Toronto. However, it is quite expensive. Try and look for deals before going. The glass floor is really something.

Getting to the upper level of the tower is a wait…buy a ticket, go through metal detector and purse inspection, a second body scan, and a queue for the elevator to go up approx. 400 feet. If you wish to go higher you purchase a second ticket.Once up to the first level (we did not spend the $12 extra...

We had a reservation at the 360 restaurant. When we arrived at the top- you couldn't see anything! I wish someone had told us- total waste. The food was excellent, but would have gone on another day. So if the weather is at all cloudy pick another day!

One of the tallest structures in the World for the longest period of time, the CN Tower a wonderful visit and experience. With the movie floors, the dinning aboce the city, the history on the wall's and the GLASS Floor - it's worth being a dare-devil as you stand on blocks of glass and look below. Toronto from a 350!
The best views Toronto has to offer and a thrill at the same time! The elevator ride is exciting and then to walk on the glass floor above Toronto is something else!!!

The CN Tower is a great place to visit while in Toronto. The ride up was very smooth and fast. The glass floor is cool. Very windy outside walking around. We loved the sign on the doors to the observation deck which said emergency exit. Really, were do you go from there? Down off the side with a parachute? Hopefully...
Very pricey. To be fair I am terrified of heights and outdoor elevators. Once you are up the view is great but other than that I felt it wasn't worth the price of admission.
so much to do, aside from riding up the elevator. You can browse around the lower level for free and have a snack in the cafe.

I saw the world from a different angle for the 1st time. I was amazed at the beauty of the city which I conclude can only be experienced in total relaxation from that height. it is the 1st place I seek to bring my visitors to this province.
great view on a clear day, overpriced restaurant with fair to middling food depending on the chef. Horrifically overpriced to look out a window.
I visited CN Tower with my friends who had came from Europe. It was already dark outside and the view was amazing. I was proud to show how my city is beautiful.

Definitely a looker! Go to the CN tower and 360 restaurant. It was pricey but well worth fitting into our budget. Considering the elevator ride and tour was included in dinner pricing, made for a great evening among the clouds.

Had a great time! Its a little pricey, but leared a lot about the construction of this iconic structure, and the view from the top was incredible (especially the glass floor). A must see when in Toronto.
Stunning view of Toronto and the area! On a beautiful, clear day you can even see the mist from Niagra Falls!One might consider it a little pricey, but in my opinion it's well worth it!

They have a package which includes food at the restaurant on top, preferred access to the lifts and a visit to the aquarium. The package is worth it. The food was excellent, the view extraordinary, and the aquarium was very interesting.
Going to Toronto and not going up in the CN Tower would be a huge mistake. Sure, it can be pricey, but if you buy one of the city of Toronto attraction bundles it works out not too bad.
Great tourist attraction many great vistas of Toronto. Pricey but get city pass on Costco website for cheaper!

You have to go up the CN tower if in Toronto. it is Toronto and perhaps a Canadian Icon landmark. It is pricey but man you can see all of Toronto and New York, great view. Step out on the glass floor to test your fear of heights...lol
The restaurant and food is excellent ...great view ! Recommend to everyone when in Toronto ..Could be a romantic dinner when ordering wine.

A trip to Toronto wouldn't be complete without going up the tower. The view is great as expected but the glass floor was a little crowded so you need to be patient. I took my sister and her family up and we all had a fantastic time. A true Canadian landmark, I love to show this place off and it is the perfect place to show off Toronto! What fun!
A must see when visiting Tornoto, great views, not too busy, no queue, not too expensive. Glass floor good fun can see right in to the Rogers Center, home of the Blue Jays.

This seems to be a must if you're a visitor to Toronto but in my opinion, you can give it a miss and you won't have missed much. This was my 3rd trip to the top of CN Tower, and my fiance's first visit. Lots of interesting information - including how the tower was constructed, and a history of the world's tallest structures. We visited in the late afternoon, watched the sunset and stayed until after dark. Outstanding views! Highly recommended.

The view of the city of Toronto was magnificent and not to be missed.A little scary standing on the glass floor but no more so that facing outward in the glass sided elevator..The food in the restaurant was good, but not the best I've ever eaten, however the view more than made up for it.Would highly recommend...
You should visit it and have a look below. Very beautiful at night with the changing lights. The sight from it is beautiful.

we had booked a meal in the 360 restaurant and the welcome was friendly. We had a window seat and the views were breathtaking.Food was superb even though a bit pricey but what an experience.then out to the observation deck with a glass floor. fantastic.

Expensive for just a lift ride. But if you are in Toronto, and using pass - go for it! Nice views from up there, and walking on a glass-see-thru floor can be an experience. Outside can get really cold as it is high after all. Go early to avoid queues.

Barring the long queue in the entrance if you are visiting CN Tower in holidays / weekends, everything else is superb here. After a long lifting-up by elevator, you'll be placed in an industrial glass-enclosed terrace where you can get bird's eye-view of the entire city and even some part of New York, if skies are clear. Nice and prestigious, a great touristic expreince, including a visit at the tower and it's glass floor. the restaurant turns 360!! preety awsome!!
Good view of the city from a height and looks best in the nightLocated centrally surrounded by buildings a place to see and worth the visit
Best time to go there on a bright sunny day where you could see the Niagara Falls. The glass floor is exciting & scary. Elevator ride helped me conquer my fear of heights.
This is one of the classic Toronto tourist traps but it is totally worth it for the view and the glass floor.

I'm surprised to say that I really enjoyed this much more than I thought that I would. It was actually one of the best experiences that I had in Toronto (outside of a sporting event). Whilst in Toronto we opted to eat at the restaurant and have a look around the tower too. I wasn't expecting the food to be very good as usually these places have such high demand it's not all cooked from fresh but the food was gorgeous! Using top quality ingredients partnered with an exceptional view made for a very nice...
Excellent viewpoint to get a birds eye view of the city.Interesting facts and figures and a slightly scary experience of walking on glass with nothing below you.Nice outing.

we had to wait about 15 minutes to get the elevator to the top. As we go up, the glass elevator on the side gave us a preview of what we will see at the top.They have a glass floor in part of the viewing area, and for those brave enough, can look straight down and see the ball...

Went here on a Saturday afternoon. There was a long waiting line, but withing five minutes we were already at the ticket booth, all of the registers were open. Inside there was also a waiting line before the elevators but that one also went quick. The view from the top is amazing! Was a clear blue sky so could see...
Excellent experience! You just have to be there to enjoy it!Excelente experiencia! tienes que ir para disfrutarlo!
Lunch in the CN Tower is well worth the visit - the food and service are first class but the view over Toronto was a highlight not to be missed while in Toronto - highly recommended.

Excellent trip to this iconic Toronto attraction. This is the exception to the rule that Toronto is "not a tourist city". You can enjoy uninterrupted views for miles around and for the more adventurous amongst you you can do the EdgeWalk or for free you can walk across the glass floor. I suppose it was low season in June because there was no queue at all. Great view all over the city.

Been to Toronto,Ontario Canada; four times. Last time in 1997. A wonderful;beautiful clean city. Went to the CN Tower. Went to the very top. Tooked several pictures of the city. Also,been to Niagara Falls;Ontario;went to...

I went on a beautiful sunny day and the views over the whole of Toronto and Lake Ontario were amazing! There was also information dotted around at both the observation deck and by the shop on the ground floor which was interesting. The glass floor was also really good, if a bit scary! Now for a little more than $30 Canadian, you can be whisked up in 58 seconds to two observation areas some 115 stories above Toronto. Other than the view was 0% due to weather and we were only in town for the day we had a good time. I would recommend only going up if the visibility is good.
Fabulous experience with great views but did not do the lean out over the top....no way. The queues were short and the journey in the lift was smooth and fast.
The view from the CN Tower is without a doubt stunning - especially on a sunny day. It's one of Toronto's best attractions and should not be missed!
High tourist area but obviously great views of Toronto. There are several extras involved in visiting the tower including dining. This is a must do when in Toronto.
Excellent place for site seeing the view at night time is very beautiful, the Restaurant in the CN is very nice very romantic.
The CN Tower is unique from other tall buildings like the Willis and John Hancock Towers in Chicago. We were also happy that we did not have to wait in a long line before traveling to the top.

Lunch at the top of the tower is well worth the experience. The seafood platter is fabulous and if you're on a budget there is a two course lunch for $55 Canadian. The revolving restaurant gives the most spectacular views across Toronto, you can see across the lake to Niagara, the islands and planes taking off from the small airport....

I visited the Tower as advised by a colleague an hour before sunset and after queueing for only a few minutes had paid and was in. I had not pre -booked although I visited in June on a Wednesday. I opted for the ticket with the extra lift ride to the highest observation area which was quieter and the views...

I guess a must for tourists visiting toronto. Visit the main deck at around 9 pm, the time was great since I could enjoy both the day-view and evening view of the great city view beneath. The small pod above 400 meter is small but offer a different experience, because it makes me feel very close to the sky, worth...
We had a great time at the CN Tower. The sky was perfectly clear, and we could see the entire city of Toronto perfectly. Definitely a must-do if you are in the area.

This is not a place to see if afraid of heights starting from the elevator to walking on the glass floor, I feel my stomach to my mouth. It is amazing to see the beautiful city all around it and the lake. Helpful and courteous staff.
Apart form the long wait to get into the lifts, it was worth it to see the view of Toronto. The glass floor in the lifts and on the skywalk were an added bonus.
Amazing views of the city as you would expect. Glass floor is interesting. Expect queues, but a must see when in Toronto.
excellent views of Toronto. The staff at the restaurant were VERY helpful and the lunchtime snack was excellent
We had visitors who loved this better than anything else in Toronto. This a must for any visitor. However, at $53.00 pp it is expensive. I would not go back personally
The view is really cool and all, but it is 72 dollars just to go up really high. Overall, you can see some really cool parts of Toronto, but still is a little pricey.
Tallest building. You have to do it if you are in Toronto. It has a glassy floor and kids loved it. I regret I did not do the walk off the top.
One of the defining images of Toronto, even Canada perhaps. A must-visit. The view is simply stunning!

I have been here twice in just over a year. I brought 5 or 6 high schoolers and it was a hit both times. The best was walking on the outside observation deck and feeling like you would blow away! It is a bit pricey but we did spend hours each time. Good value.

The view was good. In a good day, you can see the entire city. If you have been to a few high towers or observation spots, however, this CN tower does not give you any fantastic view - just some ordinary buildings from a different angle. The price is too high - it costs you C$53 for one adult to...

The tower is easy to get to in Toronto and doesn't cost anything to visit if you eat at the 360 Revolving Restaurant at top of the tower. Great menu and great views. Food was the best and I'll definitely go back on my next visit to the city.

Bought tickets online and when I got to the front desk they asked me for my credit card and a proof for ID. I asked them that if the my ticket was a present and I didn't have the credit cad what would have happened. They told me they would have to call the person who bought the ticket as...
Went up the CN tower and the views from up there are amazing, this is a must do if your going to Toronto.
it is a tall building with a excellent viewlovely helpfull staff which are only to willing to answer all your silly questions
dinner at the CN Tower is always a treat, great food & service, we arrived in day light & stayed for well over 3 hours to see the city lights by night. Fantastic views

The CN Tower offers a grand view of Toronto, near and far of the city. Plus on one side you can see inside the baseball field, Roger's Centre, where we actually saw the game taking place. We went to the tower before sunset and stayed after sunset. After sunset the view is spectacular. There is a restaurant which we did...
Must see if you visit Toronto. Enjoyed the view of the city and even walked across the glass floor! Very quickly across the glass floor, might I add! Well worth it!
The view from the top is AMAZING. It looks like you are sitting somewhere in sky and watching a beautiful city on the earth.

Great experience to ride up the elevator and see Toronto from the observation level, it really gives you a great perspective on the city. The glass floor is freaky but fun. We chose to have lunch in the 360 restaurant so admission to the observation level was free, a savings of $32 per adult.
This is a must. You know...you go up the elevators and take a visual tour of the city from above. Great views and a glass floor to temp fate. WAY TOO EXPENSIVE, but a must do.

CN Tower Toronto is a must try "experience" when visitting Toronto... The view is amazing, the restaurant amazing, the glass floor a great gimmick.. Visitting CN Tower, You have to take full tour and see the city from the "Pod" - the Tower is an amazing construction and indeed a living proof of what visions are...
Must see, glass floor, speedy elevator, just acceptable restaurant, 40 CADs are a lot, windows were dirty although early in the morning.

There was a really good view of the city at night, especially roger centre which is directly below. The glass floor was also...interesting. It was a bit scary but really cool. There was some cool info around the place too; like that CN Tower was the highest building in the world for 35 years. Only thing I thought kinda sucked...
Great view, get there early or late to avoid the queues. All very well presented with happy cheery staff
It was really nice, the view is awesome from the CN Tower. The price is a bit too high, I think. But since I don't usually do it, it was worth it !

My friends and I left after 15 minutes. I was very disappointed with the glass floor. It was so small!Maybe the view is better during the day since you can see everything clearly.I'm just glad that I didn't have to wait in line since I went up at 10pm.

CN Tower was and OK TIME. This was our first trip to the top of Toronto. I must say it is bit pricey. But now I can say. I have gone up the CN Tower! Do not think I will do it again. Just because of the cost factor. Try it at least once. Great views.

It's breathtaking and very picturesque view if you go just before sunset so you have the opportunity to see Toronto with area in daylight and in the evening with all the lights that gives Toronto fantastic viewLate spring or early fall is the best time
Avoid the long line. Book a table at the revolving Restaurant .Food very good , Cannot beat the view on a clear day.

We were going to just visit the tower but on checking the price we decided it was better value for money to dine too. If you book a table you get free entrance to observation deck after dining. The dining experience itself was amazing and even now, back home we are agreed this was our best meal of our holiday....

I went up the CN Tower for the first time since I was a kid recently. It was still just as fun as I remember, but SO expensive. $35 a person, plus $12 more if you want to go to the higher deck. Once you get up there, the glass floor is always crowded so it's hard to get a...

I go regularly to TO for work but rarely play tourist. This time I went with colleagues that had never been there so got to enjoy the most basic attraction in TO. The CN Tower is a must do at least once! I had not been there in several years and it just does not get old. The view of...

A bit pricey to justify the journey - but an incredible experience that cannot be missed for anyone visiting the city. I have been up many times and I still relish the amazing views and experience of travelling high above the city.

No visit to Toronto is complete without a visit to the top of the CN Tower. It's gorgeous to look out from the top over the water and the city. Very memorable. It was our teens first trip up and they both loved it.

The CN tower is a great place to take your children for a 360 view of Toronto and miles away , fun for all ages to go up and sight see !!! The restaurant is pricey but while eating rotates the whole time !! If your going to Toronto it's a must visit for all ages !!!

purchased a CityPass which encompassed this attraction. Tallest building in North America so you should head up and check it out. Views are great and you can pay an extra $12 to go up to the Skypod (330 meters higher). Gift shop and rotating restaurant. Get your picture taken..the glass floor is kinda neat as well :)

The Tower is worth a trip due to the incredible view and the small but scary glass floor section that you can walk on and look straight down. There is enough staff to keep things moving along quickly and smoothly. I'd consider eating at the cafe if you go up after noon. We were too early to dine there but...
Nice view from the top, but incredibly expensive experience. The rotating restaurant is delicious and an original experience, for a price.

Arriving in Toronto for the first time the one landmark that grabs your attention right away is the CN Tower. It is essential to tour this landmark when visiting the city. When planning a visit to the CN Tower I highly recommend participating in the edge walk experience. The views on the main lookout level of the tower pale in...

I thought this attraction was very overpriced for what it is. There were great views, but it is a very quick visit. The elevators were packed uncomfortably full on our rides up and down so you couldn't really enjoy the ride. The glass floor was too crowded to really go on. The Skypod was definitely not worth the extra money....
Love this place every time we visit...Make this stop part of your vacation if you are from in or out of town.
I have been here many times but I have not ever been inside. My friends posted pics of the food they were served here so me & my wife hope to go check it out soon.

It's up to you whether you want to get the photos or not. One set for 25$; two for 35$. The officer claimed in the beginning that it was a free shot, but......Overall this is a great place to go. The tour ladies standing in the lift are wonderful and honorable.
A tourist trap for sure, but a good one. I enjoyed the ride up and the views. It can be a little steep but if you buy a City Pass it should be fine.

This is the first thing my husband and I visited two hours after landing in Toronto. We paid about £35 ft the two of us which I thought was quite a bit for a 20 minute attraction although stunning. You go up in a glass elevator all the way to the top, you can walk around the tower outside up...

I have visited lot of observation desk during my travels. CN tower is special because it was build by Concrete. The structure was free standing concrete structure. Observation desk was amazing and I ll visit this place agian while my next visit to Toronto..

The tower itself has 3 viewing levels, the enclosed area at 1,100 ft, another one just below which is open to the elements and gives you a real sense of how high up you are, but the best view of Toronto you are going to get will be from the Sky Pod which is 1,400 ft. From here, on a...

The new summer security system had started the day we visited, but mid-morning there was no queue and we got in very quickly. Fantastic views of the city and the islands. We paid extra to go to the second stage and it was worth it. Expensive, but one of those things you just have to do.

This is a very crowded attraction and the payoff is less than impressive if you have been to Chicago, New York, Niagara Falls, or Jasper, Alberta. It's ok to get a city view, but otherwise not that great.
We booked the meal at the CN tower and we were so impressed with the food, service and the view. We were not rushed and it was one of the most amazing experiences in Toronto.

Went mid afternoon about a 20 min wait from buying admission to the tower to reaching the top. The day I went up, the weather was mostly sunny so the views were very good. There different price levels if you want to go tho highest level than it going to cost more. Worth it if you like heights. But still...

This is well worth a visit and the views around the city are amazing. The staff were very efficient at getting customers through security and then up the tower ever though it can be very busy. The glass floor is amazing and a good photo opportunity! Reasonable cost to get in and the option to go even further up the...

It's a cool place to go once during the day and when it's dark.I would make it a point to do it at least once.We did it the 1st time we came to toronto 7 years ago. The past 6 times, new teammates went up but people who went before just drank at the bars while we waited...
Did this about years ago what an experience glass floor bit scared to look down wing walking did appeal to me not brave at all amazing experience
Really loved this place. A bit scary in the lift going up but views are truly fantastic. Toronto island from the sky was so lovely and the skyline of Toronto was breath taking from the tower

For a special meal the CN Tower is just the ticket. The waiting staff were very attentive and helpful, the food was well cooked and tasty and good value for money considering the situation on the restaurant and the spectacular views. Overall a great experience.
The trip to the viewing level and the glass floor was exhilarating. Well worth the visit, views of Toronto were fantastic even though the weather wasn't fabulous.

When I asked my guide to tell me few best places to visit Toronto ,he took the name of c n tower ,from the height you can see the sky view of whole city ,the same view you see from Empire State Building in New York City ,while visiting Toronto one must not miss this place

No queues, no fuss, not overpriced, this is a must do attraction, you won't be disappointed. The views are stunning and make you feel so small. Staff pleasant and helpful. All in all a good value, unhurried wonderful attraction.
a must see attraction when visiting Toronto!!! amazing views of the city!! make sure you visit the cn tower on a clear day!
I love going there in Winter time, you can't go out to the balcony though as it's cold.The restaurant there is great, i got my veggie burger with french fries.
Great views from the top, can see for miles. Go early in high season to avoid the queues. Great to view at night when lit up and serves as an excellent direction finder in the city.

I visited the CN Tower partly to conquer my fear of heights, and because when you visit Toronto, you really can't NOT go! The admission for the tower visit alone is $35 for an adult. If you want to access the SkyPod, it is an extra $12. They pack the elevator so tight you really can't experience the glass floor...
To feel the beauty of height.. overview the Toronto city and the lake ontario from the top and do the sky walk and enjoy the resaurant at one of the highest places in the world...

The trip in the very fast 'Charlie and the Chocolate Factory' list was the best bit of this for me. You are basically high up, can look across Toronto at a lot of things you don't recognise and jump up and down on the glass floor if that sort of thing does it for you. You can also strap yourself...
Exciting expirience, the highest building in north America.i am proud that i had an oportunity to be there.Exrraordinary view from the top of the world.If you have chsnce dont miss it.
We loved the views- the lines were not long, and the staff was friendly- For $12 more, you go the final 400 feet up, and have a 360 degree view of Ontario and the Lake.

The lift on the outside of the building is cool as you watch yourself go up the tower, and the glass floor is cool, not too busy when we went, and although it isn't one massive glass floor, rather large panes of glass, that is scary enough when you are looking at the drop beneath you!!

The CN tower is a very cool experience. The elevator travels pretty quickly, but still takes about a minute to make its way to the top. The view is spectacular if it is a clear day. We went in the late afternoon, and the fog was rolling in from Lake Ontario, so many of the sights were covered because the...

The lift up to the Tower was quick . Views were stunning . I also visited the top tower which was better than the main tower as there was a 360deg view and you could watch the brave(lunatics!) leaning out over the tower

We went to the CN Tower for a birthday visit requested by a 5 year old, who enjoyed the visit very much. The view is spectacular, and worth the price of admission. The elevator is very quick and smooth, so much so that you are there in less than a minute. As some have commented, the glass floor is really...
Loved the walk over the glass floor. The ride up the lift was quick and views great. Short walk inside but can walk all around the tower outside. Well fenced.

The glass floor is a wrong advertising...there are about 6 glass squares with 300 people wanting to step on it. Really disappointing.The other negative was how the outside deck is secured. With this dense steal net all the view is gone and forget to take any pictures.Other high towers have much better setting, where you can at least...

We had a very nice visit going up the CN Tower. I am not crazy for heights but I thought I'd give it a try. I was not the least bit scared and was able to look out at the city of Toronto and enjoy the views. There is one spot where you can stand on plexiglass and look down...

My two little ones (5 and 3 years old) loved going up the CN Tower (which they periodically referred to as the Space Needle). The views are great. We used The City Pass and avoided a long line to purchase tickets.

Visited Toronto second time and made sure to visit the CN tower again. It was on Sunday, the lines were kind of short with quick service Ticket price is $35 plus tax .if you want to ride all the way to the top add $12 moreTook a little pause at the restaurant where we didn't eat but the beer...

Overall the CN tower is really good but for someone afraid of heights maybe not the best option! It was busy but not overly so that you felt cramped. Stayed about an hour on the observation deck and the glass floor. The glass floor area was mobbed and people just lie down all over it without consideration of others waiting...
We decided to have lunch here which gave us access to the grass floored viewing level. The food was excellent and service from Bill was great.
The experience was amazing! Especially the sky pod. You can see the earth curve you are so high up. They have see through glass too. I personally thought it was amazing.
Its super expensive and once you walk around you're basically done. Don't get me wrong, the view is beautiful but the price just isn't worth it.. in my opinion
Loved this attraction - the views were amazing although the glass floor was pretty small. We were lucky it was such a clear and sunny day and we could see for miles all round. Well worth a visit.
If you want a fantastic view of the city and surrounding area this is the place to come, wonderful 360 degree views and unique view of the Blue Jays stadium.

we pre booked our Edgewalk - there are no refunds. You can reschedule, but we were only in this area for 1 day and live in Chicago. Not an option. It rained all day, but the Edgewalk was not cancelled. My family did the Edgewalk and you could not see anything but clouds. This was good for us, because it...

Even though a very expensive attraction, the first-time visitor would probably enjoy a visit here. It is nothing more than a stunning view of the city - and a restaurant with food of low quality. Enjoy the sight, and then leave for a better restaurant experience down town. Toronto have a LOT of good restaurants.
An architectural achievement of the past century. A must visit to all people travelling to Canada. I suggest eating at the restaurant on top of the tower it has excellent food and breathtaking views.

Being one of the highest buildings in the world (3rd at the moment) with 553m there's no doubt that it offers the best views of the city. On a clear day you can even see the city of Rochester over the Lake Ontario (which we did when we visited it). It has a main deck at an altitude of around...
We went to the 360 restaurant at CN tower which is revolving. The food was out of this world as were the views. The price includes the public areas but these were nothing in comparison

The glass floor covered such a small area. The staff said the whole floor is glass but because people were so scared, they coverd most of it with carpet. Everyone had to take turns to have step onto the glass floor.Paid CAD35 to step on a piece of glass that had zero thrill factor.We were utterly disappointed.
I am afraid of heights, so maybe this was not the best attraction to choose, haha. Regardless, I have been here a couple times and each time is is breathtaking once you get to the top!

This was a fun tourist indulgence. The view from the top was great. I enjoyed a drink at the bar after walking around outside the lower ring. One can go higher but I chose not to. If in Toronto, why not go to the tower
I waited to go up there for years as didn't see the value of it but did go with the grandchildren in the winter break. A good view of Toronto city!!!

The CN Tower experience is literally a once-in-a-lifetime experience. Really, its super expensive, so you'd better enjoy it. I paid like $200+ dollars for 4 people to go to the top. It was amazing, but I won't do it again.
CN Tower was definitely one to go up if you like fast lifts, Toronto was a nice place, very friendy with some good bars and restaurants

Came here with my bestie, had dinner, which was ok. Had a pass up to the next floor. The price for dinner included the entrance fee but we had to buy the next floor up separately. Stunning views! Would definitely go up again!

This can be a bit hit and miss with regards to seeing anything, as the fog can come down quite quickly.If the weather is good expect long queues for tickets and longer queues for elevators.When you are up be prepared to be surrounded with screaming kids - they are everywhere.The glass floored section is a bit of...

This was to be a special meal - and in many respects it was. The way in was confusing but once we got past the vagrant asleep on the corridor floor leading to the lifts it improved. Reception and booking was well handled and having made the decision here months in advance we received the promised table by the window...
Buy your tickets the day before online! The line was long but moved fairly quick but still it was a long line. You only really need a solid hour here.
An icon in Toronto, this is a highlight for tourists. The views are fantastic on a clear day. Get here early to beat the crowds.

We had so much rain & fog that we didn't think we would make it to the tower. Finally the sun took over & we went right away. It was a weekday evening & not busy at all. The ride up the elevator was amazing. The views were stellar and my kids had fun taking pictures on the glass floor....

not usually what i go in for, but once we got up there, thrilling! Went late evening, so not so crowded, the lights were spectacular! However, cuz it was later, concessions & gift shop area closed. And to bad they had to wire shut the open air deck. Still worth the exorbitant fee as it was once in a lifetime.

I've been to a few high building - Empire State, John Hancock Tower etc. - none of them rate compared to the CN Tower. Well organised, very fast elevators, brilliant views, reasonable prices. The "movies" as you leave are quite dated and a bit disappointing - you could give them a miss unless you want a seat for a few...
this attraction is a must see as the view is amazingly breathtaking and even better on the edge walk if you are brave enough

The CN Tower is the typical mark of Toronto. It is located between the Ripley's Aquarium and the Rogers Centre (the "home" of the Blue Jays baseball team). With a beatiful view of the entire city, since the viewing stage is at 346 meters of altitude (equivalent to about 114 floors), it has attractives as a glass floor at some...
great view of Toronto city and surroundings. Be sure to go up if not clouded or you will not be able to see much.
I was here 30 years ago, and I was still impressed the same way as then. Then open walk had to be pre-ordered, so that have to be next time...
I love this tower. Great views, busy but worth the trip and expense. Try to visit on non holiday due to the number of tourist. Once in a lifetime trip! Need to try the floor window!

The view is nice. I suggest coming when is sunset so you can see the view at day and night time in Toronto. Tickets are expensive. There is also a restaurant on the lower level which they rent for all kinds of celebrations, so check before buying the ticket, because if it's rented you wont be able to see the...
I loved it the first time I went but after that if u go with ur visitor u eill find it boring hhhhh but try it for once it is good. Avoid cloudy days
OK so a cloudy damp day, but still great views, the lift staff are very informative, all the staff are really nice.The ground floor cafe sales area is well laid out, a must for any visit to Toronto.

The edge walk at the CN Tower is excellent. It's long enough to feel you didn't get ripped off and quick enough so it doesn't get tiresome. You also get an unbelievable and unobstructed view of the entire city and Lake Ontario.It is a little pricey at around $200 but at least you also get to go back up...

We were there afternoon of 06 June 2015.Positive - everyone can see the 360 of Toronto. While the entrance queue was long, the ticket booths were effcient.Nice transparent walking glass.Negative - the photography guy inside the tower, where he can take souvenir photo, was very rude.
The CN tower is just ok...but the view is beautiful. If you are visiting Toronto and have time to kill I suggest you go.
It's a nice touch! Loved the glass floor of the observatory. Pretty cool experience. Would recommend visiting during sunset so you get both day and night experience!

A bit expensive. I'm not sure it's strictly worth it, but it's one of those things you do just to do it. We chose to wait until after dark for the night view, which was beautiful. The glass floor was fun (and a little unnerving) with a view of the baseball stadium below. You can get some decent pictures out...

great view. The experience is once in a lifetime walking on the glass floor, going outside and feeling the wind blow as you are around 1400 feet up. Must do the skypod since you are there ( this requires more money to be spent) Wr checked out the 360 restaurant but I could not imagine eating and moving at the...

I love heights, and this was really great. The glass floors were a little scary at first, but people were laying on the floor. Being able to see Lake Ontario and almost to Niagara. Then looking straight down at the ant sized people. It was great fun.

This is a must-do when visiting Toronto but be prepared to pay for it. The CN tower is an iconic symbol of Toronto and defines the skyline. To see the city from the vantage point of the tower is a unique experience. However, it will put a dent in the wallet to get this view, especially if you are bringing...
The area around the CN tower is awesome along with the view. Really can't beat the photos from the top. This stop is a must see for all visitors.

I live in Seattle, so I consider myself a connoisseur of space-age towers. This one's not nearly as impressive from the ground, but if you can stand the brutal wait, you'll be rewarded with a decent view of the surroundings.

it is quite pricey but I think it's totally worth it. the view is gorgeous, the food is delicious (we ate at horizons), and it's definitely memorable. I really think it's something you should do at least once in your lifetime and it's such a great way to spend the day in Toronto.
If you go to CN Tower, don´t forget to do the Edge Walk! It is Awesome and the view up there is beautiful!It worth every penny.

Make sure you visit the restaurant for a great relaxed meal watching the views across Toronto. Watch the weather pass bye. The glass floor is smaller than I expected. If you are brave enough sign up for the edge walk.
Highly recommend going on a weekday morning to avoid lines and crowds. Also, book in advance on line to avoid the same and save time. The restaurants are closed in the mornings there when we went.

Went there after a gap of 10-15 year and everybody can expect the view is amazing, giving you a grand overview over the greater Toronto area.The elevator is blazingly quick so don't look down or walk on the glass panels if you can't handle heights to good or if speed can make you dizzy ;)It does cost circa...

CN Tower was a wonderful place to go! It had the best view of the city. Great to combine with a trip to the aquarium. We had a wonderful time! The food was a bit pricey and when they take your photo, you are not told when they do it but friendly people and a
Ive visited CN Tower on two occasions now and you simply won't get a better view of the Toronto area than you will from up top. We did have to queue for quite some time though - but worth it
It's fantastic place to be. The glass floor is just amazing. The view at Night of the city from here has got a different feel to it.
What a great place to visit in Toronto. Anyone visiting should make it a must see.Taking the elevator to the top will give you spectacular views
Great view. So-so food. Okay but price should give you a better quality dinner. Good service though.

column3: Los Ranchos de Albuquerque, New Mexico
column4: This is a great place to go especially if you are attending other sites in the area such as the ball park, distillery or aquarium. Really gives you the view of the city. Although this is interesting it would rank below the zoo and aquarium on the list of things to do.

An engineering marvel. Recommend visiting in the dark with all the lights on. The glass floor was amazing. Felt the entrance fee was expensive. Make a reservation at the revolving restaurant called 360 and get a free entrance to the observatory deck. Parking is exepnsive and a pain if you are travellng by car.
The glass floor is thrilling, (but also scary!) This is a great event-but VERY expensive at about $35 CA-we did this as part of the "city-pass"

Brought my children here and they enjoyed it very much. As well as I did too. The experience you feel when looking down from such a height is exhilarating. Being able to walk across the glass floor just as much.This is a must stop if you are visiting Toronto.
The glass floor is just creepy, looking down at the ground way below, but overall lovely views and a must do in Toronto.

Without visiting this iconic structure of Toronto your visit will be incomplete to one of the most multicultural city of the world. Do not forget to visit the observation tower and have lunch at the restaurant. Those who are brave can have an "outside" hanging tour at few hundred feet height.
A must when in Toronto great views of the city. The glass floor section is also a good touch! Lines seemed to move pritty quick too. All in all I'm glad I did it.
Really enjoyed the ride! There was a little bit of line-up cause we went on a national holiday, but line was moving quick.

One nice thing about the CN Tower is that it is open until 10:30 when planning your day. We didn't take advantage of buying tickets online and ended up paying full price at the Tower. We did pay the surcharge to go up to the Skypod which is SO much higher and smaller and scarier that the observation deck. Leaving...

I did not feel that the experience was worth almost 40 CAD dollars. The lifts are fast and offer a view of your journey going up but the guide had clearly lost the will to live. His monotonous greeting and invitation to ask questions was delivered without a smile or any show of interest in his passengers.The view from...

Wanted to take a trip to the top, but it's a little pricy. The ride up is spectacular, and a sunny day only added to the specical. I don't think I would do it again because of the price (over $30) but don't regret doing it once.

Up so high the view during day is crisp and clear....see the lake Ontario,the Billy Bishop airport...the Porter airlines planes take off..The night view is just intoxicating,go there with someone you love...the Condos nearby have open balconies..
The nightscape of Toronto is so gooood! You can go there around sunset time then you could see both of sunset and nightscape! The glass was not clean and full of finger print...

From the tower, once the highest building in the world, you ca see far, in all directions. Perfect for getting to know the city of Toronto better. Don't miss the glass roof. If you look down, there is about 340 meters to the ground. Scary!

It's a great place to go to get a view of Toronto and a sense of the geography of the city - and how green it really is.Fun for kids to lie on glass floor (brings out the vertigo in all of us). Fun for tourists...fun for Torontonians.
The observation deck is pretty cool, and so are the elevators (they have a partially glass floor and windows looking out to the city), but the admission was pretty expensive.

I was hesitant and skeptical but my kids begged me to go. The entry was pricey but we found a coupon for 15%. I have been to many of these observation decks- Dubai, Seattle, New York even Dallas. Nothing spectacular here, views of skyscrapers and Lake Ontario. Beware of student groups on field trips, we had several groups today and...

If you're a tourist, this is almost a "must-do" in Toronto.So I get why it costs so much. $35CAN for about an hour is expensive, but the glass floor really does deliver.Ugh, this place also makes you take a photo that they *hope* you will buy after you experience the attraction. Why, why, why? Just stop it already!

Although it is expensive the edge walk in the CN tower was an experience I'll never forget. Staying over Toronto and the views were incredible, especially as it was a clear evening. I would not recommend doing this if it's cloudy as I don't think you will see much.

Here on vacation with friends and had a meal up at the restaurant on top that spins an entire revolution every 72 mins. The restaurant was posh and provides for a free visit to the observation deck and glass bottom floor. They sat us by the window to enjoy our meal but with poor visibility when we went.I will...

You can't visit Toronto and not do the tower. Fab views of the city. Also on the way back to collect our hire car we walked the whole way round the Blue Jays Stadium and saw all the fans waiting to get in. Really soaked up the atmosphere and were sad to leave Toronto. Three days not enough.

CN TOWER is the very nice place to visit. We can see from the tower but it's take extra cost for going to the top it's take 37 dollar per person. I like the glass flour. I was scared of falling down from the tower. We fill that we are looking down from the sky.

My boyfriend was invited to a function at the horizon restaurant so we were able to go but to the observatory and the glass floor for free in the evening. It was nice but not amazing, would have been disappointed if i had paid

You can't visit Toronto without passing at the CN Tower. From the top you can see amazing landscapes of the entire city, the islands, the lake, airport. If possible, try to go at the end of the day while the sun is still up but will soon be down, the sunset from above is breathtaking! ;)

I've been up the CN tower a couple of times, but haven't been since the early 2000's. I went up with a group who had never been. For $30+ it is an adventure for sure. They have added some new elements including glass floors on the elevators (freaky!) and that walk on the edge part (for extra money). The glass...
35 dollars is expensive but the views are spectacular. Entrance is a bit chaotic and lack of signeage leads to confusion, we went in the late afternoon and walked straight in

A memorable experience, went up on a clear day, so we could see the USA in the distance. I would say for all those looking to visit pay the extra bucks to get to the very top, it is well worth it.It is expensive, but for the experience, it is well worth it

I don't mean to sound dismissive and perhaps I've visited too many of these skytower type attractions but it wasn't a stand out experience to me. I was told that on a clear day you can see Niagara Falls - we didn't but that would be really amazing. The location is good - right near the Ripley's Aquarium so at...
I'll never forget the time I went up that tower. Really should go if you have kids. It's like skydiving but a little safer. If you go up you can see all of Toronto.

I did the Edge Walk as well but will just review the inside attractions for this post. After the Edge Walk I was a bit disappointed by the inside, but my friend who didn't do the Edge Walk enjoyed it. It was dark when we did it, and I don't think the Sky Pod was worth the extra $12 to...
We had a fantastic meal on Saturday the staff were superb and we were not rushed at all. Well worth doing.

Very long line to get to the observation deck. Lovely quick life journey however once your in there. Security is very swift, just walk through a portal that fans you. Quite difficult to take pictures once your inside due to the lighting. A great Canadian landmark everyone should visit. A few things to do also once you're in there. Managed...
The trip atop the CN Tower is an experience like none other. The glass floor is a must visit as it gives you perspective as to just how high up you are.
I went to the tower when Sparkles was a nightclub there. That was in the 80's. I assume the night club is still there but maybe called something different, shirt and tie place so classy.

The tower is a must do. this amazing building has so much to show, inside there is all the history and other interesting facts about the tower and toronto.the veiws from thr top are undescribable and so beautiful. we spent hours just looking out over the city and water/iceTo mention as well the staff were amazing and so...

The prices to go up the CN Tower hae sky-rocketed since my last visit, purchased a ticket to view the sites and a feature movie being presented about the Toronto Tramway System.The CN Tower was very busy that day, which made it difficult to enjoy the views, and the whole point of my visit was to see the feature...
Their unique glass floor provided a unique experience one will never forget. Just imagine walking on glass more than 110 storeys high. Not for the faint-hearted.
A little pricey for more than one person as the basic package is nothing more than an elevator ride (no tour guide etc.) however, overall it is a great experience with fantastic views.

From the moment you enter the lifts you start an amazing experience. The lift operator gives you fun facts about how fast and how quickly you get to the top. Once at the top you have 3 choices the glass floor , the observation deck a floor up and the sky hub which is another lift up several floors. Doesn't...

Not for the faint hearted however, I would recommend going up for the views. The glass floor is amazing looking down through, not so good if your scared of heights like myself though. You can also go outside round the tower which is covered in security wire for safety, some magnificent views not to be missed.

Have been 3times now and the views still amaze me,if ur in toronto and get the chance to go up the cn tower then do not miss it,stunning on a clear day,not to mention the view looking down through the glass floor at the bluejays football stadium is fasinating and terrifying,you will remember the trip forever

Mmmm....not sure about this one. Expectations are bigger and better than the actual reality. Big views from the top, but nothing mega to see in reality. Obviously if you're in Toronto for the first time, then do go and do it and form your own opinion.

The cost for this was CAD$36 (Oh why oh why don't the Canadians add their tax to prices straight off?!? So confusing when what you see is NOT what you get!) Its actually cheaper to book on line, or part of the Toronto Attraction package. On a good day the views are totally fabulous. You have a great view all...

It a great adventure but since I am a bit afraid of height I did not like the glass area where you can look down and see the ground from so many floors above. It was an adventure new and different for me; but all in all good and dearing for me.

Went up the tower was great fun. Cost 37 dollars plus tax extra if you want to go up higher. Walked round the viewing platform and stood on the small section of glass floor then went to other section which is outside so you can hear the noise and feel the wind. Lots to look at.
