Liked looking down on...

Whether you are a visitor to the City of Toronto or you reside here, the CN Tower remains one of the top places of interest.Be prepared to pay for admission, and the higher you go, it will cost you. One way we have avoided high costs is by put having a city pass. Pay for admission and experience many...

I only went up to Lookout level but the views from this level over Toronto were fabulous. Although up higher than other buildings the height had no effect on me, even when I looked as straight down as was possible. However I then went down to the next level which in part has a glass floor and admit that looking...

It's unfortunate that this is the only great views of Toronto you can get. They charge you quite the bit to just take an obnoxiously short elevator ride with tons of strangers. The views aren't that great, you don't get a clear picture. The glass is filthy, I don't know that they clean it that often. It reflects on pictures...
Very good views and the place is ran well and staff are lovely! It was nice to see! The glass floor was pretty cool!! Scary....

Loved walking on the glass and looking down at the ground and base of the tower. There are many things to do like the observation deck, 360 restaurant that moves around. I spent most of the day here and I couldn't leave without seeing this attraction, it made my whole trip worthwhile.

If you book for admission to the CN Tower, Toronto with Infinity the staff at the tower won't accept your voucher as they no longer work with Infinity. I found that out the hard way as I had booked this almost 2 months ago, turned up and was told this and required to pay $35.99 for admission. However, it was...

It's very expensive for what it is. The kind of place you go to say you went and have a nice look at Lake Ontario but I would never go again.I heard the restaurant is a good experience and worth the money so it could be a better option to visit the CN Tower.

I loved getting a birds eye view of Toronto. We went on Sunday afternoon, barely had to wait 10 mins for tickets.The views are incredible and I can only imagine what it would be like at night!The glass floor was a bit crowded but if you wait long enough it clears up.It is expensive, the restaurant up...

The ride with the escalator to the CN tower Great dining area was clean the service was excellent the food good was appetizing. The view of the city was breathtaking see the new development and the great lake of Toronto.

Most Canadians, let alone Torontonians have not had the chance to visit the CN Tower. Whether you are a visitor or a local, it is a MUST to see and experience going up the CN Tower. I have visited the Tower twice, both during the day and at night. Each visit gave me different perspectives of this beautiful, diverse city....

As one of the tallest building in the world, you can certainly see a lot from the top. As expected from a tall building like this, the view is great.I recommend people to go there around the night (before it close of course :) ) the view is better at night. The shining light from all these buildings underneath...

i know, it is touristy, but sometimes you have to do the touristy thing to really appreciate where you are! The Tower is iconic dominating every city scape of Toronto. The 360 degree view is why you do the ride to the top! The revolving restaurant offers a more relaxed view to view the city below and the food is...

Make sure you choose a nice day, go early to avoid waiting in lines, normal entrance is enough, you have the same view. Glass bottom is just a small part of it, it's a thrill to stand there, but if you have height sickness you can visit the tower nevertheless. Don't go on the glass bottom and make sure you...

You only get to see part of the city as half of the tower is occupied by the restaurant and off bounds to public access. But at $40 tickets are very pricey and in our view not worth the money. There are much better ways to spend your tourist $$$'s in Toronto.
A sure bet when friends of family are visiting. The CN Tower is just a "must see" in Toronto. The views are splendid and you can find your neighbourhood and all that surrounds it.

We went on a family vacation to Toronto at the end of May. We purchased the Toronto City Pass and the CN Tower is on of the attractions on the pass. So worth it! We rode the elevator to the 114th floor. It takes about 58 seconds to go up or down. This is where the observation deck is. Part...

The elevator that takes you up is very, very fast! We enjoyed walking on the glass floor but it was kind of scary at the same time. We had a great view of Rogers Centre and of Toronto and of Lake Ontario. We did not do the Edge Walk because it is not for the faint of heart! We took...
Nice view, of course. I liked that the restaurant at the top had prices no more expensive than ground-level coffeeshops in Toronto. What I didn't like: the admittance price is ridiculous.
The cn tower is incredible. The view is spectacular and the glass floor is amazing. We did the sky pod tour to go up an additional level. It is a must see!
Service below average for a landmark venue ,overpriced food for a set menu ,Great view of Downtown Toronto, wish they can add back a la carte food option rather then gouging tourists and locals
I had family visiting from Portugal! They love this place plus we had great meal ,great service, great view great tourist area

Hi All,I visited CN Tower restaurant and observation desk many times in different weather conditions. So check weather first!!!If it is foggy you can have your dinner staring at the grey wall of fog.In sunny weather you might see Buffalo across Ontarion lake.But my personal prefference - evening time. You have decent dinner for reasonable price...

The view from the tower is spectacular, but the many lines we had to wait in, for hours, up and down, were horrendous. It is also very expensive. More of a "I did that once," check the box activity than anything else. If you can make it there on a day that isn't too busy, I am sure the experience...
The restaurant is expensive and while the views are great it doesn't offer great value. The viewing platforms are shabby by comparison with similar venues elsewhere

The tower looks amazing from the outside. The pricing is too expensive for when you go inside and finish viewing the city within a half an hour. Somewhere between $10-$20 would be sufficient in my opinion. Otherwise good to see.

We had the prefix menu with great wine selection. Wait staff is incredible professional and friendly. We ha dinner at late afternoon/early evening, and were able to see the best of both - day and night Toronto! Incredible panorama, tasty meals. Great evening.

Spend the extra money and have dinner at the top. Yes, it's a little expensive but don't forget if you are dining in the revolving restaurant then you don't have to pay for the ride up. Food, presentation of food, and drink selection are outstanding. I was pleasantly surprised. Great place to go for special occasions or entertaining out-of-town guests.
You will get a spectacular view of Toronto both day and night. If you go up around 7:30 and stay til dark, you'll get to see both day and night views.

I have entertained clients at the CN Tower over the past 5 years, at least 2 times per year. The quality of the food, the extensive wine list and the 360 deg. view make it a unique attraction that is good value for the money.

If you have been to other towers around the world, you might not find this one very special but just to get an overview of what Toronto looks like, it is worth a visit. However, if you really want to save some money, I suggest that you book a fixed price meal at the restaurant. That way, you get to...

Just like the Skylon Tower you see miles and miles of landscape of Toronto and it's surrounding areas. It's beautiful. It only takes a minute to reach the top. What a spectacular view of the city. It is the highest of all the Towers anywhere.

The CN tower was a great attraction to visit. I just wouldn't suggest paying the extra $12 to go up to the skypod. I wish i hadn't. It wasn't much higher than the first level. It was enclosed. It just wasn't much more than the first level.

The view is spectacular and the viewing deck a must-see. However, be sure of your timing -- you may want to go outside of school hours to avoid students-filled buses. The restaurant is lovely, however the service and the menu could both use a little work.
Its a great view of the city. Cant beat that. However, seems overpriced for visit. I would really want to do the stair climb one day.

Want to have a great brunch with a view to make the experience one of the world's best? Get a reservation for brunch at the 'tower' with friends and family to get one of the best experiences one could desire anywhere in the world. You will not be disappointed and will be letting all your friends and family know that...

This is more exciting than the Eiffel Tower....but you have to have been Paris to know this. The glass to stare down into the city is better and also the whole set-up is better. Anyways.......that's my personal opinion.

It was our last day in Toronto and we went to the CN Tower. Having read tripadvisor tips about this attraction, we took advantage of the special 2 courses for $55 in the revolving restaurant which includes the lift to the viewing platform. That saved us $25 as we are seniors or $34 on the normal price. Which meant we...

Actually Toronto doesnt seem that congested, altho I've never driven through during rush hour, so dont let the title fool you. But you are far above it all in this contraption. Was in town for convention and had pre-read about dinning options at the top, which is confusing, so I'll attempt to elaborte for you; first the structure. Built in...

Well worth a visit views over Toronto are spectacular if you are brave enough and have got 180 Canadian dollars to spare you can hang off the top of the cnn tower or just stand by the roundhouse and look up they have red suits on so you can make them out
The ride to the top of the tower is amazing.The glass floor is not for the timid as you can see right to the ground. The views from the tower are fantastic watching the ferries and the traffic below.

General admission to the tower runs right around 32 dollars. There is no doubt that the views are spectacular from here, but did not have the nerve to stand on the glass partition. I think your better bargains are 1. to purchase the pass allowing you entrance to five sites for 64 dollars or 2. The group I was with...

This tower has an amazing elevator and the views are like none other! There's glass on the sides and on the floor on some of the elevators to add to your experience. The glass floor on the observation deck was cool to walk on and offered a different perspective than I had tried before. It's definitely worth a shot if...

The CN tower offers a breathtaking view of Toronto and surroundings. We had dined at the 360 Restaurant last year and took our daughter and her family this trip. There is also a less expensive snack bar with sandwiches and such. Keep in mind though, there is no 'admission charge' if you're dining in the restaurant, so factor that into...

What more can I say other then the bets attraction in Torotno. If your a first timer to Toronto its a must , if uve been before ud still love it!! The ripleys aquarium is right beside and is a lot of fun for a whole day with the family
Not the Empire State Building, but still a nice way to spend a few hours, especially when the weather is good.

Normally a tourist must visit this place. And, of course, there is little sense in visiting unless you get to the top. Surely, the view from the top is impressive and, surely, the price to do this is steep. So, each one of us should decide as to whether it is worth of it. I got up there and left...

Got to start by saying if your that stupid to right a review and start it by saying I DON'T LIKE HEIGHTS !!! DON'T WRITE THE REVIEW OF THE WORLDS HIGHEST TOWER after you go up it!!!I could say a bit over priced but we purchased the City Pass $64 per adult but you get entry into 5 atractions,...

This enormously high tower is amazing.It has spectacular views of a beautifully designed city below.There is also a glass floor where you can walk over and look down below, way down below.You gotta try it!!!
The view, of course, was wonderful. Food delicious. Need a few more higher quality wines by the glass. Overall, very enjoyable

Amazing almost 360 degree view (there is restaurant blocking part on 1st deck), but it is worth to buy ticket to 2nd deck (don't remember name) where you can see on every side.Base on recommendation I save trip to CN for sunny, cloudless day. I recommend same !!!

We had a Friday night seafood dinner for two at 360 restaurant, a 3-tiered platter that was really too much food for 2 people, so we took home leftovers. The seafood was fresh and the chef's smoked fish was really a delight. Really enjoyed it.

After many visits to Toronto I finally decided to try to go up and visit CN Tower and it was absolutely a great experience. The views are gorgeous, even in rainy/cloudy weather. It is not too expensive and the restaurant up there (Horizons) was very quiet and serene and the food was not bad at all! Definitely a must do...
Spectacular view of one of the most beautiful cities in the world! As canadian I'm really proud that this jewel is one of the symbols of our country!

Okay. First things first - I hate heights (at least when in a building). I also hate paying ridiculous amounts of money to reach these heights. And I don't like paying inflated prices for mediocre food, tours or merchandise.The tower itself is kind of cool, but it is nothing I haven't seen when travelling to places such as Calgary,...
although not the tallest building in the world any longer, it is still quite exciting to step on the glass floor of the viewing gallery, visit to be combined with the Steam Whistle Brewery

Excellent view obviously being the tallest building in the world. The lift goes right to the viewing floor in under a minute and it's a glass elevator on the outside of the building!!! ?There is a coffe shop/restaurant and a gift shop which are both reasonable priced. Staff in coffee shop could have tried smiling though and spoken rather...

If you suffer from vertigo you need to avoid the glass floor, it takes a genuine act of will to walk on it and I found it an uncomfortable experience. The views around the city are stunning and the pod at the top was worth the extra money.It wasn't busy when we went up but I imagine that at...

Great view of the City but the queues are long to get in the lifts. We went on a Saturday and had to wait a good 15-20min before getting to the top. We also paid an extra £12 for the sky pod which was not worth the money. Just stick to a standard ticket it is as good. Overall a...

We had lunch on the day we took in the baseball game and it was superb. The cost, which first off seemed high ie: $55 pp included the $35 pp trip up the tower so was well worth it as I had baby beef ribs and my wife chicken and the view is to die for.

I had not been in the CN Tower for many years. Friends of ours were visiting from Mississippi and they wanted to see it. I was most pleased. The view is incredible as you would expect, also the trip up was great in the elevator. We went up at about an hour before sunset so we got pictures while the...
A great way to see the city. We recently had a party at the bar on the observation deck. A nice venue to gather with friends and enjoy the scenery without feeling rushed.
nice views from the top.pretty pricey, lots of dizzying options to chose from. the observation decks and the indoors area are very spartan, don't expect seats or a snack machine

Its not only about taking the lift up and then look down. Its much more to up there. Wide beautiful view. Glass floor/ I had a nice time up there. I think its the only real attraction Toronto has...:-)) beside the boot tour

We booked a table for dinner at the 360 restaurant for the night before our friends wedding. We picked the perfect time seeing the city views in daylight, sunset and night. The quality of the food was excellent and can't fault the service. It's pretty expensive but you don't mind that when it's a special occasion.
Greatest views, especially at night. Works out roughly £15 per person so an option is to have a meal in the restaurant and take in the view from there thus avoiding the entry fee

No visit to Toronto is complete without a visit to the CN Tower - one of the tallest buildings in the world. Incredible views and dizzying heights. This was one of my stops during a recent visit to Toronto. Most highly recommended.
Few words to describe a great symbol of Toronto.Majestic and impressive ... overlooking the city.The view from the top is fabulous ...

Got her around 10am late May, was quiet although one school party had gone through.first thing was an unusual security check, puffs of air blown at you,hence the messy hair. After tidying my hair went up a lift where you could look down or through glass door. Not so easy as the lift was crowded. But you go on to...

This experience is definitely not for someone scared of heights. I attended a fundraiser recently, but I've visited on prior visits also. The elevator going up had glass in the front as well as in the floor. The view at the top was outstanding. That said, the fundraising event/hospitality was terrible. The food wasn't good and not arranged well to...
Even the elevator ride is exciting. I didn't like standing on the glass floor. LOL You can see all of the Toronto from up there.

This is a great attraction and absolutely a must see when visiting Toronto, but you only need to do it once.My girlfriend and I went at the beginning of April and it was dead, with no queues that you would certainly get in the summer. This made getting tickets painless, but at $70 odd for two adults it was...

column3: Half Moon Bay, California, United States
column4: I have to say that it was the first time I had time to go up to the top of the Tower and it was a great experience on a clear day. I also think they nickel and dime you to death on this, oh you wanted to go to the very top, that is an extra $12 Canadian. But...

Visiting the CN Tower was one of the most memorable events of our time in Toronto. The construction, the views, especially at sunset, were all so interesting. There are historical displays around the perimeter so that you can learn about the construction as well as the history of the place. There are two restaurants on site. We did not eat...

i read Tripadvisors reviews so was there 15 mins after opening on a cold but clear Toronto morning and was very pleased I did. There were already short Qs but we didn't have to wait long to take the lift up to the 114th floor!! I had also bought the Skypod extension ticket for the additional $12 and was very...

I enjoyed this attraction far more than I expected. I made a reservation for lunch at the 360 restaurant at the top. If you do this then you don't have to pay the hefty fee for the lift to the top. You have to buy a two course lunch for $55 at the restaurant, which means you are getting an...
The view form the top of the tower was great, was too scared to walk on the glass floor looking down to the ground! Well worth a visit.

In my opinion, lunch at the top of the CN Tower is a must! The whole thing will cost you $50 a person and for that you will go up the CN tower, you will get two courses (delicious food!) and you will get to see spectacular views of Toronto on a 360 turn table!It is very special! Definitely...

If you love 360 degree views of cities from a high perch, this is the place for you.Have your phone ready to video the elevator ride up and down as the floor is glass.For an amazing option you might want to step outside while tethered to the building for a walk around. Not my idea of adventure, but many...

We visited CN tower as part of our Toronto city pass. Easy walk from downtown Toronto. The views from the tower are absolutely amazing! Staff were very friendly, queues were very small (late spring). The glass floor was a great attraction. Well worth a visit to this iconic Toronto landmark.

This review is only about the restuarant. The CN Tower is great, if a littley pricey. We ate in the restaurant and the food was average. it sounded good on the menu, but it was cold and mass produced. The restaurant itself was very cold indeed and we were frozen!

as I was doing the Edgewalk, entry to the observation decks and pod were included.the views from the observation decks are very good. I found the decks weren't crowded so you had all the time you wanted for photographs. The wait times for the lifts up / down wee minimal too.The glass floor does get a little crowded...

Very disappointing.Expensive entry fees, 360 degree views are obstructed by a wire mesh.Glass window viewing area is not a 360 view, but is about 270 degree.The glass floor area is on one side of the building only and really shows very little in the 4 meters the glass covers.During my visit, there were teenagers running a...

Stunning views on a lovely clear Friday evening, as it was later in the day, queues were light to get into the tower, no waiting around for entry. All the staff were very friendly and funny, approachable and knowledgeable which was great as a tourist.

I took my husband for lunch at the CN tower and it was worth every dollar spent. The good was delicious: would recommend the roast duck salad for starters. The braised lamb shank was the best I have ever eaten. Great sorbet for dessert. Very friendly and courteous waiters. The view from the 360 restaurant makes it a great place...
The reception was wonderfulStaff excellentTickets reasonableView fantasticGlass floor one of its kindSky pod beautifulIn shortMust visit placeThumbs up for concerned staff

A great experience but a bit on the expensive side considering it is just an elevator ride to the top of a tall building. However the views are spectacular, just make sure you go on a clear day. The view through the glass floor is pretty good, though it can get a bit crowded.

If you like a taste for adventure and darish wit then the CN tower is a must in your travels, even if your not then there are many other activaties in the attraction itself. I have been there twice and would happy go again. The second time I did the 360 skywalk, which was quite new at the time (2...

Till the year 2010 world heighest tower and the curosity to feel and look in sky from such height will cost you canada dollar 32 and family around CD 100.If you are in holiday spare at least 3 hours for visit.Roughly 90 minutes im line and 60 minutes minimum on uppet side.58 second elevator is very fast to be felt...
Excellent views over the whole of the Toronto area. The glass walkway is not for those with a fear of heights

Thrilling experience. Various activity options are available. Glass top viewing,sky walk etc. Ticket rates depend upon the level of activity that you choose. But must visit place. One of the best attraction in Canada.

Coming to Toronto you have to do the CN Tower. The staff are wonderful and once you are up in the tower you can stay as long as you like. It would seem that the wait in the line up could be forever but it does go ready fast. Go and enjoy the view, you will be glad you did....
"Cross that one off of the bucket list". The day I went was exceptionally clear and the view went on forever. Very informative and professional staff.
Although I do not like heights, it was nice to see toronto from so high up! The glass floor is really neat too, although I had a tough time looking down! Interesting reading along the walls too.

The glass floor is captivating, thrilling, scary and enjoyable. The elevator service also a nice touch of tour. The views of Toronto, breathless even through the wire cage terrace. No wait at the lines in the morning so pick a clear day and spend an hour or two!
If you book online 24 hours prior you get 15% discount. It's worth the money. If you are there on games day you can see it from above.
The Edgewalk was amazing! Best day ever!!! What an adrenaline rush! This is a must do in Toronto. I have ti go back to do the Edgewalk while the sunsets.
360 Restaurant,pricey $55-$80 a plate. Food is decent,view is phenomanal. Make reservations to be safe.

It's a tower in the center of Toronto which is good for getting views over the city and beyond.There is a glass floor which you can stand on and see the aquarium below and city below. Views are somewhat spoiled by the vast amount of mesh around the building but I suppose safety is paramount.Wouldn't recommend making an...

Impresive structureLovely at nightWe purchased the tickets at the front desk and the line was about 10 minutes waitOn monday memorial weekendI personally loved the first level where they have the floor glass and the open walkway (not the edge walk) the air was blowing so hard it felt fantastic to be up there and watch...
It was expensive for what you actually get. You pay for a 360 view however they have put a restaurant in part of it so it is not a 360 view.

The experience of visiting the most known place in Toronto is awesome. You can see all the city if the weather is clear. I visited CN Tower during the snow time in Toronto and that was really great because I like a urban scenery.The CN Tower restaurant is pleasurable but the most awesome experience is walk on the glass...

UK couple stopping over in Toronto at end of holiday to NYC and Ontario..We have been up the Shard in London,The Empire State and now the CN tower..The Shard is a spectacular beautiful modern building,The Empire State is both beautiful and steeped in History.The CN tower for me is neither particularly beautiful nor does it have the...

The tower looked beautiful even from outside but more in the evening . From the top view you could see the Toronto Islands , Airport with flights taking off and the beautiful buildings in the city.I loved the Glass walk. You may get scared to look down from the glass. I would have loved it more if the Glasses...

The glass floor has got to be the best attraction. The view is spectacular. Don't forget to bring your camera for lots of photo opportunities. We didn't eat at the restaurant but the menu did look great. We ran out of time on our trip but I'll be sure to make time the next time I visit.

My wife did not want to go up as she has claustrophobia. She gave me the freedom and I picked a night that was clear and blue. What a spectacular experience it was.A Toronto Blue Jay’s game was going on and you are right on top of the stadium. As the CN Tower was one of the highest buildings...
It was a long, expensive and disappointing visit. We have been many times before but this time it felt as though the staff had no interest. Again, meh ...

We really enjoyed our visit of the CN tower, however, it is very pricey. If you take the Skypod option (which I highly recommend) it's a little short of $50 (with the taxes). Also, be prepared to wait. We were inline for more then 30 minutes just to get our tickets... Then 45 minutes before getting to the elevator. And...

The tower is awesome experience as always. We had lunch in revolving dining room for my birthday. Food is on pricy side but is *exquisite* and well worth it. **BONUS**The elevator ticket is included when you eat in dining room

Kids really enjoyed the Glass Floor/views. We visited during the week when it wasn't so busy. My boys enjoyed the elevator ride up and the views. Thy were more brave than I was to go on the glass floor!Next time we will also visit the restaurant which I here has a good menu for kids at lunch time.
A high tower just for the hell of it but what an attraction. I loved every part of it. The glass floor is a stroke of genius. Would recommend this attraction for anyone visiting Toronto

It was a great view, the glass floor is a fun feature. The staff were polite and very efficient to reduce wait times. However, once you are on top, my family was bored of the view in 5 minutes and already to leave...we were disappointed that it was a bit anti climactic. Lastly, as someone with a special diet,I was...

The CN Tower. 1,815 feet. 553 meters. 181 stories tall. The views are spectacular.Let’s put it this way… from 1976-2007, no man made structure on the face of the planet (that wasn’t a guide or TV mast) was taller than the CN Tower. For 31 years it held a title that very few buildings today (in 2015) will hold...

The CN Tower is well worth a visit but maybe not if you don't like heights, the views take your breath away, went outside and walked round, that was an amazing experince, wasn't brave enough to stand on the glass floor.

We spent the extra to go up in the Skypod, and it was very much worth it. The view was absolutely gorgeous and the staff was very friendly. The glass floor was a little scary, but I managed to step on it briefly

A great experience, from the glass fronted lift to the viewing platform to the views of the city, the glass floor and the outside 360 degree walkaround. All good fun and although I don't have a great head for heights, this was all fine for me. Really amazing views on the day we visited as the weather was very clear,...

We arrived early morning and had the lift to ourselves. As the restaurant was closed we were able to enter and take photos without having to purchase food. A lovely clear morning giving excellent views.
Good opportunity to explore Toronto from high above all tall buildings. Can have lunch or dinner in the 360 degrees rotating restaurant.

Not only that you have the 360 degree view of parts of the GTA in Toronto but you are also afforded the best meal in town! The portobello mushroom with butter was to die for and the steak was delish!!!
The CN Tower was truly amazing. We went to the observatory area and the views are absolutely breathtaking. Never has Toronto looked more stunning.

Views were quite amazing. Went early and had dinner and then went for the sights as the sun went down. Amazing day time views followed by the city lights at night. If you have even the slightest fear of heights, yes it's going to be bad. Prices were high but sometimes these things are a once in a lifetime event...

This is a must see if you're in Toronto there is no doubt about it.It IS worth paying the extra CAD 12 per person to do the Sky Pod. The views are 100 times better and it's quiet.The glass floor on the main level is brilliant. Scary at first but it gets easier. Don't look down to begin...

Great views over Toronto, the CN tower is in a square by the Roger Centre. Up top you have an outside viewing and inside with glass floor. Freaked me out standing on glass but it holds a huge amount of weight. You look down on the roof top of the aquarium.

This is our second visit to the CN Tower and it is still just as good as the first time, we really suggest that you go all the way to the top the views are breathtaking.If you go on a busy day it's a good idea to purchase the express tickets as it can save a lot of time...
Lived up to its reputation the view was amazing and the food delicious would recommend this to others

Definitely one of the "musts" when in the area. Downside is the ridiculous money they charge for goung up. Our kids loved it too. Make sure it's not a cloudy day to get the best experience for the money!

Its cool, it looks awesome, its really tall, its really expensive.First off, we went when there was a baseball game scheduled later that night so they price gouged us at $30 for parking.2 people in my party did the "Edge Walk". This is where they suit you up in climbing type gear and take you outside and hook...
It's really fun looking at the aerial view of the whole Toronto. Just don't go during peak season as the crowd will annoy you. Fees are too expensive.

We waited in line for tickets for about 30 minutes. Prices are a bit high but worth the views. The restaurant was closed for a private event so that was disappointing but its a fun, quick attraction to see.

We visited the CN Tower on a week day and quite early in the day so no queues at all. The staff were very informative and the view was amazing, you can see for miles. A nice, but over priced, tickets. They charged me $100 for 3 kids and 2 adults. Should see only once. Not worth going again and...
A must do if your ever in TO, capture a full 360 view of our beautiful city and lakefront, wine and dine in the world's tallest restaurant and don't forget to check out the glass floor!
The 360 restaurant was romantic with very good food and beautiful world-class view. Pricey but expected!

So my first time in toronoto and my hotel looked straight on to the tower. I was not even on land 3 hours and I was up there enjoying all it had to offer and to my surprise with it being a Saturday and the blue jays playing at home didn't have to wait in a queue. The staff are...
If you haven't done this do it!! We had awesome views from the top and was able to get pictures taken on the glass floor. It was fun for everyone in our family even the ones scared of heights.

There is just not a whole lot that matches the view from the CN Tower. The elevator ride alone is fun and it's amazing to oversee the city and river from such heights. The wait for the elevator can be long, though, so be prepared.

Take out a trip right to the top as there is a stop about Three quarters of the way up and you have to pay extra to get to the top but it is worth the extra 12$ canadian _ Toronto is flat throughout and you can see for miles so if you have Binoculars take them

A definite must do when visting Toronto. We visited the CN Tower on a week day and quite early in the day so no queues at all. The staff were very informative and the view was amazing, you can see for miles. A nice, but over priced, gift shop awaits you after the experience

We went to CN Tower was great. The view amazing. We had dinner and the service was really good. The best prime rib I have had for sometime.The restaurant revolves as you dine but the best was the sunset. Very nice. Was expensive but worth it includes the viewing platform as well.

There was a long, tedious wait, queueing up to buy tickets. Pricey general admission tickets give access to the spectacular views, from the LookOut Level at 346 m (1,136 ft.) and the EdgeWalk viewing at 342m (1,122 ft.) on the outdoor SkyTerrace. Although advertisements boast of a glass floor, it is just a tiny section of floor that disappoints expectations....

I went mid-week which was great - no queues! The trip was enjoyable and didn't take too long. The staff were informative with interesting information on the way up the lift. The lift was made of glass and gave a great, quick view on the way up.The day was clear when I visited and it gave great clear views...

The CN tower is a must see if your in Toronto. The elevator can take you up to the observation deck and also to see the glass floor so you could all the way down. Its actually really scary but fun to do.
Great view of the city. Small area with a glass floor. Cool ride in elevator going up. Definetley the CN tower has changed over the years.

Be prepared to have your ears "pop" as you ride the glass elevator to the observation deck of the CN Tower. Enjoy a meal at the 360 Restaurant which rotates as you eat so you can view Toronto from all angles!

A unique experience if this is your first visit to Toronto, or Canada. Choose a clear sky day to take the elevator and bring in your best zoom lens. The view is mesmerizing and you may stay at the observation deck for some time. In a clear day you can see the silhouette of the southern side of lake Ontario....
Famous landmark not to be missed. Gets busy during the summer but worth the trip - the glass floor is a great attraction.

My teenaged daughter finally convinced me to do this! I have no regrets! A great view of my favourite city! The wait time was a little long, but that's the way it is for all such attractions wherever you go. The glass floor made me a little nervous....

Its a wonderful view of the city.And a breathtaking sun set. The food is first class. From the top of the tower, I saw the very first building, the York Hotel, when I first arrived in Toronto. June 9th 1951. It was then one of only four or five tall buildings in the city. I saw how hundrets of skyscapers...

Great value realized when you have dinner between May and September in the 360 restaurant. Make dinner reservations for 6.30pm so you see the sights during the day and then as it darkens, it's a whole different view. When you consider how much you pay just to go up, the dinner option is great value.

Great view of downtown Toronto, the islands, lake Ontario and the mist of Niagara Falls in the distance. It is expensive just to do 'the usual' tour, well worth doing once but having gone up twice, once is definitely the charm. The glass floor is cool! I didn't go into the 360 restaurant (expensive) and I didn't do the sky...
We visited in the winter. It was very clean and well maintained. We ate dinner at the revolving restaurant. That was a great experience. The gift shops have many options for souvenirs

Stunning view, obviously. Though not a place you would necessarily go more than once. It's not too expensive, but the food is. I'd love to try the edge walk but I couldn't afford it. Seems fun, though. Go with friends.

Growing up in Toronto, I never really apreciated the CN Tower, really just took it for granted. Having travelled accross much of latin america and seeing what they call towers has allowed me to have a renewed respect for our CN.

Okay so I don't lay flat out on the glass floor anymore but it still gives me the chills.The view can't be beat, either straight down or out across the water and the city. I love having dinner, watching the view change as the sun goes down.The food is great. It may be somewhat overpriced but I can forgive it...
I've been to the top of the CN Tower many times over the years. The experience just keeps getting better... from the elevator ride to the observation deck. It's a huge WOW.
Each tower in the world has their own unique attributes, and the CN Tower is worth seeing on a world class scale.

The entry price to view the CNTower is a bit high for what you get(I only purchased the entry ticket). I went up the tower expecting a bit more and was a bit let down. Sure the view around the tower is nice, but maybe it is because I went during the day or because the city itself is not...
It was an experience. But all in all there wasn't much to do up there. You can only look down for so long before your like "what's next"

This is one of the main attractions in Toronto. A landmark for Toronto. Week ends is usually a bit crowded. You can purchase entrance tickets online or buy a city pass / a combo for other attractions. Check on the weather as it makes a big difference - you can enjoy a beautiful view of the entire city on a...
the tower and the resturant get top marks,this was one of the highlights of our trip . |Ask for a booth view will impress you.
Meal was reasonable as you had to pay to get up to the top, so if you had a meal the view was free. We had the 3 course meal was very good, and service excellent

it seems the quality of service has gone down since the last time I visited - the staff were not as helpful, the restaurant (horizons) wasn't very clean/orderly.But the views are amazing and the you can't beat it.

Probably a must-see whilst you are in Toronto! Great views from the top across the rest of the city and the lake with lots of photo opportunities but not a huge amount else to do once you are up there!
An amazing view point of Toronto. A great trip and walk around the attraction. The views were breath taking and the weather gave very good contrast with the ice on the water and the sun in the sky

We had really good feedback about CN tower, so we didn't hesitate to visit the top of it, but it wasn't like we expected. It's a little bit expensive, and we only stayed a few minutes because there wasn't so many thing to see except all the building and the water. We were not really impressed and we wouldn't go...

I think that the CN tower is a great landmark to see and you should not miss out on going here if you ever go to Canada. It looks really good from the outside but the view of the city from the inside is much better. There is a section with a glass floor, although it's not too big you...

We went there during long weekend whic was a little bit crowded, but compared to my home country it was nothing.We enjoyed our visit, kids love the telescope and glass floor. We love it.Overall a-must-do when you visit Toronto. Great experience!

We have been loving the CN tower from several vantage points. The floor to ceiling window in our hotel bathroom affords a spectacular view the the CN Tower light shows in the evening. The lighting changes are lovely in a subtle way. The colors change but they flow in an almost organic way.We also ate lunch in the revolving...

If you feel your visit to Toronto won't be complete without a trip the CN Tower, then by all means, purchase your ticket online as another traveler noted, save yourself a few dollars, and pay a visit to the CN Tower. Not only will you save a few dollars, but you'll avoid waiting in line to purchase tickets.However, if...
Great tourist spot in the heart of Toronto. pricey but an unmatched view of the city. Book online to save
A good and symbolic experience of Toronto and Canada in general. Going up is not really worth it unless you get a CityPass. You do get a stunning view of Toronto from the top of the CN Tower though.
Liked: The view over the lake during sunsetDisliked: The wind outside but is over buildings so... can't be helped.

General ticket cost $32 plus tax. The glass floor is cool. The tower is old looking. The birdview is ok. I suggest you do some homework and know what on the groud, I only see TD bank logo on the buiding.

Great views of the city. Very fast lifts! Great to stand on the glass platform and look down. We weren't brave enough to do the skywalk but would be fun if that is your sort of thing and you have a serious head for heights. Nice restaurant where we had a quick cocktail. Staff generally friendly, though not so in...
It really is a must see place when you visit Toronto, great views and a fun glass floor. Is obviously a little overpriced for just a view however you have no time limit when up there

There have been nice times where I have been to the CN tower, but this time was very disappointing. When we got to the counter to pay we were trying to figure out if a group of 6 students could pay a different rate, but there was no option, only a family option where 2 of us had to be...

It is similar to those other towers of the world- something you cannot miss if you are in Toronto. It was not very crowdwd when we visited- somewhere around 10.30am.The ticketing was done in a jiffy. The tower staff is courteous. The elevator upto the first observation deck is smooth. The views are fantastic. Specially one is amazed to have...
Went there when my cousin visiting me from US, what a great experience, especially if the weather is nice. look down Toronto water front, lake Ontario, and downtown. You will be feeling great!
This provides breathtaking views of the city and great photo opportunities for all. I recommend this to every visitor

CN Tower which is one of the tallest towers in the world open until evening.The admission ticket is about Can$ 29/person which you can see Toronto Scenic view 360 degree from the top of the tower. There is an additional Can$ 12/person if you would like to go to the SkyPod the highest level of CN Tower which is...

As a Toronto resident, I felt satisfied visiting the CN Tower once 12 years ago; I only went back recently with family from out of town. It's a nice experience but it's way overpriced for what it is. We payed $32 per person and that didn't even take us to the top floor. If you're visiting Toronto it's definitely worth...

Although I have lived close enough to the CN tower my entire life, I had never gone up. We paid for the lunch in the rotating restaurant because, honestly it wasn't much more than just paying to go up!...

We were advised to visit this between 9-11 as this was the least busiest time. This was correct and was virtually empty. Unfortunately the weather was slightly cloudy but the view was still very good.Standing on the glass deck was interesting!
One of the best experiences! Must see place, I strongly recommend for people who are not scared of heights! And if you are, then this place will help you get over that fear! Its worth it!!!

This wasn't bad but to be honest I only went up because I'll probably never get the chance to go to Toronto again. I thought it was a bit pricey at $32 each plus an extra $12 each to go up to the higher tower (which is open air and VERY windy) but as I was only there once I...

For what you get, it's an expensive way to spend an hour or so. The view is pretty amazing but the tickets can add up in price. Do it to say you did it but wouldn't recommend a return visit. The elevator ride is pretty cool as well as standing on the glass floor a few hundred meters up.

Bring your jackets. It is very windy and chilly at night or in the afternoon.Quite pricey - if you're going to at least 3 destinations listed on the city pass, buy the city pass instead of buying a CN tower ticket.

I honestly think that this was a little bit of a rip off. $32 CAD plus tax to get up and see Toronto is really steep. Plus you had to pay an extra $12 CAD if you wanted to go to the higher viewing tower. All you really get to do is walk around half of the tower inside through...

Its wonderful experience. Little expensive. On top we can see toronto skyline and toronto iland and billy bishup airport.You can take picture as many as you want. Sunny day is preferable for good picture. One floor below the glass floor, you can stand on glass and see ripley aquarium and roger center. Glass floor area is not big. Glass...

The CN tower is over hyped atleast that's what I was told and felt. I paid extra 12$ for sky pod which was not worth it..if you are short on time then u may skip it. The view is good but not breathtaking or a must see..the view from the glass floor is nice

This was fun, but I suggest if you are in Toronto for any length of time to get the city pass. You can go to the zoo, CN tower, Science Museum, Casa Loma, and Royal Ontario Museum. That makes the tower worth it.

Entrance fee as with all Toronto venues is high. And the views... well it is just another high rise. Annoying is the way one is almost pushed in front of lenses so they can sell pictures. We did it once, but never again.

The view is amazing on top and i love that glass view that allows you to see through the floor and how high the tower is. If you go to Toronto tou have to go unless you already went. I went 2 times so far in my life and I will definitely go again.
Great place for a great view of Toronto , the lake and the foothills North. The glass floor part feels unsecure..look straight down below your feet..
Very good for a view of Toronto city and the Toronto Island. There is a glass floor that gives us the real distance we are from the ground.

If you enjoy seeing cities from a high rise, this is for you. The 360 degree views were great. The elevator has a glass floor so I videoed the trip up and down.An option I did not take was to walk outside tethered to a rail around the top of the building. Those who did it loved it.

Great views if you are here on a clear day. line wasn't so bad as I came in the evening and the sunset was spectacular. If you like heights and getting a great view, this is the place to go. The unfortunate thing it that they have a restaurant at the viewing level so looking at the east end of...

We were only in Toronto for a couple of days so decided to go up the tower and pay the extra to go up to the skypod. I must admit I wasn't initially that bothered about going up the tower but I'm glad I did, I was pleasantly surprised.The main viewing level has wonderful views and you can get...

Visited Toronto for the first time last weekend and the first destination on my tourist agenda was CN Tower. It did not disappoint. I took the elevator all the way up to the SkyPod, which at 1,465 ft above the city is the highest observation platform in North America! The SkyPod sits 33 stories above the observation deck. If you...

This place is a must. The views are fantastic of Toronto and the lake. As a person who doesn't care for heights I was fine until I saw the glass floor section and it took an age to get enough courage to walk on it. !

Went up to the Skypod, the highest public access level. Yes the view is great, but is order to get in you have to go through the security gate, with its high-tech equipment that blasts jets of air at you in order to detect any hidden items. Come on, there are ways to circumvent every security aspect so this is...
It's was like to be on the top of the world, It's was a good experience and if we go back we will go again. The restaurant was very good too. Alot of good time
With a simple structure the tower soars across the skyline offering some gorgeous views of Canada. A partner to Rogers stadium and the aquarium it is well worth the money and time.

Once you have been up one tower you have done them all to be honest.The ticket came to $50 CAD for standard admission with the higher level added (not worth it)view was good but not worth the price, the wait, the squished elevator.

This is the most iconic place to go to in Toronto. Like you have to go here or else you never actually went to Toronto.The best part is the glass floor. It's scary but cool! It can hold a lot of weight, so no fear about falling to your death.View is breath-taking!

Not necessary to go right to the top as the large circular walkway on the first station gives a great all round view of beautiful Toronto. If you do travel up to the top it is obviously very small and you are round it in 30 seconds
The views of Toronto were awesome, we also loved the glass floor....it is worth the little extra cost to go as high as you can.

Book on a clear day the views are stunning! The staff seemed miserable ( perhaps a long day). They need to be retrained to smile more, the young lift operator was the only one who seemed genuinely pleased to work there. Aside from this the attraction does get busy but the views make the effort worthwhile.
another Toronto must visit! Not a thing of beauty but worth the wait to the top. also nice gift shop. As its near waterfront and Rogers centre you can combine all three.

Most of us know that the CN tower was the biggest free standing structure in the world. However, I didn't realize that the CN tower had a restaurant on board. We went their and it was pricey just like the admission fee, but hey other than that we had a great time!
We had a reservation in the 360 restaurant so no admission fees.The view was brilliant, as was the food and service

There was nothing fantastic about this site. Firstly it was extremely expensive to gain entry. Then were the long lines....took us an hour before we got to the balcony. Didn't choose to go all the way to the top because what was the point? There was no better view. The glass floor was probably the only thing exciting. The restaurant...
It is pretty amazing, the food was delicious, the view is worth it. I had being there twice and will not doubt doing it again.
It is pricey, but well worth it. The views are spectacular, the food is first class! I had a great Chardonnay and the pumpkin cheesecake to die for! Also, the service and the people were top notch.
A must see, we did not get to go inside, but it is a landmark in toronto! Can't wait to go back again, we went during the winter time so It was cold, but fun place regardless.

A great place to view the whole of Toronto and it's different and diverse areas of the city. You could go right to the top but you have a less restrictive view of the city on the restaurant level. New lift staff were being trained knowledge was lacking about different areas of the city and more importantly about the tower....
This is a really tall tower and I MEAN WAY UP . It is safe and offers choices of food and souvenirs for all . The area is clean and safe . We parked under the Blue Jays stsdium for 9.00 .

A visit to Toronto is not complete unless you take that ride up the CN tower. The speedy glass elevator whisks you up to the observation deck. The coolest thing (though it made me dizzy) is the glass floor. You can see for miles and miles on a clear day, and maybe on a return visit, I'd like to be...

Love. Love. Love!The CN Tower was for years my favorite spot to go eat lunch while working in downtown Toronto, so, it holds amazing moments, memories and will forever be in my heart as part of an amazing journey lived in Canada.

Recommend going early evening, we went at approx 6:30pm and walked straight in.All staff were really nice, friendly and polite.The views were amazing, it's worth the visit, but overpriced for the trip. A citypass makes it more affordable.
I really did not know what to expect but I enjoyed the view from the observation deck. The glass floors were intriquing.

We really enjoyed visiting.Lovely view from the top and it was a clear blue sky and beautiful day.Good place to take it all in and we got some good photos of the city.There are not loads of must do sights in Toronto, but some great places to visit. With this in mind it would be a real...
If you're trying to get on the Edge Walk, come in after April. It's closed during winter season. Besides that, I suggest you to buy your tickets online, you can save some bucks doing it that way.

The CN Tower has to be on your 'to do' list only because it is one of the highest towers of the world and you cannot miss it. For $30 you can enjoy the transparent elevator while it takes you at 1,730 feet (some 530 m), the transparent floor, the windy terrace, and the fancy and spectacular restaurant. The ticket...

the cn tower was once the tallest building in the world and on that merit alone, one should give it a visit when in toronto. the sights from above are beautiful. if you're feeling gusty, do the walk on edge tour where you get to walk on the edge of the tower! a spectacular experience that i highly recommend.

Husband and I did this tower ride on a warm clear sunny spring day. It is truly one of mans greatest wonders in U.S./ Canada. As informative as it was impressive, this particular tour is a must in downtown Toronto!At it's pinnacle, the panoramic perspectives are positively phenomenal!

very difficult to get there on foot as could not see any sign posts from our starting point about half a mile away.entrance doors to tower very badly marked and we thought place was closed when we arrived for our dinner reservation.service was very friendly but prices were very expensive for what we got .we choose salmon...
fantastic view... 360 °...... the restaurant is amazing... nice staff and food is very good.... really beautiful !!!!

Must do on your Toronto trip.Very good view all around.Amazing to go up with that fast moving elevator. Don't forget the sky pod. It is worth the extra 12$ per person, because the view is amazing up there. Did not visit the restaurant, so can't say anything about it.Also the glasfloors are really interesting.All in all, don,t rush,...

I have been several times but still enjoy showing this sight to somebody for the first time. Go 4 lunch and enjoy the 360 restaurant that rotates changing views throughout lunch. After u can go to viewing deck and sit on the glass floor.

It's amazing! You see the whole city from above. Impressive. The glass floor is something special! You see an empty space of 350meters under your feet. It took a while to walk on it. But it was great!! The bad thing? It's really expensive!

Came here on holiday with my family, to visit family who live in Ottawa.What can i say Toronto is Gorgeous and the CN Tower was just breathtaking, its a bit of a climb up but totally worth it, the views are absolutely fantastic. The see through glass floors are terrifying but all part of the fun.A MUST SEE

If you ever go to Toronto, you HAVE TO go to the top of the CN Tower. Tallest building on earth and has a great view of the whole city. I recommend to go right before the sunset sonyou can see the view with sunlight, sunset and night.

The CN Tower is a must-see destination for anyone who is taking a trip to Toronto.There is a gift shop at the base of the tower and a restaurant.The ride to observatory deck in the glass floor elevator is breathtaking.The glass floor was amazing as well....u can take cool pictures standing on it.

If you are afraid of heights....this isn't the spot for you.The CN Tower is much more than just a tower. The architecture is pure brilliant. If you're a fan of high places then this is your kinda place! Awesome 360' view of Toronto! Three levels with a rotating restaurant but the piece de la resistance is glass floor level! Looking straight down as you stand on a glass floor that gives the appearance to be floating over 1,511Ft drop to the ground!

The tower was interesting - nice views, and a section with clear floor so you can see the ground below you. Best part of our visit was the 360 restaurant - got a great meal, and then you have access to the observation deck for free.

My wife did the edge walk, which she loved this included a certificate and 2 photos and DVD as part of the deal. I just did the trip up the tower and eventually walked on the glass floor. The view from the tower is as expected amazing. Book online and get the upper level for the best experience. The glass flor is also a must - if you don't mind hights

If you come to Toronto and didn't visit the CN Tower, you just didn't came here. It's the best place in the city. You will have the best view. The speedy elevator with the glass floor and glass doors is so much fun! The glass floor in the tower is awesome and you can do a 360 around the tower....
This tower is very high and I recommend going to the very top on a clear day. Feels nice to look down on the planes as they are landing on Toronto Island airport

Go on a sunny day if you can much better view. The glass floor is truly amazing. While in the area take a walk along the boardwalk to Lake Ontario you certainly wont be disappointed. This walk is priceless.

It was a terrific experience seeing the tower again. The views were fantastic and I met a terrific receptionist there. There are many tourists from all over the world. The C.N.Tower is for big and small everyone will enjoy it.

I visited the CN Tower in September 2014 with my boyfriend and brother. It's expensive but we were on holiday so you part with cash easier. The views from the tower and spectacular. Well worth a visit

I have never gone up the CN tower so far because I was afraid of heights. No more. I walked out on the glass floor. Yes, it felt strange but I am so totally over my fear of heights. The CN Tower is a not to be missed attraction for any visitor to Toronto. My partner has been scheming for months since we decided to go to Toronto. He was desperate to do the sky walk and he did. We went up the tower and wandered round the different areas. We left while he thought about the walk then we went back. He paid for the walk but I was told I had to...

The views were beyond belief and especially enjoyed the elevator ride up to the top. Best viewing is inside the glass viewing area but found the open walkway with the wire enclosure a bit distorting for photos.
