this was the best thing of our trip, we had a meal in the restaurant which was very good and it was revolving

I grew up outside Toronto and have visited the CN Tower in the past. On this occasion, my girlfriend and I were given complimentary tickets from another family member. Thank goodness for that. I didn't realize that tickets are so expensive. It would have cost us nearly $70 for the tickets alone. Even more if we were going to go...

I am not good with heights, but was talked into going up the tower by my wife and daughter, the veiws were fantastic from all areas of the city, not so keen on the top of the tower swaying, but well worth going up to the second level

I have been in Toronto July 2012 with my friend. I like his city a lot it just remind me in Piccadilly London. I have visited tallest tower in the world in Dubai and this CN tower, for me they are same.
Nothing super special to say, I went in the evening so I was able to see all the light from the city but I would like to go during a nice day to really see how far you can see from up there.

It is worth a visit to add to your Canadian experience. As you get to the top you have a wonderful view of downtown and have a selection of restaurants (not sure of $$). I don't think its worth visiting more than once though
it is nice to go up the CN tower and take a look at the city from up high. Not as spectacular as Burj al Khalif in Dubai, but certainly worth a visit !
Struck lucky with a clear blue sky day. Great views across the city and onward to the falls.Expensive visit with family tickets only applying to age 12, seemed a bit harsh.

Obviously the best views to be had from the tower but pick a nice day to do it. Overall the experience was great. Looking straight down from the glass floor is an experience, not great if you don't like heights though. A must do if in Toronto for sure. Didn't pay the extra for the Skypod which is some 33...
What a great site! Absolutely loved and enjoyed the view. The visit is amazing and a must must to do when in Toronto. If one can enjoy the revolving restaurant that is awesome.

It was truly a moving experience, yes, I could feel the tower swaying in the wind from the top level. The plumb bob display indicated that I wasn't mistaken. We were lucky we visited on a clear, although very cold day and we could see the spray from Niagara Falls in the distance. You get a wonderful view of Greater...

OK - I have been up the tower before. We live so close. However, I am not a fan of heights and it is just not my thing. Since 2 of my kids had never been up the tower - I got bamboozled into taking them. The tower is "the thing" but it is really sort of boring for kids....

What is there not to like about such an engineering marvel ! I was hesitant at first. I needed to overcome a certain fear. Having seen what happened on 9/11 in New York City, I cut through the hesitation and went up to the top. And what a worthwhile visit !

I went un the CN tower just in time to see the sunset! The view is breathtaking! It is also nice to step on the glass floor, even if it's small and really hard to have a nice picture. Also, if you want to go outside you can, but don't expect to have beautiful pictures, because there a mesh like...

The food was good ... but the view was spectacular ... I put May 2014 down because that is the lowest it went ... I was there many years earlier ... but the food was very good ... the view changed as you relaxed and had a few drinks and then dinner ... we had a beautiful evening sunset ......

Visited on a Friday afternoon (24th April) nice and sunny and was not disappointed, no crowds, great views, staff wonderful and informative that worked with the tower can't say same for the restaurantExpensive $99 for two must do the higher view , we felt we would only come once so top view point was a must it was great...

Probably this is the tallest concrete structure on earth that I have ever climbed. :) That makes this special for me. I visited this place with my friends. We took tickets and caught the lift that took us on top. What a sight it was from there! On one side, we could see the Ontario lake with a mini airport...
A tourist attraction for sure and quite pricy, but if you can only hit Toronto for a short period it's a great place to see the city and surrounding area.

On our first day in Toronto, suffering from jet lag we went to the CN Tower for opening time.It was a crisp, sunny day and we had the observation area to ourselves.The views are spectacular, better than anything I've seen from similar single standing structures around the world.The staff are polite and enthusiastic and we came away...
Went here with a few friends. It was awesome. I did find it quite expensive but welcome to Toronto.If you haven't been, I recommend you try it.
I loved the tour and this time we got to go up in the pod. It is fast and we visit it ever time we go to Toronto

I just did the basic tower. Think it was around $32 CAD. You get a little information booklet as well. The trip up in the elevator is really good as it has a window. The view is good from inside. Bayside and city side. Although the best view is in the restaurant – bayside (it was not seating anyone at...
A beuatiful view over the whole Toronto. In windy days the lifts will go slower, Clear sky is obviously a big advantage.

Spent an enjoyable hour or so in the tower....we paid the extra and to the very top..... .. the views are wonderful, however keep in mind that it is a glass elevator and if this bothers you it might not be the attraction for you.... we watched some of the "Edge Walkers"..... they are insane........ if you are into that...

I am afraid of heights, well i realised it when the elevator started moving but i thought that once I'm up in the tower, it will go away, well.. that wasn't the case, my boyfriend saw that i got all pale, covered in cold sweat and panicky, so he thought, now we have to take stairs downstairs. Eventually i did...

With the regular pass you can explore three viewing areas the first is glass windows which you can look from the next is a room that has a small area of glass floors which you can sit/stand/look down to the ground from, and the thirst is an outdoor area fenced around in which you can walk around and see Toronto...
This is an amazing way to waste 3 hours in wonder. The weather was bad but I didn't think i missed much. .....
Very centrally located.Good food and ambiance . Very friendly staff. Made us feel at home. Ordered salad and lobster sandwich !!! Yummy
Food was good, friendly staff in the tower. Beautiful view. Fun to walk on the glass and look below you. Just an incredible visit.

It's an absolute must-see in Toronto! However the meals at the top are quite expensive... The glass floor though is a great place to take photos and such. The spinning restaurant and observation area are great places to view the city!

I went over to see the CN tower from my hotel with no intentions of going to the top after reading reviews about notoriously long lines. I was however pleasantly surprised when I got there to encounter no line at all. Maybe it was because it was a Monday night. The tickets were kind of pricey at 34 CAD but...

What a thrill, give it a try, walk on the outside of the tower and see the city from a bird's eye view. This is an experience you will be talking about for a lifetime, it's unique. You feel very safe, with a guide the whole time. Trust me you will be buying the video and pictures. Video has audio...

CN Tower has, undoubtedly, the best Toronto views. Although the glass somehow interferes to take a clean photograph, the views are more than enjoyable. Also, you get a bit of a thrill if you stand on the glass floor!

The second largest free-standing structure in the world. Great view of the whole of Toronto and on clear days, across the lake. If you go for lunch, your ride up on the elevator is free - normal price is $28. Plus they have a prix fixe lunch menu for $50 which is absolutely delish. I had the Ontario lamb which...

At first I did want to go up since it seemed too much of a tourist attraction (yes it is). Also it was a bit expensive. It can add up pretty quick for a family or group!But then I decided to go and might as well pay up the extra $12 for the skypod. If I am going to...
The CN Tower is a must when you visit T.O., would you go to Rome and not visit the Colliseum? It's fun, and you get a beautiful view of the city that you will get nowhere else!
It can get super busy yet it's worth it as you get the best views of Toronto. The restaurants at the top are both fantastic, especially the 360.

We had dinner in the revolving restaurant. Service was great, food was excellent and not expensive. It also includes entry to the observation deck. Even if you don't go to the restaurant, the Cn Tower is a must see.

You have to pay extra to go to the very top. It sways quite a bit up there so you might feel a bit dizzy. Views are incredible but it is pricey. I am glad I did it.Tips: I went late and night and didn't get to see the movie or get photos made, etc. Movie stops at 10...
Amazing views from top the tower! Recommend going just before sunset but anytime really is amazing to be honest

We usually only visit the CN Tower when people are visiting. This time was no exception. But the exception was that we went to the restaurant for the first time and it was a great experience. I would definitely recommend going the the revolving restaurant (as long as you have enough time to enjoy the full experience). The ride to...

We ate in the 360 Restaurant which revolves once every 72 minutes, book in advance online and time it so you arrive in day light and leave in darkness. The restaurant itself is fantastic, a bit pricey maybe but you don't have to pay for entry to the tower if you are eating there so it evens out... Treat yourself,...
It was a clear sunny day and you could see a great distance. The elevator ride up was exciting. The glass floor was too scary for me, but my son loved it. A must do in the city!

The trip up is worth the money and for a slight $12 more you take the inner elevator to the upper observation deck. Regular restaurant is good value and great views. Didn't go to the 360 restaurant but it looks good to.

Very beautiful view! The price is steep ($32 a ticket is absurd to look out of a window) Would suggest doing the lunch or dinner at 360 restaurant, you get a free ride up and down as long as you purchase an entrée from their lunch or dinner menu. Yes- this will cost you around $40 for lunch or dinner,...

$32 dollars for a trip to the observation tower was a bit too expensive. Once at the top you can walk around a walkway so strongly fenced that it ruins the view, or go downstairs and walk across two small areas of clear glass set into the floor. The view is nice, but there are no materials to help you...
Well worth the trip and cost of getting up the tower, we had a meal in the 360 which meant we had access to the tower included this was well worth it.

A great site - a must for any tourist..! Especially one in their own with a tick list - willing to talk to other tourists..! The glass floor was great - and nice fellow tourists took pics for me..! And I them..!

My partner and I went up the CN tower mid April and there were not lines at all, straight in! The lifts made us giggle as they have glass viewing windows looking down which makes you a little wobbly!!Up the top the views were incredible, big picture moment!! The glass floor was good fun and took me a while...

My daughter went up in the tower and said the views were amazing. We stayed down at the bottom because our little one didn't want to go up so high. It is a little pricey but the views she was able to capture on her camera were great.

I have been to the CN Tower many times and it is generally a fun experience. I just went again about 3 days ago and felt disappointed by the experience.I went with my 8 year old son who was thrilled to go up to one of the tallest structures in the world. The whole experience is fun with regards...
Had to go on my first visit to Toronto.The cost is very high, and the wait in line very long.The view is lovely but not worth the price and wait.

CN tower experience is indeed worthwhile. Make sure you go on a bright sunny day. The view is spectacular. The glass floor experience is thrilling and don't be afraid to look down. There is also a observation deck included in the general admission price which would give an amazing view of the city. It depends on personal preference but I...
Fantastic view, even in the middle of winter.Not cheap, but what a view.Winter is actually a great time to visit Toronto; the lines are shorter, and the skies are clear.

i visited the tower awhile back past the date posted here however it still stands out as a memorable visit to me as so I have decided to review it. The views were spectacular and the staff very friendly and helpful it was def worth the visit. One of our highlights was the glass bottom floor which made for an...

I have visited here twice now albeit ten or more years apart! The views remain stunning but I think that the information presented is better now! The security is certainly more and quite exciting really- we had to go through security checks that chemically sniffed you and bag checks. A novel experience that I quite enjoyed as something new- better...

The process of getting to the top is simple. I went straight to the top and enjoyed the amazing view! It has 360 views of Toronto, a glass floor and an outside observation deck! I believe that the restaurant rotates, I could be wrong, but if it's true then do not use the restaurant as a point of reference!
Reasonably priced, superb views and very helpful staff. Very easy to use and plenty of useful information on hand. The panorama of Toronto, Mississauga and the lake area was a joy

If you don't want to spent more money to have a fine dine in at 360 restaurant. You can go directly to the viewing points with $32 per person. As this point not revolving like the restaurant, you have to walk around to see all breathtaking position. Don't forget to step on glass floor and do edge walk :)What...
My visit here was on good clear day,the views was Execellent see the whole off downtown and miles around Ontario recommend must see for any visit to toronto.

There are too much interesting things in Toronto and escalated in a tower should be the last thing to do if you have limited time. Do not waste your precious time to wait in the line and walk and push yourself through the crowd. Let some others do this thing and you choose the other attractions.
CN tower is the most beautiful view of Toronto. From there you can see all city. I really recommend the visit, motly in a clear (no cloud) day.

Expensive, but you pretty much know what the experience is going to be like just from the fact that it is a well-known tourist attraction.The views are great and there's a restaurant on top where you can sit and get a drink.The CN tower is tall! and that's about it!

Booked lunch time meal before arrival in toronto. On entering the building you are immediately looked after going into a separate que for the restaurant , All staff are attentive . Food beautiful and we were lucky to have excellent views. Takes approx 1 hour to do 360 deg. Did not feel rushed . A very pleasant experience

I am terrified of heights , TERRIFIED. (I ruined my eiffel tower experience by being a wuss). I was traveling with my boyfriend so he kind of talked me into going up the CN tower. I almost wussed out again while in line but decided to go through with it. I did shut my eyes while going up the elevator...

If your coming to Toronto for the first time it's a "no brainer" that you go for a ride to the top of the CN tower to check out the marvelous views of the city and surrounding area. Fascinating structure and engineering marvel. Read how it was constructed and other interesting facts while you are there.Pay the few extra...

We had the most horrible time in this place, narrow aisles from near by parking space, heavy doors, staff that disappeared for their private chat, view that is blocked by metal net and premium fee. It is 2015 not the 70's things must change. A traumatic visit.

Well - by being the tallest thing in Toronto - you can see everything. A bit expensive to get up there.. but the view is great... Food? okay.. Drinks - okay.. bit overpriced.. but that's to be expected... Like the Eifel Tower, Space Needle, Empire State.. - a have to "been there" experience...
Loved the glass floor! The kids thought it was great. Really great views of the city. Hardly any wait time to get to the top. All people in our party enjoyed it.

The admission charge is reasonable for a major attraction and there is plenty of information about the building. The lifts and glass floor are particularly impressive. The very reasonable restaurant meal price and quality is also to be recommended.

We went up the CN tower for dinner at 1830 hrs so it was still daylight. We were lucky enough to get a window seat with magnificent views over Toronto and Lake Ontario. We had the fixed menu dinner for $65 per adult and $35 for a child this price included your meal and journey up the tower to the...

I don't have much to say about the CN tower. The view was as expected- GREAT! But the price was very over priced. The elevators going up and back down the tower were too crowded and uncomfortable, and trying to get near the glass floor was near impossible as there were too many people there.Glad I saw it once,...

Although a little pricey it's definitely worth a visit up to the tower, but only on a good day. We went up in the skypod which was a little more money but absolutely worth it. The restaurants and cafe are also reasonable considering it's an attraction

I have been twice - once in the summer during the day, and once in the winter in the evening. Depending on what kinda person you are I would recommend going in the winter in the evening. On the other hand, if you don't mind being herded around a seemingly endless loop of benchless waste land sandwiched between the fighting...
I have been to many towers but this is the only one with glass floor. I hesitated first but was able to step on it later on. Hard to get a photo standing over the glass looking down.

I was underwhelmed by my $30 trip up the tower. High winds meant they closed the open air portion yet people were allowed to do the edge walk. Go figure. Maybe that made the voyage up feel kind of ...boring? The glass floor still has a zing to it so that got the adventure my three star rating. The rest...

Try to plan your visit to the tower in advance if ever in the area. We planned to visit but couldn't get reservations for the 360 restaurant or Edge Walk at the tower. We really wanted to do both during our visit but couldn't however we still wanted to visit the tower and see the views. The line can be...

The view is amazing, I rated this average as the organisation wasn't good. We had to queue for tickets, which was fine however, I would have thought this would have been an indication to staff the number of people ascending. The second elevator goes to the top. When we came down, the queue for the elevator to decend was all...
Loved the views especially from the Skypod. Glass floor was a bit scary but eventually overcame my fear and stood on it. Elevators are quite small but have a great view as you ascend.

I've been to CN with my friends a week ago and I must say that I loved it ! We decided to buy CityPass with 4 other attractions, which made it much cheaper. We went there during the day in order to the the whole Toronto clearly and take amazing pictures! The day wan't really sunny but it didn't decrease...

I brought my son who is 15 to the tower over march break the weather was quite cold and windy, was very quiet and not busy at all. we went around 8pm at night. Was a good time to go, miss all the crowds. The staff was really good but you do have to go through a security checkpoint similar...

Fun family activity. Elevator takes only 1 minute to get to the top. We chose to eat lunch at 360 before going down a flight of stairs to check out the view. (Tip:elevator ride is included in price fixe meals at 360 and will put you at the head of the line to get on the elevator). You can step...
This huge tower has a revolving restaurant with great food, a glass floor section and edge walking. The elevator even has a glass cut out to look down!
The CN tower was well worth a visit and the views over the area fantastic. Walked on the glass roof which was amazing
Very nice! Went there before but went there again!!You could see the wonderful scenery of Toronto and the Ontario Lake.Although is bit expensive but worth!!

It's a good idea to make this the first thing on your list in Toronto. You will get a good a view and intro to the cityscape this way and also get some really nice pictures along the way. It's a little pricey for just a ride up on the elevator and the opportunity to take pictures but it is...
Went for lunch on a Saturday with a co-worker during a business trip. A fun revolving restaurant so you can see all of Toronto. Fantastic food, and lovely staff! Overall a good, tourist experience.

I visited recently on quite a busy day, thankfully though there is a full 360 degree view so everyone can see the great views (much quieter if you pay extra to get to the top - which we did, well worth the money!)

We had dinner in the CN tower with our friends and it was an amazing experience. The food was superb and great value.. It costs $65 for dinner and observation deck and $35 just observation deck so we fee we got great value for money. The views were spectacular and the platform rotated while we were eating so we saw...

For $50 per person, you get to see Toronto's sky scrappers, Billy Bishop Toronto City airport, Lake Ontario and of course Buffalo, New York.Started from the bottom, now we are here!!The view form the tower will have you in awe..Go further up to the sky dome to be amazed.I dont know how we did it... but...

What an experience, initially not too keen on the lift on the outside of the building but this gave fantastic views. The dining room and that whole floor gave some wonderful views. Tried to walk on the 'glass' floor but something inside me stopped me putting a foot on it. Strange thing is one of the staff told me that...

column3: São José dos Pinhais, Parana, Brazil
column4: I Liked CN Tower in Toronto - Canadá, i visited only one time, my friends invited me, but, i pretend return with my family. The view is very beautiful.

this was my second visit to the tower. Iwent with a group including 2 kids and we all enjoyed it. the highlight for the kids was the glass panel in the elevator floor. The view across the water is amazing.

The food was amazing in the tower and the view was even better. I have never experienced a nice meal anywhere like it. Looking out onto the whole of Toronto from the highest point with the restaurant rotating was surreal. Amazing.

I visited the CN Tower with my friends during my 10 day trip to Toronto and it was the most spectacular view I've seen so far! We pre-booked our tickets online 24 hours before the visit as recommended so we did not have to wait in a long queue at the ticket desk. We went straight through to security check,...
We spent maybe 1 hour on top of the CN tower. Really expensive for the time we spent there. We had a nice view of the city but this should be cheaper.
Nice view and good cocktails. We had a very enjoyable visit to the CN Tower. Perfect for the first time tourist.
Loved the look on my buddy's face on the outside deck- he was terrified and on the glass floor too...

I really enjoyed the CN tower and it was winter so there was ice on some of the great lakes and was a clear day to see all over and i was a little annoyed to know you had to pay extra to go all the way to the top?? kind of strange but we did and was cool riding...

Be prepared to pay to go to the tower as it is right down-town. We parked underground on Sunday evening for two hours and it was $25.00. We were having dinner up top so our admission was free with a reservation. Otherwise it is quite pricey to go up. I would recommend incorporating a meal into your vist as that...
Go early in the morning to avoid wait, nice beer in the bar with wicked views buy the picture it is worth it to have the memory.

The day was clear but cold so the views were nice from the Tower. This is a very touristy place so you wait in long lines for something that doesn't take much time to see. Lots of kids running around, some not always very well behaved (as well as some adults.) The see through floor is interesting if you have...

Let's face it: if you visit Toronto, you need to visit the CN tower, if the weather permits you to get beautiful pictures. However, be prepared this visit to be quite short. Once up in the tower, it does not take you too long to take the awesome pictures and you are done - unless you want to stay a...

I've lived in the city for 28 years and never had the urge to go up The tower until I was talked into it by friends my overall experience was okay don't get me wrong it's pretty cool but it's no different than being another tall sky scraper. The glass floor to me was the coolest part of the whole...

It's nothing special but it's one of those things you have to do when you're in Toronto. The whole trip prob took no more than 45 minutes since you only have two levels to visit. The price is really expensive though which is annoying. There are no train stations nearby but there is a line of cabs outside the place.

I loved the glass floors and the awesome security was so unique with the spray security system instead of the metal detectors were cool. The view was great and after we took a short cruise along the river and it was a spectacular giant!

We visited the CN Tower in the evening for dinner at the (UNBELIEVABLE!) 360 restaurant. I've reviewed that separately in another review. This review is about the CN Tower itself.I would say the cost far outweighs the aesthetic value, UNLESS you go at night. On a clear night the view and experience is priceless. Watching the city twinkle and...

Went to the cn tower today just because there is not much todo In Toronto sightseeing wise.To me if u been to a sky tower befor like the one in Auckland or Sydney I would give this one a miss yes it is a nice view from the top but there nothing else no sky jump. The view can...

I recently visited the CN Tower in Toronto with my husband. We had called in advance to make reservations at the restaurant in the air. We arrived around 6:30, so it was still daytime. We were quickly ushered in and our reservation confirmed. We were then led to some special elevators for those with dinner reservations, which was nice because...

The views were amazing, because of the restaurant you have to pay an extra $12 each to go to the top if you want 360 degree views.The top level was a less busy, which almost made it worth it.The glass floor on the main level was good fun.
Visited on Easter Sunday and there were no crowds. If you like great views, pay the extra $12 for the Sky Pod - it was worth it. Pre-purchase tickets online to get the discount.
Great view but nothing special but very expensive. and We face very long lines. I like Skylon tower more.

The lineups were killer, but we were there during March Break so it's expected. Waited about 20 minutes for the elevator to the Sky Pod. The view was spectacular..go on a bright clear day for best results.
The views over Lake Ontario and the surrounding area and the restaurant at the top. Definitely worth visiting if you are in the city.

Our visit was part of our dinner package to the 360 restaurant. It's a very busy attraction, but everyone should visit at least once. The view is beautiful. Kids love the glass floor, and the walls have facts about the tower as well as other tall buildings around the globe. The elevator takes the longest - if it's busy it...

The CN Tower is a must. Stunning views. Two observatory levels to choose from. I didn't find too much value in the higher one, would have been happy enough to go for only the first level. The first level has the views you need, plenty of information about the tower and a glass floor if you feel daring. During the...
Visited in 2007 - went with a large party and we all enjoyed a meal in restaurant good not great !I enjoyed the views but could not stand nor look down the glass floor !

The glass floor was intense! Took a little while to gain the courage. Walking outside on the deck was a lot of fun, crazy wind up there though! The elevator is also glass looking out the whole way up to the top! Overall, tons of great pics and definitely worth the money!

Visited last year in the summer and could not believe the price of entry. Just to go to the ceiling floor section the price was ridiculous. I admit you get full view of the city all around. The ceiling floor is a spectacle for all. But the pricing for the time you spend is awful. Then, there is a section...
reminds me of the Empire State Building just in another cityIt had great views and the elevator ride was fast and scary
It's a great way to see/experience a part of Toronto, but it's a bit pricey. We just did the tour and chose not to do the dinner because of the cost. Overall, it was a good experience.
The best thing about CN Tower is Toronto city and lake's view. The building is one of the tallests of the kind, you can also find some souvenirs to buy.
i have been here many times. i would suggest going on a clear day. here you get a great view of the area

Ok it's expensive- but Toronto is expensive. The view on a nice day is worth it. We went during the week and it was not crowded- crowding would make this experience much less worthwhile. There are 2 levels- first with the glass floor/indoor-outdoor portion and the second higher skypod level. Not sure the skypod views were notably different (at that...

The view is spectacular and the glass floor is nerve racking to say the least. The cost is a little expensive for what you get out off he experience. But overall is it worth the effort to take the ride up.
The elevator operators and other staff kept commenting on how lucky we were for having such a clear day! Wonderful views. FAST ELEVATOR!! Glass floor is OK. Price is rather high.

Good times going way up high. We had to coax the children onto the glass floor, but this was a good place to visit. If you are there on a windy, partly cloudy day stand outside and look up at the top of tower before you go in. That fun optical illusion will make being at the top even more...

We visited the CN tower this morning and it was fantastic. The weather was amazing sunshine so it was clear enough to see everything. I don't recommend if heights are an issue but for those who don't mind there are glass bottom views. Great way to start our trip to Toronto.

There is such a thing as a FREE LUNCH!On eventual arrival at 360 all is well. However arriving at the CN tower involved encountering a lady in red, pushing people around to get them through security. I found out later they were short staffed......in security! Sarah, a CN tower manger told me that because it was Good Friday they...

I hiked down there but found out it was >$30 to go to the top. Not even a gift shop on the bottom. I figured why bother. Cool roundhouse park and brewery tasting room to wander through across the street, so I did that instead.

Our first time up the CN Tower was pretty amazing. It was a clear day and we were able to see quite a ways from the top. The glass floor is great unless you have a fear of heights. We got there about 10:00 AM on a weekday morning and it wasn't too busy. Because it was over Easter break...

We loved this place.... Dined here back in July 2014 (bit late i know) Our experience was amazing.. blessed with a beautiful sun set at the end of the full 360.. well worth a table with good food and amazing views.. enjoy!!
If you want to see Toronto and all its beauty this is the way to do it! And if you have an adventurous ambition try the walk out side the tower!
Great Views from Top for first few minutes. Expect long lines on weekends Suggest going on a weekday.But if you are in Toronto for holiday its a one time watch little expensive thou!!
Great views and as someone who is not totally comfortable with heights the glass floor takes your breathe away.
Loved the CN. It's the only way to get to see the vast metropolis that is Toronto. Not so keen on the glass elevators, but a necessary evil for those who don't like heights.
Do it! The view is breath-taking...I love Toronto and I love it even more now that I got to see it from the top!!!

Dinner in the tower was a fabulous experience, we booked for 5.30pm and got to see sun setting.Food is pricey but worth it for the view and surroundings.Staff excellent, extremely helpful and attentive.
One of many visits to the CN Tower. Expensive visit, but the views were fantastic. Food was tasty but expensive as well.
everyone must come to vist the CN tower, expensive but worth it. the view at nighttime is spectacular
An amasing view of Ontario lake, an amasing view of Toronto city.You can see down from a place with glass, and take pictures on a sunny day. You can walk, at the edge of the tower outside.

I am afraid of heights. Like shaking and crying scared of heights. My husband however, is the complete opposite. After I dragged him to the aquarium he wanted to go to the CN Tower. We originally wanted to get lunch at the restaurant, but were told it was closed until 4:30 (which was weird since there were people in the...

I live very close to the CN Tower and I see it every day, so eventually I got to wondering what it would be like to visit. I was a little overwhelmed with all the touristy-traps (photos, souvenirs etc.) but once I got up to the top, I realized why people are willing to pay so much for an elevator...
It is a bit pricey, but the 360 resturaunt has amazing views and the food is quite good. Since the ticket up costs 30 anyway a 60 dollar lunch is not that bad a deal.
Expensive but worth it for the fantastic views. Ale sure you have a clear day. binoculars are great to have.
I really enjoyed going up to see the amazing view! Wow! I ate dinner here twice. The food is expensive, but it included the elevator ride.
Luckily we had a great day with a clear blue sky and a magnificent view. We paid a bit more and went further up to the smaller platform and it was worth paying. Simply said, a must do when in Toronto
This was a great attraction with great views even on a very overcast and cloudy day. I went early when there were fewer visitors and enjoyed the attreaction before the crowds arrived.
Just view this tall building from outside, the inside is not worth the admission. The glass window inside has a bunch of scratches and is blurry.
Had fun doing this with the kids - we came on a very clear day and the view was great. Evening light show is also worth taking in.

We loved seeing the sunset from the tower. If you plan it right you can see the whole city in the sun, watch the sunset, and then watch the city light up. The glass floor makes for a great adventure!Truly a place to visit in Toronto!
Great Experience, I wish I went a little bit later around 6/7 to see sunset and the city during the day and night. But still was amazing. Very windy outside, and quite busy!

I've been coming to Toronto for years, but had never been up the CN tower. So, on my most recent trip I had a day off and given that it was the most beautiful bright day I figured it was probably a good day to go up the CN tower as the views would be great.I think the CN...

This tower takes you to 115 stories and has an awesome view. You can look down from the top where its closed, go down a level to the outside, and look down through glass under your feet. It's quite spectacular.Reason for the 4 stars is the family pack they offer for a discounted price only accepts two kids and...
Really amazing height(over 500m).Glass floor was really entertaining.The price is too high for simple travelers.

CN Tower is nice for a first visit. Similar to other downtown towers and skyline but the CN Tower has other fun features like a 360 degree view and a glass floor so you can see down. The basic entrance fee is enough for a good view. If you have a foggy day don't waste your money. Also, there is...

Arriving from the skycrapers and see a bridge and when you are over the bridge you can see the immensity of the CN tower on the left and the immensity of the Hockey stadium on the right, and below your foot the railway....incredible scenary!Only we realize that the price to go up it seems too much expensive, however that...

Although there are long ques they get you through quickly and sufficiently. We went up late afternoon and had the pleasure of watching the sun set which was beautiful. They have a couple of restaurants to eat at there but we only chose to have drinks as we had other plans. We paid the extra to go to the next...

The CN Tower is a wonderful place to visit. Well organized system, and the view from the top is thrilling, especially at night. For better value, get a City Pass. It will get you here and 4 other attractions in Toronto for one fee, and no ticket lines when you go. And you get nine days to use it,The Museum...

You cannot come to Toronto and not go up the CN Tower. Beautiful view of the amazing city, interesting facts on the walls, and a fantastic revolving restaurant that serves some of the best steak and wine I've ever had. Pricey, but worth the experience.

When we went there, it was zero visibility since it was foggy so we could barely see anything. But i can imagine since i've been to the empire state building in new york and the sears tower in chicago, that the cn tower has a beautiful view of toronto!

It was a good experience for us. It is well organize, people are lining up and waiting for their turns. ( compare to my experience in Eiffel tower last year.) good view of Toronto area! They have a bigger glass floor compare to Macau Tower.

It was a clear day and I had not been up the tower in several years. So I decided to go up. But the price ($36 Can + $12 for the skyview (upper observation deck) was surprisingly high. Almost $50.That being said, the views are amazing, especially from the upper pod (33 stories above the main pod).One complaint,...

We had an evening meal and then a tour around the beautiful CN Tower. Although rather grey during the day, this attraction is stunningly lit at night and the 360 views of the Toronto skyline are stunning. The food, although slightly more expensive (as you would expect) is very much worth it. The steak I had was delicious and service...
If its a clear day well worth the visit not a great wait when I went and the view was superbstand on the glass floor and pray nobody has a glass cutter. Staff very friendly and proud of attraction

We got lunch for 55 each +tax ..food was very good ..This includes 3 course and u can acess the viewing deck..If u want to kept the cost down then stay away from the wine as it can cost as much as$ 200 for a bottle cheeper bottles start at $50....All in all well wort the trip up..

The CN Tower is the quintessential landmark that everyone should see while visiting Toronto. It boosts some great views of the city. It’s so high that it actually feels like your looking down from a plane. My advice would be to go on a clear day, so you can look as far as your eye can see, and avoid times...
Gotta do it at least once in your lifetime - the view, the glass floor - all of it is absolutely great. If you are willing, try the edge walk - freaky and fantastic.

Although the sky was clear, it was freezing outside. For the same reason, not many activities are carried out. So if you go during the winter you cannot do the edge walk or enjoy outside on the Look Out. The restaurants are open so might be a good idea having dinner with that view.For adults its 36 including tax....

It is definitely one of the few attractions available in Toronto you should experience. We did not wait too long in the line and it was not too crowded which was surprising for a Saturday afternoon. Beautiful view but you don't need more than 30 minutes to "see it all". Also, it was quite smelly... guess people get nervous in...

Very exciting place to visit, although in August the waiting times are ridiculously long. It is not as good value as other attractions such as Maid of the Mist but it is a must see thing if you are visiting Toronto. The view from the top is amazing and equally as good on the glass floor.Overall very good but...

We live here and I always loved taking my kids here for lunch and then to walk around.I just took our grandkids and they loved having lunch while the restaurant revolves. They thought that was so cool.The views are amazing and the food is acceptable realizing that they can't cook up in the sky.

If you want an amazing view of Toronto, & on very clear days you can see the tower that is in Niagra falls. I have been up to the top al least 12 times since it is a great place to take family & friends.
I was about 8 years old and it was fun and seeing the stadium at the top was breath taking. Whilst the glass at the feet was interesting to experiences how far from the bottom you are.

We recently spent only a day in Toronto, so we were looking for the best things to do in a limited amount of time. We chose the CN Tower as our first choice. Sadly, we were very disappointed in our choice. It was very expensive for our family of four to visit the tower, and we did not feel like...
The glass floor at the topic of the CN tower is worth the price of admission. An otherwise average to good experience.
What better way to get a perfect view of Toronto then at the top of the CN Tower! Everyone should go while in Toronto.

Yeah, thats basically the main attraction in Toronto!- It's beautiful the view up there!- It's not expensive, I think its the average price (about $30)- Try to get both daylight hours and night hours. Both views are really different and really beautiful.-TIP: Don't forget that there are two attractions in one (the cheaper ticket): so it's...
view is amazing , specially in night , if you do edge walk is out of the world . wind blowing on your face gives you different planet feelingthx

I always bring guests here, and they always love it! Great for all ages. Very accessible and easy activity. And what is not to love about the view! So glad that we have this wonderful building in our city.
It is pretty amazing architectural creation. I am always fascinated by the tall structures. Bit pricy but worth it. Must to do in Toronto.

If you come to Toronto and you don`t visit the CN Tower you`ll be missing something that, for many years, was the tallest freestanding structure in the world. The views on a good day are breathtaking; If it`s foggy or raining hard, change your plan for that day. I prefer to stick to the basics - the observation tower with...

This was our most expensive attraction to visit with our granddaughter but she was thrilled. You need patience to go through the line-ups on the better viewing days and times but it is worth it if you allow the time to enjoy the experience. Do not rush it or you will feel cheated.If you do not know Toronto take...

This is a must see for all tourists to Toronto. As a homegrown Torontonian I always take my visitors to the city to the top to enjoy the view and have lunch or dinner in the restaurant which turns 360 degrees. A little on the expensive side but if the weather is clear, well worth it. In the summer, if...
Great views in all directions!! Edge walk is something to behold!!!! Don't miss the glass floor!!!11

The best time to go is in the morning when they open or at sunset. My husband and I went up for a couple of hours and after a quick walk around we decided to go have a meal in the restaurant. Food was nice and the service was pleasant. Its a bit pricy but worth it if it your...
THE most awesome view of our City! But watch for line ups on Holidays! The price is worth the view, and if you choose to eat in the restaurant, it's even more worth it!
My family and I love the CN tower, the gla floor the 3D Movie, gift shop, the revolving 360 restaurant and yes the view on a clear summer's or winter's day is breathtaking.

cn tower was a must see when visiting toronto,the thrill of going up to one of the tallest sky scraper in the world. when your up there try walking across the floor looking down ,its a great experience and the kids and kids alike will love it.

I love looking at cityscapes as architecture fascinate me. This is well worth the trip and $$. The glass floor was cool too. The staff were full of pride and information of the city. It is a bit pricey for entrance fee but where else would you find such grand views? Next time I want to go up during a...

We took the ride to the observation deck, as a family group. It's extremely safe and the views are superb, looking out over the entire city and Lake Ontario. There's also a glass floor, which for the faint of heart is a heady experience. Looking straight down between your feet for hundreds of feet to the ground is a thrill....

It was amazing but. $ 32.00 is a hard reach. Plus parking was another $ 8. It was really cool to see but the view it's like flying in a plane. Then they wanted $2 to view thru the binoculars. The glass floor is interesting but impossible to capture a picture of. The green screen photo would be better and...

We had dinner at 430. The elevator ride was nice. We were promptly sat and our waiter was very attentive answering questions. The food was good. I took my 17 year old cousin and she loved it. A new must do in Toronto.
Than the CN tower .. It's worth the money and time to say you did it . Enjoyed my visit to the top had a nice meal at the restaurant can't beat the view unless your flying .
Great lunch in the restaurant and what a view. Grandkids thoroughly enjoyed the ascent but were a bit overcome by the glass floor.

The view is amazing from the top. You can see all the city and lake. However, you get the feeling that the tower is moving at times. The restaurants on top are good. At $32 to get to the top its a little pricey me thinks.
My experience in CN Tower was good, but I expected a little more. The experience is expensive ! Have a good time...........
Awe inspiring and fun for the whole family! Panoramic views of Toronto and fun ride on the lower floor for kids. But on the expensive side.

I went with my family and they loved it, as a first time visitor begin able to see the city from the skies was amazing I wish we had done the sky walk as I hear it is something to do while there unfortunately there was a long wait and we were rushed. I would suggest making this an all...

I've had the pleasure of visiting this once whiles in Canada and my oh my, I was truly amazed! The building is soooo Beautiful and the glass floor elevator was too exciting, to me not scary at all but then again I love freaky stuff lol. It was a great view and I cannot wait to visit again soon!

At $32 to ride to the observation deck this is an expensive attraction but worth it if you are a first timer to Toronto. From the deck you can see for miles and the glass floor area can take your breath away if you aren't expecting it.

Brilliant views from the top of the tower- stunning. Enjoyed the glass panels in the lift on the way up. Glass floor was a lot of fun and the outside deck was also a great experience. Went for a beer in the restaurant and the views were incredible.

Obviously if you're visiting Toronto, you need to "do" the CN Tower. You can't miss it wherever you travel around the city or the outskirts, it's looming above. Try to avoid sunset if you want a quick visit. The trade off though is getting the best of both worlds. Clear skies first with extensive views in the distance, then the...
Great views but spend bit extra and go for brunch or dinner the revolving restaurant is great value with perfect views

My husband has no great love for heights and generally avoids getting out of his comfort zone in this regard! However, he does love his food! So, the decision was made to book Sunday lunch in the 360 restaurant from the safety of home - the menu looked good and there was really very little emphasis on height! A beautiful...
Really nice view on Toronto but the food is extremely expensive. Thrilling to walk on the glass floor.

If you want to experience the bustling, vibrant city of Toronto, then a visit to the CN tower is a must for any traveller. The view makes the climb to the top and the wait in queues worth it. It was one of the things on our tick list & didn't disappoint. I was a bit nervous of going up in the lift but it was a fantastic thing to watch yourself going from ground to about 140 floors high in 58 seconds. WOW. Tip go early in the morning, we were there for opening time and got in...

Located next to the Roger center, enter and purchase the tickets are about 35 dollars, management staff will arrang and bring us up to the tower, first if you like to go to 360 restaurant, or stop at the first stop for enjoy the view only of the city's, frozen lake and ocean views at the winter. Whether this is your first visit to Toronto, or your 87th, you should definitely experience the thrill of visiting the CN Tower! It is located in the "must see" part of the city (in proximity to the ACC, Sky Dome, Steam Whistle Brewery, the Harbour, Ripley's Aquarium). You will have a totally different perspective of Toronto's expansive urban sprawl. I...
book dinner there and the cost is waved and you can use the savings to have a little drink. Go before sunset....catch the city in the day light and night light

It was a sudden visit to this well identified attraction of Toronto. Definitely something you will enjoy. Special attraction within the attraction is the glass floor. Gives an awesome view and adrenaline rush when you're at the top standing on the glass floor. A must visit for the adventure seekers, especially with the edge walk now open for public.
A nice little attraction. Price is a bit steep for a local but it's nice to see once or twice :) I have never tried dinner on top

I really like the CN tower and one cannot come to Toronto without going up there. If you like adventure, you can go during the day and do the edge walking. Enjoyed the view in the day better than the night.We also paid to go to the sky pod which I would recommend, this was not as busy and when you look down you are a hell of a lot higher than the lower observation point.The glass floor was great, I am not scared of heights but even my...
The experience of going to the first then second viewing areas will remain with me for ever. A must visit attraction for anyone visiting this fantastic city.

Went with my family all the way to the top. I was so scared to step on the glasses, but loved it. So beautiful to see the view around . The view of Toronto is amazing. Enjoyed every minute of it. My kids loved too and we don't mind coming back. We had a good time. Here.

Pay extra to go to the top level. Make sure you walk on the glass floor. The rotating restaurant is a good way to bypass the line ups. We went in the evening and watched the sun set. A good way to visit any viewing area is to go up in day light and stay until the sun sets.
Excellent restaurant with extensive selection of shellfish, fish and meat. Helpings are very generous.

Enjoyed the view and took some great pics. I don't think the extra it costs to go a few more levels to the top is worth it. Less space, windows not that clear (In fact misted up when I visited). I was able to get a refund for the latter, so that's a plus for service. Stay and enjoy a...
This is truly an amazing experience. Toronto is a surprisingly beautiful city and the high view is awesome. Lift is quick, staff are helpful and I would love to go back.

I wasn't much a fan of the glass floor viewing platforms (not much to look at) however my husband and I had dinner at the restaurant and the food was impressive and the views are absolutely breathtaking! I will note that service was average and it was a little pricey but if you're after fantastic views of Toronto, I would...

I REALLY enjoy this! I went to both the restaurant level and the skybox levels. That's the highest I've ever been except when I'm in an airplane! It was a clear day and I could see the whole city and more! It was breathtaking! If you are in Toronto, you have got to check this out!

We went up the tower including a pod visit. The views were spectacular, well worth a visit.We had a drink and something to eat in the restaurant and although slightly expensive, the quality was excellent.There we no queues and the visit went extremely smoothly.Excellent trip.

If you want to go to the CN Tower be prepared to spend a lot of money if you want to go all the way to the top. It's very expensive and it takes forever to get back down. You basically have to line up to get back down the elevator. The view however is breath taking.

Great experience from start to finish. Very professional, loved how the elevator operator was friendly and gave great information. Fortunately the view was perfect. Sunny and a 360 view. We didn't do the Skywalk but will the next time we come back.
It offered amazing views of the lakes, and the city of Toronto. The viewing time was expedient (no long lines). Conveniently located near other attractions.

My husband and I had lunch there yesterday before flying home. It was an incredible view. The 360 restaurant is pricey for sure, but for this experience it is worth it. Plus the food was delicious, we were not disappointed. This landmark is a Canadian source of pride. A must see. The glass floor was a great addition to the...

it was really cool experience a little scary for me but my daughter wanted to go and lay on that glass so high up in the air.. The best recommendation is to eat there and then you get to see the view for free.. it is a little pricey for the meal but the view is spectacular. wow!
Amazing views. Times it to get there to see the daylight views than stayed until it got dark to watched the sunset. Lovely.

This could very easily fall into the "tourist trap" category. For starters, it is a bit expensive (minimum 30 CAD for adult entry) but it is worth a visit. If you're in Toronto, it's a must see. The view from the top is simply amazing. I was there during the winter and to see the entire city covered in white...

We spent over $100 to go all the way to the skypod. We went with a 8 and 2yrs old. The baby didn't have to pay. We went saw and left. The whole experience took less than 1 1/2 hrs. I guess we all felt the same about it... we "had" to see it but we weren't impressed.

The lunch package is well worth it - the food was amazing and the view is great. The glass walk is smaller than expected and unfortunately certain parts were closed due to weather (which we were not told when we booked our reservation).

First things first: The 360 view from CN Tower should not be missed. Seeing the financial district, the islands and all the surrounding areas from above is very impressive. The elevator ride is also an experience in itself. The only downside is the price which in my eyes is a bit too steep compared to similar attractions I have been...

It's great to say you've been up to the top of the CN Tower, but good luck breathing up in the Skypod. By far the least oxygenated building we've ever been in.The price is ridiculously excessive really for what you get (compared to the rest of Toronto). Perhaps in London you would expect such prices, but in Toronto it...

I took the kids to the CN Tower on the weekend because I really feel it's a must do, and my daughter kept asking to go. We drove down and parked at the "Green P" parking on 40 front street (5-10 minute walk), it was $7 for about 4 hours. We opted for tickets that included the "Sky Pod" for...

Every one that comes to visit Toronto insists on going up the Tower. The view is amazing but the cost is excessive. For a visitor it's ik for licals its a burden. We simply drive out guest downtown and drop them off and go to a local bar for 2 hours.

The Toronto Skyline is beautiful from this vantage point. It is not what I would consider cheap, but,especially for those who do not get to take regular trips to the area, it is worth at least a day and night visit if you can do it.
You get an incredible view of Toronto from the top of the Cn. The location is another positive point, since it is connected to the union station. A suggestion, go in a sunny day!

We visited the CN Tower twice during our most recent stay in Toronto – once in daylight and the other at night. Both times we thoroughly enjoyed the views.We booked our tickets through the Toronto CityPass which was great value for money as well as also gaining a free ticket to the top by dining in the 360 restaurant....
Certainly worth a visit.Something to always remember .Cost is a little steep so make sure if on a vacation you budget for this treat.

If there is one thing to see for your stay in Canada, this is it. A brilliant piece of Canadian engineering. The glass walk is amazing, and you can literally just take in the scenery for hours... Great for everyone, and remember to bring your camera for the view!

Second tallest Tower in the world, on a sunny day is amazing! You can see Niagara Falls from there (depends on weather condition), the Hotel where The Queen stays, the harbour view and much more.Don't go only to the lookout, go up to the Skypod! :)Tip: if you go to Ripley's Aquarium of Canada first you can have...

I absolutely loved this experience..... from the wow factor in the elevator to the glass floor... which did make me go a little queasy. We did pay to go on the extra platform which was well worth the extra $12 in my experience. If you are going to Toronto and want to experience the views from high up go for...

I love a good view and the CN tower has that in abundance. I was there out of season, so almost no tourists, which made it a lovely experience. I was told that in season it can get extremely crowded. It is worth the visit. Staff was friendly with lots of interesting facts about tower.

I am not afraid of heights, but looking through the glass floor is not for the faint of heart. What a thrill that is! Other than that, the view from the balcony was great, but bitterly cold as we went here in January. Brrrr!

The CN tower was beautiful!We had dinner at the 360 restaurant which we loved.We paid a little over $200 for dinner and drinks for me and my husband.We loved the food and the view,so pretty.Toronto was amazing fron up there.We enjoyed everything.

How could anyone visit Toronto and not go up the CN Tower? It was my first time in Toronto, but I absolutely loved it. It was -38 including wind chill on the day. Lake Ontario looked like it was steaming and clouds were forming above.The views were really something special, visibility was perfect.We had lunch at the restaurant...
Beautiful view of the city especially if you go just before dusk. You get both the natural view then the view of the city lights!
We got there for opening at 10am on 15th Feb so found hardly any wait and not busy on the viewing levels, unfortunately due to the inclement weather the outdoor viewing area was closed

our family had a great time, the Edge Walk, reminded me of The Edge, in Melbourne, Australia, at Eureka Skydeck, we also ate in the revolving restaurant, that was a a treat for the kids, and adults alike, the novelty, highly recommend a visit when in Toronto
