I purchased CityPass via Costco offered $52 each person, good enough to get around with top 5 attractions over Valentine's weekend.Went up there for a night, and no couchs/sofas provided for resting and viewing over valentine's weekend? The nice sitting area is only available at Horizon restaurant and 360, oh please!

Here you will get to the top of the tower via one of the most fastest elevators. Your way up will take less than a minute. As one of the most popular touristic attractions it is always full of people all over the world, great opportunity to make some friends if you are travelling alone. CN Tower also provide you...

It's one of the things you have to do in Toronto so they charge accordingly. $34 to the main viewing platform with the restaurant and glass floor. Another $12 gets you up to the Skypod a further 33 stories up. The Edge Walk is $195 but wasn't open during our trip thankfully otherwise I'd have felt obliged to do it...

Had a pretty good time here, despite the fact we couldn't see much because of the weather. Still got some pretty cool views from here. Would love to come back and see how amazing it is during clear skies. Kinda pricy, but if you go with the CityPass for $65, 4 other attractions. If you visit at least 3 the...
We did not expect a very culinary experience and we were right. the Seattle Tower's brunch was better than this dinner, and the restaurant seemed rather tired

Make sure to spend the extra $12 per person to go up to the Sky Pod. The elevator line to go back down was long (although we were there on a holiday weekend). Buy your tickets online to save a bit of money.
A little pricy for the experience. Make sure you go on a clear day. You could try the Skywalk while you are there at an additional cost. Not for the faint of heart
See Buffalo from here. See Niagara Falls from here. See Hamilton from here.Rotate in the restaurant.Climb the stairs if you are fit.

A MUST SEE! It offers an incredible view of the beautiful city of Toronto and everything is very exciting, especially the glass floor. It's definitely the first place to go to if you're in Toronto and haven't been to other tourist attractions like this before.
Pick a clear day. Any day. The views do not disappoint. Day or night the city is bright . Make a weekend and rock the joint. Dinner deals and the area around will leave you'd dumbfound.

Overall it was a magnificent experience. Just the view is breathtaking. Must see for people who visit Toronto, just the prices are pretty expensive. First of all everyone was just mesmerized by the nightly view of Toronto, including the harbourfront from the top.If you visit the city, the 553 meters high CN Tower (Canada's National Tower, constructed 1973 –...

Again very pleasant experience at CN Tower! For a second year we celebrated my daughter's BDayup high at "Horizons" restaurant during promo weeks. Excellent food, service and amazing view!It was a special night for the whole party!

This attraction, obviously, is a must see for people who visit Toronto or live in Toronto. I do not recommend visiting it more than once though as it is quite expensive and there is not much to gain once you get thrill of it the first time.

CN Tower is definitely a must visit place when coming to Toronto. It is one of the places we always take friends for their first time... not a place to go too often but well worth it every couple of years.

You can get undoubtedly get great views of Toronto and there is an outdoor area where it gets pretty windy. Also, the glass floor is one of the highlights. Unfortunately, I think it's way overpriced and for large groups, perhaps not worth it.
Over thirty dollars per person just to look around the city? I guess it's ok for first timers but I find it to costly! Especially for a large family.

We went up for the Winterlicious Dinner.It is expensive to even take the elevator up to the top. The dinner was excellent as was the Winterlicious deal but its not cheap by any means.The building is old. It needs an updating.If you want to see the entire city from above than I would go...but be prepared for...
We went in peak tourist season. Even though line was long, it moved really quick.Enjoyed it very much. Great photo op for some 'selfies'.

I've been going to the CN Tower since it was opened. It never fails to impress me. The view alone is of course spectacular.Some people can get a little squeamish going up the glass elevator. You can always turn your back to the window.Go visit. Make a reservation for dinner. The best time is when there's a storm---lightening...
Very interesting if you have never been up it before the glass floor is neat looking all the way down. The rotating restaurant is also a good view of the city & the food is pretty good.

CN Tower - the pride and joy of many Canadians has long been eclipsed by other similar towers across the globe.Yes, you get a good panaromic view of Toronto from the observation deck but it is expensive. The restaurant is also expensive.

Brilliant view from the top. Across Toronto Islands and the vast Lake Ontario and a complete vista of the city and beyond. A must do when visiting Toronto. Walk across the glass floor and look down to the ground far below. First time feels a bit scary but its got to be done. Try to go up on a clear...

Well worth the stop while we were in town. Amazing engineering feat and interesting to read about too, but what makes it worth it is the views from the top. While we didn't have a super clear day, we could see a good distance. Also a bit of a thrill to stand on the glass floor, definitely gets your heart...

On a clear day you can almost see forever! It's a great experience, but for two people it cost over $100 to go up, and the visit lasted just over an hour. Still, everyone should do this at least once.

We felt the CN Tower experience was quite expensive for what you get. Yes the view is amazing and the glass floor is a little freaky but fun. I wouldn't bother paying the extra $12 to go up to the next level, the view is worse than the lower level as its all fenced in. I also wouldn't bother unless...
Took our son for his 9th Birthday to the CN Tower. He loved it, and we had late lunch/dinner at the 360 Restaurant as well. Food was great (chicken club - amazing).

I recommend making dining reservations at the restaurant up top. Kids' meals are half the price of an adult meal, and everyone's elevator ride is included. There is virtually NO line for the rides up to the restaurant, and when you've finished eating you can take a flight of stairs down to the observation deck. Then DO not line up...
Incredible view of one of the best cities in North America from the observation deck at the CN Tower. Also, the 360 Revolving Restaurant is amazing!
Wow! Amazing view from the tower; glass floor was small panels but quite an experience. Make sure you visit on a clear day to get the best out of your visit.
The fact that it was the It is the tallest free-standing structure fascinated me. But what really got my heart pumping was the EDGEWALK - what a thrill :)
I always live going up the CN Tower. It's always great to look or walk in the glass floor well a Blue Jays game is on and the dome is open.
After you do all of the prerequisite attractions in the tower, treat yourself to the best surf n turf dinner you will ever have, in their 360 degree revolving restaurant.

An amazing experience. A bit pricey so make sure you visit on a clear day. You can see for miles in All directions, even as far away as Niagara Falls. The Toronto Island Airport is below the tower so it is great to see planes landing underneath you. The elevator ride is fast and the lineups can be long.
A bit expensive but the view is spectacular. Try to go during the sunset for pictures then grab a drink at the bar.
Appropriate for families, young to old, solo or a romantic date - have dinner at the revolving sky top restaurant Be an adventurous thrill seeker and do the skywalk!

If you are going to go up the CN Tower, do the sky walk. For an astounding 200 dollars, it's worth it to enjoy a literally breathtaking view. The rest of the experience pales in comparison. But is still quite enjoyable.

The CN Tower is a communications and observation tower in Downtown Toronto over 553-metre tower featuring a glass floor & a revolving eatery with panoramic views. It is also the signature icon of Toronto's skyline and the world tallest free-standing structure. I love the view as well as the revolving restaurant. 360 The Restaurant at the CN Tower, one of...

A truly unique structure with glass elevators and glass floors to walk on!! If you can go before sunset on a clear day, it is a really incredible experience. You can even have a beautiful dinner in the revolving restaurant.

One of the iconic places to visit here in T.O. (Toronto Ontario). We take all visiting relatives up here the first time they come to town. Do yourself a favour, make a reservation with the restaurant. You'll spend a bit more, but get a free trip up and an AMAZING meal. You sit on the revolving deck and watch the...
Perfect destination for the family on first Toronto visit. Only downside tends to be a little pricey...

This is an interesting site to visit. Pick a clear day. I personally find it overpriced, but I find most tourist sites over priced. It's very efficient processing and the views are excellent. There are edge walks that you can also partake in if you have the nerve.We take all our guests that are interested there but don't always...
Scared to death....but once in a lifetime adventure - a MUST SEE!!!! Once you have overcome and tried it, you will want to do it again and again.

Absolutely breathtaking view of Toronto and surrounding area. Follow the shoreline of the lake and on a clear day, or night see the Skyway bridge between Burlington & Hamilton, as well as the Skyway bridge in St. Catharines. You can see all the way to Niagara Falls. Watch planes landing below you at Toronto Island airport. Eat a very nice...
one of a kind experience - be sure to go on a clear day for amazing panoramic view of city and Lake Ontario
Wonderful views of the city if the weather is clear. Restaurant is very expensive, and rotates slowly. Great photo opportunity.
There is nothing to compare with a ride up the CN Tower to get a perspective on the City of Toronto and the areas surrounding it....all the way across to Niagara Falls and Rochester New York!
I like taking out of town guests, its good to do once.They have a thing where you can walk around the outside of the tower, you have to book in advance.

We have been up the Tower many times but the trips with our Grandchildren are the best.Just to see their reaction and things through their eyes made the experience extra special.A must do if you are in Toronto and make sure you walk on the glass floor.

Probably the top attraction site of Toronto, would help a lot if you are lucky enough to have a clear day. If you have fear of heights this one is not for you ..... The glass floors on top would certainly qualify as a horror movie :)

Fan place for young and not so young. Pricy ? yes. What isn't this days. You will get what you pay for. The wow factor . For strong at hart , try to take the top of the tower outside adventure , you will know what I mean .
It is an interesting ride up the glass elevator to the observatory deck. The food offering is hit and miss. It is a great view of the city and Toronto Island but that is about it.
We wanted to see the glass floor but paid so much. Make a timed ticket. For instance, a 30 minute showing so much, an hour time another price.
had a great visitTook my daughter and her friend they were really excitied and loved the fact that they could go higher

You have not seen Toronto if you have not climb the Tower.......If you are lucky and you see baseball game going on in the Sky Dome with open roof beneath through the glass floor....make sure to take the picture.....

The CN tower is ideal for families with kids under 13. The lofty view is available fromnumerous high/rise hotels that come with rich dividends. Line-ups can be irksome and yet like climbing a mountain the view rewards the persistent tourist. A better summer choice for families is nearby Centre Island!

The CN tower stands out as the most obvious landmark of our fine city. And it doesn't disappoint as a place to visit and experience. It has it all. A great ride, a great view and a wonderful dining experience.

I have accompanied to CN Tower many friends and family members who came for a visit to Toronto and was happy to see their reaction. Everybody just loved the view from the upper observatory. I would recommend you go there on a sunny day, so can really enjoy the visit.

The CN Tower has been a Toronto landmark since 1976, when it opened as the tallest freestanding structure in the world, a title it held until 2011 when the Burj Khalifa opened in Dubai. However, regardless of what's the tallest, the views from up there are spectacular, beyond anything you can see elsewhere in this area. There's a reasonably good...
That is how it is viewed, and it is certainly interesting by itself. Visitors to Toronto should visit it.

This is a great experience for Torontonians as well as tourists and visitors. If you can, wait for a bright clear day and you can see for miles. My most memorable experience was taking a Japanese couple up the tower on a summer evening and they could watch the Blue Jays play below because the roof was open on the...

The CN Tower is a must for every tourist to Toronto! Not only can you enjoy a 360 degree view of the city (and as far as Niagara Falls), visitors can also test their true grit on the outdoor Sky Walk (weather permitting) or enjoy a great meal in the revolving restaurant.

This is a "must see" in Toronto. Obviously best on a sunny day but very impressive at any time.Kids will really enjoy it. For those with courage, there's an outdoor, tethered walkway all around the top of the tower. Too scary for me but lots do it
Yes it is an expensive tourist trap but, it also gives fantastic views of the city and the lake. Just check the weather and go on a clear day. A must place for Torontonians to take visitors.
You can see it from just about everywhere in the city. Just look up...waaaay up!Try standing right underneath it, that's where to snap the best pictures.

There is so much to do and, of course, see at this attraction. It is definitely for everyone, from young children to the hippest of teenagers, from newly engaged to honeymooners, from weekend escapers to golden anniversarians, from hopeless romantics to the most adventurous thrill-seekers, everyone will love it and I doubt any body will leave disappointed.

You would be remiss to miss going to the top of the CN Tower and looking down below through sections of the floor made of clear glass. Quite a breathtaking view of the city from all directions and well into New York on a clear day. The revolving restaurant is also a treat suitable for a romantic dinner as well...

Yes it is THE landmark of Toronto. Yes, the view is breathtaking, but honestly, $40 per person to go up an elevator.If you go up and want food, then you are really leaving big bucks.The 360 Restaurant has a small list of options with big prices.So... no, not really.There should be something like they have for...

I consider this attraction a must see for all who are visiting Toronto. You get amazing views of the city. Glass floor is fun to walk on. I would recommend to go in the afternoon so you get to see Toronto by day & night. Don't forget your camera and check the weather for a clear day coz if it's...
I have been to the tower a few times over the years... great place with so much to do with everyone in the family.

the view is amazing. I recommend you to go. You can buy a lot of souvenirs from Canada. You can meet a lot of people of different countries. The food is great. It's not worthy of go only to see the city, you also neet to eat and enjoy the 360 restaurant.

If you want to impress your wife or make a proposal to your girlfriend, CN Tower Restaurant 360 is the best place to arrange this event! The spectacular view on the night Toronto, crispy wine and delicious cuisine will make your evening unforgettable !
The trip up the CN Tower is worth doing. You get an incredible view. Line ups can be long but move quickly. It's a unique experience.

I live in Toronto and rarely get the occasion to go out for dinner at the worlds tallest spinning restaurant but when I did, I must say it was great service, great food and a stunning view of the city and lake front. It is very pricey for 2 of us the meal cost about $250. Don't expect to pay...

On clear days you can see every point of Toronto and surrounding areas, but I've also been there on days where clouds are the main attraction. So check the weather forecast before heading to the Tower.
Awesome, I find the cn tower is one of the best place to spend the afternoon , and go to the 360 restaurant enjoy the good food with amazing view !
Bit expensive but its good to visit with family once.consider going on ferry from toronto port to center island.... kids will love it

Everytime you do have friends or family come in from out of town, this MUST be a priority on your list of must sees.Not only are the views amazing from the infrastructures of the city, but the amazing lake views with the sailboats. Summer os definitely the time to so this. The glass floor also adds to the excitement....

Don't think you can go to Toronto and not do the CN Tower. We did it at night and the view was great - but think going up on a clear day must be just as good ( especially th view of the lake).A little pricey at $32 just to go up....but it's a lifetime experience.

You do not need to go to the pod - how much more can you see? The really brave may get to hang over the edge but for the timid there is always the glass floor with a view straight down - and yes it does sway in high winds.
Toronto visit is incomplete if you would not visit CN tower. It was used to be the Tallest Viewers Gallery in the World.

Although the serving was quite slow,but the food was good and the revolving restaurant was the real thing. You will not really observe the time as you are busy looking outside and after the lunch ,you get to go up and see the whole Toronto in CN Tower.
Lots to do. Skywalk is the best was to see the hole city. Hotels around are cheap and lots if shopping all around.
yes expensive no problems if scared of heights feels safe has a restaurant worth booking an average expensive meal as it circles the skyline neat experience

CN Tower is a great place to go. I would suggest in summer months from May until October. Also, experience the elevator ride and edge walk. I did not experience the edge walk but my friends have. But the view of Toronto from the top is amazing.

When you arrive in Toronto, especially downtown, one architectural marvel stands high above all the others and that is The CN Tower. Don't strain your neck looking up - wayyyy up!!! Then make your way to the entrance of this modern wonder of the world and head up to the top for an outstanding view of the city. There's lots...

Traveled up the tower as the kids had always wanted to do it.Went early in the morning and didn't have too long (15 minutes) of a wait to buy tickets.The ride up and down was neat, if a little crowded. Once we got up there was hardly room to walk. We checked out the glass floor and observation...

The view is breathtaking! Any sunny day is the best time to go. We went to a 360 restaurant and had a lunch there. We had very good service, and the food was delicious. A bit pricey but a must see in Toronto!
Toronto can be seen from 360 degree, with Lake Ontario on one side to street views to the north. I'm always surprised at how many trees our city has which is especially viewed from the CN Tower.

I have been to the CN Tower so many times I've lost count, yet I'm never disappointed with the thrill of the elevator ride up to the top, or the view once I'm there. I held my youngest son's 6th birthday party at the CN Tower, it was one that he will never forget. It was actually really great value...
It's a unique place to be in North America. The view of the city from all angles os fantastic!It's in one of the best cities in the world, if not the best.

Definitely something to experience when in Toronto. As others suggest be sure it is a day with good visibility to get the max from your excursion. Love that it is right beside the Ripley's Aquarium which is also absolutely worth it - love the sharks and fish swimming right above and around you - in tanks of course.

The view on a clear day is nothing short of spectacular but the ticket prices are ridiculous! If I am to be honest I would rather sneak into one of the high rise buildings in downtown Toronto and check out the view from there....for free!!

It is an affordable and enjoyable day for the entire family. We ate dinner at the top and enjoyed the view of Toronto. The kids enjoyed the sensation of the fast elevators. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Worth going for lunch as the price includes the views from on high also there is a separate elevator for the dining room and often no line-ups.Wine list is good but may add significantly to your bill.Check the weather for a really clear day--view is fantastic.
Don't bother going if it is low fog or the city is clouded in. Yu need a clear day to enjoy the view.

Awesome view of the city of Toronto, Lake Ontario and the Toronto Islands one nice day you can see the plans take-off andLand at Island airport.Summer you can see the sail boats through out year see the ferry takes people to island.An unique aspect to restaurant at top or CN Tower is that restaurant revolves around the the...
Not considering the Eiffel Tower - it is a nice structure but as you can see from the outside, it does look boring. It cost too much to go up. The line up is ridiculous. The staff are unfriendly.
If you're going for the view you'll be impressed and although the restaurant has improved it's still average
You can jump and down on a Plexiglas floor and see the ground and people 1/2 mile below your feet. The harbor sight and watching planes fly around at a height lower than you is awesome.
I have visited the CN tower many times been to the restaurant and taken visitors to see the view. The food is not spectacular but worth it for the view. All my visitors loved it.
It was my wife's first trip to Canada and the sea food special was outstanding! It was a very clear night and the view was excellent. A very positive experience for her.
it was an amazing trip up to the upper deck of the tower what an amazing view from there it was breathtaking a must see

I paid what seemed like a fortune to go to the top of the tower (well, almost the top -- that costs extra. But alas, the day was very cloudy so the visibility was somewhat limited. I really enjoyed the exhibits, though. Their gift shop is terrific.
Fantastic views... A definite must while visiting Toronto! Beware of unecessary tourist traps, such as the cost of dinning in tower, unless it is a special occasion.

Absolutely amazing views of Toronto and the harbour. You can also stand on a plexiglass floor and see how far it is straight down! If you're really adventurous, the Skywalk might be for you. You are securely attached to the outside of the tower and you then lean out over the edge. The revolving restaurant at the top is expensive...

This is fun activity to do when visiting Toronto, or even if you live here like I do. It's a great view of the city, and you can easily see the U.S. on the other side of Lake Ontario. On some days you can see what looks like clouds on the horizon to the southwest, but it's actually vapour or...

As someone who lives in Toronto, its funny how after a while you don't even notice this giant toothpick sticking out of the ground.I would sometimes lie in bed in my downtown condo and wonder if it fell over would it hit my building from here. Then one day I realized that I can actually go inside it and...

If you have a nice, clear sunny day (no grey or smog), going up to the main deck or the observation deck will provide a very nice view of the city and Lake Ontario. It has been stated that on very clear days it is possible to see Rochester, NY - (??). The glass floor is cool (for me, it...
Too expensive for a family to go up to the top.. Although tourists want to see toronto from the cn tower much to expensive

Our family went to the CN tower when it was first built. It was nice to go and see how much the tower and the city has changed. Overall the price is reasonable and you can spend as much time as you like. I also paid the extra and went up to the next level. The glass floor sure is...

We were lucky that we got a clear evening and the views were outstanding. Went for a meal at 360 degree restaurant which gives you free access to the other floor (with the glass floor). Could imagine it feels expensive if you are paying directly. We booked for 5.30pm which meant that the sun set while we were eating, which...

We visited the CN Tower on a beautiful clear night and were rewarded with stunning views over the city. You can see for miles!The elevator ascends one side and descends another side, while there is a glass panel on the floor.On the observation deck there is a large glass floor - a fantastic photo opportunity for those not...

The view from the upper observatory is amazing, even though my group has not been lucky when we went there because the weather was mainly cloudy and it obstructed the complete view. On the downside, the tickets are expensive and the observatories are not completely open to the sky (there are closed windows all around), what makes it difficult to...

I know it's cold my suggestion pick a day when visibility is unlimited go to yahoo.ca and there will be information thereIt is an awe inspiring sight to see Torontocovered in snow and be able to see out 100 km in all directions. I know it's a little pricey but worth the trip for me

I visited as a child and again in January 2014. I thoroughly enjoyed this attraction and I would go again. It is a must-see when if you are showing friends around Toronto who are not from here/Canada. The view is great, stay up for a while to soak it in. Lots of construction...play the 'count the crane game...' Interesting to...
A bit pricey but a must see in Toronto. The only better view in the city is from the island because you can see the skyline perfectly.

This was my second trip, but I took someone who had never been. The ticket booths are very efficient and well run, as is the lining up for the elevators. The walk-around 360 view is breathtaking. We went to a nice little restaurant and had a small snack. We had very good service, and the food was delicious. We also...

I first visited the CN Tower in 2007 and the view from the top was amazing. I cannot remember how much I paid for entry but it was not expensive. I highly recommend going as you will see some nice distant landscapes.

The iconic torinto skyline! Yes the tower is a site to see but its very expensive and cost even more to go further up in the tower and the "glass" is a small square that you can barely enjoy when they jam pack the elevators to capacity on the so called tour .. it is definitely a go just to...

The cn tower is great attraction to see the city from different views especially on crystal clear days. The best way to see this attraction is to book a dinner at 360, because going up to observation deck is quite expensive. Booking a dinner allows you to really enjoy a great dinner and see the city as you revolve and...

The tower wasn't the top of our list when we visited over Christmas but great experience. Long line to get tickets but went fairly quickly. Elevator ride was fantastic takes only about 1 minute to get up and has glass bottom and sides so you can see whats going on. Crowed once we got up. Impressive structure and views. Glass...

On our first night in Toronto we visited the Steamwhistle brewery and the CN Tower. My friend did the Skywalk while I was just enjoying food at the restaurant. Unfortunately there were only one place left for the Skywalk so I let my friend do it...The scenic view from the tower was amazing and I really enjoyed the time...
Worth the visit! Just amazing view of the city and lake. Want to go again soon! Made a perfect day out complete.

All the way up the the CN Tower at the end of December 2014. Great views from every angle on a clear, crispy winter afternoon. Saw sun go down.. No line ups, friendly staff and able to go outside, around the 360 edifice at the very top many times. Jumped on the glass floor looking down at the baseball stadium...

We went to the CN tower during Labor Day weekend so obviously it was packed with people but the ticket line and the line to go up to the tower was worth it!! You have suck a beautiful view of Toronto from the CN tower. Really recommend it for people who visit Toronto

expensive, sometimes too crowded to enjoy. Restaurant over priced. Good place for children though. Good view from the top. Glass floor is fun but scary for some. Elevator ride the best part of CN Tower.

If you want to relax, enjoy a fantastic view over downtown Toronto, and have a good beer, the CN Tower is a great spot. You can also combine this visit with the Aquarium at the same time as they are close by. My advise is to visit the aquarium first and get to the CN Tower at the end of...

Went for lunch because reservations were full for dinner. No matter what time you go I would recommend making a reservation. We skipped a long line at a lunch by doing so! The food was better than I expected which was a pleasent surprise. We got lucky with a windo seat! The views of the city were incredible! Our waitress...

This is one of the tallest tower, I have visited I love it and I really enjoyed being there. It feels lovely. This scenery is wonderful. It's one one the place everybody has to visit, I would say put it on your bucket list if you can afford to get there, it is a must seen place I would recommend...
CN tower is very interesting place to visit. You can see whole city. It is very beautiful. People who work there will tell you everything about CN tower.

This wasn't the first tower I've been in but definitely one of the cleaner ones.Prepare before hand by trying to schedule your visit around the peak days and times and you will enjoy this far more. It's definitley worth checking out but what I liked the most was the exterior light effects at night.
Its a must if you visit Toronto.And now you can walk around the top outside. Well if you are brave.I been up there many times.The restuarant at the top is awesome but not cheap.

Again we had already decided we wanted to visit the CN Tower when we visited Toronto so as we surfaced up out of the metro station complex into the street it rises proudly up into the sky among the sky scrapers of Toronto. We made our way towards it and as we got closer you started to realise just how...

I really enjoyed the visit to the CN Tower. The ride up is quite a thrill, especially if you are standing near the glass doors. The view from the tower is great. Be sure you go on a clear day. My daughter had a blast running on the glass floor, where others where afraid to even step on it :)...

The view is good but I feel like the experience is very expensive for what it is. The staff were a bit hit and miss, some were very friendly and some made us like an inconvenience (especially in the gift shop).

We bought a city pass which entitles you to entrance to the CN tower along with other attractions for the fraction of the normal price.The lift ride is brilliant, try to be the last in the lift so you are lookign out of the glass window.The lower levels have plenty to see and the glass floor is a...

The view from the top was beautiful! I must admit that the admission seems a bit overpriced though. The glass floor is a really interesting experience! We enjoyed it and it seemed as if the other visitors were enjoying it too.

It's a bit pricey but worth doing once for the view. Go during the week in the middle of the day if you want to avoid a queue. If you live in Toronto, I highly recommend doing one of the charity stair climbs to the top. There are normally a couple a year.
Great experience. Best time to go at this time of year No tourists so now quueing. In the summer it can take 3 hours to go Up and one to come down

For the internal aspect, we speak about a building interesting to look. We did not rise in the tower during our passage because the weather was not beautiful and there was more a line of more than two hours.

I went up the CN Tower many years ago, so hesitated at paying again. It's around $40-50 if you go both to the main viewing level ("LookOut Level") and the "SkyPod" viewing deck. But it was worth it. The view in winter with the snow is spectacular. I stayed up there long enough to see it in daylight and then...

I visited the tower at night, a brave choice because I could not reallyr record much with my phone camera, but worth it because from the tower, you appreciate the expanse of the Lake properly, in the vast uninhabited black expanse. The city itself is a glittering mesh of multicoloured specks and streaks of light and I had some fun...

Worth going to visit when you are in town.. A typical tourist location. The place had a great view and the food was good to fair. I think it was expensive considering the quality. I would prefer to eat at the Trump and pay the same price. I think that you must go to the tower at least once!

Ive been up the CN Tower many times growing up in Toronto and every time i go back with new friends visiting it reminds me of the aw-inspiring 360 degree view of Toronto Ive left behind moving out west.

I enjoyed going up in the tower , but for me its one of those things I would probably not do again only because I would spend my money on a new experience the next time. But do recommend if you have never went up to do it at least once.

I traveled with a girlfriend to Canada and it was her first time ever in Canada. And of course we couldnt miss the visit to CN Tower before leaving!!We pay more than 30 USD to go up to find out that we could have done the same thing and getting a dinner at the restaurants on the same level...
A bit pricey, but worth it for the first time visitor to Toronto. We paid the additional for an even higher view from the area called "the Pod". Unparalleled views !

Walking from Union Station, after taking the GO Train, VIA Rail or TTC subway is through a covered walkway for most of the distance. It was very cold the day my granddaughter and I went and the wind chill was frigid. Be sure to dress for outdoor weather both for the walk and to enjoy the outside observation deck.The...
The 360 restaurant was fab, the views amazing - visit 30 minutes before sunset and see 2 different views of the city

If you are travelling to Toronto, it is worth it to visit the CN tower, not only because the estructure it self but the amazing view that you get from the upper part is outstanding, mostly on a clear sky day!Also you get a small explanation from a guide on the elevator.The 360 view restaurant do not open...
Obviously you cant beat the views, but its always lovely to visit a restaurant that doesn't rest on that alone. I would happily dine here even if it was at ground level.

We started our visit to Toronto with the CN Tower. I have been up to the top but my husband had not. We were not disappointed. We went up, had a look around and came down again. The whole thing took about 45 minutes or so. It's certainly a beautiful view! The price to go up is a little steep...

If you are not afraid of heights then this is the best view in all of Toronto, and you can even see the American side on a clear day. This is not a cheap trip and there are many ways they will try to suck every dollar out of you. Many places to eat, play, buy souvenirs, and many other...

The CN Tower is a must see if you are visiting the area. You can see this structure for miles. Visited with family while there for a wedding, the family kept saying you have to see it. So we did. The parking in the area was easy, however it could be that we were there in the WINTER!! But never...

I came here when I visited Toronto in September, and I found myself here again in January. I didn't pay the extra to go up to the top the first time, but I didn't make the same mistake twice. While Toronto doesn't quite have the same city sprawl of New York, or Tokyo, the views are incredible, especially when it...
Lunch was great at high levelThe food is excellent and the view amazing I would recommend everyone to take the time for a lunch. There is so much to see!

A great experience for the first time. Good views of the city. Needless to say not great for those afraid of heights. Especially the glass floor that allows you to see all the way down. If you have not been then I recommend that you do. If you have then you might agree that the visits following the first are...

Celebrate at the top. Lunch is a great way to not only visit the tower, but enjoy a long look at the view too.! Much nicer than the more crowded observation decks. Reasonably priced when you compare it to just visiting the observation decks.
A must visit for anyone who is in Toronto. The staff are friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable. The view is magnificient and the glass floor was exhilarating!

The price has gone up since I was here last but I had friends visiting from overseas so we had to go. It was a beautiful day and the veiw was breathtaking. We were all too scared to go hang over the edge.

Alright, so my first day in TO had clear sky, when i got to know about the city pass i got it without hesitation (just be aware of parking! 4$ every 30 min), i got up there, the way up is really cool going 20 km per hour and seeing how everything gets smaller and smaller, visibility was kinda limited...

If its your first time in the city, you have to visit here. The views of the city are great and you will get some good photos.Once you've been you can head over to the brewery near by for a tour and a nice pint of beer.

Bought Tower Experience + Sky Pod ticket (for additional CAD12 on top the usual Tower Experience ticket). Loved the 360-degree view of Toronto city. Very crowded though. At the Sky Pod, it gets very tight and I think they should control the number of people in Sky Pod at a time. Waiting for a chance to take the lift down...

This was going to be a treat on our trip - hoping for fantastic views and good meal. Unfortunately, despite discussing with the waiter that one of the group had a severe nut allergy, she was served a meal "with a dusting of pistachio"... 911 at the ready. Still cant believe it happened. Poor poor service.
Eating at the CN tower is one of a kind. It has an AMAZING view..... but with that view comes a hefty price tag. Defiantly not an everyday place to eat

The sight was amazing! I loved being up that high. I got to see all of Toronto! I wish I would have eaten up there. That's my only problem. The cost of food was too high in the restaurant, after spending so much to get up there who wants to shell out $70 for one meal? Other than it was...

This is a great way to see all of the city. Kind of pricey. We got off of the subway a little too early and it was quite a walk. There are many entrances so make sure you do a little research before you go. Plus there is quite a lot of construction close by at the train station.

It's expensive to go up there, but it's worth doing once in your life and I've been up their three or four times in the 35 years I've been on this Earth and I can look down and see the city from above. I can't say it blows me away anymore, but I think that's just because I'm spoiled. I...

We visited the tower on our first day in Toronto, it was on our 'must do' list. whilst I am not a huge fan of heights, my husband loves to go up tall buildings partly to scare the life out of me, but mainly to get our bearings and an idea of how an area is laid out. he succeeded...
Went for a conference in Metro toronto convention centre. CN tower was very close. Visited the tower in an afternoon. No need to say this is a must visit in toronto.

Make sure you get to this place when in Toronto. Take the glass floor elevator to the top and then enjoy the stunning views of this city. It's such an amazing feat of engineering, it's almost too much to describe. And check out the glass walkway, just incredible. It will mess with your mind.Be ready to queue a little,...
Fantastic elevator ride to the top and the glass floor was awesome! We saw the Rogers stadium below and visited there the next evening. Definitely worth the visit!

This is one of the tallest tower in world .It is also called as a Canada's National Tower.In 1995, the CN Tower was declared one of the modern Seven Wonders of the World by the American Society of Civil Engineers. It is 553 m high and mind blowing .When u reach to tower using elevator,u will feel like flying to...

The lifts do over 500m in less than a minute, with glass wall and floor. Could have done that a few times. The observation area is cool, but go down a level to the glass floor and see who will walk across it! A photo must! The restaurant is exemplary, we were mesmerised by the view. Got to go again!

The CN Tower is so spectacular. A visit to the top is a must. The glass floor, the city views, looking out across the water! Just excellent. It can be expensive to arrive and go up so check for offers online and pre book is my advice
Definitely a good icon of the skyline for Toronto. Stands out. Good views from above especially on a clear day.

The CN Tower is well...a tower. Just like any other tall building or tower in any other city I've ever been to. The view is of course amazing and fun. I didn't eat at the restaurant but it smelled great and I've heard good things about it. It was fun to sit and watch planes at the little airport right...
A must see attraction!!! The glass floor is one hack of a gimmick. Magnificient 360 degrees view of Toronto.

It's a must-do when you're in Toronto and on a beautiful, sunny day, the view over the city and the lake is breath-taking. But nevertheless this experience is rather expensive, so if you want to save some money, book the tickets on the CN-Tower website.

Go on a clear day or you won't see much. Views were amazing from the top, not sure if it was worth the money though, especially for a family. Go early, as soon as they open because it starts to get busiet aftet about 11ish. Glad I did it though.

It was once the tallest free-standing structure in the world and although that title is lost, it is still a must see. The views are incredible. Try to time your visit so that you can see it during the late afternoon, catch the sunset and enjoy the nighttime view. Line ups can be long during the tourist season. Bring your...
Great views and a neat way to see Toronto. Glass floor was unnerving for someone not comfortable with heights.

The CN Tower is a magnificent place to go with friends and family, and definitely a must-go of Toronto. From the glass observation desk, you can see basically the entire city, and the Lake Ontario - it's a very beautiful view. I've been to CN Tower many times, and enjoyed it ever time. The only setback is that the CN...
I grew up in Toronto and every few years still go up the CN Tower. The views of our city and walking on the glass floor are a must.

Yes. It's a tall building. Yes it's a gorgeous view from up there. Yes the glass ceiling is creepy. But it's crazy expensive and very very busy. I guess being from the area and seeing it my whole life there just isn't that omg factor a tourist may have. I take friends when they visit because it's apparently what you...

Even on a foggy day the view was awesome. I loved the glass floor. Con: was the long lines - it took forever to get to the elevator and its expensive. some cool souvenirs and if you can afford it a drink at the restaurant is recommended to really 'drink' it in.
Very expensive but we always go up the CN Tower every time we are in Toronto! The restaurant at the bottom leave s a little to be desired but the one at the top is very expensive.

The view from the observatory floor is amazing. Like many other towers with observatory level, you can the birds eye view of the Toronto city and appreciate the landscape.As you return to the ground floor you have to go through the gift shop, which worth looking at as they have great souvenir items.Great view, love it!

This is definitely Toronto's most famous landmark. The tower can be seen as soon as you approach the city by air and pretty much from anywhere in the city. It is so spectacular to stand right at its base as it goes straight up in the air and make you feel so small. Definitely worth the stop even just to...

The $12 extra fee to go up to the sky pod was worth it. The initial cost of the tower was steep. If you are going to do a few things in Toronto you should buy the visitor pass. It doesn't include everything so research first and it will could save you quite a bit, especially if you are taking...

This is one of the must do sights when you are in Toronto, and I am afraid of heights! The elevator ride up to the viewing platform is fantastic or in my case heart stoppingly frightening as three floors up you suddenly realise the elevator is made mostly of glass, something which is not apparant when you enter it in...
Awesome, the main attraction for the amazing city that is Toronto. On a summers day the views are unrivaled!

I live in Toronto and had gone up I. The CN Tower maybe 5 years ago.Tonight, I went to the 360 restaurant. The food was good but mind you a bit pricey.The views were amazing. Sitting in the revolving restaurant you can see all of the city and at some angles, even across the lake to NY. It...
It has glass floor which enables you to see the ground ... my personal experience it is thrilling but fun ... no Toronto visit if you don't visit this Tower as it is the landmark of Toronto ...

I normally love going up towers to see the view of the city - but I found this one to be a bit of a disappointment.Firstly the cost, $36.00 just to get to the main level - and then they wanted another $12 for go any further - this was very steep compared to the other attractions I visited...
It's a must see if a one time visiter, after that you really don't need to do it a second time. The kids loved it.
We ate at the 360 restaurant for Sunday lunch. It was pricey and the food was average but the waitor was very nice. The drinks are very high with little alcohol but you can't beat the view

It was a nice evening view looking over the City of Toronto. Experience the open catwalk and the glass floor. Did not pay the extra $12 per person to go up another 33 stories. If you go up in the Winter, make sure you take a hat!
Absolutely wonderful view. Although it was a nerve racking experience looking down through the glass floor. I would recommend although it was a little pricey.

A lovely way to see the whole city. We had to queue fo over an hour to get the tickets, so would advise buying them online before hand. It was very busy, so when we were at the top we had to fight to get to the front to see anything. But once at the window it was lovely.

It was amazing how high it was but that wasn't good enough so we went to the pod, that was amazing.Obviously it was cold & windy being December but still could see for miles & a walk on the glass floor is a must even if it scares you to death!I would of liked to have gone up...
It was a great experience but the price is steep at $32 plus tax and with no student discounts. The glass floor is only a small section. I thought it would be larger.

They reason that it'd because they are doing a new retail strategy and including 2 20 minute films in the price. I guess we'll definitely be going to spend...

I remember going to the CN Tower as a kid when it was still the tallest man made structure in the world. It is now dwarfed by a few other buildings around the world! It also looks and feels old and needs some overhauling and some new features need to be added to it.

CN Towers is very close to where I stay while in Toronto. So I can walk up to the place and buy a ticket to go up up and away!For one, the ticket to go up is pretty stiff. I dunno the exact amount but I think its between $20 to $25. But once you are in the elevator,...

You should go at the late afternoon to see Toronto in daylight and dark.I think to buy the tickets online it's sometimes cheaper there is sometimes a discount.

Travelled to Toronto a few times for work and would definitely recommend dining at the revolving rooftop restaurant. The food was delicious and the view amazing! After dinner, the observation deck is a must. The glass floor is a WOW!

Breath taking view from the second deck of entire Toronto city.. As we were there in the evening we got to see the night lighting of the tower also which was just WOW. The view from the glass floor was just too good. Although we missed the sky walk, I will definitely make it a point to be there next...

After visiting Empire State Building, WTC, Burj Khalifa, I was not very impressed with CN Tower. It is a typical Sky rise with a viewing gallery.If you have not been elsewhere it maybe worth it. Otherwise skip it.
Excellent atmosphere! Great view! We all loved it! Glass floor was a lot of fun! We plan to do the skywalk next time for sure!!!

A must on any visit to this great city.The views are tremendous and I would recommend paying the extra $8 to go up to the Skypod. However if you are claustrophobic then it can be a little warm however numbers are managed.As other reviews say you must go on the Glass floor to get the real effect !
It is an amazing attraction. If you have time wait until it get darker so you can enjoy day and night, totally different view.

You can't visit Toronto without going to the cn tower, breath taking views of downtown! We went to the second observation deck, you have to pay extra to get there and if you plan of going on a warm day, go at night or early in the morning as it gets very warm in there. It is included in the...

You can't miss this while in Toronto, well worth it. I went to the Skypod and the extra cost is justified the extra height does make a difference. The glass floor is great, as you step onto the floor it feels strange but an amazing view when looking down. We did not have time to have a meal which was...

We went to the highest accessible point and for someone who is naturally scared of heights it was quite the experience, but so worthwhile! There are such amazing views across the city and further afield. Great place to see the entire city. The views are amazing on a clear day and the restaurant is also very interesting.
First time visiting the Tower at night. The sceneray was amazing. I found the fee expensve (30$) but it's still worth going there.

It was a must see in T.! We were lucky to have gotten night visiting voucher with us from the group before us. Recommend dining at the revolving rooftop restaurant and watch the city below you. What a feeling!

I know that the CN Tower provides great views of the Toronto skyline, but you really don't have any way to take pictures from the tower. The observation deck has barriers up to keep people safe that definitely don't add anything to your photos. The price was ridiculous. Save your money

It's too much dough for what it is. But you kinda have to see it. Some view - but the "Grand Canyon" effect - after a few minutes you've seen it all. Not at all true for the Grand Canyon - but that what it's called. If it's clear I'm sure you can see forever, but just pay up and...

It costs a little to get to the top of the tower, but it`s worth every penny. The view is amazing, especially at the upper deck. The elevator brings you at a convenient speed to the middle deck. Sure it is one of the most popular attractions and people actually flock to this place in numbers but to me it was a slight disappointment as the view was obstructed and for a clearer view they required an additional payment and further climb and even so the day was not in favor for a perfect view but I will...
It has a really good view at morning or night but a little bit expensive for my student life. Besides all, it's a place where you have to go when in Toronto.

My sister booked a meal in the 360° restaurant as a surprise for me. What a surprise! It was amazing. The security procedure was a bit much but each to their own. Cn tower well worth the vist bit scary lift goes up very fast enjoyed the views over toronto never went up to the restaurant but you must vist it

Yeah the view is impressive but not really worth the cost or the time it takes to get up and back down. We bought tickets in advance wihich gave us a time to arrice but still had to queue for nearly two hours to get to the top. Half an hour looking about and then another hour wait for the...

I went at then CN tower for dinner at the 360 restaurant with my friend. The service was really bad. The waiter was stressful and he was putting a lot of pressure to us to make quick decisions. Good view but if you want clear, unobstructed views you need to pay an extra to go even higher.the food from the restaurants its nothing special, actually not good!

It stands as a needle viewed from a radius as far as the eye can see in the Greater Toronto area...and on a clear day across great lake Ontario. Truly a spectacle worth visiting for the view on the way up, the view at the top and the adventures and interactions that ensue.

Had travelled back from Niagara and arrived in at Union Station about 2pm (July 2014)! With directions from staff at the 'Info desk' made my way to the CN Tower and went up to the Restaurant level. You can really see all around the city as long as its nice day. Its even better if its sunny. Lovely view of Toronto.

My husband purposed here and it felt like I was at the top of the world. It is an amazing ride up the elevator and then the view is just exquisite. I think its best to go here during the summer and also call to make sure the observation deck is open. They also have the edge walk available during...
Great views, well run, quick to get up to the sights. Very expensive to visit. The glass floor was a hoot. It's right next the acquarium, so well worth a visit.

Long queue, 52 sec climb up by elevator and boy you hit the sky. Superb view on a clear day, offers lots of food and fun up there. Food quality is average. There is a glass flooring up there, from which one can see the ground situated infinitely away.

The CN Tower has a wonderful view. The problem is you have to pay to much to see it. For the cost you basically spend 10-20 minutes staring out of windows. I find that it is better to pay and eat at the restaurant to fully appreciate the view. Though be prepared that the food is really bad.

You have to go up the tower and see the view. Then you go down the tower and do something else. Best to go on a clear day...and you may as well go for the lunch as it includes lift tickets and you by pass the line ups. The food is about a 5/10 on average. My kids still love going here, even after they have been so many times.

Group member had a severe nut allergy , waiter was asked 3 times if the starter had nuts told, NO WHEN A REACTION STARTED TO OCCUR TOLD " sprinkled with pistachio nuts" RESULT EMERGENCY ADMISSION TO HOSPITAL for treatment at a Hugh financial physiological and psychological costs. - The ticket agent was very clear right from before we paid and told us visibility was zero. "Do you still want to go up if you can't see anything?" "Nope", we answered. You can enjoy viewing Toronto. Nothing else especial about it. It is quite expensive and you get bored very soon! I suggest do not have high expectation if you are planning to visit CN tower. A typical tall tower, nothing else.

Tourist Trap. It's one price to got up to the main level, the look out area there was a restaurant that my boyfriend and I did not eat at but it was more money to go to the highest point the 360 degree room. It is also very expensive to do the edgewalk which we couldn't do because it was...

You have to see this attraction it is worth the 90 some dollar expense. The photos and the food are not necessary to have fun don't get sucked in to them. I highly recommend this place for every one. Tip very busy around the 4th of July/Canada Day so if you don't like crowds try some other time.
Beautiful to see Toronto by tower. Really expensive though for general admission. Can be really windy and cold in december, but worth it
Elevator ride was exhilarating and glass floor was fun...next time I'm in for the Skywalk experience and will cap it off with a meal in 360.
$32 for adults/$24 for kids for a trip to the top is just too much. The views are amazing though. The glass bottom floor is a lot of fun too.

Booked online knowing there was a nice set menu. Views for a dinner can hardly be beaten. We chose a good time to go arriving before sunset. CN tower is a great place to visit with family and friends. However, make sure you go when the weather is good. Otherwise you will not be able to see too far.

we visited the CN tower in late november 2014. it was a great way to see the city from way up - incredible views. we went later in the afternoon and the whole experience only took 90 minutes or so. i look forward to going back in the warm weather to do the edge walk.

We came here to eat dinner on our first night of our visit. Yes, the dinner is expensive, but it also includes your admission for going to sightsee at the top of the tower, so you don't double pay for that. You get bored with sitting in the line before arriving upstairs. If you want to eat in there it’s 55$ the menu. It’s a public parking across the street & I recommend to pay at least 3h, because you have to wait a lot, even if you don’t want to take 100 pictures at height.
We went here on our short trip in Toronto and really enjoyed the views. Good viewing, informative displays making the experience a little more interesting. Worth a visit

I had not been here in 20+ years, and it was fun to go again. The glass floor walk is a fun newer addition. Great views of the city and Lake Ontario Worth the $
We were told it is the tallest free standing building in world. Rotating restaurant was great but pricey. Obsevation deck is stunning.

It's a fun experience. The view is beautiful but you have to go on a clear sky day, otherwise it's not worth it. The restaurant is too expensive (for me) but same as other restaurants in similar atractions. Same with the photo, it costs $20 plus, similar price as the Empire State building. We went on a clear day and went straight to the top of the tower. Windy on the observation deck the kids loved the blast of air pushing them. Views of the city and the island. I wanted to do the skywalk but it was too windy.

This is a must do if you are in Toronto. Choose a clear day for the best views - you wont see much from that high if you go on a cloudy or foggy day. We chose to visit an hour before sunset so we could watch the colours change and darkness fall over the beautiful city. You almost get...

If it's not clear, well, it is still quite a sight. The information panels are interesting. The see-through floor can be unnerving. It is a bit on the pricey side. The skywalk was not open the day we got there - too windy.
It is a attractive place for tourise, the view of the city is beautiful, but the admission fee is relatively high.

Cost me about $100 to go up the cn tower. This includes the sky pod which was an extra 100 feet higher. It was a great experience especially walking on the glass floor. The views from the tower are amazing and the food in the revolving restaurant is stunning I had th mushroom busuter the lam for my main an as it revolves the veiw changes food very nice

We took my daughter and a friend here for lunch. $55 pp which included appetizer main course and dessert. Food was surprisingly good. amazing views of the city adn the lake. the edgewalk was incredible most exhilarating experience in my life

Best view of Toronto and lake Ontario. You can go there by public transport or by car.You can have good dinner at night and enjoy the lovely view of Toronto.Restaurant is not cheap, but it is a first class service.Better to be there Monday-Friday. Family rates are also applies.

Looking over a city from high above is always intriguing, but if you pay 35 dollars for that, it turns into something painful. I regretted going up on CN Tower. I personally did not find it exciting and I was quite furious that it is so expensive.

Every trip to Toronto is not complete without a trip to the CN Tower. It is a great view of the city and the elevator ride is an experience. The glass floor is a real kid pleaser. Anytime someone visits us from another Country we always make this one of our stops and it is always a favourite!

It was 4 of us who went to see the CN Tower and were contemplating paying to go all the way up. But at the end, we decided to get the tickets and it was a great experience. The balcony / open area is an amazing experience, so is the glass floor.

My wife and I spent a day in Toronto in May 2013.The CN Tower was the highlight of our visit. A great view, even during a not so clear night. See-thru floor at 349 meters high is fun too!!The restaurant up stairs is obviously high end & price, but worth every cent!

I was very impressed busy not only by the tower but how my kids could go up by themselves. Obviously it's safe with all the security but I was still surprised.
go on a good day - i went as part of the visit to the 360 restaurant and this was an amazing view. you get a great view of the city as this is a popular attraction in Toronto.

The tower was okay, but you know... There are tons of these around. Not very special or different and a bit over priced. Not really worth it, but it's okay.

For the money, it's not the best tower in the world. It is a no-brainer, this is a must see attraction if you are in Toronto. Provides a breath-taking view of downtown Toronto (and some parts of GTA as well). Visiting during clear sky is preferable as you will have greater visibility range.

Great staff and a superb attraction make this tower worth a visit. The glass floor lift and viewing deck, along with a sky walk if you're feeling brave add to the whole experience. Good knowledgable staff and worth the extra cash to visit the very top!

The CN Tower was worth the trip and the price of admission. It is a Toronto and Canadian icon. We paid exorbitant fees to go up there and it is a dead end! The Taipei 101 is much better value as it is round and it costs less. However, this tower offers unparalleled views of the city of Toronto and Lake Ontario.

Best to go on a clear day. The view is spectacular. The glass floor is terrifying to me - but I had to go on it. My heart raced.

As the second-highest building in the world, the CN Tower is a marvellous sight. When looking up from the very bottom, it seems like an endless beauty. The views from the very top are breathtaking and the revolving restaurant is a must when in Toronto.

A real nice view of the city and experiencing the shaking of the tower....scary but amazing.....The 360 degrees view was spectacular
Great views. Has to be done. A little on the expensive side but worth it. The views are amazing And anyone visiting Toronto should definitely go.
Great - wonderful view of the city if it is a clear day. Check on the screen in the lobby before you purchase your tickets.
Excellant..The view is absolutely stunning from up above. I am fearful of heights however you feel very safe and secure while being so high..The restaurant service is impeccable.

If you are in Toronto, you must visit CN Tower otherwise your visit will not be complete.It is world's second highest tower. A Toronto Icon, A spectacular view! Caters to the average tourist - The Glasss Walk and the terribly adventurous! - The EdgeWalk - not for the faint of heart! Altogether a great experience, with souvenir shop to end tour

I am a Torontonian for years now and I could say that I don't get tired going up to the CN tower. you can't go wrong ! get to the top and enjoy an awesome evening meal while you see the entire city of Toronto and all the lights. The revolving restaurant seats hundreds comfortably. CN tower was under construction while I was there. It's always a beautiful sight at night, all lit up.

Wonderful views. The glass floor is awesome, though I was somewhat terrified looking down. Not for the faint of heart. We had lunch at the Bistro; $16 for a cheeseburger! Oh well, what can one expect at this tourist attraction? We did enjoy it. When in Toronto, it's a must see!

Long lines and pricey but excellent views. If possible go when they first open for what seems like a smaller crowd
A must see Toronto landmark!!! Go on a clear day. A cloudy day is disappointing since you will only see a grey wall.

Gorgeous place and hmmm nice food ;)This is the must visit place if you have friends coming outside of Toronto or from other country !

Just an okay visit. Loved the view, but the price is just not worth it. Just my opinion, of course. Maybe some of you will think it's worth it. I took some visiting friends from out of town and I didn't really get the impression that they thought it was worth it.

Yes another place to add to your bucket list, see Toronto from here and you will never forget the city. Great at daytime or night time

Approaching from the distance, this thing is just big. After taking the elevator to the observation platform, the glance from there is just amazing. You can see planes landing just in front of you and the scyscraper which aren´t small at all look like garden houses. A clear must-see if you are in Toronto or close by.

We including seeing the Pod at the top of the Tower when we went up to the top. The view is amazing and you can see the entire city. A must. Unfortunately we didn't know you need reservations to eat in the 360 restaurant. But there is another one up there that you can dine and drink at.

I have to say I was a little bit disappointed what you get for that price. I think its a little bit expensive and I would not do it again. yes its a nice city view but thats it .
Try to time your visits for an hour before whenever the sun is going to set. Or even earlier... don't go on a cloudy day. Rather expensive now.
