the tallest building in Toronto. You gotta see it.Take a ride up the elevator but don't look id your afraid of heights.Don't try to run up the over 100 flights stairs, unless you're fit

if you are visiting Toronto you MUST go up the CN Tower.Make sure you go on a sunny day though , because if it is cloudy you won't see very far. The revolving restaurant is enjoyable but a little expensive, but definately something to experience..

OK, so you feel like you are being milked when you pull out your credit card at the bottom. And then mile again when you pull the car out again up in the pod to go up to the very top level. But even going up in the lift is quite an amazing experience. Very impressive engineering and adrenaline fuelled...
It's Vacation time! Bring your wallet, because at the end of the day the Memories with family and friends that count!

I have wanted to do this for a long time and now I have checked it off my list. We went on Sunday and got up very quickly, had great view as it was a bueatiful day.Glad I got to do it. My only complaint would be that it was really expensive for what it was. $70 for two...

Beautiful views .Good food ,friendly staff who could ask for anything more.You are on top of Toronto and you certainly feel great and comfortable .You would want to see it again next time you visit Toronto .

Went up for dinner and were expecting nothing special due to the size of the place.The food was very good and decent value when the cost of the trip to just view is taken in to account.The view at night was incredible, we had a clear night so could see for milesFantastic experience

I've been 'up the tower' a good few times and enjoyed every moment. Now I always make a reservation and have a meal. When you deduct the cost of the trip up the tower the meal isn't very expensive. It's just a special place.
Wonderful evening with dinner and glass of wine city lights and the stars...Reasonably priced for a night out or even one afternoon
A little more pricy but a true once in a lifetime adventure...if you have the nerve. try the edge walk. You friends and family will be amazed when you post the pics...you may be too!

I took some relatives up the tower over the summer and they loved it! Much to my surprise, the food and service were fantastic. (and I have a discerning palate) Go towards the end of the day....the views are sensational then! It's fun trying to figure out where you live and where certain buildings are located....

Being a native of Toronto, we had not visited the CN Tower for years. But having friends from Europe visiting in October, decided to take them here for lunch. Not only was the view terrific, but the food and service were just a delightful surprise. The price fixe was $55 per person, but well worth the cost as it also...

Unbelievable sights high above Toronto where Buffalo NY is clearly visible. On your visit, I recommend you make restaurant reservations in advance. Our dinning experience has always been positive with sumptuous menu items and a great wine list. When your done with dinner, the observation decks are all available at no extra cost. Now if your a dare devil and...
We have taken the Trip to the Top of the CN Tower many times.At one time on a very clear day we could see the Mist from Niagara Falls - very rare!And I have a Foto to prove it.

No visit to Toronto is complete without a visit to the CN Tour. The observation desk is just wonderful. I can't speak from experience about the "walk on the edge" because I wouldn't do it at even at gunpoint, but I am sure it is a big thrill. I enjoyed standing on the transparent floor and looking down. Even the...

This a unique place for a visit to see the city from a different angle. Its breathtaking view can leave you speechless.Its a bit on a pricey side but well worth it for a one-time visit. I have been there numerous times but the first time was the most exciting.

In Toronto for the week as a family and we did this on final day. Decided on a late tour and booked a meal for 5pm as suggested by tripadvisors. Sat down at dusk with a fantastic table by the window and watched the whole of toronto rotate as we ate. This was wonderful as by the time it came...

Let's call it what it is, CN Tower is a pricey tourist attraction that offers unique views of the city. No visit is complete with out it.I appreciate the tower adds value to the experience by offering an open floor and an opportunity to step outside when weather appropriate.I would recommend timing it with a meal (reservations required)...

I've visited the CN tower a number of times throughout my life but when I found out the added an attraction allowing people to walk on the edge of its roof and get a view of the entire city from up there I knew I had to do it. It was astoundingly freeing to hang from the edge of the...

Toronto city tour would be incomplete without visting CN Tower. We went till the glass floor level and the height was good enough to give superb views of Toronto. The glass floor amuses most visitors and that's something we also liked. The elevator is very quick and the staff is very friendly. We went just before sunset and got an...
Visiting the CN Tower is a must!!!Starting from the elevator ride and arriving on top is fantastic. Walking on the clear glass and doing photo opps is super fun

For those who love a great view of the city and a nice meal, this is the place to go. We ate at the restaurant at the top of the tower and loved how the whole place rotated, so we could get the full view. The food and service were excellent, so this is a must. Will be back.

If you are in Toronto, and haven't been up the CN Tower, it's time.Unforgettable photo opps away on the Look Out Level of the CN Tower, a staggering 346 meters (1,122’) off the ground. Worth the trip up to walk on the glass floor, and peer down at the ant size people below. The toddler in our group loved...

CN Tower is definitely one standard touristy place that should be visited by all. It is family/couples/adults/seniors/teenagers kind of place - great 360 degrees views of Toronto.The heights are head spinning and the lifts with glass panels in the floor are not for faint hearted... The level with the glass floor is totally crazy and visitors will outdo each...
Spectacular views and good food. Enjoy the experience for only $25 more than the general admission ticket to enjoy lunch in the revolving tower.

Located right near the lake, downtown and next to the stadium, the CN tower is about 1,400 feet high. Quick elevators take you up for the restaurant and/or just the view. Restaurant rotates slowly so you get several shots at 360 degree views during your meal. We went with a large group on business (about 35) so we had a...

This is a simply must do experience if you visit Toronto. The views over the city and Lake Ontario are spellbinding. As a bonus pay the small extra fee and take the elevator up a further 100 metres to the Skypod, it really is worth it!Something you'll remember forever.

Finally made it to the top of the CN Tower after thirty years of living in Toronto! Awesome views of the city and definitely a must see. Best suggestion would be to buy your tickets in advance online because it saves you a lot of time waiting when you show up. Otherwise, the wait isn't so bad getting to the...
Really good to go, you must visit this tower is iconic in Toronto, you can see all the city from there, however I think that is better go during the night to see all the city lights. Recommended
Make sure, you visit on sunny day , otherwise, on foggy or cloudy day you will miss views.There is no harm in seeing this place once in five years.

If views from above excite you, it's the best place to see Toronto. It comes for a price and frankly it's not cheap, as you won't stay there for too long. The glass floor seemed to excite some of the visitors. The edge walk is ridiculously overpriced and even if it did excite me, I'd rather spend the money elsewhere

Went up on the morning of our 1st full day in Toronto. The weather was great and to be honest after reading many of these reviews I expected a long queue. What a surprise to walk up, purchase a ticket and go straight to the top. We purchased the additional ticket to go to the very top and the views...

If I was going to see Toronto I was told, you have to go see the CN tower. Let me warn you, to look out the tower itself will cost you around $35 dollars.Once you do look out for 10-15 minutes and get your pictures you will start to remember, value for my money? Not really.
Went in july 2009. The glass floor is really scary if you keep looking down. But it is really a bird eye view where you can see the scenery of Toronto.

A great dinner in a scenic setting. The staff is well-trained, and dinner was most enjoyable in the rotating 360 Restaurant. With a constantly changing view of the lake, city, and busy downtown Billy Bishop Airport, there was a new vista every time we looked outside.
That's a must-do if you spend time in Toronto. Take your time, enjoy the restaurant and the view. Oh yes, and don't stand on the glass platform if you suffer from vertigo.

Amazing views over Toronto. However, choose a clear day to go up, otherwise visibility will be very poor.Definitely worth a visit. It's a very long way up.Price was reasonable, although the edge walk was $200 so we declined on that.A must see when in Toronto

On a clear day this is a 'must do' for any tourist. The all round views of Toronto are fantastic. Shame there is no commentary on the views. The glass floor and visitors antics provide scares, thrills and laughs in equal measures. The cafe/restaurant lets you eat and stare out from your table.

Visited the great CN tower last week, the view from the top is stunning, the people were very helpful and we had a delicious meal. If you eat a meal at the restaurant at the top ( providing) you have a main course), there is no fee for going up the tower, although the restaurant is not the cheapest, when...

CN Tower is fab! Again bought tickets with the City Pass. Missed the queues although it wasn't particularly busy the day we went because it was a bit misty t the top but you did get warned about the weather when you arrive, which is great because you were under no obligation to just buy the ticket and go up....

CN Tower is a perfect place to have a BirdEye view of Toronto. I would recommend to go till the SkyPod as it will give better view. Visit CN Tower on bright clear day so as you can have maximum visibility of the place. Preferably visit CN Tower from early evening hours till it gets dark. Downtown looks stunning when...
Great experience, loved the Pod at the very top of the tower but that was a little expensive as I had to pay more

This is addressed to the shameless person who took my camera from the Tower on Sunday, 19 October. You spoiled what was a lovely experience at the top of the Tower, and a wonderful trip. I would recommend a visit to the Tower but do look after your property properly, there are a lot of dishonest people about!

My husband and I went to the top. We bought the city pass, and this was one of the attractions included in booklet. I would recommend the city pass, if you are planning to do more than one of the attractions, it's well worth it. The view are great, and the glass floor was very neat to see. The whole...

CN Tower offers a beautiful panoramic view. It is especially wonderful at night with the lights of the city and surrounding areas in view. The glass floor is great and gives you a good perspective of how high up you are. It is well worth it to go to the highest level. Have been there several times.

Found the admission price was extremely high, and upon reaching the top I was disappointed to find that instead of having an uninterrupted 360 view, half of the view was taken up by a restaurant.Upon going down a level I found it was impossible to take pictures because of the bird cage surrounding the outside viewing balcony.Also there...

We didn’t go inside, but it was still nice to get some pictures with this iconic Canadian tower while visiting. Not sure about going inside… I didn’t look into prices but am told it’s expensive just for the view.

A friend and I went to Toronto for the weekend and decided to go to the CN Tower. For it being a Saturday it was not as crowded as I was expecting. For the two of us, it was over $70 for tickets, which was a little more comfortable than we were wanting to spend. We also went up before...

Not really on the top of the world but this tower once was the tallest freestanding structure in the world.A glass elevator quickly takes you to the observation deck which is approximately 1100 feet high. This is still around 700 feet from the top of the structure.The view is fantastic but unfortunately we were there late in the...

It was cool to go here and see the amazing views of the City, but it is kinda pricey and the lines are long.We hadn't really planned to come here, but it seemed like a good thing to do.It took forever to wait in line to buy tickets, then it took forever to wait in line for the...

Yes, this is a great tower with a view but, perhaps it's just me, I thought it fairly monotonous. You spend ages waiting for a lift, have a look around, then spend even more time waiting in a huge queue for a descending lift. Not really worth it in my opinion.

It is a great view and you have to do it if you visit the city but it is a little over price. Just remember that when your standing on the glass floor, that WHOLE floor is meant (rumour has it) to be glass but they had to change it as ppl didn't like it.
Very nice place, but entry is fee is really high for what is really just a tour of a very tall building. Very hard to park downtown - take transit.

I don't love heights but I thought I would visit the CN Tower. Yes, it is tall and once up there, there is a nice panoramic view of the city. That glass floor can set your heart pounding although it is perfectly safe. It is an expensive day for the family and really, I found that the kids were quickly...

The view from the tower is amazing. The glass floor is super cool. The various members of my family spent quite a bit of time sprawled on the glass floor taking selfies. The 15 minute video on the building of the tower is worth taking in. You should definitely do the outdoor walk - less scary than the edge walk...
Amazing views of the city but completely overpriced which was very disappointing. A game was going on in the stadium which made the views even better.
I'm glad I did it but it is overpriced for the tour and our hotel had 35 floors so I seen a lot of the city from that the elevator was the highlight really

Seriously, the price for what you get is ridiculous. I paid less money to get to the top of the Eiffel Tower. We were there on a clear day which was nice, the glass floor is kind of neat but there's no way I'd do that again. Take a picture of the tower from the street instead and save your...

I so wanted to see the CN Tower. It didn't let me down it was lovely. We chose to have a meal as then you don't pay to go up the tower. On some sites it said the meal was basic, but we had a gorgeous meal beautifully presented AND you have amazing views. We had actually booked for Friday...
My wife and I went on the CN Tower and as engineers we both were quite impressed but the size, the technology and the success. The view as well is amazing.

The view is incredible, spanning over 100 kilometres on clear days. I recommend only going when it is a clear sunny day, purely for visibility reasons. It is split on two levels, the first gives you panoramic views of the city. The only major let down is that the restaurants block some of the most stunning views of Lake Ontario....

The CN Tower offers a great view over Toronto, the Lake Ontario and on a good day you can see on the other side of the lake as well as straight to the Niagara Falls (you don't see them....). The observations deck offers an indoor and an outdoor area. Suitable also for small children. As a small hint... if you...

If you go just before sunset, you get to see 2 entire different faces of the city. Loved when all the lights came up on the buildings and the streets. Even managed to catch a baseball game from above, since the stadium is right below the tower! The only reason I did not give a 5 star rating is because...
A place with beautiful view....You can see city all, and take many pictures for remember and showing the your friends..

Visited for the first time and really enjoyed the experience, it is a very tall structure which on a clear day will give you amazing views of Toronto and the surrounding areas. There is no point going up when the cloud is below the observation deck as you won't see anything.It was a little windy the day we visited...

My first impression of the CN tower was not a pleasant one as it appeared they were not operating all of their elevators. Going up in the elevator the staff kept cramming people in (at least 10 people). This was very uncomfortable as going up you get to experience the glass elevator and view the city however was not possible...
Engineering at its finest! Enjoyed going up and looking at the views. However we did miss the documentary showing on the ground floor which meant to be good.

As a pilot I see a lot from my office window. Realising the same kind of view in daily life is difficult - save for the CN Tower.Having been here many times (I bring each of my kids) I never fail to be impressed by the view. It is simply beautiful.On this trip we purchased the SkyPod supplement...

I really enjoyed the CN Tower. It's really easy to find (obviously) and the views are simply breathtaking. It is pricey (basic ticket is $35). You can spend more if you want to go all the way up to the highest observation pod.

Some people say it is just a tower, of which you can see the things on the ground from a different perspective, and that's perhaps correct when you just take a few looks down here and there. But when you take your time to watch out for the details and to simply enjoy the breathtaking views, then this is the...

I climbed the tower on a sunny day, and the too expensive ticket was indeed compensated by a great view from the top of the tower. From there you can really "dominate" the entire city and more!Just wait for the good day to visit it!

The CN Tower is one of those touristy things you feel compelled to do and they know it. It is highly overpriced ($32) just to ride up and walk around for 15-30 minutes. Oddly, the elevator wait to go down was longer than going up. I would suggest dining at the 360 Restaurant, you'll pay a minimum of about $55...

We ate at the revolving 360 restaurant so we had free admission to the tower. And we didn't have to wait in line because there is a special line for the restaurant. The ticket line to the tower was extremely long so I suggest you buy the tickets online. I Liked how the elevator has a glass door so you...

It is pretty expensive but it's a fun ride up, a lovely view and you can stay up there as long as pleases you. The glass floor is always a hit. There is a restaurant. The photo they take of you and offer as a souvenir is a nice touch if you are interested. There is a mini-CN for your...

Enjoyed a most wonderful day at the CN tower on thanksgiving Sunday and the weather was simply glorious which gave us stunning views across Lake Ontario and far beyond. The queues for tickets were quite long but as it was a national holiday it was only to be expected, once inside it was very well organized with little or no...

Yes I liked the view but would have preferred seeing it during the day and would then have paid the extra $12.00 to go to the skypod as you really can't see much at night. Advised waiter when we ordered pre-dinner cocktails that we will be having wine with the meal but he did not offer to show the wine...

We only had one day in Toronto and so our trip to the top of the CN Tower was our main experience of this city. An impressive structure reaching into the sky, the viewing platform affords spectacular views of the city and across Lake Ontario as far as Niagara Falls. A definite 'must do' for everyone. It's also worth securing...

The tower is somewhat ageing and is not as cool as it once was when I was a child. It's awesome to come during sunset and when not a lot of people are around. Other than that, now it's a bunch of kids trying to take ridiculous selfies on the glass floor.I had fun on my date and it...
Had lunch in 360 restaurant and really enjoyed it. Great views. Would recommend especially as the ride up is included in lunch price.

Hi guys, would you like to see Toronto from the highest top in Ontario? So you have to visit the CN Tower to expierence the view of the maaahvelous Toronto. From one of the floors of CN Tower, u can see how high you are, because that floor is made of transparent glass and u can stand on the glass...

In all honesty, I had to admit the view was great, although came at a cost. Although my local friend invited me, I felt uneasy the money she had to fork out for that. Weekend is always crowded, if you can, come during the week, there is almost no need to queue to go up or down. Since its opening...

Without doubt this was the most exciting & funny part of our trip.The tower is no longer the tallest in the world but it is still the icon of Toronto.The elevator to the observation deck takes less than a minute but features a preview of the glass floor & views out over the whole city.We opted for...
What an experience you shouldn't miss it the food and service was excellent but the scenery from so high up was magnificent.

Very enjoyable way to spend a couple of hours. As you would expect the views are breathtaking especially on a clear day. You will need to factor this in when planning a visit as the view is pretty limited on a cloudy day as the viewing areas are often completely hidden in cloud. There is a cafe in the viewing...
First time I have ever been to one of these "look out towers" was interesting. The view was amazing got some wonderful photos.

The views on the clear bright day it was were excellent. I could just see Rochester's industrial chimneys but not Niagara.The waiting to buy the ticket at the bottom (45 minutes) and the thirty minutes to get on the lift to the Skypod were a big downer. There is of course nothing the operator can do about it except...

The attraction is a most see. There are 4 levels to visit and an additional attraction within attraction which allows you to walk outside on the edge while secured with a harness.What we didn't like was the ticketing system, you save money if you order online but it has to be purchased at least 24 hours ahead of time,...

We stayed just across from the CN Tower and just had to go up this during our stay. I think it was quite busy as they had a very poorly managed queue outside which then went into a better managed queue inside which sent you through into another queue for security before queing for the lifts before finally getting up...

A bit expensive if you don't want to partake of the fairground attractions. A very professional set up and well managed.The views are spectacular and the walk on the glass floor is worth doing.In my opinion the extra $12 to access the higher viewpoint is a bit of a ripoff but the views are amazing.

Very romantic setting for any couple. We ate in the 360, and spent about $250 with dinner and drinks for two. Definitely expensive, but I feel like out of all the attractions in Toronto, the CN Tower is a MUST do. Would recommend making a reservation, and only for 2 people... Any more than 2 people, and you will not...

I was here on a saturday morning and I didnt have to wait too long: 20 minutes to purchase the ticket and other 20-30 for the elevator. The view is really nice, there are 2 floors you can go to with the normal ticket.
Yes, you will get a good look to the city and surrounding area. Comparing to other places entrance fee is high. Don't go there in cloudy weather.
I went around 6 pm. That way I could see Toronto day and night. The view is outstanding, Try to go all the way to the top, you'll love it.

Very speedy process from paying to getting to the top of the tower, including the obligatory photos ! We were not rushed, we were able to take our time and enjoy the experience. Would certainly recommend it.

We had little group tour of the CN tower with a English guid in the lift up to the observation deck with the glass bottomed lift. Once on the deck the views were fantastic and on a really clear day you can see for miles. Outside in 2 certain spots it was like walking into a force 10 gale but...

This has been one of the main tourist attractions in Toronto for many years, and it is well worth a visit.144 storeys high and under a minute to the top in a high speed elevator. The observation tower is another 33 stories on another high speed lift.A walk on the glass floor at the top is very scary but...

The half view available at the CN Tower was very disappointing. I have been to the Hancock Bldg in Chicago and the Top of the Rock in New York City. I expected to walk a full circle at the top of the CN Tower and was so disappointed. OK- you have a section of glass floor to look down upon,...

Incredible 360 degree views from 1465 feet in the sky. See up to 100 miles away. All the way to Niagara Falls. Unbelievable! The glass floor is amazing. I tried to walk on it, but my brain said.. Umm, No Way! And how about the Edge Walk?.. Not a chance! I'm happy with the view from SkyPod. Lots of awesome...
This was a highlight of our trip to Toronto. Well worth the expense. Fantastic views over the city and surrounding area. Got some really excellent photographs.

If the heights of CN Tower make you feel slightly faint, I would recommend a bite to eat at the 360 restaurant. A steak and chips is $40 and although this is a fine restaurant the prices are very reasonable considering your altitude. Breathless views, fine food, the 360 restaurant is a must to do for visiting Toronto.
The CN tower is truly a must on the list if you are planing to tour around Toronto. Worth looking at the lovely view from the deck.

Fantastic panoramic views around the city from the viewing deck which has a glass floor in parts where you can take photos looking down to the ground. Rumour has it that the whole floor is made of glass and simply covered by carpet !! Well worth doing and now ticked off our bucket list.

During a recent visit to Toronto I visited the CN tower. It is one of those things you must add to your "Must do" list. The lifts to the top are fast, very fast and part of the floor in the lift has a glass bottom, so if you are frightened of heights don't look down. Once at the top...

We enjoyed our experience at the tower. The views were amazing. It was a little hazy and we weren't able to see as far as I would have liked, but overall this was worth the trip to Toronto from Niagara falls. We ate at 360, and really loved the view and food.Overall the Tower is a very nice experience,...

The view couldn't be better, you will enjoy Toronto from the heights, you can eat up there and spend a good time.Also you can buy some gift, if you have enough cash, since its a little expensive but it worth it

I am not one of those reviewers who slate an otherwise good restaurant just because they failed to satisfy some dietary quirk or slightly muddled a booking. The tower restaurant is an absolutely great experience. The food is expertly prepared and well presented, and of course the view is....awesome! But who on earth takes, let alone wears, a backpack to...
Great views from the observation deck but if you are a bit of a wuss like me then walk over the glass floor part in the evening!

I have lived in Ontario my whole life and did not go to the CN Tower until I was almost 50 years old. We went August/2011 but it wouldn't let me choose that date. My husband, daughter and I went and we loved it! We were there early and there were no line ups for anything. The view was great,...
Went up in the CN tower, all the way to the Skypod. They also honored the access 2 entertainment card which was awesome

We recently visited the CN tower on a beautiful sunny summers day. It was very busy with many people lined up for both the security check and to enter the elevators, but we finally got through and the view from the viewing platform is certainly spectacular. With the lake nearby, we enjoyed watching the ferries crossing the harbour, and planes...

column3: New York, New York, United States
column4: No one visits Toronto without visiting the iconic CN Tower. I had a great time there. Make sure you get to the very last floor so that you can soaking the magnificent view of the city of Toronto. Don't be a coward like me, must sure you stand on the glass floor and take a photo. If you can afford...
A must when visiting Toronto! Amazing views of the city with a great restaurant at the top. average price for any attraction such as this.
Amazing view of the city. Great opportunity for pictures. There were no waiting lines and the price was reasonable.

If you want a good way to throw money away, you should definitely go to the cn tower, and while you're at it, pay to go right to the top! At both stages your view is obstructed by wire mesh or window pane, making for disappointing photos. We had to queue for about an hour to go to the sky...

What a beautiful view of the city. The trip up the elevator might cause a bit of anxiety as you watch yourself rise above the city, but the views at your destination are definitely worth it. With a full 360 view of the city and beyond,the experience is amazing. Then take a moment to stand on the glass floor and...

We opted to have lunch in the 360 restaurant and had a lovely meal while watching the slowly changing view. It made for a much more memorable experience than just going to the normal observation decks. The service and food were excellent and we were allowed to eat our meal at a leisurely pace. In the course of eating the...
A must see if visiting Toronto. The views from the top of the tower are amazing. The walk on the glass floor is not for the faint hearted but do it if you can. A great place to visit.

Visited this in Summer 2012, definitely worth seeing as the visit is not just about the views from the top. You can walk on the glass floor to appreciate the elevation and for the adrenaline junkies there is the 'walk on the edge', where you wear a harness and take a walk outside. An interesting and informative visitor centre with...

We went here for my husband`s birthday. It had an amazing view. You get to eat dinner, while the floor rotates around the CN tower. It is best to go right before sunset- you get to see the day view, sunset, and night view. The food was good too- we ordered pasta and steak. Also, you don`t have to pay...

This was our second visit to Toronto and also our second trip up to the tower. We have enjoyed it each time. This time our visit was at night and it offers fantastic views of the city and surrounding region at night!We walked on the glass floor and we went all the way around the exterior observation deck. We...
CN tower is great place to see. Its very tall tower . there is a restaurant in main pod and glass floor for people who like some adventure. For people who like to have some thrills can try Edge walk
CN tower is really worth seeing if u never went to Toronto.however, If u went to Toronto or live there, then you don't have to visit there.

This monumental tower in the skyline really defines what we call Toronto. Having been there as a child, I recently revisited the CN Tower with some out of town relatives. It still amazes me with how breathtaking the view from the top is and the amount of information there is. They have really modernized each element and continue make this...

Definitely book a table in the 360 revolving restaurant. Pay for the fixed price menu. Starter main and desert. Which also gives you included acess to the viewing platforms.Definitely worth it. Didn't work out much more for the food than if you just bought the tickets for the viewing platform on there own!Enjoyed the views and the food.

Do not forget to look for glass flooring, you can be on top of tower walking over a glass transparent flooring.Makes it even more worthwhile.Suggest to check with hotel concierge on waiting times,have done the tower a few times during separate visits, somehow queue length seems to be very short/long depending on day/time

Fantastic views of Toronto and beyond from the tower. We went on a Saturday and queued for only 10 minutes to get our tickets.The staff were friendly and efficient and the ride to the top was quick with glass viewing panels on the floor of the lift. The glass floor on the viewing platform is great as long as you...

Definitely one of those things you just gotta do once! Pretty sure I wouldn't go again since it was quite a cost but the whole event was quite informative with an amazing view!I have a handicap and can't say enough about how helpful the staff were, especially since I was alone (husband has height fright).

I like going to the highest point and having a look... and Toronto was no exception... But this one was really nice - the elevator to the top was great... you could feel the acceleration and look under your feet... the space where you land has a nice restaurant where you can pause to have a drink and take in...

We visited the tower on the last day of a trip for a wedding and I was impressed with the tower. The staff was polite and very informative. The views of the city and beyond are not to be missed. Your food choices and souvenirs available are great. We parked under the stadium next door and I thought the price...
It's a beautiful view from the top of the CN tower ?? My family loved it . It's like a 10000 mirrors

I got a feeling about this because I was born in Toronto and l don't know my parents went there and l am free for this city to give me some good life but now l am ready to start my life living in Seoul instand of staying here
$37 pp to ride up an elevator in 58 seconds, walk around the observatory, then one floor down for the glass floor? Sorry we were done in a half hour. Beautiful views though.

This was something else to cross of my bucket list. Took a chance one afternoon and surprisingly the queue was quite reasonable. The elevator to the top was quite an experience in itself. The most awesome view when you get to the top. Spent a long tine just studying the details of this oh so impressive vista. Certainly an experience...

Okay the CN Tower has got to be the aim centre attraction. You have amazing views and the lift/ elevator is thrilling going up and down. It has a glass floor so not for the faint hearted.You learn a lot about the height of the tower compared to other buildings across the world. It's a lovely day trip to...

The tower is nice, close to aquarium and a local brewery. The view is also nice, but the attraction is overpriced.If you're on. Hotel in downtown, probably you can have a great view also, but for free.Hot dog outside CN Tower were nice!!

$32 per person to travel up a tower, is very expensive, and I do not feel I got value for money.The view is excellent, it was a clear day and you could see all of Toronto. Aside from the view, there is nothing to do up there unless you are willing to spend more money. The restaurant was closed...
This has to be one of the things to do before you die. Great experience. I visited the tower back in 1992 and vowed to take Cath to see it also. We dined in the 360 restaurant. See separate review.

If you want to have the best views of Toronto, you have to get to the top of the CN Tower!I recommend you to book online as it is very busy, that will avoid you to queue at the ticket office where queues can be quite long.However, be aware that you’ll still have to queue inside the building...

We queued for a while and decided to update the experience to go right to the top pod. What a view at night and you can take as long as you like whilst up there. Take a camera because the view is outstanding . Good value for money except for the photos they take of you and try to sell...
One of the coolest place. If you ever go to Toronto, you must visit this place. The observation tower and clear glass floor was fun...

The CN Tower is an amazing structure with spectacular views on clear days. We purchased both the general admission that gets you access to the observatory, and the extra ticket for access the Skypod, which is located above the main observatory area.There are lots of opportunities for photos, and the views of the greater Toronto area are pretty special...

I'll start out by saying that I really enjoy observation towers, and looking out into cityscapes, so my review might be partial, but I definitely recommend visiting the CN Tower. While the cityscape view from the CN Tower isn't quite as built up as what you would expect to see from the towers in other cities (such as New York...

Fantastic spot to get a full appreciation of the size of Canada's largest city, especially with it being right on the edge of Downtown where the largest skyscrapers are. I felt that the $32 was a bit extreme for what it was but it's just one of these things which people aren't going to turn away from if they'd made...

Made the trip up the tower as we do every couple of years. Always taken back from the great view up there. Have never visited the rotating restaurant but might next year. Always a fun time at the CN and staff are fun there as well.

Amazing experience! I'm afraid of heights but i'm so glad i went all the way up. The view is great. When you're glad you can even see the Niagara falls.I went to the smaller second platform and the photos i've taken are beautiful.Highly recommended :)

It was a good surprise, after some review here i didnt wait a very good food. But, we received a very nice table at the window, with a very polite and good server. We choosed 1 from the menu and 2 alacart. All fodds were very good, they had also nice wines. If I deduct the fee for the tower,...
It is something you have to do, but it really isn't that great for what you are paying for. It would be great if this was closer to 10-15$ rather than 30-40$.

This is one of thoes things you should go see as its a Canadian Landmark. We were really surprised at the cost for two of us to go up which was in the $70 range. Its was something we were going to do no matter on the price. But its not something I would do again because of the price....

Of course being in Toronto we had to visit the CN Tower. Once we got inside and were told the price to go up, I had second thoughts, but my friend really wanted to go. I had hopes that for that price there is probably some attractions at the top or something. Nope. Nothing. Just looking out at the city....
Went here with a group on a Coach Tour. Loved it. The views from the top are outstanding. There was a very nice gift shop too. The glass floor is amazing and gives a great perspective.
This is totally amazing and worth it… If you go on a very clear blue sky day ! Not terrible if it isn't clear just doesn't reach the potential if it was a clear day !
We made a reservation for lunch in the revolving restaurant. The food was ok, not great, but the view made it all up. Go to the glass floor after lunch.

CN Tower is the main landmark of Toronto and you see it in every corner of the city. We planned to visit the tower but at the desk we see that the price of a ticket is 32 euro. That was the point we walked away and enjoyed the tower from the outside.
There were 6 of us for dinner at a window table. The food and our waiter were excellent. Highly recommended.

We visited the C N Tower as my husband had booked to do the edge walk experience,he had a brilliant time and it was a clear day so the views were fantastic. We decided to have lunch in the 360* restaraunt which was a great experience and the food was delicious well worth the money

The price to see the general info stuff, the lookout floor, the glass floor level and the skypod (additional cost) is great value. The skypod takes you 147 stories and the view is spectacular. You can look down on the adventurers doing the Edge Walk (I can personally recommend this as well) and get one of the highest lookouts in...

If you are in Toronto, then don't miss out on visiting the CN Tower. Had great views for downtown Toronto and also enjoyed the glass floor views. If the weather is fine on the day, you'll have no worries.

We were visiting Ontario from Alberta, and figured we'd hit all the major attractions sight-seeing wise. I ended up not even going up the tower as i did not want to waste 40$ when, really, it was so cloudy that there would be no point. I think even weather permitting it seems like a less than desirable way to spend...

My CN tower tower experience was one that I would never forget. I did the entire tour, including the Edge Walk! That (the edge walk) in itself is a breathtaking, heart-throbbing experience. - As an adrenaline junkie, this was the main reason for my visit to the tower. The glass floor area is great for taking great souvenir photos, especially...
This is a must see. Great time in the tower and evening meal in the tower. We enjoyed the scenery at the top of the tower, the glass floor view.

The CN Tower is great to visit on a bright sunny day when you can totallysee the city and beyond,dusk is also amazing when the lights are on butlight enough to see the buildings.To prevent the long lineups, eat at the revolving restaurant first,the line gets you up faster.Great for visitors and kids!

We had dinner here on our last evening in Canada. [2 glasses of Prosecco $13 each, 1 bottle of Cabernet Sauvignon $56, 2 Chowders $21 each, 1 Rib of beef $45, and 1 Pork $46] Total bill $242 but halve that for GBP and you get to £121 and no cost of entry. If that's expensive then knock off the...
The CN Tower is a ‘must do’ attraction. From the fast elevator ride up to the stunning panoramic views and the vertigo inducing glass floor it was all superb. Don’t leave Toronto without doing this.

You get a great view of Toronto and Lake Ontario on a clear day but the cost to go up is quite expensive. There is an additional charge to go to the sky pod but if you heading up you should go to the top. You can save some money and avoid one line up by buying tickets online, however...
amazing views! worth doing just for the lift ride alone, kinda reminded me of the life in the old Charlie and the Chocolate Factory... magical!
We went on a weekday and it was not terribly busy. It was also a clear day and we were able to enjoy a fabulous view. Our nine year old grandson really liked the glass floor section.
I went up to work on my fear of heights. I couldn't stand on the glass floor... but it was still a greag adventure.
it is something you have to experience at least once. Incredible views as well as fun stuff to do for all ages. Only down part is the price, not cheap for anything there.
Positives- easy to find- best view over Toronto and surroundingsNegatives- overcrowded (that was expected)- pretty high price, close to a rip off - more than $50 dollars for a tower
You can not visit Toronto without stopping by CN Tower! The view is amazing..and you can do the "Edge walk" if you up for a challenge!
Expensive and long lines to get to the top. The view is nice. Edge walk looks really nice but it is too expensive.

The CN Tower is a great tourist attraction to visit if you are in Toronto. Yes, it is expensive to go up but the views are priceless! The glass floors are very cool and a fun feature of the attraction. This structure really makes the Toronto skyline unique. Definitely worth the visit!

There are so many observation decks in the world, but which one can boast overlooking one of the most amazing waterfalls in the world?The view is breathtaking. If your budget allows, go for the revolving restaurant too! The meal would be so unique and memorable.

This is one of the experience a tourist cannot miss when visiting Toronto. Even if is a bit pricey (GA&SkyPod Adult at 44 CAD and Child at 36 CAD), the great views of the dowtown area, the island and the Lake Ontario are amazing. If I came back, no sure that I would go to the last floor since the...

The CN Tower (Canadian Tower) not the CNN Tower (which is American) is a great tourist attraction and an engineering feat and is the tallest free standing structure up in the Northern Hemisphere. The external lift takes 1 minute to get to the top of the Tower which is approx 531 metres.Restaurant offered a set menu or open menu.We...
This is a truly amazing structure with a beautiful view. I would recommend paying the extra $12 to go all the way to the sky pod. The glass floor is very intimidating.

Easy process to get to the top. Kind of overpriced, but we had a great experience. The outside was closed when we were there due to windy conditions, which was too bad. What a view from the top - it real is spectacular. A must do in Toronto.

It only takes 58 seconds to bring you to the viewing area of this wonderful tower. If you dare, you can walk on the glass bottom floor and take pictures under you. You can have dinner/lunch there, but it is quite pricey. It is an experience that you do not want to miss.

We went up here on our trip to Toronto and the view was incredible. It is something that you should check out when going to Toronto. The only issue is that it was a bit expensive, but still should not be missed for the amazing views of the city.
Great view of the downtown area and Lake Ontario. I liked it as much as the Willis (Sears) tower in Chicago. If you are driving, be aware. No street parking and very expensive public parking.

We went to see the CN Tower and decided to eat at the restaurant instead. The price to go the tower alone is about 32 Canadian each for adults, it is crowded, hot and sweaty and although quite high up not easy to spend much time there. We opted for the the rotating restaurant at 55 Canadian each for the...

The restaurant is pricey and not the quickest of service but the food and view from the windows of a day are amazing. It included the viewing platform with the glass floor. These we're less impressive at night but worth visiting in the day.As for the EDGEWALK this is expensive but should be done by anyone unafraid of heights....

A great experience if you like heights. It has to be a clear day otherwise it's a waste of money. We enjoyed our time 541 metres up but 15/20 minutes is sufficient. The glass floor is fun but the light can ruin your photos.

The CN tower is worth seeing. Views are spectacular and there are several levels you can go to. It is interesting watching planes take off from the island runway. The glass floor is busy but good to see.It's an expensive trip, but worthwhile for all the family.
The price was a little hefty to go up. The view was great. It was a "been there, done that" type of attraction.

I lived in Toronto for a year and thought about going up for quite some time before deciding to do so on my second to last day.First off: If you're a student, remember to ask for a discount - they don't advertise it, but they have one.Quite honestly, I hadn't believed it would be that stunning. The views...
Book lunch. Straight Up. Relax and enjoy. View is superb. Access to the rest of the Tower after you eat.
One way to get the bird eye view of Toronto is on the CN tower. Nice for pictures. I really liked the glass floor, it is awesome for pictures!
Fun place. Especially the floor of glass that allowed you to see to the ground. We ate at the restaurant which gave you amazing views of the city. Food was pricey, but it was worth it for the views.

We decided to go up for dinner even though it was pricey as to just go up for the views you had to pay $20 or $30 anyways. The meals were OK - nothing too fabulous - but the staff were nice and were helpful with getting photos.
Beautiful building, beautiful rooms, beautiful grounds. Definitely worth a visit, nothing else need be said!

A visit to the CN Tower was a must even before we came to Toronto. The view was breathtaking and will never be forgotten. The glass floor was also very exciting. We were able to see a 360 degree view of Toronto. Will definitely recommend.

This is something you would do once, but maybe not twice unless you are escorting some other new tourists in this area. Customer service has a big mergin of improvement. Really, those stuff who takes souvenir photo (which is no necessary required by all, but only to some) and escorting all the way to the tower are ones who can...

great for kids and everyone to visit and see a 360 degree view of Toronto from high in the sky. You can also walk on glass looking below to the ground. The restaurant in the sky is great also with a view of the city. A must do.

I was visiting Toronto with friends and we decided to head up the CN Tower before going to the Blue Jays games.We were lucky because the visibility was superb, the views from up there are brilliant.I would suggest its well worth paying the extra and going up to the SkyPod.The queues were fine but there were loads...

Been to the Empire State Building, WTC, Rockefeller Center and now the CN Tower. Guess when you are that high, its all the same. But the good thing about the CN Tower is that there is a glass floor which made it most interesting of the taller buildings I've been too. The lines were long, perhaps it was because of...

Gotta do it once, paying full price not worth it, really worth it if you buy the citypass for multiple attractions. Glass floor was cool, We went first thing in the morning and there was no lineup, and that was on a Blue Jay game day

If you aren't afraid of heights than the CN tower is definitely a place to visit if you're in the Toronto area. The prices are after rising over the years which a disappointment, but its worth it if you've never been in a similar tower before. The best part isn't even the glass floor, its the stunning view you get...

One of the tallest buildings in the world till 2010, it's An iconic place in Toronto.It's right near some other big attractions, like the baseball stadium (I think we saw the Blue Jays playing), and the Ripley's Aquarium, it's an area that is pretty busy.We went during school time in Canada and it was easy to purchase tickets,...

We had great hopes of what we would find here. We learned that the expense of getting in and experiencing the various opportunities wasn't worth it. We had inquired several weeks ago about wheelchair accessibility of the Edge Walk but never got a response. The restaurant was a little too pricey for our wallets. As retired folks, we have to...

Enjoyed a wonderful dinner and spectacular views when we visited Toronto for our anniversary. The food was great, as was the service. Although somewhat pricey, you are buying an experience rather than just dinner. My only caveat, particularly for young couples for whom this would be a splurge, the noise level was extreme, owing in part to the tightness of...

We got stuck in the Toronto city traffic in the afternoon and a 25 minutes ride took almost 2hr 45mins to reach at the CN Tower. Still we have a huge expectation that at the end it will be fascinating.Always the stuff wanted to convince the visitors to purchase the high priced package tickets to avoid 2 hrs waiting in...

Pros: Great view, glass floor, quick elevator with views the entire way up, busy but not crowded, part of the CityPass couponsCons: Long lines, may be confusing to get there, no real direction/flow of people, boring videosThis is a must see if you're visiting Toronto. One of the most iconic structures in the world at least deserves the...

If you want to check out Toronto from a upper position, then CN Tower is the place to go. With the first glass floor ever created in the world, you get one of many extraordinary sensations in this monument. Another great sensation is walking around outside the tower where you can feel the strength of the wind or the warmth...
a BEAUTIFUL EXPERIENCE.Through the elevator, the city buildings, people seemed as tiny specks in the air...standing on the glass floor appeared as if we were flying...

Wonderful view of the city at night. I had a chance to eat dinner in their pricey restaurant but the food was really good. I ordered the steak and generally I do not eat meat, but I'm glad that I made this selection because it was TASTY and tender. The view and the ambiance made for a great evening with...
This was an exhilarating experience. High in the sky, with a panoramic view, and the glass floor was a great viewing experience.

As one of Toronto's biggest attractions, we enjoy taking our out of town friends and family. Of course it's one of the 1st things people want to experience. The cost grows very quickly when you've got a family of 4 plus guests. It's unfortunate that so many must miss the opportunity because of pricing.

I have a disability, and they say its handicap accessable, but it is not. There are no clear directions and long lines. The employee sold me a ticket for the skypod only for me to find out (after another long wait) that you need to use stairs just to get up there. The windows are dirty too. The entire experience...

On my quest to reach the tallest structures around the world, this was a must stop for me. We walked near the glass floor but with my fear of heights, I choose not to look directly down. Everyone else did and said the view was spectacular. Our favorite viewing point was the SkyPod. Of course, we picked up our group...

What s interesting for me is to visit usually the highest building around the world although I Dont like heights but this is one f the places that u can't miss them. It have a very nice view for toronto and it s very interesting to visit and even to have a light meal in the restaurants and take photos...

I actually got in for free because of a partnership with my employer, but I can't imagine actually paying $30 for this experience. Yeah, the view is cool, but $30 cool? I'd rather spend that next door at the Aquarium. Or go to the Steam Whistle Brewery. Or even the Railroad museum. Or spend more and go to a Jays...
My wife and I went up on a Thursday afternoon. The wait was reasonable and the view was exactly what you would expect. Great view and a must see when in town.

What a lovely experience visiting the CN tower and dining at the 360 Restaurant. Having been up some of the worlds tallest buildings my initial thought was this is just another building but the view is definitely breath taking looking over Lake Ontario. The view from the glass floor was also a different way of seeing Toronto. Would recommend especially...

We enjoyed our meal and initially the staff appeared to be fine - unfortunately the offerings of sauces for the beef course were haphazard and very much on a quick 'take-it or-leave-it' basis. Having used my spoon for my desert when I received my coffee and asked for a spoon I was advised to use the dessert spoon ( which...

My boyfriend and I went to Toronto for the first time and we had such an amazing time. I dragged my boyfriend to go to the CN Tower and he excepted. It was a long long wait but it was beautiful when we got to the top. The glass floor was a little scary but it was a great experience....

After waiting ages in a queue for tickets I finally made it inside. More queues and the obligatory cheesy photo taken before I could get up the tower. Don't get me wrong, once up there the view is spectacular - particularly out over Lake Ontario. There was a Blue Jays game on when I was there too so it was...
The most exciting height experience in Toronto. This place will have your heart throbbing when you get to the very top. A must see attraction when in Toronto

Must go here to eat, the food outstanding, desserts outstanding, staff outstanding. Worth every penny to eat and go up to the top of the tower and stand on the glass floor. I met one of the chefs and he was so friendly and it was nice he came out when I jokingly asked my waiter to meet him. try...
It was quite expensive i thought,but the views at the top were great.The ques for the lifts were very long!!

Booked meal to avoid queues to get in. Great views of Toronto but of course expensive, approx CAN$200 for 4 of us. Food and service excellent. Glass floors on lifts and part of floor excites everyone. For even more money you can book a walk around the edge of the tower attached by ropes. Safer just to walk around the...

I love great views - so whether it's the Space Needle in Seattle, Eiffel Tower in Paris, Empire State building in NYC - they all provide great views of great cities and the CN Tower lives up to that expectation. If you want great pictures - I'd recommend a day time visit to see the lake, but with a nicer...
Amazing place to visit with a lot more then the view. Glass floor is awesome. Food in the lounge was surprisingly very good
Great sight to see with great views. You should definitely pay the extra to go to the sky pod. Full 360 degree views.
Okay.... $32 for just going up the towerI understand it's world's tallest and it has a great view but $32???Seriously, the skydeck in Chicago just costs $19What a rip off
If you are not afraid of heights and even if you are i suggest you check this Toronto gem out if you don't believe me, come see for yourself what i am talking about.

We went to the CN Tower in the afternoon and queued at a desk which we assumed was for the CN Tower which we were told after a 20 minutes queue that we were not in the correct queue. So were told to go outside and queue up there. The queue was very long another 30 minutes.Finally got to...
Great overall view of the city landscape, a icon of Toronto that should not be missed, with a thrilling elevator ride to the observation deck.

You just can't miss CN tower, standing at any part of Toronto. One of the great man made structure is prime tourism attraction in Toronto. Observation deck gives full view of Toronto in all direction, it's truly amazing experience. At CN tower 360• revolving restaurant is must to dine in if you visiting Toronto, great view multiply the flavours in...

Our trip to the CN Tower with interesting featured stops on the way up was a most fascinatingexperience. On reaching the top we had a unique, unimpeded, panoramic view of Toronto city and its environs! We waited till dusk and watched the flickering lights coming on down below and it was an awesome sight never to be missed!The...

Great view of the city! The glass floor was my favourite part. The elevator ride was fun too. If you go to Toronto without going up in the tower, you have really missed out! It's thrilling! Beware, if you're afraid of heights!!!
This is a life changing experience, something you will never forget..ever! The restaurant is beautiful and the food is delish!!!.

I would advise planning your excursion as early as possible so you could enjoy your time when the tower is not too crowded. All the attractions there are interesting and I would recommend buying a full package and go everywhere. You need at least 3 hours if you would like to relax and enjoy your time at CN Tower.

The view of Toronto from the top of the tower were amazing you can walk round 360 degrees and see right across the city and the harbour and island stopped for a drink in the bar with a wonderful view over the harbour

column3: Nieuwerkerk aan den Ijssel, The Netherlands
column4: I understand of course that Toronto's CN Tower is a must-see for every tourist. And it's ok, but not very exciting in the end. Seeing Toronto and its surrounding from this height is nice, you can buy an ice-cream, look down through the glass floor, visit a toilet, but there is not that much more to get worked up about....
Even if you are afraid of heights, you need to take a trip to the top of the CN Tower. We went at night to get a different look of the lay of the land. Awesome.
Well worth a visit, great views. If you pre book a meal at the revolving restaurant then you get to avoid the queues and you don't have to buy a ticket just pay for your meal.

Some years ago when I stood on top of CN tower I stood on top of the world. It was the tallest man made structure of the world. Now it is no longer the tallest one but is still the # 1 landmark of Toronto and Canada.
Great views, but the long walk from Union Station to the tower wasn't worth the expense. A one time visit is enough.
It's a great thing to see. I however did not go to the observation deck because I am afraid of heights. But I believe that the view would be extraordinarily beautiful.

Had a terrific time here. The structure is an amazing engineering feat. Go directly to the restaurant and save yourself the cost of paying nearly $80 for two just to get to see the tower, it's already included in your restaurant trip. Don't get hung up on trying to get a window seat, instead try for the booths one level...
The CN Tower is a good experience, the views are fantastic, and when you go outside on the viewing deck the air is so fresh and clean, WE REALLY ENJOYED IT....
The CN Tower is a must to see. We had dinner which was excellent with the great view. Really recommend to spent the $.

The first thing I saw coming down the stairs from the 360 Restaurant to the observation ("Look Out") level was live video of some crazy people doing the Edge Walk. Apparently they pay for the privilege, but you couldn't pay me enough to do that. :-) Anyway this is the place in Toronto to get spectacular views of the city....

It is one of the best attractions in the city of Toronto, and definitely worth going to. Check weather forecast for visibility because on a very humid summer day suburbs can be a bit foggy.From LookOut level (with general admission) you will be able to see most of the city and to walk on the glass floor, but keep...

We spent $95.00 for two people to go to the "skypod". The views are ok but the "glass floor" was packed with children sitting on it not moving to allow others to see the "view". The glass is scratched and hazy and not that "spectacular" view as the hype says it is. The upper Skypod is small with better views...

The CN Tower was once the tallest building in the world. It has since been surpassed by a couple in Dubai. But in spite of this, it's an awesome site. What I can say is that once you're at 114 stories, paying the extra $12 to go another 33 stories is really irrelevant! The only benefit was that I got...

When visiting Toronto the CN Tower is a must. This should be a stop on anyone's list of places to see when touring the city. Great views, great food and a great atmosphere. Plus if you are up for an adventure they have the CN Tower Edgewalk which I also highly recommend.

The CN Tower is a good experience, the views are fantastic, and when you go outside on the viewing deck the air is so fresh and clean and if you go on a hot day, very refreshing. I go up the Tower every year and I really enjoy it.
Impressive sights espcially at night. When i was up there, it had snowed so everything was covered in white, which was cool

Every time I go downtown Toronto I always try to find the CN Tower.The view not just during the day but also at night it’s beautiful, specially when the tower keeps changing to so many different colors, like a rainbow. It’s amazing!

The CN tower is one of the best attraction in Toronto. It is a great experience, specially when you look from top to bottom through the floor's glass. You also see and show your friends/visitors ALL Toronto at a glance, and how beautiful it is. Very impressing and amazing.

CN Tower was fascinating and beautiful! Lots of views and worth the extra money to go to the very top.We happened to go right when it opened. There was little to no crowd and plenty of space to walk around (and no strangers heads in your photos!). Noticed in just a few hours it got super crowded.
good to visit when the sky is clear... amazing view of the Toronto island and the city of Toronto.A little bit scary the glass floor but overall a good experience ;)
Good: the viewBad: customer serviceUgly: crowd controlWhat a great view! Sadly, customer service and crowd control are a problem - even on off peak times
It was one of the most treeling adventure in my life!A and see bit scary, when my friend and me lay down and see people below.Funny, enjoyable trip. All Toronto in your hands!
Coming to Toronto for the first time? This is your best view of the city!Best time? One hour before sunset until evening...

We visited the CN Tower in July of 2014 and really enjoyed the experience. We have been to the top of the Sears Tower, Space Needle, Empire State Building and the World Trade Center one year before their destruction so we like to checkout the tall buildings! I really enjoyed the Glass Floor section of the view from the tower....

It's a spectacular tower to watch. Edge walking in summer is an awesome experience. It has observatory tower as well as glass floor where one can see direct beneath of his/ her own feet. One can collect souvenir from the shop inside.

The most wonderful, exciting experience I have ever done -- doing the "Edge Walk"....the guide was informative, made you feel so relaxed and you saw the City from that great height. You then have the opportunity to explore the rest of the Tower.

Its a great experience ... The view is breathtaking and the restaurant is really good. I go there every year . Torontos aquarium is right there too so you can enjoy lots of things without travelling from one place to another .

Seeing the views of Toronto from the CN Tower is the best way to get acquainted with the city.Best to go on a clear day but can see far enough on a cloudy day-as long as it isn't foggy, you can see for miles.Make sure you walk on the glass floor over looking the ground for thrills.The...
This allows you a great view on downtown Toronto, because of the resturant that revolves at at 360 degree angel.

CN Tower was a must visit attraction on our trip in July. Although the price was somewhat steep and we waited well over an hour for entrance, the ride up and views of Toronto and neighboring areas was quite impressive. Really wanted to do the outside walk, but was too costly.
A great place to take visiting family from out of town. May not be tallest, but the staff and the Wow factor are hard to beat!
Went to CN Tower had a great experience don't like heights but had a look over the edge. The view was fantastic had a bit of lunch and cocktail both very good.

The CN Tower is one of the highlights of Toronto. It is a must see. Arrive early to avoid queues, and definitely do the tour. It is much more than a standing monument. Read the walls, there is a lot of history, and take a picture for the bucket list, my camera died :( , so I'll have to visit...
interesting overview of the area but I prefer the ground and walking around where there is a lot to see and do and enjoy

Always a hit.Go up on a clear day if possible for best viewing. Remarkable view of a wonderful city. Watch planes take off from island airport. Edge walk not for the faint of heart but very safe. Restaurant for dining very good. Cafe area rather crowed as to be expected.
If you go to Toronto without going up in the tower, you have really missed out! It's thrilling! (Beware, if you're afraid of heights--the glass elevator is not for the faint of heart!)

CN tower is the largest free standing concrete structure (not a building) in the world. The glass floor experience is very unique. I have been to the Burj Al-Khalifa tower in Dubai, UAE but nothing compares to the glass floor. A MUST SEE!!

As I know it has been coted around one billion dollers to build CN Tower and it is unique tower in the world as I have traveled and visited 44 countries. For sure you wont for get CN Tower once you visit it. Also there are so many other atraction around it like Rogers Center Stadium and so on.

If you want to avoid the line up for the lifts (elevators) then a meal in the CN Tower revolving restaurant is the answer. However, be warned it does cost more than normal. You will pay roughly about $80 plus beverages per person - water is free. They will also include a service charge of roughly 17% on the final...
I took my daughter to the CN tower restaurant for her 16th birthday. We had a good time. She was thrilled about it all.
A great opportunity to view the city for both residents and visitors. Bring your camera and watch the sky walkers

I have gone up to the CN Tower many times with family and friends visiting from outside the city, outside the province and from outside the country, and I never get tired of it. It is the place to go no matter where you are from. It's also worth paying for the package that includes the pod. Laying down on...

A very busy place, but once you're up at the top the view is stunning. Truly beautiful. Worth the time and the ride up there. The glass floor is really neat. The area is big enough and the entire wall is made up of windows so it wasn't a problem finding space to look out and take pictures. The price...
Amazing view of the city and wonderful food. We went on a snowy evening and it was just perfect. Would love to bring my family back here.

I was stuck in Toronto Airport so chose to stay longer and see the city. I went to the CN Tower though the line was VERY VERY long if moved at a good pace and the ride up the elevator was awesome, talk about a rising view. Talk about an over wleming view of Lake Ontario and the city of...

Amazing views of the city after a rapid ascent in the lift.Rogers Centre baseball stadium - Torono Blue Jays, for anyone interestred - not me though although it was good to see some little people wielding silly sticks from way above - is directly below the viewing platform.Beware the glass floor for anyone with vertigo as it is...

Great building. I did the edge walk and loved it. It was worth every penny. The views are magnificent. I usually tend to do main attractions only once but this is the tower I would like to go back and take in the views again. I might go to the restaurant.

The CN Tower is an amazing place that offers the best view of any attraction anywhere. It zooms you up 140+ flights at over 20 MPH, and then allows you to go up to the upper ring for an additional fee. Yes, it is costly, but I would not miss this as one of the premiere things to do in...

Our family just got back from Toronto. Kids really wanted to see CN Tower so we decided to lunch at their 360 Restaurant. You get free entrance with your meal. Nice view of Toronto, good view, although it seems a little pricey. Price was a little more reasonable with the City Pass (if you are going to do the other things on the pass).

CN Tower was great...at the top there is a glass floor for those who like to feel like they are about to drop 1000+ feet. Also nearby is the Rodgers Center where the Toronto Blue Jays play, as well as the dock with tour boats on the Lake.
A little expensive, but great overall experience for the family. It is a must see when in town. The views are incredible.

Family members did the Edge Walk so we went up the tower. The complication was buying the tickets as there were 4 of us. they sort of sold us on the sky pod for an extra $50.00 or so.making it sound like we will be able to go up with them., the truth is that they go up and back...

The waiting line for the cn tower is about one hour long.The best way to visit the tower is to get a reservation at the 360 restaurant. You have priority access to the tower. I visited the Shanghai Tower 5years ago, so it was interesting to compare the CN tower experience. It was a different experience as it had great views further afield. Also shows how things have progressed when at one point this was the tallest building I the world.

You can't really go anywhere in Toronto without seeing it, and coincidentally, you can also see a great deal of Toronto and the surrounding area from it. You see this as you enter Toronto, so had to have the experience. It was a quick 59 minute ride, but enjoyable. A bit scary when you lay down and see the people below. Make sure you look at it at night as it changes colors from red to purple.

No where else can you see a city from 1500 feet above.... like if you where in a GoodYear blimp hovering over the city. The SkyPod in particulary amasing. \amazing worth going to visit the outlook from top of tower is beautiful.also you must lay on the glass floor and look down.
So you can't go to Toronto and not go up the cn tower. The views are incredible and the extra 12 to go up to the top in my opinion are worth it. Having said that it is very expensive.

We have visited the C/N Tower on numerous occasions over the last seven years. On this occasion we managed to visit the Sky Pod level the view was much better than our previous visits. I keep hearing about the lines - so we showed up right when they opened and breezed through the whole thing at a leisurely pace. The kiddo enjoyed being in the highest publicly accessible viewing deck in the world - but he was freaked out by the glass-floored area. Amazing views from a fun landmark.

I am a Torontonian, so it is hard for me to rate how great this really is when i pass it every day. The view at night is AMAZING. The glass floors are also impressive. The dining is worth the money when you go at night. It isn't as great in the morning. so check the restaurant's hours, etc.

One of the best things to do in the city (in my opinion) but very crowded and quite expensive. They charge extra if you want to visit the sky pod (about 33 floors higher)- The elevator takes 10 people at a time. And we had to wait around 40 minutes to get up there. And it is quite stuffy.

The CN Tower is pretty cool in it's own right. Spectacular views of the city and Lake Ontario. What really sets it apart though is shelling out the bucks for The Edgewalk experience. Visited the CN tower as part of our Toronto trip with the kids, but it wasn't that great. It was okay, but not fantastic. The kids enjoyed the elevator ride to the top and the view up top for a short while, but it wasn't a great venue overall. I think it is worth it for tourists to go once,...

Forget taking an elevator to the skypod to stare out a glass room at the city of Toronto. Hang over the very edge of the CN tower, experience the thrill of standing (outside) more than 300m above the earth. Yes, it is pricey. But so, so worth it. The guides are very thorough in their security checks, which is probably...
Great view of the city! The glass floor was my favorite part. The elevator ride was fun too. I didn't try the restaurant.

The CN tower is a must in toronto (as far as classic toronto attractions go) but it's exactly what you expect. Hugely popular and somewhat expensive. Obviously popular with children and families. Well-organized to manage the crowd. World's tallest tower when built, now taken over by other towers around the world.

One of the best I have ever done,entering the building ,you have security,There quick & efficient,before you know it ,your at the viewing platform deck ,the views are fantastic,have a snack,try the top uppermost viewing platform deck,this will put the icing on the cake,for your trip to the tower,enjoyed every minute of my visit to the tower,....would love to go...

After hearing great things about the CN tower I decided to go up and was actually excited about experiencing it.I initially wanted to partake in the edgewalk but my group were all a bunch of wimps!Regardless we headed up to check it out. Firstly, like any landmark with an observation deck there is going to be a fee on the tourist scale. The Space Needle, Empire State Building, etc. are all guilty of that. You can see the whole Toronto. But the glass view is not as beautiful as what you can see in Macau tower. Only the Lakeside view that is appealing. So windy on the west side.

My frist time in Toronto, I had to go up the Tower which is one of the main attraction in Torornto .. Beware if afraid of heights! This was beautiful chance to see the entre city at once. We could see the whole city, our hotel and other landmarks.

Our trip to Toronto was planned to go to a Baltimore Orioles baseball game at Rogers Center. We decided the best way to see the city would be from the CN Tower. There is almost no parking - you must take the subway. The price was very high. I would not recommend this attraction.

You can see the entire Toronto from the tower. If you are not afraid of heights go on to the Skypod, which even higher from the restaurant level. I've lived in or around Toronto my entire life and decided to do the CN Tower for the first time since I was a little kid. I had sunset views but didn't think they were that great. Toronto looks best when you can see the CN Tower in the skyline. I guess if you visit Toronto it is one of...

I was a great activity for the family to visit this landmark.Could not believe how many people had the same idea mid-week, as it was busy not not too busy.Spectacular view, great to feel the breeze on my face.Kids loved it.Must do...especially the glass floor and observation deck.

We queued for quite a while to pay, and then queued some more - but the views were breathtaking.Loved the glass floor (realised that I wasn't as comfortable with heights as I thought) and extra payment to go right to the top was worth it.

We bought a ticket to the very top which is really expensive. But the view was amazing on this clear day. Get there early in the morning then there are less people. It is really a must - but only on a clear day!

We went about 7pm so we could the evening sun set and lights in the city. We had to stay in queues about 30 mins. They also showed a free movie on Red Rockets, which gives an idea about the transpiration system in Toronto.

we had a lot of fun at the cn tower. you get a wonderful view of all of Toronto. however, for those of you that are even a little scared of heights, this is a scary place to visit.not cheap though. it cost us around $100

Great attraction. We had a fantastic dinner in the 360 restaurant. Treated myself to the steak and lobster which was superb. Unrivalled views, of course, and great service. We arrived early to be in the front of the queue to get up to the viewing platforms ahead of the crowds. Great views of Toronto. Well worth paying a little extra to go up the second lift to the very top viewing point.

$ 100 for 2 people, the elevator ride and glass floor are impressive. The tour is closed too quickly, the restaurant is too expensive for the food served ... There have many other things to do in Toronto!

Yes, the panoramic view is great. Yes, the glass floor is novel and a great photo opportunity (though only about 10' x 20' of glass). Oh, but the queues in the summer to reach the view. Of course if your in Toronto this is a must see experience. When we got there we were told that it was around $30 to go to the main level and then another $12 to go to the very top. Obviously we were going to go to the very top we didnt go all the way into Toronto to get...

This tower blows away the Empire State Building.
