The CN Tower is one of those "must do" things when you visit Toronto. The view is great, but it was quite expensive. It's probably worth it the first time. Not the second time.

The tower is great, everyone can enjoy it. It's the tallest tower of America and they know how to use it. I still think that it was very expensive. But the experience is something that must be lived if you are going to Toronto.

2014 me and my family visited the CN Tower.Going to Toronto it's a must if no-one has told you about it.Apart from the 3 or 4 sets of cues to get to the top, it wasn't a bad couple of hours out.The kids loved the glass floor but were bored otherwise.

For 100 $ a family ticket. Going up in a Fast, Shaky, Full, With Lots of Windows and Glass Floor elevator is the Starting experience! Must see in Toronto. I advise you to purchase tickets via Internet. The glass floor experience is really nice.

If you are into heights with great sights, the CN Tower is the place to go! We went during the week in the late afternoon. My husband and I have been to several observation decks and we both agreed that the CN Tower was a unique experience. It's the best way to see the city. It has an observation area with open air. It could get chilly up there at night time so don't forget to bring a jacket. You should go see for yourself!
It has a fantastic view, but it is overpriced-in my opinion. There is a big line to get in, and we also got to see the people doing the edge walk.

We booked a meal at the 360 restaurant we didn't have to queue because we had booked which was a big plus. Lots in the shops but we thought many of the goods were on the pricey side. I'm from Toronto, so we all know the CN Tower is the one encompassing icon; it is the landmark figure of this city. Would you miss the Leaning Tower of Pisa in Italy? No! Admission is expensive but necessary if visiting Toronto ... Enjoy!

It's probably cliche to say it's a must visit in Toronto, but it's true. One of a kind experience and best way to see the whole city. *INSIDE TIP* Eat at the restaurant or visit the bar and you won't have to wait in the long lines ;)
Stunning view of the city! It was super windy when I visited which made the experience more thrilling!

You will need to set aside a good couple of hours, and be prepared to queue, but it compares well to the Eiffel Tower as a huge tourist attraction. It also strikes one as expensive - $50 to get to the top (well, the Skypod which is as high as you can go), although you can spend another $175 to...

I didn't like it that much...the view of the city and the suburbs is not amazing...nothing really beautiful to see around! Probably everyone visiting Toronto goes to the CN Tower. We were there on a long weekend so the crowds were predictable. It isn't a cheap attraction but well worth seeing once. On clear days the views are amazing.

Like every other tower/observatory-based attraction, you get a nice view from the top. But the downside is the waiting in lines (buying tickets, waiting for elevators to go to different levels and then waiting for elevators to get back to ground level). It is worth visiting if you have a minimal of three (3) hours available. However, depending on the...

Wonderful landmark. Fast ride to the top. Brilliant weather whilst we were there and had amazing views over the city as well as the city airport and water. Highly recommend a meal in the restaurant - great food and drink whilst admiring the views.
A nice view of toronto, but i find the glass to be a bit dirty.You go up, take pics... then what do you do? I never understood the fascination of going up towers and looking around.

The meal was good but the experience was great and the views spectacular. Booked a meal on line a couple of months in advance and glad we did as the restaurant looked full. Our visit to Canada was awesome the sights we seen were spectacular. Such a beautiful place and we can't wait to go back. It's so clean and people were nice and very helpful.
Did this a few years ago, thought it was great, loved the glass floor too, don't look down! Ha ha, also eat in the revolving restaurant!
It's something you have to do if you visit Toronto. The glass floor experience is terrifying if you don't like heights but definitely worth doing. Great view of the city.

The tower and experience was absolutely fantastic! What a production to go up 114 stories, but it was well worth the bit of a wait. I think everyone should experience, at least once, a view from the top of the CN Tower. And, if you are brave enough, step onto the glass floor and look down. Really enjoyed going up the tower and gaining another perspective of Toronto. Was lucky enough to be able to see a snow storm rolling in, which made for some great pictures

CN Tower is a must see. Take the tour first, then explore on your own. The views are unequaled and the opportunity to hang on a rope at about 1/4 mile up is scary and exciting. How can someone visit Toronto and not go up this tower?! The location is great- right next to the aquarium and Rogers Center. The atmosphere is electric when there is a baseball game going on! We are locals in the GTA and went yesterday. It was $64 for one adult and one child - way overpriced. We waited in a long long long lineup for an hour (on a Monday go figure). Good tip if you want to visit this tick-box attraction in Toronto is to book a table for lunch. at first sight it seems expensive but when you realise that the lunch price includes entry it is much more reasonable. There are many tall building in many major cities....but none quite like Toronto's CN Tower. Easy to get to. Surrounded by attractions. The fix price lunch menu at the revolving restaurant is excellent quality, and great value. During the day you can see for miles, outstanding. Be aware if you feel motion sickness!! Although aside from looking out the window it is hard to tell you are moving.
This attraction was number one for us to see. We liked that great view to the beautiful city of Toronto. Great feeling to be there.
Nothing special with the CN Tower, just another tall building where U can look outside the glass and see Toronto!! There are a lof of nearby tall residential buildings where U can do the same!

If you've only got a few days in Toronto you NEED to go up the CN! It offers great views of the city, and amazing views over Lake Ontario. You can really see the massive size of the Lake from the top.

It's a wonderfull place to visit if you are in Toronto. Costs 28 bucks, but totally worth it.Do the floor glass walking, it's amazing!

Imagine flying so high you can see 40km in any direction. You can do it at CN Tower. On a clear day you can practically see to Niagara Falls. Quite the place to watch a beautiful sunset and have a drink while taking that bird's eye view. A must for tourists and locals alike.

Another fabulous trip to the Tower - has to be on any list of things to do if visiting Toronto. I love seeing cities from up high, and this is the perfect way to see Toronto and surrounding area. Buy tickets in advance online to avoid lines. Also, early morning seems to be a lighter time.

This was our second trip up the CN Tower and if you love views like this, it is completely worth it. We went at night and there was no wait. We actually watched the end of the Blue Jays game by looking down and enjoying how it looks from afar. Good views of the city, but further away views are...

In our case the day was perfect. Clear skies, sunset and even a Jays game during our diner. We reserved a table at the 360 rest, and even with the expensive menu, it was worth every penny. What a fantastic way to view the city! We enjoyed every minute and it was definitely worth the entrance fee. People who are afraid of heights should be prepared for the very top! Would definitely want to visit here again!

It's so hard to come to Toronto and not have your kids experience this landmark but the exorbitant prices and RIDICULOUS lineups at every stage of this event lead you to question the intelligence of the choice,that is unless you weren't the one paying for it, then I guess I'd have to say it's an interesting experience. I visited CN tower many time and everytime I visit I get the different side of beautiful view from it. I've been to the CN Tower so many times and have never been dissapointed. .. this time was even more special because it was the first time for my 2 and 7 yr olds! The staff were fantastic and attentive to both kids! One tip... get there early!

Went in june and loved it to bad it was cloudy so you couldn't see much. but if you are going on a clear day you have to go up and over look the city.
The view is fantastic both near and middle distance (too hazy to see further)Very busy with manageable queuesLots of options we did not tryWalking on the glass floor was not easy

Amazing to see the scene change from day to the night lights of a Toronto. The food is expensive but of good quality. Service was good and our waiter picked up on our wish to go slow to optimise the viewing experience.

The cn tower is a must visit when you are in Toronto. It is a great sight and the kids will really enjoy the glass floor.we had more time to view the tower on our own than with the tour.
Have been up to the top of the CN tower many times,If ever in Toronto this place is a must on a clear day you can see for miles away.

The tower of course dominates the skyline in Toronto but do go to the higher level, the views are fantastic. They say on a clear day you can see Niagara Falls - I think I might need really good eyesight for that. You can eat at one of the levels.

The view from the CN tower are unbelievably beautiful. It was clear when were up there. Seeing the city is amazing. The elevator ride was fast and easy. Expect long lines this time of year. Amazing experience and views. Bought the tickets in advance which saved lots of time by avoiding the main line. We ended up doing this on our last day in Toronto and it was one of the clearest days we had. Weather had been a little hazy on days leading up to it so we never knew what to expect. Glad we did this. Viewing platform is amazing and you have a panoramic view of Toronto. Adjacent to the Blue Jays Stadium, you are also very close to the water front.

Who's to say you'll get back so do it when you are in Toronto. My busband insisted we walk on the glass floor. It was a bit scary at first to see below your feet but glad I did it. We took lots of pictures and once we were down .We headed to the Blue Jays/Yankee game.

The view is spectacular. However, the line up for tickets and then the 45 minute wait for elevator ride.I have been in top floors of hotels and the view is similar not just as high.The price of $34.00 for adult is ridiculous. Once is enough

I've been coming to Toronto for years and hadn't gotten up the tower until recently. There was nothing particularly great about it. Definitely not worth the money. I'm glad I've done it, but wouldn't recommend as a must-do in the city.

The only downside is that there can be a loooong line to wait during tourist season. But the views are amazing and the elevator ride is fun. If you're interested in the history and building of the tower, be sure to catch the little movie that's always running on the lower level.

This is an absolute must do if you are in the city of Toronto. The tickets online are a bit cheaper than just buying it at the tower. The tickets are expensive, but it is worth it. Hard to explain.. but cant be missed.. was an amazing story and design. 157 stories in the sky!!!! once in a lifetime view and ride.

We went on a beautiful night so we could see all over the city -it's pricey but worth it. Staff was always smiling and helpful.

Well worth the visit. This is the highest tower in the world and is an amazing experience,one not to be missed when visiting Toronto. Take the time to visit the restaurant and have great food.

Great views of the city and a must-do when in Toronto :-) Price isn't bad..bout 20gbp each. ( you can pay extra for the higher level too ) Don't go around lunch..was 75mins to get to the lifts and about 15 mins wait to get back down..

Pick a bright and sunny day and you will see the best of Toronto! Get the video so you can relive it again with your friends and family. I went with a friend from Australia and she enjoyed it as well. If you can catch a time when there is a ball game on that would be extra special.

Landmark in Canada.Impressive views.Somewhere you have to visit if you are in Toronto.Lot's of things to see around it.

you might think it is a little expensive but worth it. Recommend paying the extra $12 to go right up to the highest point I guess it might be worth it if you went outside the tower for the rope experience

An absolute must to visit. Considering the numbers, it's very slick, and the views are fantastic! Go to the very highest point if you can.

went with family and kids loved it. much different than what we have in chicago. loved the fact that there are no lengthy waits...

its definitly one of tge must to see in toronto , but in comparession to other tall symbols of the world if was not maintained well and clean , they could make more money with cn tower .

Went up in the CN Tower on our first visit to Toronto. The views were fabulous of all the metro area of Toronto. The price was reasonable for the ticket. The outside view was cool to see. Was not brave enough to do the walk outside.

The CN Tower is no longer the world's tallest structure but it still offers the best views of Toronto and remains up to date. I understand the Tower's exterior is due for a makeover before the 2015 Pan American Games..it could use it. Painting that concrete shaft should be a painting job for the record books.
We spent nearly two hours and enjoyed the fantastic view. All very well organized and the construction details explained from scratch.
View is amazing and elevator ride is fun. Easy for even the "don't like heights" crowd. Glad we went.....EVERYONE said not to miss it.

On a clear day, the rotating restaurant provides a great view of the GTA without the crowded railings of the observation deck, and the food was quite good. There is a fixed price of $50 for adults, and $30 for kids, but when you factor in the fact that you also get to skip the line for the observation deck...

The CN tower is an easy walk along Front Street from Union Station (GO trains & buses, TTC subway). It's right next to Rogers Centre (home of the Blue Jays baseball team) and the new Ripley's Aquarium. Going up in the glass-sided elevator is fun, and the views of Toronto and even across Lake Ontario to Buffalo on clear days...

Beautiful views of Toronto! Hard to step out onto glass floor , but worth it! I would go earlier in the day next time as it was crowded. Also, we would like to go at night sometime as I'm sure the cityscape would be beautiful then.

I had some time to kill awaiting the arrival of my coworkers for a business trip and was staying at the Intercontinental hotel right next door so decided to spend a few hours here and it was so worth it. The weather was not ideal so the views were not as spectacular as they could have been, but I enjoyed...

This is a must see site, so go see it, preferably on a nice day. It's a unique structure and already historic. It's so tall the views are almost surreal -- more like what you'd expect from a plane window than from a building. But it's extremely commercialized and when all is said and done, not the most interesting place...

Everyone in Toronto is the epitome of Canadian charm, so much so here at the CN Tower, anything the staff could do for you they did it almost seconds after you voiced your request. There is security so prepare yourself for that and your kids. If you have kids in strollers they will take you through a separate area, where...

I am from Toronto, and feel this should be rated the # 1 attraction. If you are visiting from another city or country you must go up the C N Tower. From the outdoor elevators to the glass floors it is an exciting experience.If you are afraid of hieghts --- don't bother. When you are at the top you...

If you are in Toronto do not miss the CN Tower. I personally do not like heights and had the time of my life. There is nothing like seeing Toronto from over 1,300 feet. You can view Toronto from the glassed in area, the observation deck or the glass floor. We went around sunset which made it even more spectacular....

You have to visit CN Tower if in Toronto! Great views out over the city, we went on a nice clear day so view was fantastic. We also took a trip to Horizons Restaurant, which I would recommend also. We went in the late afternoon and wasn't that busy, maybe we just got lucky but it's well worth a visit!

Great restaurant and excellent waiter but the portions are a little less than what you would expect for the price and desert was way way to small of a serving. The view is amazing and you can never get enough of the CN tower. It is magnificent and I have been going for years and now to bring my family...

We recently decided to take the elevator to the top of the CN Tower and enjoy dinner.I was very pleased with the entire experience. We were lucky because at 5:00 pm there was no wait at all. I assumed the dinner would be mediocre at best, but thought we should take advantage of the tourist attraction while we were...

My family traveled to the top of the CN tower on a clear day for a wonderful view of the city. There are many packages to choose from for viewing and we chose the basic. Although the lookout area was busy, we were able to enjoy beautiful views of the city. Our child was in a stroller when we visited....

The only thing to dislike here is the cost to just go up and look around, but the view is awesome and unbeatable. We only had about 7 hours to spend in Toronto ...so we narrowed our Must do's this trip to the Hop On/Off bus and the CN Tower. I love this sort of thing - yes, touristy but I, for one, am not ashamed or embarrassed to BE a tourist. We had purchased our tickets ahead of time so we breezed...

The CN tower is worth visiting but of course if you have visited other towers like the burj khalifa, eiffel tower etc, you'll find it similiar. Awesome View of course! Great experience for our 6 year old. But sooooo hot with so many people in the middle of summer. Well I went up the CN tower this past weekend with a visiting family member. It was 32 dollars and not really worth it.You have to walk past 3 different paparazzi workers trying to get you to do green screen shots for you to buy. We by passed these lines to get to the elevator up. Once you get...

We visited the CN Tower today and had an excellent day. The weather was good and we got some amazing views of Toronto. It was a bit hazy due to the smog but the views were still good. I would recommend paying the extra $12 to visit the Skypod as the view is a lot better although be aware there...

I made plans to go to the CN Tower only because to me it would feel like not going to the Eifel Tower if I went to Paris. We learned that the fee to go to the top was $32 and said that is crazy! Then I saw that the rotating restaurant at the top would be $55 (fixed price...

We bought the Family Pass and added on the SkyPod. The CN Tower is awesome. The whole area around the Harbourfront has a great vibe. There's always a cultural festival where you can get some tasty foreign food. I didn't go up the tower this time but just being around it was great.

What else can I say- it's an amazing 360 degree view of Toronto and her lake. The glass floor is crazy (and super busy). Make sure you take the time to read the historical facts printed on the walls, it's all very interesting!

We had lunch in the revolving restaurant. The views were wonderful but the food was not as good as expected. The advantage is that if you have a meal in the restaurant, you do not have to queue to go up the tower and the entry fee is included in the meal price.

While in Toronto we made a visit to the C N tower. I believe the second highest man mad building in the world. It takes 54 seconds to reach the top in a glass fronted elevator where you get great views on your way up. You some times have to be a bit pushy to get to the front so...

I've been to the top of this tower several times and it's always impressive, especially on a clear day. Make sure you have dinner at the revolving restaurant. It's the world's highest. The food and service is very good and the views can't be beat. It will be an expensive night however.

Always enjoyed going to visit yes I agree prices are expensive. Would highly recommend the edgewalk especially on a sunny days as view is fabulous and better then being insidebut not if you don't have a head for heights

My dad and I came up from Texas for a rangers/jays game and had some time to spare before. We made the decision to go up in the CN Tower. It is a sight to behold! I'm not really afraid of heights so the skypod was a must! The 360 vote is awesome as well as the glass floor. If...
Very cool view and something you should definitely do, but it is just a tower. The Horizon's restaurant was mediocre, with a better drink than food menu.

If you are on a multi-day stay in Toronto, check the weather as soon as you arrive and pick out the clearest day for your visit to the Tower. Unless you have very low level clouds that might provide for some interesting photos from above the cloud line, you'll not get your moneys worth unless you a clear view. If...
Excellent fast service, Beautiful views . We visit every time we travel to Toronto. No Hassle to buy tickets. See you next year.

I went to CN Tower on a Subday night, around 6:00 Pm There was no line up and we went straight to the top. It was a great view as I have been numerous times. My net friend from China loved the view. We took many pictures and I explained the different buildings and sites of the city. She took...

Go early to enjoy the CN tower before bus loads of tourist arrives. Entrance fee is steep, but with City pass, you save quite alot. Lots of people doing lying down shot on the glass panels, so you might not want to be wearing skirts to this attraction.

We celebrated our anniversary with dinner at the top of the CN Tower. The menu is a bit on the pricey side but the food was good. It appeared that a party of 4 or more had a much higher chance of getting a table by the window than a party of 2. Maybe you can make special requests for...

With the CN Tower being the must-see attraction to visit in Toronto, you might deem it to be a touristy cliché. But it's an experience to ride the elevator up the tower, get the best views of the city (your choice of daytime or nighttime views), and reveal your fear - or non fear - of heights. The glass floor...

Can't argue with the views from the top, and the glass floor section, but this is not cheap. The 'extras' are decidedly tired and out of date and of questionable value.Still, really has to be done when visiting this fine city.
after paying $35+ to get in tower for a view, you can add $12 approx for a higher view which i feel is a bit too much. the view was just ok.

This landmark of Toronto is a must see for whoever visits the city. Located very near the Metro Toronto Convention Center (MTCC) where many conferences are held most of the time, it attracts visitors in large numbers. Entrance fee is a bit steep for visitors. However, visit is worth taking.

Expensive and ok. But it has been the pride of the Toronto skyline for so long. Between the sky dome aka Rogers Centre and CN Tower you know Toronto. The elevator ride is fun. You get a great view of all of Toronto. The glass floor is a little freaky but fun. I honestly enjoy it every time I go...

First the good: We lucked out by arriving late in the afternoon, so there was no wait to get an elevator. Staff was polite.Then the bad: Spent close to $100 for the 3 of us to enjoy a view. After 10 short minutes, we were bored. The glass floor was very disappointing as the glass squares are really small....

We eat at the Horizon restaurant in the CN Tower while celebrating our 6th anniversary. It was a great experience and had a beautiful view. Although the admission is a little pricey it is totally worthy. Good customer service at the Horizon restaurant and the CN Tower it self. Although it is a little crowded by the glass floor area...

Cool idea but not really worth it. The kids liked the glass floor but after 2 minutes didn't really notice - just sat and played. VERY expensive for a family on a budget - not worth $100 plus tax for a family of four. Save you money and go out to dinner.

I've been to CN tower once and its a must see for those visiting Toronto.My friends an d I had dinner on the 360 restaurante. Its was an unforgettable time. Beautiful view we were very lucky because was a clear day and the view was great on sunset time.I highly recommend it.

This was my second visit to the CN Tower. However, my first visit was about 20 years ago, so this was my first time as an adult. General admission was a little pricey. But we also paid extra to go up to the sky pod. I would recommend it.Kids loved the glass floor. I expected it to be a...

The CN tower is an iconic landmark and the views from the observatory deck are superb. However, at 99 Canadian dollars for a family ticket (2 adults, a 4 and a 6 year old) excluding taxes, they are very expensive. Too expensive in my opinion and I could not escape the feeling that they are simply milking this thing for...

If you're in Toronto, you must do the CN tower. As all the other reviews say, you get great views, get to experience a nerve-wracking glass floor and you get plenty of time to explore. But, it's expensive and a tourist trap. An adult ticket is $32 (plus tax) to the main observation deck, and an additional $12 (plus tax)...

I think I've been to CN tower at least 6-7 times over my lifetime. We've done most of the attractions like go to the top level deck, glass floor, and even eaten at the 360 restaurant. The only thing left is the Sky walk, which will probably have to wait for a bit. It's generally crowded, which is sort of...

I went with a girlfriend & my 5 year old son on a sunny day so the views were spectacular but the prices astronomical. It cost $99 for the 3 of us to do the basic elevator/climb look out. This was a must in Toronto on a clear day. It was great to see the entire city from such a high vantage point. The view from 447Mt height SkyPod cannot be described. it need to be experienced. You will get enough time to be at the viewing deck.

I forgot how nerve-wracking the glass floor can be, even if I have stood on it many times before. What can I say about the third tallest building in toronto. No matter where you are in central toronto this awsome structure dominates the skyline and it would be an awful waste not to experience it. This was my first visit to Toronto and I am glad I went to the CN Tower. It is an iconic image on the Toronto skyline and offers beautiful panoramic views, a glass floor area, and a restaurant. If you are on a budget, consider getting a family pass. It offers a good savings for multiple people.
The view is amazing at ALL levels! Walking along the edge was scary but worth while. The cafe has delicious food. Pictures are great and friendly staff.

As you would expect, it's a nice view of Toronto and surrounds, and there is quite a lot of viewing points so it doesn't ever feel that crowded.The glass floor is the busiest part, and not the most pleasant experience because of that. Albeit loud with families with kids. But that's OK - I have noise-reducing earbuds! I came in at the Billy Bishop airport. It was amazing to see that little strip of land from on high. I was nervous about my departure!

a lot of our friends went to owen sound to celebrate a birthday with a friend and we all went to Toronto.. we went for dinner at the tower and it was fantastic. the ride up is a glass elevator and you ride it to the top. we had dinner which was a bit pricey but the view was well...

I did the CN tower twice. Hard to describe how thrilling and cool the experience was. My family did this one without me.They really liked it & said the view was amazing..The glass floor was cool except for the wild group of school kids up top that were not sharing the space.The elevator ride was a little scary. Would recommend going during daylight, just for the pictures! However, the view's astounding even at night,

$33+tx (so like 38) to the main observation deck. Then they try to upcharge you $12+tx (so like 14) to go up 33 more floors to the skypod. So you're at like $52 per person. The views are good. I liked looking at the airport near downtown Toronto. Ticket prices are rather steep, however.
Arrived on a clear evening, the sky was just beautiful. It's absolutely a great experience to look at Toronto from the sky. Glass floor was really great.

The tower was five minutes walk from our hotel, the Radisson Harbour front, so we decided we had to pay a visit. It was fun and we were lucky it was a clear day. It's rather expensive - and the lines are long - but the views are terrific - so on balance it's well worth the effort.

My husband and I decided to do the edge walk. It was seriously cool. We had great views of the city and after getting that vantage point it was hard to appreciate the indoor view. the cn tower is a must see once but i must say i was quite disappointed in the see through glass floor. i thought it would have been much bigger! This attraction was nothing special to me.. Visited the CN Tower for lunch at the 360 Restaurant, taken to seat by the window, with spectacular views. Ordered 3 course lunch from the prix fixe menu. On a clear day you can see for miles all around Toronto and Toronto Island. The glass floor while crowded lets you see how high up you really are. But you are effectively paying $32 for a trip up a tower. Had chicken fingers in the restaurant which were really nice. Not brave enough to try the edge walk!
A little expensive and sometimes a little bit of a wait to get to the top but it's totally worth it for the view and the walk around the outside. I still can't stand on that glass floor though.

The C N Tower is a must visit if you are in Toronto. The lifts are on the outside of the building a bit scary at first glance but once you are on its great fun. If you go for a meal at nighttime the restaurant slowly revolves and you get to see the city from all Angeles. If you...
Nice place!Dont expect too much since it is similar to other places like Empire state bldg, Rockfeller. The best time to see is in the evening close to sunset! Good views of the lake.
When in Toronto this is something you just have to do. It's expensivish but the view of Toronto and the lake are spectacular and well worth it.

Visiting Toronto and not going to CN Tower is unimaginable. For most of the people CN Tower is what constitutes Toronto in its very essence. Easily visible from the whole city, makes great impression when you stand right under it - it's so high you can hardly imagine what it's look like up there. The views are absolutely breathtaking! Riding to the top of the CN Tower, you see the Rogers Centre shrink beneath your feet, then you look up and see the entire city of Toronto become a scale model of itself. See the Greatest view of the GTA, the CN tower is one of the tallest buildings in the world,, wonderful restraunt

Despite its age, we still enjoy bringing family and friends to the tower. It gives you a beautiful view of the city if the skies are clear. Getting pricey however and don't bother with the pod extra. Not worth it.

We visited the tower in the morning when it was just opening (9am) and it was not crowdy yet. The elevator takes you to 350m in about 30 seconds.The views on the lake Ontaria and the city are great and the glass floor is a nice bonus!

Overcame my fear of heights by stepping onto the glass floor. Paid extra to go to the very top- not worth it at all. Weather was gloomy so visibility was not so great for distance viewing. Apparently on a clear day you can see all the way to Niagara Falls.

This is great way to start your time in Toronto. The view is amazing and if you have a map at hand you will quickly place the benchmarks of the City. Add to the view a meal in the 360 Restaurant, and I think you'll find you're on to something.I confess that I did feel "herded" during the access...
I have been on this tower twice and the first time I went it bent my mind. The views are amazing and it is an experience which has been brilliant, truly specteculor!

If you really want to see Lake Ontario, Toronto and most of the areas for miles around, visit the CN tower. The best views are from the skypod, but you need an additional ticket to get there. Easy to get up having booked our tickets on-line before we travelled to Toronto. A full 360 degree view although we did not eat at the restaurant. Not very busy but that may have been because the weather did not start off that great.
i waited until it was a clear day, and i was rewarded - The view of Toronto is stunning.Too bad i did not stay for lunch, because this could be the experience in a life-time.

The CN Tower has very great view of City. We visited it night time and the view was excellent. The entire CITI in light looked very nice. The Glass Floor has very small area for viewing. We have all been to an observation tower.....this is the best, period. It is not the historic gem that the Empire State Building, or the John Hancock Tower is, but it is a view that is astounding. Can get very,very crowded on a weekend day when the skies are clear. Do not pass it by.

My advice would be to go up late afternoon and the view the city by day and then enjoy the sunset whole having drinks at the restaurant bar at the top of the tower. It was my first experience to visit CN tower and it was mind blowing. The experience to go right at the top of CN tower was awesome. I would really recommend people who visit Toronto to go and must do CN tower. The view is fantastic.
A classic site. Even if you're afraid of heights, there's more than just the view and the glass floor. There are museums, shops, and restaurants. A must-do as part of your travels.

We visited on a day when the visibility was not the best, the view of the city was good but the view was limited, felt like we paid too much to be taken on a crowded elevator to look out at the city. The glass floor is a small area of glass that you may stand on and look down...
The CN tower is clearly an iconic Toronto landmark, but we expected more than an expensive view after a long queue. If I only had 2 days in Toronto, this wouldn't be on the agenda.

Well, we went on a Saturday afternoon and the lines were soooooooooooooo long, I think over 100 people were waiting. Everyone was jammed together in a very uncomfortable snaking line. We did it, but if we ever did it again, we would come at a time when it is not so crowded.

Great views of the city and the ballpark underneath where the Bluejays play. Plenty of opportunities for additional options in addition to just going up to a sightseeing deck. You can even look through the floor STRAIGHT DOWN!
We visited on a weekday afternoon last September .. virtually no line! We did have to wait a little at the elevators, but not too long. Offers wonderful views of a great city. Don't miss it!

Wish I had done more research before driving to Toronto. The trip up is $34 but had I known that you could go up free of charge if you were eating in the restaurant...I might actually have seen the view from the top. Sad I missed this one but it was not a cost friendly trip for a family. Make...
We went in the evening so we saw the sunset and night view of toronto.Less line up in the evening. Ground level don't miss theatres which is showing about Ttc and CN tower.(document)

My suggestion would be to go to the tower's restaurant, have a meal, enjoy the views from your table, and then go upstairs to the observation deck and take it in. We quickly realized our mistake in not paying the premium to ascend to the upper observation deck which I believe was a hefty $50 fee. I found the ticket office staff very helpful as I did not know what to expect. I liked the views. What I didn't care for being shepherded through to have photo taken - although this seems to be the norm at a lot of attractions. The lift wouldn't start and the operator dealt with the problem efficiently and within a...

We went there in March. The Toronto weather was chilly. But what a view from the top. We could see small planes on the runway. Also the water looked amazing from the top of the tower.Dining at the 360 restaurant was an amazing experience.Definitely worth visiting if you are in Toronto.

Finger prints all over the windows but the glass floor was neat. For the best view, grab a meal at 360-windows are clean and you don't have to contend with the crowd fighting for window space. ( You get free access to the observation deck when you buy a meal)
There is no greater feeling than feeling like you're on top of the world.Love the gift shop, as well as the glass floor.
After visiting Burj Khalifa in Dubai / UAE , it's not the highest place to be in , but it is great to see all Toronto from above .

Bring your camera and go all the way to the top. Fantastic views. Only drawback is the price. They charge $34 plus an additional $12 to go from the main observation deck to the very top. I am glad I went.
We didn't go last year when we were in Toronto because it was hazy so the view would not be great, so we were happy to get better weather this year. Loved it! Awesome views, helpful staff.
When you visiting toronto it is a must - we visited the tower in the evening and saw a beautiful sunset

loved the CN tower and the views from there. Good value for money. We visited early morning and crowds not too bad (except for a noisy party of schoolkids) The views are phenomenal especially from the top floor.
the view is great from the top along with the glass floor.But there is not much to spend time there.

If you're like us and don't want to spend additional $12 to be a tad higher, you'd be a little disappointed like us to not be able to see the city from all angles of the Tower because half of the Lookout Level is restaurant. Loved this! The glass floor in the observation deck got rid of my fear of heights... for the moment. Just walk to the center of the glass floor before looking down was my strategy. The downside was the 1hr wait to get to the top but I think it was worth it.
Amazing and spectacular view, great attraction and lookout! You should visit the Cn tower used for telecommunication one of e most spectacular and tallest buildings in the world
the CN TOWER is the most wonderful tower in the world plenty of diferent entertainments there. You can see the CN TOWER from everywhere you are! Visitala porque vale la pena.

With nice weather, this is a good attraction, albeit pricey. Avoid the noontime crowds, as the observation area can get very crowded, and would be more fun when the deck is not too crowded.

There are touristic sites that you visit for the little chance of added value or for fear of missing a crucial experience of the city. This was awesome, riding up the outside of the tower on those elevators! The view is wonderful and the plexy plates in the floor you can see through are nice for the downward view. If it's your first visit to Toronto I would put this place on this list.

When I came to Toronto the one thing I wanted to do was go up on the CN Tower. I wanted to do the edge walk but my family didn't want to. I went up at night and personally I think it's the best time to go up!

The CN tower has a great view across the city of Toronto, 360 degrees around.
