The guest admission process was easy - I recommend that you consider what you intend to do at the tower as a meal at the CN 360 restaurant and the Edge walk activity both include admission to the viewing deck, which otherwise has a separate...

Although expensive to enter, the CN tower really does have a spectacular view. I'm very glad I visited but its not something for one who doesn't like heights... or appreciate great scenery enough to pay 40 dollars and queue.

This had to be one of the most torturous waits ever. The entire staff had no sense of urgency to move people along. To top it all, after waiting all this time, a number of people try to jip the line to get in front- and the staff was clueless to stop it. I can see how riots occur. Waiting...

We have been to the Empire State Building, Top of the Rock, Sears (Willis) tower, among others. May be because of that, this felt like nothing new. I probably will give the edge to Top of the rock, but the CN tower views are comparable.

My husband and I went for lunch here on Sunday. 55 dollars for a three course meal and the elevatorride!The view: WOW!!!!!! The relax atmosphere compared to the craziness going on at the platform and the glass floor, only that difference was so worth the money!It is so cool that u turn around while eating. You get a...

Very impressed by the tower, looks beautiful by night, sadly I did not bring any lens to take a photo by night.A must to visit at least by outside, is quite expensive to go up, but I love the view, $41.00 CAD per adult

Fantastic views although the weather was misty at the start but cleared an hour or so later.The service came with a smile/joke and much friendliness and although it appears expensive, I think you get what you pay for.Our friends guided us to dine there rather than just pay the entrance fee as there was only a 15$ difference...

This is a stunning attraction next to the new aquarium. It was a bit confusing to find the wheelchair accessible route in but once we had done that the visit went smoothly. The views are well worth the entry price. The bar staff were happy for us to just go for a drink so we were able to sit at...
Fabulous view. Food was fine, service fine too. Put my bag on the floor and realised it needed a good hoover - I think this affected my view. A busy place, popular with tourists. Worth a visit.

Sorry, but this is a tall tower, but there's not much to see from up there. The glass floor is not scary. Also this costs quite a bit, about $49, and I don't think it's worth it.I guess if you took the walk on the outside it would be worth visiting, otherwise I'd say give this a miss
The view from the CN-Tower offers a spectacular view of Downtown Toronto. The tower is 553 metres tall, and according to the staff, you'll be able to see as far as Niagara on a clear day.

It's a must do trip when in Toronto. Great views from the top and the sky deck.What a high and spectacular view above all the buildings below! Be careful because the Cn Tower is 553 metres tall! Just amazing! A worthwhile visit on a clear day.You can try the edge walk or the higher floor for a wider view...

CN Tower it was amazing experience, I think is expensive due to the amount of people that wait for go up but great and the staff in general interact nicely towards the visitors.The café bar, simply delicious, I ate the vegetarian sandwich WOW the best one I ate, internet service Wi-Fi excellent but restricted since the fee is almost...
Great spot to overview the city and lake and have a romantic dinner. Very tasty and excellent service.

We picked the most perfect day to go up the CN Tower. Clear, sunny sky and 75 degrees. The line moved quickly on a Friday morning so we had a very little wait. Quick ride up on the elevator which has glass section to see out as you go up. Just did the main tower for viewing which was fine...

You go here for the view of the city and the lake. You can try the edge walk or the higher floor for a wider view for an additional fee of $12. The elevator has a glass floor. There's also a glass floor where you can take selfie of yourself just like what others were doing.Buy Toronto pass here...

We live in the UK and recently travelled to Toronto Canada. A popular attraction there is the CN tower and part of this is the 360 restaurant. The CN tower gives views of Toronto every side. A worthwhile visit on a clear day. I write to caution future visitors of the extortionate tipping behaviour of the waiter in the 360...

It's a must do trip when in Toronto. Great views from the top and the sky deck. Queues were good today. The cinema was bizarre as was about the Toronto tram ?! The only down side was the cost at $44 plus tax a person with adult prices kicking in from 13 years.

We came for a meal at the CN Tower on the first night of our honeymoon and it has to be said that it was absolutely incredible. Our waiter was extremely attentive and polite and the food such high quality that we've raved about it to all of our friends since we got home (I can particularly recommend the maple...

Very expensive, poor signposting, long, long queues. We went all the way to the top, and were sorry we bothered to go in at all - yes, there is a view, but it wasn't worth the price, and as others have said you really can't take good pictures. We were only in Toronto 24 hours - I'm sorry we wasted...
It was great to be on top of cn tower. I went all the way up to observation deck it was amazing view . I can't tell you the experience mind blowing must visit
It is impressive. Before getting up, give it a look from the very ground... Pay the extra fee for the highest floor and go. It is an engineering piece of art!!!

If you are in TO you have to go to the CN Tower if nothing more than to say that you did, but the view is worth it. I was there on a clear day and you can see forever, it gives you a different perspective, not only of how high you are up, but how big the City of...

column3: Oak Island, North Carolina, United States
column4: Loved the glass floor and had to take a minute before stepping onto it. Also loved the view down the elevator shaft while going up and down to the top.
Went to the cn tower and it was breath taken I love it first time to Toronto and sight seeing is a must ...
We booked a meal on-line back in the UK an looked forward to it as our first night in Canada - fantastic - I cannot say more!

It is a nice view from the top but very disappointing as there is not much to do once you get up top. A must see for sure if you haven't been to the top. The last time I was up there was 20 years ago. I I think it is quite expensive.

Hate heights but my son persuaded me to go up here and I am glad that I did, fantastic views. The queue to get in looked horrendous, but moved very quickly. Didn't like the glass floor in one area but other people seemed to enjoy standing on it. Well worth a visit

I hate heights but I love CN Tower -it is so spectacular - it is a must to go all the way up to 447 meters above the street - gives you a magnificent view over the great city of Toronto with its marvellous buildings and city layout.

The best part of the CN Tower was seeing it from a distance as we drove there. The place was reminiscent of Disney World where everything is highly commercialized and the cost to ride the elevator up is insane. I'm not sure why I was surprised (call me naive) but I couldn't believe. Naturally, most people think, "Well, I'm here...

I'm incredibly scared of heights and when you watch the elevators go up and down it can intimidating. I went up years ago when I was much younger and found it terrifying and it ruined the experience. I recently came back on vacation to Toronto and decided to give it another go and it was awesome. Being there with my...
they have an amazing view at the top its crazy, i love the part when you can walk on a transparent glass, its very nice

First thing we did in Toronto was go up the CN Tower. Definitely worth it, especially as this will be our only time there. The glass floor view was awesome. Weather was perfect and we could see for miles. Couldn't see Niagara Falls though. I did not think it was worth it to go up to the SkyPod as there...

Loved the view, food was good but expensive and I felt that the hours of operation aren't very good for one of toronto a greatest attractions....we had to rush to eat our food because we were told they were closing...

The CN Tower is one of those “must do” items if you are in Toronto, so we did it on our recent trip to Canada. It’s pricey at $32 ($28.80 online); we had purchased the Toronto City Pass, so it was included in that. At our B&B in Toronto, they told us the better deal is to make reservations at...

We enjoyed the CN Tower for a few hours one afternoon. Unfortunately, we should have planned better and went around better weather, but it was still a great time! It was a cloudy day so we had to see around this, but this was mainly in the restaurant 360, that we enjoyed for lunch. There is a prixe fixe menu...

You have to go up the CN Tower if you are visiting Toronto. You MUST pay the extra fee to go up to the SkyPod. The views & pictures are amazing from SkyPod. The lookout has fencing all around, so your views and pictures won't do it justice. Gotta go up to the Skypod...Enjoy.

A little misty on the morning we went up but still very enjoyable. The "Sky Pod" is 174 floors high with great views. I particularly liked the glass floor!Some interesting fact boards are positioned round the walls.

One of Canada's must see!!! Like any other tourist attraction they capitilize on the tower in every way. The gift shop is well stocked. However, the majority of the items can be bought outside on the streets for less. The crystal picture at the gift shop is a must however and is a wonderful momento of the CN tower. The...

Whenever we are abroad we visit the tallest building in the city to get a bird's eye view of the place. The CN tower has an extra possibility, to stand on tempered glass and look straight down below you - not for the faint-hearted! If you are very adventurous then go for the edge-walk. For people like me whose sense...

Get the city pass for discounts on the attractions. We had just visited Chicago and the Willis/Sears Tower and the experience is comparable except it is tough to get photos because you have to lay down on the glass bottom and the base of the CN tower obstructs some of your views, especially of Rogers Center. There is no point...

This was recommended to do thing so we tried it. I'd say it was worth it if you go all the way up to the top. The first stop with the views from the windows is a bit rubbish in my opinion, especially if you want to take photos. Going all the way up to the top was nice as...
Fantastic views across Toronto, go the the sky pod for another 33 floors above the already high glass floor level at 147 floor

Great views, but a bit pricey. Still, I would recommend it in a heartbeat. Dare yourself to stand on the glass bottom floor! It was extremely crowded the day we were there, with long lines for the elevator to go up to the viewing area, so bring water and comfy shoes. We didn't eat at the restaurants but did pick...

The day we went was pretty cloudy which made it difficult to see far away but was still pretty cool. Being afraid of heights all the kids jumping on the glass floor when you're trying to even put a toe on it did not help

Visited here in April. Fantastic views at night from the very top, worth the extra £ to go up. Not all the attractions were open due to the time of year and as we were going up at night, we missed the IMAX experience. Expensive but interesting .

What an awesome experience! We live in St. Louis and have the Gateway Arch, 635 feet high. The CN Tower is almost twice that height. Wow! The glass floor was difficult for me and I was very gently coaxed out onto it by the hand of a guide who explained that the glass floor was five times stronger than the...

Pretty standard experience, for those who have been in tall towers like the Eiffel, etc., but this one offers some windowed views straight down (unnerving to be sure) and spectacular vistas over the city and the adjacent lake.
The best part is summoning up the courage to walk across the glass floor...and watching others attempt it nervously, is great entertainment!

real easy access and fun attractions at the bottom. the 58 second ride up was informative by the elevator operator. The View was spectacular and gave us a great perspective of the layout of the the city and all surrounding area
Great restaurant with a great view staff very friendly and knowledgeable about the 360 view and the. Light changes o and take the lift there is over 2000 stairs
An excellent refuge from the post Christmas snow in Toronto. It was not particularly crowded given the aquarium next door.
Had a nice but expensive meal in the restaurant. Drinks are ridiculously priced. Service was excellent.The cost of the meal does also get you up to observation deck as well.
good meal, not great, but the view is worth everything. the rest of the tower is ok, but again, the view from the top at the restaurant is worth the price of the overpaid meal.

Can't beat the view--on a clear day it is Spectacular with a capital "S." But it's also costly. A general admission ticket now runs over CAD$30/person. Then it's an extra $12/person to go up to the Sky Pod. The latter is worth doing once, so you can brag that you were up as high as you could go, but the...

Never visited it when I lived in Toronto --didn't realise what I was missing! Visited it years later as a tourist when I took my kids around Toronto. Fantastic! Even see the planes flying beneath you. Don't miss it.

During our recent visit to Toronto we decided to visit the CN Tower. When you arrive at the ticket office you have the choice to purchase tickets at two different levels. We decided to go up to the highest level possible. For two people it cost $100 to visit the Tower. It was very expensive and definitely not worth the...

It has been a while but it is well worth the time, the view is spectacular. My last visit was years ago when my kids were young, this stupid review will not let me select a date over 1 yrs ago, so I am selecting the oldest date available.
The restaurant at the top had fine food. The day was sunny and the company was pleasant. It gave me an interesting perspective of the city.
The views from the top were breathtaking, even during their late winter/early spring season. Our tour elevator guide was informative and friendly.

Our dinner was great, the service excellent and the views spectacular. We spent 2 hours and the restaurant went twice round as we picked out famous buildings of Toronto and watched boats come and go on Lake Ontario.

The view from the rotating restaurant is phenomenal on a clear day! Love the food alongside the view. Wish time could stop right here!Must do! Finish off the meal with the rest of the tower to appreciate the view

I have been up the CN Tower when I was younger and remember loving the view. We did not go up this time, because my spouse is afraid of heights.Just being around the CN Tower is quite lovely and there are plenty of activities. It is truly THE Toronto landmark and is lovely to behold from most parts of...

it has been a while that we have been to the CN Tower but it was nice and the restaurant there was good...you have a good view if it is not cloudy,which is hard to pick a day for that .overall we enjoy our day in Toronto

Went last night, and can honestly say the best experience ever! We had booked dinner for 8pm, which gives you direct access to the Tower, with no extra charges. Photo taken which was brought to the table in display folder, a very reasonable $25. The meal was delicious. We choose the set $75 and it was worth every penny. It...

wow fantastic 380 degree views as you walk around the first elevation, the second is even higher! Sent a postcard from within the tower gift shop and it got home to the UK before us (almost 4,000 miles) and that doesn't happen when we holiday in the UK about 200 miles away!! Lay on the glass floor to have your...

While the CN tower had a great view of the Toronto islands,admission is overly priced for spending about 30 minutes at this attraction. Not much more to do than snap a few pictures of the view or at the glass bottom viewing level. The tower itself is beautiful at night and better appreciated from a distance.

Well worth the visit. Glass floor still a bit scary and there seemed to be school trips and kids jumping up and down everywhere! But you cannot beat theview or the experience of bring in the most iconic building of the city skyline. We didn't bother with the 360 restaurant as you had to book in advance and if was...

Visited the CN Tower with my two daughters. Had three course lunch with access to the glass floor and observation tower. It was great, no queues. Fantastic views of Toronto. The floor rotates to enable you to see every part of the City. It cost $55 each.
I don't like height and I did it. If you visit Toronto this is a must and to be honest well worth it. I would suggest lunch at top which avoids the queue

We had lunch in the restaurant which was well worth the extra price over the basic price of going to the viewing platform. A great choice of a very good three course menu with good wines whist rotating around at 115 floors high and getting a full view of the whole of Toronto.

When you are in downtown Toronto, you can navigate by this building. It is not cheap to visit (compared with the Shard though, I guess it is reasonable) but worth it. The lift zooms you to the top where the brave can stand on the glass floor and look down. Fantastic views. A must !

Spectacular views of Toronto, the waterfront & surrounding areas. We went up later on in the day to get the sunset views & the queues were not too long & there was not masses of people. The glass floor was great looking straight down but the views & vistas at sunset were stunning.

We went to the tower and had lunch in the 360 Restaurant, ($55 per person, which includes your admission to observation deck.) We went to buy tickets at 12:30, the lady told us "I'm sorry but they are already sold out for lunch." We were just going to go get tickets for only the observation deck when she said to...

I liked everything but the price. I was traveling solo and bought the general admission and Skypod package, which cost about $50.00 (CAD). The views were great the day I visited, I could see for miles/kilometers.The CN Tower is right next to the Rogers Centre where the Toronto Blue Jays play and Ripley's Aquarium of Canada. It's also just...

We were there in 2013.It took us probably 2 hours to get into the elevator and then up there we were bored pretty quick.Sure, there is a restaurant up there, but we were not hungry.Besides seeing Toronto from "the sky" nothing else was worth the 70 dollars/ person that we paid.

I would recommend a trip up the tower to all visitors to Toronto. The trip up and down in the elevator is amazing. The views from the top are spectacular as is the glass floor. You will get a great all round view of Toronto with amazing shots through the glass floor. The price of your photograph taken on entry...

You know, it's just one of those attractions that's impossible to resist -- and it delivers: a 360-degree (or close to it) view of Toronto from a very high place. Didn't try the restaurant. Expect a line, especially for the downward trip, and time restroom visits with that in mind.

The queue to get tickets although long was fast moving. The rapid rise to the top was not as bad as I had feared but the view was well worth it. I was even brave enough to walk on the glass floor, well, a wee bit of it anyway!

Went with my 2 girls, 9 & 12 and they loved it!The glass floor is just cool as it was back when they openned it 15 or so years ago... They also have the edge walk, wow, very expensive, but, maybe next time...The view is breathtaking from all angles, the restaurants look nice.Still an expensive outing. 99$...

I go to Toronto two or three times a year and every time the first thing I want to find is the CN Tower. There is just something that draws you. I can't stop looking at it. Our teenage son loves it so much from the first time he saw and visited it three years ago, that this time that...

I'm terrified of heights but this had to be a must do! Having bought and paid for coupon saving scenic sites all around Toronto, it was a no brainer. This was my very first time up the CN tower, I couldn't back off now! I even had to turn my head away going up as the scenic view as it...
A gastronomic experience coupled with superb views = not to be missed. A speedy elevator ride to the top and a glass floor to take your breath away.Signage was confusing but a minor irritation.
The View alone makes it worthwhile, the elevator down feels almost like its in free fall.Wasn't particularly impressed with the restaurant - but the view and subtle sway make it enjoyable.

If in Paris the first time, the Eiffel Tower is a must; in in NYC, either the Statue of Liberty or the Empire State; if in Toronto, the CN Tower. Some innovations since 1998 (my first visit to Toronto), which have enhanced the experience. Have visited in Nov (on windy days the Skypod is off limits) and in the summer...

Visiting the CN Tower gives you a good 360-degree of Toronto and its surrounds, but nothing much more than that.I paid for the extra trip up to the Sky Pod, but it was nothing fantastic. Just more of the same views, but this time blocked by grills. I don't think one would miss anything if you didn't go up...

Go up in the tower after you've been in Toronto for a few days so you have an idea of what you are looking at. Also, if you are up for one expensive but special meal, eat in the rotating restaurant up at the top. The views are spectacular. Make a reservation an hour before the sun sets so you...

I was told that if there's one place I should visit when I'm in Toronto, it should be the CN Tower. General Admission is around CAD 30.00 but if you wish to go to the sky pod which is basically the highest point you can go in the tower, you'll have to pay an extra CAD 12.00. I would recommend...
You have to do this, I'm not fond of heights, but it is so worth doing. The views of the city are brilliant.

If attending, then spend a bit more for the SkyPod, another 33% higher.Very good, probably best to attend other than weekends. My second trip, and we went up on a weekday afternoon.Knowing the landmarks is much more satisfying than staring aimlessly at a cluster of structures, parks, and roads that you cannot connect to.
A great adventure. The glass floor is amazing! We had dinner in the horizons restaurant. The food was gorgeous. The service was excellent from Laura.

Definitely do not miss going up the CN Tower if in Toronto. It was amazing. The views are brilliant. There is no time limit on the visit so just enjoy it for as long as possible.It is always a privilege to experience and visit man's achievements and the CN Tower is no exception.

I got a free pass to go up the tower and even though I didn't have pay I still think it is overpriced and a waste of time and money. The line-ups to get up the tower, up to the Sky Pod, and to get back down again were all very long, even though it was fairly early on a...
I love the view from the CN Tower! This is great place - must see. I recommend you Toronto attraction coupons, you save 15% off on general admission.

Here's the way to do it, you are ready to splurge. Go eat at the 360 Restaurant. It's pricey, but the food was good and the view was amazing. I know some people may be bored of seeing a beautiful panoramic view, but I am not one of them1 Once you are done with dinner, you get free access to...

Do bother spending the $35 if you have been to any other tower or tall building in the world. The glass bottom elevators are a joke, especially since they crowd so many people in that somebody will be standing on your view. The view from the top is cool, but no better than the one from the airplane window.Skip...

We picked a beautiful morning to go up on top and loved it! Very neat structure and amazing views from Observation place.Definitely go earlier in the morning to beat the crowds and bring a camera! Highest Free Standing structure in Western Hemisphere.

The views from the second tower are breathtaking however it is small and cramped and the price is crazy! For three of us the cost was almost 150.00 bucks. There really isn't anything to do other look. I think they should charge a lot less. The trinket shop on the bottom is ok. It's your normal touristy shop.

Visited the CN Tower on a recent trip and loved it! Great picture taking and getting a lay of the land. We did both heights; normal plus the extra high bubble. The bubble was a considerable distance higher and well worth the extra charge. The views were tremendous, could see the buildings at Niagara Falls. Would have loved to do...

The views from the tallest structure in North America are truly amazing! Starting with the elevator ride up to main viewing area, the breath taking vistas of the city of Toronto and Lake Ontario are well worth the price of admission. My wife and I recently moved to the city and the perspective that you get of this beautiful city...
If you have the time you must make a reservation to have lunch at the tower.Great views of Toronto. Staff is very nice and the food was delicious.

The CN tower is on almost every single Toronto postcard and we love showing it off. Last year, I decided to pay another visit to this wonderful attraction. Everything was still very well maintained and the interactive portions like the glass floor were very educational and fun as well!

On a clear day the view is very good. You will have to wait in line to get a ticket which is a little pricy. Could not get reservation for the restaurant which was booked for the whole day :-( If you want to use the restaurant book some days in advance.

The CN Tower is Toronto's most famous landmark but the view from the top is disappointing. The observation level is not impressively high up (only about 2/3rd the way up) but worse only half the indoor observation deck is only open and the view from the outdoor observation deck is obstructed by thick chain mesh, so you won't get the...

I'm not a great fan of observatories so I was pleasantly surprised to find myself having fun at CN Tower.I bought tickets to go all the way up to the skypod. The elevator up was an experience as it had glass panels on the floor, allowing passengers to see the lift rising. My boys claim the ride was just...

If really tall buildings are your thing, then go for it - but otherwise, I really just find this place overpriced. If you do want to go, the best thing is to make a reservation at the revolving restaurant. That way you get a free ride up the elevator and you can enjoy a meal while taking in the city.

Anyone who visits Toronto HAS to visit the CN tower. It's like HAVING to visit Niagara Falls if you go to Canada. Granted, it is a little pricey ( around $100.00 for a couple but we did pay $24.00 extra (part of the 100 to go up higher 30 more stories) but there is no time limit on how long...

We booked in for lunch before our afternoon flight. The waiter promised to ensure we were out on time and he did a great job. We had opted for the view from the revolving restaurant, rather than the viewing deck and were glad we did. Its $55 for a three course meal plus wine extra. The food choices were extensive...

Unless you hang out with a local, i find toronto to be a bouring place for a tourist. so you will have to visit this atrraction to pass time by. once you get up there you will see a nice view but its not breath taking. just ok. it didnt add any special value to my trip

I visited here for lunch in the restaurant (separate review if I can find it!). The tower is a great experience and the views across Toronto are just magic. It's very busy though, so don't go if you dislike crowds.I can't comment on the entrance fee, as this is rolled into the price of lunch.
What a wonderful experience! Place was very clean, even if there was lot of people the employees manage to give a personal experience. Restaurant was ok. I would definitely go again!

Had waited years it visit this place, and was not disappointed. There were no queues to get our tickets, and we were soon in. The lift took just 58 seconds to go up, and although I do not like heights, did not find it unpleasant .it is a glass elevator, so you can see all the way down, and part...

This is simply a must do when you are in Toronto. We purchased the extra ticket to go right up to the skypod. The views are fantastic from there. We stood on the glass floor for photos. Really enjoyed being scared witless. Be aware that it is pricey. 2 tickets came to 100 CD.
360 restaurant had mediocre food, but was in motion changing your view slowly. Going to restaurant gets you to the top without paying general admission.

I have lived pretty close to the CN tower, but it took someone putting me on the train and telling me we were going in order to actually get me there. The train (or subway) by the way is a perfect way to travel as you do not have to walk far from Union station (and the walk is pretty...
The spinning restaurant is super. Try the skywalk if you dare it is great fun. A great family day out just not small children less you get someone to watch them if doing the walk
The view is gorgeous of the whole city and out over the lake. Shows how green Toronto really is. The restaurant 360 has delicious food and the view changes constantly as it revolves
The CN Tower is definitely worth a visit.You have a great view of the city and standing on the glass bottom is just breathtaking
Nice experience. Views spectacular although it was really creepy when the clouds rolled in very quickly.

Our 12.30pm edge walk tour was postponed until 5pm due to a lightening storm but there was so much to do in the CN tower that the time passed very quickly. We had lunch in the restaraunt, visited the gift shop, simulator ride, glass floor, film show andviewing decks. Perfect day, ( apart from the storm .)
This was our second time to CN tower and we chose to go early. We had much better experience going early. We avoided long lines and spent a lot of time taking pictures on the glass.

It is a great view of the city and very cool. The downside is that it is basically a 50 dollar elevator ride with a 3D movie and some other random things that are available before you go up. I would like to go back again some day with reservations for the rotating restaurant.

We had read many reviews about the CN Tower and some people were moaning about the size of the portions in the restaurant. The food was excellent and so well presented and the waiter was charming. This was certainly something that I can tick off of our bucket list. Well worth doing a real experience. Do not miss this experience...
Not a very inviting looking tower...in fact we only saw it from outside as it did not look at all inviting...We may have missed a great view. Too bad, no regrets

If you are visiting the CN Tower, pay the extra and go all the way to the SkyPod. The view from there is almost frightening. You will feel the height of the tower from up there. The glass floor is fun to stand over and the elevator ride is another part of the experience.

The CN Tower is a modern wonder, and it's "the thing to do" in Toronto. We bought Sky Pod tickets, which took us 1465 ft. high. It was a Saturday afternoon, and the lines weren't long at all. The cost for two people was $91.56 USD. I would recommend buying your tickets online, because you can get a much better...

Expensive but worth it. Pay the extra for super high deck view too. Guaranteed (by me) value for money.Go during the day if you want portrait photos with the view else the wire mesh will reflect too strong with the flash.Great view - best at day but after view from the streets at night to see the tower...

Our one free day in Toronto started out rainy, so our plans to have lunch at the 360 restaurant in the Tower seemed pointless. Clouds were obscuring the tops of the buildings in the city, and we couldn't even see the Tower, even when we were just a few blocks away. Had lunch in Chinatown instead, but by the time...

If you've ever lived in or visited Toronto, you have to visit the CN Tower. Once the tallest building in the world, it's got an amazing view! On a clear day you can see some amazing things. The lookout areas, the glass floors and the lightning fast elevators are amazing. The Skypod isn't worth the extra $12 as it's simply...
Great view in all directions and some cool features going on. The glass floor in facinating and a bit spooky to stand on :)

I think that to get the most out of the CN tower, the real deal is going to the 360 restaurant.For a fixed price of 55 (compared to the tower-only ticket of 32), you sit down for 70 minutes while the restaurant makes a complete 360 and also get some food :).The fixed price is not mandatory, but...

Had to be done; everybody visiting Toronto goes up the tower. I don't like heights. Nevertheless, partner dragged me up there and it was terrific.No, I didn't stand on the glass floor but I did have a peek, nervously, from the edge. What worked for me was the 360º restaurant, with its great food and great service, that goes...

The view is great, to be sure. However there really is nothing to make you spend any time there. It is a very quick visit. The glass floor is kind of neat but was crowded. I would bet that the whole visit took less than half an hour.I did notice from looking out of the glass floor two other...
Best panoramic view of beautiful Toronto. Been going every year to Toronto since 1972..Hour & half flight or 8 hour drive from Chicago to a foreign Country!

Pricey, but great views of the city below. Glass floors are exciting and scary at the same time. Can get very crowded with a lot of tourists who don't respect personal space. They say you can sometimes see across the lake to Niagara Falls, but we could only see faint land in the distance. Definitely a must-do while visiting in...

Great time, thought it would be just another high rise experience like Empire State Building or one of the other tall structures (coit tower in San Fran, Tower of Americas in San Antonio, etc) but this was surprisingly and pleasantly so much more. Funny what that extra 500ft can do.TIP for enjoying the experience:OBSERVATION DECK - Start out...
the weather was not perfect but the view from there is just amazing!!! it is worth the time and money

The CN tower provides such a gorgeous views of the city of Toronto and Lake Ontario. We planned our visit right before dusk so we could have daylight and nighttime views. Certainly not for anyone afraid of heights. We ate at the 360 restaurant which means we did not have to pay to go up the tower. Food was excellent...

Interesting to be so high above the ground. The day I visited was pretty cloudy so you were above the clouds once up there. Even if the weather was not perfect for a visit, there were lots of tourists and apparently school students on class trips, so I wonder how long you have to queue during school holidays. People were...

If you been in any tower before then this will feel the same. You get a good view of toronto. The highlight is the glass floor which is on the observaion deck will blow you wind. There is also a glass floor in the elevator that allows you to see down the shaft. Otherwise there is a movie and the...

Excellent views lovely meal great surroundings good service the restaurant revolves very slowly giving you varied views over the Toronto skyline great at dusk just waiting for the sunset worth waiting for.
I enjoyed the CN tower , standing on the glass floor was scary but awesome, the views of Toronto was amazing. The gift shop a bit of a disappointment. Overall I had a great time
We enjoyed this, great views from the main level. We bought the extra SkyPod ticket, which I not sure is worth the extra $12 per person. My son loved it.

Every big city these days seems to have some tall building to climb up into and take in the view, and Toronto is no exception. Being one of the top touristy things to do, we visited the CN tower.The experience overall is overrated. We had a clear day, and enjoyed the view, but Toronto does not have a particularly...

Kids loved it, glass floors was awesome. One of those things you can cross off the list and not have to go again. kids under 4 are free otherwise it can get costly real fast. long lines that love quickly. Try and avoid weekends.

Actually, u need to spend a lot of money and a lot of time to get up to the tower. if u have gone to NSeoul Tower or Shanghai Dongfang Tower, u dont need to get up here. but if u really wanna see the beautiful scene, u'd better go at night!

No matter what time of the day you enter this place, as well as no matter is it winter or summer, this place takes your breath away every time. I love to visit every time I am in Toronto, at least to have cup of coffee while being on "top of the world". Really fun place ,well organised and perfect...
you apy to go up to one section but if you want to go highher u pay more really a waste of money you can see the same sights form top floor of hotel !!

The basic entrance fee is listed as $32 but after paying your tax it came to $36.16. Understandably security is very strict. Firstly you have to stand in a booth, a bit like an airport scanner but enclosed and then air is blown at you to check for particles on your skin - a new one to me. Next a...

Overpriced, overrated. Ridiculous outside area: nice if you like taking pictures of a fence! If you are coming here and have not made reservations to eat on the 360 restaurant (which BTW has terrible food) you will be disappointed with the view. There is a big metallic fence outside which prevents you from taking nice pictures. The best view is...
Very organized and there was minimal wait time to get up the tower. Fantastic views of the city and Lake Ontario. Every visitor needs to do this at least once.

This is one of the 'Must' Attractions of Toronto and is definitely worth a visit. It gives you amazing views of the city and the restaurant 360 is also amazing. If you are visiting Toronto, this should be on Top on the List of 'Places to Visit'.

We went on a very windy, clear day. So we had a great view but had to hold onto our hats. Be sure to watch the planes taking off from the small airport on an island. It was interesting seeing the people tryout the glass floor that gave a view to the ground. We didn't go as high as we...

The cost to enter is high but when you up to the point more high, really you forgot the price. The experience to see the view of Toronto city was spectacular. Since this high you can see the Niagaras fall.Really wonderfull.

Amazing views of the city. We went up on a relatively clear day and could see for miles and miles. We went a second time to eat at the restaurant. Food was lovely and the views of the city by night were well worth it.
So glad we chose to go. We went up just before sunset and watched the lights come on across Toronto.

CN Tower is one of those things you should go and see and do if you go to Toronto. Bit touristy, and I thought a bit pricey but still fun. And do walk out onto the glass floor and look down. Yes it's scary, and it took me several tries and several minutes to get the courage to do it...
Went her for dinner on business and the experience an view was great. I would recommend this for the views alone.Next time I will be taking my wife to enjoy the experience even more.

As one of the tallest buildings in the world, the CN Tower is really a must see. The 360 restaurant is quite cool, giving you a view of well...360 degrees.We ate here in the day, however I'm sure it is beautiful at night, as well, it was cloudy, therefore I'm sure it's that much more amazing on a clear...

This was great. Price was OK (about $35/pp) and makes for a great photo album. Wanted to try the Edge Walk but decided not to spend the $175/pp for us to experience it. Maybe next time. Heard great things about the restaurant at the top, didn't get a chance to try it though. Highly recommend the CN Tower!
If you want to see an Arial view of Toronto without going up in a helicopter, this is the place. Spectacular views in all directions. The glass floor was a little unsettling, but a lot of fun.

A good way to beat crowds and get a better bang for your buck is to spend the $55pp for lunch at the revolving rooftop restaurant. The food is only adequate (kind of like on a cruise ship) but you can tour the facility and don't have to wait in long lines.

What can I say! This is an iconic landmark in Toronto which can't be missed, however don't expect it to be cheap.Also if you want the full 370 make sure you oh to the sky pod or outside on the glass floor level. The main level is half taken up by restaurant.

We decided that we had to try this attraction despite my occasional trepidation over looking down from high structures. However I never felt uneasy even when my wife insisted we go up to the highest point and it was a fantastic experience. The views all round were excellent . The queues for the lifts were well managed and the wait...
A well organised attraction with breathtaking views and lift ride. We'll worth going to the very top.

this tower well worths the visit. the ticket is around 25 USD . it has a very nice view of city. there is a souvenier shop at the basement wich has a photo booth. if you have time, you can enjoy the Train museum and steam beer factory nearby.
If you are visiting Toronto, you must do this trip, amazing views and interesting facts. The elevator trip up is good fun.

It is really tall but the high speed lift does not allow the feeling sink in. It is too quick to realise that you have reached the observation deck. At least it is not blind, it is possible to see a part of the city as you raise. I had seen the Moscow TV tower at 340m but CN Tower...

Well organised but the wait can be an issue if you have not prebooked.. Also gave up on the line to go to the top level even though I had paid the extra. It would have been good if you had had some idea of the wait time as I stood in line for 30 mins before realising the elevator...

We only visited the 360 restaurant and decided to go when we knew we would get a daylight and night view during our meal. We went end of May at about 8pm and the view was amazing as the tables moved through 360 degrees in 72 minutes. A unique experience. Oh the food was good too.

Fantastic far-reaching views over Toronto. A simulator ride & short 3D documentary are included in the ticket price which, although have nothing to do with the CN tower or Toronto, are entertaining nonetheless. The elevator ride up the tower is a fun experience, as sections of the elevator walls & floor are made of clear glass, so you can see...
Great views from one of the highest viewing platforms in the world. Pretty good value too, but get there before 10.30 otherwise the wait to go up could be a long one.

Had dinner in the restaurant before hitting the skypod. The glass floor is always good to freak people out. It's really along way down.On a clear day the view is great, at night the best snapshot of the city is from the tower.Tip don't set anything down in the revolving restaurant it will move around and you will...
The view was very nice and the glass floor there is something you must walk on. The glass elevators also give you a nice view and there are also a few more different things you can do there.

I'm staying in Mississauga and couldn't skip on seeing the iconic CN Tower while in the Toronto area. I'm very glad I did. The views were phenomenal from inside the tower. The glass floor was a neat touch, although it was packed with people trying to get pictures looking like they are falling, or hovering over the ground 1,000+ft below....

From the top on a nice clear day there's a great view of Toronto or the Lake and the surrounding area. The lift operator is informative and friendly, bu it's much cheaper to take the stairs if you're able. I enjoyed jumping on the glass floor and scaring everyone around me. A must for any tourists or local!

Considering that the cost of the meal included the ascent to the revolving restaurant level of the CN Tower and the chance to do all the general `tourist` things available as well then it was one of the best value meals I have had. The food was delicious, the staff friendly and the view spectacular. I wouldn`t hesitate to recommend...

Though i have been there twice i did not give me feeling of 'wow'. good point is you have clear view of Toronto skyline from top and they say if you go early morning on clear sky day, you can see mist of Niagara falls from top deck.I thing you should plan your visit such that you can observe...

CN tower is pretty much seen from every part of Toronto. It is grandiose building with an amazing view of the city. Toronto has many beautiful places you need to see and this is one of them. I wouldn't call it beautiful from the outside - it is concrete tower but view it has is simply wonderful. It is definitely...
Greedy people. CAD 26 plus parking etc just for the view. Not worth the money. Better skip this tower and spend the money on something else. The CN tower is not worth the money.

Was there on a Sunday recently and figured since I hadn't been there since I was in grade school, it would be worth it. Practically started coughing when I saw the price. Went ahead and did it anyways.It's really quite beautiful to have such a view of Toronto, spent a lot of time staring at buildings. But that's pretty...

Technically, I did not take the tower tour but I did visit the observation deck after having had dinner at the 360 Restaurant. The observation deck was a lot of fun at night! We could feel we were very high up in the air, it was cold and really windy, and the multi-colored lights made it a surreal experience. The...

I grew up and live in Toronto. Downtown Toronto. And I am publicly admitting that the first time I ever went set foot in the CN tower was when my uncle visited from Japan in 2009 (not 2013. TA only has dates as far back as 2013 :\).I always loved/still love looking at the tower, especially at night when...
A nice experience to visit but avoid peak hours/holidays too many people. Other than that it's worth a visit and it's kinda pricey just to see Toronto from the top.
The food is great! just buy the pre-fix dinner and it will cover your entrance to the view. The revolving restaurant is awesome at first I was getting dizzy but then I got used to it. its awesome!
Amazing visit, not just about going up and down, pleanty to see and do. Give the edge walk a try, if you dare !
Originally did not planned to visit, but happened to be next to it at 9:30pm so we took our chance and went. A bit expensive, but won't regret. We were nearly alone and completely alone in SkyPad.
Definitely a "must do" to see the tallest tower on the planet, if a little expensive. Amazing on a sunny day!
Pros: Fun experience, nice to see Toronto from above. Cons: Long lines, crowded, and a bit pricey. Overall, would visit again but probably avoid peak hours.

This is one of the landmarks you hear about when talking about Toronto. We decided during our first trip to Toronto to visit. We happen to visit the day of a Toronto Blue Jays game and as we got closer to the tower there were crowds everywhere (The stadium is at the base of the tower). We purchased tickets with...

Brought 2 tickets online for $57 (including debit card fees) and in my opinion £32 is about fair when you take into account that you have no time limit up at the top, you can spend as much time there as you like.There is no seeting in the main area, but fortunately there were some spare seats just outside...

Amazing views of the city and waterfront as you walk around the observation platform. You access it by a glass lift, we had priority ascent and avoided the queues as we had a dinner reservation at the 360 deg. restaurant, see separate review. We went on a sunny day at approx. 3.30pm. and it was very busy, difficult to get...

This is a landmark of downtown Toronto. If this is the first time you come to visit Toronto, it's a definite must see place. You get an amazing view of the entire Toronto and you can also go down to the 360 restaurant for a drink afterward.

The CN Tower is worth the visit.There are several levels and the view from the top is worth the effort and provides a good feel for Toronto.Pictures through the glass floor are fun and worth taking.While clearly a tourist site, it is recommended.
This was on my list of things I must do in Toronto and it was worth every penny lovely experience and amazing view.

The Edge Walk is just awesome to do. To see the whole of Toronto and hang over the edge like that is stunning. They really do everything to make it very safe. Really worth doing.360° restaurant indeed like previous review is a little bit dirty (sticky tables). Food is good and with a nice drink enjoying the view is...

CN tower, a landmark in the heart of downtown Toronto, is definitely a must visit for all Toronto visitors. It's vibrant colours at night, definitely does not fail to astonish its viewers. Amazing View of the city, water, sky scrapers etc. Amazing place to go. Really enjoyed the outside walk about around the caged in ring at the top of the tower. Not sure what it's actually called sorry. The only rating I personally didn't like is the swaying feeling as you go up elevator. Really kinda freaked me out. They have...

It's worth a trip up to see the view, but the queues are always long. The elevators are very crowded and it's a bit of a scrum up the top at the observation deck. Much better experience to book a table at the 360 restaurant so you skip the queue and can eat while slowly revolving around the window.
As I said,just average,,,,,nothing special,pricy($30+tax not inc the higher level).the restaurant dirty and unorganized !!glass floor ok!
One of the must-sees in Toronto. Spectacular view over the whole city from the top. The glass floor can challenge one's courage.

After the Blue Jays game went up to the top level of the CN tower. Was well worth it. The view is fabulous. We were a little hesitant to walk on the glass flooring but after some coaxing out we went. Found the guides courteous and helpful.

A glass floor to look STRAIGHT down, an outside walk about....this tourist attraction will be fun for the kids (and super safe), fun for the adults, educational, and a great oppertunity to get the BEST pictures of the city.If its just the 2 of you, time it so you go up at dusk, and have cocktails as the sun...

The CN Tower is boasted to be the tallest building in the Western Hemisphere. It may be but you can't get that high. The view you do get from about 2/3 up the height of the buidling is amazing, especially of Lake Ontario and the glass floor is interesting. I am not afraid of heights or falling, yet, stepping onto...

The CN Tower's view of Toronto, and area is incredible and on a very clear day with the aid of binoculars you are able to glimpse at the Niagara Falls and New York State across Lake Ontario.A word of warning, it is a tourist trap....with very expensive bobbles and the food in the restaurant is not worth the price...

You get a beautiful 360 view of Toronto's skyline. The glass floor is a bit intimidating but definitely worth trying. The Skypod is quite pricey but you do see a difference being higher. You'll get better views and you can feel it sway (which was quite scary).
The revolving restaurant is great for dinner. The menu isn't cheap, but if you bundle the whole experience it is well worth it.
We had a good time. Food was good. It was our first anniversary. I would go back again, but for lunch this time so the view will be better because you will be able to see more.
We went early morning and found no queues, in fact we walked straight into the visitor centre, bought our tickets and went to the top of the tower within ten minutes!
CN Tower has great views. It was not to crowded the second week of May. However it is really expensive
Can get very pricey, but there is plenty to see and do. The glass floor is great and views of Toronto especially on a clear day cannot be better.

We went up to eat but were so disappointed with the veggie menu ($65!!) that we left without eating. The lift operator offered to let us off to see the views and we weren't disappointed by those. Glass floor, great views, friendly staff.

This was my second trip to Toronto but my first to the CN Tower. It was a must see. We went on a beautiful clear day. We also found the secret to seeing it fir free and skipping the long line. A must see for any tourist.

Having been the third time I've visited this attraction, I found it similar to the last 2 experiences, but my significant other had never been so it was nice to see him experience this wonderful tourist attraction. It was not too busy to attend, was a Sunday evening in May. Always a good time seeing the amazing features of Toronto.
Loved the view, the glass floor, the Himalamazon ride, and the 787 airplanes movie. A fun tour, and the CityPass made it economical. We chickened out of doing the EdgeWalk, but it looks exhilarating!
the cn tower provides great views of the city from above. Glass floor is really nice. No need to really pay an extra $12 to go further up it the sky pod. not much difference n view

Ok, this review is a little tricky. The views are the best in North America as it's the worlds 2nd tallest building. I guess the dilemma is how do you come here and not go all the way up to the Skypod? Now, having said that expect to drop $100 for 2 people to go all the way up to...
This is the best view in town. The restaurant is pretty pricey but the food was good and the views made it worth it.
this is a must for overseeing toronto. the glass floor is a major highlight. it takes almost a minute to get to the top.

I went to CN, the city is awesome, I love all Toronto, but CN specially is expensive for nothing! they've different prices, if you want high, higher, or highest! why? Moreover, the restaurant is "well-known" for the absurd prices and horrible food!

I've been to other observation decks before, so I wasn't sure if it was worth it to visit the CN Tower while in Toronto. I figured why not... And I'm so glad we did! Amazing views from all angles, even without paying extra to go to the very top (we did pay the extra though). I enjoyed the whole time...

Views are spectacular, but the netting that circles the (lower/main)observation room makes taking decent pictures nearly impossible. I get that it's there for safety reasons but there has to be a better option. (i.e.; wires at the Seattle Space Needle)

Other ways to get a ticket without purchasing at CN Tower. There are often discounts available online and can save 20% on tickets. If you reserve space in the revolving restaurant at the top of the tower you get a free ticket to the top. The price of a meal isnt far off a ticket to the top so better...

Ok sure, everyday there are taller buildings being built but remember this one held the record for over 30 years! Great views go without saying but our romantic dinner for two was spectacular even without the scenery. Highly recomended!

this is the tallest standing tower in the world, i have seen it more than 20 times in the past 33 years and never get tired of seeing it beautiful for old and young must see by all, the view from top of toronto is to die for but pick a day with no clouds for better view

well it is the monument of Toronto. just to get up the tower is expensive. I would rather make a reservation and have a dinner also enjoy the view. it is almost cost you the same to get on top of the tower and have meal at the 360 restaurant

I have been a few times at the CN tower even though i have a fear of heights :) it didn't seem to bother me at all. I find it a bit pricy to go up if you have already done it before and thus the 4 star.

We went during the late evening as our students wanted to enjoy another view as the lights came on. we went during the Victoria day and celebrations could be seen all over Toronto. It is windy up there so bring a sweater or windbreaker.The cost are fairly expensive but you also ge the 2 movies Wings and a 3d roller...

The CN Tower is amazing great food in the restaurant 360 and it revolves very slow and so much to do, get a great view of Toronto my hometown, I do not like heights but I had to do it and did!! Elevator ride with see view glass elevators to look out and your up in a matter of minutes...
The view is spectacular from up there, unlike any you'll find. It's worth going at least once in your life!
hello This amazing man made structureone must try---dinning restaurant 360 restaurant is one of best dinning experience

If the weather is sunny and clear, a must see attraction especially for children.A bit pricey for a family of 4 but once in a liftetime................suggestion: have dinner (food is quite good) and it will be cheaper and worth the hour 360" view over the city and Lake Ontario.
Been there, done it! Taken the elevator to the top. Saw the sights and enjoyed a fantastic valued meal while rotating around the CN TOWER. This is an experience you must treat yourself to.

I was a little wary after reading some of the reviews, but going up in the CN tower was worth the price. It is an awesome view and an experience I won't forget. For the thrill seekers, there is a ledge walk as well that I did not do, but it looked as though those that did enjoyed it. I...

We went here on our son's wish trip and even though it wasn't part of the package we were given, my son wanted to go here. So off we went. The customer service was great! They helped us to get where we needed to go so my son could visit the glass floor and I can't say enough about the...

The view from the CN Tower, provided it isn't foggy or cloudy, is fantastic. You can see almost the entire city, and the view of the lake and the islands is really good. The rotating restaurant has good food (the chocolate fountain for dessert is a must), but you will pay a for the rotation and the view.

I have been to the CN Tower several times over the years and it's awesome. To see the city from that high is great. I also really like the "See through" glass floor. I have also been to the restaurant which is very nice, but rather pricey. Would take the kids to the tower, but not for dinner.

The CN Tower is one of the landmarks of Toronto and a beautiful site for anyone to visit.I would highly recommend checking out the glass floor where you can look down on the city from 342 metres high! And yes, you can walk on it .. if you dare! :)

You can't really visit Toronto without going up the CN Tower. Just before sunset can be a great time, but a cold February morning really impressed some friends from Switzerland. Make sure the weather is clear, you definitely want a good view. The glass floor is terrifying to a lot of grown-ups, but obviously not to the little kids jumping...

Be prepared to spend a great deal of money and time here. Money because there are so many things to do there i.e. you can walk outside the building at the edge, you can dine, there is a souvenir shop and some cinema. Time because the view is just beautiful to look at.Warning: The place can get crowded and...

They really haven't updated much up there in 10+ years so if you've been before then don't waste your money going back. If you have never been then it is definitely worth it. I went to the 360 restaurant and it was decent but for the price there are better options in Toronto. The tower amenities are sparse once you...

Being from the area, the CN Tower is not so exciting if I were to go up myself. However, on a recent trip with someone from Bulgaria, it is exciting to see through someone else's eyes and, quite frankly, to be reminded that this is still one of the tallest buildings in the entire world - even after almost 40...

Even though I live in Toronto I love visiting the CN Tower. Not a fan of heights so I just close my eyes in the elevator! There is something about the view of the city from that high up that is just breathtaking!

Go to the top of this tallest, free-standing structure in the world. You first take an elevator to the communications pod, then take a separate elevator to the lookout area. Be sure to step outside, feel the wind and look straight down through the glass floor. Sick. Pathetic. Great.
You have to visit on a clear day but worth it...on a good day you can see the spray from Niagara Falls....the glass floor made my knees go weak....
Pricey but very cool views of Toronto! Pricey for what you get but the kids will enjoy. Especially laying on the glass floor!

A must do on your trip to Toronto! Can fit the mood for a family (a day visit) or couples attraction (evening visit.)Just hope for a nice clear sky to really enjoy the stellar views...great photo opportunities and the glass floor is bonus!

My sister and I visited here after a short break in New York and Niagara to spend a couple of nights in Toronto before flight back to UK. I like towers and have visited a few in the world and this was the tallest. A pass with the City Sightseeing bus tour, drops you off just outside, either side. Superb...

We waited 4 hours to reach the observation deck after being told by every person working there the lineup was only an hour wait. We paid to go up and see the higher deck but the wait to go up farther was another hour so we opted to forget about it very awful day for the children.

As every tower already the elevator ride is worth the trip.The view is spectacular - they say on clear days the U.S.A. can be seen.Big fun for kids is of course the glass bottom. They lay in all possible positions pretending to be flying in the air!A must when in Toronto
You simply cannot visit Toronto and not go up the CN Tower! It takes 58 seconds to get up there. The glass floor gives you a nice thrill. The view is great! Great for everyone!
If you go to Toronto you have to go up the Tower. You wont be disappointed either the view are tremendous

We went when it opened in the morning so no queue,we where giving layout of the Tower,then the elevator it was fast everything clean,went to the very top but not hanging on the ledge.but the level that was open to experience openness was good enough for us,the restaurant had a good menu nice meal,on the level that had the the...
You want to see all of Toronto and maybe most of Ontario then go to the top of CN tower well worth the trip.

since the tickets to go up the CN Tower are expensive, we decided to go have dinner at the restaurant (if you have dinner, you don't pay the tickets) we thought it would be a very touristy place (and it is!) but the food was great and the experience at the restaurant was really really good with a wonderful wine...

Usually I'm disappointed with the 'must see' attractions of a city. The CN Tower, though, was excellent. A bit of a hike from Union Station, but the trip up to the top was quick and there were great views once up there. I could even see the Blue Jays baseball game from up there.

I paid CAD 49 (inclusive of tax) for both the main observation deck and the skypod, expecting to take excellent photos from one of the world's tallest structures. True, the scenery did not disappoint, but the photographic opportunities did. The skypod had windows with numerous frames that effectively blocked any panoramic view, even for the naked eye. It also didn't...

We visited the CN Tower at about 9:30am on a Tuesday in early May. There were very few people around and we pretty much had the place to ourselves, which made it a very enjoyable experience. It was just under CAD $100 for the two of us including entry to the Skypod, which is the much smaller but higher viewing...
Not only are you walking on a glass floor but you can go outside and overhang approx...1500 ft high !!!The aquarium is next door so this is a full day

That was a breathtaking view of Toronto city. Coupled by the Blue Jays game. I must say that I enjoyed every second that I spend up there. Not forgetting the Skypod experience. I felt like I was at the apex of Toronto.
If you go to Toronto you have to go up the Tower. It's like the Empire State Building in NY or the Eifel Tower in Paris it's a must do. You wont be disappointed either the view are tremendous
A little pricey,but the views are superb. When you get up there you realise just how big Toronto is.

You really do need to spend the extra to go up to the Skypod deck. The view is stunning. We waited for a clear sunny day to ensure we got the best possible outlook.Whilst the view is good from the lower levels and going outside is also great you just can't beat being that high.

The view is unparalleled (on a fine day), the structure impressive, and the lift rides up and down pleasantly terrifying. But naturally, this is steeped in tourist tat, forced photo opportunities and overpriced food and drink options. If it's anything other than a glorious day, I'd think twice.

This was one the most expensive tower tours I have taken in recent years at $36.16 per adult (incl. taxes). Once you get up there, it's a great 360 degree view of the city which includes the waterfront, the airport, baseball stadium and city skyscrapers. One floor down and you can experience the glass bottom floor. There is a cafe,...

We pre-booked our visit to the CN Tower and were able to skip the short queue and head straight up to the top of the CN Tower. We first visited the look out level which is 346 metres above the ground. This gave fabulous views of the Toronto Islands, Toronto city airport and the city and buildings of Toronto. However,...

If you've been to NYC and went at the top of the Empire State Building or Top of the Rock, you might be disappointed as well. The view is nice from the CN tower but it's only indoor if you don't take the navel option and less impressive of course than if you were outside. I think 25 dollars is...

Worth every penny. Great views over the city. We got there about 10:00 and just beat the crowds. The glass floor in particular was a highlight. Helpful staff and good gift shop- what more do you want?

If the view from up there is not, then the glass floor will definitely make your trip there worthwhile and test whether you have a fear of heights. It's amazing how your mind can play tricks on you, but it took me a while to find the courage and walk on it.Totally worth it (even though the price was...

Its a most imposing building, spotlessly clean, and very beautiful. You can have a meal and drinks in the restaurant at the very top of the tower, although we didn't. The views are amazing. The CN Tower reaches far above the skyline of Toronto. Well worth a visit.

The tower itself is pricey, so I recommend going for dinner and the view is free. The food was expensive but you can't beat the view so it was definitely worth it! The service was not the best, but I still wouldn't miss it!

The lines were short when we visited. We were obviously very luck, as the queue areas were frightening long. The kids really enjoyed the elevators and the views. We paid extra to visit the SkyPod, and this is a must-do.

Would need to pick your day would not see much if overcast. Certainly worth to go up the tower. I think if you go for a meal the tower is included worth to check out b4 paying for the tower only. We used the city pass.
Great view of the area and the lake. The elevator ascended/descended slowly so it did not catch you off guard or make you dizzy. Nice staff.

Yes, its pricey. But its totally worth it. We went on a cloudy day and could still see for miles. The glass floor was a fun addition. We had a drink at their rooftop restaurant they were delicious, and the server absolutely wonderful, giving us recommendations on what we could do next. She was fabulous.
We have a wonderful dinner in the restaurant (excellent service) and enjoyed looking through the glass floor. It is a great activity for kids too!
A must do in Toronto. Yes, it is a bit touristy but still fun. The view is amazing. Walking so much in this beautiful city it is nice to see where I had been and needed to go.

447 metres up. By far the largest anything in Toronto. You can't get a better view than this of Toronto. Nothing to complain about. Plenty of indoor viewing space, outdoor and indoor. Went up right before sunset, which is the best time. Then you get daytime view, sunset view, and night time with the city lights.

The CN Tower IS Toronto's skyline and a symbol of the city. Without it nothing would differentiate Toronto's skyline from any other North American city.Viewing the CN Tower from the base is quite breathtaking (and a good way to need a chiropractor!). The lift ride to the top is fun - I never imagined flying up so many levels...

The tower is spectacular. Lunch at the 360 restaurant is pricey but do it if you can. The relaxed atmosphere, amazing views of Toronto and a delicious meal were a highlight of out trip. Don't miss the glass floor on the observation deck.
Great for the kids, they loved the glass floor. I've been up 8 times but the price is not worth it. $140 for a family of 4. Saw it all in about 30 minutes.

oh my. The CN tower is truly awesome in so many ways - from the entry and the line to go up in the really fast glass fronted elevator to the view from the observation landing. A walk on the glass floor was brilliant and the first time we went the roof of the superbowl was open and we could...
This is one of the best views you could have from toronto. The restarant looks great , but i didnt have time to go, although i will tottally recommend it for couples.

Check the weather carefully before you decide to go and make sure you check Toronto Island, Toronto, Hamilton and St. Catharines. You can see all the way to St Cats and beyond if it is a clear day. Beware of windy days if you want to go to the Skypod as you definitely feel the sway and the outer walk...

The CN Tower is the iconic massive tower in Toronto that in many ways is the symbol of the great city. I have been a few times in the past, but my recent journey made me want to reflect a little about the experience. My friend and I decided we wanted to have a fancy lunch, or at least one...

Our visit to the CN tower was the highlight during our three days stay in Toronto. You already get excited when you are getting close to the tower and realize how big it is. There was a short line for the elevator, but once you are in that elevator the fun begins. There are glass windows, so you have a...

Cn tower is just Excellent. Illuminating at night, it really is THE symbol of the city. From the tower, you have a wonderfull view of the City and Lake Ontario. The best, late afternoon when the sun goes down. And, the glass floor, WOW! hopefully, these glass are solid.... :-)

If you are afraid of highs, do not go in there!!! It is amazing, you can see the whole city and beyond once you are on top. There is a restaurant inside which is amazing, a bit expensive, but it is a once in a life time experience so it's worth to eat and enjoy the views.At the top...

The view is awesome and the glass floor is really cool! We ate at 360 and that was nice because otherwise you pay almost $30 to ascend the tower and there's probably maximum ten minutes of looking before you're bored.
Excellent views across the city. We did our visit in October so there were no ques and we had clear access to enjoy the glass floor. Di it, you won't regret it.

We went for dinner in the revolving restaurant. The food was good with fantastic views of the city. If you go for dinner you don't have to pay to go up the tower so it make it seem cheap.after dinner you can still go to the viewing tower as well.
Spent a fabulous afternoon going up the tower and taking lots of photos. The views are stunning and there is also a 3D film and a simulator ride at the end. Well worth a visit
We decided to have lunch at the CN Tower. It was expensive but well worth it. Food was great and service was first class. I would call it a "once" visit. No need to spend that kind of money twice
With your dinner at the restaurant, you have access t the observatory, and the glass floor... That's an incredible experience!!!

First time in Toronto and even though my husband doesn't like heights, I had to go up the CN tower. It was amazing, just like most of the reviewers, it felt awesome. Looking through the glass floor I still felt as if I could have fallen. $35 well spent as it's something you will only do once.

Incredible experience. Put this at the top of your tourist visit. Pay extra for the sky pod thing. We went early May and avoided the long lines that I imagine can queue up. While honeymooning in Toronto, we visited the CN Tower. Absolutely incredible views & the glass floor is a once in a lifetime experience (the hubby stayed near the wall & wouldn't venture out to the middle of the glass floor where kids were jumping up & down in a fashion he was sure would result in death, ha). Go all...

I recently spent my anniversary weekend in Toronto, and ate dinner at the 360 restaurant at the top of the CN tower. What an experience !! It was a bit expensive but so worth it. The far reaching views were amazing. The glass floor was very scary but had to be done.

Amazing 360 degree views of the city! If you make reservations for 360 restaurant at the top, you don't have to pay to get up. The restaurant rotates so you can see the entire city, and the food is really good. Definitely give it a try!

The CN Tower is full of things to doThere is an area for souvenirs, there is another area for pictures at the top of the tower and there is a restaurant.I had a delicious dinner there, it costed around $60 for the dinner and visiting all the CN tower, the nice thing is that the restaurant spins slowly...
Lunch at revolving restaurant very good value at 55 dollars because you pay about 40 dollars just to get to observation platform. Definitely worth it. Views spectacular.

This was my fourth time to visit the cn tower! Found it pricey for a family, I went with my three children! Not a lot to do but sights from the top are brilliant! I only went again for my children to be able to say they've been up there! Worth doing the once but make sure all your children(...

Went twice. Once by day - on a sunny day - make sure you go right to the top. Booked restaurant for the night and it was stunning. The food was good and great choice. Reserved the restaurant the day before, but there was plenty of space.

We'd spent a few days in Toronto on our holiday in October and knew it would be inevitably to eventually visit the CN Tower. It was something we said we'd do, even though I am terrified of heights! Incredible view of the city form the CN Tower you could see it all from it. It will cost $38 per person to go up and $12 more to go to the very top.
This is a very nice place from which to view the city and the lake front. We stoped for a lunch in the restaurant. The sites around the tower are worth the visit also.

Well , I visited the Tower for the 9 th time on my last trip to Toronto. This time was different. Each time we have visited the tower, we went in the afternoon,stood in a long line to get in, then a line for the elevator - all that to get to the busy observation deck - a thrill that...

Go to the top. If it fits your budget, the revolving restaurant is actually very good. Sitting there watching the city go by, the planes landing downtown, the lights coming on. Stand on the glass floor and look down. Do it all at least once.
I saw the sun set from the 360 degree restaurant at the CN tower. The view was absolutely stunning. The food and the wines were both brilliant!

We got the general admission ticket. The views from the top were spectacular! And the glass floor was both scary and exciting!Staff on the whole were good except when we asked not to get our photo taken (we weren't asking to skip the queue just the photo!). The girl refused and was quite rude!
Amazing view while you dine. If you go in the evening you get the observatory all to yourself after dinner. Very cool wine cellar (or is it an attic?) food is good....not amazing, but good.

Ok, let's face it, CN Tower is a must according to all tourist guides, books, websites, etc. so one feels one almost has to go. However, here's a few tips everyone should know. Our main reason for going to downtown Toronto was to see the CN Towers. We booked before leaving England as wasn't sure how busy it gets. It was a windy day when we went so we couldn't go outside which was a shame but we still saw a great view & the paid the extra $12 each to go to...
ENUS:Obligatory passage for anyone going to Toronto. Very cool, worth it!PTBR:Passagem obrigatoria para quem vai a Toronto! Muito Lela! Eu Recomendo!
Had lunch at the tower and had the best views of Toronto. Can't beat the views. The seafood towers are scrumptious.

As a resident of Toronto, I have been up the CN Tower many times over the years. I've have enjoyed every trip that I've taken up the tower. CN Tower is one of the most exciting attractions of Toronto. Even though the entrance fee is very high, especially the glass floor, where you can stand on a transparent floor and see hundred meters down, was worth visiting.

I remember looking up at the tower when I got there and being amazed that looking up underneath it you couldn't see the top. We headed off early one morning. It was a clear day and we had amazing views, we watched airplanes landing and taking off. When we were leaving there was queues galore. Go early.
My family joined me over the weekend on a business trip and we enjoyed each attraction in the tower. It was woth the admission and a TRULY UNIQUE experience.

CN tower is considered to be one of the tallest buildings in world and is an amazing place to visit. You just go to the top in very little time and the view from the top is awesome. One of the must see attractions in Toronto.

If you want to be at the top of the sky... this is the place for you... with a variaty of activities, its a great place to take some pics of the city skyline, in a clear day you could get to see some US skyscrapers.I have visited the tower four times, this one i found they created a...

That wonderful view of Toronto. Is a beautiful experience, the feeling is weird but very nice when you are at more of 1,100 feet above the sea level with a view of 360 degree! I waited all my life to Visit and it was a big let down. Not all it was hyped up to be. Parking was horrible and security and staff was rude.

a native to the city, i brought some friends from Montreal here during the christmas holidays. They were excited for the visit. The glass floor was incredible ! The line to the elevator was a bit long though .....................

We booked dinner through 'Open Table'; a great third party to deal with!
