This is handy & important information for visitors and 'newbies' to the city; especially...
We were very impressed with the idea of the skywalk even though we did not do it as it was a rainy and windy day we thought that the challenge is worth doing !

It is something you would do at least once in your life time! The most amazing part is to stand on that glass floor and look down! The view from the Sky Walk is breath taking! Best time to go up there is just before sunset and catch the Sunset as well as the night lights!Only thing that got...
Great views and the 360 restaurant has amazing food and rotates so you can take some fab pictures and see Toronto from different angles.Allow 2 hours or 3 if your eating.
We actually went to the 360 for dinner. The ride up, the view from the top and the food & service made everything perfect.

This is the tallest tower in the Western Hemisphere. For that alone, you should go up to the sky walk unless you're afraid of heights. Once up there, you can see practically all of Toronto and beyond Lake Ontario. I liked it

Have been up the tower a few times, always a great thing to do when in Toronto. Wonderful views and you can see miles and miles away. The CN tower provided stunning views of Toronto in the winter. Staff were super friendly. Perfect for couples and families. There was also a convenient café on the first floor and the food was good.
We visited the CN Tower in September , the entrance price is quite expensive but it does have really good views of the entire city and beyond ( obviously if you go up on a good day )...

CN tower is located in the city centre of downtown Toronto. Subway is just 5 minutes walk of which I recommend because parking is very expensive. Breathtaking. A must see and do while in Toronto. Go-up to the observation deck in the glass paneled non-stop elevator. Listen carefully to the elevator attendant' commentary. Take your time as you walk inside and outside the observation deck. Don't forget you camera!!!!

Really enjoyed this. We ate lunch in the restaurant (not the revolving one) which was great because you get a seat at a window and see everything and can take the time to enjoy it. The food was really good as was the view. The glass floor was too scary for me though.
This is the best way to see views from the CN Tower. The meal and service were brilliant and you could enjoy the scenery in a relaxing and peaceful atmosphere.

Enjoyed our visit up the tower but could only afford the basic ticket as prices are very high. However - we really enjoyed the freedom to spend as long gazing at the views as we wanted and enjoyed the extras included - like the 3D film etc.

My wife and I decided to try out the CN Tower while we were in Toronto for a 3 day trip. I looked it up prior to going but never checked the prices. Since it would be the highest thing I've ever been in I didn't mind paying for it. We pairs 24 per person and then it was informed...
This is a great bird's eye view of Toronto. If you book reservations at the 360 restaurant you can bypass the regular line to go up, plus you have access to the observation floor at no extra cost.

If you are definitely going, make sure you buy your tickets on line. It saves money and more importantly - time! The ticket line gets packed very quickly. There is an extra fee for the Skypod but it's well worth it. You can really see a spectacular view of the city!
this was pricey for the 15 mins we went up. 40 dollars per person. however when we got there it was nice to see the whole of toronto

If you are ever in Toronto this is a must see place for tourists. The elevator to the top is pretty fast and there is a restaurant at the top of the tower. The restaurant is pretty pricey but if you make a reservation you will get the free ride to the top of the CN Tower. The restaurant is...

We spent the extra money to go all the way to the top of the CN Tower. It was worth it.As a person with a serious fear of heights, it wasn't so bad. I can't say that I enjoyed everything about it, but I am glad that I took the opportunity to do it. I would have regreted not...
It's a must go place! It's easy to find and has a lovely view! The restaurant is wonderful although it's expensive!

If you don't like heights, forget this. But if you want a super-fast elevator ride, stunning views in all directions and a delicious meal in the 360 restaurant, you will have an experience to remember.

We visited the famous tower on a weekday, mainly with the intention to take a breather from the daily grind and it paid off.The 'Himalamazon' ride at the end of the trip was the biggest surprise and the kids were thrilled!
This is a great place to visit when you are in Toronto. Highly recommended. I suggest going there at night to see the lights.

We went with our family (on Family Day!). We all enjoyed the view from the top. It was neat to see the planes taking off / landing at Toronto Island Airport. Glass floor isn't that spectacular, but it is kind of cool to look down. A couple of us had visited a few years ago, and were looking forward to...
Short wait time in line for the time we went. Awesome views and experience overall. A bit on the pricey side, add ons drive up the already expensive price. Clear day a just, we lucked out.

On a sunny day the view of the citallesy from the top deck of the tower is magnificent- at least in my opinion.There is a revolving restaurant that we used many years ago. The general admission price per adult is definitely a deterring factor as it is quite steep. Despite this, the views from the top are incredible. Best time to go (which is when we went), is dusk as you get to see it during day and night time.

The CN Tower is a focal point of the city of Toronto, and a must for any tourists. It goes up to the top in a minute, with views out of the side of the elevator.There is a glass floor to look down on, a observation deck if you want to go outside to take in the views, and...
Fantastic views of the surrounding area. A great place to visit on a clear day (which we had). Would imagine in peak season it would get extremely busy.

Obviously very touristy and a bit pricey, but I feel like this is a must for people visiting the city. The tower is impressive in both height and beauty and looks lovely when all lit up at night. On a clear day, you can see as far away as...almost forever.One of Canada's greatest man made feats, the CN Tower is a once in a lifetime experience. Once you see it in person, you'll have to go on up to the top!
The view was great! The staff are lovely people. You have all the time in the world at the top of the tower. The wait is a bit long to get to get to the top, but overall you must do this!

Def worth a visit, great views. I'm scared of hights and actually didn't have any issues while at can tower, although did not step on glass floor. Revolving cafe is lovely and compared to uk price was not expensive.

This amazing tower is definitely "the must see" attraction for all visitors to Toronto. The view was great. The ride they offered in the simulator was unrelated to the tower, but my 9 yr old son enjoyed it. The glass floor was also pretty neat.

The CN Tower is completely wheelchair accessible. My fiance & I had a great time. The views were stunning. The "Glass Floor" was isn't for those who are afraid of heights. I recommend going for an afternoon. It's worth your $$ & time.
I went to there last yearif you like take a picture it's good for you

This is a cool Toronto attraction for all tourists.We went in November, so it was more off-season - there wasn't really much going on at the top of the CN Tower for us to do.You can go "outside" (fenced in) weather-permitting to get some fresh air from above. The most iconic building in our city! The view from both he main observation deck, and the tiny upper SkyDeck, are simply incomparable. Most days you can see across the lake to New York State. love the view, relax have a espresso before you walk across the glass floor :)have you the guts to go outside and lean over (of course safely)

Its an absolute must see on a visit to Tornoto.From the ride up, to the views of the city spread out below, the large expanse of water and the glass floor to walk on - its an unforgettable view and experience. The 360 Restaurant is spectacular in every sense - views, food, wine, and attention. Very well organized trip to the top of the CN Tower. It gives a very nice view over Toronto area en further!

A great attraction and a must see place. view was breathtaking, winds were too strong for me to do the edge walk but the glass bottomed floor can give you a chill or two. reasonably priced..

Visit this area regardless of time in Toronto. It's always great to take sometime and visit Toronto's CN tower. You get fantastic views of the city while enjoying great ambiance and lovely service
If you go up be prepared for the fast elevator. I'm always wondering what color it will be or how it will be lit. A landmark.

CN Tower was fun. However, get the fast track line pass. It's not worth waiting in a long line to see.
To really enjoy make sure you go on a clear day with no clouds. It is well worth the extra charge to go up to the sky pod

Great views, glass floor on viewing deck is incredible! Fun place for family and friends. Must for anyone visiting Toronto.
I live in Toronto and have been up the CN Tower several times. A 'must-do' if you come to Toronto only once. Gives you a fantastic 360 degrees of the city. There are also interesting attractions.
Elevator ride up to the top and back down is breathtaking. It's an experience that you will talk about for years. View spectacular on a clear day. Avoid peak times.
As a person coming to Toronto one should take in the sights , going up the tower allows that wonderful perspective of our big metropolitan city .
an experience to elevate quickly and sight out the glass elevation along with a glass floor to look out below, walking on air. Walking around the CM Tower allows the full 360 view around TO.

Anytime of day/evening; especially end of day watch city light from day to night. All ages. Enjoyed revolving restaurant.

its a fabulous view and really good view , i would recomended only on a clear day though !!also the ride up and down is great.if your adventures take the sky walk around the tower ,its really awesome with great fun pple that will lead you !!

Must do for sure. Go for lunch skip the tour. Go as early as possible. Its best to go to 360 and sit eat and enjoy the view as the rest turns.

Majestic lookout over the city, and on a clear day, you see all the way to Niagara Falls!!! Right at the heart of many other tourist attractions in the city.

Great place to view sunsets overlooking Lake Ontario and the city of Toronto.Enjoy a memorable dinner in the revolving restaurant.P.S. don't put anything value able beside the window, you may not see it for an hour as you revolve

This is a must do for all visitors to Toronto, the view is amazing, the ride up is exhilarating and if you are adventurous you could hang out up there outside.
Well worth seeing and having lunch in the revolving restaurant and if you are brave enough try the outside walk on the top of the tower. Not for the faint hearted.
The best way to enjoy this Toronto attraction is to have dinner at the revolving restaurant. The changing view on a clear night is great. Reservations necessary and can be made on line.
The views from the top of the CN tower are amazing! Standing on the glass floor is scary but a lot of fun. The glass elevators make the ride up neat as well.

If there is only one thing you can see/do while you're in Toronto, it has to be the assent to the top of the city. The CN Tower view is spectacular. Having a nice bite to eat as your table rotates for a 360 degree view of the city is a real treat. If you're brave/stupid enough, you can do...

Enjoy the meal up the CN tower,as you don't have to pay to go up the tower.So if you take off the price of the meal,going up the tower is very reasonable.It takes at least an hour to go round in the revolving dining room,so you see 360 views without the masses all around you on the lower decks.But...
When the weather's favourable, there's no better view of the city and, with luck, Niagara Falls in the distance.. A bit steep (both the tower and the price) but a must for out-of-town visitors.

I have lived in Toronto since 1995 and have been to the top of the CN Tower 13 times. Every time my friends or relatives visit Toronto, I recommend the experience and, in return, get to re-visit the place. Go up on a clear day to get the best views. Since it is such a visible landmark in Toronto, enjoy...
Experience a thrill of heights, great food for a reasonable price and FANTASTIC PHOTOS for memories.

The tower is a must do in Toronto. It's fun to go up the elevator and you get a great view of the City. Make sure though, don't waste your money just on the elevator ride. Make reservations for fixed price lunch $55 or dinner $60. The ride up is $40+ alone, so for just a little more you can...
I Loved the glass floor, history information and many in our group went on the outside walk...not me!
if you are in Toronto, you should check CN tower ride ,it is like going to Paris but not checking Eiffel tower

This is a must do when in Toronto. The view is spectacular when it is a clear day, and not bad even if not. There is a glass floor (actually I think that it is a very thick secure acrylic material). Kind of eerie feeling to stand so high and see the ground - kids and adults both enjoy the...

could be added to the Wonders of the World in the 21st Century. You don't want to miss this one. Born in Toronto, lived here all my life yet can humbly suggest this will be a highlight. Make sure to do this visit on a clear, sunny day and enjoy.
Lots to see and do here. Sky Walk, not for me but VERY popular.Restaurant that moves, this is great site seeing above the city and the food is delicious.Very family friendly.

While fairly expensive, one should take about an hour to eat lunch while the restaurant turns and gives you a view of Lake Ontario & City of Toronto from on high. One can also go to level below and walk around the tower and see the sites, etc.
A long expensive wait for a nice view. Food good but expensive. Way too touristy. Less exciting now since it is not close to the biggest any longer

It took me many years to work up the nerve to make my way to the top. I have been to the top a number of times and plan on taking visitors from London, UK in May. It is amazing at the top. The views are spectacular! Young and old all enjoy visiting the CN tower. The glass floor... Amazing!...
Very interesting to see the city from the height. Much cheaper than to hire a helicopter. Strongly recommend.
All I have to say about this place is ,,if u come to toronto you do have to visit the most popular place in town...
Tallest tower in the world until Dubai took the title away! Restaurant is good (not cheap), and view is something else.

This is a nice place too see and now it is even good for the thrill seeking crowd. The breath taking view is well worth the price.Just the elevator ride is something...Have fun live life and laugh, bring family or friends...

Anybody visiting Toronto ( i'm from TO) should book a day to visit CN Tower, go up the tower & enjoy the city view on a clear day, walk on the Glass Floor & enjoy the food in the restaurant. Remeber this is a great landmark that you would like to add in your photo album of visited places.
go to this place...it's an awesome adventure...worth the money. We also went to the huge aquarium nearby.

Toronto, being a relatively flat city, needs this kind of perspective in order tho help understand the scope of it. Not to be missed.I strongly recommend bringing a maps enabled smart phone with you to help you intentify what you're seeing.
Not really worth the price of admission, even for the people were from out of town. Quite a disappointment.

If you want to have an integral look at Toronto city and understand it, then a visit to CN Tower is the way to go. You could also get a table with a magnificent view of downtown Toronto or the lake to have a snack and a drink. Or if you have more time you can to the 360 restaurant...

Visiting the CN Tower is a great way to see Toronto from high above the city. Even the security gates are fun with a gust of air blasted at you as you enter. The glass elevator soars above the ground at a fast speed. You can see across the lake, the islands and all the city from the wrap around...
Views are fantastic on clear days. Arrive early to beat the crowds, especially on holidays and during summer.

Safe and very comfortable place for visitors. I've been there with friends that were visiting from out of town, I also went there to have lunch with a friend in the restaurant. The food was excellent and good portion.I strongly recommend the CN Tower to Anyone visiting Toronto for the first time. Great location, centrally located in the heart of...
With a glass floor and also the ability to go for a walk on the wild side, this is the perfect place to visit for dinner in the revolving restaurant or a walk outside!

Icon is such an overused word today. However like it or not CN Tower is an icon for Toronto. It might be obvious but just make sure the weather is clear and you have a head for heights, it will provide an instant overview of the City's layout.

The 360 Restaurant is A+, expensive but you get what you pay for. View is of course great. Not that there's a whole lot to goggle over looking out over Toronto. Hey, look, four storey buildings. Can't remember what the fee for entry was.

Go on a clear day to see the lake and city for miles and miles. Good access by subway, usually a wait at the bottom unless you have pre-ordered your tickets, a fancy dining room that revolves - expensive but beautiful views - and a smaller cafe for quick bites. Near the Conference Center, the Air Canada Center and the...
Unique experience with great view of the city and such a famous landmark. Save money on the ride up by booking a meal at the 360 Restaurant at the top of the tower

This is a very high stucture of ciment. From the top, you can feel the tower moving. There are 2 stories. At the top, there is a turning restaurant that allows you to see Toronto at a 360 degres angle. It is quite expensive to go up the tower approximately 40 dollars. Make sure you go by a clear day...

Years ago when the tower first opened there was much excitement and hoopla due to the media. The restaurant at the top, which revolves very slowly(barely notice),had a wonderful menu and a Sunday Brunch that was certainly done up to the tee! Now the prices are far too inflated for what you are served and the trip up is not...
The CN Tower is a "must see" in Toronto. The view from the top is simply fantastic. You get to see the whole city and Lake Ontario. Don't forget to step on the glass floor :)
It is a good experience to visit for the very first time..... its more beautiful in night time. You need one full day to spend as there is a looooooong line up to go and come down.
A bit expensive but very worth while and unique adventure. Amazing view of the city, lake and surrounding area. Glass floor area where you can stand on the glass, frightening but fun.
Weather dependant, the views can be remarkable. All towers have the same basic tourist attractions so it is not really that unique of an experience.
The CN Tower is a must see for sure! Enjoy the best views of Toronto and the surrounding cities! A different and unique experience! With many fun activities to enjoy! Love it!

A great way to see the city - lots of options for things to do: go up, see the imax, walk on the glass floor, do the sky walk (if you dare!) go up the top level or just the observation deck.Its one of those attractions you will likely do and if your family enjoys all the experiential things...
It is pricey to go to the top of the CN tower , especially when you have to pay for more then one person.But the view is beautiful, it is a must for tourist

Great view, but do dinner if you can and sit close to the window. Food is excellent, atmosphere is very nice and the views are spectacular. If your crazy do the life line walk outside the top of the tower.

Do you want to see how big Toronto is? Go to CN tower and you will! The cool stuff start with the panoramic elevators, then you have 4 levels of observation, in one of them you can walk on a floor made of glass, on another you can feel the wind outside. And if you dare you can walk on...
The view from the top can't be beat!! I haven't yet done the Edge Walk, but it's on my list of things to do this summer for sure!!
Should visit in the night as overlooking the city of Toronto the lighting is very beautiful.Public transportation is available.
We have had special dinners at the top of the CN Tower! The view is amazing and the food isgreat. There is a special elevator for the restaurant!
Relatives visiting from Australia who have heard and asked to visit The CN Tower.We visited as a family,they were amazed at the excellent view of the city.

Expensive to go up the Tower but get a great view of the city. I actually bought tickets to go have lunch at the restaurant and that allows you to go up the restaurant lift which is quicker and you don't have to wait in line with everyone else. The food is so so, but its worth doing especially in...
This is the perfect spot to see all of the Toronto skyline. It is most beautiful at night with all the lights, but equally lovely during the day.

One of the most recognizable structures in the world, the CN Tower is must see for any visitor to Toronto. Be sure to purchase the ticket to get to the highest observation level. It is an amazing sight! The revolving restaurant is very good but a little pricey.
If it's your first time to Toronto then the CN Tower is a must. Great views of the city and you must eat at 360 Restaurant, it's delicious!

I was initially dubious about what seemed like quite a lot of money to go up a tower. It seems much taller when you are up the tower and we had a clear day and it was literally like being in an aeroplane. Definitely invest in the extra to go to the top deck as this affords an even more...

My four year old son loved going up to the top of the CN Tower. I found the building a little tired and dated. This being said, my son has talked more about the CN tower than anything else we did in Toronto!

We visited the CN Tower late on a Sunday Afternoon. We had purchased our tickets ahead of time so we walked past the ticket line straight to the elevator line. Once we were crammed into the elevator we took the quick ride up to the look-out level, this level only goes about 1/2 way around the viewing level, the other...

We were visiting relatives in Toronto, who booked us a visit and a meal here as a treat! We arrived at 5.45pm and were taken up to the restaurant in a very fast moving lift!. We were shown to our table, by the window. The view was fantastic!! Our food order was taken and we then had the pleasure of...

The view from the CN Tower is amazing to say the least! , i loved everything about the tower other than the price, in my opinion its a little steep id rather spend a few bucks doing stuff on the tower than paying so much for the attraction, it was and is a great view and a great attraction!

The CN Tower had Great views of the city, we went on a sunny day with blue skies could see quite a way, best to go on a non cloudy day, we did not eat in the restaurant as it was a little pricey but the menu looked great.

This was our first time in a Toronto so we purchased the city pass, which included tickets to the CN Tower. It is definitely a must-do at least once and the 360-degree view is beautiful. The experience is worth the cost, but it's probably not something that we would do again.

I've been here a few times in my life. Brought my family a little while back, and it was enjoyable. Reasonable price. There is shops and restaurants and if your brave you can hang from the edge of the tower from a rope. I would love to try that. I'm an adventurous person. Being closer to 50 yrs old doesn't...
It's cool but first a bit expensive and not very rapturous but it has a good view and realy is it possible that you;ve been in toronto and you don't go to CN tower!

My family and I were really bored. So we decided to go to the CN Tower, the only attraction we missed. The price was ok, but we loved it. It was kind of scary for me because I'm scared of heights. We didn't eat there so I guess we missed all the great food.

We decided to head north instead of south for spring break and picked up the City Pass Toronto. This is a great way to see many of the city attractions at a great cost. The CN Tower was a great experience..we went a wonderful sunny day and had great views and a lot of fun seeing all sorts of things...

Kinda pricey to go see the roofs of smaller buildings underneath through scratched glass on the observation deck with tons of other people trying to take pictures at the same time...The 360 views are ok - you can get better views from low flying airplanes. Compared to the roof and 360 views of Stratosphere in Las Vegas, this was...

Ok, here's my #1 tip for the CN tower. Go for lunch or dinner. The cost to get up the elevator is $35 alone. If you go for lunch or dinner, the extra cost is only $15-$20 over the elevator cost. (It will get expensive if you drink a lot of booze). The rotating restaurant is definitely pretty awesome. The...
tremendous views of the surrounding areas not being a great lover of heights did not take up the option to walk on the outside but some did.it really is a must if you visit Toronto.

Absolutely fabulous - food excellent and views stunning.Yes, the restaurant food is expensive but the staff down below very diplomatically point out the menu (and the prices) before you book so you know what to expect. The service we had was faultless and we were not rushed at all, so could take in all the ambiance of those amazing...

I do not have a head for heights but never let this put me off. The views from the very top are amazing. It does make you feel a bit wobbly though but you soon adjust. After adjusting I was able to walk on the glass floor which was amazing. The children there have no fear and lay face down...
$35 for the basic ticket is too steep just to get an elevator up the tower. The restaurants at the top are also costly although the food is ok.

View from the top was incredible. Make sure it's a clear day though. We could see across the lake and the city view was mesmorizing. We ate at the 360 restaurant and took our time with dinner and the observation levels. The clear floor is a bit nerve racking, but the staff was very good at getting you through your...

Fantastic views obviously, nice clear sunny day so could see for miles.Glass floor was a challenge, brain could not compute standing on thin air.Other attractions there were a bit weird, simulator ride and film show, the tower is what it's about

We caught a great sunny day in August, so the views were great! The glass floor is an experience on its own. We didn't have time to eat at the restaurant but will definitely do it next time. The ride on the elevator is also very fun.
The view from the top of the tower was absolutely breath taking. The city pass covered the cost but it is good value for money and definitely worth a visit.

Cost of $99/family of 4. But we did spend a few hours! The view, of course, is splendid. There is a great 'simulator ride' (kids did twice!) and a movie on history of flight included. And that glass floor is an experience all on it's own!!

We were lucky to have a decent day in March to visit the tower. It was worth the fee to ride to the observation deck and see the city from that height. We didn't eat at the restaurant due to timing but the menu and the food looked good.The ride up in the glass elevator is quite an experience...

The food was excellent, my wife had asked for a well done steak, (I always tell the waiters that she thinks she is a goddess and wants burnt offerings). She received one which was slightly pink, a passing waitress noticed her lonly picking at her food, enquired as to the problem and immediately rectified the mistakeby providing a new...

The CN Tower's 360 restaurant is definitely an experience that everyone should try at least once. Its views are incredible, especially if you're able to make your reservation to coincide with sunset. While not inexpensive, the food is excellent, staff are wonderful, and you have the added bonus of being able to go to the observation decks without charge after...

Hubby & I decided on this restaurant as we went to a revolving restaurant in Niagara Falls that impressed us. This restaurant paled in comparison. The service was great, the views were great, but it was loud and the food was horrible and waaaay over priced. When I pay $72 for a 12 ounce beef tenderloin I EXPECT it to...

It is a nice way to see the city from the top. Specially in a clear day. But if you have been to a tour before you will not be excited. It is just another one very similar to the others like the Needle Tower in Seattle and the Sydney Tower in Australia.
A true testament to engineering and vision for the future.All agegroups will enjoy this excursion.From the high speed elevator to the glass floor on the viewing deck,an experience worth having.

It's like be in Rome and do not visit Vatican. As any touristic Tower in a touristic city, you gonna get lines and lots of people on weekends and hollydays. Nice restaurant. The glass floor on the top is the highlight for those afraid of trying the "walk around " the tower outside.

A magnificent tower. I have dined many times in the revolving restaurant which may be the best way to see the waterfront and the inner city of Toronto. The elevators are glass providing great views on the way up/down. The observation deck is often buffeted by winds I would stay inside until the wind calmed down. There are a number...

I went in late october, thus there were no crowds to endure. The revolving view of the city is spectacular. It's made even more so, if you're enjoying a huge assortment of mussels fresh from the waters of the Canadian Maritimes, at the restaurant.

It's so funny, I was actually afraid to step onto the glass floor! But, the views were great. Personally, I would rather spend the extra money and eat at 360, then view the observation deck, since the prices for the observation deck are so high. But, it is a great way to see the city.

I came here with my father-in-law who is afraid of heights. I honestly don't know how he didn't have a heart attack, but he was a good sport about it. The views from the top are amazing and the glass floor make even those who aren't scared of heights feel a little queezy when looking down. Something everyone should see...

I was hesitant to go here at first but oh well there is nothing to lose. The price was not that bad for the kind of experience you can get being on top of the highest tower and seeing 360 degrees view. The only thing I did not like was it was too crowded and it takes long to go...

At $35 per adult (including tax) this is one of the most over-priced tourist attractions I've come across. The quality of the experience was maybe worth 2.5 stars, but add in the greediness of the attraction and it goes down at least half a star.Your $35 gets you only to two floors of the large, middle disk. If you...

CN tower tours are very well organized. We came at a quiet time of year which allowed us to see a lot more with no line-ups. Great to have a refreshment in the restaurant also with great service and views.

A must in Toronto, though a bit expensive. Offers fantastic views, especially of the coast and the airport on the island with planes taking off and landing. Oh, and the glass floor is great to sit on!
We bought the Toronto City Pass and include CN Tower entrance. My 3yrs old daughter loved the view and the glass floor. Impressive!!!!

Great view on a sunny winter day (and winter = no smog) with low wind (we were told that they close the outdoor walkway in even a light to medium wind). Buy tickets online in advance. Go late afternoon in sunshine and stay to watch the lights come on -- fantastic. Lots to appreciate in the view of course but...
Going to the CN tower is an excellent choice though the lines are long and the tickets are pricey, the breath taking views and experience is well worth the wait and money!

Congratulations to Toronto, is a great site and a tremendous engineering achievement. 360 view is outstanding and if you are lucky can see the niagara falls from the sky dome for additional 12 CAD in a clear day.

We thought this attraction was way too pricey. We did not go up higher to the sky deck. We bought just a basic ticket to observation deck which included a movie. The movie was very boring and not related to CN Tower, slightly disappointed. View of the city from the observation deck was really nice. And the glass floor was...
Really worth going up there and visiting the restaurant if you are going to Toronto. It is a great way to see the city and worth the money.I would recommend.
It will give you a beautiful view of the city but that's all it is. Just not my thing, and not worth the money

If I had have had more time there I would have done the edge walk also, just to see the view from the top! You can get great pictures done there from the level with the glass floor. Plus the views are good

This is a really good attraction with some of the best view ive ever witnessed from the 360 degree viewing tower. Glass floors are really scary (if you don't like heights , which i don't), its right in the middle of an area which contains The Rogers Centre (sporting events) and Aquarium so you can go down there for the...

Quite expensive to eat in the restaurant but I would definately dine rather than just paying to go up the tower.. Try to go up at around 8.00 so you can see the view from day time to night time.. Food is good too..

One of Toronto's biggest tourist attractions. Thus they charge way too much in my opinion. The week before visiting I went to chicago and went up the the sears tower. It was much cheaper and the walk out leg was far more fun and scary than the glass floor in the CN Tower. The fact you need to pay extra...

When in Toronto visiting our son, we took a tour of the CN Tower. It is a good way to see the City of Toronto. It is a bit expensive but if you are new to the City you should go and do this. The CN Tower gives a great view of one of the tallest building in Canada. We...

If you can afford it, making a reservation to eat at the 360 makes the whole trip easy and delicious. We were whisked up - no waiting, had a window seat and were never rushed as we stayed for one and a half hours. Our waiter was informative and even gave us a tip on how to avoid the wait...

The whole idea of going was a surprise to me, but in the end I love the memory. It's hard to shell out the money beforehand, but afterwards you realise it was one of those things that's worth it. Standing on the glass floor and looking down gets your heart rushing, the 360 restaurant is neat (though damn pricey. The...

Loved the view of city - had a drink and snack in Horizons Restaurant - good - tickets far to expensive - film was not very good - didn't do ride because of wait - when buying tickets, staff did not give us any other options for ticket price.

Eating at the 360 revolving restaurant was one of the highlights of our stay in Toronto. Its only $23 more than the general admittance and you get to avoid any queues and have a good quality 3 course meal whilst the restaurant revolves to bring the view to you! Would highly recommend.

fantastic night out with all the city lit up below you, we had a meal at the sky top restaraunt very classy , but i spent more time looking out the window rather than looking at my date.walking on the glass floor is not for the faint hearted.

The view from the floors are ok, and the glass floor is usually loved by children. Its pretty cool to be able to look at Lake Ontario and spot some cities in the distance. For the price you pay to go up and get the view, in my opinion, you are better off going to the 360 restaurant, enjoying a...

We loved it! Over 400meters on the sky looking down its freaking awesome. Our son enjoyed the glass bottom, where he could walk on and look down.Not to much people and we had no waiting time.The skypod was scary (for me) I felt how the movements because of the hard winds. "Normally the tower moves between 1 to...
Before you go make sure that the weather is good so you can enjoy a great view of the Toronto area. It has also a restaurant but we didn't stayed to eat, it's on the pricey side.

It's a great view on the right day, but really....$100 for a family of 4?It's not the main thing in Toronto anymore....time to drop the price to what it's worth...about $10 per person seems fair....just sayin'.....

What a spectacular view. Rotating restaurant ( expensive ) but the view is incredible. A few interactive games and rides for the kids and a very pricy gift shop. Went once but no need to really go again.

I meant to visit the CN tower during the day, to enjoy the view. However, the visit got delayed and I reached there around 5. Had already booked tickets online and printed them off, so no worries there (costed me roughly $45 each, all in). Watched a 3D movie, and there was a ride as well. Finally got upstairs around...

This was an amazing experience! I am really glad that we decided to go up. I was a bit nervous at first stepping into that elevator with the glass all around and the glass panels in the floor...but it was very interesting to see everything on the way up as well as down the elevator rail. When we reached the...

Can, t believed the views from the very top, the baseball stadium looks that small and I found it was well worth a visit if you have the time. I wen't on business so the time was limited whilst waiting for flight back. But you can't go their without going up the tower.

We visited this tower with my family on new years day.. We wanna do the edge walk but arent available because of the weather condition.. From the moment i step in the elevator going to the top i was in an awe already.. It was really a beautiful sight above.. A breathtaking moment.. I was glued watching airplanes taking on/off.....

We had gone over to see Niagara Falls, try to spend a day or two at the Falls. That evening we had dinner at the CN Tower in Toronto. It was a beautiful view, a wonderful dinner and a perfect setting for dinner for two.

CN tower offers magnificent views but the 360 degrees view is obscured by the restuarant. The only cool thing is the glass floor. For CAD36 with taxes, there is not much of an experience since many other observation decks in other parts of the world such as Shanghai World Financial Center and Taipei 101 have more modern elevator trips and...

I think the CN tower is amazing. The glass floor is pretty amazing and the ability to walk on the outside (protective area) was great, you can really get a sense of the city from up there. And I enjoyed being able to look out into NYS, though you need a clear day for that

Went during sunset, it was the best time to see Toronto in both daylight and darkness, we were able to walk up and get our tickets with no queue whatsoever. The view was amazing from the height and the glass floor really does make your heart jump into your mouth. Mark this attraction as a must do whilst in Toronto,...

We visited the tower on a trip to Toronto. The views on a clear day are tremendous. Downtown Toronto is a beautiful city and we thoroughly enjoyed the wide panorama that we were able to see from the tower.
Been up a few towers in my time and this is as good as any. Good views, some glass to jump on and a nice dining experience.
We loved the CN tower and all of the amazing views! I especially loved the see-throuh glass floor section as it was very thrilling to lie on it!! Great souvenir shop too :)
Was an ok experience - glad I did it with the kids - very overpriced for what it was - movie there was not relevant and boring
I like the CN tower! When we stand on top, my son felt so excited to see the scene of the city! And we enjoyed the dinner there as well! My son said he'd like to go back!

A great experience for young and old. Getting there is easy by TTC or GO-Train. Experience starts in the elevator going up. Everyone should have a chance to see Toronto from this height. A sight to remember. Downfall..don't drive Toronto roads are the worst!
It was very expensive we bad a lot of family members with us and the they said oooo boy no go back there again sorry
You must visit this place. We're lucky that our friends invited us to check out this place and what a great experience.Highly recommended!
Menu is too limited. Not a great selection for vegetarians. Fixed menu needs to have more of a choice.

I took my children Here when they were young and they loved to jump Up and Down on the glass floor and scare their mother. It Is cool to see everything from this far up and looking at the little mice people below certainly makes you feel small

If you are younger the food has more flavours to appeal to the older generation. But it was still worth it to slowly eat the meat and watch the view from all angles. I went for lunch though not supper so also keep that in mind.

You'd save a ton of money to take your own pictures and get them developed/printed at Walmart or another picture studio. I paid too much for pictures of my girlfriend and I on the glass floor, really wish I brought my own camera. I loved the observation deck as well, for someone who has vertigo I had a lot of...

Spectacular views are I guess the reason you visit the CN Tower. With the Skypod viewing area under refurbishment and therefore out of bounds, and no access to the outside area, the trip up the tower was, for me, a little disappointing. Still, couldn't visit Toronto and not do it.

I'm somewhat of a building nerd, so as soon as I booked the trip to Toronto for my husband and myself the first attraction I booked was the CN tower! I purchased passes online for the 15% discount offered at the time and went ahead and also got the Sky Pod add-on for both of us.Positives:- Nice professional...

I went to the CN Tower with my family in early August. We pre-booked before we went to the tower and were greeted respectfully by the ground staff.
