It's a 'must do' in Toronto and it was definitely worth the cost. Due to the Arctic weather the outside viewing area was closed, although this is outside of their control I felt the ticket should have been discounted due to this. The glass floor was pretty fun once the few dozen screaming kids left. Should be some control by...
Even it was a must do list, it was not that exciting. You can tie to rope and hang from the tower on summer time if you are looking for thrilling experience.
Food is great and extremely good value of you deduct the cost of just going to the observation deck. Restaurant spends 72 minutes to do one round. Great menu, good price, highly recommendable.

My partner and I visited the CN Tower on my birthday and fortunately the weather was really good. Definitely an attraction to do on a clear day. The views are great and you can see the Island. On the ride up you go in an elevator with clear windows so you can watch as you head up, though personally I...

The cn tower is only fun if you like heights otherwise i dont think there is a point in going because all you do is see the city and most days in toronto have bad weather so you cant see that much. To sum it up un less you love heights and love going on an edge that is over...

Of course we had 3 lovely days of clear skies and sun only to have our reservation at 360 on a foggy, gray sky day! That being said, the lunch we had was phenomenal, the service was wonderful, and it is a very interesting destination. Would love to go back and do the harness walk outside someday!

What's a visit to Toronto without a CN Tower tour? I have been to the CN Tower several times and its always a very nice experience. The view of the city from the CN tower is just breathtaking! The small section of glass floors also provides a nice peak of the city below.

Its a must do if you are visiting Toronto, we went to the observation deck which is 346m and the higher 447m Skypod - both are spectacular. We also had a meal at Horizons which not only offered good reasonable value food but with a great view!

This is a must if you are visiting Toronto, you can see the most amazing view of the city and even test your nerves...brave enough to walk on the glass floor? Yes, it was quite hard but after a while looking down at the city it's not that bad. Definitely worth the experience!

Must see attraction. You can choose going all the way up, or stop somewhere in between. I had an amazing experience with the lenses where you can better view the scenario. It brings everything so much near to you, that you can view Niagara Falls and Rochester, so I was told, on a good clear day.I did not see...

My wife and I went there to celebrate our Birthdays and valetines day!Great restaurant! Service was great! Food we great! Price was OK. Beautiful view of the city. The rotating was not an issue. It only rotates once per 72 minutes.Great dinner with my lovely wife!
We had to go up to the CN tower after being in Burj Khalifa. It was a nice view and we enjoyed the restaurant. Guess it must be done when you are in Toronto !

This wasn't my first visit to the CN Tower but I went with 2 friends who had never been before. I really enjoyed my visit. The views can't be beat and we got some amazing pictures that I'm sure I couldn't have gotten any other way. It's definitely someplace I would bring friends and family to if they had never...

My husband and I recently had dinner in the CN Tower. The food was really good and the service was excellent - the one disappointment was that the weather was dreadful that evening and there was a fog which rendered the view invisible - completely and utterly - all we could see was white fog. We cannot, however, blame the...
A must if you are in town, if you go all the way to the top, you can see a clear view of Toronto, there is a lot of activities inside the building for the whole family, you wont regret it!
The view was great. The food at 360 restaurant just average. Your meal price is going toward the atmosphere.

Worth it for the amazing views and the scary glass floor. Although it was expensive we did pay the extra to go up to the skypod - I don't think it was worth the extra money though as the views were the same.
Loved the CN tower. Have excellent views across the whole of Toronto - we went to the Skypod as well, which was worth the extra money we paid.

My boyfriend and I and two teenage daughters debated on whether to spend the money on this attraction (me not being a fan of heights), but in the end we were all glad we did. I was very nervous, as I have done the Top of the Rock in NYC and did not like the open/near the edge feel, nor...
Lines are a bit long for safety, do I'd have to assume peak hours could be quite cumbersome...Skip the meal, just enjoy the view, and the glass floor OMG !!

The Tower is well worth the cost and time to get the best view in Southern Ontario. On a clear day you can see Niagara Falls. If you are an adventurist and brave, try the Sky Walk (seasonal) and you wont forget the experience. Good food and beverages in the restaurants. For a full dinner on the weekends you should...
I visited here back in 2002, with family. Just great! An amazing view and if you're brave enough also - I recommend standing ON the glass panel!
Stunning views from all levels, Plexiglass clear floor where you can look straight down to ground level (kinda creepy). A must do in Toronto for sure!

Don't think it the tallest in the world any more but still impressive The weather was great consequently so was the view. Diner was just OK and pricey but all things considered it was a great family night out

I really enjoyed my visit to the CN Tower. It wasn't particularly busy which meant there were no queues or lots of people.Obviously the main attraction is the view however there's also some interesting facts and the glass floor is incredible - funny seeing that some people wouldn't walk on it though...Take some time and get more bang...

We ate dinner at the 360 restaurant in the CN Tower which gives you free access to the viewing level as well. Honestly the views from the restaurant (especially due to the low lighting levels) were for more exceptional. But if you want to skip dinner I'd suggest going to the tower at least. We went at night and although...
My wife and I ate lunch on the CN Tower. While it was not cheap, we both said it was one of the best parts of our trip. It was a very relaxed slow paced meal and the Short Ribs were awesome.

As the highest vantage point in Ontario the CN tower obviously offers fantastic views. If you go up on a clear day you get a tremendous view of both the city and the lake. The lift ride up and the glass floor are other parts of this attraction that make a visit to the tower a good way to spend...

The dining experience was fantastic. Waiting extremely helpful and polite, and obviously the view is second to none even on a cloudy day it's going to be a good time. When you pay for the dinner you get to see the glass floor and go up for free as it's all included in the price, so dinner is definitely the...

The view is great, but that's the only great thing here. The exhibit is outdated, seems like it was done in the eighties when I was born, they did add some infos, but it really needs to be refurbished. It's really not worth 36$ for a single entry.

The CN tower is great if it's your first visit to Toronto or you haven't been to the tower before. Also great for kids. It is very pricey though and the appeal wears off once you've seen it before. Make sure you check out the glass floor!

I'm pretty shaken by heights, so this was a bit masochistic on my part but I like to push myself sometimes... Anyways, the views are unparalleled and the whole space is great. There's a section of the tower that is made of glass so you can stand on it and see (and feel) the height. Only the brave step on...

I was hesitant to book the 360 restaurant at the CN Tower but I'm really glad I did it! The meal includes the elevator ride and going to the observation deck as well as the looking glass (which cost about $30 a person on it's own). The food was ok. Nothing out of the world, but the view is!I...
Perfect time with kids and fun experience. Nice 3D movie and rides. Perfect gift shop! Convenience walking surrounding restaurant

It's the CN Tower...you just have to do it! The tyour is way overpriced and the food is absolutely terrible. Talk about bland and preserved. Everything tasted like it was overheated in a microwave. Good martinis though! Definitely get your money's worth there...especially with the altitude. Be careful when you get back on the ground!

This place is amazing. I have a fear of heights but the view was so amazing I had to enjoy it. There is an outdoor area with a mesh floor, a clear glass area to walk on, food, and you can even hang off the top with a safety line if you are that crazy...Only negative was the wait to...

The fixed price menu in the revolving restaurant includes entrance and lift to the top is just a few dollars more than just the entry ticket so is good value. Book early to get a table by the window and the 360 degree is just spectacular. It is great to see planes take off below you from the Toronto Island...
Great views from above, outrageously expensive to get there. CAN$ 36.16 is way too much for a view over the city and lake Ontario

Despite an initial vertigo episode, this was fantastic experience with brilliant views across Toronto and beyond (I couldn't quite see the my house from there though!). The whole attraction was well managed and the trip to the top took about a minute. It was the height of the season but it wasn't too crowded which for me is a plus....

Fantastic views of the city. A bit pricey but worth the money and trip. This is included in the must-get city pass which also gives you admission to a movie and ride. If you're daring enough (I'm not!), the Edgewalk seems amazing!

We ate here during our stay in Toronto. It's a lovely restaurant and the food is nice. The price is normal for Toronto but quite expensive compared to the uk. We spent £250 for 2 people with a bottle of wine. Definitely worth a visit though.

Toronto is a city that can easily be done in about 3 days, especially in winter when outdoor options are limited. The CN Tower is a must-see on any trip to Toronto, regardless of season. A couple of tips here: if you're going to the Royal Ontario Museum, Casa Loma, Ontario Science Center as well, you might strongly want to...

The tower is massive and certainly demands attention. When you go in, you have quite the array of options as far as tickets. There is general admission, then other tickets that include things such as the observation deck and the elevator that goes all the way to the top. I believe they also offer an adventure attraction where you get...

This was amazing and breath taking. I absolutely loved being up in the sky so high, the feeling of my ears popping because of the high altitude. I had the feeling that I was on top of the world. Basically, it takes a minute for the elevator to get you up to the observation deck. Then you can walk around,...

If you go to Toronto, this is obviously the place to be! Choose a sunny day or else it won’t be worth it! The view from top is out of this world, and is worth waiting endlessly for the elevators. Buy your tickets in advance as not to wait in line, and once you’re at the top, go ahead, and...

We dined at the CN tower with friends from Hong Kong, we and they thought the over all experience was great. The revolving restaurant was great, and finished with sunset at the observation deck. Lovely .

The market for tall structure observatories seems to be as hot as ever with new tall buildings cropping up all over Asia and the Middle East. The CN tower, to its credit, has done a lot to try to add to its appeal over the years.The tower has become a bit like the county fair. You pay to get...

I visited this in '07 or '08. You haven't really visited Toronto until you've experienced the view from what used to be the tallest tower in the world... It's the number one thing people ask about if you've visited the city!

It's been several years since we visited CN Tower, but it is a memory we'll cherish forever! Don't miss an opportunity to visit. It should be on your bucket list. Though I have forgotten many of the details of the visit, the views of mega city Toronto were breathtaking and the food was wonderful. A must do!! We visited "before"...

This Tower is 533 Meters high. Best view of the city. I would recommend you going at dusk so you can see the city in the light, and at night. Remember to turn off your flash when you take pictures into the windows. Also they have a sky walk you have to book ahead, but the ride up is included...

The CN Tower is something you have to do at least once while visiting Toronto. It gives you unrivalled views over the lake and the city. Glass boxes allow you to step over the height of the building, and are terror inducing if you're afraid of heights. There are lots of little informational boards and things to read around. The...

It's a must, really. Nowhere else quite like it. Entertaining guide went through what presumably is his usual patter in the superfast lift that took us up - saying so much without drawing breath! Observation deck was great fun - especially watching people who didn't know there was a glass floor standing on it and then looking down and discovering!...
Very good visit, nice view. Love the glass floor. Restaurant was very good. Would come back again. Prcie a bit high, but it was worth it. It was a bit crowded on the weekend.
This was the perfect Sunday afternoon outing with the family. Plenty to see and do, and a decent lunch. An all around great day!
Great visit, awesome views and fun. We loved the glass floor!! The views of Toronto were spectacular. Was a little crowded when we visited. Fabulous couple of hours.

For a high throughput tourist destination i found that this facility was exceptionally well organized for its age.Whilst the pricing felt a little high, it was worth the cash, especially the "little extra" to get all the way to the highest viewing platform - simply stunning views.The initial lift up is fun and fast! the view during this...

You haven't had the full Toronto experience unless you've been up the CN Tower and walked the glass floor. No sky walk when I went but looking out the glass is scary enough :S (I went a few years back)It's basically like most towers with a view except this one's a lot taller than usual, so worth the trip...

You see this on TV all the time well it was on our to do list during our stay. Staff were friendly and helpful and we went up during the evening and the night view was amazing. Staff were very knowledgeable, a must do if you are in Toronto.
What a good attraction and fairly priced in my opinion. Great views from the Top. We also had food from the Café at the base which was also good and fairly priced.

wow what a great view of the city, worth going just to look out. The staff and atmosphere were great, the food was good but just slightly below what i would expect for the price. The dining area rotates very slowly to show all of the city which is very cool, however if you are prone to motion sickness or...

I stayed in Toronto for one full day en route to Quebec, and I was determined to go up the CN Tower. It was a once in a lifetime thing for me, as I live in the UK. The day I visited was bright, but visibility was not 100% -- the ticketing staff told me I might want to hold...
Once your up there, the title of the review says it all. The food is not up to much, but it is pricey, remember they have no competion up at that height, best to eat first then do the tower.

Visiting the tower is a little costly ($32 + tax per adult), but there are restaurants, an arcade, a short-film movie theater and observation decks, so it's easy to see where the money goes. We went up while it was still daylight and had an appetizer at the Horizons restaurant while we waited for nightfall. The views were nice, and...

If you are afraid of heights, dont do it!!!! Other than that its a basic go up really high and see the city. We got lucky and went on a clear night so we could see for miles. Apparently there is a lot of smog and fog in toronto so you probably wanna look up at the weather before spending...
Brilliant, Had been some 20 years beforeThis time we did pick the right dayThe sun was out the sky was blue and clear, the perfect view.staff were nice and helpful.

Have made a few trips up the CN.Learned the lesson of going early to avoid time-dragging queues.Fantastic views around Toronto.All visits have been an experience but it is good to have a relaxing drink when visitor numbers shrink a bit.

My husband went on the CN Tower as a child and when we were planning our trip to Toronto the CN Tower was the first thing he mentioned. We purchased a City Pass, which included General Admission to the Tower.If we hadn't went with the City Pass I would have been thoroughly upset with the amount of money we...

It's a great architectural achievement with great views, but totally overrated and overpriced. I can't imagine a moderate income family being able to afford this and I don't think I'd recommend the splurge

The CN Tower was great and the views amazing including being able to stand on the glass floor. The ride simulator that was thrown in was good also and the shop had loads of nice things. The restaurant is great for it's revolving nature and views of the city but the food an acquired taste perhaps. Highly recommend the tower.
this has great viewing platform with glass floor for the more adventurous. now also has the walk about the out side. The veiw over the city and lake can be spectacular depending on the weather.

The CN Tower is a nice place to visit if you go to Toronto. The only drawback is the fact that there are no parking lots really close to the CN Tower and if it is cold (I mean... really cold!) you may have some hard time to get from your car to the tower and back.I would strongly...

The CN tower is definitely a must see when visiting Toronto, but let's face it : it's just too expensive for what it is (as are most of the attractions in Toronto). Yes, the views from the top are amazing (you sometimes can't even get to the highest point during winter, which is very disappointing considering the price), but it's...
Great attraction to see and visit! You can even go for a walk on the edge if you have the guts too! A must see and do!

I visited Toronto in September and was lucky enough to visit the CN tower. I have to admit I'm not a fan of heights but I felt I couldn't not go up the CN tower! We were fortunate that the day we went visited was a beautiful one with clear skies with very little wind. The lift up was spectacular...

column3: Newcastle upon Tyne, England, United Kingdom
column4: Not too expensive. Great views from the top. The glass floor at the top is very freaky and it takes some people a while to pluck up the courage to stand on it (I didn't dare)!

Every time i have visited toronto the price of the CN tower has creeped up, it does provide amazing views of the city but i'd encourage people to look online for various discount codes (e.g. maybe using a canadian air miles card for a discount) before turning up.

$36 for the basic entrance is very expensive for a tower visit in my opinion (compared to World Financial Center or Pearl Tower in Shanghai for example). Buy online minimum 24 hours in advance to get 15% off. You get a great view of Toronto though, the glass floor is intriguing. As with any tower, I would not recommend to...
The CN tower is a great monument one should not miss. You can see miles of Toronto in a stretch from a 360 degree view. Maybe a little pricey to get in but on the whole it was a good experience.

With great trepidation I entered the outside elevator of the CN tower Toronto. After a dizzying express ride to the top. I stepped out into a beautiful restaurant and amazing evening view of Toronto. The meal was superb, and I saw in the New Year with great gusto with the rest of the patrons. A very friendly atmosphere and when...

Well what a place to go to you can see for miles and see most of Toronto as well <I went there with grandchildren they sure did enjoy the glass floor .The food at the 360 restaurant was good but the price was a bit step

Very little in the way of displays about the construction or what you could see. Glass floor area small and crowded. The whole experience could be so much better with some updating! Way overpriced for what you get!

I loved going to the CN Tower. It was great. We ate at the 360 restaurant. That paid for our admission to the Tower. Lunch was kind of high... but good good food. The 360 Restaurant is just like it sounds... the restaurant goes around so you can see the entire city below in 72 minutes. Great for picture takers...

Great views of the city accompanied by a buzz of excited and cheerful tourists, eagerly taking photographs. buildings and sculptures from so high up. Good time to go up is late evening to catch city by day, into sunset and then into night.Make sure you visit the top 360 restaurant, great place to eat on top of the world...

The tower itself is spectacular to behold from a distance, but unfortunately grey concrete when you get close to it. It is quite a sight, the needle that hits 553.33m. I did the Edge Walk, so the general admission for the observation level AND the SkyPod was included. The lines to enter where not to long, and after ten minutes...
Really enjoyed the CN Tower.Staff was very helpful, honest and pleasant.We were surprised with the 4D venues.Gift shop had many educational gifts.

A worthy addition to your Itinary just to experience the glass floor. Great views of the city and the pricing is adequate. Would recommend you give this a go, perhaps start early to avoid lengthy queues,

The view at night is definitely better! As well as avoiding the crowd. The Skypod isn't much crazier in terms of the view, maybe it's because I've been up in Burj Khalifa before it, but still, an extra 12$? Go for it!

You get a great view of Toronto on a clear day, giving you a good idea of the layout of the city and where points of interest are. Unfortunately on the lake side there is a restaurant so you are resricted to what you can see, unless of course if you eat there. There is a large area that is...

Edge walk is amazing - my wife is not afraid of heights so she had a blast pushing the limits (trying to swing off the tower - this is not allowed and you will get scolded) i am afraid of heights, but felt safe as each person is attached by 2 separate laniards that can each support 1000 lbs. The...
If You wants to say "wow" You should go there.From the Tower You can see the whole city and If the weather nice and clear You can see the Niagara:)Go and enjoy:))

I decided to go to the CN tower while on a business trip in Toronto in November. It is quite expensive ($35+) and I quickly regretted my decision to not buy something else with that money. The view is nice, but that's about it. I later checked into my room at the Intercontinental Hotel only to discover that the view...

The day we went here was fairly overcast, but at the time we thoguht it would be our only free day in the city. You couldn't see that far due to the weather, but you could still see the city.I felt this was really over priced given the amount of time we spent there. Once you had had a...

Just amazing! Even the elevator ride! The prices are worth it- you can stay as long as you want, at least I think you can. I paid the extra money to go to the Skypod, and I thought it was really cool!I feel like if you're going to be vacationing in Toronto, you need to go to the top...

On a recent quick two day business trip to Toronto, my colleagues and I had a team building dinner at the famed CN Tower, and it was definitely the highlight of the trip. The experience is somewhat surreal and is definitely something that I would recommend to anyone who visits Toronto. The view was spectacular and again it is really...

This was the highlight of our eating out. The 360 restaurant was amazing, the view was spectacular, we had the opportunity to experience the late afternoon to early evening sunset. Something we will do again if we had the chance.

I am biased against spending a lot of money to go up a tower to see a view but the CN Tower is ALWAYS worth the price of admission. The view is spectacular and the terror of standing on the glass floor and looking ALL the way down to the street is unmatchable. It is a fun people watching spot...

Waited in line for about a half hour total to get tickets and get to the top-not bad at all! Fabulous view..weWent at night and it was gorgeous. Glass bottom was just a small area itWas okay but outside was much better. Didn't do skypod we heard it wasn't worth the extra money. The basic entrance ticket we...

went to the top and had a great drink cheap as well then tried to walk on the glass ceiling and its a long view down I dare anyone not to worry for at least a second or two.staff really nice and good value for money.

Great experience, very fast lift, you get searched before you go in and go through a scanner, my daughter got picked out and searched more, they went through her bag and she had loads of chocolates they asked if we feed her, they were very polite and nice. The glass floor was very popular, the view was fantastic, the other...

The tickets are a bit pricey and they try to sucker you into buying their photos of you, but it's otherwise a great thing to see.The kids also had a great time, and especially enjoyed the glass floor. Not for those that are faint of heart, though!The only caution would be about the restaurant at the top. I...

View was amazing. All staff were pleasant. Went up for dinner, got our picture taken and was told it would be available for purchase at our dinner table. No picture came. After dinner we were told to call a number to the photo company. They had left for the day and said to view picture on-line. Was a shame.

For the best CN Tower experience I highly recommend going on a clear, sunny day. The tower has a lot to offer from a restaurant 114 stories up to the Edge Walk where you can walk on the outside of the tower to enjoying some photography of Toronto or the scared look in friends' faces when they walk on the...
Definitely recommend this.. and would advise to have dinner here too... food was amazing and the views to die for.

We planned a lovely dinner at the top of the CN Tower.....and because of the weather we missed out on the beautiful view. I am definitely not blaming the weather on the management, but do want to note that it is not worth the trip up unless the skies are cloudless.

This is one of the icon of the city will you miss it? It is not the tallest tower in the world any longer but it is still impressive. Do not skip the glass floor unless you suffer from vertigo; it gives you a good idea of where you are. We did have dinner on top and it was OK

I went here with my SO and it was very nice to see the city (and the islands). We went for dinner at the restaurant and then went out to the platform to have a look around (and to see if we could see our house from up high haha). As a foreigner in Canada it was nice to see...

It would be hard to separate CN Tower and Toronto as they're one in the same. CN Tower tops Toronto's skyline so it only made sense that we headed there first when arrived in the city. We went at night since the tower was lit and it turned out to be a great decision as the tower was lit, and...
We were fortunate to visit in quiet time and enjoyed the view of frozen Ontario Lake. You can walk on the glass and see the view from the bottom. It pays off to visit through Toronto City Pass.
If you'd like to see for miles, and the weather co-operates, it's a good place to visit.The restaurant is expensive and not worth the trouble or the $$$$

Even though it's a little expensive, the cost was worth the view from the CN tower--it's a little like going to the Statue of Liberty on Staten Island, or the top of the Empire State Building in NYC, or to the top of the Sears Tower in Chicago. Admire the sleek lines of the tower, enjoy the view, relax.

This is a tall tower in the middle of a city and so you get what you expect … good views. Since the Empire State Building this type of experience is hardly earth-shattering but it is worth the effort.

Of course you have to go up the CN Tower when in Toronto. It is expensive for what it is, and we did pay the extra for the 'Pod' experience which I really have to wonder why. The views at sunset were spectacular, the coloured light show around the Tower at night was pretty cool... much like the weather outside...

The CN Tower, on arriving in downtown Toronto, is a very imposing sight. However, standing alongside the structure is an amazing experience -- all 553 metres of it! My wife and I were on a Thomas Cook escorted tour, of the USA and Canada, so the tickets for the visit were sorted for us -- we just had to ascend...

The entry fee is on the high side, but the view from the top is well worth it. The tower is so iconic that you really do have to take a trip up there.The glass fronted lifts are an experience in themselves, and the glass floor is certainly not for the faint hearted!Helpful, friendly staff when we visited...
Well, if you are in Toronto you might as well do it. It's fun and if the day is clear the view is beautiful. I thought it was pricy but I had a good time there.

Wasn't planning to come here but did so to pass some time. Compared to other towers in the world this is very average. And relatively expensive too at 30+ dollars for general admission only. They could do with some little signs around the place to indicate places of interest. Staff were also a bit sullen. Give it a miss.
The view from the viewing gallery is awesome. the experince of standing on the glass roof is an experince of its own kind. lifts are pretty fast and well managed however the price is a bit steep.

Had dinner at the CN tower restaurant on my birthday and it was amazing! The night view was just breathtaking, the food was really good and the service excellent. It is not the cheapest, but definitely worth it!

My husband and I visited the CN Tower when in Toronto. We paid for the SkyPod in addition to the general admission. While it was nice to go higher, it definitely wasn't worth the cost. This was definitely something that we wanted to do, but I can say that we'd never go again. Definitely a big tourist attraction, but fun...

This was something my wife and I visited while we were in Toronto for a long weekend getaway. It was fairly expensive to take an elevator to the top and, while the views were gorgeous, I don't think we would go there again when we visit Toronto next. That being said, I believe it is one of those iconic touristy...

The admission is pretty high, but the experience is great and memorable. The glass floor is thrilling and the viewing platform options are nice. The restaurant is expensive and their wine cellar seemed all right. Overall a must if in Toronto.

We took the trip to the highest point on the tower and my grandson really enjoyed the view and the trip up the elevator. Lots of fun and beautiful scenery, the day we were there we could see the town of Niagra.

It is the trade mark of Toronto.It has all the little things that make a tourist get his memory. It has a restaurant, the food is average but price. Buffet is a bite better. The view for downtown Toronto and Lake front is very good.

Nothing special about this place, given that there are so many similar towers around the world now with much more to do. This tower essentially gives you an average view of the city, as well as the glass floors (just a portion) through which you can see all the way down to the ground. Besides that, nothing else.

i loved the view from up there! there was this glass floor that made it seem like you're about to fall! my friend was scared of the glass floor but i made them go on it! the CN tower was so cool! the view was cool, you could even see a lake!

first time in toronto you have to go the CN tower. We decided to buy the meal package, wish we hadn't. Glad we went up, but also know when I go back don't have to do it again. food was not good, just do tour.
its something you have to do bit pricey but the view makes up for it and if your brave enough the sky walk well let s just say you will never forget it

My boyfriend and I visited Toronto over Thanksgiving, and we went to visit the CN Tower on our first day. The Tower is pretty cool looking from afar and is a nice touch to the skyline. We were surprised to learn that a ticket to the top costs over $30, with an additional $12 to go to the top lookout....
If you are in Toronto, the CN Tower has to be on your list to visit. The restaurant is excellent, and the views are just spectacular. Yes it is expensive, but worth every cent.
When I am in Toronto, I always make it to the CN tower. Enjoy going to the top. I was going to do sky walk, but it was to cold for me and I will do it next time

Make sure that you go to the top of the CN Tower on a clear day.Tip: Ride to the top of the CN Tower for free by dining at the 360 Restaurant in the CN Tower and ordering an entree or fixed price menu. The food is excellent!

Amazing view 110 stories up above Toronto is well worth the price of admission. The restaurant rotates around the observation deck as well. On a clear day you can see forever...or at least to Niagara Falls/Buffalo across Lake Ontario
Well touristy or not you really have to try it to experience it!! A-Mazing!! You really do need to put your own words to this attraction.

OK...this will be short and sweet! I planned a day to drive from Niagara Falls to Toronto (NOT a quick drive), and this was one of the main attractions that I chose. Well, I was VERY disappointed once I got to the area. I have traveled within the U.S. and overseas, and I understand that it costs to visit attraction,...

Insane admission fees for such a second rate attraction. Long lineups for going up and down. Dont go to the very top, this will only cost you extra (money, but above all 1 hour line up time), and on 90% of the days you wont see any more or better.The restaurant on top is good quality-wise, you pay for...
best view of Toronto. If you have a chance you should try out the 360 restaurant as well. The food is great!
A special treat for out-of-town guests. Dinner at the top includes the elevator ride cost. Prices in the diningroom are quite high, but worth the view!

CN Tower is the heart of Toronto.Its USP is the Glass Elevators from which you get the view of Toronto while climbing up.Once in..the Tower u can walk on the Glass floor inside the tower which gives you the view right to the ground.If you are looking for some more thrill.. try sky walking. it is amazingly adventurous.Also,...

My husband proposed to me at the CN tower! At the 360 revolving restaurant, the top of the tower, it's an amazing view. As we took the elevator up I had a flood of memories wash over me as we climbed higher and higher. Memories of visiting when I was a kid, with my parents and sister in the middle...

A must do in Toronto, fun for the whole family. Something everyone should experience once. It was something I made sure to share with my daughter when she was old enough to enjoy it. As well, if one if inclined, the 360 restaurant is also quite the experience.

The CN Tower is an amazing thrill to the right people as you can walk on a glass floor in the observation deck and do lunch or dinner or dance in the Bar. Then if you are not done you can go up on the top of the tower and do the Edge Walk where you are strapped in and...
Go once! I was dubious but would certainly say it's worthwhile to do once! Pricey enough but I was pleasantly surprised by the experience.

like any such tower, the views are excellent on a clear day, not so much in November, but yes in summer. fairly expensive, long lines, a little tired in places, but the food pretty good. It is a tourist destination so don't expect anything but a tourist spot, but it's still worth a visit (it will probably be your first...

Its been a few years since I've been, but it's a must do on your first visit to Toronto. Great restaurant at the top and for thrill seekers, try the new Edge Walk experience at 356 meters above Toronto!
Awesome 360 view of the city and surrounding. Glass bottom floor at the top for the brave, revolving restaurant, adjacent to the Roger center and the convention center.

What can be said about this tower that hasn't. Over all it is what it is. It is a place where you can visit more than once in a lifetime and gives a different angle and feeling at evey stage of life. A must at leat once!!
Exciting to check out CN tower at least once. Children and adults will both enjoy going to see the CN tower, it is a wonderful attraction.

The elevator ride is neat but you need to be near the glass doors to get the full effect of just how fast your going and the view on a clear day is amazing, especially walking around outside. I just think the price is a bit high, we paid about $23 each, i was a little disappointed that the glass...

You can't get much better than the views of CN tower!When you arrive you get taken up a lift and the guide will tell you information e.g how far and fast you are currently travelling. When you exit the lift you are free to walk around. There is a 360 degree view, there is also a glass floor which...

View from the top is awesome, good location for photography. Amateur photographers have a good opportunity to explore long shutter modes and night mode photography. DSLR users get there with wide angle lens and tripod (must have) Visit around evening so that you can see both day light as well as nights.Visiting tower is bit expensive 32$ pp. Book...

The panorama over the city and the huge lake is spectacular, One of the tallest buildings on the planet. The cuisine in the restaurant is consistently excellent. The ride up and the ride down,the elevators, thousands of feet later, are incredibly fast but fun. They actually say after your ride on the elevator " Thank your for flying CN!" This...
If the weather is overcast this is a bust. On a clear day it's amazing! Climbing is a huge pain unless you are a pro.
Great views. Downtown Toronto and Lake Ontario. Next to Rogers Stadium - home of the Maple Leafs. Also next to Ripley's Aquarium.
For me it is a question of scale. I get the same sense of wonder looking out over the city from the top of the TD centre as I do from the top of the CN tower.

going up to the top by elevator was exciting, able to view the lake and city view was great. I love this revolving restaurant giving an even greater view all around. The CN Tower is a main attraction here in Toronto, and while it is a little pricey, it is worth it for trip into the sky and the view.

Even though the high rise condos are dominating the Toronto skyline, the CN Tower is still the place to see commanding overview of this great city. And if you's like to dine with a spectacular view the 360 Restaurant offeris surprisingly good cuisine at comparatively reasonable prices.
really is the best view in the city - plexiglass floor is cool - but go all the way and pop for the Edge Walk - now that is truly awesome.

You get a real appreciation for the size of the Greater Toronto Area from the CN Tower. On a clear day you may be able to make out the spray from Niagara Falls and some of the south shore of Lake Ontario: the USA side. And you can really see how much construction is currently underway in the core. This...
The CN Tower easily gives you a birds eye view of the city vistas. Its a great thing to do at least once in your life time with your family.
Nice place to visit! Dare to walk on the glass floor and enjoy the view! The restaurant has good food, a little pricey.

Great view of the city on a good weather day. The "Edge Walk" and glass floor are exciting and thrilling adventure for those who are not squeamish. Revolving restaurant is expensive, but for something special to celebrate, is worth the price.

You should definitely go to the CN Tower if you are in Toronto. There are a bunch of great things to do. The view is great, of course, but there's also a glass floor where you can test your nerve (I didn't have enough nerve to stand on it myself). For the truly daring, you can walk strap yourself on...

An amazing journey, but at a stiff price. Make sure it is a clear day to take advantage of the amazing views. Don't go if hazy or rainy. The glass floor is unique, and the walk around the open outside area is quite adventuresome on a windy day.
The Tower has been in Toronto for many years and is very popular among tourists - you can see for miles - highly recommended!I have not been there recently but great,,,,,

It is a great thing to do if you love seeing things from really high up. It has an awesome view of Toronto. It also has a restaurant on top that revolves and at night it is really quite spectacular although it is very expensive and the food is not that great.
Very unique experience with fabulous views. Can be line ups. Food okay and a bit pricey, but how can you resist a revolving restaurant? See everything.
Incredible view of Toronto, especially if you go on a sunny day.It's a 360 degree view from up high. Takes courage to view from the glass floor and to look down from there.
When I was a child in the Toronto you could pretty much see the CN Tower from everywhere. It is part of the landscape of the city and as such is part of most people's must do list.

Awesome view of the City and surrounding area. Nice to have a meal in the revolving restaurant, or stand on the glass floor looking straight down. Yikes! Right downtown with lots of parking nearby. On a clear day you can see the spray from Niagara Falls.

FOr a longtime, the CN Tower was the highest free standing structure in the world. It has been surpassed now but it's still a lot of fun and a great way to show friends and family our city - from the glass floor (yikes) to the not bad at all revolving restaurant to the new "hang off the edge" experience,...

Awesome view of Toronto, There is the 360 Restaurant that makes one full rotation of the city within an hour so you can see it all while you eat. The coolest thing is the Edge walk outside that high up, You have to do it!

Haven't been there for a while. The price is way too high (hah, hah), no where to park and if you go into a parking lot, the price is ridiculous. Driving down there is a menace and from what I remember, if you take the subway, you have to walk, even if some of it is indoors. Most of my...
This is a great view of Toronto and area. It's like a view from an airplane. Just be sure it is a clear day before going up or you may see little but clouds.

Despite the City of Toronto getting more and more tall buildings, and new higher free standing towers have been built, none are threatening to overcome the CN Tower for adventure and height. Check the web site for the two charitable stair climbs in the spring and the fall and the adventures of standing outside on the rim. Still the number...

This is a definte must see for tourist. You need to prepare for long lines especially during peak hours and on clear days. There is some interesting facts to learn about the construction of the tower and you can even make a meal of it in the tower restaurants. All in all, the CN Tower is a good experience.

Great family outing....way too expensive! Elevator ride is not for the squeamish...lots of fun, especially for the kids. Best to make certain you save this adventure for a good weather day because you really want to take in the breathtaking views to the max. Restaurant is expensive and you should have reservations, but given this outing is a rare occurance,...
The view is excellent, the revolving restaurant (don't put your purse on the ledge) and their new attraction the Edge Walk (if you are very brave) are the major reasons why it is worth the trip.

The CN Tower is a must for all tourists and Torontonians to visit. Now with Ripley's Aquarium added to your days outing, makes all the more exciting. You can spend a full day enjoying the view and other activities.

I'm not fond of heights, but once you get through the elevator ride, the view is amazing!The restaurant is a lovely spot to grab a bite, just don't put your purse on the side wall because the restaurant revolves and you might lose track of it (even though you don't feel the revolving)

Imagine seeing Toronto as an angel. This is the feeling one gets as they soar to the top of the CN Tower to view the sights below of Toronto. For those adrenaline -junkies, if you feel adventurous and love the sense of flying, get strapped in and lean out over the edge of the tower. Not for the faint of...

Went with my sister who was visiting from overseas, and both of us enjoyed it a great deal. It seemed to be a favorite for kids as there were plenty of families with kids, teens. Also saw many couples, as well as elderly visitors. I would rate this as a Top 3 attraction in Toronto. The elevator ride up was...

The CN Tower is very impressive. What a beautiful view of the city. A great experience, from the moment you ride the elevator and listening to the guide to the moment you leave, you feel the unique thrill.

From the view up top, you get a better appreciation of the beautiful and lively city.During the day, you can see Lake Ontario and the buildings across Toronto.At night, you can see the city light up. Enjoy a romantic dinner.

This experience visiting Toronto should be at the top of your list. The 360* view of the city is amazing. At times you can look down & see the Blue Jays playing at Rogers Centre.Strongly recommend the restaurant. It does a slow revolve approximately 1 hour. You won't even notice the movement while enjoying a delicious meal or Sunday...

CN Tower is probably the best Toronto/ North American attraction. Going to the SkyPod is one of a kind experience I'd recommend to everyone. Best time to go is 1hr before sunset so you can enjoy the view "before" and "after". The city is amazing. If you'd like to enhance the experience step on the outside deck and hear and...
great experience, especially on a sunny day. Lots of other activities too! Now, a new aquarium to visit.

You cannot miss CN Tower ... from almost anywhere in Toronto.And you cannot miss going up to the sky ...You have some exciting activities right there ... walk around outside the tower ... wow!And don't forget about the restaurant.God bless you.

You can't really go wrong with a trip up the CN Tower, unless you're there on a foggy day! There aren't too many places in which you get high enough to actually see the curvature of the earth. It's quite something.The 360 restaurant is good, but incredibly expensive. It's worth waiting for a table by the glass; don't be...

Long line-ups at Peak times of the year. The view is spectacular for a one-time experience. Kids will love the glass floor. Revolving restaurant would be great for a memorable business luncheon. If people want to experience a walk on the outside of the tower, very expensive to do so, but great for thrill seekers. Good for couples, families, business,...
A must-do for all visitors. We recently took visitors from the UK and they were wowed by the views - I have to admit it was pretty impressive. Can be a little pricey but it's a great experience.

CN Tower a must to visit while in Toronto, panoramic views of one of the Top Cities in the World.Beautiful, breathtaking views. Look through this 'Eye of the Needle' and see where the Nations of the World come together in Peace---Toronto!!!

Stepping upto the glass floor at the top is a great experience, the views of the islands and the downtown are nice. The tickets are pricey though and you can get nicer views of the city from restaurants like the Panorama Lounge.
Good family fun, clear days the best, sunsets great! Be sure to walk on the plexi-plass floor! Weekends can be crowded.
Great views! We really wanted to do the Edgewalk as we have heard so many exciting things about it but will have to save that for next trip as we ran out of time.

Went to 360 restaurant omg fabulous experience. Food was delicious and the view was to die for. It revolves very slowly so every time looking out the window the view gets even better. Service was excellent. Prices are ranged very good to cover all courses from $70 up and seperately also and wine choices starting at $12 limited choices depending...

It's just another tall, tall building. If that is what you want to see, you'll probably enjoy it. If you want to get a sense of the city, it is entirely superficial.The best part of the CN Tower is that it is a wonderful landmark from a distance. If you are not sure where you are, you can look...

As a Toronto resident, I usually only visit the CN Tower with visitors. It's gotten better over the years, with more stuff to do and see besides the observation decks. A really good idea to go on a fairly clear day, with good visibility. It's not really necessary to go to the highest level (which costs extra) - the main...
Wonderful. It is fun to go just before dark. Then you get to experience both day and night. The glass floor is amazing.

This is a great place to visit if you are passing through Toronto. It gives a panoramic view of Lake Ontario and of the great city of TOThe ONLY drawback is that you have to get your WALLET out. VERY expensive!!!!

While the tower is an iconic building in Toronto you will find most Torontonians have never spent the money to go to it. I lived directly across from it for over a year and enjoyed the nightly light shows but never felt the need to go up especially after reading the ratings for the restaurant that is thought to be...
Go for lunch - you save the access fee - good food, great view, walkable from most hotelsNew Aquarium opened next door, haven't been but friends say its great
Fabulous view of the city. Should be seen during day as well as night. Showcases how much greenery there is in Toronto
Amazing view, a thrill for kids and panicky moments for some who never even knew they had a fear of heights!
I've never seen such clean public bathrooms! Granite and no paper on the floors. There is a restaurant we didn't eat at, but I've heard the food is not anywhere as good as the view.
Nice to go once, haven't tried the edge walk but very expensive especially for a family. Have eaten there and gone up to the top but went there longer than one year ago.

I always have visitors from out of town visit the CNN Tower! It is the only way to really understand the city - bird's eye view - and it is the only way to appreciate how truly green with mature trees and huge parks Toronto really is!
This is a must see in the big smoke, especially cool on clear day and windy day when it really sways in the wind.
Have lunch in their restaurant on a sunny afternoon - the view is incredible and you can sometimes see the mist from Niagara Falls in the distance!

its all about the view from the top. its very spectacular especially at night when the city is all lit up. I would recommend taking the tour at least once when visiting Toronto. its also worth dining in the revolving restaurant if u can get a table

On a Clear day you can see forever!! If you go there for dinner on the rotating platform (pretty good food!) you can skip the line-ups and there's no fee to go to the obersvation deck! Really worth the experience. I loved the see-through floor!
If the highlight of a city is just a tower then you can't expect much from the city. Highlights: A tall building that overlooks Toronto and a glass floor.Yay!

You can see Toronto from above and experience the wonderful views.Its interesting to visit and also experience the elevator ride when you go up and then come down, its a thrill.And at nightthe CN Tower lights up in diferent colours
What an amazing visit. You can get an amazing view from the city. There is a glass floor which is very unique and thrilling.

I love going up buildings and towers when I travel. The CN Tower is really impressive, but once you are there, there is not much to do. An audioguide or information panels about what you are looking at would be great.

WOW! I've never been this far up in a building in my life! What an awesome experience from the elevator to the very top! The young lady who ran the elevator was very informative of the history of the tower and area. From the observatory the views are priceless and I got the greatest pictures of my life. This attraction...

If you're new to Toronto this is worth doing for the view alone. There's also a bar and restaurant area you can enjoy although it is overpriced given where you are. On the weekends, especially in the summer, the lines can be fair long (30 minutes or more).

Now this is a tall building. It is worth looking at from the street level (and you can see it from every place in the city) and especially worth seeing at night, when the lights are on. If you have the spare time and money, you can also go up for the view. The restaurant is not a necessity: there...

The CN tower is a must see if you are in Canada! It is really cool to look up and say "Holy Cow!" and then to get inside and look down is breathtaking! The glass floor is outstanding! kind of scary but at the same time is a neat experience! a must see!

We visited on the Canadian Thanksgiving weekend (Monday). We did not have to wait for anything at all. Tickets were included with the CityPass (which we felt was a great value) and our kids, aged 8 and 10 were amazed by the glass floor. Prices in the shops were high, but we expected that and just walked down the street...
This is worth doing for the view. There are daredevils that will walk the outside but the view from inside is great.

This was a definite "must do" for us while in Toronto and we were not disappointed.We were very lucky as there was not a cloud in the sky on the day we visited so the views were incredible - we could see for miles and miles!Definitely visit the Skypod - the views are even more spectacular up here....

If you're in Toronto, don't miss the CN Tower, for on a clear day you can actually see all the way to Buffalo, US.The views are amazing, the price very reasonable, lines efficient, and glass floors scary :)Originally coming from a small city, the first time I stepped out from Toronto Union Station I was dazzled by the...

CN Tower is one of those places that is the "face" of the city. Just like the Colisium is for Rome, the Eifel Tower for Paris or the Great Wall is for China, CN Tower is the placed that if you miss, you basically haven't been anywhere in Toronto, therefore, it is one for the "no miss" list.Great views...

The CN tower is one of my seven wonders of the world. I am not alone in listing it as it exists on other lists compiled since only one of the original seven listed still exist. Go on a clear dayotherwise is wasted moneyprice is a little bit expensivegoing up you should sty in the line in front of the elevator s for 20 to 30 minutesonce you are up 1 hour is enough

I have lived in Toronto for many years now. My husband and is a born and bred Torontonian. While we visited the CN Tower before, this time we took in a visit to the Skypod....another 33 floors above the main lookout. $12 extra dollars but worth it if there is good visibility. At night, with city lights below, the view is spectacular.

Wow... was this a great experience. I was there once before in 1995 (I think) and it is just as amazing as I remember. The security to go through didn't take long and everyone was right.. GO EARLY! We didn't have to wait but 3 minutes for an elevator. There were no lines and we were there at 10am. The...

I have been there before but my 11 year old grandson was thrilled. I think the most impressive part for him was looking down through the glass floor and the outside elevator. He was very impressed. Something everyone should do at least once.

I've lived in Toronto my entire life and only recently went up to the top of the tower. It's worth the visit. The food is good, but expensive and the service was excellent.The glass floor didn't live up to the hype for me and the lines can get long so you may want to think about getting a city...

The tallest free standing structure in the Western hemisphere is definitely worth a visit if you're in Toronto for the first time. You go up so high that your ears pop in the elevator!Amazing engineering and architecture. Kids and adults alike will love the view.

This is the my rule with every major city I go, if it's a familiar landmark, I'm on it! But then aren't we all? Aren't we all wanting a slice of that tourist pie? I wanted to cross visiting the CN Tower in downtown Toronto off my list before I left. Wow, it's just like Madame Tussauds or any other...

When visiting Toronto on a family trip we dined in the CN tower. We had to book well in advance as June is a busy month and when we arrived true to form the entire revolving restaurant was full.However, our server was kind and courteous and seated us straight away, introducing himself and handing out our menus and wine...

If you're visiting Toronto the CN tower has to be on your itinerary, it offers stunning views of the city. I suggest that you go in the afternoon and have drinks in the 360 restaurant. I ate dinner as well, but wasn't impressed. Please bear in mind that the CN tower is quite expensive especially if you decide to go...

It was well worth every cent. The staff is knowledgeable & can point out places you would like to perhaps visit. The view was spectacular, as was the food & the presentation. I would recommend going for lunch. There is far more to see. We went there at the beginning of our trip & thought it was a little expensive...

Wanted to pay with US dollars but a 5% convenience charge was applicable, a bit disgraceful when other places took with no trouble. But this is a must do if visiting Toronto but very expensive at $35. A good view though ah ah.

First of all, it's quite an experience going on the external high speed lifts to the observation floors and you seem to reach the destination in the blink of an eye!We had dinner twice in the revolving restaurant at the top of the CN Tower and enjoyed immensely the "moving" landscape whilst so doing. As the Eiffel tower is to Paris, the CN Tower is to Toronto. Just pick a clear day and any wait in line will be worth it. Look to the south to see the commuter aircraft landing below you! The restaurant is over rated although the view can't be beat. Put down the extra few coins to go to the...
Did the CN tower, it was ok had some good pic views but didn't blow my mind but it's something u should do

This was a fun thing to do in Toronto and once you got up there the view was incredible! We timed it to get there late afternoon so got to see the view in daylight, dusk and through to darkness. Had a drink in the Horizons Restaurant and it was very expensive .. a glass of red wine was $14...

Fun Saturday morning spent up the CN tower, I think it is reasonably expensive for what it was but enjoyable none the less. The glass floor was the best bit by far as my brain was playing tricks with my feet as I tip-toed across the platform! If you are going to Toronto, you have to visit it!

Taking the glass elevator was thrilling. It gets you to the top quickly. When you arrive the view is spectacular. There is a glass floor that is 113 stories high completely unnerving to stand on.Decided to forego dinner at the revolving restaurant due to poor reviews and have wine and cheese at the cafe (WAY to expensive)There is...

The CN Tower is worth the visit, for sure. You can see the city from above, which is not common considered the amount of high-rise buildings of Toronto! Amazing is the glass floor: through it you can see the base of the tower, the people walking down there seem ants! The elevator takes only one minute to go from the...

A bit pricey to do solo, but we did the package through City Pass and were happy with this deal. The elevator ride up is fast. We went in July the night Prince Williams son was born and the building was illuminated in blue for the baby boy. There was also a baseball game The Toronto Blue Jays going on...

Having been to the Willis (former Sears) Tower in Chicago, the Empire State Building in New York City, the Stratosphere Tower in Las Vegas, and the Space Needle in Seattle, I have firsthand knowlege of tall structures. Only slightly interesting….would have been better perhaps in good weather…it was very cloudy when I went
I really enjoyed this experience! The view was terrific and there are a bunch of facts. The glass floor, although intimidating is very neat. WillBe back.

The CN tower is very expensive. It really reminds us of the Blackpool tower - nice view on a good day but otherwise disappointing. They've put a lot of tacky additional 'experiences' in to try to justify a large price tag when you are really paying £30 to go up a tower...it is THE thing to do in Toronto though...
The express lift speeds you to the top of the tower to enjoy spectacular views across the city of Toronto. A must is the photograph on the glass floor, everybody has to do it.

I've been to Toronto many times and on the latest trip, I realized that I've never been up the CN Tower. Why, I can't go to Toronto and not visit the famed CN Tower, right? Wrong. At $32 + tax, this experience is so not worth it. I'd pay $15.You get great views in the elevator, inside the station...

unless you've never been this high before, then for goodness sake, go for it! the blood will get all excited, your cheeks will be rosy, your heart will palpitate! you can see forever on a clear day, or at least all the way to Niagara Falls!

During my stay in Toronto I visited the CN Tower with my Wife and 15 year old Grandson.We visited the C N Tower on Friday 1st November.This was to be my Grandson's second visit as he had been to the Tower 3 years earlier on a School trip.The views are breathtaking and whilst it seems a little expensive it...

I love towers, because of the views they offer. The CN tower is no different. It has phenomenal views over the city, and beyond. Even the lifts have a view. I went on a windy evening when the outside viewing terrace was closed due to the weather, and the restaurant closed due to a function, so the extra cost of...

The CN tower is a great building that dominates the city of Toronto. It looks great day or night. It is about 1800 feet tall and you can go as high as about 1450 feet by taking 2 elevators up there.The first takes you about 1100 feet up which has great views, you can get a second elevator for...

The biggest plus: you can see from one end of Toronto to the next! Fabulous view on a clear day, I only wish they had the appropriate signage to point out direction and specific key landmarks (as done when you go to the top of the Empire State Building). There was a video running inside but if you didn't catch...
Informative exhibition on the CN tower and other comparable buildings around the World.The glass floor was special

Everyone has already said so much about the tower, so I'll just say this:The view from the observation deck was incredible and well worth it.I went for the skypod, and it is simultaneously awesome and terrifying. CN Tower was good. Kind of expensive for 2 adults and 2 kids to do the basic ride up to the top.It was good and not busy on a very blowy and cold October day.There was no time limit on the ticket, so we bought the tickets just as a coach tour had arrived. We went for a...
Stay for dinner! Wish the tower roated so you can take in all the sigts while you eat. I have a fear of heights, but I felt safe in the CN tower. We will be visitng again!
It too good up there....Full view of Toronto could be seen up from there.... pure nature , big skyscraper and much more..
Have been up both daytime and night time. I preferred the day, It's always exciting to go up these tall buildings until you get up there, then it's meh... look around then wait in a line to go down.

If you are not scare of hights, certainly a nice thing to mark in your " have to do" list.Only two buts, number 1 is very expensive for what it is, number two inform yourself if there are any private events as they restrict where you can go or see (it was in our case)

You pay $50.00 to get to the top, look around at a skyline of well, city and then go back down. Things haven't been updated or upgraded in 25 years, including a patches of loose carpet and loose vinyl-type flooring. Very dated and for the price you pay, it's seriously not worth it.I think the only way it'd be...
From the ground the tower doesn't look anywhere near as impressive as the New York skyline. It is taller but really doesn't look it - but the views from inside and that glass floor - awesome

When visiting toronto for the first time it's definitely on the list of things to do. However it $34+tax each and was a big let down. You are in the lift up for less than a minute. Impressive but at the same time you can't take in the views at this speed. A walk around took 30 min. We didn't...

This was amazing one of the best things we did on the whole of the 2 week holiday. I would recommend its not to be missed. I'm scared of heights and i even went up in the glass elevator it was just awesome and I feel it has cured me. views where fantastic we could see for miles. I sent...

It is a must do but it is rather expensive and if you want to go to the very top or do the outside walk have a fat wallet. The basic trip is essentiall a lift ride to the restaurant area where you can walk around on the inside as well as the outside. There are excellent views for miles...

I have visited the CN Tower many times and to be honest it's not much more than a $32 (plus taxes) one minute ride in an elevator. The ride up is good but make sure you pick a clear day or you are wasting your time as the views are what makes it special. If it's very windy it shuts...

Heads up, if you eat a main course meal at the 360 Revolving restaurant, you get free access to the observation deck and glass floor. This takes a nice bite out of the menu prices. Access to deck closes at 10 pm, so eat 8 pm or earlier. The experience is worth the price, 360 meal or not.

Great to visit and learn so much about this construction, the displays are interesting and compelling. We read it all!I particularly liked the "distance from" display and took photos to prove where we were in relation to where we live.The glass floor is cool and looking down is a "must.
That is one very tall tower that provides spectacular views of the entire area. A great place to go at least once when you are in Toronto.

The elevator ride up was kind of cool but lasted 58 seconds. The view from the top was nice but it was not anything that I would wait in line for hours to see. We went at night-there were no lines! If you have to go-then try to go after 7. I would have been disappointed if I had waited...

On the very clear, sunny day that we visited the tower, we had spectacular views. We could see the city of Niagra and the mist coming up from the falls. From the Look Out Level, we got a 360 view of the city lights of Toronto. Simply beautiful. My family loved the Glass floor view of the street below, mostly of the ROGERS Centre really. But the metal grid that separates the glass kind of gets in the way of the view down below. The really enjoyable part is the...

Fantastic views over the city. Shame you can't take good photos through the glass, due to the reflections. I do not rate the service in the 360 restaurant. We all came away feeling disappointed by the poor service we experienced.

The views are beautiful, but the problem that we found is that if you purchase the ticket without the restaurant you only get a 180 degrees view from the tower (indoors). You have to go to a different level to see 360, and it is outside and very windy. The other thing is you don't know what you are looking...

Freakin up there! Beautiful views...I can see my house in Buffalo! However, I thought it was a bit expensive @ $30 each to ride up an elevator. Have been twice in the past 6 months.
