Brilliant view and a really fast, soundless lift. You can see generally the whole city and there's a part with a glass floor so you can see right down to the bottom of the tower (I don't recommend this if you're scared of heights like I am, it's real scary). Great value and the 4D movie was great, just me...

To be able to walk 360 degree's and see all of Toronto from Lake Ontario to the South, andthe Green Belt area's to the north is fantastic(on a clear day!) This is in the open air part.For you brave souls, step onto the clear glass squares, where nothing seperates you and1132 feet straight down except a few...

You should visit this tower if you want to catch a good view of the city. It gives great views both indoors and outdoors. The elevator experience was interesting too as we get to the top so quickly. There are no massive skyscrappers in this city though, mainly short houses.

We got tickets for CN Tower as a package deal with our hotel. I am really glad we did because I never would have paid the high cost of admission. Traveling with 3 teenage boys, I was worried if they would be bored walking around the top of the tower but they had a great time! The elevator ride up...

This is a must do while visiting Toronto. Here is my tip: go at dusk if you can. The lines are shorter, and you get the best of both worlds: daytime and nighttime views. Most people go during the day, but the nighttime views are absolutely spectacular.Also, the CN tower is right next door to ripley's aquarium and also...

T.his is our second trip up the CN Tower. If you are in Toronto this is definitely something you want to do. There is more to do than just the trip up. Go up as far as you can. There are movies to view and display to see. See if you are brave enough to stand on the glass floor....

As soon as I can I jump on an elevator to see any city from the sky. The CN Tower is overpriced and not well organized. You can see a 360° panorama just from the rooftop restaurant (which was closed...). Going to the upper level, a crate cuts the view (horrible pictures...). Not worth the price.

A trip to Toronto is not complete without a visit to the CN Tower, the lift only takes 59 seconds from the ground floor to the top.Sit on the glass floor and have your photo taken with the drop below.The views are absolutely not to be missed, if you are the adventurous type, put on a harness and...
Thought it was very expensive for a trip ur a Tower. Impressive view all the same Would not like to do it when very busy

I was not really looking forward to going to the CN tower but, went while on vacation in Toronto. it was great! Great views and I took some really good Toronto pictures their. I think walking around the screened in area around the tower was fun. This is a good place to take children
Really must visit. Great view even on a cloudy day over the entire city. The glass floor panels are a little freaky if you have a fear of heights, but all and all well worth the visit.
This is the CN Tower in Toronto. We rode the very fast elevator to the top (ears popping). The restaurant revolves so you always have a new view of this beautiful city. This was a great experience.

Walking into the CN tower I was stunned at how long the lines were. Luckily, both times I went up I had no wait time. Here's how: 1: If you really want to experience the CN Tower and create memories do the Edge Walk. It's an incredible experience and if you don't want to lean over the edge you can...

This is another don't miss while in Toronto. It is centrally located downtown and very easy to get to. Consider going up at night ( the tower was open until 10:00 p.m.). The view is spectacular and just beautiful. I couldn't pick out Niagara Falls at night, but the lights of the city and the moon ( which was full)...

We were in Toronto to visit the brand new Ripleys Aquarium (see my review on it for more info).Since the CN Tower is right beside the Aquarium, we thought that we would take our 6 year old twins up for the first time. There are two observation deck levels. The main one and then there is the "pod" which...

According to my 10 year old: "It was great because there was a glass floor that you could see through and look at the street below and the top of the new aquarium. You could see for miles and view the buildings of Toronto". We walked from our hotel and did not have to wait long for tickets. The security...
If you visit TO this is a must on you list of things to do. The glass floor was a bit scary but still worth doing. The line up was huge when we started but moved quickly.
Good food and breathtaking views! It was a clear night so we could see across the lake to Niagara. The glass floor was a bit scary, but overall a great place to visit and good value for money.

You have to go. At the revolving restaurant level, there is a marvelous viewing area - - indoors and out. You can see forever on a clear day - wait til there is one. Tourists prostrate themselves on the very thick glass floor in one small area. There is a 2nd elevator to the pod - which is just below...

Although loads of people queing up to go up the tower everything ran swiftly and smoothly, didn't have to wait in long queues, There was live video feed of the nutters who paid to walk outside, so you could watch their experience. All in all a very good experience.

Visiting the CN Tower in the middle of Toronto is a great experience. The staff are friendly and system is well organised.The highlight of the trip is the glass floor which you can stand on, have pictures and look down to the pavements of the street below.My main suggestions would be to book tickets in advance and go...

CN Tower provides the best view above Toronto. Despite the price, this tourist spot has to be visited during your stay in Ontario. The best part of the day to have a view of the city area is at sunset.

As everyone else has already noted, the CN Tower is a bit pricey, can have long lines, and makes you exit through the gift shop. In return you get wonderful views of the Toronto area, the Toronto Islands, and Lake Ontario as well as the opportunity to take hokey but fun pictures standing on the glass floor to post on...

Went on Saturday Oct 12 but the line was too long. Tried again on Tuesday morning and no line up to contend with. I had been to the Tower before but still found the experience fascinating. The view was amazing as was the info on the construction. I was accompanied by my sister and brother who had not been to...

This is our third trip to the CN Tower but first at night time, had dinner in the revolving restaurant, it is not cheap, but well worth the experience which includes a free ride to the top of the tower. It is recommended to make a reservation prior to your visit.

A bit pricey but worth a visit - we just did the regular tour which did not include a visit to the pod(the highest part of the tower).We were there in the early evening - lovely view of the lights of Toronto. Don't miss the glass floor where you have a view all the way down to the street -...

We very much enjoyed our trip to Toronto, and the CN tower was an integral part of our family trip! I was surprised to find out that it is actually taller than the Eiffel Tower. The lines can be long, but the views on a nice day are magnificent!

To say the CN tower dwarfs the glass and steel forest that makes up downtown Toronto would be an understatement. It gives acrophobia new meaning. The tallest free-standing structure in theWestern Hemisphere provides breathtaking views of this magnificent city. The view through the glass floor 113 stories up can be unnerving. That, and the thrilling ride in the outside...

The beautiful tower has a second deck above the main one. There is a magnific view of the city, like seen it from an airplane. There are also restaurants and part of the floor is made of glass to see below.

I like the CN tower, it is worth a visit. It's quite pricey for what it is though. We bought the city pass, which is a savings if you plan on doing everything it has to offer. We took some great shots with the camera from the top of the tower.

Don't get me wrong, I really enjoyed being up high and seeing the views, but I'll admit that for the cost I was rather surprised at the lack of information inside. I have seen other attractions that have images that tell you what buildings you are looking at from a height, or what areas of the city are, but this...

I know that the CN tower is a huge Toronto attraction, and yes, it is "neat" to see the city from up above. However, is it worth standing in line for over an hour and paying $30.00 to ride up a really tall elevator, snap some photos, and come right back down? Probably not. The advertised glass floor is not...

This building is very interesting , and for many years held the record as the tallest building in the world , it stands some 335ft above ground level , before you go in just stand under the building and look up at the tower , it is quite a unique building , the foyer area is quite nice , you...

The ride up the elevator is something else. Makes you feel very small...I enjoyed the glass bottom floor, although it freaked me out. Kids were actually stamping on it, and I just felt chills watching it.

Haven't done the CN Tower in years. It was fun and what a thrill to walk on the glass floor. Next time we will do the sky walk wehre they hook you up and you can walk outside on the edge. It was booked so if you want to do this attraction book ahead of time. Cost was $175 pp

Definitely a must visit. The tour is nice but pricey. Take looneysand nickles with you as there are plenty of smashed nickel keepsake machines and dont forget your camera. The motion ride is dated, but included is the base price. Dont trust the restaurants to be open. Call ahead as they dont adhere to their website hours.
I think you know what to expect, but it is still worth the visit. The views are extraordinary, and completely justify the price.

This is a busy place so hang on to your kids. There are lots of facts to read and it's kinda boring and i like reading facts usually. If you go a little later in the day you can see it in the day light and when the city lights up. I liked that part.

As advised, we arrived close to opening time in the morning and had little to no wait. The elevator ride and observation room were nothing short of amazing! We also did the little simulator ride, which was goofy, but ok if there's not a line. All in all, great experience and worth the admission price.

Friend were visiting from Italy and Poland and wanted so desperately to go to the top of this tower. Had they not paid for me (insisting), I would not have spent the money to go up. Once there, though, it was pretty amazing to be that high up.
Nice views, well worth it. Not a long wait when we were there. Lovely views of Toronto and the lake.

I went there on a sunday morning.. Weather is nice..not a lot of people.me and my friends enjoyed their sunday brunch with the nice view of toronto.. Food is good but is kinda pricey.. Its worth the trip..

Fantastic View from the ground & from the inside the height was magnificent if you go to the tower at night it's the most beautiful sight in the world it's the only self-supporting structure of it's king in North America

This has been on my bucket list for some time so it was really amazing to get there, the trip to the top was only minute in the lift and you did not know you where moving, I liked standing on the glass floor seeing to the bottom and had a back drop of the men working on the building,...

There is really only one building that encapsulates Toronto: the CN Tower. The building's iconic shape is used as shorthand for the entire city. It is a magnificent example of design and engineering. It is not only a symbol for this city, it is also a symbol of a time when things actually got done in Ontario - if it...
The view from the tower is well worth the fee. The restaurant in the lower floor is also a great choice.
Took the family including grandma and grandpa. Beautiful views, fun experience. Staff need to be a little more aware of helping people with mobility issues. Well enjoyed by all
Not only great views of Toronto and surrounding lake - stay up for lunch or dinner at one of two restaurants.

The whole experience was exciting. Going up on the glass floored elevator itself was thrilling enough. A big sigh when you reach the top only to be mesmerized by the 360 degree views from the top. The only little hitch was the line on the elevators coming down which could be quite a wait.

Went to the CN Tower today (Sat 12 Oct), no queues etc, however, the cost for 2 for the "experience" and sky pod was, after tax... $100 (less a few cents). As someone mentioned in an earlier review its all over in about 30 mins. The CN Tower is a must for the view alone which was amazing but ditch...

It had been about 15 years since I've visited Toronto, so I thought I should take the opportunity to go up to see the views from the CN Tower. I now know that it was better just to admire the landmark from outside because the experience offered and ride up are not worth the 34.00 per person charged by this...

This is the attraction you feel you must see when you visit Toronto. It has great views of the city and the lake and a glass floor you can walk on. But at the end of the day, the view is of Toronto which is not unlike many other cities in North America. It is incredibly expensive. Look for discount...

What a great attraction! Despite the crowds the CN tower staff made getting in and around the tower's features easy. Security was personable and thorough. The moose statue on the way up fascinated the kids and the tower's shop was easy to navigate. The skywalk was a unique and daring way to see the city. Very memorable. People like to...
Of all the ?towers" we've ever visited this is one of the best views. There is a bar where you can see all the way to Niagara.

I haven't been up this tower since I was 2-years-old and I'm sure a lot of things have changed over the course of 20 years. I came here in July and waiting 3+ hours on line was one of the most terrible experiences of my trip to Toronto. Nothing like standing on line for more than 3 hours and being...

What a day out at the CN Tower. Great views from the observation deck even better from the Sky Pod via very fast lifts 15 MPH to the observation platform and a second lift to the Pod. You look down to see people doing the Edge-walk - scary. After as long as you want for a picture or film of...

First off, it is terribly over priced. Around $70 for two adults. Ridiculous. Needs major updating on viewing deck. Dingy tired decor. No coffee shop just a dull restaurant which was empty but took up 1/4 of the view! Very disappointed. Felt like a rip off. View is good but the "experience" is lacking. Could be a million times better....
It's very tall, and fun for kids. But the whole experience stops being interesting at about the 30 minute mark, which may make you question its value, 'cause it isn't cheap to go up there.

I love visiting the tallest building in each city I go to, and trying to see a panoramic view of the city from the top. So, when my boyfriend and I decided to visit Toronto for the weekend, I knew I had to come here again. It is quite pricey (about $100 for the both of us, for the SkyPod...

Has an excellent viewing deck, with revolving restaurant near top of the Tower, well worth a visit.Food can be a little pricey especially in the revolving restaurant deck, but a packed lunch was not a problem in other areas of the Tower.

First on our list of attractions on our visit to Toronto, however it has a confused layout, no details at point of sale as to what was included in our admission price - we had to discover this for ourselves, once inside we were hindered by the lack of clear directional signs around the attraction. Great views once we made...

When we were driving up the Queen Elizabeth Parkway, I saw the CN tower in the distance, behind a view sky-scraping apartment complexes, and I thought, "All right!! We're at Toronto!"However, we drive another 45 minutes until we were actually at the city. The CN tower just happened to be tall enough to show itself from several dozen -...

Travelling up 553m, 144 storey high within 58 secs is indeed something which you would not regret. At the top, you are able to view the skyline of Toronto and experience the strong wind coming in from the sea.
It's definitely worth visiting for the views. Only need a couple of hours to explore. The 3D show was good too.

My husband and I went to the CN Tower in Toronto last week. When we got up in the morning it was foggy but the fog had burned off by the time we reached the city. We parked near the CN Tower because it was a good landmark and decided to go there first. The weather looked good from the...

Went up the Tower as part of a deal with a meal in the Restaurant.The whole experience is amazing, standing or walking on the glass floor is 'scary' but ' needs to be done! The views are spectacular and well worth the visit, decided not to go to the top as it was more expense but you cannot visit...

What a spectacular view all round the city! It is expensive, but we qualified for seniors' rates, which made quite a difference. Canada is very fair with their concession rates - even on the trains!It is so interesting to see the city airport so clearly - built on an island. We could even see the ferry taking people over...
This is fun and interesting, the staff is helpful, the movements are well organized. If you linger you can stretch this into a 45 minute visit. Considering the price ($32) it is not a good value.

An attraction in my opinion that doesn't live up to the hype created about it.Yes. it's tall but that's it. The elevators are probably the most exciting part.The glass floor is good, if you can fight your way on to it as it just seems like a mad scramble to stand on a square inch on glass.The...
Not worth the price. The "glass floor" was very disappointing. They are small pieces of glass (dirty glass) and the view was not very cool under your shoes. The 360° view its ok.

Having just dined at the Skylon Tower Revolving Restaurant, Niagara it was a little irksome to pay exactly the same price - USD95 - just for the pair of us to go up the tower in Toronto.Plus there was about a 45 minute wait for the elevator and more waiting to descend.The ticket was very misleading, as it...

This is a great place to visit to see the view, walk the glass floor to take your breath away. The bad side is the price $32 each if you want to go to the view platform. However if you want to go right to the top add another $12! and if you want to do the high walk add...

Very organised, great views, a must whilst in Toronto. We didn't have the guts to do the Edge walk (plus seems a lot of money $200!!), the general entrance fee though is better value, pay the little bit extra to go up to the Sky Pod..
You need know. It's is awesome. Recommend you visit in summer. A lot of things to do know such as restaurants and stores.

I'm not sure what I expected but it was very expensive for what you actually got to do. There was no movie. The views were ok. There isn't much to see because there isn't anything outstanding/monumental in the landscape. Was very disappointed.

Its a pretty step ($32) per person elevator ride for a view over Toronto!! If you've seen one view over a metropolitan city then you've seen them all. I was looking forward to the 'Glass' floor - only to be disappointed. When I think of a glass floor - I assumed that the whole floor was made of glass -...
Had dinner here and it was a great meal. The views are fabulous and was great as I was there to watch the sun go down.The glass floors and the outside viewing area are also excellent.
It was a sunny day, the food is not bad, the views are wonderfull once you can see all Toronto. All toghether deserves a visit and the best it is with the lunch included.
A must do in Toronto. The experience of the height was great, the glass floor & viewing areas were all world class. Would have loved to do the sky walk but my wife had a sore shoulder.

We stayed in Toronto and visited the CN Tower as it is the icon tourist attraction that you must see, and we thoroughly enjoyed it! It is located right next to the Rogers Centre (home of the Toronto Blue Jays) and is one impressive structure.We paid the admission fee which we later found out could have been cheaper if...
Love this tower. I hate heights so I was unable to stand on the glass floor and I was scared to look out at the skypod. We ate at the casual restaurant and food was good. View was beautiful too.

Considering that it costs over 30 dollars to take the lift up the CN Tower just for the view the added pleasue of eating a delicious meal while watching the world, or at least the Toronto bit of lt, go by is real value for money. The set menu without wine (which is expensive but no obligatory) is just 55...

Great view of Toronto area; it was quite pricey to get in, but because of the amazing weather we had the day we visited, it worth every penny.The glass floor was a lot of fun...The prices at the gift shop were very high to stay at least!
Visit early to avoid big cues. great veiws of the city from the veiwing deck. And there is a glass floor.
Great view, glass floor is fun, very expensive and set up to make as much as they can (gift shop, photos, etc)

We planned on visiting the CN Tower as part of our City Pass purchase and chose to visit it weekday early on when they opened. Since our visit to Toronto was not that long, we knew we may be chancing the weather, which turned out to be a partly cloudy day, which obstructed what could have been a spectacular view....
Very good. Amazing views and great sunset. 3d/4d was well worth the wait. Worth the money Amazing colour changing effects at night.

I really enjoyed getting an in the clouds perspective of Toronto but the experience is really overpriced. I did the general admission which gets you access to the main viewing level and glass floor but that was still close to $40. The skywalk experience looks really cool but it was way too costly so I had to resist.
Viewing Toronto from the top of CN Tower is unique. The revolving reaturant is nice but expensive. I noticed that buying souvoniers from the top is better than the ground floor.
It is a nice place to take out of town guests. We had dinner in the tower and the service was great, the food was very good, but not great and of course there was a nice view.

The CN Tower while a must do, is very limited in its broad appeal. You need good weather as the first occasion we could not even seen the tower due to the mist so returned on another day. It is just an observation tower with very good views but at $32 admission is abit steep. the oberstaion deck restaurant was...

For you not to go up and see how wide spreed Toronto is, this will be a loss. We had no clue how big Toronto is until we went up the CN tower. We did also stop for dinner and enjoyed a nice late after noon dinner. This is a must!!

What is there to say about the CN Tower? You go. You pay too much. You stand in lines. You take a circuitous route so they can take a cheesy picture of you in front of a ratty green curtain that they try to sell you by routing you past the photo sales counter on your way out after you...
plan your trip on a clear day anfd you can see Niagara Falls !! was a great day and was really cool being so far up!!
Well worth it. The elevator ride alone is a thrill. The view from the top is amazing. Go on a clear day.
Lots of walking to get there, Great views, We could see all of the Toronto area and across Lake Ontario.

I went up there both during the day and evening and was well worth seeing both aspects. Standing on the glass floor with the tremendous drop below was a bit scary but safe. It's just a shame it is difficult to take good photographs through the outside mesh.

The view from the top is scary as heck, I saw people lay on the glass floor that I could barely convince myself to walk on. An hour is enough at the top, at least it was for my family.If you're pressed for time skip the lower level attractions, they're included in the price because they really won't be...

First time in Toronto, but I felt like a native in this eclectic city. The CN Tower is a premier attraction, the tallest attraction in Canada, so I thought I would see the hype. Word of the wise, prepare and budget accordingly because it is expensive for one person and a family of 4 can pay in access of $150...
I have gone up in many towers and this seemed expensive just for the basic ride and the view was nothing great - lots of high-rise office buildings.
While the view is super and the construction unique, it was totally filled with commercial souvenir shops and kiosks. It only took us about 25 minutes to see it all and not much to experience.

We queued for the tower for about 30 minutes with "High Expectations" if you'll pardon the pun and we weren't disappointed! The tower was so high that we felt giddy looking down, there was drinks and snacks available which was ideal if like us you forgot a bottle of water, there wasn't much of a tour though, it was just...

You should go there. I took some great photos from there. I used just the City Pass. I didn`t took additional attractions.When you go down, there is a restaurant "Le Cafe" beside the souvenir store. Greta Food and health price..... about CD 12,00For 360 degrees restaurant is about CD39,00 fixes price + taxes + services

This is well worth the visit, from the speedy lift to the top to the stunning views all over Toronto. It is worth the admisson fee alone to be able to walk around and then stand on the glass floor looking down the 1800 foot drop just to be able to say you have done it.
The que was longer than I thought it would be midweek - but the view of the bay was lovely - walking on the glass floor is a bit scary - even if the brain says it is fine.
Been to Toronto many times. First time up the Tower! Could have spent all day in the Skypod! Make sure the camera/smartphone is fully charged and extra storage space for videos and photos!!!

As expected - great views of Toronto and the islands.Not the best tallest structure/ viewing platform I have been to as there is little information explaining what you are looking at and the facilities to enhance the viewing experience need a bit of modernising to keep it in touch with the facilities offered at other viewing platforms (London Shard,...

The CN Tower was the main reason I purchased a Toronto City Pass ticket, and it turned out to be the most underwhelming part of my Toronto city experience. I had heard so much about the tower and couldn't wait to experience it myself.First of all, it was a bit too expensive for my liking, then the lines were...

History of the building of the tower is interesting but nothing compares to the panoramic 360 degree view from the top. In perfect weather conditions, even the Niagara falls can be seen. Standing on the glass floor is unforgattable. Better to visit in the early hours because the crowd is huge in the afternoon.

I had visited before but this was my husband's first time. Being an avid camera person, he really enjoyed looking and taking pictures of the Toronto area from that height. It's funny how you can become a bit skittish when you see the clear panel on the floor that you can walk on if you choose to. Most people didn't....

I have been to a number of towers including Tokyo, Shanghai and this is nothing special but seemed like it was twice the cost. Glass floor was huge but outside area was below average on the main deck. (no one out there)

At the simple adult ticket of $32+taxes(!!), this is a bit pricy, but once you go up the 15 mph lift the views are worth it.A walk on the glass floor is a must.There is a restaurant up there but not much else, basically the views are the key feature and on a clear day, amazing!

You can't come to Toronto and not visit the CN Tower. The queues can be huge, but we decided to book dinner in the restaurant and so skipped all the queues and managed to see the city by day, twilight adn night whilst eating a delicious meal!

This is one incredible attraction to explore on a sunny day ! Give yourself at least 2-3 hours, or better yet include a lunch time at the restaraunt. The best times to go are early morning or late afternoon to see the tower throw its shadow. I agree with other reviews that its a bit pricey,however well worth it. Besides,...

Despite its age, the CN Tower is still impressive. Spectacular view over the entire city with its streets, harbor, airport and railway system. Quite expensive ticket though. The 3D video show can easily be left out as it is not that great.
Great for first time visitors to Toronto. Excellent city views. You get a general picture of what Toronto looks from the sky.

This was a fun experience with a beautiful view but I seen high beautiful view a lot like this one before. The price is a little steep for what your get, They pack the elevator up uncomfortable and once you’re up there is a cool glass floor to walk on but that’s about it, Once you’re up the view is...

Nice experience, cool view. However, the price for a family of four to go all the way to the top of the tower was enough to set my wallet on fire. I know tourist attractions tend to be expensive, but I'm not sure this one was worth the exorbitant cost.
At the top of the cn tower the view was sooooo beautiful and amazing! Plus I loved jumping and laying on the glass floor!

Absolutely a must-do if you're in town even for few hours. In the claerest days you can even see Niagara Falls, which are only 70 kms from Toronto. The glass floor you can walk on is very exciting.If you can spend some more money you can take the elevator until the very top of the tower. It's worth for all...

Downside is the $32 +tax price tag. I almost didn't go up. But I am glad I did. The view is FANTASTIC and gives you a perfect idea on how big the city is, as the building just keep going and going up those streets. A must see.....
Great views, great history, and a lovely way to spend the evening. The restaurant service and food were both good...a bit over priced, but you are paying for the view and the experience!

Views were amazing and I loved the glass floor, however at 36 dollars it felts like a rip off. In hindsight i would probably have rather done the set price lunch/dinner for approx 60 dollars instead as I would have had a feed and spend more time up the tower.
a must if in toronto-go early or pre book tickets to avoid crowds gets busy when the coaches start to arrive

I visited cn tower with family A MONTH AGO AND WE LOVED IT....we got there quite early on the underground tube and it is very easy to get around. everyone there is so gelpful, and if you aks them where you want to go, the ticket office will arrange for the best way to get there and assist....the tower was...

The views over Toronto and surrounding areas is stunning. Was very lucky as the day I visited was very sunny and clear so the sun shining off the lake was stunning. An additional ticket needs to be purchased if you want to view from the secondary, higher platform. I also visited the 360 restaurant which revolves and gives all round...

I loved it. I loved the glass floor. Also the view of toronto. I liked the 4D trip ride. But did not like the 3D air plane movie it was pretty boring. But all of this is included in the price.I like the fact that the CN tower is open until 23hr so you can go there after you...
The glass floor was a bit disappointing (we expected it to be bigger), but you have a very good view over the city and Toronto Islands

Not for the vertigo-afflicted! This attraction gives you views over Toronto and beyond - just as long as you go during clear weather.The price ($32) is a bit steep, but the views you get are just breath-taking. We went up last week, when it was quite windy, and still got an ok view although some personal items did go...

You look at 32 dollars plus tax and go no way but change your mind and you must go ! Choose a nice day though and if its cloudy do not go. We thought your ticket though should cover say 2 visits in the day like Vancouver where you can go as often as you like in the day you...

One of the tallest freestanding structures in the world, CN Tower is Toronto's most famous landmark. If you visit Toronto, it's worth going up for a nice panoramic view of the city but only on a sunny day, without smog. Otherwise, you'll be dissapointed.The glass floor is the most exciting thing there. The views from the 360° restaurant are...

I have to agree with my fellow reviewers that this is a must do! Even if you don't pay the extra to go up to the next level, or the extra to do the edgewalk, it is still worth seeing from the observation area and the glass floor. It's kinda freaky at first to stand on the glass floor, but...
It's one of those must see places with great views and a fun glass floor but it is expensive and doesn't take long to get around it.
The glass floor is awesome and the Look Out is very nice. A little expensive to go up to the Sky Deck (additional $12) and if it is a hazy day then not worth the extra money.

CN Tower was really worth a visit. Friendly and informative staff and beautiful views! When my partner was looking into the Edge walk the guys seemed very knowledgeable about it and very helpful. unfortunately the weather stopped Kev doing it so we intend to go back!!

Next to the Rodgers centre. Fastest lift I have been on. Terrific 360 degree view with guide on hand to point out places of interest. Good value to book the restaurant as it moves around as you dine. 3D film on flight and also a simulator ride. Glass floor is good for those who can take it.
While it is not cheap, it is worth it.Your first steps onto the glass floor will give you butterflies!Well worth seeing. We loved it.

The CN Tower is a pretty standard tourist stop in Toronto, but it was worth visiting. The views were awesome and it was pretty neat walking on the glass floor. We also ate at 360 The Restaurant up on the tower, so there were no lines to wait in and access was complimentary.
Loved walking on the glass bottom floor.. Such an exquisite view!!! A very family oriented site to go visit... The CN tower is a must s
It was indeed one of the must visit places in Toronto. A beautiful view of the city and lucky might have a glimpses of Niagra falls.However, its expensive for entry.

Of course, its a MUST do when you come to visit Toronto, but be prepared for long lines and lots of people. And be cautious of the weather that day, because it always makes it hard to see the beautiful city if the weather is bad! And of course, there isn't much to do up there, so don't plan on...
Is good to get great views of Toronto but works out pretty expensive but I suppose has to be done. Can be pretty busy with big queues.

The tower looks awesome after sunset due to the colorful illumination. The elevator is fast and in no time you are at the top. Edgewalk was closed when we had been there due to weather conditions. Visiting Toronto - CN tower is a must see attraction.

Not sure if it was because it was a Sunday or because the Blue Jays were playing but it was not very busy at the tower today No long queues. The ride up in the lift was smooth and very quick, although the lift operator said her speech so quickly and monosyllabic that I'm not sure what she said. The...

Loved it! Walking on the glass was fantastic, got me many pictures. Walking outside..., wow! I went at night and I liked it a lot, since I've never been at night, it has always been during day time! Go!! You won't regret!
Even though it was a foggy morning the group I was with still managed to see plenty of Toronto. Worth going up there.

We went to Toronto just to take the kids up the CN Tower, and it brings back so many memories! The view is as stunning as I remembered, and it was worth the price to share this with my daughters. We paid the extra $12 to go up to the skypod, and the view from up there was beautiful too....

We booked our trip to the tower in advance before we left the UK, and because it was our honeymoon we chose to have a 3 course meal in the revolving restaurant.I'm really glad we did, because the combination of scenery and quality of the food was well worth the price.The service seemed a tiny bit rushed (our...

Was worth the price of the meal as it wasnt much more than the price of just going up the tower.The views were magnificent!!!The price of the wine was however overpriced but the service was really good and very cheery waiter.

Love visiting the CN Tower! Everyone working there is ever so friendly...especially since I can now compare to those who work at the Empire State Building! I've been during the day and at night and definitely recommend the night! So beautiful to see the city lit up like that. I took my teenage niece who was visiting from Latin America...

Had the opportunity to visit CN Tower during a short visit to Toronto. It was worth every penny! The views were excellent! Looking over Toronto on a clear day is a must. We walk on the open glass floor and even had a short dance on the glass to the amusement of others. It was fun! An exciting building, in...
went up in the evening and was great to watch the sunset over the city. worth the long queue! also the light show is worth going back for.

We stopped in Toronto just to visit this place. My wife freaked out at how tall it was but the elevator ride was fast and smooth. It was a grand view on the whole area and the lake. The coolest feature in the observation part was the clear glass floor part. Next time I'll have to try the thing that...
The wait was nearly an hour to get to the tower and an other 30 min if you are going to the next level up. It was worth the wait for the view.

Excellent place to visit, specially during the night to see lighting of Toronto. Please buy online tickets with SKYPOD included as it works out cheaper. Do not miss the 4D flight show and the simulator show. The walk out side the fenced area is very good as it is illuminated with different colors. The Skypod is extra higher than normal...

Other reviewers have said it and I agree that it's not cheap! But do you come to Toronto without going up the tower? No of course not! It dominates the entire skyline and the view from the viewing area is amazing. Travelling up in the glass lift is possibly unique? Even if it isn't unique it is the only lift...

Although the views were spectacular, the food was equally spectacular. Very well prepared and tasty. Members of our party had glazed chicken, salmon and spaghetti. Everyone was very pleased with the food and the excellent service. One of our wait staff was named DEY and he did an excellent job of waiting on us.

We spent a couple of hours visiting the tower as part of our honeymoon tour. The whole experience from the ride up in the elevator to the simulator ride was just brilliant. I think we took about 200 photos of the spectacular views from up there.Tips: Listen to the guides in the elevator on the way down about instructions...

This was SO expensive! We couldn't believe the poor value for money; we went up none the less - the views are great but the signs and information is all very dated. When we arrived at the bottom, we were directed to a 'ride' which was AWFUL - we were asked to wait in a conference room, and when we...

The view of the city on the top is really amazing (and it's 360º), plus, you have the glass floor that makes this visit even better!!!(The first 10 seconds standing on it give you an adrenalin rush that you will never forget!!!)Is one of the places you really cannot miss if you're in Toronto.

My experience here was amazing. I have never been at such height, this was first time. It was amazing but scary to be on the glass floor on the top most level and you could see below, it was amazing. Its a great fun experience and + you can see the entire City from there.
We went there just before sunset , the gift shop down stairs is better than up stairs. Just go there if u r in toronto.

This is a great tourist attraction and a beautiful landmark. However for the fee that they charge it is way too expensive attraction. There are many other towers that I have been too but not so expensive. The staff were young, friendly, helpful college students.
When in Toronto one must visit the CN Tower. Just taking the elavator is an experience,. Once at the top the view is outstanding. This is a must visit site. Enjoy

When you visit cities you seem to spend a lot of your time going 'up' things. The CN Tower is 'the landmark' in Toronto and seems to above you wherever you are. It is a lot of up - and you get there in under a minute in the elevator!The views are fantastic and if you are doing it...

A must see attraction in Toronto. Bird eye view on the city and seemingly half of Ontario. The elevator is a fun with many older ladies almost fainting because of high speed and transparent glass floor so that you can see how high you get all the way up. It is very windy up on the tower so smth warm...

You must do this trip - when you get home, it's the first thing people ask when you say you've been to Toronto: 'Did you go up the Tower?'It's not cheap, but you'll probably only go once - although I'd like to go up at night! The views are incredible and the glass floor... try not to let the...

glass floor a must and says it holds up to 14 hippos. I would have liked to see how they got them up there to find out. lol. Do the lunch as it gets you the admission included and its included. A must see in Toronto, if you dont do it, its like going to Paris and not seeing the...
We visited CN Tower and had dinner in the revolving restaurant... get ur best camera and go it is really nice. we went a bit before sunset so saw both day and night views of the city.. beautiful
If you go to Toronto you have to go to to the top of CN Tower. We enjoyed it, but it was a bit pricey.

We loved how easy it was for my Dad to navigate himself around the first floor in his FREE wheelchair supplied by the CN Tower. The staff where uber helpful too and went out of their way to ensure our visit was enjoyable.P.S. If you are scared of heights the journey is a bit scary but the views from...
It is something you must do while visiting Toronto. But it is very expensive and when we visited there was a long queue for the lifts.

A Toronto must do. Don't let the lines discourage you as it's well worth it. We went first thing in the morning and still had to wait about 45min to get up the tower. The views from the top are amazing. It's well worth the extra $12 to go right to the top.The glass floor is very neat. I...
It's a bit pricey, but totally worth the views. My family's favorite part was the glass floor. It's a must-do if you are visiting Toronto!

It is something you must do while visiting Toronto. It is good, when the sky is clear you can see really far. Make sure to bring binoculars and good camera.Entry price is expensive. $37 for an adult, and if you want to go to the highest point, add an extra $12, meaning almost $50 for one person. That is...
go to the top. Glass for was cool and scary at the same time. The view was great. If you dine at 360 you do not have to wait in the crazy lines.
In August i went up the CN Tower, it was amazing, there is a glass floor up there and for anyone who is scared of heights, well u will feel safe up here!! great experience and an excellent view

What a great way to spend my first evening in Toronto! The CN towers provides information its own history, as well as educating on some well known skyscrapers in Toronto. The Rodgers stadium is next to the CN Tower, also worth visiting while in this area of the city.

Iconic attraction in the centre of Toronto, fabulous views and an awesome glass floor.Only downside was that even on a weekday the queues for the lifts were long, especially on the way up to the sky pod.Also the prices at nearly $100 for two people to go all the way up were as sky high as the tower...
If you have never been to Toronto, this is a must see place. The tower is well maintained and always amazes me. Don't pass this up when in Toronto
Great views, but at a cost. The 4D show leaves a lot to be desired, not really sure what it had to do with the Tower.
I've been here so many times and i love going up each time . it is a little expensive but its definitely an experience if you've never been up ! staff is nice and helpful

We were hesitant to go up the CN tower because each ticket was over $30, but I'm glad we did. It's arguably the main attraction in Toronto and it's easy to see why. The view is breathtaking! When we were there, we got to see an air show going on outside which was amazing. Make sure you visit both floors:...

The CN tower is a must-go place if you are visiting Toronto. Near the billy bishop airport and in the heart of downtown Toronto, the view from the CN tower is breathtaking.However there is not much to do up there. Unless you are planning to dine in their expensive sky tower restaurant, play extra to walk on the edge...

we where here in august and the weather was great this is a good attraction if not afraid of heightsit is not cheap but worth the visit there is no time limit when you get to the top and lots to see & do the glass floor was good & sky pod is worth the extra to do not...
you get a great view from the top looking all over Toronto. Perfect for taking family shots. Memorable moments and you can try it at least once
excellent views over the city of toronto, ride up in elevator takes the breath away, no place for those who don't like heights. Draw the line at actually doing the edge walk though!!!!

The view is great! Make sure its a clear day. Don't pay extra money for the dome (highest point), the view is the same and the shooting options are less better. If you have AAA member card you can get 10% discount.

It takes a while to get your turn on the elevator, but the view is worth it. It's great that you can spend all the time you want on the observation floor. The casual restaurant has very slow service, so don't be in a hurry if you plan to eat there.

The tower is wonderfull and the person that are working there are very honest. It was foggy when we went and thay all suggest that we should not waste are money on the attraction that day because we would not see anything. I was deceived not to go in the tower but I was also thankfull for the advice
If you're afraid of heights, don't worry. The glass floor is NOT the entire floor, just a small square portion that people line up to stand on.
The view is so beautiful and the restaurant is very good, but expensive. The glass floor is an amazing experience.

Even my husband, who has no head for heights, enjoyed the views so long as he didn't get too close to the edge. I enjoyed walking around on the perspex floor looking down on the world below. It is quite expensive but for us it was worth it to see the overall view of Toronto and the waterfront.

Lines were pretty insane when we came to do the Edge Walk. Our guide recommended we come back in the evening, when lines would be shorter. We did just that, and only had to wait ~10 minutes to get up to the general observation tower. It was pretty busy still, but nice to look out over the city as the...

The price of $32 just to take an elevator up the CN Tower for a view is a little too much but the views of the city from up there are spectacular. You can avoid the price if you eat at the Tower restaurant, but the entree price will more than make up for whatever you've saved.

I went up on the CN Tower at 8pm, so I could have had a view @ day and night. It was amzing to see downtown, the toronto island and everything else in a bird's-eye view! But it`s not cheap to go up there! Maybe too expensive (about 30 dollars), but worth to spend it once.

Well organized tour, reasonable price, snacks/drinks at the top, glass window you can look straight to the bottom on. Not one of the most impressive tower tours I've been to (skylon, 1.000 islands, kansas city,) but still nice

Probably the most amazimg attraction of Toronto city! From the top the wiew of the city is simply magnificient and the lift on the tower should be done as first thing in order to have an idea of where all other things to visit are. Acquarium was almost finished an ready to be opened last March 2013.
This is a great activity for the whole family. Spectacular views on a good. Line ups were a bit long.I did a charity event climbing the stairs but would recommend the elevator.

I went up the CN Tower for the first time long time ago!I remember being sooo excited and thrilled to go on the, once the tallest,building in the world!The ride up on the external elevator was breathtaking! The speed and the view all around us! - I couldn't believe it was happening! We stayed there until it got...

I loved this place. The views are unbelievable. The glass floor was scary and awesome at the same time. However you do not feel the height when you go to open area on the next floor. Overall, I like this place except the price.
been there many times but it was even better seeing it threw the eyes of my grandson. go more off season so the wait is less but worth the wait for sure.

If you are visiting Toronto you must visit the CN TOWER.Beautiful building,the best view in town.Day and night are amazing.Also a great gift shop on ground level.Great restaurant where you can enjoy the best view in town.
There was a great view and the glass floor was neat but it was way expensive. I wouldn't do it again. We found a coupon but it still cost us way too much!
Must do this if you have the time. Go all the way to the top worth the money. I'm claustrophobic but didn't have any trouble with this.

Go up on a clear day and take a lot of shots with your camera...too expensive but worth it.You can have a nice dinner at the 360 Restaurant or trying the Edge walk.The tower has a beautiful nightly Illumination.Walking on a glass floor feels so good!cheers CN tower
This was a great attraction in a great city! The glass floor on the top floor was exhilarating!Worth it!

Very expensive to go to the CN Tower. They should have a cheaper family admission. There is a beautiful view but after 10 minutes and we were ready to leave. I don't think I'd pay out that much money to do it again.

we visited the CN tower did the basic tour which put us at the lower level in the tower, there is a higher spot which is an additional $12 to reach but and additional elevator ride but the basic tour still gives you a great view of the city along with a glass floor which though it is safe to...

The view from the CN Tower is amazing. We were able to watch the Blue Jays play in the stadium right below us and see half way across Lake Ontario. We were disappointed when we found out that there was an additional $12.00 charge to go from the observation deck to the Skypod and chose not to continue all the...
Excellent attraction in the centre of Toronto. It has other very good attractions very close with the Sky dome next door and it has a very good restaurant with excellent views of Toronto city centre.
The tower was once the tallest free standing building in the world. Still great to ride to the top and get a marvellous view.
The CN Tower is a great way to see Toronto. It's especially cool when the Rogers Centre has the roof open and you can look down on it.
A great time and worth the money.....would love to do the edge walk but i'm not brave enough!! Used all of the facilities, the 3D cinema and the kids enjoyed the motion simulator.

Went up the tower upto the last one, that is the Sky Pod from where on a clear day you can see Niagara Falls and Rochester, New York. From there, we could see down lane a train moving like a caterpillar. We could see clearly the city Airport and Toronto Islands. All in all it was a wonderful experience
Pre book on line as this avoids waiting in line. The view is spectacular and it took us quite an effort to stand on the glass floor and look down though lots of kids were doing it!

It was a busy day...some hokey game and a scheduled construction work didn't bother me at all...the amazing view from the top of that enormous structure was breathtaking.Don't miss the glass floor...it's free... :)And don't bother to attend any other activities that the tower provides...maybe just the skywalk attraction, thaw it's quite an expensive treat.

It's a bit frightning walking on the glass floor which even isn't on the top of the topwer, but gives you an impression of how high the tower really is. Price of walking outside the tower is too much expensive for most avarage tourist.

A great activity for the whole family in Downtown Toronto. The views from the tower are spectacular, and far better than the tower in Fukuoka that I previously reviewed. There's a glass floor to stand on which is quite entertaining and a Skywalk that let's you walk out on the rim of the tower s(although I didn't take part in...
This is very pretty at night but if you had to see it by day it would also be good. I have been twice and would recommend it either one

We thought it best to make the trip to the top of the CN tower when the sun was shining. We did not go to the very top as that is not accessible to mere mortals like us, but we did go to the Skypod, which is 100 metres above the general observation deck at 338 metres. It is well...

Went on a clear day this summer. Long wait - took nearly 45 minutes to get to the elevator that takes you up. But once we got there, the views were spectacular. You see the whole of Toronto on one side and the lovely Lake Ontario on the other. Bit pricey, but if its a clear day, then it may...

I spent 32$ ( I guess las year was cheaper) for nothing. we spent like 45 minutes moving from a line to another and finally on the top, a huge cloud bars our vision so all we saw was a white smoke not TORONTO. May be organisers should consider suspending visits when it's cloudy coz you see nothing. Last year...

Go on a nice day and you have a spectacular view of Toronto. Go on a cloudy day, and this can be a real dud with your only view being thick fog. Tickets are $32 (cheaper if booked on line) and the wait on labour day weekend was about 45 minutes. Go in the morning and/or on weekdays to avoid...

Went on a cloudy day therefore could not see much. Was warned by ticket clerk that view would be limited. Went up anyway and would imagine that on a good day the views are amazing. Did not go to the skydome but it still cost 35$ about 24 pnds, at the time of writing, for basically a ride in a...
Too bad the restaurant blocks part of the view. Loved watching the people brave enough to walk the ledge live...the instructors are insane!
CN Tower - has to be done when you visit Toronto. It's like visiting Paris and not going up the Eiffel Tower - unthinkable.Great views and not too pricey for the experience.

Couldn't go to Toronto and not visit the CN Tower!! Admission to the Tower and the Skypod cost almost $100 - glad there was only 2 of us and not a family!! Definitely a brilliant view but seriously overpriced.

Most Torontonians only go up the CN Tower when they are showing friends and family around. Ok - we were in the same boat. A friend from France really wanted to go up. We kind of poo-pooed her idea at first but we were really glad we decided to go. We had dinner in the restaurant that doesn't rotate. That's...

We did the combined tour and a meal, and spent about 4 hours looking around and seeing the sights. We would recommend the meal to coincide with the sunset and if you are really lucky the roof of the Rogers Stadium will be open and a game will be on.The meal it's self isn't cheap ,but was worth it...

We took the subway, unfortunately there was so much construction going on that it was difficult to locate the way to the CN tower. however after a little more walking we made it. Totally worth it. We got the city pass which covers CN tower, casa loma, TO zoo, ROM and the science centre. I think if you do 2-3...

This is probably one of those attractions most people say you have to do, but I really find it's overpriced. The view of the city is good obviously, but it seems like they're milking too much out of people for it. $32 to go to the "base camp" and an extra $12 if you want to go to the higher...
The CN Tower was everything I hoped it would be. The views were incredible. The other attractions inside the tower were well worth a visit too

Had to be done, really - the essential sight of Toronto. Pricey (though look for discount vouchers in some of the pick-up papers), but a good time spent up there. Glass floor impressive and queasy. Excellent views (though admittedly Toronto does lie in quite a boring area...). Kids loved it.

The ride in the glass elevators is nice. Also included in basic ticket is a movie & a motion ride. The motion ride took a while to get going-technical difficulties,but was pretty good once it worked. We had 20% off coupons I found online,which helped since the fee is 32.00/each! But ,definitely a must do when in Toronto.

We bought the tickets online. It is costly ($27). The view is nice but there is no audio tour or no information of any type available about the city or buildings. The general admission ticket include a 3D film and motion theater ride. The film was about airplane and the ride was about nothing. We were expecting some connection with...

My boyfriend and I were traveling to Toronto, and went here for dinner. Yes it's a touristy thing to do - but it's worth it. Amazing views of Toronto, excellent food, great wine, and the romance of dining at such heights - really recommend it if you don't mind spending a bit of cash :)

Went to the top of the CN tower with the wife. We lucked out that the Expo was going on so we got a free air display from a few fun planes!The view was a good one - got some nice photos, but the "glass deck" was a huge disappointment. It was so small and crowded with kiddos wanting...

One of the main attractions of Toronto, it is worth at least one visit in your lifetime. Great views of the city and the lake, but around 30 CAD general admission (the Lookout and the glass floor levels). Funny and scary experience!

Unfortunately I picked a very cloudy day it is a landmark and there is beautiful views, 2 people with additional sky pod charge 99 dollars the sky pod had less people but not sure if the 12 bucks pp was worth it. People are very nice and informative. I would call and ask about the visibility before going and paying,...
Great view over the City and a classic tourist experience but very expensive as a family. Worth eating up high though

We enjoyed our time at the CN Tower. The restaurant was good, the view was fabulous and I liked how you could go outside on the deck. Holy, was that ever windy. Probably about 80 km/hr. We took a video, so crazy! Definitely worth visiting when In Toronto and if you make reservations at the restaurant and eat entrees, you...

I like seeing the view from so high up. It was a great experience both during the day and and night, either view is awesome.If you want to eat at the top of CN Tower there is the Horizon or the 360. When you consider it is $32 US to just ride to the observation deck the cost of...

The CN Tower is good, but I say that to almost every skyscraper/tall buildings/towers attraction, so I have to say that it's just average. I mean, well, there are dozens of dozens of these attractions in the world and you can visit any, they are all pretty good, give you a nice view of the city/place. But what I liked...

Felt we had to do it so we did :-) Very glad we sprung for the extra $12 to get to the skypod. 360 degree views of the city with slightly fewer people. Down to the glass floor level and the obligatory stand on the glass. This area was packed with people! The outdoor terrace off this level is difficult...
Went up the first day of our visit and was a great way to get our bearings especially on such a clear day! Great views but the glass floor was my favorite! Weird but you have to get on it!

We were really excited to go up the CN Tower, unfortunately, it was too crowded (due to Labour Day long weekend in Toronto). There were multiple lines before you can take the elevator up to the viewing deck.you queue to go through security scan, queue to go through the first entrance, another queue for the lift up to the...

We got a City Pass as a gift prior to travelling. One of the vouchers was for this attraction. It is a fabulous building with lots to see and do. It also has an excellent gift shop at reasonable prices. If you are adventurous you can walk around the outside of the building although it is costly to do this....

For that much price. I expected more. But still good overall. Little confusing on how to get out on the sidewalk. And may be the sun or that time of the day. Couldnt take much pictures inside the cabin. Was getting too dark but as went on the sidewalk thing. It was fine.

I have been up the CN Tower in the past, but always during the day. This trip, 2 friends and I decided to go up the tower Friday night.The cost is a little steep, you can get a better rate if you purchase in advance online.We did not go up to the sky pod, we did see the...

The CN Tower is the premier tourist attraction in Toronto, but it's not cheap. If your visiting Toronto you'll most likely want to go, but it pricey - and unless you go early, it may also get crowded.Since this was probably the only time we'll be in Toronto for many years, we decided to go despite the costs and...
Great views of the city, little priced out for a famly, would like tickets to be a little less, but all in all worth every penny, great trip and not a long wait which was a bonus.
Good dinner ..steak was the best I have ever had. Great views but sorry to say could not go outside as it was very windy. Walk over the glass. ...you get a great view

Well, when you go to Toronto every one knows the CN tower, we did it as it was something to tick off, another tall building. But I was pleasantly surprised, in fact really enjoyed it, we did arrive about lunch time and stayed for lunch, (wasn't that unreasonable in prices). All in all a good trip
The view is beautiful but $30 a person for something that takes less than an hour? It costs an additional $12 to get to he top.

Situated on top of the 550 metre tall CN Tower overlooking Toronto this observation platform is a great experience.The elevator takes a mere 51 seconds to reach to top of the tallest freestanding tower in the World, and of course once there a 360 degree view awaits.A further attraction on the observation deck is the large portion of...
Unfortunately it was raining for us and the views were limited, however I am told that you can see the spray from Niagara on a clear day.

Amazing experience, breathtaking view. Recommended for sightseeing lovers and heights addicts. Allows you to get a full panoramic view of Toronto. If you have the guts, you can try walking on the edge hanged in by ropes!

If you're visiting Toronto the CN Tower is a must see attraction. It does cost quite a bit but if you have the City Pass it's free. While I was at the CN tower, we decided that we'd spend the extra money and go up to the Skypod. The extra $12.00 was well worth it, taking us up 447m/1,465ft. above...

It would be wrong not to visit the CN Tower while you are here!!! Beautiful city views! Be aware of long waits in lines. Dont forget a camera! It is especially pretty when lit up at night. Very expensive to eat there

This was our first stop in Toronto. We did it as part of the city pass, which I highly. We went on a Thursday morning at around 10 am. The crowds were not too bad a sweet got to the top quickly. Impressive structure and views of Toronto and the lake. Check out the glass floor.

Nice view. I now can say "been there, done that" but... very very expensive for what you get back. They must have paid it a long long time ago...My recommandation is : you want to do it, do it but prepare to give some $$$$$. But if you are not sure stay away!
Really enjoyed our visit, glass floor is the highlight, even tho the girlfriend was afraid to step on it. A must see in toronto.
Went here as a kid when it was the tallest in the world and loved it. Though not the tallest any more, it's still a great view of a great city.
Give yourself time overall consider coming early or late to avoid the lines or come during the week.

The CN Tower is one of those things you just have to do, unless of course, you are terrified of heights. It’s touristy, it’s pricey, it’s crowded, but what the heck you only live once and you may only visit Toronto once!We went late in the afternoon and encountered considerable lines. We did have the CityPass so we bypassed...
It was quick to go up! Loved looking around the city. Parking was expensive (30$). It was worth going up.
Made it to the top on our third try. Got there before 10, no line. View was spectacular from the skypod.

a great view over Toronto and sea go up to the hub you can walk on the outside if your mad jump on the glass floor there is a café bar up top enjoy the view while you eat there is an open viewing platform so you can feel how strong the wind is up high do it if you...

This was so cool - the glass bottom floor was so scary! Definitely a must see in Toronto. We didn't pay the extra $12 to go up the extra floors, but where we were was enough! You could see so much of Toronto and beyond. Loved it!

A great view over Toronto and the island. It's recommended to go an hour before sunset and wait for the night to fall, so you can see the city on two different perspectives. Toronto is beautiful by night and CN Tower is a perfect spot to see the city.The glass floor on observation deck is amazing and you can...
Incredible views from the top and you do feel like you are on top of the world. The lift took seconds to take you to the top and to look down was mad. One of the wonderful things I have done in life.

The CN Tower is getting older ,needs some maintenance. The view, on a clear day, appears as if you were on from the top of the world, There are some attraction in the lower floor and displays, Not the quality you expect, but good for children The food on top of the tower, is excellent. try to go on weekdays....

The CN Tower had great views from the observation decks (there is one inside and one down a floor outside) but the best experience is going all the way to the Skytop, which is $12 extra on the cost, which is already pretty steep. The tower also has a glass floor which was neat but not really what I thought...

CN Tower gives you a 360 degree view of Toronto surrounding area. Daytime you can see shoreline of the lake, buildings, etc. Nighttime you can see the beautiful lighting of the city. If you are brave enough, you can take a picture lying on top of the "glass" floor seeing through all the way to the ground of the CN...

Nice place to take family and friends who are visiting from out of the province and country. pricing could get a bit expensive. I would not recommend the CN Tower restaurant, over-priced and lacking taste for their foods

Still very much worth going up the tower. Views are like being on a plane. If staying downtown be prepared to walk through several building sites. Counted 7 new skyscrapers being built plus a new subway station. Lot of grit in your eyes. I reckon Toronto will be great in 3/4 years.
I've been there too many times, taking tourists, to find it special. When it was the tallest in the world it was more exciting. I strongly recommend it to anyone who hasn't been.
We spent a couple of hours here on our first day and the views were breathtaking, you need to pay the extra and go all the way up.

I really enjoyed our trip up the tower. It was nice not to have to queue.The high speed lifts were fab. I couldn't believe how fast they took us to the top! We asked one of the guys in the lift if they ever broke down and he said no! Which was reassuring! He said the only time they...
Nice view and definitely worth taking the extra time up the highest point of the building.Definitely must go to the viewing glass floor for good view from the top.. Try the edge walk too!
Lines, lines, lines. Buy your ticket and start in your first line. Takes awhile to get through security and the lines to get to the top of the tower, but worth it! The views are amazing.

I go here every time I'm in Toronto and it's new every time. Make a reservation for lunch or dinner. The food is superb, the view is wonderful and admission is free to the tower if you're eating here. The tower is the communications hub for the Canadian National railway and is close to the main passenger station for commuter...

Took a total of 15 people to the CN Tower, it was a long wait but worth it. Beautiful views, the kids thoroughly enjoyed it. Attempted to do the skywalk but backed out. The teenagers did it and have a nice time

The CN Tower never fails to offer an unbelievable view of the city.The previous night we had attended a concert at the Amphitheatre and after a taxi decided to try and gouge us we chose to walk to our hotel. If you are in Toronto I highly recommend it. Quick view of our great city. The Thrill of glass bottom level. Now you can even hang from the tower from the outside! The thrill is next to none

this good on a bright sunny day ....breathtaking views from the deck.. you can see the whole toronto and as far as niagara falls... elevator ride itself lets you see the city around you.. i sure you will love it.
