Amazing view.....one of the few things worth visiting in the city. You can get a terrific view of toronto but 32 dollars plus additional 12 if you want to go to the top is way too much. Nice to try the window floor...if you are brave enough: I didn't
Hazy conditions prevented optimum long range views. Lines were long, nevertheless. Lots of kindergarten age children were in the lines, and the noise was deafening.

Stood in a queue for about 30 mins, which was OK for a Saturday in summer. Standing on the glass floor is a must, of course, although the kids seemed to be less nervous about it than the adults! Good views from the upper level, just a pity about the mesh, which I guess is necessary but kinda spolis the...
For only $200, 2 adults and 2 kids can go up the CN Tower and then up to the final little upper observatory to see miles and miles around. Cost is crazy, but worth doing once.
Great landmark, beautiful view from the top! Definitely want to try that new Sky Walk! Cool place to visit if you haven't yet
Been here before but now with children old enough to appreciate the views. Great for first time visitors.

The CN Tower, in my humble opinion, is the biggest ripoff going. It cost 32 dollars for admission. With this you can go up to the main middle part of the tower (not even the top, that is an extra 12 bucks!), go on a simulation, and then be treated to a movie which is really an ad for Boeing....

We were in Toronto for a recent stay and visited the CN Tower. The views were amazing and gave you a unique panoramic view of the city. There is an optional $12 per person upgrade to go to a higher floor but the additional height really didn't change the perspective and was not worth the expense for the family.

My family went here on a clear day. It was a little expensive to go up to the top, but somewhat worth the price to go up. DO NOT eat at the 360 restaurant, as it costs 11 dollars for a simple hamburger and 3 bucks extra to add cheese. Rip-off! The observation deck was nice and we could even...
I have been up the CN Tower a number of times over the years and the view is always sensational. With the changing landscape in Toronto it is great to see the changes from above.
When in Toronto, be sure to make the trip to the CN Tower, but do it on a clear day. Quite expensive but sorthåredes the money, but again you must do it on a clear day.

I went to the CN tower as part of the Edge Walk experience so a full pass was included in the price and It was great.The 3D movie was fun but didn't seem to really go with the rest of the theme as it was about surfing in Hawaii and we went Mid October so seemed a touch out...

For a giant tower that’s visible from anywhere in Toronto, it is not an easy place to access. Getting inside the actual tower though proved to be a bit of a nightmare. There was blocked off entries and bad signage, which led us to get lost.Once you get there, it is just a big tower like in any other...
You have to go up if you are a tourist. And they know this so the price will be paid nomatter what it costs. But it is expensive.

Most of the reviews and advertisements over exaggerate this attraction. While the views were beautiful, it was costly and not as elaborate as stated. The one feature they mention is the "glass floor". We were disappointed to find out it's only a 9x12 portion of the tower that is plexiglass so you can see below. It would be nice if...

I see a lot of people saying how expensive the CN Tower visit can be so I figured one way to see it and get exercise was to participate in their annual CN Tower Climb for charity. All I had to do was get $75 in donations, which I did via Facebook and other online connections and I was qualified....
OMG, not a cheap view, long line, however, something that you should do. You can experience the tower via You tube and save your cash.

First time up the tower in over 7 years and my isn't it different.Sadly it seems to have lost much of its shine and whilst it commands some very pleasant views it offers little more.The admission price is very expensive for what is available and my tip is don't bother paying to go right to the top as...

The price is a little on the expensive side, but its one of those need to do things.You pay you entrance fee, you go through security checks like being back at the airport. Then you get an electronic box & head phones for your automated tour. At certain points you are given information & history pointers through this.The...

I suppose this is somewhat interesting, but I found that once I was at the top, it didn't seem all that high. This is certainly not worth the $32 cost of admission. You line up for an hour, take a short elevator trip to the top, look around for about five minutes, then go back down. Even the skywalk glass...
The cost is quite prohibitive, even though the views are magnificent. They try to combine a few things and expect to pay $50 to get to the top :)

Exciting place in Toronto. Very expensive, but that's the business with tourists. Interesting view around the city.Different lighteffects on the tower or to illuminate it. It's not so nice with this illumination to look around.Alltogether we enjoyed our visit because of the amazing view.
I am not sure if I need to every go back but to stand on the glass floor and look down on the blue jays stadium was very cool. This is one of those once in a lifetime must see.

There is not a lot of places in Toronto (or anywhere else maybe) that you can get that high to see the city. We went there first time during the day, it has an entrance fee but its not too expensive. Alot of kids, school classes and tourist, of course. Second time we booked a table with set menu for...

A great downtown core tourist attraction where you can view 360 degrees around the GTA and Lake Ontario. Dare to go to the top and stand on the glass floor and look down. Admission prices are not cheap, but then again, you'd only go once in your lifetime.
It was included in my trip package. It offered great views of the city, water and stadium. I did enjoy the experience. I wish I had made a reservation for the restaurant. The menu looked fabulous

We queued for about an hour which is absolutely fine but they need to have indicators for instance lines on the floor indicating an hour wait, 30 mins etc. The revolving restaurant wouldn't let us have just starters even though it had only just opened and was empty which was ridiculous. Full dining only. The glass floor is a must...

go early - book on line if you can - go for the skypod too excellent views and great experience .the shows and ride at the bottom are a bit old and outdated do them if youve got time as youve paid for them but your not missing anything if you dont

I definitely had a lot of fun looking out at the surrounding area from the tower and then down below from the glass floor, but the ticket price plus the 13% HST was bit much, but fun nevertheless. I would have done the Skypod, but that was $12 more dollars. I'll definitely go back when I'm in Toronto again, but...

Incredible views of the city. Was there on the evening after the recent storm that flooded out parts of Toronto.You are better off going up to the restauraut and seeing the views from there, though the view from the area below the restauraut isn't quite as grand as from just upstairs. For not much more than the price of...

For the price, avoid this place. There is a lot more you can do I Toronto then wait an hour in line to go up and an hour in line to come down. The tower is always busy and it makes it a very unpleasant experience. I have been in other similar towers (Calgary, Seattle) and they were much more...

Upon arriving in Toronto, the first place we visited was the CN Tower. It was a bit more expensive than I would have guessed (more than $70 for two adults), but it's worth doing once.As the tallest structure in the Western Hemisphere, the CN Tower provides an awesome view of Toronto and the surrounding area. This was great place...

If you can, get your tickets ahead of time to save standing in line. Also don't go just before a blue jays game cause it gets really busy. We went on a friday mid afternoon and it was busy but not overwhelming. I highly recommend you pay the extra for the sky pod. Much better views all around. And if...
Expensive and it SucksI think it was around $36 to get there.It was a total disappointment. The only average attraction is the glass floor and it has a nice view but it is not worth the cost.

We had a great time at the CN Tower at the end of June. It wasn't overly busy so there was very little wait to go up to the top. There are lots of great photo ops, and staff were really friendly and polite. The glass floor was really scary but what a rush!!!! The edge walk looks crazy fun,...
A great place to visit. Have a meal in 360 restaurant, the best way to see Toronto. Try to pick a clear day and if you stay until its dark all the better.

Incredible views and great to learn about Lake Ontario, Toronto sights, etc. The general admission is pricey. Skypod is higher, yes - but is the added price worth it? Probably not. Pick a good, clear day and you may be able to see Rochester, NY!I would LOVE to try the EdgeWalk (hanging free at edge of deck with a...

We are glad we did it but once in a lifetime will be enough. We are not fans of heights, but even with this fear you can enjoy. We just were very aware of our surroundings and stayed in areas that were within our comfort zone. It was pleasant, not a long wait. The bathrooms however were deplorable. I was...

its beautiful and not to be missed if you are in toronto,however, canadians should be more creative and build some activities around this unique place.not just leaving the people inside to mingle and do the small area glass walk.

Went to the CN Tower with our family. I had previously checked about a week ago or so the rates and decided that the best option was buying the family pass for $99 ONLY available onsite. To our surprise they told us at the booth that it had been discontinued!! If I had known before, I could've bought online with...

This is a rip off. With tax it costs $36 per adult for general admission and you can't get all the views. The outside deck is all chicken wire so no photos work and its hard to look through. The observation level misses the eastern view as Horizons restaurant takes this. This is Very poor for tourists and we figure...

I went to the C.N. Tower a while ago, the Jays were struggling, I wanted to see If I could bring them some luck nuff' said. lol. Well, we got in line and waited for the people to serve us to tickets. It was only around a 45 minute wait, which apparently is the normal on a good day! When...

Having traveled to numerous attractions around the world, the CN tower I find a bit overpriced. The experience itself is nice, you get to see the entire city and on a clear day you can see even other areas further than the downtown core.

Our favourite part was the elevator ride up! It felt like it only took a minute or so, but it was an exciting ride. Once we were at the top, we managed to take a couple hundred photos of the city from loads of different angles. The most interesting thing to see in our opinion was the Toronto Islands because...

It was incredible to arrive by train and look back for an amazing view : the central station with the CN tower in the sunset. The following day going up the tower was amazing and fun, and you must take your pics in the transparent floor .... it feels so high !Yes is another tower in another city, with...

It just a waste to go . I can't even take a good pictures due to window fames. If you really want to go , I believe general admission tickert is good enough. Skypod didn't give any good view, and air is so limited , hard to breath .
You can't go to Toronto and not go to the Tower. It's a thrill and a privilege to have such a beautiful and amazing feat of engineering in Canada.

Since it is the highest tower in America (continental) you have to visit it, but if you have been to the Empire State, Hancock or Willis Tower (skydeck) in Chicago, you will be disappointed; extremely pricey, ($45 to go to the highest level, discount internet price), the best part is the view to downtown and some parts of the lake,...

The views are incredible and the glass floor is to die for, literally. But dont be a sucker, buy tickets in advance and print them out! Or you can waste another 30-60 minutes waiting at the ticket booth. The cafes and food venues, I think 3 total have good variety and are quite better than they have to be. We...

Have being on all these so one looks like the other. The restaurant is quite good but you have to have a reservation. Better not say any more as my son got engaged up there. Have being on better buildings.

This was over priced. The ride to the top was ok, ears popped etc... as it only takes 58 seconds.The views are great, but the service and the extra for the upper level makes this very expensive.The shop is tacky and the wait is long for the ride to the top.I suppose it is a ´must do´...

It was the weekend of the 4 of July so it was busy! the line for the ticket was about 20 minutes, but for the amount of people in line I thought the line move pretty quick. The line to get to the elevator to go up took about an hour. But there were things to look at and read...

Although was not the first time we had such experience, we enjoyed the great views of Toronto. We diden't use the restaurant as cost too much, but if you have the money and is once life's experience, do it !

I think that this is pretty much a must-see for anyone going to Toronto, but I don't think I would go a second time. The view is spectacular and exciting, but it is just a view with not much else to offer. Your admission ticket does include two movies, but honestly I wish I could have removed their cost from...

Waited over 1 1/2 - 2 hours to get in. Paid over $50 per person including the upper viewing area. Though it's nice to see the city below, definitely not worth the time/money. Waited near 2 hours, spent $450 for a 10-15 min. tour. I'm not sure why I always have to visit every tall structure in every town we...

As a man afraid of heights these places give me a wobbly feeling just looking up at them. But because I'm not a sissy, I go up them anyway. I can't comment on the price because my visually impaired friend and I got in for free! (Not sure if we should have). The lift takes one minute to go all...
One of the Toronto symbols! Highly recommend to step on the glass floor, if you brave enough. Great view! We definitely had a great time

CN Tower dominates the Toronto skyline and is your direction finder in the city.Not a cheap ride on the standard rates especially if you aren't using the restaurants but something one must do when in Toronto (on a rare visit). Other features are the Skypod, (another obs deck 33 storeys above the Lookout deck as an extra), the glass...
a must do in Toronto, the view is fantastik and other activitties that are included in the price are super cool.kids loved it!
Liked: The colored light shows that happen at every one hour interval.A bit pricey if you wish to go up.

We went about 6PM on a Saturday and there were very few lines. Later on Sunday it was packed. The view is somewhat spoiled by the restaurant taking up 25% or so of the viewing area. As the deck rotates once every 72 minutes, you could stand in the same place for that period of time and see the entire...

When we booked the meal in the 360 resturant u got acces to the viewing platforms.I am not a lover of heights but i must say it was worth pulling myself through the fear factor.The veiws are stunning i reccomend it to anyone

Wonderful views - we arrived just before 11AM on a weekday and there was no line whatsoever, went right up the elevators with our City Pass. The glass floor was small but fun for kids. After taking many pictures and making our way down the elevators, we were pleased to hear the price also included a free 3D movie and...

Great time at the CN Tower. We went as soon as it started getting dark. Great view of the bay and city. My kids loved it especially the fact i kept lighting up every few seconds. The glass floor was also very cool. I recommend going at night as it was a great experience. Get the city-pass and save some...
CN Tower is a must visit attraction in Toronto but the admission fees are not cheap. Long line up during our visit.

You really need to do this if your in Toronto. I did this on a rather dull day, but was worth it. Go early on as it is so so busy! I went up to the highest point and there was only me there at the time so was really good!
The view of Toronto is tremendous. If you book a meal for 55 dollars you get in free! Do try it and don't be afraid as everywhere is protected. You won't fall off!
Too expensive for what it is. You can't take good pictures because of the windows. The glass floor is really small. Well, it will seem like NYC but it's really not.

Going up the CN tower is one of those 'tick it off my list' things, the glass floor is kind of cool and it's amusing to watch aircraft take off on the nearby island airport and they still be below you as they rise into the air, but in other ways the view is no more special than the view...
Unbelievable views for sure! The glass elevator on the way up is a bit scary, but definitely worth it when you get to the top - the views are amazing - this is a don't miss!!!

The "rocket" ride in the elevator to the viewing area was excellent and the panoramic views of the are was mind blowing. The glass floor left some very squeamish while others could not bring themselves to stand on the glass and look down all that way. Went back to the revolving restaurant that afternoon and enjoyed the views all over...

My wife and I spent two fabulous hours celebrating our 20th wedding anniversary. We revolved twice and got to watch the city go from evening to dark. Get the fixed price dinner; the food was outstanding, the service excellent, and the experience cannot be priced. It's transcendent. go!

I hate heights, but i always go to elevated places. Its like I can't get enough of the views. The observation deck was nice, good views of the city and harbor even on a cloudy day. The outdoor deck was nice and windy. What really got my stomach dropping was the glass floor. I couldn't make myself walk on it....

If you're in Toronto you will want to experience this, but I can't say that it was very exciting. The observation deck is busy and fairly average. The glass floor is a tiny section full of people, the open observation deck is covered in mesh, and the skypod (which costs extra) isn't any better. All photo opportunities are obscured by...

This 18,000 plus foot elevated structure was named one of the seven "Wonders of the World" by the America Society of Civil Engineers. Up to 2010, the CN Tower was the tallest structure on earth. It has a stunning 360 degree view of Toronto, which is one of the fastest growing and exciting cities in the world. For those scared...
Had to be done and well worth it ! , Views amazing ,Kids loved it and the glass floor was amazing , you must go up the tower if in the city , watch the weather as views can be restricted

This is a must-do for visitors to Toronto. We've been to the observation decks at all the "talk buildings" in several major US cities (NYC, Chicago), and this rivals any of them. This is a great experience for families (our 2 small children loved it). The glass floor section is surreal, making you feel like you're suspended in mid-air!
The kids loved the glass floor. They were a little bored by the aviation movie which, thankfully, was part of the city pass purchase price.

The view is worth a trip to the top of the tower. We ate in the 360 restaurant, which I guess is another review entirely. While the view from the observation deck is great, it's significantly better in the restaurant, where you don't have to deal with throngs of people competing for space and sight lines. But perhaps that's simply...
It is excellent experience and must visit. If you are dare enough, there is edge walk above 1100 ft too.

Not the tallest free standing tower since the Burj Khalifa came into existence but CN Tower gives you access to a city view that its competitor couldn't imagine in a million years. A trip to Toronto is incomplete without visiting the CN Tower.

This is a must see. The observation deck is simply stunning when looking out over Toronto. Luckily it was a clear day and could see for miles. I had an Edge Walk ticket so I got to experience everything that the CN Tower had to offer. I would highly recommend this attraction to anyone visiting Toronto.

I mainly did this to say I went up in the CN Tower, I first attempted to go up it around 4pm one afternoon but was advised it was an hour wait for the elevator. I do appricate being advised of that. So I opted to go the following morning when they opened. The downside of this was that it...

The CN Tower is a must see attraction in Toronto. Meaning that you go up and see Toronto from above. Try to go there when there is something going on in the nearby Rogers Centre and the roof is open. You never saw e.g. baseball from that perspective.

The price of admission was outrageous. The view from the observation deck is far less impressive than many of world's top skylines. The traffic getting there through downtown Toronto and parking around the tower were most annoying. I've driven many times through NY, Chicago, LA, Paris, Rome, Seoul, Tokyo, and Hong Kong, and that's saying something. My advice is 1)...

The CN tower was a great experience and you get some great views from the top. You can also watch some planes land at billy bishop airport if your into that.You can save up to 5 % by purchasing tickets online from the official CN tower website, this can be a saving of up to 5 bucks per person....

My boyfriend and I visited the CN Tower back in April 2013. We had a wonderful time. The staff was super friendly, and the view was amazing. At first the glass floor took some time to get used to. They do have a 360 restaurant inside which I heard good reviews on. When we were there the Ripley's Aquarium was...

I'll just say it up front - yes, visiting the CN Tower is a "tourist thing" but face it - how many times in your life will you have the opportunity to visit one of the modern wonders of the world, or one of the highest buildings in the world? That alone makes it a "must do" if you visit...

On our way home from Cuba we had a couple of hours between our flights and decided spending them in the city. We took a taxi and stopped at the CN Tower. Just outside there are a couple of old steam engines and railway cars which we first had a look at before crossing the road and going up to...

We had access to the site using our City Pass so we didnt really have to sit in line and wait too long. Right off the bat there is a photographer taking family pictures. They make it seem like this is a mandatory thing however if you do not want to wait for the photo you simply walk right by....

Great views of the city. But little else. C$50 to visit the upper viewing gallery as well as the lower.Enjoyed it, but thought it was greatly overpriced. Doesn't help that the design: angled windows, mesh etc, makes it difficult to take good photos

column3: New York, New York, United States
column4: the observation deck has a transparent floor on sections that you could stand on and see everything underneath your feet. it was scary at first then fun and amazing.

When I thought of the CN Tower I thought..Nice views, fun elevator ride up, and some interesting souvenirs.Which is what I exactly got. You can get some nice pictures up there and see Toronto from a different point of view which is nice. The glass floor is interesting, it allows you to see through the floor to the...
The sites from above we're amazing. However, the price of admission was notably high and the elevator was packed in a way that minimized the experience of reaching the destination.

We went on a busy Sunday in mid June. There was a BlueJays game going on, so parking was a challengeI would definitely suggest paying the extra $12 for the sky pad experience. While we were up there, the Rogers Centre opened their dome, and we could see right into the stadium. It was very cool. The elevator ride...
Pretty good view but expensive. Like the glass floor you can stand over.Try and go up on a clear day.
The view is fantastic, as you can see for miles. There is a glass floor, which is popular. It is, of course, very touristy, with photographers and gift shops everywhere, but well worth a visit.

My wife and I hit the tower the first day we got to Toronto. The sky had just cleared out from rain and we didn't know if we'd get a better opportunity to see the Toronto skyline at night so we went. The lines weren't too bad and the view was pretty cool. There was a lot of good information...
The view is worth the price in my opinion. Really spectacular. The extra amount to get to the very top is a must. The free ride and movie at the end on the ground floor is a SKIP. .

Great views of the city. This is a must for any visitor to the city. Go for a walk around the outside and if you are very brave stand on the glass floor to see the sheer drop below. A great experience.
It's definitely overpriced for what it is. Yes, the views and the glass floor were neat but they are worth $15 not $30.
We didn't pay for the trip up, but after visiting quite a few towers/structures around the world, this was more of a check list thing to do while in Toronto.

A definite must see if in Toronto. Queues not too long, however there were lots of rude french speaking children on school trips running around and banging into people - teachers took no notice!!! My husband paid to go up to the pod and said it was worth it. However, we were reluctant to pay the $C170 each to do...
An expansive attraction but stunning views and a place to visit if you are doing the tourist things in Toronto.

When its a rainy cloudy day, there is zero view.We were in bad luck.Food was a bit pricey but wasn't my first time here so its expected.The server took a lot of time (20 mins to place my order) and on a piss poor rainy day thats just unacceptable

Most obvious tourist attractions are worth avoiding but this is really worth the cash and the time. Top tip pay the extra and go right to the top, the upper level is just a great place to stand and watch the city.

Booked CN Tower visit online - note that you have to print the tickets yourself - and then headed down to the Tower on the same day.Unfortunately our tickets failed to print out our details which we only realised once we'd arrived and been instructed to queue up in the ticket line anyway to have our eTickets validated. Fortunately...

We decided since we were driving to Vaughan from Montreal that we would take our girls to the CN Tower since they had never been! I couldn't believe how much it cost....$99.00 for the 4 of us!! For that price there isn't much to do except go up, look out and stand on the glass floor! They should have something...
This was a great experience. It was not to pricy, and the glass floor was amazing! The customer service was exceptional, though it could have been better.

Went to the tower on a monday night, from the start it felt like an unorganised set up, nobody to tell uswhere to go to view the motion ride attraction before we went up for the view,abrupt security guardChecking our bags.In the end we missed out on the motion ride as we ended up watching a 3D...

My wife an I only had time whilst in the Toronto area for either Niagara Falls or the CN TOWER but not both, so due to the fact that we were feeling rather tired we opted for the attraction closer to the airport. Well I remember going to this about a scary 27 years previously,We had a good weather...

The lines were easy to navigate and the guides helpful and friendly. There were many different ways to enjoy the view, all included with the normal cost. I was also quite surprised at the bargains available in the gift shop for souvenirs.

Very tall and had a nice view at night. We did enjoy seeing the glass floors where you look straight down. Just too expensive to pay full price. We did the City Pass which gave access to the Royal Ontario Museum, the zoo, the science museum, and the casa lobo. Much better bargain doing all those which are better than...
We always make it a point to go the CN Tower each time we visit Toronto... The view from the top never gets old..I would recommend paying a bit extra to go to the 2nd level as the view is great!!!

Looking through the floor at the busses below (they looked like ants!) was really amazing. The sights at night are well worth the trip up. The whole city in lights will always be a favorite memory of Toronto

There is obviously no better view in Toronto than there. But... there are longgg lines before getting in. So be patient. Glass floor was giving goose bumps. But as the price includes only the view you will have, the experience is expensive. Try to go if possible on a clear day, otherwise it's a spoiled experience. But it's a great...

This is the second time I visit the CN Tower. I live in Toronto, and both times, I have been fascinated by the amazing views you can see of the city of Toronto, the whole downtown, and the lake Ontario. If you are visiting Toronto, this is one of the places you cant miss to go.The price to go...
pay a load for the 4 of us to go up the tower. not very impressive, the glass floor was small area, I thought it was a whole floor made of glass. Up and down in less than an hour.

First let me say that I think it is priced too high for most families of 4 to afford tickets. But for couples it is the perfect spot - great for first date or any special occasion. The first elevator ride was uneventful but we learned some fun facts from the operator. We had drinks & an appetizer at Horizons...

Yes, a visit to the observation level of the tower is pricy. Even more so if you also do the SkyPod. Altogether about $40 if you buy in advance online. A better option is to look at the CityPASS if you're going to do a couple of the other include attractions.That being said, there are fantastic views from the...
No waiting, great views. They have a glass floor you can walk on that is real cool. Not too expensive for Toronto

From up there you have one of the best views i ever had! we had a clear day so you could see everything. the glass floor is pretty cool. another very cool time to go up there is during a baseballgame at rodgers center.
best view of Toronto, and glass floor was awesome. yet way overprized.. $36 is not worth it! its easy to get to, yet expect long lines to get in.

Breathtaking view. If you don't want to spend money to go up, there is a historic site at the bottom of the tower where some locomotives are displaced. You can take some good pictures there. You can also take a walk around that area and historic sites are within a 15 minutes walk.

Had group of kids and senior citizens. It's a view of the city from up high, but i can do that on my Google maps. The kids enjoyed the small area of a glass floor for a few minutes. Ticket price includes a movie/documentary about flight which half of us fell asleep in. Also a 3D ride which was probably...
The CN Tower is one of 7 Wonders of the Architectural World at 1815 feet in height. Great views of Toronto and environs and a thrill of a rush getting to the top.
A must see tourist attraction that has amazing views of the city. Get the camera out and see what you can stop from the top, highly recommended.
This was great. Short wait times, awesome elevator ride, incredible views of the city. Observation deck and glass floor was awesome.

We just had one afternoon in downtown Toronto so we decided to make the tower one of our stops on our short walking tour as it was right in the middle of several other attractions. We were a little surprised that it cost $32 per person just for general admission, but decided to give it a try. Because we went...

This is an excellent place to visit if you are Toronto city, You can have most beautiful view of the whole city from this tower and The glass floor is amazing. The evening view of the city is just mind blowing.

It's a 350m observation deck with a partial glass floor, the opportunity to walk out on a metal grill outside and the obligatory restaurant and shop.I am not fazed by heights, and pride myself on ensuring my head rules my emotion - but I now believe only the young can just accept standing on glass above a 346m verticle...
This has to be a highlight. The glass floor is amazing and the 360 views of Toronto breathtaking. If you have the stomach and the money do the outside walk.
If you are not afraid of heights, it offers the best view of the city. Pretty expensive but worth a visit

Fairly expensive for what it is, but what a view from the top! Toronto is a very pretty city and is shown in it's best light from above.Glass floor is good but could show a wider landscape below.Wish we'd have done the edge walk but we were short on time :-(

Another tick off the bucket list :)Great views and sightsWas a bit off putting the time and security to get in and then the diner that had great views but not allowed in unless you were eating, the walk around 360 bit was not good for photo taking as the mesh was in the way, but good views...

It was us just normal "tourist trip" to Toronto. Normally we take trip as business trip, but what to do within easter time? NHL game, Niagara and of course dinner at CN Tower. It was great, good food and incredible views around big lakes and Toronto. And the the glass bottom elevator to the top, don't miss it even you...

If you are going to Toronto, don't miss out to visit CN Towers! Comfortable elevators take you easily to the 350-meter level, with a wonderful view over the beautyful city. And if you dear you can WALK OUTSIDE the tower! Good restaurants and other facilites as well.

Don't be cheap on this. If you are going to go to the CN Tower go and eat in the 360 restaurant. That way you get to see the whole city without people bumping into you. Also if you go and have dinner or lunch up there they wave the $36 charge for going up. You are able to see...
Great attraction fun lift with glass bottom and the glass floor at the top. You can also walk around the outside now if you have the time and nerve.

I've been up there 3 or 4x. I lived with in 10 minutes walking distance, Its a wonderful area, great tourist attraction and many things to do in and round the area.If you are visiting Toronto, you definitely must go, even if you don't go up the tower, there are many many many things to do in and round...

But so recognisable form disaster films where it is destroyed alongside the Hollywood sign, Big Ben and the Taj Mahal. V useful if you're staying, as I was, at the Renaissance Hotel as it's built atop it, almost. Excellent instagrammage.
The view is breathtaking - just that nothing much to do after that. Maybe am being a bit biased because I have seen many such tall towers in the past.

We booked the restaurant at the top of the CN Tower through the concierge at our hotel. Our main reason for going was for the view from the top. We were very disappointed with the non existent views, as it was a very cloudy, wet night. We would not have gone there if we had known that we would not...
We took a trip up the CN tower and then paid $12 to go up the next stage. Great views and the glass floor was awesome to walk on. Would have gone outside but thought $175 was really expensive.

Our whole trip lasted 20 minutes including queuing. Don't go up to the observation tower if you intend to take great photos. You have to visit the CN Tower if you've never been to Toronto. Pay the extra $12 to go up to the next level. Great views of the city!

I was in Toronto for a conference and as part of our welcome to Toronto package was a few entrance tickets to different sites in the city. One of them was admission to go up the CN Tower.I rode the elevator up, took shots of the 360 city view , went out onto the observatory (super windy) and then...

the CN tower has great views of the city all around and well worth the look, you jump in an elevator that is on the outside of the building and takes you to the top viewing deck where you can wonder around, there is also a restaurant up there if you go for dinner it would be wonderful at night...

I echo some other reviews here, very poor value. Look out over a city of condos, take a few photos through the glass, the mesh is so fine on the outside deck the photos look awful spending about 15 minutes there. I felt ripped off and wasn't about to spend more money on food, access to the next higher viewing...

I loved this attraction. There was a clear sky the day we visited so you could see for miles, I got some amazing photo's! A little pricey to get in but once I got to the viewing tower I knew it was worth it. Aesthetically pleasing also. It's a must!!

Informative and friendly staff, willing and able to please the visitor. A great experience to be whisked up to a great height in 60 seconds in an outside lift/elevator. And a glass floor to give the collywobbles to the nervous.
If you are visiting Toronto then it should be part of your tour. You must go to the top and must go to the glass deck.. if you can book dinner at the 360, it is definitely worth it.

Definitely a must visit while you are in town. Pick up the CityPass to get a great value on 5 different venues. I only used 3 of them and it was a little less than if I purchased them individually. The rest I gave away.
I went up at night and there was no queue. When I was there, there were people walking outside and this was shown on TV screens in real time, which was interesting.
Very steep entry price, 3 D movie and simulator have nothing to do with the tower. View only so so, Can skip if not such an iconic symbol
Awesome views of the city. Loved the glass floor. I would highly recommend this. We did not go up to the Sky pod because it was a separate fee.

At 1,815 feet the CN Tower has lost its title as the tallest free standing structure in the world, but still attracts millions of tourists looking for a bird's eye view of Toronto and the surrounding areas. A glass elevator whisks you to the 1,122 foot high indoor/outdoor observation deck where a portion of the floor is transparent. Instead of...

Please please please don't waste your money by going up in the CN Tower. I've been up in similar structures elsewhere (Seattle and Chicago, for example), and NEVER have I paid anywhere close to what they charge here. And when you get to the top, there is very little to see/do. We spent maybe 15 minutes at the top before...

I was very disappointed to find out that the fee I paid for my group tour did not actually take me all the way to the top. The glass floor was cool but I was not willing to pay another $12 to see the rest of it. I had expected guides that would explain the history , etc instead you...
Having lived in Canada for 14yrs, finally had the chance to visit CN tower. I must say it was just spectacular view. Never realised that Toronto was so beautiful at nighttime.
If you have been up other towers - dont bother! Good views but many kids lying out on glass floor blocking access and views. Over priced photos and food.Have a nice meal by waterfront instead!

We went all the way up to the Skypod, and yes, it was very high and an experience worth doing. Travelled with our daughters aged 10 and 12. We have been to Toronto many times but had never gone up the CN Tower. I had been once as a child but not in a very long time.Understanding that most things you do in Toronto with the family will cost money, we accepted the fact that we would have to...
Probably a one-time experience for us. The food was excellent and the view from the moving deck while eating was really great. But it is expensive.

We were lucky enough to go up on a very clear day so we had great views. They have a glass floor which was the highlight for me. If you are in the area and want to see Toronto from the sky then this the place to do it. I would pre purchase tickets to avoid the lines.

As most other tourists to Toronto we paid a visit to the CN Tower, we went at dusk to see the city lights, there were alot of road works and construction outside which made finding the entrance quite difficult, but inside we bought the more expensive tickets which included a 3D film, which turned out to be about an aeroplane...
simply a must-do! Definitely go to the uppest deck. I didn't really like the simulation thing you go on before/after you visit the Tower Deck. Cafe on the ground floor is nice and reasonably priced.

Book lunch for about 50 dollars. It saves you the 30 admission. You get a comfy seat, excellent food, we had Caesar salad, superbly cooked steak and a mega chocolate tower desert.. Sat for a couple of hours, brilliant views and you are not being jostled by all the tourists on the other floors. Rotation takes about 90 mins. The...

I am not brave when it comes to things up high, but i heard too many good things about the Tower not to go. Turns out, the elevators going up to the first observation deck are on the outside and have floor to ceiling glass windows. If your like me and not too fond of heights, try not to be...

easy access can very busy at ticket level fast ride to restaurant. level but view can be restricted by surrounding buildings. suggest paying extra 12 dollars to get lift to top area, for unrestricted view of Toronto suggest visiting second cup coffee house at base level excellent service and cheaper pastry's than starbucks.
Tip: book lunch or dinner at 360 restaurant and you save the cost of the entrance to the viewing platform! But the views from the top are great over the city and the lake.
Well overpriced for what it is and over very quickly. Not sure what the attraction is to this rip off.
For people who have nothing to do in Toronto, just pay a visit and spend some money to see views. Car parking is not difficult to find but expensive.
The views are stunning from there !I don't know why but I kind of braced myself for the whole floor to be see through, but thank God for that, there is only part of it.

It's the greatest attraction in Ontario! The only time I go is when we have visitors from out if town (which is not often). The view is spectacular and that's what you go for! We didn't eat at 360 apparently you need reservations and the alternative was just mediocre, In the heart of the City, the food choices are endless.
Visited this place when I was really young. This is the highest point of Toronto, remeber to take a camera!
we missed a guide to tell us more what we were looking at. the place was clean and there was a booth for taking picture but no one to give you info.
pricey, but seriously, it's an icon. If you don't go up, you will look back and wish you had dealt out the cash to do so.
It was an excellent experience ,We enjoyed visiting it .Small kids enjoyed walking on the glass floor .We had nice food on top of CN Tower .The view was great .
A great experience.A very detailed account of how this tower was constructed.Dislikes, prhaps ther could be cheaper food andbeverage outlets.

For Toronto's top attraction, I felt it could with more staff and better trained in customer service I found the whole experience frustrating and not that enjoyable including the staff member that told me the 360 restaurant was full when it wasn't.When you finally get up there its a very nice view as you would expect, I think the...

We enjoyed the view from the CN tower. My school age kids thought walking on the glass floor was the best part. We went at 1:30 and had about a 40 minute wait; however when we left at 4:00, there was no wait. Parking directly across in a small lot was $25.00, but we found a garage 2 blocks away...
The view is second to none and a must for photographs. It can be a bit pricey to reach the top at about $38.00 per person.

Went today with my Czech friend and his family including a 5 months and 2 years old. I've gone in the past with a friend and on a school trip that I can remember. It was busy today. We went after we ate. It seemed to me that the price has probably increased by about 10 bucks by then, I'm...

This was one of the highlights of our trip. The views are just out of this world, you feel on top of the world! However my disappointment after having visited the Pearl tower in Shanghai were the glass floor goes all the way round, this one only has small sections. The overall effect is not the same. If you have...

A great tourist trap - especially on a clear day. All the staff very helpful and informative and seemed to love their jobs. Would recommend the extra expense of going up to the Sky Pod and never felt hassled or rushed. It is better to go at the time of day when it is dusk and watch the city change...
A great place to get some amazing views of Toronto. Try going around dusk to get some stunning sunset and night-time photos of the city.

The views are excellent and the night lights just coming on as we were there were very pretty. The hours of operation are very generous and allow you to take advantage of the attraction after you have spent the day doing other things.
I would recommend the CN tower as it is unique in Northamerica. The view of the city of Toronto is spectacular

A bit overpriced at about $50 but something you have to do once in life for sure. Have been back since my teenage years and decide to accompany a colleague while in town for work.If you willing to pay the high price to go up, you might as well pay the extra $12 and go to higher observation deck...

We visited the CN Tower which at the time was the tallest free standing structure in the world I'm not sure it is now. We travelled to the top and walked on the glass floor, looked around the entire 360 dgrees and watched the sun set before eating in the 360 restaurant. An amazing evening.

Hate heights? don't go...love heights? Please go. The elevators run from the outside, so you get a nice view of the area. Step on the glass floor to test your bravery! Located next to Rogers Center, Metro Convention Center and soon the new Rippley's Aquaruim

The glass floors in the skydeck and the elevator are a nice touch but don't really provide a spectacular view of anything except straight down. This restaurant is lovely. The dinning was fabulous. The view is amazing. You will really enjoy the experience as the restaurant revolves around and you see the beautiful lights of the city at night.

Wouldn't have gone but we received free tickets. Ridiculously expensive ($32 adult, $24 child). This is a must-see when in Toronto. The views are great. I have been twice. Once in August of 2012 and most recently in May 2013. We drove from Niagara Falls to Toronto on the QEW along Lake Ontario. When we arrived it was the beginning of rush hour and the roads were busy. We had a lot of fun visiting CN Tower. It was a rainy, cloudy day and we still had a fun time. This is a "must seel" when in Toronto. We enjoyed the view and lunch at 360 restaurant.
I have been to the CN Tower a couple of times. This time was disappointing as Toronto has grown so much that the view from the tower is not as good as it used to be.

The trip up the tower was great, view was breath taking and activities were fun however the price just wasn't right. This used to be the world tallest tower until being topped by the Burj tower in Dubai. Nonetheless this is a great place to visit. Too much money, not enough thrills. Such a waste of my money. This place is not for adults without kids.

The observation deck of the CN Tower is quite disappointing. There is a strange grid on the windows which ruins the view and makes it hard to take good pictures. The glass floor is quite small and only consists of 2 windows. If you visit the 360° restaurant you get the observation deck for free. The experience in the restaurant...

No trip to Toronto would be complete without ascending the CN Tower. Although it's expensive, especially when you go to the very top - the views over the harbour and the city are unparalleled. The glass floor is a great feature and we were delighted that we went.

Its my second visit to CN tower and both the times it felt exciting.Things to watch -1. Glass floor- exhilarating experience to walk on glass floor.2. My wife is scared of heights but enjoyed every moment of the spectacular views afforded from the top of the CN Tower. Worth paying that little bit extra to go right to the top. Visit early morning to avoid the crowds.

This was 34 dollars each for the lift to the top but if you wanted to go a higher level that was extra.The one we had was high enough. Lovely views over Toronto Island and there a glass floor to look down on. Over priced for a lift. Still I'm pleased we went.

CN Tower the tallest in Toronto. The view that you get from there is very good. We had gone in the evening and there was not much of a rush to go in. You can see the football game being played at Rogers Centre from above. They open up the dome at Rogers Centre when a match is being played...
The view from the glass floor is scary but cool. Dinner at HORIZONS was delicious, the service was impecable, and the view was breathtaking!

The first time I went up I had to overcome my fear of extreme heights however, I found that it really was not that bad! The elevator moves fast and if you don't want to look down as you go up and see the ground go away - you don't have to (it is quite neat though). Seems as though...
We wanted to go up to the top and take pictures of the city, but it was $32 per person to take the elevator ride to the top. Wasn't worth it in my book, so we took pictures from the bottom up :(
If you would like to see all Toronto CN Tower is the best place. It is very interesting to look how airplanes landing on the small iceland.

I lived in Toronto for year, this was my first time visiting the CN Tower close up and all the way at the top. The time to stop and look at, at such a beautiful city was breathtaking and I was simply in awe. I went late at night and got to see the city skyline. If you've never been...

It was quite a view from the top, but really other than seeing all over the city, it was a bit pricey for my tastes. I only went to the first stop, and declined the further 33 floors up, which was another $12. I'm pretty sure I wouldn't bother going again.
Been there dozens of times! I love it! my family enjoys it as well. I recommend doing the skywalk-what an experience. It is Toronto's landmark and I try and visit as most as I possibly can
Loved every minute of this attraction and even paid the extra $12 to visit the Sky pod.....146 floors up! Must see!!

On a super clear day we could see NY. We bought our tickets online saving $. We opted for both the Skypod as well as the observation deck. I went up the tower only as part of the Sky Walk package. Go on a sunny, clear day. Great view. Out of season there are no queues. In season avoid weekends...
The best time to visit this attraction is in the evening.You can see the beautiful skyline.The souvenir shop is nice. The 3D movie is a frat visual experience.
this was amazing and is worth every penny!! we had a great time and even braved the glassed floor! the view is amazing and on a clear day you can see the whole of Toronto and further.

Ok the lift up is quick and you get very good views of the city but would have like to see a bit more about the construction of the tower as appose to a show about the making of the Dream liner aeroplane (3D cinema show). On every ones to do list so you have to pay for it!

Everything from the service to the view is good. It's just that I don't feel worth it spending 32 dollars and just spent 10 minutes on the top. The view of every city is always the same.But the L'HautDaCieux the edge walk sounds great, just too expensive for 175 dollars.
Loved the view, the service was exceptional and the food as well. Must do dinner spot if visiting Toronto, great way to see the skyline of the city!

It is awesome the glass floor is amazing and on the same level there is a balcony that is awesome the leaning over the side of the building looks cool I didin't try it though.people might say that the sky line is like the same but it isint cn tower much better I recommend you going.

The CN tower affords you a ride to the top in a glass enclosed elevator. Although not as historical or artistic as the Eiffel Tower or the Statue of Liberty, the CN Tower is the main landmark of Toronto.The view is OK (you see Toronto and Lake Ontario) and the elevator ride is exciting. the glass floor on the CN tower is breathtaking!tickets r fairly priced, get your photograph clicked and walk around the precious canadian tower spend an hour or so, great great view of the ontario lake and downtown toronto from the top!
A 'must do' in T.O.Not for those with vertigo, especially the top bit or the glass floor.You have to do it though and the views are spectacular.
Well worth the money. We got the all inclusive tickets and found it to be value for money. Amazing 360 degress of views around the city and over the island. A must do while in this beautiful city.

CN Tower was once the tallest tower all over the world. The view and architecture is outstanding! the view from the glass floor is unreal! I wouldn't walk the side of it with bungee cords but I would love to dine in the restaurant in the sky!

Bringing back childhood memories can be a good or a bad thing. It wasn't a bad experience, but there was not much that has changed. For first time goers it would be a fantastic experience with the elevator ride to the top, the glass floor, the rides, and the view. The food and refreshments were way over priced! It is...
the views are awesome. check out the weather...better be sunny and bright outside. On a clear day they say you can see the mist from Niagara falls...

Yes, it is expensive for what you get and going to the higher Skypod level costs another $12. However, the view from that height is spectacular. When planning a trip to Toronto, it is a neat stop. The CN Tower may not be the tallest free standing structure anymore, but it still has an unbelievable view. This is definitely a "must do" in Toronto. People of all ages can and clearly do enjoy it. I missed out the last time I came about 7 years ago so I was determined not to miss it again. Don't be put off by "wimps". It's grrrreat!

Was all dark till we started going up,then bang glass window elevator,I was leaning against ,I don't like heights .and being against the window freaked me out,looking from the bottom the whole tower sways back and forth big time,,was cool to add to my ,I bin there list but not to excited about it

It is about as expensive as the Empire State building and worth it. Make sure to walk on the glass floor. Our best souvenir is a photo taken by an employee on the glass floor.

Visited Toronto over 20 years ago and I remembered the CN Tower differently. Tried to time our arrival for sunset to get both day and night views. One of the must see in Toronto, have to to all the way up there! Going there every year for my birthday.... Miss this year's due to a very bad cold... but other than that I would have gone! lol great view of the city and beyond...

The CN Tower in my opinion only is a great icon that represents the city well but as far as going up the tower, I would say its a waste of money. The views are great from up top but spending $35 to go up an elevator doesn't seem to make any sense to me. When I walk around the...

An obvious attraction to first time visitors to Toronto. Well worth a visit -either during the day or at Night. The revolving restaurant serves excellent meals. We ate there by chance. We had no reservation but got a table within 10 minutes. A fantastic view of the City.

The CN tower is a fun experience with views of the city and Lake Ontario with a restaurant, glass floor and activities as well. I visit a couple of times a year.

Fairly expensive but totally worth it.. especially if you are there on a clear day makes a big difference. Lots of information and guides to tell you everything you wish to know.
While in Toronto, the CN Tower is a must. The view is amazing and well worth the ride up! Try it once and you will enjoy

Great place to visit. walk on the glass floor at the top of the tower, walk outside or take a walk on the skywalk if you dare. Great tourist attraction, fantastic views and the Aquarium will soon be opening which gives you even more to see. Nice gift shop for souveniers too.

Though it's a bit costly but you should never miss out on seeing the CN Tower both from outside and from the view-point on the top. Very helpful staff, not too long in queues, and a wonderful reward at the top.Great souvenir shop at the top as well - loved the baby clothing section.Very interesting info about the building of the tower.
Fantastic views.... but extremely expensive !!!! It is very important to choose wisely the date of your visit. In a clear day with blue skies, the view of the Lake Ontario is absolutely amazing.

I visit all tallest buildings/towers whenever I go but this one looks better from the bottom than from the top. The ticket will not take you to the top deck - you have to pay extra. The sky view amazing and is not required to pay more to go to the highest place in the tower to have a gratefully view of Toronto and the lake. I must point out I love towers, they give you such a grand view of everything. The CN Tower has great views of the surrounding area and waterways. The elevators are so intense! We got a general admission pass and it was well worth the $30. Breathtaking views of the city and during the week there was no line. Make sure to stand on the glass floor! It's wild! Staff was friendly and knowledgable for the most part. It was a definite must see in Toronto.
So much to see and its breathtaking going at night/when its dark. If you love the city, its nice to see just how big it is.

Even while North America Is No Longer The Skyscraper Or Tower Capital Of The World The CN Tower Is Worth A Visit As Toronto's Defining Trademark. Great food. Awesome attraction. The view is spectacular. It's not a low budget kind of trip but completely worth it. It's a must if you visit Toronto.

Views were amazing, this is an expensive trip but well worth it and is really a one off. We went over the glass floor and this was scary at 1st but fine after your on it, as it SO strong and can actually hold up to 14 LARGE HIPPOS ! so this was a comfort knowing that. The skypod is...

If you have the chance to go to Toronto, you have to make time for a trip up the CN Tower. At minimum to see the spectacular views, particularly at night. Agree with most other reviewers - it is pricey, but the view is amazing. Pricey but worthwhile. Having lunch there, delicious, is quite an experience. Do not forget to take your camera along. The view is breathtaking.

Awesome experience! Got to see a great view of Toronto. The elevator is the worst part, but worth it. Not sure if the extra level was worth the extra money, but we did it anyway. Hard to beat the pictures we got from that high! Do it!

Enjoyed the view from the top if a little overpriced, but the inside of the tower is dated and old and the information boards need updating badly. The lift ques were somewhat frustrating also especially when you want to leave.Cafe / Resturant in need of update also.

Liked- smooth lifts, clean areasDisliked- tortuous way in, tired staff,almost obligatory photo,uninspired shopNot recommended unless the sun is shining,as shadows make the view and enliven the lake's colours

Awesome views and a cool movie, but probably not worth the price of admission, especially since the outside viewing deck was closed. I thought there would be more to do, to be honest.....
Can't wait to try the Edge Walk next! Glass Floor is awesome. Try participating in the annual fundraiser and take the stairs up - a whole new appreciation of the CN Tower and its height!

Great experience and fantastic views. Visited early evening mid-week in March so no queues. Well i decided to go to the CN Tower In Toronto, as I am driving Thru Queen Elizabeth Highway, you can see it and it pretty amazing. However getting there you have to drive Thru a lot of Traffic. once i got there i park in downtown for $20 dollars which is a hefty price, then i just walk to...
A Little bit expensive, but incredible experience in the tallest building of the world. Glass bottom floor and the views are also incredible.

What a view.Cost is just under $50 each but the view and experience is worth it.It is amazing.We went first thing when there wasn't much of a queue.The lift is an experience in itself as the city opens up before you.The glass floor is a must.Take your camera and enjoy the view.

Amazing sights, a great restaurant, walking on glass, and the insane edge walk all make this attraction a must-visit. You really haven't seen Toronto until you've gone to the heights of the CN tower to have an amazing panoramic view of the city. Amazing view. Lovely meal in 360 deg restaurant-well worth a visit.Glass floor a bit too scary for me but lots of people enjoyed it.

I have been three times and each time has been a different experience. The surroundings change so quickly because of Torontos growth spurts. It is the tallest building in the americas i believe and the view at night is really breath taking. Free standing structure which is the landmark in Toronto. Will be able to see Toronto from the top of the tower. Worth going up when the weather is nice and sky is clear

This is such a great attraction! I've always wanted to go up, and it lived up to my expectations. We went late in the evening, and the staff were very relaxed and friendly! Is one of the greatest wonder of the world.I heard the restaurant is great but I didn't get to go eat there as we were strap for time, will have to check it out this summer with my son.CN Tower is must see for visitors to Toronto, especially right when the sun is setting the view is amazing.

You can see the entire city from the tower. The glass floor was cool, too because you can really tell how high up you are. This is a great place to go to see the city both during the day and at night.

The best time to experience this is to go up at sunset, but the queues are big, so a tip is to book a table at the 360 restaurant in advance and avoid the hordes. The food is good (not great, but more than passable) and you get a real experience rather than a tourist crush

I waited many years to go up the CN tower. Wasn't super impressed for the price, really expected more. Should have gone when I was a child. Something to check off my list of landmarks to visit though.

I had a great time. You might wanna try to go on game day, so that you can see the Rogers Stadium in all its glory, or maybe right before dusk in order to take pictures with many different sky colors. It is not cheap, but it was totally worth it!

Visiting the CN Tower is not cheap, but the views are amazing. Try and visit on a clear day - we could see as far as Niagara Falls. Our children loved the glass floor - the highlight for them. No trip to Toronto would be complete without a visit up the tower!

CN tower is for sure a must-see Toronto tourist attraction. Luckily, there was no line for going up the day we visited. For a third of a century, the tallest structure in the world, it remains the highest building in North America. An imposing landmark from anywhere in the greater Toronto area, the CN Tower retains its aura of power and elegance and has been named one of the seven wonders of the modern world by the society of civil engineers.

You must visit the CN Tower and go up the super fast elevator either to the observation area or to the revolving restaurant. Beware of the picture takers though and don't feel obligated to pose r but the pictures unless you absolutely must have them!

The view was amazing, but for the admission price, I was expecting a bit more activities. We basically took the elevator up, walked around, took a few pictures and came back down. It worth the time to go up there for a look. On a good day, you can see as far as the mist of Niagara Falls.

Its a very good experiance to be on that hight and standing on the glass floor. I enjoyed it a lot. The place is really good and the ride there was awesome. I was thrilled

Absolutely breath taking view. We didn't go to skypod, but the glassed view on second floor and the glass floor worth the time. A bit expensive and the movie included in the tour wasn't great. But you can see all the magnificence of Toronto city.

This is another one of the buildings you must visit . A walk on the space deck is a bit scary for young ones but I thoroughly enjoyed it.

I loved the views. We went on a clear day so you could see the entire city. The glass floor was a little freaky but it was still really cool. I loved that you could roam from floor to floor. I can't wait to go back soon!

It's only fun your first time going, after that its just boring. Been here 3 times in my life and its just the same thing over and over again. They need add more stuff to do.

Have been to the CN Tower many times. It is like you have to refresh the views in your mind. Every season will give you a different scenery to remember. Enjoy going to the Tower. the glass floor is great and the upper circle is great where you can step out. The elevator ride in fun too.

Great for tourists and family members who stop by and want to see a bit of the city. Do the skywalk which is great...but don't be afraid of heights. haha

This was truly a memorable experience. The trip up the CN tower was amazing, and entirely worth the money to go even a little higher to the observatory. The views are stunning, and the whole experience was unforgettable. You cannot visit Toronto without making the trip up.

It was overpriced to get in this- once you seen one tower (Seattle, Vegas, Calgary) you've seen them all.

cant believe this thing is really that tall. when i looked at it, it felt like it was going to fall on me. I have been to new york city and seen tall buildings all grouped together. but just to see one isolated from the others, was a great view.

The CN Tower is easy to get to, situated between the Rogers Centre and the Metro Convention on Front Street, but if in doubt, just head for the Tower as it is hard to miss wherever you are! Beautiful view over Ontario lake and City Of Toronto.a must attraction you have to see when you are Toronto.

Unforgettable experience !Very good security arrangements !Highly trained and professional staff !Very good maintanance !Very good oversee of entire Toranto from top gallery !
Being new to Canada the CN tower was a great first attraction. The view from the glass floor was amazing and the food was good too! I would recommend it to anyone.

I've been in the tower a number of times - usually with someone who hasn't been there prior...it's always a thrill to make this a "thing to do" with them because the view, the elevator really is spectacular and sharing it with those who are exhilarated brings that out in me all over again.
We went up the tower on a clear day, and the views were truly amazing. It is pretty expensive to pay $31 just to look at the view, otherwise I'd give it a 5 star.

Not so spectacular, as they sell it.. the glass floor is old and scratch you can see anything. Calgary’s one is muuuch better.. it gets better when you go to the top.. or maybe when in summer you can take the walk in the edge!The view of Toronto at night is very nice that is true.I wouldn’t go...

Beautiful view and the elevator ride was an experience in its self. Could see through the glass doors while you went up. Upstairs the view was amazing. Will let my pics do the review. Loved it and will go again.
This is a great attraction in Toronto. It is so cool to look straight down. You can also go on the out side. The restraunt is great too. It is pricey but worth it!

Totally worth it when you get the Toronto City Pass. It wasn't the clearest day, but we could still see a lot at the top. The glass floor was fun and stomach-dropping. We had family visiting from overseas and it's one of those things that you feel like you should do if your visitors have never been to Canada and may not be back to Toronto again. The glass floor is great and the views out the windows are great, but even if all the doors to the outside have velvet ropes blocking them off, you can STILL go out via the revolving door! The ropes close the flat doors on windy days. Going outside us much more fun. ;)

Loved the tower and the glass floor. The price was a bit steep but it is a good opportunity to see Toronto from above. The videos beforehand were a bit pointless but still interesting, well worth a visit.
This is a must do. Very enjoyable and interesting. Especially jumping on the glass floor. Great day out for the family.
The tower is a classic tourist stop when in Toronto. Several options as far as viewing platforms, but either is wonderful! A little pricey ($60 for a couple) but definitely a must-see.

The tower is a great location to enjoy a birds eye view of the beautiful Toronto Landscape - the walking glass is a thrilling addition to the experience. It is enjoyable for all ages and offers educational insights into the building of the structure. Recommend to all.
Total price was $47.50 for admission including the extra $12 for the observation deck higher up. Amazing views

The glass floor is great but scary for a person who suffers from high claustrophobia . The glass floor was a bit smaller than I expected. From the tower you get great views over the city. We bought a Toronto city pass which included most popular attractions of the city.

A must for any visitor and people who live here should do it once in a while. You can see the spray from Niagara falls, coast of NY state, probably a third of lake Ontario. At night the view is amazing as well. Be sure to go on a day that you can get up to the top observation deck....

This is a must see for out of town guests! The view of the city and Lake Ontario is incredible and walking on the glass floor is not for the faint of heart! Beautiful views of the city. You can have dinner or lunch at the top, but make sure you make reservations ahead of time if you want to.

Ok maybe it's one of the world's biggest tower, but I find the price is very much overpriced. Basic price is around $35 per person! If you have but only a day in Toronto, go to the CN Tower. It's no longer the world's tallest tower, but the restaurant and views are well worth the price. If you eat, expect to pay $50.00 a plate, but admission to the observation deck is free.

Going to the top of the CN Tower is something everyone should do! The views over Lake Ontario were incredible, and on a good day like we had, you could see for miles and miles. Lots of interesting facts dotted around the tower l, however the price seems extraordinarily high just for some nice views.
Pricey, but well-cooked, locally sourced food. Go as the sun sets for the great views over the city of Toronto, then visit the viewing platforms after your meal.

Be sure to visit CN Tower. Fun and fascinating! A good value for the price. Spectacular views. Even our teenaged sons had a great time.

As far as world class views go, Toronto has it. Great to walk the street and area for interesting, if a little upscale, shops. Many one of a kind Toronto classics as well as designer and imported chic boutiques. Good restaurants too. Great way to spend a Saturday afternoon if you, ike shopping.

Provides a great view of the city but is very expensive. I'm not convinced it's the best use of time or money.
We went early morning to avoid the queues and got through easy enough and it was worth seeing the city from the top on a clear day you can see for miles.
Enough said. Go see for yourself. But the queues are long and tedious in the summer months so be prepared to wait.

we went up the CN Tower late in the afternoon and got to see City before dark, and then waited till after dark and saw all the lights. it was awesome!you could see for miles and the view was exceptinal.what a marvel to be able to build something of that nature that many years ago.a must to...

From the top of the tower there is a fantastic view (you don't have to go all the way up in the needle). You might feel dizzy. You should spend some time in the bar. Just sit down, relax and enjoy the view.

It was interesting. I've been on a cloudy day and on a clear day. It's not worth the money to go except when the visibility is good. Going up to the highest pod isn't worth the extra $6-10. The lineup for the pod can be long and there's not much else to see up there.
Tourist trap - expensive , souvenirs mostly made in China.Food just OK but again expensive.Glass floor experience worthwhile.
I only wish it had been less crowded when I went. Such a great view! It is a little pricey, however totally worth it.
It wasn't crowded, and I enjoyed having a really good look at the City and its surrounds. Huge gift shop, and a cafe.
A must for every tourist, smooth ride to the top with great views.Always interesting to watch tourists step on the glass window.Treat yourself to some excellent dining while there.
The quick glass elevators, the amazing views, the revolving restaurant, the glass floor...what more can I say?
It's been at least 5 years since I was at the CN tower so the girlfriend and I took the day to head downtown and go for a peek. Classic and a must see for everyone visiting including the locals. :)

This is def a place to go to when you're in Toronto. There is a city pass that you can buy so that you may try 5 different places when you are there which includes the castle, museum, cn tower, science centre.We paid the extra to go to the next level and it was pretty much the same thing...

If you are lucky enough to go to Toronto make sure you visit the CN tower but dont just go to the observation platform go on up the other 33 floors to the top - the view is amazing and is well worth the extra amount. The experience of travelling in the lift is just like travelling in a train...

Have been - it's one of those - been there done that experiences. Prices are outrageous - food awful and if it wasn't for the view not much else can be said - except try to go on a "clear" day when the smog is not there - you'll see more that way on the panoramic view

Then CN tower is amazing it has a great view of Toronto. 360 degree unobstructed views of the city on a clear day you can see out 160 KM. It's worth paying extra to go to the skypod an additional 30 stories up. Also the edge walk outside the tower is highly recommended for thrill seekers
Must have experience when visiting torontoGood views from towerBest is the lift with views and glass floorShop a bit expensive although typical of tourist places
I think the only thing i haven't tried has been the hanging off the side..but not for my heart. CN tower is very nice, food is ok..not my style more than anything but views on a clear day are great
