As with any observation tower, the views are incredible. The CN Tower is not exception. You can even walk across a glass floor that looks straight down! However, if you go up to the Sky Top, be prepared as it is mostly windows in a smaller area and you are truly at the top of the world. Pretty intense at...

In big cities we always try to go to the highest point to see the city from the clouds and we're never disappointed. Be sure to eat at the 360 restaurant - good value as you get two observation decks AND a fabulous memorable lunch.

Expensive - more than $80 for 2 adults and not really worth it. The ticket price includes a motion picture (about 5 mins long) which is quite good and a 3D movie about designing an airplane which is quite interesting but nothing to do with the tower. The glass floor in the tower and the lift is fun and the...

Go early in the morning if you don't like crowds and long line ups. If spending time in Toronto eating at the cn tower restaurant, it's pricey but food is good and on a clear day great view of the city.

We visited the CN tower in August this year and it is quite impressive, worths the visit as its definitely a land mark of Toronto. The lift ride is spectacular, and you can see the baseball fielf from the top of the tower, quite an experience!

The CN Tower is part of our history. One of the first of it's kind. I remember when it was built and how much awe it inspired. Pretty cool to be able to take your kids there. Great fun when everyone avoids the glass portion of the floor...then you find out the entire floor is see through like that. Very...
You just have to go there when in Toronto. It's a must. Better go there twice - during a day and night, you will see it's worth it.

Nice price and prefect view of every thing great staff great service , the space inside is a bit to small always have to be asking for and excuse and to exit was very stress full but over all it was very nice .
It is a place everyone visits once in their LIFE time. Enjoyed dinner up there as well and enjoy the meal and experience. Kind of afraid of heights and my rating was just my own opinion!!!!

The CN Tower naturally offers great views of Toronto and looking out over Lake Ontario is a particular treat, but I couldn't help feeling slightly underwhelmed in the end. Firstly there's no doubt this place is overpriced, two adult tickets comes to around $55 by the time you've added tax and that's not even going to get you up to...
Stunning view, excellent restaurant, food really good. Too expensive. One thing you should look at is the hghest 'winecellar' in Canada.

A view is a view, but it can be interesting to see things from above so we went - and of course paid - to have a look at Toronto from above.But we saw very little - the Tower was preparing for a function that evening and so more than half the facilities were closed off to public access...

Pre-purchase your tickets & it's a breeze to get in & up the tower.The glass floor area is fun, but can be a little disorienting when you stand up (if you've been brave/crazy enough to sit or lie on it).The restaurant has an amazing view & burger. It's the best - just try it!

wait for a clear, sunny day, and go early in the morning (during the week, if possible), and go way up to see Toronto and Lake Ontario from the heights. the exhibit about the tower and its history is informative, and it is the perfect tourist trap. world's highest postbox is up there, should you choose to mail a postcard...
Obviously views are amazing, but to be whisked up so high so quickly was incredible. Amazing service in restaurant and wonderful to have a different view every few minutes as the restaurant revolved
It was great! Make sure to travel ALL the way to the top.. Check out the glass floor .. kids loved it!! Go on a clear day!! :)

best views in the city on a clear day, lifts are quick, glass floor can get crowded but if you get a day with good weather its worth the trip up. Little expensive though in my opinion! It is not the tallest building in the world anymore!

My friend and I had a belated 60th birthday dinner at the 360 restaurant on top of the CN tower. Expensive but worth it for the view. The glass floor was amazing and my grandchildren loved seeing the pictures I took of me standing on the floor with the traffic looking like it was a mile below!

I have been to the top of many other towers and observation decks, but CN Tower is probably the best of them all.Be sure that you select a very clear and sunny day to go to the top of the Tower.The glass floor observation is really unique and thrilling.

after watching a maple leafs ice hockey match ,we decided to go into the cn tower,the lift wwas so fast we reached the top without even knowing,they say the lift goes as fast as a jet taking off,we went out and what an awesome view,you dont notice the tower sway and well worth a visit

Booked this before I left the UK. Good fast entrance despite the quantity of folk entering. Lots to see and do. Staff helpful and friendly. Unbelievable views from the top! Hillarious watching folk on the glass floor, and in the glass floored lift :) Worth every penny.

Everyone should experience the CN Tower! It is so amazing to see the great city of Toronto and the shoreline from so very high up! It amazing what people can build! So glad I got to experience it again for the first time through my daughter's eyes! Fantastic!

Enjoy the views and save some money too. Because I have experienced rotating restaurants before in Sydney, Dallas, Seattle etc. I didn't need to In Toronto. But, I wanted to see the city from the tower and enjoy a nice meal. In Horizons, tables line the windows for taking in the view, the atmosphere is casual and friendly, and the...

This tower impressed me with its lift. If you stand by the door you are on the outside going up and there is only the glass window separating you from the outside with the view of the ever receding buildings. Then you really notice just how high you are going, it was almost too much and I really wanted to...

It cost 23 CA dollars just to go up and look out of the windows, which we thought a bit expensive. The views are good and out of season it wasn't busy, so we could relax and spend some time looking around. The revolving restaurant is disconcerting, but the static one is just as good, more relaxed and fine for...
Loved the walk in the observatory deck. Glass floor was fun. Kids enjoyed the little movie and ride. Well work it.

I asked for my Steak medium rare, when it arrived it was medium to well done, the staff were rushed and although we had pre booked were not given a seat on the lower level. We went up the CN Tower as part of a visit to Toronto and the views were amazing! The CN Tower is a 'must see' and is very similar to other high rise towers in other cities. You have a great view of Toronto and can also look down through a glass floor to see where you have been.Couldn't particularly see the point of standing outside and hanging off the tower.

Went up for 30 mins just to take some photos of Toronto - not disappointed - felt like I was in an aeroplane we were so high up. Restaurant looked lovely but was on my own so I gave it a pass. Well worht a visit

Ate at the top, stunning views, remember when you go to the toilet to remember we're you were sat as the restaurant area continues to rotate, when you exit the table is not in the same place!!! SO what it was raining and cloudy. The view was still out of this world. The glass floor was sooo creepy. We did this on a side trip from Niagara Falls and the view was so well worth it. The elevator ride up was quick and started the feel with the glass floors. Then once up to the base camp...

expensive, but nice view on clear day.Expect a few minutes waiting line to get the elevator down too.

Wonderful views, sadly the day I went the weather was foul and the views came and went! Still a fascinating experience, wall displays are informative.

You can't go and not have a nice time. Something about the place just makes you happy... even if you're scared of hights (like me) it's fun even...I've been there maybe 10 times in the last 12 years.... It makes you appreciate Toronto a little bit more.

Everyone said this was a must do in Toronto if you could only do one thing so we did. Great view of Toronto, Lake Ontario, the islands,etc. We were there at sunset which made the views even better. Only negative would be working all around the building so difficult entry and parking was pricey.

Great view on the top of CN Tower, the icon of city of Toronto. I went there at night, don't expect anything else, beyond the glass flor and the view. They also have a restaurant at the top.The only thing that I didn't like was the rate to go up, it was about 30 CAN.

Had a night layover in Toronto, so got to go to the CN town and went up and down fairly quickly on a rainy evening, October 6. it was a really great view, quite cool and windy that night but still awesome to see the night lights of Toronto and this awesome attraction. This is a 'must' if you ever visit Toronto, the only proviso is that the visit must take place on a day with decent visibility. I haven't been up the tower since about 1978 so it was fun to return and enjoy the view. Had a picture taken on the glass floor as a memento of the day, great fun.

I've been there, and years ago I worked at the CN Tower. It's a great attraction, and a "must-see" for visitors to Toronto. The CN tower. We visited the tower in September2012.It is a spectacular thing in its ownright.with beautiful scenic viewing areas including the glass floor.I would recommend a visit.
Great to see from outside. I was to tired to adventure inside but I'd say the view is amazing. The surrounding area is great just to hang out and brilliant on a sunny day.

If you’re visiting Toronto a trip to the CN tower should be at the top of your attractions list. The views of the city are spectacular! Toronto's CN Tower dwarfs NYC's Empire State Building and provides a great bird's eye view of the city and Lake Ontario. The tower is right next to the stadium and we decided to head up just before the Jays started their game. Great views of the city but a little crowded from the tourist.
Great - really exhilarating to be walking around the outside so high up, to be recommended and includes the DVD, a couple of photos and an awful lot of safety checks!
A fantastic view of the city and well worthwhile seeing. Not too bad if you are also terrified of hights as you do feel very secure.

I have always been fascinated by the CN Tower,the magnificient height of this structure ,the ride up to the top and dinner at the Revolving Restaurant.The view of Lake Ontario and on a good day one can see al the way to Niagara Falls.

The view was amazing. Worth the money to see the City from so high! Make sure to bring your camera.Also, check out the gift store, it has great products.

good food, breakfast was nice with friendly staff. great views of Toronto all round and below through the glass floor.the gift shop is well stocked and of course is the only way out through it.worth a visit just for the views alone

The views are amazing but almost the best part it's on the restaurant side. Please be aware that it is pricey, and you can only go up once with the ticket, so you'd better decide whether you want to go during the day time or the night time before heading there.

We visited the Tower on a cloudy but clear day and had great views of the city. Expect to spend 2 hours if you really want to take your time and pictures. Using one Metropass discount (20%) for 4 tickets effectively upgraded everyone one package, so it was a very good deal.
In every large city, there is usually a tower of some sort to see all the views. Even though we have been on many towers we at least got a lot of great pictures.

The CN Tower was once the tallest free-standing structure in the world and is well worth the ticket price. CN tower is one of the most prominent landmark in Toronto, one should get to the top before the sun sets to appreciate the great landscape . So much to do but it is very high. Glass floor in one section - makes you woosy looking down. Dancing at the discotect on a Saturday evening. Beautiful view
its very nice , we love it me and my friends , we love to visit again , its not far from where i live

Beautiful view of the city, specially when the skies are clear. The panoramic elevators are an interesting way to go to the top of the tower. Don't miss the glass floors!

I'll be honest, it hurts me to pay simply to go up an elevator. Whether it is the CN tower or the Empire State Building, it just doesn't make sense to me. But paying for a good meal and get to have the view on top of it, that's worth it. If you choose to eat in the restaurant of...
Cool place, you have to do it at least once in your life! It's a little pricey but worth it in the end
Tremendous views over city and beyond,especially on clear day.Also includes 3-D film and ride in simulator.

Over priced and ridiculous security scans after you purchase your ticket. If I had known I would not have bought one. A half hour later, we see a birds eye view of a building site. Kitch souvenirs and terrible service. Meh meh meh.

Going up the tower gave us a good view of the city but other than that there was not a lot to do. Going up and down the glass elevator was pretty exciting...

The CN tower is one of those places you HAVE to visit, just because it is such an iconic part of Canadian tourism. But, once you've seen it there is really no reason to return. It is expensive. The glass floor is pretty scary.Do it once, and then move on.
Great views over the city and the scary glass floor gives you that 'do one thing that scares you every day' feeling of accomplishment.
The view from the uppermost platform is priceless on a clear day. A nice experience which should not be missed when in Toronto.
A little pricy to go up and you need time. Te skypod was a waste because it got muggy and we could not see more the the beaches.

We loved this experience. It isn't cheap but how often do you get the chance to walk across a glass floor hundreds of feet above the ground? Once in Toronto, you have to visit this landmark. The view of Lake Ontario is magnificent. If you can, reserve a meal in the 360 restaurant and you pay nothing to climb.

This was my fourth time up the CN Tower dating back to 1980 and the view just gets better and better! If you ever in Toronto, Canada, you should definitely visit the CN Tower! The view to our beautiful Toronto is breathtaking! Perfect spot for photographers as well. It was very nice, but there was a very long wait to go to the upper level so we had to suffice with the lower. The observatory is nice but not much different than others in the world. The glass floor is a nice addition and the fact that you can see plains take off from above. That was a...
NIce view but that is about it... The food is ok but the view is worth it. You can't beat the city view.
The tallest tower in the world with great view of the city. Go early in the morning before all the tour buses show up. This is a must visit.
A Toronto experience not to be missed. Terrific views from the top, although I did not take advantage of standing on the 'glass floor' ! Well worth the visit, (especially on a good day weatherwise).
classic attraction worth going up and also worth a drink in the resturant.Can imagine it might be pricey with a family but couples should certainly see.

Fun thing to do if you are new or want a great view. A bit spends but well worth the amazing view especially during sunset.

Originally went up without my wife because she was scared of heights. When I got up there realised it was no big deal and so texted her and she came up as well! This is such a cool attraction, world famous, that not much can be said about it. We really enjoyed it, breath taking views. Recommend that you take the pod at the top.

the cn tower was great, i enjoyed every bit of it, the only part i did not enjoyed much was goin up in the elevator because my ears hurt, it felt just like in a plane but i had a blast and fantastic view and don't forget to try out the glass floor lol.

Just GO!You will not be disappointed, from breathtaking views across Toronto, to a stomach wrenching walk across the glass floor!!: D
If the weather is perfect, there is nothing so breathtaking as the views from on top. The staff could be friendlier. For a tourst attraction that should be a must when getting hired..

Visiting CN Tower only makes sense when the weather is fine. Even although we came there hours after the last raindropps fell the outside balcony was closed. Nevertheless the 360° view is simply unforgettable.

Several people told me that the CN Tower was a must-see attraction for a first time visit to Toronto. To be honest, it didn't look too impressive when I got my first glimpse of the city. However, once at the top I changed my tune. It's difficult to describe how much taller it is than everything else and how much...

We always try to go up a high building when in a new city. This is because we like to walk to all the areas we want to see. It gives a good guide to distances and whats where. We were able to get a good view of the Toronto Islands too, which were on our "list". The actual visit...

This was my first trip to Toronto and I was very impressed. The ride up to the top was so fast and the glass floor in the lift so cool but not scarey. Walk all round the tower and go outside where possible to get full benefit. You can see across the water and into the city. I was surprised...
There are two levels to go to. The top one is truly scary because you can feel it sway with the wind. A fabulous view of the city and harbour.
There is an amazing view, but avoid cloudy or rainy days. On a clear day you can see Niagara Falls. For the adventurous try the Edgewalk but you have to book this in advance
Decided to stop into the CN tower on the way back from Niagara and were able to catch the sunset - it was beautiful to watch from way up there!

CN Tower is great, food is excellent, view is spectacular and the ride up in the elevator is breathtaking. I like the shops there also and it is a great tourist attraction. I really like the revolving dining room, it is cool with great service and food.

Perhaps the most quintessential Toronto attraction, the CN tower offers an unparalleled view of the city. You go here because it's almost an obligation when visiting Toronto. The section of the tower floor which is glass is quite the experience as you look down, seemingly forever. Not for the faint of heart. However, a little known fact about the floor...
Spend the extra dollars to go all the way to the Pod. It's an additional 33 or so stories higher. Worth every penny!

This is the best place to see the sunset, amazing view of toronto skyline and very interesting view of the airport and the stadium, if your lucky you get the stadium dome open! Will visit again next time!

The visit to the CN tower was just average because first of all, it's a little bit too expensive. Then you are not even able to select which elevator to use to go up and down (to see different directions) and the glass floor is nothing special – just some small glass windows you can stand on, some of them...

Fabulous trip up the current 2nd tallest tower in the world, the tallest in North America. Fabulous views from the 1st stop all the way up to the skypod! Once in a lifetime opportunity to look out the glass floor if you dare! Make sure you take a camera!!!
If you can stand the heights, this is a great experience. Walk on a glass floor (still haven't been able to do this!) beautiful view of the entire city!
I am not good with heights but was determined to go up the Tower. My son and I went and he loved the partial glass elevator ride and the glass floor section at the top. Views were spectacular.
Excellent views but a bit too crowded for me in the summer. Next time I'll try to go in the off season.
This is well worth a visit you don't need to go any further than the first stop as the view is magnificent and it is more expensive to go higher

This is not what Toronto is about. An over rated, highly commercialized and expensive activity. Go to Kensington market, Centre Island, Queens street, Parkdale, the Annex, for a more interesting impression of Toronto. I live here.

If you go to CN Tower do the full experience. The Sky Pod is awesome & not to scary (I have a fear of heights, but was comfortable there even though it was 147 stories above Toronto. The Hymalamzon ride is fun, but over too soon & the 3D flight movie great to watch. Give yourself 2-3 hours to fully...
The view is amazing. something everyone should do. I was not impressed witht he security features that they have, but i understand why.
A night to remember for all the right reasons, but book before you go as it was very busy while we were there
If you find yourself in Toronto, I definitely recommend making a stop here.The gift shop on the ground level also has some pretty cool souvenirs.

Fantastic views over the city and lake. The glass floor takes some beating - 1100ft below your feet. For those (unlike me) of an adventurous disposition and with a great head for heights, you can go outside and - while strapped to a harness - stand on the edge and lean out! Not for the faint-hearted.

We were up there on a perfectly clear day and having already spent a week in the city were able to identify all the paces we had visited. No queue for tickets or to go up and everyone was so helpful. The only disappointment was the delay in coming down as they had obviously stopped some of the lifts. Beware...

when you're in Toronto you should absolutely visit the CN Tower!just ignore the souvenirs shops and don't spend your money in the restaurant, but go up the highest observation deck and enjoy the great view of the city! :)

Worth the admission. Beautiful 360 view of the city. Have your photo taken by your friend while you are sitting on the glass floor 33 stories up. (I couldnt do it!) There is a restaurant. There is another level 10 stories higher. There is so much information to take in. Great time!!

You find towers everywhere and I tend to skip them.Still this is spectacular (as long as there is no vertigo involved)View from this hight is great especially because of the mix of island, coastline and city.

I'm of two minds about CN Tower, after two trips ten years apart. On the one hand, it is an incredible view, a full 360 over the city, lake, waterfront, and even out to the suburbs. If it's not a reasonably nice day, not really worth the fare. It's good for both kids and grownups, but at times can be...

I enjoyed the CN tower. We decided to do the SKY POD tour as well and it was worth the extra $5.00. The lines move quickly and there are plenty of opportunities for pictures. This is a must see when visiting Toronto.

When you are in Toronto you have to go to the CN Tower I was told. OK, it's impressive that you are so high above Toronto in such a short time, but then you just see what you expected to see, the city. I was not really impressed by the view. Unfortunately, we couldn't combine it with a diner in...

Worth not only the views of all of Toronto, but also to look through the clear glass floor to the world so far below. It was crowded but worth the wait. Don't bother to eat up there--not worth the costs. Enjoy the view and get better food below.

Although considered one of Toronto's biggest attractions, I think it is a bit expensive. The view is great, although it is nice in the cold wiinter when the air is clear. However, a bit pricy for a nice view of the area.
The views are spectacular and the food is excellent, slightly on the expensive side of things, but worth every cent.make sure and book in advance, it will be one of the highlights of your trip.
25 bucks just to go up and look around? A little too much. But, they will get business cause its a major attraction in toronto. But, nice view.
Went there to get great views of the city and definitely not disappointed. Bit of a wait but it was worth it especially the glass floor - really freaky. Enjoyed the visit.
Very busy just before sunset. We had to line up for over an hour. If you book at the 360 degree restaurant you skip all the lines

Great piece of architecture. I took the full pass for $35-40 including taxes and still managed to finish everything in half of the day. Sky deck and glass are good ones to pick if u are in hurry. The shops for souvenirs are quite good, and were reasonable.Must see sight in Toronto.

if you visit the CN Tower then eat there also as this then becomes vallue for money otherwise the ticket to the top is quite expensive and a meal in a restaurant that rotates is pretty special and makes the overal cost betterbvalue.The views are amazing and you get a real sense of the size of the city.
We went up on a clear autumn night do it was amazing, The views were what a person would expect to see. Worth going up

Everybody told us to visit the cn tower because it's supposed to be the highlight of toronto. but in fact we didn't enjoy it. It was really expensive to go up, there were millions of people (even tough we went in the evening) and we had to wait over an hour to get up. The glass plattform is really small...
check this one out, but best to reserve revolving restaurant to avoid queues and for a good meal, even if a bit pricy. Also fun features especially for kids, such as glass floor.
Amazimg views. I didn't do any of the really adventurous stuff, ie dangling outside, but it was a lot of fun and I got some great photos.

With it's 360o view allowing you to see things in ways unimaginable, the CN Tower not only is a marvel in engineering and construction, but it's a marvel in sight seeing! At this vantage point, landscapes and skylines have a whole new feel unimaginable at ground level. You can actually see the curvature of the Earth this high up! Of...

We had some vouchers as a present for our honeymoon to go for dinner to the tower.The views are amazing and the food as very good as well. They have different prices so it wasnt very expensive for a fix menu

It is the second time that I have had the chance to visit Toronto and the CN tower. It was my husbands first trip to this beautiful country.Queues were managable and tickets were easy and quick to purchase. We were told the time to go to the lift so just went to the cafe for 20 minutes before going...
It is a toronto landmark that one has to visit at least once in their lifetime. It is too crowded and noisy for frequent visits. Good souvenirs to purchase.

Great view and the cost is not too high. No lines on weekdays. For the kids it was their first time up ther and I visited it for the first time 25 years ago.we all enjoyed it.If there is a game in the sky dome under it and you happen to visit, it is a nice vision. Bottom line...

To be fair I am from NYC...Empire State Building...back in the day..WTC....so a bird's eye view is not a new concept to me. To go up to the tower they charge 25 bucks...however..you can make reservation to go to the restaurant that revolves and order the pre-fixed dinner which is 55 bucks and it includes admission to the tower/ In...
The view from the observation tower and restaurant are amazing! If u are brave u can walk on the glass bottom floor

I brought my kids here and they love it they really got a kick out of the glass floor and the view from the top is amazing.Be sure to stop there on your trip to Toronto.Travel CUTS University of Guelph facebook page has a contest where you can win tickets for the total tower experience.Just like and...

My boyfriend and I were in Buffalo, NY for the weekend and had already seen the falls, so we decided to take a day trip up to Toronto. You can't go to Toronto without going up the CN Tower! While the prices are a bit steep in my opinion, you're really paying for the experience. We paid extra to go...
The planes are landing beneath your feet pretty surreal, amazing views from the bar worth it for that alone.

Couldn't visit Toronto without doing the CN Tower so on a day trip from a stay in Niagara we drove the hour and half back to Toronto. We parked near the Blue Jays Stadium and walked to the entrance, paid for the Tower Experience and up we went. The lift moved very fast and seeing the floors go by so...

We only went to the tower because it was included in our CityPass. We enjoyed the experience and are glad we went. It was quite packed which made it less appealing but they were very efficient at moving people. We didn't pay the extra fee to go to the higher level. Don't know if it would be worth it.
Food was good, service was excellent in the revolving restaurant. Be sure and go down two floors to stand on the glass floor and look down. Awesome!

A quick and painless process to get in, get tickets and go up. Haven't been here in 30 years, so things have changed a lot. Loved the view of Rodgers Center from the observation deck, and watching the planes take off from the Toronto Island Airport. This is a cultural landmark that can be seen from amazing distances, for example...
The lines weren't pleasant (which isn't surprising for a landmark) but was all worth it once I got to the top. Was able to enjoy panoramic views of the city. A must see!!

Obviously everyone should go here at least once. Go early and you will be rewarded with a better experience. No one wants to queue for ages, especially with children and in hot/cold weather. Do the whole thing and pay for the pod too.Enjoyed the view over the city and the lake. If you feel brave walk the glass floor....

Both to get in, and once inside, there was quite a queue without much to take your mind off it, but it moved fairly quickly. Once inside the views out over Toronto are amazing on a good clear day, and as it is next to the Blue Jays baseball stadium you can see into the stadium (but you're too high...

column3: West Palm Beach, Florida, United States
column4: great place to get a great view of the city though it is very pricey for what you get.Half of teh glass enclosed area is occupied by the restuarant, while teh open area is understanbly encased in wire mesh. Photos from here are not going to be real good. The saff was very freindly and the lines move quickly. The...

i strongly recommended getting the Toronto city pass, this one is on it. the views were insanely beautiful from the top. spend the extra 7.00 and go higher. i would say go early in the morning. i went at noon and it was starting to get very busy. when i left the line to get tickets was about 60 deep....
not too impressed. too much hype and not good enough food. Great view though. Pick a clear night to go.
The tower is a well-done exhibit from the ground floor on up. I'd prefer less waiting upstairs, but I don't think there's much that could be done about that. And besides, it was worth the wait.

Ok, it was a bit expensive for what you get, but walking on the glass floor (and I was SO scared before!) was one of the coolest moment of my life. Don't forget to snap any kind of photo you can. The elevator floor wasn't as good as the pavement on top of the tower but it was nice anyway.

We went to the CN tower as a family, 2 adults and 2 younger children. As you enter the building, the layout is such that if it is congested, it is confusing as to where you should go to buy tickets. We bought our tickets...$90 for all 4 of us and the wait was only 20 to go up. I...

On seeing the tower thinking wow can't wait to go up, on entering ticket prices were quite expensive but after 58 seconds in a lift the views were amazing we then went up 2 the next level awesome overall great views of the city we luved it

Being a native New Yorker, I have high standards for skyscrapers. But I went to CN Tower with an open mind since my fiance is Canadian and raved about it. Unfortunately, I really wasn't impressed. The top floor view of the city was nice but a little uneventful. The city doesn't have the electricity & excitement that I was hoping...
Been there more than a couple of times now and enjoy it everytime. Great views, great food and always in good company. A must see when visiting Toronto.

This was a much anticipated experience for my kids. We got there at around 11am on a summer week day, and the line, although long was very fast and flowed nicely. We decided to get the ticket that included the skypod. That was well worth the extra cost. It was amazing being so high above everything in view, and so...
Had to try it once to say I went. It was expensive for what you get but it's a must do touristy thing for Toronto. Didnt' do the edgewalk but it looked interesting.
I've been to this place long time ago when i was a yute i remember i went here with my grandma and aunty nydia them and my grandpa roy

Pretty cool experience! The glass-floored elevators were crazy! We were able to watch some of the airshow from the observation deck, too. Neat. It was not too crowded and we were able to spend as much time as we wanted looking out and sitting on the glass floor. Definitely worth doing!

We purchased our tickets online and bypassed the line at the entrance. It was a busy Saturday morning already and we were there at 10:30am. I recommend the Observation Plus ticket option. The main observation deck is busy; you may have to wait to stand in front of an empty window. The glass floor is a thrill!! Make sure to...
Have been before but with friend who has not been it was a MUST do!Glass floor is fun but the legge walk would be Amazing ...maybe next time

Line ups were ridiculous at 2 1/2 hours long to get up there, was finished in 15 minutes then had to line up to get downstairs. Minus the terrible line ups, could have been great but not a good way to spend your time.
It was a nice tall tower. Did not do the edge-walk, which could have boosted the review, for those who have the credit to do it, should try it. Otherwise it is a nice view from a tall building.
the CN tower always means the movies, pictures are in Torontogreat symbol, our mascot, love the lights, good location, recognizable, always know where south i in the city. visitors love it

You couldn't come to Toronto and not visit the cn tower, price wise it's like anything in Toronto expensive but like i said you have to do itEasy enough to get tickets and then only 58 seconds and your on top of the world, we couldn't have picked a better day it was beautiful and you could see for...

The view is amazing from the tower. The glass floor was great, it was an exciting feeling to step on it. The queue was ok, it took around an 20 minutes to buy the ticket and arrive to the top. There is queue to the elevator when you come down too but overall it was very good.

Wouldn't do this one again for the cost. At least we didn't have to wait in the long lines we heard are common at this attraction as it was a cloudy day. Cool to be that high, but, again, not sure we'd say it was worth the cost.

Firstly I will say if you are to visit Toronto it's a absolute must "to do"!.The location of the CN tower is great to see the island and the beauty of the water. Plus to the right side and truly specular view of Toronto. Entry is fast and although I visited at the end of the summer vacation time...

I love the glass elevator ride up...do it at night if you can as your all lit up. The observation deck is by far the best view ever of the city. The price is considerable but well worth the nighttime city skyline view.

We went early morning hard to walk from parking to the to the front tower which sucks due to construction As it known worlds 2 nd largest tower so more excited to ge on ride ...Top of the tower is good but no air conditioner so if u worried about it don't pay 10 extra bucks but the glass tower...

What a view from the vantage point, was a clear beautiful day when we went and the view of Toronto was amazing.The staff were exceedingly friendly and helpful and offered good information when asked.The gift shop as you would expect is quite pricey but alternative shops give the same gifts at a lesser cost.Overall a very good...

Yes it's a tourist thing and yes it's worth doing! If your deathly afraid of heights you might want to pass but for most it's a real rush. You go up in a glass elevator which I didn't think was so bad but walking on the glass floor was a bit unnerving. They have a small glass floor section where...

There is something postive to be said about looking at the urban landscape of this wonderful city fromn the CN tower Yes, the views are incredible and you might want to know more about so many places. Spectacular views for sure are most appreciated after you walk along the side walk below the tower before going to the top. Perhaps...

*Worth noting. I visited the CN Tower after dark*My first impression was not a good one. The ticket seller sort of convinced me to upgrade my ticket because he said I wouldn't have enough time to enjoy the view unless I bought the ticket to skip people in line for the elevator....while the trip to the 'regular' deck was...

We werent sure whether or not to do given the price (more than most other famous tower structures we've visited) but the views were impressive and gave a real sense of the whole of Toronto and surrounding areas.

Get early and relax for the rest of the day. It has an incredible view...and more than a little scary.Check out the glass set up...it looks like something from the Matrix.The glass lift is "something." Have a camera ready and able to snap...so much so fast to see.

Its not a pretty structure, unlike some of the other tallest buildings in the world but you get a great view of the city from it. I definitely recommend going to the top if you're a fan of heights & tall buildings, or even if you just wat to see the city from above.Book your ticket on-line, I was...

It may no longer be the tallest building in the world but the views from the top will take your breath away! For those on a budget, the Sky pod doesn't give you THAT much better a view than the main deck while, for those not worrying about the purse strings...the 360 restaurant with its revolving floor is extraordinary with...
The best time to avoid the masses is at night time and it is a great place to visit and a must do. I liked the fact that the tour was so organized

Get here for 9am and there will be no lines, I walked on the glass and am still here. The views are incredible on a clear day and you actually look down on the planes taking off from the nearby airport! You'll go up in a glass lift so have your camera ready as it's worth taking photo's from it.

We toured the CN tower because we felt it was the thing to do. We've been to Sears Tower (I will always call it that!) on their observation glass floor many times and that was way cooler than this. I heard on TA that you should go later in the day to avoid the lines and it was good advice....

If you are visiting Toronto or anything around that area, you definitely want to take a visit to the CN Tower. If you are coming from far away, I recommend that you try to take the full experience and experience everything the site has to offer. They have an excellent motion simulator ride and movie theater at the bottom of...
Awesome view. On Top of the City of Toronto. The restaurant rotates around the city. On a clear day you could see for miles. Taking pictures is allowed so remember to bring your camera. Enjoy.

My friend and I went up the tower for an evening meal. The food was ok, nothing overly exciting but tastey. The view however was great, as we went on the revolving floor. You start your meal looking out at one point, and it takes about an hour to do a full circle. The views of Toronto and the GTA...

Sure the CN tower gives you a vantage point mostly unrivalled anywhere else, but in my experience this does not equal the price you pay for the trip to the top.They have added items like a glass floor in one area, which does bring some excitement to the experience, but all in all it's just another photo stop, in...

I could only see it from out side but it is truely a lovely structure and symbol of Canada. My friends had gone and enjoyed Edge walk & the 360 degree Restaurant. They enjoyed watching Toronto and Canada from top which was a wonderful experience.

Phenomenal views, but choose the time you plan to go wisely. We waited almost 3 hours to get in, and then only spent about 20 minutes at the top as our 2 young children were too tired to enjoy. I'd visited other times when it was less crowded and it was much more enjoyable.

The views from the top of the CN tower are breathtaking and well worth one visit. The cost of the elevator ride is outrageous and kind of mars the experience. Same with the price of professional photos.
Just loved the lift going up the outside and standing on the glass floor, well worth a visit, but go early in the morning as gets very busy.

This is one of the most unique landmarks, something that Toronto is always associated with. There is a glass floor from which you can see former "Skydome" (Roger's centre). Definetely an interesting experience, but not really for people, who are afraid of heights. Also sometimes they hold walking up the stairs of the CN tower competitions/marathons. The view is great...

Would recommend the basic tour! The 3D movie about flight and the Boeing company is not worth it. The animated ride is a waste of time. They old have done a movie on the outcry, the different areas of Canada, like Disney does at Disney World. Waste of time. So buy the basic $29.95 ticket.

Amazing and worth the wait. It took about an hour of a wait once inside. It moved quickly and there were tv's and many things to watch inside. It is a great visit. The lines are shorter in the AM. They serve snacks on the top where were very good. The restaurant upstairs is quite reasonable with very good food...

Went here on the night of my birthday. There wast too much of a queue which was nice as was expecting far worse after experiencing the queue for the empire state building last year. They make you do the annoying photo that I never buy before you go up there should be a line if you want to skip this....

Our family of four (with 2 kids, ages 10 and 13) visited the CN Tower and paid the extra money to go to the Sky Pod. I would highly recommend this experience! Although the woman at the ground-floor ticket booth told us that the extra wait to ride the Sky Pod elevator would be over 90 minutes, our actual wait...

Are you afraid of heights? Don't go!! The world's second tallest structure is 181 stories high and has a glass floor in some parts! A very neat ride up an elevator takes you to the first pod and you can see for miles. There is a nice gift shop and restaurants on both levels. But other than the view there...
The view amazing, and I have vertigo, and walked on the glass floor. But I didn't look down. Make a reservation, and you don't have to wait in the elevator line up.

Amazing views of all Toronto and if you're brave enough you can walk on the outside! The glass floor makes you realise just how high you are. It gets very busy at weekends and when the schools are on holiday.

As part of the admission price we received tickets to a 3D IMAX movie - The Ultimate Wave Tahiti with Kelly Slater which is the best 3D movie I have ever seen. In addition to the fabulous views of Toronto from the top of the tower, we ate lunch in the casual dining restaurant which was very reasonable and great...

Had one of the best meals ever, i thought it would be a tourist rip off, how wrong was i, this was really amazing,having eaten in the window of the world in the twin towers, i was not expecting much of a buzz, but the revolving floor was a one up. we got there in time to see the city...

Of course you're paying for the view, for the experience to get up to the top, but as is the norm for all tourist attractions...it's a bit pricey. Being a home grown Toronto girl, we don't always look at these types of things as being necessary, for some of us, we see the tower every day on the way to...

Friends and families always talk about the CN Tower as a main attraction when you go to Toronto; so my mom and I (as Toronto first timers) went to see what it was all about.I have to say that it is quite pricey for the basic ticket (the one that allows you to the glass floor and observation deck)....
Make sure you have lots of time to wait in line - minimum price around $25. Fortunately it was a pleasant evening - the ticket couters are outside.

I take my nieces every year to the CN Tower and they never seem to tire of the experience. We go on weekends so its always packed - but the atmosphere is friendly and fun. Fun at least until I open my wallet and find I'm spending almost $100 for us to go to the top. Not sure if I...
Although from the ground it looks so high, once up on the observation deck you are no longer aware of it. The views are spectacular and you can see for miles.

Fantastic attraction well worth the money. Dare yourself to walk on the glass floor! The lift up is really fast and made everyone very quiet on the way up and down. Plenty of time to take photos - would recommend.

It would be great if you didn't want to spend hundreds of dollars and wait for hours. If you wanted to "upgrade" to the higher level package that didn't require waiting it would cost $65/person. Thats $325 for a few minutes of viewing. I may be a tourist, but I'm not stupid. Should cost $10-$15 max.
I was brought to the CN tower but scared of heights. The food is fantastic and so is the staff. Its too bad that its so far up in the sky. Wouldn't work for anyone that is scared of heights.

So the height was not so dazzling to me. And not like there was a great vista of incredible architecture visible from the observation deck. Of course, I didn't do the "Edge Walk". But it seemed very pricey for what was offered. The most dazzling thing was the efficiency of the security check. Extremely impressive. Go Canadians!!
This Place is absolutely surreal! I love being able to go to the CNE tower anytime I feel it! We are so lucky to have this in Toronto.

We really weren't sure about going up CN tower but some friends who lived in Toronto recommended it to us as a "must do". Luckily we bought tickets elsewhere so didn't have to queue for tickets, which would have added yet more time standing around but as it was we waited about an hour to go up to a crowded...

Long lines and expensive - but it's one of those things you should do when in TO. This iconic tower is the most recognizable of the buildings in TO - so the view from the top is a bit of a let down, especially if you don't know the city well as there are few other buildings (nor are there...

We bought the package including the panoramic view, the glass floor and the "rollercoster" ride. Only the basic panoramic view is worth it.The glass floor is more like a glass window about 2 square meters and everyone crowds around it. The view below your feet is not impressive. all you see is a little patch at the base of...

The view is amazing from the tower. The glass floor was great, it was an exciting feeling to step on it.The queue was long, it took around an 70-80 minutes to buy the ticket and arrive to the top. There is queue to the elevator when you come down, but there we should waited only approx. 20 minutes. We...
We went on a weekday, so it was not terribly busy. Nice way to see the city and beyond. A definite must when your in downtown Toronto! Eat before you go, or after your done! Food is expensive!

From any of the CN Tower's fully enclosed observation decks, it seems so surreal to watch aircraft take off and land from the Toronto Island airport from ABOVE! And from these heights, everything looks peaceful and orderly -- not to mention the great views of Toronto and of Lake Ontario.

the views from the tower were magnificent; however it was a little pricey for entrance. try to get a coupon before you go in order to save a little bit of cash. A lot of the hotels will have some coupons available at the front desk.

My wife, friends, and I visited the CN Tower this past weekend and it was quite an experience! If you're not accustomed to standing in long lines for at least an hour, I would suggest bringing a small stadium chair along. Kind of expensive and very exhausting to stand in line for so long. Once you take the short (58...
The restaurant that turns at the top of the CN Tower was very good. Waiter was excellent and informative, with dinner suggestions as well as pointing out points of interest.

Although the tower is very good, it is just a tower like any other. Fabulous views of the surrounding areas and the glass floor is a great hit with tourists taking pictures of friends lying on the glass.

The view from the Observation Deck is impressive. We went at night and the view, with the lights and full moon, was well worth it. We also had reservations for dinner at the revolving restaurant so didn't have to wait in line or pay to visit the deck. Great deal. Standing on the glass floor and looking down was an...
There's nothing like walking on the glass floor for the first time. It's worth it to go up to the skypod. It's expensive so go on a clear day.

We brought our son, 4, to the CN Tower for the first time. According to him, it was "super duper awesome"! It's nice to see the city from the high vantage point. We looked for and found a 20% off coupon so for two adults and one child total cost was 50$.

So So...expensive yawn...the sellers at the ticked booths drive you crazy trying to up sell this "OK" attraction...pictures you get are ok, Get a window seat on a short flight out of the downtown airport you will do better.

For its fee, the CN tower is really not worth the view. Although it offers the visitors a sight of the city at its rate it does not compare to the arch in St. Louis, Mo or the viewing towers in Japan. After the ride, one would get the feeling that something seemed to be amiss and actually there is...
They've taken the best part of the viewing area and turned it into restaurants.So, unless you sit to eat, you pay to view the city, or the lake through the mesh screening.
Nice place to see the whole town as long as you are not afraid of heights. Restaurant is not that great. The rest of it is worth a visit.
Impressive engineering, nice staff, well design for traffic flow, nice and reasonable git shop (actually cheaper than the Mall)
Impressive to go up in 58 seconds but 2 hours wait is long just to look outside. Needs more interactivity for $29 per person.
Wanted to do the edge walk but you have to make a reservation 2 months ahead of time. We had to wait about half hour but it was worth it
Well worth the visit - goo layout, lots of fun. Kept my six year old son very entertained. THe views were fantastic, and standing on the glass floor looking at the street is unnerving.

Its a tall tower. You go up. You take pictures. You like this activity, then you will love CN tower. There is an Edge Walk (you walk on the Edge of the tower saucer) but its expensive. Get your adrenaline at Wonderland in Toronto for a much cheaper rate

I would've liked to have found a discount for this (while not having to buy the CityPass), but I was unable to. We just went up to the Observation Deck and had a walk around. We were there on a Wednesday afternoon and the crowds weren't too bad at all.

On a clear day you can see Niagara Falls way off in the distance with some binoculars. The day I went there was just a slight haze but I could not see the falls. The tower has multiple levels, but you have to pay extra to visit all of them. I recommend buying the combo ticket which allows you to...

It is nice to be a tourist in your own city.Enjoyed the visit of the tower by a clear day in december.Fun to walk on the glass floor with a view of the street.Impressive to be higher than the plane flying in and off bishop airport.A must do for visitor or new comers in Toronto

Great experience; the tower package is good on it's own and really good value (if a little crowded) but tag on the Edgewalk and it's a really incredible experience. I won't tell you too much; just look at the website!

If it's a clear day, the view is fabulous and worth the money. EVERYTHING ELSE about the place is tacky and horrible, although the recently introduced space walk is an expensive but no doubt thrilling edventure if you have a head for heights (even more thrilling if you don't!). If it's not a clear day go somehwere else.

My husband and I went at about 2pm on Aug. 28, and the lines were very long...it took us nearly an hour and a half to get to the uppermost Skypod, even with the most expensive package. None of the packages are cheap. Once you get to the top the view and photo opportunities are great. I did get many...

The CN tower offers an amazing view of the city. It is an absolute must for anyone visiting Toronto.There is also fine dining, casual dining and food stands once you're in the observatory. On the bottom level there are more attractions and shops.It is also very conveniently located in downtown Toronto.

Terrible organization skills of staff. Line took over 1 hour with people cutting ahead routinely with no consequences. very nice view when finally got to top, but was so upset from long crowded wait, with people pushed up against my wife and i the whole time, couldn't wait to get down and get out of there!!

CN Tower is really amazing: you can overlook skyscrapers! The highest tower on the world offers you "glass floors": worrisome looking down and thinking you're really suspended on the void!!! Children seem to appreciate it more than adults!

The CN Tower is undoubtedly the most famous attraction and symbol of Toronto. A trip to Toronto wouldn't be complete without visiting this tower. The tower is really tall and the scenic elevator takes you up the tower in less than two minutes or was it one. If you're afraid of heights, better sit in the back 'cause it can...

I went to the CN Tower on my recent Toronto trip, and it was a pleasant experience overall. I didn't go to the Sky Pod because there was about an hour and 45 minute wait in line, but I did the lookout and glass floor, and those were both amazing, especially the latter, as there were plenty of kids walking...
Lie on the glass floor high up above the ground, visit the museum and enjoy the lift up. Iconic, not to be missed trip in Toronto

After building up the courage to overcome my fear of heights and visit this unique Canadian tourist attraction with my family, I was saddened by the fact that the Edge Walk was all booked up for the day. Visiting the Tower is a bit pricey but totally worth it if you want to experience the thrill of heights and the...
Walking around the top of the tower while attached to a rope is totally amazing!! The price of the Skywalk also includes admission to all other parts of the tower.

The cheapest ticket is almost 30 dollars which I find expensive. The observation deck has wire mesh all around so taking pictures is not really possible. One deck higher there is glass which allows you to take some pictures. However, you can only access half since the other half is a restaurant. I was kicked out when asking if I...

Most of the reviews I've read sum it up: it's expensive, lines are long/boring, but the views are excellent. The only thing I would add is this: for the best view, go during daylight hours. I went at night and the wait time was not that long. It was fun being up there at night and seeing all the city...

My son and I went to the viewing floor and enjoyed the experience a lot. The elevator ride up is fast and if you're standing beside the window it can be a little frightening at first. We bought tickets online before arriving, so avoided longer lines. The Edgewalk looks like a lot of fun, but not for those of us...

I do have to say you must go when it is quiet. What should have taken 30mins to go up the tower, take some pics and out took about 3-4 hours as we went on the day of a Blue Jays game so it was chocker block, Ques everywhere and it was hot so just not as fun as it...

We visited the CN tower in August 2012. I had not been up the CN tower since I was a child so I was excited to finally go there again with my own kids. Being and living in Toronto area, this was long over due. My first concern based on the reviews I read were the long lines. To help...

Holy expensive batman! Just to go up and walk around (wihtout the sky pod or any extras) cost the 2 of us a 50 dollar bill. the glass floor wasn't as large as we expected it to be and it took about 20 minutes just to be able to get onto it to take a picture because of the amount...

A really good family attraction - travel the high speed elevator up one of the highest free-standing constructions in the country to see some of the most amazing views. Stand on the glass floor peering down at over 1,000ft or go even higher to the Sky Pod and look down at the people walking around the outside of one of...

During this trip we stayed in rooms generally above the 40th floor. therefore, somehow this tower did not feel so special anymore.The glass was also not really clear so you did not really get the feeling of "you might fall through".The views were nice though so if you aren't scared of heights this might just be your thing...

went up as part of dinner. it was very quiet, probably because it was 8pm. the glass floor was much smaller than I expected. the outdoor viewing was excellent, though windy. Only wish that the indorr viewing was 360, but I guess that is why you get skypod tickets.

I don't like hights and usually don't do them, but this was easy. I took the lift to the top and was amazed at the views. You can see the whole of Toronto from here and it felt safe as well. Its a must to do!

We paid for the "complete tour" which included access to the skypod, the glass floor, the 3D movie and the simulated "rollercoaster"ride. We arrived early on in the day and didn't have to wait too long for any of the above. We enjoyed the views from the sky pod and the other viewing areas and didn't feel rushed at any...

Bought tickets online and I recommend so to bypass anymore queues at the venue!!! Queues I was advice was not bad this visit our longest wait was 10/15mins max!The outside viewing platform was the best in my opinion as the welcomed fresh air was a bonus as inside is stuffy due to crowds and possible poor air conditioning! Views...
When I visited it was the tallest, however it is still an amazing place especially the glass floor must see

Our trip to the CN tower felt like it was full of touristy mumbo-jumbo, but I'm glad we went. Skip the gift shops, the expensive photos, the exorbitantly priced food, and the add-ons they try to sell you with your ticket.What you need to do is get the basic ticket, get to the top of the tower, and see...
Loved the view -- absolutely hated all of the lines. But, what are you going to do????? It's a popular attraction.

Too many people, too little space for the amount of people they let go up, stuffy and just uncomfortable for me. It took a long time to get down since the lines were so long.The only bonus, until I could get of there, was watching the Blue Jays play baseball from high up.

Such breath taking views of the city. I've visited the CN Tower 3 times, once at night and twice during the day and I am never disappointed. I really enjoy the elevator ride as its all glass and you can was watch the city views change as you go up and down.

A very good expierience.Just has to be done.The sky pod is worth that bit extra if you like heights.The lift service was very good.The staff were friendly and helpful.As you expect there are ques at times but it is worth the wait.
no getting past it: this is scary. I love heights but this is different. well organized tours and certainly an impressive sight from all over town.
At one time, the tallest free standing structure in the world, this tower offers incredible 360 degree views of Toronto. A great place to visit, although it is a bit pricey.

Being an iconic image of the Torontonian skyline, a visit is definitely recommended to go all the way up to the observation deck and get breathtaking views of Toronto. Other than that and the glass floor (which you can see the ground from), there is nothing much more however. A climb up the CN Tower's stairs also happens annually.
Wow-what a great view of the city, and Lake Ontario. This is a must when you visit Toronto-been inside twice-worth it each time. To see an approaching electrical storm is fantastic.

Visited the tower on a Saturday night around 10 pm. We didn't have to wait in line or fight any crowds. Although it was a little rainy that night we decided to go anyway, as the day was so hot and hazy I don't think we would have enjoyed it. The lights were beautiful and we could see quite far....

I have been to Toronto before, but didn't think the tower was worth it. It was. We paid the basic price which gave us the observation deck and the awesome "glass floor" level that allows you to see down. We watched the daredevils who were outside hanging from the tower from bungee cords. The $175.00 fee and fear (frankly) stopped...

The CN tower was pretty cool. A but expensive but a sightseeing must. We went up not long before sunset and it was pretty cool to see the sunset over Toronto. The glass floor is kinda creepy but pretty awesome.

I bring relatives from the UK here when they visit.I was born and raised in Toronto, so have been here several times. while the view is great the food average only .There are much better places to eat.

The ride is very nice - the elevator has a glass floor! From the top you can see most of Toronto, but the fun is posing for pictures in the glass floor of the viewing deck. If you have time, it is worth to eat in the restaurant: the menu has a good price and you get a free ride...

We did not have the best weather day when we went up so maybe that took away from the visit. It was over $100 for the four of us to go up. It might have been better on a crystal clear day. Even on this day, it was a little crowded so I would go very early or very late...

The CN Tower is the tallest building in Canada and visiting it is an experience that you’ll probably never forget! I’ve actually been to the tower about 5 times, so I’m pretty familiar with it. I recommend that you buy a regular ticket because you can visit the outdoor observation deck which allows you to take beautiful photographs, get an...

Make sure you visit this attraction when you visit Toronto and make sure you bring a camara with you. The 360 Restaurant is kind of pricy but really worth every penny. Make sure you make a reservation well in advance because it is usually crowded.
The views are spectacular,you can see for miles on a clear day. If you have the nerve you can even go outside and hang off the building on a safety line

I love tall buildings so this was a pure joy. Talk about on a clear day you can see forever. Better yet on a windy day try staying vertical on the outside observation deck. I turned into a small child trying to walk against the wind. Truly a happy memory.

We were lucky there weren't long lines. Well run, signage could be a bit confusing. Lovely views but found it disappointing that there wasn't signage to indicate the views we are looking at. I felt it was excessive to offer this audio information for another $5! Movie was not up to date and may only interest people interested in design...

Great views and neat see through floor. We went about 4 PM on a weekday and it was a two hour wait. They allowed us to exchange the tickets for the next morning and held them for us at the customer service desk. When we came back in the AM it was empty and we could go right up. Really...

As part of a group tour I suppose this was going to be a little fraught given the time scale.This was our last evening together after a great tour of twelve days, food was fine but had to be consumed at an Olympic pace,plates disappeared,another arrived within seconds,wine was thrown down ones neck,back in the lift, no time to decide...

I had read a suggestion on a website suggesting you visit after 8 PM because the lines were shorter. This was excellent advice! We went at 8:50 in order to watch the sunset at 9:20. There were no lines at all. We got some amazing pictures of the sun setting over the city and stayed around a bit to see...

While the view from up top of the tower is beautiful, there's not much to do once you get up there. The glass floor is neat, kind of scary and the elevator ride up is fun, there is a glass floor on the bottom.
We waited in line for over 1 hour to get upstars to glass floor leve, than another 40 minutes to go up to top of Tower.Views were unbelievable!But was it worth the wait????

Amazing view and experience. If you go, I recommend that you have lunch or dinner at the (pricy) revolving 360 degree restaurant. Although pricy, admission to the three main levels is included thus making the dinner price competitive. I also recommend making a (no deposit required) reservation on line or by phone. If you do, you bypass all the lines...

A couple of weeks ago, I had to take care of some colleagues visiting our local branch. It was their first time in Toronto and in Canada, and they had some free time before their flight departed. I wanted to show them a “must do” or “must see” of our city. The perfect place to start the tour was the...

For someone who is afraid of heights, it took me a lot of courage to visit one of the tallest structures in the world. The tower provides a spectacular view of the city and it felt like the top of the world. The glass floor is quite impressive, but scared me to death. But, it was so worth it. A...
It was a great way to get a birds eye view of Toronto. The lift was scary going up as it had a glass bottom !

$25 basic cost for the elevator to the observation deck, plus $6 if you want to take the extra elevator to the slightly higher level.Good views of course, expensive shop (mostly full of tat), average cafe at the bottom. Very expensive restaurant on the observation deck. Note it is VERY advisable to get here early (9am) to avoid elevator...

It's one of the kids one should see if they visit Toronto but can get boring to visit it again. The lines for the elevator can get very long. Its was nice that we could borrow a complementary wheelchair for my mom so that she did not have to stand in the line for a long time. Its quite expensive...
The CN Tower has great views of the city and beyond on a clear day. It is pretty high and is neat to visit. good photo ops.

This is the most poorly run attraction we've been to in years. While waiting in line (for 45 minutes) there was absolutely nothing but blank walls. No pictures, no history, no facts, etc. The observation level deck (lower of the two obversation levels which comes w/the basic entry fee) was absolutley packed - there was obviously no limit to how...
it is a must place to to for travelers and you can have a full view of toronto downtown and also you can have dinner there by enjoying the 360 degree view of toronto

We went early in the morning and definitely beat the crowds. The glass floor alone is worth going up, and the views are pretty spectacular. Nice gift shop on the ground floor, too. We didn't pay the extra $10 to go the Skypod (another 300 ft up), but somewhat wish we did.

I went there at night after a meal at the 360 Restaurant. At night, the view from the restaurant was breathtaking. The observation deck was nice, too, but the protective mesh made it a little difficult to see everything else. I only wished I had been there to do the sky walk outside earlier in the day. That would have...
Long, long lines with minimal air conditioning, rather boring to be honest~would not go there again if I visited Toronto for a second time.

We really enjoyed the CN tower. It's a great way to see Toronto and learn about the city. It is WELL WORTH the $65 price to buy the VIP tickets to not wait in all the lines. You could end up spending more time waiting in lines than seeing the sites without it. We were told 360 (the rotating restaurant)...

We had a great visit here, it’s a little expensive, but its still a must do if in Toronto. I don’t think the sky pod is worth the extra cash. Try and visit on a clear day with no haze you can see for miles.

We used the city pass and were able to go to the top as well and have the 360 view. It is truly amazing. I had eaten at 360 restaurant before and the fact that you are slowly making your way around the tower and get to see the entire view while you are having your meal makes it even...

If I'd known beforehand I could have got vouchers which would have provided discounted fees for children to go up the CN Tower. Well worth searching for discount vouchers in free magazines or obtain vouchers from union station information centre. The glass floor takes some courage and faith to stand on but we survived, along with everyone else! Be warned,...

When we arrived at the tower the girl in the ticket box suggested we buy the full package ticket, which we were glad we did, it included the normal lookout level, which to me was a disappointment, the windows were dirty, the glass floor was dirty and their restaurant took up a lot of viewing area, it was very difficult...

We were there on a clear day so the views to the horizon were fantastic. What's not so good is that there is no information about what you are looking at, so you're basically paying $30 (top deck too) for a view. Paying the extra $6 dollars to go to the top deck is just about worth it for 360...

it's our third time on the CN tower, but our child first time and that's why we went again. we found it very expensive ride up to the top and very crouded as well. if you choose not to pay even more to get to the higher balcony - you find that a resturant block half the circle and so...

If you have the patience to cue even with a baby, but are ready for a long wait without priority line, then it is a must to have seen it. The view is spectacular, but there are too many people to be really able to enjoy the looks. However, amazing piece of architecture.
Wow, views are spectacular, we did the basic ticket but for a family of four we felt that $90 was a little too steep for a 15min visit.
great view over Toronto - unbelievable experience on the glass floor. Visit the tower on a sunny day will give you a great view and a unforgettable experience

We got there early and lines and crowds were no problem. Of course views are awsome and with the geography being flat you can see in every direction until th ehorizon falls off. Oh yeah, it's a long waaay to the ground.

I was disappointed with this attraction. If you wanted to purchase the basic package you were required to wait wait over an hour just to get inside. This was on a weekday in August. If you purchased the deluxe package you only had to wait 20 minutes. We only had a few hours so we decided to purchase the deluxe....

If you like skyscrapers, and I do, then the CN Tower is a must do when in Toronto. The view, of course, is exceptional, and the glass floor looking down over the Rogers Centre is really neat. My only regret is that I didn't have time to do the Edge Walk!!! Enjoy!

It cost more than $50 for two of us to simply go up to the observation deck, but the views are beautiful. My husband walked out on the glass floor, along with dozens of other people scrambling to find a space and take a picture at the 118-story drop beneath their feet. We went at 5:00pm and had NO WAIT...

I was looking forward to this but was disappointed. Firstly the main viewing are is Not 360 degrees, as a restaurant takes up about 90 degrees. So unless you are eating there or unless you pay more to go to the higher part of the tower, you won't see a 360 degree view. I found the windows were quite dirty...

The sight from the top is breathtaking. Just stood there and looked out over Toronto and admired the beauty. I'm terrified of heights however I held onto my cookies to enjoy a sight I may never get to see again!

column3: São José do Rio Preto, Brasil
column4: One of the best places I´ve ever been in my life to see a town. The restaurant located there is wonderful and they serve you a very good meal. The name is 360º. The view from there is amazing. You must walk on the glass floor and look down. Kids loved it so much !
We did the glass floor and the observation desk. Gave us the wauw factor. We had excellent weather, which can make the difference. The glass floor was great and exciting.

A great way to spend a couple of hours and get a great view of the Toronto landscape.If you're scared of heights stay away.The fast elevator ride up and down are pretty cool.Went on a rainy day, therefore the view wasn't as spectacular.Good fun.Worth it.

The view from the top of this tower is spectacular. Its a must if you are in toronto. It was a cloudy day when we visited but we were still able to have a good view. The minimum cost of $23 plus tax is a little bit pricey but you may opt for the toronto citypass @£59 pls tax for...

This is a pretty cool tower, and it is a fun place to go. If the crowds are really bad and you have a minimal amount of time, they do have a "Premier Pass", which costs about $65 per person, and you can bypass the the lines. Well worth the cost! The extras, movies that are included in the price,...

I took my 4 year old Daughter this month and had a great time, lots of things to do and even more things to see. We arrived around 10am and there was only one couple in the line. The price is reasonable even after the extra $10.00 to go to the "Sky Pod" which I do recommend. If you are...

Experiencing the tallest structure in the world was awesome. Like any other attractions of such around the world the CN Tower tour is no difference. The long lineup to wait to get on the elevators could be a chore with younger children.
This is a must-see in Toronto. From the observation deck there is a spectacular view, though a bit scary for someone afraid of heights like me. But definitely worth seeing and quite a thrill!

I had to wait until almost the end of my Canada trip to visit the tower because I wanted to have one of the best views from it. The weather was always cloudy in the past days and the tower was surrounded by clouds. I luckily went on a beautiful day and enjoyed some beautiful views of Toronto. I didn't...
This was enjoyable, obviuosly offers a good view of Toronto. This visit is quite informative and does exactly what you expect it to.

Feel on top of the world when you visit Toronto. The scenic beauty you enjoy from the top is amazing. You can see the curvature of the Earth. The view of Lake Ontario is excellent. enjoy the view from the Glass floor.
Yes its expensive, but how can you look at it for days on end and not go up. The view does not disappoint. We got the city pass, which makes this worth it if you do everything.

With my plans to visit Canada, came a list of ‘To Do Things’. On my long “Bucket List” has always been the CN Tower and Banff in Canada. So once I was done with my older sister, Niagara falls and Kitchener, I went off to Etobicoke to see my baby brother (who by the way looks older only because he...
I have a bit of vertigo I found out, after looking down through the plastic / glass floor at the top of the tower. It's worth the trip up here to orient yourself to the city.

Well the CN Tower COULD have been a lot cooler. Unfortunately the weather wasn't our best friend that day (cloudy, cloudy, cloudy) and visibility was pretty limited. Supposedly you can see out like 45-50 miles on a clear day...Anyway, we booked the "Total Tower" ticket and if you are over 18 let me make some recommendations.#1) Do not...

A lot of people complain about the price but I think around $40+(depending on what you want to do) is more than worth the view alone. There's hardly nothing like it in the world! Going to Toronto and not going up the tower(all the way to the space deck) is like going to Kuala Lumpur and ignoring the Petronas Towers....

Fairly long line but moved very quickly. Super high and great views of city, water and islands. My 19 y/o daughter wished she had done the Edge Walk. Everyone we spoke to who did it said it was expensive but worth it.

I watched this structure being built in the early 70’s and can still appreciate it as not only a landmark, but not a traditional place to visit and have a Dirty Martini at over 1,000 feet above Lake Ontario. From the second you enter the fastest elevator in the country, you are lifted high above the city of Toronto with...

The CN Tower is amazingly tall and a landmark for tourists and locals. I loved taking the long, but very cool elevator up and standing on the glass floors. The line ups where very long to go to the second floor but very worth while. At the top there was an amazing view of Lake Ontario and the city. It...
Great way to view Toronto. We had lunch there and avoided the crowds. Our waiter was great and told us about what we saw outside.

We were able to visit the observation decks after our dinner at the 360 restaurant and I'm so glad we did! Great view...but I would have been disappointed if I had waited in line for hours and paid $25+ just to see the view. The lines were super long all day. The view is really nice but it's better to...
Get your cameras and camcorders up to the highest structure in Canada. Nice views in any direction, plus a part of the floor with a very thick glass for a great photo.

The CN tower is touted as "the tallest building on the planet" and is also one of the Modern Wonders of the World. For those reasons alone it's worth seeing if you are in Toronto. I've actually been up twice now. The first time I paid for the standard ticket that gets you to the observation level where you can...
Had dinner and visited the skypod as well. Don't really recommend the skypod but the rest of the view was very nice. Dinner was expensive but of good quality.
It was exciting to go back to the CN Tower after 20 years. Fantastic view of the whole city. Looking forward to going back in September to eat at the top of the CN Tower.

Felt this was a must-do as part of our visit to Toronto. Having been up a fair few towers in our lives, it was frankly a bit of a let down.The height and construction are impressive, but that's about it. You don't even get a full 360 degrees with a (overpriced) restaurant stuck in the viewing platform. The glass...

Bottom line - You pay $30 to go up an elevator and end up 1400+ feet over Toronto. It is definitely a great view, but after that there's nothing else of interest in the tower...except more ways for you to spend your money. I think the John Hancock Observatory in Chicago is more interesting

After have been up in Rockefeller Centre and Empire State Building in New York we wanted to try the CN Tower, but it was quite a disappointment. Apart from being quite expensive, it was not possible to go all the way around due to the bar and the view is not that great. It didn’t help that the weather was...
