Maybe it's because I visited when it was at the peak of summer holidays so there were hundreds of tourists at the CN Tower, but honestly the lines were just ridiculous!Only up sides I found was how the security checks you through those wind blowing things by the entrance which I thought was pretty cool and the elevator ride...
Great location, impressive, great views allow a couple of hours minimum to explore as you will need to queue
You"d be silly not to do this, View is speatacular, Not to pricey, easy to get to, Great place foe pictures

I enjoyed taking the elevator up to the observation deck as well as a quick but expensive lunch on a Sunday afternoon. The ride up is quick, and the atmosphere is outstanding. A must if you have the time and are in the area.

The feeling and view up there was really awesome. We went up during sunset and we stayed on longer so that we can take in the city other too when the sky turned to darker blue. My girl liked to walked on the glass floor and looked all the way down, it's was a trilling experience for her!

Our family visited the CN Tower this evening. Despite having high expectations for this attraction, I feel I can only rate it as average. I will clarify by saying the tower and the views are spectacular, but we purchased the highest level tickets for complete access to all viewing areas and also what the woman in the ticket booth described...
we went up the tower during sunset it was amazing and while we waited we able to watch a couple of 3D movies the wait was a while in the line but it ws worth it

we did not go all the way to the top; there is another line for the next elevator; you should go at least for the feeling you get when you walk on the glass floor; recommend the restaurant at the main level; not very busy when we where there and good food

As can be expected, the CN Tower is a bit of a tourist trap, with about 5 different attractions they charge you for (separately or in packages). We had dinner at the 360 Restaurant, which was surprisingly tasty and accompanied by a great view, but of course expensive. It did allow us to skip lines and not pay admission though,...
Great view of the city! The glass floor is brilliant so high. Worth the visit! You can stay there for hours.

I visited the CN Tower last year during my trip to Toronto and I really enjoyed it. I've been really amazed by the speed of the elevator to get on top and by the glass window on the elevator floor (you feel like powered into the sky). Once on top you got an amazing circular view on Toronto and the...
Lots of waiting just to get to a cool view but if you don't have much to do that day, it was pretty fun.
A must do while in Toronto (at least once). Great view, kids enjoyed the 58 second elevator ride to the top!
I´ve been in Towers everywhere, from Las Vegas to New Zealand, and this one is for sure, one I recommend and that I would definitly go back!
This is a no-brainer. Try to get discount tickets through the CAA or many other outlets before you go.

The CN Tower is such a recognizable landmark and icon of Canada that it's a must visit. It helps if you've toured Toronto enough before you visit the tower to be able to identify the buildings and places that are visible from the tower. Consider doing the EdgeWalk--it's quite memorable.

I last took the Tower 30 yrs ago as a teen and wanted my boys 9,16 18 to experience it. Yes, it is a very tall tower with views over Toronto and areabut the lifts (elevators ) posed a fairly long wait for each ascent to each level and then down again.We had not timed our visit to...
Awesome views of the City! We ate lunch at the restaurant--pricey but what do you expect from a major tourist destination.
Wonderful view over the city.The ride & film are a total waste of time and money. My Daughters thought they were boring

We had to wait 1.5 hours to get up to the observation deck. The staff was great and handed out free water to those waiting. We had been looking forward to the glass floor but it is only a small section of the observation area which was a let-down.

We had lunch and just relaxed for hours, we took a walk on the glass floor and went out on the obersvation deck, I love places like this,the CN tower is a must if you are in Toronto.Just siting watching planes land and the sun shine makes my day, go here, you will be blown away and a memory...

The CN Tower is truly a must-see attraction. The view is amazing, but the idea that you're 140+ stories above Toronto standing on a glass floor makes the CN Tower something you'll talk about for years. Although the view from the Sky Pod is the same as from the Lookout Level, pay the extra few dollars and make the trip...
Much like everything else in Toronto, the CN Tower experience has really been put together well. It's an absolute must-do for anyone visiting Toronto.
fun to visit and go up in the elevators for the view - its especially good on a clear day in the winter, you feel you can see "forever" - ok restaurant

We were visiting Toronto in the middle of the July tourist season and expected huge crowds where ever we went. Someone had told us to visit the CN Tower after 5 pm when the crowds would be gone for dinner. They were right. The lines were very short and we waited practically no time at all.The view from the...
A great experience especially on the glass floor. If you are thinking of going do it early and buy your tickets from the hotel to avoid the queues as they were massive.

The sights from the observation deck where beautiful. My boyfriend and I thought it was a little on the high side just to take an elevator up 137 stories and look around but we enjoyed the view once we got there.

The CN tower dinner experience was very good. Very good food, variety and courteous staff. And at the same time you are eating in the revolving restaurant you see all the views around you of Toronto. But it doesn't revolve very quickly just very slowly. You can walk across and go to the toilet and when you finish at the...

Long lines, very crowded but its a must see item in Canada. Yes you are going to wait in line,but it is well woth it at the end. There are not many plaves with a view like that. If you are in Toronto, you need to go to the CN tower.

I know it was a rip off before we went but since its our first time in Toronto we thought ok, lets do it. Quick entrance. went up the elevator, nothing exciting really, few seconds of a view then on to the viewing floor. Maybe i've been up to many towers but i just wasn't jumping for joy impressed for...

We took our 9 yr old son to visit the CN tower on a recent trip to Toronto. The lines went quickly, the outdoor view was superb from the level with the glass floor, standing and sitting on the glass floor was super cool and the elevator ride was a bit thrilling. We actually ate at the restaurant Horizons, had...

This one brings down your hat if you had one on your head. The ticket is about 35dollars and gets you into the tower. You first go to the observation deck. View of Toronto is really good. On a clear sunny day you may get a glimpse of Niagara falls. Next thet take you to another level where you have...

We went in a group of friends expecting to do the "observation plus experience" (29.99$), you know, skypod and everything. The problem is, when we were buying the tks, they let us know that it would take us a one hour something waiting for the 1st ride on the elevator (that takes us to the look out+glass floor) and another...

You can't beat the view from the CN tower. The elevator ride is fun and the main level observation area offers a great view. Sure, this is a touristy thing to do...but I didn't understand the scale of Toronto (number of buildings and the size of the city) until I took a trip to the CN tower. it's a bit...

It was $30 per person to go up the tower but the view was unlike any you could get of Toronto. The glass floor, despite being told it could hold 14 hippos, was scary but gave a great photo opportunity.
It's certainly a Toronto must-see attraction - if you are not afraid of highs. Watch for the clear days for a great overlook.
Nice restaurante on the top with 360 view. Necessary to book table well in advance. CN Tower looks very nice at night, smart lightening.

Pretty cool tour if you have a couple hours to kill. They will take you up 144 stories to get some amazing views of Toronto. They have a glass floor you can stand on up there to look straight down. A little intimidating at first but its a must do if you are going to be up there. While you...

Just recently visitied the CN Tower with my husband and two oldest grandsons (ages 12 and 10). We took the "total experience" package which included a movie about flight and a simulated ride called "Himalamazon (sp?)." The movie and ride really had nothing to do with the CN Tower. My grandsons thought the movie was boring; and although they enjoyed...

The lines are fast. The elevator is fast. The views are great. I don't like heights but I did go to the glass floor. I did not look down however. Note: you can walk through the restaurant even if you are not dining so you can get views 360* around. We went on a nice day which helps. We also...
CN Tower is one if the best observation decks i visited.it provides amazing views of toronto. their gift shop is nice also with many items to select with reasonable prices.
Great view at night. Got engaged here 21 years ago. Great place to bring relatives from Europe when they come for a visit.

When we bought the tickets, i was told that the waiting time is ~50 minutes but i can reduce it to ~15 if i pay more... and get more attractions with it. i think this is unfair, but i did bought the additional experience.The climb is perfect and so is the glass floor and the upper deck.The attractions...

We went to the CN Tower Sunday, as our last stop on our Toronto weekend...Upon arrival it was very confusing as to where to buy the tickets, it seemed like the tickets were being sold inside, but in fact we found out after waiting in that line, that they were actually sold outside at another booth...Adding to the...

I had booked a ticket from the UK which you exchange for the entrance ticket on arrival at the CNN Tower. Went past all the queues at the doors but then hit a queue inside which was going to take 2 hours to get through. Apparently this was because it was a public holiday and I was advised to come...
That's why you go there, that and the obligatory visit to the gift shop where you can find all things Canada. Really great views and plexiglass floors to scare the heck out of you (or your kids!)

We visited the tower in July, it is fantastic. We got the "whole experience" ticket which gave us access to the very top of the tower as well as two very random attractions in the basement.We went right up to the top and the views were stunning, it is a pitty that viewing platforms slightly lower are spoilt by...

The view at the top of the tower is always nice (with a clear day). We went during the weekday in July and there was no line and barely any wait. There is a simulation ride at ground level of the CN Tower. It was just ok. I would not spend the $$ unless it is included in the CityPass...
Expensive, especially for families (and worth probably 10 dollars less), but really how many times can you take a glass elevator 1500 feet into the air.
expensive for what amounts to sight seeing....Would skip this one my next trip to TO. PS: if you have a fear of hights this is not the place for you
Staff were rude, the line up was long, I could feel the building sway, couldn't wait to get down, there's a lot of conte truncation going on around it , people were rude.
Yes it is a tourist trap. Yes it is not cheap. But on a clear day you can see Buffalo 150 kms. away.
Had a clear night. Wonderful view. We were with a couple visiting Toronto for the first time...nice to see the city from above.
We liked the view and the ohhhh-ahhh experience. The glass floor and looking over the baseball field through it was really neat! Be ready to spend big money for it all though.
The views from the CN Tower are amazing, but the tower is very crowded and the prices are ridiculously high! Still, this is a must-do if you are visiting Toronto.

This is fun for the whole family! My children loved the glass floor and we took several pictures with them laying on it. I love that you had an indoor and an outdoor experience in which to view the city. The ride up was exhilarating since the elevator also had 2 glass floor sections to look down through. We also...
I was worried that it would be too high or scary. Not at all. A safe and interesting site. Well managed. Great views. One of the tallest buildings in the world.

I visited the CN tower with my son who has anxiety. He was afraid of the elevator, and called in the morning and asked if we could take the stairs. Due to security reasons we couldn't, but they did allow us to use the elevator without the glass floor. The staff were amazing with him and we didn't have to...
Speedy ascent and descent unlike other tourist destinations of its type. First time there. Glass floors were neat. Nice to learn about the structure!

It was quite a wait to reach the observation floor on a Thursday afternoon in July. But, wow! The views, the interesting information, the glass-floored observation deck. Definitely a must-see in Toronto.
Expensive and not value for money.Fast track system should beavailable on at least one day a week to avoid groups.

The CN Tower is worth while seeing. Entrance is quite expensive but you can easily spend a few hours at least. I chose the full package (approx 40 CAD), which included the LookOut + Glass Floor + SkyPod + Movie + Motion Theater Ride.The lookout is great, you can see all of Toronto from a birds eye perspective. The...

I still can't quite believe that the Canadians built a tower simply as a tourist attraction. But as a tourist attraction I was slightly disappointed by it. I bought a full-entry ticket-- which gives you access to all the areas in the tower, including the Skypod.I was a bit disappointed by the Glass Floor. I had imagined a whole...
Can't really not go here! Bought a Toronto Pass ticket which was a good value way of seeing lots of attractions. Lifts are super fast and queues weren't too long. Big hit with all the family!

The CN tower is definitely something worth seeing. Is it overpriced? Yes, but everything touristy in Toronto is so just prioritize.They offer several different packages, depending on what you want to see. We ended up with the package that included the look out, the glass floor and the skypod.We had to wait in line to get tickets, but...

Every time we go to Toronto we seem to gravitate to the CN Tower. The ticketing office is outside at the base but if you come at it from Front Street and find yourself inside by guest services it is a little confusing that you need to go out the doors to get a ticket. They offer several packages depending...

Canadians will hate me for this but after visiting the Burj Kalifa the CNN tower just looks shabby and outdated. They have old signs up that tell you it is still the tallest building in the world which hasn't been true for a while. We had drinks up at the 360 restaurant and the drinks were really bad. It is...
Much like Seattle's Space Needle...but have to admit it is always a charmer for children. If you are on family vacation, it is a MUST stop for the children.
Easy accessible location with great views of the lake and downtown Toronto. Good for one visit - sits right next to the ball park
This is a great place to get the panoramic view of the whole city. We only did the observation deck and didn't do the full package, but it was plenty for us. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable.

It was amazing to be that high that the planes were below you. We watched the end of the Blue Jays game from the tower and watched them close the dome a bit later. The kids loved it and we ate at the restaurant for a snack with an amazing view of the lake and waterfront.
actually, the view is not very amazing. But if you are the 1st. time visitor to Toronto, you surly should go to one of the places of interest.
Expensive but worth it. I recommend making a reservation at the 360 restaurant so you don't have to pay just to go up in the tower.
On a clear day you can see a great panorama. Very popular tourist attraction about $20. It has a restaurant at the top but a little pricey. You need to make the restaruant a special destination spot.

Some love the tower, others despise the money spent on it. I have been up twice, once alone and once with family. It is very well worth the money. The view is breathtaking. It looks awesome from up when in a thunderstorm or at sunset. The latter is more predictable. Try to time your trip so that you reach around...

Such a cool and unique expierence.A few tips:Go when it opens and buy your tickets ahead of time.Pay the extra $ to go all the way to the top....and immediately go there (it gets crowded)Make reservations to do a meal at the rotating resturant. It is on the expensive side but so cool. The waitstaff was...
A must on any vacation to TO. We loved the views and displays throuhout the tower. Had lunch at Horizon's, with wonderful views of the skyline.

Different prices dependent on the level of experience you want - check the free papers for discount vouchers as we saved 20%. Cant miss the tower from wherever you are in the city, its is so tall & dominates the skyline.Views are amazing, you dont realise how far you can actually see - on a clear day as far...

If I had it to do over again, I wouldn't. We waitied i line to buy tickets, waited in line to get to the main observation deck, waited in line to get to the sky pod, and even waited in line to catched the elevator to leave this place. :( Only get the whole package if it's a busy time,...

After you spend a little while on the observation deck, stop in at the restaurant get a seat facing the lake and enjoy a nice meal and/or drink and watch the planes takeoff/land from the nearby island airport. It's a lot of fun and very relaxing.

Its a long wait and pretty expensive if you dont have the city pass. They boast about the glass floor but there are so many people on it it doesnt matter. It also has a bunch of metal beams running thru it so its more like glass panels. We went right before we headed to a blue jays game so...

go if you like photography or doing really touristy stuff, kids will like it. .. it's expensive for what it is.... the restaurant was $250 (for two) crappy steaks, cuts were all fat and grissle, and terrible food in overly SMALL portions.. we had subway after we left because we were still hungry.

It doesnt get any higher than this. I got talked into going to the space pod for a few extra bucks that gets you another 33 storeys up. Its a pretty busy attraction but if you want to see Toronto from another perspective I recommend this.
For spectacular views, you can't beat this. Just be sure to pick a day with no dense cloud cover or fog!

We visited the CN Tower using the Citypass with a friend from out of town. The pass included going up to the main observatory point (which includes the glass floor) as well as a "pre-main attraction event"-- either a motion theatre ride or the 3D movie. My partner and our friend really wanted to do the motion theatre ride, which...
Very nice time killer. Great view of a beautiful city. If you are scared of heights, avoid. lol
Must go to attraction in Toronto. Go to the glass floor and the sky pod.

The CN tower is one of the worlds iconic structures, and a must see and do when visiting Toronto, and it doesn't disappoint. The staff are very courteous and do everything to help the customer (quite a common attitude in Toronto-great people). The views are awesome, and we did the glass floor and the nacelle, which provides a wonderful view...
My 6 year old loved the glass floor was very proud to be the only person brave enough to stand, sit and lay on it.

CN Tower is a must see while in Toronto. Be aware...if you are "afraid" of heights (like I am) then this is not the place for you. The glass floor is amazinly "scarey". There were little kids walking, laying-down and jumping up and down , while I was scared to death to even get close to it. My kids aged...
Everyone should visit this place if they are ever in toronto. We didn't eat here but just went for the view. Make sure you walk over the glass floor!
If you're in town for a visit, you can't help but see the CD Tower but it's worth a trip up to the top if you have the time.
Amazing views. Just be cautious if your not good with heights, the glass floor on the top floor may make you feel very uncomfortable.

Finally got myself up the CN Tower. Came here 26 years ago on a school trip and it was foggy that day. This time it was a lot clearer and made for some spectacular views. I bought the total tower experience through CAA which is the best deal. Includes observation deck, glass floor, skypod, 3D movie and motion theatre ride....

wow 90 dollars for the three of us,including my 6 year old, 25 minutes to get to the elevator, so many people on the glass floor you were lucky to get near it and wow. Not to mention that they wanted 25 dollars for pics you could take your self. save your money folks
It is definitely at the top of my to-do list for friends and family visiting from out of town. It's a little pricey but the views are great!
A must if you are in Toronto and like heights. Quite expensive, but, the view from the top is phenomenal!
If you like panoramic views, this is wonderful. I first visited it 35 years ago, and with the growth of Toronto, it is a completely different panorama.

We visited out of season and the day was very cloudy but we wanted to go.We did not have to wait to go in and when we got to the top it was not to busy.The staff were very friendly.I think it would be fantastic on a sunny day clear day but we were not blessed with...

If You are afraid of heights, then you might suffer in this attraction...I went there with my family and visited the observation deck and glass floor. It was quite scary at the glass floor. The view in the deck was amazing and completly worth it all. But I recommend this attraction (if you are not afraid of heights!)Tip: If...

If you are in Toronto I think you have to go enjoy this place. It's great to be up so high and take in the view...we did it at sunset so it was nice to see the day turn to night and watch the lights come on around the city. But I'm sure it's also nice during the day.It's...

The CN Tower is ridiculously expensive for what you get (an elevator ride to the top of a really tall tower and then up to a glass enclosed platform.) The lines weren't bad on our visit and the views are pretty nice. However, the CN Tower is not the best view of Toronto IMO (it feels too much like looking...

This is a great place for tourists to come and visit the city. You get to see the whole city from a high point of view. The edge walk is a fun experience for all. The CN Tower is NOT a place for locals. You just spend money just to go up, see the city, and go back down. The...

A few weeks ago, was my first time visitng the CN Tower in Toronto and I can say it was definitely worth the long commute and the prices. I visited with my son and mother and they also enjoyed the experience very much. We purchased a package which included views from the glass floor, sky pod and lookout. All of...
This is the best view in Toronto and a lot of fun.

Well worth going up the CN Tower, the views are incredible. I loved the glass floor, looking straight down 382m to the ground...The queue was short when we went, and from joining it to walking out onto the viewing deck took us less than 20 minutes. I have heard this can be in excess of several hours if the...
We did the whole experience (except for the Edge Walk.) Totally worth the $35/each. Amazing views and the glass floor HAS to be seen!
Going to Toronto a must see, spend the extra few bucks to go all the way up truly worth the extra. went with a first timer and we both had a good time.
accessible for wheelchair, very crowded, hard to reach the observation windows.
really enjoyed this attraction. Great city views and great restaurant. Dared to step onto the Glass Floor - glad I tried it before we had dinner. Well worth a visit

The best place to have lunch and show out of towners the city. I always make a reservation on Sunday of Labour day weekend to have lunch and watch the air show going on at the CNE grounds. You have a nice lunch and occassionally the planes in the air show buzz the tower!
go there in the morning - few people only. Afterward a lot of tourist groups are there and space is limited

This Toronto landmark is a fun stop if you're in Toronto, but I think it's over-hyped and admissions is overpriced. The observation deck is not as big as they make it seem. The walkway on the deck is rather narrow. Two normal size adults would struggle standing sideways shoulder to shoulder from wall to observation rail. It's not as wide...
It is a great view but don´t pay for visit the CN Tower, book a dinner table there instead...then you get a nice view and a nice dinner!
We visited and had dinner at the CN tower restaurant during a recent trip to Toronto and all I can say is WOW. The view was breathtaking and dinning experience were absolutely exquisite.
Nothing too impressive (except the glass floor area, which takes a bit of nerve to walk across initially)
It's nice to be at the top floor to view City ofToronto but the visitor's price ticket is so outrageous..paid $ 35.99 (US dollar).Better go somewhere else fun if you're in a budget...

If you have been on the top of NYC or even Montreal, Canada, CN to you it's not much different. The glass floor is a very small area so you don't feel like walking on the air at all. We waited to see night scene of Toronto, but very disappointed, not many lights are on in this city, mostly dark...
View was brilliant, staff told you how long queues were for the extras (ie skypod) before you booked tickets incase you wouldn't want to wait.

Went to 360 - CN Tower restaurant. Was fantastic. Lucky enough for great weather. The 3 tier seafood platter was out of this world. Splurge, order it and a bottle of wine and you are set for a spectacular evening. Service from Samir and Nurmal was amazing. No complaints. GREAT night :) Included is the Observation Deck and the glass...

column3: West Kirby, Glannau Mersi, Deyrnas Unedig.
column4: We decided not to go up because the long wait - estimated at 1½ hours.Our advice would be to avoid the first week in July - the 1st July being Canada Day and also lots of US people taking advantage of the 4th July holidays.
Great view of Canada! The glass floor on the tower was not what I was expecting! But the view and tower was a marvel!

While it's nothing special, it's worth the visit if in Toronto. The views are amazing!We were a little scared going up the super-fast elevator, but once our stomachs relaxed, it was fun to walk around, check out the views, and stand on the glass floor so high above ground.
It's a must. Great view, I could also recommend the rest. - nice dessers

Being the once tallest structure in the world, the CN Tower has a lot of expectations to live up to, and it definitely does. I might be a bit biased because I'm a Torontonian, but the tower is thrilling, my favorite attraction being the glass floor. I still having mustered up the courage for the EdgeWalk, though.

Wow! The view from the top is really incredible nice. I had a pre- booked dinner at the revolving restaurant and food was very good. But beware! If you order any entree they say is for one, it is really for two or three. The servings are monstrous.

The CN Tower gives you great views of Toronto and the islands. On the viewing floor, there is an area with glass that you can step on and look right down to the ground - so if you are afraid of heights, watch where you step. The glass area is only small and usually quite busy with people taking photo's,...

Although I've been to the Canadian National (CN) Tower several times over the years, every experience is a little bit different. In this case, the CN Tower has added additional attractions - the EdgeWalk, the Legends of Flight 3D, and the Himalamazon simulation/motion theatre ride. The Observation area and the Skypod are a must....so is the tower's glass floor (everyone...

My kids and I go to Toronto annually, and the CN tower is always a must stop on their list. We love taking silly pics on the glass floor overlooking the ground floor. It's always a little creepy standing on it. The elevator rise is always fun for them too.

During our trip to Toronto my wife and I both agreed we should revisit this attraction. (the last time we both visited was 25 years before plus).With this in mind we decided to go up the tower and enjoy the experience again, and we were no disappointed.The only thing I would say is that try your best to...
Lines can be long, but the views are worth it. Spend the extra money to visit the skypod. You could also spend quite a bit more money and do the Edge Walk (I didn't - too expensive).
well coordinated staff and lines, breathtaking views well worth the thrill. had been here 2-3 times previously and would do it again

The CN Tower used to be a highlight of Toronto but over the years as tall buildings fill the skyline and the tower ages, I no longer find it to be good value.Tip: I would suggest going up to the restaurant for a coffee / dessert rather than paying to go to the observation deck.
If you are in Toronto, dont miss this attraction!I am afraid of heights but I could really enjoy this anyway.They have a "Egde Walk" that i opted out.... that was not for me...

Lookout: The view on top is really nice even if the best part (downtown) is a little bit hidden by the restaurant.Glass floor: just a small area with a lot of visitors on it and a view on a site. Around that you can do a 360° tour outside but impossible to take some pictures because of the grilling....
Good views of Toronto, free to roam around at leisure, good gift shop. For $5 dollars more you can visit the skypod
More hype than wow factor. If you've done Burj Khaifa in Dubai, then this will be very disppointing.Cafe on the upper floor is worth a visit as the views are really nice

I've been to the CN Tower more times than I can count on two hands, but I always come back for another visit.It's a landmark in our city, and provides the perfect views of the landscape.I always take friends up, from out of town, and everyone loves it.

the glass-bottom elevator ride up and the panorama. Spectacular during lightning storms. Extremely expensive but frequently top-notch restaurant on the roof which pretty much requires reservations and is experienced with serving Canadian game, fish and seafood.
I'm terribly afraid of hight but this is really nice to do and not that scary.The glassfloor is a small portion of a floor and you can avoid it if you want to.

Only spent about 2 hours here, once you get to the top that is really about it. the elevator ride and the glass floor is about the extent of the excitment at this place. the view is amazing but there was so many people crowded around the glass floor that it was hard to even find a spot to get...
we went inside and used the glass elevator and sat on the glass floors had foto taken brilliant veiws
Wonderful views, except for the long lineups. My partner and I did took the Edge Walk package. It was totally worth the while.
Compare to Sears Tower in Chicago, Empire State Building in New York and the Space Needle in Seattle. A must for travelers!
Amazing lighting show at night. Amazing views of the city skyline.

Met with girlfriend from Niagra Falls NY took road trip to revisit Toronto 18 years later. Went to the tower to get up dated photo from the last visit sat in same place and got new photo it is a beautiful view and amazing how much the city has grown. Don't miss out.

Went to CN tower on a Tuesday mid week in the summer and the line up for the whole experience was unbelieveable. Had to wait to get up the tower, and then again had to wait to go up higher to the sky pod. Overall cost was $30/ person for over an hour of waiting. While the views are amazing...

The view from the top is great. I am a bit scared of heights so I looked around quickly and went down. You can tour at your own pace. They have cool TVs that show you, in real time, the people walking on the edge which was a nice touch especially if someone you know is out there. The glass...
Great views of the city. The glass floor is slightly disconcerting, although our 5 year old had no problem jumping up and down on it! Giftshop has a good selection of Canadian souvenirs.

The glass floor and film presentation on the construction of the tower (both on the main observation level) are must-dos every time I visit. It's also well worth going all the way up to the Space Deck -particularly on a clear evening to watch the sun set. Bring your camera!

We went up to the Sky Pod and although an expensive outing it was worth it for the experience of getting up so high with such a spectacular view of the city. We went up first thing in the morning as soon as it opened and that worked well for us with minimal queueing and probably the clearest view of...

As a Torontonian I will try to write this review with an open mind, as a tourist to Toronto, this is an amazing experience, especially if you have not gone past 50 floors in a high rise building/tower.The observation deck and the sky pod is truly an experience, getting a panoramic view of Toronto.The downside to all of...

Make sure you visit the Sky Deck.. its surely worth the visit. There is a glass floor view, you get a great view of the city and block island, heard you even get a view of Buffalo, NY on a nice day :D...
Amazing! What a great time we had visiting this fantastic Tower, the views were just stunning although i didn't like the glass floors, made me just a little dizzy!
An expensive attraction for what you get but truly a great treat as an attraction whilst in Toronto
As the title says, great views and info on the tower.We sent on a sunday evening so it was not that busy.will definatly be doing the edge walk at some point in the future...
Wouldn't go there in high season. I can imagine it being way to busy. And absolutely go to the glass floor for a great picture

We had a little trouble finding our way around, but once we got to the observation level it was fantastic. Best view of the city by any means. My wife did the edgewalk (I'm afraid of heights, so not me). She absolutely loved it, and there was a set of monitors in the observation deck for me so I could...

I gave this an average rating because they have different packages and the one we got was the 4D Ride. The ride was very underwhelming. The graphics are from the 90s. The other package was the Skypod or something like that. Basically, it was a ticket to go higher in the CN Tower. We didn't choose that because it was...

Like no other venue in Toronto. See the entire city. Look down into the Rogers Centre. Watch aircraft take off and land at the Island airport. Have dinner in the revolving restaurant or look down thru the glass floor. For a real treat, visit the CN Tower at night! A visit to the CN Tower is not cheap, but no...

Got up early on a weekday to go to the CN tower and it was still fairly busy. ON other peoples advice we didn't bother paying the extra fee for the Skypod and just went ot the main veiwing floor. Great views of the city and region, on a nice sunny day. However it was quite windy the say we...

Loved this, I even planned it to go up in the daylight and then capture the dusk and the city by night as well, so really got my moneys worth! Fab views of the city that will always be like a second home to me, I could even see where I worked with ease, not hard to find Toronto City...

Toronto is the biggest city of Canada.I visited CN tower in 2010, It has the Look out level, the Glass floor and the Outdoor sky terrace, where u can see the Toronto city view from the top.the impressive one is the glass floor as u can sit, walk , lay down and even jump on it as u dont need...

The view of Toronto city from the CN tower is fantastic. Apart from the downtown area, Toronto is not a city of high rises, so you do get a fantastic view. The glass floor is a must see, and is not as scary as it sounds! Do give it a try. It's fun if you know the Toronto buildings, to...

a nice ride and with wonderful view of the city. Climb to the highest point. Worth, the view is spectacular and a beautiful country like Canada. Go to Toronto and not visit the CN Tower is like going to the Vatican and not seeing the Pope!
great view, great place to dine and what a great structure..
Fantastic view over the Lake Ontario also 360 degrees of Toronto, then try the observation deck and step onto the glass floor and look down to the miniscule public below!

Was not too keen about the ascent to the top in the lift, seemed a bit scarey at first but got used to it quickly - also the glass floor was amazing but not for the faint hearted - terrific views all over Toronto, nice little cafe for a snack afterwards. Well worth the entry fee!
If you like architecture, nice views etc, this is a nice place to visit. A view that you wont get anywhere else, try to go between day and evening so you can appreciate Toronto DAY /NIGHT views

A great way to see the entire city and beyond! The CN tower provided points of intreats for me while visiting Toronto as I pointed I travelled, The glass floor is a bit for the brave hearted..I didn't really enjoy that as much But for those who are a bit more adventurous...you will enjoyCheers FromNew Jersey
Excellent views of the city. Would have liked to walk along the outside of the skypod.
I visited the CN Tower with my 11 year old daughter this summer. CN Tower offers unobsttructed views of Toronto. Great info inside, super staff and a nice souvenir shop.
Great view of Toronto....especially from the 'floor':)

Being from the area, I still like to visit the CN Tower to show off the beauty and expanse of our lovely GTA to visiting friends and family. It's also a good place for budding photographers. Buy tickets online to jump the line, and if you have alumni or corporate discount, use it, because it is not cheap. As one...
CN Tower brings visitor a wonderful view of Toronto and metropolitan area. A place nobody who goes to Toronto should lose.

One of many trips to the top. Awesome view of GTA and the lake. Pictures are a little difficult through the glass and mesh but I managed. The glass floor is cool...if you can get on it. Nice place to get a drink as well.Elevator operators are very cordial. Lines for the elevators are a little like herding cattle...
one hour to get to the top and then another hour to go the highest level. very crowd and unorganized and limited elevators

A bit overpriced for the shear amount of visitors that come through, but worth it in the end. There was a wait time associated first in buying tickets and then waiting to get into the elevator. I hate that my partner doesn't listen to me when I say I'm scared of heights. So he goes to. get tickets and off we go. to make matters worse the lifts are outdoor and once at the top the floor is fibre glass. the only thing that calms me is the thought of nutella crepes from the stall at...

Almost everywhere has a viewing tower these days, so whereas this was "wow" while it was still the tallest in the world, now its, well, just another viewing tower, and an expensive one at that.Buy tickets online, so at least you only have to queue for the elevators and security, and not the ticket booths as well.This said,...

still worth a visit. You won't get any better views of Toronto then from here. The glass floor is unnerving but great fun. If it's cloudy don't bother going. It's a place you go once, but you at least once!

Wonderful views, going up to the sky deck is a treat and then looking down from the glass bottom floor is awesome. With a game starting at the Rogers Stadium, we were able to hear the national anthems, while on the top of the tower.

We got a Toronto City Pass for $58 and saw several attractions. This was really cool. You can see all of Toronto, Lake Ontario and even the Mississauga skyline off in the distance. Great views but think twice as it is terribly overpriced. Tourist trap!
Very good value. Visitors should note that if you want to eat in the excellent 360 revolving restuarant you have free admission to the tower. A must if you stay in Toronto.
How far you can see , i dont know exactly but it must be more than 30 km the weather permitiing when up on the skydeck.
but the "glass floor" is not as impressive as the "cube" at Willis tower (sears tower) in Chicago.

Now, I think it is worth a visit for someone who's never been BUT plan ahead otherwise it's a miserable time. The lines are VERY VERY LONG and that's just to buy tickets. If you're going to Toronto, you probably have to go to the CN tower, just because it's the big landmark, but really, it's pretty uninteresting. Visiting Toronto on a budget, we opted that the one sight to see would be the CN Tower. We visited the CN Tower on July 2, 2012. I went to the CN tower on my first day in Toronto and had a great time. The tour was a bit expensive, but the staff was extremely friendly. You can't beat the CN tower for a thrill the view is amazing and you most stay for lunch at the revolving restaurant, a must see for TO

I did the Edgewalk on the CN Tower and it was amazing. Very nerve wracking at first but you soon relax into it. So glad I did it! The tower itself is also amazing just to go up, incredible views.We ate at the 360 restaurant which was very nice, food was lovely and views stunning.

Ok, so I didn't do it myself, I took my parents who did the Edgewalk for their joint 65th birthdays! It was worth every penny! DVD is excellent to relive it over and over! The views inside and outside are amazing. Fun glass floor. Keep your valuables close by. Witnessed a professional pick pocket last time we were there and...

Overlooking the view of Toronto,Canada and looking at it at a high point. Looking downing down from the glass floor inside from below you. On the sky port viewing the city down below and the great lakes even viewing new york on a sunny day. With thrill and excitement you would want go again just see view again.

Having lived here allmy life I had to visit the CN tower at least once and I did a few years ago. Long waits, expensive and not a whole lot going on pretty much sums it up. Its tall and the view is good but not worth the price AT ALL!! If you want an "exhilerating" experience go to Canada's...

The CN tower is one of the 7 engineering wounders of the world and they are not wrong. It is an amazing experince just going up and down in the lift and the 360 restraunt which we booked on line before we left the uk is exelent both from and experience and dinning point of view. This is one of...
Took me four years of living in Toronto to find the excuse to go up. Views are incredible.

OK so I don't like heights! but this one is definitely worth a visit.Well organised with helpful and friendly staff. The views are incredible, definitely go to the skypod. Glass floor is intimidating but ...I DID IT!!! The edge walk is a little too scary but you adrenaline junkies give it a go!!
Very impressive and well organized structure. Great views of Toronto.The only drawback - no place to sit/rest.
It used to be one of my favourite visits but now it is not special somehow - misses some kind of educational piece.

A lovely appointed facility. Excellent views over the city and waterfront. Bit freaky on one section (a glass floor) which had sheer veritcal view from the floor down to the ground. Not for the faint-hearted and lovely to watch the antics of other people using imaginative camera poses to photograph. A suggestion however - watch pricing and look for vouchers...
Not worth going all the way to the top, same views as the regular level.

Had amazing views, and interesting facts on the walls. The glass floor was awesome, as well as the outdoor observation deck. You could see people a little ways below doing the "EdgeWalk" which was quite a sight!
Well worth it. You have to go up it now don't you. Pay the extra while your there and go up to sky pod I think its worth it.

It was very nice place you can enjoy the time with your family or friends on the Top of the CN tower.You have nice reveolving restaurent on the top of the CN tower.Now they started walking out side on CN tower .

As a resident of Toronto, I don't usually take in the local tourist attractions, however we recently went with visiting relatives and what a pleasant surprise! Went with out of country relatives with the kids. Kids loved the glass floor. We also loved watching other crazy people hang over the edge
Love the sense of pride I get when I stand at its base knowing it is symbolic of Canada and the City of Toronto.

Great trip up the CN Tower . You have to go!. Forget any jitters. To see the splendour of Toronto laying before you is amazing. if you go to Toronto don't leave it without visit the CN Tower.It will be one of the best thing I visited during my travels.Beautiful view, glass floor to watches down and you have to try the experience to stay on the top walking outside.
If you want a real eye opener go up the tower. You will get a full view of Toronto.
Worth the wait in line for the views of the lake and city. Nice displays at the top to provide for interesting diversion from dizzying heights. Glass floor is a big hit.
yes it is quite expensive but it is one of those must do things when visiting Toronto, the views are spectacular, it is worth paying the extra $10 to go up to the pod.

I had purchased a 'complete tour' ticket, but was disappointed by the movie which was about surfing. I was expecting a movie on how the tower was made. The city views are simply awesome and you can spend as much time u want. Well., and the edge walk is definitely not for the faint-hearted :)

Something you really have to do if you're in Toronto. It is a very tall building. The view is great. They do a nice job of getting you up, moving people through smoothly. The glass floor is great, my body really tried to rebel against walking out there. The City pass saved us from the line.
After queuing for 30 minutes it was well worth the trip to the top. Superb all round views of the city, breathtaking to say the least.

If you're in the city you must do this activity. I highly recommend going to the restaurant, as it's nearly the same price as just going to the observation deck. The rates are extremely reasonable and the staff are very upfront about what your ticket gets you, and how long the waits are. Yes it is pricey, yes it is tall but hey if you are here in Toronto do it. The glass floor and observation deck are worth it.
I enjoy the view especially the glass floor.They add aquarium for another tourist destination opening will be next summer.

Too pricey for just an elevator ride up to the top. I can think of a ton of other things i should have spent our money on besides this.

the view is awesome, it's like you can see the city for miles and miles it 'just that awesome

be prepared to spend a lot of money. And then more money once you are up there. But, if you are new to Toronto, or just visiting, it's kind of like going to Niagara Falls, you just have to do it...

It was superb view on what was a clear day, well managed attraction - we only went up to the obervatory. Would reccommend stopping for some food at the top. fantastic views of Toronto and beyond from the top of CN Tower, a definate must see if you visit Toronto, well worth the entrance fee
This is a must see in Toronto. Beautiful view. Try to catch a sunset on clear day. Great photo opportunities.

If visiting Toronto, a visit to the CN Tower is a must. You'll be in a landmark of Toronto and have greats views of the city and beyond. To make the experience even more enjoyable, I would also definitely recommend a visit to the restaurant at the tower.

The line up for the elevators was short with almost no wait. We purchased tickets for the total tower, experience. The skypod was well worth the extra price....

Great to say you've been there, The glass floor should have been brilliant and would have been so if the view below didn't contain a big construction site! The shop was expensive as expected but the staff when you found them were not at all helpful.

what a view from up top and standing on the glass floor is amazing,also did the simulated ride through the mine, amazing and so realistic especially the sheer drops we were in hysterics, the kids there were shouting for more.

Great view of Toronto and Lake Ontario.Must see as a tourist.

Great view of the city. Can go up for free if you have dinner. Dinner is good but expensive due to the fact you pay for the ride up

Awesome experience - from the super-fast elevators to the glass floor to the views. Can't believe how high up you really are! Had evening meal at the restaurant and watched the city lights coming on - best time to go up.

The view was incredible and the glass floor made our day!

Is a must in anyones agenda when visiting Toronto. As ever these experiences are a bit on the expensive side but you have to do it. Amazing views over the whole city, a must if you're visiting Toronto - just be sure to close your eyes in the lift!

I have been here more then once. Lot's of fun, but the glass floor scares me. I have yet to walk on that thing lol
the usual CN tower trip. Great views as you would expect. Picked a quieter day which was perfect with short waiting times for the elevator etc.
enjoyed this the glass floor was enjoyed by a lot of people, but not me could not do it.. The wait was not bad to get into it... everything smooth n seamless.... even got gifts in giftshop

This is obviously a must see when you are in Toronto. The glass floor is the best part and I definitely recommend the skypod.

Always a great place to visit! A little pricey - but oyu do it for the experience. Looking forward to taking the kids this summer!

A little pricey for an elevator ride & a view! View was wonderful...but if you don't know the area, doesn't mean so much. (I'd never been to Toronto before). We did not have to wait long...everyhting ran efficiently.
A must see for out-of-towners - not something I'd likely do again. Very expensive although the view (on a clear day) is quite nice.

A little pricey in my opinion but a pretty neat experience. Our youngest son loved it. On a busier day, the extra ride up to the Skypod can be quite a long wait though. The glass floor is pretty cool but expected it to be a bit of a larger area without doing any research on it.
The CN tower is a little expensive, but it is definitely worth seeing. The views are beautiful!

The CN Tower is one of those "must visit" attractions when you are in Toronto. It really gives you an amazing bird's eye view of the city and its surrounds. We used Citypass tickets which made it even greater value. Superb views
Went there on the opening and a few times when visiting Toronto since then. Great view, friendly, knowledgeable staff.

The view from the CN Tower is fantastic - especially from the "Skypod" upper level. The CN Tower is one of those "must visit" attractions when you are in Toronto. It really gives you an amazing bird's eye view of the city and its surrounds. New York has the Empire State Building, Paris has the Eiffel Tower, Toronto has the CN Tower. Liked everything. Had been previously but first visit for my husband. Had the set evening meal at a window table which was very nice.
It is a main attraction and you just have to go, the views are excellent and the glass floor is pretty good also. The restaurant is nice for a special meal but is expensive
Great view well worth the visit. We had dinner in there . it was a bit overpriced but food was good.
A 'must do' visit to Toronto! No long lines of people, just a great view over the city.

This is the highest space in Toronto where you can really see all Toronto, Toronto islands, and so on. If you come during early morning you have a chance to come up alone and you'll not find queue and noise.

Great view of the city and the lake from the Observation deck...check out the glass floor.Look for the deal, not sure if they still do but a few years back they had a deal in summer for 5 bucks. Agree with some of the other reviewers the standard cost of 40 bucks is a bit too much.

When I took my daughter to the cn tower we were very excited. It was crowded and to be honest a bit of a let down when we finally reached the top. I get the reason why people want to up but I think your money would be better spent having an evening meal in the restaurant.

Too many people but enjoyed the tour during our short time there. Would have liked to spend more time there with less crowd.
Iconic Toronto attraction, with amazing views.Avoid the 3D film and motion ride--they are expensive and looking pretty sad now (the ride hasn't changed since we last visited 4 years ago)

A trip up the CN tower is a must when visiting Toronto. It's a little tired, and pricey too, but nothing beats the rush of standing on the glass floor and facing so much air between your feet and the ground below!
Our visit to the CN tower was wonderful. Great site to visit! It's also a way to see all of Toronto's nebourhood all at the same time without too much time when your stay there is not long enough.
I took my four year old, and this was my first time as well. A bit over rated but a must to see for sure! Went on a Friday and it wasn't too busy in the afternoon which was a bonus.

Awesome views. Pretty expensive for what it is. But we like views so we were willing to pay it. Only spent about an hour there.
What a great view! A must see when you are in Toronto.
The best thing about the CN Tower is looking up at it - and using it for a point of reference if you`re lost.

Sure, I find looking out from high places a bit challenging. But this was worth it. And, add the additional ride to the Skypod, for a total viewing elevation of 1465 feet ASL. Good views, had a funny photo done of the kids jumping off the CN Tower, good souvenir. Walked on the glass floor, pretty daunting!
Watched the sunset from the observation deck. Simply incredible! Unique experience!

Can't beat the view over all of Toronto and the glass floor to look through. Visited twice over the past few years and wasn't disappointed either time.

The views are fantastic, but I did feel it was overpriced.

The view were amazing from the CN tower. Love the glass floor

I've done it twice now and it's funny how you get that weird feeling in your legs stepping on the glass bottom! Great views of Toronto and surroundings!
The view from the top is fantastic. Quality of the food is reasonably good. Every couple of years we go up there to see what's new and exciting.

Although the price may seem steep (pardon the pun) for an elevator ride, it is worth it! The adventure starts with the glass floor, ear popping elevator ride. You shoud get to the top and walk over the glass floor. You might need a beer before, and you can have the beer in the bar. We did not go to the observatory at the very top nor did have the climbig experience outside. It was cold and rainy. But I would recommend if your are brave.
Awesome views from this amazing tower. Fun to walk on the glass floor. Restaurant on the first floor was good value for money and had spectacular views.
Views are always stunning and puts this beautiful city in a new perspective
was told it would be half hour wait, after 90 minutes we bailed as we had a show to catch and spend another 60 minutes in line the next day.

I would have been ok to wait 1 hour. After all it is a high tower and a landmark. Waiting 2 hours however is not worth it. At least if there was seating along the way, I am certain it is very feasable.Will not return and I have learned my lessons for future tall atrtactions!
It was worth the trip up there....awesome view of Toronto :)Must get on the GLASS FLOOR!!! :)

The CN Tower was amazing. We did the skypod and that had the most amazing view (and I hate heights). The glass floor was a bit of a disappointment on the mian level, I expected more, but other visitors thought it was quite neat). Well worth doing.

The CN Tower is one of our biggest assets here in Toronto...so you have to see it! There is an admission fee but once you get to the top you get a fantastic view of the city. And if you're brave enough, you can step onto the frightening glass floor...

we went right when they opened to beat the crowd, and we were 2 of only a few people in the sky pod. sky pod is a must, a few more dollars but you go up 33 more floors. great to just look at all the high rises, and lake as well as planes taking off from airport.

The CN tower was the 2nd highest in the world until the day before we toured it. Now it is the 3rd highest. Wonderful views from the Skypod and observation deck. The glass floor was interesting but I just couldn't bring myself to walk out on it. There is a nice "cafe" in the basement where we got a reasonably...
This really is a must do when in Toronto. The view is excellent. However, slightly over priced and almost 2 hour wait the day we went.
In short, you can expect a great view, but expected to pay for it every step along the way.
I liked the idea of it, and enjoyed the view, but this was way overpriced

It was nice to see Toronto from this perspective, especially at night. It's much like many of the world's other tall structures (Eiffel Tower, Space Needle, Empire State Building) but a unique experience nonetheless.

It was great to go up so high and have a beautiful view of Toronto and lake Ontario. Lines to go up/down are slow (about 45 min). I liked the sky pod the most (higher point) . You can take better pics from there. Glass floor is just ok. I would avoid himalamazon. It is really lame. The 3D movie...

Our wait wasn't as bad as we expected - only about 30 minutes. The tower is defintely a must see, for it provides amazing views of the city. I would probably enjoy sitting down to eat at the restaurant if we had more time. At their motion theater they were showing a movie simulating a boat ride through Amazon river...

Plan most of a day to enjoy everything. We ran out of time and didn't see the movie. Spent a long time in line when we had paid for a quick pass no one told us what line to get into for a shorter wait. Seems like the crowds could be better managed but the view is great.

Yes there are queues to go up (and even to come back down) and ticket prices are steep but this is still a must see attraction when the weather is good. The day I was there I could see all the way across Lake Ontario to New York State - wow!

On the two occasions I've been the tower (once during winter and again in autumn, during the evening), I've been lucky enough that I had virtually no wait time between buying the ticket and getting up to the viewing area.The thing is, once you get through the novelty of the (small) glass floor, there's really not much interesting about...

This is a fun place to visit. The price is worth it once you get up to the top. Spend the little extra money to go to the highest point location. it is that much better of a view than the lower platform. Amazing how your mind is scared when you can walk on the glass floor and look straight...
We were told it was 1 hour. Would not of done it if we had known it was 3. Great views but that is about it. Too pricey and painful!

Definitely a MUST SEE. There are restaurants on top, and one of them moves around in circle so you can see the city in a 360 degree while you eat. But you can do that on your own just by walking around the tower upstairs, even without visiting the restaurant -- Also, there's a level where the floors are made...
Expensive. The food is not great but the views are worth the price.
Since their is not much in toronto to do for tourists, the CN tower is a nice change

This is the epitome of Toronto tourism and it shouldn't be missed. I haven't gone higher than the glass floor on any of my escapades up there, but that glass floor is fun. It's especially fun watching the people who are terrified to walk on it (sorry if you're one of them!). Everything looks so tiny from up there! You...

If you love being high above the crowd with vistas in all directions, make the effort to walk or ride up this lakeside landmark. The Sydney counterpart is poor in comparison, and only the NYC counterpart Empire State Building ("Sleepless in Seattle") has greater appeal since the fall of the Trade Centre. Seattle's Space Needle may strike a familiar chord,...
What else can I say - highest observation floor in the world.
Loved it! the walk on the transparent deck was amazing. Pick a day when it is beautiful and sunny

My favorite parts of the CN tower were the glass floor and the outdoor walk around observation deck. I was there on a Thursday night, so the restaurant was closed, which would have been cool to visit... They could have cleaned the windows on the indoor observation deck more, there were face & finger prints all over them.

i'm not sure if yesterday was an exception but the lines at this attraction were worse than Disney... endless disorganised queues to get anywhere, even just to get out of the building we had to wait in line for 30 minutes with people pushing and shoving. By the time we made it through the first queue (at least half an...

Nothing special, was actually more disapointed. Over priced for what you get, friendly staff though. I would prefer to go at night time to see the lights, instead during the day you see all the construction. looking down the cn tower you see cement and construction.... great view ( sarcasim )
Another tall tower in another city. This is exactly what I expected. Slightly overpriced. Very little waiting which was great. It does give you a good perspective of the city though

A must do in Toronto. Spectacular views on a clear day. Your higher than the plans landing and taking off at the airport in the harbour. The see thru floor is not for the faint of heart. Spendy, but worth it.

Had a really good time and would have included lunch had we known that the Tower visit was included in the price. There is a fab experience you can add the Edge Walk not for the faint hearted and also costs $200 (you have to book) Would like to say I did it but that would be a lie!!

It may now only be the 3rd tallest free-standing tower in the world, but it is still well worth a visit. Make sure you get a clear day as the view is amazing. Don't do the sky walk or the walk over the glass if you get vertigo! It is not for the faint hearted. Well worth a trip up...

On a clear day you can see Niagara Falls from the obsvation deck. Even when this isn't possible the views are amazing. Despite the contract between the rather shabby stairwells and the rest of the complex, this is a well-designed attraction with enough to keep you occupied for several hours. The security booths appealed to my inner Trekkie!

I guess I got what it was: a view from the city from above. If it was, say $7 and not hyper-hyped as it is, I would definitely recommend it. But at $35, when they shove down your throat a (bad) 10 minute movie that has nothing to do with the tower, I'd recommend anyone to go have a drink...

When you visit "high" places, like skyscrapers, the joy of experience has a direct relationship with the organization, the conservation, and the entertainment options. The ground glass is so crazy! Have your cool moment in the panoramic restaurant. In the end, buy a few trinkets in the shop, because no one can resist, am I right?
Its truly a wonder of the world, it is nice but scary at the same time esp the glass floor... nice view of all you can see in canada...luv it a lot...
Great views and interesting information about the construction. Nice choice of restaurants on top. The glass floor area is fun to watch and see people's reaction.
It was nice to go to the top of the tower and see toronto from up there again

The CN Tower is one of the defining symbols of toronto. For that reason you have to go.Saying that it is expensive for what you get. On a nice day it is a great view. When the clouds are in you get very little. It can be crowded and long lineupsIt is one of those places you have...
It is the icon of Toronto. Every tourist needs to visit the CN Tower. Period.
The view from the glass floor is excellent , a good view when you go up & down on the lifts.

My husband and 14year old son did the Edge Walk and they loved it. Definitely reserve your spot at least one day ahead! My 12 year old and I had a great time in the Sky pod, glass floor, and the observation deck. It's really fun to watch the Jays! We bought our photo, they did a great job. The...

We were very underwhelmed by the CN Tower experience. Yes you get a view over the city, but it's not exactly the most picturesque city in the world. If you've never been up a tower before you might enjoy it, but having done similar things in Malaysia we found this pretty boring. Luckily we were there in off-season. If we'd...

It was excellent,but great fear as i go up the Elevator reach 131st floor,i love it,inside u have a glass floor,which i have being pull on to take a picturee,i was so scare looking down from the 131st floor to the bottom,omg but i enjoyed,have to go back to the cn tower again,you would like it too if you go...
For the amount of time you'll spend in line - and the cost of admission - you'd be much better off to jump in your car, drive to Niagara Falls and ride the Maid of the Mist.

It was a long wait (around an hour), but it was well worth wait once we got through. We took a lot of pictures and had a lot of fun. It was hard for us to take pictures on the glass floor level, though. The view below would be too bright and it'd just be white-washed. Perhaps if you go...

Be prepared to stand in line up to 40 minutes or more. If you have small children, make sure u bring a coloring book or a deck of cards or some activity to keep them busy. The view is well worth the wait!

My husband and I found this to be a fantastic view of the city and the surrounding area. Lots of fun to try to pick out different buildings around the city. Also lots of info on the building of the tower etc.

The CN tower is the tallest building in the Western hemisphere, and it is worth the trip to the upper pod if you are in Toronto and have the time and cash to spare. Every part of the tour was fun because the building is so tall. The price tag was steep at $30 per person without the video presentation....
Not very spectacular, just like other tower around the world, nothing special expect the fact this one was made by concrete.
Loved the view, and the revolving restaurant. Great family adventure. Don't have the nerve to do the skywalk :)
The view is great. The glass floor is exciting. Our guests loved it.

I loved our visit which was on a clear and sunny day so the views were amazing. We wanted to do the Edge Walk but we booked the day before and there was only slot available so my sister took that and despite being terrified, she loved the experience.Next time it's my turn!!!
Wonderful views and our lunch was great too. Service was great, our waiter was always quick to replenish our drinks, food was served promptly.
Really loved our visit here, you really cannot skip this one if you are in town !
Anyone visiting Toronto must experience the CN tower. The views are extraordinary of Toronto and Lake Ontario. Kids and Adults love it.
You should really visit this. Great views of the city and the moving restaurant is certainly different.
Its a very nice experience, also you can't go to Toronto and don't visit the CN Tower. A bit pricey but worth it

I did the Edge Walk, which costs a little under $200 and lets you walk around the outside of the tower. You also get access to the skypod and observation tower, and to the movie and ride. The walk was interesting, and our guide was entertaining. You wear a harness that goes around both your arms and legs, and they'll...
Had to wait in line an inordinately long time with a large group of 14 year olds -- not much fun. And yes, it is a very tall building. Expensive.

Its worth the trip up once in your life if you've never done a tower. Otherwise its about the same experience as any other high building! Restaurant was average and overpriced but as I recall fairly friendly.

really getting expensive to go up, although the view, on a nice day, goes for at least 100 miles around...glass elevator. newest thing is , for an extra cost, the chance to be put into a harness, and go OUTSIDE on the upper deck, and hang off the edge! Talk about a thrill(we didn't do it; way too much money)

A must see tourist attraction. It was the second time I visited and it was just as enthralling for spectacular views and the glass walk thrills. The CN Tower is also very well situated for the Rogers Centre(home of the Blue Jays and Argonauts) and the local brewery and harbour trips . You could spend a couple of days thereabouts....

This was exactly what we thought it would be. A birds eye view of Toronto! The glass floor area was small, so people were crowded around that, but if you wait a few min, the people clear out and you are able to get on and take your pictures. :) A nice trip!

It's unfortunate that not all Torontonians take advantage of a visit to this iconic landmark... Paris has the Eiffel Tower, NYC has Lady Loberty and Toronto has the CN Tower!Worth the $25 or so dollars (hotels or the internet usually have 2-1 coupons) to get up the high speed elevators to the viewing deck and the view on a...
view the ride to the top The walk around and viewing Toronto from that height

I've been to the tower many times. I've climbed the stairs on two occasions, been to the 360 restaurant, the glass floor. It still is awesome to me. I would recommend this location to anyone visiting the city.
Don't miss this ever. It's a great place to go and you can book the tickets on-line. Don't forget to have your photograph clicked once inside.
Stunning views across the city and surprisingly quick to go up when we went (unlike the Empire States Building in NY!). If you go I recommend going all the way to the top for a full view.
Had a lovely birthday dinner up in the tower right before sunset. Unfortunately it was a little bit too cloudy to see the sunset, but the night view was amazing when the whole city lit up!!
Once the tallest man made structure in the world. Great views. Bad food unless eating at the it own restaurant which can be pricey

what an amazing view!!!!! You can see all of Toronto (including the Island). ALSO... It has been said that on a nice sunny day... YOU CAN SEE NIAGRA FALLS!!! I havent been on a sunny day, honestly i t was raining but nevertheles it was an amazing experience.

my mum and I went up the CN tower and we didnt know what to expect. This was amazing though! It gives you a unique view of the city, and a great view of lake ontario! The glass floor was a little freaky but once you're on the glass and looking down you'll be glad you did it! CN tower...
Used to be a neat spot ......Why do you let people in with flip flops and hats on backwards?Go to canu10 times better
Sort of pricey, so I suggest making reservations at the restaurant, to waive the entrance fee. Excellent views.
The view and the marvel of engineering embodied by the tower. Definitely worth a visit, but be prepared to pay a fairly stiff fee for the privilege.
It sure is awfully high up there at the top. Pay the little extra to go to the SkyPod. Worth the $.

The ride in the open view in the open view elevator is prettty amazing and when you walk around at the top and see the view, wow!!! Haven't done the walk 'outside' the tower on the ledge with a harness but it may be on my Bucket List for the future! Restaurant was great too!

The thing to do in Toronto so don't miss it but don't bother with the tickets for the shows - they are rubbish and totally unconnected with the place you are in. They used to show a great film about how it was built but have swapped that out for this new junk. Complete waste of money
Such an incredible view! Looks scary though. There's a place where you can walk on glass..

When we arrived at around 8 pm- we had not expected to wait 45 minutes - but we decided to stay anyway. this is a great & unique attraction, i went there because it was 1 of the worlds tallest buildings but the thing that blew me away was the glass floor, as an adult i was scared to walk on it at 1st but when the safety thoughts went out my head i was lying on it taking pictures & kids...

We had an okay time at the CN tower. The view from the CN tower was amazing - no question about that. I've done those action drives before, but the Himalaya/Amazone one just made...
Well, the view is really something. Best value is to eat at the restaurant, however. You avoid the line-ups (which can be lengthy)!

If you eat at their restaurant it's free to go alllll the way to the top. The restaurant is pretty good so it's a great deal all around. The view is unbelievable and make sure to walk on the glass floor, kinda scary.
ever tallest object and the landmark of Toronto,Ontario,Canada
CN Tower a little pricey to get up there, but the views are amazing, and it is definently worth your while to see it!!
We had terrible experience of the service from the 360 retaurant! Standard tower, nothing so amazing!

You have to go to the CN Tower when you visit Toronto - it's a given. In my opinion, you do NOT have to buy the most expensive ticket. The view from the observation deck is plenty - go for this less pricy option; I still think $24 is steep. Buy tickets online ahead of time if possible and avoid...
I am a local and make this trip 2 times a year with my kids and wife. Greta staff and i am planning to do the edge walk next visit(august)

If you are queasy about heights - do not go near the clear part of the floor! It made me nauseous to see the kids laying and jumping on this thick see-through part. You can see allllllll the way down! The wait can be really long, but it's a fun thing to do!
Well worth going to as the views are truly spectacular. But expensive at ±$23/person.
great experience. do spend extra if you have to to go to the top pod. glass floor is very daring and super scary.....
Had a great time. It's pretty disabled friendly. I went after 20 years and was just as good as I remember it.

Great 360 degree view. It was nice that you can get the package you want depending on your interest. The glass floor was fun but it's in an inner area which limited your view like you were looking down a tunnel (still gave you the wobbly leg feeling though).
Happy to say i went up the CN Tower and stood on the glass floor.

What i liked most is taking pictures from cn tower with my 21X zoom camera got unbelievable pics great experience..and our four year old daughter liked walking on glass floor and had a lot of fun together.

First time my husband and I have gone up the tower, after many trips to Toronto! Beautiful clear day and the views were terrific. The CN Tower in downtown Toronto, Canada is a MUST see. From the initial elevator ride to the top on the outside of the building, in itself is an attraction. The first level where there is a restaurant is spectacular. The glass floor is something you will not soon forget. One section of the Deck is a glass floor, what...

I thought the price was a little high for this attraction but the views from the tower are great and you definetely have to go to the top. Make sure you walk out on to the glass floor... you mind says it is safe but your feet are not so sure!!

Was worth the cost. Better than the skylon tower in Niagara Falls. Glass front elevator was cool and also had glass panels on floor you could look through as you went up/down!!Views were good from the observation deck, but its worth the extra cost to go up to the sky deck which has AMAZING views!! If you have never been up really, really high in a big city, here's your chance. It's not cheap, but it is a good experience.
