The CN tower is a great place to see Toronto from way up. But don't expect to go through it without spending alot of money. It was very expensive trip up the elevator just to stand on some plexiglass. This is one of those attractions that once is enough
Great views of Toronto, bit expensive and not the biggest tower since 2007!

Not sure why this thing was built,it is a lot of expensive realestae for the restaurant to pay for,and getting frozen fish fillets up top,is not making things better.Do not bother-it is too silly.Go to an art gallery or Museam instead,or rest the day,watch tv in your hotel room and order food in-it will be better than the food up...
Go and see the sunset at this place. It's worth it!!!

The CN Tower is a little on the old side now. There needs to be some upgrading. The best way to take advantage of going up for the view is to book into the restaurant at the top. That way you use the high entrance fee towards a meal...better value for your money.

The CN tower was a hit with the glass area. On the day we were there, a group of demonstrators was around the ground area. IT was so interesting looking down and seeing them. It was a clear day and we could see all of Toronto. It was very special.
Best view of the city. Great restaurant. A worthwhile place to visit.
Just stand under it and marvel at the winds that have blown on it for how many years. Maybe it is time to extend the observation tower straight up to the Heavens!!!!
Buy a CityPass! You can for miles, and can also see over the toronto islands. I didn't walk on the glass floor as I was too scared!!

We visited the CN Tower in the evening. The views from the Tower are amazing! At night you can see all of the city so bright & alive. The fee is approximately $30 per adult for the observation & sky pod area. The elevator to the observation area has a partial glass see-thru floor & glass wall & takes less...
had some amazing views over Toronto at night. Its not hard to spot the tower from anywhere in the city at night once its lit up
The view was great but the wait was so long to get to see the view!

The trip up to the very top of the CN tower is worth it to say you've been there and the view is amazing.The open deck is truly amazing and worth venturing out for the fainthearted, as for the glass floor, will you be able to do it???
When I travel with the family, we always spend time at the top of the CN Tower and enjoy a great burger in the Horizons restaurant

Go early in the morning - lines can get long later in the day, especially weekends. It's worth seeing even though you've "climbed" other high buildings before. The observation deck and the glass floors are interesting and the views are nice because of the lake. The only negative part is the fact that you can wait a long time in...
Get the whole package deal to experience everything the CN Tower has to offer, what a great experience.
Overpriced food, very poor quality. Very poor customer service, total tourist trap. No effort made to make your experience memorable

A great place to visit at dusk. I enjoyed walking on the glass floor taking pictures. Avoid the motion ride and the 3-D film. Cheesy. The restaurant was overpriced--yet the view from the top of the Tower was stunning. A must-see.

Ok, I have kids now and I had gone to CN tower once before. Let’s face it, this place is tourist money vacuum.We went on a Friday mid day so it really wasn't very busy. The place was UNDERSTAFFED. We had to wait with others a long time to get back down because they had about 6-8 elevators with...

First off, the views are amazing. You can see all the way into New York, which is pretty impressive given the size of Lake Ontario. That said, if the weather is smoggy, hazy or cloudy, I don't recommend going. There's so much to see if the weather is clear, that anything less just wouldn't compare, and the cost is rather...

I love TO but let's face it, it's not that interesting from above, like the view of NYC from the Empire State.. what is special about TO is the neighbourhoods. I love seeing the CN Tower from the street, I guess it's our Eiffel Tower ;) Having gone up once I don't see going up again.

I think the only 'low' point of this visit was the queue to get tickets. I think it could have far better organized with perhaps big free standing signage giving details of options and packages for the tower. But not for a family. Can get really pricey. The panel area is scarry as anything!

First visit, loved it, very impressive, plan to go back one day and see the new features.
The view was astounding.The only thing I didn't like was line up for the elevators and the crowding of said elevators.
The view of Toronto and downtown from top was Exhilarating...the glass view was amazing...Must see place of Toronto!
We had a nice time and evening sunset was brilliant. The ride for the kids were excellent.
My kids loved playing on the glass floor. Hundreds of feet straight down!

If you are visiting Toronto or a resident this is a must visit. But make sure it is a clear day. Whether you choose to go during the day or night the views are amazing and ones that you will never forget.

we used our airmiles to get the whole tower experience. well worth it. The skypod was the best part. Spend the extra to go there, you can see down better as the glass it angled different than the glass floor area. The Glass floor was fun, make sure you jump up and down on it to freak out the other...
went with company, best to see at late afternoon when sun going down
Definitely a must do, both at day and by night. Must stand on the glass floor.
Much better than I expected. There was plenty to keep you amused. The sky pod and glass floor were definitely highlights of the trip.

If you're visiting Toronto, you can't really avoid going up the CN Tower. The view from the top is amazing and I don't personally feel you need to pay the extra and go to the very top for a good view. The standard price ticket gives you a more than good enough view and if you can, try and plan...
Well worth a visit but wouldn't bother with film/himalamazon attraction. Has no relevance to visiting the CN Tower. Views are fantastic from the tower.

30 years since I visited as a schoolboy on a rugby tour.The tower still as imposing a feature although jockeying for its position a little more than it used to...the other skyscrapers!Slick and polite ...remember to go on a clear day...get there early as it begins to get busy around 12 onwards - school and organised trips arrive....

The CN Tower has enough entertainment included to easily cover a morning visit. Arrive by 10 AM to beat the crowds and get great views of the city and lake. An extra $6 on basic admission gets access to a 3D film, the (a bit terrifying skypod) and a 4D ride all very worthwhile.

I loved the CN Tower - what an experience. A total adrenaline rush. From the moment you step into the lift you know you are in for an amazing experience. The glass floor was the highlight for me. It takes a while to get your head around the idea but after time I managed to walk on the glass -...

This is the iconic Toronto destination, and is well worth a visit. On a clear day you can see the whole city and well beyond, and even across Lake Ontario. The glass floor is fun to look through and the people deciding whether to stand on it are fun to watch too! Be prepared for long lines to purchase tickets...
What a view and a great experience....I can't say any more that would do justice! Date of visit - several times (last was March 2011)
The ride up was great. Looking out over the city was great.

Must see if never there before. Great for kids of all ages. Our 8 year old would have stayed on the glass floor at the top of the CN tower all day if we let her. Revolving restaurant is great. View at night fab! Will return.
just the high point but there is nothing to see from top. borning view . find near by high biludings for free.
Worth visiting every few years. Will go again this summer.
Great view of Toronto and surrounding areas. A must see when you are in Toronto. Combining it with Toronto Island will make it a great day.
great views, great memories.you got your photo taken at the beginning and it was made to look like you where outside. was quite expensive but worth it for the memories
Great tourist spot with great views of the city!...little pricey but worth doing at least once in your life
Seattle Needle, Sears Tower, Empire state building... it's just another tall building. If you've been up others, skip it, if you haven't, the novelty will still be with you so go for it!

Amazing views and the glass floor is great fun. We didn't bother with the Sky Pod (or the other extras), but I didn't feel as though we had missed out. It was a lovely clear sunny day when we went up, which I guess helps.

It was the highlight of our trip to Toronto. Pay the extra $10 to go up to the skypod. Amazing views of Toronto. If you dare walk on the glass floor. I couldnt do it but my husband and my 5 year old son had no fear and loved walking on the glass floor. Avoid weekends and go early. Its...

When you think in a landmark of this city, there is no doubt that this is the main one. It’s true, is not cheap to visit the look out and glass floor (CAD 28.60, tax included), but the bird eye views are really impresive, particularly the 360° opened panorama, downtown area and Toronto Island and its airport. When my husband suggested that we should visit the CN Tower, I have to admit that I wasn't exactly excited, but agreed anyway. I mean, I've had my share of being in tall buildings . . . the view is great, but maybe not worth the $$, but the glass floor is kinda cool. Surprised this place is not very busy.
Great view, very cheap entrance and nice restaurant
At least you have been to the highest point in Toronto. If you have been to many parts of the world, you won't have that WOW effect

We splurged and went all the way to the Pod. What a view. It was such a beautiful clear day that we could see the mist from Niagara Falls. Glass floor was a real thrill for my daughter. What great photos and memories we have from this visit.
Took my son for his 13th Birthday. We had a great time. Plenty to see and do, price is a little high but manageable.
great view, good food, just do not try to walk up the stairs to the top.

The view on a clear day is breath taking even as you get higher in the elevator, I see center island, Ontario place,Casa Loma, Beaches Area from the north to the south, west to east of the city as far as your eye can see. The sunset you should not miss. Have a camera for sure
The panoramic view of the city and Lake Ontario. An elevator ride you will not forget!
The ride up is fun... but it is just sight-seeing... for a very hefty price

We were fortunate that the weather was exceptionally good, the views of Toronto were excellent. Born and raised in Toronto, but have been to the Tower a few times when family visits from out of the country.It really is a neat experience to see the city from that vantage point, but it is terribly overpriced and is actually very limited on things to do once you get up there.I haven't been there since...

Must visit attraction if in Toronto. It is quite expensive but provides great views of the city on a sunny day. Stepping onto the glass floor that high up was an experience, but as hard to get a clear spot with so many people up there? We took the extra lift to the higher level which was worth doing, even...

Paid for the pod & definitely worth it to feel the tower swaying in the wind. We went on a cloudy, rainy day but could see for miles. The elevator ride is amazing & the area with the glass floor is frightening, however - amazing views & definitely worth it. We paid for the experience but found out afterwards that...

If you have a chance to go to the top, it is very cool. You can look straight down through a glass floor. With an appointment you can also walk outside on top of the tower. Not for the faint of heart. A little pricey but worth it.

Finally...I had time in Toronto to do the CN Tower. You have basically two choices...first deck (where the glass floor is) and then all the way up for ten bucks more. Spend the additional ten. You won't regret it.Oh...the glas floor. If it can hold me, you'll be ok. Live a little, step outside of your comfort zone and...
fantastic views on a clear day. saw clear across the city and the lake. superb

CN Tower is a tourist trap, but it is a must if you are visiting Toronto.It is very expensive to go up, but standing on the glass floor is quite the harrowing experience.I have yet to try the new Edge Walk. I would like to do it, but it is very expensive as well. I can't reconcile spending...

The food was great, not the best I have had. Staff excellent. Be prepared for long meal as the view of Toronto spectacular, day or night. Can see places you may not knew existed or looked so good. Plenty to do here for whole family. Should not be missed!
It is like any other tower that you have visited in your life, but is a must go to see the city from the top
I highly recomend going when in town. I would save the elevator cost and go to the resturaunt with reservations.

An extreme must do, we had the city pass ticket but went again the second week so we could do the skypod.Very high but the views are great (provided there is no fog). My husband was quite scared as he doesn't like heights but I don't think he's too bad with them now!The lift is quick with glass...

This was an amazing visit and the high point of our trip, no pun intended. The outside of the tower is spectacular, right across from the home of the Blue Jays.It is a bit pricey, as any attraction will be, but I can imagine the upkeep costs are great.There are plenty of things to read as you progress...

I guess I was expecting more. This was my first trip to the CN Tower and I didn't think it was great really. I mean once you get to the top and walk around it's over. I think it would be more enjoyable at night. It was hard to get a chance to see/walk on the glass floor because there...
Outstanding view on a clear day...the glass floor is not for those with a fear of heights
Holey-moley! Gotta check out the glass floor, and look down, between your feet! Make sure the weather is clear...
This attraction is unforgettable and something that is a must do in Toronto!

This is on the list of top tourist attractions in Toronto, for sure! The tower is great, awesome views from the top, the glass floor is a big hit too! The 360 revolving restaurant is very overpriced though. I bought an orange juice there and it cost $5 bucks or something ridiculous! I'd recommend eating elsewhere. There are a variety...
The CN Tower itself is a must see! The food not so. Lovely staff and good service but the food was really quite average, wouldn't rush back!

Spending time in Toronto? Then check out the CN Tower. Loads of fun for the kids with an amazing elevator ride up and a fantastic view of the city! Why not walk down all those stairs for a change??? Its good exercise!
amazing experience that give you sensation go for............

The CN tower is unique and deserves a visit once. The glass floor is cool and the views are spectacular. They have a photo lab where you can get funny photshopped pictures, which was a nice bonus. But there is no where to sit and relax unless you eat in the expensive restaurant, and the tour groups were loud and...
If the weather is good you can see the USA across the lake. Take the elevator to highest observation point, it's worth. Not too many tourists up there, better view.
Loved it ! What more can I say ! Great views frm the top, the glass floor aint for the faint hearted !

The veiw from the tower is fantastic. Ate at the restaurant (I think it was called 360). Was not impressed with the food and especially the prices. The lines to the elevators were pretty long, but overall a good experience
Very costly, but everyone should do it at least once in their life.

The views are incredible at night, but $30 a person to go up in the tower and the sky pod are a little high. Overall was worth it one time but would not do it again. Great pictures at night of the city.
Been to the CN tower many times, but on this visit, went at around 8.30pm, so saw the toronto skyline, "light up". Wonderful sight and great experience
We were told that as it was raining visabilty was minimal. We only had that day to see it. We went up and we could see a good distance. worth the time and money

We had a nice visit. We saw a 3D movie about surfing in Tahiti, it was cool. The ticket sales staff were helpful and explained the packages well. The staff we encountered were pleasant and informative. I wish I had realized the photo taken at the beginning was going to be used for the souvenir photos, I thought it was...

As a dual Citizen (US & Canada), I'm often visited by my US Friends, and it's worth our while to head to the CN tower.It's a real treat to go in the colder months, and even better to visit during the week. We were the only ones in the elevator on the way up !!Bring your camera. Don't...
Well worth the money you can see all the way round Toronto

You can see Niagara Falls on a clear day, choose your days carefully! I especially loved the "glass" floor at the top, which is quite cool or scary, depending on your fear factor. We went during the week so it was not that busy. The presentation and the guide provided some great trivia information too. Both children and adults would...

Four of us visited the CN Tower just before dusk, and travelled up to the revolving restaurant. We watched the sun set over drinks and entrees, watched the city become dark over mains, and ate a scrumptious dessert as the lights came on throughout the city. The only disappointment was that, as it was still winter, I could not do...

Great views of lake Ontario and Toronto area. Glass floor is very cool; you can see all the way down the side of the tower....found it hard to get the nerve to walk over it....even with the kids jumping up and down on it! Elevator has glass sides so you get a great view on the way up and down.
Must place to see/experience. On a clear day you can see U.S. A.

From someone terrified of heights.....I was persuaded to go up and I am so glad I did. The views all round are stunning. I couldn't bring myself to stand on the glass looking down but when I got into the lift I realised that it had a glass floor so I had no choice...and yes ...I did look down!This...

I had dinner at the CN Tower last year and was pleasantly surprised at the food quality and portions. I have eaten at these types of restaurants in the past and have usually been disappointed. Service was great and so was the food. Bring your wallet; it's not cheap.

My first time was also my first date with my now boyfriend so I'm a touch bias. We did the whole experience, ride, movies and all. The views are amazing and you can spend as much time as you like. I loved the 3D movie but could do without the ride (great for kids though). Lots to do for the...
Quite expensive for basically an elevator ride and good view of the lakeshore area of Toronto.
Best way to see the entire city. Go at sunset, you will get the daytime, sunset, and evening views.

Pricey,and try to avoid the crowd/line-up/waiting-BUT You can see the City from an aerial view. You will then see the CN Tower from wherever else you visit in the city, at night, in the distance,through the fog... If you want to really know this enigmatic city, this will give you a lot of material. Note the land/lake-tree-neighbourhood-sprawl-scale of it all.
The tower gives you a great view of the surrounding area. There was no line and we went straight up.I love to see a city from above as it gives me a much better orientation when I am on the ground.

Any visit to Toronto must include a trip to the CN Tower. We were fortunate to visit on a beautiful sunny day in March. What an engineering marvel! It was a little pricey, but we bought tickets that allowed us to go up the tower, as well as see the surfing movie and the simulation ride. I'm not sure what...
not as busy as expected for march break , but longish waits to head up to skypod level due to smaller elevator. ...worth the view.
great view on a clear day-well positioned on the lake-fun elevators to get you there whoosh

Once the worlds tallest free standing structure, towers in Dubai, Taiwan, etc. have left it in the dust. It is what people associate with the city most often and has been a fisxture on the skyline since the mid 70's. Worth a trip up on a clear day and you can jump on the glass floor for extra kicks.
Great attraction. Glass floors high above for you to see all of Toronto, and the surrounding lakes.
It all depends on the menu. Parking isn't always the most convenient. Lovely view regardless, unless there are low clouds.
On a clear day, you can pretty much see every corners of Toronto.
Not my favorite place because I dont like hights, but its a great place to visit and great photo ops.
You cannot visit Toronto without going up the tower. It is great and the glass floor at the top really plays with yopur mind.

Our hotel was very close to the CN Tower, and we usually go up towers when there is one wherever we are. It was a reasonably clear day and we went up, there is a glass floor you can stand on, it's not expensive and something fun to do.
Elevator to top!! What a view of city. Toronto Harbor front. Gift shop, restaurant.

I think, as many of these types of attractions often are, it is expensive for what is offered. Yes it is tall, yes there is a glass bottom, and yes it is neat to see the city up high. Once I had done it once, I didn't need to do it again.
Whenever our family visits from across the pond, this is a must do, and it is always an incredible experience!

Couldn't believe the attitudes and lack ambition some of the workers had. It felt like I was burdening their day by being there. A national sightseeing attraction that can show the world how amazing we are and instead get a really bad reception. If your planning on doing some Toronto sightseeing, put this attraction on your "will do it if...
Make sure you go up on a clear day! The view is breath taking

We got to the CN Tower first thing in the morning and had absolutely no lineups. The photo quality was...
if you do this highly recommend edgewalktakes it from good to great
Expensive for a 15 minute view, OK maybe 30 minutes, but not anything else. Overpriced restaurant with mediocre food.

We had a good time at the CN tower doing a touristy thing while being at home. The price to go up is a little steep, but other than that it is a worthwhile activity if you are visiting the Toronto area, or if you live here.
The CN Tower Experience itself is a lot of fun, but the prices are prohibitive and once up there the food choices are less than stellar.
Until the Birge Dubai, this was the highest free-standing structure in the world. Great view of a great city and the sixth largest lake in the world.
The rapid rise with the elevator, the simulator, the 3D movie ...A very good experience.

Make sure you go on a clear day or clear night to get your dollar's worth. And pay the extra bucks to go to the very top. Part of the fun is identifying places you know, so do it toward the end of your trip, I guess? If you live here, you've already been up.

I have been to lots of tall buildings around the world. Some have more interesting scenery, others were newer. The CN Tower was all right. I prefer the one in Auckland, but this isn't Auckland ! The entrance is expensive but there is the option of buying a City Pass. We didn't pay the fee as we ate in the...
Fantastic views from the top. Paid extra to go to Skypod - well worth it!
kids seem to really enjoy the scary glass elevator ride.
The most incredible views - including an outside walk around for the very brave!

It was my second visit,but I enjoy it even more.Spectacular view over Toronto and lake Ontario.I found most exciting stepping on the glass floor:)Try to go week days and mornings,to avoid loooong lines.

If we hadn't received complimentary tickets, I probably wouldn't have gone. The history and the elevator rides are wonderful, the view is what you would get from any high place - a big city and a big lake.

The thought of being that high up still makes me dizzy, you gotta try the little ride and the spinning restaurant. It was all good ( this coming from a person with a serious fear heights) it took years of mustering up courage to actually visit. But it was fun

HAve visited here before when I was younger and it was a lot more breath taking then....now it just seems like a more typical tourist attraction, and the price is a bit much to just go up and see the view.
It is a nice view from up top. Unique building. You can walk outside on a cable. $300 but would be an experience for those who are brave!

Great view. Worth a visit. Impressive building, though must admit that coming from NYC, we were spoiled by the Empire State Building and World Trade Center. Glad we visited. It was fun for our 13 year old to look down through the glass floor, so many stories above the ground.
Your on Top of the World and can see for miles on a clear Day

Amazing expreience! 4D Movies, Rides, Glass Floors, Able to walk around the entire building within a caged-in enviroment, Resturants, Newest attraction Walking along the top edge of the CN Tower with only a harness no cage, Attractions in the making a full scaled Aquarium in the basement roots of the tower! Over all out-standing expreience. Very proud to be a...

Edgewalk is the ultimate challenge - but if you cannot handle outside - the 360 restaurant is amazing (go for the prime rib) and best deal: use your air miles to create res for 3 course meal! yummm...

I went up to CN tower, visited the skypod, did the glass floor walk, 3D movie, and moveing theatre.The views are fantastic! i do recommend doing this. It is beautiful both in daylight and at night. Such a spectacular view of Toronto from the CN Tower. Make sure you pick a clear day and also, if it is too windy, you will not be allowed either on the outside deck or up to the sky pod.I did not eat at the restaurant, however, I understand it is fabulous and if you book a dinner reservation,...
Loved the view from atop the CN tower and showing our 5 year old the view we as children enjoyed.

I live in Toronto but found it a great experience to go to the top of the CNTower.....the view is spectacular.....it is one of the places I always want to take visitors to our Country. Biggest problem is parking of course but if you take the Subway it gets you there.
All that hype doesn't deliver. Just like being in a downtown office building. It's not worth the price. I wouldn't go here even if someone pay me to go !!! What waste of money
The view is great. The question is whether you want to pay the big bucks for that. I think it's better to just check out the place from the ground. It's impressive on its own.
Been up the CN Tower twice, 1st time only went to the viewing platform second time went to the Pod, such amazing views! Would definately recommend!

It held both records for 34 years...from 1976 until the completion of the Burj Khalifa and Canton Tower. Today it's still the tallest in the western hemisphere. The view is amazing. Try the restaurant and the observation desk. It is also lit up at night. In 2011, they added a walk around the outside of the tower. I haven't and...

I visited this way back in 2007 when I was working in Canada. It was the first time I had stood upon one of the highest observation decks in the world. The place explains how the CN tower was built, how it was built. Provides an interesting view of the world.There is also an area for you to walk...

Fun attraction, but only the first time that you go up. It seems more like a tourist trap to me. The 'glass floor' is really not that big a deal. I would recommend going to the restaurant for the beautiful views!
Gives you a completely different perspective on the city... a bit pricey but awesome... best time is to see the sunset... that wasy you see the city in the day and all the lights at night fall.
What a great way to see Toronto.We always bring our family and friends from out of town to the CN Tower> Breathtaking night or day.
lots to do eat ect if you come to toronto you should visit

When my family was visiting Toronto, the hotel clerk recommended the CN Tower as our first stop. Since it was on the Citypass, we went for it. When we arrived at the front desk, we were told the wait for the ride to the top was going to be an hour and a half. Since we thought this was a...
Even though I head downtown Toronto on a regular basis, there's nothing like getting the view from the top of the CN Tower. What a spectacular city.

This was my second visit to the CN Tower. I took my family this time. This is a must do experience if you are visiting Toronto. However, the fun this time was taking my family. I have a friend who travelled from half way across the globe to see Toronto. And of course the CN Tower. When we got there, the only thing open was the floor were you view from. I was dragged here by well-meaning friends. Horribly regimented and incredibly expensive. A little expensive but you get a real feel for the City of Toronto.Try and pick a nice day so you get the benifits of seeing more.Be brave and walk over the glass floor!!
Very interesting but very expensive just for an elevator ride! The view is something that cannot be explained MUST be seen!
If your going to see Toronto you need to do it and take in the great views from the top.

This Tower was at one point the tallest in world but still its view and height are marveling! Once at the top the view is spectacular! I remember visiting the CN Tower just after it opened in the mid 70's and wondering how long it would last as the World's tallest free standing structure. I never thought it would hold that distinction for over three decades. It is a marvel of engineering and even though I have been to the CN Tower to many times to...

While the views can be spectacular, the nickle-and-diming can get to you quickly. A simple family outing can easily end up costing $100+. And don;t even think about eating in the revolving restaurant. The food is cooked below and the quality is mediocre at best.I honestly don't plan on returning. The view simply isn't worth the price charged.
great view - long wait for food in restaurant - tacky gift shop

The CN tower is a must see and do experience when in Toronto. The views from the top are absoltuley breath taking and its very cool to get a 360 view of the entire city. Had such fun and a great time. WIll definetly go back soon!

The Tower is a beacon, literally. However getting there from Union Station via the Skywalk was a bit of a challenge, given a series of ill-signed "diversions" culminating in a large construction site for a new Ripley's Aquarium. Good views on a clear day and standing on the glass floor is a unique experience.
Great view. 360 restaurant nice. Not much else to do except look at the city below (which is impressive) however be sure not to go on a cloudy day!
Impressive structure. Great views of the city and beyond. Not sure i would pay and queue up for the skypod again.
For 70 bones a person you get a great tour...... Btw beer is only $5.65 a bootle up there!!!

I've been up in the tower on several occasions and I could not get enough of the views, but everything has gotten so expensive, it's ridiculous; plus it's always really busy, the lines are just so long, security and metal detector basically non-existent and to top it all off, it's gotten so dirty and stinky up in the tower, it's...

The lines can be long, but if you can swing it on a Monday Tuesday or Wednesday in the morning or lunch time, there is no better place to get a full 360 degree view of the city, and enjoy a great hour or two. Kids enjoy the planes taking off and landing continuously from the airport below. Glass floor...

This was my very first trip to Toronto and this has always been on my to do list. It is pretty pricy to go up in it but the views of the city are SO AMAZING! I got some amazing shots from up there. The only think that freaked me out was the glass floor in a section of it....
Go on a clear day. Try it just before sunset to get the daylight and evening views of the city.

for the cost to take a trip up the elevator.. I'd rather go up the bank of Montreal building to the top floors for the view.. no cost there.. but CM tower is a landmark that now had colors that change at night lighting up the tower at night
great view, worth the wait, just get a city pass so you can skip the line.
Always a pleasure seeing the sites from this magnifient tower.Great food at the top.
A must see while in Toronto. Spectacular view! Maybe one of the best ever.

Very high security. Fun activities including the imax theatre as well as a virtual ride. Fantastic views but lots of long line-ups so bring lots to stay hydrated [buying refreshments up there can be very pricey!!] Admission included the ride up as well as a theatre and ride ticket for around $40.

I visited the needle last August and I really enjoyed the experience. The view from the top of the tower is amazing and allows you to get great photos. I recommend going all the way to the top. If you want to save some money on the admission ticket, try to get some of the coupons on the tour books...
The view the amazing the staff was friendly and knowledgeable!

The CN Tower is something to see at least once in your life. We brought our two young boys over the holidays and they were blown away by the view and the glass floor. Check the weather and make sure it is clear before heading up to the observation deck. Try not to park at the base of the tower, it is a huge rip off.
The view & the glass floor, we always stay & the hotel within a 5 min. walk the intercontinental. there is a arcade downstairs also.
It's a amazing place! You can see all city! you can feel afraid in the first step, but after the 10 step, you start jump!!!!!
can't wait to try the skywalk. our first visit was great, but definitely avoid it if you are afraid of heights.
very good ride to the top. nice views of toronto try jumping on the glass. it is scary to think it can break fortunately it doesn't break. try to take your time while up there.

We always bring our guests here when they visit Toronto. Yes it is expensive...but you have to do it. Check...
quiet on attendance , not too much to do but a great view from the top

OK, it`s kind of fun to go up this tower. But the views are not that great. Toronto is an interesting city with culture, sport, shops, restaurants, etc. but come on, it is a very ugly city from above. So not worth the high price of admission. Great views. Go at night or for sunset, and definitely spend the extra cash to go to the higher part.
Huge thing, definitely we would miss something, not being there. You can compare it only with Chicago Sears Tower and the view from there.
Although we felt that there weren't too many attractions to see in Toronto, the trip to the top of the CN Tower was well worth it. The views are stunning, especially through the glass floor.
Spectacular views, and thrills for those who enjoy heights

The view is amazing!It's not the cheapest thing to do in Toronto though thats for sure.If your just visiting the city, i'd say go for it, it's an unforgettable view!If your a local or someone who visits often, i'd say don't go too much, it really wears it down until it becomes more of a "meh, been...

My wife and I went up the Cn tower excellent trip my legs started to go in the elevator up but when we got to the top, what a view. It took me ages to build up the confidence to stand on glass floor but did in the end. The skypod is well worth the extra money so much higher...
Great views and makes for a great day. Its something you forget about, since its right in your own backyard 7 you see it everday. But it is worth the tip, & you remember how great the views are.
Spectacular view and the glass floor is quite something.
If you have not gone, try it at least once. You will never forget it. It does cost a bit to go up it like $20 - umm - just like Niagara Falls.

This is the place to go to on a clear day. Stunning views!! The food in the restaurant is nothing to write home about and the prices are over the top...but the view makes up for it...make sure to walk on the glass floor...
When it's not snowing you can see for miles and miles - spend as long as you like there not time limit or rushed tour.
Ask for the totally full package is very worth it, because you go on to the top "sky pod" is a 450 meters high, the Crystal floor, the 3D movie and the small ride.

Though it's possible my expectations were to high, it just wasn't the earth shattering experience I anticipated when I got on board. Maybe I waited too long? All these years of thinking it would be wonderful set me up pretty much maybe, but I wouldn't spend the money again.

It's a good idea to go up on a cloudless day - just about an hour before sunset and have a meal. The CN Tower revolves so you can see the city during daylight, during sunset and after dark. Great experience!

I have been there a few times since it was built and my father, who was part of the excavation crew had never been there. So I organized a family treck there. It was fun to go there again, lots of changes and lots of new things to do. But very busy with long line ups.

Went with my husband, adult daughter and her boyfriend. I am horrified of heights but had to do for the experience. The views are outstanding, elevator ride is really fast, great picture opportunities.

Views are truly wonderful. On a clear day you can see all the way to NY.Do not go if it is a foggy day as your chances of seeing anything would be quite slim.The glass floor keeps scaring people afraid of heights and there is always someone laughing nervously while their friends/family try to gently push them onto...
The view is spectacular and the meal in the revolving restaurant an experience to itsself!
It was ok but nothing special. Good views of the city and Lake Ontario
Awesome views well worth the money and the time. If the weather is warm its not a bad walk.
Fun for everyone!! Amazing view, fantastic experience for kids and adults, Glass floor is the greatest thing!!!

Used to be the tallest free standing structure in the world. Kind of a touristy thing to do to ascend and overlook the city. Initial ticket only gets you to the first level and you pay additional to go higher. Small area with a see through floor for views straight down, kind of cool.
Absolutely no complaints. Delighted with the food and with the service.
Easy access, well organized inside. It wasn't busy at all, but it was a weekday, so that could be why. A must for any new visitor to Toronto.
Talk about a great location! Great place for a romantic dinner for two! Good food and the view cannot be beat!
The view is wonderfulTIP: pick a day that is ot cloudy or you will not see anything!!

The CN Tower is a very cool place to visit. As long as you go at a good time it's definitely worth your time. The views are amazing, the elevator ride up is fun, and the glass floor is a lot of fun! The only reason I rate this as average is because I have been there a couple times...
Maybe one day I would like to do the tower walk but honestly what can be said bad about the CN tower? Makes Toronto what it is without it it would be just another city with a harbour. Or maybe not..
Very expensive...it is what it is. You go up an elevator and get a great view.
You have to go at least once in your life. It's pretty great and if you have the chance you must do the "climb the CN" challange. You wouldn't believe how hard it is but it's a great accomplishment.
... but the prices are a bit high. I am thinking about trying skywalk this summer..
Always crowded and full of people Q-ing up Q-ing up Q-ing up
The view was wonderful but be aware that they charge a premium if you try to pay with U.S.$$. I thought that was rather inhospitable.

You really cannot miss the CN tower, as it's the tallest building by far in Toronto. Getting into the tower with a buggy was a little challenging but once inside it was well worth it.

It's a huge tower that has great views of the city...that you pay and arm and a leg to go up on. If I had known (lies, I knew but was too scared), I probably would have done their newest thing which is allowing people to walk the perimeter of the tower OUTSIDE on a harness. Thrill seekers should flock.
I did not like the price but it was a true experience to learn about its history and observe the city from so high up
Great views and terrific photo opportunity, fairly busy but queues moved quickly....revolving restaurant was not open when we visited (mid afternoon)....
i'm sure this was a big deal back in the day, but if you've been to NYC, Chicago, ATL recently, you've seen better.

This is an OK thing to do. Yeah, it used to be the tallest freestanding building in the world, but so? I guess in Toronto there aren't a lot of big buildings. But there's also not much to see up there. Save your time and money, I say.
It is one of Toronto's landmark that everyone living outside Canada should visit. But if you live in Toronto, you can just glance up to look at the Tower since going up is quite expensive.
Greatest view in N. America! and the food is pretty good in the revolving restaurant!!

You have to go at least once - when I finally did, I asked myself 'why did I wait 20 years?'. Your next foreign visitor should be YOUR EXCUSE to take a ride to the top!I have not eaten there - restaurant that spins sounds cool though!

Several times while in the Toronto area, we stopped at the restaurant on top. Fantastic! each and every time. The tower itself is a fun place to explore. At night, the tower has lights that change colour up it's side. So pretty

The architecture is great.simply outstanding.the people were friendly and as a whole worth visiting.We spent some time in the revolving restaurent and believe me I've never seen such a magnificent sight in my life !
Been there as a kid and went this past summer with my family. It was a little crowded but still a fun experience and one that I enjoyed sharing with my two boys.
What's not to like about this ? Fantastic views of the city, lake and surrounding areas of southern Ontario. Pick a clear day and get ready to be impressed.

I thought it was going to be a regular boring thing to do as a tourist, but as I got into it - I began to enjoy what the CN Tower had to offer. It should be on your list of "Things To Do" while in Toronto.
This is a must see atraction in Toronto. The glass floor is fantastic!
It is spectacular lit up at night. I'm afraid of heights- so I'm alittle chicken on the elevators; but, my husband loves them & walking on the outside decks. We both agree that the views are amazing.

OK this experience was a Birthday Wish for our 25 year old daughter. This was the BESTway to see the CN tower - we made a reservation (there were 7 of us) in the 360 DegreeRestaurant. We did NOT have to wait in the huge "July" (holiday) Line UP - we went directly to the 360 degree Restaurant...
Scary ride up, terrifying glass floor, Wicked view and fastic food in the 360* restaraunt

I have only been here for a charity climb, and have never riden the elevator, but if you feel like a challenge it is a good one. With a spectacular view as a reward. Climb up when there is a baseball game on and you can watch it through the glass floor.

WOW! This was an excellent outing! Perfect time of year to go - midweek in January on a sunny day with the temperature at -10C. There were NO lineups :-) It was really worth it to pay the extra and go up to the second stage, where the view is unobstructed. As well, the film and ride in the basement...
On a clear day you can see New York City. its a great attraction for Canada.
Best view in Toronto. Pick a clear day. Don't focus on the touristy aspects.
The views of course. The staff was also very pleasant.

We bought the Total Tower Experience ticket which included the Look Out, Glass Floor, Skypod, 3D Movie and Himalamazon ride for about $40. I've been before, at various times of the day and in different seasons and I would recommend going up an hour or so before dusk so that you can see the city in daylight and at night....

So , its not surpise the CN tower is cool, and I feel the price is right. My only grip was after I paid they told you how long the wait wqas to go up( few hours) or if we pay more we can go up right away. That ticked me off a bit.
The view is really fantastic, one of the best and the cafe is OK
Nothing at the top apart from shops and the walk of faith glass floor. Fantastic views on a nice day. Semi Reasonably priced restarant at the top too
Visiting the CN Tower was fun for my Son, but it was a little expensive for what you get to experience.
expensive, waited in a long line, stayed up there about five minutes is that all there is?

Tooooooooo expensive!!!! Im not sure why anyone these days would spend that type of money to ride an elevator....at least if they offered a free meal or something when you got to the top it would be worth it but no, not the case. back down you go!

While it's not necessarily the most thrilling adventure, heading up to the top of the CN tower is a sure way to take in an excellent view of the city. Beware that a cloudy day won't yield the best view. Also, most city dwellers avoid the 360 restaurant. Save your $ and head to Panorama at the Manulife Centre on...
You get to see the beautiful Toronto architecture and also the natural beauty of Lake Ontario. Take the time to eat on top or at least enjoy a drink in the bar.
elevator ride, glass floor - great view... WOW ! do not eat at the restaurant - typical tourist trap.

It's seems an obligatory thing to go up in the CN Tower on your first visit to Toronto. The kids and I did it and it was more fun than I thought. There are great views and it's pretty cool to be up in that high and look around the lake and city. We watched planes landing on the little...

CN tower is very cool. At the glass floor level there is also an outside observatory which is very nice...

Its just something you have to go see. Its expensive, and not completely mind blowing, but you just have to get up there and see the city from that point of view. And the glass floor is always a good time. You definitely have to check it out.
Loved tormenting my kids by going on the see-through floor. The view is amazing and worth the price of admission.
The tower is just taking up space . It may have been a wow factor 30 years ago , but today its time has come and gone.
Who would miss this opportunity, the view is gorgeous from the top and the restaurant is fabulous ..at night spectacular!!
It is fun to take the ride to the top of the tower and look down the "glass floor" do not waste your money eating at the restaurant - very expensive and food is horrible.
a bit expensive, but it is a must do once in your lifetime.
must do on a clear night or day! Went up on a clear day and had a great view of lake ontario and the surrounding area of toronto. my favorite thing i did in toronto!

Amazing. Done the attraction on a clear night it really is stunning and the ride up is like something from mission impossible. A must if you're in Toronto.

What can you say.....yes, it is pricey, but then....the view is incredible! I've been up several times and always enjoy my time at the top. I would go back...but on a clear blue sky day you can see for miles and miles

Its one of those things, like the Petronis Towers or Big Ben, that tourists must do when in town. Walk on the glass floor if you dare. See the views and, if you want eat at the revolving restaurant. If you're in Toronto, this is a must do! It's a little pricey, but the views are incredible and the pictures you get are totally worth it! Make sure you go on a clear day so that you get those perfect shots.

Seriously... the vision it took to build this back in the day... it just blows my mind. the trip to the top is expensive, and the amenities at the top not the greatest. Take a tip from similiar activities in Chicago, Boston and NYC - make it more interesting!
Incredible view, good food, perfect service... You can't miss this restaurant !!!!

No Parking, expensive and not much to do once you get to the top. Once was enough

A must do activity in Toronto!! The staff were friendly and helpful. Well worth the money!

Amazing view and wonderful place to visit and be impressed. Parking is costly though during the weekdays.

the cn tower is amazing they have restarunts that spin around toronto so u can see the city they have stores in side and thier elevators are made from windows so you can see toronto so cool

Going to Toronto and not climbing the CN tower is just like going to Paris and not see the Eiffel Tower. A must see attraction.

Highest place in Toronto, go up and have a look. Walk on the glass floor, if you dare! Or go outside and do the daredevil walk around the outside, if you have no fear!

A trademark of Toronto, so a must see. A pleasant trip to the top and down. I loved the view from the top of Rogers Center, you can see the entire greater Toronto area on a beautiful clear day. You'll enjoy your trip there.

One advice, go on top! I have stopped at the first level and regretted not having taken the second level. It is f**** impressive, and is for sure the most recommendable and mandatory attraction in Toronto

Enjoyed my trip up the CN Tower. Went there for a corporate function and was treated like a star. The view was great, and so was the elevator ride. Glad I got to go.

This is great, if you don't like heights don't do it. Takes a bit of courage to stand on the glass floor at the top but it is a great way to see Toronto from on high.

the views are stunning. We were lucky to have a clear day. the glass floor is scary but worth it!

Worth doing once in a lifetime - do so on a nice day. Longest wait is to get up and down the tower.

Extremely overpriced and very average food. Although the view is world class the food is poorly cooked and not presented well. Service is spotty and there is a great deal of noise. Very crowded atmosphere

I liked the view. Go there between 4 and 5 pm to see the city by day and by night.Moreover we ate in the restaurant, $50/person with a good service, good food and a wonderful view on the city by night

While in Toronto we visited the CN Tower which towers over everything. The wait to ride up to the observation deck was not bad at all and once you reach the top you see why it is such a hit... I highly recommend going at night-the city lights & the moon were a sight to behold. You can see soooooo...

Toronto didn't seem to me to be a very touristic city. There's not hundreds of thing to do, it's not like those cities that you wish you would stay longer to do this and that.The visit to the CN Tower is, therefore, mainly THE attraction in Toronto.Passes are not cheat at all, but come on you are there...

Unless you are very afraid of heights, then there is no excuse for missing this must see tourist attraction. Avoid the add-on movies. You probably have better choices at home. The skypod level is not necessary either as you can't really tell the difference in views from 334m and 447m. If you dine in the 360 Restaurant, then your ticket...

The CN Tower was a fun experience but not cheap. Great to do if you are in Toronto for a short time but there is probably more to the city than just this tower. The lift is pretty small. The security check (where they blow air on you) is a strange experience!

We had dinner at 360, the fancy restaurant. That includes a visit to the observation decks. The skyline of Toronto at night is fantastic. My daughter said "I never knew there were so many tall buildings here. " Yes, it's a big city. The ride up in the elevator is quite a rush too.
Whether you are from Toronto or touring the city, this is a great attraction. Also, try 360 the revolving restaurant. Pricey but worth the view and the food is great.

Visited the CN tower and while we were up the tower we decided to have lunch.What a good decision that was ! My son had salmon and it was fantastic. The waiters were good, the view was great and the food was brilliant. I would love to go back again.Don't miss standing on the glass floors up the...
This was an awesome experience. From the wonderful meal in the moving restaurant to walking on the glass floor.

if you visit Toronto, you have to go up the CN Tower. If you don't, it's like going to New York and not going up the Empire State Building! It's just something you have to tick off your to do list.It was the tallest structure in the world until a few years ago (thanks Burj Kalifa).It takes 58...
for what you get it is over priced and the staff are like robots and emotionless. Parking is insane and also over priced.

I went to CN Tower with my parents and aunt who are all in their late 60's. My mom walks with a cane and made sure to check their website to verify she would not have difficulty getting around. The walk from the curb to the entrance is about a city block long. Once you enter, you go through a...
I had never done the CN Tower, heights are not my thing, but it was amazing. We had a great time, the glass floor is a must and the Belvedere walk out is great too.

Very expensive, but totally worth it. We did this for my husband's birthday in August ... I surprised him to help him get over his fear off heights :) He LOVED it. I thought the views (at sunset) were just beautiful ... Toronto never looked so good. Now we can never go back to just looking from inside, it won't...
really enjoyed the view from up in the CN Tower. The cars looked like ants! the glass floor was also really cool
I loved the glass floor.And the lines were so fast and the staff was very polite.
Nice views of the city despite the clouds! Not much to do apart from views of the city and sitting/standing on he glass floor! Not for those scared of heights.

The CN Tower dominates the Toronto skyline. For years it had bragging rights to being the tallest free-standing building in the world. until four years of so ago when it was surpassed by a few buildings in Asia and the Middle East. But it remains the tallest free-standing structure in the Western Hemisphere.You go the CN Tower because it's...

The tower is great place to get know better the city. In sunny days is also possible to see the US side of the lake.When going to the tower, I would recommend to go the Steam Whistle Brewing and the Roger Center to enjoy better the trip to downtown.

The place is run by a bunch of kids. We were packed (I mean packed) into an elevator for the ride up. When we got to the top it wasn't too bad. Decent view, but when we wanted to return we had to wait for almost 30 minutes. The kids that work there are rude, disrespectful and honestly looked and...

If you have climbed sears towers/empire state and enjoyed those you will be treated to a similar view. The glass floor is now mostly covered by carpet with a small area uncovered. Check the weather before going. It does not make sense to spend all that money when you do not have a view.
Easy access - no queues. Amazing ride to top and spectacular views. Option to do high walk - actually outside the tower!
One of the must visit place when you are in Toronto. Ticket price might be pricey but it's worth it. Be sure to check out the glass bottom section on the lower level.

My wife and I took in the CN Tower in Toronto by choosing the the 360 Restaurant. To say we were pleased is to understate the matter. We wanted to go up the tower and found the cost to be right at $25. At the restaurant for a minimum order of $35 we took in a better view than the...

It is worth making a pre-reservation at their website for lunch or dinner at Restaurant 360, because you'll enjoy excellent food, excellent service, outstanding views and you will save some money because elevation ($23,99) is complimentary with the purchase of a main course. Moreover, those who have a restaurant reservation skip lines to the observation deck. Another excelent aspect is...

While on the trip to downtown Toronto, it was the day to visit CN tower. Having been on KL tower, Petronas towers in KL and The Peak in Hong Kong, we were not sure how different this will be and different it was. It is a real piece of architecture. We chose for full La Tour of the tower and...

This is a well-organised visitor attraction with fast lifts and great views. If you have the opportunity, have dinner in the revolving restaurant at the top - the food is excellent, service is great and the views are outstanding.

Spectacular point of view of the city, see through floor section that will make your blood pressure rise, and an opportunity to really appreciate the architectural feat that this building is. Enough said. It's worth the price and really can't be missed as there aren't very many places like this in the whole world.

If you're not afraid of heights, pay the extra fee and go all the way up to the highest smallest "ring" above the main one. One can really feel on top of the world up there! Great 360 view of the city, islands and lake.
The price was a bit much: we did the glass floor and lookout areas. But we got some great pictures of the lake and city.
A must go in Toronto, to look at this beautiful city. Our 3 year old boy loves this CN tower. He was so impressed looking at ships, trains, high-rise buildings from above.

Okay, the tickets seem a little pricey to go up in a tower and look out onto the city but it is breathtaking, especially if you're there at sundown. I found the price on par with any other tourist attraction in Toronto or any other major city. We also had dinner at 360, the restaurant at the top. Again, expensive,...

The restaurant is an enjoyable experience. A bit pricey but the trip in the elevator is included in the diner rates. The food is great, the service impeccable and the view of Toronto by night is awesome.

generally you have the choice of a great view by day or night, both is recommendable. At peak times there is a queue, we were lucky and arrived in the top after less than ten minutes. You start with a view around, then go down to a level with a glass floor you can step on and walk about -...

We spent around an hour on CN Tower. The height is great and the view is magnificent.It's a must watch and visit in Toronto.One issue is finding a parking for our rented car and the method of payment which was inconveniently by credit card and no personnels were available to collect it in cash or using debit cards.

Fantastic view. We went on a bright sunny day, and could see for miles. The only drawback is the extremely long wait to get into the elevators. as everything in Toronto......ridiculously expensive. We got to the queue and didnt go any further as we just wanted to go and see the view. They do not advertise that you can do that for $10. We didnt find that out until we looked at the website after we had left Canada. What a shame.
Its the number 1 tourist attraction in the area.Beautiful views on the day I was there.
The food wasnt probably the best i had but the atmosphere and view was definitely worth trying
I did not like the whole experience, they push it too much, and I found it silly and uninteresting. Definitely TOO expenssive for going up a silly tower.
Worth going up to see the view. Interesting info. Didn't stay to eat, but looked like a good thing to do.

This is a must-see if you are in the Toronto area. It offers stunning views from both the regular level and the very top dome. There is lots to see and do in the tower, but I would recommend trying to go there when it is clear outside since your view will be obstructed otherwise.
We went just before sunset, ordered cocktails, and the more expensive meal package. We were there for daylight, sunset and night time so saw Toronto in all its glory. he food was nice as well!
The views are amazing. We were fortunate enough to go on a sunny day. However, it is pricey to get in.
What a great experience, the kids loved the skypod wiew and the glass floor. The kids also loved the himalayazon simulator and the 3D movie, but for me they was just ok.

Glad to join a group of students and paid only 10 CAD for a tour organized by the school for international students. We went there on a weekend and the weather was quite chilly and windy. The glass floor was awesome not for the faint- hearted though. The outdoor observation was closed due to strong winds and because of this...

Absolutely a must do in Toronto.my parents had been to Toronto before and I couldn't belive when they told me they hadn't been up so we decided all to good. And was it worth it.The views are great and is quite nice to watch the brave candidates to do the walking on the edge thing.I belive we...

If you are scared of heights this might not be for you but this is an amazing place that takes you several storys in the air in an elevator that has a glass front and a see through bottom and where you are able to go outside to view all of Toronto and they also have a see through floor....

The CN tower was just amazing. Riding the elevator up you get a fantastic view of the entire city and surrounding area. Built in 1976 it still remains an iconic Tower. We went all the way and the views were stunning !
Awesome place to visit. I think its worth seeing Toronto from CN Tower at night and during the day. Absolutely must see! Price: $27 and up.

A great experience: fast glass-fronted lifts whisk you to the observation tower, almost 2000' above the ground in under 60 seconds. It houses the largest revolving restaurant in the world - very swish and quite good value ($60 a couple with your ticket discount). The lines were short, probably as it is low season although it did take us an hour wait to get on the elevators down due to a school group. The views are unparalleled in toronto and the glass floor is amazing Despite being reinforced and strong enough to hold 14 hippos, it's still a little scary stepping on to them.

Maybe it is that I have done this before, but $30 to ride an elevator seems a little steep. It was a novelty for my wife and mother in law, otherwise just an expensive ride up and down to view.

The attraction is fun and amazing . The structure is a must see, unique architecturally design. The glass floor is very small. The glass floor will give you a great height sensation. The glass floor was very cool to walk on. View was awesome. It should definitely be done at least once. Don't really know if I'd spend the money again. I took my fiance here for her 27th birthday. We both grew up in the Niagara area, now living outside of Barrie, and neither of us had ever visited the Tower.We did the total experience package. However don't by the souvenir photos taken on entry - look totally super imposed (as they are) but also have the CN Tower in the background, when you are meant to be there!
Went up with a large group and were there in the evening. Awesome to see the lights of the city.

The view that you get from CN Tower is very nice, you can see Ontario Lake with Toronto Islands on one side, downtown on the other. With a 3-day weekend and beautiful weather, we couldn't resist a drive from Maryland to Niagara Falls, then on to Toronto the next day. It was my first trip to this beautiful city. We had the opportunity to visit Niagara Falls with our granddaughter in Aug. 2011 and took a day trip by Via Rail train from NF to Toronto. A must train ride for sure! I have been to the CN tower many times and it always feels like the first.The staff is friendly and informative, and the price to go up the the observation level and glass floor is fair. This is one of the tallest structures in the world. If you are in Toronto, it's #1 place to visit. And don't forget Casa Loma, it's great, very interesting!

Took in the CN Tower while in Toronto this summer. Brilliant view from the 360 degree observation deck. Access is via very speedy lifts on the outside of the structure. Honestly, if you only pay for the Observation Experience you will leave feeling somewhat disappointed. Sure, the glass floor is cool but the view from the lookout is nothing to write home about. Go up to the skypod and it's a whole different story. Wow!
To avoid crowds/ line, we made a reservation for dinner at CN Tower. We had low expectations, but were pleasantly surprised by the quality of food and service.

We bought the Total Tower experience, which included a 3D movie, motion ride and skypod (higher viewing tower). We went on a weekday morning so it wasn't too crowded, making our visit a pleasant one. We ate at the 360 restaurant so we got free admission. It seems every city has a building, an attraction, something that says "I'm in ......" fill in the city. Toronto has the CN Tower. You can't miss it can you? Located in Down Town Toronto. A must see place. One of the tallest structures on the Planet. The view from the top of the tower is amazing. The nearby places are also worth visiting. Public Transport is readily available.

3 couples went in the daytime and then again for dinner to the CN tower. They had good vegetarian options and it was a different experience at night seeing the city.

Took a walk to the CN Tower while we were in Toronto, glad we did. I'm a big fan of sight lines overlooking a city and this one did not disappoint. Well, we went up, had a scan of the view... very good.... and that was it. I felt I had done it in 15 mins and it's quite expensive for that. There was also a 3-D film included in the ticket. This turned out to be about surfing in Tahiti (a bizarre choice and totally out of context with the...

It is an expensive tour to take, but a must if in Toronto. The accommadations at the top were a lot nicer than expected. We didnt' get a chance to eat at the restaurant. The glass floor is a cool feature as well.

The view was just like expected, which means it was awesome! You can see the whole city and stand on the glass floors, but you must expect to pay quite much for it. Still, it's worth it. Forget the "rides" in the rain forest, pathetic, for those of steady nerves do consider the wark arround the tower at altitude, looked great but no for us oldies !!

I went to the CN Tower with my wheelchair bound father. The staff were super accomodating to my dad's needs. The lines were very long> When we got their we had to pay an additional $10.00 to go up to higher floors and then could not get back to the other floors but had to go all the way to the gift shop and go back up again.

A great feat of architecture based on a documentary I saw on TV. Great to see it in reality. Absolutely tall and the glass floor at the top was a nice touch. Living so close to the cn tower you forget - it's not just for tourists. Sure you can take a cheesy souvenir picture when you enter and there are lots of trinkets for sale. But the view is spectacular and you can see the lake , Toronto island and the whole city on a clear day. I think it's a...

If you've been to the space needle in Seattle, save your money. The CN Tower is very commercial, crowded and expensive. Just not that impressed. Do not buy the Imax package - rip off.

This place will set you back a bit but a must see in Toronto. You do not feel rushed. Great in the fall to see the changing of the leafs.
