This attraction is top notch and worth the money. However like all popular tourist destinations, the more your know about a destination the better the experience. During peak holiday travel periods multiple lines can reach lengths of OVER 1 HOUR or more. Depending on how much money you want spend, you can cut lines and times down.*** There are...

This was a total waste of money & they don't tell you that you will be sniffed before entering. If you believe in full disclosure & freedom, don't bother. There are plenty of other very worthwile places to visit like the art gallery of Ontario. I will never reccomend the tower to anyone, please spread the word of how deceitful...

I decided to review the CN Tower after going up again, the last time being 6 years ago. I can concur with fellow reviewers that it can be expensive; however, the scale and nature of this attraction warrants the payment, in my opinion. Interestingly, some fellow reviewers commented that this will disappoint if you've been to the Hancock Tower in...

There's a nice view, not as spectacular as that from the Empire State Building but I guess if you haven't seen the Empire State Building it can be quite impressive. I liked the plexiglass floor, it was cool and exciting. I liked it even though I expected it to be better and found it expensive.

If like us you are visiting Toronto for the first time you must blow your budget and eat in the restaurant in the CN Tower.Yes, it's just a tower, it is very expensive to eat there, the public areas on the viewing level get overcrowded and are a bit tacky but there is something very special about the revolving...

Getting to the top is costly, labyrinthine, and time-consuming (although the elevator ride itself is speedy and thrilling). At 7:45 p.m. the viewing windows were badly smudged with fingerprints. The open-air viewing deck, one floor down, was marred by mesh fencing, very difficult to see through. The expanse of glass floor was very small, and almost completely covered by people...

The CN tower is a MUST see, it's definitely one of the most attractive places in Toronto. The view from up there is magnificent, you can see the whole city ,the harbor and the ocean. The glass floor is a nice experience but not if you have something about heights :) You will feel like you are standing on air!...

I took my family for dinner at the top and had one of the best meals of my life.The observation level was pretty cool. The huge steel fence they have to prevent jumpers is a bit of an eye-sore... but it prevents jumpers, so that's certainly forgivable.All in all, a decent experience if you're willing to pay the...

It's very expensive to visit the CN Tower, so don't rethink your decision to get the basic package when you go. I did and I regret it. I sprung for the extra cost to go to the "Sky Pod" that is 33 stories above the main observation deck. And frankly I couldn't tell the difference at that height. There isn't...

I hurried there at dusk on a nice clear sunny day only to discover that it was not worth a minute of my time. The windows are not cleaned well at all. So the view was hazy and indistinct. Very unpleasant. For those who have seen a great view from Sears tower, this will disappoint you immeasurably.

CN Tower is the worlds tallest free standing tower. And the fee you will pay to go up it is probably the worlds highest priced elevator ride. It will cost you around $30 Canadian Dollars to ride up, take alook around the viewing platform which is caged off which spoils the view, and of course the glass floor, which is...

This was our fourth Tower dinner experience. We have eaten dinner at the revolving restaurants in Seattle, Calgary and Niagra Falls. All have had excellent views and excellent service. But, the CN Tower's food was our least favorite. My husband is vegetarian and was pleased to see several choices on the menu. He picked the Egglant and was very disappointed....

OK.. I got to the point of almost buying a ticket to take the 59 second elevator ride to the top of CN Tower, my knees were weakening the closer I got to buying the ticket... then the guy said the elevator had glass panels in the side... and ..."BUT, it only takes 59 seconds to get to the top,...

Have just returned from a brilliant trip to Canada which included Toronto & the must-do visit to the CN TowerWe bought the package including everything & it was worth every penny! Its got to be done!We bought tickets on the day & as it was midweek there was no queue There were a few people in the tower...

Well, if you go to Toronto, you must go up the tower, right? So we did. I thought it was extremely expensive, and my kids didn't know any better, so I didn't buy the tickets up to the very top. My son loved the glass floor, though I have to say I was unerved by looking straight down, as was...

I just had the most wonderful lunch up the CN Tower. I booked online with opentable.com a week ahead when I planned my trip to Toronto. Couldn't have been easier. On the day, a colleaue was able to join me and I was able to update the booking online easily.I originally only intended to visit the Tower but I...
dont know what I was looking at but the view was amazing.

Went on a beautiful sunny weekday in April and it was a great experience.... if only because there were absolutely no queues for anything... elevators were waiting for us :) Loved the glass floor and glass ceiling in the elevators!Views (especially from the skypod) were, of course, spectacular!If you at all have a choice at all... of season...

If your in Toronto you need to go up the CN Tower. The queue can be long but they do advise you of the waiting time at the ticket office so you can plan your trip. Its best to go on a clear day as you can see for milesYou must stand on the glass floor

we had dinner at the 360 and went to the viewing deck and the outside viewing deck. for a visit to toronto its a must. the views are amazing and the elevator ride is very cool.its interesting to learn about it too. we went in the evening but would love to see the day time view sometime also

I have been to the CN Tower twice now and both times the food was so wonderful! Their steaks are some of the best I have ever had! Truely a wonderful experience.My first visit was with my company and then I had to go back with my boyfriend so he could see what I was bragging about! We had...

We pre-booked the Total Tower Experience and had a great time. We arrived early on Easter Sunday morning (about 9am) and there were no queues at that time. Views are spectacular, kids loved the glass floor area, and there are better than average cafe/restaurant facilities on offer. The video on the construction of the tower (about 10-15 minutes) was really...

You get what it says on the tin a trip (very fast) up a very tall tower with glass doors (so try to be last in if you like a view and first if you would rather not!). Dare to step on the glass floor - look down and take a pic! Extra charge for the sky dome.

I loved visit Ontario CN Tower, the last hight place I've been was Sears Towers, which CN Towers beats easily!!Nice Tour worth $25 to go all the way up, Eat at the restaurant, it is expensive but worth, Nice Burger. The view is amazing up there, Clean place but the Gift store is not that cheap, keep this in...

This was an incredible experiance for my friends and I. The elevator ride up the tower is INCREDIBLE! The ride is 58 seconds and the elevator is all glass, but if you are afraid, the glass can be fogged up. Its really cool. Afterword, we went up to the SkyPod which I understand is the world's highest observation point.We...

My wife and I arrived at the CN Tower on December 1st, with a voucher we had bought online for the basic Tour (the Look Out and the Glass Floor) which had been bought through isango.com.So imagine our embarrassment when we arrived at the desk to be told that the CN Tower staff were unaware of the company, and...

CN Tower was nice, but definitely not worth $30 a person just to go up. Perhaps we are somewhat jaded by living in Chicago and having the Sears Tower in our backyard. The line to go up wasn't bad the day we were there, we waited only 15 minutes once we made it through security and bought our tickets. I...

You get a great view of Toronto and the region. At night it's a must see as you get a very different view than during the day. On a clear day it's able to see Rochester or Niagara.Go up all the way to the Sky Pod at a height of 447 meters.Lay down bellyside down on the glass...

My wife and I considered going up the tower but were taken back by having to pay over $60 just to go up. We found a tourist office nearby who offered a package deal for a bus tour and the CN tower for $50 (for two adults). However when we looked at the price of having lunch at the CN...

Although we live in the Toronto area, we decided to take our 3-year old to the CN Tower for the first time. I managed to find discounted tickets from CAA's website. Even if you don't have a CAA membership, I would advise you to purchase the tickets online from the CN Tower site to avoid the massive lines when you...

I was a little apprehensive about spending $30 to go up in a tower, but my boyfriend and I thought the CN tower was well worth it.The views from both the observation deck and skypod are AMAZING! It's nice that you are basically on your own and can spend as much time as you want up there and move...

We had more fun than we thought we would at the CN Tower. We went in the evening, 2 adults and 3 kids - ages 6, 10 & 13. The elevator ride up was fun and fast. The glass floor is really cool and you can look down and see the Rogers Center. The view from the outside deck is...

I was looking forward to the CN tower visit since I arrived in Toronto from BC, but the experience left much to be desired. We bought the City pass for the full tourist experience and found that this was by far the best deal out there! I recommend buying the package if you are looking to not spend a lot...

Paid $22 apiece to get me and my wife to the top. There are some other nonsense attractions (some virtual thrill ride) you can pay for- but I opted to just get to the point and go to the top of the tower. I also dodged the predictable line on the way up whose only purpose was to take your...

The CN Tower is arguably the tallest freestanding structure in the world, at least until the building in Dubai is open. It's worth the trip to the top if you're interested in these mega-buildings, or if you don't live in NY, Chicago or another skyscraper city. Otherwise, it might not be worth a long line. I went in the morning...
The view is great, went all the way to the top. The food in the restaurant is very good.

Recently had out of country visitors come to Toronto. Of course, they wanted to see the infamous CN Tower. $30 per person (family of five brings it to $150.00) to go up just to look out, plus $18 to park.Once up there, you have to pay for everything else.I think that's disgusting and a detriment to the Toronto...

After a few trips to Toronto, we finally made it to the tower. It was worth the trip up. Even my daughter, who does NOT like elevators, managed the 58 second ride to the top with no issues. The glass floor is very cool, and we all managed to overcome what our eyes were telling us and step on the...

Beautiful view from the 360 restaurant at the top. If you eat there, you save the attraction charge because dinners aren't charged. We made reservations for dinner at 6:30 which was perfect for late August. It allowed us to view the city in daylight, and as the restaurant rotated were able to watch the sunset. After our meal we went...

I had been to the top of the CN Tower before, and was going to go on it again while on a recent Toronto weekender, but my logical b/oyfriend couldn't figure out why we should spend $22 p/person to ride an elevator and look out a window. The view from the top is awsome, but once you get up there...
We loved the observation deck... best time to go is just before sunset...the line was short and we even looked down on a Blue Jays game. The highlight of our short visit to Toronto

The CN Tower is the 'thing' to do in Toronto, whilst it was ok it wasn't great. In fact, if you plan to go to Las Vegas go up the Stratesphere instead it was a much better experience.The queue to go up is massive, we waited 45 mins (my sister paid more to go in the express line which...

Went up to the observation deck at night. Ride up feels like coaster ride - if you don't like heights, close your eyes or look at floor. The wait time is much shorter than going in the middle of the day, but the view is limited as all you see are the lights of the city. You can see into...

I cannot stand reading complaint after complaint on TA. However, the CN Tower is so grossly overpriced that its really unfair. Its a ride up -- a walk around and then down. The view is nice -- the ride up is cool but seriously -- thats it. I mean -- if you go to Toronto youll do it -- but...

We went up the tower on a Friday morning late July and no queues.It is expensive as we got tickets for Skypod as well but all worth it the views are fantastic I even braved the glass floor. Even the lift is an experience although that glass floor I did not view!This is a must for anyone visiting Toronto

Whne we bought tickets recently we were told that the wait to get to the viewing platform will be 20 minutes. After 45 minutes an attendant told us is will be another 45 minutes! As we were in a hurry, she kindly put as in the 'express' queue - it still was another 20 minutes. So - wrong info/ misselling....

If it looks crowded, buy the premium package just so you are not queueing for hours - the extra $6 is worth it just for that. You still have to queue for a while, but when you see the hundreds of bored people on the other side of the hall, you'll know you made the right choice! Unfortunately, when you...

1. The line ups may be long, to avoid long line ups try early morning or late afternoon. I would recommend around 5:00 PM. This way you'll be able to catch the sunset and also the city lights at night.2. Do not forget your camera. To take quality pictures on the glass floor, aim the camera towards the overhead...

We went on a Saturday afternoon ,which was not good planning of course. We did have long waits but it was well organised and the queues were 'processed' well. Worth going up to both viewing levels and dare to step on the glass floor. Views excellent. You can spend as much time as you like once up there. I would...
We had a great time here. Trip up and down was very fast!! The restaurant was surprisingly good and very courteous staff.

In town for a Red Sox / Blue Jays Game.Got to the tower about 10:30 am. Long lines.Took us 2:30 hours to view all.A little dissapointed with the glass floor. It is only about 8-10 panels and alot of people tring to get onto them for photos.Views are outstanding!Also if you have a ticket for...

If you haven't been to the CN Tower, or if it's been years since you've been - go again.We bought the City Pass and for $60 (for an adult) it gets you into 5 different Toronto attractions. Well worth the money and you'll save money if you plan on sight seeing in TO.I'm afraid of heights so the...

If you're in Toronto, you HAVE to visit the CN Tower. The view is just amazing! We did not eat in the 360 restaurant due to the cost, but did go to the 2 viewing floors. The glass floor is really neat - smaller than I expected, but neat nonetheless. We visited in late afternoon, and had no lines at...

column3: Houston, TX (live here, not from here!)
column4: On the advice of (yeah!) other Trip Advisor travelers, we began our stay in Toronto with lunch on top of the CN tower, at the 360 Restaurant, ------------. This is the way to "do" the tower.If you have $40-$60 per adult person to blow on lunch, do it. Make a reservation (phone above), which then allows you to jump...

The CN Tower is a marvellous piece of architecture which offers you a fantastic view over Toronto that you won't get anywhere else other than in an aircraft. Those wary of high places (myself included) feel a mixture of excitement and sheer dread as you watch the lifts ascend; the lift ride itself is actually quite speedy and smooth so...
It is worth the trip to the top to see the view of all of Toronto for many miles. For those of us who have a fear of heights being on the outside can be intimifating but you will enjoy it still.

Ok I'll admit, we hesitated to take the trip because of the price. But it was worth it. The views are great and it was just a lot of fun. We went around 1pm and found the lines easy and the wait short. BUT... if you opt for the Sky Pod, go all the way up first. You exit from...

You can't visit Toronto and not visit the CN tower. The view is worth the price of admission. I would recommend going late in the day when crowds have thinned out some. At times you may have wait to enjoy the glass floor but it is worth it. It is so cool to be up top when the lights come...

We went to the CN Tower on a recent trip to Toronto and it was worth it. We felt like complete tourists but it's a "must-do" while visiting the city. If you want to beat the lines and have a memorable visit, book a reservation in the 360 restaurant. You'll get whisked right up to the top and when you're...
Highly recommended, especially the glass floor, you might wait on the elevators but it's worth it. Go only when there is clear sky
Its one of the must go attraction, Located in Downtown Toronto. It is the tallest free-standing structure in North America and signature icon of the Toronto skylines

Visited the CN Tower, while in Toronto at the end of March. The prices at the tower are acceptable, but it costs extra to take the elevator all the way to the top. At the level below the observation deck there are glass windows where you can see all the way down!The view is great, the CN tower is...

well i went to toronto for 5 nights last year and the standing out was the cn tower.the views amaze and freeze you as its so goodi could see niagra !if you go you MUST see the 3d film it was so scarycn tower dos nice burgers the best ever hve them
absolutely gorgeous view after a nice snow fall

I am not afraid of hights..........well I am now. The CN Tower is a great experience but of you are afriad of hights stay away.The restaurant is very nice with fantastic vires of Toronto. Just below is the glass floor shich is great for photos.The Skypod on the other hand...well what can I say I have never been...

I've been to the tower three times now and would go again next time I'm in Toronto. Some negatives but mostly good things to say. The staff were mostly friendly. We bought the package to go to the top observation deck. When waiting in line for the tickets, it was clear and sunny but by the time we were at...

Very touristy but worth the visit. spent about an hour here not very busy on our visit. The restaurant was expensive as was the snack bar. Good views and makes someone who is scared of heights very nervy. The glass floor was a bit of a disapointment but otherwise worth the visit.

You have the option of buying the attractions individually or buying all of them together. I'd recommend buying “Total Tower Experience,” - then eating at the 360 Restaurant. You will receive a credit (refund) off the attraction package. Buying online will definitely save you time. Here's what we did and our reviews:Bought 2 adult “Total Tower Experience” tickets at...

I recently, indulged in the tour of the CN tower, and it was an interesting experience to say the least, the elevator ride up, is different, it takes 15 secs to get to the top of the worlds tallest building... which is pretty quick, and be ready for your ears to pop, once at the top, the obsevation deck has...

We went early on a Aug 2007 morning to hopefully not wait long. We waited over 2 hours to get to the elevator. It was totally packed and once up there you could hardly move from the amount of people. Not worth waiting more than 10 mins for.

Oh, the wait. the wait...We arrived at 10am, to be told at the entrance that there would be a 35 minute wait for the first elevator, followed by a further 35 minute wait to ascend further to the 'Sky Pod' (the higher observation deck). In reality each wait was about an hour.The views are undoubtedly great (on a...

Our hotel had a beautiful view of the CN Tower and it is quite gorgeous all lit up at night. If you do decide to go, make sure you go early in the morning. We went at 9:00 and there were no lines. I had gone back in the evening to their gift shop and the lines were huge. On...

There's not much I've seen that quite compares with a trip up the CN Tower. Toronto's a photogenic city, what with the Great Lake, and all that, and where better to view it than from on top?We chose to have a fancy dinner at the "360" revolving restaurant near the top, but you can have amazing views without breaking...

My family and I visited the CN Tower last year. It was included in the CITYPASS (which was a great deal).The view was great at the first level and top level.Bu the top level was a little crowded and told a long time waiting for the elevator.If we had to visit the CN Tower as a single...

The tower is one of the "typical" tourist attractions. There are a number of different tickets for you to choose. I bought the ticket what included the access to the tower and the "skypod" or the extension to the top. I went there in the afternoon and there were a long line (half an hour) after the security check to...
Been there twice and I can't get enough, It's so high and just a great trip. It has a showcase on the way up as well.

Nice View, nothing like going to New York tough. I'd strongly recommend to go by nighttime since the view is much better. Even in a very clear day, you won't really see Niagara Falls, other than a great white spot.Still, it feels good knowing your at the highest observation point int the world, as of now.The Glass Floor...

Its a nice view, the glass is clear so you will have no trouble seeing the town. Its especialy nice when you go here later in the day the lights are beautiful. The only thing is the lines, they made us wait about 2 hours before you can get on. I suggest going when its a wendsday or Tuesday when...

These was nothing wrong with the CN Tower tour other than it is just too expensive. We did the Observatin Deck, Glass Floor and Skypod level and while it was enjoyable and quite a view it is just not worth $30 a person.I would rather take that money and do something else in Toronto! And believe me there is...

If you are travelling to Toronto this summer I highly reccomend visiting the CN Tower for a few hours and take in the sights of Toronto. Iif you're going up to the Observation Deck, don't be cheap and make sure you go up to the SkyPod!!Also try to go up when it is a clear day and when there...

I was staying only for a day in Toronto and was lucky enough that the day was perfect in terms of weather. Frankly, CN Tower is the only attractive place for me from the entire sightseeing list of Toronto.I reached at about 5:30 pm, it has good connectivity from the train station via the skywalk. Like for most other...

I was a little nervous to say in the least but my partner reassured me to give it a try. We were staying at the Global backpackers inn and got our tickets at a reduced price from their reception. They allowed access to get to the main big pod but there is a smaller pod towards the very top which...

Once you are Toronto, the CN Tower is hard to miss: on a clear day you can see it from about any place in the city. The trip up is 21 Canadian dollars, which is worth the money. As the other reviewers suggest make sure that you go on a clear day. If it is rainy, snowy or foggy and...

My boyfriend and I went on our first romantic setting I guess you can say to the CN Tower. It was AMAZING. We got there at 10 AM and there was NO crowds whatsoever. We did the Tower Experience and saw the Obersation Deck, Skypod, movie and the ride. You have to go through a quick security check but it...

I am a native Torontonian and have been up the tower a few times, although not in the last ten years. If you can avoid the peak summer season, so much the better, as this place can get busy! We went in winter, and experienced no lines for anything. I did find the constant offer to have your photo taken...

CN Tower is advertised as the number one attraction in Toronto. Paid more than $21 for just the elevator ride up and access to the glass bottom floor. After paying the tour guide told us "unfortunately" we wouldn't be able to see anything. The tower is so high that the viewing window was totally engulfed in clouds. Couldn't see anything...

We booked a table at the 360 for 5.30pm so it was daylight whilst we dined on a very clear day which gave us spectacular view across the city. The restaurant was very good - we paid £45 per person for a 4 course meal and drinks/coffee; food was of a high standard. (this also included entrance fee). Because we...

I went there with some friends in a cloudy day to check Toronto's most famous atraction. It was a Thursday but the lines were big enough to make you crazy. It's a long way until you get to the elevator, so be patient.It's exciting when you're inside the elevator going up and there is a kind girl who tells...

Whatever people write you have to go as it's the one thing people will almost certainly ask you if you did when you get back home. As far as costs go, if you're in Toronto for a few days get the CityPass, it includes the SkyPod experience which if you don't have will cost you a further $4.I would...

It's unmistakably one of the finest views you'll ever see, and the glass floor looking straight down is amazing. But be sure to avoid going up during any peak times. The crowds are jam packed, and you'd be surprised how fast IQ points drop when there's a glass floor for people to take pictures upon. The wait for the elevators...
We went there in the evening to view the sunset. The lines we long. The elevator ride was not scary or super fast. The glass was quite dirty, so the pictures did not turn out very good.

My cousin and I decided to check out the CN Tower on our day trip to Toronto. When you buy the tickets, you are given three choices of what to see -- going to just the Observation Deck (the cheapest of the three options), and two other things that increase in price -- I'm assuming that the most expensive one...

I think if you have never seen the CN Tower in Toronto, it is a must do, unless you are afraid of heights. We waited less than an hour to reach the viewing floors. They make you go thru security "puffers", to make sure you are not a bomb beholder-lol. They also take your picture, for purchase later, if so...

Just returned from my visit to the CN Tower.I felt like I was visiting a tacky carnival. The beverage machine at the bottom of the tower stole wouldn't accept my money so I used the machine beside it and it TOOK my money and gave me nothing in return.There were no paper towels in the mens restroom.The...

I was a little disappointed with the place. It was dirty and messy. Trashes were everywhere. We didn't know about the ticket deals that you have to buy another ticket to go up top. They should have told us at the ticket booths.

My girlfriend took me to the tower, even though we're both a little nervous about heights. When you first go in, you pay for your ticket, which is like $24 (CAN), or $28 (CAN) if you want to go to the very top. I recommend you to go all the way up. Anyhow, after purchasing your ticket, you will walk...

Unfortunately it was a little overcast when I visited the CN Tower but the views from the top were still wonderful. There's not a lot to do once you are inside except go higher. The glass floor was a little disappointing as it is a smaller area than I imagined and even on a quiet day I still had to...

The view is excellent from the restaurant and the observation deck. I do not know where you will get a better view of the skyline, so I think this is a good spot for visiting once, but not twice. We figured we might as well have dinner in the restaurant so we get to relax and enjoy the view. The...

The tower offers a great view of the city and is a must see for Toronto. Since It costs $21.50 for a ride to up the main level, if you go you may as well eat at the 360 Restaurant because even though it's rather pricey there is no charge to ride up and the food is excellent (see other...

CN Tower was a beautiful! We ate at the restaurant on the near top of the tower called 360 which you need reservations for. The food was great1 We has shrimp coctail, oysters ona half shell, caesar, honey lavendar chicken,salmon filet, steak with braised ribs, and prime rib. everyone loved their meals and we got a fantastic view of the...

Living in the GTA and having friends in the US, we've been to the CN Tower as tourists probably a dozen times over the years.For me, the experience is always exciting, perhaps a bit voyeuristic. Without getting a pilot's license, there is no other way to be able to look down on so much of the Toronto area for...

The CN Tower is an overpriced tourist trap. yes its a nice building with a nice view, but $25 per person just to get to the middle observation tower and even more to go further? Thats a ridiculous price for an elevator ride. Skip this attarction unless you have money to burn

I was here on a holiday weekend which was not good in terms of fighting the crowds. We bought the whole package which included a movie, somewhat lame simulation ride and entrance to both the main observation deck and the higher, smaller deck. This allowed us to get an earlier entrance time. The views from both decks are stunning. The...

A great trip for children and adults alike. Even with my deep fear of heights I managed the journey right to the top in the enclosed glass elevators.Thoroughly recommended for a great panaromic view across Ontario.

The CN Tower is one of the best attractions of Toronto! It is the world's biggest building and offers the best views of the city. I recommend saving your money and getting the "Lookout and Glass Floor" package. The views from the "Lookout" floor are just as good as the Skypod and its a better value. The tickets are a...

If you want a revolving restaurant, go to Le Royal Meridien, Abu Dhabi.If you want a view or high building, go to the Strat at Las Vegas or Sears Tower, Chicago....You will have a better view, better food, and a better service.Enough said.

The CN tower is certainly a ''must see'' if you visit Toronto.I recommend you go up about an hour before sun set and stay up for about 2 hours so that you see the sun set and see the surrounding area in both the day and night.Make sure you pick a clear day to go up as I...

On our recent trip from the U.K to Toronto one of the "must do" items on our list was the C.N. Tower. We arrived early, and I’d advise this, because as we were leaving the queues were starting to build.We'd previously purchased tickets for the C.N. Tower over the net, this also saved on any unnecessary queuing.Almost immediately...

If you have never been to the CN Tower, it is something you should try at least once in a lifetime. However, do not expect superior customer service from the staff. If you are planning to spend any time on the observation deck, do not plan on eating at the Lookout Kiosk if you do not have Canadian cash. It...

We visited here with our two year old child. The place is completely stroller unfriendly - you have to ask to be specially transported by elevator to the glass floor - one unhelfpul member of staff suggested we carry our stroller up the stairs rather than let us go in his elevator! You have to ask to be let out...

The CN Tower is definately worth seeing. It is a little pricey especially if you do everything there. Things are not labeled well so you will have to ask before you do things. We wanted to see the movie first and ended up at the elevator to the tower. If you are into history I recommend seeing the movie about...
Price good using Citypass. Great views, go on a clear day.

I recommend getting to the Tower early. We did not have to wait in lines and went all the way up to the top by ourselves. The views are spectacular and the glass floor is a must. Lie down and embrace vertigo.

it was very windy and they shut down the top part of the tower while i was there and then there was a snow storm!!! the photo that gets taken when you come in is the best photo to pay for we had another one taken on the glass floor but it wasnt really worth it.great thing to do...
I loved this placeits fun, the staff are friendly and the view is fantastic

Just visited Toronto with my husband and two children and first stop was the CN Tower, I was disappointed with the view and cost too much for what you get to see and do! Skypod was being refurbished and unable to go outside. I wouldnt do it again.

Its something you have to do when you go to Toronto, and my god I wasnt expecting it to be "that" high! Its pricey to get in - $24.95 for basic admission excluding tax, raising to around $28 for admission to the sky pod too.Inside is the usual array of shops before going up in the lifts which is...

I love the cn tower and i have been there most of the times i have gone to toronto. this beautiful building provides a terrific skyline and everytime i am there, everyone is so nice. the lines may get long at times but its a great family attraction to see. i did go outside and the thick metal wires weren't...

Yes - this is an expensive attraction. Not being a lover fo heights I was prepared to hate it and want to come down!! BUT I loved it!! Went early-ish one morning in mid-october so no queues. The weather was perfect - not a cloud in sight and the views spectacular! Went a further 33 stories upto the Skypod -...

The views from the tower are as good as you would imagine given its height, however I was dissapointed by the very dirty windows. Whilst I appreciate that it must be hard to keep them clean, the view through them is the whole point of visiting the tower, and I am left with photos/ videos where the specks of dirt...

Agree with the previous comments about the price, but if you've paid to get to Toronto you can't not do it!We pre-booked tickets via the internet - do the observation deck & sky-pod, we avoided the rest. Get there early - the light is better & no queues. We got there 9:15, straight up & down, by the time...

A great thing to do, just to say you've done it, but it is really expensive to get up there, not to mention it is often crowded with other tourists. Okay, so its overpriced, but it is an absolute must do while in Toronto. My only advice, go late in the day when it is still light, but will turn dark soon. Great views of sunset, plus you get to see the town in the day and night, thus stretching your dollar value.By the way, I saw the neatest...

I heard rave reviews of the CN Tower. I did not go to the top Skypod. I don't know how much better it is there, but it was an hour wait to get to the Skypod so I just went to the main level. I thought that the view was nice, but it was similar to the Empire State Bldg....

We went to the 360 resturant for dinner food was ok a bit pricey but the view is well worth the price. The view at sunset is great for romantics. After dinner went to observation deck and watched part of the Blue Jays game at Sky Dome (Rogers Centere) from the deck neat ariel view.
